step-1: prepare the crepe batter in 2 separate batches.
step-2: in a very large bowl, whisk together 12 cups (1.5 kg) of flour, ½ cup (100 g) of sugar, and 2 teaspoons of salt.
step-3: create a well in the center and add 24 eggs.
step-4: stir together vigorously with a large wooden spoon until combined.
step-5: add 1 cup (240 ml) of milk and continue to stir vigorously until combined.
step-6: add 1½ cups (345 g) of the melted butter.
step-7: stir until combined.
step-8: gradually add 14 more cups (3.3 l) of milk to the batter, stirring well after each addition.
step-9: once the batter has loosened a bit, switch from the wooden spoon to a heavy duty whisk.
step-10: whisk vigorously to remove any clumps.
step-11: once the milk is incorporated and there are no more lumps, whisk in 1 cup (240 ml) of water and 2 tablespoons of vanilla.
step-12: place the batter in the fridge to rest for 1 hour.
step-13: repeat steps 1-7 to prepare the second batch of batter.
step-14: heat a large round electric griddle to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-15: pour ½ cup (120 ml) of batter onto the heated griddle and swirl evenly to coat.
step-16: fill in any gaps with extra batter.
step-17: cook for approximately 2 minutes, until the crepe begins to lightly brown on the bottom.
step-18: flip the crepe and cook for another minute on the other side.
step-19: remove from the pan and set aside to cool.
step-20: repeat 99 more times.
step-21: this will take approximately 5 hours.
step-22: place the completed crepes in stacks of 10 and store, covered, in the fridge until ready to assemble the cake.
step-23: make the vanilla pastry cream: in a large stock pot set over medium heat, add the egg yolks, milk, cream, sugar, salt, and cornstarch.
step-24: whisk vigorously to combine.
step-25: whisk constantly until the mixture thickens significantly and bubbles just begin to burst on the surface.
step-26: you do not want to let the mixture come to a full boil.
step-27: this will take approximately 10-15 minutes.
step-28: remove the pot from the heat and add the butter and vanilla.
step-29: stir until fully incorporated.
step-30: repeat to make the other flavors of pastry cream.
step-31: mix in each flavoring while the cream is still warm, after incorporating the butter.
step-32: pour the cream onto a baking sheet lined with plastic wrap.
step-33: this will ensure the custard cools safely and quickly.
step-34: cover with more plastic wrap, ensuring the plastic touches the surface to prevent a skin from forming.
step-35: immediately place in the fridge to cool and set, overnight.
step-36: to assemble the crepe cake, place 1 crepe on a large cutting board or baking sheet (you will need to be able to transfer the cake to and from the freezer).
step-37: spread about ½ cup (110 g) of the cooled pastry cream (flavor of your choice) evenly over the crepe.
step-38: place another crepe directly on top and spread with more pastry cream.
step-39: repeat until you have 25 crepes stacked with the first filling.
step-40: transfer the assembled cake to the freezer to chill for 15 minutes between flavors.
step-41: repeat with each flavor of pastry cream, layering 25 crepes with each flavor filling.
step-42: make sure to freeze the cake for 15 minutes after every 25 layers.
step-43: once assembled, freeze the cake for 30 minutes to set and firm up.
step-44: dust the top with powdered sugar, then slice and serve.
step-45: sticking a wooden dowel into each slice will help the cake keep its shape.

step-1: lay down about 6 feet (1.8 meters) of tinfoil on a flat surface.
step-2: place place 4 clusters of 2 lasagna noodles towards the left half of the foil sheet, leaving about a ½-inch (1 cm) gap in between each cluster.
step-3: fold the right half of foil over the noodles, pressing flat.
step-4: to help you see where the noodles are, run your finger along the edges of the noodles to create a rough outline in the foil.
step-5: fold the top and bottom flaps of foil over, creasing and pressing flat.
step-6: flip the foil sheet onto the table so that it’s now standing, then arrange into a square box, using the 4 groups of noodles as a visual guide.
step-7: fold and crease over any excess foil to join the ends together, then set aside.
step-8: in a large pot, melt the butter over medium heat.
step-9: whisk in the flour, cooking until the mixture reaches a light golden color.
step-10: slowly drizzle in the milk and bring to a boil, whisking constantly until smooth.
step-11: mix in salt, pepper, and nutmeg.
step-12: bring to a boil.
step-13: transfer the béchamel to a large bowl and press plastic wrap onto the surface of the sauce to prevent a skin from forming.
step-14: set aside.
step-15: heat oil in a very large pot over high heat.
step-16: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the onions, carrots, and celery and cook until the vegetables have started to sweat but aren’t browning.
step-17: add in the ground beef and use a wooden spoon or spatula to break up the meat into small pieces.
step-18: cook the beef, stirring occasionally, until half of the liquid has evaporated.
step-19: add in the tomato sauce, tomato paste, chicken stock, salt, and pepper, stirring to combine evenly and breaking up any last lumps.
step-20: turn down the heat to low, and simmer, covered, for about 2 hours.
step-21: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-22: to assemble, line a greased 9x9-inch (23x23-cm) square baking pan with 2 sheets of foil that extend over the sides.
step-23: spread a thin layer of béchamel on the lined baking pan and top with 2 lasagna noodles.
step-24: spread a thin layer of meat sauce evenly across the noodles, followed by a thin layer of béchamel.
step-25: repeat the layering process, following the order of: 2 noodles, meat sauce, and béchamel.
step-26: alternate the direction of the lasagna sheets after every layer.
step-27: after 50 layers, place the foil box over the lasagna, helping it stay upright and stable.
step-28: continue with the layering process until the 99th layer.
step-29: sprinkle parmesan on top, then cover the whole lasagna with foil.
step-30: bake for about 1½ hours, uncovering the foil halfway, until the top is a deep golden brown.
step-31: cool for at least 2 hours, then carefully lift out the lasagna with the foil sleeves onto a large cutting board.
step-32: peel away the foil walls, then sprinkle the top of the lasagna generously with chives.
step-33: cut and serve.

step-1: beat the eggs into the buttermilk.
step-2: add the chicken pieces to the buttermilk mixture and chill for an hour.
step-3: in a large mixing bowl, mix the flour with all the herbs and spices.
step-4: coat the soaked chicken pieces in the herbed flour mixture, shaking off any excess.
step-5: heat oil in a large sauce pan to 325˚f(170°c), then turn to low heat.
step-6: fry the chicken in batches for 15 minutes until the chicken is cooked and the skins turn golden brown.
step-7: transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: make the pesto: in a food processor, combine the basil, garlic, pine nuts, and olive oil.
step-3: blend for 30 seconds, or until thick and saucy.
step-4: add the parmesan and salt and blend for another 30 seconds, or until thoroughly combined.
step-5: cut the top off the loaf of bread.
step-6: use a serrated knife to cut a circle in the center of the bread, then use a large spoon to scoop out the inside.
step-7: try to keep bread in one piece.
step-8: use a rolling pin to roll the excess bread into one flat piece of bread.
step-9: spread melted butter on both side of the rolled out bread and bake for 10 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-10: remove the toasted bread from the oven.
step-11: assemble the sandwich: place bread bowl in an oven-safe pan.
step-12: spread pesto on the bottom of the inside of the bread bowl, then layer in half of the mozzarella slices, 4 slices of tomatoes, 5 slices of turkey, and 4 chopped slices of bacon.
step-13: top with the toasted bread and brush with pesto.
step-14: add the remaining bacon, turkey, tomato, and cheese.
step-15: finally, spread pesto on the bottom lid of the bread and over the cheese.
step-16: place the lid of bread on top of it and then press down with a heavy oven-safe pan.
step-17: bake for 20 minutes, or until golden brown.

step-1: in a large heatproof bowl, pour the hot heavy cream over the semisweet chocolate chips.
step-2: let stand for 30 seconds, then whisk together for 1 minute, or until thick and smooth.
step-3: place 1 cup (85 g) of marshmallow fluff in a medium heatproof bowl and place the remaining fluff into a separate medium heatproof bowl.
step-4: add a tablespoon of milk to the bowl with 1 cup (85 g) of fluff and the remaining 2 tablespoons milk to the bowl with the remaining fluff.
step-5: microwave each bowl of fluff for 15 seconds.
step-6: remove the bowls from the microwave and use a fork to stir the milk into the fluff until it is thick and smooth.
step-7: cover the bowl with less fluff and store in the fridge – it will be used later for decoration.
step-8: line a 5x8-inch (13x20cm) loaf pan with parchment paper and place a row of graham crackers on the bottom of the pan.
step-9: pour a thin layer of the marshmallow fluff over the graham crackers and use a spoon or spatula to spread the mixture evenly.
step-10: place another row of graham crackers on top of the fluff, then pour a thin layer of the chocolate ganache over the crackers and use a spoon or spatula to spread an even layer.
step-11: repeat three more times.
step-12: cover and chill in the fridge overnight.
step-13: remove the cake and reserved marshmallow fluff from the fridge.
step-14: use the parchment to lift the cake out of the loaf pan.
step-15: microwave the leftover marshmallow fluff mixture for 15 seconds, then use a spatula to spread the fluff over the cake in an even layer.
step-16: optional: use a small kitchen torch to gently toast the marshmallow topping.
step-17: sprinkle crumbled graham cracker and chocolate chunks over the top of the cake.

step-1: lightly flour a clean work surface.
step-2: flour a rolling pin and roll out each puff pastry sheet to flatten the seams.
step-3: lay the sheets 2 by 2.
step-4: make a diagonal cut across the 2 bottom sheets of puff pastry from the lower right corner to the midpoint on the left side of the lower left sheet.
step-5: make another diagonal cut across the 2 top sheets of puff pastry from the upper right corner to the midpoint on the left side of the upper left sheet.
step-6: holding the bottom pieces together, rotate clockwise 180˚ and up, so that the left side of the bottom strip meets the left side of the lower middle strip.
step-7: holding the top pieces together, rotate counterclockwise 180˚ and down, so that the left side of the top strip meets the left side of the up middle strip.
step-8: seal the seams by brushing a bit of egg wash where the pieces of pastry meet, overlapping the pieces slightly, and pressing together.
step-9: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-10: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-11: arrange the cheese slices in a single layer across the lower portion of the triangle.
step-12: top with a single layer of ham slices.
step-13: roll up the puff pastry from the base of the triangle to the top point.
step-14: place the croissant on the prepared baking sheet and cover with aluminum foil.
step-15: bake for 45 minutes
step-16: remove the croissant from the oven, take off the foil, and brush the croissant with egg wash.
step-17: bake for another 1 hour and 15 minutes, until the croissant is golden brown.
step-18: let cool for 20 minutes, then slice and serve.

step-1: in a pot over medium heat, add the olive oil and garlic.
step-2: cook for about 2 minutes or until fragrant, but not browned.
step-3: add the tomatoes with their juice, and crush with the back of a spoon.
step-4: add the onion and salt, and stir occasionally.
step-5: bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer for an hour.
step-6: discard the garlic and onion, then puree to the desired consistency with a food mill or immersion blender.
step-7: transfer the sauce back to a pot and add the bay leaf, dried oregano, and dried basil.
step-8: bring to a simmer for about 90 minutes or until the desired thickness.
step-9: discard the bay leaf, add the fresh basil and, to taste, salt, pepper, and sugar.

step-1: freeze the juice boxes or water bottles to use as lunch-box cool packs.
step-2: thinly slice the apple and place in a medium bowl with the water and lemon juice to prevent browning.
step-3: cut the cheese slices into thirds.
step-4: cut the bread slices into quarters.
step-5: to quickly cut the tomatoes and grapes, place between the bottoms of two plates and slice horizontally.
step-6: lay out 4 slices of turkey breast.
step-7: place a piece of cheese and an apple slice on the upper half of each one, then wrap the turkey around them, tucking the ends underneath.
step-8: serve with half the grapes, half the cherry tomatoes, and crackers.
step-9: slice the 4 remaining turkey slices into quarters.
step-10: layer the bread, turkey, cheese, and remaining cherry tomatoes on the skewers.
step-11: serve with remaining grapes and apple slices.

step-1: preheat the oven to 325˚f (170˚c).
step-2: place the chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl and melt completely, about 1 minute.
step-3: separate the egg yolks and egg whites.
step-4: using a hand mixer, whisk the whites until soft peaks form.
step-5: add the yolks, one by one, into the bowl of chocolate, whisking to combine.
step-6: using a rubber spatula, gently fold ⅓ of the whipped egg whites into the yolk and chocolate mixture.
step-7: repeat with the remaining egg whites, adding ⅓ at a time.
step-8: pour the batter in a greased 6-inch (15 cm) cake mold.
step-9: bake for 30 minutes.
step-10: once the cake is cool to the touch, gently invert it onto a plate.
step-11: optional: sprinkle with powdered sugar, slice and serve top with ice cream.
step-12: serve with seasonal fruit.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: separate the egg yolks from the egg whites and place into two bowls.
step-3: mix the chocolate hazelnut spread into the bowl with the egg yolks.
step-4: in the second bowl, whisk 2 egg whites until stiff peaks form.
step-5: fold ⅓ of the whipped egg whites into the chocolate/egg yolk mixture until fully incorporated.
step-6: add the remaining egg whites to the mixture and fold gently, but thoroughly, until the mixture is smooth.
step-7: pour the mixture into a greased ramekin.
step-8: clean the rims so the soufflé rises evenly, and bake for 15-17 minutes.
step-9: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f(200°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, mix the self-rising flour and greek yogurt until it comes together to form a ball.
step-3: transfer the dough ball to a lightly floured work surface and use your hands to begin flattening and shaping the rough into a roughly 8-inch (20 cm) disk.
step-4: using a bench scraper or knife, cut the dough into 4 equal pieces.
step-5: one at a time, roll each piece of dough into a log roughly 8 inches (20 cm) long.
step-6: shape the log into a ring and transfer to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-7: brush the tops of the bagels with egg wash and sprinkle generously with everything seasoning.
step-8: bake for 20-25 minutes, until the bagels are golden brown.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f(200°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, mix the self-rising flour and greek yogurt until it comes together to form a ball.
step-3: transfer the dough ball to a lightly floured work surface and use your hands to begin flattening and shaping the rough into a roughly 8-inch (20 cm) disk.
step-4: using a bench scraper or knife, cut the dough into 8 equal pieces.
step-5: one at a time, roll each piece out into a roughly 12 inch (30 cm) log and set aside.
step-6: transfer the dough logs to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and shape individual knots.
step-7: repeat with remaining logs.
step-8: in a small bowl, mix together the olive oil, garlic, parsley, and salt.
step-9: brush each knot with garlic oil mixture.
step-10: bake for 20 minutes, until the garlic knots have begun to turn golden brown.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f(200°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, mix the self-rising flour and greek yogurt until it comes together to form a ball.
step-3: transfer the dough ball to a lightly floured work surface and use your hands to begin flattening and shaping the rough into about a 12-inch (30 cm) round.
step-4: if at any point the dough begins to stick, sprinkle on a bit more flour.
step-5: carefully transfer the dough to a lightly floured baking sheet.
step-6: spread the sauce evenly across the dough, sprinkle on the cheese, and top with pepperonis.
step-7: bake for 20 minutes, until the cheese has melted and the crust has turned golden-brown.
step-8: slice and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, mix the self-rising flour and greek yogurt until it comes together to form a ball.
step-3: transfer the dough ball to a lightly floured work surface and use your hands to begin flattening and shaping the rough into a roughly 8-inch (20 cm) disk.
step-4: using a bench scraper or knife, cut the dough into 8 equal pieces.
step-5: one at a time, roll each piece out into a roughly 14-inch (35 cm) log.
step-6: transfer the logs to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and shape into individual pretzels.
step-7: brush the pretzels with egg wash and sprinkle with salt.
step-8: bake for 20 minutes, until the pretzels are a deep golden brown.

step-1: add the mozzarella to a bowl and microwave for 1-2 minutes, until melted.
step-2: allow the mozzarella to cool for 30 seconds.
step-3: with a spatula, gently fold the egg yolk into the cheese.
step-4: turn the mixture out onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-5: place another piece of parchment paper on top of the dough and press down with your hand until thin.
step-6: remove the top piece of parchment and cut the dough into thin strips.
step-7: place the “pasta” on a rack and refrigerate for four hours or overnight.
step-8: place the “pasta” in boiling water for one minute.
step-9: drain into a colander and run cool water over the pasta to prevent sticking.
step-10: serve with your favorite sauce and toppings.

step-1: mix the spice cake mix and pureed pumpkin.
step-2: spread into a greased loaf pan.
step-3: bake at 350°f (177°c) for 55-60 min.
step-4: cool completely.
step-5: frost to your liking!

step-1: mix one box of cake mix with one 12 oz (255 ml) can of soda.
step-2: pour into a greased glass baking dish.
step-3: bake at 350°f (180°c) for 30-40 minutes (depends on the cake mix/soda combination).
step-4: make sure not to touch it until it’s cool.

step-1: whisk the flour, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon together in a medium bowl.
step-2: in a separate large bowl, beat the eggs and sugar together with an electric mixer until light, fluffy, and nearly doubled in size, 6-8 minutes.
step-3: using a spatula, gently fold in the flour mixture until just combined (some streaks of flour are okay).
step-4: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-5: combine the milk and vanilla extract in a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, then gently fold into the batter, mixing just to blend.
step-6: spray 2 9-inch (23 cm) round cake pans with nonstick cooking spray.
step-7: divide the batter between the pans.
step-8: bake until the cakes are golden brown around the edges and spring back slightly when pressed in the center, about 20-25 minutes.
step-9: while the cakes are baking, combine the evaporated milk, coconut milk and condensed milk in a liquid measuring cup or small bowl and whisk to blend.
step-10: once the cakes are done, immediately remove the cakes from the pans and invert them onto a wire rack or baking sheet.
step-11: cool for 2 minutes.
step-12: then, poke the cakes all over with a fork.
step-13: return the cakes to the pans.
step-14: drizzle the condensed milk mixture over the cakes, letting it soak in.
step-15: let sit for 15 minutes.
step-16: in a medium bowl, whip the heavy cream and powdered sugar with an electric hand mixer until stiff peaks form.
step-17: carefully transfer one of the cakes to a cake stand.
step-18: spread a layer of the whipped cream over the cake.
step-19: place the other cake on top and spread with the remaining whipped cream.
step-20: decorate with berries, if desired.
step-21: slice and serve.

step-1: working in batches, place the sliced sweet potatoes on a piece of parchment paper and sprinkle with salt.
step-2: microwave for 2 minutes and 30 seconds, flipping halfway, until the chips begin to brown.
step-3: continue to microwave at 30 second intervals if necessary.
step-4: allow to cool

step-1: place the ramen noodles in a large bowl (discard the seasoning packets or save for another use) and pour the boiling water over them.
step-2: let sit for 6 minutes, stirring every now and then to break up the noodle blocks.
step-3: drain and rinse under cold water.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: in a small bowl, combine the garlic, cornstarch, sesame oil, lime juice, and soy sauce.
step-6: stir well, then set aside.
step-7: place the broccoli in a large, microwave-safe bowl and microwave for 1½ minutes, until soft.
step-8: set aside.
step-9: heat 1 teaspoon of olive oil in a large, nonstick pan over high heat.
step-10: add the steak to the pan and toss with 2 tablespoons of the reserved sauce.
step-11: cook until browned, about 2 minutes.
step-12: remove from the pan and set aside.
step-13: heat another teaspoon of olive oil in the pan, then add the onion.
step-14: cook, stirring often, until browned, about 4 minutes.
step-15: add the broccoli and cook until lightly browned, about 2 minutes.
step-16: remove from the pan and set aside.
step-17: add the remaining teaspoon of olive oil to the pan, then add the noodles and the remaining sauce.
step-18: cook, stirring constantly, until the noodles soak up the sauce.
step-19: return the cooked vegetables and steak to the pan and stir to distribute.
step-20: transfer the noodles to a serving dish and garnish with green onions, cilantro, and sesame seeds, if using.

step-1: in a large nonstick pan, combine the warm water, olive oil, flour, sugar, yeast, and salt.
step-2: use a spatula to stir the ingredients, then smooth the dough to the edges of the pan.
step-3: spread the marinara sauce over the dough, all the way to the edges.
step-4: sprinkle the mozzarella evenly over the sauce, then top with the pepperoni.
step-5: place over medium heat, cover, and cook for 10 minutes with the vent covered.
step-6: uncover the vent and cook for 5 more minutes, until the edges are crispy.
step-7: slide the pizza out of the pan onto a cutting board and let cool for 5 minutes.
step-8: sprinkle with basil, then slice and serve.

step-1: to clean mussels, scrub them with a stiff brush under cold running water to remove any grit.
step-2: discard any mussels with cracked or broken shells, or that do not close.
step-3: in a large lidded pot over medium-high heat, stir butter until melted.
step-4: add the onion and cook, stirring frequently, until it has softened and started to brown, 6-8 minutes.
step-5: add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds, stirring constantly.
step-6: add the red pepper flakes and season with salt.
step-7: stir to combine.
step-8: add the mussels and stir until completely coated.
step-9: add the white wine and stir.
step-10: put the lid on the pot and cook until the mussels have opened, 3-5 minutes.
step-11: discard any shells that don’t open after 5 minutes.
step-12: add the parsley and stir.
step-13: serve with bread.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: in a bowl, combine all of the ingredients except the baguette, and mix until smooth.
step-3: slice the baguette in half lengthwise, then spread the butter mixture evenly on both sides of the baguette.
step-4: place on a tray lined with parchment paper and bake for about 15 minutes, until cheese is bubbly and starting to brown on the edges.
step-5: slice, cool, then serve.

step-1: add rolled oats to a blender and blend until the oats are the size of a fine crumb.
step-2: add the banana and milk and blend well.
step-3: pour in a glass, and enjoy!

step-1: put a pot on a medium low heat and melt the butter with the condensed milk.
step-2: stir in the cocoa powder and continue to stir for 10-15 minutes until the mixture begins to pull away from the edge of the pot.
step-3: it’s done when you run the spoon through the centre of the mixture and it takes a few seconds to combine again.
step-4: spread the mixture onto a buttered plate and refrigerate for 2 hours.
step-5: when set, roll the mixture into small balls and coat them in the chocolate sprinkles (you may need to apply a small amount of butter to your hands to help them from sticking).

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a large mixing bowl combine the oats and banana and mash banana and mix until well incorporated.
step-3: add additional ingredients should you desire.
step-4: bake for 12 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 250°f (120°c).
step-2: rub the cajun seasoning evenly over the top and bottom of the ribs.
step-3: bake for 2 hours, until ribs are tender.
step-4: increase oven temperature to 500°f (260°c).
step-5: brush the bbq sauce evenly over the top and the sides.
step-6: bake for an additional 15 minutes, until the sauce is bubbly and caramelized.
step-7: serve with the extra bbq sauce!

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200˚c).
step-2: in a bowl, mix together the salmon, chili sauce, and the scallions.
step-3: place the fillets on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
step-4: spoon any leftover sauce on top of the salmon.
step-5: bake for 12-15 minutes, until the salmon is cooked but still tender.

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine chocolate chips and condensed milk.
step-2: microwave for 1 minute and mix together until smooth.
step-3: lay a piece of parchment paper over a 9 x 9-inch (23 x 23cm) baking dish.
step-4: transfer chocolate mix to baking dish, spread evenly.
step-5: refrigerate for 10 minutes.
step-6: spread peanut butter evenly over the top of the cooled fudge.
step-7: refrigerate for 2 additional hours.
step-8: carefully cut into squares

step-1: add avocado, banana, and chocolate milk to blender and blend until smooth.
step-2: pour into a glass, and enjoy!

step-1: prepare a square glass baking dish with cooking spray.
step-2: melt marshmallows over medium heat in a nonstick pan.
step-3: stir every 30 seconds to avoid burning.
step-4: (spray your spatula with nonstick cooking spray to make stirring easier.)
step-5: once the marshmallows are melted, add in the rice cereal and chocolates.
step-6: stir until fully combined.
step-7: stir until fully combined.
step-8: scoop the mixture into the sprayed baking dish and flatten with a spatula.
step-9: cool for 30 minutes, then cut into squares.

step-1: preheat oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-2: in a small bowl, melt the chocolate chips.
step-3: cut puff pastry in half.
step-4: cut slits 1 inch (2 ½ cm) apart on both ends of the pastry, leaving the middle section untouched.
step-5: spread half of the chocolate spread and sliced strawberries on the center third.
step-6: starting at one end, fold the pastry strips over the chocolate/strawberry mixture, alternating sides until mixture is completely covered.
step-7: repeat for second half of puff pastry.
step-8: bake for 12-15 minutes.
step-9: let cool for 5 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (175˚c)
step-2: empty half of cookie butter into a microwave safe bowl.
step-3: microwave for 50 seconds, stirring halfway.
step-4: set aside to cool while you prepare the egg mixture.
step-5: in a large mixing bowl add sugar and 5 eggs.
step-6: beat with an electric mixer on high for 6 to 8 minutes, until tripled in size.
step-7: with a rubber spoon, fold some of the egg mixture into the slightly cooled cookie butter.
step-8: gradually fold the cookie butter mixture back into the remaining egg mixture (this will help prevent the eggs from deflating) until fully incorporated.
step-9: pour batter into a greased 12-cup muffin tin.
step-10: bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes.
step-11: remove from oven, loosen the edges of each cake with a knife - invert the pan onto a wire rack.
step-12: melt additional cookie butter to drizzle on top.

step-1: place cookies in a gallon sized plastic bag and hit with a rolling pin or pan until crushed.
step-2: pat the cookie crumbs into the bottom of a 9” pie dish.
step-3: spread the softened ice cream on top and smooth out.
step-4: drizzle the top with melted chocolate.
step-5: freeze for 4 hours, or until the ice cream is hardened.

step-1: separate cookies and cream filling into two different bowls.
step-2: pour the cookies into a plastic bag and smash with a rolling pin until they are crumbs.
step-3: combine crumbs and condensed milk in a bowl, mix together and set aside.
step-4: in a large bowl, whip your heavy cream with a hand mixer until stiff peaks form.
step-5: fold the cookie mix into the whipped cream and transfer to a deep baking dish.
step-6: top with additional cookie crumbs and cream.
step-7: freeze for 4 hours.

step-1: preheat the oven to 325˚f (160˚c).
step-2: scoop the ice cream in a microwave-safe bowl.
step-3: microwave the ice cream for 30 to 40 seconds or until completely melted.
step-4: allow to cool for 5 minutes.
step-5: add the egg yolk into the melted ice cream and whisk well.
step-6: pour the mixture into a ramekin.
step-7: place the ramekin in a pan.
step-8: pour hot water into the pan to come roughly halfway up the sides of the ramekin.
step-9: bake for 40-50 minutes.
step-10: the crème brûlée should be set, but still a little jiggly in the middle.
step-11: remove the ramekins from the roasting pan, allow to cool to room temperature, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, and up to 3 days.
step-12: remove the crème brûlée from the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before browning the sugar on top.
step-13: sprinkle a tablespoon of sugar on top of each crème brûlée.
step-14: using a torch, melt the sugar to for a crispy top.
step-15: if you don’t have a torch, you can broil the crème brûlée to melt the sugar.
step-16: keep an eye on it, to make sure you don’t over cook it.
step-17: allow the crème brûlée to sit for at least 5 minutes before serving.
step-18: you can also make various flavor by using different ice cream flavors.
step-19: if you are using flavored ice cream, use 1 egg instead of 1 yolk.

step-1: chop dark chocolate into a bowl.
step-2: microwave in 15-second intervals, until fully melted.
step-3: slowly fold in greek yogurt until thoroughly combined.
step-4: chill in the refrigerator for 15-20 minutes, until mixture is solid but still formable.
step-5: using a tablespoon, scoop the mixture and use palms to form and roll into balls.
step-6: roll truffles into your favorite toppings.
step-7: for sprinkles, chopped nuts, and shredded coconut: first dip truffles into melted chocolate for best results.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a bowl, mash the bananas with a fork.
step-3: add nut butter and mix until combined.
step-4: divide the batter into two bowls.
step-5: add cocoa powder to one bowl of batter and mix well.
step-6: add the blueberries to the other bowl of batter and mix well.
step-7: add the batter to a muffin tin.
step-8: bake for 18-20 minutes.
step-9: let muffins cool.

step-1: preheat oven to 350ºf (175ºc).
step-2: in a large bowl, combine ingredients.
step-3: transfer mix to square baking dish.
step-4: bake for 15 minutes.
step-5: allow to cool for 5 minutes and then carefully cut into squares.

step-1: in a large pot, bring the milk to a boil.
step-2: add the pasta and stir constantly until the pasta is cooked, about 10 minutes.
step-3: turn off the heat, then add the cheddar.
step-4: stir until the cheese is melted and the pasta is evenly coated.

step-1: cut mangoes into ½-inch (1.3 cm) cubes and put on baking sheet.
step-2: cover and freeze for a minimum of 4 hours.
step-3: in a food processor, add the frozen mango, water, and honey.
step-4: mix until the mixture is smooth.
step-5: remove from food processor and scoop into tray.
step-6: freeze for one additional hour.

step-1: in a bowl, mash the banana with a fork.
step-2: add eggs and cinnamon.
step-3: mix until combined.
step-4: heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat.
step-5: add a spoonful of batter and cook for 3-4 minutes, then flip and cook for an additional 3-4 minutes.
step-6: serve with maple syrup or honey.

step-1: put 1 part peanut butter and 1 part honey in a bowl.
step-2: microwave for about a minute.
step-3: stir until combined.
step-4: add 3-4 parts cereal.
step-5: stir.
step-6: scoop into bit size pieces and place on wax paper to cool.

step-1: preheat oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-2: in a large bowl, mix together the peanut butter, sugar, and egg.
step-3: scoop out a spoonful of dough and roll it into a ball.
step-4: place the cookie balls onto a nonstick baking sheet.
step-5: for extra decoration and to make them cook more evenly, flatten the cookie balls by pressing a fork down on top of them, then press it down again at a 90º angle to make a criss-cross pattern.
step-6: bake for 8-10 minutes or until the bottom of the cookies are golden brown.
step-7: remove from baking sheet and cool.

step-1: prepare a cupcake tin with 6 liners.
step-2: stir peanut butter and powdered sugar together until smooth.
step-3: spread 1 to 2 tablespoons of chocolate in the bottom of each cupcake liner.
step-4: dollop 1 to 2 teaspoons of the peanut butter mixture on top of the chocolate.
step-5: cover each dollop of peanut butter with more chocolate and smooth out the top.
step-6: refrigerate for 1 hour or until chocolate has hardened.
step-7: remove peanut butter cups from the liners.

step-1: spread a thin layer of whipped cream in a square glass baking dish.
step-2: layer graham crackers on top, then cover with a layer of whipped cream.
step-3: sprinkle ⅓ of the strawberries on top, then layer with cream again.
step-4: repeat steps 2 and 3 until no more ingredients remain.
step-5: (the top layer should be strawberries and should not be covered with cream.)
step-6: refrigerate for at least 3 hours.

step-1: sear the chicken thighs evenly in a pan, then flip.
step-2: add the soy sauce and brown sugar, stirring and bringing to a boil.
step-3: stir until the sauce has reduced and evenly glazes the chicken.
step-4: serve with rice, if desired!

step-1: slice the skirt steak into roughly 3-inch (7-cm) pieces.
step-2: transfer the pieces to a medium bowl.
step-3: thinly slice the pork shoulder, then transfer the pieces to a separate medium bowl.
step-4: pound the chicken thighs flat, then slice them in quarters.
step-5: transfer the pieces to a third medium bowl.
step-6: in a small bowl, combine 2 tablespoons salt, 1 tablespoon pepper, paprika, chili powder, cumin, garlic, and lime juice.
step-7: stir until there are no lumps.
step-8: evenly divide the marinade among the 3 bowls of chicken, steak, and pork.
step-9: toss the meats until they are evenly coated, then refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
step-10: preheat the oven to 300°f (150°c).
step-11: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-12: place 3 onion halves in the middle of the baking sheet, then insert a skewer in each onion, evenly spaced, near the inner edges.
step-13: thread a piece of chicken onto one skewer, then a piece of steak onto the second, followed by a piece of pork onto the third.
step-14: repeat with the rest of the meat.
step-15: secure another onion half onto the tops of the skewers to hold the towers together.
step-16: bake for about 1½ hours, until the meat is slightly brown on the edges.
step-17: increase the oven temperature to 450°f (230°c).
step-18: on one side of the baking sheet, toss the bell peppers and sliced onion with the remaining ½ tablespoon of salt, remaining ½ tablespoon of pepper, and the oil.
step-19: on the other side of the baking sheet, spread out the tortillas.
step-20: cover the tortilla side with foil.
step-21: bake for 15 minutes, until the edges of the meat and the vegetables are slightly charred.
step-22: slice your meat of choice into a tortilla, add vegetables, and top with guacamole, sour cream, pico de gallo, and a squeeze of lime.

step-1: preheat the oven to 450°f (230°c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: place the loaves of bread cut-side up on the prepared baking sheet.
step-4: in a small bowl, combine the the olive oil, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
step-5: brush over the bread.
step-6: bake for 10 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and dried out.
step-7: top the bread with the toppings of your choice.
step-8: you can mix and match any flavor combinations you prefer!
step-9: for meat lovers pizza, add marinara sauce, mozzarella, mozzarella, pepperoni, sausage, ham, and bacon.
step-10: for alfredo veggie pizza, add alfredo sauce, spinach, artichokes, mushrooms, parmesan, and sun-dried tomatoes.
step-11: for barbecue chicken pizza, add barbecue sauce, chicken, pepper jack, bell pepper, and red onion.
step-12: for prosciutto pesto pizza, add pesto, prosciutto, roasted red pepper, parmesan, eggs, and pepper.
step-13: bake the pizza party boats for 15 minutes, or until the ingredients are heated through and the cheese is fully melted.
step-14: slice and serve!

step-1: in a pot over medium heat, add the olive oil, onion, garlic, and tomato paste.
step-2: cook for 5-7 minutes or until the tomato paste has caramelized.
step-3: add the canned tomatoes, dried oregano, and dried basil.
step-4: reduce heat to a simmer and cook for 15-20 minutes or until the desired thickness.
step-5: add salt and pepper to taste.

step-1: in a large bowl, mix together the graham cracker crumbs, sugar, and melted butter until combined.
step-2: pour the crust mixture into a 9-inch (23 cm) springform cake pan.
step-3: press crumbs down firmly with the bottom of a small ramekin or glass to form an even base.
step-4: carefully break the remaining graham crackers in half, so that you have 8 squares.
step-5: push the graham crackers into the crust with the split line facing upwards to form an x shape, dividing the crust into four equal sections.
step-6: press down on the crust one more time to ensure the graham crackers are secure.
step-7: cover and chill in the freezer for at least 10 minutes while preparing the fillings.
step-8: in a small bowl, dissolve the gelatin in the water.
step-9: set aside to bloom.
step-10: in a large bowl, beat together the cream cheese and sugar until smooth.
step-11: add 2½ cups (720 ml) whipping cream and beat until the batter is light and fluffy.
step-12: warm the gelatin in the microwave for about 15 seconds so that it’s fluid, and incorporate into the batter.
step-13: divide the cheesecake batter evenly between 4 medium bowls.
step-14: in the first bowl, whisk in the vanilla extract and remaining whipping cream.
step-15: in the second bowl, whisk in ⅓ cup (80 grams) lemon curd.
step-16: in the third bowl, whisk in the dulce de leche.
step-17: in the fourth bowl, whisk in the chocolate hazelnut spread.
step-18: to assemble the cheesecake, slowly pour the contents of bowl #1 into a quarter of the pan.
step-19: repeat with remaining flavors.
step-20: use a spatula to smooth the tops.
step-21: carefully dollop the raspberry jam in small circles on top of the vanilla cheesecake.
step-22: use a toothpick or knife to carefully swirl it into the filling.
step-23: garnish the outer border with fresh raspberries.
step-24: garnish the outer border of the chocolate hazelnut cheesecake with the chocolate hazelnut truffles.
step-25: garnish the outer border of the dulce de leche cheesecake with the chopped pecans and drizzle with dulce de leche
step-26: pour the remaining lemon curd on top of the lemon cheesecake and smooth with an offset spatula or spoon.
step-27: garnish the outer border with candied lemon slices.
step-28: cover the top of the pan tightly with plastic wrap and chill for 4 hours or overnight in the fridge before slicing and serving.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: line 3 11x17-inch (28x43-cm) baking sheets with parchment paper.
step-3: make the pancake layer: in a large bowl, combine the pancake mix, eggs, milk, and vegetable oil.
step-4: whisk to combine, being careful not to overmix.
step-5: divide batter between 2 of the prepared baking sheets.
step-6: spread evenly and bake for 10-15 minutes, until you can poke and no batter comes out
step-7: make the egg layer: in a large bowl, combine the eggs, milk, salt, and pepper.
step-8: pour the egg mix onto the remaining prepared baking sheet.
step-9: spread evenly and bake for 10-15 minutes, until the edges are completely set.
step-10: line another baking sheet with 2 sheets of parchment paper.
step-11: arrange the canadian bacon slices in a row at the top of the baking sheet and lay spinach on top.
step-12: place the chicken sausage patties in a row under the canadian bacon and top with the american cheese slices.
step-13: fold the bottom part half of the parchment paper over until you reach the patties to create a “barrier” between the meat toppings and the vegetarian toppings.
step-14: place the vegetarian burgers on the bottom half of the baking sheet and top with the cheddar cheese.
step-15: reduce the oven temperature to 350˚f (180˚c) and bake the toppings for 15-20 minutes, until the meat is warmed through and the cheese has melted.
step-16: on a cutting board, layer the sandwich starting with a pancake layer, followed by the egg layer.
step-17: arrange the bacon and other toppings in quadrants on the egg.
step-18: top the canadian bacon and spinach with hollandaise sauce, if desired.
step-19: top with the second pancake layer.
step-20: slice into 16 sandwiches and serve immediately, or wrap in parchment paper and freeze in an airtight container for up to 1 month and microwave on defrost for about 5 minutes, until it is warm.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c)
step-2: spray a bundt pan with cooking spray and place both pieces of french bread dough into the bundt pan, pressing the edges together.
step-3: bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown.
step-4: cool completely, and carefully slice in half.
step-5: place the top half aside during assembly.
step-6: visually separate the round bread into four quarters.
step-7: the first quarter is on the top left, second, top right, third, bottom left, and fourth, bottom right.
step-8: spread mayonnaise on all four quarters of the bottom slice of bread.
step-9: then, spread mustard on quarters 2 and 3.
step-10: place slices of provolone cheese on quarters 1 and 3, followed by cheddar cheese on quarters 2 and 4.
step-11: place deli turkey slices on quarter 1 and roast beef slices on quarter 2.
step-12: put deli ham slices on quarters 3 and 4.
step-13: add bacon slices on top of the turkey in quarter 1, then lettuce on quarters 2 and 4.
step-14: add salami and pepperoni slices to quarter 3.
step-15: finish off the first quarter with some tomato slices, ranch dressing, and lettuce.
step-16: spread mustard on top of the lettuce of quarter 2, and mayonnaise onto the lettuce of quarter 8.
step-17: add tomatoes and lettuce to finish off quarter 3.
step-18: place the reserved piece of bread on top and carefully cut the ring into sandwiches.
step-19: it may help to use toothpicks to hold the sandwiches together.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, mix together the yogurt, gluten-free flour blend, baking powder, and salt until a dough forms.
step-3: transfer the dough to a lightly-floured surface and flatten into a 12-inch (30-cm) disk.
step-4: use a small cookie cutter to punch out 12 biscuit rounds.
step-5: transfer the rounds to a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-6: use a pastry brush to brush the butter on the biscuits and lightly sprinkle the tops with salt.
step-7: bake for 15 minutes, until the biscuits are set and just starting to brown.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, mix together the yogurt, gluten-free flour blend, baking powder, and salt until a dough forms.
step-3: transfer the dough to a lightly-floured surface and flatten into an 8-inch (20-cm) disk.
step-4: cut the disk into 6 equal parts and roll each part into 8-inch (20-cm) logs.
step-5: transfer the logs to a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-6: in a small bowl, combine the oil and italian seasoning.
step-7: use a pastry brush to brush the oil mixture over the breadsticks.
step-8: bake for 15 minutes, until the breadsticks are set and just starting to brown.

step-1: in a large bowl, mix together the yogurt, gluten-free flour blend, baking powder, and salt until a dough forms.
step-2: transfer the dough to a lightly-floured surface and flatten into an 8-inch (20 cm) disk.
step-3: cut the disk into 4 equal parts and flatten each part to about ¼ inch (6 mm) thick.
step-4: very carefully transfer the dough pieces to a nonstick pan preheated over medium heat.
step-5: cook each side of the flatbread until well browned.

step-1: make the truffles: in a small saucepan over medium heat, bring the coconut milk to a simmer.
step-2: pour the warm coconut milk over the chopped chocolate in a heatproof bowl and stir until melted and smooth.
step-3: add the vanilla and salt and use a rubber spatula to combine.
step-4: cover and cool in the refrigerator for 2 hours, until set.
step-5: when you press the mixture with your fingertip, it should create create an indentation.
step-6: do not chill for too long--the mixture will be extremely difficult to scoop if it hardens too much.
step-7: using a 1 tablespoon measuring spoon, portion out the truffle mixture and place onto the baking sheet.
step-8: roll each truffle between your palms to create a sphere.
step-9: your hands will get messy during the process.
step-10: the outside should be slightly tacky from the heat of your palms.
step-11: this will help the topping stick best.
step-12: if they get too soft, place in the fridge for 10 minutes.
step-13: roll the truffles in your toppings of choice.
step-14: serve immediately or refrigerate for 1 hour for firmer truffles.
step-15: the uncoated truffle balls will keep in the fridge for up 10 days.
step-16: coat in the toppings just before serving.

step-1: preheat oven to 170˚f (70˚c).
step-2: in a food processor or blender, puree strawberries, kiwi, sugar, and lemon juice.
step-3: over a bowl or jug, pour the puree into a strainer and stir to remove most of the seeds.
step-4: on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper, pour the puree and spread evenly over the paper, being careful not to let it spill over the edges.
step-5: bake for 5 hours, or until it is mostly dehydrated and is no longer sticky.
step-6: (this may take up to 6 hours depending on the oven.) it is done when it has a bendable, leathery texture.
step-7: cool completely and cut into strips, leaving the parchment paper attached.
step-8: roll each strip up and tie with a ribbon or twine.
step-9: to serve, remove ribbon/twine and parchment paper.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: line an 8-inch (20-cm) square baking pan with parchment paper.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the graham cracker crumbs, 3 tablespoons of granulated sugar, 2 tablespoons of cocoa powder, and 6 tablespoons of melted butter until fully incorporated and the mixture looks rich and chocolaty.
step-4: transfer the mixture to the prepared baking pan and pack down to cover the bottom of the pan in an even layer.
step-5: bake for 10 minutes, then let cool.
step-6: reduce the oven temperature to 325˚f (160˚c).
step-7: separate the eggs into two large bowls.
step-8: add the remaining ¾ cup of granulated sugar to the egg yolks and whisk until pale yellow.
step-9: add the remaining ½ cup of melted butter and the vanilla and mix until fully incorporated.
step-10: sift in the flour and ⅓ cup (40 g) of cocoa powder and mix thoroughly.
step-11: slowly add the milk, stirring continuously, until a very wet batter forms.
step-12: set aside.
step-13: beat the egg whites with an electric hand mixer until frothy.
step-14: add the cream of tartar and continue beating until medium peaks form.
step-15: whisk ⅓ of the egg whites into the egg yolk batter, then gently fold in the remaining egg whites with a rubber spatula.
step-16: pour the batter over the graham cracker crust and bake for 40 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center jiggles slightly.
step-17: let cool for at least 1 hour.
step-18: in a large bowl, whip the heavy cream until soft peaks form and the cream has doubled in volume.
step-19: sift in the remaining 2 tablespoons of cocoa powder and the powdered sugar and fold with a rubber spatula to incorporate.
step-20: invert the cooled cake onto a cutting board.
step-21: remove the parchment paper and flip the cake again so the graham cracker crust is on the bottom.
step-22: spread the chocolate whipped cream onto the cake.
step-23: slice and serve.

step-1: pre-heat the oven to 180°c (350°f)
step-2: season the chicken with the salt, pepper and mixed herbs.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: heat some oil in a large pan and sear the chicken for about 10-15 minutes evenly on each side, until golden brown.
step-5: take the chicken out and set aside.
step-6: add the shallots and cook down in the remaining juices for about 5 minutes over a low-medium heat.
step-7: add the garlic cloves and gently cook them for about 2 minutes.
step-8: pour in the vermouth or white wine and gently cook so that it reduces slightly.
step-9: add the chicken, parsley sprigs and tarragon, followed by the chicken stock.
step-10: bake in the oven for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
step-11: serve with crusty bread and vegetables of your choice.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: line a small baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: using a sharp knife, carve out one of the breasts from the rotisserie chicken.
step-4: if the chicken is particularly small, use both breasts.
step-5: chop the chicken breast into very small pieces and set aside.
step-6: use a fork to poke holes all over the sweet potato.
step-7: transfer the sweet potato to the prepared baking sheet.
step-8: bake for 40-50 minutes, until the sweet potato is tender when pierced with a paring knife or skewer.
step-9: add the cabbage to a medium skillet over medium heat.
step-10: add the barbecue sauce and sauté until the cabbage starts to soften, about 3 minutes.
step-11: add the chopped chicken and stir just to incorporate.
step-12: remove the pan from the heat.
step-13: once the sweet potato is cool enough to handle, slice it in half lengthwise and scoop out the flesh with a spoon until a ¼-inch (6 mm) layer remains.
step-14: fill the sweet potato skins with the chicken and cabbage filling, drizzle with barbecue sauce, and top with the sliced green onions.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: place the pie crust on a cutting board, and cut out circle shapes using the top of a coffee cup.
step-3: collect scrap pieces, and roll out again to stamp out more shapes, making 12-14 circles total.
step-4: fill half the circles with a tablespoon of the cream cheese, followed by a heaping teaspoon of jam.
step-5: using your finger, lightly wet the edges of the cut rounds with water.
step-6: cover the tops with the remaining circles, pressing the two dough halves together.
step-7: crimp edges with a fork to seal.
step-8: in a bowl, beat the egg with water.
step-9: brush the tops of the pies with the egg wash.
step-10: use a small, sharp knife to cut a ventilation hole, or slit into the top of the pies.
step-11: arrange the pies on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-12: bake for 15-20 minutes until golden brown.
step-13: allow to cool completely before serving.

step-1: cut cauliflower into small florets, about 4 cups (1.2 kg).
step-2: add cauliflower florets into a 6-quart (6 l) dutch oven of boiling water and boil for 5 minutes.
step-3: drain the cauliflower in a colander, and return to the pot.
step-4: reduce heat to low.
step-5: add in salt, pepper, and sour cream, and stir until thoroughly combined.
step-6: stir in cheddar cheese until melted.
step-7: remove from heat.
step-8: top with parsley (optional).

step-1: in a bowl, mix almond flour, almond butter, and vanilla extract.
step-2: create round balls using your hands.
step-3: place onto a baking sheet and chill for 20 minutes or until solid.
step-4: in a microwave-safe bowl, melt the chocolate in 30-second intervals.
step-5: individually coat eat ball in the chocolate and place back onto the baking sheet.
step-6: sprinkle with sea salt, if desired.
step-7: chill until chocolate is set.

step-1: line a muffin tin with muffin tin liners.
step-2: in a bowl or measuring cup, add the dark chocolate and ¼ cup (50 g) coconut oil.
step-3: stir in vanilla extract.
step-4: microwave for 30-second intervals until melted, stirring each time.
step-5: pour half of the chocolate mixture into the liners (just enough to cover the whole bottom).
step-6: save the other half for the top layer.
step-7: freeze for 15 minutes.
step-8: in a bowl or measuring cup, add the peanut butter, honey, and 2 tablespoons coconut oil.
step-9: microwave 15 seconds or until slightly melted and pourable.
step-10: pour mixture evenly into the muffin tin.
step-11: freeze for 5 minutes.
step-12: pour remaining chocolate mixture on top of the peanut butter layer.
step-13: freeze until firm about 1 hour.
step-14: store in the refrigerator until ready to serve.

step-1: in a small microwave-safe bowl, microwave the chocolate in 15 to 30-second intervals, stirring occasionally, until completely melted.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: while the chocolate cools a bit, beat the eggs thoroughly with a whisk until foamy and pale.
step-4: pour in the honey and melted chocolate and whisk until fully combined.
step-5: sprinkle in the whole wheat flour and salt.
step-6: fold the batter together with a spatula just until the flour disappears.
step-7: pour the batter into a greased 8x8-inch (20x20 cm) baking tin and spread the top into an even layer.
step-8: bake for 15 minutes, until the batter has just begun to set.
step-9: let the brownies cool at least another 30 minutes before slicing and serving.

step-1: separate the head of broccoli into individual florets, coat in olive oil, salt, and pepper, then roast for 20 minutes at 180°c (350°f).
step-2: cook the rigatoni in boiling salted water for 8-10 minutes until al dente, then drain, saving some of the pasta water.
step-3: place the pasta back in the pot with about 50ml (¼ cup) of the pasta water.
step-4: on a low heat, add the tomatoes, broccoli, pesto, and parmesan, and stir until combined and the cheese has melted.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the peanut butter, sriracha, lime juice, and water.
step-2: use a fork or whisk to mix until smooth.
step-3: using a vegetable peeler, shave the zucchini into wide ribbons.
step-4: you should have about 8 cups (990 grams) of zucchini ribbons total.
step-5: add the zucchini ribbons and light parts of the green onions to the sauce and toss until coated.
step-6: the sauce may seem thick at first, but the zucchini will release some water and thin the sauce a bit.
step-7: season with salt to taste.
step-8: divide the noodles between serving bowls.
step-9: garnish with the dark scallion parts.

step-1: pre-heat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: for the gravy, heat the butter in a large sauce pan.
step-3: break up the sausage in the pan and let it brown for a few minutes.
step-4: add in the flour and toss the sausage to toast for 1 minute.
step-5: pour in the milk and stir constantly until the mixture has thickened, about 8 minutes.
step-6: season with salt and pepper to taste.
step-7: grease a 9" x13" (23cmx33cm) roasting pan.
step-8: spread the hash browns evenly along the bottom of the pan and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
step-9: add the cheddar cheese in an even layer and top with scrambled eggs.
step-10: pour the gravy on top of the eggs in the roasting pan.
step-11: for the biscuit dough, combine the flour, salt, baking powder, and baking soda in a large bowl.
step-12: pour the melted butter into the cold buttermilk and stir gently with a spoon until the butter hardens and forms lumps.
step-13: pour the milk mixture into the flour and mix until well-combined.
step-14: transfer the dough to a floured sheet of cling wrap and generously dust the dough with flour.
step-15: using a floured rolling pin, roll the dough into a rectangle that matches the size of your roasting pan.
step-16: roll the dough onto the rolling pin and transfer to the roasting pan, then brush with melted butter.
step-17: bake for 25-30 minutes.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: line a 9-inch (22-cm) springform pan with 2 layers of plastic wrap long enough to hang over the sides.
step-3: press the cookie dough evenly into a circle along the bottom of the pan, then fold the plastic wrap over the top.
step-4: unclasp the pan and freeze the cookie dough disk.
step-5: re-clasp the pan, then spray the bottom with cooking spray.
step-6: pour in the brownie batter.
step-7: spray the bottom and sides of a 5-inch (12-cm) or deeper, 8-inch (20-cm) wide cake pan, then press the greased cake pan into the brownie mix until the batter reaches halfway up the sides of the springform pan.
step-8: bake for 35 minutes, then cool for about 5 minutes.
step-9: reduce the oven temperature to 300°f (150°c).
step-10: in a large bowl, mix together the cream cheese, sugar, vanilla, and egg until there are no lumps and the batter is smooth.
step-11: while the brownie is still warm, carefully rotate and press down on the cake pan using oven mitts or pads to push the cooked brownie even more up the sides of the springform pan into an even ring.
step-12: chill 30 minutes.
step-13: arrange a single layer of the sandwich cookies, roughly 14-15, on the bottom of the brownie shell as close together as possible.
step-14: pour the cheesecake batter on top of the cookies and spread evenly across the top.
step-15: tap the pan to release any large air bubbles, then bake for about 40 minutes until the cheesecake slightly jiggles in the center.
step-16: freeze until the top of the cheesecake is slightly firm, about 30 minutes.
step-17: arrange another layer of cookies on top of the cheesecake layer, then place the frozen cookie dough disk on top.
step-18: tuck in any edges, then bake for 20 minutes.
step-19: chill completely, then release the pan.
step-20: slice, and serve with a dollop of whipped cream topped with another cookie!

step-1: place a glass upside down in the center of a springform pan.
step-2: spread out desired amount of beans.
step-3: spread out desired amount of cheese.
step-4: spread out desired amount of pico de gallo.
step-5: spread out desired amount of sour cream.
step-6: spread out desired amount of guacamole.
step-7: drizzle on lime juice, and sprinkle on chopped cilantro.
step-8: place 3 cherry tomato halves in a cluster to look like holly berries and freeze for 15 minutes.
step-9: remove springform pan and glass carefully.
step-10: serve with tortilla chips!

step-1: melt the butter in a small microwaveable mug or dish.
step-2: grease a ramekin with the melted butter.
step-3: crush the graham crackers into fine crumbs, then mix it with the remaining butter.
step-4: with a spoon, press the crust flat against the sides of the dish.
step-5: in a small bowl, combine the cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla, stirring until there are no lumps.
step-6: transfer the mixture on top of the cracker crust, then spread it evenly on top.
step-7: microwave for at least 4 minutes, 30-45 seconds at a time, at 50% power.
step-8: make sure the cheesecake does not bubble over the sides.
step-9: chill in the freezer for at least 30 minutes, until it is completely cool to the touch.
step-10: with a knife, loosen the edges of the cheesecake then invert onto a plate, or eat straight from the dish.
step-11: top with a few raspberries.

step-1: place cookies into plastic bag and smash until fine crumbles form, or use a food processor and make it as fine as possible.
step-2: in a large bowl, combine cookie crumbs and melted butter and mix until it clusters.
step-3: in a cupcake tin, put a spoonful of the crumb mixture and form into crusts.
step-4: freeze for 2 hours.
step-5: in a medium saucepan, heat sugar and water until amber brown.
step-6: do not stir!
step-7: take off the heat and pour in the heavy cream and vanilla, stirring until caramel forms.
step-8: caution: adding the cream will cause sugar to boil, so carefully mix.
step-9: quickly pour caramel into the cookie crust and let it sit until caramel is firm.
step-10: approximately 5 minutes.
step-11: heat up the heavy cream and add the dark chocolate.
step-12: let the chocolate sit for a minute and stir until smooth.
step-13: pour a spoonful of chocolate over the caramel and then refrigerate for an hour or until the chocolate is firm.
step-14: sprinkle the tarts with some sea salt to balance sweetness if desired.

step-1: season each steak generously with salt and pepper, making sure to rub the salt and pepper into the sides of the steak.
step-2: in a cast iron skillet, heat the vegetable over high heat until smoking hot.
step-3: lay the steaks in the pan and cook for about 2 minutes.
step-4: flip the steaks, then add the butter, swirling it around the pan.
step-5: using a large spoon, scoop the melted butter over the tops of the steak, basting them continuously.
step-6: cook for about 2 minutes to get medium rare.
step-7: (check the steaks with an instant read thermometer if you have one; you want an internal temperature of about 135˚f.) set the steaks aside on a cutting board to rest.
step-8: wipe out the skillet and heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil over medium-high heat.
step-9: add the onion and mushrooms and sauté, stirring constantly, until caramelized, about 20 minutes.
step-10: using a serrated knife, slice the top off the bread and scoop out the insides to create a bread bowl.
step-11: nestle one steak into the bottom of the bread bowl.
step-12: layer the cheddar cheese evenly on top.
step-13: add the caramelized onions and mushrooms and use a spoon to spread them evenly over the cheese.
step-14: top with the spinach, then the bacon, then the swiss cheese.
step-15: finally, put the second steak on top, tucking it under the lip of the bread bowl.
step-16: cover with the bread lid and wrap the entire loaf in foil.
step-17: place the wrapped sandwich in the fridge and put a cutting board on top of it.
step-18: stack books on the cutting board to compress the sandwich.
step-19: chill in the fridge for at least 5 hours.
step-20: preheat the oven to 250˚f.
step-21: remove the foil from the sandwich and place it on a baking sheet.
step-22: bake for 20 minutes, until the bread is slightly crisp.

step-1: preheat oven to 300°f (150°c).
step-2: spray a baking tray with cooking spray, then line it with a piece of parchment that extends past the sides.
step-3: these will be the handles to lift out the dessert.
step-4: visually dividing the pan into 8 equal rectangles, shape the chocolate chip cookie dough into a flat, even, rectangular shape that fits the divided section in the top left corner, making sure the edges are as straight and sharp as possible.
step-5: shape the m&m cookie dough into a similar rectangle in the section diagonally across from the chocolate chip cookie dough.
step-6: break the graham cracker sheets along their seams into pieces that are just as long as the cookie dough rectangles.
step-7: press them to form a wall in the bottom left section.
step-8: place 2 full graham cracker sheets in bottom of the section.
step-9: layer the chocolate evenly on top.
step-10: spread the marshmallows across the chocolate.
step-11: in the section directly to the right of the chocolate chip cookie dough, carefully spread the brownie batter into a similar rectangular shape.
step-12: roll two of the pie crusts together with about a 3-inch overlap, then trim it into a rectangle.
step-13: on the far right side of the pan, lay the rectangular sheet of pie crust over where the 2 rightmost sections would be.
step-14: press the pie crust into the edges of the pan, then trim off any excess that goes beyond the pan.
step-15: place a double layer strip of pie crust in the middle, creasing the dough near the bottom into the pie crust that was laid down in order to help it stick and stay up.
step-16: seal off the left exposed edge of the pie crust with another double strip of pie crust.
step-17: you should now have 2 rectangles completely enclosed in pie crust.
step-18: if the brownie mix has spread a little bit, push it back into its original rectangular shape.
step-19: add the apple pie filling to the bottom right square.
step-20: add the pumpkin pie filling to the top right square.
step-21: immediately spread the banana bread batter into the section between the brownie and the pie crust.
step-22: breaking another graham cracker sheet into pieces, form another wall along the bottom of the banana bread rectangle and the right of the m&m cookie dough.
step-23: lay down 2 more sheets of graham crackers inside that rectangle to form a base, then evenly spread the cheesecake batter on top.
step-24: bake for 1 hour.
step-25: cool completely, then slowly and carefully lift the entire dessert out using the parchment paper handles.
step-26: immediately transfer to a large cutting board.
step-27: make 8 evenly-spaced slices vertically and 4 slices horizontally, creating bars that are have 1, 2, or 4 flavors.

step-1: in a microwave-safe ramekin or small bowl, combine the almond flour, baking powder, parmesan, rosemary, garlic powder, salt, pepper, melted butter, and egg.
step-2: stir everything together with a fork until smooth.
step-3: microwave on high for 90 seconds, until the bread has risen.
step-4: let the bread cool in the ramekin, then serve as desired.

step-1: in a saucepan, boil ½ cup (100 g) sugar, water, and acai puree.
step-2: reduce heat to simmer and cook until mixture thickens into a syrup.
step-3: add lemon when thickening.
step-4: let cool before using.
step-5: preheat oven to 225˚f (105˚c).
step-6: line a baking sheet with parchment paper and set aside.
step-7: in a bowl, using an electric mixer, beat the egg whites until they are foamy.
step-8: add salt and lemon juice.
step-9: continue whisking.
step-10: slowly add sugar while whisking and beat until glossy, stiff peaks form.
step-11: spoon meringue mixture on the parchment sheet and smooth the top of the meringue with the back of the spoon.
step-12: drizzle about ¼ teaspoon of acai syrup on the meringue and swirl with a toothpick.
step-13: repeat for each cookie.
step-14: bake for 90 minutes, until the outside shell becomes stiff and the meringue has gone from shiny to matte.
step-15: the cookie should easily lift off the parchment.

step-1: make the bammy: add the cassava to a food processor and pulse until finely shredded.
step-2: transfer to a clean towel and squeeze to extract excess liquid until the cassava is fully dry.
step-3: transfer to a medium bowl and break up the cassava.
step-4: sprinkle in the salt and stir to distribute.
step-5: heat an 8-inch (20 cm) skillet over medium-low heat.
step-6: carefully pour half of the cassava into the pan.
step-7: use a silicone spatula to pat the cassava into a disc.
step-8: cook the bammy for about 6-8 minutes on each side, until light golden brown..
step-9: transfer the bammy to a shallow dish filled with the coconut milk and let soak for 1 minute.
step-10: do not let soak too long, or the bammy will fall apart.
step-11: add 1 tablespoon of canola oil to the skillet and carefully transfer the bammy back to the pan.
step-12: fry for another 5 minutes on each side, until light golden brown.
step-13: repeat with the remaining cassava.
step-14: set aside.
step-15: make the ackee and saltfish: rinse the salted cod in a bowl with 4 cups (960 ml) of cold water.
step-16: drain and repeat twice more.
step-17: add the rinsed cod to a small saucepan with 4 cups (960 ml) of water.
step-18: bring to a boil and cook for 15 minutes.
step-19: drain and repeat once more.
step-20: transfer the fish to a medium bowl.
step-21: use 2 forks or your hands to flake the fish into chunks.
step-22: set aside.
step-23: heat the canola oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
step-24: once shimmering, add the onion, red and green bell pepper, tomato, garlic, scotch bonnet, thyme, pepper, and salt.
step-25: sauté, stirring occasionally, for 8-10 minutes, until slightly softened.
step-26: add the ackee, flaked saltfish, and scallions and carefully fold in to the vegetables.
step-27: sauté for 4-5 minutes more, until warmed through.
step-28: season to taste with more salt if needed.
step-29: slice the warm bammies into quarters, then serve with the ackee and saltfish.

step-1: in a large cast-iron skillet, heat the oil over medium heat.
step-2: add the garlic and onions, cooking until the onions are translucent and the garlic is starting to slightly brown.
step-3: add the spices and harissa paste, cooking the spices until fragrant, about 1 minute.
step-4: add the tomatoes and tomato paste and cook for about 10-15 minutes until the sauce has thickened to the point where pressing down with a spoon leaves an indent that holds its shape.
step-5: taking the back of a large spoon, make 5 large indents into the sauce, using a left-to-right wiggling motion to ensure that the “walls” of the sauce are tall enough to hold an egg.
step-6: crack the eggs into each of the indents, then cook over low heat for about 15-20 minutes until the eggs are cooked to your liking.
step-7: note: to speed the process up, cover the skillet with a large lid.
step-8: sprinkle with chopped parsley, remove from heat, and serve with crusty bread to mop up all the sauce.

step-1: evenly spread almond butter over one side of the tortilla.
step-2: place banana along one edge of the tortilla, and roll up.
step-3: slice the roll into small pieces.
step-4: inspired by: http://www.thegraciouspantry.com/clean-eating-banana-wrap/

step-1: line an 8x8 baking pan with parchment paper.
step-2: evenly spread the yogurt over the bottom of the pan.
step-3: top with berries.
step-4: freeze at least 2 hours.
step-5: remove from freezer and break into pieces.
step-6: inspired by: http://www.myfussyeater.com/frozen-yogurt-bark/

step-1: slice apples horizontally, about ¼-inch (6 mm) thick.
step-2: using a spoon or small round object carefully push the center of the apple out.
step-3: spread on peanut butter, then top with granola and chocolate chips.

step-1: in a bowl, mix the tuna, mayonnaise, mustard, salt, and pepper.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: slice a cucumber into 4 sections.
step-4: use a melon baller to hollow out the center, not quite through to the bottom.
step-5: fill each cucumber with tuna mixture, and top with half of a cherry tomato.

step-1: slice zucchini at an angle into ¼-inch slices.
step-2: place on a baking sheet, and broil for 4 minutes.
step-3: top each zucchini slice with marinara, mozzarella, and toppings of your choice (we used mini pepperoni).
step-4: broil an additional 3 minutes.
step-5: inspired by: http://damndelicious.net/²⁰¹⁴⁄₀₆/04/zucchini-pizza-bites/

step-1: sift flour into a large bowl, with a pinch of salt, caster sugar and the zest of one lemon.
step-2: mix.
step-3: in a large saucepan, add the boiling water, butter and vanilla extract.
step-4: heat gently until the butter is melted.
step-5: once the mixture in the saucepan is boiling, turn off the heat and add the flour mixture.
step-6: beat quickly until lump free and leave to cool for 5 minutes.
step-7: beat in three large eggs one by one until the mixture is thick and sticky.
step-8: leave to cool for another 10-15 minutes.
step-9: transfer churro mixture into a piping bag with a wide star nozzle.
step-10: heat oil in a large saucepan until 180°c (350°f).
step-11: pipe the churro mix into the oil, snipping the end with scissors.
step-12: cook 3-4 at a time.
step-13: cook for 5 minutes until golden brown.
step-14: drain the churros on some kitchen towel, then coat in a cinnamon sugar mix.
step-15: serve with strawberry jam and clotted cream for a delicious twist on afternoon tea!

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: spread a layer of alfredo sauce on the baking dish.
step-3: place chicken breast over sauce.
step-4: season chicken with salt and pepper, to taste.
step-5: spread broccoli over chicken.
step-6: pour remaining alfredo over chicken and broccoli.
step-7: top with parmesan cheese.
step-8: bake for 40 minutes.

step-1: in a large pot over medium-high heat, add the potatoes, garlic, and cover with cold water.
step-2: add a big pinch of salt.
step-3: bring to a boil, reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer until the potatoes are fork-tender, about 20 minutes.
step-4: drain potatoes and garlic in a colander and press them through the holes of the colander with a metal spoon back into the pot.
step-5: alternatively, use a potato ricer.
step-6: add the butter and one clove of garlic to the potatoes and stir over medium-low heat with a rubber spatula until melted and smooth.
step-7: pour in the heavy cream and stir again until combined.
step-8: gradually add in the cheese, stirring between each addition, until completely melted.
step-9: continue stirring the potatoes until smooth, thick, and elastic.
step-10: begin to stretch the potatoes upwards with the spatula.
step-11: if the mixture is breaking, add in more cheese.
step-12: if the mixture is too thick add in more cream.
step-13: serve immediately as a side with roasted veggies or a meat of choice, or alone with fresh chopped garlic!

step-1: spread almond butter on the toast and top with blueberries.
step-2: sprinkle granola on top.

step-1: combine dates, almonds, almond butter, salt, and half of the coconut in a food processor and blend until a sticky dough forms.
step-2: (if dough is not coming together, add one tablespoon of water and continue blending.)
step-3: wet your hands and form dough into 2 tablespoon-sized ball.
step-4: roll in remaining shredded coconut.
step-5: let dry at room temperature for 2 hours before serving.
step-6: store in an airtight container.

step-1: cut sweet potato into thin slices, about ¼ inch (6 mm) thick.
step-2: place in toaster and set it to the maximum cook time.
step-3: when it pops, flip the sweet potato slices over and toast 1 more time.
step-4: depending on the strength of your toaster and your preferences, you may need to toast it 1 more time after that.
step-5: remove from toaster and let cool enough to handle.
step-6: spread almond butter evenly across sweet potato toast.
step-7: top with fresh blueberries, pomegranate seeds.

step-1: in a medium bowl, add oats, nut butter, and honey or maple syrup, and mix until well combined.
step-2: spray baking dish with cooking spray.
step-3: pour in mixture and spread evenly.
step-4: cover and place in freezer until firm.
step-5: cut into bars and serve.

step-1: in a medium bowl, mix the yogurt, almond milk, vanilla, honey, chia seeds, and cocoa powder together until well combined.
step-2: pour the mixture into an airtight container and refrigerate, covered for 4 hours.
step-3: spoon the pudding into desired serving dish and top with slivered almonds and chocolate shavings.

step-1: mix breading ingredients together in large bowl.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: *note: you can crush almonds by pulsing them in a food processor or high-speed blender, or by carefully cutting almonds with a sharp knife.
step-4: whisk egg in a separate bowl.
step-5: dredge the salmon in the egg, then the breading mixture.
step-6: heat olive oil in a skillet on medium heat.
step-7: once the pan is ready, add the salmon and let cook on one side for 3-4 minutes until golden brown.
step-8: flip and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes on the other side.
step-9: serve salmon with a side of your favorite veggies.
step-10: we used asparagus.

step-1: in a medium bowl, soak 1 cup of raw almonds in 2 cups (.5 l) of water overnight.
step-2: drain the bowl of water and place the almonds in a blender.
step-3: add 1 tablespoon vanilla, 3 tablespoons honey, 1 pinch of salt, and 4 cups (1 l) of water to the blender.
step-4: blend the mixture on high for 90 seconds.
step-5: use a cheesecloth to strain the liquid into a pouring container.
step-6: (optional) refrigerate 1-2 hours or serve immediately.

step-1: line an 8-inch (20 cm) square baking dish with parchment paper.
step-2: add the almonds, dates, pretzels, salt, milk, and vanilla to a food processor and pulse until the mixture starts to clump together.
step-3: transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish and press into an even layer.
step-4: drizzle the top with greek yogurt, if desired.
step-5: chill for 1 hour.
step-6: remove the bars from the baking dish by lifting the parchment paper.
step-7: cut into 12 individual bars.
step-8: serve immediately or store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.

step-1: char the bell pepper over a burner or under a broiler until it is well-blackened on all sides.
step-2: wrap in a plastic bag and set aside until cool enough to handle, then peel and seed the pepper.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: heat the oil in a large skillet over high heat.
step-5: add the chiles de árbol and habanero and toast until fragrant, about 3 minutes; toward the end of toasting, add the pine nuts and almonds and toast until fragrant.
step-6: add the tomatillos, tomatoes, water and three-fourths teaspoon salt, and cook over high heat until the tomatillos are tender, about 10 minutes.
step-7: transfer mixture to a blender along with the bell pepper and purée until smooth.
step-8: add the red wine vinegar and adjust seasoning.
step-9: the salsa should be thick enough to generously coat the back of a spoon.
step-10: any unused salsa will keep, covered tightly, in the refrigerator for a week.

step-1: mix together the patty ingredients until evenly combined.
step-2: flatten the beef into a thin layer, then place a chunk of cheddar inside, wrapping the beef completely around the cheddar.
step-3: form a patty with your hands.
step-4: repeat with the remaining beef and cheese.
step-5: heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
step-6: cook the burgers for 3 minutes on the first side, flip, then cook for 6 more minutes.
step-7: assemble the burgers with the bun, bacon, tomato, and lettuce.

step-1: combine the chicken with all the marinade ingredients in a large bowl.
step-2: stir to make sure each piece of chicken is coated evenly, then cover with cling film and chill for about an hour.
step-3: combine all of the breading ingredients in a large bowl, then roll the marinated chicken pieces in the flour, shaking off excess.
step-4: repeat with the rest of the chicken.
step-5: heat oil in a skillet over high heat to about 350°f.
step-6: fry 3-4 pieces at a time for about 15-20 minutes until the breading is dark golden brown, flipping several times to ensure the breading cooks evenly and does not burn.
step-7: the heat of the oil should drop to about 320°f.
step-8: drain the chicken on paper towels or on a wire rack, resting for about 10-15 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-2: in a bowl, add the crushed graham crackers and melted butter and stir to combine.
