step-3: place the graham cracker mixture in a greased 8-inch (20-cm) springform pan, spreading them in an even layer.
step-4: bake for 20 minutes or until in turns slightly golden on the top.
step-5: in a bowl, mix the cream cheese and sugar using a hand mixer until smooth.
step-6: add the eggs and vanilla, and continue beating until all ingredients are fully incorporated.
step-7: add the cream cheese mixture to the top of the graham cracker crust.
step-8: bake for 1 hour, or until it looks semi-jiggly in the center and set on the edges.
step-9: refrigerate for 12 hours, or overnight.

step-1: heat the oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
step-2: add the beef and stir to break up.
step-3: season with the salt, pepper, cumin, chili powder, paprika, and cayenne.
step-4: stir and cook until deep brown in color, 10-15 minutes.
step-5: add the onion, bell pepper, garlic, chipotles, and a pinch of salt.
step-6: cook until the vegetables are softened, about 10 minutes.
step-7: add the tomato paste and cook until it darkens, becomes aromatic, and starts sticking to the bottom of the pan, 10 minutes.
step-8: add the chopped tomatoes, beef broth, black beans, and kidney beans.
step-9: stir to incorporate, then bring to a boil.
step-10: cover, reduce the heat to low, and simmer for at least 30 minutes or up to 2 hours.
step-11: ladle the chili over the fries and top with cheddar cheese, sour cream, and green onions.

step-1: in a large bowl, crumble the cake into fine, uniform crumbs.
step-2: add the vanilla frosting and mix thoroughly.
step-3: scoop about 2 tablespoons of the cake mixture at a time and roll into balls.
step-4: you should have 36 total.
step-5: working with half of the white chocolate chips and half of the coconut oil at a time so the mixture stays melted, combine in a medium bowl and microwave on medium heat in 30-second intervals until melted, about 2 minutes.
step-6: stir until smooth.
step-7: dip ½ inch (1 ¼ cm) of each lollipop stick in the melted white chocolate mixture.
step-8: insert each stick ½ inch (1 ¼ cm) into the center of a cake ball.
step-9: refrigerate for 10 minutes.
step-10: make the cake pop stand: use a marker to mark 36 evenly spaced dots on the foam.
step-11: use a lollipop stick to make holes where the dots are, about ½-inch (1 ¼ cm) deep.
step-12: make the blue cake pops: working in batches of 3, dip 9 cake pops in the melted white chocolate, using a spoon to help coat.
step-13: let the excess drip off.
step-14: sprinkle the pops with blue sprinkles.
step-15: place the cake pops 3 x 3 (7 x 7 cm) in the upper left corner of the cake pop stand.
step-16: note: if the melted white chocolate is dripping down the lollipop stick, allow the mixture to cool for 5 minutes before trying again.
step-17: if the white chocolate cools too much, microwave for 15 seconds.
step-18: make the red cake pops: working in batches of 3, dip the remaining 27 cake pops in the melted white chocolate, using a spoon to help coat.
step-19: let the excess drip off.
step-20: carefully dip one side of the cake pop into the red sprinkle mixture.
step-21: let sit in sprinkles for 30 seconds to set.
step-22: let dry completely in the stand, with the sprinkles positioned towards the top of the cake stand.
step-23: let the cake pops dry completely.
step-24: store at room temperature for up to 2 days before serving.

step-1: place crackers into box.
step-2: roll up turkey slices and place into box.
step-3: place carrots into box, and a scoop of honey mustard.
step-4: refrigerate until ready to eat.

step-1: preheat oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-2: place a medium mixing bowl in the refrigerator to chill.
step-3: cut a round of parchment paper to the same circumference as the base of the pan, with a hole in the center that is the same circumference as the can.
step-4: line the springform with the parchment.
step-5: cover the sides of the can completely with parchment, securing with tape and making sure that the tape is covered by parchment.
step-6: in a medium bowl, sift the flour and ½ cup (100 grams) of the sugar together.
step-7: in a large bowl, combine the egg whites, vanilla extract, salt, and cream of tartar.
step-8: using an electric mixer, beat the mixture on medium speed until soft peaks form.
step-9: you will know when they’ve reached the soft peak stage because the whites will just barely be able to hold their shape.
step-10: increase the mixer speed to high and gradually add the remaining cup of sugar, 2 tablespoons at a time.
step-11: beat until the mixture forms stiff peaks.
step-12: this may take up to 10-12 minutes.
step-13: you will know that you are getting close to stiff peaks when the whites turn very glossy with a satin-like appearance.
step-14: lift the beater out of the bowl and check if the peak stands straight up in a point with no curling at the tip.
step-15: once it does, your ready for the next step.
step-16: sift the flour and sugar mixture into the egg whites, about ⅓ cup (80 ml) at a time.
step-17: using a large flexible spatula, carefully fold in the flour until there are no clumps left.
step-18: be careful not to overmix at this point, which will deflate the batter and decrease the volume of the cake.
step-19: add ¼ cup (60 ml) water to the can to weigh it down, so it stays steady in the springform pan.
step-20: carefully transfer the batter to the prepared pan, working your way around the aluminum can and smoothing the top of the batter with the flexible spatula.
step-21: bake for 40-45 minutes, until the cake has risen completely, nearly reached the top of the pan, and the top is evenly golden brown with a few cracks.
step-22: the top of the cake should spring back when gently pressed with your fingertip.
step-23: if there is any indentation left, the cake needs to bake for longer.
step-24: return to the oven and check every 5 minutes.
step-25: remove the springform pan from the oven.
step-26: pour out any excess water from the can, then replace can and immediately invert the pan over a wire rack.
step-27: (the soda can will prop up the cake while it cools, allowing air to circulate around it.) let cool completely, about 45 minutes.
step-28: meanwhile, prepare the strawberries.
step-29: in a medium bowl, toss to combine the sliced strawberries with the lemon juice and sugar.
step-30: refrigerate the berries until you are ready to serve the cake.
step-31: remove the aluminum can from the center of the cake.
step-32: carefully run a knife along the outer edge of the pan to release the cake (it should release easily).
step-33: remove the parchment paper.
step-34: top the cake with whipped cream and macerated strawberries.

step-1: heat the oil in a large pot until it reaches 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper and dust with flour.
step-3: add the flour, granulated sugar, salt, baking powder, and baking soda to a large bowl.
step-4: whisk to combine.
step-5: rub the butter cubes into the dry mixture until well-incorporated and no large chunks remain.
step-6: in a small bowl or liquid measuring cup, combine the buttermilk, egg yolks, eggs, and vanilla.
step-7: whisk with a fork to combine.
step-8: make a well in the center of the dry ingredients.
step-9: pour the wet ingredients into the well and fold together gently with a spatula until no flour streaks remain.
step-10: flour a clean surface and dump the dough from the bowl.
step-11: sprinkle a generous amount of flour on top of the dough and shape into a disc.
step-12: wrap the dough in plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator for 15 minutes.
step-13: remove the dough from the refrigerator, sprinkle with more flour, and roll out to ½ inch (1-cm) thick.
step-14: flour a 3½-inch (9-cm) round cookie cutter and cut rounds from the dough, then cut out the centers using a ½-inch (1-cm) cookie cutter.
step-15: place the cut doughnuts on the prepared baking sheet.
step-16: reroll the leftover dough, keeping the cut-out centers, to make more doughnuts.
step-17: make the animal shapes: for cat doughnuts, cut a small triangle out of the top of a doughnut.
step-18: for dog doughnuts, use the small cookie cutter to cut 2 half circles out of the bottom of the doughnut and press the cut edges to round.
step-19: for the bear and frog doughnuts, use a wet finger to press 2 divots at the top of a doughnut, then attach 2 cut-out centers for ears.
step-20: flip the doughnuts over so the side with the centers is against the baking sheet.
step-21: working in batches, lower the doughnuts carefully into the hot oil.
step-22: fry for about 1 minute, then flip and fry for another minute, until golden brown all over.
step-23: remove the doughnuts from the oil using tongs or a spider.
step-24: cool on a wire rack for 2-3 minutes.
step-25: to make the glaze, add the powdered sugar, honey, and ¼ cup (60 ml) of milk to a large bowl and whisk until smooth.
step-26: add food coloring of your choice, if desired.
step-27: dip the doughnuts in the glaze.
step-28: return to the wire rack and let dry.
step-29: decorate, if desired.
step-30: use melted chocolate and leftover glaze to pipe faces onto the different animal doughnuts.

step-1: prepare pancake mix per box instructions.
step-2: heat a nonstick pan or pancake griddle on medium heat.
step-3: for large pancakes, pour 1 cup (235 ml) of batter onto the pan.
step-4: for small pancakes, pour a little less than ¼ cup (60 ml) of batter onto the pan.
step-5: for medium pancakes, pour ⅓ cup (80 ml) of batter onto the pan.
step-6: allow to cook until bubbles form and begin to pop all around the pancake.
step-7: the pancake will also lose its shiny sheen and begin to look more matte.
step-8: flip and cook on the other side for 2-3 minutes, or until the bottom is lightly browned.
step-9: for the lion pancake, you’ll need 1 large pancake, 1 small pancake, sliced strawberries for the mane and nose, blueberries for the eyes, and chocolate chips for the mouth.
step-10: for the monkey pancake, you’ll need 1 large pancake, 2 small pancakes, 1 medium pancake, blueberries for the eyes and nose, and chocolate chips for the mouth.
step-11: for the owl pancake, you’ll need 1 large pancake, sliced bananas for the eyes and feathers, blueberries for the eyes, and sliced strawberries for the beak and wings.
step-12: for the pig pancake, you’ll need 1 large pancake, 1 small pancake, chocolate chips for the snout, blueberries for the eyes, and sliced strawberries for the ears.
step-13: make your favorite animal pancakes and top with syrup, or another favorite pancake topping.

step-1: to make the rabbit: julienne the carrot and set aside.
step-2: slice one side of the boiled egg so it sits longways.
step-3: chop the sliced egg white into tiny cubes and set aside.
step-4: to create the ears, use a paring knife and make two slits touching at one end.
step-5: do not slit too deep.
step-6: prop up the ears by stuffing the egg white cubes under the slits.
step-7: for the nose, poke a hole and place a piece of the julienned carrot.
step-8: place the black sesame seeds for eyes.
step-9: to make the hedgehog: cut the tip of the straw on a diagonal.
step-10: slice one side of the boiled egg so it sits longways.
step-11: chop the sliced egg white into tiny cubes and set aside.
step-12: to create spikes, use the straw to make 6 slits on the egg, touching at one end.
step-13: do not slit too deep.
step-14: prop up the slits by stuffing the egg white cubes under the slits.
step-15: for the nose, poke a hole and place a black peppercorn.
step-16: place the black sesame seeds for eyes.
step-17: to make the owl: slice the olive thinly.
step-18: slice the boiled egg’s bottom part so the egg sits stable.
step-19: chop the sliced egg white and set aside.
step-20: for the ears, make a slit in a shape of a “v” on each side of the eggs.
step-21: for the belly make 5 slits in a shape of a “v”.
step-22: push the slits up with using a toothpick.
step-23: for the beak, make a slit in a shape of a “v”.
step-24: prop up the beak by stuffing the egg white cubes under the slits.
step-25: place two olive slices for eyes.
step-26: for the mouse: slice the carrot and save 1 piece for making ears and julienne the rest for the tail.
step-27: using a pastry tip, cut out the sliced carrot into two circles for ears.
step-28: slice one side of the boiled egg so it sits longways.
step-29: chop the sliced egg white into tiny cubes and set aside.
step-30: make two slits for inserting ears with using a paring knife.
step-31: insert the cut-out carrots for ears.
step-32: for the nose, poke a hole and place a pink peppercorn.
step-33: place the black sesame seeds for eyes.
step-34: place one of the julienne carrot pieces into the opposite side for the tail.

step-1: add the almond milk to a small pot over medium heat.
step-2: add the turmeric, ginger, peppercorns, cinnamon stick, star anise, and cloves.
step-3: whisk to combine.
step-4: heat the milk for 4-5 minutes, until steaming, but do not let it come to a boil.
step-5: serve warm or over ice and sweeten to taste.

step-1: heat the vegetable oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
step-2: add the onion, ginger, garlic, salt, and pepper, cook for about 3 minutes, until the onions begin to soften and become aromatic.
step-3: add the brown sugar, turmeric, and curry paste and stir to coat the aromatics.
step-4: cook until the mixture is fragrant and begins to simmer, about 5 minutes.
step-5: add the potatoes and coconut milk.
step-6: stir to combine and bring to a boil.
step-7: once boiling, cover, reduce the heat to low, and simmer until the potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.
step-8: remove from the heat.
step-9: ladle the soup into bowls and garnish with whatever vegetables and herbs you have on hand.

step-1: in a medium bowl, whisk together the olive oil, vinegar, honey, salt, and pepper.
step-2: spiralize the green cabbage, purple cabbage, and green apple then transfer to a large bowl.
step-3: pour dressing over slaw and stir to combine.
step-4: serve with salmon fillets.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: roll out the sheet of puff pastry and cut into 8 equal rectangles.
step-3: cut a border about 1 cm (½ inch) from the outside, not cutting all the way through the pastry.
step-4: spread the blackcurrant jam all over the center.
step-5: layer apples in an overlapping pattern.
step-6: sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon.
step-7: transfer to parchment-lined tray and brush with egg wash.
step-8: bake for 25 minutes, then cool.
step-9: mix together the icing sugar and milk until it is a thick paste.
step-10: drizzle over the cooled pastries.

step-1: preheat the oven to 550°f (285°c), or as high as your oven will go.
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: using a serrated knife, slice the baguette crosswise on a slight diagonal into ½-inch (1 cm) slices.
step-4: transfer the baguette slices to the prepared baking sheet.
step-5: top each piece of bread with 1-2 slices of brie cheese.
step-6: bake for 5 minutes, or until brie begins to bubble and the bread is toasted.
step-7: top each piece of bread with 1-2 apple slices and candied walnuts.
step-8: drizzle with honey.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: cut apples into ⅛ inch (3 mm) to ¼-inch (6 mm) slices.
step-3: arrange slices on a baking sheet.
step-4: spray apples with nonstick spray or brush with oil.
step-5: then sprinkle apples with cinnamon.
step-6: bake for 30 minutes, flipping halfway.
step-7: let cool.

step-1: place the apples, cinnamon sticks, ginger, cloves, and salt in an 8-quart (7.5-liters) slow cooker.
step-2: pour the water over the apples.
step-3: cover and cook on high for at least 8 hours, or overnight (up to 24 hours).
step-4: remove the solids from the cider, pressing the pulp to extract as much liquid as possible.
step-5: whisk in the brown sugar until dissolved.
step-6: serve hot, or store in the refrigerator to serve later.
step-7: reheat before serving.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, whisk together the brown sugar, granulated sugar, salt, olive oil, and vanilla.
step-3: whisk in the eggs, 1 at a time, until fully incorporated.
step-4: add the baking soda, cinnamon, half of the flour, and half of the cider and whisk to combine.
step-5: add the remaining flour and the rest of the cider and whisk until completely combined.
step-6: line a 12-cup muffin tin with paper liners.
step-7: pour the batter into the muffin tin, filling each cup about ⅔ full.
step-8: bake for 20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center of a cupcake comes out clean.
step-9: let cool.
step-10: make the frosting: in a large bowl, cream the butter and cream cheese together with an electric hand mixer until light and fluffy, about 5 minutes.
step-11: add the powdered sugar in 3 to 4 additions, mixing in between each until incorporated.
step-12: add the cinnamon, apple cider, and vanilla and mix to combine.
step-13: transfer the frosting to a piping bag or zip-top bag.
step-14: pipe the frosting onto the cupcakes.
step-15: top with a sprinkle of cinnamon.

step-1: bring apple cider to a boil over medium-high heat.
step-2: reduce down to ½ cup (120 ml) (takes about 20-25 minutes).
step-3: pour into a large glass measuring cup.
step-4: add butter to hot cider and stir to melt.
step-5: set aside, cool.
step-6: in a large bowl, whisk together eggs with white and brown sugar.
step-7: add cooled cider/butter mixture, sour cream, and vanilla extract.
step-8: in a large bowl or in a fine mesh strainer set over the wet ingredients, sift together flour, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
step-9: using a wooden spoon, mix dry ingredients into the wet until just incorporated.
step-10: cover and chill for 1 hour.
step-11: on a very well-floured surface, roll out the cooled dough to about ¾-inch (2 cm) thickness and cut into donut shapes using pastry cutters or a mason jar/cup and a bottle cap/shot glass.
step-12: chill cut donuts 10 minutes more if necessary.
step-13: heat oil to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-14: fry donuts, 3-4 at a time, flipping occasionally until golden on both sides.
step-15: remove to a paper towel lined baking sheet to drain.
step-16: roll in cinnamon sugar while still warm.

step-1: combine flour, salt, cinnamon, allspice and baking powder in a bowl.
step-2: in separate bowl, combine eggs, sugar and vanilla.
step-3: blend.
step-4: add apple cider and milk.
step-5: blend until well incorporated.
step-6: slowly add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, blend until you have a smooth and creamy batter.
step-7: heat vegetable oil in a deep skillet.
step-8: transfer the batter into a zipper bag and trim the corner.
step-9: pour batter in funnel cake shapes into the hot oil.
step-10: once golden brown, flip and cook the other side (1 min max).
step-11: remove and drain on paper towel.
step-12: dust with powdered sugar and top with ice cream.

step-1: place the apple peels and cores (optional) in a quart-sized jar with a wide mouth.
step-2: cover the peels completely with the water.
step-3: add the sugar and stir.
step-4: make sure your scraps are completely covered with water.
step-5: cover the mouth of the jar with a coffee filter or a thin cloth, then screw on the outer ring of the lid.
step-6: let sit in a dark area at room temperature for 1-2 weeks, stirring the mix once a day to stimulate proper fermentation and prevent mold from forming.
step-7: when you notice some fizz and a significant amount of bubbles on the surface, strain out the scraps and compost them.
step-8: put the liquid back in the jar, cover with a coffee filter or a thin cloth, and let it sit.
step-9: taste it once a week and once it has reached your desired level acidity, cover with a lid or transfer to a closed bottle to stop the fermentation.
step-10: the apple cider vinegar will keep for about a year in the refrigerator.

step-1: add all ingredients into a mason jar or serving container.
step-2: secure lid and shake well to combine.
step-3: serve over your favorite salad.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: cut the bread into 1-inch (2 ½ cm) cubes.
step-3: dice peeled apples into small bite-size pieces.
step-4: in a medium bowl, mix together the bread, apples, sugar, and cornstarch.
step-5: in a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, vanilla, and cinnamon.
step-6: pour egg mixture into the bread bowl.
step-7: give the ingredients a good stir, then pour into a 9x13-inch (33 cm x 23 cm) greased baking tray.
step-8: drizzle with maple syrup.
step-9: bake for 45 minutes or until golden brown.

step-1: add the instant oatmeal, freeze-dried apples, pecans, cinnamon, vanilla bean, and sugar into a mason jar.
step-2: store in a cool, dry place for up to a month.
step-3: to prepare, pour boiling water or milk over oats.
step-4: stir to combine and let sit for 3 minutes.
step-5: serve with fresh chopped apples.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: remove the core and thinly slice apples.
step-3: place apple slices in a large bowl and gently mix in sugar, cornstarch, and cinnamon.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: in another bowl, combine flour, oats, brown sugar, baking soda, salt, and butter.
step-6: mix until crumbly.
step-7: line a 9x13-inch (23x33 cm) baking dish with parchment paper and pour ⅔ of the oats mixture in the bottom of the pan, pressing firmly to pack it down to make a crust.
step-8: pour apples over the crust and spread in an even layer.
step-9: pour the remaining oat mixture over the top and spread evenly.
step-10: bake for 30 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-11: cool completely before cutting.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f/180°c.
step-2: peel the skin from the apples and grate on the coarse side of a cheese grater.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: (to prevent browning, place grated apples in a bowl and cover with lemon juice and water.
step-5: drain before adding to the batter.)
step-6: in a large bowl, beat the eggs with a whisk until foamy and pale.
step-7: add the greek yogurt, honey, and vanilla, to the bowl and whisk until the mixture is thick and well combined.
step-8: sprinkle on the rolled oats, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, and the grated apple.
step-9: use a spatula to fold the wet and dry ingredients together.
step-10: pour in the almond milk and continue mixing until everything is well incorporated.
step-11: using a medium ice cream scoop, portion the batter into 12 muffin tin cups lined with cupcake liners.
step-12: top with your choice of toppings.
step-13: bake for 35-40 minutes, until the muffins have set and just started to turn golden brown.

step-1: preheat your oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-2: in a cast-iron skillet over medium-low heat, add the apples, sugar, cornstarch, lemon juice, spices, and salt.
step-3: mix to combine and stir for 5-10 minutes until the mixture starts to thicken.
step-4: let simmer for 5 minutes on low heat.
step-5: sprinkle the box cake mix over the apple filling.
step-6: add the nuts and evenly distribute the sliced butter over the top to ensure even baking.
step-7: bake for 45 minutes to an hour, until the top is golden brown.
step-8: serve warm with ice cream.

step-1: add steel-cut oats, cinnamon, salt, maple syrup, apples, water, and milk to a greased slow cooker.
step-2: stir then cover.
step-3: cook on low for 7-8 hours.
step-4: carefully remove lid and serve with chopped nuts.

step-1: preheat oven to 160°c (325°f).
step-2: in a medium saucepan, cook the apple, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, lemon zest, vanilla extract, and the juice of half a lemon until soft and fragrant.
step-3: mash until the mix resembles a paste.
step-4: let cool.
step-5: cream the butter and brown sugar with a hand mixer in a large bowl, smoothing out with a wooden spoon if needed.
step-6: sift in the flour, cornflour, baking powder, cinnamon, and ground cloves and mix until incorporated.
step-7: add one of the eggs and mix in.
step-8: repeat twice until all three eggs are fully incorporated to make the batter.
step-9: fold in the apple mixture.
step-10: pour cupcake mix into a muffin tin lined with cupcake cases.
step-11: fill about halfway.
step-12: bake for 30-35 minutes.
step-13: let cool.
step-14: in a small bowl, rub the flour, oats, brown sugar, and butter together with your fingers until you have a crumble.
step-15: transfer to a small tin and toast under the grill for 5-10 minutes until golden brown.
step-16: top the cupcakes with whipped cream and the crumble mix.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: grease a bundt pan.
step-3: combine apples, butter, brown sugar, lemon juice, vanilla extract, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and cornstarch in a large saucepan.
step-4: cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until apples have browned and softened and sauce has thickened, about 10 minutes.
step-5: drain excess sauce into a separate bowl.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: cut each biscuit in half and flatten into rounds.
step-8: stuff each round with a tablespoon of apples.
step-9: close the round together by pinching at the seam and roll into ball using your hands.
step-10: layer half of the balls in the pan and spoon half of the reserved sauce on top.
step-11: repeat with remaining balls and sauce.
step-12: bake for 30 minutes.
step-13: cover with foil and bake for additional 10-15 minutes.
step-14: cool for 15 minutes.
step-15: whisk together the powdered sugar, vanilla, and milk, until you reach a smooth consistency.
step-16: drizzle over bread.
step-17: removing bread from the pan and drizzle with icing.

step-1: place apples and honey in a food processor or blender and puree into a thick, smooth sauce.
step-2: transfer the sauce to a sauce pan over medium heat and cook, stirring frequently, until enough moisture has cooked off that pools of liquid are no longer forming when running a spatula through the mixture, about 5-7 minutes.
step-3: pour the sauce onto a baking tray lined with a silicone baking mat and smooth into a thin, even layer.
step-4: bake for 6 hours at 175ºf (80ºc), until entire surface is just dry to the touch.
step-5: once cool, turn the baking mat onto a cutting board and remove the silicone baking mat.
step-6: roll the fruit sheet and cut into 1-inch (2 cm) pieces.
step-7: note: if your fruit sheet comes out a bit too dry and you worry that rolling will cause it to crack, simply cover the surface with a few damp paper towels for a few minutes and try again.
step-8: the moisture will rehydrate your fruit sheet just enough to be a flexible consistency.

step-1: make the pie dough: in a medium bowl, combine the flour, sugar, and salt.
step-2: mix with fork.
step-3: add the butter and work into the flour with a fork until only pea-size lumps remain.
step-4: add the apple cider vinegar and mix into the dough with your fingers.
step-5: gradually add the ice water and mix with your hands until the dough starts to come together.
step-6: add more water as needed if the dough is dry.
step-7: the dough should not be very tacky or sticky.
step-8: shape the dough into a rough ball and cover with plastic wrap.
step-9: chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-10: meanwhile, make the apple filling: in a large skillet over medium heat, combine the sliced apples, lemon juice, cinnamon, and sugar.
step-11: cook, stirring continuously, until the apples are soft, about 10 minutes.
step-12: add the butter and stir to incorporate.
step-13: remove the pan from the heat and let the filling cool.
step-14: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-15: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-16: on a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough into a round that is about ⅛-inch (3 mm) thick.
step-17: roll the dough around the rolling pin and transfer to the prepared baking sheet.
step-18: spoon the apple filling into the center of the dough, leaving a 2-inch (5 cm) border around the edges.
step-19: fold the edges over the apples.
step-20: brush the egg wash over the crust and sprinkle coarse sugar all over the galette.
step-21: bake the galette for 25 minutes, until the crust is golden brown.
step-22: meanwhile, make the caramel sauce: in a small pot, combine the sugar, salt, and butter.
step-23: cook over medium heat until the sugar dissolves and turns amber in color, 2-3 minutes, swirling the pan occasionally.
step-24: pour in the heavy cream and stir with wooden spoon.
step-25: remove from the heat and let cool slightly.
step-26: drizzle the caramel sauce over the galette, then slice and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 300°f (150°c).
step-2: place the apple peels on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-3: mix the sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl and sprinkle it over the peels.
step-4: toss the peels with your hands until evenly coated with the sugar mixture.
step-5: bake for about 30 minutes, tossing the peels halfway through with a pair of tongs.
step-6: let cool before eating.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: cut the cinnamon roll dough into 3 even strips, then cut those strip in 3 pieces, making 9 pieces total per cinnamon roll.
step-3: set aside the icing.
step-4: in a medium bowl, combine eggs, milk, cinnamon, and extract, stirring until smooth.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: in a pan over medium-high heat, combine butter, apples, and brown sugar, cooking until sugar starts to caramelize, about 10 minutes.
step-7: remove from heat.
step-8: sprinkle the cinnamon roll dough pieces evenly in a 9×9in (23 x 23cm) baking tray.
step-9: pour the egg mixture on top, followed by the apples.
step-10: drizzle the reserved icing on top.
step-11: bake for 25–30 minutes, until golden brown.
step-12: serve with ice cream!

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine the grated apple, almond butter, maple syrup, and vanilla, and stir until smooth.
step-2: add the oats, cinnamon, and salt, and mix until evenly distributed.
step-3: chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-4: use a tablespoon to scoop out the mixture, then roll into balls with your hands.
step-5: store in the refrigerator in an airtight container for up to 1 week.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (175°c).
step-2: slice the bread into ½ inch (1 cm) cubes.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the eggs, milk, vanilla, and cinnamon, stirring until smooth.
step-4: add the bread and stir until the bread cubes have evenly absorbed the milk mixture.
step-5: spread the bread evenly in a 9-inch (23cm) round baking pan.
step-6: in a large bowl, combine the apples, brown sugar, and cornstarch, mixing until evenly combined.
step-7: spread the apples evenly on top of the bread.
step-8: bake for 40 minutes, until edges are brown.
step-9: cool, slice, then serve with vanilla ice cream and caramel sauce!

step-1: preheat oven to 300˚f (150˚c).
step-2: line a springform pan with a pie crust, pressing it around the sides of the pan until smooth.
step-3: in a medium bowl, beat the cream cheese, sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, and nutmeg until smooth.
step-4: add the sour cream and mix together.
step-5: add in one egg at a time, whisking until smooth.
step-6: pour mixture into the springform pan and bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
step-7: after baking, turn off the oven and let the cheesecake cool inside for 1 hour without opening the oven door.
step-8: turn up the oven temperature to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-9: in a saucepan, add the apples, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, cornstarch, and water over medium-low heat.
step-10: stir occasionally until apples are soft (about 10 minutes), then remove from heat.
step-11: let cool.
step-12: once cool, spread apple pie filling over cheesecake.
step-13: cut the other pie crust in to ¼-inch (6 mm) strips and make a lattice pattern across the top.
step-14: brush with egg wash.
step-15: bake for 25 minutes, until golden brown.
step-16: chill until set then serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: roll out aluminum foil into a cone.
step-3: make 4 cones for 1 pie sheet.
step-4: cut pie sheet into quarters.
step-5: place cone at one end of the sheet and roll dough onto the cone.
step-6: using a fork crimp the ends of the pie dough.
step-7: bake 5-10 minutes until the dough is set.
step-8: let it cool before pulling out the aluminum foil.
step-9: in a medium bowl, combine all ingredients and mix.
step-10: place pie cone in a mug for stability and spoon in the fruit mixture.
step-11: turn oven down to 400°f (200°c) and bake for 15 minutes or until the fruit is soft.
step-12: top it with ice cream and your favorite topping.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a bowl, add the butter, brown sugar, sugar, cinnamon and flour.
step-3: use a fork incorporate all of the ingredients until a coarse crumb forms.
step-4: chill until ready to use.
step-5: in a bowl, add the flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, and baking soda, stir to combine.
step-6: in a large bowl, add the butter, sugar, and maple syrup.
step-7: whisk until fully incorporated,
step-8: add the egg and vanilla to the bowl with the butter and mix until fully incorporated.
step-9: add half of the flour mixture, and mix until just combined.
step-10: add the second half of the flour mixture and mix until there are streaks of flour still showing, making sure to not overmix.
step-11: pour the lemon juice over the apples then gently fold the apples into the batter.
step-12: spread batter evenly into a greased 9-inch (23 cm) square cake pan.
step-13: sprinkle crumble mixture over the top, creating different size crumble pieces by squeezing some small clumps together in your hands for varying texture.
step-14: bake for 25 minutes, or until toothpick comes out clean, cover with foil the last 5 minutes to prevent the top from over baking.
step-15: let cool for about 20 minutes, slice and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, combine apple wedges and lemon juice.
step-3: in a small bowl, mix together sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves.
step-4: sprinkle over apple wedges and toss until fully coated.
step-5: lightly flour a work surface and unroll the pie crusts.
step-6: using a round 4-inch (10 cm) cookie cutter, cut out discs.
step-7: arrange discs on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-8: place an apple wedge on one half of each disc.
step-9: using a round piping tip, cut circles into the other half.
step-10: lightly moisten the edges with water with your finger.
step-11: fold over and seal.
step-12: crimp edges with a fork.
step-13: brush the tops of shaped dumplings with egg wash and sprinkle with sparkling sugar.
step-14: bake for 10 minutes, or until golden in color.
step-15: cool completely.
step-16: serve with caramel dipping sauce.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375°f (200°c).
step-2: in a medium-sized bowl, add the flour and salt.
step-3: mix with fork until combined.
step-4: add in cubed butter and break up into flour with a fork.
step-5: mixture will still have lumps about the size of small peas.
step-6: gradually add in ice water and continue to mix until the dough starts to come together.
step-7: you may not need all of the water, but if the dough is too dry then add more.
step-8: the dough should not be very tacky or sticky.
step-9: work the dough together with your hands and turn out onto a surface.
step-10: work into a ball and cover with cling wrap.
step-11: refrigerate.
step-12: peel the apples, then core and slice.
step-13: in a bowl, add the sliced apples, sugar, flour, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, and juice from the lemon.
step-14: mix until combined and all apples are coated.
step-15: refrigerate.
step-16: on a floured surface, cut the pie dough in half and roll out both halves until round and about ⅛-inch (3.2 mm) thick.
step-17: roll the dough around the rolling pin and unroll onto a pie dish making sure the dough reaches all edges.
step-18: trim extra if necessary.
step-19: pour in apple filling mixture and pat down.
step-20: roll the other half of the dough on top.
step-21: trim the extra dough from the edges and pinch the edges to create a crimp.
step-22: make sure edges are sealed together.
step-23: brush the pie with the beaten egg and sprinkle with the sugar.
step-24: cut four slits in the top of the pie to create a vent.
step-25: bake pie for 50-60 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and no greyish or undercooked pastry remains.
step-26: allow to cool completely before slicing.
step-27: top with ice cream and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, combine the graham cracker crumbs, sugar, cinnamon, and melted butter.
step-3: in a greased 6-cup muffin tin, press the graham cracker mixture firmly into each cup, ensuring it evenly coats the sides and bottom.
step-4: bake for 7-10 minutes, or until the butter has been fully absorbed by the graham cracker crumbs.
step-5: freeze the crusts for 15 minutes.
step-6: in a small saucepan, add the apple juice, cinnamon whiskey, and vodka.
step-7: add the gelatin and bring to a simmer over medium heat, whisking until the gelatin is dissolved.
step-8: remove the pan from the heat.
step-9: using a baster, fill cooled graham cracker crusts with the gelatin mixture.
step-10: refrigerate for 30 minutes, or until the gelatin is firm.
step-11: cut each cup into quarters and garnish with whipped cream and cinnamon.

step-1: peel and thinly slice the apples (keep the apples in a bowl of lemon water as you go to keep them from browning).
step-2: in a large bowl, toss the apples with the brown sugar, salt, cinnamon, lemon juice, and half of the cornstarch.
step-3: once the apples are well coated, let sit and macerate for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
step-4: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-5: transfer the apples to a colander set over a medium bowl and let drain for about 15 minutes, until all of the liquid is drawn out.
step-6: transfer the liquid released from the apples to a small pot over low heat.
step-7: in a small bowl, mix the rest of the cornstarch and the water to make a slurry.
step-8: add the slurry to the apple liquid and quickly stir to incorporate.
step-9: bring to a boil, then add the butter and stir until melted.
step-10: immediately remove from the heat and pour over the apples, stirring to coat.
step-11: gently lay 1 rolled-out pie crust in a 10-inch (25-cm) pie dish.
step-12: lay the apples in the pie crust, making sure they are flat and facing the rounded edges out in order to fit as many apples as possible in the crust.
step-13: pour any leftover liquid from the bowl over the apples.
step-14: top with the other rolled-out pie crust.
step-15: trim the excess dough from the edges.
step-16: press the 2 crusts together to seal, then fold the edges under.
step-17: crimp the edges.
step-18: then brush all over with egg wash and sprinkle the with sanding sugar.
step-19: use a paring knife to cut a few vents in the top for steam to escape.
step-20: bake for 40-45 minutes, until golden brown.
step-21: let cool for at least an hour
step-22: slice and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: grease a 12-cup muffin tin with butter.
step-3: make the muffin batter: in a large bowl, combine the flour, apple, brown sugar, cinnamon, salt, baking soda, vanilla, egg, applesauce, plain yogurt, and apple juice.
step-4: whisk until well combined.
step-5: make the topping: in a medium bowl, combine the flour, brown sugar, butter, oats, and cinnamon.
step-6: mix with a fork until crumbly.
step-7: divide the muffin batter between the cups of the muffin tin.
step-8: top each muffin with 1 tablespoon of the crumble topping.
step-9: bake for 30 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted in the center of a muffin.
step-10: make the glaze: in a medium bowl, combine the powdered sugar, lemon zest, and lemon juice.
step-11: whisk until smooth.
step-12: drizzle the lemon glaze on top of the muffins.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: peel and core the apples.
step-3: soak the peeled apples in a large bowl filled with water and lemon juice so they won’t brown.
step-4: working one at a time, thinly slice the apples.
step-5: melt the butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat.
step-6: add the apple slices and sprinkle with the sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
step-7: stir continuously and cook until the apples are soft, about 10 minutes.
step-8: remove the pan from the heat.
step-9: make the taco shells: using a cookie cutter or the lid of a mason jar, cut out 14 small circles from the tortillas.
step-10: brush the small tortilla rounds with melted butter and coat with cinnamon sugar.
step-11: shape the cut-out tortillas to look like taco shells and place between the cups of an upside-down muffin tin to hold their shapes.
step-12: bake for 10 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-13: let the taco shells cool until easy to handle.
step-14: spoon the apple pie filling into the taco shells.
step-15: top with small scoops of vanilla ice cream and drizzle with caramel sauce.

step-1: in a blender, combine the apple, oats, cinnamon, nutmeg, maple syrup, and milk.
step-2: blend on high speed for 3 minutes, or until completely smooth.
step-3: transfer the apple mixture to a small saucepan and heat over medium-low heat until just warmed through.
step-4: do not boil.
step-5: pour into a mug and serve immediately.
step-6: nutrition - calories: 403, total fat: 8 grams, sodium: 133 mg, total carbs: 72 grams, dietary fiber: 9 grams, sugars: 25 grams, protein: 14 grams

step-1: peel the apple and slice into 2 cm (¾-inch) thickness.
step-2: using a teaspoon, cut out the core of the apple and place apples in a medium bowl.
step-3: mix in cinnamon and coat each apple ring.
step-4: in a large bowl, mix egg, butter, vanilla extract, and milk with a whisk.
step-5: sift in flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt, and mix the batter.
step-6: it is okay to leave lumps.
step-7: heat pan on medium heat and melt butter.
step-8: dunk each ring into the batter and place on pan.
step-9: wait until bubbles form on the batter, then flip.
step-10: top it off with your favorite toppings.

step-1: in a large pitcher, combine the green apple, red apple, lemon, simple syrup, whiskey, apple cider, and rosé.
step-2: stir well, then chill until ready to serve, up to 2 days.
step-3: immediately before serving, add the sparkling apple cider and stir to incorporate.
step-4: pour into glasses and garnish with lemon wedges.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200˚c).
step-2: peel, core, and cut apples into ½-inch (1 ¼ cm) chunks.
step-3: in a bowl, mix the chopped apples, sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, salt, and orange zest.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: on parchment paper, stack 2 pie crusts on top of each other.
step-6: roll out to 17 inches by 12 inches (43 cm by 30 cm).
step-7: cut diagonally into ¾-inch (2 cm) strips.
step-8: roll out another 2 pie crusts.
step-9: place on a 15 x 10 x 1 inch ( 38 x 26 x 3 cm) baking sheet.
step-10: spread out apple mixture into the crust, then form a lattice top with the pie crust strips.
step-11: tuck the crust inward around the edges, and bake for 35-40 minutes at 400°f (200˚c).
step-12: serve warm with ice cream.

step-1: combine the greek yogurt, nuts, honey and cinnamon in a small bowl and mix to combine.
step-2: serve with apple slices.

step-1: make the apple filling: combine the dried apples, brown sugar, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, and water in a large pot over medium-high heat.
step-2: bring to a light boil, then reduce the heat to low.
step-3: cook for 30 minutes-1 hour, or until the apples are tender and have absorbed the liquid.
step-4: mash the apples with a potato masher until no large chunks remain.
step-5: remove from the heat and let cool.
step-6: make the cake: in a large bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon.
step-7: in a separate large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
step-8: add the eggs and molasses, and whisk until fully incorporated and the mixture is light brown.
step-9: add ⅓ of the flour mixture to the wet ingredients and fold with a spatula until fully incorporated.
step-10: add half of the buttermilk and stir until fully combined.
step-11: continue alternating with the remaining flour and buttermilk, fully incorporating each addition before adding the next.
step-12: the batter will be thicker than a traditional cake batter.
step-13: chill the cake batter for 30 minutes.
step-14: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-15: grease as many 9-inch (22-cm) cake pans as you have and line with parchment paper.
step-16: dump the cake batter onto a floured surface and dust with more flour.
step-17: pat into a rectangle, then divide into 5 equal pieces.
step-18: transfer a piece of cake batter to a prepared pan and pat into an even layer.
step-19: bake for 12 minutes, until firm.
step-20: repeat with the remaining layers.
step-21: let cool completely.
step-22: to assemble, add a cake layer to a serving plate and top with a layer of apple filling.
step-23: spread evenly.
step-24: repeat with the remaining cake layers and filling.
step-25: wrap the cake in plastic wrap and chill for 24 hours.
step-26: dust the cake with powdered sugar, then slice and serve.

step-1: for the batter, mix together the flour, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
step-2: mix in the egg and buttermilk.
step-3: gradually stir in the milk.
step-4: next, core the apples and slice vertically into doughnut-size rings.
step-5: each apple should give you about 3 rings.
step-6: heat the oil in a deep frying pan to 180˚c (350°f).
step-7: coat each apple ring in the batter.
step-8: carefully lay the doughnuts into the oil and fry for a few minutes on each side, until golden brown.
step-9: drain on paper towel before coating in sugar.

step-1: peel the apples and soak them in a medium bowl filled with lemon water to keep then from browning.
step-2: using a cheese grater, grate the apples.
step-3: in another medium bowl, combine the grated apples and sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon.
step-4: stir to coat well and set aside.
step-5: make the churro dough: in a medium saucepan over high heat, combine the butter, brown sugar, salt, and water.
step-6: bring to a boil.
step-7: reduce the heat to medium-low and add the flour.
step-8: using a wooden spoon, stir until the dough comes together to form a ball, about 1 minute.
step-9: remove the pot from the heat and let cool for about 5 minutes to prevent accidentally cooking the eggs.
step-10: add the eggs, 1 at a time, being sure to fully incorporate each egg before adding the next.
step-11: set the dough aside.
step-12: spread a kitchen towel over a medium bowl.
step-13: transfer the grated apple to the towel and squeeze to remove moisture.
step-14: add the grated apple to the churro dough.
step-15: mix well with wooden spoon and transfer to a piping bag with a large star tip or large round tip.
step-16: heat the oil in a large pot until it reaches 350˚f (180˚c).
step-17: pipe the dough into the hot oil, using scissors to cut into bite-size pieces as you squeeze.
step-18: work in batches, if necessary, so as not to overcrowd the pot.
step-19: fry the churros until golden brown and fully cooked, 2-3 minutes.
step-20: transfer the hot churros to a medium bowl filled with cinnamon sugar and toss to coat.

step-1: toss the peels in a small pot of boiling water.
step-2: add the cinnamon stick and sugar.
step-3: let simmer for about 10 minutes.
step-4: strain out the peels.

step-1: in a medium bowl, mix softened butter and sugar until smooth.
step-2: add the egg and stir well to combine.
step-3: sift in the flour and fold until fully incorporated.
step-4: cover the dough with plastic and rest in a fridge for at least 30 minutes.
step-5: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-6: sprinkle flour on the work surface and rolling pin so the dough won’t stick.
step-7: roll out the dough to ¼- to ⅛-inch (6-3 mm) thickness.
step-8: using a 3-inch (7 ½ cm) round cookie cutter, cut out the dough.
step-9: cut out center of each cookie with using a 2-inch (5 cm) round cookie cutter.
step-10: place the cookie on a parchment-lined baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes.
step-11: take out the sheet from the oven and place hard candies in the center of each cookies.
step-12: bake for 3-5 minutes or until the hard candy melts and spreads out.
step-13: let the cookies cool completely.
step-14: in a microwave-safe bowl, melt the white chocolate, about 10-15 seconds.
step-15: for the bottom cookies, add your favorite sprinkles onto the hard candy.
step-16: take the top cookies and drizzle melted chocolate around the rims.
step-17: immediately sandwich the 2 cookies and set in fridge for 15 minutes.

step-1: peel the ginger using a spoon, then slice thinly.
step-2: cube the chicken breasts.
step-3: heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat.
step-4: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the garlic and fry until golden brown, 2-3 minutes.
step-5: remove from the pan, draining off any excess oil, and set aside.
step-6: heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil in a large pan with a lid over medium-high heat.
step-7: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the onion and sliced ginger and cook, stirring, until softened, about 3 minutes.
step-8: add the chicken and rice and stir to combine.
step-9: season with salt and pepper.
step-10: add the water and cover with the lid.
step-11: simmer until the water is absorbed, the rice is tender, and the chicken is cooked through, about 15 minutes.
step-12: remove the pot from the heat and stir in the fish sauce.
step-13: serve the chicken and rice with lime juice, hard-boiled eggs, scallions, the fried garlic, and chicharrones.

step-1: add the chicken thighs to a large pot, cover with water, and season with salt.
step-2: boil the chicken for 40 minutes, or until cooked through.
step-3: drain.
step-4: shred the chicken from the bones and set aside.
step-5: heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat, then add the rice and continually stir until the rice turns a light brown.
step-6: add the garlic, onion, and salt.
step-7: stir the rice until it turns golden.
step-8: add the tomato sauce, bouillon cubes and hot water.
step-9: increase the heat to medium-high.
step-10: cover and simmer for 20-25 minutes, until the rice is cooked and has absorbed the liquid.
step-11: check occasionally to make sure the rice is not drying out too quickly.
step-12: mix in the shredded chicken, peas, and carrots.
step-13: remove the rice from the heat and fluff with fork.

step-1: in a food processor, combine the arugula, walnuts, garlic, lemon juice, water, and salt, and process until finely chopped.
step-2: slowly stream in the olive oil while continuing to process until the pesto is smooth.
step-3: serve on grain bowls, pizza, pasta, toast, and more!

step-1: in a large bowl, combine marinade ingredients.
step-2: add chicken into the bowl, coat the chicken, and marinate for 30 minutes in the fridge.
step-3: fully cook chicken.
step-4: cut into cubes.
step-5: in a mason jar, combine ingredients for the dressing.
step-6: shake and set aside.
step-7: prep the salad.
step-8: add all of the salad ingredients into a large bowl and add the cubed chicken and dressing.
step-9: toss.

step-1: preheat oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-2: with a sharp knife, slice the squash in half.
step-3: if the squash is too tough, puncture in several places forming a dotted line around the squash.
step-4: microwave for 3-5 minutes to soften.
step-5: allow to cool before cutting in half.
step-6: scoop out the seeds, brush with oil, and sprinkle with salt, and pepper.
step-7: bake for 40-45 minutes, or until a fork can easily pierce the skin.
step-8: meanwhile, in a blender combine basil, olive oil, vegetarian parmesan cheese, garlic, pine nuts, and salt.
step-9: set aside.
step-10: in a pan add the olive oil and garlic over medium-high heat, sautè 30 seconds-1 minute, add in mushrooms and cook for 3 minutes.
step-11: add asparagus and stir until cooked.
step-12: remove squash from the oven, with a fork pull at the edges to produce that stringy “spaghetti” quality until you’ve completed both of them.
step-13: in the mushroom and asparagus pan combine “spaghetti” and pesto and mix.
step-14: return to the squash and serve with or without plates.
step-15: garnish with parmesan.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: cut off about 1-2 inches (2.5-5 cm) of asparagus ends.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: in a large bowl combine crushed almonds, parmesan, garlic powder, oregano, salt, and pepper.
step-5: whisk eggs in a shallow bowl or dish.
step-6: dip asparagus in eggs, coating evenly, and then toss with the crushed almond mixture.
step-7: place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper in a single layer.
step-8: bake for 15-20 minutes, flipping halfway.
step-9: prepare dip while fries are baking.
step-10: combine all dip ingredients in a small bowl and set aside in the refrigerator until ready to use.

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚f).
step-2: on a cutting board, cut the chicken breasts in half, lengthwise, leaving it intact on one side.
step-3: season the inside of the chicken with salt and pepper.
step-4: sprinkle the lemon zest on the interior of the chicken.
step-5: top with piece of provolone and three stalks of asparagus, then fold the chicken over enclosing the filling.
step-6: season the outside of the chicken breasts with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and paprika.
step-7: heat a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat, and add the oil.
step-8: add the chicken to the pan, and cook for 3 to 5 minutes, until golden brown.
step-9: flip the chicken over and cook for an additional 3 to 5 minutes.
step-10: cover the skillet with aluminum foil and place in the oven for 15 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 155˚f (70˚c).
step-11: remove the skillet and let sit, covered, for 5 minutes.
step-12: remove the foil, and serve.

step-1: in a large bowl, cream butter, sugar, and shortening together with a hand mixer.
step-2: mix the eggs, one at a time, into the batter.
step-3: in a medium bowl, combine the milk, lemon extract, and vanilla extract.
step-4: in a separate medium bowl, whisk the flour, baking powder, and salt.
step-5: alternately add the dry and wet ingredients into the batter.
step-6: pour the batter equally into two greased and lightly floured loaf pans.
step-7: bake in a non-preheated oven set to 350°f (180°c) for 1 hour, or until toothpick inserted comes out clean.
step-8: cool for 30 minutes before slicing.
step-9: serve with vanilla ice cream and berries.

step-1: cook the sweet potatoes in a large pot of boiling water until fork-tender, about 25-30 minutes.
step-2: drain and let cool completely.
step-3: preheat the oven to 365˚f (185˚c).
step-4: peel the sweet potatoes, then transfer to a large bowl and mash thoroughly with an electric hand mixer or fork.
step-5: add the melted butter, sugar, nutmeg, cinnamon, and salt.
step-6: beat to combine, then scrape down the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula.
step-7: add the eggs, 1 at a time, beating to incorporate each addition.
step-8: add the self-rising flour, buttermilk, vanilla, and lemon extract, and beat to combine.
step-9: divide the sweet potato filling between the frozen pie crusts and smooth the tops.
step-10: bake for about 1 hour, until pies are set in the center.
step-11: cover the crusts with foil if it is getting too dark before the pies finish baking.
step-12: cool the pies for 2 hours on a wire rack.
step-13: slice and serve.

step-1: spread mashed avocado over toast, and top with roasted chickpeas and a dash of hot sauce.
combine all ingredients in a bowl and gently stir to combine.
step-2: cover, and store in the refrigerator until ready to serve.

step-1: in a medium size bowl, whisk the eggs, salt, and parmesan until well combined.
step-2: in a medium size saucepan over medium-high heat, melt the butter and pour the egg mixture into the pan.
step-3: let the egg cook just until it starts to set, then add the cheddar cheese, black beans, onions, and peppers to the center of the egg wrap.
step-4: cover with a lid and cook for another 3 minutes, or until the egg is fully cooked through and the cheese is melted.
step-5: add the avocado slices.
step-6: add avocados and remove from the pan.
step-7: fold in the egg wrap’s left and right sides, then roll from the bottom to the top to form a burrito.

step-1: blend avocado, egg yolk, garlic, and lemon juice in a powerful blender or food processor.
step-2: pulse to blend and add heavy cream gradually.
step-3: blend the sauce until smooth and set aside.
step-4: cut up strips of bacon and cook in a large pan.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: in a large pot, bring water to a boil and cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions.
step-7: drain and coat with olive oil.
step-8: add sauce, bacon, parmesan, salt and pepper, stirring until well-combined.
step-9: serve and sprinkle with parmesan.

step-1: combine avocado, yogurt, lime, garlic powder, black pepper, and salt in a medium bowl.
step-2: mash the avocado to desired consistency.
step-3: add onion, celery, jalapeño, and chicken into the avocado mixture and stir to coat evenly.
step-4: serve on toast with optional topping of sriracha and cilantro.

step-1: for the dressing, combine dressing ingredients in a small bowl.
step-2: whisk together until mixed thoroughly.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine chickpeas, cucumber, tomatoes, onion, avocado, carrots, and dressing.
step-4: toss together until evenly combined.
step-5: serve and garnish.

step-1: add the cold brew coffee, avocado, vanilla, coconut milk, yogurt, and ice to a blender.
step-2: blend until smooth.
step-3: serve in a glass and top with coconut flakes.

step-1: cut each egg in half and remove the yolk.
step-2: place the yolks in a medium bowl, and refrigerate the whites while you prepare the filling.
step-3: in a large bowl bowl, mix together the avocado, greek yogurt, mustard, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
step-4: add the egg yolks and mash with a fork to incorporate.
step-5: for a smoother filling, add the ingredients to a food processor and pulse to combine.
step-6: transfer the filing to a piping bag fitted with a round tip or a zip-top bag with a corner snipped off.
step-7: pipe the filling into the egg whites.
step-8: sprinkle with paprika.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: cut the avocados in half and carefully remove the pits.
step-3: scoop out 1-2 tablespoons of avocado from the center of each half (save it for another meal!).
step-4: transfer the avocado halves to a baking sheet and carefully crack an egg into each avocado cup.
step-5: if the divot is too small, it may be easier to separate the egg yolks and whites before placing them in the avocado.
step-6: add your favorite topping combo, such as tomato and basil, feta cheese, bell pepper and onion, and bacon and chives.
step-7: season with salt and pepper to taste
step-8: bake for 18 minutes, or until the egg whites have cooked completely.

step-1: slice the avocados in half, and then slice lengthwise into wedges.
step-2: mix the bread crumbs with the cayenne pepper and salt.
step-3: roll the slices in flour, then in the whisked eggs, then in the breadcrumbs.
step-4: place the slices on wax paper on a baking sheet.
step-5: spray well with cooking spray.
step-6: add a sprinkle of black pepper if desired.
step-7: bake for approximately 12 minutes at 400˚f (205˚c).
step-8: flip all the way through and re-spray.
step-9: serve with your favorite dipping sauce!

step-1: in a blender of food processor, combine avocado, banana, honey, coconut oil, lemon juice, and salt.
step-2: blend until smooth, scraping down sides as necessary.
step-3: pour mixture into a parchment lined 8x8 inch (20x20 cm) freezer-safe dish and top with chopped walnuts and coconut flakes, or your favorite toppings!
step-4: freeze for at least 3 hours.
step-5: remove from freezer and cut into squares.

step-1: add chickpeas, avocado, garlic, lime juice, and seasonings to the bowl of a 2-quart food processor.
step-2: blend until smooth.
step-3: while blending, slowly add in the olive oil until hummus is creamy and smooth.
step-4: garnish with chopped cilantro, some diced tomatoes, and a drizzle of olive oil.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: on a baking sheet, season salmon with garlic, olive oil, salt, pepper, and paprika.
step-3: bake for 10-12 minutes.
step-4: in a small bowl, mix avocado topping ingredients until fully incorporated.
step-5: don’t overmix or you’ll break down your avocado.
step-6: spoon avocado topping over the salmon.

step-1: in a small saucepan, bring the water and a pinch of salt to a boil.
step-2: add the quinoa, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes, or until the water is absorbed.
step-3: transfer to a medium bowl to cool to room temperature, then fluff the quinoa.
step-4: refrigerate the quinoa for 20 minutes.
step-5: add the spinach, cucumber, tomatoes, and avocado to the bowl of quinoa and mix to combine.
step-6: add the lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper, and mix well.

step-1: thinly slice half of an avocado.
step-2: keep slices together and start molding them into a line.
step-3: start folding one end inside and wrapping other end around in a circle.
step-4: place rose-shaped avocado on toast and add sliced strawberries at each corner of the toast.

step-1: peel the avocado half, then slice crosswise very thinly, keeping the avocado shape intact as you go.
step-2: starting from one end, fan out the sliced avocado in straight line, then curl into a rose shape.
step-3: carefully transfer the avocado rose to the slice of toast.
step-4: top with the pomegranate seeds.

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine all ingredients and gently mix together.
step-2: for best flavor, allow to set 30 minutes.
step-3: garnish with additional feta just before serving.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: slice each avocado in half, then into wedges.
step-3: scoop out of the peel.
step-4: mix panko breadcrumbs with salt and cayenne.
step-5: dip each avocado wedge in flour, then eggs, then panko, then place on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-6: bake 12-15 minutes, flipping once.

step-1: add mashed avocado (or non-fat greek yogurt), cooked chicken, celery, red onion, parsley, lime juice, salt, and pepper.
step-2: stir until well combined.

step-1: make the pulled pork: in a medium bowl, mix together the pepper, cumin, oregano, garlic, and lime juice.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: make a few incisions, 1-2 inches (2-5 cm) deep, on both sides of the pork butt, cutting against the grain.
step-4: sprinkle generously with salt all over, make sure to season inside the incisions.
step-5: transfer the pork butt to a roasting dish, and pour the marinade all over.
step-6: make sure the pork is well coated, including inside the incisions.
step-7: cover and marinate for 8-10 hours, or overnight.
step-8: preheat the oven to 250˚f (120˚c).
step-9: roast the pork, covered, for 8-10 hours, or until the pork is tender and easily falls apart when prodded with a fork or tongs
step-10: let cool enough to handle, then remove any bones, and shred the pork with tongs.
step-11: keep in the fridge up to 5 days.
step-12: make the cuban sandwich: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-13: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-14: set the bread open face on the prepared baking sheet and spread the mustard over one side.
step-15: top with the swiss cheese.
step-16: brush the garlic oil on the other side of the bread.
step-17: top with the ham.
step-18: arrange the pulled pork over the cheese.
step-19: toast in the oven for 2 minutes, or until the cheese melts.
step-20: add the pickles and press the sandwich

step-1: preheat oven to 325˚f (170˚c).
step-2: grease and line a 9-inch (23-cm) square baking dish with parchment paper and place on a baking sheet.
step-3: make the crust: combine the flour, powdered sugar, salt, and butter in a medium bowl, and use your hands to mix until a crumbly dough forms.
step-4: transfer the dough to the prepared pan, and use your hands to press it against the bottom and about 1 inch (2 cm) up the sides.
step-5: poke the bottom all over with a fork.
step-6: bake for 20 minutes, until light golden brown.
step-7: while the crust is baking, make the lemon filling: in a large bowl, whisk together the eggs and egg yolk.
step-8: add the granulated sugar, lemon juice, zest, and a pinch of salt, and whisk to combine.
step-9: whisk in the flour until just combined.
step-10: when the crust is done baking, remove it from the oven.
step-11: pour the lemon filling over the crust and carefully return it to the oven for 25 minutes, until the filling no longer jiggles and the center is mostly set.
step-12: while the filling bakes, make the meringue: in a clean, dry medium bowl, use an electric hand mixer to beat the egg white until stiff peaks form.
step-13: add about half of the sugar, whip for 30 seconds, then add the rest of the sugar and whip until combined.
step-14: transfer the meringue to a pastry bag fitted with a large tip or zip-top bag with a corner snipped off.
step-15: pipe 9 evenly-spaced dollops of meringue on top of the lemon bars.
step-16: return to the oven for 10-12 minutes, until the meringues are lightly browned.
step-17: let cool completely, then refrigerate for 1-2 hours.
step-18: slice into 9 bars.
step-19: serve chilled or at room temperature.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: slice the camembert into thick matchsticks.
step-3: make deep, thick slits into the bread without cutting all the way through, about 90% down is good.
step-4: rotate the bread 90° and make more cuts, 90% through again, creating little sticks of bread that are all held together by the crust at the bottom.
step-5: combine the butter, parsley and garlic.
step-6: stuff camembert in between the bread sticks.
step-7: drop the cooked bacon bits over the bread, pushing some of them down into the cracks.
step-8: drizzle butter evenly over the bread.
step-9: bake for 18-20 minutes until the camembert is melted and the top of the bread is crusty.

step-1: slice bread into cubes.
step-2: in a bowl, add egg, milk, cheese, salt, and pepper, and mix.
step-3: in a microwave-safe mug, place half of the cubed bread and desired amount of bacon and tomato.
step-4: place the rest of the bread and fixins and pour the egg mixture into the mug.
step-5: microwave for 1½ minutes or until egg is fully cooked.
step-6: sprinkle with some green onions.

step-1: peel and grate the raw potato, then wrap in a clean towel and squeeze out as much of the liquid as you can.
step-2: put the grated potato into a large bowl and stir in the cooked mashed potato and the flour.
step-3: stir in the melted butter and season if necessary.
step-4: add a bit of milk and stir, then add a bit more milk - keeping doing this until all of the milk is combined into the mixture and you have a somewhat sticky dough, if it’s too wet add a bit more flour.
step-5: dust your hands and work surface in flour and grab a palm sized amount of the mixture, flattening it out to about 1-cm (¼ in) thick.
step-6: spoon some grated cheese and some bacon bits into the center and drop another flattened out dough mixture piece on top.
step-7: cut into a nice round shape using a cookie cutter making sure it’s fully sealed.
step-8: note: try not to make these too thick or they might not cook all the way through, if they are thick, lower the temperature to a low-medium heat instead.
step-9: fry in butter over a medium heat for about 4-6 minutes on each side until golden brown.
step-10: serve topped with a tablespoon of soured cream and a few bits of scallions.

step-1: pre-heat the oven to 200°c (400°f).
step-2: remove the peel from the plantains.
step-3: cover in melted butter.
step-4: bake for around 20 minutes then flip the plantains, cooking for another 20 minutes until golden brown on both sides.
step-5: chop the bacon into bits and fry until crispy.
step-6: cut the cooked plantains down the middle.
step-7: stuff with the mozzarella, bacon and extra mozzarella.
step-8: bake for another 5 minutes until the cheese has melted.

step-1: beat three eggs in an empty bowl and add a bit of salt until well-combined.
step-2: cut bacon into 1-inch pieces and finely dice the onion.
step-3: heat oil in either a wok or nonstick frying pan over medium heat and add beaten eggs.
step-4: gently scramble the eggs; when they are almost done, remove from wok and set aside.
step-5: add bacon to the wok and allow it to render down and become crisp.
step-6: once the bacon is done, take it out of the wok and set aside, along with the scrambled eggs.
step-7: add the diced onion to the wok and stir-fry until translucent.
step-8: then add the cooked rice, make sure the rice is fluffed and cooled, and stir-fry for 2 to 5 minutes.
step-9: use spatula to break up any clumps.
step-10: add the salt, pepper, sugar, and soy sauce.
step-11: stir for another minute or so.
step-12: once there is steam coming off the rice and it is completely heated through, add scrambled eggs and cooked bacon.
step-13: sprinkle with green onion, as desired.

step-1: preheat oven to 425ºf (220ºc).
step-2: cook bacon in a cast iron skillet until crisp.
step-3: remove any excess grease, if preferred.
step-4: add the potatoes and onion soup mix to the skillet and stir.
step-5: add salt and pepper to taste.
step-6: bake in the skillet for 20-25 minutes, or until potatoes are cooked through.

step-1: put all of the cheese, a bit of salt, and a pepper into a big bowl and mix it all up with a fork.
step-2: add ½ of the red pepper, all of the spring onions, ½ of the pecans and ½ of the bacon in to the bowl and combine it with the cheese mixture.
step-3: pour the mixture onto a sheet of cling film and wrap it all up.
step-4: shape it into a ball and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
step-5: in a shallow bowl, mix together the rest of the red pepper, pecans, and the bacon along with all of the parsley and the poppy seeds.
step-6: remove the cling film from the cheeseball and roll it around the topping mixture until completely covered.
step-7: serve with a selection of crackers.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c)
step-2: slice the puff pastry into ½-inch (1-centimeter) strips.
step-3: slice the bacon in half lengthwise into thin strips.
step-4: wrap a strip of bacon around an asparagus spear in a spiral.
step-5: wrap a strip of puff pastry around the asparagus, looping it in between the bacon spiral.
step-6: repeat with the rest of the asparagus.
step-7: place the wrapped spears on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
step-8: brush them with egg wash, then sprinkle a pinch of salt & pepper on top.
step-9: bake for 18 minutes, until golden brown and puffed.

step-1: slice the stems off the brussels sprouts and cut each one in half, then thinly slice.
step-2: transfer the shaved sprouts to a medium bowl and break apart with your hands.
step-3: to prepare the vinaigrette, juice one lemon into a small bowl and remove the seeds.
step-4: add the mustard, oregano, pepper, and salt.
step-5: whisk to combine.
step-6: slowly add the olive oil while continuing to whisk until evenly blended.
step-7: slice the avocado and remove the pit, then dice.
step-8: trim the ends of the scallions, then dice.
step-9: in a large bowl, combine the brussels sprouts and spinach.
step-10: add the avocado, bacon, scallions, parmesan cheese, cranberries, and almonds.
step-11: pour the dressing evenly over the salad.
step-12: toss thoroughly until well mixed.

step-1: slice the lettuce into about 1-inch (2 ½ cm) pieces, then transfer to a large salad bowl.
step-2: add the bacon, avocado, croutons, cheese, and dressing, mixing until evenly combined.
step-3: serve with additional parmesan on top.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: cut each chicken breast in half crosswise, then cut the larger half again horizontally, creating 3 cutlets.
step-3: transfer to a large bowl.
step-4: in a small bowl, combine the salt, garlic powder, smoked paprika, onion powder, chili powder, black pepper, and cayenne pepper.
step-5: stir to combine.
step-6: pour the spice mix over the chicken cutlets and toss to coat completely in the seasoning.
step-7: set the chicken aside.
step-8: arrange the bacon slices in a 9x5-inch (23x13-cm) loaf pan, making sure the bottom and sides are fully covered, and that the strips hang over the sides.
step-9: layer in 4 seasoned chicken cutlets, 2 tablespoons of barbecue sauce, 5 slices of cheddar cheese, 4 more chicken cutlets, another 2 tablespoons of barbecue sauce, the green pepper, onion, 2 tablespoons of barbecue sauce, the red pepper, 5 remaining cheese slices, and the remaining chicken.
step-10: then, wrap the overhanging strips of bacon over the top of the loaf.
step-11: cover the loaf with foil and bake for 1 hour.
step-12: then remove the foil, drain any excess fat, and bake for another 30 minutes uncovered, making sure the chicken is cooked through and the bacon is brown and crispy.
step-13: remove the bacon loaf from the oven and turn on the broiler.
step-14: invert the loaf onto a wire rack set atop a baking sheet and baste the loaf with the remaining barbecue sauce.
step-15: broil for 5 minutes, until the glaze dries slightly.
step-16: slice and serve with rolls or other barbecue party food.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: carefully pierce potatoes with a fork.
step-3: on a baking sheet oil the potatoes well and sprinkle with salt.
step-4: bake for one hour.
step-5: if making more potatoes, an additional 15 minutes per potato is needed.
step-6: once cooled, cut the potatoes vertically, scoop out the inside, and transfer to a bowl.
step-7: in the bowl with the scooped out potato, add the cheese, scallions, ½ cup (110 g) of bacon, sour cream, butter, milk, and pepper, and mix well.
step-8: scoop the potato mixture back into the hollowed-out potatoes and top with cheddar cheese and remaining ¼ cup (55 g) of bacon bits.
step-9: bake an additional 15 minutes until the cheese is melted.
step-10: serve warm with sour cream and chives.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180˚c).
step-2: in a medium-sized mixing bowl, combine cheddar cheese, bacon, chives, salt, and pepper.
step-3: spoon cheese mixture into a greased mini muffin tin.
step-4: bake for 5-8 minutes or until cheese is melted and edges are slightly brown.
step-5: cool on cooling rack or paper towel for 10 minutes.

step-1: place eggs in a small saucepan.
step-2: add cold water to the pot to completely submerge the eggs.
step-3: bring to a boil, then cover pot with a lid and turn off the heat.
step-4: let eggs sit in the hot water for 14 minutes.
step-5: transfer the eggs to a bowl of ice water to cool.
step-6: peel the eggs.
step-7: slice eggs in half lengthwise and carefully remove the yolks.
step-8: transfer the yolks to a mixing bowl and set aside the halved egg whites.
step-9: mash the yolks with a fork until crumbly.
step-10: stir in the mayonnaise, vinegar, salt, and french’s yellow mustard until the filling is smooth.
step-11: transfer the filling to a piping bag and pipe into the halved egg whites.
step-12: top the deviled eggs with the scallions, bacon, and cheddar cheese, dividing evenly.
step-13: top with freshly ground pepper and serve.

step-1: in a medium-sized bowl, add the cream cheese, cheddar cheese, jalapeños, and bacon, and use a hand mixer to blend until combined.
step-2: using a teaspoon, scoop out the cream cheese mixture and roll into a ball.
step-3: place onto a parchment paper-lined sheet tray and freeze for 30 minutes.
step-4: in a bowl, add the cornmeal, flour, salt, pepper, baking powder, baking soda, sugar, and cayenne pepper, and whisk to combine.
step-5: in a separate bowl, add the buttermilk, egg, and onion, and stir until combined.
step-6: slowly add the buttermilk mixture to the dry ingredients, whisking until just combined.
step-7: let rest at room temperature for 30 minutes.
step-8: preheat a pot of oil to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-9: dip the cream cheese balls into the batter, ensuring they are fully coated on all sides.
step-10: add the hush puppies to the oil and fry until golden brown on all sides.
step-11: transfer to a wire rack or paper towel lined-plate to drain.
step-12: serve immediately.

step-1: in a pan over medium-high heat, add the bacon, and cook until crispy.
step-2: transfer to a cutting board and roughly chop.
step-3: in a bowl, add the bacon, cream cheese, green onions, and shredded cheddar.
step-4: mix well.
step-5: divide the ground beef into four even portions and shape into balls.
step-6: form a well into the center of each, large enough for the cheese mixture.
step-7: place a quarter of the cheese mixture into the center of each ball, and enclose inside the ground beef.
step-8: gently press each ball into a patty shape, and season both sides generously with salt and pepper.
step-9: heat a cast-iron pan over medium-high heat.
step-10: once hot, add the burgers and cook for 4-5 minutes on one side.
step-11: flip the burgers, and cook for 2 minutes.
step-12: add a slice of cheese on each burger and cook for an additional 2 minutes, until the burger is cooked through and the cheese is melted.
step-13: remove burgers from pan, and place on top a toasted burger bun.
step-14: top with condiments of your choice.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: fry the onion, garlic, bacon and mince until cooked and transfer into a large bowl.
step-3: add the mozzarella, gherkins and mustard, and mix well.
step-4: set filling aside.
step-5: in a large bowl, make a well in the flour and slowly mix in the beaten egg and water until combined.
step-6: knead for 5-10 minutes then leave in a warm place to rest for 1-2 hours.
step-7: once rested, knead for another minute, then divide dough into 4.
step-8: roll out each piece until it is a 7x7 inch (18x18 cm), then cut into 4.
step-9: put 1 tbsp of the filling into each square, brush the sides with water and then fold into triangles.
step-10: repeat for all the dough.
step-11: oil a baking tray and cook wontons for 8-10 minutes at your oven’s highest temperature.
step-12: to make the sauce, mix together the mayo, ketchup, and mustard.
step-13: serve and enjoy!

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: over a long sheet of saran wrap, lay 8 of the bacon strips down back to back.
step-3: lifting up every other strip, fold about 1-inch (2 cm) the bacon back on itself.
step-4: lay another slice of bacon perpendicular to the strips and fold the flaps back over the horizontal strip of bacon.
step-5: repeat with the rest of the bacon until a tight weave has formed.
step-6: set aside in the fridge.
step-7: in a medium saucepan, add the butter and garlic over medium heat, cooking until aromatic, about 30 seconds.
step-8: add the cream, and bring to a boil.
step-9: add in the parmesan, parsley, salt, and pepper, stirring constantly until the cheese has melted and there are no lumps remaining.
step-10: pour half of the mixture over the shredded chicken, reserving the other half to use a sauce in the end.
step-11: mix the chicken with the sauce until thoroughly combined.
step-12: on a separate sheet of saran wrap, lay down the lasagna noodles, overlapping them slightly.
step-13: spread the chicken mixture over the noodles, making sure that you leave about a 1-cm (½ inch) gap at the bottom so the noodles have room to roll on themselves.
step-14: place the cheese slices evenly across the chicken, then press the spinach into a row centered between the cheese slices.
step-15: while one hand keeps the spinach flat, use the other hand to lift the saran wrap up and over, causing the noodles to roll on themselves.
