step-16: make sure to roll tightly until the entire thing has come together into a neat rolled bundle.
step-17: transfer the lasagna roll to the bottom of the bacon weave, and repeat the saran wrap rolling process until the bacon has tightly and completely wrapped the lasagna roll.
step-18: unwrap and transfer to a baking tray.
step-19: bake for about 25 minutes until the bacon is starting to get crispy but not too dark.
step-20: cool for about 15 minutes, then transfer the roll to a cutting board.
step-21: slice generous 1-inch (2 cm) thick portions, then serve with the remaining alfredo sauce.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: make the marinade: in a medium dish or bowl, combine the ketchup, tomato sauce, apple cider vinegar, mustard, light brown sugar, and granulated sugar.
step-3: set aside ½ cup (130 g) of the mixture for the glaze and another ½ cup (130 g) for the dip.
step-4: butterfly the chicken tenders.
step-5: place a large sheet of plastic wrap over them and gently use a meat mallet or rolling pin to flatten the chicken to about ⅛-inch (3 mm) thickness.
step-6: remove the plastic wrap and place the chicken tenders in a the remaining marinade.
step-7: cover and refrigerate for one hour.
step-8: remove chicken from the refrigerator.
step-9: wrap a chicken tender around a mozzarella cheese stick.
step-10: take a strip of bacon and spiral it around the tender.
step-11: repeat with remaining chicken tenders.
step-12: place the chicken tenders on a baking sheet.
step-13: bake for 20 minutes or until slightly crispy.
step-14: flip tenders halfway through.
step-15: remove the tenders from the oven and generously brush with reserved glazed.
step-16: bake for another 10 minutes or until completely crisp.
step-17: remove from the oven, top with chopped parsley, and serve with reserved dip

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine the avocado, bacon, red onion, tomato, jalapeño, lime juice, salt, and pepper.
step-2: mix together until fully incorporated.
step-3: sprinkle with cotija cheese.
step-4: serve with tortilla chips.

step-1: in a medium pan over high heat, cook the bacon until browned, about 12 minutes.
step-2: transfer the bacon bits to a paper towel to drain and leave the bacon grease in the pan.
step-3: to the pan, add the flour, pepper, and salt and whisk to combine for 5 minutes.
step-4: add the milk and dijon mustard and cook until thickened, about 5 minutes.
step-5: remove the béchamel sauce from the heat and cover to keep warm.
step-6: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-7: grease a bundt pan with the salted butter.
step-8: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-9: with a rolling pin, roll out the bread to flatten and cut 8 slices in half.
step-10: arrange the 7 whole slices around the outer sides of the bundt pan and 4 half slices around the inner ring.
step-11: place 5 slices of ham over the bread.
step-12: sprinkle 1 cup (100 g) of mozzarella and ⅓ of the chopped bacon on top of the ham.
step-13: place 6 half slices of bread on top of the bacon layer.
step-14: top with 8 slices of ham, another cup of mozzarella, and another ⅓ of the chopped bacon.
step-15: top with another 4 slices of ham.
step-16: place 6 half slices of bread on top of the ham.
step-17: bake for 25 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-18: invert the ring onto the prepared baking sheet, remove the bundt pan, and brush the top of the ring with béchamel sauce.
step-19: sprinkle with the remaining cup of mozzarella and the rest of the bacon.
step-20: broil for 10 minutes, until the cheese is melted and browned.
step-21: sprinkle the ring with parsley.
step-22: transfer the rest of the béchamel sauce to a small bowl and place in the middle of the ring.
step-23: slice the ring and serve warm with the sauce and sunny-side up eggs.

step-1: in a medium bowl, mix eggs, cream, bacon, cheese, and onions.
step-2: cut a long rectangle through the top of the baguette and partially unstuff the baguette.
step-3: spoon the mixture into the baguette.
step-4: bake for 25 minutes at 350°f/ 175°c
step-5: cut and serve while still warm.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: place the slices of bacon in the muffin tin wrapping in a circle.
step-3: bake the bacon for 10 minutes.
step-4: crack one egg into each of the cups and sprinkle with salt, pepper, and cheddar cheese.
step-5: bake again for another 10 minutes or until egg yolk is at desired consistency.
step-6: run a knife around the edge of each cup to loosen and remove.
step-7: sprinkle with chives, if desired.

step-1: cut sweet potato into thin slices, about ¼ inch (6 mm) thick.
step-2: place in toaster and set it to the maximum cook time.
step-3: when it pops, flip the sweet potato slices over and toast 1 more time.
step-4: depending on the strength of your toaster and your preferences, you may need to toast it 1 more time after that.
step-5: remove from toaster and let cool enough to handle.
step-6: scramble eggs with salt and pepper.
step-7: place two slices of cooked bacon on the sweet potato toast.
step-8: top with scrambled eggs.
step-9: garnish with green onion.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: cut one sheet of puff pastry into long ½ inch (1 ¼ cm) wide strips and set aside.
step-3: cut strips of bacon in half lengthwise and set aside.
step-4: take a trimmed green bean and carefully wrap it with bacon and the puff pastry to completely cover the bean.
step-5: place the tightly wrapped beans on a parchment paper-lined sheet pan.
step-6: brush the wrapped beans with the egg wash, and season with salt and pepper.
step-7: bake in the oven for 20 minutes, or until bacon is crispy and the puff pastry is golden brown.
step-8: serve the twists warm or at room temperature.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: using a knife, cut around the pit of the avocado, separating the halves from each other.
step-3: remove the pit and use a spoon to scoop out the avocado.
step-4: in a large bowl, combine the avocado, onion, tomato, cilantro, salt, and lime juice.
step-5: mash and stir with a fork until there are no large chunks of avocado left.
step-6: season chicken breasts with salt and pepper on all sides.
step-7: slice chicken breasts in half crosswise.
step-8: cut a slit into the center of each half to make a pocket.
step-9: take a heaping spoonful of the guacamole and pack it into the pocket.
step-10: pinch the edges of the chicken closed.
step-11: wrap the chicken with two strips of bacon, making sure the ends of the bacon all end up on the same side of the chicken.
step-12: heat oil in a pan over high heat.
step-13: sear the bacon-wrapped chicken for two to three minutes on each side.
step-14: remember to cook the sides of the chicken as well.
step-15: bake for 10 minutes and then serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c) and cover a cookie sheet with parchment paper.
step-2: in a pan, cook bacon until crisp, then chop into small pieces.
step-3: discard excess fat (reserve approximately 2 tablespoons).
step-4: in the same pan, sauté the onions in the reserved fat until they start to become translucent.
step-5: add the jalapeños.
step-6: cook until the onions start to caramelize and remove from heat.
step-7: in a large bowl, combine the cream cheese, bacon, cheddar, pepper, garlic powder, and jalapeño mixture.
step-8: stir until thoroughly incorporated.
step-9: on a lightly floured surface, gently roll out the puff pastry until the surface is smooth and even.
step-10: spread the japapeño mixture on the pastry sheet, stopping 1 inch (2 ½ cm) from the top of the dough.
step-11: starting at the bottom, tightly roll upwards and pinch the top edge to seal into a log shape.
step-12: cut the roll every 1½ inches (3 ¾ cm).
step-13: place the pieces face-up, 2 inches (5 cm) apart on the baking sheet.
step-14: sprinkle the tops of the pastries with cheddar.
step-15: bake for 25 to 30 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the sides of the pastries are a light golden color.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c)
step-2: add eggs to the bowl.
step-3: in a medium-sized bowl, whisk the eggs, milk, salt, and pepper.
step-4: add in the green onions and cheddar, and mix again.
step-5: pour the egg mixture into the pie crust and bake for 35-40 minutes or until set.
step-6: increase the oven temperature to 400°f (200°c).
step-7: lay the bacon on top of the pie and weave to make a lattice top.
step-8: bake again for 20 minutes or until bacon is crispy.
step-9: broil for crispier bacon.

step-1: cook bacon until crispy.
step-2: drain on a paper towel, then set aside.
step-3: place chopped lettuce, tomatoes, cucumber, avocados and bacon in a large bowl.
step-4: in a small bowl, mix olive oil, balsamic vinegar, mustard, salt, and lemon juice to form the dressing.
step-5: toss the salad with the dressing.

step-1: in a large pot or skillet, add 2 cups (470ml) of milk, pasta, salt, and pepper.
step-2: bring it to boil, stirring constantly so the milk and pasta do not burn.
step-3: when the liquid is evaporated halfway, add the rest of the milk.
step-4: stir until pasta is al dente.
step-5: add shredded cheeses and mix until melted.
step-6: take off the heat to prevent mac ‘n’ cheese from over cooking.
step-7: in a oven-safe ceramic bowl, coat the inside with butter (or oil).
step-8: place sliced cheese until the bowl is fully covered.
step-9: add bacon (or any desired fixins’), and add the pasta to the top.
step-10: roll or spread out pizza dough to fit the bowl and place over the top.
step-11: in a small bowl, melt butter.
step-12: add in garlic powder, salt, and italian seasoning, then brush on top of dough.
step-13: bake in a 350°f (180°c) over for 25 minutes.
step-14: carefully place a plate over the dough and flip the bowl.
step-15: use a butter knife or fork to separate from the bowl.
step-16: sprinkle with parsley for garnish.

step-1: thread one end of the bacon onto the end of a skewer.
step-2: add a mushroom half, and weave the bacon around the mushroom and back through the skewer, creating a wave pattern between the mushrooms.
step-3: move the bacon and the mushrooms down the skewer, repeating until the other edge of the bacon is threaded through.
step-4: repeat with remaining bacon and mushrooms.
step-5: heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
step-6: sear 3-4 skewers at a time, seasoning with salt and pepper, and flip when the undersides are golden brown.
step-7: season the other side with salt and pepper and cook until bacon is as crispy as you’d like.
step-8: cool and serve!

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: place chicken breast in a baking dish.
step-3: season chicken with salt and pepper, to taste.
step-4: spread 1-2 tbsp.
step-5: ranch on each chicken breast.
step-6: layer two slices of bacon on top of each chicken breast.
step-7: top with cheese.
step-8: bake for 40 minutes.

step-1: in a medium size bowl, whisk together the eggs, salt, and parmesan until well combined.
step-2: in a medium size saucepan over medium-high heat, melt the butter and pour the egg mixture into the pan.
step-3: let the egg cook just until it starts to set, then add the cheddar cheese, potatoes, sausage, and bacon to the center of the egg wrap.
step-4: cover with a lid and cook for another 3 minutes, or until the egg is fully cooked through and the cheese is melted.
step-5: remove from the pan and fold in the egg wrap’s left and right sides, then roll from the bottom to the top to form a burrito.

step-1: in a 16 oz (475 ml) mason jar, add eggs, salt, pepper, bacon, spinach, and cheese.
step-2: place the lid on the mason jar and shake until ingredients are well-combined.
step-3: remove lid and place microwave for 1½-2 minutes, or until omelet appears puffy.
step-4: *be careful mason jar will be hot*
step-5: top with green onions, if desired.

step-1: lay out stips of bacon on a clean cutting board or other clean flat surface.
step-2: lightly brush each strip of bacon with maple syrup making sure to coat the entire surface of the meat.
step-3: lightly sprinkle with black pepper.
step-4: take a brussels sprouts and starting from the bottom, roll up each piece of bacon so that it evenly wraps the vegetable.
step-5: lightly brush the tops of each wrapped brussels sprout with more maple syrup and sprinkle on additional pepper.
step-6: transfer the pieces to a baking sheet making sure to place each piece of rolled-up bacon with the seam side down.
step-7: bake at 350˚f (180˚c) for 20-25 minutes or until bacon is done and thoroughly cooked.
step-8: remove from baking tray and place on paper towels to remove excess bacon fat.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: in a bowl, add the ground beef, worcestershire sauce, dijon mustard, salt, pepper, onion powder, and garlic powder.
step-3: mix to combine.
step-4: transfer to a wire rack on a sheet pan.
step-5: create a ring shape with the meat mixture, gently pressing it flat until it’s 2 inches (5 cm) thick.
step-6: place each piece of bacon around the meat ring tucking the bacon underneath.
step-7: bake for 20 minutes, then broil 15-20 minutes on high heat until bacon is crisp.
step-8: in a saucepan, add ½ cup (120 ml) of milk and flour on medium heat, whisking until thickened and pulling away from pan.
step-9: pour in the rest of the milk and add the salt, stir until bubbling and thickened about 5 minutes.
step-10: remove from heat.
step-11: stir in cheese, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, green chilies, and dijon mustard.
step-12: transfer to a ramekin or bowl.
step-13: set aside.
step-14: arrange the bottom rolls in a circle.
step-15: place meat ring on top of buns.
step-16: add lettuce and tomato on top of the meat ring then place the top part of the buns around the top of the meat ring.
step-17: place fondue in the center of the meat ring.
step-18: slice and serve immediately.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, mix the ground beef, eggs, bread crumbs, salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
step-3: mix until well combined.
step-4: put the mixture in a medium baking tray lined with aluminum foil and distribute the meat mixture evenly.
step-5: add the ham, cheese, and spinach on top of the meat.
step-6: carefully lift the meat and form a roll.
step-7: in another aluminum-lined baking tray, place the slices of bacon side by side, one next to the other.
step-8: place the meat roll on top of the bacon.
step-9: roll up the meat with the bacon, then wrap with foil.
step-10: bake the aluminum-wrapped roll for 25 minutes.
step-11: increase the temperature to 500˚f (260˚c).
step-12: remove the foil and bake for 20 more minutes until the bacon is golden brown and crispy.
step-13: cool for 5 minutes, then slice and serve.

step-1: combine filling ingredients in a medium bowl, and mix thoroughly.
step-2: refrigerate at least 15 minutes.
step-3: cut the ends off the jalapeños, slice in half, and remove the seeds and white flesh from the interior.
step-4: butterfly the hot dogs.
step-5: stuff them with a few spoonfuls of the filling.
step-6: place one jalapeño half over each end of the hot dog, fitting the dogs snugly inside.
step-7: use two strips of bacon to wrap each jalapeño dog.
step-8: secure the bacon at each end with a toothpick.
step-9: grill the dogs over medium indirect heat until the bacon is crispy, about 10 minutes, turning halfway through.
step-10: if you don’t have a grill, you can bake them in the oven at 400°f (200°c) for 15-20 minutes.
step-11: remove the toothpicks and serve in buns with your desired toppings.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, mix together beef, cooked onions and garlic, parmesan, eggs, panko, salt, pepper, worcestershire, milk and parsley.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: in another bowl, make the glaze by mixing ketchup, brown sugar, mustard powder, onion powder, paprika, and tomato paste.
step-5: reserve half of the glaze in a separate bowl for after the meatloaf is cooked.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: in a large bowl, mash cooked potatoes, butter, salt, pepper, milk and parmesan to desired consistency.
step-8: set aside.
step-9: line a bundt pan with slices of bacon and use a pastry brush to spread a layer of glaze on the inside of the bacon.
step-10: add ⅔ of the meat to the bottom of the bundt pan and spread up the sides and up the middle of the pan making a “bowl” for the mashed potatoes.
step-11: add the mashed potatoes into the “bowl” and smooth out.
step-12: top the mashed potatoes with the remaining meat, smooth out, coat the top with the raw meat glaze, and fold the slices of bacon over the top of the meat.
step-13: cover with foil and bake for 1 hour, remove the foil after 30 minutes and carefully drain some of the fat before putting it back into the oven.
step-14: place a cooling rack on top of the bundt pan and flip over onto a baking sheet.
step-15: remove the bundt pan and coat the meatloaf with the reserved glaze.
step-16: broil on high for 3-5 minutes or until the glaze has caramelized.

step-1: freeze the string cheese (for at least a few hours)
step-2: once frozen, place the string cheese on top of a slice of bacon, and fold the edges over to cover the cheese.
step-3: once folded wrap/roll the cheese in a second slice of bacon.
step-4: make sure to use toothpicks for support.
step-5: pour oil into a pan and heat to 350°f (177°c), then place your bacon mozzarella stick into it.
step-6: fry until the bacon appears to be cooked in it’s golden brown state then let dry on a paper towel.
step-7: once dried, serve with a dipping sauce of your choice!

step-1: add the warm water to a medium bowl.
step-2: sprinkle the yeast over the water and let sit for 5 minutes, or until mixture is frothy.
step-3: in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, parmesan cheese, sugar, baking powder, salt, basil, and oregano.
step-4: add 2 tablespoons of olive oil and the yeast-water mixture.
step-5: mix with a rubber spatula until a ball of dough forms.
step-6: dump the dough out onto a clean surface and knead for about 5 minutes, until the dough is springy.
step-7: grease the large bowl with the remaining tablespoon of olive oil.
step-8: place the dough in the bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and let rise in a warm place for 1 hour, or until doubled in size.
step-9: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-10: sprinkle a bit of flour over the dough then dump onto a clean surface.
step-11: tear the dough into 30 separate pieces, then roll into 6-inch (15-cm) long strips.
step-12: place a strip of bacon over each dough strip.
step-13: tie both together to form a knot.
step-14: place the knots on a wire rack placed over a baking sheet.
step-15: bake for 20 minutes, or until bread is golden brown and the bacon is crispy.
step-16: in a small bowl, mix together the butter, garlic, and remaining 2 teaspoons of parmesan cheese.
step-17: brush the knots with the butter mixture and bake for another 5 minutes.
step-18: transfer to a serving plate.
step-19: garnish with chopped parsley.
step-20: serve with marinara sauce alongside.

step-1: preheat the oven to 250°f (120°c).
step-2: let the ribeye roast come to room temperature.
step-3: place the ribeye on a greased wire rack set over a baking sheet.
step-4: season all over with salt and freshly ground pepper.
step-5: bake the roast for 3 hours, or until the internal temperature reaches at least 125°f (52°c) for an eventual medium-rare cooked prime rib.
step-6: let the ribeye cool to room temperature.
step-7: increase the oven temperature to 450°f (230°c).
step-8: mix together the butter, garlic, paprika, chives, rosemary, brown sugar, salt, and pepper in a bowl until evenly combined.
step-9: rub the butter mixture all over the ribeye roast.
step-10: on a large piece of parchment paper or plastic wrap, weave together the slices of bacon until you have a bacon lattice twice as long and twice as wide as the roast.
step-11: place the bacon lattice over the roast and tuck any excess bacon around the prime rib.
step-12: return the bacon-wrapped roast to a greased wire rack set over a baking sheet.
step-13: bake the roast for 30 minutes, or until the bacon lattice is crispy.
step-14: the center of the meat should not heat up too much so it is very important you cook it to the desired doneness when the roast is in the oven the first time.
step-15: remove the roast from the pan and pour the pan drippings into a medium saucepan over medium heat.
step-16: add the flour, whisking until there are no lumps and the mixture starts to simmer.
step-17: add the beef broth and stir until the gravy comes to a boil.
step-18: remove the pan from the heat and strain the sauce into a gravy dish.
step-19: carve the prime rib into ¾-inch slices, then serve with any sides you like and the homemade gravy!

step-1: quarter pork to portion into approximately ½-pound (225 gram) pieces.
step-2: this will cut down cooking time.
step-3: place pork into a large bowl.
step-4: add salt, garlic powder, and liquid smoke, and mix until each piece of pork is evenly covered.
step-5: wrap each pork with 2 strips of bacon.
step-6: place pork into the slow cooker and cook for 6 hours on low.
step-7: in a small bowl, combine mayonnaise, sugar, lemon juice, vinegar, salt, and pepper, and mix well.
step-8: in a large bowl, add the vegetables and pour over the dressing and mix until the slaw is fully coated.
step-9: take pork out onto a baking sheet.
step-10: with 2 forks, pull apart the meat into desired size.
step-11: broil on high for a few minutes to until the ends of the pork start to crisp up.
step-12: serve on a bun with slaw.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a small bowl, mix cheese, bacon, and green onion.
step-3: in a small bowl, whip 2 eggs with milk.
step-4: carefully hollow out 1 bagel with a small silver spoon.
step-5: place both bagel halves on a baking sheet.
step-6: fill both bagel halves with cheese and egg mixtures.
step-7: bake in the oven for 25 mins, or until the egg is cooked.

step-1: wrap a 10-inch (25 cm) freezer-safe bowl in plastic wrap.
step-2: scoop the vanilla ice cream into the bowl, and using a spatula smooth the ice cream to form an even layer.
step-3: freeze for 1 hour, or until frozen.
step-4: remove the bowl from the freezer, and scoop the strawberry ice cream onto the frozen vanilla layer.
step-5: using a spatula, smooth the strawberry ice cream to form an even layer.
step-6: freeze for 1 hour, or until frozen.
step-7: after the strawberry layer is frozen, repeat with chocolate ice cream.
step-8: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-9: in a bowl, add the eggs and sugar and whisk until well combined.
step-10: add 1 egg and mix until combined.
step-11: repeat with remaining eggs, mixing after each egg is added.
step-12: alternate adding a little bit of flour and milk, whisking after each addition until combined.
step-13: repeat until the flour and milk have been used up.
step-14: the batter should be smooth and creamy.
step-15: add the baking powder, salt, and vanilla extract and whisk until well combined.
step-16: pour the batter into a greased and floured 10-inch (25 cm) cake tin.
step-17: bake for 50 minutes to 1 hour, until the top is golden brown and a toothpick comes out clean.
step-18: let the cake cool completely.
step-19: once cool, invert the cake onto a plate and set aside.
step-20: bring a pan of water to a simmer over medium heat.
step-21: place a heatproof bowl over the simmering water, and add the egg whites, sugar, and cream of tartar.
step-22: whisk constantly until the sugar has dissolved and the egg white mixture is warm, about 3 minutes.
step-23: remove the bowl from the pan.
step-24: using a hand mixer, beat the egg white mixture until stiff, glossy peaks form, about 10 minutes.
step-25: add the vanilla extract and mix until just combined.
step-26: remove the bowl of ice cream from the freezer and gently invert it onto the cake, creating a dome shape.
step-27: remove the plastic wrap from the ice cream.
step-28: working quickly, use a spatula to spread a layer of meringue over the entire cake and ice cream dome so that it’s fully coated.
step-29: using a kitchen torch, brown the peaks of meringue.
step-30: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: peel apples completely, removing all skin and stems.
step-3: halve apples across the middle creating both a top and bottom piece.
step-4: using a melon baller remove the core, being careful not to go completely through the bottom.
step-5: once the core is removed, continue using the melon baller to carve out the interior of the apple, keeping the small pieces of apple seperate.
step-6: in a small bowl, combine the carved out apple pieces with the white sugar, cinnamon, cornstarch, and softened butter.
step-7: mix until apple pieces are evenly coated.
step-8: lay puff pastry out on a lightly floured surface.
step-9: with a rolling pin, spread pastry out to make a sheet measuring roughly 9x14 inches (23x36cm).
step-10: using the round top of a sauce pan (ideally 6-7 inches (15-17 cm) in diameter), cut 2 circles of pastry out of each sheet and set them aside.
step-11: spoon filling into the hollowed-out core of the apples and place each filled apple in the middle of a round piece of pastry.
step-12: apply a light wash of egg white to the rim of the pastry and fold toward the center over the apple, crimping the pastry as the edges meet.
step-13: continue until all the edges have been brought together.
step-14: use your hands to keep shape of the dumpling.
step-15: once shaped, brush more egg white over the top of each dumpling.
step-16: lastly, using a small pairing knife, cut a small vent into the top of each dumpling.
step-17: bake for 18-22 minutes in a preheated oven, or until pastry is golden brown and filling is bubbling.
step-18: cider sauce: while dumplings are baking combine water, apple cider, sugar, and cinnamon in a saucepan and bring it to a boil.
step-19: boil for 15 minutes allowing sauce to reduce and become thick.
step-20: before serving, remove from heat and whisk in the 2 tablespoons of butter and lemon juice.
step-21: serve by pouring sauce over dumplings while still hot.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200ºc).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper and set a wire rack inside.
step-3: drain and rinse the artichokes.
step-4: pat them dry.
step-5: in a medium bowl, combine the bread crumbs and vegetarian parmesan cheese.
step-6: dip the artichoke hearts in the melted butter, making sure they are evenly coated.
step-7: then coat well with the bread crumb mixture.
step-8: place the artichoke bites on the wire rack.
step-9: bake for 15 minutes, then reduce the oven temperature to 350ºf (175ºc), flip the artichokes, and bake for 15 minutes more, until the artichoke hearts are warmed through and the bread crumb mixture is toasted.
step-10: meanwhile, make the garlic aioli.
step-11: in a small bowl, combine the mayonnaise, olive oil, garlic, lemon juice, salt, and parsley.
step-12: stir to combine.
step-13: sprinkle the artichoke bites with parsley before serving with aioli alongside.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: slice the avocados in half and remove the pits.
step-3: place the avocado halves on a baking sheet and scoop out some of the flesh to make a bigger hole.
step-4: crack one egg into each hole and season with salt and pepper.
step-5: top with toppings of choice and bake for 15 minutes or until yolk reaches desired consistency.
step-6: sprinkle with fresh herbs, as desired.

step-1: preheat an oven to 350°f (180°c)
step-2: add the flour, salt, and pepper to a bowl and whisk to combine.
step-3: in a separate bowl, crack the eggs and whisk.
step-4: in a third bowl, add the bread crumbs, garlic powder, cumin, and paprika, and whisk to combine.
step-5: halve the avocados, cutting from the stem to the base.
step-6: remove and discard the pits.
step-7: cut each half into ½ inch (1 ¼ cm) wide slices then remove and discard the skin.
step-8: working with one avocado slice at a time, dip in the flour mixture, then egg, and finally bread crumbs, making sure each are fully coated.
step-9: place the avocado slices 1-inch (2 ½ cm) apart on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-10: transfer the baking sheet to the oven and bake for 10 minutes.
step-11: flip the avocados and continue baking until golden brown, 10 to 15 more minutes.
step-12: in a medium bowl, mix together the yogurt, salt, pepper, garlic, and lime juice.
step-13: cover and refrigerate until you’re ready to serve.
step-14: add the red and green cabbage and the carrots to a large bowl, then stir in half of the yogurt sauce until well combined.
step-15: remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the avocado slices cool 2 to 3 minutes before serving.
step-16: place three avocado slices on a single tortilla and top with slaw and toppings of your choice.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: cut off the top of the bread boule so the top surface is flat and without crust.
step-3: slice the crusty top into sticks and set aside.
step-4: set the brie wheel on top of the bread and cut out a hole for the brie.
step-5: set the brie aside and remove the cut out bread.
step-6: in a small bowl, mix the olive oil with 2 cloves of garlic and brush over the bread.
step-7: set the boule aside.
step-8: carefully cut the top rind off of the brie wheel.
step-9: place the brie, cut-side up, inside the bread and set it on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-10: scoop out about a tablespoon of the center of the brie and pour the white wine into the divot.
step-11: top the brie with the remaining minced garlic and chopped bacon, and season with pepper.
step-12: arrange the bread sticks next to the bread on the baking sheet.
step-13: bake for 15- 20 minutes, until the brie is completely melted.
step-14: sprinkle with chives.
step-15: dip the bread sticks and any other dipping items you’d like in the brie.
step-16: to reheat, bake the brie at 250°f (120°c) for about 15 minutes, until melted.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: remove excess moisture from chicken wings with a paper towel.
step-3: in a large bowl, stir in baking powder and salt until chicken is thoroughly coated.
step-4: bake on a baking rack for 1 hour, or until golden brown and crispy, flipping every 20 minutes.
step-5: (for best results, place baking rack on a baking sheet covered with parchment paper or foil to catch drippings).
step-6: in a skillet, combine buffalo sauce ingredients on medium heat.
step-7: then stir in chicken wings until fully coated.
step-8: serve with your favorite side dish or dipping sauce.

step-1: place an oven rack at the bottom of the oven and another at the top.
step-2: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-3: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-4: heat the olive oil in a dutch oven or large oven-safe pot over medium heat.
step-5: add the onion and cook for about 5 minutes, until starting to brown
step-6: add the garlic and rosemary, and cook for 2 minutes, until fragrant.
step-7: add the rice and 4 cups (960 ml) of vegetable broth, and stir to combine.
step-8: bring to a boil, then cover.
step-9: place the risotto on the bottom rack of the oven.
step-10: bake for 70 minutes, until all of the liquid has been absorbed by the rice.
step-11: (it will appear dry, but you’ll be adding moisture back later in the recipe.)
step-12: add the butternut squash to the prepared baking sheet.
step-13: drizzle with olive oil, then season with salt and pepper.
step-14: toss to coat.
step-15: place the squash on the top rack of the oven, above the risotto.
step-16: bake for 45 minutes, or until the edges of the squash begin to brown and caramelize.
step-17: make the fried sage garnish, if using: in a small pot or pan over medium-high heat, add enough olive oil for the sage leaves to sit in.
step-18: once hot, carefully place a few leaves into the oil with tongs.
step-19: fry for 10-20 seconds, until the leaves are crispy but not browned
step-20: carefully remove from the oil and drain on a paper towel-lined plate.
step-21: sprinkle with salt and set aside.
step-22: remove the risotto from the oven.
step-23: add the remaining vegetable broth, the parmesan, and butter.
step-24: stir until creamy.
step-25: (the liquid will absorb into the rice as you stir).
step-26: add the butternut squash and stir to incorporate.
step-27: serve immediately with fried sage for garnish.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: slice chicken breast in half, and cut into thin strips about the thickness of a french fry.
step-3: season bread crumbs with salt, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, dried basil, dried oregano, and pepper.
step-4: mix well.
step-5: dredge chicken strips in the flour first, then cover in egg, and coat with bread crumbs.
step-6: place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake for 20 minutes, flipping halfway.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (215°c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, combine the panko, parmesan cheese, basil, garlic powder, oregano, salt, and pepper.
step-3: beat the 2 eggs in a shallow dish.
step-4: dredge the chicken in the egg wash, then coat with the bread crumb mixture.
step-5: transfer the breaded chicken breasts to a greased roasting pan.
step-6: top the chicken with 2 small slices of mozzarella.
step-7: bake for 20-25 min, until the cheese and bread crumbs have turned golden brown and the chicken is cooked through, or until it has reached an internal temperature of 165°f (73°c).
step-8: serve with whole wheat spaghetti, marinara sauce, and a sprinkle of fresh basil.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: in a bowl, add the paprika, chili powder, cumin, oregano, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper and mix to combine.
step-3: place the chicken breasts on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-4: drizzle with olive oil, pour half of the seasoning over the chicken and spread on both sides of the chicken.
step-5: save the remaining seasoning for later.
step-6: bake for 30 minutes, flipping halfway, or until the internal temperature of the chicken reaches 165˚f (75˚c).
step-7: shred cooked chicken.
step-8: add cream cheese, cheese blend, and remaining seasoning.
step-9: mix well.
step-10: place a couple of scoops of the chicken mixture across the bottom third of a flour tortilla.
step-11: roll up tightly and place on a baking sheet.
step-12: bake for another 15 minutes, or until golden and crispy.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180˚c).
step-2: in a saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter and brown sugar in the water and bring to a boil.
step-3: turn off the heat and stir in the flour.
step-4: take the pot off of the heat source, and mix in the vanilla, then the eggs one at a time.
step-5: transfer mixture to a piping bag with a 5 point, or star, tip.
step-6: pipe out thick 3-inch (8 cm) strips of churro batter onto a baking sheet covered with parchment, using a knife to release each piece from the piping tip, if needed.
step-7: bake for 10 minutes, then broil until golden brown.
step-8: dredge each churro in melted butter, then cinnamon sugar.
step-9: serve with melted chocolate if desired.

step-1: preheat oven to 250˚f (120˚c).
step-2: place apple slices on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and sprinkle with cinnamon and salt.
step-3: bake for 40 minutes, until the apples are slightly browned.
step-4: cool completely before serving.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: grease 2 8-inch (20 cm) round cake pans with nonstick spray.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the melted ice cream, cake mix, and egg whites.
step-4: whisk until smooth.
step-5: divide the cake batter evenly between the prepared pans.
step-6: bake according to the package instructions, about 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cakes comes out clean.
step-7: let cool completely, about 30 minutes.
step-8: place 1 cake on a cake stand or platter.
step-9: spread an even layer of frosting over the cake.
step-10: sprinkle 6 of the crushed chocolate sandwich cookies evenly over the frosting.
step-11: top with the other cake layer.
step-12: spread a thin layer of frosting over the top and sides of the cake.
step-13: chill the cake in the refrigerator for 15 minutes.
step-14: coat the top and sides of the cake with frosting.
step-15: transfer the remaining frosting to a piping bag or resealable plastic bag fitted with a medium star tip.
step-16: pipe 8 1½-inch (20 cm) swirls of frosting around the outside of the cake.
step-17: place a chocolate sandwich cookie vertically in each swirl.
step-18: sprinkle the remaining 4 crushed cookies in the center.
step-19: slice and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: cut 1 inch (2.5 cm) off the top and bottom of each squash, so you reach the seeds.
step-3: discard the top and bottom pieces.
step-4: slice the remaining squash into ¼-inch (½ cm) thick rounds.
step-5: use a metal teaspoon to scoop out the seeds from the rings.
step-6: in a medium bowl, whisk together the bread crumbs, parmesan, garlic powder, paprika, basil, oregano, salt, and pepper.
step-7: in another bowl, beat the eggs.
step-8: add the flour to another bowl.
step-9: coat each squash ring in the flour, tapping off any excess.
step-10: next, coat in the eggs.
step-11: finally, coat in the bread crumb mixture, making sure to press the breadcrumbs into the squash to adhere.
step-12: place the coated rings on a baking sheet.
step-13: bake the squash rings for 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown, flipping once halfway through cooking.
step-14: make the honey mustard dipping sauce: in a small bowl, mix together the dijon, whole-grain mustard, and honey.
step-15: use immediately or refrigerate in an airtight container until ready to serve, up to 3 days.
step-16: serve the squash rings with the dipping sauce.
step-17:
nutrition
calories: 180
total fat: 6 grams
sodium: 820 mg
total carbs: 25 grams
dietary fiber: 4 grams
sugars: 4 grams
protein: 9 grams

step-1: egg cups: grease a large muffin tin.
step-2: place a slice of ham in each tin, then crack an egg over each slice of ham.
step-3: cover with tin foil, then bake at 350˚f (175˚c) for 8-10 minutes (eight minutes if you like your yolk very runny).
step-4: hollandaise sauce: fill the bottom of a double boiler part-way with water.
step-5: make sure that the water doesn’t touch the top bowl.
step-6: bring water to a gentle simmer.
step-7: in the top of the double boiler, whisk together three egg yolks and ½ tsp white vinegar until well mixed.
step-8: slowly pour the melted butter in the egg yolk mixture, a little at a time, while constantly whisking.
step-9: if you pour too much too quickly without whisking, the mixture might not thicken or mix properly.
step-10: if the hollandaise gets too thick, add a teaspoon or two of hot water.
step-11: continue whisking until all the butter is incorporated.
step-12: remove from heat, whisk in lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
step-13: place a toasted english muffin half down, layer the ham and egg cup on top of the english muffin, then drizzle your hollandaise sauce over the egg.

step-1: soak the chickpeas in the water for at least one night, ensuring that the chickpeas are fully submerged.
step-2: drain the chickpeas in a colander.
step-3: line a baking sheet with paper towels and add the chickpeas.
step-4: cover with more paper towels and let dry for at least 2 hours.
step-5: preheat oven to 350°f (180 °c).
step-6: add the dried chickpeas, parsley, cilantro, coriander, mint, 5 cloves of garlic, onion, paprika, 2 teaspoons of cumin, ground coriander, baking soda, toasted sesame seeds, salt and pepper, in a blender and blend until smooth.
step-7: use your hands to form falafel the size of a ping pong ball.
step-8: place falafels on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-9: brush the falafel with olive oil.
step-10: bake for about 25-30 minutes.
step-11: to prepare the tzatziki, cut a cucumber in fourths and remove the seeds.
step-12: use a box grater to grate the cucumber into a bowl.
step-13: salt the grated cucumber and let sit for 5 minutes.
step-14: place the salted cucumber into a sieve and press down with a spatula to remove excess liquid.
step-15: mix the grated cucumber with greek yogurt, 2 tablespoons of mint, the minced garlic cloves, 1 tablespoon of olive oil, lemon juice, salt and pepper.
step-16: serve the falafel with the tzatziki.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f/220°c.
step-2: cut ends and sides off of potatoes and cut into ¼-inch/6-mm sticks.
step-3: place potatoes into a bowl of cold water and let it soak for 30 minutes.
step-4: dry potatoes thoroughly, then add olive oil, salt, pepper, paprika, and garlic powder.
step-5: bake the fries for 30 minutes.
step-6: flip halfway.
step-7: for the fish, pat dry with paper towels.
step-8: season with salt and pepper.
step-9: in a mixing bowl, combine flour, garlic powder, and paprika.
step-10: in another bowl, whisk two eggs together.
step-11: in another mixing bowl, add panko bread crumbs.
step-12: dip the fish into the flour mixture, then the eggs, then the bread crumbs.
step-13: drizzle olive oil on top of fish for more crispiness.
step-14: grease the pan, then bake fish for 15 minutes.
step-15: for the tartar sauce, combine greek yogurt, salt, pepper, onion powder, pickle relish, fresh parsley, and lemon juice.
step-16: mix until well combined.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: remove excess moisture from chicken wings with a paper towel.
step-3: in a large bowl, stir in baking powder and salt until chicken is thoroughly coated.
step-4: bake on a baking rack for 1 hour, or until golden brown and crispy, flipping every 20 minutes.
step-5: (for best results, place baking rack on a baking sheet covered with parchment paper or foil to catch drippings).
step-6: in a skillet, heat olive oil and garlic on medium heat for about 30 seconds, or until garlic starts to release its flavor.
step-7: stir in remaining herbs and spices.
step-8: once combined, add in chicken wings and stir until fully coated.
step-9: serve with your favorite side dish or dipping sauce.

step-1: slice the potatoes into wedges.
step-2: place potato wedges in a large bowl.
step-3: drizzle olive oil and toss to coat.
step-4: sprinkle potato wedges with shredded cheese and toss again.
step-5: in a small bowl, mix salt, italian seasoning, garlic powder, and paprika.
step-6: sprinkle seasoning onto potato wedges and toss to coat.
step-7: place potato wedges on a baking sheet with skin-sides-down.
step-8: bake for 40 minutes at 400˚f (200˚c ) until potatoes are fork-tender and golden.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: unroll cans of dough, separate into triangles.
step-3: on a large cookie sheet, place a bowl in the center (about 5 inches [12cm] in diameter).
step-4: arrange the triangles in a ring around the bowl, dough should overlap.
step-5: layer cheese, pepperoncinis, basil, salami, ham, prosciutto, and provolone on each triangle closest to the ring.
step-6: season with salt and pepper.
step-7: bring the top of the triangle over the filling, and tuck the edges under the bottom layer of dough.
step-8: repeat around the ring until the entire filling is enclosed.
step-9: bake for 30 minutes or until the dough is golden brown.
step-10: serve with olive oil and balsamic.
step-11: cool 5 to 10 minutes before cutting into serving slices.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: remove excess moisture from chicken wings with a paper towel.
step-3: in a large bowl, stir in baking powder and salt until chicken is thoroughly coated.
step-4: bake on a baking rack for 1 hour, or until golden brown and crispy, flipping every 20 minutes.
step-5: for best results, place baking rack on a baking sheet covered with parchment paper or foil to catch drippings.
step-6: in a skillet, combine honey mustard sauce ingredients on medium heat.
step-7: stir in chicken wings until fully coated.
step-8: serve with your favorite side dish or dipping sauce.

step-1: preheat oven to 450°f (230°c).
step-2: using a clean pair of scissors or kitchen shears, cut along the middle of the top of the shell towards the fins of the tail, making sure to cut in a straight line.
step-3: do not cut through the end of the tail.
step-4: using a spoon, separate the meat from the two sides of the shell, then lift the meat up and out from inside the shell.
step-5: press the two sides of the shell together, then lay the meat over the seam where the two shells meet.
step-6: if you are having difficulty opening the shell up to lift out the meat, flip the tail over and make cuts along the carapace where the legs meet the bottom part tail.
step-7: this will help break the rigid structure of the shell and allow it to be more flexible.
step-8: while cutting through the shell, you may have also cut into the meat, which is perfectly okay.
step-9: make a shallow cut through the middle of the lobster meat so that you can peel down the thin layer of meat over the sides.
step-10: this gives the lobster tail its signature look.
step-11: in a small bowl, combine the butter, salt, pepper, garlic powder, paprika, lemon juice, and parsley, then brush the mixture evenly over the lobster meat.
step-12: place the tails onto a baking sheet, then bake for approximately 12-15 minutes, until the lobster is fully cooked but not rubbery.
step-13: serve with a side of broccoli and a lemon wedge.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: grease 2 8-inch (20 cm) round cake pans with nonstick spray.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the melted ice cream, cake mix, and egg whites.
step-4: whisk until smooth.
step-5: divide the cake batter evenly between the prepared pans.
step-6: bake according to the package instructions, about 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cakes comes out clean.
step-7: let cool completely, about 30 minutes.
step-8: place 1 cake on a cake stand or platter.
step-9: spread an even layer of frosting over the cake.
step-10: top with the other cake layer.
step-11: spread a thin layer of frosting over the top and sides of the cake.
step-12: chill the cake in the refrigerator for 15 minutes.
step-13: use the remaining frosting to coat the top and sides of the cake.
step-14: place the cake over a baking sheet to catch any excess cookies.
step-15: use your hand to coat the sides of the cake with crushed mint cookies.
step-16: slice and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: place milk, applesauce, nut butter, maple syrup, vanilla, and eggs in a medium-sized bowl.
step-3: whisk until combined.
step-4: add oats, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt.
step-5: stir quickly to make sure everything is well-hydrated.
step-6: pour batter into a greased muffin tin, and add toppings of your choice.
step-7: bake for 20–25 minutes or until the middle springs back when gently pressed.
step-8: oatmeal cups can be enjoyed immediately and/or frozen in an airtight container (once completely cool) to be enjoyed later by microwaving for 2 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: cut chicken breasts into strips and season with salt and pepper.
step-3: in a re-sealable plastic bag, combine flour, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, and italian seasoning.
step-4: add the seasoned chicken strips into the flour mixture and seal the bag.
step-5: shake until the chicken strips are well coated with the flour mixture.
step-6: beat 3 eggs in a small bowl and dip each piece of chicken until well coated.
step-7: in another bowl, combine bread crumbs and parmesan cheese and coat each piece of chicken with the mixture.
step-8: place the coated chicken strips on a greased baking sheet and bake for 35-40 minutes, flipping halfway, and bake until golden brown (times and temperatures may vary based on oven).

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a food processor, combine the oats, hazelnuts, walnuts, shredded coconut, cherries, flax seeds, cinnamon, and salt.
step-3: pulse until finely ground.
step-4: add the coconut oil, honey, and vanilla, and pulse until just combined.
step-5: the mixture should hold together when squeezed between your fingers.
step-6: cut the pears in half lengthwise.
step-7: using a tablespoon, scoop out the cores.
step-8: with a paring knife, cut a “v” shape around the edges of the stem, cutting downward on an angle.
step-9: remove the stems.
step-10: set the pears in a baking dish, cut-side up.
step-11: fill each with ¼ cup (30 grams) of the crumble topping, pressing lightly into the pears.
step-12: bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the topping is golden brown and the pears are tender when pierced with a paring knife.
step-13: serve immediately, topped with whipped topping and a drizzle of honey, if desired.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: in a small bowl, combine all the paprika seasoning ingredients, stir.
step-3: cut the potatoes in half lengthwise, and cut each half into quarters lengthwise, making 16 total wedges.
step-4: place wedges in a bowl of water to remove the extra starch from the potatoes.
step-5: drain.
step-6: place wedges on a baking sheet and pour olive oil, 3 spoonfuls of the paprika seasoning, and parmesan over the potatoes.
step-7: using clean hands, mix together to coat potatoes, then arrange potatoes in rows, without overlapping, so they bake evenly.
step-8: bake for 30 minutes, flipping halfway, or until crispy.
step-9: cut cod fillet down the middle and into 3 to 4-inch (8-10 cm) long pieces.
step-10: some of the thicker pieces may need to be cut in half.
step-11: mix the paprika seasoning into the panko.
step-12: dredge each fish stick through the eggs, flour, back in the egg, and finally, panko.
step-13: place on a baking sheet
step-14: bake with the potato wedges for 15 minutes, flipping halfway, or until golden brown and cooked through.
step-15: serve with your favorite dipping sauces.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: cover a sheet pan with foil or parchment paper.
step-3: drizzle olive oil on the salmon, then season with salt and pepper.
step-4: top with lemon slices and thyme.
step-5: bake for 10-12 minutes.
step-6: (the salmon should flake easily with a fork when it’s ready.)

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the chicken wings, olive oil, corn starch, pepper, and salt and toss with tongs to coat.
step-4: transfer the wings to the baking sheet.
step-5: bake for 40 minutes, until golden and crispy.
step-6: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: in a medium-sized casserole pan, combine shrimp, salt, pepper, red chili flakes, garlic, butter, lemon juice, and white wine.
step-3: bake for 10-13 minutes, or until shrimp turns pink and is fully cooked.
step-4: bring 4 quarts of water to a boil, add salt to taste, and cook linguine pasta al dente according to package directions, stirring occasionally.
step-5: strain linguine and combine with shrimp until pasta is fully coated in white wine scampi sauce.
step-6: garnish with chopped italian parsley.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: grease 2 8-inch (20 cm) round cake pans with nonstick spray.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the melted ice cream, cake mix, and egg whites.
step-4: whisk until smooth.
step-5: divide the cake batter evenly between the prepared pans.
step-6: bake according to the package instructions, about 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cakes comes out clean.
step-7: let cool completely, about 30 minutes.
step-8: place 1 cake on a cake stand or platter.
step-9: spread an even layer of frosting over the cake.
step-10: sprinkle ⅓ cup (65 g) sprinkles over the frosting.
step-11: top with the other cake layer.
step-12: spread a thin layer of frosting over the top and sides of the cake.
step-13: chill the cake in the refrigerator for 15 minutes.
step-14: use the remaining frosting to coat the top and sides of the cake.
step-15: cover the top of the cake with the remaining ⅓ cup sprinkles.
step-16: slice and serve.

step-1: rinse and peel sweet potatoes.
step-2: to cut into fries, cut a small sliver off the edge of the potatoes lengthwise to create a flat side for them to rest on.
step-3: turn the potato over to lay on its flat side.
step-4: cut each slice lengthwise into three to four fries.
step-5: place the fries in a bowl of water and soak for one hour.
step-6: (this helps remove excess starch from the potatoes so your fries will be crispier.)
step-7: rinse and dry off.
step-8: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-9: in a large bowl or gallon bag, toss the fries with cornstarch until they’re evenly coated.
step-10: then add the oil and toss to coat.
step-11: add the pepper, paprika, garlic powder, and brown sugar and toss to evenly distribute your spices.
step-12: (hold off on adding the salt until after baking.
step-13: this will help make sure the fries are crispy.)
step-14: line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil and spray with nonstick cooking spray.
step-15: lay out the french fries, being sure not to overcrowd the pan.
step-16: (you may need two pans, depending on how large your pans are.
step-17: avoid overcrowding one pan or your fries may not crisp up.)
step-18: bake for 15 minutes.
step-19: flip fries with tongs, then bake for an additional 10–15 minutes.
step-20: sprinkle on salt (to taste) and serve!
step-21: add shredded parmesan and chopped parsley for an optional garnish.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: remove excess moisture from chicken wings with a paper towel.
step-3: in a large bowl, stir in baking powder and salt until chicken is thoroughly coated.
step-4: bake on a baking rack for 1 hour, or until golden brown and crispy, flipping every 20 minutes.
step-5: (for best results, place baking rack on a baking sheet covered with parchment paper or foil to catch drippings).
step-6: in a skillet, combine soy sauce, honey, and brown sugar on medium heat.
step-7: bring to a boil and add in sesame seeds.
step-8: once sauce is thickened, stir in chicken wings until fully coated.
step-9: serve with your favorite side dish or dipping sauce.

step-1: preheat oven to 190°c (375°f).
step-2: in a small saucepan, cook the apple, brown sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg over a medium-low heat until softened.
step-3: cut three thin strips on a chilled sheet of puff pastry.
step-4: cut two of the strips into four and make a small lattice pattern with them.
step-5: repeat to make three more lattices.
step-6: cut the tops of the apples and scoop out the insides carefully with a melon baller.
step-7: mix some of the toffee sauce in and fill with the toffee apple mixture.
step-8: place the lattices on top of each apple and drape the remaining strips around the lattice, cutting off any overhang.
step-9: place apples in an ovenproof dish, brush the pastry with egg wash and sprinkle over some more brown sugar and cinnamon.
step-10: bake for 20 minutes.
step-11: serve with ice cream and more toffee sauce.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: make the syrup: in a small pot over medium high heat, combine the sugar, water, and lemon juice, and bring to a boil.
step-3: simmer until reduced to a syrupy consistency, 5-7 minutes.
step-4: remove from the heat and let cool.
step-5: make the filling: in a food processor, combine the walnuts, sugar, and cinnamon.
step-6: process until very finely ground.
step-7: assemble the baklava: on a flat surface, lay out a sheet of phyllo dough.
step-8: brush with melted butter.
step-9: spoon some of the filling along the bottom edge of the phyllo sheet, leaving ½ inch (1 ¼ cm) space from the bottom, then roll up as tightly as you can.
step-10: transfer to a baking sheet and repeat with the remaining ingredients.
step-11: you should be about to fit about 12 phyllo rolls per baking sheet.
step-12: brush the tops of the rolls with butter, then use a knife to score the rolls diagonally where you will slice them after baking.
step-13: bake for 20 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-14: immediately after removing from the oven, brush the baklava with the syrup.
step-15: finish slicing, then serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: cut sweet potatoes into medium julienne.
step-3: spread sweet potatoes evenly onto parchment paper-lined baking tray.
step-4: season with olive oil, pepper, and salt.
step-5: bake for 20 minutes.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: trim asparagus and cut into pieces diagonally.
step-8: spread evenly on the baking tray next to the sweet potatoes.
step-9: season with olive oil, pepper, and salt.
step-10: season chicken with pepper and salt.
step-11: place on top of the veggies.
step-12: bake for 15 minutes or until the internal temperature of the chicken reaches 165˚f (75˚c).
step-13: while chicken is baking, reduce balsamic vinegar, white wine vinegar, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, pepper, and salt in a small saucepan for 5-7 minutes until the sauce slightly thickens.
step-14: distribute veggies and chicken into four containers.
step-15: pour the sauce reduction onto the chicken.
step-16: can be refrigerated up to 4 days.

step-1: add the ingredients into a mason jar.
step-2: screw the lid on tightly and shake vigorously.
step-3: the dressing can remain in the fridge for 1-2 weeks.
step-4: pour over your favorite salad ingredients and enjoy!

step-1: pour instant out into mason jar or bowl.
step-2: add salt to taste (optional).
step-3: add cinnamon.
step-4: pour hot water and stir the oatmeal occasionally.
step-5: let stand for 1 minute.
step-6: add sliced banana and almonds to taste.

step-1: combine all the ingredients above in a large bowl.
step-2: mix the dressing ingredients together and spread over fruit, mix well.

step-1: add all the ingredients to a blender and mix on high.
step-2: pour into a bowl and top with desired fruit and other toppings.

step-1: preheat oven to 325°f (170°c).
step-2: mash bananas, then add applesauce or greek yogurt, honey, egg, vanilla extract, and almond milk.
step-3: whisk until well combined.
step-4: in another bowl, mix whole wheat flour, baking soda, and salt together.
step-5: add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and stir well.
step-6: spray loaf pan with cooking spray or wipe down with oil.
step-7: pour mix into a loaf pan.
step-8: bake 50-55 minutes.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, mash the bananas with a fork.
step-3: add the oil, egg, sugar, and vanilla.
step-4: stir until combined.
step-5: add the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon.
step-6: stir until just combined.
step-7: don’t over mix.
step-8: pour the banana bread batter into a greased 9-inch (22 cm) springform pan.
step-9: bake for 30-40 minutes, or until the top is set.
step-10: in a large bowl, add the cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla.
step-11: whisk until combined.
step-12: microwave the milk until hot, about 2 minutes, then add the gelatin powder.
step-13: quickly stir until gelatin is completely dissolved, about 5 minutes.
step-14: pour the gelatin mixture over the cream cheese and whisk again until smooth.
step-15: pour the cheesecake mixture over the baked banana bread crust.
step-16: chill for 3 hours, or overnight.
step-17: unmold the cheesecake, then slice and serve drizzled with caramel sauce.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: grease a bundt pan with nonstick spray.
step-3: in a large bowl, mash the bananas.
step-4: add the eggs, yogurt, honey, and vanilla and whisk to combine.
step-5: add the flour and baking soda and stir with a rubber spatula to incorporate.
step-6: fold in the walnuts.
step-7: pour the batter into the prepared bundt pan.
step-8: smooth the top with a spatula.
step-9: bake for about 50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
step-10: baking times may vary, so keep an eye on the bread
step-11: invert the cake onto a wire rack set over a baking sheet and let cool completely.
step-12: make the frosting: in a small bowl, mix together the powdered sugar and 2 tablespoons of greek yogurt.
step-13: add more yogurt as needed until your desired consistency is reached.
step-14: pour the frosting over the bread.
step-15: quickly sprinkle more walnuts on top before the frosting sets.
step-16: slice and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: make the cake: place the peeled bananas in a medium bowl and use a fork to mash them.
step-3: add the eggs, vanilla, and sugar and whisk until the mixture turns pale yellow.
step-4: add the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt and whisk to combine.
step-5: grease a baking sheet well and line with parchment paper.
step-6: pour the batter onto the baking sheet and use a spatula to spread evenly.
step-7: bake for 12 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and springs back when gently pressed.
step-8: cover a large, clean dish towel with powdered sugar (this will help keep the cake from sticking to the towel).
step-9: while the cake is still warm, carefully flip the baking sheet onto the towel.
step-10: lift up the sheet and remove the parchment paper.
step-11: starting from a short end, gently roll up the cake with the towel.
step-12: let cool for at least 1 hour.
step-13: make the filling: add the cream cheese to a medium bowl and whip with a fork until light and fluffy.
step-14: add the sugar, vanilla, and milk.
step-15: mix until the filling is silky and smooth.
step-16: add the melted chocolate and fold with a spatula to combine.
step-17: unroll the banana bread and spread the filling evenly over it.
step-18: roll the banana bread back up without the towel, wrap the outside with the towel or plastic wrap, and chill for 4 hours.
step-19: remove the roll from the fridge and sift powdered sugar over the top.
step-20: top with whipped cream.
step-21: run a vegetable peeler across a chocolate bar to sprinkle chocolate curls over the whipped cream.
step-22: slice and serve.

step-1: add bananas, chickpeas, honey, vanilla, and cinnamon to a food processor and blend until smooth.
step-2: top with walnuts and serve with your favorite fruit or dipping snack.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a bowl, mash the bananas with a fork.
step-3: add in the melted butter, egg, sugar, and vanilla and mix until combined.
step-4: add in the flour, baking soda, and salt and mix again until just combined.
step-5: pour the batter into a loaf pan.
step-6: bake for 50 minutes, or until cooked through.
step-7: once cool, take the banana bread out of the pan and slice into three horizontal layers, widthwise.
step-8: line the loaf pan with plastic wrap and place the bottom layer of bread in the pan.
step-9: top the bread with the softened vanilla ice cream and spread evenly with a spoon.
step-10: place the middle layer of bread on top of the vanilla ice cream.
step-11: top the middle layer with chocolate ice cream and spread evenly with a spoon.
step-12: place the top of the banana bread on top and cover with the plastic wrap.
step-13: freeze for one hour or or overnight.
step-14: slice and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: prepare six pint-sized mason jars with nonstick spray or oil of choice to prevent sticking.
step-3: in a medium bowl, mash bananas.
step-4: mix eggs, yogurt, honey, vanilla extract, and baking soda into mixture.
step-5: add flour and mix until just combined.
step-6: pour the batter into the mason jars, filling half of each jar.
step-7: do not add the lids.
step-8: bake for 50 mins, or until a toothpick comes out clean from the middle of the bread.
step-9: allow to cool for 15 minutes before serving.

step-1: add the instant oatmeal, freeze-dried bananas, walnuts, vanilla bean, and sugar into a mason jar.
step-2: store in a cool, dry place for up to a month.
step-3: to prepare, pour boiling water or milk over oats.
step-4: stir to combine and let sit for 3 minutes.
step-5: serve with walnuts and fresh sliced bananas.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, mash the bananas into a fine paste using a fork.
step-3: add the eggs and whisk together until well incorporated.
step-4: add in the greek yogurt, honey, and vanilla extract, then mix.
step-5: pour the flour over the wet mixture then sprinkle in the baking soda.
step-6: using a spatula, fold the wet and dry ingredients together until the dry bits of the flour have disappeared.
step-7: using a medium ice cream scoop, portion the batter evenly into a greased muffin tin.
step-8: top the muffins with your choice of toppings.
step-9: bake for 20 minutes, until the muffins have risen and set.
step-10: unmold from the tray and serve.

step-1: peel the bananas and slice off the tops and bottoms to create a straighter middle section.
step-2: save ends for later.
step-3: insert a popsicle stick into the middle of each banana and place on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-4: freeze the bananas until solid, about 1 hour.
step-5: in a medium bowl, mash the banana ends with a fork until smooth.
step-6: add the sugar, vanilla, oil, and egg.
step-7: mix until combined.
step-8: add the flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt.
step-9: mix again until smooth.
step-10: in a large pot, heat the oil to 325°f (170°c).
step-11: place a wire rack inside a baking sheet and line with paper towels.
step-12: pour the banana bread batter into a tall glass.
step-13: when the oil is hot, dip one of the frozen bananas into the batter until completely covered.
step-14: keep the rest of the bananas frozen until ready to fry.
step-15: fry the bananas, one at a time, until golden brown and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
step-16: transfer the fried bananas to the towel-lined rack as they are done.
step-17: sprinkle with powdered sugar and serve with melted chocolate and caramel sauce for dipping.

step-1: add all of the ingredients except for the banana and pecans in a clean mason jar.
step-2: stir everything together.
step-3: add the banana and pecans.
step-4: put a lid on the mason jar and refrigerate overnight 40°f (≤ 5°c).

step-1: on a cutting board, cut bread into small cubes.
step-2: place onto a baking sheet and bake at 350°f (175°c) for five minutes to help dry the bread out.
step-3: in a large mixing bowl, add ripe bananas and mush.
step-4: add in beaten eggs, milk, cinnamon, and vanilla extract, and stir.
step-5: once fully mixed, add bread and let it soak for 5 to 10 minutes.
step-6: add in chocolate chips.
step-7: stir together, and spoon mix into a large muffin tin.
step-8: bake at 350°f (175°c) for 20 minutes.
step-9: scoop your favorite ice cream or whipped cream and top with chocolate syrup.

step-1: preheat oven to 350ºf (175ºc).
step-2: in a large bowl, mash the banana until it's liquid.
step-3: add the remaining ingredients to the bowl and mix until incorporated.
step-4: pour the mix into a greased 8x8" (20cm x 20cm) baking pan.
step-5: bake for 15 minutes.
step-6: allow to cool for 5 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180˚c).
step-2: in a blender, combine all ingredients except chocolate chips.
step-3: blend thoroughly, mixing up with a spoon if needed.
step-4: divide mixture among 12 lined muffin tins.
step-5: sprinkle chocolate chips on top of the muffins.
step-6: bake 20 minutes.

step-1: mix oats, almond butter and honey in a large bowl.
step-2: mash the banana, then add it into the bowl of oats.
step-3: add chocolate chips.
step-4: mix.
step-5: place bowl in the refrigerator for 60-90 minutes, or until the mixture has solidified.
step-6: mold mixture into bite-sized balls.
step-7: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: pour pancake mix, milk, and eggs into a bowl and mix just until combined.
step-3: pour batter onto a parchment-lined baking sheet and spread to the edges.
step-4: place banana slices on top of the batter, followed by the chocolate chips.
step-5: bake for 15 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-6: cut into squares and serve immediately, or freeze up to 1 month.
step-7: to reheat, place on a microwave-safe plate and heat for 20 seconds per pancake on the plate.

step-1: slice bread into cubes.
step-2: in a bowl, add egg, milk, and cocoa powder, and mix.
step-3: in a microwave-safe mug, place half of the cubed bread and desired amount of bananas and chocolate chips.
step-4: place the rest of the bread and fix-ins and pour the egg mixture into the mug.
step-5: microwave for 1½ minutes or until egg is fully cooked.
step-6: top it off with whipped cream and chocolate syrup.

step-1: in a large bowl, mash the bananas.
step-2: add the granulated sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla and whisk until evenly incorporated.
step-3: add the milk and whisk to combine.
step-4: sift in the cornmeal, salt, baking powder, and cinnamon and whisk until fully incorporated.
step-5: in a medium pan over medium heat, melt the butter and add ⅓ cup (40 g) of pancake batter.
step-6: cook for 3-5 minutes, or until lightly golden brown, then flip.
step-7: cook for 2-3 minutes more on the other side, then remove from the pan.
step-8: repeat with the remaining batter.
step-9: serve with honey and butter.

step-1: preheat oven to 450°f/230°c.
step-2: place pie crust in a 9-inch (23 cm) pie dish.
step-3: with a fork, poke holes all around the bottom of the crust.
step-4: bake crust in oven for 10-12 minutes.
step-5: in a large bowl, combine banana pudding mix and milk.
step-6: whisk vigorously until thick, about 2 minutes.
step-7: add two thirds of the whipped cream to the bowl and fold in until evenly mixed.
step-8: remove the crust from the oven and allow to cool.
step-9: add a layer of banana slices to cover the bottom of the crust.
step-10: top the banana layer with the pudding and whipped cream mixture and chill for at least 3 hours.
step-11: top chilled pie with remaining whipped cream.
step-12: decorate with left-over banana slices.
step-13: slice pie and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350ºf (175ºc).
step-2: in a large bowl, mash a banana until it reaches a liquid state.
step-3: mix in the remaining cake ingredients.
step-4: pour the mix into 12-cup muffin tray.
step-5: bake for 18 minutes.
step-6: allow to cool for 10 minutes before applying frosting.
step-7: to prepare the frosting, mash 2 bananas until they reach a liquid state
step-8: mix in cocoa powder, honey, vanilla, and salt.
step-9: add frosting to cupcakes.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: over medium-high heat, melt butter and stir together brown sugar, cinnamon, and vanilla.
step-3: bring to a simmer and add the sliced bananas.
step-4: in a large bowl, whisk 8 eggs, brown sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, vanilla, heavy cream, and milk.
step-5: add the cubes of french bread, and gently stir until the bread has soaked up all the liquid.
step-6: pour the bread into a greased 9x13 inch (23x33 cm) baking dish.
step-7: top with the banana and sugar glaze.
step-8: bake for 45-50 minutes until golden brown and slightly crispy around the edges and top.
step-9: (times and temperatures may vary based on oven).
step-10: serve with powdered sugar on top.

step-1: in a mixing bowl, use a fork to smash the bananas.
step-2: add in pancake mix, cinnamon and milk.
step-3: whisk together until combined.
step-4: fry in oil.
step-5: about 1 tablespoon per fritter.
step-6: cook for about 2-3 minutes until they are golden brown and cooked through the middle.
step-7: sprinkle powdered sugar.

step-1: cut the bananas into slices and place into a freezer safe bag.
step-2: freeze until solid.
step-3: in a food processor or blender, add frozen bananas, vanilla bean or vanilla extract, and coconut milk.
step-4: blend until smooth.
step-5: line a baking dish with parchment paper.
step-6: evenly distribute the banana mixture into the baking dish.
step-7: freeze for at least two hours.
step-8: before taking out the ice cream, add dark chocolate and coconut oil into a bowl.
step-9: microwave for 1 ½ minutes, stirring after every 30 seconds, until fully melted.
step-10: let the chocolate mixture cool completely then add crispy rice cereal.
step-11: mix well.
step-12: lift the parchment paper out of the baking dish to remove the ice cream.
step-13: cut the ice cream block into ½-inch (12.7-millimeter) cubes.
step-14: dip bites into chocolate mixture until evenly coated.
step-15: place bites on a baking tray and freeze.
step-16: let the bites thaw 5-7 minutes before eating.

step-1: fill a food processor with heavy cream, condensed milk, and bananas.
step-2: close the top and blend for 30 seconds.
step-3: use a funnel or carefully pour the ice cream mixture into a large squeeze bottle and tighten the lid.
step-4: layout a large thick cloth on top of your cooking area to protect the surface from the liquid nitrogen’s low temperature.
step-5: using insulated gloves, fill a stainless steel bowl with liquid nitrogen and set it on top of the thick insulated cloth.
step-6: use the squeeze bottle to squeeze the mix at a constant drip into the liquid nitrogen.
step-7: fill the bowl with droplets and allow the liquid nitrogen to boil off.
step-8: once all the liquid has boiled over from the bottom, serve.

step-1: add the banana, matcha, almond milk, spinach, and ice to a blender.
step-2: blend until smooth.
step-3: serve in a glass topped with a sprinkle of matcha.

step-1: add tofu and maple syrup to a mixing bowl and whisk together until smooth and no large lumps are present.
step-2: transfer tofu mixture to ice tray and using a rubber spatula to evenly spread the mixture into each of the cube slots.
step-3: freeze completely.
step-4: place bananas, mint, chocolate, 4 tofu cubes, cocoa powder, and milk in a blender, making sure that the cubs sit on top of the other ingredients.
step-5: blend until smooth.
step-6: serve immediately.

step-1: mix together egg white and honey in a greased coffee mug.
step-2: add oat flour, baking powder, and cinnamon, and mix until combined.
step-3: add in fresh bananas.
step-4: microwave on high for 90 seconds (times may vary).

step-1: add the arugula, banana, almond butter, oats, cinnamon, turmeric, and salt to a resealable container.
step-2: cover and store in the freezer for up to 3 months.
step-3: when ready to prepare, add the contents from the container and the almond milk to a blender and blend until smooth.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, mash bananas.
step-3: mix eggs, maple syrup, salt, baking powder, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and greek yogurt into mixture.
step-4: add oats and milk, and mix.
step-5: let the mixture sit for a few minutes, so the oats soak up the liquid and the consistency is like oatmeal.
step-6: line muffin tins with muffin liners.
step-7: pour the mixture into each muffin cup about ¾ full.
step-8: add your preferred toppings and gently push your toppings into each muffin cup.
step-9: bake for 30 minutes.
step-10: let cool for 5 minutes before eating.
step-11: once cool, you can also store in an airtight container or freeze in a storage bag.

step-1: in a bowl, mash bananas.
step-2: mix in the egg, then vanilla and cinnamon.
step-3: pour pancake batter in ¼ cup (60 ml) amounts on a griddle or skillet over medium-high heat.
step-4: cook until bubbles pop on the surface of the pancake, then flip and cook the other side.

step-1: roll each slice of bread flat with a rolling pin.
step-2: carefully cut off the crusts.
step-3: spread desired amount of peanut butter and bananas along the edge of the bread, and roll up.
step-4: in a bowl, combine eggs, milk, cinnamon, and vanilla.
step-5: dip each roll-up in egg mixture, and pan-fry in a buttered skillet until all sides are golden brown.

step-1: place the bananas, egg yolks, sugar, cornstarch, vanilla and milk into a blender and blitz until smooth.
step-2: transfer mixture to a saucepan and cook over medium heat until thick stir constantly for about 8-10 minutes.
step-3: pour mixture into a heat safe bowl, cover and chill for at least 4 hours
step-4: to serve, scoop a few spoonfuls of pudding into a serving glass.
step-5: add one layer of vanilla wafers, then whipped cream.
step-6: repeat.
step-7: serve or allow to sit in the fridge for up to 4 hours.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: grease a 10-inch (25 cm) springform pan with nonstick spray.
step-3: make the banana bread crust: set aside 7 vanilla wafers, then add the rest to a zip-top plastic bag and pound with a rolling pin into fine crumbs.
step-4: transfer the crushed wafers to a medium bowl, add the melted butter, and stir to combine.
step-5: pour the crust into the prepared pan and press against the bottom to about ¼ inch (6 mm) thick with a flat-bottomed measuring cup.
step-6: in a large bowl, mash the bananas with a fork until smooth.
step-7: add the sugar, oil, egg, vanilla, salt, flour, and baking powder.
step-8: beat with an electric hand mixer until well-combined.
step-9: pour the banana bread mixture over the crust and spread evenly with a spatula.
step-10: bake for 30 minutes, or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
step-11: make the cheesecake filling: in a large bowl, combine the milk, gelatin, and banana pudding mix.
step-12: beat with an electric hand mixer until thick and smooth.
step-13: add the sugar, vanilla, and cream cheese, and beat again until well-combined.
step-14: add the eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition.
step-15: pour the cheesecake filling over the banana bread crust.
step-16: bake for 1 hour, then turn off the oven and leave the cheesecake in the oven.
step-17: prop the oven door open slightly with a kitchen towel to let the hot air slowly escape.
step-18: after 2 hours, remove the cheesecake from the oven.
step-19: refrigerate overnight.
step-20: arrange the sliced bananas on top of the cheesecake.
step-21: release the springform, then pipe whipped cream on top of 7 of the bananas.
step-22: place the reserved vanilla wafer cookies on top of the whipped cream.
step-23: slice and serve.

step-1: break the waffle cones into pieces and add to a food processor.
step-2: pulse until medium crumbs form.
step-3: pour in the melted butter, and pulse for another 20 seconds until the butter is incorporated.
step-4: pour the crust mixture into a 10-inch (25 cm) springform pan and press down with a spatula into an even layer.
step-5: freeze for 10 minutes.
step-6: arrange the banana slices on top of the crust.
step-7: scoop the chocolate ice cream over the bananas and spread in an even layer.
step-8: freeze for 20 minutes.
step-9: repeat with the strawberry ice cream, then freeze for another 20 minutes.
step-10: add the vanilla ice cream, then freeze for 1 hour.
step-11: release the springform, and slice the cake.
step-12: top each slice with whipped cream, chopped peanuts, a cherry, and chocolate syrup.

step-1: slice a banana into thirds, and then cut each segment in half lengthwise.
step-2: on a parchment paper-lined sheet tray, place a tablespoon of chopped nuts in a small circle shape.
step-3: pour a tablespoon of melted chocolate over the top of the nuts.
step-4: lay a popsicle stick on the chocolate, and top the stick with additional melted chocolate.
step-5: add two halves of sliced banana facing upwards in the melted chocolate.
step-6: repeat with all the other banana splits on a stick.
step-7: freeze for at least 2 hours.
step-8: when frozen solid, add a dollop of whipped cream, and top with a cherry (or any other toppings of your choosing).

step-1: preheat oven to 300˚f (150˚c).
step-2: mix together bananas, coconut oil, vanilla, brown sugar, and egg.
step-3: stir until all of the ingredients are incorporated.
