step-4: add walnuts, flour, cinnamon, baking soda, and cornstarch, and stir until fully incorporated.
step-5: place 2-inch (5 cm) balls of cookie dough 2 inches (5 cm) apart on a baking sheet.
step-6: place a piece of chocolate inside ball of dough.
step-7: press dough together until chocolate is covered.
step-8: bake for 10 to 12 minutes until golden.
step-9: can be stored in an airtight container up to 5 days.

step-1: note: to make a brown onion, try adding ½ teaspoon of mixed herbs while cooking.
step-2: mash together the potatoes, salt, pepper, cheese, butter, and onion.
step-3: cut the sausages in half and surround them with a thin layer of mashed potato.
step-4: lay out 3 bowls, each one containing a different coating: flour, eggs, and breadcrumbs.
step-5: coat the croquette first in flour, then eggs, followed by breadcrumbs, then one more time in the eggs, and lastly breadcrumbs.
step-6: heat the oil to 160°c (325˚f).
step-7: note: if you don’t have a thermometer, you can test the oil by dropping in a small piece of white bread.
step-8: if it sizzles and browns within 45 seconds, the oil is ready.
step-9: carefully deep-fry the bangers and mash bombs in small batches for a few minutes until golden brown.
step-10: drain on a paper towel, sprinkle with salt, and serve with warm gravy.

step-1: brown the sausages on all sides in a large skillet - until mostly cooked through.
step-2: set aside to cool slightly.
step-3: unroll each sheet of puff pastry and cut into 4 pieces.
step-4: spread mash over each pastry, top with cooked sausage and additional mash.
step-5: roll up each sheet - pinch together to seal and trim off any excess.
step-6: place on a greased baking sheet - seam side down - and brush each roll with beaten egg.
step-7: bake in a preheated oven at 190˚c (375˚f) for 25-30 minutes - until the pastry is golden and crispy on all sides and the meat has cooked through.
step-8: serve with a side of onion gravy.

step-1: preheat oven to 220°c (425°f)
step-2: to make the yorkshire puddings, sift the flour and salt into a large bowl and mix in the eggs and half the milk.
step-3: whisk until a paste, then add the other half of the milk and whisk until smooth.
step-4: rest for 30 minutes.
step-5: add a teaspoon of vegetable oil to each muffin tin hole and heat until sizzling.
step-6: turn the oven down to 200°c (400°f) and pour a tablespoon of yorkshire pudding batter into each hole.
step-7: bake for 15 minutes or until risen and golden brown.
step-8: to make the mash, peel and slice three medium potatoes.
step-9: boil in salted water until soft.
step-10: drain, then add the butter, sour cream, and milk, and mash until smooth.
step-11: season with salt, pepper, and fresh chives.
step-12: to make the bangers, quarter two sausages and chop one onion.
step-13: fry the onion for two minutes, then add the sausages and fry both until cooked.
step-14: to assemble, add a teaspoon of gravy to the bottom of the yorkshire pudding, then add the onions on top, then the mash and a sausage quarter.
step-15: sprinkle with more chives.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: wrap tofu in an absorbent towel.
step-3: set cast-iron skillet or other heavy object on top for 15-20 minutes to remove extra moisture.
step-4: unwrap tofu and cut into small cubes.
step-5: transfer to a baking sheet and season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
step-6: bake for about 20 minutes, or until the tofu is firm to the touch and golden brown.
step-7: in a medium bowl, add soy sauce, vinegar, sesame oil, garlic, and ginger.
step-8: stir to combine.
step-9: spiralize the cucumber and carrots into a large bowl.
step-10: transfer veggies to a bowl and assemble with tofu, brown rice, cilantro, green onions, red cabbage, radishes, mint, jalapeños, and sauce.

step-1: fold a 45cm (17 ¾ inch) long rectangle of aluminum foil into triangles until you have a triangle with a longest side of 10-12 cm (4-4 ¾ inch).
step-2: form this triangle into a cone.
step-3: make as many aluminum cones as you want.
step-4: cut a sheet of puff pastry into 2.5cm (1 inch) strips.
step-5: wrap the pastry around an aluminum cone so that it overlaps by about 1 cm (⅓ inch).
step-6: press the tail of the pastry onto itself so that it sticks.
step-7: lay this seam face down on a baking sheet and brush with egg wash. bake for 18-20 minutes at 180°c (350°f).
step-8: whip the double cream.
step-9: reserve 2-3 large scoops of whipped cream.
step-10: mix the remaining whipped cream with the toffee sauce.
step-11: scoop mixture into a plastic bag for piping.
step-12: peel and slice banana.
step-13: remove aluminum cone.
step-14: pipe cones by alternating 2cm (¾ inch) of toffee cream and 1 slice of banana.
step-15: top with a swirl of reserved cream and a vertical banana slice.

step-1: preheat the oven to 180°c (355°f) and line a baking tray with grease-proof paper.
step-2: mash the banana and mix in the toffee sauce.
step-3: whisk in the brown sugar and butter, followed by the eggs and vanilla extract.
step-4: fold in the flour, baking powder, salt, and chocolate chips.
step-5: chill the cookie dough in the fridge for about an hour.
step-6: spoon onto the tray and bake for about 12 minutes, or until golden brown.

step-1: smash the biscuits into fine crumbs, using a blender or the bag and rolling pin method.
step-2: pour into a bowl and set aside for later.
step-3: stretch and thin out the bread a bit using a rolling pin.
step-4: spread a generous amount of caramel on each slice.
step-5: place a few pieces of banana at the bottom and roll it up tight.
step-6: whisk the eggs together in a small bowl.
step-7: dip the roll-up into the egg and then biscuit crumbs.
step-8: fry over a medium heat in butter for 2-3 minutes each side.
step-9: serve with a dollop of whipped cream and some finely grated chocolate.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: pour the sweetened condensed milk into a baking dish.
step-3: cover with aluminum foil and set in a larger baking dish.
step-4: fill the larger dish with hot water until it reaches halfway up the sides of the smaller dish.
step-5: place in the oven and cook for 90 minutes.
step-6: check the water level occasionally, making sure that it reaches halfway and refilling as necessary.
step-7: carefully remove the baking dish from the hot water bath and let cool to room temperature.
step-8: whisk the mixture (now it’s dulce de leche!) until smooth.
step-9: reduce the oven temperature to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-10: in the bowl of a food processor, combine the graham crackers and melted butter.
step-11: pulse until crackers are finely ground and the mixture resembles wet sand.
step-12: grease a 9-inch (22 cm) tart pan with nonstick spray.
step-13: add the graham cracker mixture to the tin and press evenly to cover pan completely.
step-14: bake crust for 5 minutes, until golden and fragrant.
step-15: transfer to a wire rack and let cool to room temperature.
step-16: spread the dulce de leche in the cooled tart crust, using a flexible spatula to smooth it into an even layer.
step-17: cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or up to overnight, until set.
step-18: in a large bowl, beat the heavy cream until soft peaks are just beginning to form.
step-19: add the sugar and beat until soft peaks form.
step-20: remove the pie from the refrigerator.
step-21: scatter the banana slices over the dulce de leche.
step-22: top with the whipped cream, spreading evenly to cover bananas, and garnish with chocolate shavings.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: in a medium-size bowl mix together the beef, pork, bread crumbs, onion, parsley, garlic, eggs, salt, and pepper until just combined.
step-3: take a walnut size of the meat mixture and roll into a ball.
step-4: repeat with remaining meat and transfer to an oiled rack on a sheet tray.
step-5: bake meatballs for 15 minutes, until golden brown.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: add oil to a pan on medium-high heat, and cook onions and garlic until they are deeply caramelized.
step-8: add in the cider vinegar, ketchup, tomato paste, mustard, worcestershire, honey, brown sugar, stir, and bring to a simmer.
step-9: about 5 minutes.
step-10: add salt and pepper to taste (optional).
step-11: add the cooked meatballs and coat them with the sauce.
step-12: sprinkle with the fried onions, poke with toothpicks, and serve!

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: fold the parchment paper in half, then open up.
step-3: quarter the potatoes and thinly slice the onion.
step-4: on one half, lay down the cut potatoes, drizzle on oil and sprinkle on salt & pepper.
step-5: lay the chicken on the potatoes, season with salt and pepper and spread on the barbecue sauce.
step-6: top with sliced onions.
step-7: fold the parchment paper over the chicken, and cinch the paper together by folding it over itself along the edges.
step-8: bake for 25-30 minutes or until internal temperature of chicken reaches 165˚f (75˚c).

step-1: in a medium saucepan, combine the ketchup, worcestershire, apple cider vinegar, mustard, brown sugar, molasses, paprika, garlic powder, and cayenne whisk to combine.
step-2: bring to a boil over medium heat, then simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until thickened.
step-3: serve warm or store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: slice into the chicken several times, about 1 cm (½ inch) apart, but only cut about 85% of the way through, leaving the bottom intact.
step-3: cook the red pesto and basil on a medium heat until the basil is just wilted.
step-4: sprinkle over the mozzarella and stir until melted.
step-5: allow to cool to the touch, and then fill each segment of the chicken breast with about 1 teaspoon of the mixture.
step-6: bake in the centre of the oven for 18-22 minutes until the chicken is cooked through and the juices run clear.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the ground beef, garlic powder, parsley, salt, pepper, and paprika.
step-2: brush the ramekin with barbecue sauce.
step-3: lay down the bacon strips, rotating clockwise, spacing evenly on the edges.
step-4: place half of the beef patty on top of the bacon.
step-5: press the beef patty evenly into the ramekin, leaving a small divot in the middle.
step-6: place the cheddar cheese in the divot.
step-7: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-8: place the second half of beef patty on top of the cheese and pat to flatten.
step-9: lay the ends of the bacon strips over the patty.
step-10: brush the remaining barbecue sauce on top.
step-11: place the ramekin on a baking sheet along with the sesame bun, face down.
step-12: bake for 25 minutes, or until the bacon is crisp to your liking.
step-13: assemble the burger with the toasted sesame bun, lettuce and tomato.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: in a medium-sized bowl, mix the ground beef, onion, parsley, bread crumbs, egg, garlic, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper until combined.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: line two empty ice trays with bacon, overlapping each piece to cover the tray completely.
step-5: press the bacon down into each round with two fingers.
step-6: spoon some of the meatball mixture into each round and press down to smooth.
step-7: make sure to pack the meat down to touch the bottom of the ice tray.
step-8: fold the edges of the bacon on top of the ice tray.
step-9: flip the ice tray over onto a baking sheet and carefully lift the ice cube tray off of the meatballs.
step-10: bake for 20 minutes, or until bacon is just brown.
step-11: brush the meatballs with barbecue sauce and bake for 10 minutes, or until the bacon is crispy and meatballs are cooked through.
step-12: transfer the meatball sheet to a cutting board and cut the bacon to create single meatballs.
step-13: place a toothpick in each meatball.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c) (or 350°f (180°c) on a convection oven).
step-2: in a large bowl, mix the ground beef, ground sausage, bread crumbs, onion, garlic, and egg together with your hands until thoroughly combined.
step-3: roll the mixture into golf ball-sized balls.
step-4: use your thumb to create a dent in the balls, add a bit of mozzarella and seal.
step-5: cut the bacon rashers in half and roll around the meatballs.
step-6: place the meatballs on a foil-covered tray and bake for 20 minutes.
step-7: remove from the oven and brush with bbq sauce, then bake for 5 minutes more.
step-8: repeat brushing and baking two more times for an extra-thick layer of bbq sauce.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: in a large bowl, mix the ground beef, garlic powder, onion powder, pepper, salt, bread crumbs, garlic, diced onion, parsley, egg, ketchup, mustard, worcestershire sauce, and honey until evenly combined.
step-4: set aside in the refrigerator.
step-5: cut the 4 onions vertically on cutting board.
step-6: remove the stem and root from each piece.
step-7: the layers of each onion will act as "shells" to wrap around each meatball.
step-8: remove the meatball mixture from the refrigerator and pinch off golf ball-sized pieces of meat.
step-9: press a small cube of cheddar cheese into the middle of each meat portion, then form into a meatball shape with your hands.
step-10: wrap each meatball in 2 onion "shells", then with 2 strips of bacon, and transfer to the prepared baking sheet
step-11: brush the meatballs with barbecue sauce, covering them completely.
step-12: bake for 45 minutes, brushing again with bbq sauce halfway through, until deep brown with a nice crust on the outside.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: peel and cut onions into ½-inch (1 cm) rings.
step-3: separate the rings.
step-4: wrap a piece of bacon around one onion ring.
step-5: repeat with remaining onion rings and place on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-6: combine the bbq sauce and honey in a bowl, and brush onto rings.
step-7: bake for 20 minutes, or until golden brown.

step-1: in a medium bowl, add the brown sugar, onion powder, garlic powder, mustard powder, smoked paprika, pepper, tarragon, and salt and stir to combine.
step-2: use half of the spice rub to season the entire chicken.
step-3: cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or up to overnight.
step-4: preheat the grill to 350°f (190°c).
step-5: remove the chicken from the fridge and season with the remaining spice rub.
step-6: our out half the can of beer.
step-7: place the half-filled can in the chicken cavity and stand it upright.
step-8: grill the chicken over indirect heat for 30-40 minutes.
step-9: baste the chicken with barbecue sauce and cook for another 10-15 minutes, until the internal temperature reaches 165°f (75°c).
step-10: remove chicken from the grill and let rest for 15 minutes before carving.

step-1: preheat oven to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-2: cut the head of cauliflower in half.
step-3: pluck bite-sized florets from each half.
step-4: trim bottoms of florets as necessary.
step-5: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-6: spread cauliflower florets on the baking sheet.
step-7: drizzle with olive oil.
step-8: season with salt and pepper.
step-9: bake for 20 minutes.
step-10: remove florets from oven and toss with bbq sauce.
step-11: return florets to the oven and bake for an additional 10 minutes until browned to your liking.
step-12: brush more bbq sauce on the cooked cauliflower for extra flavor.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (175°c).
step-2: in a large pan or skillet, lay down half of the tortilla chips, followed by half of the ground beef, bbq sauce, cheddar, mozzarella, tomato, red onion, bacon, and parsley.
step-3: repeat with the remaining half of the ingredients, followed by a drizzle of bbq sauce on top.
step-4: bake for 15 minutes, until cheese is melted.

step-1: in a medium bowl, add ground beef, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and bbq sauce.
step-2: mix well.
step-3: slice onions into ½-inch thick slices.
step-4: take the outer layer off and separate each layer of the rings.
step-5: fill the onion slice with a spoonful of meat.
step-6: place cheese cube in the middle and add a little more meat to cover the cheese.
step-7: dredge the onion ring and fry in oil heated at 325°f/160°c for 3-5 minutes or until fully cooked and golden brown.
step-8: serve with your favorite sauce.

step-1: preheat grill to medium heat.
step-2: combine the chicken, bbq sauce, salt, and pepper, stirring until evenly mixed.
step-3: threading one end of the bacon onto the end of a skewer.
step-4: add a piece of chicken, and weave the bacon around the chicken and back through the skewer, creating a wave pattern between the chicken.
step-5: move the bacon and the chicken down the skewer, repeating until the other edge of the bacon is threaded through.
step-6: repeat on the rest of the skewers with the remaining chicken and bacon.
step-7: grease the surface of the grill by rubbing the grates with tongs and an oiled paper towel.
step-8: grill the skewers for about 12-18 minutes with the lid closed, flipping them halfway.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: place chicken breast in a baking dish.
step-3: season chicken with salt and pepper, to taste.
step-4: spread bbq sauce on each chicken breast.
step-5: layer onions on top of the chicken.
step-6: bake for 40 minutes.

step-1: in a bowl, mix the shredded chicken with the barbecue sauce.
step-2: on a baking sheet, portion the bbq chicken into 3 logs and place a skewer through the chicken.
step-3: freeze for 1 hour, or until solid.
step-4: in a bowl, whisk the flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking soda, salt, and pepper.
step-5: add the egg and milk, and mix until combined.
step-6: set aside for 20 minutes.
step-7: pour mixture into a cup.
step-8: in a large pot or dutch oven, heat oil to 350°f (180°c).
step-9: remove the chicken from the freezer and gently loosen the chicken from the sheet with a fork.
step-10: dip the chicken skewer into the cornmeal batter until completely coated.
step-11: place corndog into the oil and fry for 3-5 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-12: place on a paper towel to drain.
step-13: serve with bbq sauce.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: in a bowl, mix shredded chicken with ½ cup (115) barbecue sauce.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: spread pizza dough out on a parchment-lined pan.
step-5: bake 10 minutes.
step-6: top with remaining barbecue sauce, cheddar, chicken, mozzarella, red onion, and parsley.
step-7: bake an additional 10 minutes.
step-8: slice and dip!

step-1: cut the pizza dough tubes in half lengthwise, then cut crosswise into 2-inch (5 cm) pieces, and roll into balls.
step-2: place the pizza dough balls in a large bowl, then add the olive oil, salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
step-3: toss gently with your hands to coat.
step-4: add the mozzarella and onion and toss gently with your hands until evenly distributed.
step-5: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-6: in a medium bowl, combine the chicken and ¼ cup (65 g) of barbecue sauce.
step-7: add to the bowl with the dough balls and toss gently with your hands to incorporate.
step-8: fill the bottom of a 9-inch (22 cm) cake pan with dough balls, make sure not to pack them too tightly.
step-9: spray the outside of a small oven-safe bowl with nonstick spray and place on top of the dough balls in the middle of the pan.
step-10: fill the area around the bowl with the remaining dough balls.
step-11: bake for 25 minutes, or until the tops of the dough balls begin to turn light brown.
step-12: remove from the oven.
step-13: use tongs to remove the small bowl and bake for another 10 minutes, or until the tops of the dough balls are golden brown and bubbling.
step-14: fill the bowl indent with the remaining cup of barbecue sauce and sprinkle with cilantro.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the cream cheese, cheese, chicken, peppers, parsley, and barbecue sauce.
step-2: transfer the mixture to a parchment paper-lined 9x9-inch (23x23-cm) square pan.
step-3: spread the mixture evenly and freeze for 1 hour, or until firm.
step-4: cut the block into 32 triangle poppers.
step-5: pour the flour, eggs, and crushed nacho chips into 3 separate medium bowls.
step-6: double bread the poppers by dipping them in the flour, egg wash, and nacho chips, then again in the egg wash and nacho chips.
step-7: heat the oil in a large pot to 375°f (190°c).
step-8: fry the poppers, four at a time, for 40 seconds, or until golden brown.
step-9: sprinkle parsley on top of the poppers.
step-10: serve with guacamole, salsa, and sour cream.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a small bowl, combine chicken and bbq sauce well.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: place pita bread on a baking sheet lined with parchment and spread bbq sauce over it.
step-5: add the chicken to the pita and sprinkle with mozzarella and red onion, to taste.
step-6: bake for 15-20 minutes, or until cheese is melted and chicken is heated through.
step-7: garnish with fresh cilantro, slice, and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-2: cut the chicken breasts into ¾-inch (2 cm) cubes and transfer to a medium bowl.
step-3: add the salt, paprika, pepper, garlic powder, barbecue sauce, and honey, and mix with your hands until the chicken is well-coated.
step-4: heat the oil in a large cast-iron skillet over high heat.
step-5: add the chicken and cook for 10 minutes, or until golden and charred on the edges.
step-6: remove the pan from the heat.
step-7: place the tortillas side by side on the baking sheet with the edges overlapping slightly.
step-8: sprinkle the shredded cheese, red onion, bacon, cooked chicken, and parsley evenly over the tortillas.
step-9: bake for 10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted.
step-10: serve warm.

step-1: slice chicken breasts into bite-sized chunks.
step-2: combine the chicken with the salt, pepper, garlic powder, and chili powder, mixing until evenly seasoned.
step-3: place the flour and eggs into separate bowls.
step-4: dip a piece of chicken into the flour, then the egg, then back into the flour.
step-5: repeat with the rest of the chicken.
step-6: heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
step-7: fry the chicken pieces until deep-golden brown and crispy.
step-8: set aside on a paper towel to drain.
step-9: in a pan over medium heat, cook the bbq sauce until bubbly.
step-10: toss the chicken in the sauce until evenly glazed.

step-1: in a large skillet, add chicken breast and season both sides with salt and pepper.
step-2: cook 15-18 minutes, flipping halfway and adding the onions when you flip the chicken.
step-3: (cooking times may vary depending on thickness of the chicken breast).
step-4: remove the chicken from the pan and continue to stir onions.
step-5: shred the chicken while onions are cooking.
step-6: return the shredded chicken to the pan with the onions.
step-7: add the bbq sauce and stir.
step-8: remove from the pan and set aside.
step-9: place a tortilla in a pan and add a layer monterey jack and cheddar cheese on half of the tortilla.
step-10: place cooked chicken and onions, and top with the rest of each cheese.
step-11: fold in half and cook 6 minutes, flipping halfway.
step-12: serve with extra bbq sauce and garnish with fresh parsley.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (170˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, combine shredded chicken, red onion, and bbq sauce.
step-3: place a small bowl, filled with mozzarella cheese, in the middle of a greased baking pan and arrange crescent dough triangles around the bowl with the smallest angle on the outside.
step-4: sprinkle ½ of the cheese along the inside of the ring and spoon bbq chicken mixture on top of the cheese, also in a circular shape.
step-5: top with the rest of the mozzarella.
step-6: lay the top of the triangle over the filling and repeat until the all of the triangles have been wrapped around the filling.
step-7: bake for 25 minutes or until golden brown.
step-8: cut into pieces and serve with choice dressing in a bowl in the middle.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: roll out the pizza crust into a rectangle.
step-3: spread on the bbq sauce.
step-4: top with chicken, onion, cheese, and parsley.
step-5: roll it up longways, and cut into slices.
step-6: bake face-up for 15 minutes.

step-1: heat a grill over medium-high heat and clean and lightly oil the hot grates.
step-2: season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper and place on the grill.
step-3: grill the breast for 5 minutes, then flip, brush with some of the barbecue sauce, and continue to grill until cooked through, 5-7 minutes more.
step-4: transfer the chicken to a plate and set aside to cool slightly.
step-5: use 2 forks to shred the chicken, add to a bowl, and toss with the remaining barbecue sauce.
step-6: serve on pretzel buns with coleslaw.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: slice the rolls in half lengthwise.
step-3: place the bottom half in a 9 x 13-inch (23 x 33 cm) rimmed baking dish.
step-4: spread the chicken evenly over the rolls, followed by the barbecue sauce, red onion, pepper jack cheese, and parsley.
step-5: top with the remaining rolls.
step-6: brush the tops of the rolls with melted butter.
step-7: bake for 20 minutes, until the bread is golden brown.
step-8: slice into individual sliders, then serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: slice the chicken into even strips.
step-3: dip the chicken strips into the bbq sauce, then coat them in the bread crumbs.
step-4: place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake for 15 minutes.
step-5: brush the remaining bbq sauce evenly on both sides of the chicken strips and bake for another 10 minutes and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 350ºf (180ºc) and line a tray with parchment paper.
step-2: debone, remove skin, and shred rotisserie chicken.
step-3: spread bbq sauce evenly across tortillas.
step-4: top with onion, chicken, and cheese.
step-5: bake for 5-10 minutes.

step-1: add ham, salt, onion and bbq sauce to a slow cooker.
step-2: cover and cook on low for 5 hours.
step-3: shred ham using two forks.
step-4: preheat oven to 375°f (180°c).
step-5: using a rolling pin, roll the dough into a 16x12-inch (40x30-cm) rectangle, about ¼-inch (6 mm) thick on a well-floured surface.
step-6: distribute shredded ham over the dough, leaving a 1-inch (2 cm) open strip on the short side facing you.
step-7: roll the dough into a log shape, pinching the seams to seal it.
step-8: with a serrated knife, evenly cut roll into 8 slices.
step-9: arrange slices in a greased cake pan.
step-10: bake in oven for 20-25 minutes.
step-11: cool in pan for 10-15 minutes.
step-12: drizzle rolls with more bbq sauce and top with relish, if desired.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350ºf (175ºc).
step-2: carefully slice 3 gold potatoes into ⅛-inch (3-mm) slices using a knife or mandoline.
step-3: in a large bowl, mix the potato chips with ingredients.
step-4: arrange chips on greased baking sheet.
step-5: bake for 30-35 minutes.

step-1: drain and rinse the jackfruit, then cut into smaller pieces, removing the core.
step-2: in a medium saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
step-3: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the onion and cook for 4-5 minutes, until semi-translucent.
step-4: add the garlic, salt, and pepper, and cook for 2-3 minutes, until the garlic is fragrant.
step-5: add the jackfruit, chili powder, paprika, cumin, and liquid smoke, and mix well.
step-6: add the vegetable broth, cover, and cook for 15 minutes, until the jackfruit is soft enough to be mashed.
step-7: preheat the oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-8: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-9: mash the jackfruit with potato masher or a couple of forks, until it looks pulled or shredded.
step-10: transfer the jackfruit to the baking sheet and spread in an even layer.
step-11: bake for 25 minutes, until the jackfruit is slightly browned and crispy.
step-12: make the coleslaw: add green and red cabbage and carrots to a large bowl.
step-13: in a small liquid measuring cup, combine the mayo, mustard, apple cider vinegar, salt, and pepper, and mix until creamy.
step-14: pour the dressing over the vegetables and toss the coleslaw until the dressing is well-distributed.
step-15: set aside.
step-16: remove the jackfruit from the oven, and pour the bbq sauce over.
step-17: mix well.
step-18: return to the oven, and bake for another 10 minutes, until the edges are slightly crispy.
step-19: use a large bread knife to cut the whole sheet of slider buns in half.
step-20: remove the top and set aside.
step-21: spread the bbq jackfruit on the bottom half of the buns, then top with coleslaw.
step-22: add the top buns, then slice into 12 sliders.

step-1: in a small bowl, mix together the paprika, chili powder, garlic powder, onion powder, and salt.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: in a separate small bowl, mix together the brown sugar and olive oil.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: melt the coconut oil in a large pot over medium heat.
step-6: add 3-4 popcorn kernels and cover with the lid.
step-7: once they pop, add the rest of the kernels and cover, shaking every 10 seconds, until they begin pop.
step-8: once the pops are more than 3 seconds apart, turn off the heat and let sit for 15 seconds to allow any final kernels to pop.
step-9: uncover and drizzle the brown sugar mixture over the popcorn.
step-10: carefully toss to coat.
step-11: sprinkle the spice mixture over the popcorn and stir to coat evenly.
step-12: transfer to a bowl and eat immediately, or spread in a single layer on a baking sheet and let cool completely before storing in a sealed container for up to 2 days.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c) and spray a baking sheet with nonstick oil.
step-2: cut chicken breasts into bite-size pieces and place in a bowl.
step-3: add the barbecue sauce to bowl with chicken and stir.
step-4: in a large ziplock bag, crush the barbecue chips into desired crumbs (to replace bread crumbs).
step-5: coat each piece of chicken in chip crumbs until fully covered and place on prepared baking tray.
step-6: bake chicken until golden brown, about 12 minutes.
step-7: serve with a side of ranch dressing or any sauce!

step-1: preheat the oven to 300°f (150°c).
step-2: arrange an oven rack on the lowest setting, removing the other racks if needed.
step-3: place the pork shoulder on a cutting board and slice the meat into 2-inch (5 cm) thick slices.
step-4: in a small bowl, combine the brown sugar, salt, paprika, mustard powder, cumin, garlic powder, chile powder, coriander, onion powder, black pepper, and cayenne.
step-5: sprinkle the spice mixture all over the sliced pork and toss to coat evenly.
step-6: set a wire rack over a baking sheet and grease with nonstick spray.
step-7: place the potato halves on the rack, cut sides down.
step-8: insert a skewer into each potato half.
step-9: thread the pork slices onto the skewers.
step-10: cover the pork tower with foil, place in the oven, and roast for 4 hours or until the pork is fully cooked and tender.
step-11: to a small pot on medium heat, add oil, minced onion, garlic, and the leftover spice mixture.
step-12: stir the vegetables and cook until soft.
step-13: make the barbecue sauce: in a medium pot over medium heat, combine the ketchup, brown sugar, molasses, worcestershire sauce, apple cider vinegar, garlic powder, paprika, dijon, and cayenne.
step-14: whisk and bring the sauce to a boil.
step-15: remove from the heat and set aside until ready to use.
step-16: once the pork is finished cooking, remove the foil and pour the barbecue sauce over the pork tower.
step-17: use a brush to evenly cover all of the meat.
step-18: return the pork to the oven for 30 minutes, or until the sauce starts to caramelize.
step-19: carve the pork tower with a serrated knife.
step-20: serve the meat on the buns, with sides like coleslaw, mac ‘n’ cheese, and pickles.

step-1: mix together cabbage, carrots, green onions, jalapeños, paprika, pepper, garlic powder, salt, lemon juice, apple cider vinegar, olive oil, and honey.
step-2: chill until ready to use.
step-3: heat a skillet over medium heat.
step-4: add olive oil, bbq sauce, lemon juice, onion powder, garlic powder, paprika, cayenne, pepper, and salt.
step-5: stir until sauce begins to bubble and thicken.
step-6: mix in chicken and stir until fully incorporated.
step-7: place bbq chicken on top of bottom slider bun.
step-8: top with slaw.
step-9: place top bun.
step-10: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: slice the potatoes into ½-inch (1cm) slices, then cut the slices into ½-inch (1cm) strips.
step-3: place the sliced potatoes on a baking sheet along with the pork shoulder.
step-4: make sure that the potatoes are not touching the pork.
step-5: drizzle the olive oil over the potatoes, then sprinkle the pork and the potatoes with the salt and pepper, rubbing them in so that they are all coated evenly.
step-6: cover the pork with one cup (286g) of the barbecue sauce, then rub it evenly on all sides.
step-7: bake for 45 minutes.
step-8: remove the fries, then place the pork in the center of the tray.
step-9: bake for another two hours at 350°f (175°c)
step-10: transfer the pork to a large bowl, and using two forks, shred the pork.
step-11: combine the pulled pork with the remaining one cup (286g) of barbecue sauce.
step-12: in a skillet or a baking tray, layer half of the fries, half of the bbq pork, half of the red onion, the pepper jack, half of the scallions, then repeat with the remaining fries, pork, red onion, cheddar, and scallions.
step-13: bake for 15 minutes, until cheese is melted.
step-14: serve with sour cream.

step-1: put all of your ingredients in a crock pot.
step-2: cook on low for 8 hours or high for 4 hours, until fork-tender.
step-3: shred with two forks and combine with the sauce on the bottom of the pot.

step-1: add the ketchup, molasses, apple cider vinegar, yellow mustard, worcestershire sauce, garlic, and pepper in a saucepan over medium heat, whisking to combine.
step-2: reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes, stirring frequently.
step-3: for thicker sauce, cook for additional 5 minutes
step-4: cool for 20 minutes.
step-5: store in an airtight container in refrigerator for up to 1 week.
step-6: add pork, salt, pepper, paprika, onion and 1 cup (290g) of prepared bbq sauce to a slow cooker.
step-7: cover and cook on high for 5-6 hours.
step-8: preheat oven to 375°f (180°c).
step-9: using a rolling pin, roll the dough into a 16x12-inch (40x30-cm) rectangle, about ¼-inch (6 mm) thick on a well-floured surface.
step-10: shred pork using two forks.
step-11: distribute pulled pork over the dough, leaving a 1-inch (2 cm) open strip on the short side facing you.
step-12: roll the dough into a log shape, pinching the seams to seal it.
step-13: with a serrated knife, evenly cut roll into 6-8 slices.
step-14: arrange slices in a greased cake pan.
step-15: bake for 20-25 minutes.
step-16: cool for 10-15 minutes.
step-17: brush more bbq sauce on rolls and top with chives, if desired.

step-1: on a cutting board, use a box grater to shred the sweet potato.
step-2: heat a large pan with oil over medium heat.
step-3: add the sweet potatoes to the hot pan and cook, stirring occasionally, until they begin to soften, about 2-3 minutes.
step-4: add the onions to the pan with the shredded sweet potatoes, and cook until golden brown for about 2-3 minutes.
step-5: add the bbq sauce, salt, and pepper to the sweet potatoes and onions, and stir until fully incorporated.
step-6: cook for 3-5 minutes until browned.
step-7: add the red cabbage, carrots, apple cider vinegar, salt, and pepper to a bowl and stir to combine.
step-8: refrigerate until ready to serve.
step-9: add the greek yogurt, garlic, lemon juice, dill, salt, and pepper to a small bowl and mix to combine.
step-10: refrigerate until ready to serve.
step-11: add the greek yogurt sauce onto the bun, top with the bbq sweet potatoes and slaw.

step-1: using a charcoal chimney or lighter fluid, light 6-8 pieces of lump charcoal and let them come to a full burn.
step-2: add to your firebox and preheat the smoker to roughly 225°f (105°c), adding charcoal to the fire as necessary.
step-3: add the ginger, cayenne, garlic powder, paprika, minced garlic, onion powder, black pepper, and mustard powder in a medium bowl and mix thoroughly.
step-4: place ribs on a large sheet of aluminum foil and coat liberally with spice rub on all sides.
step-5: place a metal pan filled with water at the end of the smoker’s cooking chamber closest to the firebox.
step-6: place ribs directly on the grate of your cooking chamber and close the smoker.
step-7: open the vents at both ends of the smoker.
step-8: add a chunk or two of smoking wood to the firebox each half hour to create a stream of thin but visible smoke that is somewhat blue in appearance.
step-9: too much wood may result in thick, gray smoke.
step-10: if this happens, open the smoker and clear the smoke out, waiting to close it until you’re able to achieve manageable smoke again.
step-11: maintain the heat by adding additional charcoal as necessary.
step-12: smoke ribs for 3-5 hours, spraying each hour with water to keep the surface from drying out.
step-13: cook time will vary based on the size and type of rib (baby backs will cook faster than spareribs).
step-14: use a meat thermometer to gauge doneness.
step-15: at 170°f (75°c), remove the ribs from the smoker and place onto a large sheet of aluminum foil.
step-16: if using barbecue sauce, apply now with a basting brush.
step-17: wrap the aluminum foil up to enclose the ribs, and place them back in your smoker for an additional 30 minutes.
step-18: let meat rest at least 15 minutes off the heat before slicing.
step-19: serve with remaining barbecue sauce and preferred sides.

step-1: combine brown sugar, paprika, garlic powder, chili powder, onion powder, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper in a small bowl.
step-2: pour into a small glass container and secure with an airtight lid.
step-3: store up to 1 year.

step-1: using a butter knife, spread the refried beans in an even layer onto the tortilla.
step-2: add the jalapeño slices and shredded cheese to the top half of the tortilla.
step-3: fold the tortilla in half from the bottom, then fold in the sides, being careful not to tear the tortilla.
step-4: toast on medium-high, until golden brown.
step-5: watch to make sure it doesn’t burn.
step-6: let cool for 1-2 minutes before removing from the toaster.
step-7: serve with salsa, if desired.

step-1: assemble the burritos by microwaving the flour tortilla for 20 seconds, and begin to layer burrito starting with refried beans, followed by the cooked rice and cheese.
step-2: fold in the left and right sides of the tortilla and roll it up from the bottom, tucking the bottom edge under the filling.
step-3: wrap in parchment paper and label.
step-4: freeze up to 1 month.
step-5: to reheat from frozen, wrap the burrito in a damp paper towel and microwave for 2-3 minutes, flipping halfway or until the center is hot.
step-6: let stand 1 minute before eating.

step-1: in a medium bowl, mix together the sirloin steak, soy sauce, cornstarch, brown sugar, and ginger until the meat is evenly covered in the marinade.
step-2: set aside to marinate for 20 minutes.
step-3: heat the oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
step-4: dump in the meat and marinade and sear each side until golden brown.
step-5: transfer the meat to a clean bowl and set aside.
step-6: place the broccoli into the hot skillet and sauté until the broccoli has just started to brown, about 1 minute.
step-7: pour the water into the skillet and immediately cover with a lid.
step-8: let it steam for 2 minutes, until the broccoli has softened.
step-9: remove the lid and toss in the garlic, red pepper flakes, and sesame oil.
step-10: sauté until the garlic becomes fragrant, about 30 seconds.
step-11: add the steak back into the pan and stir to combine.
step-12: remove from heat and serve on a bed of brown rice.

step-1: heat oil in a large skillet.
step-2: cook down onions until translucent.
step-3: add meat, 1 teaspoon salt, and ½ teaspoon pepper, and cook until meat is fully cooked.
step-4: transfer into a large bowl.
step-5: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-6: combine cheese, ketchup, mustard, worcestershire sauce, and 1 teaspoon of salt.
step-7: mix thoroughly.
step-8: roll out the pie crust and cut into 4 pieces.
step-9: place a spoonful of the stuffing on one side of the dough, leaving ¼ inch (6 mm) from the edge and fold over, creating a triangle.
step-10: with a fork, crimp down the 2 sides so the stuffing stays in.
step-11: transfer onto baking sheet.
step-12: brush on egg and sprinkle on sesame seeds.
step-13: bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown and pie crust is thoroughly cooked.
step-14: let it cool for a few minutes

step-1: preheat oven to 375ºf (190ºc).
step-2: add a teaspoon of olive oil to a heavy saucepan and brown the beef over medium-high heat.
step-3: season with salt and pepper.
step-4: mix in the dried herbs.
step-5: move beef to one side of the hot pan and add in onions.
step-6: stir to soften, then add garlic.
step-7: mix in crushed tomatoes.
step-8: bring to a boil and cook for 5-10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
step-9: taste and season with salt and pepper as necessary.
step-10: remove from heat.
step-11: spoon a thin layer of meat sauce in the bottom of a casserole dish.
step-12: layer as follows: tortellini, cheese, basil, sauce, tortellini, cheese, basil, sauce, and cheese.
step-13: bake for 15-20 minutes, or until cheese is melted and bubbling.
step-14: cool for several minutes and serve.

step-1: add ground beef to a large skillet over high heat and sprinkle with taco seasoning.
step-2: cook, breaking up the meat, until browned.
step-3: drain the fat and set aside to cool.
step-4: assemble the burritos by microwaving the flour tortilla for 20 seconds, and begin to layer burrito starting with refried beans, followed by the cooked beef and cheese.
step-5: fold in the left and right sides of the tortilla and roll it up from the bottom, tucking the bottom edge under the filling.
step-6: wrap in parchment paper and label.
step-7: freeze up to 1 month.
step-8: to reheat from frozen, wrap the burrito in a damp paper towel and microwave for 2-3 minutes, flipping halfway or until the center is hot.
step-9: let stand 1 minute before eating.

step-1: heat half of the butter in large pot or dutch oven.
step-2: add the beef, in batches, browning all sides of the meat.
step-3: season with 1 teaspoon of salt and pepper.
step-4: transfer the beef to a bowl and set aside.
step-5: clean the pot.
step-6: in the same pan, heat remaining butter, then add in the onion, celery, and carrot.
step-7: cook until softened.
step-8: add in the beer.
step-9: with a wooden spatula, scrape off the browned bits on the bottom of the pan to further flavour the stock.
step-10: add in the seared beef, tomato purée, bay leaves, juniper berries, and 2 teaspoons each of salt and pepper.
step-11: bring the stew to a boil, cover, and simmer for 2-4 hours, until the beef becomes tender.
step-12: serve topped with parsley.

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine the bread crumbs, pecorino romano, ½ cup (20 g) chopped basil, provolone, parsley, 5 minced cloves of garlic, salt, pepper, and the olive oil.
step-2: stir and set aside.
step-3: lay the flank steak on a cutting board.
step-4: season both sides with salt and pepper.
step-5: cover the the meat with a sheet of parchment paper.
step-6: using a meat mallet or rolling pin, pound the steak until it’s ¼ inch (6 mm) thick.
step-7: remove the parchment and sprinkle the bread crumb mixture evenly over the steak.
step-8: starting from the bottom, roll the meat into a log.
step-9: using butcher’s twine, tie up the roll so it holds its shape while cooking.
step-10: season with salt and pepper.
step-11: heat the canola oil in a large dutch oven over high heat.
step-12: when the oil is shimmering, add the steak roll and, without moving it, cook until a dark brown crust forms on one side, about 3 minutes.
step-13: turn the roll and repeat until all sides and the ends have been seared.
step-14: remove the roll from the pan and set aside.
step-15: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-16: add the butter, carrot, onion, celery, remaining 3 cloves of garlic, salt, and pepper to the pan and cook until caramelized, about 5 minutes.
step-17: add the white wine and stir to loosen any brown bits from the bottom of the pot.
step-18: cook until the wine reduces and the pan is slightly dry again.
step-19: add the tomatoes, bay leaves, oregano, and red pepper flakes.
step-20: stir to combine.
step-21: return the beef roll to the pot.
step-22: cover and bake for 1 hour, flipping the roll halfway through (if the sauce is drying up too much, add more crushed tomatoes or water), until the beef is tender.
step-23: slice the braciole and arrange on a serving platter with the sauce.
step-24: serve the braciole with orecchiette or polenta.
step-25: garnish with grated pecorino romano and fresh basil.

step-1: remove all leaves and cut the cauliflower into small florets.
step-2: place the florets in a food processor and blend until they are a rice-like texture.
step-3: be careful not to over process or it may turn mushy.
step-4: set aside, and drain excess moisture with a towel, if desired.
step-5: in a large saucepan over medium-high heat, cook the steak until no pink is showing.
step-6: add the broccoli, salt, pepper, soy sauce, and brown sugar.
step-7: cook for 4-5 minutes until most of the liquid has reduced.
step-8: add the cauliflower rice, then cook for about 3-4 more minutes.

step-1: in a 2-cup (480 ml) liquid measuring cup, combine the water, cornstarch, soy sauce, garlic, brown sugar, and white pepper.
step-2: in a medium bowl, season the steak strips with salt.
step-3: pour half of the sauce over the meat and set the rest aside for later.
step-4: mix the sauce with the steak, cover with plastic wrap, and marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes to 1 hour.
step-5: in a wok or deep skillet over medium-high heat, heat 2 tablespoons of cooking oil, then add the par-cooked noodles.
step-6: cook for 1-2 minutes, allowing the noodles to crisp, then flip and cook for another 1-2 minutes.
step-7: transfer to a plate and set aside.
step-8: in the same wok, add 1 tablespoon of cooking oil and the marinated beef.
step-9: cook the beef for 3-4 minutes, then flip and cook for another 2 minutes, or until slightly crispy.
step-10: remove from the wok and set aside.
step-11: in the same wok, heat the remaining tablespoon of oil and add onion and broccoli.
step-12: season with salt, then stir and cook for 3-4 minutes, or until the onions are translucent.
step-13: return the steak to the wok, followed by the crispy noodles and sesame oil.
step-14: mix well and pour in the reserved sauce.
step-15: toss gently and cook for another 2-3 minutes, or until everything is well-combined.
step-16: garnish with sliced scallions.

step-1: pour soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic, brown sugar, water, and cornstarch over the strips of beef.
step-2: mix well, and marinate in the refrigerator for at least an hour.
step-3: in a wok or deep skillet, cook the beef in the marinade thoroughly and set aside.
step-4: in the same pan, heat up the oil and cook onions, garlic, and broccoli until onions are translucent.
step-5: push all of the cooked vegetables to the side of the pan.
step-6: beat the eggs and pour into the cleared half of the pan.
step-7: scramble the eggs and mix with the rest of the vegetables.
step-8: add rice, soy sauce, sesame oil, pepper, and cooked beef.
step-9: mix well and let the rice cook until slightly crispy.

step-1: make the rice: wash the rice in a medium bowl of water, draining and refilling until the water is clear.
step-2: pour the washed rice into a large pot and add 3 cups (720 ml) of fresh water.
step-3: let soak for 30 minutes.
step-4: place the rice on the stove over medium-high heat and bring to a boil.
step-5: cover, reduce the heat to low, and simmer for 12 minutes, or until all of the water is absorbed by the rice.
step-6: turn off the heat and let the rice rest with the lid on for 10 minutes, then fluff the rice and set aside until ready to use.
step-7: make the stir fry sauce: in a liquid measuring cup or medium bowl, combine the soy sauce, honey, ginger, and garlic.
step-8: whisk to combine.
step-9: make the filling: heat the vegetable oil in a medium pan over medium heat.
step-10: add the beef, salt, and pepper and cook until the meat is browned and cooked all the way through, 3-4 minutes.
step-11: remove the beef from the pan.
step-12: add the onion and broccoli to the same pan.
step-13: cook for 2-3 minutes, until slightly tender.
step-14: add the stir fry sauce.
step-15: combine the cornstarch and water in a small bowl and stir until cornstarch dissolves.
step-16: pour into the pan.
step-17: cook for 2-3 minutes more, or until the sauce is thick and the broccoli is tender.
step-18: return the beef to the pan, add the sesame seeds, and stir until thoroughly combined.
step-19: remove the pan from the heat.
step-20: line a 5-inch (13 cm) diameter bowl with plastic wrap.
step-21: scoop two tablespoons of rice into the bowl and use the back of a spoon (or your fingers) to flatten in an even layer against the inside of the bowl.
step-22: add a ½ tablespoon of filling and top it off with a little more rice.
step-23: use the plastic wrap to mold the rice around the filling.
step-24: unwrap and use your hands to shape the rice into a triangle.
step-25: repeat with the remaining rice and filling.
step-26: in a medium pan, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
step-27: add 2-3 rice triangles to the pan and fry on each side for 1-2 minutes, or until the rice is crispy and starting to turn golden brown.
step-28: brush soy sauce on all sides of the triangles and fry each side for another 1-2 minutes, or until dark golden brown.
step-29: repeat with the remaining triangles.
step-30: sprinkle the rice triangles with scallions, then serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: sprinkle the salt and pepper evenly over both sides of the beef.
step-3: cut the beef into 1-inch (2 ½ cm) strips.
step-4: dredge the beef in the egg, then roll it in the bread crumbs, pressing as many bread crumbs into the beef as possible.
step-5: repeat with the remaining strips of beef.
step-6: heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
step-7: pan fry the breaded beef strips until golden brown on both sides.
step-8: remove and drain.
step-9: cut the baguette into 4-inch (10 cm) long pieces.
step-10: hollow out the insides of each baguette piece.
step-11: spread the beans evenly inside the baguette pieces (optional).
step-12: place one mozzarella slice on top of the other with a 1-inch (2 ½ cm) overlap.
step-13: put the breaded beef strip in the middle, then top with a slice of avocado.
step-14: wrap the cheese tightly around the beef and avocado, then push it inside the hollowed out baguette piece.
step-15: slice the stuffed baguette piece into 1-inch (2 ½ cm) slices.
step-16: place the baguette slices side by side on a baking sheet lined with foil.
step-17: mix the butter with the garlic, parsley, and parmesan.
step-18: brush the garlic butter mixture evenly on top of the baguette slices.
step-19: wrap the foil around the bread, then bake for 20 minutes, until cheese is melted and the garlic on top is golden brown.

step-1: in a re-sealable freezer bag, add beef, garlic, coriander, cumin, paprika, white vinegar, and olive oil.
step-2: seal the bag and distribute seasonings.
step-3: allow to marinate in the refrigerator for 24 hours.
step-4: in a food processor, add garlic cloves and pulse until the garlic becomes finely minced.
step-5: add salt and pulse until well incorporated.
step-6: scrape down the sides of the bowl if you see the garlic building up on the sides.
step-7: turn on the food processor and keep it on.
step-8: in a thin stream pour ½ cup (59 ml) of oil followed by ½ tsp of lemon juice.
step-9: keep alternating until you have used all of the oil and lemon juice.
step-10: the garlic sauce should become light, fluffy and creamy.
step-11: store garlic sauce in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week!
step-12: preheat the grill on high.
step-13: to assemble the kebabs, spray skewers with non-stick cooking spray and alternate threading beef, onions and bell peppers onto the skewer.
step-14: cook 5-7 minutes on each side.
step-15: serve kebabs with garlic sauce, salad, rice, hummus, and pita bread.

step-1: season the meat on all sides with salt and pepper.
step-2: heat a large heavy pot with a lid over medium-high heat.
step-3: add a tablespoon of olive oil and brown the meat in batches until a crust forms, turning to ensure even color on all sides.
step-4: once one batch is done, set aside in a bowl or plate with a lip, add another fresh tablespoon of olive oil and continue until all the meat is brown.
step-5: add another tablespoon of oil to the pan and sauté the onion, carrot, celery, and garlic until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
step-6: pour in the wine and let it boil off and reduce until barely any remains in the pan.
step-7: next, add the browned meat back to the pan, along with the tomato paste.
step-8: stir until tomato paste is coating all the ingredients and allow the paste to toast slightly.
step-9: pour in the tomatoes, stock, and herb bundle and stir, bring to a simmer and cover with a lid.
step-10: allow to simmer for 3 hours, stirring occasionally.
step-11: alternatively, if your pot and lid are oven safe, cook in a 325˚f (170˚c) oven for 3 hours.
step-12: remove the herb bundle and beef shank.
step-13: pull the meat from the oxtail.
step-14: using a fork or tongs, discarding the bone and any extra cartilage or extra fat.
step-15: add the meat back to the ragu and stir.
step-16: skim off any extra fat from the top of the ragu.
step-17: cook pasta in boiling salted water until al dente.
step-18: reserve 1 cup (120 ml) of the pasta water before draining.
step-19: add a few ladlefuls of ragu, the pasta, and a splash of pasta water to a large pot, gently stir to coat the pasta in the ragu.
step-20: add a handful of cheese and stir to melt into the sauce.
step-21: garnish with more cheese and fresh parsley before serving.

step-1: preheat oven to 180°c (350˚f).
step-2: add salt and pepper to the flour and use it to coat the diced beef.
step-3: brown off beef in a deep ovenproof pan with olive oil.
step-4: remove from pan.
step-5: add more oil and fry the onions until translucent.
step-6: add the carrots and celery and fry for another 3-5 minutes.
step-7: add the garlic and fry for 2 minutes together with the beef.
step-8: add in the tomato puree and rosemary and fry for a further 2-3 minutes.
step-9: add the chopped tomato and cook for 2 minutes.
step-10: add the red wine and allow to reduce slightly.
step-11: add the beef stock and allow to reduce for 10 minutes.
step-12: cover the pot with a lid and cook for 2 hours.
step-13: remove and cover the top of the stew with thinly-chopped peeled potatoes, arranged so they are overlapping slightly.
step-14: cover with melted butter, salt, pepper, and thyme and cook for a further 45 minutes at 200°c (400˚f) with the lid off.
step-15: remove from oven once potatoes are cooked and cover with the grated gruyere.
step-16: grill on high for 5-10 minutes until cheese is bubbling.

step-1: in a medium bowl, season the beef with salt and pepper and toss to coat.
step-2: add ¼ cup (30 g) of flour, and toss the beef cubes until they are fully coated.
step-3: in a large pan over medium-high heat, heat the canola oil until it shimmers.
step-4: place about half of the beef cubes in the pan.
step-5: sear the beef on one side until it develops a deep brown crust, 3-5 minutes.
step-6: then flip and sear on the other side for 3-5 minutes.
step-7: then, stir the beef until evenly browned on all sides.
step-8: remove the beef from the pan.
step-9: repeat with the remaining meat.
step-10: melt the butter in the leftover meat drippings.
step-11: add the onion, season with salt and pepper, and cook until the onions are soft and slightly golden, about 5 minutes.
step-12: add the sliced mushrooms and cook until deeply browned and tender, about 10 minutes.
step-13: add the cognac and scrape the brown bits, releasing them from the bottom of the pan.
step-14: cook and stir until the cognac is fully incorporated, about 2 minutes.
step-15: sprinkle the remaining ¼ cup (30 g) flour into the pan and stir to coat the the caramelized veggies.
step-16: add the beef broth and stir it into the flour and vegetables.
step-17: bring the liquid to a boil, then reduce to low heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
step-18: the sauce should be thick enough to coat the back of a spoon.
step-19: once the sauce is thickened, turn off the heat.
step-20: put two scoops of hot gravy into a bowl with the sour cream.
step-21: mix the two together to slightly warm, or temper, the sour cream.
step-22: then add the sour cream mixture to the rest of the gravy and stir it in until fully combined.
step-23: sprinkle the stroganoff with chopped parsley and serve with buttered egg noodles, rice, or potatoes.

step-1: preheat the oven to 200°c (400°f).
step-2: half the potatoes and scoop out the insides, keeping the scooped out potato for later.
step-3: cut the steak into thin strips and sear in a hot pan.
step-4: remove the steak.
step-5: melt the butter in the pan, then add the onions and garlic.
step-6: season with salt.
step-7: cook the onions and garlic until translucent, then add the mushrooms.
step-8: when the mushrooms are soft, stir in the mustard, paprika, and leftover potato.
step-9: stir in the beef stock, then simmer until mostly reduced.
step-10: add the soured cream, then add the seared beef back in as well.
step-11: season with salt and pepper and remove from the heat immediately.
step-12: stuff the potato skins with the stroganoff mixture.
step-13: bake for 8-10 minutes.
step-14: sprinkle with parsley and serve.

step-1: in a food processor, place mushrooms, garlic, salt, pepper, and thyme and blend into a fine paste (about 30-60 seconds).
step-2: transfer to a medium-sized frying pan, being sure to spread it evenly across the bottom of the pan.
step-3: cook the mushrooms over medium-low heat while stirring frequently.
step-4: after about 7-10 minutes the mushroom mixture should shrink to half the original volume and begin to form a paste.
step-5: note: the goal here is to cook off the bulk of the water inside the mushrooms.
step-6: this’ll keep the puff pastry from being too mushy at the end.
step-7: at this point, remove the mushroom mixture from the heat and set it aside.
step-8: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-9: liberally season the outside of the tenderloin pieces with salt and pepper.
step-10: in another medium-sized frying pan, heat 2 tablespoons of neutral oil over high heat.
step-11: once the oil has begun to smoke, quickly sear the tenderloin pieces on both sides (45-60 seconds per-side).
step-12: once seared, transfer the meat to a plate or cutting board to rest.
step-13: using a basting brush, generously paint the mustard over the resting pieces of beef, making sure to coat both sides.
step-14: to assemble the wellingtons, lay out a piece of puff pastry on a lightly floured surface.
step-15: place a piece of ham in the center of the pasty.
step-16: next, layer about 1 tablespoon of the mushroom mixture on the center of the ham using the back of a spoon to flatten the paste to about the size of the tenderloin pieces.
step-17: place one of the mustard-coated beef fillet on top of the mushroom mixture, then top the piece of beef with another spoonful of the mushroom mixture, making sure to pat it down flat across the top of the meat.
step-18: layer with another piece of ham and close the the wellington by folding the puff pastry over the center of the meat.
step-19: using your hands, carefully seal the edges of the pastry then transfer seam-side down to a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
step-20: lightly brush the outside of each wellington with egg wash.
step-21: using the back of a paring knife, lightly score the tops of the pasty in a checkered pattern, being careful not to pierce the pastry.
step-22: bake the wellingtons in a 400˚f (200˚c) oven until the pastry is fully cooked and golden brown (about 20 minutes).
step-23: allow each wellington to rest at least 10 minutes before cutting into it.

step-1: heat oil in a large pot so it’s at least 4 inches (10 cm) deep.
step-2: if you have a thermometer, be sure the oil reaches at least 360ºf (185ºc) for frying.
step-3: in a bowl, whisk together flour, cinnamon, and redd’s apple ale until smooth.
step-4: slice off the top and bottom of the apples, and slice each apple into ½-inch (1 cm) thick rounds.
step-5: with a teaspoon or large piping tip, cut out a circle in the center of the apple ring to make it look like a donut.
step-6: with a paper towel, pat down the apple slices.
step-7: dip the apple slices in the batter.
step-8: fry them two to three at a time.
step-9: flip each apple slice once during frying and fry until both sides are golden brown.
step-10: carefully remove from the oil and place onto paper towels or a drying rack.
step-11: cool, then sprinkle with powdered sugar.

step-1: pour the crisps into a ziplock bag and smash into pieces using a rolling pin.
step-2: pour into a bowl and set aside.
step-3: preheat a pot of oil to 180˚c (350˚c).
step-4: mix all the beer batter ingredients in a bowl until combined, careful not to overmix.
step-5: cut the chicken into strips and coat well in the batter, then the crisp coating.
step-6: fry for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until chicken is golden brown and cooked through.
step-7: transfer to some paper towel to soak up some of the excess oil.
step-8: serve with chips, your favourite sauces and leftover beer.

step-1: in a large pot over medium-high heat, bring 3 inches (8 cm) of oil to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: peel and cut onions crosswise into ½ (1 ⅓ cm) inch slices.
step-3: separate into rings and place in a large bowl with ice water while you prepare the batter.
step-4: in a medium mixing bowl, whisk together 1 cup flour (125 g), salt, white pepper, and baking powder.
step-5: whisk in beer and 2 tablespoons of ice water until just combined.
step-6: in a separate bowl, add the remaining 1 cup (125 g) of flour.
step-7: remove the rings from the ice water bath and pat dry.
step-8: coat the rings first in the flour then in the batter, allowing any excess to drip off.
step-9: working in batches, transfer battered rings to hot oil to cook for 2 to 3 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-10: transfer to a paper towel lined rack to drain.
step-11: sprinkle with salt.

step-1: in a small bowl, combine the sour cream, lime juice, lime zest, and salt and mix well.
step-2: in another bowl, combine the red cabbage, green cabbage, jalapeño, 2 tablespoons of the sour cream sauce mix, lime juice and salt.
step-3: mix until fully incorporated.
step-4: season the shrimp with a big pinch of salt.
step-5: combine flour, garlic powder, smoked paprika, cayenne, salt and baking powder in a medium size bowl and mix well.
step-6: add beer and stir well.
step-7: add shrimp into the batter, making sure each is fully coated.
step-8: heat oil in a pot to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-9: fry the shrimp in batches for 4 - 5 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-10: transfer the shrimp to a paper towel-lined plate.
step-11: top a tortilla with guacamole, rainbow coleslaw, fried shrimp, a drizzle of sour cream sauce, sliced radishes, and cilantro.

step-1: in a large skillet, brown the bratwurst on both sides over medium high heat.
step-2: add both cans of beer to the skillet.
step-3: simmer over medium-low heat for 20 minutes.
step-4: remove bratwurst from skillet and set aside.
step-5: continuing to simmer beer over medium low, add cream cheese and cheddar cheese to the skillet.
step-6: stir occasionally until mixture is smooth, about 5 minutes.
step-7: add cayenne and mustard to beer cheese, stirring to incorporate.
step-8: remove beer cheese from heat.
step-9: cover a large plate with a layer of tortilla chips.
step-10: top with beer cheese.
step-11: slice bratwurst and arrange over nachos and add desired amount of nacho fixings.
step-12: repeat with another layer of chips and fixings.

step-1: add beer and brats to sauce pan.
step-2: cook on medium high heat for 10-15 minutes.
step-3: place brats on grill and cook until done (probably another 10-15 min).
step-4: with 1 cup (235 ml) of beer in the pot, add cream cheese and cheddar.
step-5: stir until cheese is mixed.
step-6: add the cheese mixture on top of the beer brats.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: slice a small piece of your pizza dough, roll it into a ball then flatten it out.
step-3: toss the cheddar cheese with the corn starch until it’s evenly distributed.
step-4: in a medium saucepan, bring ½ cup (120 ml) of beer to a simmer.
step-5: add in the cheese and corn starch mixture and whisk until it begins to thicken.
step-6: once thick, take off the heat.
step-7: note: it may cool and become more solid over time, but don’t worry!
step-8: it will melt back down in the oven, so this is fine.
step-9: place a small spoonful of the beer cheese mixture in the center of the dough.
step-10: pick up the top and bottom edges and bring them up and together.
step-11: do the same with the left and right edges.
step-12: continue bringing in the rest of the edges of the dough until it all meets in the center and there are no gaps for the cheese to leak out of during baking.
step-13: note: you can pick up and twist the top of the dough to make sure everything is more secure.
step-14: bring five cups of water to a boil in a medium pot.
step-15: when you’ve finished putting together your pretzel bites, add the baking soda to the water and immediately scoop in your pretzel bites.
step-16: boil for 20-30 seconds,
step-17: take out and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-18: in a small bowl, combine one egg and two tablespoons of beer and beat with a fork until they are well blended.
step-19: brush the mixture onto the top of each pretzel bite, then top with coarse salt.
step-20: bake for 15-20 minutes (or until they have browned).

step-1: cut rind off soft cheeses while they are still chilled, then cut into cubes.
step-2: blend cheeses with fork, then add cream cheese, beer, spices, and diced onion and mix again.
step-3: when well incorporated, stir in salt & pepper to taste.
step-4: chill.
step-5: take pizza dough out of package and roll into a ball.
step-6: in a large bowl, add beer and flour to the dough and mix with hands until firm and not sticky.
step-7: add more flour if needed.
step-8: rip off a piece of dough and roll it into a 6-inch (15 cm) long log.
step-9: to form the pretzel, pull the ends of the log to the top of the circle.
step-10: twist the ends around each other once and bring them down to meet the bottom of the circle.
step-11: then transfer to a baking sheet.
step-12: repeat until all dough is used.
step-13: chill pretzels in the fridge for 20 minutes.
step-14: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-15: bring the water to a boil in a medium pot.
step-16: add the baking soda to the water and immediately add pretzels.
step-17: boil for 20-30 seconds, then take out and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-18: brush egg wash onto the top of each pretzel, then top with coarse salt.
step-19: bake for 15-20 minutes or until deep brown.
step-20: before serving the beer cheese, garnish with sliced red onion, if desired.
step-21: cheese mixture can be used as dip or spread.

step-1: in a non-stick skillet, toast the walnuts over medium-high heat for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
step-2: remove from heat and set aside.
step-3: in a small bowl, mix the lemon juice, water, honey, thyme, salt, and pepper.
step-4: while whisking, slowly add the oil to the bowl to create a vinaigrette.
step-5: in a large salad bowl, add the mixed greens, pears, beets, onions, walnuts, and lemon vinaigrette.
step-6: toss to combine all ingredients and serve.

step-1: add the celery, apple, beets, and spinach to a blender, and blend until smooth.
step-2: using a mesh strainer, strain the juice over a large liquid measuring cup to remove the pulp.
step-3: use a spoon to help stir the pulp and press out the liquid.
step-4: reserve the pulp to make pulp muffins.
step-5: chill the juice for at least 30 minutes (and keep up to 3 days).

step-1: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: add the beet to an oven-safe dish and pour in enough water to come ¾ of the way up the beet.
step-3: cover the dish tightly with foil and set aside.
step-4: poke the potato all over with a fork and place in the center of a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-5: place both the beet and potato in the oven and roast for 45 minutes, until fork tender.
step-6: remove from the oven and let cool until safe to handle.
step-7: gently rub the beet to remove the skin.
step-8: (if you’d like, wear rubber gloves to protect your hands from being dyed by the beet juice.) trim any remaining stem from the beet after peeling, then roughly chop.
step-9: transfer the beet to a food processor, along with the egg, parmesan, and salt.
step-10: puree until completely smooth.
step-11: set aside.
step-12: peel the skin from potato and grate through the small holes of a box grater, or press through a potato ricer, if you have one.
step-13: in a large bowl, combine the potato and the beet mixture.
step-14: fold gently to combine, being careful not to over mix.
step-15: add the flour, ½ cup (60 grams) at a time, and fold until the dough comes together.
step-16: you may not need to use the full 2 cups.
step-17: turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead gently until a pliable dough is formed that is tender but not sticky when handled.
step-18: divide into 8 portions.
step-19: roll a dough portion into a ½-inch (1 ¼ cm) thick rope.
step-20: cut the rope into 1-inch (2.5 cm) pieces.
step-21: repeat with the remaining dough.
step-22: if desired, roll each piece of gnocchi over the tines of a fork to create ridges.
step-23: bring a medium pot of well-salted water to a boil over high heat.
step-24: working in batches, drop 8-10 gnocchi into the boiling water and cook until they begin to float.
step-25: once they start floating at the surface, let cook for 30 seconds more, then transfer from the water with a slotted spoon to a plate and set aside.
step-26: in a medium pan, melt 2 tablespoons of butter until just beginning to bubble.
step-27: add 1 tablespoon of sage and half of the gnocchi, to avoid overcrowding the pan.
step-28: sauté for about 1 minute per side until the gnocchi are lightly toasted and well coated with butter and sage.
step-29: repeat with the remaining butter, sage, and gnocchi.
step-30: serve immediately with parmesan cheese for garnish.

step-1: start by preparing your beetroot.
step-2: wash thoroughly under water and remove the stems and root.
step-3: next, peel the beetroot and cut each bulb in half.
step-4: next, slice your beetroot as thinly as you can.
step-5: for ease and speed, it is useful to use a food processor with the slicing attachment; if you don’t have one, just do your best to cut the beetroot as thinly as you can.
step-6: take a baking tray and cover with kitchen paper.
step-7: lay out the beetroot slices in one even layer, cover with more kitchen paper, and press down.
step-8: dry the beetroot overnight.
step-9: (if you can’t wait this long, you can remove the kitchen paper and place the beetroot slices into an oven preheated to 210˚f (100˚c) for 15 minutes or until you can see the slices starting to dehydrate.)
step-10: place a deep saucepan over a medium heat and fill halfway with oil.
step-11: preheat the oil to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-12: once the oil is up to temperature, cook the beetroot in small batches for around 1 minute or until crispy.
step-13: carefully remove crisps from the oil and drain onto kitchen paper.
step-14: season with salt.

step-1: to a large bowl, add the beetroot, sweet potato, salt, black pepper, garlic granules, smoked paprika, lemon zest, coriander, tahini, feta, eggs, and breadcrumbs.
step-2: mix until thoroughly combined.
step-3: form the mixture into burger-shaped patties.
step-4: next place a large frying pan over a low-medium heat and add around 1 cm (½ in) of oil.
step-5: you need enough oil so the burgers are at least halfway covered with the oil when they are in the pan.
step-6: once the oil is warm, cook the burgers for around 5 minutes per side or until cooked through and golden brown on the outside.
step-7: remove from the pan and drain excess oil on kitchen paper.
step-8: to prepare the tzatziki, add the greek yoghurt, cucumber, garlic, mint, lemon juice, black pepper, and salt to a bowl and mix thoroughly.
step-9: refrigerate until ready to serve.
step-10: place your beetroot patty onto a burger bun, top with tzatziki and rocket salad.

step-1: pour the water into a medium bowl or large liquid measuring cup and sprinkle the yeast over the top.
step-2: let stand for about 5 minutes, until foamy.
step-3: add the eggs, milk, melted butter, and sugar, and whisk to combine.
step-4: in a large bowl, whisk together the flour and salt.
step-5: pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, stirring with a flexible spatula to form a shaggy dough.
step-6: turn the dough out onto a clean surface and use your hands to knead until it comes together in a smooth ball, about 2 minutes.
step-7: grease a clean large bowl with canola oil.
step-8: transfer the dough to the greased bowl and cover tightly with plastic wrap.
step-9: let the dough rise in a warm place until doubled in size, about 1 hour.
step-10: punch the dough down with your fist, then turn it out onto a lightly floured surface.
step-11: roll the dough into a large rectangle, about ¼ inch (6 mm) thick.
step-12: with a sharp knife, cut the dough into 2-inch (5 cm) squares, then transfer the squares to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-13: heat the canola oil in a large pot over medium-high heat until it reaches 350˚f (180˚c).
step-14: lower the dough squares, 3-4 at a time, into the hot oil.
step-15: as soon as the beignets puff up, use tongs or a kitchen spider to gently flip them over.
step-16: fry until golden brown on both sides, flipping as needed, 2-3 minutes more.
step-17: transfer the beignets to a wire rack to drain.
step-18: dust the beignets with powdered sugar and serve warm.

step-1: in a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs and milk.
step-2: heat the olive oil in an oven-safe pan over medium-low heat.
step-3: when the oil is shimmering, add the kale, bell pepper, salt, and pepper.
step-4: sauté until the pepper is tender, about 10 minutes.
step-5: pour the egg mixture into the pan and sprinkle the feta cheese on top.
step-6: continue to cook, pushing in the edges occasionally to make sure all the egg cooks evenly.
step-7: remove from the heat.
step-8: place the pan in the oven and broil on high until the top is lightly browned, about 4 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f/190˚c.
step-2: cut the peppers in half through the stem.
step-3: leave the stem attached, but remove the seeds and membrane.
step-4: place onto a parchment-lined baking tray.
step-5: bake for 20 minutes.
step-6: crack a whole egg into each pepper half.
step-7: season with salt and pepper.
step-8: add spinach,mushrooms and parmesan to 2 of the pepper halves.
step-9: add salsa and cheddar to 2 of the pepper halves.
step-10: add tomato, and basil to the 2 remaining pepper halves.
step-11: bake for an additional 15 minutes, until the egg whites have set or until your eggs are cooked to your preference.

step-1: slice a yellow bell pepper on its side to create rings.
step-2: place the 2 rings in a pan and let simmer for a few seconds.
step-3: crack one egg inside each of the rings.
step-4: cover the pan and cook 4-5 minutes.
step-5: (or to desired wellness)
step-6: serve the bell pepper egg rings with toast and fruit.
step-7: (optional) top with salt and pepper to taste.

step-1: cut top of 1 bell pepper off and deseed and destem the inside.
step-2: using the tip of a small knife, cut out a jack o’ lantern face into the side of the bell pepper.
step-3: stand the bell pepper up and fill with slices of the other two bell peppers or other vegetables.
step-4: serve with ranch.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: grease a baking sheet with nonstick spray or line with parchment paper.
step-3: cut the bell peppers carefully around the stem and remove the stem and seeds.
step-4: cut the peppers crosswise into ½-inch (1 cm) slices.
step-5: in a large bowl, combine the bread crumbs, parmesan, garlic powder, paprika, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper.
step-6: add the eggs to a separate bowl and whisk.
step-7: add the flour to a third bowl.
step-8: dredge the bell pepper rings in the flour, then the eggs, then finally in the bread crumb mixture, making sure to coat all sides.
step-9: arrange the bell pepper rings on the baking sheet.
step-10: bake for 10-15 minutes, flipping halfway through, until golden brown on both sides.
step-11: serve with your favorite dipping sauce.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, combine the paprika, salt, cayenne, fenugreek, ginger, onion powder, cardamom, nutmeg, garlic powder, cloves cinnamon, and allspice.
step-3: mix well.
step-4: save two tablespoons of spice mix.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: add the chicken drumettes to the bowl with the spice mixture and toss to coat evenly.
step-7: marinate in the fridge at least 30 minutes, up to overnight.
step-8: in a small bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, and cornstarch.
step-9: sprinkle the flour mixture over the marinated chicken.
step-10: toss them until well-coated.
step-11: place the chicken on a wire rack set over a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-12: bake them for 30-40 minutes or chicken is slightly browned.
step-13: in a small saucepan, melt the butter.
step-14: once the butter is melted, add the reserved 2 tablespoons spice mix and stir to combine.
step-15: drizzle the spice butter mixture over the drumettes.

step-1: preheat oven to 280°f (135°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, whip egg whites until stiff peaks form.
step-3: in a small bowl, combine baker’s sugar and cornstarch and mix well.
step-4: gradually (split into 5 portions) add sugar into the egg whites.
step-5: once the egg whites form a stiff peak with a sheen gloss, set aside.
step-6: bake for 1 hour.
step-7: then turn oven off and let cloud cakes sit in hot oven for another hour or two until the oven is totally cool.
step-8: whip the heavy cream and sugar together until the cream is set.
step-9: carefully place each layer of cake with cream and berries.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a saucepan over medium heat, bring the butter brown sugar and corn syrup to a boil.
step-3: remove from heat.
step-4: add the flour and nuts into the butter mixture.
step-5: stir until cooled, about 10 minutes.
step-6: on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, use a teaspoon to scoop 5 balls 5 inches (13 cm) apart onto the baking sheet.
step-7: bake for 6-7 minutes, until the edges are a deep golden color.
