step-8: let the cookies cool for about 1 minute, until they are cool enough to handle but still flexible.
step-9: place the cookie over the backside of a muffin tin and gently form until the cookie is a cup shape.
step-10: wait until the cookie has hardened into the cup shape, then remove from the muffin tin, about 1 minute.
step-11: in a bowl, microwave the chocolate in 20-second intervals, stirring in between for 1 minute.
step-12: take one of the pecan lace cookie cups and dip the edge into the chocolate.
step-13: let cool.
step-14: place one dollop of whipped cream in the cookie cup and top with 2 strawberry halves and 3 raspberries.
step-15: serve immediately.

step-1: make the custard: in a medium microwave-safe bowl, whisk together the egg yolks, sugar, cornstarch, vanilla, and milk.
step-2: cover with plastic wrap.
step-3: cook the custard in a microwave for 4 minutes, stirring after every 2 minutes until very smooth.
step-4: re-cover with plastic wrap, pressing onto the surface of the cream to prevent a skin from forming.
step-5: chill in the fridge until cool, about 30 minutes.
step-6: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-7: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-8: make the pastry: in a medium saucepan, bring the water, butter, and salt to a boil over medium heat.
step-9: as soon as the mixture begins to boil, reduce the heat to medium-low and add the flour.
step-10: using a wooden spoon, mix thoroughly to combine.
step-11: continue stirring (about two minutes).
step-12: the dough should form into a ball and easily pull away from the sides of the pan.
step-13: remove the mixture from the heat and let cool for 5 minutes.
step-14: add 4 of the eggs to the cooled dough, one at a time, being sure to fully incorporate each egg before adding the next.
step-15: (the eggs will initially be difficult to incorporate into the dough, but continue stirring vigorously and they will eventually come together to form a smooth, shiny dough.
step-16: when the dough drops making a v shape, it is ready!)
step-17: transfer the dough to a piping bag and pipe onto the baking sheet in an 7-inch (17-cm) ring shape.
step-18: pipe a second ring outside the first ring.
step-19: pipe a final ring on top.
step-20: beat the remaining egg, then brush over the ring.
step-21: bake for 20 minutes.
step-22: then, without opening the oven, reduce the heat to 350˚f(180˚c) and bake for another 15 minutes.
step-23: turn off the oven and leave the puff pastry inside for another 10 minutes.
step-24: cut the choux pastry in half horizontally.
step-25: pipe the custard into the hollow center of the shell.
step-26: pipe whipped cream on top of the custard.
step-27: top with berries.
step-28: place the top half of the shell.
step-29: dust with powdered sugar.

step-1: add the instant oatmeal, freeze-dried raspberries, freeze-dried strawberries, milk powder, and sugar into a mason jar.
step-2: store in a cool, dry place for up to a month.
step-3: to prepare, pour boiling water or milk over oats.
step-4: stir to combine and let sit for 3 minutes.
step-5: serve with fresh raspberries and strawberries.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a bowl, whisk wet ingredients until combined.
step-3: in a separate bowl, combine dry ingredients.
step-4: spread 1 cup (100 grams) of berries over the bottom of an 8x8 inch (20x20 cm) glass baking dish.
step-5: add dry mixture, then wet mixture, then the remaining berries.
step-6: top with sliced almonds.
step-7: bake 40-45 minutes, or until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean.
step-8: top with honey.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine flour, eggs, butter, and sugar, stirring until ingredients are slightly mixed.
step-2: add the milk ½ cup (120 ml) at a time, stirring vigorously, making sure the milk is completely incorporated into the batter and that the batter is smooth before adding more milk.
step-3: repeat with the rest of the milk.
step-4: the batter should be very liquidy and have no lumps.
step-5: in a pan over medium heat, pour ⅓ cup (95 g) of the batter in the center and swirl the batter around the edges of the pan until set.
step-6: to know when the crepe is ready to flip, lift up one of the edges about ⅓ of the way.
step-7: the bottom side should be golden brown.
step-8: flip the crepe.
step-9: cook until the edges are starting to slightly crisp.
step-10: remove from heat and cover with a paper towel to make sure the crepes stay moist.
step-11: in a pot over medium heat, combine all the berries with the lemon juice and the sugar, stirring until the mixture comes to a boil.
step-12: cook for about 2 minutes, then remove from heat and cool completely.
step-13: mix the cream cheese with the powdered sugar until smooth.
step-14: spread half of the cream cheese mixture on one side of the crepe.
step-15: spread half of the berries on top of the cream cheese.
step-16: fold the crepe over the berries, then fold in half.
step-17: repeat with the other crepe.
step-18: serve with powdered sugar.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: prepare your favorite plain vanilla cake recipe or use a prepared box and follow its instructions.
step-3: using the back of a wooden spoon, poke at least 3 rows of 4 holes in the cooked cake, making 12 holes total.
step-4: in a large bowl, mash the strawberries with a potato masher or fork until mashed to a pulp
step-5: add the cream cheese and condensed milk, whisking until there are no large lumps
step-6: add the mashed blackberries and raspberries; stir just once or twice so the colors remain differentiated.
step-7: pour the mixture over the cake and let settle into the holes for about 10 minutes.
step-8: some of the mixture will still stay on top, which is okay.
step-9: spread the whipped topping evenly over the cake.
step-10: sprinkle graham crackers on top and add sliced strawberries or other fresh berries
step-11: chill the cake for at least 3 hours or up to overnight.

step-1: spray the inside of a microwave-safe ceramic mug.
step-2: add in flour, cocoa powder, sugar, and baking powder.
step-3: mix to combine.
step-4: add the vegetable oil, milk, and stir until smooth.
step-5: stir in the chocolate chips.
step-6: microwave on high for 1 minute 30 seconds.
step-7: let cool completely.
step-8: top with whipped cream, sprinkle on fresh blueberries, raspberries, and mint.

step-1: in a medium bowl, add the flour, baking powder, 1 tablespoon of sugar, and the butter.
step-2: cut the butter into the flour with a fork until the mixture crumbly.
step-3: add the milk and stir until the mixture comes together.
step-4: heat the mini frying pan over low heat.
step-5: add the berries, water, and remaining tablespoon of sugar to the frying pan.
step-6: scoop the dough on top of the berries, flatten slightly with a spoon, and cover with a small plate.
step-7: cook for 30 minutes or until the berries have softened and the dough is cooked through.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, whisk together warm water and honey.
step-3: add eggs, milk, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and salt.
step-4: whisk.
step-5: place bread cubes into a well-greased cast-iron pan.
step-6: pour the egg mixture over the bread cubes and submerge all of the bread cubes.
step-7: let soak for 20 minutes.
step-8: arrange the fruit on top.
step-9: bake for approximately 1 hour.
step-10: serve with yogurt and maple syrup.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: combine eggs, milk, vanilla, and cinnamon in a large bowl.
step-3: dip bread slices into egg mixture and gently press into muffin tin coated with cooking spray.
step-4: bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown.
step-5: prepare filling and fruit slices while cups bake.
step-6: fill up the slices with the filling and fruit.
step-7: serve with a drizzle of maple syrup.

step-1: add tofu and maple syrup to a mixing bowl and whisk together until smooth and no large lumps are present.
step-2: transfer tofu mixture to ice tray and use a rubber spatula to evenly spread the mixture into each of the cube slots.
step-3: freeze completely.
step-4: place blueberries, raspberries, strawberries, 4 tofu cubes, and milk in a blender, making sure that the cubes sit on top of the fruit.
step-5: blend until smooth.
step-6: serve immediately.

step-1: in two glasses, divide the yogurt and top with a layer strawberries and bananas.
step-2: continue with another layer of yogurt, granola, and berries.
step-3: drizzle with honey.

step-1: blend mixed berries, greek yogurt, almond milk, and peanut butter until smooth.
step-2: top with your favorite toppings.

step-1: make the filling: add the raspberries, blackberries, black raspberry liqueur, and 1 tablespoon of maple syrup to a large bowl.
step-2: stir and let sit for 10 minutes for the berries to macerate.
step-3: in a medium bowl, mix together the cream cheese and remaining tablespoon of maple syrup until smooth.
step-4: spread the filling evenly over the 4 slices of bread.
step-5: arrange some of the berries on 2 slices of the bread and top with the other slices of bread.
step-6: press to seal the pieces together.
step-7: in a shallow dish, whisk together the milk, egg, black raspberry liqueur, and salt.
step-8: melt the butter on a griddle or in a large skillet over medium heat.
step-9: quickly dip both sides of the bread pockets in the milk mixture, then transfer to the pan and fry on each side for about 3 minutes, until golden brown.
step-10: in a large bowl, beat the heavy cream until soft peaks form.
step-11: add the maple syrup and continue beating until the cream holds medium peaks.
step-12: serve the stuffed french toast with a dollop of maple whipped cream and a scoop of macerated berries with their soaking liquid.

step-1: combine vodka, orange juice, and sparkling water in a pitcher.
step-2: stir in the fresh oranges.
step-3: set aside and chill.
step-4: puree mixed berries, tart cherry juice, and maraschino cherry liquid in a blender or food processor.
step-5: strain the purée through a sieve into a separate pitcher.
step-6: when ready to serve, pour orange vodka mixture into a glass of ice, leaving some room.
step-7: top off the drink with the berry liquid and watch it settle to the bottom.
step-8: garnish with an orange and maraschino cherry.

step-1: in a jar, add all the spices and shake until combined.
step-2: store in a tightly covered container, such as a mason jar, for up to a year.
step-3: season your favorite meats and vegetables with the rub.

step-1: to marinate the meat, add the ribeye to a medium bowl with the green onion, red chili, garlic, soy sauce, sesame oil, sugar, and mirin.
step-2: mix until the meat is well-coated.
step-3: marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
step-4: bring a large pot of water to boil over high heat and season generously with salt.
step-5: blanch the spinach for 30 seconds, transfer to an ice bath to shock, and drain.
step-6: transfer to a small bowl and season with 1 teaspoon of sesame oil, a pinch of salt, and pepper.
step-7: blanch the bean sprouts for 1-2 minutes, then shock the ice bath.
step-8: strain and pat dry with a paper towel.
step-9: transfer to a small bowl and season with 1 teaspoon sesame oil, a pinch of salt, and pepper.
step-10: in a medium skillet over medium heat, add 1 tablespoon of sesame oil, the yellow squash, and 1 teaspoon salt.
step-11: sauté for 2-3 minutes, until the squash is softened.
step-12: set the squash aside in a small bowl.
step-13: in the same skillet over medium heat, add another tablespoon of sesame oil, the zucchini, and 1 teaspoon of salt.
step-14: sauté for 2-3 minutes, until the zucchini is softened.
step-15: set aside in a small bowl.
step-16: add another tablespoon of sesame oil, the daikon, and a teaspoon of salt to the same skillet and for sauté over medium heat for 30 seconds.
step-17: add ¼ cup (60 ml) of water and cook until liquid has evaporated, 4-5 minutes.
step-18: set aside in a small bowl.
step-19: in the same skillet over medium heat, add another tablespoons of sesame oil, the carrots, and 1 teaspoon of salt and sauté for 2-3 minutes, until softened.
step-20: set aside in a small bowl.
step-21: in a small bowl, pour the hot water over the dried mushrooms and soak for 5 minutes, or until the mushrooms have softened.
step-22: wring out excess moisture from the mushrooms and thinly slice.
step-23: in the skillet over medium heat, add 1 tablespoon of sesame oil and sauté 1 minced clove of garlic for 30 seconds, or until fragrant.
step-24: add the mushrooms and sauté for 2-3 minutes more.
step-25: set aside in a small bowl.
step-26: add the remaining ¼ cup (60 ml) of sesame oil to a liquid measuring cup or small bowl.
step-27: add 2 teaspoons of salt, the remaining minced garlic clove, the gochugaru, and sesame seeds and whisk to combine.
step-28: pour a bit of the seasoned oil over the sautéed beans sprouts, sliced cucumber, and blanched spinach, tossing with your fingers to coat.
step-29: heat a large skillet over high heat, then add the ribeye and marinade and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, until the beef is browned.
step-30: remove the pan from the heat.
step-31: assemble the bibimbap: place the rice in the center of a shallow dish.
step-32: add the cucumber, mushrooms, zucchini, carrots, daikon, spinach, bean sprouts, and yellow squash around the sides of the rice.
step-33: scoop the beef into the center of the rice and top with the fried egg.
step-34: garnish with thinly sliced green onions and nori and a sprinkle of sesame seeds.
step-35: serve the bibimbap with kimchi and gochujang.
step-36: to eat, mix everything together.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: prepare cake mix according to the box directions and pour batter into a greased springform pan.
step-3: bake for 35 minutes, or until a toothpick will comes out dry when inserted.
step-4: in a large mixing bowl, add the softened cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla, and mix until combined.
step-5: microwave the milk for 90 seconds, then whisk in the gelatin powder.
step-6: pour the gelatin mixture into the cream cheese mixture and whisk until combined.
step-7: pour the cheesecake mixture over the cooled birthday cake and chill in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours.
step-8: pipe whipped cream along the edge of the cake, then follow with sprinkles all over the top.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar.
step-3: add eggs, one at a time, and mix thoroughly.
step-4: add vanilla and mix thoroughly.
step-5: add dry ingredients and milk.
step-6: mix thoroughly.
step-7: generously butter and flour two 9-inch (23 cm) baking pans.
step-8: divide batter between both, and bake for 35 minutes.
step-9: remove cake from oven, cool completely, and transfer to wire rack.
step-10: in a bowl, beat heavy cream until stiff peaks form when removing the beaters.
step-11: top bottom layer of cake with whipped cream, then kiwi and strawberry, then more whipped cream.
step-12: place the top layer of cake.
step-13: cover entire cake with whipped cream and fruit.

step-1: spread drained chickpeas onto a towel and pat dry.
step-2: remove chickpea shells.
step-3: place chickpeas, peanut butter, vanilla, honey, and salt into food processor.
step-4: mix halfway then add chickpea water to help consistency.
step-5: add sprinkles and white chocolate chips to mixed dough.

step-1: preheat oven to 325°f (160°c).
step-2: combine cookie dough, white chocolate, and sprinkles in a bowl until evenly distributed.
step-3: using an ice cream scoop, place 6 scoops of dough on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-4: bake for 14 minutes.

step-1: add chickpeas, preferred nut butter, milk of choice, honey, vanilla, and salt to a food processor and blend until smooth.
step-2: transfer to a bowl and fold in sprinkles until evenly distributed.
step-3: serve with your favorite fruit or dipping snack.

step-1: add the angel food cake mix and yellow cake mix to a jar.
step-2: place a cupcake liner over the cake mix and add the rainbow sprinkles.
step-3: cover with the lid.
step-4: store in the pantry for up to 3 months.
step-5: when ready to eat, remove the lid and cupcake liner with the sprinkles from the jar.
step-6: pour the water into the dry cake mix.
step-7: mix thoroughly, making sure to scrape the dry mix from the bottom of the jar.
step-8: microwave for 20 seconds.
step-9: pour the sprinkles into the jar and gently stir to distribute, being careful not to push all of the sprinkles to the bottom.
step-10: microwave for another 40 seconds, until cooked through.
step-11: top with whipped cream and rainbow sprinkles, if desired.
step-12: serve immediately.

step-1: combine cake mix, chocolate chunks, oil, and eggs in a mixing bowl.
step-2: using an ice cream scoop or your hand, form golf ball-sized balls of cookie dough and transfer to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-3: bake at 350°f (180°c) for 10-12 minutes.
step-4: garnish with sprinkles.

step-1: in a 12-ounce (375 ml) or larger mug , mix all ingredients until just combined.
step-2: microwave on high for 90 seconds to 2 minutes, watching to make sure it doesn’t spill over (depending on the size of the mug).
step-3: let cool one minute before eating.
step-4: top with whipped topping and sprinkles (optional).

step-1: in a bain-marie, melt the butter, sugar, and cocoa powder.
step-2: stir in the egg and keep stirring for a minute until the mix thickens.
step-3: remove the bowl from heat.
step-4: add the graham cracker crumbs, the almonds (chopped finely), and the coconut flakes.
step-5: when well mixed, pour into an 8 x 8 inch (20x20 cm) pan and flatten until you get an even layer.
step-6: cream the custard powder, softened butter, and heavy cream until smooth.
step-7: add the powdered sugar and mix until smooth.
step-8: add the sprinkles and mix.
step-9: pour the mixture on top of the crust and spread it until you get an even layer.
step-10: in a bain marie, slowly melt the white chocolate and the butter.
step-11: cool it down a little bit then pour it over middle layer.
step-12: chill the bars for at least 3 hours.
step-13: cut them into 9 even squares and sprinkle each one with rainbow sprinkles.

step-1: cut each biscuit into 8 pieces.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: in a bowl, mix the eggs, milk, pepper, and salt.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: for the gravy: melt the butter in a saucepan, over medium heat.
step-6: stir in flour, salt, and pepper, and slowly add the 2 cups of milk.
step-7: increase to medium-high, bring to a simmer, stirring until gravy is thickened.
step-8: in a greased 9x13 (22x33 cm) glass baking dish, layer the biscuits, sausage, cheese, egg mixture, and gravy.
step-9: bake at 350°f (180°c) for 35-45 min, until the eggs on the bottom are cooked.

step-1: in a large bowl, add the cream cheese, powdered sugar, vanilla, and sour cream, and use an electric hand mixer or whisk to combine.
step-2: using a spatula fold in the whipped cream.
step-3: crush the graham crackers in a large plastic bag using a rolling pin or heavy pan.
step-4: pour the crushed graham crackers into a medium bowl, add the melted butter, and stir to combine.
step-5: set aside until ready to use.
step-6: fill an ice cube tray with the cheesecake mixture.
step-7: press a few pieces of strawberry into the cheesecake.
step-8: top with a spoonful of the graham cracker mixture.
step-9: use the spoon to clean up the edges.
step-10: freeze for at least 8 hours or up to 1 week.
step-11: use a butter knife or offset spatula to loosen the cheesecake bites from the ice cube tray.
step-12: flip the tray and let the cheesecakes fall out.
step-13: let the cheesecakes thaw before serving, about 1 hour.

step-1: prepare baby oatmeal and allow to cool.
step-2: add bananas, apples, baby oatmeal, and water, breast milk, or formula to a blender or food processor.
step-3: blend very well.
step-4: add more liquid as necessary.
step-5: refrigerate up to 4 days or freeze up to 1 month.
step-6: note: check with your pediatrician before introducing new foods to children under 12 months.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: add black beans to a food processor and pulse until blended.
step-3: add eggs, baking powder, unsweetened cocoa powder, coconut oil, maple syrup, and vanilla extract.
step-4: blend until well combined.
step-5: spray loaf pan with cooking spray or wipe down with oil.
step-6: pour mix into a baking pan.
step-7: sprinkle dark chocolate chips on top.
step-8: bake for 30-35 minutes.

step-1: heat one tablespoon of olive oil in a pan.
step-2: combine onions, garlic, salt, and pepper and cook until onions are translucent.
step-3: add carrots, cumin, coriander, chili powder, and cayenne pepper until carrots are tender.
step-4: remove pan from heat.
step-5: in a bowl, mash the beans and then add the contents of the pan along with the soy sauce and quick oats.
step-6: mix and form four patties.
step-7: place in freezer for 30 minutes to set.
step-8: cook patties on a pan coated in cooking spray over medium heat, flipping halfway.
step-9: use patties to create your dream veggie burger.

step-1: in a large bowl, add black beans, rice, corn, seasonings, and egg.
step-2: using a potato masher, mash the ingredients until thoroughly mixed together.
step-3: once mashed, add the bread crumbs and mix to combine.
step-4: take a quarter of the mixture and shape it into a patty using your hands.
step-5: repeat with the remaining mixture to create four patties.
step-6: in a pan, heat a small amount of oil over medium heat.
step-7: add the patties and cook for 4-5 minutes, flip, top with a slice of pepper jack, and cook for another 4-5 minutes.
step-8: place patties on buns, and top with sliced tomato, red onion, avocado, and fresh salsa.

step-1: combine all ingredients in a small bowl.
step-2: mix until combined and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, microwave black beans for 1 minute, or until softened.
step-3: add roasted red peppers, garlic, cayenne, cumin, and salt.
step-4: mash until black beans are finely mashed.
step-5: add cornmeal and mix until thoroughly combined.
step-6: using a ½ cup (120 ml) measuring cup, portion 5 patties from the mixture.
step-7: place onto a lightly greased parchment paper-lined sheet pan.
step-8: bake for 30 minutes, or until firm and browned, flipping over halfway through.
step-9: serve burgers with your favorite fixins.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a blender or food processor, add tofu, black beans, onion, spinach, garlic, and tomato paste, and blend until smooth.
step-3: transfer to a large bowl.
step-4: to the bowl, add the oregano, salt, pepper, paprika, breadcrumbs, and egg.
step-5: mix well until a dough forms.
step-6: use your hands to form 1-inch (2-cm) balls from the black bean and tofu mixture.
step-7: place in rows on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-8: bake for 20 minutes, or until golden, flipping halfway.

step-1: heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
step-2: add the onion, garlic, and chili powder and cook until fragrant, about 3 minutes.
step-3: add the tomatoes, black beans, water, salt, and pepper and let simmer for about 20 minutes.
step-4: use an immersion blender to puree the soup until slightly chunky, or transfer half of the soup to a blender and puree, then transfer back to the pot.
step-5: ladle half of the soup into a bowl and garnish with red onion, cilantro, and a lime wedge.
step-6: store the remaining soup in the fridge.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375ºf (190ºc).
step-2: generously coat a 12-cup muffin tin with nonstick spray.
step-3: stack the tortillas and cut off the edges so the tortillas are square.
step-4: then, quarter the squares so you have 12 small tortilla pieces.
step-5: press a tortilla square into each cup of the prepared muffin tin.
step-6: fill each cup with 1 tablespoon of black beans, 1 tablespoon of corn, and 1 teaspoon of cheddar cheese and top it with a jalapeño slice.
step-7: bake for about 10 minutes, until the edges of the tortillas are golden brown and the cheese has melted.
step-8: garnish with pico de gallo.

step-1: have all ingredients at room temperature.
step-2: whisk together eggs, milk, and water.
step-3: add butter, vanilla, and sugar.
step-4: sift in flour.
step-5: whisk until no clumps remain.
step-6: strain the crepe batter into two bowls: one for the vanilla crepes, the other for chocolate crepes.
step-7: sift cocoa powder into one bowl and whisk together.
step-8: preheat an eight-inch pan over medium heat.
step-9: pour ¼ (60ml) cup of batter into the pan, swirl until you have an even crepe.
step-10: flip after one minute and continue to cook for an additional 30 seconds.
step-11: stack crepes and cool to room temp.
step-12: layer crepes, spreading a thin layer of whipped topping between each layer.
step-13: dust with powdered sugar.
step-14: chill if not serving immediately.

step-1: in the bowl of a food processor or high-speed blender, blend the blackberries and honey until thoroughly combined.
step-2: pour into a rectangular loaf pan and smooth into an even layer.
step-3: freeze for 2 hours, or until frozen but still soft enough for scooping.
step-4: if freezing overnight, cover with a lid or plastic wrap, and let it sit out at room temperature for 5-10 minutes before serving.

step-1: in a large bowl, crush blackberries into a pulpy mixture.
step-2: pour in tequila.
step-3: slice limes and add them with mint sprigs, and stir mixture.
step-4: chill for at least 30 minutes.
step-5: chill for at least 30 minutes.
step-6: right before serving, pour cold ginger beer and club soda into the mixture.
step-7: serve.

step-1: add the blackberries to food processor and purée into a smooth paste.
step-2: add the blackberry purée to a small saucepan with the simple honey syrup and thyme.
step-3: simmer over medium heat for 5 minutes, until slightly reduced.
step-4: let cool completely, then strain into an airtight glass container and store in the refrigerator for up to 2 months.
step-5: to serve, mix 1-2 tablespoons of blackberry thyme syrup with 8 ounces of seltzer water in a glass over ice.
step-6:
nutrition, per 1 tablespoon
calories: 16 
sugars: 4 grams

step-1: combine water, grenadine, and food coloring.
step-2: using a pipette or an eyedropper fill the inner chamber of plastic vampire teeth with the grenadine mixture.
step-3: freeze the filled vampire teeth.
step-4: fill a clear glass with lemon-lime soda or any other clear carbonated beverage.
step-5: place the frozen vampire teeth ice cubes on the rim of the glass.
step-6: the grenadine ice cube will melt into the drink and slowly turn the drink red.

step-1: whisk together all the rub ingredients in a small bowl.
step-2: spread the rub evenly over the pork ribs and place on a wire rack set over a baking sheet with meat side up.
step-3: cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight.
step-4: for the bbq sauce, heat oil in a large pot or dutch oven over medium-high heat.
step-5: add poblano chile, red onion, garlic, ginger, and a pinch of salt, then cook until onions begin to soften.
step-6: add the remaining sauce ingredients and bring the mixture to a simmer.
step-7: turn the heat down to medium-low and cook at an active simmer until the mixture is reduced to about 2 cups (470 ml), about 30-45 minutes.
step-8: once reduced, cool slightly then transfer mixture to a blender.
step-9: puree until smooth.
step-10: preheat oven to 275˚f (140˚c).
step-11: uncover the ribs.
step-12: spread 1 cup (290g) of the bbq sauce over each rack of ribs.
step-13: keeping them raised over the baking sheet on the wire rack.
step-14: pour water into the bottom of the baking sheet.
step-15: bake in a preheated oven for 3-3 ½ hours.
step-16: remove ribs from oven and preheat the broiler to high.
step-17: broil the ribs for 5-10 minutes to finish, until the sauce caramelizes.
step-18: cut into individual ribs.

step-1: zest all 5 blood oranges and divide between 3 separate small bowls: 2 bowls should contain the zest of 1 orange each, and 1 bowl should contain the zest of 3 oranges.
step-2: set aside the 2 bowls with less zest for later use.
step-3: add the olive oil to the bowl with the zest of 3 oranges.
step-4: set aside for 30-60 minutes to infuse.
step-5: juice 3 of the oranges and set aside 3 tablespoons of juice for the glaze.
step-6: reserve the remaining orange juice in a liquid measuring cup.
step-7: you should have about ½ cup.
step-9: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚f).
step-10: in a large bowl, sift together the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt.
step-11: add the sugar, blood orange olive oil (with the zest), ½ cup (120 ml) of the blood orange juice, water, and white vinegar.
step-12: whisk until the batter is smooth with no lumps.
step-13: lightly grease the bottom and sides of an 8-9-inch (20-22 cm) round cake pan with olive oil, and place a parchment round in the bottom of the pan.
step-14: (to make the parchment round, tear off an 18 x 13-inch (45x33 cm) piece of parchment paper.
step-15: with a long edge closest to you, fold down the top right corner to meet the bottom edge.
step-16: press down on the long side of the triangle to flatten, then turn so that side is facing you and fold in half, bringing the points together.
step-17: turn again so the long side of the new triangle is on top and fold in half twice more.
step-18: flip the cake pan upside down and hold the pointy end of the triangle at the center of the pan.
step-19: trim the excess parchment that extends past the edge of the pan.
step-20: flip the pan, unfold the triangle, and place the parchment round in the bottom).
step-21: pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 35-40 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean.
step-22: while the cake bakes, prepare the toppings: cut the top and the bottoms off the 2 remaining zested oranges.
step-23: using a paring knife, carefully remove the skin and pith from the oranges until you are left with just the flesh.
step-24: turn each orange on its side and cut into ¼-inch (6 mm) wide rounds.
step-25: place the rounds between 2 paper towels to blot some of the excess juice.
step-26: this will allow them to stick to the glaze more effectively.
step-27: make the glaze: sift the powdered sugar into a medium bowl.
step-28: add the reserved zest of 1 orange, and the remaining 3 tablespoons of blood orange juice.
step-29: whisk into a glaze.
step-30: it should be thick, but spreadable.
step-31: remove the cake from the oven.
step-32: let cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then flip onto a wire rack set over a baking sheet to cool completely.
step-33: once the cake has cooled, pour the glaze over the cake, letting it drip down the sides.
step-34: decorate the top with the orange slices, pistachios, and remaining orange zest.

step-1: in a pitcher, combine all of the ingredients and stir well.
step-2: serve over ice with your favorite toppings!

step-1: season the onion, garlic, and celery with salt and pepper, and cook in a little oil until softened.
step-2: stir in the vodka and lemon juice.
step-3: add the can of chopped tomatoes, hot sauce, and worcestershire sauce, then simmer for a few minutes.
step-4: add the sauce to a blender and whizz until smooth.
step-5: serving suggestions: this is a great replacement for any other tomato-based sauce.
step-6: use it as a pizza sauce, over pasta, or in a bake!
step-7: will keep in the fridge for up to one week!

step-1: slice the top ¼ off of the potato.
step-2: carefully cut a border ½ inch (12 mm) away from the skin making sure not to cut through the bottom of the potato.
step-3: continue cutting smaller and smaller circles, never going through the bottom, until you have 3 circles about ½ inch (12 mm) inside one another.
step-4: flip the potato over onto the flat side, and cut “petals” all around and all the way through, leaving an oval in the middle intact.
step-5: it is important to cut through the potato so each layer can blossom once baked.
step-6: bake for 30 minutes at 425°f/220°c.
step-7: in a medium bowl combine parsley, garlic, butter, salt, and pepper.
step-8: coat the potato and get as much as possible in between each layer.
step-9: bake for another 30 minutes.
step-10: add mozzarella and parmesan cheese on top and in between the nooks and crannies and bake for another 5 minutes or until cheese is light brown.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: in a bowl, add the chicken, red bell pepper, onion, jalapeño, and taco sauce, and mix to combine.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: cut each tortilla in half.
step-5: evenly spread about 2 tablespoons each of the cheddar cheese, monterey jack cheese, and chicken mixture on one half of the tortilla.
step-6: roll the tortilla into a cone starting from the cut edge making sure not to push the ingredients out of the tortilla.
step-7: place a wide mouth jar or glass in the center of a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-8: create a ring around the jar with the tortilla cones.
step-9: the point of the cones should be in the center, touching the surface of the jar.
step-10: there should be about 13 cones in the first layer.
step-11: sprinkle both cheddar cheese and monterey jack cheese over the first layer of cones.
step-12: start the second layer of cones by placing one cone on top and in between 2 cones in the first layer.
step-13: continue this process with the rest of the cones.
step-14: there should be 3 full layers of cones with 3 left to fill some of the empty space in the top.
step-15: sprinkle the rest of the cheddar and monterey jack on top of the blooming quesadilla.
step-16: remove jar from center of ring.
step-17: bake until the cheese is melted and the edges of the tortillas are crispy, 15 to 20 minutes.
step-18: transfer to a plate.
step-19: place dip of choice inside the ring.
step-20: top with desired garnishes.
step-21: serve immediately.

step-1: heat the oil in a 6-quart (5 ½ l) dutch oven over high heat until it reaches 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, combine flour, garlic powder, paprika, pepper, onion powder, cayenne, and 1 tablespoon of salt and whisk well.
step-3: in a liquid measuring cup with a spout, whisk together the milk and half of the flour-spice mix.
step-4: slice the potatoes on a mandolin or with a sharp knife into ¹⁄₁₆-inch (1 mm) thick slices.
step-5: transfer the potato slices to a large bowl and cover with water.
step-6: move the potato slices around to remove excess starch, then drain the water.
step-7: sprinkle the potato slices with the remaining 2 tablespoons of salt and toss to coat.
step-8: on a cutting board, slice off the very top and bottom of the onion.
step-9: cut 8 equal slits into the onion, taking care to leave the onion attached at the root end.
step-10: place a potato slice between each onion layer.
step-11: transfer the onion potato lotus onto a spider or fine-mesh strainer.
step-12: place the spider over a medium bowl and drizzle the spice batter over the lotus.
step-13: use your fingers to prod between the layers to ensure the batter soaks into the nooks and crannies of the onion.
step-14: pour the remaining spice mixture over the onion lotus.
step-15: use your fingers to prod between the layers to ensure even coverage.
step-16: fry the onion lotus for 10 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-17: transfer the onion lotus onto a wire rack set over a baking sheet.
step-18: garnish with parsley.
step-19: serve warm, with ketchup and ranch dressing for dipping.

step-1: mash half of an avocado.
step-2: add salt and pepper, to taste.
step-3: mix until well combined.
step-4: spread the mashed avocado evenly across toast, then top with tomatoes, lettuce, and bacon.

step-1: prepare 2 boxes of white cake mix according to instructions on box.
step-2: separate batter evenly into 3 bowls.
step-3: add 1 drop of blue coloring to one bowl, stir until color is mixed thoroughly.
step-4: repeat with the next 2 bowls adding more food coloring until the desired colors are reached.
step-5: grease three 6-inch (15 cm) cake pans and line with parchment paper.
step-6: pour each colored batter into a separate pan.
step-7: bake according to box instructions.
step-8: remove cake from pans and let cool.
step-9: use a serrated knife cut the round top off of the cake so the cakes are even and flat.
step-10: place the first cake on a cake stand and add a thick layer of frosting.
step-11: place the second cake on top, and add more frosting.
step-12: place the third cake on top and frost the cake until completely covered.
step-13: frost the entire cake until smooth.
step-14: chill in the refrigerator for 1 hour.
step-15: for the ganache, heat the heavy cream in the microwave until bubbling, about 45 seconds.
step-16: add the white chocolate and stir until smooth.
step-17: you may need to microwave the ganache for 10-20 seconds to melt any lumps.
step-18: separate the ganache into 3 bowls.
step-19: add one drop of food coloring to one bowl.
step-20: stir until the color is evenly mixed.
step-21: repeat the the next 2 bowls adding more food coloring until the desired color is reached.
step-22: spoon ganache in circles one on top of the other, making sure the ganache is not too thick.
step-23: continue until the ganache starts dripping over the edge.
step-24: slice and serve.

step-1: add the blueberries and honey to a food processor and combine until evenly mixed.
step-2: transfer to a loaf pan and transfer to freezer until completely frozen.

step-1: add the instant oatmeal, freeze-dried blueberries, almonds, vanilla bean, chia seeds, and sugar into a mason jar.
step-2: store in a cool, dry place for up to a month.
step-3: to prepare, pour boiling water or milk over oats.
step-4: stir to combine and let sit for 3 minutes.
step-5: serve with slivered almonds and fresh blueberries.

step-1: add the instant oatmeal, freeze-dried blueberries, almonds, chia seeds, vanilla bean, and sugar into a mason jar.
step-2: store in a cool, dry place for up to a month.
step-3: to prepare, pour boiling water or milk over oats.
step-4: stir to combine and let sit for 3 minutes.
step-5: serve with slivered almonds and fresh blueberries.

step-1: in a large bowl, mash the bananas until they reach a liquid state.
step-2: whisk in the eggs.
step-3: heat butter or oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
step-4: pour batter into the warm skillet to cook.
step-5: garnish with desired number of blueberries.
step-6: after about a minute and a half (or until golden) flip to finish cooking.
step-7: allow to cool for a minute.
step-8: serve warm.

step-1: place the blueberries, spinach, and banana in a blender or food processor and blend until just combined.
step-2: add in the ice and continue to blend until the mixture is smooth.
step-3: serve immediately.

step-1: make the simple syrup: in a small saucepan, combine the sugar, basil, and water.
step-2: bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
step-3: once boiling, cook for 2-3 minutes, until the sugar has dissolved and the basil is fragrant.
step-4: remove from the heat.
step-5: strain the herb syrup through a fine-mesh sieve set over a blender.
step-6: add the blueberries and lemon juice.
step-7: blend on high speed until smooth.
step-8: divide the mixture between 6 ice pop molds.
step-9: freeze until solid, at least 6 hours.

step-1: in a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the brown sugar and water.
step-2: bring to a boil, stirring to dissolve the sugar completely.
step-3: add the blueberries to the pot and boil until the berries begin to burst, about 15 minutes.
step-4: remove from heat and cool for 5–10 minutes.
step-5: transfer the mixture to a blender and blend until smooth.
step-6: strain the syrup through a fine-mesh sieve or cheesecloth.
step-7: store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 month.
step-8: in a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the bourbon, lemon juice, and simple syrup.
step-9: shake vigorously for 20 seconds.
step-10: strain into a glass filled with ice and top with ginger beer.
step-11: garnish with lemon wedge.

step-1: in the bowl of a stand mixer, add the milk and yeast and let sit for 5 minutes, or until it starts to bubble.
step-2: add the flour, sugar, and salt to the bowl with the yeast.
step-3: add the dough hook attachment, and mix for 30 seconds, or until the dough is shaggy.
step-4: add the eggs, one at a time, until fully incorporated, about 2 minutes.
step-5: add the butter 1 tablespoon at a time, mixing until fully incorporated.
step-6: if the dough is too sticky, add 1 tablespoon of flour at a time.
step-7: once the dough begins to pull away from the sides of the bowl, transfer it to a lightly floured surface and knead for 3 to 4 minutes.
step-8: place the dough in a large bowl and cover with plastic wrap and let rise for 1 hour, or until doubled in size.
step-9: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c)
step-10: on a lightly floured surface, roll the dough out into a 12x6-inch (30x15 cm) rectangle.
step-11: in a small bowl, whisk the egg and heavy cream until well combined.
step-12: brush the mixture over the rolled out dough.
step-13: spread the blueberries in an even layer over the bread.
step-14: starting at the bottom, carefully roll the dough up into a log.
step-15: place the dough in a parchment paper-lined loaf pan.
step-16: cover with a kitchen towel and let rise for 1 hour, or until it has doubled in size.
step-17: brush the dough with the remaining egg wash, and sprinkle with turbinado sugar.
step-18: bake for 45 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-19: rest for 15 to 20 minutes, then remove from pan.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: spread the almonds on one half of the baking sheet and the walnuts on the other half.
step-4: toast for 10-15 minutes, or until lightly browned and fragrant.
step-5: let cool 20 minutes before roughly chopping.
step-6: in a food processor or blender, combine the dates, salt, and water, and process until well-combined.
step-7: transfer the date mixture to a large bowl and add the brown rice cereal, oats, blueberries, cinnamon, and salt.
step-8: stir until well-combined.
step-9: add the chopped nuts and fold to combine.
step-10: transfer the mixture to a parchment-lined baking sheet and spread flat with a spatula.
step-11: cover with plastic wrap and chill in the fridge for 30-45 minutes to set.
step-12: in a large bowl, combine the chocolate and coconut oil, and microwave for 1½ minutes, stirring every 30 seconds, until melted and smooth
step-13: pour ⅔ of the melted chocolate over the bars and spread evenly.
step-14: cover with plastic wrap and freeze for 10 minutes, or until the chocolate is set.
step-15: invert the bars onto a cutting board and remove the parchment paper.
step-16: drizzle the remaining chocolate over the top.
step-17: return to the freezer for 10 minutes, until the chocolate is set.
step-18: cut into 16 bars.
step-19: wrap individually in parchment paper and store in the fridge or freezer until ready to eat.

step-1: pre-heat oven according to the cinnamon roll package instructions.
step-2: cut cinnamon rolls into bite-size pieces and set aside.
step-3: in a bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, vanilla, and cinnamon until well combined.
step-4: place cut up cinnamon rolls into an 8" x 8" (20 cm x 20 cm) baking dish.
step-5: pour blueberries on top followed by the milk mixture.
step-6: bake for 40-45 minutes or until fully cooked.
step-7: if the top is looking too brown, cover with foil for the remaining time.
step-8: slice then garnish with icing and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (175°c.)
step-2: in a mixing bowl beat cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla until creamy.
step-3: add eggs, and while beating slowly incorporate the milk until creamy.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: using cold crescent dough, roll up crescent rolls and curve into crescent shape.
step-6: place rolls in an ungreased 9x9 (23x23) pan.
step-7: pour blueberries over the crescent rolls.
step-8: pour cream cheese mixture over rolls and blueberries.
step-9: bake at 350°f (175°c) for 35 minutes or until rolls have become golden brown.
step-10: top with powdered sugar.

step-1: in the bowl of a food processor, add the walnuts, and pulse until coarsely ground.
step-2: add the flour, sugar, cinnamon, and salt, and pulse until finely ground.
step-3: add the butter and pulse until the mixture comes together and holds when compressed.
step-4: press the mixture into a 9-inch (23-cm) round tart pan.
step-5: prick the bottom of the crust with a fork.
step-6: freeze for 1 hour.
step-7: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚f).
step-8: bake for 20-25 minutes.
step-9: add the blueberries and water to a medium saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat.
step-10: reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer until most of the blueberries have burst, about 5 minutes.
step-11: strain the blueberry mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a small bowl.
step-12: add the blueberry juice, eggs, egg yolks, sugar, lemon juice, and cornstarch to a medium saucepan over low heat, whisking constantly.
step-13: once the mixture is warmed through, add the butter, 1 tablespoon at a time, whisking until melted and incorporated.
step-14: continue whisking until the curd begins to thicken, 5-8 minutes.
step-15: strain the curd through a fine-mesh sieve into a bowl.
step-16: whisk in the olive oil.
step-17: pour the blueberry curd into the par baked tart shell, and bake for 15 minutes.
step-18: chill the tart in the refrigerator overnight.
step-19: slice the kiwis into desired shapes and arrange on top of the chilled tart.

step-1: mix oats, almond butter and honey in a large bowl.
step-2: add dried blueberries, cinnamon, vanilla, and salt and mix to combine.
step-3: place bowl in the refrigerator for 30-60 minutes, or until the mixture has solidified.
step-4: mold mixture into bite-sized balls.
step-5: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: roll out pie crusts onto a well-floured surface.
step-3: using a 4-inch (10 cm) flower-shaped cookie cutter, cut out as many flower shapes as possible.
step-4: ball up and roll out any remaining dough to make more flowers.
step-5: press flowers into a greased mini muffin tin, so that the petals fall on the outside of the mold.
step-6: prick the bottoms with a fork.
step-7: freeze for 20 minutes.
step-8: in a medium bowl, mix blueberries, sugar, flour, cornstarch, and lemon zest.
step-9: divide filling between flower cups.
step-10: dot the top of mixture with butter.
step-11: brush egg wash on the petals.
step-12: bake for 15 minutes, or until edges are golden.
step-13: cool completely before serving.
step-14: sprinkle with powdered sugar.

step-1: slice bread into quarters and layer on bottom of a greased slow cooker.
step-2: top with blueberries.
step-3: in a large bowl or measuring cup, whisk together eggs, maple syrup, coconut oil, vanilla extract, cinnamon, lemon zest, and milk.
step-4: pour mixture over bread and stir.
step-5: cook on low 7-8 hours.
step-6: carefully remove lid and serve with maple syrup and powdered sugar.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: in a bowl, combine softened cream cheese, sugar, and cinnamon.
step-3: add eggs and heavy cream and whisk until well combined.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: cut a rectangle along the top of the loaf of french bread and pull out the part you cut along with the soft inside of the loaf.
step-6: set the “bread boat” aside.
step-7: tear apart the rectangle and soft inside of the bread that you removed into little bite-size pieces.
step-8: gently, fold the bread pieces and blueberries into the egg mixture until all of the liquid is absorbed.
step-9: place the “bread boat” on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and pour in the bread and egg mixture.
step-10: bake for 30-40 minutes or until the top is golden brown.
step-11: if the top is browning too quickly, cover the top of the boat in foil for the remaining time.
step-12: let cool before cutting into slices and serve with maple syrup.

step-1: slice bread into cubes.
step-2: in a bowl, add egg, milk, cinnamon, and vanilla, and mix.
step-3: in a microwave-safe mug, place half of the cubed bread and desired amount of blueberries.
step-4: place the rest of the bread, berries, and the egg mixture into the mug.
step-5: microwave for 1½ minutes or until egg is fully cooked.
step-6: drizzle maple syrup.

step-1: place blueberries in a food processor or blender and puree into a thick, smooth sauce.
step-2: pour the sauce onto a baking tray lined with a silicone baking mat and smooth into a thin, even layer.
step-3: bake for 6 hours at 175ºf (80ºc), until entire surface is just dry to the touch.
step-4: once cool, turn the baking mat onto a cutting board and remove the silicone baking mat.
step-5: roll the fruit sheet and cut into 1-inch (2 cm) pieces.
step-6: note: if your fruit sheet comes out a bit too dry and you worry that rolling will cause it to crack, simply cover the surface with a few damp paper towels for a few minutes and try again.
step-7: the moisture will rehydrate your fruit sheet just enough to be a flexible consistency.

step-1: in the bowl of a food processor, add the flour, sugar, and salt, and pulse 2-3 times.
step-2: add the cold, cubed butter and pulse 8-10 times until the butter is pea-sized.
step-3: transfer the dough to a large mixing bowl, and gradually add the ice water, 1 tablespoon at a time, mixing with your hands until the dough comes together.
step-4: knead the dough on a work surface, and divide into two even discs.
step-5: wrap in plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator overnight.
step-6: add 3½ cups (350 g) blueberries, sugar, salt, tapioca starch, and lemon juice to large bowl and stir to combine.
step-7: remove one dough disc from the refrigerator and place on a lightly floured work surface.
step-8: using a rolling pin, roll the dough into a 12-inch (30-cm) circle, adding more flour to the dough as needed.
step-9: place the rolled out dough in a 9-inch (23-cm) pie dish, trimming any excess dough to fit the dish.
step-10: add the blueberry mixture to the pie dish.
step-11: remove the other dough disc from the refrigerator and place on a lightly floured work surface.
step-12: using a rolling pin, roll the dough into a 12-inch (30-cm) circle, adding more flour to the dough as needed.
step-13: using a ruler, cut the dough into ½-inch (1-cm) strips.
step-14: place a 3-inch (7-cm) round metal cookie cutter in the center of the pie.
step-15: arrange the strips of dough around the cookie cutter, working your way around the pie.
step-16: trim any excess dough.
step-17: remove the cookie cutter, fill in the center with the remaining blueberries, and chill the pie in the refrigerator for 1 hour.
step-18: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-19: bake for 10-15 minutes, until the top is golden brown.
step-20: reduce the oven temperature to 375˚f (190˚f).
step-21: continue baking for 40-45 minutes, until the crust is cooked through and the filling is bubbling.
step-22: let the pie rest at room temperature for at least one hour.

step-1: pour all ingredients into a blender and blend until smooth.
step-2: garnish with a lemon slice.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: grease a muffin tin of muffin liners with cooking spray.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: in a large mixing bowl, whisk together eggs and sugar.
step-5: add greek yogurt, applesauce, honey, vanilla extract, lemon zest, and lemon juice.
step-6: mix until well combined.
step-7: stir in flour, baking soda, baking powder and salt.
step-8: gently fold in blueberries.
step-9: distribute batter evenly among prepared muffin cups, filling about ¾ of the way full.
step-10: top with additional blueberries if desired.
step-11: bake muffins for 20-25 minutes.
step-12: cool muffins in pan for 10 minutes before serving.

step-1: place blueberries, lemon juice, and cold water in a blender and blend until smooth.
step-2: strain the blueberries mixture through a fine-mesh sieve, using a spoon to press the last of the liquid through.
step-3: add the sparkling water and honey and mix until the honey dissolves.
step-4: serve over ice with extra blueberries.

step-1: dice mango into thin slices.
step-2: distribute the blueberries and mangos evenly among the popsicle molds.
step-3: fill in the gaps of air with water.
step-4: freeze the popsicles for at least 5 hours.
step-5: take the frozen popsicles out of the ice mold and enjoy!

step-1: mix together egg white and honey in a greased coffee mug.
step-2: add oat flour, baking powder, and nutmeg, and mix until combined.
step-3: add in fresh blueberries.
step-4: microwave on high for 90 seconds (times may vary).

step-1: add all of the ingredients except for the blueberries in a clean mason jar.
step-2: stir everything together.
step-3: add the blueberries, whole.
step-4: put a lid on the mason jar and refrigerate overnight 40°f (5°c).

step-1: in a mug, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, and kosher salt.
step-2: add milk, butter, and vanilla.
step-3: mix until smooth.
step-4: stir in lemon zest and blueberries.
step-5: microwave for 1½-2 minutes, or until cake appears puffy and cooked through.
step-6: cool 2 minutes.
step-7: top with sparkling sugar (optional).

step-1: preheat oven to 190°c (375°f).
step-2: mix the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl.
step-3: in a smaller bowl, mix the milk, butter, and egg until combined.
step-4: whisk into the flour mix until a smooth batter is formed.
step-5: in an ovenproof pan, melt a tablespoon of butter and swirl around to grease.
step-6: pour in the batter, and scatter blueberries over evenly.
step-7: sprinkle over more sugar.
step-8: bake for 25 minutes.
step-9: serve with icing sugar, blueberry jam, and whipped cream.

step-1: in a mason jar or sealable container, add the oats, milk, yogurt, vanilla extract, chia seeds, cinnamon, blueberries, and graham crackers, and stir together.
step-2: seal and place in the refrigerator overnight for up to five days.
step-3: top with additional blueberries, if desired.

step-1: in a blender, blend everything besides the blueberries.
step-2: pour pancake batter on a griddle or skillet over medium-high heat, and place blueberries on the pancake.
step-3: cook until bubbles pop on the surface of the pancake, then flip and cook the other side.

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: pour pancake mix, milk, and eggs into a bowl and mix just until combined.
step-3: pour batter onto a parchment-lined baking sheet and spread to the edges.
step-4: place peach slices on top of the batter, followed by the blueberries.
step-5: bake for 15 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-6: cut into squares and serve immediately, or freeze up to 1 month.
step-7: to reheat, place on a microwave-safe plate and heat for 20 seconds per pancake on the plate.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f/220°c.
step-2: roll out aluminum foil into a cone.
step-3: make 4 cones for 1 pie sheet.
step-4: cut pie sheet into quarters.
step-5: place cone at one end of the sheet and roll dough onto the cone.
step-6: using a fork crimp the ends of the pie dough.
step-7: bake 5-10 minutes until the dough is set.
step-8: let it cool before pulling out the aluminum foil.
step-9: in a medium bowl, combine all ingredients and mix.
step-10: place pie cone in a mug for stability and spoon in the fruit mixture.
step-11: turn oven down to 400°f/200°c and bake for 15 minutes or until the fruit is soft.
step-12: top it with your favorite topping.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f/200˚c.
step-2: in a bowl, mix the blueberries, sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, salt, and lemon zest.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: on parchment paper, stack 2 pie crusts on top of each other.
step-5: roll out to 17 inches by 12 inches (43 cm by 30 cm).
step-6: cut diagonally into strips.
step-7: roll out another 2 pie crusts.
step-8: place in a 15x10x1 inch (38x25x2.5 cm) baking sheet.
step-9: spread out blueberry mixture into the crust, then form a lattice top with the pie crust strips.
step-10: tuck the crust inward around the edges, and bake for 35 minutes.
step-11: serve warm with ice cream.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, combine 6 tablespoons of sugar, the flour, and tapioca granules.
step-3: sprinkle the sugar mixture over the blueberries in a large bowl.
step-4: add the lemon juice and stir to combine.
step-5: line an 8-inch (20-cm) metal pie tin with 1 of the pie crusts.
step-6: spoon the blueberry mixture into the crust.
step-7: place the other crust on top.
step-8: press the edges of the crusts together with a fork and trim any excess dough around the sides with scissors.
step-9: brush the milk over the top crust and sprinkle with the remaining tablespoon of sugar.
step-10: cut a few slits in the top to release steam as the pie bakes.
step-11: bake the pie for 15 minutes, then reduce the oven temperature to 350˚f (180˚c) and bake for 30-35 minutes more, until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbling.
step-12: cool the pie on a wire rack for at least 2 hours to let the filling set.
step-13: slice and serve with ice cream.

step-1: bring a pot of water to a rapid boil.
step-2: gently lower the eggs into the water and cover.
step-3: cook the eggs for exactly 6 minutes for soft-boiled eggs, 8 minutes for medium-boiled eggs, and 11 minutes for hard-boiled eggs.
step-4: once time has elapsed, scoop out the eggs and immediately transfer to an ice bath to chill.
step-5: peel the eggs.

step-1: using cupcake liners in a muffin tin, fill each with four to five raspberries.
step-2: top with a scoop of rainbow sherbet.
step-3: freeze until ready to serve (best if frozen for at least two hours).
step-4: in a large pitcher, mix together the juice concentrates, raspberries, and vodka.
step-5: just before serving, mix in the ginger ale.
step-6: remove a sherbet scoop from the cupcake liner and place in a large mug.
step-7: fill halfway with punch.
step-8: finish with champagne.
step-9: garnish with fresh mint.

step-1: cut the centre out of a slice of bread, leaving only the thin crust in one piece - then cut that centre into smaller squares.
step-2: place all of the bread along with another regular full slice on a baking tray and lightly toast under a grill for a few minutes.
step-3: melt the butter in a pot on a medium-low heat, then add the cheese.
step-4: stir it all in until everything is melted.
step-5: gradually add the beer bit by bit, stirring until combined before adding the next bit of beer.
step-6: stir in the mustard and worcestershire sauce and remove from the heat.
step-7: stack the hollowed out crust of the bread onto the full slice and drop in half of the small squares.
step-8: fill this with the cheese mixture, then top with whatever squares you have left over.
step-9: put it under the grill for another 1 or 2 minutes until the bread has fully toasted and the cheese mixture is slightly brown.
step-10: serve and enjoy!

step-1: add all ingredients to a heatproof bowl and cook on low in the slow cooker for 1 hour.
step-2: give it a stir.
step-3: take it out of the slow cooker and serve with fruit or sweets!

step-1: preheat the oven to 180°c (350°f).
step-2: in a single layer, bake the hazelnuts for 20 minutes.
step-3: wrap the hazelnuts in a clean towel and rub vigorously for a few minutes to remove the skins.
step-4: pour the hazelnuts into a food processor (discarding the skins) and blend on high.
step-5: slowly add the irish cream liqueur and the double cream.
step-6: take off the lid and add the icing sugar, cocoa powder, and melted chocolate, then blend again until smooth.
step-7: (unless you have a very good quality food processor, there will be little bits in there - which simply add texture!)
step-8: transfer into your favourite jar, where it will keep in the fridge for up to 2 weeks!
step-9: spread on crusty bread and crepes, or stir 1 heaped tablespoon into 250 millilitres (1 cup) of warm milk for an indulgent hot chocolate!

step-1: arrange 8 scoops of sherbet on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-2: freeze for 30 minutes.
step-3: in a large punch bowl, combine the strawberries, blueberries, lemon, raspberries, and grapefruit.
step-4: add the lemon lime soda, champagne, and pink lemonade.
step-5: stir to combine.
step-6: remove the sherbet scoops from the freezer and use a spoon to place in the punch bowl.

step-1: crush wafers.
step-2: crush nuts of choice.
step-3: place in a large bowl the wafers, nuts, 1 cup powdered sugar, corn syrup, and bourbon.
step-4: mix until well blended.
step-5: shape into quarter-sized balls.
step-6: roll in powdered sugar.
step-7: refrigerate for at least two hours.

step-1: combine the peaches, bourbon, and vanilla ice cream in a blender.
step-2: blend until smooth.
step-3: top with whipped cream and a peach slice.

step-1: preheat oven to 325°f (160°c).
step-2: combine the brownie, eggs, and oil until a sticky dough forms.
step-3: take an even amount of cookie dough and brownie dough and roll them into a golf ball-sized sphere.
step-4: repeat with the remaining dough.
step-5: place 6 balls on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-6: bake for 14 minutes.

step-1: place 4 large dollops of brownie batter in a preheated, greased waffle iron.
step-2: cook for 2-3 minutes, until brownies are semi-firm to the touch.
step-3: serve with vanilla ice cream and caramel sauce.

step-1: season the chicken thighs on both sides with the salt and pepper.
step-2: heat the oil in a wide, heavy-bottomed pot with a lid over medium heat.
step-3: when the oil is hot, add the chicken thighs, skin-side down and let cook without disturbing for 10 minutes.
step-4: this will allow the skin to caramelize and develop a ton of flavor in the process.
step-5: turn the thighs over, cook for 1 minute more, then transfer to a plate.
step-6: add the onion, tomatoes, poblano, garlic, and paprika to the pan.
step-7: cook for 5 minutes, until the vegetables are softened.
step-8: carefully add the vinegar and stir to loosen any browned bits stuck to the bottom of the pot.
step-9: cook until the vinegar is reduced by half, 2-4 minutes, then pour in the stock.
step-10: return the chicken to the pan, skin-side up.
step-11: cover and reduce the heat to low.
step-12: cook for 20 minutes, then remove lid and continue cooking until the internal temperature of the chicken thighs reaches 165˚f (75˚c).
step-13: meanwhile, make the red rice: in a large pan, cook the slab bacon over medium heat until the fat renders and it begins to crisp, 5-8 minutes.
step-14: add the onion, bell pepper, celery, and jalapeño and cook until softened, about 10 minutes.
step-15: add the rice and stir until toasted, about 2 minutes.
step-16: stir in the tomatoes, ½ cup (100 g) of the reserved tomato juice, bay leaves, and season with salt.
step-17: add the chicken broth.
step-18: bring to a boil, then cover, reduce the heat to low, and simmer for 20 minutes, until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender.
step-19: serve the chicken over the rice with some of the braising jus and vegetables ladled over.

step-1: preheat the oven to 325˚f (160˚c).
step-2: cut the pork belly in half crosswise and place in a dutch oven or large oven-safe pot.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the salt, sugar, pepper, star anise, garlic, bay leaves, soy sauce, apple cider vinegar, and water.
step-4: whisk until the salt and sugar have dissolved.
step-5: pour the braising liquid over the pork belly.
step-6: cover the pork belly with a sheet of parchment paper, then tightly cover the pot with a sheet of aluminum foil.
step-7: bake for 2-2½ hours, until the pork is tender but not falling apart.
step-8: remove the pork belly from the braising liquid and transfer to a wire rack set over a baking sheet.
step-9: chill uncovered in the refrigerator overnight.
step-10: make the adobo sauce: in a medium saucepan over low heat, combine the water, soy sauce, sugar, canola oil, bay leaf powder, black pepper, garlic, coconut vinegar, and coconut milk.
step-11: simmer for 15-20 minutes.
step-12: remove the sauce from the heat and reserve until ready to use.
step-13: remove the pork belly from the refrigerator and cut it into approximately 8 5-ounce (140 g) pieces.
step-14: score the pork by slicing through the fat cap, stopping once you reach the meat, in ½-inch (1 cm) sections.
step-15: fill a large pot halfway with the oil and heat until it reaches 375˚f (190˚c).
step-16: fry the pork belly until the skin is crispy and the center is hot, about 8 minutes.
step-17: slice the pork belly between the scores.
step-18: to serve, ladle some adobo sauce on the bottom of a serving bowl.
step-19: arrange a portion of pork belly on top and garnish with a poached egg, szechuan pepper, scallions, fried garlic, and cilantro.
step-20: serve with jasmine rice alongside.

step-1: first, salt and pepper your short ribs.
step-2: in a large, heavy-bottomed pot, brown the short ribs in oil.
step-3: remove and set aside.
step-4: in the same pot, add the chopped onions, carrots, and celery.
step-5: cook until onions are translucent.
step-6: add the red wine, cook until some of the alcohol has burned off.
step-7: stir in the garlic, rosemary, tomato paste, beef broth, canned tomatoes, bay leaf, salt, and pepper.
step-8: return the browned short ribs, bring to a boil.
step-9: cover and lower heat to a simmer.
step-10: simmer for three hours or until the meat is very tender.
step-11: transfer the meat to a separate bowl, remove the bones, and pull apart the meat.
step-12: return to the pot.
step-13: give it a stir so all the meat is coated in the sauce.
step-14: note: keep warm until ready to serve.
step-15: serve over mashed potatoes or pasta and garnish with grated pecorino romano and fresh parsley.

step-1: in a medium pot, heat olive oil, then sauté garlic and onions until soft and brown.
step-2: add shredded chicken, salt, and paprika (or cayenne pepper).
step-3: stir to incorporate.
step-4: transfer mixture into a bowl, add cream cheese and parsley.
step-5: mix well.
step-6: in the same pot, add butter, chicken broth, and milk.
step-7: bring to a boil.
step-8: stir in flour until dough is formed.
step-9: transfer dough to a flat surface.
step-10: knead the dough while it is warm, but not hot.
step-11: pinch a piece of dough, about the size of a large egg, and roll into a ball.
step-12: using your hands, flatten the dough and spoon filling into the center.
step-13: wrap the dough into a pear shape and make sure there aren’t any holes.
step-14: while heating a pot of oil to 350˚f/180˚c, dredge the dough in egg and panko, then deep-fry till golden brown and cooked through.
step-15: drain on a towel, or wire rack and serve immediately.

step-1: combine the chicken with the garlic, salt, pepper, and lime juice in a bowl until evenly coated.
step-2: cover with cling film and refrigerate for about an hour.
step-3: dip each chicken wing in the flour, shaking off excess.
step-4: heat oil in a large pot to about 375°f.
step-5: fry half of the chicken wings at a time until dark golden brown.
step-6: the oil temperature will drop to about 350°f.
step-7: drain on paper towels.
step-8: serve with lime wedges and fried garlic.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: line baking sheet with aluminum foil and place a sheet of parchment paper over the foil.
step-3: with a serrated knife, cut off the top half-inch (1 cm) of the sourdough loaf.
step-4: cut around the edge of the bread, then use your fingers to remove the center and set aside for later.
step-5: line the inside of the bread bowl with the sliced cheddar cheese.
step-6: place the bread bowl on the baking sheet and wrap the outside with the parchment and foil.
step-7: bake for 8 minutes, or until the cheese is melted.
step-8: in a large bowl, combine the eggs, salt, pepper, bacon, shredded cheese blend, broccoli, scallions, and heavy cream.
step-9: whisk until smooth, then add the cherry tomatoes.
step-10: pour the egg mixture into the bread bowl, leaving a half-inch (1 cm) of space at the top.
step-11: cover the bread bowl with foil.
step-12: bake for 1 hour and 40 minutes, or until the center of the quiche has set
step-13: let cool for at least 30 minutes before slicing.
step-14: serve with a mixed green salad.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: place the bacon, tomato, and broccoli in greased casserole dish.
step-3: sprinkle hash browns and cheese on top.
step-4: in a large bowl, whisk together pancake mix, eggs, milk, salt, and pepper.
step-5: pour pancake mixture over ingredients in the casserole dish.
step-6: bake for 45 minutes.
step-7: let cool for 5 minutes before serving.
step-8: top with scallions, and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: carefully pierce potatoes with a fork.
step-3: on a baking sheet, oil the potatoes well and sprinkle with salt.
step-4: bake for about one hour.
step-5: if making more potatoes, an additional 15 minutes per potato is needed.
step-6: once cooled, cut the potatoes vertically, scoop out the inside, and save the scooped out insides (for mashed potatoes, etc.).
step-7: spread butter on the inside of each scooped out potato.
step-8: add cheese, bacon, one egg per potato, salt, and pepper.
step-9: top with chives.
step-10: bake 25 minutes, until the egg white has cooked through.
step-11: serve warm with chives.

step-1: in a bowl, whisk yogurt, honey, and vanilla until smooth.
step-2: transfer to a glass baking dish, and freeze for at least 2 hours.
step-3: preheat the oven to 300°f (150°c).
step-4: in a bowl, mix oats and coconut oil together until all oats are coated with oil.
step-5: add the sunflower seeds, almond slivers, dried cranberries, and 3 tablespoons of honey to the bowl, and mix to combine.
step-6: pour the oat mixture onto a baking pan lined with parchment paper and spread and pat down till the pan is fully covered from end-to-end.
step-7: bake for 20-30 minutes and mix the oats halfway through to allow them to cook evenly.
step-8: add the halved banana to a plate and top with vanilla frozen yogurt, granola, and fruit of your choice.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: on a cutting board, split the bell peppers in half from stem to base.
step-3: cut out the stem and the seeds.
step-4: transfer halved peppers to a baking tray, cavity side up.
step-5: sprinkle each half with salt and pepper.
step-6: bake for 15-20 minutes, until peppers are slightly soft.
step-7: sprinkle the mozzarella and half of the chives evenly among the four pepper halves.
step-8: then crack eggs into the center of each pepper.
step-9: sprinkle the salt, pepper, bacon, cheddar, and remaining chives on top of the eggs.
step-10: bake for 15-20 minutes, until egg whites are set.
step-11: serve!

step-1: fry bacon until browned and crispy, render out as much fat as possible.
step-2: remove the crispy bacon and set aside for later use.
step-3: keep the bacon fat which will be used to make the gravy.
step-4: make the bacon gravy in the same pan that you fried the bacon.
step-5: add flour to the pan and stir until flour forms thick paste.
step-6: cook for about a minute without burning the flour.
step-7: slowly stir in the chicken stock.
step-8: keep stirring until you have a smooth consistency.
step-9: simmer until the sauce thickens.
step-10: keep warm and set aside.
step-11: flatten biscuit dough and cut into strips.
step-12: deep fry (oil at 350°f (175°c)) until brown and crispy.
step-13: drain on paper towels, and place on baking sheet.
step-14: repeat with remaining biscuit dough.
step-15: layer the fried biscuit dough on the baking sheet.
step-16: sprinkle the cooked breakfast sausage, fried bacon, shredded cheddar and top with eggs.
step-17: pepper to taste.
step-18: broil for 5 - 10 minutes or until the shredded cheddar has melted.
step-19: remove from oven, sprinkle on the chopped chives and drizzle on the bacon gravy.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: heat the oil in a frying pan.
step-3: add the onion and stir until translucent.
step-4: add the chorizo.
step-5: note: you don’t need to use more salt since chorizo has enough salt.
step-6: cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
step-7: add the bell peppers and stir.
step-8: beat the eggs until the yolks break and add them to the chorizo mix.
step-9: stir until the eggs are just cooked.
step-10: flour a surface and open a tube of biscuits.
step-11: place them close to each other.
step-12: roll them out with a rolling pin to create one single dough.
step-13: sprinkle cheddar cheese over the rolled biscuit dough.
step-14: add the chorizo and eggs.
step-15: roll it up and pinch the edge to seal it to the roll.
step-16: brush the roll with egg wash.
step-17: using scissors, make slits in the dough about 2 inches (5 cm) apart from each other.
step-18: then twist them to alternating sides to create a braided look.
step-19: bake for 25 minutes, or until golden brown.

step-1: in a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook the bacon until crispy, 4-6 minutes.
step-2: remove the bacon from the pan and drain on a paper towel-lined plate.
step-3: in the same pan, add the garlic.
step-4: cook over low heat for about 30 seconds, or until it starts to brown.
step-5: in a medium bowl, beat 8 eggs and add to the pan, along with the scallions, salt, and pepper.
step-6: scramble the eggs until mostly set but still a little wet, about 3 minutes.
step-7: remove the pan from the heat.
step-8: peel the potatoes and grate on the large holes of a box grater onto a clean kitchen towel set over a bowl.
step-9: wring out any excess liquid.
step-10: transfer the shredded potatoes to a clean, large bowl and add the remaining egg, the flour, and ½ cup (50 g) cheddar cheese, and season with salt and pepper.
step-11: mix to combine.
step-12: line a 4-inch (10 cm) diameter bowl with plastic wrap.
step-13: place ½ cup (75 g) of the grated potato mixture in the bowl.
step-14: use the back of a spoon to smooth the potatoes against the sides of the bowl in an even layer, creating a divot in the center.
step-15: fill the well with a bit of cheddar cheese, a spoonful of scrambled eggs, a bit of bacon, and top with another sprinkle of cheese.
step-16: pick up the sides of the plastic wrap, twisting to create a sealed ball.
step-17: repeat with the remaining ingredients.
step-18: chill the potato balls for 20 minutes.
step-19: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-20: line a baking sheet with parchment paper or foil and grease with nonstick cooking spray.
step-21: unwrap the balls, place them on the prepared baking sheet, and brush with egg wash.
step-22: bake for 35-45 minutes, or until the potatoes are crispy and brown.
step-23: sprinkle with parsley and serve with ketchup on the side.

step-1: assemble the burritos by microwaving the flour tortilla for 20 seconds, and begin to layer burrito starting with hash browns, followed by scrambled eggs, cooked breakfast sausage, and cheese.
step-2: fold in the left and right sides of the tortilla and roll it up from the bottom, tucking the bottom edge under the filling.
step-3: wrap in parchment paper and label.
step-4: freeze up to 1 month.
step-5: to reheat from frozen, wrap the burrito in a damp paper towel and microwave for 2-3 minutes, flipping halfway or until the center is hot.
step-6: let stand 1 minute before eating.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°f).
step-2: beat eggs and season with salt and pepper, to taste.
step-3: add eggs halfway into each tin of a greased muffin tin.
step-4: add desired toppings.
step-5: bake for 20 minutes.
step-6: eat now or keep in airtight container in the fridge.
step-7: heat when ready to eat.

step-1: cut the middle of the bread from the slice leaving a ½-inch (1 cm) border of crust.
step-2: in a pan, place the tomato, ham, and green onion.
step-3: cook over medium heat, stirring for about two minutes.
step-4: with a spatula or spoon arrange the toppings into the shape of the inside of the bread.
step-5: place the crust over the toppings.
step-6: carefully pour the egg into the hole on top of the toppings to make sure the egg does not spill over.
step-7: season with salt and pepper and a sprinkle of mozzarella cheese.
step-8: place the inside of the bread back on top and once the eggs are cooked and cheese is melted flip over, about two more minutes.

step-1: mash two bananas in a small bowl.
step-2: add the honey and almond extract.
step-3: mix well and set aside.
step-4: mix the rolled oats, cinnamon, and a pinch of salt in a large bowl, then add the banana mixture to it.
step-5: mix well.
step-6: transfer to muffin tin tray, pressing down on the middle and sides to form the cup.
step-7: chill for 1-2 hours.
step-8: bake for 10-12 minutes at 350°f (180°c).
step-9: leave to cool for 10-20 minutes.
step-10: top with yogurt, blueberries, and raspberries.

step-1: heat oven to 400˚ (200˚c).
step-2: mix eggs, milk, and spices in large mixing bowl.
step-3: add broccoli, bacon, and cheese, and continue mixing until all ingredients are well incorporated.
step-4: cut ends off the red onion and then slice in half.
step-5: gently pop out rings, using desired size.
step-6: heat cast-iron pan on low and place onion rings in the pan.
step-7: spoon in small amount of egg mixture and press on the onion ring create a seal, then repeat for all rings.
step-8: pour the remaining mixture filling to just about the top of each ring.
step-9: cover with foil.
step-10: place in oven and cook for 25 minutes, or until eggs are cooked through and slightly puffed and onion rings are tender.
step-11: remove from pan immediately and sprinkle with desired topping.
step-12: (we used grated parmesan cheese.)

step-1: preheat the oven to 450ºf (232 ºc).
step-2: roll out your pizza dough (homemade or store bought).
step-3: add olive oil.
step-4: cover with whatever toppings you prefer.
step-5: bake the pizza for 10-12 minutes, or until the eggs are cooked to your preference.
step-6: we cooked it until the egg whites were cooked, but the egg yolks were still runny.
step-7: but you do you.

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: in a small mixing bowl combine the mozzarella and feta and set aside.
step-3: on a large floured surface, roll out the pizza dough to an oval roughly 10 inches (25 cm) in length.
step-4: transfer the dough to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-5: cover surface of dough with olive oil and spoon on cheese mixture leaving a 1 inch (2 cm) margin around the outside of the dough.
step-6: fold in the 1 inch (2 cm) margin creating a crust around the cheese.
step-7: brush the crust with egg wash.
step-8: bake for 10 minutes.
step-9: remove the baking sheet from oven and with a knife spread out some of the melted cheese in the center of the pizza boat and crack an egg into it.
step-10: turn down heat to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-11: bake for an additional 6-8 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: on a cutting board, peel potatoes then cut each in half widthwise.
step-3: using a melon ball scooper or a metal teaspoon hollow out the potato starting from the cut side, once you have most of the potato hollowed out from that side create a smaller hole on the rounded side and continue hollowing until you can see through the potato.
step-4: place potatoes in water to avoid discoloration while you finish hollowing out the rest.
step-5: place potatoes with the smaller hole facing up on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-6: wrap one piece of bacon and each potato, tucking in the end of the bacon so it stays in place.
