step-7: you might need to use a toothpick to hold the bacon in place.
step-8: bake for 45 minutes, or until bacon reaches desired crispiness.
step-9: allow potatoes to cool slightly then press cheddar cheese into the bottom of the potato.
step-10: crack an egg over the top hole of the potato being careful not to let too much of the egg white pour over the side.
step-11: sprinkle chives over the egg.
step-12: bake for 6 to 12 minutes depending on how well done you would like your eggs.
step-13: let cool before serving.

step-1: preheat oven to 375ºf (190ºc).
step-2: spray a 9x13-inch (23x33 cm) baking dish with cooking spray.
step-3: in the baking dish, whisk the eggs, milk, salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
step-4: mix in broccoli, red onion, and bell pepper.
step-5: bake until the top starts to get golden brown, about 25 minutes.
step-6: place the deli meat and bacon on a 9x13-inch (23x33 cm) nonstick sheet pan.
step-7: bake 5-10 minutes, or until they reach desired doneness.
step-8: arrange the sliced english muffins on another sheet pan.
step-9: broil for 5-10 minutes, or until they reach desired doneness.
step-10: once your eggs cool, slice into 6 squares.
step-11: cut your parchment paper into 8x8-inch (20x20 cm) squares for each breakfast sandwich.
step-12: lay a moistened paper towel across the parchment and assemble your breakfast sandwiches.
step-13: wrap the assembled sandwich in the moist paper towel first, to ensure freezer freshness and even cooking when microwaved.
step-14: wrap in parchment and label.
step-15: store in an airtight plastic bag or container up to one month in the freezer.
step-16: when ready to eat, remove the parchment paper and microwave on high for 2-3 minutes.
step-17: allow to cool.

step-1: stack the slices of bread and cut the crusts off.
step-2: arrange the slices in a 3" x 3" (7.5cm x 7.5cm) square on clingfilm, overlapping them slightly.
step-3: roll out with a rolling pin until they are all combined together.
step-4: spread ketchup over the square, then add the scrambled egg, bacon and sausages to the bottom third of the square.
step-5: drizzle ketchup on top of the sausages.
step-6: roll up and remove the cling film.
step-7: cut in half.
step-8: heat up the butter in a pan and fry the rolls in butter until all sides are golden brown.

step-1: preheat oven to 325°f (170˚c).
step-2: prepare a mason jar lid with oil or nonstick spray of choice to prevent sticking.
step-3: place the mason jar lids upside down on a baking sheet.
step-4: crack 1 egg into each mason jar lid.
step-5: bake the eggs for 10-15 minutes.
step-6: remove the eggs from the oven and let them cool for a minute on the baking sheet.
step-7: slice and toast an english muffin.
step-8: assemble the sandwich with one egg, a slice of tomato, and slices of avocado.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, combine the ground pork, sage, thyme, maple syrup, salt, pepper, fennel, paprika, and garlic powder.
step-3: mix with your hands until evenly combined.
step-4: divide the sausage mixture evenly between the wells of a 12-cup muffin tin.
step-5: using your fingers, press the mixture against the bottom and up the sides of the cups in an even layer that is flush with the tops of the cups.
step-6: crack 1 egg into each sausage well, then top with tomato slice and season with flaky salt.
step-7: bake for 30 minutes, or until the sausage is golden brown and cooked through and the egg is set.
step-8: remove from the oven and let cool slightly.
step-9: serve immediately or cool completely and freeze for up to 1 month.
step-10: to reheat, microwave the cups for x minutes, until warmed through.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: slice the rolls in half lengthwise.
step-3: place the bottom half in a 9 x 13-inch (23 x 33 cm) rimmed baking dish.
step-4: spread the eggs evenly over the rolls, then add the ham, cheddar, bacon, and spinach.
step-5: top with the remaining rolls.
step-6: brush the tops of the rolls with melted butter and sprinkle the pepper on top.
step-7: bake for 20 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown.
step-8: slice into individual sliders, then serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375ºf (190ºc).
step-2: generously coat a 12-cup muffin tin with nonstick spray.
step-3: stack the tortillas and cut off the edges so the tortillas are square.
step-4: then, quarter the squares so you have 12 small tortilla pieces.
step-5: press a tortilla square into each cup of the prepared muffin tin.
step-6: fill each cup with 1 tablespoon of refried beans, 1 tablespoon of scrambled eggs, and 1 teaspoon of cheese and top with a cherry tomato quarter.
step-7: bake for about 10 minutes, until the edges of the tortillas are golden brown and the cheese has melted.
step-8: garnish with cilantro.

step-1: make the flour tortilla: in a large bowl, combine the flour and salt.
step-2: add the olive oil and mix well.
step-3: the texture should look like coarse cornmeal.
step-4: add the water and knead until the dough comes together in a ball.
step-5: if it is too wet, add more flour.
step-6: wrap the dough with plastic wrap or cover with a damp cloth.
step-7: let rest for 10 minutes.
step-8: make the sautéed vegetables: in a large skillet, heat the canola oil over medium heat.
step-9: add the onions and bell peppers.
step-10: season with the salt and oregano.
step-11: cook until the vegetables are soft, about 10 minutes.
step-12: remove from the pan and set aside.
step-13: make the home fries: in a large skillet, heat the canola oil over medium heat.
step-14: add the potatoes.
step-15: season with the salt, pepper, and paprika.
step-16: cook until the outsides of the potatoes are slightly crispy, about 5 minutes.
step-17: set aside.
step-18: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-19: grease 10-inch (25 cm) diameter dutch oven well with olive oil.
step-20: remove the dough from the fridge and transfer to a lightly floured surface.
step-21: using a rolling pin, roll out the dough to about ⅛ inch (3 mm) thick and 2 times larger than the dutch oven.
step-22: transfer the rolled out dough to the pot, pressing down around the edges so it forms to the inside of the pot and letting the excess hang over the sides.
step-23: layer the home fries, bacon, cheese, spinach, breakfast sausages, sautéed vegetables, scrambled eggs and cooked italian sausages over the dough.
step-24: fold the overhanging dough over the top.
step-25: bake for 40 minutes, or until the top is golden brown.
step-26: let cool for 30 minutes.
step-27: invert the timpano onto a cutting board and let cool for 10 more minutes before slicing.

step-1: add the turkey, pepper, thyme, sage, garlic powder, and salt to a large bowl and mix to combine.
step-2: form the turkey meat into eight equal patties.
step-3: heat a skillet on medium heat and coat with a bit of oil.
step-4: cook patties for 5-10 minutes on each side, or until the inside is no longer pink.

step-1: heat olive oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat.
step-2: add the bell pepper, black beans, corn, and onions, and cook until caramelized, about 5 minutes.
step-3: remove the vegetables from the pan and set aside.
step-4: reduce heat to low, and eggs, and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
step-5: cook, stirring constantly, until barely set, about 2 minutes.
step-6: place the vegetables, scrambled eggs, and cheese in the center of a tortilla, and fold the sides into the center, completely covering the filling.
step-7: add the quesadilla, seam side down, to the skillet and cook over medium heat until the outside is toasted and cheese is melted.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: roll out the puff pastry sheets and cut out 8-centimeter circles for the pie base and 7-centimeter circles for the top.
step-3: in a greased muffin tin, place the pie bases in each hole, pressing them up against the sides.
step-4: add the bacon, brie, and cranberry sauce, then use the egg wash on the sides of the bases.
step-5: attach the pie tops, making sure they are properly sealed, pierce with a fork, and brush more egg wash on the top.
step-6: bake for 15-20 minutes or until the pastry is risen and golden brown.

step-1: cut sweet potato into thin slices, about ¼ inch (6 mm) thick.
step-2: place in toaster and set it to the maximum cook time.
step-3: when it pops, flip the sweet potato slices over and toast 1 more time.
step-4: depending on the strength of your toaster and your preferences, you may need to toast it 1 more time after that.
step-5: remove from toaster and let cool enough to handle.
step-6: spread brie evenly across sweet potato toast.
step-7: top with walnuts, drizzle with honey.

step-1: put a pot on a medium low heat and melt the butter with the condensed milk.
step-2: stir in the cocoa powder and continue to stir for 10-15 minutes until the mixture begins to pull away from the edge of the pot.
step-3: it’s done when you run the spoon through the centre of the mixture and it takes a few seconds to combine again.
step-4: spread the mixture onto a buttered plate and refrigerate for 2 hours.
step-5: when set, roll the mixture into small balls and coat them in the chocolate sprinkles, (you may need to apply a small amount of butter to your hands to help them from sticking).

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: grease a 9x13-inch (23x33-cm) baking dish.
step-3: melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat.
step-4: add the sausage and cook until browned and no longer pink, about 5 minutes.
step-5: add the celery, onions, and garlic.
step-6: cook until softened and golden, about 5 minutes.
step-7: add the oregano and sage.
step-8: cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
step-9: in a medium bowl, beat together the eggs, chicken stock, half of the parsley, the salt, and pepper.
step-10: in a large bowl, combine the bread and cooked sausage mixture.
step-11: pour the egg mixture over the bread and sausage mixture, and stir to coat.
step-12: transfer the stuffing to the prepared baking dish and cover with foil.
step-13: bake for 30 minutes, then remove the foil and bake for another 15 minutes, or until the top is golden brown.
step-14: top with the remaining parsley.

step-1: place a digestive biscuit onto a baking tray, stack 4 squares of chocolate and two marshmallows on top of it.
step-2: grill under a high heat until the marshmallow toasts and the chocolate starts to melt.
step-3: make a sandwich with a second digestive and eat it warm.
step-4: careful of the hot marshmallow!

step-1: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: to make the flax egg, combine the flax meal and water in a small bowl and set aside.
step-3: over high heat, bring a small pot of water to a boil.
step-4: add the broccoli florets and cook for 4-5 minutes, or until tender.
step-5: remove with a slotted spoon and transfer to a cutting board.
step-6: finely chop florets to the consistency of rice.
step-7: transfer the broccoli to a medium bowl and add the quinoa, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, pepper, nutritional yeast, baking powder, flax egg, and flour.
step-8: stir well until the ingredients are evenly distributed.
step-9: use your hands to form bite-sized patties, about 1½-2 tablespoons each.
step-10: place the bites on a greased baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway through.
step-11: serve with ketchup (optional).

step-1: shave the stems of the broccoli and cauliflower with a box grater.
step-2: chop the top half of the leek.
step-3: heat the oil in a medium frying pan until shimmering], then add the broccoli, cauliflower, leeks, salt, and pepper.
step-4: cook the vegetables for 5 minutes until tender.
step-5: serve over salad, on bagels, or mixed in with any base you like.

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c)
step-2: on a baking sheet, place the 4 potatoes.
step-3: using a fork, puncture holes all around the potatoes.
step-4: bake for 1 hour until the potato gives when you press into it.
step-5: in a pan, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil.
step-6: add the onions and cook until golden.
step-7: add the garlic, broccoli, salt, and pepper, and cook until the broccoli is tender.
step-8: scoop mixture into a bowl.
step-9: add the cream cheese and cheddar cheese to the bowl of broccoli and stir to combine.
step-10: set aside.
step-11: once the potatoes have cooled, place one on a cutting board.
step-12: cut the potato in half lengthwise.
step-13: cut off one of the ends of the potato.
step-14: using a spoon, scoop out the insides of the potato making sure not to scoop out too much or the potato skin will be too thin.
step-15: with the remaining potatoes, cut them in half lengthwise and cut off both of the ends and scoop out the potato.
step-16: on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, place both ends.
step-17: place three of the skins alongside one potato end and place the other 3 potato skins alongside the other end
step-18: brush the potato skins with the rest of the olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
step-19: scoop the broccoli cheddar mixture into the potato skins and press down into an even layer.
step-20: sprinkle the rest of the cheddar cheese and mozzarella cheese over the potato skins.
step-21: bake for 5 minutes until melted.
step-22: top with parsley.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: finely chop the broccoli florets, and then transfer to a large bowl.
step-3: add the cheddar, cream cheese, ham, onion powder, and mix evenly until combined.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: in a bowl, mix together the salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, oregano, and paprika, then stir to combine.
step-6: place the chicken breasts on a cutting board and slice across horizontally, making sure not to cut all the way through.
step-7: season both sides of the chicken liberally with the spice mix.
step-8: place each chicken breast on a double layer of plastic wrap, then cover with more plastic wrap.
step-9: use a meat pounder to thinly pound the chicken breast and form into a rectangular shape.
step-10: repeat with the remaining chicken breasts.
step-11: lay down two of the flattened chicken breasts into a greased loaf pan lined with parchment paper, slightly overlapping them.
step-12: place the ham slices evenly across the bottom and sides, hanging the ham over the sides of the loaf pan.
step-13: spread broccoli mixture evenly on top of the ham, pressing it flat into the edges of the pan.
step-14: fold over the flaps of ham to completely seal the mixture.
step-15: place the third flattened chicken breast on top.
step-16: use a fork to tuck in the edges, creating a seal.
step-17: bake for 25-30 minutes, until the loaf looks slightly brown and red on top.
step-18: cool the loaf in the pan.
step-19: release any juices from the pan.
step-20: remove the chicken loaf using the parchment paper.
step-21: slice into 1-inch (2-cm) slices, and serve!

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: carefully pierce potatoes with a fork.
step-3: on a baking sheet oil the potatoes well and sprinkle with salt.
step-4: bake for about one hour.
step-5: if making more potatoes, an additional 15 minutes per potato is needed.
step-6: once cooled, cut the potatoes vertically, scoop out the inside, and transfer to a bowl.
step-7: in the bowl with the scooped out potatoes, add the cream cheese, cheddar cheese, broccoli, salt, pepper, and milk.
step-8: mix well.
step-9: scoop the potato mixture back into the potatoes and top with cheddar cheese.
step-10: bake an additional 15 minutes until the cheese is melted.
step-11: serve warm with sour cream and chives.

step-1: preheat oven to 325°f (160°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, whisk 12 eggs with salt and pepper.
step-3: add onion and cheese and combine.
step-4: in an oiled baking dish, add tomatoes, broccoli, and egg mixture.
step-5: bake for 30-45 minutes or until golden and eggs are set.
step-6: garnish with scallions.

step-1: preheat the oven to 325˚f (165˚c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: in a small bowl, microwave 1½ cups (225 g) of broccoli for 1 minute.
step-4: add the cheddar cheese, garlic powder, onion powder, and cream cheese.
step-5: mix thoroughly, and set aside until ready to use.
step-6: on a cutting board, butterfly the chicken breasts with a knife.
step-7: cut through the chicken breast so you have 6 thinner chicken cutlets.
step-8: cover in plastic wrap, and tenderize by beating with a rolling pin or a heavy pan.
step-9: remove the plastic wrap, and season with salt and pepper.
step-10: place a scoop of the broccoli cheddar mixture on top of a chicken cutlet, and spread until the chicken is covered.
step-11: roll the chicken up starting from the tapered end.
step-12: use 2 toothpicks to keep the chicken tightly rolled.
step-13: repeat with the rest of the chicken.
step-14: in a plastic bag, crush the cheddar crackers until they have a coarse, sand-like texture.
step-15: pour the cracker crumbs into a large bowl.
step-16: add the rest of the minced broccoli.
step-17: stir to combine.
step-18: put the flour into a medium bowl.
step-19: whisk the eggs in another medium bowl.
step-20: using tongs, place one of the pieces of chicken into the flour.
step-21: turn the chicken in the flour until it is fully coated, tap off any excess flour.
step-22: place the chicken in the egg, turn until the chicken is coated.
step-23: place the chicken in the broccoli cracker crumb mixture, turn until the chicken is fully coated.
step-24: repeat with the remaining chicken rolls.
step-25: transfer the pieces of chicken to the prepared baking sheet.
step-26: bake for 40-45 minutes.
step-27: let the chicken cool slightly, then remove the toothpicks.

step-1: in a medium bowl, beat the eggs.
step-2: add the broccoli, cheddar cheese, salt, pepper, and garlic powder and beat to combine.
step-3: heat the mini frying pan over medium heat.
step-4: pour the egg mixture into the pan and cover with a small plate.
step-5: cook for 10 minutes, or until the egg is set.
step-6: transfer to a plate and top with sliced chives.

step-1: in a saucepan over medium high heat add broccoli and water.
step-2: let steam for 5 minutes, or until slightly tender.
step-3: drain the broccoli and let cool in a medium mixing bowl.
step-4: once cool add cheddar cheese, egg, flour, minced garlic, salt and pepper to a bowl and mix until the mixture has a semi-creamy texture.
step-5: place a large pan over medium-high heat and add vegetable oil.
step-6: use a spoon to scoop out medium dollops of mixture and place it in the pan.
step-7: let cook on each side for about 3 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-8: remove from pan and place on paper towel to absorb excess oil.

step-1: prepare 1 box of mac 'n' cheese according to instructions on box.
step-2: add cooked broccoli, cheddar cheese, and pepper stir until fully incorporated.
step-3: top with desired garnish.
step-4: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a bowl, add broccoli, potatoes, 1 cup (100 g) cheddar, ½ teaspoon salt salt, and ¼ teaspoon pepper.
step-3: stir to combine.
step-4: grease a 9-inch (23 cm) nonstick tart pan with olive oil.
step-5: pour the broccoli mixture into the pan.
step-6: press evenly into the pan and the sides of the pan until firm using a measuring cup.
step-7: bake for 45 minutes until the potatoes begin to brown.
step-8: in a bowl, mix together the eggs, broccoli, tomatoes, onion, remaining cheddar, half-and-half, and the rest of the salt and pepper.
step-9: pour the egg mixture into the cooked crust.
step-10: bake for 25 minutes until eggs are firm.
step-11: let cool, then serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: in a saucepan, melt butter.
step-3: add the garlic, heavy cream, and pepper.
step-4: stirring constantly, bring to a boil and reduce heat to a simmer.
step-5: add parmesan cheese and keep stirring until sauce has thickened.
step-6: spread a generous spoonful of sauce on the bottom of a 9x13 inch pan and cover with 3 cooked lasagna noodles.
step-7: follow with a layer shredded chicken, broccoli, and mozzarella.
step-8: add more sauce, and repeat to make another layer.
step-9: on top of the last noodle layer, cover with the remainder of the sauce, and mozzarella.
step-10: cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes.
step-11: remove the foil, and bake for 15 more minutes, until the cheese has browned.

step-1: on a cutting board, use a knife to remove the broccoli florets.
step-2: discard the stem.
step-3: in a medium saucepan, bring the water to a rolling boil, season with salt, and add broccoli.
step-4: cover and cook for 3½-4 minutes, until a knife can easily run through the florets.
step-5: transfer the broccoli to a blender with a slotted spoon.
step-6: reserve the water.
step-7: add broccoli, pepper, and broccoli stock to the blender and blend until smooth.
step-8: keep adding water until desired consistency is reached.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (204°c).
step-2: fill a medium saucepan with water and bring to a boil.
step-3: aggressively season with salt.
step-4: blanch the broccoli in boiling water for about two minutes.
step-5: drain and finely chop the cooked broccoli.
step-6: in a mixing bowl, add broccoli, scallions, garlic, cheddar, egg, and bread crumbs.
step-7: optional: add hot sauce of choice.
step-8: mix well and chill in the refrigerator for 15–20 minutes.
step-9: spray a nonstick baking sheet with nonstick spray.
step-10: shape the mixture into tot shapes and spread them evenly on the sheet.
step-11: bake for 8–9 minutes.
step-12: flip and then bake for an additional 8–9 minutes on the other side until golden brown.

step-1: place the potatoes in a medium pot filled with cold water.
step-2: cover and turn the heat to medium-high.
step-3: bring to a boil and cook potatoes for 20-25 minutes, until fork-tender.
step-4: as the potatoes are cooking, melt 2 tablespoons of butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat.
step-5: add the onions and sauté for 8-10 minutes, until golden brown.
step-6: remove the pan from the heat.
step-7: in a medium bowl, combine the flour, warm water, olive oil, egg, and a pinch of salt.
step-8: use a fork to mix together, then once the dough begins to come together.
step-9: knead with your hands for 2-3 minutes, until smooth.
step-10: shape the dough into a disc.
step-11: cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
step-12: once the potatoes are finished cooking, drain and transfer to a medium bowl.
step-13: add the cheddar cheese to the hot potatoes so the cheese melts a bit.
step-14: add the sautéed onions, sour cream, salt, and pepper
step-15: mash the potato mixture with a fork, then mix with a spatula until smooth.
step-16: cover with plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator for 15 minutes.
step-17: remove the dough from the refrigerator and place on a floured surface.
step-18: lightly flour the top and roll out the dough to about ⅛-inch (3-mm) thick
step-19: use a pint glass to cut out circles.
step-20: gather the scraps and re-roll, then let rest for 5 minutes.
step-21: cut out more circles of dough.
step-22: keep the dough circles covered with plastic wrap to prevent them from drying out while you work.
step-23: to assemble the pierogi, scoop a rounded tablespoon of the potato filling into the center of a dough circle.
step-24: lightly stretch the dough around the filling and pinch closed with your fingers.
step-25: repeat with remaining dough and filling.
step-26: if the dough circles gets too warm to handle, chill in the refrigerator for 10 minutes.
step-27: bring a large pot of water to boil.
step-28: boil the pierogis, in batches if necessary, for 3 minutes, until they float to the surface.
step-29: be careful not to overcook.
step-30: scoop the pierogis out with a slotted spoon and place them in a oiled bowl so they don’t stick together.
step-31: just before serving, melt the remaining 4 tablespoons of butter in a large nonstick saucepan over medium-high heat.
step-32: once the butter is melted, add the sage leaves.
step-33: cook until the butter begins to brown and smell nutty, 2-3 minutes.
step-34: reduce the heat to medium and add the pierogis, working in batches if the pan is too crowded.
step-35: lightly brown the pierogis, about 2 minutes per side.
step-36: remove the pan from the heat.
step-37: to serve, spoon the brown butter over the pierogies and sprinkle with salt and freshly cracked black pepper to taste.

step-1: whisk together the flour, baking soda, cream of tartar, ½ teaspoon cinnamon, and salt in a bowl and set aside.
step-2: melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat.
step-3: the butter will begin to foam.
step-4: make sure you whisk consistently during this process.
step-5: after a couple of minutes, the butter will begin to brown on the bottom of the saucepan; continue to whisk and remove from heat as soon as the butter begins to brown and give off a nutty aroma.
step-6: immediately transfer the butter to a bowl to prevent burning.
step-7: set aside to cool for a few minutes.
step-8: with an electric mixer, mix the butter and sugars until thoroughly blended.
step-9: beat in the egg, yolk, vanilla, and yogurt until combined.
step-10: add the dry ingredients slowly and beat on low-speed just until combined.
step-11: chill your dough for 3 hours or as long as possible in the refrigerator (important!
step-12: note: you can place it in the freezer for 30 minutes if you are super eager, although i cannot promise the same results if you do this.
step-13: fridge is always best!
step-14: you want the dough very cold.
step-15: if you desire a 'puffy' cookie, place them in the fridge overnight.
step-16: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-17: once dough is chilled measure about 2 tablespoons of dough and roll into a ball.
step-18: meanwhile mix the rolling mixture in a bowl.
step-19: roll balls in cinnamon-sugar mixture.
step-20: place dough balls on cookie sheet, 2 inches (5 cm) apart.
step-21: bake the cookies 8-11 minutes or until the edges of the cookies begin to turn golden brown.
step-22: they will look a bit underdone in the middle, but will continue to cook once out of the oven.
step-23: bake longer if you like crispier cookies.
step-24: cool the cookies on the sheets at least 2 minutes.
step-25: remove the cooled cookies from the baking sheets after a few minutes and transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
step-26: repeat with remaining dough.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: in a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, salt, and baking powder.
step-4: in a large bowl, combine the oil, melted butter, sugar, and cocoa powder and whisk.
step-5: add the egg and vanilla and mix until the ingredients are incorporated.
step-6: add the flour mixture, and mix thoroughly with a spatula.
step-7: roll the dough into 2-inch (5-cm) balls.
step-8: press a truffle into each dough ball and wrap the dough around so the truffle is not exposed.
step-9: place onto a parchment paper covered baking pan.
step-10: bake for 10 minutes, until the dough is slightly firm to the touch.
step-11: dust with powdered sugar.
step-12: can be stored in an airtight container up to 5 days.
step-13: reheat in the microwave for 20 seconds before eating.

step-1: in a large bowl, add the cream, condensed milk, and cocoa powder, and whip until soft peaks form.
step-2: add the brownies and gently fold to combine.
step-3: add the dulce de leche and gently fold, being careful not to fully incorporate into the mixture.
step-4: transfer to a baking pan and freeze for 3-4 hours.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: for the brownie, in a bowl, mix butter, sugar, cocoa and eggs until creamy.
step-3: add flour, baking soda and mix well.
step-4: reserve.
step-5: transfer batter to a greased and floured 9-inch (22 cm) bundt pan and spread evenly.
step-6: bake for 25 minutes.
step-7: set aside.
step-8: for the carrot cake, in a blender mix carrots, oil, eggs, sugar until well combined.
step-9: add flour, baking powder and blend to combine and smooth.
step-10: pour the carrot cake batter over the pre-baked brownie.
step-11: bake for 45-50 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean.
step-12: set aside for 10 minutes to cool before turning out.
step-13: for the chocolate sauce, mix chocolate and cream in a small bowl and microwave on medium power for 1 minute and 30 seconds, stirring at each 30 seconds.
step-14: pour the chocolate sauce over the cake.
step-15: serve with more sauce.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180°c) and line a baking tray with greaseproof paper.
step-2: in a large bowl, whisk together the brown sugar and eggs.
step-3: next, whisk in the butter, chocolate, and vanilla extract.
step-4: fold in the flour, baking powder, and salt.
step-5: finally mix in the chocolate chips.
step-6: chill in the fridge for 30 minutes, until slightly set.
step-7: scoop golf ball-size dollops of cookie dough onto the baking tray, making sure you leave enough room for them to spread out.
step-8: bake for 12 minutes, until crispy on top and slightly gooey in the middle.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180°c) and line a baking tray with grease proof paper.
step-2: in a large bowl, whisk together the brown sugar and eggs.
step-3: next, whisk in the butter, chocolate, and vanilla extract.
step-4: fold in the flour, baking powder, and salt.
step-5: finally mix in the chocolate chips.
step-6: chill in the fridge for 30 minutes, until slightly set.
step-7: scoop golf ball-size dollops of cookie dough onto the baking tray, making sure you leave enough room for them to spread out.
step-8: bake for 12 minutes, until crispy on top and slightly gooey in the middle.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180°c).
step-2: whisk the brown sugar and butter in a bowl.
step-3: whisk in the egg and vanilla.
step-4: fold in the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt.
step-5: stir in the chocolate chips.
step-6: divide the batter between 4 ramekins, or any other oven-proof pots you may have lying around in the kitchen.
step-7: bake for 15 minutes, or until cooked but still fudgey inside.
step-8: serve with whipped cream.

step-1: preheat oven to 180ºc (350˚f).
step-2: in a bowl, add the melted butter and eggs and mix.
step-3: then stir in the sugar until incorporated.
step-4: add the flour, cocoa powder and mix well.
step-5: add in the melted dark chocolate and mix to combined.
step-6: bake for 22 minutes.
step-7: let it cool.
step-8: divide the brownie in two parts.
step-9: put one part in a bowl and crumble it with a fork.
step-10: pour the sweetened condensed milk and mix well.
step-11: set aside.
step-12: in a big bowl, whip the heavy cream to medium-stiff peaks.
step-13: gently fold the brownie mixture into the cream.
step-14: pour it in a tray and cover with the rest of the brownie.
step-15: mix the brownie bits into the ice cream with a knife.
step-16: cover with plastic wrap and freeze for at least 4 hours.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: prepare the brownie mix as directed for “fudgy” brownies.
step-3: replace the directed amount of water with dark, freshly brewed, coffee.
step-4: take 1 cup (235 ml) of the batter and transfer it to a 9 x 9in (23 x 23 cm) brownie tray that has been lined with parchment paper.
step-5: using a spatula, spread the batter evenly over the bottom of the pan to make a thin layer.
step-6: once the batter is spread out, take another piece of parchment paper and layer it on top of the batter.
step-7: using your hands, smooth out the brownie mix to create a flat, even layer in the pan with no air bubbles between the batter and the paper.
step-8: repeat steps 3 and 4 so that you have 2 thin brownie layers.
step-9: bake for 14 minutes.
step-10: once baked, remove the top layer of parchment paper form the brownie.
step-11: then remove the thin brownie form one pan and transfer it to a cooling rack.
step-12: note: you will have one on the cooling rack and another still in the baking tray with the top layer of parchment paper removed.
step-13: take the ice cream out of the freezer and give it 5-10 minutes to soften.
step-14: once soft, spread the ice cream over the top of the brownie in the baking tray.
step-15: use a spatula to even out the layer of ice cream before taking the first brownie layer from the cooling rack and placing it on top.
step-16: lightly press the top brownie down into the ice cream then transfer the entire baking tray to the freezer to freeze completely.
step-17: once frozen, use the remaining layer of parchment paper to lift the contents out of the baking tray and transfer them to a cutting board.
step-18: quickly trim away the excess ice cream.
step-19: cut the large layered brownie square into 8 2x4-inch (5x10-cm) sandwiches.
step-20: either serve immediately or wrap the sandwiches in foil and transfer them back to the freezer for a later time.

step-1: pre-heat oven to 350ºf (180°c).
step-2: combine brownie mix, egg, vegetable oil, and strong coffee into a large bowl.
step-3: mix well.
step-4: pour batter into a parchment lined 10x15-inch (25x38 cm) baking sheet.
step-5: bake for about 10 minutes.
step-6: while the brownie is baking and cooling, mix mascarpone cheese, espresso powder, and vanilla extract together in a bowl until smooth.
step-7: in a separate bowl, whip the heavy cream and gradually add in powdered sugar.
step-8: when the cream is whipped, add to the mascarpone cheese mixture and gently fold until homogenous.
step-9: take the brownie out from the baking sheet put on a flat surface, then use either a mason jar lid or a cookie cutter to cut out as many circles as you can.
step-10: to assemble the tiramisu, alternate the cream and brownie, starting with the cream.
step-11: chill tiramisu in the fridge for an hour.
step-12: to serve, dust with cocoa powder and/or espresso powder.

step-1: prepare the brownies according to the package instructions, then remove from the oven and let cool in the refrigerator for about 20 minutes.
step-2: while the brownies cool, use a melon baller or teaspoon to scoop out the tops and centers of each strawberry.
step-3: set each strawberry in the cup of a mini muffin tin.
step-4: in a large bowl, beat the cream cheese with an electric hand mixer until soft.
step-5: add the mini chocolate chips, vanilla, and cooled brownies and stir until mixture has a thick, dough-like texture.
step-6: take 1 tablespoon of the brownie mixture in your hands and roll it into a ball.
step-7: place the brownie truffle inside a strawberry.
step-8: repeating with remaining ingredients.
step-9: chill the strawberries in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-10: add the dark chocolate and white chocolate to 2 separate small bowl.
step-11: microwave each bowl separately in 30-second intervals, stirring between each, until melted, about 1 minute total.
step-12: dip the top of 1 strawberry in the melted white chocolate, poke a cookies and cream-dipped cookie stick through the top, and sprinkle with chocolate sandwich cookie crumbs.
step-13: repeat with 7 more strawberries.
step-14: dip the top of another strawberry in the melted dark chocolate, poke a chocolate-dipped cookie stick through the top, and sprinkle with red sprinkles.
step-15: repeat with 7 more strawberries.
step-16: dip the top of another strawberry in the melted white chocolate, poke a strawberry-dipped cookie stick through the top, and sprinkle with freeze-dried strawberries.
step-17: repeat with the remaining strawberries.
step-18: let the chocolate set, about 5 minutes, then serve.

step-1: whisk together eggs, milk and salt and pepper.
step-2: add the cubed crusty bread, stir and let the bread soak up all the egg mix.
step-3: oil a 9x13-inch (23x33 cm) pan, put down ½ of the soaked bread, add ham, spinach and cheese.
step-4: top with the rest of the bread.
step-5: if you need to, pat down the strata with your spoon or spatula.
step-6: sprinkle more cheese over the top.
step-7: bake in preheated oven at 350°f (177°c) for 45 minutes.

step-1: in a medium sized mixing bowl combine the tomatoes, garlic, basil, olive oil, balsamic, salt, and pepper, and stir until evenly incorporated.
step-2: serve on toasted baguette.

step-1: in a small bowl, combine the balsamic vinegar and the honey and stir until honey is dissolved.
step-2: mix the honey vinegar mixture to the roasted brussels sprouts and coat evenly.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: in a medium saucepan, melt 1½ tablespoons of butter over medium-low heat.
step-3: add the onion and garlic and cook until softened and translucent, about 5 minutes.
step-4: add the remaining 1½ tablespoons of butter and the flour and whisk to combine.
step-5: increase the heat to medium and continue cooking for 2 minutes, until the flour is golden brown.
step-6: slowly whisk in the milk and vegetable stock.
step-7: bring the mixture to a boil and continue to whisk until thickened, about 3 minutes.
step-8: remove the sauce from heat and whisk in the gruyère and 2 ounces (60g) of parmesan cheese until completely melted.
step-9: season with salt to taste.
step-10: grease a medium baking dish with olive oil, then add the brussels sprouts.
step-11: pour the sauce over the sprouts and sprinkle with the remaining parmesan cheese.
step-12: bake for 20 minutes, until the sauce is bubbly and browned.
step-13: serve warm.
step-14: nutrition, per serving - brussels sprout gratin - calories: 178, total fat: 11 grams, sodium: 434 mg, total carbs: 13 grams, dietary fiber: 2 grams, sugars: 2 grams, protein: 8 grams

step-1: make the honey buttercream frosting: in a large bowl, cream together the butter and cream cheese with an electric mixer on medium speed until well combined, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed.
step-2: add the honey and beat to incorporate.
step-3: add the powdered sugar and a pinch of salt and beat on low until mostly combined.
step-4: increase the mixer speed to high and beat for 3-5 minutes more, until the buttercream is light and fluffy.
step-5: if the frosting feels soft, you can also refrigerate it for 10-15 minutes so it stiffens slightly.
step-6: assemble the cake: place a cardboard cake round on a cake turntable and dab a small amount of frosting in the center of the cardboard round.
step-7: center one yellow cake layer over the dab of frosting, then evenly spread about ½ cup of buttercream on top with an offset spatula.
step-8: top with a layer of chocolate cake, then another ½ cup of frosting.
step-9: repeat with the remaining cake layers and frosting.
step-10: after adding the final layer, lightly frost the entire cake to create a thin crumb coat.
step-11: refrigerate the cake for 15 minutes.
step-12: cover the chilled cake with the remaining frosting in an even layer.
step-13: return the cake to the refrigerator for 15 minutes more, to allow the frosting to stiffen.
step-14: take the cake out of the refrigerator.
step-15: with the bubbles facing outward so they don’t get frosting on them, wrap the sheet of bubble wrap around the perimeter of the cake.
step-16: trim the wrap to form a collar that fits loosely around the cake and comes about 2 inches over the top edge.
step-17: remove the bubble wrap.
step-18: keep the cake in the refrigerator until you’re ready to finish the assembly.
step-19: make the yellow candy honeycomb: place the candy melts in a medium microwave-safe bowl.
step-20: microwave on medium power (not on high, which will cause the candy to seize) in 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until the candy is fully melted and smooth.
step-21: place the bubble wrap bubble-side up on a flat surface.
step-22: pour most of the melted candy along the bottom two-thirds of the bubble wrap.
step-23: working quickly, use an offset spatula to spread the candy over the bubble wrap, leaving the top third empty.
step-24: once the bottom two-thirds are evenly covered, use a spatula to spread the candy in a wave pattern along the top edge.
step-25: let sit for 5 minutes.
step-26: while you wait, remove the cake from the refrigerator and position it near the bubble wrap.
step-27: after 5 minutes, test the bubble wrap by lifting up a corner.
step-28: if it looks like it is beginning to harden and has a sheen to it but is still pliable, it is ready to be used.
step-29: if the candy is still very loose and dripping, let sit for another 1-3 minutes, checking every minute.
step-30: once the candy has set, pick it up by the top corners and quickly wrap the side with the candy around the cake.
step-31: press it onto the cake so it sticks.
step-32: once attached, try to slowly peel one corner of bubble wrap off.
step-33: it it sticks, let sit for 1-3 minutes, checking every minute, until ready to peel.
step-34: if it begins to peel, continue slowly peeling off the bubble wrap until entirely removed.
step-35: if the candy cracks while you are peeling off the bubble wrap, either remelt and repeat the process, or break it into large shards to decorate the outside of the cake.
step-36: refrigerate until serving time.
step-37: immediately before serving, top the cake with homemade honeycomb pieces and crushed honeycomb.
step-38: drizzle honey around the edges of the yellow candy honeycomb.
step-40: drizzle each piece with more honey before serving.
step-41: for instructions for how to make your own honey comb, check out https://tasty.co/recipe/homemade-honeycomb

step-1: preheat oven to 450°f (230°c).
step-2: heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
step-3: add chickpeas, salt, pepper, cumin, garlic powder, turmeric, and chili flakes, and stir until toasted.
step-4: remove from pan.
step-5: heat sesame oil in a skillet over medium heat.
step-6: add tofu, and sprinkle with ginger powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
step-7: sear until a golden crust forms, then flip and do the same for the other side.
step-8: set aside.
step-9: on a baking sheet, toss sweet potatoes and broccoli in oil, salt, and pepper.
step-10: bake for 30 minutes.
step-11: in a bowl, combine ingredients for each sauce.
step-12: divide into 4 small tupperware containers.
step-13: to build the bowls, fill four tupperwares half with quinoa, half with brown rice.
step-14: layer the ingredients of each bowl on top.
step-15: when ready to eat, pour on dressing.

step-1: preheat oven to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-2: break the head of cauliflower into florets, about 1½-inch (4 cm) wide.
step-3: in a large mixing bowl, add the flour, paprika, garlic powder, salt, pepper, and milk, and stir until well-combined.
step-4: add the cauliflower florets to the batter, making sure each piece is evenly coated.
step-5: transfer to a parchment lined baking sheet.
step-6: bake for 20 minutes, flipping halfway.
step-7: in a small mixing bowl, combine the hot sauce, vegetable oil, and honey, and stir until evenly combined.
step-8: brush the hot sauce mixture on cauliflower and bake for an additional 20 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-2: cut the head of cauliflower in half.
step-3: pluck bite-sized florets from each half.
step-4: trim bottoms of florets as necessary.
step-5: in a medium bowl, mix the batter ingredients.
step-6: add cauliflower to the batter.
step-7: stir so each floret is fully coated.
step-8: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-9: spread cauliflower florets on the baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil.
step-10: bake for 20 minutes.
step-11: remove the cauliflower from the oven and toss with buffalo sauce.
step-12: return cauliflower to oven and bake for an additional 10 minutes until browned to your liking.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200˚c).
step-2: on a large baking sheet, toss together the cauliflower florets, olive oil, paprika, salt, and pepper.
step-3: roast until tender, 20-25 minutes.
step-4: in a large bowl, whisk together the hot sauce, sriracha, melted butter, and lime juice.
step-5: add the roasted cauliflower to the bowl and mix to coat.
step-6: scatter the tortilla chips over the baking sheet.
step-7: top with the cauliflower, monterey jack cheese, and cheddar cheese.
step-8: return the baking sheet to the oven and bake until cheese is melted and bubbling, about 5 minutes.
step-9: top with avocado, radishes, celery, sour cream, and cilantro.
step-10: serve warm.

step-1: preheat oven to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-2: on a cutting board, break the head of cauliflower into florets.
step-3: in a large mixing bowl, add flour, paprika, garlic powder, salt, pepper, and milk, and stir until well combined.
step-4: add cauliflower florets to batter, making sure each piece is evenly coated.
step-5: transfer to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes, flipping halfway.
step-6: in a small mixing bowl, combine hot sauce, vegetable oil, and honey, and stir until evenly combined.
step-7: brush hot sauce mixture on cauliflower and bake for an additional 20 minutes.
step-8: serve on warm tortillas with desired taco toppings.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a bowl, mix the chicken, cream cheese, and buffalo sauce.
step-3: pour mixture into a cast iron skillet and smooth with a spoon.
step-4: cover with cheddar cheese and bake for 20 minutes, or until cheese is melted and bubbly.
step-5: top with scallions and serve with your favorite chips.

step-1: preheat to oven to 375°f (190°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-2: in a large bowl, combine the chicken, salt, pepper, mozzarella cheese, green onions, buffalo sauce, and ranch dressing.
step-3: roll out the pie crusts on a lightly floured surface to about ¼-inch (6 mm) thick.
step-4: using a paring knife, cut thin strips to resemble football laces.
step-5: then, cut out small football shapes from the remaining dough.
step-6: reroll any excess dough and cut out more shapes.
step-7: you should have about 48 footballs total.
step-8: transfer 24 football shapes to the prepared baking sheet.
step-9: spoon a heaping tablespoon of the chicken filling into the center of each football, leaving about a ½-inch (1 cm) border around the edges.
step-10: brush the edges with egg wash and place another football on top, pressing the edges with your finger.
step-11: crimp the edges with a fork to seal.
step-12: arrange the lace cutouts on top of the footballs.
step-13: brush more egg wash over the tops.
step-14: bake for 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-15: let cool for 5 minutes before serving.
step-16: serve with ranch dressing, if desired.

step-1: place chicken breasts, 2 teaspoons of salt, peppercorns, onion quarters, garlic cloves, bay leaves, and water in a large pot.
step-2: cover the pot and bring to a simmer over medium heat.
step-3: once the water is simmering, cook for 10 minutes, until the chicken registers 165°f (74°c) when pierced with an instant-read thermometer.
step-4: transfer the chicken to a cutting board and reserve at least ½ cup (120 ml) of the cooking liquid to use as chicken broth .
step-5: using 2 forks, pull the chicken apart until shredded.
step-6: in a large nonstick pan, heat the oil over medium-high heat until shimmering.
step-7: add the diced onion, diced celery, and a pinch of salt.
step-8: sauté until the vegetables have softened, about 2 minutes.
step-9: add the minced garlic and sauté until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
step-10: add the hot sauce and chicken broth.
step-11: stir until the liquid has reduced slightly, about 5 minutes.
step-12: add the shredded chicken and mix until everything is well incorporated.
step-13: remove the pan from the heat and let the chicken cool for 5 minutes before spooning into the lettuce leaves.
step-14: top with shredded carrots, sliced celery, and bleu cheese dressing.

step-1: in a medium bowl, add the chicken and buffalo sauce.
step-2: stir to combine.
step-3: add the celery, red onion, salt, and pepper.
step-4: stir to combine and set aside.
step-5: make the greek yogurt ranch dressing: in a small bowl, add the greek yogurt, dried parsley, garlic powder, dried dill, onion powder, salt, pepper, and lemon juice.
step-6: stir to combine.
step-7: lay each lettuce leaf flat on a plate and scoop the chicken mixture into the middle.
step-8: top with a spoonful of greek yogurt ranch dressing.
step-9: garnish with blue cheese crumbles and sliced green onion, if desired.

step-1: in a bowl, combine all the ingredients with a fork until smooth and evenly mixed.
step-2: transfer to an 8x8 inch (20x20 cm) baking dish lined with parchment paper.
step-3: smooth the mixture out with a spatula so that it’s evenly spread in the dish.
step-4: freeze until solid, at least one hour.
step-5: working quickly, remove the solid mixture from the sheet and cut into 4-inch x 1-inch (10 cm x 3 cm) rectangles (there should be 16).
step-6: one by one, bread each stick by coating in flour, then dredging in egg and then bread crumbs.
step-7: dip once more in the egg, then once more in the bread crumbs, and transfer to a baking dish.
step-8: heat the oil to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-9: carefully lower about three or four of the coated sticks into the oil and fry for about 30 seconds, until golden brown.
step-10: continue this until all of the sticks are fried.
step-11: serve warm with ranch dip.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f/175°c.
step-2: in a bowl, mix the chicken with the hot sauce and the ranch.
step-3: in a large pan or skillet, lay down half of the tortilla chips, followed by half of the buffalo chicken, monterey jack, tomato, and green onions.
step-4: repeat with the remaining half of the ingredients.
step-5: bake for 15 minutes, until cheese is melted.

step-1: in a bowl, combine the cream cheese, buffalo sauce, chicken, cheddar, and ranch.
step-2: mix with a fork until smooth and evenly mixed.
step-3: cut each end of the onion, peel of the papery onion skin, and cut the onion on its side into large rings.
step-4: separate the large slices into its separate layers.
step-5: put the rings on a parchment paper-lined sheet tray.
step-6: take the chicken mixture and press a small amount against the inside of the onion creating a ring shape of the mixture with a hole in the middle.
step-7: freeze until solid.
step-8: usually 3-4 hours.
step-9: heat a pot of oil to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-10: set up a breading station by placing flour, beaten eggs, and panko bread crumbs into separate bowls.
step-11: working quickly, bread each frozen ring by coating in flour, then dredge in egg and lastly in bread crumbs.
step-12: transfer to a baking dish.
step-13: carefully lower two coated rings into the oil and fry for about 3 minutes or until golden brown.
step-14: continue this until all of the rings are fried.
step-15: serve warm with blue cheese, ranch, or more buffalo sauce.

step-1: slice chicken breasts into bite-sized chunks.
step-2: combine the chicken with the salt, pepper, garlic powder, and chili powder, mixing until evenly seasoned.
step-3: place the flour and eggs into separate bowls.
step-4: dip a piece of chicken into the flour, then the egg, then back into the flour.
step-5: repeat with the rest of the chicken.
step-6: heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
step-7: fry the chicken pieces until deep-golden brown and crispy.
step-8: set aside on a paper towel to drain.
step-9: in a pan over medium heat, cook the butter and the hot sauce until bubbly.
step-10: toss the chicken in the sauce until evenly glazed.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: thoroughly wash the potatoes and dry them completely.
step-3: pierce the potatoes with a fork.
step-4: add the potatoes to a baking sheet and bake for 60-70 minutes, until soft.
step-5: remove from oven and allow the potatoes to cool for at least 10 minutes.
step-6: cut the potatoes in half, and carefully scoop out the inside of the potatoes leaving a thin border of potato on the sides.
step-7: brush the insides of the potato skins with the olive oil.
step-8: place the skins on the baking sheet, and bake for another 10 minutes.
step-9: remove the skins from the oven, flip them over, and return to the oven for 5 minutes.
step-10: while the potatoes are baking, add the cheddar cheese, mozzarella, cream cheese, shredded chicken, ranch seasoning and hot sauce in a bowl, and gently mix them together.
step-11: fill each potato skin with the mixture, and then top each potato with reserved sharp cheddar cheese.
step-12: bake the potato skins for about 15 minutes, or until cheese is browned and crispy.
step-13: remove from oven and garnish with your favorite white dressing and chives (optional).

step-1: in a large bowl mix together shredded chicken, celery, carrots, cream cheese, and hot sauce.
step-2: to form the potstickers scoop about a teaspoon amount into the center of a wrapper.
step-3: wet your finger and brush the top edge of the wrapper with water.
step-4: fold the wrapper in half and press and crimp the edges to close.
step-5: heat oil in a medium skillet over medium high heat.
step-6: place the potstickers seam side up into the hot oil and leave to brown (once placed do not move - you want a nice golden brown on the bottom, right?
step-7: after about two minutes, or until desired color is reached, add the water and cover the saucepan.
step-8: leave to steam about two more minutes - or until the water has mostly evaporated and the potstickers have steamed.
step-9: uncover, remove from pan and serve with your choice of ranch or blue cheese dipping sauce.

step-1: carefully slice the pack of dinner rolls in half, being sure to keep the rolls connected as a single units as they are split into tops and bottoms.
step-2: remove the top and place the bottom section in a 9x12 inch (23x30 cm) baking dish.
step-3: sprinkle the bottom with about 1 cup (100 g) of the shredded mozzarella cheese (make sure it is evenly coated as this will act as a barrier between the sauce and the bread, preventing the rolls from getting soggy).
step-4: top the cheese with the shredded rotisserie chicken.
step-5: drizzle the hot sauce and ranch dressing evenly over the chicken and spread out evenly with a spoon.
step-6: top with remaining mozzarella cheese.
step-7: place the top half of the rolls on top and brush evenly with melted butter.
step-8: bake in a preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, until the cheese is melty and the rolls have heated through.
step-9: remove from oven, cool slightly before transferring to a cutting board.
step-10: using a large knife, follow the lines of the rolls, cutting them into 12 individual sliders.

step-1: using a fork, poke holes in the top of the sweet potato.
step-2: microwave on high for 10 minutes.
step-3: while the sweet potato is heating, season chicken breast with salt and pepper.
step-4: heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
step-5: add the chicken and cook until browned, about 4 minutes.
step-6: transfer the chicken to a bowl and shred with a fork.
step-7: drizzle with buffalo sauce and toss until well coated.
step-8: in a bowl, add the greek yogurt, chopped green onion, salt, and black pepper and stir to combine.
step-9: cut sweet potato open lengthwise and fill with buffalo chicken, then top with crema and garnish with sliced green onions.

step-1: using a butter knife, spread the cream cheese in an even layer over the tortilla.
step-2: in a small bowl, mix together the chicken and buffalo sauce.
step-3: add the chicken to the top half of the tortilla.
step-4: sprinkle with scallions.
step-5: fold the tortilla in half from the bottom, then fold in the sides, being careful not to tear the tortilla.
step-6: toast on medium-high, until golden brown.
step-7: watch to make sure it doesn’t burn.
step-8: let cool for 1-2 minutes before removing from the toaster.
step-9: serve with ranch, if desired.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: arrange tater tots on a 11x17 inch (28x43 cm) nonstick baking sheet.
step-3: place strips of bacon on a separate baking sheet, and bake along with the tater tots.
step-4: bake the tater tots according to package directions, about 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway.
step-5: while the bacon and tater tots cook, prepare your buffalo mixture and cheese sauce.
step-6: in a mixing bowl, season chicken lightly with a pinch of salt and pepper.
step-7: add the green onions and buffalo sauce.
step-8: mix well and keep warm.
step-9: in a pot, combine cheddar cheese and cornstarch.
step-10: stir until cheese is well coated with the cornstarch.
step-11: set the saucepan set over medium heat, adding in evaporated milk and buffalo sauce.
step-12: bring sauce to simmer, whisking constantly until cheese has melted and sauce has thickened, about 5-8 minutes.
step-13: set aside and keep warm over very low heat.
step-14: stirring occasionally to prevent burning.
step-15: once crispy, remove bacon from oven.
step-16: place strips on top of a paper towel to strain excess fat.
step-17: chop strips into a rough dice.
step-18: set aside
step-19: remove tater tots from the oven once lightly browned on the bottom.
step-20: lightly season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
step-21: to assemble totchos, layer tater tots followed by the cheese sauce and buffalo chicken onto your serving platter.
step-22: garnish with blue cheese dressing, remaining buffalo sauce, bacon and remaining green onions.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the chickpeas, buffalo sauce, vegan mayonnaise, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper and mash well with a fork or potato masher until the mixture has a chunky consistency.
step-2: to make the ranch dressing, combine vegan mayonnaise, almond milk, apple cider vinegar, lemon juice, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, salt, pepper, parsley, and dill to a liquid measuring cup and whisk until smooth.
step-3: use a large bread knife to cut the whole sheet of slider buns in half crosswise.
step-4: remove the top and set aside.
step-5: spread the buffalo chickpea mixture on the bottom half of the slider buns, then top with lettuce, tomato, and red onion.
step-6: drizzle the ranch dressing over the top.
step-7: place the top half of the slider buns back on top.
step-8: then slice between the buns to make 12 sliders.

step-1: in a large saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
step-2: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the chickpeas and cook until lightly browned, 2-3 minutes.
step-3: add the garlic powder, salt, and buffalo sauce and cook for 2 more minutes, until the sauce thickens and the chickpeas have browned.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: in a small bowl or liquid measuring cup, combine the hummus, lemon juice, and water and whisk thoroughly.
step-6: to assemble a wrap, top a tortilla with romaine, chickpeas, tomatoes, and red onion, then pour on the dressing.
step-7: fold in the sides of the wrap and roll up like a burrito.
step-8: cut in half.

step-1: meatballs: in a medium bowl, mix together ground chicken, bread crumbs, egg, blue cheese, salt, pepper, and frank’s red hot until evenly combined.
step-2: be careful not to overmix.
step-3: roll into golf-size balls.
step-4: heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
step-5: add meatballs and cook until brown on all sides, about 3–4 minutes per side.
step-6: remove meatballs from the pan (they will not be fully cooked at this time).
step-7: batter: whisk together cornmeal, flour, salt, sugar, and baking powder.
step-8: add in egg and milk, then whisk until a smooth batter forms.
step-9: heat 3 inches of vegetable oil in a pot until temperature is 350ºf (175ºc).
step-10: place the meatballs on skewers, lollipop-style.
step-11: holding onto the skewer, dip the meatball into the batter.
step-12: use a spoon to help fully coat each meatball in batter.
step-13: lower the meatballs into the oil and cook for 3–4 minutes, until the meatballs are cooked through and the outsides are a deep golden brown.
step-14: drain on paper towels.
step-15: serve with more frank’s and ranch dressing for dipping.

step-1: in a small bowl, mix together the paprika, cayenne, and salt.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: in a separate small bowl, mix together the sugar, hot sauce, and olive oil.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: melt the coconut oil in a large pot over medium heat.
step-6: add 3-4 popcorn kernels and cover with the lid.
step-7: once they pop, add the rest of the kernels and cover, shaking every 10 seconds, until they begin pop.
step-8: once the pops are more than 3 seconds apart, turn off the heat and let sit for 15 seconds to allow any final kernels to pop.
step-9: uncover and drizzle the hot sauce mixture over the popcorn.
step-10: carefully toss to coat.
step-11: sprinkle the spice mixture over the popcorn and stir to coat evenly.
step-12: transfer to a bowl and eat immediately, or spread in a single layer on a baking sheet and let cool completely before storing in a sealed container for up to 2 days.

step-1: cut the tortilla into smaller circles.
step-2: pack with cheese, ham, and a hard-boiled egg separately.

step-1: make the lemongrass chili oil: chop the bottom 4 inches (10 cm) from the lemongrass stalks and discard the tops.
step-2: peel off any tough outer layers and discard, then thinly slice the remaining lemongrass.
step-3: process the sliced lemongrass in a food processor until very finely minced.
step-4: you should have about 1 cup (130 g) total.
step-5: in a large enameled dutch oven, heat the canola oil over high heat until it reaches 300°f (150°c).
step-6: add the garlic and lemongrass to the hot oil and cook until the garlic is golden brown and aromatic, about 10 minutes.
step-7: add the shallots.
step-8: reduce the heat to very low and add the red pepper flakes.
step-9: cook until extremely aromatic, about 2 minutes.
step-10: add the fish sauce, sugar, and water.
step-11: continue cooking for 2 hours, stirring occasionally to prevent the garlic from scorching at the bottom, until the oil has turned red.
step-12: remove the pot from the heat and let the chili oil cool, then transfer to an airtight container and refrigerate until ready to use, up to 3 weeks.
step-13: make the pickles: place the daikon and carrots in a deep bowl.
step-14: in a small pot, combine the sugar, vinegar, water, garlic and salt.
step-15: bring to a simmer over medium heat and stir until the sugar dissolves.
step-16: pour the brine over the vegetables and let sit for at least 1 hour.
step-17: the pickles can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 weeks.
step-18: make the nuoc cham: in a small pot, bring the water and sugar to a simmer over medium heat.
step-19: add the garlic and stir until the sugar dissolves.
step-20: stir in the vinegar and fish sauce.
step-21: remove the pot from the heat and let the nuoc cham cool, then transfer to an airtight container and refrigerate until ready to use, up to 3 weeks.
step-22: make the steak: rub the steak with the rice bran oil and sprinkle salt on both sides.
step-23: heat a large cast iron skillet over medium-high heat until smoking.
step-24: sear the steak in the hot skillet until the internal temperature reaches 130–135°f (54–57°c) for medium-rare, 6–10 minutes, turning the steak as needed to ensure even cooking.
step-25: the timing of the steak will depend largely on the thickness of the meat.
step-26: remove the steak from the skillet and let rest for 10 minutes, then slice thinly against the grain.
step-27: to serve, add the rice noodles to a wide, shallow dish.
step-28: arrange the lettuce, basil, mint, pickles, fried shallots, and peanuts on top.
step-29: arrange the beef on top and spoon over some nuoc cham and lemongrass chili oil.".

step-1: cut the apple into 6 wedges.
step-2: remove the core and seeds.
step-3: to create the ears: using a paring knife, make two intersecting slits about ¾ of the way down the skin side of each apple slice.
step-4: do not cut too deep.
step-5: remove the piece of apple between the slits.
step-6: soak the apple wedges in salt water or lemon water until ready to eat.

step-1: preheat oven to 160°c (320°f).
step-2: fry the onion until translucent.
step-3: add the chicken and fry until white.
step-4: add the garlic cloves and fry for 2 minutes.
step-5: remove from heat and transfer mix to a bowl.
step-6: mix in the diced tomato and burrito spice mix.
step-7: stir until completely covered.
step-8: place the six tortillas on top of each other.
step-9: cut into a square and then cut into quarters.
step-10: in an oiled muffin tin, place the first layer of tortilla squares in and push down.
step-11: push the other layers of tortilla on top of these in a star formation.
step-12: spread refried beans on the bottom of each tortilla, then the cooked rice, then the chicken mix, then top with grated cheddar cheese.
step-13: bake for 15 minutes.
step-14: serve with sour cream, guacamole, salsa, and coriander.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: add a tablespoon of olive oil to a skillet over medium-high heat.
step-3: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the onion, bell peppers, jalapenos, garlic, salt, and pepper.
step-4: cook, stirring occasionally, until golden brown and caramelized, about 15 minutes.
step-5: set aside to cool
step-6: place 4 chicken breasts in a bowl near a wide work surface.
step-7: combine the salt, pepper, paprika, oregano, cumin, garlic powder in a small bowl, and mix together with a fork.
step-8: pour half of the spice mixture onto the chicken, set the other half aside to use later.
step-9: rub all the spices onto the chicken until completely coated.
step-10: to pound out the chicken, first take a chicken breast and butterfly it by slicing half way into it to open it like a book, making sure not to slice it all the way through.
step-11: cover the breast with parchment paper or plastic wrap.
step-12: gently pound the meat with a mallet or rolling pin until it is evenly flattened, about ¼ inch (6 mm) in thickness.
step-13: onto each pounded chicken breast, rub on about 2 tablespoons refried beans, 1 tablespoon chopped tomatoes, 1 tablespoon cotija cheese, and 1 tablespoon cooked black beans.
step-14: make sure to not overfill the pounded chicken.
step-15: carefully roll the chicken breast until the ends overlap and then place the chicken into a greased baking dish.
step-16: bake for 20 minutes or until the chicken is fully opaque and reaches at least 165°f (75°c).
step-17: for the chipotle sauce, add the tomato sauce, chipotle peppers, tomato paste, lime juice, and the remaining spice mixture to a blender and puree until smooth.
step-18: pour the sauce over the cooked chicken roll ups and sprinkle with more cotija cheese.
step-19: broil for 5 minutes or until the sauce bubbles and the cheese melts and browns slightly.
step-20: serve with cooked rice, avocado, sour cream, and/or pico de gallo.

step-1: preheat the oven to 180°c (350°f).
step-2: melt the butter in a large skillet over medium high heat until melted.
step-3: add the chicken, salt, and pepper.
step-4: fry for about 5-8 minutes or until cooked through.
step-5: take out and set aside.
step-6: add the onion and fry for 2 minutes.
step-7: stir in the flour.
step-8: gradually whisk in the milk.
step-9: whisk in the butter chicken sauce.
step-10: whisk in the mozzarella and cheddar cheese.
step-11: once the cheese has melted into the mixture, stir in the chicken and elbow pasta.
step-12: sprinkle on some more cheese on top.
step-13: bake in the oven for 15 minutes, until the cheese is brown and bubbling on top.
step-14: garnish with coriander.

step-1: meatballs: in a medium bowl, stir together bread crumbs and milk.
step-2: let sit for 5 minutes.
step-3: add in garlic, egg, salt, and pepper, then stir until well-combined.
step-4: stir in ground chicken.
step-5: combine well, but do not overmix.
step-6: with oiled hands, roll the meat into golf-size balls.
step-7: pour 1 tablespoon vegetable oil into a skillet over medium heat.
step-8: add meatballs and brown on all sides.
step-9: remove meatballs from the pan (meatballs will not be fully cooked through at this time).
step-10: wipe the pan out to make the sauce.
step-11: sauce: heat vegetable oil and butter in the same skillet over medium heat.
step-12: add onions and sauté until translucent, about 5 minutes.
step-13: add garlic and ginger, then let sizzle for a minute or two
step-14: let the sauce cool for 5–10 minutes.
step-15: blend sauce until smooth, adding a tablespoon or two of water if it is too thick to blend.
step-16: pour the sauce back into the skillet.
step-17: whisk in the butter, cream, and 1 teaspoon garam masala.
step-18: add the meatballs to the sauce and stir to coat.
step-19: cover and cook for 5 minutes, or until meatballs are fully cooked through.
step-20: garnish with cilantro.
step-21: serve with rice and lime wedges.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the butter and sugar.
step-4: cream together with an electric hand mixer until the butter is light and fluffy,
step-5: add the egg and milk, and continue beating until smooth.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: in medium bowl, stir together the flour, baking soda, and salt.
step-8: gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and beat to combine until the dough comes together.
step-9: turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and roll out to ¼-inch (¾ cm) thick.
step-10: cut out shapes with cookie cutters of your choice.
step-11: re-roll the excess dough and cut out more shapes until all of the dough is used.
step-12: transfer the cookies to the prepared baking sheet, spacing about 1 inch (2.5 cm) apart.
step-13: bake for 6-8 minutes, or until the cookies are firm around the edges but still soft at the centers.
step-14: transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
step-15: make the frosting: in a large bowl, combine the powdered sugar, butter, vanilla, and condensed milk.
step-16: beat with an electric hand mixer until creamy and smooth.
step-17: divide the frosting between smaller bowls and add food coloring, if desired.
step-18: decorate the cookies with the frosting, sprinkles, and candies.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: to make the cake batter, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt in a medium bowl.
step-3: in a large bowl, use a hand mixer to cream the butter and sugar until fluffy.
step-4: mix in the egg and vanilla extract.
step-5: once incorporated, mix in the milk.
step-6: gradually add the flour until the batter becomes thick and dough-like.
step-7: to make the filling, use a hand mixer to beat the butter and cream cheese in a separate large bowl.
step-8: once fluffy, gradually add the powdered sugar.
step-9: mix in the vanilla extract and cream and beat until mixture is smooth and thick.
step-10: grease a 6-cup muffin tin with nonstick spray.
step-11: take a golf ball-size portion of cake dough and line the base and sides of a cup.
step-12: repeat with the remaining cups.
step-13: fill each cake bowl with ¼ cup (30 g) of filling.
step-14: take another golf ball-size portion of cake dough, roll it in a ball, and flatten with your fingers to create a 2-inch (5-cm) circle.
step-15: place the circle over the top of the filling, and press down the edges to make sure it seals to the other dough.
step-16: repeat with the remaining cakes.
step-17: bake for 20 minutes until light, golden brown.
step-18: remove from the oven, invert onto a cutting board.
step-19: serve immediately topped with sifted powdered sugar and raspberries.

step-1: preheat oven to 375ºf (190ºc).
step-2: coat each ear of corn in a thin layer of butter and roll in the parmesan cheese to coat.
step-3: place corn in a square baking dish and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
step-4: bake for 25 minutes.

step-1: over low heat, add water to your saucepan and slowly incorporate the butter, a few tablespoons at a time.
step-2: whisk together to make sure the water and butter combine and doesn’t separate.
step-3: add the lemon zest and sprig of thyme and give it a stir.
step-4: add the shrimp and poach for eight to 10 minutes.
step-5: remove shrimp and set aside.
step-6: discard the sprig of thyme.
step-7: in the same saucepan and over low heat, add garlic, shallots and the orzo.
step-8: salt and pepper to taste.
step-9: stir until all the liquid has been absorbed.
step-10: pour in the chicken stock and cook until the orzo is al dente.
step-11: stir occasionally to make sure nothing is sticking to the bottom of the saucepan.
step-12: once the orzo is al dente, add the spinach.
step-13: stir in until just wilted.
step-14: remove from heat.
step-15: serve the spinach and orzo, place a few shrimps on top and garnish with chopped parsley.

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine all the buttermilk marinade ingredients.
step-2: toss in chicken thighs and marinate for at least one hour in the refrigerator.
step-3: in a small bowl, combine all the ingredients for dill dressing.
step-4: cover and let sit for at least an hour in the refrigerator.
step-5: in a medium bowl, combine all ingredients for seasoned flour.
step-6: dip chicken in flour until chicken is completely covered.
step-7: repeat for all chicken thighs.
step-8: heat the oil to 350˚f (180˚c) in a deep pot.
step-9: do not fill more that ½ full with oil.
step-10: carefully fry chicken for roughly 7 minutes, or until cooked through (internal temperature reaches 165˚f (75˚c)) golden brown and crispy.
step-11: drain on a paper towel.
step-12: layer a couple handfuls of spring mix greens on a plate.
step-13: add sliced tomatoes, cucumbers, and red onions.
step-14: top with fried chicken.
step-15: spoon the dill dressing on top of the salad.

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine all the buttermilk marinade ingredients.
step-2: toss in chicken thighs to coat.
step-3: marinate for at least one hour in the refrigerator.
step-4: in a small bowl, combine all the ingredients for dill dressing.
step-5: cover and let sit for at least an hour in the refrigerator.
step-6: in a medium bowl, combine all ingredients for seasoned flour.
step-7: dip the marinated chicken in flour until chicken is completely covered.
step-8: heat the oil to 350˚f (180˚c) in a deep pot.
step-9: do not fill more than half full with oil.
step-10: carefully fry chicken for roughly 7 minutes, or until cooked through.
step-11: internal temperature should reach 165˚f (75˚c), and the chicken is golden brown and crispy.
step-12: drain on a paper towel-lined plate, or wire rack.
step-13: heat a large skillet.
step-14: butter cut sides of the burger buns, then toast on hot skillet until browned and crisp.
step-15: build sandwich with bread, lettuce, fried chicken, tomato slice, and dill dressing.

step-1: in a bowl, add the flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, and baking soda, and whisk to combine.
step-2: in a bowl or measuring cup, whisk the buttermilk, eggs, and melted butter until smooth.
step-3: add the buttermilk mixture to the dry ingredients, gently incorporating with a spatula.
step-4: make sure not to overmix, as that will result in dense pancakes.
step-5: add the butter to a pan over medium low heat.
step-6: once the butter begins to bubble, add ⅓ cup (80 ml) of batter to the pan.
step-7: cook until the top side begins to bubble and the bottom is golden brown.
step-8: flip the pancake and cook until the underside is golden brown.
step-9: repeat with the remaining batter.

step-1: preheat oven to 400º f (200º c).
step-2: on a cutting board, halve the squash vertically.
step-3: scoop out the seeds, and peel the squash.
step-4: cut the squash into ½-inch (12 mm) half moons, then cut into ¼-inch (6 mm) fries or wedges.
step-5: in a bowl, toss the fries with oil, salt, and pepper, then transfer to a baking tray.
step-6: bake for 20-35 minutes, flipping halfway through.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: roast the squash: add the butternut squash to the prepared baking sheet.
step-4: drizzle with the olive oil and season with the salt and pepper.
step-5: toss to coat.
step-6: bake for 30 minutes, until the squash is tender and starting to brown around the edges.
step-7: make the dough: transfer the squash to a large bowl and mash until smooth.
step-8: in a separate large bowl, combine the whole wheat flour, all-purpose flour, yeast, salt, ginger, sage, olive oil, and maple syrup
step-9: stir with a wooden spoon until well mixed.
step-10: add 1 cup (450 g) of the mashed butternut squash (save the rest for another use) and work with your hands until the dough begins to come together.
step-11: transfer the dough to a lightly floured surface and knead for 8-10 minutes, until smooth and elastic.
step-12: place the dough in a bowl, cover with a kitchen towel, and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size, 1-2 hours.
step-13: make the maple olive oil: in a small bowl, mix together the olive oil, maple syrup, and salt.
step-14: once the dough has risen, roll out to about a 20-inch (51-cm) wide circle.
step-15: brush with maple olive oil and sprinkle with the chopped sage
step-16: cut the dough into about 1½-inch (4-cm) squares.
step-17: roll up each dough square like a jelly roll.
step-18: place the dough pieces in a greased 8½x4½-inch (21x11-cm) loaf pan with the cut sides up.
step-19: loosely cover the loaf pan with a kitchen towel and let rise for 45 minutes.
step-20: towards the end of proofing, preheat the oven to 350°f (180˚c).
step-21: lightly brush the top of the proofed loaf with maple olive oil and garnish with the whole sage leaves.
step-22: bake for 35 minutes, until golden brown.
step-23: if the top begins to brown too quickly, loosely cover with foil for the remainder of the cook time.
step-24: let the bread cool for 15 minutes before serving.
step-25: nutrition - calories: 117 calories, total fat: 4 grams, total carbs: 19 grams, dietary fiber: 2 grams, sugars: 3 grams, proteins: 3 grams

step-1: melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat, then add the garlic and onion and sauté for 1-2 minutes, until the onion is translucent.
step-2: add the potato, celery, carrot, salt, and pepper.
step-3: sauté for 3 minutes.
step-4: add the butternut squash, broth, water, bay leaf, and thyme and stir.
step-5: bring to a boil.
step-6: cover and reduce the heat to low.
step-7: simmer for 25-30 minutes.
step-8: remove the thyme stems and bay leaf.
step-9: use an immersion or countertop blender to blend the soup until smooth.
step-10: let cool for 2 minutes, then serve.

step-1: heat olive oil in a large pan.
step-2: add the butternut squash and salt, and sauté for a few minutes.
step-3: then add garlic, turkey, italian seasoning, pepper flakes, and black pepper, and stir until meat is fully cooked.
step-4: add in spinach and salt until the spinach is wilted.
step-5: in a large bowl, add ricotta, egg, cheese, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
step-6: mix well.
step-7: add the cooked squash mixture into the bowl.
step-8: mix until evenly blended.
step-9: cook a box of jumbo shell pasta al dente.
step-10: set aside in a bowl covered in olive oil to prevent sticking.
step-11: heat butter in a medium pan.
step-12: once melted, add in flour.
step-13: cook the flour until it turns light brown.
step-14: add milk to the pan and stir continuously until the sauce thickens.
step-15: add a pinch of salt and pepper.
step-16: in a casserole dish, sheet the sauce on the bottom.
step-17: stuff each jumbo shell pasta with the stuffing and place on top of the sauce.
step-18: bake at 400°f (200°c) covered for 30 minutes.
step-19: sprinkle parmesan cheese and bake again for 5 minutes until the cheese melts.
step-20: garnish with parsley.

step-1: preheat the oven to 300˚f (150˚c).
step-2: cut parchment paper into a 5×5 (13x13 cm) square and place on a baking sheet.
step-3: arrange candies into a circle with one candy in the middle.
