step-4: bake for about five minutes, or until the candies have melted into one molten piece.
step-5: slide parchment paper and molten candy from the baking tray to a cold counter top and let it cool for 30-45 seconds.
step-6: carefully (will still be very hot) and quickly peel the paper off and place the center of the candy on an upside down shot glass.
step-7: push the sides of the candy down around the glass quickly with your fingers and let it harden and cool to room temperature.
step-8: flip the glass over and remove the shot glass.
step-9: make sure that whatever liquid you are pouring and the candy shot glass are the same temperature, or else the candy will crack.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350f˚ (180c˚).
step-2: in a large bowl, add the short ribs, all vegetables, herbs and black pepper to taste for the marinade.
step-3: add the wine to cover.
step-4: marinate at least 6 hours in the fridge.
step-5: remove the meat from the marinade and pat dry with a towel or paper towel.
step-6: strain the veggies from the wine.
step-7: reserve both the wine and veggies for later.
step-8: season the meat with a generous amount of salt and pepper.
step-9: coat each side with flour and set aside.
step-10: in a large ovenproof pot, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat on the stovetop.
step-11: when the oil begins smoking, carefully slip ribs into the pot and sear until well-browned, 4 to 5 minutes per side.
step-12: transfer ribs to plate.
step-13: in the same pot, sauté the veggies from the marinade until lightly caramelized and browned, 5 to 7 minutes.
step-14: add the wine in the pot, stirring to deglaze.
step-15: add tomato paste and stir to dissolve.
step-16: bring the liquid to a boil so the alcohol from the wine evaporates.
step-17: add beef broth and bring it back to a boil.
step-18: add the ribs back to your pot.
step-19: spoon the liquid over the ribs to coat them.
step-20: cover the pot and transfer to the middle rack of your oven.
step-21: bake until meat is tender enough to be pierced easily with fork, about 2½ hours, opening the oven every 30 minutes and carefully skimming the fat from surface.
step-22: serve with mashed potatoes, or another side of your choice, and garnish with chopped parsley on top.

step-1: in a medium bowl, whisk together the almond milk, vanilla, agave, and cacao powder until well combined.
step-2: add the chia seeds and whisk to incorporate.
step-3: cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 3 hours, or up to overnight, until the chia seeds have absorbed the liquid and the mixture has a pudding-like consistency.
step-4: divide the pudding between 2 small bowls and top each serving with 1 tablespoon of almond butter and sea salt, coconut flakes, and raspberries to taste.

step-1: peel and slice the bananas, then freeze overnight.
step-2: add the frozen bananas, cacao powder, cacao nibs, almond milk, and agave to a food processor or blender.
step-3: blend until smooth and thick.
step-4: transfer to a loaf pan and freeze for at least 2 hours.
step-5: serve with your favorite toppings.

step-1: add the ingredients into a mason jar.
step-2: screw the lid on tightly and shake vigorously.
step-3: the dressing can remain in the fridge for 1-2 weeks.
step-4: pour over your favorite salad ingredients and enjoy!

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: cut the puff pastry into 9 equal squares.
step-3: taking one of the squares, make 5 equal 1-inch (2 cm) cuts on 2 sides of the square.
step-4: make 3 vertical 1-inch (2 cm) cuts in between the edge of the uncut side and the 2 slits on the cut sides.
step-5: make 2 vertical 1-inch (2 cm) cuts under the top slit and above the bottom slit.
step-6: repeat this pattern until you have 6 rows with 3 cuts and 5 rows with slits and 2 cuts.
step-7: set aside
step-8: take another square place one of the apple halves in the center, peeled side facing up.
step-9: brush egg wash on each side of the square around the apple.
step-10: combine the butter, cinnamon and sugar in a bowl.
step-11: brush over the apple until it is completely coated.
step-12: take the other cut square of dough and stretch it over the apple, your cut should look like holes in the dough.
step-13: pinch the bottom of the dough together until it is sealed.
step-14: brush with egg wash and sprinkle with coarse sugar.
step-15: bake for 15–20 minutes until pastry is golden brown and puffed.

step-1: preheat oven to 250˚f (130˚c).
step-2: place wings in a large bowl and pat dry.
step-3: add the baking powder and salt to the wings.
step-4: stir to coat.
step-5: spray a baking rack with nonstick cooking spray and place on top of a foiled sheet pan.
step-6: distribute wings evenly on top, making sure none of them touch and they are all face-up.
step-7: bake for 35 minutes, then increase the temperature to 425˚f (220˚c) and bake for an additional 45 minutes, or until wings are crisp and golden.
step-8: (do not remove the wings from the oven when increasing temperature.)
step-9: for sauce, combine bbq sauce and cajun seasoning in a hot pan.
step-10: bring to a boil and add wings.
step-11: stir to coat the wings.

step-1: in a small bowl, combine all the cajun spice rub ingredients and stir.
step-2: place the salmon fillets on a cutting board and rub the olive oil over all sides of the salmon fillets.
step-3: sprinkle the spice rub over the salmon, using your hands to ensure all sides are covered.
step-4: cook on a bbq over a medium to high heat for 2 minutes per side.
step-5: the outside should start to blacken and crisp, leaving the salmon juicy inside.
step-6: once the salmon is cooked set aside.
step-7: in a large bowl, add all of the salsa ingredients and stir well.
step-8: serve the salmon with an extra sprinkling of parsley alongside the salsa.

step-1: heat oil in a large pot over high heat.
step-2: cook the garlic, sausage, and chicken until garlic starts to brown and the chicken is no longer pink.
step-3: sprinkle over the cajun seasoning and stir to evenly coat the sausage and chicken.
step-4: add the cream, and bring to a boil.
step-5: add the pasta, stirring until evenly mixed.
step-6: to finish, add parmesan and parsley, stirring until cheese melts and pasta is coated with a thick sauce.
step-7: serve.

step-1: place the eggs in a pot and fill with cold water until the eggs are just covered.
step-2: bring the pot to a boil, then cover, remove from heat, and let sit for about 12 minutes.
step-3: transfer the eggs to a bowl of ice water for about 3 minutes, then peel them and cut them in half.
step-4: transfer the egg yolks to a bowl, and set the cooked egg whites aside.
step-5: mix the mayonnaise, mustard, cajun seasoning, celery, bell pepper, and hot sauce with the yolks and transfer to a piping bag.
step-6: (alternatively, use a zip-top bag with a corner cut off.)
step-7: pipe the mixture into the eggs, garnish with the smoked paprika and green onion, and serve chilled.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a small bowl, combine the cajun spice mix ingredients and stir to combine.
step-3: in a baking dish, combine potatoes, corn, 2 garlic cloves, 1 tablespoon of oil, and ½ tablespoon of the cajun spice mix.
step-4: mix until the vegetables are coated evenly with the spice mix.
step-5: place butter on top.
step-6: bake for 25 minutes.
step-7: in a medium bowl, combine the sausage, shrimp, garlic, oil, and ½ tablespoon of the spice mix.
step-8: save the remaining spice mix for future recipes.
step-9: mix well.
step-10: add the sausage and shrimp into the same baking dish as the corn and potatoes.
step-11: bake for another 15 minutes.
step-12: top with fresh parsley.
step-13: serve with lemon wedges and beer!

step-1: combine garlic powder, paprika, onion powder, cayenne pepper, oregano, thyme, salt and pepper in a small bowl.
step-2: pour into a small glass container and secure with an airtight lid.
step-3: store up to 1 year.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: in a small bowl, combine paprika, cayenne, garlic powder, oregano, thyme, and salt.
step-3: reserve 1½ teaspoons of the seasoning.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: coat both sides of the chicken breasts with the seasoning mixture.
step-6: in an oiled cast-iron skillet, cook chicken on medium-high heat 4 minutes per side, or until chicken is browned.
step-7: bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the internal temperature of the chicken reaches 165˚f (72˚c).
step-8: let the chicken rest for several minutes.
step-9: in a small bowl, combine yogurt, minced garlic, lime juice, olive oil and reserved seasoning mixture.
step-10: set aside.
step-11: cut chicken into pieces.
step-12: in a large bowl, add lettuce, chicken, red onion, avocado, cherry tomatoes, and black beans.
step-13: add dressing and toss.

step-1: combine all ingredients in a food processor until smooth.
step-2: stir in rainbow sprinkles.
step-3: transfer to an 8x8-inch (20x20 cm) glass dish.
step-4: freeze for at least 2 hours.

step-1: in a medium bowl, mix coconut oil and white chocolate.
step-2: melt in microwave for 60 seconds.
step-3: stir every 15 seconds until melted.
step-4: place cereal in large bowl and add extract into melted chocolate.
step-5: mix in melted chocolate and sprinkles then stir until evenly coated.
step-6: in a large plastic bag, add powdered sugar and the cereal mix.
step-7: close and shake until each cereal is coated with sugar.

step-1: season the sushi rice with the rice vinegar, fanning and stirring until room temperature.
step-2: on a rolling mat, place one sheet of nori with the rough side facing upwards.
step-3: wet your hands and grab a handful of rice and place it on the nori.
step-4: spread the rice evenly throughout the nori without mashing the rice down.
step-5: season rice with a pinch of sesame seeds, if using, then flip it over so the nori is facing upwards.
step-6: arrange, in a horizontal row 1 inch (2 cm) from the bottom, the crab followed by a row of avocado and a row of cucumber.
step-7: grabbing both nori and the mat, roll the mat over the filling so the extra space at the bottom touches the other side, squeezing down to make a nice tight roll.
step-8: squeeze down along the way to keep the roll from holding its shape.
step-9: transfer the roll onto a cutting board.
step-10: rub a knife on a damp paper towel before slicing the roll into six equal portions.

step-1: for the dough balls, mix together the flour, yeast, and salt in a large bowl.
step-2: make a well in the middle and pour in the water plus 1 tablespoon of the olive oil.
step-3: knead the dough for 7-8 minutes until springy to the touch and a smooth soft dough has formed.
step-4: wipe a bowl with the remaining olive oil, place the dough inside and cover with cling film.
step-5: leave to rest for 1 hour.
step-6: on a baking tray lined with greaseproof paper, place the lid of the camembert in the middle.
step-7: roll the dough into balls and dot around the lid to make a wreath-shape.
step-8: cover and leave to rest for 30 minutes.
step-9: pre-heat the oven to 180°c (350°f).
step-10: mix the butter, garlic, and parsley together and coat over the dough balls.
step-11: sprinkle on some salt over the dough balls.
step-12: replace the lid with the camembert and sprinkle the rosemary and thyme over the camembert.
step-13: bake for 15 minutes.
step-14: garnish with the pomegranate seeds and rosemary sprigs.

step-1: cut off the top of the bread loaf, and scoop out a hole large enough to fit the camembert.
step-2: microwave butter and garlic to create the garlic butter.
step-3: butter the inside of the bread bowl and lid with the garlic butter.
step-4: cut the top off of the camembert and place in bowl.
step-5: bake for 15 minutes at 180°c (350°f).
step-6: serve with the loaf innards.

step-1: peel the japanese sweet potatoes and cut into bite-size pieces.
step-2: heat the oil in a large pot until it reaches 300˚f(150˚c).
step-3: fry the sweet potatoes in the hot oil until tender, 4-5 minutes.
step-4: remove from the oil and place on a wire rack.
step-5: increase the oil temperature to 350˚f(180˚c).
step-6: return the sweet potatoes to the oil and fry until golden brown, 1-2 minutes.
step-7: remove from the oil and drain on a wire rack.
step-8: in a medium pan, combine the sugar and corn syrup.
step-9: stir until thick and amber in color, 4-5 minutes.
step-10: add fried sweet potatoes to the sugar mixture and toss to coat well.

step-1: top toast with cantaloupe, prosciutto, and a sprinkle of feta.
in an medium pot over high heat, combine the rice, bay leaves, 2 tablespoons of butter, 1 teaspoon of salt, and 4⅓ cups (1 l) of water.
step-2: bring to a boil.
step-3: cover, reduce the heat to low, and simmer for 20 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and fluffy.
step-4: heat a large sauté pan over medium-high heat.
step-5: add a drizzle of olive oil.
step-6: toss in the peppers, onion, and garlic.
step-7: cook until the onion is slightly translucent, 8-10 minutes.
step-8: add the red pepper flakes, remaining teaspoon of salt, the tomato paste, and remaining cup (240 ml) of water.
step-9: stir, cover, and boil for 2-3 minutes.
step-10: add the calamari, shrimp, mussels, and peas.
step-11: stir and cover with the lid.
step-12: cook until the mussel shells open, 5-6 minutes.
step-13: remove the pan from the heat.
step-14: add the lemon juice, remaining 2 tablespoons of butter, and chopped parsley then stir.
step-15: transfer the cooked rice to a large bowl.
step-16: use a slotted spoon to scoop the seafood mixture over the rice.
step-17: stir to combine, add ½ cup (120 ml) of the seafood braising liquid, and stir once more.
step-18: garnish with parsley leaves (optional).

step-1: mash half of an avocado.
step-2: add salt and pepper, to taste.
step-3: mix until well combined.
step-4: spread the mashed avocado evenly across toast, and top with heirloom tomatoes, mozzarella, and chopped basil.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: in a saucepan, heat balsamic vinegar and honey over high heat.
step-3: stir until sauce reduces to ⅓ cup (80 ml).
step-4: set aside.
step-5: on a cutting board, slice the chicken breasts in half horizontally.
step-6: cover chicken with a piece of plastic wrap.
step-7: using the rough side of a metal mallet, pound the chicken until ½-inch (1 cm) thick.
step-8: repeat with remaining breasts.
step-9: drizzle olive oil over pieces of chicken and season with salt and pepper.
step-10: place 2 slices of mozzarella on each piece of chicken.
step-11: spoon ¼ cup (50 g) of diced tomatoes on each piece of chicken.
step-12: place 3 pieces of basil on each piece of chicken.
step-13: roll up the chicken, making sure the ingredients are tucked under the breast and not pushed out the sides.
step-14: place the roll-ups in a greased baking dish.
step-15: drizzle each roll-up with more olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
step-16: bake for 15 to 20 minutes, until internal temperature reaches 160˚f (71˚c).
step-17: place one slice of mozzarella on each roll-up.
step-18: broil for 5 to 10 minutes until the mozzarella has melted over the chicken.
step-19: let chicken rest for 10 minutes.
step-20: place a basil leaf and slice of tomato on each piece of chicken.
step-21: drizzle with balsamic reduction.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook the pasta according to the package instructions.
step-3: drain and transfer to a large bowl.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: in a large cast-iron skillet, melt the butter over low heat until foamy.
step-6: add the flour and stir until completely smooth and slightly thickened, about 2 minutes.
step-7: while stirring, gradually add the milk and cook until the sauce is thickened, about 4 minutes.
step-8: season with the paprika, pepper, and salt.
step-9: fold in the spinach and stir until wilted.
step-10: add 1½ cups (150 g) of shredded mozzarella and stir until completely melted.
step-11: add the cooked pasta and stir to coat in the sauce.
step-12: sprinkle the remaining shredded mozzarella evenly over the pasta, then top with the fresh mozzarella if using.
step-13: arrange the tomato slices on top.
step-14: bake until browned and bubbling, about 25 minutes.
step-15: top with basil before serving.

step-1: place a single tomato and mozzarella ball on top of a basil leaf.
step-2: wrap the top and bottom of the leaf around the tomato and mozzarella, then thread onto a skewer or long toothpick.
step-3: drizzle with balsamic and olive oil and season with salt and pepper.

step-1: preheat oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-2: with a sharp knife, slice the squash in half.
step-3: if the squash is too tough, puncture in several places forming a dotted line around the squash.
step-4: microwave for 3-5 minutes to soften.
step-5: allow to cool before cutting in half.
step-6: scoop out the seeds, brush with oil, and sprinkle with salt, and pepper.
step-7: bake for 40-45 minutes, or until a fork can easily pierce the skin.
step-8: in a pan over medium heat, add the oil, garlic, and onions, and sautè until onions are translucent.
step-9: add the cherry tomatoes, salt, and pepper and simmer until they are cooked and begin to become softened.
step-10: remove squash from the oven, with a fork pull at the edges to produce that stringy “spaghetti” quality.
step-11: add the squash to the tomato mixture and mix in the pan.
step-12: add mixture back to the hollowed out spaghetti squash halves.
step-13: top with mini mozzarella balls ans basil.
step-14: bake an additional 5-10 minutes, or until cheese melts.
step-15: serve in the squash, and top with basil.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: grease a 12-cup muffin tin with nonstick spray.
step-3: trim the ends from the zucchini, then slice lengthwise with a vegetable peeler.
step-4: line the muffin cups with the zucchini strips.
step-5: in a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, tomato, milk, salt, and pepper.
step-6: add a few pieces of mozzarella to each zucchini cup.
step-7: divide the egg mixture evenly among the cups.
step-8: sprinkle the basil on top.
step-9: bake for 18 minutes, until the edges are slightly browned.

step-1: preheat oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-2: core apples and cut into ¼-inch slices, then cut those slices in half width-wise.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine apples and all filling ingredients.
step-4: stir well and transfer to a 13x9 inch (23x33 cm) baking dish.
step-5: for the topping - in a separate bowl, combine all topping ingredients and mash together with a fork until it forms into small and medium-sized clumps.
step-6: sprinkle the topping evenly over the apples.
step-7: bake for 40-45 minutes or until the liquid has thickened and the apples are tender.
step-8: cool for 10 minutes and serve with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a bowl, mix the crust ingredients.
step-3: press into the bottom of a greased 8-inch (20 cm) springform pan.
step-4: bake for 5 minutes.
step-5: in another bowl, mix all the filling ingredients except the apples.
step-6: in another bowl, mix all the topping ingredients except the caramel.
step-7: spread the filling over the graham cracker crust, then layer the apple slices on top.
step-8: sprinkle the topping mix evenly over the apple layer.
step-9: bake for 30 minutes
step-10: drizzle on caramel sauce.

step-1: on a cutting board peel and cut the apples into slices ¼-inch (6-mm) thick.
step-2: place the apple slices in a medium bowl.
step-3: add the sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, and salt.
step-4: mix until the apples are well-coated, then set aside until ready to use.
step-5: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-6: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-7: roll out one of the pie crusts.
step-8: use a 4-inch (10-cm) diameter glass or ramekin to cut 6 rounds from the dough.
step-9: repeat with the remaining crust so you have 12 dough circles total.
step-10: place a few apple slices on top of one of the dough circles.
step-11: place another circle of dough on top, and seal the edges together.
step-12: with a fork, crimp the edges and poke a few holes on the top of the hand pie.
step-13: repeat with the rest of dough and apples.
step-14: transfer the hand pies to the baking sheet and brush with egg wash.
step-15: bake for 20 minutes, until golden.
step-16: let cool for 10 minutes.
step-17: in a small saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter with the brown sugar, vanilla, salt, and honey.
step-18: mix thoroughly until the caramel begins to bubble.
step-19: remove the sauce from the heat and pour into a small bowl for dipping.
step-20: once the hand pies have cooled, dunk them face down into the caramel, let any excess drip off.
step-21: flip the hand pies right-side up so the caramel oozes down to the edges.
step-22: let cool for 2 minutes.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine flour, eggs, butter, and sugar, stirring until ingredients are slightly mixed.
step-2: add the milk ½ cup (120 ml) at a time, stirring vigorously, making sure the milk is completely incorporated into the batter and that the batter is smooth before adding more milk.
step-3: repeat with the rest of the milk.
step-4: the batter should be very liquidy and have no lumps.
step-5: in a pan over medium heat, pour ⅓ cup (95 grams) of the batter in the center and swirl the batter around the edges of the pan until set.
step-6: to know when the crepe is ready to flip, lift up one of the edges about ⅓ of the way.
step-7: the bottom side should be golden brown.
step-8: flip the crepe.
step-9: cook until the edges are starting to slightly crisp.
step-10: remove from heat and cover with a paper towel to make sure the crepes stay moist.
step-11: in a pan over medium heat, mix the brown sugar and butter until slightly bubbling.
step-12: add the cinnamon and bananas, stirring until bananas are evenly coated with the caramel.
step-13: remove from heat and cool.
step-14: spread half of the banana mixture on half of one crepe.
step-15: fold the other half of the crepe on top of the bananas, then fold the crepe in half.
step-16: repeat with the other crepe.
step-17: serve with whipped cream and a drizzle of caramel sauce.

step-1: put all ingredients into a blender and mix until smooth.
step-2: serve in a glass and garnish with toppings (optional).

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: make the cake: in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, cinnamon, cloves, baking powder, salt, and baking soda
step-3: add the eggs, applesauce, vanilla extract, light brown sugar, and vegetable oil, and whisk until the batter is thick and smooth.
step-4: make the topping: in a medium bowl, use a fork to cut together the brown sugar, flour, cinnamon, and butter until the mixture resembles wet sand.
step-5: cut the tops off the apples and use a spoon to hollow out the centers, making sure to remove all seeds.
step-6: place the apples in baking pan with tall sides.
step-7: brush the rims of the apples with lemon juice.
step-8: fill the apples with cake batter to ¼-inch (6-mm) below their rim.
step-9: sprinkle the topping over the batter.
step-10: bake for 30 minutes, until the tops are crisp and golden brown and the cake is baked all the way through.
step-11: remove the apples from the oven and serve with ice cream and caramel sauce.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: in a large bowl, beat together butter, brown sugar, granulated sugar, and vanilla extract until smooth.
step-5: add the eggs one at a time, beating as you go.
step-6: add the flour mixture a bit at a time while beating, until it forms a smooth dough.
step-7: add pretzels to a zipper bag and crush with a rolling pin.
step-8: fold in the chocolate chips and crushed pretzels until evenly combined.
step-9: press a caramel flat and place in the middle of a ball of dough, roughly two tablespoons.
step-10: fold dough around the caramel, using a bit more to seal if necessary.
step-11: place on a well-greased or parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-12: bake for 8-10 minutes, then remove from oven.
step-13: while still warm, press a single pretzel into the top of each cookie.
step-14: serve with a cold glass of milk or on their own!

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190°c).
step-2: peel the apples and cut in quarters.
step-3: soak the apples in lemon water to prevent the apples from browning.
step-4: slice the apples into thin slices.
step-5: in a small bowl, combine sugar, brown sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg.
step-6: stir to combine.
step-7: sprinkle sugar and spice mixture over sliced apples and let sit for 30 minutes.
step-8: line a pie dough in a cast iron pan, and prick the dough with a fork all around.
step-9: chill.
step-10: drain the apples, squeezing them with your hands to remove the excess moisture.
step-11: reserve the liquid to make caramel sauce.
step-12: line the apple slices in the cast iron pan by overlapping each slice to make look like a rose.
step-13: for the center, roll up one apple slice tightly and place it in the center of the tart, creating a rose bud shape.
step-14: cover the pan with a piece of aluminum foil and bake for 30 minutes.
step-15: uncover the foil and bake for 10 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-16: in a saucepan, bring the leftover liquid from apple to a boil.
step-17: once the liquid is reduced by half, add the heavy cream and stir well.
step-18: pour caramel sauce over to the apple pie.

step-1: get a muffin tin and coat with vegetable oil spray.
step-2: place a cookie’s worth of dough into each section of a muffin tin.
step-3: press the dough down to make a cup shape.
step-4: bake for 10-12 minutes.
step-5: as soon as the cookies are removed from the oven, place one snickers bar in each cookie cup.
step-6: let cool and cover with caramel just before serving.

step-1: place graham crackers into a plastic bag and crush them into fine crumbs with a rolling pin.
step-2: pour the graham cracker crumbs into a bowl and combine with melted butter, mixing until the texture is like slightly wet sand.
step-3: press the graham cracker crumbs in an even layer into the bottom of a 9-inch (23 cm) springform pan.
step-4: refrigerate.
step-5: in a large bowl, combine softened cream cheese, vanilla, powdered sugar, and peanut butter until well mixed.
step-6: add the cream cheese mixture to the springform pan and refrigerate at least 1 hour.
step-7: in a saucepan over medium-high heat, combine butter, brown sugar, half & half, and cinnamon.
step-8: stir until mixture darkens and sugar dissolves into the mixture.
step-9: lower the heat to medium-low and add the bananas to the saucepan and sauté in the sauce for 1-2 minutes on each side.
step-10: take off heat and let rest for 10 minutes.
step-11: decorate the top of the cheesecake with banana slices and pour over remaining caramel sauce.
step-12: chill for at least 30 minutes.
step-13: slice and garnish with chocolate or caramel syrup.

step-1: heat the olive oil in the 2.5-quart saucepan over medium-high heat.
step-2: add the rosemary sprigs and fry until fragrant and the leaves are crisp, 1 minute.
step-3: using tongs, remove the rosemary and transfer to paper towels to drain.
step-4: if any leaves are left behind in the oil, remove with a slotted spoon and transfer to the paper towels as well.
step-5: return the pan with the oil to medium heat.
step-6: add the onions and cook, stirring occasionally, until soft and caramelized, 20-25 minutes.
step-7: add the garlic and cook for 1 minute, until fragrant.
step-8: stir in the spinach and cook for 2 minutes to evaporate any excess moisture.
step-9: add the cream cheese and cook, stirring, until completely melted and incorporated into the onions and spinach.
step-10: remove the pan from the heat and stir in the sour cream, mayonnaise, lemon zest, salt, pepper, and lemon juice.
step-11: let cool to room temperature or cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for up to 2 days.
step-12: remove the rosemary leaves from the stems over a cutting board.
step-13: crush with your fingers or finely chop with a knife.
step-14: transfer the dip to a serving dish and smooth the top.
step-15: sprinkle with the fried rosemary and serve with pita chips, toasted bread, or crudités.

step-1: preheat oven to 450°f (230°c).
step-2: rinse off your potatoes and give them a light scrub to remove any excess dirt.
step-3: dry with towel then cut into fries.
step-4: in a large mixing bowl, combine potatoes, olive oil, salt, garlic powder, and paprika until each fry is fully coated in all of the spices.
step-5: place fries on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake at 450°f (230°c) for 30-35 minutes or until the fries are crispy and golden brown.
step-6: marinate flank steak with salt, pepper, chili powder, oregano, garlic, cilantro, lime juice, and orange juice for 20 minutes.
step-7: heat up a cast-iron skillet with 1 tablespoon of canola oil.
step-8: place steak in the hot cast-iron skillet and cook for 3 minutes on both sides for a medium cooked steak.
step-9: take steak off the heat and let it rest for 10 minutes before dicing.
step-10: in an ovenproof skillet, place baked french fries, pepper jack cheese, and diced carne asada, then broil until the cheese is melted.
step-11: top with sour cream, guacamole, diced tomatoes, cilantro, and cotija cheese.

step-1: in a large bowl, whisk together the oil, vinegar, lime juice, orange juice, garlic, jalapeño, chopped cilantro, salt, coriander, cumin, pepper, and chili powder.
step-2: place the steak in a gallon-size resealable bag.
step-3: pour in 1 cup (240 ml) of the marinade and set the rest aside.
step-4: seal the bag and shake to evenly coat the steak in the marinade.
step-5: refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or up to 4 hours.
step-6: in a small saucepan, bring the reserved ½ cup (120 ml) of marinade to a boil over medium-high heat.
step-7: cook until thickened and reduced by half, about 5 minutes.
step-8: remove from the heat and set aside.
step-9: heat a large grill pan over high heat until very hot.
step-10: remove the steak from the bag and discard the marinade.
step-11: cook the steak on 1 side until there are dark grill marks and it is beginning to caramelize around the edges, about 6 minutes.
step-12: flip and cook on the other side for 5 minutes for medium rare, or 7 minutes for medium.
step-13: transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes.
step-14: working in batches, heat the corn tortillas in a pan over medium-high heat, turning with tongs, until softened and just beginning to brown in spots, about 1 minute per side.
step-15: wrap the toasted tortillas in foil to keep warm.
step-16: thinly slice the steak against the grain, then cut the slices in half.
step-17: transfer to a large bowl and toss with the reduced marinade to coat.
step-18: serve the steak with the warm tortillas, pico de gallo, guacamole, sour cream, cotija cheese, and cilantro leaves, if desired.

step-1: to make the guacamole, add the avocados, serrano peppers, cilantro, garlic, salt, and a bit of water to a blender.
step-2: blend until smooth, adding water as needed to thin it down.
step-3: transfer to a bowl and set aside.
step-4: to make the red sauce, add the dried chilies, stewed tomatillos in 2 cups (480 ml) of their stewing liquid, stewed tomato in ½ cup (120 ml) of its stewing liquid, garlic, and bit of salt in a blender.
step-5: blend until everything is well incorporated, adding more salt to taste.
step-6: mix 1 teaspoon of salt into 1 tablespoon of taco seasoning and rub the seasoning onto both sides of the steak.
step-7: cut the steak into thin strips, then cut into small pieces.
step-8: add 1 tablespoon of oil to a large griddle or cast iron pan over high heat.
step-9: once the oil is hot, add the steak and cook for 6-8 minutes or until the steak has browned on all sides.
step-10: move to the side of the griddle to keep warm.
step-11: reduce the heat to medium/medium-high and add a bit more oil to the griddle.
step-12: place the tortillas on the griddle and top with a generous amount of cheese.
step-13: on half of the tortillas, add some of the cooked steak, diced onion, cilantro, red sauce, and guacamole.
step-14: place the other tortilla (cheese-side down) on top of the fillings.
step-15: serve.

step-1: in a large bowl, season the pork with salt and pepper.
step-2: toss until well-coated.
step-3: heat the vegetable oil in a dutch oven over high heat for 5 minutes, until very hot.
step-4: working in batches, sear the pork on each side for 1 minute, until a brown crust forms.
step-5: add all of the pork to the pot with the chili powder, oregano, cumin, bay leaf, garlic, and onion.
step-6: toss to combine.
step-7: add the lime juice, orange juice, and chicken broth.
step-8: cover, reduce the heat to medium-high, and cook until the meat is tender, 1 hour.
step-9: remove the pork from the pot and shred using 2 forks.
step-10: let the carnitas cool for 10 minutes.
step-11: in a large bowl, combine the mixed greens, carnitas, carrots, corn, black beans, and avocado.
step-12: toss well.
step-13: add dressing, if desired.
step-14: divide between plates and serve.

step-1: for the slow cooker carnitas: combine the spices in a bowl and rub all over the pork shoulder.
step-2: in your slow cooker, place onions and jalapeños.
step-3: place pork shoulder on top of the onions and jalapeños.
step-4: add the lime juice, orange juice and garlic cloves.
step-5: cover and cook low for 8 hours or high for 4 hours.
step-6: for the buns: dissolve instant yeast, sugar and warm water in a small bowl.
step-7: let it proof/activate for 5 minutes or until bubbly or foamy.
step-8: sift together the dry ingredients (flour, salt and baking powder).
step-9: add the yeast mix to the dry ingredients, knead to form ball of dough.
step-10: place ball of dough into greased bowl, cover and proof dough for 1 hour or until double in size.
step-11: punch down dough, roll out and cut into golf ball sized pieces.
step-12: cover and rest the golf ball sized dough balls for 15 minutes.
step-13: when slow cooker carnitas are done, pull apart with a fork and transfer to a separate bowl.
step-14: keep the juices in the slow cooker and use it for a dipping sauce later.
step-15: when ready, prepare your steamer over high heat.
step-16: flatten each dough ball, add about a tablespoon of pulled carnitas to the center and pull the sides of the dough around the filling.
step-17: place seam side down on a piece of parchment paper.
step-18: steam for 15 minutes.
step-19: serve with the slow cooker juices as a dipping sauce.
step-20: if the dipping sauce has too much fat, skim the fat.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: on a cutting board, use a vegetable peeler to peel the carrot into ribbons.
step-3: in a small bowl, mix carrot ribbons with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
step-4: toss until well coated.
step-5: transfer carrot ribbons to a baking sheet.
step-6: bake for 10-15 minutes flipping halfway through.
step-7: if carrots need more crisping, turn oven down to 300˚f (150˚c) and bake for additional 5 minutes, or until desired crispiness is reached.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: grease 3 8-inch (20 cm) round cake pans and line with parchment paper.
step-3: grate the carrots on the small holes of a box grater.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: in a large bowl, sift together 2½ cups (310 g) of flour, the cinnamon, allspice, salt, baking powder, and baking soda.
step-6: whisk together.
step-7: in a separate large bowl, beat the brown sugar, granulated sugar, and eggs together with an electric hand mixer on medium speed until just combined.
step-8: with the mixer running, gradually pour in the vegetable oil.
step-9: with the mixer on medium-low speed, add ⅓ of the flour mixture at a time to the wet ingredients.
step-10: beat just to incorporate.
step-11: stop mixing when there is just a small amount of flour visible.
step-12: in a small bowl, toss the raisins with the remaining tablespoon of flour.
step-13: add the raisin, grated carrots, and pineapple to the batter and fold to incorporate with a rubber spatula.
step-14: divide the cake batter evenly between the prepared pans and smooth the tops.
step-15: bake for 25-30 minutes, until a fork inserted in the center of a cake comes out clean.
step-16: cool the cakes on a wire rack until the pans are cool to the touch.
step-17: remove the cakes from the pans and let cool completely on the rack.
step-18: make the icing: in a large bowl, beat together the butter, cream cheese, and vanilla with an electric hand mixer on medium-low speed.
step-19: once combined, mix on medium-high speed for 30 seconds, until light and fluffy.
step-20: add the powdered sugar, ½ cup (60 g) at a time, beating on medium-low speed to incorporate each addition.
step-21: assemble the cake: check to see if the top of each cake is flat.
step-22: if not, use a serrated knife level off the cakes.
step-23: place 1 cake layer on a serving platter or cake stand.
step-24: spoon ¼ of the icing on top and spread in an even layer.
step-25: add another layer of cake and spread with another ¼ of the icing.
step-26: set the last cake layer on top with the bottom up to ensure a very flat surface.
step-27: spread the rest of the icing over the top and sides.
step-28: gently press the walnuts into the icing around the sides of the cake.
step-29: chill for 30-60 minutes to let the icing set, then slice and serve.

step-1: break the cake into a large bowl, crumble it until it is in fine crumbs.
step-2: add sweet condensed milk and mix until you form a dough.
step-3: open a small amount of dough and cover one brigadeiro in it, rolling until you form a ball.
step-4: add one stick into each ball and freeze for 15 minutes.
step-5: dip your cake pops into melted chocolate, covering them.
step-6: let it rest and add some sprinkles on them.

step-1: shred carrots by hand or in a food processor then set aside in a small bowl.
step-2: in a large bowl combine brown and powdered sugars with eggs, whisk until smooth.
step-3: add oil and mix.
step-4: add remaining carrot cake ingredients and stir until blended, set aside.
step-5: in a large bowl, whisk cream cheese and powdered sugar until smooth to start the cheesecake.
step-6: mix in eggs one at a time.
step-7: add in remaining ingredients and mix until well blended.
step-8: in a greased 8-inch (20 cm) springform pan, pour ¾ of the carrot cake mixture and smooth it out, followed by ½ of the cheesecake mixture, then repeat with remaining mixtures.
step-9: bake in for 45 minutes at 180°c (350°f).
step-10: remove from oven and let cool to room temperature, about 1 hour.
step-11: refrigerate for 4 hours, or overnight.

step-1: make the cream cheese filling: in a medium bowl, combine the cream cheese, powdered sugar, flour, and vanilla.
step-2: mix with a fork until smooth.
step-3: scoop 16 teaspoon-sized balls of icing onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-4: freeze for at least 1 hour.
step-5: make the cookies: preheat the oven to 350°f (180˚c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-6: (do not use a silicone mat--if the bottoms of the cookies are too thin, the silicone will stick to the cookies and the icing centers will fall through when removed from the pan.)
step-7: in a medium bowl, mix together the flour, baking soda, and salt.
step-8: set aside.
step-9: in a large bowl, combine the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar, and beat with an electric hand mixer or whisk for 1-2 minutes, or until well combined.
step-10: add the eggs, 1 at a time, then the vanilla and cinnamon and beat until combined.
step-11: add the flour mixture and beat until just incorporated.
step-12: fold in the carrots, raisins, and pecans with a rubber spatula.
step-13: scoop 16 heaping tablespoons of dough onto 2 prepared baking sheets, spacing at least 3 inches apart.
step-14: flatten each scoop with moistened fingers.
step-15: place a frozen icing ball in the center of each dough round.
step-16: top the filling with another scoop of dough and use moistened fingers to flatten and seal the edges so the filling is completely encased.
step-17: bake for 15-18 minutes, or until the edges are light brown.
step-18: be careful not to overbake or the filling will ooze out.
step-19: let the cookies cool completely.
step-20: this is important! if you try to lift the cookies before they are cool and the icing is still warm, it could fall through the cookies.

step-1: add oats, walnuts and ground almonds to a large bowl and mix together.
step-2: add peanut butter, honey and cinnamon and mix.
step-3: add carrot and raisins to the mixture and mix until a everything has stuck together.
step-4: form into 12 balls and place on baking paper.
step-5: refrigerate for 1 hour.

step-1: stir together rolled oats, grated carrot, raisins, and ½ of the almond milk.
step-2: store in an airtight container in the fridge overnight.
step-3: (if you’re following the clean eating challenge, you already did this!)
step-4: combine the carrot-oat mixture, the remaining ½ of the almond milk, honey, vanilla, and cinnamon in a small pot over medium heat.
step-5: bring the mixture to a simmer and cook, stirring occasionally, until the mixture is thick and the oats are cooked, 4 to 5 minutes.
step-6: serve immediately, with almonds and greek yogurt on top.

step-1: add all of the ingredients except for the carrot and walnut in a clean mason jar.
step-2: stir everything together.
step-3: add the leftover walnuts and carrots.
step-4: put a lid on the mason jar and refrigerate overnight 40°f (≤ 5°c).

step-1: in a food processor, combine chickpeas, oats, carrots, red onion, egg, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and olive oil.
step-2: blend just until combined.
step-3: add lemon juice and blend again until well-combined.
step-4: scoop out a handful of the mixture and form into patties.
step-5: heat a tablespoon of olive oil over medium-high heat.
step-6: cook the patty 4-5 minutes on each side, or until golden brown.
step-7: assemble with your favorite burger toppings.

step-1: in a food processor, combine chickpeas, oats, carrots, red onion, egg, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and olive oil.
step-2: blend just until combined.
step-3: add lemon juice and blend again until well-combined.
step-4: scoop out a handful of the mixture and form into patties.
step-5: heat a tablespoon of olive oil over medium-high heat.
step-6: cook the patty 4-5 minutes on each side, or until golden brown.
step-7: assemble with your favorite burger toppings.

step-1: in a saucepan over medium high heat add carrots and water.
step-2: let steam for 5 minutes, or until slightly tender.
step-3: drain the carrots and let cool in a medium mixing bowl.
step-4: once cool add parmesan cheese, egg, flour, corn, parsley, and salt to a bowl and mix until the mixture has a semi-creamy texture.
step-5: place a large skillet over medium-high heat and add vegetable oil.
step-6: use a spoon to scoop out medium dollops of the carrot mixture and place it in the pan.
step-7: let cook on each side for about 3 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-8: remove from pan and place on paper towel to absorb excess oil.

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine the vegetable broth, apple cider, soy sauce, maple syrup, liquid smoke, mustard powder, paprika, ground coriander, garlic powder, and pepper.
step-2: place the carrots into a baking dish and pour the marinade on top.
step-3: let marinate for at least 30 minutes.
step-4: preheat the oven to 425°f (220˚c).
step-5: if baking, cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake for about 40 minutes.
step-6: remove the foil and bake for another 25 minutes, until the carrots are just tender enough to be poked with a knife.
step-7: if grilling, heat the olive oil on a grill pan on high heat.
step-8: add the marinated carrots to the pan and spoon a bit of the marinade over.
step-9: cook for about 2 minutes on each side, until slightly charred.
step-10: place the carrots in buns and add your desired toppings.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: cut carrots into fries and combine in a large bowl with olive oil, parsley, paprika, salt, and pepper.
step-3: place on baking sheet lined with parchment paper in a single layer.
step-4: bake for 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway.
step-5: prepare dip while fries are baking.
step-6: combine all dip ingredients in a small bowl and set aside in the refrigerator until ready to use.

step-1: add apples, carrots, mango, and water, breast milk, or formula to a blender or food processor.
step-2: blend very well.
step-3: add more liquid as needed.
step-4: refrigerate up to 3 days or freeze up to 1 month.
step-5: note: check with your pediatrician before introducing new foods to children under 12 months.

step-1: add the orange, carrot, and ginger to a blender, and blend until smooth.
step-2: using a mesh strainer, strain the juice over a large liquid measuring cup to remove the pulp.
step-3: use a spoon to help stir the pulp and press out the liquid.
step-4: reserve the pulp to make pulp muffins.
step-5: chill the juice for at least 30 minutes (and keep up to 3 days).

step-1: heat 1 tablespoon of sesame oil in a large, nonstick skillet over medium heat.
step-2: pour in the shrimp and season with ¼ teaspoon of the salt.
step-3: fry the shrimp for 1 minute on each side.
step-4: remove the shrimp from the pan and pour in the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil.
step-5: toss in the carrots and remaining ¼ teaspoon of salt and sauté for a few minutes until they begin to soften.
step-6: add in the snow peas, garlic, and soy sauce and sauté until the garlic becomes fragrant, about 30 seconds.
step-7: toss the shrimp back into the pan, sprinkle on the sesame seeds, and mix until everything is well incorporated and the shrimp is fully cooked, about 1 minute.
step-8: divide the mixture evenly between 4 bowls and sprinkle with a few more sesame seeds, if desired.

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine the soy sauce, hoisin sauce, rice vinegar, honey, sesame oil, ginger, and garlic.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: in a medium bowl, season the chicken with salt, pepper, and cornstarch.
step-4: heat a 9.5" fry pan over medium-high heat and add sesame oil.
step-5: add the chicken and cook for 5-6 minutes, or until the chicken begins to brown.
step-6: remove chicken and set aside in a separate bowl.
step-7: add the broccoli and bell peppers, and cook for 2-3 minutes.
step-8: add the chicken, cashews and sauce.
step-9: stir together and allow sauce to thicken.
step-10: remove from heat and serve over brown rice.

step-1: line an 8-inch (20 cm) square baking dish with parchment paper.
step-2: add the cashews, dates, coconut, salt, coconut milk, and vanilla to a food processor and pulse until the mixture starts to clump together.
step-3: transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish and press into an even layer.
step-4: top with more coconut, if desired.
step-5: chill for 1 hour.
step-6: remove the bars from the baking dish by lifting the parchment paper.
step-7: cut into 12 individual bars.
step-8: serve immediately or store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.

step-1: add the chicken stock to a microwave-safe liquid measuring cup and microwave on high power for 3 minutes, until hot.
step-2: stir in the saffron threads and set aside.
step-3: on a cutting board, pat the shrimp dry with paper towels.
step-4: season with 1 teaspoon of salt and the pepper on both sides and set aside.
step-5: heat the olive oil in a 12-inch (30 cm) cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat until it begins to shimmer.
step-6: add the chorizo and cook, stirring, until browned in spots, 3 minutes.
step-7: add the onion and cook until softened, about 3 minutes.
step-8: add the garlic and paprika and cook, stirring, until aromatic, about 30 seconds.
step-9: add the rice and stir until lightly toasted, 1 minute.
step-10: add the tomatoes and reserved chicken stock and stir to combine.
step-11: reduce the heat to low and cover the pan with a lid.
step-12: cook without stirring until the rice is al dente, 15 minutes.
step-13: remove the lid and arrange the shrimp, mussels, and peas on top of the rice.
step-14: cover and increase the heat to medium-high.
step-15: cook until the shrimp are opaque and the mussels are open, 5 minutes.
step-16: discard any mussels that do not open.
step-17: remove the lid and pour the lemon juice over the paella.
step-18: sprinkle with the remaining teaspoon of salt and the parsley and serve.

step-1: add the ingredients into a mason jar.
step-2: screw the lid on tightly and shake vigorously.
step-3: the dressing can remain in the fridge for 1-2 weeks.
step-4: pour over your favorite salad ingredients and enjoy!

step-1: boil the water over medium high heat.
step-2: add a large pinch of salt.
step-3: add the cauliflower florets.
step-4: cover the pot and boil for 5-7 minutes, or until cauliflower is soft.
step-5: with a slotted spoon, add the cooked cauliflower to a blender.
step-6: add the milk, butter, garlic, salt, and pepper and blend until smooth.
step-7: toss the cooked pasta with cauliflower alfredo.
step-8: serve topped with parmesan, and parsley.

step-1: in a saucepan over medium high heat add cauliflower and water.
step-2: let steam for 5 minutes or until slightly tender.
step-3: drain the cauliflower and let cool in a medium mixing bowl.
step-4: once cool add cheddar cheese, egg, flour, green onion and salt to a bowl and mix until the mixture has a semi-creamy texture.
step-5: place a large pan over medium-high heat and add vegetable oil.
step-6: use a spoon to scoop out medium dollops of mixture and place it in the pan.
step-7: let cook on each side for about 3 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-8: remove from pan and place on paper towel to absorb excess oil.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: place a towel over a large bowl.
step-3: using a box grater, grate the head of cauliflower down to the stem over the bowl.
step-4: add the salt to the cauliflower, mix it in, and allow it to sit for 20 minutes.
step-5: after 20 minutes, use the towel to wring out the excess water from the cauliflower and return it to the bowl.
step-6: add the chickpeas, onion, bell pepper, garlic, cilantro, and spices to the cauliflower.
step-7: using a potato masher, mash the ingredients until thoroughly mixed together.
step-8: take a quarter of the mixture and shape it into a patty using your hands.
step-9: repeat with the remaining mixture to create four patties.
step-10: take the patties and place them on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes.
step-11: place patties on buns, and top with hummus, lettuce, tomato, and pickles.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (200°c).
step-2: using a food processor or a cheese grater, grate the cauliflower until fine or “riced.”
step-3: transfer the riced cauliflower to a large microwave-safe bowl, sprinkle with salt and microwave for 5 minutes.
step-4: this will steam the cauliflower to help you remove the moisture.
step-5: allow cauliflower to cool and transfer into a second bowl lined with a thin towel (cheesecloth and paper towels will also work).
step-6: wrap the cauliflower tightly and squeeze out the liquid.
step-7: you may need to switch towels to ensure as much liquid has been removed as possible.
step-8: return the cauliflower to your large bowl and add olive oil, garlic powder, onion, parmesan, salt, pepper, and 2 of the eggs.
step-9: combine well.
step-10: line a lightly greased muffin tin with the cauliflower mixture, using your fingers to press it firmly into the bottom and sides, creating a crust.
step-11: bake for 20-30 minutes, or until the crust turns golden brown.
step-12: pour the remaining whisked eggs evenly into the cauliflower cups, then add toppings of your choice.
step-13: we used tomatoes and basil, spinach and mushrooms, and broccoli and cheddar cheese.
step-14: bake an additional 15-20 minutes or until eggs are cooked through.
step-15: allow to cool slightly before serving.

step-1: preheat oven to 500˚f (260˚c).
step-2: remove the leaves and stem of the cauliflower.
step-3: transfer pieces to a food processor and rice the cauliflower by pulsing it in the food processor, or by shredding it on a box grater.
step-4: once riced, transfer to a large bowl and microwave for 4 minutes.
step-5: let it cool down for a few minutes before handling!
step-6: transfer cooked cauliflower to a clean towel and wring out as much liquid as possible.
step-7: place wrung cauliflower in a bowl and combine with mozzarella, oregano, basil, salt, garlic powder, and an egg.
step-8: mix well.
step-9: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-10: place cauliflower mixture in the middle.
step-11: spread out the mixture and form a circle out of the cauliflower mixture, pushing along the edge to raise a “crust.”
step-12: bake for 15 minutes, or until the crust has become golden brown in the center and on the edges.
step-13: top with your favorite pizza sauce and toppings, being careful not to overload the pizza.
step-14: bake for another 5-7 minutes, or until the cheese has fully melted.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: add the cauliflower to the bowl of a food processor and pulse until finely crumbled.
step-3: place in microwave-safe dish and microwave for 5 minutes.
step-4: allow to cool completely.
step-5: place cooked cauliflower into a towel and squeeze out as much water as possible.
step-6: discard liquid.
step-7: add the cauliflower to a bowl with 1 egg, parmesan cheese, garlic powder, and ¼ teaspoon salt in a bowl.
step-8: press crust mixture evenly into tart plate, making sure to go up the sides of the plate.
step-9: bake for 15-18 minutes, until golden.
step-10: set aside to cool.
step-11: reduce oven temperature to 375°f (190°c).
step-12: in a separate bowl, whisk together 5 eggs, milk, crumbled feta cheese, ½ teaspoon salt, and pepper.
step-13: in a medium skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
step-14: add asparagus pieces and cook until slightly tender.
step-15: add the spinach and cook until wilted.
step-16: place asparagus and spinach mixture on the bottom of the cooked cauliflower crust.
step-17: pour egg and cheese mixture over the top and sprinkle with green onions.
step-18: bake for 45 minutes, or until quiche is set and slightly golden.
step-19: let cool for 15 minutes before serving.

step-1: microwave cauliflower for 15 minutes or until tender.
step-2: mash cauliflower, mix in salt, pepper, garlic, onions, parsley, flour, grated parmesan and egg.
step-3: from patties with the mashed cauliflower mix.
step-4: coat both sides of patties with wheat flour.
step-5: fry in oil until golden brown and crispy on both sides.
step-6: add sour cream or chives to taste.

step-1: add the cauliflower to a steamer basket set over a medium pot of boiling water.
step-2: cover and steam for 10 minutes, or until fork-tender.
step-3: transfer the cauliflower to a clean dish towel and squeeze the excess water into a bowl.
step-4: transfer the squeezed cauliflower to a food processor.
step-5: add the flour, salt, and olive oil and pulse until the dough forms a ball.
step-6: transfer the dough to a lightly floured surface and knead for 3-4 minutes, or until the dough bounces back when poked.
step-7: shape the dough into a ball, then cut into 4 equal pieces
step-8: working 1 piece at a time, cut in half again, then roll out a rope about 6 inches (3-cm) long and 1 inch (2-cm) wide.
step-9: slice each rope into ½-inch (1-cm) pieces.
step-10: roll each piece along the back of a fork to create a line pattern.
step-11: transfer the gnocchi to a large pot of salted boiling water.
step-12: boil until the gnocchi float to the surface, 3-5 minutes, then remove with a slotted spoon.
step-13: toss the gnocchi with pesto sauce and serve immediately.

step-1: grate a cauliflower over a large bowl.
step-2: sprinkle a pinch of salt over the grated cauliflower and mix evenly.
step-3: leave to sit for 20 minutes.
step-4: pour the cauliflower into a clean kitchen towel and wring the water out.
step-5: in a large bowl, combine the cauliflower, and remaining ingredients, (except your cheese and toppings) stir until well mixed.
step-6: using a spoon transfer two hearty scoops of mixture to form each “bread slice” onto a skillet on medium-low heat for about 10 minutes, each side.
step-7: add your cheese and any other toppings, allow a couple minutes for cheese to melt.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: using a coarse grater, grate the cauliflower until the entire head has crumbled down into small bit.
step-3: transfer the cauliflower bits to a bowl and sprinkle over a ½ teaspoon of the salt.
step-4: mix the cauliflower to incorporate the salt and let sit for 20 minutes to draw out moisture.
step-5: transfer the soaking cauliflower to another bowl lined with a large towel.
step-6: wrap the towel closed and squeeze so that all of the excess liquid is strained.
step-7: transfer the cauliflower back into the first bowl used and mix with the cheese, chives, garlic, olive oil, basil, black pepper, eggs and remaining ½ teaspoon of salt.
step-8: turnover a large roasting tray and line with parchment paper - this helps prevent burning on the bottom of the hash browns.
step-9: divide the cauliflower mixture into 6 even portions, place on the tray, and shape into hash browns.
step-10: bake for 35-40 minutes, until golden brown.
step-11: let the hash browns cool for about 15 minutes until they have set.
step-12: serve with desired dipping sauce.

step-1: cut the cauliflower in half and break it into small florets.
step-2: place the florets in a food processor and pulse until they break down to rice-size pieces.
step-3: remove from the processor and set aside.
step-4: add the mushrooms to the food processor and pulse until broken down to rice-size pieces.
step-5: heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
step-6: add the onion and garlic to the pan and cook for about 4 minutes, until fragrant and the onion is translucent.
step-7: add the cauliflower, mushrooms, cumin, smoked paprika, chili powder, soy sauce, salt, and pepper and stir.
step-8: cook for about 10 minutes, until the cauliflower and mushroom mixture is tender and the water released from the mushrooms has evaporated.
step-9: add the rice to a bowl and top with cauliflower “meat” and your favorite toppings.
step-10: serve with a lime wedge and garnish with cilantro.
step-11: if you have leftovers, the cauliflower “meat” will keep refrigerated in an airtight container for about 2 days.

step-1: cut the cauliflower in half and break it into small florets.
step-2: place the florets in a food processor and pulse until they break down to rice-size pieces.
step-3: remove from the processor and set aside.
step-4: add the mushrooms to the food processor and pulse until broken down to rice-size pieces.
step-5: heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
step-6: add the onion and garlic to the pan and cook for about 4 minutes, until fragrant and the onion is translucent.
step-7: add the cauliflower, mushrooms, cumin, smoked paprika, chili powder, soy sauce, salt, and pepper and stir.
step-8: cook for about 10 minutes, until the cauliflower and mushroom mixture is tender and the water released from the mushrooms has evaporated.
step-9: preheat the oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-10: add the tortilla chips to an oven-proof dish.
step-11: load with the cauliflower “meat” and other toppings of your choice.
step-12: sprinkle with the shredded cheese.
step-13: bake for about 10 minutes, until the cheese has melted.
step-14: let cool for 5 minutes, then garnish with cilantro and serve.

step-1: cut the cauliflower in half and break it into small florets.
step-2: place the florets in a food processor and pulse until they break down to rice-size pieces.
step-3: remove from the processor and set aside.
step-4: add the mushrooms to the food processor and pulse until broken down to rice-size pieces.
step-5: heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
step-6: add the onion and garlic to the pan and cook for about 4 minutes, until fragrant and the onion is translucent.
step-7: add the cauliflower, mushrooms, cumin, smoked paprika, chili powder, soy sauce, salt, and pepper and stir.
step-8: cook for about 10 minutes, until the cauliflower and mushroom mixture is tender and the water released from the mushrooms has evaporated.
step-9: heat a tortilla over low heat in a large, greased skillet.
step-10: sprinkle the tortilla with a layer of cheese, then add a layer of cauliflower “meat”, caramelized onions and peppers, and another layer of cheese.
step-11: top with another tortilla and cook for about 4 minutes, until the bottom layer of cheese has melted and the bottom tortilla is golden brown.
step-12: carefully flip the quesadilla and cook for another 4 minutes, until all of the cheese has melted.
step-13: repeat.
step-14: slice each tortilla into wedges and serve.

step-1: cut the cauliflower in half and break it into small florets.
step-2: place the florets in a food processor and pulse until they break down to rice-size pieces.
step-3: remove from the processor and set aside.
step-4: add the mushrooms to the food processor and pulse until broken down to rice-size pieces.
step-5: heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
step-6: add the onion and garlic to the pan and cook for about 4 minutes, until fragrant and the onion is translucent.
step-7: add the cauliflower, mushrooms, cumin, smoked paprika, chili powder, soy sauce, salt, and pepper and stir.
step-8: cook for about 10 minutes, until the cauliflower and mushroom mixture is tender and the water released from the mushrooms has evaporated.
step-9: add the cauliflower “meat” to the tortilla, along with your favorite toppings.
step-10: serve with a lime wedge.
step-11: if you have leftovers, the cauliflower “meat” will keep refrigerated in an airtight container for about 2 days.

step-1: melt butter on medium heat in a large pot.
step-2: add the garlic and onion, and sauté 1-2 minutes until onion is translucent.
step-3: stir in salt and pepper.
step-4: add the cauliflower, vegetable broth, and water, then stir.
step-5: bring to a boil.
step-6: add the thyme then cover and reduce to a simmer for 15 minutes.
step-7: uncover and remove the thyme.
step-8: use an immersion or countertop blender to blend the soup until smooth.
step-9: mix in vegetarian parmesan and chives.
step-10: allow to cool 2 minutes then serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚f).
step-2: add the cauliflower to the bowl of a food processor, and pulse until it becomes the size of rice.
step-3: place the cauliflower in a microwave-safe bowl and microwave on high for 3 minutes, or until it begins to steam.
step-4: remove the cauliflower and place on a clean kitchen towel.
step-5: wrap the towel around the cauliflower, and squeeze out as much liquid as possible.
step-6: discard the liquid and transfer the cauliflower to a bowl.
step-7: add the parmesan, egg, salt, almond flour, and oregano to the bowl with the cauliflower.
step-8: stir to combine.
step-9: transfer the mixture to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and use your hands to form it into a round disk, ½-inch (1 cm) thick and 10-inches (25 cm) in diameter.
step-10: bake the crust for 25 to 30 minutes, or until the crust begins to brown.
step-11: top the crust with marinara sauce, mozzarella, and basil, or other toppings of your choice, and bake for 10 more minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: slice cauliflower into small florets.
step-3: place cauliflower onto baking sheet and season with salt, pepper, and olive oil.
step-4: bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes or until lightly browned and a bit crispy.
step-5: in a large bowl, combine all dressing ingredients.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: once cauliflower is cooked, set aside and let cool slightly.
step-8: dice eggs, onion, and celery.
step-9: in a large bowl, combine cauliflower, eggs, onion, celery, and dressing.
step-10: garnish with more freshly chopped dill before serving.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: in a large bowl add the cauliflower rice, broccoli, chicken, mozzarella, cheddar, garlic powder, onion powder, and salt.
step-3: stir well to combine.
step-4: add mixture to a baking pan then cover with aluminum foil.
step-5: bake for 40 minutes.
step-6: uncover then top with remaining cheddar.
step-7: bake for 10 minutes.
step-8: remove and allow to cool for 5-10 minutes.
step-9: garnish with parsley, if desired and serve.

step-1: pulse cauliflower in a food processor until broken into rice-sized pieces.
step-2: heat the sesame oil in a large skillet or wok.
step-3: toss in the carrots and sauté until soft, about 5 minutes.
step-4: add in the garlic and shrimp and sautée until the shrimp begin to turn pink, about 2 minutes.
step-5: add the peas and cauliflower rice and mix until the cauliflower has warmed through.
step-6: move the contents of the pan to the side to create a well in the center.
step-7: pour in the eggs and slowly scraped the cooked bits off the bottom of the pan to scramble the eggs.
step-8: once the eggs are almost finished cooking, mix everything in the pan together.
step-9: season the cauliflower with white pepper and soy sauce, give one last good mix to combine and serve with a garnish of sliced green onion.

step-1: on a cutting board, use a knife to remove the cauliflower florets.
step-2: discard the stem.
step-3: in a medium saucepan, bring the water to a rolling boil, season with salt, and add cauliflower.
step-4: cover and cook for 6-7 minutes, until a knife can easily run through the florets.
step-5: transfer the cauliflower to a blender with a slotted spoon.
step-6: reserve the water.
step-7: add cauliflower, pepper, and 1 cup (235 ml) of cauliflower stock to a blender and blend until a smooth consistency is reached.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: remove the green leaves from the cauliflower stem with a knife.
step-4: place the cauliflower core-down on a cutting board and trim 2 sides so they become flat.
step-5: cut the cauliflower in half and then cut each half in two to get 4 “steaks”.
step-6: rinse and dry the cauliflower steaks.
step-7: in a small bowl, combine the olive oil, lemon juice, basil, oregano, thyme, rosemary, onion, and garlic, plus salt and pepper to taste.
step-8: mix well.
step-9: place the cauliflower steaks on the baking sheet and brush generously with the oil mixture.
step-10: bake for about 25 minutes, flipping halfway, until tender.
step-11: serve as desired, such as on a sandwich with pesto and red pepper, or with barbecue sauce and roasted potatoes, or with vegan mushroom gravy and lentils.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f/190˚c.
step-2: chop the head of cauliflower into small pieces.
step-3: pulse in a food processor until cauliflower is finer than rice.
step-4: place in a bowl and salt, to taste.
step-5: microwave for 4 minutes.
step-6: drain the cauliflower using a kitchen towel and squeeze out all the excess water.
step-7: after draining add the cauliflower into a bowl and mix in the eggs, lime juice, pepper, dried oregano, paprika, and chili powder.
step-8: mix together.
step-9: roll out 6 balls of the mixture and then press onto a baking sheet.
step-10: bake for 10 minutes, flip and then bake for another 10 minutes, or until edges are crispy.
step-11: after cooling, fill with your desired fillings

step-1: preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: fill a saucepan with water and bring to a boil.
step-3: aggressively season it with salt.
step-4: blanch the cauliflower in boiling water for about 5 minutes.
step-5: drain and finely chop the cooked cauliflower.
step-6: in a mixing bowl, add cauliflower, egg, bread crumbs, cheddar cheese, parmesan cheese, garlic, and salt.
step-7: chill in the refrigerator for 15-20 minutes.
step-8: spray a nonstick baking sheet with nonstick spray.
step-9: shape the mixture into tot shapes and spread them evenly on the sheet.
step-10: bake for 10 minutes at 400°f (200°c).
step-11: flip and then bake for an additional 10 minutes on the other side until golden brown.

step-1: take a large frying pan and place over a low/medium heat.
step-2: add the butter and leave to melt and foam for a minute or so.
step-3: next add the onions, mushrooms, garlic, salt and pepper.
step-4: slowly cook for around 10 minutes whilst continually stirring.
step-5: you want the mushrooms to halve in size and the onions to be golden brown.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: take the celery sticks and peel the top ridged side to remove some of the stringy texture.
step-8: then cut into a small dice.
step-9: place the onions and mushrooms back onto the heat and add the diced celery.
step-10: stir for around a minute to warm through the celery and coat it with all the meaty flavour of the mushrooms and butter.
step-11: next add to mushroom and celery mixture to mash potato and mix to combine.
step-12: once combined take around a tablespoon of mixture and form into a croquette shape.
step-13: place the flour, eggs and breadcrumbs in three seperate bowls.
step-14: to coat the croquettes, coat each croquet in flour, making sure to dust the excess off.
step-15: then dip in egg, then breadcrumbs.
step-16: place back into the eggs then back into the bread crumbs to give an extra thick and crunchy coating.
step-17: place a large pot over a medium heat and add the oil.
step-18: heat the oil to 180˚c (350˚f).
step-19: carefully place the croquettes into the oil and cook for 2-3 minutes or until golden brown.
step-20: (cook the croquettes in batches of 5-6 depending on how large your pot.
step-21: if you cook too many at a time the oil may bubble over)
step-22: once cooked, drain kitchen towel to remove excess fat.
step-23: serve with an extra sprinkle of coriander and a sprinkle of sea salt.

step-1: fill cupcake wrappers ¼-full with cake batter.
step-2: you want the baked cupcakes to not quite reach the top edge of the wrapper.
step-3: bake cupcakes according to whatever batter is being used.
step-4: remove at the lower end of what your box mix recommends, or when a toothpick poked into a cupcake comes out clean.
step-5: in a gallon-sized bag, crush cereal into small crumbs.
step-6: in a large bowl, combine cereal crumbs and butter.
step-7: using the small end of a spatula, poke holes in the cupcakes.
step-8: fill holes with sweetened condensed milk.
step-9: top cupcakes with cereal crumb mixture and pack down with a spoon, creating a uniform crust.
step-10: individually wrap cupcakes in plastic wrap.
step-11: chill cupcakes in cooler or refrigerator until ready to eat.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: make the muffin batter: in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, cinnamon, ginger, cardamom, nutmeg, baking soda, and salt with a fork.
step-3: in a separate large bowl, combine the applesauce, brown sugar, eggs, vanilla, and vegetable oil.
step-4: mix with a fork, then gradually incorporate the dry ingredients until the batter is thick and smooth.
step-5: make the cheesecake filling: in a medium bowl, use a fork to mix together the cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla until fluffy and smooth.
step-6: grease a 2 12-cup muffin tin with nonstick spray.
step-7: scoop about ¼ cup (30 g) of muffin batter into each cup.
step-8: add a teaspoon of cheesecake filling to the center of each cup.
step-9: use a toothpick to swirl the cheesecake into the batter.
step-10: bake for 18 minutes, or until the muffins are springy and lightly browned around the edges.
step-11: let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180˚c).
step-2: grease a 9-inch (23-cm) round cake pan with olive oil, using a paper towel to spread evenly.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the polenta, almond flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
step-4: stir well.
step-5: zest and juice the orange.
step-6: add the orange zest and juice to a separate large bowl with the eggs, olive oil, maple syrup, vanilla, cardamom, cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves.
step-7: whisk well to combine.
step-8: add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and gently fold with a rubber spatula until fully incorporated.
step-9: fold in the diced plums.
step-10: pour the batter into the prepared pan.
step-11: arrange the sliced plum decoratively on top of the cake in a circular pattern.
step-12: bake the cake for 50-55 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
step-13: let cool for 20 minutes, then remove from the cake pan.
step-14: slice and serve with whipped cream and more orange zest, if desired.
step-15: nutrition per serving, not including whipped cream - calories: 519, total fat: 42 grams, sodium: 334 mg, total carbs: 30 grams, dietary fiber: 4 grams, sugars: 19 grams, protein: 9 grams

step-1: boil two cups of water.
step-2: mix 4 packets of unflavored gelatin into the water.
step-3: let cool for a few minutes.
step-4: add one bottle of cream or vanilla soda, and ¾ of a bottle of champagne.
step-5: cover and refrigerate 3-5 hours.
step-6: (over night for a definite set)
step-7: if set in a pan, use a knife sprayed with cooking oil to cut.
step-8: or to make life easier, refrigerate in separate plastic cups.
step-9: top with sprinkles and/or pop rocks, directly before serving!
step-10: the pop rocks/ sprinkles will melt, so be sure to consume quickly!

step-1: in a large freezer bag, place a piece of dry ice.
step-2: close the plastic bag, but leave a one-inch opening to prevent the bag from fill with gas.
step-3: cover the bag with a kitchen towel and carefully use a kitchen mallet to break the dry ice into a powder.
step-4: in a large bowl, combine heavy cream, half & half, sugar, activate charcoal (avoid consuming more than 100 grams of activated charcoal), 2 tablespoons mint extract, and at least 4 tablespoons black food coloring (more food coloring might be needed depending on concentration).
step-5: whisk together ice cream mixture until frothy.
step-6: slowly add a spoonful of dry ice into the mixture and whisk together.
step-7: gradually add and mix in dry ice until a solid consistency is achieved.
step-8: wait for all the dry ice to evaporate before consuming.
step-9: do not eat solid dry ice.
step-10: for best results, eat within 24 hours.

step-1: slice the top of both cakes to create a flat surface.
step-2: cut both cakes in half widthwise to create four cakes.
step-3: place a small plate on top of the cake and cut around to create a smaller circle.
step-4: place a glass in the middle of the cake and cut around to create an even smaller circle.
step-5: assemble the first layer by placing the outside chocolate ring on a plate or cake stand.
step-6: insert the next yellow cake ring and then the inner chocolate cake ring.
step-7: frost the cake with a thin layer of frosting in between each layer.
step-8: continue forming layers alternating the colors on the outside.
step-9: after the fourth layer frost the entire cake and cool in the refrigerator.
step-10: slice and serve.

step-1: in a food processor, or by hand, crush ½ a box of triscuits.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: combine all of the filling ingredients in a large bowl.
step-4: pinch off bite sized balls of filling and roll between your hands (about 1 oz or 28g each).
step-5: roll the balls in the crushed triscuit mixture, then coat it in beaten egg, then again in triscuit mixture.
step-6: heat a sauce pan of vegetable oil to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-7: line a tray with paper towel to drain the fried bites.
step-8: fry each bite until triscuit coating turns a light brown, about 45 seconds.
step-9: note: if they’re fried too long, the cheese filling will escape and you’ll be left with a sad shell of a former cheese bite.
step-10: garnish with more chopped dill and a squeeze of lemon.
step-11: serve immediately.

step-1: combine cheese, bacon pieces, jalapeños, and ranch in a bowl.
step-2: stir together and refrigerate.
step-3: season the ground beef with salt and pepper in a large bowl, and mix in with your hands.
step-4: grab a baseball-sized piece of beef.
step-5: roll it with your hands into a ball and place on a parchment lined baking tray.
step-6: using a clean, empty soda or beer can, press the ball of beef around the can to create a bowl.
step-7: make sure to smooth out any cracks.
step-8: fill the bowls with the cheddar mixture and refrigerate for 2 hours.
step-9: preheat the grill to 350˚f (175˚c).
step-10: cook burger bowls over indirect heat for 25-30 minutes.
step-11: serve with or without a bun with your favorite toppings.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375ºf (190ºc).
step-2: make the filling: melt the butter in a large cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat.
step-3: add the the flour and whisk until bubbling.
step-4: whisk in the milk until smooth, then add the chicken, peas and carrots, pearl onions, potato, salt, and pepper .
step-5: stir until everything is well coated, then continue to cook until the filling is bubbling and the liquid has thickened slightly, 7-10 minutes.
step-6: remove the pan from the heat.
step-7: make the biscuits: in a large bowl, stir together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
step-8: using your a fork, your hands, or a pastry cutter, work the butter into the dry ingredients, leaving pea-sized chunks.
step-9: add the buttermilk and fold with a rubber spatula until a thick dough comes together.
step-10: turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface.
step-11: bring the dough together into one large mass, then roll out with a rolling pin to about 1 ½-2 inches (4-5 centimeters) thick.
step-12: using a 2-3-inch (5-7 centimeter) biscuit cutter or small glass dipped in flour, cut out rounds from the dough.
step-13: cut out all of the rounds, then place on top of the filling so the dough does not warm too much.
step-14: re-roll the dough scraps if needed.
step-15: you should have about 10 biscuits total.
step-16: brush tops of the biscuits with the beaten egg and top with cheddar cheese.
step-17: bake for 25-30 minutes, until the biscuits are golden brown and cooked through.
step-18: carefully remove from the oven and let cool for 10 minutes.
step-19: garnish with chives before serving.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350ºf (175ºc).
step-2: carefully slice 3 gold potatoes into ⅛-inch (3-mm) slices using a knife or mandoline.
step-3: place cheddar crackers into a ziplock bag and crush them so that they reach a powdery state.
step-4: in a large bowl, mix the potato chips with oil, cheddar powder, and salt.
step-5: arrange chips on greased baking sheet
step-6: bake for 30-35 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c) degrees.
step-2: peel and grate the potatoes, and soak them in ice water.
step-3: squeeze out excess water and place potatoes in a bowl.
step-4: add the rest of the ingredients to the bowl and mix well.
step-5: on a nonstick pan, form patties of the potato mixture with your hands.
step-6: bake for 35-40 minutes or until brown and crispy.

step-1: in a large bowl add the ingredients.
step-2: mix well.
step-3: in a large skillet, heat a half cup of oil (or until entire skillet is covered with a thin layer) over medium-high heat.
step-4: spoon 2 tablespoons of mixture to form each fritter into the hot oil.
step-5: flip after about a minute and a half or when you can see the edges beginning to brown.
step-6: repeat for other side.
step-7: serve with a dollop of sour cream and chives.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: add 2 cups (200 g) of cheddar cheese and the butter to a large bowl.
