step-3: mix to combine with an electric hand mixer or stand mixer.
step-4: add the flour, paprika, garlic powder, and 2 teaspoons salt and mix well.
step-5: add 3 tablespoons of ice water and mix.
step-6: add the remaining ice water 1 tablespoon at a time.
step-7: the dough should hold together when pinched, but crumble apart if you break it up in your hand.
step-8: if it seems too dry, add a bit more ice water.
step-9: transfer the dough to a clean surface and knead with your hands until it comes together.
step-10: shape the dough into a disc, then wrap in plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-11: lightly flour a clean surface and roll out the dough into a circle about ⅛ inch (8 mm) thick.
step-12: carefully transfer the crust to a 9½-inch (24-cm) glass pie dish.
step-13: trim the edges (save the trimmings to make crackers!).
step-14: poke holes in the bottom of the crust with a fork, then use the tines to crimp the edges.
step-15: line the dough with parchment paper and fill with pie weights.
step-16: bake for 30 minutes, until the edges are crisp.
step-17: while the crust is baking, prepare the fillings.
step-18: in a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook the bacon until crisp, 5-7 minutes.
step-19: using tongs, remove the bacon from the skillet and let drain on paper towels until cool enough to handle.
step-20: add the broccoli to the skillet and cook until lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
step-21: remove the pan from the heat.
step-22: chop the bacon.
step-23: remove the pie weights from the crust, then add the broccoli and chopped bacon to the center.
step-24: sprinkle with the remaining shredded cheddar cheese.
step-25: in a medium bowl, lightly beat the eggs.
step-26: add the milk, remaining ½ teaspoon salt, and the pepper.
step-27: whisk to combine.
step-28: pour the egg mixture over the fillings in the crust.
step-29: bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the eggs are set and the top is lightly browned.
step-30: cover the edges with tinfoil if they are starting to burn.
step-31: let the quiche cool for 15 minutes before slicing and serving.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: place cheese crackers in a resealable bag and crush with a rolling pin until they become finely ground.
step-3: add pepper, if desired.
step-4: in a separate bowl, beat eggs until smooth.
step-5: roll each chicken piece into flour and then coat into eggs.
step-6: place each chicken piece in the cracker crumbs.
step-7: coat the chicken with the crumbs.
step-8: arrange chicken pieces on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-9: in a medium bowl, combine broccoli and potatoes.
step-10: add olive oil, rosemary, garlic, salt and pepper.
step-11: toss until vegetables are well-coated.
step-12: arrange vegetables on parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-13: bake chicken and veggies for 35-40 minutes or until chicken is golden brown and cooked through.
step-14: top chicken with parsley and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220˚c).
step-2: wrap cauliflower in a clean dish towel, then turn it upside down and bang it against the surface of your counter until you feel the cauliflower crack (be sure to rotate to break it up on all sides).
step-3: pull florets off of stem and break apart the bigger florets into smaller pieces.
step-4: microwave florets for 4 minutes.
step-5: in one small bowl, pour flour; in another, whisk two eggs; and in a medium bowl, combine your bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, and cheddar cheese.
step-6: coat each piece in flour, followed by the eggs and finally the bread crumb mixture.
step-7: spray a baking sheet and place all cauliflower bites in it, then drizzle olive oil over them or spray with cooking spray.
step-8: bake in the oven for 30 minutes or until golden brown.
step-9: serve with marinara, ranch, or sour cream.

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (225˚c).
step-2: on a cutting board, slice chicken breasts against the grain into strips.
step-3: place the chicken strips in a bowl and add in buttermilk and ranch packet.
step-4: stir until well-coated.
step-5: cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place in the refrigerator for at least an hour.
step-6: pour cheese crackers into a resealable bag and crush with a rolling pin until they become finely ground.
step-7: open the bag and place a marinated piece of chicken in the cracker crumbs.
step-8: coat the chicken with the crumbs and place on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-9: bake for 20 minutes, flipping halfway.

step-1: chop chicken breasts into bite-size pieces.
step-2: in a large bowl, combine chicken, buttermilk, and ranch packet.
step-3: refrigerate for 2 hours.
step-4: in a large ziplock bag, crumble the cheese crackers into desired crumbs (to replace bread crumbs).
step-5: place cracker crumbs into a medium bowl and coat each piece of chicken until fully covered.
step-6: heat oil to 350°f (180°c) and fry chicken until crackers turn golden brown (3 minutes).
step-7: place on a paper towel to dry.
step-8: serve with a side of ranch or any sauce.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200˚c).
step-2: slice the potatoes in half, lengthwise, then slice each half lengthwise three times and across four times, to cube.
step-3: bring a large pot of water to a boil and drop in chopped potatoes, cook 10 minutes.
step-4: drain potatoes and mix in ranch, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper.
step-5: transfer to a 9x13-inch (23x33 cm) baking dish.
step-6: bake for 30-35 minutes, or until nicely browned.
step-7: while still hot, mix in cheddar and chives.
step-8: allow to cool for 5 minutes.

step-1: add the breakfast sausage to a large nonstick skillet over medium heat.
step-2: cook, breaking up with a spatula until no longer pink, 7-8 minutes.
step-3: add the white and light green scallions, ½ of the bell pepper, and ½ of the spinach.
step-4: sauté for 2 minutes, until the spinach is wilted, then add the rest of the spinach and continue cooking until wilted.
step-5: remove the pan from the heat and let cool.
step-6: in a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, salt, and garlic powder.
step-7: add the milk and whisk to incorporate.
step-8: grease a 9 (22 cm) x 13-inch (33 cm) glass baking dish with nonstick spray.
step-9: add the cubed bread to the baking dish.
step-10: if you don’t have day-old bread, spread the cubed bread on a baking sheet and dry out in a 300˚f (150˚c) oven for 15-20 minutes.
step-11: sprinkle 1 cup (100 g) of shredded cheese over the bread, then evenly spread the sausage mixture on top.
step-12: pour the egg mixture over the sausage mixture.
step-13: cover the baking dish with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or overnight.
step-14: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-15: in a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, combine the chicken stock and heavy cream.
step-16: pour over the chilled bake.
step-17: sprinkle the remaining cup of cheese and remaining bell pepper over the top.
step-18: cover with foil and bake for 45 minutes, then uncover and bake for another 15-20 minutes, until the custard is set and the cheese is golden brown.
step-19: remove from oven and let cool for 15 minutes.
step-20: garnish with the dark green scallions, then slice and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 325˚f (160˚c).
step-2: using an electric hand mixer or stand mixer, beat the cheese, butter, and salt in a large bowl.
step-3: once combined, mix in the flour and add the ice water one tablespoon at a time.
step-4: the dough should hold together when pressed but crumble apart if you break it up in your hand.
step-5: if it seems too dry, add a little more ice water.
step-6: divide the dough in half and pack together into 2 discs.
step-7: wrap in parchment paper and chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-8: roll out the dough to ¼ inch (6 mm) thick, pinching together the cracks on the edges.
step-9: trace and cut out 6 spoon shapes from each disc of dough.
step-10: place the cut-out cheese spoons on top of greased, upside-down spoons on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-11: lightly press down to mold the dough to each spoon’s shape.
step-12: bake for 25 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-13: serve with layered taco dip, if desired.

step-1: combine bisquick and butter together until you have a crumbly mix.
step-2: add milk, dried parsley and shredded cheddar.
step-3: the dough will be sticky.
step-4: take a handful of dough, flatten, place a cube of cheese in the middle and roll the dough around the cube of cheese.
step-5: place on a parchment lined baking sheet and bake for 45 minutes at 450°f (232°c)
step-6: while the biscuits are baking, make the butter topping.
step-7: melt the butter and add in the garlic powder and old bay seasoning.
step-8: once the biscuits are done baking, brush the butter topping over each biscuit.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: cut off the top of the bread.
step-3: use a bread knife to cut around the inside of the bread and scoop the center out.
step-4: cut all the removed bread into bite-sized cubes.
step-5: mix two teaspoons of crushed garlic into the melted butter.
step-6: brush the garlic butter on the bottom and the inside walls of the bread boat.
step-7: dip all the bread cubes in the remaining garlic butter, set aside.
step-8: combine the cream cheese, cheddar, mozzarella, milk, remaining crushed garlic, salt, and pepper in a medium bowl.
step-9: pour the cheese mixture into the bread boat.
step-10: brush the top of the cheese mixture with egg yolk.
step-11: place the bread boat and the bread cubes on a baking sheet.
step-12: bake for 15 minutes, remove the croutons, and continue cooking the bread boat for another 15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and a golden brown crust is formed.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a large pan, melt 4 tablespoons of butter over medium heat.
step-3: whisk in the flour, reducing heat to medium-low, cooking for 1 minute.
step-4: gradually whisk in the milk and water.
step-5: add the macaroni and cook over medium-high heat until boiling.
step-6: stir frequently for 8 to 10 minutes, until the pasta is al dente.
step-7: remove the pan from the heat and add the cream cheese, cheddar cheese, fontina, gouda, and cayenne, and season with salt and pepper.
step-8: stir until fully combined.
step-9: transfer the mixture to a grease baking dish.
step-10: in a medium skillet, melt the remaining 3 tablespoons of butter over medium-low heat.
step-11: add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds, stirring frequently.
step-12: add the crushed crackers and stir to combine.
step-13: toast the crumbs until browned, stirring for 3 to 5 minutes.
step-14: remove the pan from the heat.
step-15: sprinkle the toasted crumbs over the macaroni and cheese, and bake for 15 to 20 minutes.
step-16: remove from the oven and rest for 5 minutes.
step-17: serve with fresh basil

step-1: tear up the two slices of bread and blend into soft breadcrumbs.
step-2: add the breadcrumbs, grated potato, grated cheddar cheese, spring onions, egg and salt and pepper to a large bowl and mix until properly combined.
step-3: add the marmite and a splash of water to a small bowl and microwave until slightly runny.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: dust the surface with plan flour and roll out 500g (2 cups) of shortcrust pastry into a rectangular shape the thickness of a pound coin.
step-6: use a 15-16cm (6 in) diameter bowl to cut out circles of the pastry.
step-7: brush the marmite in a circle in the middle of the circle, leaving a 2-3cm (1 in) border around the edge.
step-8: add 2-3 tbsp of the potato filling on top.
step-9: brush the border with egg wash and fold over into a semi circle shape, making sure it is sealed.
step-10: crimp the sealed edges so that the filling is extra secure.
step-11: brush with more egg wash.
step-12: re-roll any leftover pastry to make more!
step-13: bake for around 50 mins at 150°c (300°f) until golden brown.

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine the butter and milk and microwave for 50 seconds.
step-2: mix with a spatula until the butter is completely melted.
step-3: add the active dry yeast and mix well.
step-4: add the salt and sugar and mix well.
step-5: fold in the bread flour and cake flour until fully incorporated and microwave for 20 seconds.
step-6: transfer the dough to a floured surface and divide it into 6 pieces.
step-7: take a piece and roll it into a ball.
step-8: roll it out to a round about ⅛ inch (3-mm) thick using a rolling pin.
step-9: repeat with the remaining dough.
step-10: put a third of the cheese into the center of the dough.
step-11: top with another dough round and crimp the edges to seal.
step-12: repeat with the remaining cheese and dough.
step-13: heat a medium nonstick frying pan over medium heat.
step-14: add a filled naan round and cook for 3 minutes, until lightly browned.
step-15: flip the naan bread, then use a spatula to flatten and cook for 3 minutes more.
step-16: cook the remaining naan.
step-17: slice into wedges and serve.

step-1: preheat your oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: freshly shred the cheese.
step-3: place your cheese in neat piles on an ungreased baking sheet.
step-4: bake for about 8 minutes, until all the individual shreds melt into one disc.
step-5: be careful not to let the cheese color too much.
step-6: once they are all melted, let them cool for 2 minutes on your baking sheet, then lift them onto paper towels to blot off any excess grease.
step-7: to form the shells, lay them over a propped up utensil.
step-8: (or you can use anything in your kitchen, a wide bowl or saucepan could work too!) set these aside to cool.
step-9: to make the taco filling, brown the ground beef on high heat.
step-10: make a well in the center, add in the onion, jalapeños, garlic, and sprinkle in the taco seasoning packet.
step-11: stir to combine.
step-12: add water if you need it for a nice saucy filling.
step-13: use a fork to hold your cheese shell in place and fill with the beef mixture, and toppings of your choice.

step-1: cut just the top off an onion and place it cut-side down.
step-2: using a sharp knife, go around the root of the onion and make 4 evenly spaced cuts, being careful not to cut all the way through.
step-3: go back around and make 2 additional cuts between each quarter.
step-4: flip the onion over and coax apart its layers (or “petals”).
step-5: place 2 slices of mozzarella cheese on top of each other, cut them into ½-inch (1 cm) slices, then cut them in half.
step-6: place a piece of cheese in between all of the onion petals.
step-7: freeze the onion for 1 hour.
step-8: in a medium bowl, whisk together the milk and the eggs.
step-9: in large bowl, whisk together the flour, garlic salt, black pepper, and paprika.
step-10: place the onion in the wet mixture, turning it until every petal is coated.
step-11: place the onion in the dry mixture, coating every petal.
step-12: coat the onion in the egg wash and dry mixture one more time.
step-13: place onion in the freezer for 20 minutes.
step-14: heat canola oil to 375ºf (190ºc) in a deep-fryer or dutch oven.
step-15: with tongs, add the onion to the oil for 2 minutes or until it is browned and crispy on all sides.
step-16: move onion to plate covered in paper towels and allow to drain for 5 minutes.

step-1: slice the cheese into sticks (about the size of string cheese).
step-2: season the ground beef with salt and pepper (or your favorite seasoning mix) and split it up into 5-6 palm-sized balls (you may want to do five and keep a bit of excess ground beef for an omelet or a slider the next day).
step-3: flatten each ball out into a rectangle.
step-4: place a cheese stick towards the bottom.
step-5: roll it up, making sure that the ground beef is evenly concealing the cheese stick.
step-6: place the soon-to-be burger dogs on a hot grill.
step-7: grill for 6-10 minutes, turning the dogs when charred grill marks appear on a side.
step-8: you’ll need to do 3-4 turns (or more) to make sure you have even cooking around each dog.
step-9: burgers should be done when some cheese starts oozing out along with meat juice.
step-10: serve on hot dog buns with your favorite burger or hot dog condiments.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a bowl, mash the cauliflower until slightly combined.
step-3: add the egg, ¾ cup (90 g) bread crumbs, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and parsley, and mix with a fork until combined.
step-4: chill for 10 minutes.
step-5: form the mixture into nuggets with a cube of cheddar cheese in the center.
step-6: pack them tightly.
step-7: roll each nugget in flour, then egg, then bread crumbs.
step-8: place on a baking sheet covered in parchment paper.
step-9: bake for 18-20 minutes, flipping the nuggets halfway through.
step-10: brush with oil for browner nuggets.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: stretch pizza dough out into a rectangle.
step-3: cut into 8 equal-sized strips.
step-4: stretch strips lengthwise, and widthwise.
step-5: place mozzarella down the middle of each strip.
step-6: fold and pinch the dough around the cheese along the entire strip, ensuring to close off the ends.
step-7: form a pretzel shape by taking the ends of the strip, making a “u” shape, twisting the ends around each other twice and connecting the ends to the bottom of the “u” shape.
step-8: transfer to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-9: mix melted butter, garlic, and parsley and pour onto pretzels.
step-10: sprinkle parmesan evenly on top of the pretzels.
step-11: bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown.

step-1: cut the top off each jalapeño and core it, scraping out all the seeds, with the back side of a spoon.
step-2: fill the jalapeños with pepper jack cheese, either melted or cubed.
step-3: place the top back on the jalapeños and secure with two toothpicks inserted diagonally.
step-4: note: be sure each toothpick goes through both the top and the bottom of the jalapeño to secure it.
step-5: dredge in flour, eggs, then breadcrumbs.
step-6: for a thicker breading, double bread the jalapeños by repeating the egg and breadcrumb dredging.
step-7: heat oil to 325°f (160°c).
step-8: fry each jalapeño popper until golden brown (about 2-3 minutes).
step-9: cool and allow extra oil to drip off on a plate lined with paper towels.
step-10: remove the toothpicks.
step-11: season with salt and serve immediately once cooled enough to handle.

step-1: line a plate with two paper towels.
step-2: place two small portobello mushroom caps on the paper towels, then cover with two more paper towels.
step-3: top with another plate.
step-4: meanwhile, in a small bowl, mix together mayonnaise, ketchup, worcestershire sauce, garlic salt, and hot chili sauce.
step-5: place a slice of swiss cheese down on a counter top, then place a slice of american cheese on top, folding the corners of the american cheese in towards the center.
step-6: do the same with swiss cheese, forming a ball shape.
step-7: place the cheese ball on one mushroom cap and then sandwich the other on top of it, pressing down to make the mushroom edges touch.
step-8: take a piece of clear plastic wrap and wrap it around the mushroom burger, twisting the sides like a piece of candy to release all of the air.
step-9: tuck the plastic wrap under the mushroom and refrigerate for 10-15 minutes.
step-10: put the egg, flour, and bread crumbs into 3 separate bowls.
step-11: remove plastic and coat mushroom burger in flour, egg, then bread crumbs.
step-12: dip in egg wash and bread crumbs one more time.
step-13: heat vegetable oil in a large pan until it is 375ºf (190ºc) and fry mushroom burger for 1-2 minutes or until golden brown.
step-14: remove burger onto paper towel to drain excess oil and let cool 1-2 minutes.
step-15: assemble burger, spread special sauce on buns.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: unroll the dough, it should form 15x9-inch (38x22 cm) rectangle, then cut the rectangle horizontally into three equal strips.
step-3: (these will be your three pretzels.)
step-4: carefully stretch each of the strips by width and length — stretch each to about 3 inch (7 ½ cm) width and about 34 inch (86 cm) length.
step-5: sprinkle 1 cup (100g) of cheese down the center of each dough strip.
step-6: reserve the last 1 cup (100g) of cheese for later.
step-7: fold the dough over the cheese, pressing to seal and rolling slightly to create 3 dough logs filled with cheese.
step-8: cover a baking sheet with foil and spray with vegetable oil.
step-9: to form the pretzels, take one dough log, move it to the foil covered baking sheet, then form a circle with the ends of the log at the top of the circle.
step-10: twist the log ends around each other once and bring them down to meet the bottom of the circle.
step-11: repeat with the other two dough logs.
step-12: wrap pepperonis on the pretzels — 5-ish per pretzel — then sprinkle the remaining cup of cheese among the three pretzels.
step-13: bake 14-18 minutes until deep golden brown.
step-14: serve immediately with pizza sauce for dipping.

step-1: add ground beef, salt, and pepper to a large bowl.
step-2: combine until the meat is evenly seasoned.
step-3: roll into 16 meatballs and set aside.
step-4: cut each cheddar cheese block into 8 cubes (totaling 16 cubes).
step-5: press the cheddar cheese cube into the meatball and wrap the meat around it, completely covering the cheese.
step-6: preheat a skillet on medium heat for 10 minutes.
step-7: after preheated, carefully coat with a light layer of oil with a high smoke point (we used canola oil).
step-8: add sliders to the pan, frying on the first side until the bottom is browned and crisp and the sides begin to brown (about 2-4 minutes, depending on the desired doneness).
step-9: flip and finish cooking on the other side.
step-10: serve immediately on hawaiian sweet rolls with your favorite burger garnishes.
step-11: (we added roma tomatoes, red onion, lettuce, and sriracha mayo.)

step-1: crush the chips in a plastic bag.
step-2: in a bowl, combine all ingredients except the cheese and vegetable oil.
step-3: stir until fully incorporated.
step-4: with your hands, grab about a golf ball-sized amount of the ground beef mixture and slightly flatten it in your palm.
step-5: take 1 cube of cheese, place it in the the middle, and press the beef around it so the cheese is fully covered and in the center of the meatball.
step-6: heat a thin layer of vegetable oil in a cast-iron pan over medium to medium-high heat.
step-7: once the pan is hot, cook the meatballs.
step-8: rotate them throughout cooking to brown all sides and cook through.
step-9: once meatballs are fully cooked and browned, remove from the pan and top with salsa, sour cream, and cilantro.

step-1: combine thawed hash browns, flour, salt, pepper, and eggs in a bowl.
step-2: take a piece of cheese and wrap a palmful of the mixture around it, shaping it into a tot (you may have to squeeze out some excess moisture to make it nice and tight).
step-3: fill a large, deep skillet halfway with oil and heat over medium.
step-4: when the oil is hot, drop in some tots, turning them along the way until they're crispy and golden brown.
step-5: let cool a bit.

step-1: crumble and cook the beef in a skillet adding salt and pepper to season.
step-2: drain.
step-3: mix in ketchup, worcestershire, mustard, and brown sugar.
step-4: grease a muffin tin, and line 8 cups with the refrigerated biscuits.
step-5: divide the meat mixture among the 8 cups.
step-6: bake at 400°f (200°c) for 10-15 minutes, until the biscuit dough is brown.
step-7: top with cheese and bake an additional 5 minutes.
step-8: top with your favorite toppings and serve.

step-1: heat oil in a pot over medium heat to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a bowl, mix together the ground beef, salt, pepper, and onion powder.
step-3: peel and slice the onion into 1-centimeter (½ inch) rings.
step-4: detach the rings from each other.
step-5: take a spoonful of the beef mixture and press it into the bottom of a ring.
step-6: push a cheddar square into the center of the beef.
step-7: seal the top with another spoonful of the beef, pressing it flat.
step-8: repeat with the rest of the rings.
step-9: place the flour, eggs, and bread crumbs into three separate bowls.
step-10: dip a ring into the flour, shaking off excess, then into the egg, the bread crumbs, then back to the eggs, and one last time into the breadcrumbs.
step-11: repeat with the remaining rings.
step-12: fry the rings for 5-6 minutes, until deep golden-brown.
step-13: drain on a paper towel, then serve with ketchup!

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: cut the dough into 14 evenly sized pieces.
step-3: working one at a time, stretch out a piece of dough into a long strip, about 8 inches (20 cm) long.
step-4: place a piece of american cheese at the top, followed by a meatball, and roll up the cheese and meatball in the dough.
step-5: rotate halfway through rolling to ensure you are completely encasing the cheese and meat into the dough.
step-6: pull tight and use any remaining slack to cover any possible gaps/holes.
step-7: press the dough into itself to seal and place on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-8: repeat with remaining dough, cheese, and meatballs.
step-9: in a medium saucepan over high heat, bring the 5 cups of water to a boil.
step-10: once boiling, add the baking soda and stir to dissolve.
step-11: return the pot to a boil.
step-12: in batches (about 3-5 at a time), add the rolled dough balls into the pot and allow to boil for 20-30 seconds, stirring gently.
step-13: remove and place back on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-14: repeat with remaining dough balls.
step-15: brush each boiled ball with beaten egg and then sprinkle each with coarse sea salt.
step-16: bake in preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, until the outsides have browned.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c).
step-2: combine the beef, salt, pepper, and garlic powder in a 9 x 13-inch (22 x 33-cm) rimmed baking dish, mixing thoroughly, then pressing into a flat, even layer.
step-3: bake for 20 minutes.
step-4: drain the liquid and set the cooked beef aside.
step-5: slice the rolls in half lengthwise.
step-6: place the bottom half in the same baking dish.
step-7: place the cooked beef on the rolls, followed by the onions and cheese.
step-8: top with the remaining rolls.
step-9: brush the tops of the rolls with melted butter and sprinkle the sesame seeds on top.
step-10: bake for 20 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is melted.
step-11: slice into individual sliders, then serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a greased muffin tin, place five tater tots into each cup.
step-3: press the tater tots with a spoon into a cup shape.
step-4: bake the tot cups for 25 minutes.
step-5: allow to cool for five minutes.
step-6: in a large skillet over medium heat, cook the onion and garlic.
step-7: then brown the ground beef and then drain on paper towels.
step-8: add in the worcestershire, salt, and pepper.
step-9: remove from heat.
step-10: spoon about 1 tablespoon of the burger mixture into each cup.
step-11: sprinkle cheese on top.
step-12: bake for 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted.
step-13: allow your burger cups to cool slightly before topping.
step-14: top your burger cups with lettuce, cherry tomatoes, pickles, and sesame seeds.

step-1: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-2: in a large bowl, combine the cream cheese, powdered sugar, vanilla, and salt until smooth.
step-3: transfer to a piping bag fitted with a round tip or a zip-top bag with a corner snipped off and set aside.
step-4: in a medium bowl, combine the graham cracker crumbs and cinnamon.
step-5: pour the graham cracker crumbs evenly over the prepared baking sheet.
step-6: pipe the cream cheese mixture into 8 “chicken” nuggets directly onto the graham cracker crumbs.
step-7: use a spoon to gently cover the nuggets completely with the crumbs, then cover the baking sheet with plastic wrap and freeze for 2 hours.
step-8: in a small bowl, combine the raspberry preserves and chocolate syrup to make “barbecue sauce”.
step-9: gently brush any excess crumbs off the nuggets, then serve with the sauce.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: roll the cookie dough into 1-inch (2 ½ cm) balls and place them in a greased muffin tin.
step-3: using your hands or a shaped tool, press the dough balls down so they form a cup shape.
step-4: bake for 10-15 minutes.
step-5: in a medium bowl, whisk together the softened cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla until smooth and no lumps remain.
step-6: fold in the whipped topping.
step-7: scoop the cheesecake filling into a piping bag or a plastic sandwich bag.
step-8: once the cookie cups have baked and cooled, remove them from the muffin tin.
step-9: pipe the cheesecake filling into each cup.
step-10: serve with chocolate syrup or fresh fruit.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, mash bananas.
step-3: mix eggs, brown sugar, white sugar, butter, vanilla extract, and yogurt into the mixture.
step-4: add flour, salt, and baking soda and mix until well combined.
step-5: to prepare the cream cheese filling, mix egg, cream cheese, sugar, and flour in a small bowl.
step-6: pour half the banana batter into a greased 9x5-inch (23x12 cm) bread pan.
step-7: pour cream cheese filling evenly over the banana batter.
step-8: pour the remaining banana batter on top of the cream cheese filling.
step-9: bake for about 50 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean from the middle of the bread.
step-10: (baking times may vary, so keep an eye on the bread.)
step-11: allow to cool for 15 minutes before serving.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, whisk together the cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla extract, stirring until smooth.
step-3: refrigerate.
step-4: in a large bowl, mash the bananas with a fork.
step-5: add in the flour, sugar, baking powder, oil, egg, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, and vanilla.
step-6: stir until just combined, without over mixing.
step-7: pour half of the banana bread batter into a greased bundt pan.
step-8: with an ice cream scoop, scoop the cream cheese mixture evenly onto the cake batter, making sure that it does not touch the sides of the cake pan.
step-9: pour the rest of the banana bread batter on top and smooth it evenly.
step-10: bake for 30 minutes, or until the banana bread is golden.
step-11: to make the caramel glaze, heat the sugar in a saucepan over medium-high heat.
step-12: once the sugar begins to melt, stir with a wooden spoon or whisk.
step-13: once the sugar reaches a boil, add the butter and stir until melted.
step-14: remove from heat, add in the heavy cream and immediately stir until incorporated.
step-15: allow the caramel to cool and thicken.
step-16: invert the banana bread onto a wire rack set on top of a baking tray.
step-17: pour the caramel glaze over the cake, letting the excess drip off the wire rack and onto the baking tray.
step-18: once the glaze has set, slice the cake.

step-1: in a large mixing bowl, combine cream cheese, powdered sugar, and vanilla.
step-2: mix well and freeze.
step-3: roll out prepared brownie and cut into 32 squares (8 rows of 4).
step-4: using a melon baller or your hands, form cream cheese mixture into size of a truffle.
step-5: form brownie square around mixture and seal it around the cream cheese ball.
step-6: dip brownie in melted chocolate, covering the entire ball.
step-7: coat the chocolate covered brownie with graham cracker crumbs and chill.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the ground beef, salt, and pepper.
step-2: in a ramekin, spread two-thirds of the beef patty evenly along the bottom and the sides.
step-3: place half the diced onion and provolone in the well.
step-4: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-5: place the rest of beef patty on top and pat to flatten.
step-6: place the ramekin on a baking sheet along with a sesame bun, face down.
step-7: bake for 25 minutes.
step-8: assemble the burger with the sesame bun, lettuce, and the rest of the onion.

step-1: heat olive oil in a large skillet and add the strips of skirt steak.
step-2: season with salt & pepper and cook 5-7 minutes.
step-3: remove from the pan.
step-4: add onion and bell peppers to the pan and cook until slightly soft.
step-5: remove from skillet.
step-6: place the tortilla in the pan and add a layer of cheese on half of the tortilla followed by the steak, peppers and onions.
step-7: top with more cheese and fold in half.
step-8: cook for 6 minutes over medium heat, flipping half way.
step-9: serve with cheese sauce and garnish fresh parsley.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: heat the vegetable oil in a large pan over high heat.
step-3: add the onion and cook for 10 minutes, until translucent and the edges start to brown.
step-4: push the onion to one side of the pan and add the red and green bell peppers to the pan.
step-5: season with 2 teaspoons of salt, 1 teaspoon of garlic powder, and 1 teaspoon of pepper, and cook until the peppers soften, about 5 minutes.
step-6: remove from the pan and set aside.
step-7: place the steak on the cutting board, and cover with a piece of plastic wrap.
step-8: pound with a meat mallet or rolling pin to about ½-inch (1 ¼ cm) thick.
step-9: remove the plastic wrap and season the steak on both sides with 1 tablespoon of salt and 1 tablespoon of pepper.
step-10: line 7 slices of provolone cheese along the bottom edge of the steak.
step-11: place the sautéed vegetables on top.
step-12: starting from the bottom, roll up the steak, encasing the cheese and vegetables inside.
step-13: top with the remaining 7 slices of provolone and secure with skewers or toothpicks.
step-14: transfer the steak roll to a baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes, until cheese is melty and the steak is cooked through to your preference.
step-15: rest for 10 minutes before slicing between the skewers and serving.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: turn the loaf on its end, and cut a square out, leaving a ½-inch (1 cm) thick edge.
step-3: remove the center of the bread.
step-4: cut the hollowed bread piece into two and roll them down for compression.
step-5: slice the bell peppers.
step-6: cut the onions.
step-7: thinly slice the flank steak.
step-8: season the flank steak with salt and pepper to taste.
step-9: heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
step-10: cook the flank steak until browned on all sides, about 2 minutes.
step-11: remove the steak from the pan.
step-12: add the green peppers, red peppers, and onions, and cook until softened, about 4 minutes.
step-13: season the peppers and onions with salt and pepper to taste.
step-14: place the hollowed bread piece into the bread box.
step-15: line the bread box with provolone on all five sides.
step-16: add the flank steak, green peppers, red peppers, onions, and cheese to the bread box.
step-17: seal the top with cheese and cover it with the second half of the hollowed bread.
step-18: place cheese on top of the box.
step-19: bake the cheesesteak box for 10 minutes.
step-20: take the cheesesteak box out and and place nine skewers sticks in the cheesebox.
step-21: slice the cheesesteak box into 9 cubes, forming 9 cheesesteak skewers.

step-1: add sliced beef to a large bowl, season with salt, pepper, onion powder and toss to coat.
step-2: sprinkle 2 tbsp flour, toss to coat.
step-3: place a pot over medium-high heat, drizzle olive oil.
step-4: once hot, add half the sirloin in, brown, remove onto a plate to hold, then repeat with the remaining sirloin.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: add more oil to the pot, add sliced onions, add pinch of salt and pepper, and caramelize the onions, stirring frequently to avoid burning.
step-7: once the onions are softened, add mushrooms and continue sautéing until cooked.
step-8: stir in dried thyme and garlic.
step-9: sprinkle remaining 2 tbsp.
step-10: of flour onto mixture, stir to combine, then add beef stock.
step-11: reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer for 10 minutes.
step-12: mix in heavy cream, then add beef, along with juices, stir to combine.
step-13: ladle stew into hollowed out sourdough bowls, top with slice of provolone, then broil until the cheese is brown and melted.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: cut the flank steak against the grain into ⅛-inch (3-mm) thick slices.
step-3: in a large skillet over medium heat, heat the olive oil, until shimmering.
step-4: add the steak, paprika, garlic powder, ½ teaspoon of pepper, 1 teaspoon of salt, and the worcestershire sauce.
step-5: mix to coat the meat with the spices and cook until the meat is cooked through, about 3 minutes.
step-6: transfer the meat a bowl, leaving the juices in the pan.
step-7: cover and set aside until ready to use.
step-8: add the butter to the pan with the meat juices.
step-9: add the onions and cook until tender and shiny, about 10 minutes.
step-10: add the green bell peppers and the remaining ½ teaspoon of pepper and teaspoon of salt, and cook until the onions and peppers are caramelized, about 10 minutes.
step-11: cut the top off of a red bell pepper.
step-12: cut around the seed pod, then pull it out of the pepper.
step-13: remove any remaining seeds.
step-14: repeat with the rest of the peppers.
step-15: cut 9 of the provolone slices in half.
step-16: place the peppers in a 9x13-inch (23x33-cm) baking dish, cut side up.
step-17: scoop a bit of steak filling into each pepper, followed by the peppers and onions, then 3 half slices of provolone.
step-18: repeat with the rest of the steak, then the rest of the peppers and onions.
step-19: place a whole slice of provolone on top of each pepper.
step-20: bake for 30 minutes, until the skin of the peppers is shriveling, and the cheese is golden.
step-21: top with parsley.

step-1: with a jar or cookie cutter, cut 2 circles into each piece of bread.
step-2: place in muffin tin cups.
step-3: wrap a piece of cooked bacon along the edge of each muffin cup—make sure the bacon is just cooked and still warm, so it doesn’t break or crumble.
step-4: sprinkle ½ tbsp.
step-5: of shredded cheese into each cup.
step-6: top with an egg.
step-7: season with salt & pepper, and bake at 400°f (205°c) for 15 min (longer for firmer yolk).
step-8: top with green onion.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: crisp bacon over medium heat.
step-3: allow it to cool, then crumble.
step-4: generously grease a large bundt pan with cooking spray.
step-5: in a bowl, mix both kinds of cheese.
step-6: cut each biscuit into four pieces.
step-7: flatten each piece in the palm of your hand and add a pinch of the mixed cheeses and crumbled bacon.
step-8: gather the edges and pinch the biscuit into a ball.
step-9: in a small bowl, mix melted butter, italian seasoning, and garlic.
step-10: drop the biscuit pieces in the butter mixture and place in the bundt pan.
step-11: bake 30-35 minutes or until golden-brown.
step-12: (be careful - the butter may begin to smoke toward the end of the bake time.
step-13: if it begins to smoke, remove from the oven.)
step-14: let stand for five minutes, then place a heatproof plate on top of the pan.
step-15: using a pot holder, flip the pan and plate over and invert onto your serving plate.
step-16: be careful as the pan will still be hot.
step-17: sprinkle with parsley.

step-1: roll out the pastry and brush with the beaten egg.
step-2: sprinkle on the paprika and cheese evenly, then sprinkle flour on a rolling pin and flatten down.
step-3: cut into ½ inch (1 ¼ cm) wide strips, then fold in half and pinch the ends together.
step-4: gently twist pastry.
step-5: wrap bacon around the twists.
step-6: sprinkle on brown sugar and minced rosemary.
step-7: bake at 350°f (190°c) for 45-50 minutes, turning halfway through to make sure they are golden brown all over.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200˚c).
step-2: peel and grate the potatoes.
step-3: drop shredded potatoes into a large bowl of ice water to remove surface starch.
step-4: strain or squeeze potato shreds and transfer to a large bowl.
step-5: add butter, cheese, eggs, chives, garlic salt, oregano, and pepper in with the shredded potatoes.
step-6: mix together.
step-7: take a handful of the mixture and pack it on a baking sheet into desired hash brown shape.
step-8: bake for 40-45 minutes or until brown and crispy.
step-9: allow to cool for 5 minutes.
step-10: serve warm.

step-1: preheat the oven to 180°c (350°f).
step-2: bring some water to the boil in a saucepan and boil the runner beans and broccoli for 2-3 minutes.
step-3: take them out of the water and set aside.
step-4: in the same boiling water, cook the gnocchi for 2 minutes (or, until it floats to the top of the water).
step-5: drain.
step-6: in the same saucepan, mix together the drained gnocchi, runner beans, broccoli, mozzarella, parmesan, cream, and pepper.
step-7: pour into an ovenproof dish and bake for 5 minutes at 180°c (350°f), until the cheese bubbles.

step-1: in a bowl, mix cream cheese and hot sauce until smooth.
step-2: mix in chicken and monterey jack cheese.
step-3: unroll cans of dough, separate into triangles.
step-4: on a large cookie sheet, arrange the triangles in ring, dough should overlap, leaving around 5 inches (12 ¾ cm) in the center.
step-5: layer half of the mozzarella on each triangle closest to the ring.
step-6: spoon mixture on top of the mozzarella.
step-7: top with the rest of the mozzarella.
step-8: bring the top of the triangle over the filling and tuck the edges under the bottom layer of dough.
step-9: repeat around the ring until the entire filling is enclosed.
step-10: bake at 375˚f (190˚c) for 35 minutes or until the dough is golden brown.
step-11: cool 5 to 10 minutes before cutting into serving slices.
step-12: serve with choice dressing.

step-1: in a pot, heat oil and add chicken.
step-2: season chicken with salt and pepper.
step-3: add garlic, then brown the chicken.
step-4: add broth, heavy cream, and pasta, and bring to a boil.
step-5: cover and reduce the heat to a simmer for 15-20 min.
step-6: turn off heat and stir in 1 ½ cups (165 grams) of parmesan cheese.
step-7: pour half of the pasta into a greased 11×7 inch or 9×13 inch (28x18 cm or 33x23 cm) baking dish.
step-8: sprinkle evenly with 1 cup (115 grams) of mozzarella cheese.
step-9: layer the remaining half of the pasta evenly on top.
step-10: sprinkle evenly with 1 cup of mozzarella (115 grams) and ½ cup (55 grams) of parmesan.
step-11: broil 10 - 15 minutes, or until the cheese is golden brown.
step-12: remove and sprinkle with fresh parsley.
step-13: serve warm and enjoy!

step-1: heat olive oil on medium heat in a large pot.
step-2: add chicken breasts, season with salt and pepper, and allow the chicken to brown on one side.
step-3: flip chicken, then add onions and garlic as the second side browns.
step-4: once the chicken has browned on both sides, add chicken broth, water, and pasta to the pot.
step-5: stir all ingredients, cover the pot with a lid, and bring to a boil.
step-6: when it begins to boil, uncover and stir.
step-7: bring the heat to low, stir, then cover and let simmer for 20 minutes.
step-8: after 20 minutes has passed, uncover and add in the broccoli.
step-9: stir continually as the broccoli steams until the rest of the liquid evaporates.
step-10: add milk and cheddar cheese and stir until the cheese melts and you have a smooth cheese sauce.
step-11: add salt and pepper (to taste), cayenne, and nutmeg.
step-12: stir once more, then you’re ready to serve.

step-1: shred the cooked chicken breasts in a bowl using 2 forks.
step-2: transfer the chicken to a larger bowl and pour in the egg yolks, flour, cheese, spring onions, paprika, rosemary, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
step-3: mix together and then roll the mixture into balls using your hands.
step-4: coat the balls in breadcrumbs.
step-5: heat up a litre of oil in a frying pan and deep fry the balls for about 3 minutes.

step-1: heat oven to 375°f/190°c.
step-2: in a casserole dish, combine rice, pepper, onion powder, cream of chicken, cheese, broccoli, and chicken stock.
step-3: mix until everything is combined.
step-4: lay chicken on top of the rice mixture.
step-5: space evenly.
step-6: cover with foil and bake for 50 minutes.
step-7: take off cover and top the chicken with more cheese.
step-8: bake uncovered for another 5 minutes or until cheese is melted.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: mix the chicken, half of the enchilada sauce, and half of the cheese blend in a bowl.
step-3: wrap the tortillas in a paper towel and microwave for 30 seconds.
step-4: place the chicken on the tortilla and roll tightly.
step-5: place the enchiladas in a baking pan and top with remaining sauce and cheese.
step-6: bake for 15 minutes, or until cheese has melted.
step-7: top with sour cream and cilantro.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a large pan over medium heat, cook the chicken, beans, corn, and salsa.
step-3: in a springform pan, lay down one tortilla, then top with chicken mixture and cheese.
step-4: layer another tortilla on top and continue to stack until pan is full.
step-5: top with more cheese.
step-6: bake for 30 minutes or until cheese is melted.
step-7: top with sour cream, guacamole, and salsa.

step-1: first, season the ground chicken with salt and pepper.
step-2: grab a handful of ground chicken and roll into a rough ball shape, place a cube of cheese in the center and wrap the ground chicken around it.
step-3: form it into a chicken nugget shape.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: season the panko with oregano.
step-6: take the chicken nuggets and coat with flour, dip in egg and cover with the panko/oregano mix.
step-7: deep fry in the oil until browned and crispy.

step-1: stir bread crumbs, salt, and parmesan together in a bowl.
step-2: in a large bowl, mix together chicken, salt, pepper, oregano, basil, parsley, minced garlic, and parmesan cheese.
step-3: grab a handful of the chicken mixture and pat it out flat in your palm.
step-4: place a slice of mozzarella cheese in the middle and fold the chicken over the edges.
step-5: make sure the cheese is fully covered on both sides by the chicken mixture.
step-6: cover the patty with the bread crumb mixture on both sides.
step-7: cook patty in a pan over medium-high heat for 4 minutes on each side.
step-8: place on a bun and garnish with marinara sauce and fresh basil.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: carve out a deep hole in the center of the dinner rolls.
step-3: press down the bottom of the bun to create a denser bottom layer.
step-4: add olive oil, onion, and garlic to a skillet and cook for about 20 minutes or until caramelized and softened.
step-5: add the oregano, basil, chili flakes, pepper, salt, marinara, chicken, and parmesan cheese.
step-6: cook until well-combined, reduced, thick, and heated through.
step-7: put one thin slice of fresh mozzarella at the bottom of the dinner roll hole, fill with approximately ¼ cup of the chicken parmesan mixture, and top with another slice of mozzarella cheese.
step-8: bake rolls for 15 minutes or until the bread has darkened a little, the chicken mixture is bubbling, and the cheese melts.
step-9: let cool slightly, sprinkle with chopped fresh basil, and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 180°c (350˚f).
step-2: fry the garlic in a pan with a little oil.
step-3: add the chicken, season with salt and pepper, and fry for a minute.
step-4: stir in the bacon and fry with the chicken until it is no longer pink.
step-5: pour in the chicken stock, rosemary, and thyme, and simmer for about 10 minutes.
step-6: stir in the sour cream and cooked broccoli.
step-7: take off the hob and pour filling into two ramekins.
step-8: top with cheese.
step-9: place in the oven for a further 10 minutes, or until the cheese starts to bubble.

step-1: preheat oven to 400ºf (200ªc).
step-2: debone, remove skin, and shred rotisserie chicken.
step-3: brush potatoes with oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
step-4: with a fork, poke several sets of holes on the front and back of the potato.
step-5: bake for 40-45 minutes or until inside is cooked.
step-6: once potatoes are cooked and cool enough to handle, slice down the center lengthwise, and, using a spoon, scoop out the centers to form a bowl.
step-7: in a large bowl, combine the chicken, scooped out potato, ½ cup (50 g) of cheddar, cream cheese, and spinach.
step-8: stir until combined.
step-9: evenly distribute the filling between the potato skins and sprinkle the tops with the remaining cheddar.
step-10: bake for 15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200˚c).
step-2: in a bowl, whisk together egg whites, garlic powder, parsley, salt, and pepper.
step-3: evenly distribute egg mixture in a greased mini muffin tin.
step-4: the more mixture per muffin slot, the thicker the chip.
step-5: top with shredded cheese.
step-6: bake for 12-15 minutes, or until until cheese is melted and edges are slightly brown.
step-7: cool for 10 minutes.
step-8: remove chips using an offset spatula.

step-1: saute onions, celery, red peppers, and carrots in a pan.
step-2: salt and pepper to taste.
step-3: mix in package of taco seasoning.
step-4: add fire-roasted tomatoes, kidney beans, chickpeas, black beans, and corn.
step-5: simmer for 15 minutes.
step-6: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-7: prepare boxed cornbread mix according to box instructions, then fold in the cheese.
step-8: spread cheesy cornbread batter over chili.
step-9: bake at 375˚f (190˚c) for 20 minutes.
step-10: let cool for a few minutes, then garnish with sour cream and cilantro

step-1: with a spoon, press down on the center of the bread to form a pocket.
step-2: line the edges of the bread with butter, and crack an egg into the pocket.
step-3: line the edges of the bread with shredded cheese.
step-4: sprinkle on salt and pepper, and bake at 400°f (204°c) for 10-15 min.
step-5: 10 min will have a runny yolk whereas 15 min will have a firmer yolk.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f/180˚c.
step-2: slice the eggplant into ½-inch (1 ¼ cm) pieces.
step-3: salt the slices and leave them to “sweat” for 20 minutes then wipe them off.
step-4: slather each slice with olive oil.
step-5: bake for 25 minutes.
step-6: in a medium bowl, combine all pizza sauce ingredients and stir until homogenous.
step-7: remove eggplant slices from the oven and pour about 2 tablespoons of the sauce mixture onto each one.
step-8: sprinkle mozzarella and cheddar on each slice.
step-9: put the slices back in the oven for 1-2 minutes to melt the cheese.
step-10: allow to cool before serving.

step-1: in a bowl, add the chicken thighs, salt, pepper, garlic, dried parsley, and olive oil, and toss until evenly coated.
step-2: add the chicken to a skillet on medium-high heat.
step-3: sear until golden brown, about 4 minutes.
step-4: flip and cook the other side of the chicken, 2 minutes.
step-5: remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
step-6: preheat oven to broil.
step-7: add the butter, sliced onions, salt, and pepper to the same pan, stirring occasionally until softened.
step-8: reduce heat to low and cook until they are deeply caramelized, about 1 hour.
step-9: add thyme and beef broth and bring the mixture to a simmer.
step-10: add the chicken on top of the onions, and sprinkle with gruyère cheese.
step-11: broil for 5 minutes, until the cheese is melted and golden brown.
step-12: serve over bread.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: cut the bread diagonally to form diamond shapes, making sure not to cut all the way down to the base of the bread.
step-3: place the pieces of white cheddar between cuts.
step-4: cover with shredded mozzarella.
step-5: sprinkle salt, pepper, parsley, and melted butter on top.
step-6: bake for 15-20 minutes or until all the cheese is melted and the bread is lightly toasted.

step-1: place a hot dog in the middle of a cheese slice.
step-2: roll the cheese slice around the hot dog, then push a wooden skewer inside.
step-3: place the cheese-wrapped hot dogs seam side down on a baking sheet.
step-4: freeze for 20 minutes.
step-5: in a large bowl, combine the flour, salt, pepper, baking powder, milk, and eggs, stirring until the batter is smooth and has no lumps.
step-6: pour the batter into a tall glass cup for easier dipping.
step-7: heat oil in a pot over medium-high heat until 375°f-400°f (190°c-200°c).
step-8: take a frozen hot dog and dip it fully into the batter, lifting it out then rotating it to let excess batter drip off.
step-9: using tongs, carefully place the battered dog into the hot oil, rotating it so that it frys evenly.
step-10: remove when golden brown, then pat with a paper towel to drain.
step-11: serve with ketchup and mustard!

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180˚c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, mix the ground beef, bread crumbs, parsley, egg, salt, and pepper until evenly combined.
step-3: pinch off a ball of the mixture, roll between your hands to make ping pong ball-sized meatball.
step-4: cook the meatballs over medium heat, turning to brown each side.
step-5: remove from heat and drain on a paper towel.
step-6: with your hands or a rolling pin, flatten out the pizza dough rounds and top with a tablespoon of marinara and mozzarella cheese.
step-7: place one meatball over the dough and wrap the dough over the meatball pinching at the seams to close.
step-8: place the balls in a circle, seam-side down, in a cast-iron skillet.
step-9: mix the melted butter with garlic, salt, and italian seasoning.
step-10: brush the balls with the garlic butter mixture.
step-11: bake for 20 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-12: let cool for 5-10 minutes.
step-13: place a bowl of warm marinara sauce in the middle of the skillet.
step-14: sprinkle the balls with parsley.

step-1: preheat oven to 375ºf (190ºc).
step-2: spread out broccoli in a medium rectangular casserole dish.
step-3: stir the garlic and cheddar cheese together in a separate bowl.
step-4: sprinkle the cheese evenly over broccoli and add salt and pepper to taste.
step-5: bake for 25 minutes.

step-1: mix hash browns with butter and salt, and press into a 9-inch (20cm) pie plate.
step-2: bake at 450°f (230°c) for 20 minutes until golden brown.
step-3: meanwhile, cook sausage and onions in a skillet until onions are clear and sausage is cooked and crumbled.
step-4: transfer to a bowl and cool.
step-5: add the eggs, cheese, milk, salt, and pepper.
step-6: mix.
step-7: pour into the hash brown crust.
step-8: bake at 350°f (175°c) for an additional 30 minutes, until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.
step-9: cut and serve with your favorite toppings.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: heat the oil over medium heat in a large, nonstick skillet.
step-3: toss in the mushrooms and season with salt, pepper, and thyme.
step-4: sauté until the mushrooms have started to darken in color.
step-5: place the spinach on top of the mushrooms and toss until the greens have wilted, about 2-3 minutes.
step-6: set the spinach mixture aside.
step-7: season the chicken breasts on both sides with salt and pepper.
step-8: using a sharp knife, make vertical cuts, about half an inch apart, making sure not to cut all the way through the chicken.
step-9: transfer the chicken to a greased roasting pan.
step-10: stuff the spinach mixture into the cuts of the chicken breasts.
step-11: season with paprika and top with a sprinkle of grated cheddar cheese.
step-12: bake for 20-25 minutes at 400°f (200°c), until the cheese has melted and the chicken has reached an internal temperature of 165°f (72°c).
step-13: let the meat rest for 5 minutes before serving.

step-1: place a hot dog on a slice of cheese, then roll the cheese slice around the hot dog.
step-2: push a wooden skewer inside, then place the cheese-wrapped hot dogs seam side down on a baking sheet.
step-3: freeze for 20 minutes.
step-4: in a large mixing bowl, add the dry ingredients.
step-5: once fully combined, mix in the wet ingredients, milk, egg, and jalapeño.
step-6: stir until batter is smooth with no lumps.
step-7: pour the batter into a tall glass for easier dipping.
step-8: preheat oil to 350°f (180°c).
step-9: take a frozen hot dog and dip it fully into the batter, lifting it out then rotating it to let excess batter drip off.
step-10: using tongs, carefully place the battered dog into the hot oil, rotating it so that it fries evenly.
step-11: cook for 3-5 minutes or until golden brown.

step-1: chop the head of cauliflower into florets.
step-2: bring a medium pot of water to boil over medium-high heat.
step-3: add a pinch of salt and the cauliflower and boil for 15 minutes, or until the cauliflower is soft.
step-4: drain the cauliflower, then return to the pot.
step-5: add the butter, salt, and milk to the cauliflower.
step-6: mash the ingredients together until most of the milk is absorbed and the texture is creamy.
step-7: add pepper and the cheddar cheese and stir to combine.
step-8: add the chives and mix.
step-9: garnish with chives and more cheddar cheese.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: in a large mixing bowl, combine ground beef, italian sausage, garlic, parsley, parmesan cheese, salt, pepper, bread crumbs, eggs, and milk.
step-3: mix until everything is fully infused together.
step-4: roll into 4-5 ounce meatballs.
step-5: for even amounts, use a medium-sized ice cream scooper.
step-6: over medium heat, add 1 tablespoon of olive oil to a pan, and brown the meatballs on both sides for about 2-3 minutes or until you create a nice crispy sear.
step-7: cook about half way through.
step-8: they will finish cooking in the oven.
step-9: in a casserole dish, spread a few tablespoons of marinara sauce to the bottom of the pan to help prevent sticking.
step-10: then place meatballs in the casserole dish and add the remaining jar of marinara sauce.
step-11: top with 2 cups of shredded mozzarella cheese.
step-12: cover in foil and bake at 425°f (220°c) for 25 minutes or until the cheese is fully melted and the meatballs are fully cooked.
step-13: serve and garnish with parsley.

step-1: remove dough from package and roll out on lightly floured surface to desired size.
step-2: add alternating rows of pepperoni, mozzarella, and salami until dough is covered, leaving 1½ inches (4 cm) of space along the outside of the dough.
step-3: add the roasted red pepper, shredded mozzarella, red pepper flakes, and oregano on top of meat and cheese.
step-4: roll up the stromboli slowly.
step-5: combine melted butter, garlic, parsley, salt, and pepper.
step-6: brush the butter mixture onto the stromboli, evenly coating each side.
step-7: bake stromboli at 400˚f (200˚c) until golden brown (about 15-20 minutes).

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180°c).
step-2: roll out a sheet of puff pastry and spread the pesto evenly over it, leaving a small amount of room at the edges.
step-3: sprinkle over the mozzarella and place another sheet of puff pastry on top, making a sandwich.
step-4: cut into thin strips with a sharp knife.
step-5: grab both ends of each strip, press down firmly to seal the edges and twist.
step-6: transfer onto a baking tray lined with baking paper, and brush with beaten egg.
step-7: season with salt and pepper and sprinkle over the parmesan.
step-8: bake for 25 minutes until golden brown.

step-1: grate the green plantains into a large mixing bowl.
step-2: add salt, pepper, and chili powder, and mix to combine.
step-3: wrap one slice of cheese around a hot dog link and cut into fifths.
step-4: take one tablespoon of your plantain mixture and encase one slice of the cheese-wrapped hot dog, shaping into a cylindrical “tot.”
step-5: repeat until all slices are covered and shaped, and place on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-6: freeze one hour.
step-7: in a large pot over medium-high heat, heat your oil to 375ºf (190ºc).
step-8: drop four to five tots into the oil and fry until golden brown, about one to two minutes.
step-9: place on a paper towel to drain excess oil.
step-10: serve warm with your favorite dipping sauce!

step-1: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: using a mandolin or a sharp knife, thinly slice the potatoes lengthwise.
step-3: in a 13-inch (33-cm) cast iron skillet, layer slices of potatoes around the outside of the pan.
step-4: add another layer of potatoes, keeping them centered in the pan and moving clockwise until the pan is covered.
step-5: top with a third of the cheddar cheese, a third of the gruyère cheese, and half of the ham.
step-6: add another layer of potato slices around the outside of the pan, then a add layer of slices around the center of the pan.
step-7: top with another third of the cheddar and gruyère and the remaining ham slices.
step-8: add a final layer of potato slices around the center of the pan
step-9: top with the remaining cheddar and gruyère cheese.
step-10: cover with greased aluminum foil and bake for 40 minutes.
step-11: remove the pan from the oven and increase the oven temperature to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-12: in a medium bowl, combine the flour, garlic, parmesan, salt, pepper and mix well.
step-13: slowly add in the cream, whisking until fully incorporated.
step-14: uncover the skillet and pour the cream mixture over potatoes, spreading evenly.
step-15: bake for another 10-15 minutes uncovered, until the cheese is melted and golden brown.
step-16: cool for at least 30 minutes, then slice and serve.
step-17: garnish with fresh parsley.

step-1: place potatoes on a baking sheet and poke holes in two sides with a fork.
step-2: coat potatoes with olive oil, and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
step-3: bake for at 425°f (220°c) for 45 minutes.
step-4: remove potatoes from oven, and let cool.
step-5: chop into 1-inch (2 ½ cm) pieces.
step-6: lay half of the potatoes on the bottom of a greased 9x13 inch (23x33 cm) baking dish.
step-7: sprinkle on half of the bacon, spread half of the sour cream, and sprinkle on half of the cheese.
step-8: repeat for a second layer.
step-9: bake for 20 minutes at reduced temp of 350°f (180°c), or until cheese is golden brown and the edges start crisping up.
step-10: sprinkle with chives.

step-1: using a box grater, shred the potatoes into a towel in a bowl and squeeze out as much liquid as possible.
step-2: set aside and grate the onion.
step-3: add the grated potatoes and grated onion onion to a large bowl.
step-4: add in the eggs, garlic, cornstarch, salt, pepper, cheddar cheese, monterey jack, and breadcrumbs and mix until combined.
step-5: take ½ cup of the potato mixture and form into a thin patty, about ⅓-inch thick.
step-6: heat cooking oil over medium-high heat and place potato patty into the skillet.
step-7: cook for 3-5 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and crispy on the outside.
step-8: repeat with remaining patties.
step-9: serve with sour cream and green onions on top, and enjoy!

step-1: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: cut pizza dough into 12 portions.
step-3: roll into balls.
step-4: boil water and add baking soda.
step-5: note: make sure your pot is narrow enough that the water level covers the dough balls and make sure there’s enough room left in the pot that it won’t boil over when the baking soda is added.
step-6: place dough balls in the pot, boiling for 20-30 seconds in batches.
step-7: line a 10” (25 cm) skillet with the dough balls, making a ring along the outside edge.
step-8: scramble the egg and brush the dough balls with egg wash. top with salt, to taste.
step-9: par-bake the dough for 15 minutes.
step-10: while the dough is baking, combine the cream cheese, 1½ cups (150 g) of cheddar, sour cream, cayenne pepper, and garlic powder until smooth.
step-11: fill the center of the dip ring with the cheese dip.
step-12: top the dip and the dough balls with the remaining cheddar.
step-13: bake for an additional 10-15 minutes (or until the pretzel balls have browned and the dip has fully melted).
step-14: allow to cool before serving.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: thinly slice the potatoes into rounds about ⅛-inch (3 mm) thick.
step-3: submerge in a large bowl of water to keep from browning and set aside.
step-4: in a medium pot over low heat, melt the butter.
step-5: once the butter begins to foam, add the garlic and cook for 2-3 minutes, until fragrant.
step-6: add the flour and stir until flour and butter resemble the consistency of wet sand, creating a roux.
step-7: while stirring continuously, add the non-dairy milk, vegetable broth, salt, and pepper and bring to a boil.
step-8: stir in the nutritional yeast and continue to cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce thickens.
step-9: remove from the heat.
step-10: in a medium baking dish, add 2 layers of the sliced potatoes, followed by a layer of the sliced onions.
step-11: pour on half of the cheese sauce and spread with a spatula to coat all of the potatoes and onions.
step-12: add another 2 layers of potatoes and pour on the remaining cheese sauce.
step-13: cover with a lid or foil and bake for 1 hour.
step-14: then, uncover and bake for 10-15 minutes more, until the top is golden and bubbling and the potatoes are tender.
step-15: garnish with parsley and serve warm.

step-1: coat a 10 inch (25cm) oven-safe skillet with olive oil.
step-2: place the dinner roll dough balls in a ring around the skillet.
step-3: cover and let rise until thawed and doubled in size.
step-4: in a medium bowl, combine cream cheese, parmesan, romano, mozzarella, sour cream, artichoke hearts, spinach, garlic, basil, and red pepper flakes.
step-5: once the dough has thawed, uncover and scoop the dip into the center of the skillet.
step-6: brush the rolls with olive oil, and top with an additional sprinkle of cheese (optional).
step-7: bake in a preheated oven at 375˚f (190˚c) for 25 minutes.
step-8: (if the bread browns too quickly, lower oven temperature to 350˚f (180˚c) or cover the bread with a ring of foil).
step-9: remove and let cool slightly before serving.

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: sauté onions and garlic until transparent.
step-3: add the ground beef and taco seasoning.
step-4: cook until browned.
step-5: remove from heat and set aside.
step-6: on a floured surface, cut the pizza dough into 5 strips and place spoonfuls of the beef mixture into the middle of each strip, followed by the mexican cheese blend.
step-7: fold and pinch the dough around the cheese and meat along the entire strip, ensuring to close off the ends.
step-8: brush each breadstick with olive oil and transfer to a baking sheet.
step-9: bake for 10 minutes.
step-10: remove from the oven and top each breadstick with more cheese.
step-11: bake for another 5 minutes or until the cheese is golden brown.

step-1: in a large saucepan over medium heat, brown the ground beef.
step-2: once the beef is browned, add the onion and garlic.
step-3: cook until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
step-4: add the salt, cumin, chili powder, cayenne, paprika, and oregano.
step-5: cook for 2-3 minutes more to allow the flavors to meld and ensure the beef is cooked through.
step-6: remove the beef mixture from the pan and set aside.
step-7: in a clean large saucepan over medium heat, combine the shredded chicken and crushed tomatoes.
step-8: add the salt, cumin, chili powder, cayenne, paprika, and oregano.
step-9: cook until warmed through, about 5 minutes.
step-10: remove from the pan and set aside.
step-11: in a medium bowl, mix together the parmesan and mexican-blend cheeses.
step-12: heat a medium nonstick pan over medium heat.
step-13: add about ¼ cup (25 g) of cheese to the center of the pan and spread into a circle.
step-14: let the cheese melt, then add a spoonful of beef or chicken filling to the bottom of the circle.
step-15: slide the cheese shell out of the pan onto a cutting board and let cool for 30 seconds, then roll tightly to encase the filling.
step-16: the melted cheese should stick to the outside, sealing the taquito.
step-17: repeat with the remaining ingredients.
step-18: serve the taquitos with lime wedges, sour cream, and fresh cilantro.

step-1: make the beef: heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
step-2: add the onion and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes.
step-3: add the garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes more, until softened but not browned.
step-4: add the beef, cumin, chili powder, oregano, salt, and pepper to the pan.
step-5: stir to break up the ground beef, then let sit undisturbed for about 3 minutes to let the meat brown.
step-6: stir and continue cooking until no pink remains, 5-7 minutes total.
step-7: add 2 tablespoons of the pickled jalapeño liquid and cook until slightly evaporated, about 1 minute.
step-8: remove the pan from the heat.
step-9: drain any excess liquid from beef and set aside.
step-10: make the wontons: in a medium bowl, mix together the american cheese and beef until well combined with large chunks of cheese still intact.
step-11: fill a large, deep pot about ⅔ of the way with vegetable oil.
step-12: heat the oil until it reaches 350°f (180°c).
step-13: set a wire rack on top of a baking sheet.
step-14: on a clean work surface, lay out 10 wonton wrappers at a time.
step-15: scoop about 2 teaspoons of the beef mixture into the center of each wonton wrapper.
step-16: lightly brush 2 edges of the wrapper with egg, then fold up one corner to meet the opposite corner, forming a triangle, and gently press all the edges together to seal, ensuring all the air is pressed out from around the filling.
step-17: repeat with the remaining filling and wrappers.
step-18: working in batches, gently lower 4-6 filled wontons into the hot oil.
step-19: fry until golden brown, flipping once, 2-3 minutes total.
step-20: transfer to the wire rack to drain and sprinkle lightly with salt.
step-21: arrange half of the stuffed wontons on a baking sheet.
step-22: cover with ½ cup (50 g) of the shredded cheddar and about half the black beans.
step-23: top with the remaining wontons and cheddar cheese.
step-24: broil the wontons until the cheese is melted and bubbly, about 2 minutes.
step-25: top the wonton nachos with the remaining black beans, jalapeños, red onion, tomato, sour cream, avocado, and cilantro.
step-26: serve with lime wedges on the side.

step-1: preheat oven to 400ºf (220ºc).
step-2: grate zucchini into a medium bowl.
step-3: transfer grated zucchini into a large bowl and add parmesan cheese, garlic powder, pepper, red pepper flakes, salt, and egg.
step-4: mix together.
step-5: pour the mixture onto a small towel and wring the excess fluid from mix.
step-6: place a piece of parchment paper on a baking sheet and spread mixture evenly into a square about a ½-inch (1cm) thick.
step-7: bake for 35-40 minutes or until middle has thickened.
step-8: remove from oven and spread cheddar and mozzarella cheese over top .
step-9: place back in the oven at 350ºf (180ºc) for 10 more minutes or until cheese melts and is bubbling.
step-10: let cool for 5 minutes, then cut.
step-11: serve with marinara, ranch, or any sauce of your choosing!

step-1: break down the chicken into 6 parts--2 thighs, 2 breasts, and 2 wings.
step-2: add the chicken pieces to large bowl with the worcestershire sauce, 2 tablespoons of canola oil, the salt, and pepper and toss to coat.
step-3: in a large pan over medium-high heat, add the chicken, skin-side down, and the remaining tablespoon of oil.
step-4: sear the chicken until browned on both sides and the skin is crispy, about 5-8 minutes per side.
step-5: remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
step-6: to the hot pan, add the onion, celery, green chiles, garlic, and tomato paste, stirring to combine after each ingredient is added.
step-7: sweat until fragrant and the onions are translucent, about 5 minutes.
step-8: deglaze the pan with the beer and chicken stock.
step-9: return the chicken to pan, cover, reduce the heat to medium-low, and braise for 1 hour.
step-10: make the pico de gallo: in a large bowl, combine the tomatoes, onions, jalapeño, salt, cilantro, and the lime zest and juice.
step-11: stir to combine.
step-12: make the avocado yogurt: in a large bowl, combine the yogurt, avocados, lemon juice, salt, pepper, and olive oil.
step-13: mash with 2 forks until mostly smooth and well combined.
step-14: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-15: remove the chicken from the braising liquid.
step-16: increase the heat to high and cook the braising liquid until reduced by half, about 30 minutes.
step-17: using forks, shred the chicken and place the meat in a large bowl.
step-18: discard the bones or save for another use.
step-19: add 1 cup (240 ml) of the reduced braising liquid to the chicken and stir to combine.
step-20: assemble the nachos: spread the plantain chips on a baking sheet in an even layer.
step-21: top with half of the black beans and all of the chicken, then the remaining black beans.
step-22: cover with the cheddar, mozzarella, and pepper jack cheeses and finish with the pickled jalapeños.
step-23: bake for 10-15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted.
step-24: top the nachos with the pico de gallo, avocado yogurt, and cilantro.

step-1: make the cherry blossom jelly: in a small bowl, combine the agar and sugar.
step-2: pour the water into a small pan, then add the agar mixture and stir.
step-3: cook over high heat until the water is boiling.
step-4: reduce the heat to low and cook for 2 minutes.
step-5: meanwhile, fill a large bowl with ice and cold water.
step-6: move the pan to the ice bath, and chill for 3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
step-7: rinse the salted cherry blossoms and soak in water for 10 minutes.
step-8: gently squeeze the flowers to remove the calyxin.
step-9: in an ice ball tray, place the cherry blossoms in the bottom and pour the agar-sugar mixture over them.
step-10: chill for 15 minutes.
step-11: make the milk jelly: in a small bowl, combine the agar and sugar.
step-12: pour the milk into a small pan, then add agar mixture and stir.
step-13: cook over high heat until the milk is simmering.
step-14: reduce to the heat to low and cook for 2 minutes.
step-15: move the pan to the ice bath and chill for 2 minutes.
step-16: pour the milk mixture over the chilled cherry blossom layer in the ice ball tray.
step-17: cover with the lid and chill for 1 hour.
step-18: remove the raindrop cake from the tray, and pour the brown sugar syrup over it.
step-19: garnish with matcha powder, if desired.
step-20:
enjoy!

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: pit the cherries by placing them on top of an empty glass bottle, one at a time.
step-3: using a chopstick, push through the cherry to remove the pit.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: in a medium bowl, mix together the flour, sugar, and salt.
step-6: add the eggs and stir well to combine.
step-7: add the half-and-half and vanilla and whisk until smooth.
step-8: melt the butter in an 8-inch (20 cm) cast-iron skillet over medium heat.
step-9: once the butter has melted, remove the pan from the heat.
step-10: spread the cherries evenly in the pan.
step-11: pour the batter over the cherries.
step-12: bake for 40-45 minutes, until the clafoutis is golden brown and firm to the touch.
step-13: dust the powdered sugar on top.

step-1: combine cherries, sugar, cornstarch, almond extract, and lemon juice in a saucepan.
step-2: cook over low heat for 5-10 minutes, crushing the cherries with a spoon and stirring occasionally.
step-3: remove from heat and let cool.
step-4: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-5: roll out the puff pastry.
step-6: using a cookie cutter, cut 9 rounds out of each sheet of pastry.
step-7: fill each round with a spoonful of cherry filling.
step-8: fold in half over the filling and pinch closed with your fingers, followed by a fork.
step-9: place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-10: brush with egg wash and sprinkle with raw sugar.
step-11: bake 10-12 minutes until golden brown and puffy.
step-12: cool slightly and serve with a cup of coffee.

step-1: in a glass, muddle maraschino cherries and lime juice.
step-2: add vodka and stir.
step-3: in a copper mug, pour cherry mixture over ice and top it off with ginger beer.
step-4: add edible flowers for garnish.
step-5: serve.

step-1: add the sugar and cornstarch to a large saucepan and whisk until combined.
step-2: stir in the water and lemon juice.
step-3: cook over medium heat, whisking until the sugar has dissolved, then reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer until a thick syrup forms and turns golden, about 5 minutes.
step-4: add the cherries and cook for another 2-3 minutes until syrup has thickened.
step-5: turn off the heat and stir in the almond extract.
step-6: set aside to cool.
step-7: line an 8-inch (20 cm) springform pan with plastic wrap.
step-8: transfer the cherry filling to the pan and spread evenly.
step-9: freeze for 2-3 hours, until firm.
step-10: combine the crushed cookies with the melted butter in a medium bowl until well-combined.
step-11: transfer the cookie crumb mixture to a 10-inch (25 cm) springform pan.
step-12: use a spatula or measuring cup to press the cookie crumbs down to form an even base.
step-13: freeze for 10 minutes.
step-14: in a large bowl, beat the cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla extract together with an electric hand mixer until combined.
step-15: add the heavy cream and beat for another 2-3 minutes until combined and fluffy.
step-16: spread half the cheesecake mixture over the chilled cookie crust.
step-17: freeze for 10 minutes.
step-18: unwrap the cherry pie filling, and place it on top of the set cheesecake layer.
step-19: cover with the remaining cheesecake batter, spreading until smooth on top.
step-20: decorate with fresh berries.
step-21: chill in the fridge for at least 4 hours before slicing and serving.

step-1: add the cherries to a food processor and puree until smooth.
step-2: transfer the cherry puree to a saucepan over medium heat with the simple syrup and vanilla.
step-3: simmer for 5 minutes, until slightly reduced.
step-4: remove from the heat and let cool completely.
step-5: once the cherry syrup is cool, strain into an airtight glass container and store in the refrigerator for up to 1 month.
step-6: to make the soda, pour 1 cup (240 ml) of seltzer water into a glass filled with ice and add 1-2 tablespoons of cherry syrup.
step-7: stir to combine.
step-8: garnish with cherries, if desired.
step-9:
nutrition, per 1 tablespoon:
calories: 19
sugars: 4 grams

step-1: preheat the oven to 300˚f (150˚c).
step-2: in a small bowl, combine the raisins and sweet red wine.
step-3: let sit for at least 10 minutes, until the raisins absorb some of the wine.
step-4: in a medium bowl, use an electric hand mixer to beat the egg whites until medium peaks form.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: in a large bowl, use an electric hand mixer to cream together the butter and sugar.
step-7: add the egg yolks and beat until incorporated.
step-8: add the salt to the flour, then gradually add the flour mixture to the wet ingredients, beating until just incorporated.
step-9: using a rubber spatula, fold in the soaked raisins, walnuts, and glazed fruit until just combined.
step-10: gently fold in the egg whites.
step-11: transfer the batter to a 9x5-inch (23x13 cm) loaf pan and smooth the top.
step-12: bake for 2 hours 15 minutes to 2 hours 30 minutes, until a skewer inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean.
step-13: let cool.
step-14: serve immediately or wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for up to 7 days.

step-1: in a large mixing bowl, combine the oats, rice cereal, coconut oil, honey, brown sugar, salt, and vanilla until evenly mixed.
