step-2: for chocolate chip, take ¼ of the oats mix and combine with chocolate chips.
step-3: stir until mixed.
step-4: move the mixture to a small baking dish.
step-5: for apple cinnamon, take ¼ of the oats mix and combine with dried apples, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
step-6: stir until mixed.
step-7: move the mixture to a small baking dish.
step-8: for cherry almond, take ¼ of the oats mix and combine with almonds and cherries.
step-9: stir until mixed.
step-10: move the mixture to a small baking dish.
step-11: for peanut butter crunch, take ¼ of the oats mix and combine with pretzels, peanut butter, and chocolate candies.
step-12: stir until mixed.
step-13: move the mixture to a small baking dish.
step-14: bake each bar mixture at 350°f (175°c) for 5-8 minutes.
step-15: let granola cool and then cut into desired bar shape.

step-1: preheat oven to 325˚f (160˚c).
step-2: combine wet ingredients together in a large bowl.
step-3: then add in all the remaining dry ingredients.
step-4: add mixture into a 8x8 inch (20x20 cm) baking pan lined with greased parchment paper.
step-5: firmly press down mixture until it is one smooth layer.
step-6: (if you grease the spatula as well it will prevent the mixture from sticking to it!)
step-7: bake 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-8: let cool 10 minutes.
step-9: drizzle top with melted dark chocolate.
step-10: chill for 30 minutes, or until dark chocolate is solid.
step-11: cut into 8 equal pieces.
step-12: wrap each bar in parchment paper or foil.
step-13: store in the freezer for up to 3 months or in the refrigerator up to 1 week.

step-1: combine the berries and water in a small saucepan over medium-low heat.
step-2: cook for 15-20 minutes, stirring frequently, until the fruit is broken down and the mixture is saucy.
step-3: remove the pot from the heat and stir in the chia seeds, lemon juice, honey (start with a small amount and add more as needed, depending on how sweet the fruit is), and salt.
step-4: let sit for 10 minutes to allow the chia seeds to hydrate and thicken the jam.
step-5: then transfer to a resealable jar.
step-6: the jam will keep in the refrigerator for up to 1 month.

step-1: in a microwave-proof liquid measuring cup, combine the water and the milk.
step-2: microwave on high for 45 seconds.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, salt, garlic powder, parmesan, and yeast.
step-4: mix thoroughly.
step-5: pour the milk mixture over the dry ingredients.
step-6: stir to combine.
step-7: knead the dough on a clean surface for 5 minutes until smooth, if the dough is sticking to the surface add olive oil 1 teaspoon at a time, then form into a tight ball.
step-8: drizzle 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large bowl.
step-9: place the dough in the bowl and cover with plastic wrap.
step-10: let rise for 1 hour.
step-11: preheat the oven to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-12: in a separate large bowl, combine the chicken, 2 cups (200 g) mozzarella, parmesan, garlic powder, pepper, and alfredo sauce.
step-13: mix thoroughly.
step-14: place the risen dough onto a floured surface.
step-15: roll out the dough so it is twice as long as it is wide and about ¼ inch (½ cm) thick.
step-16: transfer the dough to a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-17: roll up all of the sides of the dough to create an oval shape.
step-18: pinch the dough and pull it while twisting, wrapping the dough into little spirals and placing it onto the rolled edge of the dough.
step-19: continue all the way around until you have several little spirals of dough.
step-20: pour the chicken alfredo mixture over the dough and spread it until it reaches the edges of the dough.
step-21: brush the sides of the dough with egg wash.
step-22: sprinkle the rest of the mozzarella on top of the chicken alfredo mixture.
step-23: bake for 30 minutes, until the crust is golden brown.
step-24: sprinkle with parsley.
step-25: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: spread pizza dough out on a parchment-lined pan.
step-3: bake 10 minutes.
step-4: top with alfredo sauce, mozzarella, chicken, tomato, and parsley.
step-5: bake an additional 10 minutes.
step-6: slice and dip!

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: slice each chicken breasts in half lengthwise and sprinkle 1 teaspoon of salt, pepper, and garlic powder evenly on both sides of each chicken breast.
step-3: heat oil in a large pan over high heat, then sear the chicken for about 1 minute per side.
step-4: they will continue to cook through in the oven later on.
step-5: in the residual oil (drain some if necessary), toss in the garlic and onions, stirring constantly until the mixture has started to brown.
step-6: pour in the cream, stirring until it starts to boil, then add the parmesan and parsley.
step-7: cook for 1 additional minute, then remove from heat.
step-8: in a 9" x 13" (23cm x 33cm) rectangular baking pan, spread about ¼ of the cream mixture on the bottom.
step-9: lay enough lasagna noodles to cover the sauce, then spread about ½ of the remaining cream mixture on top.
step-10: place enough chicken breasts to cover the sauce, then sprinkle with half of the mozzarella, followed by half of the bacon and half of the parsley.
step-11: repeat the layers once more, starting with noodles, sauce, chicken, bacon, parsley, and mozzarella.
step-12: bake for about 25 minutes, until the cheese is golden brown.
step-13: cool for about 15 minutes, slice, and serve!

step-1: preheat oven to 450°f (230°c).
step-2: roll out dough to about 10 - 12 inches (25-30 cm) in diameter.
step-3: top pizza with alfredo sauce, chicken, and tomatoes.
step-4: bake in oven for 15-20 minutes, or until crust is crispy and cheese is melted and 5. turning golden brown.
step-5: garnish with parsley and cut into 8 slices.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: in a large sauté pan, melt the butter over medium heat.
step-3: add the garlic and sauté for 2-3 minutes, until softened.
step-4: add the heavy cream and parmesan and stir to incorporate.
step-5: once the mixture comes to a low boil, reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10-15 minutes, until the sauce coats the back of a spoon.
step-6: season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg.
step-7: remove the sauce from the heat.
step-8: pour a thin layer of sauce in a the bottom of a 9x13-inch (23x33 cm) glass baking dish.
step-9: arrange 1 package of spinach ricotta ravioli over the sauce.
step-10: top with 1 cup of shredded chicken and ½ cup (50 g) of mozzarella cheese.
step-11: cover with more sauce.
step-12: arrange another package of ravioli over the first layer, and top with the remaining cup of shredded chicken and another ½ cup (50 g) of mozzarella.
step-13: top with more sauce.
step-14: add the last package of ravioli and cover with remaining sauce, making sure all the ravioli are covered.
step-15: top with the remaining cup of shredded mozzarella cheese.
step-16: cover the ravioli lasagna with foil and bake for 20 minutes.
step-17: uncover and cook for another 20 minutes, until the cheese is golden brown.
step-18: let cool for 10 minutes.
step-19: sprinkle with chopped parsley, then serve.

step-1: in a pot, cook pasta according to package instructions, drain, then set aside.
step-2: in the same pot, heat 2 tablespoons olive oil and sauté 2 garlic cloves.
step-3: add chicken breasts, season with salt and pepper, and fully cook.
step-4: remove cooked chicken from pot and set aside.
step-5: in the same pot, pour the chicken broth, then add asparagus, salt, pepper, and the remaining garlic and stir.
step-6: cover and reduce heat to a simmer for 5 minutes.
step-7: add cooked chicken, penne, remaining olive oil, parmesan, and tomatoes, and stir until fully incorporated and the cheese has melted.
step-8: serve while hot.

step-1: bring a quart (950 ml) of water in a large pot to a boil over high heat, and salt to taste.
step-2: cook pasta for 8 minutes, or until slightly underdone.
step-3: cook pasta for 8 minutes, or until slightly underdone.
step-4: add broccoli to pasta and simmer for 4 minutes with the lid on.
step-5: add broccoli to pasta and simmer for 4 minutes with the lid on.
step-6: strain the pasta and broccoli in a colander, and run cold water over to prevent the broccoli from over cooking.
step-7: strain the pasta and broccoli in a colander, and run cold water over to prevent the broccoli from over cooking.
step-8: heat the olive oil in the pot over medium-high heat, and add the chicken.
step-9: season the chicken with season salt and pepper.
step-10: heat the olive oil in the pot over medium-high heat, and add the chicken.
step-11: season the chicken with season salt and pepper.
step-12: once the chicken is cooked through, remove it from the pot and set aside.
step-13: once the chicken is cooked through, remove it from the pot and set aside.
step-14: add the butter to the pot, and melt it.
step-15: once butter is fully melted, add in garlic and stir continuously for 10 seconds.
step-16: add the butter to the pot, and melt it.
step-17: once butter is fully melted, add in garlic and stir continuously for 10 seconds.
step-18: add the heavy cream, salt, pepper, and nutmeg.
step-19: stir often, and cook until sauce starts to bubble slightly.
step-20: add the heavy cream, salt, pepper, and nutmeg.
step-21: stir often, and cook until sauce starts to bubble slightly.
step-22: once the sauce is bubbling and begins to cook down, add in parmesan cheese and stir until the sauce thickens.
step-23: once the sauce is bubbling and begins to cook down, add in parmesan cheese and stir until the sauce thickens.
step-24: add in the cooked chicken, pasta, and broccoli, and stir until fully combined.
step-25: add in the cooked chicken, pasta, and broccoli, and stir until fully combined.
step-26: top with parmesan cheese or red chili flakes.
step-27: top with parmesan cheese or red chili flakes.
step-28: enjoy!

step-1: season the chicken thighs all over with 2 teaspoons of salt, 1 teaspoon of pepper, and the poultry seasoning.
step-2: in a large dutch oven, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
step-3: place seasoned chicken, skin-side down, in the hot oil and begin to render the chicken fat, about 5 minutes.
step-4: once the skin in crispy, flip the chicken and continue cooking for 3 minutes more.
step-5: remove the chicken from pot and set aside.
step-6: pour the chicken fat into a small bowl and reserve.
step-7: add the water, onion, the chopped carrot, chopped celery, and parsley stems to the pot.
step-8: return the chicken thighs to the pot and bring to a boil over medium high heat.
step-9: once boiling, reduce the heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
step-10: remove the chicken from the pot and discard the skin and bones.
step-11: shred the meat and set aside.
step-12: strain the stock through a fine-mesh sieve and discard the vegetables.
step-13: add 1 tablespoon of the reserved chicken fat to the pot over medium heat, along with the sliced carrots, sliced celery, garlic, and 2 tablespoons of flour.
step-14: stir to combine.
step-15: slowly add the reserved chicken stock, 2 teaspoons of salt, 1 teaspoon of pepper, and the garlic powder.
step-16: add the shredded chicken back to the pot and bring to a simmer over low heat and continue cooking for 20 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
step-17: meanwhile, make the dumplings: in a medium bowl, combine the remaining cups of flour, the baking powder, remaining teaspoon of salt, remaining ½ teaspoon of pepper, and the remaining 3 tablespoons of reserved chicken fat.
step-18: mix with a fork to combine.
step-19: add the buttermilk and mix to incorporate, then knead for 2 minutes, until the dough comes together.
step-20: pull off about 1 tablespoon of dough at a time and add to the soup.
step-21: continue cooking until the dumplings are cooked through, about 10 minutes.
step-22: ladle into bowls and garnish with the parsley leaves.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
step-3: on the first sheet, place the chicken, broccoli, and cauliflower with space between each piece.
step-4: drizzle the chicken and veggies with oil, and season with salt and pepper.
step-5: spoon the pesto on top of the chicken and spread into a thick, even layer.
step-6: season the veggies with the oregano and toss them on the sheet so that everything is evenly coated.
step-7: bake for 8 minutes, leaving room in the oven for the second baking sheet.
step-8: on the second baking sheet, place the salmon, yellow squash, and bell pepper with enough space between each piece.
step-9: drizzle the salmon and veggies with oil, and season with salt and pepper.
step-10: squeeze the fresh lemon juice over the salmon fillet.
step-11: season the veggies with garlic powder and toss them on the sheet so that everything is evenly coated.
step-12: add the second tray to the oven and bake both sheets for 12 minutes, until the chicken and salmon are both cooked through.
step-13: slice the chicken and salmon and place an assortment of protein and veggies in food storage containers.
step-14: these containers can be stored in the fridge for up to 4 days.
step-15: to serve, remove the lid from the container and microwave until desired temperature is reached.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: sift together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in another large mixing bowl.
step-3: cut unsalted butter into small chunks and add to bowl or use a cheese grater to grate butter into smaller pieces.
step-4: use a fork to incorporate the butter into the flour mixture until it forms a crumbly texture.
step-5: add milk and stir the dough until it is thick and pulls away from the sides of the bowl.
step-6: transfer dough to a lightly floured, flat surface.
step-7: pat the dough down to about 1-inch (2 cm) in thickness, fold in half, and pat down once more to 1-inch (2 cm) in thickness.
step-8: cover with a towel and let rest for 30 minutes.
step-9: while dough rests, combine chicken, cream cheese, spinach, mozzarella cheese, garlic powder, pepper, and salt in a large mixing bowl.
step-10: lightly flour a rolling pin and roll out dough out to about ½-centimeter (¼ inch) thickness.
step-11: use the lip of a cup to cut out 45 circles.
step-12: remove chicken spinach dip from the refrigerator and fill each dough circle with 1 tablespoon of dip.
step-13: fold each circle in half and press down the edges to seal the dip inside the dough.
step-14: fold the left side and right side of each half circle towards each other like a fortune cookie.
step-15: place the stuffed dough in an 11-inch (28 cm) nonstick or greased tart pan.
step-16: make an outer circle and work your way in, creating 4 circles total.
step-17: brush with egg wash.
step-18: bake for 25 minutes, or until golden brown.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the chicken thighs with the garlic powder, thyme, dried parsley, salt, pepper, and olive oil.
step-2: toss until well coated.
step-3: in a dutch oven over medium-high heat, cook the chicken until golden brown, about 5 minutes per side.
step-4: transfer the chicken to a cutting board to cool for 5 minutes, then shred with 2 forks into small pieces.
step-5: to the same pot, add the butter, carrots, celery, onion, mushrooms, and garlic.
step-6: season with salt and pepper, stir, and cook over medium heat until the veggies are soft, 5-10 minutes.
step-7: remove from the pot and set aside.
step-8: add the wild rice and 3½ cups of chicken broth to the pot.
step-9: bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 45 minutes, or until the rice is tender.
step-10: once the rice is cooked, stir in the parmesan, cooked vegetables, heavy cream, and remaining 4½ cups of broth.
step-11: bring to a boil.
step-12: stir in the sour cream, fresh parsley, and shredded chicken.
step-13: serve warm topped with more parmesan.

step-1: in a small/medium jar, mix olive oil, minced garlic, salt, black pepper, oregano, and chili flakes together.
step-2: shake it well, and save it in refrigerator for later.
step-3: note: refrigerate left over garlic sauce.
step-4: it lasts for up to one week
step-5: pre-heat the oven at 425ºf (220ºc).
step-6: oil spray the flat baking pan, roll out the pre-made pizza crust, if it’s needed, use a rolling pan to make the crust equally flat on the pan.
step-7: spread garlic sauce on pizza crust, place down sliced fresh mozzarella, sliced chicken breasts (cooked) and sprinkle diced onions.
step-8: bake it in the oven for 25-30 minutes until the cheese melts and the crust become golden brown.
step-9: take the pizza out and place down sliced avocados, and some grape tomatoes.

step-1: preheat oven to 350ºf (175ºc).
step-2: cook the lasagna noodles until al dente, drain and rinse the noodles with cold water then lay the on a paper towel to remove excess water.
step-3: in a medium saucepan add butter, heavy whipping cream, and cream cheese, cook over medium heat and whisk until melted.
step-4: add minced garlic, garlic powder, salt and pepper, whisk until smooth.
step-5: add the parmesan cheese and bring to a simmer, continue to cook for about 3-5 minutes or until it starts to thicken.
step-6: pour 1 cup (228 grams) of the alfredo sauce in a 9x13 inch (23x33 cm) pan.
step-7: add bacon and chicken to the alfredo sauce, mix together.
step-8: spread about 2 tbsp.
step-9: of alfredo sauce mixture over each noodle.
step-10: roll each noodle and place seam down in the pan.
step-11: once they are all in the pan pour remaining alfredo mixture over the top and sprinkle mozzarella cheese over the top.
step-12: cook for about 30 minutes until it is heated through and cheese bubbles and browns

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: on a cutting board, slice chicken lengthwise into 1-inch (2 cm) thick slices.
step-3: take each slice of chicken and cut it in half lengthwise leaving about 1 inch (2 cm) uncut on one end of the strip.
step-4: cut off part of the uncut end of the chicken so you do not have a thick spot in the middle of your longer chicken strip.
step-5: place chicken strips in a bowl.
step-6: add ½ teaspoon salt, pepper, onion powder, garlic powder, and 3 tablespoons lemon juice and mix to combine.
step-7: transfer to the refrigerator.
step-8: on a cutting board, slice each piece of bacon lengthwise creating 12 strips in total.
step-9: wrap the cut strip of bacon around the asparagus.
step-10: wrap a marinated chicken strip around the bacon-wrapped asparagus.
step-11: repeat with remaining ingredients.
step-12: place each bacon chicken asparagus twist on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-13: bake for 10 minutes.
step-14: turn up the heat to broil, and broil for 10 minutes.
step-15: flip the twists over, and broil for an additional ten minutes.
step-16: in a bowl add the greek yogurt parsley, dill, ½ teaspoon salt, and 3 tablespoons lemon juice.
step-17: stir until well combined.
step-18: remove bacon asparagus twists from baking sheet, and let cool.
step-19: serve with herb yogurt dipping sauce.

step-1: heat oil in a pot over medium-high heat.
step-2: cook the chicken with the salt and pepper.
step-3: add the garlic and broccoli, cooking for 1-2 minutes.
step-4: add the milk, parmesan, parsley, and bacon, bringing to a boil.
step-5: add the spaghetti, and toss until evenly coated and sauce sticks to the noodles.

step-1: preheat the oven 200ºc (400ºf).
step-2: season the chicken breast with salt and pepper, both sides.
step-3: bake the chicken breast for 25 minutes, or until cooked through.
step-4: with two forks, shred the chicken.
step-5: add the eggs, flour, rosemary, parsley, bacon, garlic powder, onion powder, pepper, mozzarella cheese, chipotle sauce, and salt.
step-6: mix to combine.
step-7: preheat a pot of oil to 180˚c (350˚f).
step-8: make small balls with the chicken mixture by rolling between your hands.
step-9: the coat the balls in breadcrumbs.
step-10: fry the balls until golden brown about 2-3 minutes.
step-11: drain on a paper towel to remove excess oil and sprinkle with salt.
step-12: garnish with a sprinkle of parsley.

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c)
step-2: on a baking sheet, place the 4 potatoes.
step-3: using a fork, puncture holes all around the potatoes.
step-4: bake for 1 hour until the potato gives when you press into it.
step-5: in a bowl, add the chicken, salt, pepper, half of the scallions, ½ cup (50 grams) mozzarella, and ranch.
step-6: stir to combine and set aside.
step-7: once the potatoes have cooled place one on a cutting board.
step-8: cut the potato in half lengthwise.
step-9: cut off one of the ends of the potato.
step-10: using a spoon, scoop out the insides of the potato making sure not to scoop out too much or the potato skin will be too thin.
step-11: with the remaining potatoes, cut them in half lengthwise and cut off both of the ends and scoop out the potato.
step-12: on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet place both ends.
step-13: place three of the skins alongside one potato end and place the other 3 potato skins alongside the other end
step-14: brush the potato skins with the rest of the olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
step-15: scoop the chicken mixture into the potato skins and press down into an even layer.
step-16: sprinkle the rest of the mozzarella cheese over the potato skins.
step-17: bake for 5 minutes until melted.
step-18: top with bacon and the rest of the scallions.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: with a fork, poke the potatoes.
step-3: place the potatoes on a plate and microwave for five minutes on each side.
step-4: in a bowl mix the chicken, ranch dressing, bacon, and cheddar cheese.
step-5: carefully place the potatoes on a baking sheet, and slice them half way down.
step-6: fill the potatoes with the chicken mixture.
step-7: top with more cheddar cheese.
step-8: bake for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted.
step-9: top with sour cream and scallions.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: cut pizza dough into 8 sections on a floured surface.
step-3: with one section, roll out dough until flat and circular.
step-4: in a medium bowl, mix together the chicken, ranch packet, red onion, and bacon.
step-5: place a slice of mozzarella on the rolled out dough.
step-6: top with 2-3 tablespoons of the chicken mixture.
step-7: fold one side of dough up and over ingredients, and seal calzone by crimping the edges together.
step-8: place on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-9: apply egg wash to outside of calzone and sprinkle with cheddar cheese.
step-10: bake calzones at 400°f (200°c) for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown.

step-1: in a large bowl, mix the warm water, sugar, and yeast.
step-2: let sit for 5 minutes, or until the mixture becomes cloudy and slightly foamy.
step-3: add the flour, salt, and 1 tablespoon of oil to the bowl with the yeast mixture and stir until combined.
step-4: turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 3-5 minutes.
step-5: wipe the large bowl clean and lightly coat with remaining oil.
step-6: place the dough into the bowl and cover with plastic wrap and a dish towel.
step-7: set in a warm place for 20 minutes, or until the dough has nearly doubled in size.
step-8: preheat oven to 450ºf (230ºc), and line a sheet tray with parchment paper.
step-9: once risen, turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and stretch the dough into a 12x22-inch (30x56 cm) rectangle.
step-10: layer the ranch, chicken, bacon, and cheddar in the center of the rectangle, lengthwise, leaving 1-2 inches (2 ½-5 cm) on the top and bottom.
step-11: slice the dough in half through the center, lengthwise.
step-12: fold each piece’s center edge towards the outer edge and pat down, creating a long roll-up.
step-13: slice each roll into 4-5 equal pieces.
step-14: pinch the edges closed on all the pieces and place on sheet tray.
step-15: brush the tops with olive oil and sprinkle with remaining cheese.
step-16: bake for 15-20 minutes, or until light golden brown.
step-17: serve immediately or allow to cool, then freeze in an airtight container up to 1-2 months.
step-18: to reheat, microwave for 45 seconds to 1 minute.

step-1: in a shallow dish, combine 2 cloves of garlic, the ginger, 2 thinly sliced scallions, the soy sauce, 2 tablespoons sesame oil, the mirin, and brown sugar, and whisk to combine.
step-2: add the chicken and toss to coat.
step-3: cover with plastic wrap and let marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-4: bring a large pot of water to boil over high heat and season generously with salt.
step-5: prepare an ice bath in a large bowl.
step-6: blanch the spinach in the boiling water for 30 seconds, then transfer to the ice bath to shock, then drain.
step-7: transfer to a small bowl and season with 1 teaspoon of sesame oil, salt, and pepper.
step-8: in a medium skillet, heat 1 teaspoon of sesame oil over medium heat.
step-9: add the carrots and cook until softened, 2-3 minutes.
step-10: remove from the pan and set aside.
step-11: season with salt.
step-12: in the same skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of sesame oil over medium-high heat.
step-13: add the remaining clove of garlic and cook for 30 seconds, until fragrant.
step-14: add the mushrooms and cook, stirring frequently, until softened, about 2 minutes.
step-15: season with salt, then remove from the pan and set aside.
step-16: in the same skillet, heat the remaining tablespoon of sesame oil over medium-high heat.
step-17: add the marinated chicken and sauté, stirring occasionally, until cooked through, about 5 minutes.
step-18: heat a nonstick pan over medium-high heat.
step-19: melt the butter in the pan.
step-20: once the foaming subsides, crack the eggs into the pan and cook until the whites are firm and golden brown around the edges and the yolks are still runny, or to your desired doneness.
step-21: to assemble the bibimbap bowls, top the rice with the chicken, kimchi, sliced scallions, carrots, spinach, mushrooms, cucumbers, and fried eggs.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a large pot over medium-high heat, melt the butter.
step-3: add the onion, stir until softened.
step-4: about 1 minute.
step-5: whisk in the flour, stirring constantly to prevent the flour from browning.
step-6: about 1 minute.
step-7: whisk in the chicken broth, salt, and pepper.
step-8: continue to whisk until no lumps remain.
step-9: whisk in the heavy cream.
step-10: bring to a light simmer until the sauce has thickened slightly.
step-11: test for additional salt/pepper.
step-12: add the mixed vegetables and shredded chicken, stir until fully incorporated.
step-13: transfer to a 9x13-inch (23x33 cm) baking dish.
step-14: evenly top with 12 pieces of biscuit dough (you will have extra biscuits, which can be baked off separately).
step-15: bake in a preheated oven for 20 minutes, until the biscuits are golden and the gravy mixture is bubbling.
step-16: cool slightly before serving.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f/180°c.
step-2: in a bowl, mix chicken, broccoli, alfredo sauce, and ½ cup/55 grams of mozzarella.
step-3: stuff mixture into the jumbo shells, and place in rows in a greased 9x13 inch/23x33 cm glass baking dish.
step-4: spread on ¼ cup/57 grams alfredo sauce and sprinkle on remaining ½ cup/55 grams of mozzarella.
step-5: cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f/200°c.
step-2: cut the puff pastry into six rectangles and place on a nonstick baking tray.
step-3: on one rectangle, spread 1 tablespoon of alfredo.
step-4: top with steamed broccoli, shredded chicken, and cheddar.
step-5: place a rectangle of pastry on top and seal the edges with a fork.
step-6: repeat with remaining pastry rectangles.
step-7: brush with egg wash.
step-8: bake for 15-20 minutes or until the pastry is flaky and golden.

step-1: liberally season chicken thighs with salt and pepper.
step-2: in a 4-quart jumbo cooker, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium-high heat.
step-3: add chicken and cook 3-4 minutes a side, until lightly browned.
step-4: transfer to a plate.
step-5: add another tablespoon of olive oil to the skillet before adding the mushrooms.
step-6: lightly season with salt and pepper, and cook until mushrooms begin to brown, about 5 minutes.
step-7: once browned, remove mushrooms to the same dish with the reserved chicken thighs.
step-8: add the final tablespoon of olive oil followed by the sliced onion and pepper.
step-9: season with salt and pepper, and cook over medium heat until they begin to brown, about 5-7 minutes.
step-10: create a well in the middle of the onion-pepper mixture and add the tomato paste.
step-11: cook out the tomato paste for about 1 minute before mixing it together with the onions and peppers.
step-12: add garlic, oregano, red pepper flakes, and rosemary.
step-13: mix them into the onion and peppers before adding the red wine.
step-14: use the moisture from the red wine to scrape off any stuck-on bits from the bottom of the pan.
step-15: let wine reduce by half before adding the diced tomatoes and chicken stock.
step-16: return to a simmer.
step-17: place chicken and mushrooms on top of the simmering sauce, being sure to also add any accumulated juices that may have collected.
step-18: sprinkle with chopped parsley.
step-19: cook while covered for 12 minutes or until chicken’s internal temperature reaches 165˚f (75˚c).
step-20: serve chicken and sauce with a side of pasta or bread.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: make the flatbread bowl: in a medium bowl, stir together the flour, salt, and yogurt with a flexible spatula to combine.
step-3: knead the dough with your hands until a smooth ball forms, about 5 minutes.
step-4: lightly dust a clean work surface with flour.
step-5: turn out the dough and roll out to a 9-inch (22.5 cm) round as thin as a sheet of paper.
step-6: rotate the round occasionally to help the dough hold its shape.
step-7: lightly dust with flour as needed to keep the dough from sticking, but be careful not to use too much flour, which will make the flatbread tough.
step-8: invert an 8-inch (20 cm) metal bowl so the domed side faces up.
step-9: grease the bowl generously with nonstick spray, then spray one side of the dough.
step-10: gently lay the dough, greased-side down, over the bowl, pressing it flush against the surface.
step-11: it’s fine if the dough folds over on itself in places.
step-12: grease the inside of the other bowl, then spray the exposed side of the dough.
step-13: press the second bowl over the dough.
step-14: with a paring knife, trim any excess dough around the edges.
step-15: transfer the bowls, still upside down, to a baking sheet and bake for 25 minutes, or until the dough is golden brown, lift the top bowl to check.
step-16: transfer to a wire rack and let cool for at least 15 minutes.
step-17: when the bowls are cool enough to handle, remove the top bowl.
step-18: gently invert the other bowl and let the flatbread bowl slide off.
step-19: let cool completely on the rack.
step-20: it will continue to crisp as it cools.
step-21: make the salad: season the chicken breast on both sides with salt and pepper.
step-22: heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat.
step-23: sear the chicken until deep golden brown, about 6 minutes per side, or until the thickest part of the chicken reaches 165°f (75˚c) on an instant-read thermometer.
step-24: remove the chicken from the pan and let rest for 5 minutes.
step-25: in a medium bowl, whisk together the worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, garlic, mustard, parmesan, and salt to taste.
step-26: drizzle in the remaining 3 tablespoons of olive oil in a slow, steady stream, whisking constantly to emulsify.
step-27: stir in the yogurt until smooth.
step-28: season with pepper to taste, if desired.
step-29: once the chicken has rested, thinly slice.
step-30: fill the flatbread bowl with the romaine, then top with the sliced chicken, croutons, dressing, and parmesan cheese.

step-1: boil water, add the pasta, and cook according to package instructions.
step-2: drain water, and let the pasta chill.
step-3: meanwhile, season each of the chicken breasts with 1 tbsp.
step-4: olive oil, salt, and pepper.
step-5: grill for six to eight minutes on each side.
step-6: cut the chicken into bite-size pieces.
step-7: in a large bowl combine pasta, romaine lettuce, tomatoes, chicken, croutons, parmesan, and caesar dressing.
step-8: toss gently.

step-1: in a large bowl, mix the warm water, yeast, and sugar.
step-2: let sit for 5 minutes, or until the mixture becomes cloudy and slightly foamy.
step-3: add the flour, salt, and 1 tablespoon of oil to the bowl with the yeast mixture and stir until combined.
step-4: turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 3-5 minutes.
step-5: wipe the large bowl clean and lightly coat with remaining oil.
step-6: place the dough into the bowl and cover with plastic wrap and a dish towel.
step-7: set in a warm place for 20 minutes, or until the dough has nearly doubled in size.
step-8: preheat oven to 450ºf (230ºc), and line a sheet tray with parchment paper.
step-9: once risen, turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and stretch the dough into a 12x22-inch (30x56 cm) rectangle.
step-10: layer the cheddar, broccoli, and chicken in the center of the rectangle, lengthwise, leaving 1-2 inches (2 ½-5 cm) on the top and bottom.
step-11: slice the dough in half through the center, lengthwise.
step-12: fold each piece’s center edge towards the outer edge and pat down, creating a long roll-up.
step-13: slice each roll into 4-5 equal pieces.
step-14: pinch the edges closed on all the pieces and place on sheet tray.
step-15: brush the tops with olive oil and sprinkle with remaining cheese.
step-16: bake for 15-20 minutes, or until light golden brown.
step-17: serve immediately or allow to cool, then freeze in an airtight container up to 1-2 months.
step-18: to reheat, microwave for 45 seconds to 1 minute.

step-1: to make the sauce, mix the grated ginger, garlic, ketchup, soy sauce and oyster sauce in a small bowl until combined.
step-2: set aside
step-3: fry the chicken until cooked through.
step-4: add the red pepper and spring onion and fry for 2 minutes.
step-5: add the beansprouts and fry for a further 3-4 minutes.
step-6: add the sauce and fry for another minute or two.
step-7: add noodles to each hole of the muffin tin and pat down to make a small indent.
step-8: bake for 15 minutes at 180°c (350°f).
step-9: remove nests from muffin tin.
step-10: spoon the chow mien onto the baked noodles.

step-1: make the dressing: combine blue cheese dressing, salt, and pepper in a 16-ounce (480 ml) mason jar.
step-2: stir with a fork until well-combined.
step-3: add the tomato, chicken, bacon bits, hard boiled egg, and lettuce.
step-4: store in the refrigerator for 2-3 days.
step-5: when ready to eat, shake well to combine.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, combined the greek yogurt, milk, vinegar, parsley, dill, onion powder, garlic powder, black pepper, and salt and mix until smooth.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: place the chicken on a greased roasting tray and season both sides with salt and pepper.
step-5: bake for 20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the juices run clear.
step-6: let the chicken rest for 5 minutes before dicing.
step-7: in a large serving bowl, combine the romaine lettuce, red onion, cherry tomatoes, diced chicken, avocado, eggs, and bacon.
step-8: pour desired amount of ranch dressing over the salad and toss.
step-9: portion the salad among serving bowls and top with more dressing, if desired.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: sprinkle the chicken breasts with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and onion powder, tossing to coat evenly.
step-3: on a cutting board, place a chicken breast between two sheets of plastic wrap and pound until about ½-inch (1 cm) thick with a meat mallet, rolling pin, or heavy pan.
step-4: remove the plastic wrap and place a layer of swiss cheese, then ham, then one more layer of swiss cheese.
step-5: evenly roll the chicken, and place onto a new sheet of plastic wrap.
step-6: wrap the chicken in the plastic wrap, twist the excess plastic, and roll the chicken while twisting the sides in to tighten and firm up the roll of chicken cordon bleu.
step-7: tie the excess and chill in the fridge to set for 30 minutes.
step-8: cut the puff pastry sheets in half and gently roll out width-wise.
step-9: brush the pastry with mustard and place the chicken on to the bottom edge of the pastry.
step-10: tightly roll the chicken in the puff pastry, pinching the seams together to close and folding the sides under the bottom.
step-11: place the chickens rolls on a greased baking sheet and brush all sides with egg wash.
step-12: with a fork, score a decorative design onto the surface of the puff pastry.
step-13: sprinkle with salt.
step-14: bake for 35-40 minutes or until the puff pastry is a dark golden brown and the internal temperature of the chicken is 165°f (75°c).

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: slice the chicken breasts in half into cutlets and season with salt and pepper.
step-3: in a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, salt, pepper, 2 teaspoons oregano, 2 teaspoons onion powder, 2 teaspoons basil, and 2 teaspoons garlic powder.
step-4: in another medium bowl, beat the eggs.
step-5: in another medium bowl, combine 1½ cups (75 g) of panko bread crumbs, the remaining 2 teaspoons garlic powder, 2 teaspoons basil, 2 teaspoons onion powder, and 2 teaspoons oregano.
step-6: in a large skillet, heat the canola oil over medium-high heat.
step-7: bread the chicken cutlets by coating in the flour mixture, then in the egg, and finally in the panko.
step-8: working in batches, fry the breaded cutlets in the hot oil for 2 minutes on each side, until golden brown and cooked through.
step-9: transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.
step-10: make the cheese sauce: in a small saucepan over medium heat, whisk together the butter and flour.
step-11: cook until the flour is golden brown, about 2 minutes.
step-12: slowly whisk in the warm milk until fully incorporated.
step-13: bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer until thickened, about 3 minutes.
step-14: turn off the heat and whisk in the gruyère and swiss cheeses until completely melted.
step-15: add the salt and stir to combine.
step-16: spread about ⅓ of the sauce in the bottom of a 9x13-inch (22x30 cm) baking dish.
step-17: top with 4 lasagna noodles, 4 chicken cutlets, and 4 slices of ham.
step-18: repeat to make another layer and then top with the remaining sauce.
step-19: sprinkle the remaining ½ cup (25 g) of panko bread crumbs and the gruyère cheese over the top.
step-20: bake for 45-50 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and crispy.
step-21: garnish with chopped parsley and serve.

step-1: slice the chicken breast in half lengthwise to create thinner cutlets.
step-2: using the bumpy side of a meat mallet, pound the chicken until ¼-inch (6 mm) thick.
step-3: add the flour, eggs, and bread crumbs to 3 separate, shallow dishes.
step-4: to the dish with the eggs, add the parsley, garlic, and milk.
step-5: season with salt and pepper.
step-6: mix with a fork to combine.
step-7: add the parmesan cheese to the bread crumbs and stir to combine.
step-8: working 1 piece at a time, coat the chicken cutlets in the flour, shaking off any excess, then the egg mixture, then the bread crumbs.
step-9: set the coated chicken on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and refrigerate for 1 hour.
step-10: melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat.
step-11: add enough olive oil to come ¼ inch (6 mm) up the sides of the pan.
step-12: working in batches, fry the chicken until golden brown, about 3-4 minutes per side.
step-13: add more oil as needed for subsequent batches.
step-14: drain the chicken on paper towels to absorb any excess oil.
step-15: season with a pinch of salt.
step-16: serve the chicken with lemon wedges.
step-17: the dish pairs well with pan-roasted potatoes and tomato salad.

step-1: add the olive oil, apple cider vinegar, honey, dijon mustard, salt, and pepper together in a small bowl.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: on a cutting board, season the chicken with salt, pepper, and paprika.
step-4: heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
step-5: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides, about 4 minutes.
step-6: in a large bowl, add the sliced pear, spinach, cranberries, walnuts, and cooked chicken, and dress with the vinaigrette.

step-1: slice chicken breast into strips.
step-2: add the curry powder, oil, pepper, and salt to the prepared chicken.
step-3: rub in the dry ingredients and make sure the chicken is evenly coated.
step-4: heat oil in a skillet over medium heat.
step-5: add the chicken and cook until partially done.
step-6: remove from skillet and place in a clean bowl.
step-7: add onions, ginger, and garlic to skillet.
step-8: cook until the onions are translucent.
step-9: add the diced tomato, curry powder, cayenne pepper, and chicken stock.
step-10: return the partially cooked chicken.
step-11: stir and cook until chicken is done.
step-12: stir in the chicken stock cornstarch slurry.
step-13: cook until the curry has thickened.
step-14: turn off the heat and stir in the greek yogurt.
step-15: preheat oven to 450°f (230°c), place french fries on baking sheet, bake for 18 minutes (either from scratch or frozen).
step-16: pour chicken curry over french fries, garnish with cilantro, as desired.

step-1: in a small bowl, combine the salt, pepper, cumin, smoked paprika, turmeric, coriander, cardamom, dry mustard, cayenne, and allspice.
step-2: stir to combine.
step-3: in a large bowl, add the cubed chicken thighs, 2 tablespoons of yogurt, 4 cloves of minced garlic, the ginger, and half of the spice mixture.
step-4: toss the chicken until it is fully coated.
step-5: cover the bowl with plastic wrap, and marinate in the fridge for 2 hours or overnight.
step-6: make the naan bowls: in a liquid measuring cup, combine the warm water, sugar, and yeast.
step-7: set aside to bloom for 10 minutes.
step-8: in the meantime, mix the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl.
step-9: to the yeast mixture, add the yogurt and milk.
step-10: stir until smooth, then pour into the dry ingredients.
step-11: stir to combine, then dump the dough out onto a floured surface and knead with your hands until it forms a smooth, soft ball, about 2 minutes.
step-12: place the dough in a clean large bowl greased with olive oil and cover with a clean kitchen towel or plastic wrap.
step-13: let rise at room temperature until doubled in size, about 2 hours.
step-14: heat the olive oil in a large dutch oven over medium-high heat.
step-15: working in batches to avoid overcrowding the pot, cook the marinated chicken on all sides until cooked through and browned, about 20 minutes.
step-16: drizzle in more oil, as needed, to prevent the meat from sticking to the bottom of the pot.
step-17: transfer the browned meat to a plate as it finishes cooking and set aside.
step-18: add the carrots, onion, potatoes, remaining 5 cloves of minced garlic, and reserved spice mixture, stir and cook until the vegetables brown slightly and start to soften, 15 minutes.
step-19: stir in the tomato paste and cook until aromatic, about 3 minutes.
step-20: add the crushed tomatoes and chicken broth.
step-21: stir to combine.
step-22: bring to a simmer.
step-23: add the chicken, stir, and return to a simmer.
step-24: cover and cook for 30 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and the chicken is cooked through.
step-25: stir in the remaining 3 tablespoons of yogurt, then cover and keep warm.
step-26: once the naan dough has risen, dump onto a floured surface, and divide into 6 equal portions.
step-27: roll each portion into a ¼-inch (1 /2 cm) thick circle, approximately 10 inches (25 cm) in diameter.
step-28: heat a large cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat.
step-29: place a disc of naan dough in the skillet.
step-30: cook for about 2 minutes, until the dough puffs up, then flip and cook on the other side until browned, 1 minute.
step-31: transfer the naan to a medium bowl and place another bowl on top.
step-32: repeat with the rest of the naan dough, stacking bowls between each round.
step-33: as the naan cools, they will retain the bowl shape.
step-34: brush the naan bowls with warm melted butter.
step-35: fill the naan bowls with the chicken curry and rice.
step-36: serve with yogurt, cilantro, and lime wedges.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: cut zucchini in half and hollow out the centers
step-3: add the greek yogurt, lime juice, and salt together in a small bowl and stir to combine.
step-4: on a cutting board, season the chicken breast with salt, pepper, and chili powder.
step-5: heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
step-6: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the chicken and cook until browned, about 3 minutes.
step-7: remove the chicken from the pan and let cool.
step-8: once cooled, shred the chicken with a fork.
step-9: add the chicken to a bowl with the salsa and stir to combine.
step-10: stuff chicken mixture in hollowed out zucchini boats, and top with cheddar cheese.
step-11: bake until cheese is melted and browned, and zucchini is tender, about 20 minutes.
step-12: top with tomato, avocado, cilantro, and lime crema.
step-13: serve with lime wedges.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: grease a bundt pan with nonstick spray.
step-3: invert a 3-inch (8-cm) diameter bowl in the center of two tortillas.
step-4: use a knife to cut around the bowl and discard the centers.
step-5: invert a 2-inch (5-cm) diameter bowl in the center of two tortillas.
step-6: use a knife to cut around the bowl and discard the centers.
step-7: invert a 1½-inch (4-cm) diameter bowl in the center of one tortilla.
step-8: use a knife to cut around the bowl and discard the center.
step-9: heat the oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat.
step-10: add the bell peppers and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
step-11: add the onion and toss to combine.
step-12: add the chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, and salt.
step-13: toss to combine.
step-14: add the chicken and cook until the onions are translucent and the chicken is warmed through.
step-15: place one of the tortillas with the 3-inch (8-cm) hole on the bottom of the greased bundt pan.
step-16: arrange a layer of cheddar cheese slices around the tortilla.
step-17: stack the second tortilla with a 3-inch (8-cm) hole over the cheese layer.
step-18: top the tortilla with half of the fajita mixture.
step-19: layer one of the tortillas with a 2-inch (5-cm) hole on top of the fajita layer.
step-20: top with a layer of pepper jack cheese.
step-21: layer the second tortilla with a 2-inch (5-cm) hole on top of the pepper jack layer.
step-22: add the remaining fajita mixture.
step-23: layer the tortilla with a 1½-inch (4-cm) hole and top with the remaining cheddar and pepper jack.
step-24: layer the last tortilla on top of the last cheese layer.
step-25: cover the top of the bundt pan with a 12-inch (30 ½-cm) round cake pan or aluminum foil and bake for 45 minutes.
step-26: let cool for at least 30 minutes.
step-27: invert the bundt pan onto a cutting board.
step-28: slice the chicken fajita party ring and top with sour cream.
step-29: serve with guacamole.

step-1: in a large skillet, coat chicken with salt, pepper, chili powder, cumin, cayenne, and garlic powder.
step-2: cook 5-7 minutes.
step-3: add the peppers and onions and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until they are soft.
step-4: remove chicken, onions and peppers from the pan and set aside.
step-5: place the tortilla in the skillet and add a layer of cheese on half of the tortilla.
step-6: add cooked chicken, peppers and onions.
step-7: top with more cheese and fold the tortilla in half.
step-8: cook for 6 minutes over medium heat, flipping half way.
step-9: garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with pico de gallo, guacamole, and sour cream on the side.

step-1: slice the chicken breasts into strips, about an inch apart, and coat with taco seasoning.
step-2: in a large skillet, heat 1 tbsp.
step-3: vegetable oil and cook chicken until no longer pink and slightly charred.
step-4: remove cooked chicken from the skillet.
step-5: heat another tbsp.
step-6: oil, add onion and garlic and cook for a couple minutes until it’s slightly translucent.
step-7: add the peppers, and cook slightly, then mix in the cooked chicken.
step-8: remove from heat and set aside.
step-9: in a clean pan, melt a bit of butter.
step-10: add a tortilla and move it around until it’s buttery.
step-11: add cheese, then fajita mixture, then more cheese, then top with another tortilla and pat it down.
step-12: flip the quesadilla over and cook the other side until it’s golden.
step-13: remove from pan and cut into quarters.
step-14: repeat these steps with the remaining tortillas.
step-15: *optional - serve with sour cream, guacamole, and salsa.

step-1: mix together the ingredients for the fajita rub.
step-2: heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large, nonstick skillet over medium heat.
step-3: toss in the sliced bell peppers and onion, sprinkle over 2 teaspoons of the fajita spice rub, and sauté until soft, about 8 minutes.
step-4: using a sharp knife, carefully slice the chicken breast in half.
step-5: lay a sheet of plastic wrap over the chicken breast and flatten the meat with a mallet or rolling pin.
step-6: spread a quarter the sautéed pepper mixture evenly on the chicken breast.
step-7: roll the breast and skewer with toothpicks so that the roll holds its shape.
step-8: slice the roll into ½-inch (1¼ cm) pieces, making sure each piece is held together with a toothpick.
step-9: season each roll on both sides with the fajita spice rub.
step-10: heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil in the skillet and fry the chicken rolls about 3 minutes on each side until fully cooked.
step-11: let rest 5 minutes before serving.

step-1: heat the oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
step-2: cook the chicken, bell peppers, onion, salt, chili powder, cumin, and garlic powder for five minutes, stirring constantly.
step-3: flip the chicken, and cook for another five minutes, until chicken is cooked and vegetables are slightly soft.
step-4: remove from heat and slice the chicken into strips.
step-5: in a small bowl, combine the olive oil, lime juice, brown sugar, chili, and salt, stirring until evenly mixed.
step-6: in a large bowl, toss the romaine lettuce with the chicken, peppers & onions, avocado, and dressing.

step-1: preheat oven to 425ºf (220ºc).
step-2: heat vegetable oil in a large skillet.
step-3: thinly slice onion, red bell pepper, and 1 garlic clove.
step-4: in heated skillet, saute onion, peppers, and garlic on medium-high.
step-5: cook for 4-5 minutes until onions are slightly translucent and tender.
step-6: stir in the chicken, taco seasoning, and a squeeze of lime.
step-7: mix together well.
step-8: remove skillet from heat and set aside.
step-9: microwave butter for 20 seconds, or until fully melted.
step-10: mix in minced garlic.
step-11: cut the dinner rolls in half and place the bottom layer on a parchment paper lined cookie sheet.
step-12: sprinkle a thick layer of cheese on top of the rolls.
step-13: then scoop a layer of the chicken fajita mixture on top.
step-14: finally, sprinkle another layer of cheese.
step-15: place on the dinner roll tops and brush them with the butter and garlic mixture.
step-16: bake sliders for 5 minutes.

step-1: in a 5-quart dutch oven coated with oil, cook chicken, chili powder, cumin, and pepper for 3 minutes.
step-2: add the garlic, onion, and bell peppers, and cook until the onions are clear.
step-3: add the juice of 2 limes, crushed tomato, chicken broth, and cream, and bring to a boil.
step-4: submerge the corn and corn tortillas in the soup.
step-5: reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes.
step-6: stir to break up the tortillas before serving.
step-7: top with avocado, cilantro, and cotija cheese if you want!

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: using a fork, poke holes down one side of each sweet potato.
step-3: microwave for 3-5 minutes, or until softened.
step-4: let sweet potatoes cool before handling.
step-5: cut the sweet potatoes in half and carve out the centers, leaving a small rim around the outside of each “boat.”
step-6: place sweet potato boats on a baking sheet covered in parchment paper.
step-7: add the bell peppers and onion to the other side of the baking sheet.
step-8: mix the fajita seasoning ingredients together.
step-9: drizzle in olive oil.
step-10: season the boats and veggies.
step-11: add chicken breast on top of the veggies, drizzle in olive oil and add additional seasoning.
step-12: bake 20-25 minutes, or until chicken reaches 165˚f (75˚c).
step-13: let cool for a few minutes.
step-14: shred the chicken with 2 forks and mix together with the veggies.
step-15: fill up sweet potato boats and top with mozzarella cheese.
step-16: bake for 5 more minutes, or until cheese is melted.
step-17: garnish with your favorite toppings (we used guacamole and cilantro).

step-1: in a large, nonstick skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
step-2: toss in the onions, bell peppers, salt, chili powder, cumin, and black pepper, and sauté until the onions and peppers have softened.
step-3: add in the shredded chicken and toss until everything in the pan is evenly coated and warmed through.
step-4: pour the chicken mixture into a large serving bowl .
step-5: toast the tortillas in the seasoned pan, about 3 minutes per side.
step-6: divide the mixture evenly between tortillas, top with a drizzle of sour cream, and serve.

step-1: in a large skillet heat oil over medium heat.
step-2: add garlic, onion, carrot, corn, and peas.
step-3: cook until carrots are tender, stirring occasionally.
step-4: add brown rice, chicken, egg, soy sauce, sesame oil, salt, and pepper to taste, and stir.
step-5: cook for another minute, or until everything is heated thoroughly.
step-6: serve with a sprinkle of sesame seeds and green onion.

step-1: season steak with a pinch of salt and pepper, then cut steak into bite-size pieces.
step-2: in a large bowl, combine all batter ingredients.
step-3: whisk until all ingredients are mixed through.
step-4: preheat about an inch of oil to 350˚f (180˚c) into a heavy, high-sided skillet or pan.
step-5: in a medium bowl, add flour and salt.
step-6: place steak into the flour, then batter, and then into the flour again.
step-7: lower the steak bites into the hot oil, being careful not to overcrowd the pan.
step-8: cook each side for 4 minutes or until golden brown.
step-9: transfer it onto a drying rack and season with salt.
step-10: discard the oil on the pan, but leave some oil for the gravy.
step-11: in the same bowl, add flour, milk, and salt, and mix until thicken.
step-12: dip the steaks into the gravy.

step-1: slice the chicken into thin strips, about ½-inch (1 ¼ cm) wide, so that they resemble fries.
step-2: season generously with salt and pepper.
step-3: in a medium bowl, mix together the white pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, black pepper, and salt.
step-4: add the flour and mix until well combined.
step-5: in a separate medium bowl, beat the eggs.
step-6: add the panko to another medium bowl.
step-7: dredge the chicken strips in the flour-spice mixture, then dip in the egg, then the panko, pressing the bread crumbs onto the chicken to ensure even coverage.
step-8: heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet.
step-9: shallow-fry the chicken fries for 1–2 minutes on each side, until fully cooked and golden.
step-10: drain on paper towels.
step-11: arrange half of the chicken fries on a platter or baking dish, then top with half of the cheese curds and a bit of the gravy.
step-12: top with the rest of the chicken fries, the remaining cheese curds, and gravy.
step-13: garnish with chives and serve immediately.

step-1: soak the wooden skewers in water for 30 minutes.
step-2: in a large bowl, combine the greek yogurt, paprika, oregano, coriander, cumin, garlic, cayenne, cinnamon, pepper, tahini, olive oil, and salt.
step-3: add the chicken and stir to coat completely in the sauce.
step-4: cover with plastic wrap and marinate in the fridge for at least 30 minutes or up to 4 hours.
step-5: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-6: make the tzatziki: in a medium bowl, combine the greek yogurt, cucumber, lemon zest, garlic, dill, pepper, salt, olive oil, and lemon juice.
step-7: stir to combine.
step-8: cover and refrigerate until ready to use.
step-9: thread 3-5 pieces of chicken onto each wooden skewer until loosely filled, leaving at least an inch (2 cm) of space on either end of the skewers.
step-10: place the skewers on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes.
step-11: slice the dinner rolls in half.
step-12: place the bottom half on a greased baking sheet.
step-13: sprinkle with diced tomatoes and chopped red onion.
step-14: stick the par-cooked chicken skewers into the bottom buns, spacing evenly.
step-15: place the top buns over the skewers and press down.
step-16: combine the olive oil, garlic, parsley, and salt in a small bowl and brush on the top buns.
step-17: bake the buns and the chicken for 10 more minutes, or until the chicken is fully cooked and the bread is toasted.
step-18: place the gyro sliders on a large platter and serve with tzatziki.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine marinade ingredients and stir well.
step-2: on a cutting board, place a piece of plastic wrap over the chicken thighs and pound until about ½ inch (1 cm) thick with a meat mallet, rolling pin, or heavy pan.
step-3: in another large bowl or gallon plastic bag, combine chicken thighs and marinade, stirring well to coat.
step-4: cover and refrigerate for at least one hour and up to one day.
step-5: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-6: shred the cucumber, be sure to squeeze out any excess liquid.
step-7: in a medium bowl, combine tzatziki ingredients and stir well.
step-8: cover and refrigerate at least 30 minutes.
step-9: on a baking sheet or a large cast-iron skillet, use the onion half as a base and position the skewer vertically like a spit.
step-10: skewer the chicken thighs individually, rotating each one 90 degrees.
step-11: bake for 1.5 to 2 hours, until internal temperature reaches 165°f (75°c).
step-12: let cool for 10 minutes.
step-13: carve off slices of chicken to fill a pita.
step-14: top with onion slices, tomato slices, and tzatziki sauce.

step-1: add the tomatoes, red bell pepper, quartered onion, and pepper to a blender and blend until smooth.
step-2: in a pot over medium heat, add 2 tablespoons oil, diced red onion, chicken, and curry powder.
step-3: cook until onions are soft and chicken has browned, about 8-10 minutes.
step-4: remove chicken from pot and set aside.
step-5: raise heat to medium-high, and using the same pot, add pureed tomato mixture, cooking until reduced by half.
step-6: add in remaining oil, and fry sauce for 8-10 minutes.
step-7: stir in chicken, along with rice, stock and thyme leaves.
step-8: cover pot tightly with foil.
step-9: cover with lid and reduce heat to low, cooking for 30 minutes.
step-10: once rice is cooked, fluff up before serving.

step-1: make the tonkatsu sauce: in a small bowl, mix together the ketchup, worcestershire sauce, and sugar until combined.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: make the sandwich: heat 2 inches of canola oil in a medium pot over medium-high heat until it reaches 350˚f (180˚c).
step-4: slice through the thick part of the chicken thigh so it an even thickness.
step-5: season with salt and pepper on both sides.
step-6: add the flour, egg, and panko to 3 separate shallow dishes.
step-7: coat the chicken thigh in the flour, then the egg, then the panko.
step-8: to test the oil temperature, add a pinch of panko—if it sizzles immediately, it’s ready for frying.
step-9: carefully fry the chicken for about 2 minutes per each side, or until golden brown.
step-10: drain on paper towels.
step-11: in a small bowl, mix together the mayonnaise and hot mustard.
step-12: assemble the sandwiches: spread the mayonnaise sauce on each piece of toasted bread.
step-13: on one side, layer on the cabbage, a drizzle of tonkatsu sauce, the chicken, and more tonkatsu sauce.
step-14: top with the other slice of bread.
step-15: cut the sandwich in half, then serve.

step-1: season chicken with pepper, salt and 1 tbsp sesame oil.
step-2: mix thoroughly and set aside.
step-3: in a different bowl add, chicken broth, 1 tbsp sesame oil, soy sauce, hoisin sauce, and cornstarch.
step-4: mix thoroughly.
step-5: heat oil over medium-high heat.
step-6: add chicken, cook until no longer pink (3 to 4 minutes).
step-7: remove chicken and add ginger and garlic cloves, stir until fragrant.
step-8: add mushrooms, onions, carrots, and sugar snap peas.
step-9: stir fry until vegetables are tender.
step-10: add the cooked chicken and cooked egg noodles.
step-11: toss in sauce and cook for another three minutes.
step-12: garnish with scallions and call it a night in!

step-1: add all the marinade ingredients to a bowl and mix until fully combined, set aside.
step-2: slice a full-size chicken wing into three parts along the joints.
step-3: discard the wing-tip (or you can save them for making a chicken stock).
step-4: for the drummet (the upper, meaty, one-bone part of the wing), cut along the circumference of the thin end so that the bone and the meat are no longer connected.
step-5: then push down the meat so the drummet becomes a lollipop.
step-6: for the winglet (the middle, two-bone part of the wing), separate where the two bones join, and also cut along the circumferences of both ends, so the bone and the meat are no longer connected.
step-7: take out the thinner bone, and push down the meat into one end of the thinner bone.
step-8: place the prepared chicken lollipops in the marinade.
step-9: stir and cover.
step-10: marinate in the fridge for at least 1 hour.
step-11: mix all batter ingredients until smooth without lumps.
step-12: dip the meat end of the chicken lollipops into the batter.
step-13: in a medium-sized pot, heat the oil to 170˚c (340˚f).
step-14: deep fry the chicken for 5 minutes or until the batter becomes golden brown and the chicken is cooked throughout.

step-1: heat up rotisserie chicken and marinara sauce.
step-2: place cooked pasta in a thermos followed by hot chicken and marinara sauce.
step-3: shake to mix and place in lunch box along with sliced bell peppers.
step-4: slice an apple and reassemble slices around the core.
step-5: wrap with a rubber band to prevent browning.
step-6: pack bento box in the lunchbox with a frozen juice box and a fork.

step-1: butterfly, pound and divide one chicken breast into 2 pieces.
step-2: combine flour, salt and pepper and dredge chicken breast in the seasoned flour.
step-3: dust off any excess.
step-4: fry the chicken in a little bit of oil on a hot skillet/pan.
step-5: fry 3 minutes per side.
step-6: in the same skillet or pan, add the mushrooms.
step-7: cook until soft.
step-8: add the marsala wine, lemon juice, minced garlic, butter and parsley.
step-9: cook until sauce has slightly thickened.
step-10: serve chicken on top of or with pasta/ rice and spoon sauce over.

step-1: boil 5 eggs in boiling water for 5 minutes.
step-2: immediately transfer eggs to an ice water bath to cool.
step-3: this will prevent the eggs from cooking further and will ensure a nice soft-boiled egg.
step-4: in a food processor, combine the chicken, onion, garlic, ginger, cumin, chili powder, garam masala, and coriander, and blend.
step-5: peel the eggs.
step-6: press out the chicken mixture into 5 patties, roll the eggs in flour and wrap the patty around.
step-7: whisk the remaining eggs together.
step-8: roll the chicken-wrapped egg in flour, then egg wash, and finish in breadcrumbs.
step-9: repeat for each egg.
step-10: heat oil to 170˚c (325˚f) and fry each egg for about 5 minutes, until golden brown on all sides.
step-11: serve hot or cold!

step-1: in a medium pot, combine all ingredients for glaze and bring to a boil until the bubbles start to become sticky and glossy.
step-2: combine the ground chicken, green onions, ginger, sesame oil, and ¼ cup (60 ml) of the soy glaze in a bowl until evenly mixed
step-3: if the mixture does not hold its shape when rolled into a ball, add in panko breadcrumbs, mix evenly, and re-roll the meatballs to test their structural integrity.
step-4: roll about 1-inch (2 ½ cm) meatballs, then skewer 3-4 meatballs on a skewer.
step-5: repeat with remaining mixture.
step-6: heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
step-7: sear 3-4 skewers at a time and flip when the undersides are golden brown.
step-8: brush the glaze on the skewers evenly and cook for about 5 more minutes, flipping every minute and brushing additional glaze as necessary.
step-9: cool and serve!

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine the ground chicken, bread crumbs, egg, parmesan, garlic, parsley, salt, and pepper.
step-2: mix well, then form into 1-inch (2 cm) meatballs.
step-3: you should have 16-18 total.
step-4: in a large pot, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat.
step-5: sear the meatballs on all sides until golden brown, 4-5 minutes.
step-6: remove from the pot and set aside.
step-7: in the same pot, heat the remaining tablespoon of oil.
step-8: add the onion, carrot, and celery and cook, stirring occasionally until tender, 3-4 minutes.
step-9: add the garlic and cook until fragrant, 1-2 minutes.
step-10: add the chicken stock and bay leaf.
step-11: cover and bring to a boil.
step-12: once boiling, add the orzo and meatballs.
step-13: cover and simmer for 7-8 minutes, until the orzo is tender.
step-14: add the swiss chard, cover, and cook for 2-3 minutes until the chard has wilted.
step-15: add the parmesan cheese and season to taste with salt and pepper.
step-16: add the lemon juice.
step-17: ladle into bowls and serve.

step-1: in a large pot, melt butter and add onions and garlic.
step-2: cook until onions have begun to soften.
step-3: add celery, carrots, and cooked shredded chicken.
step-4: add the chicken broth, egg noodles, salt, pepper and bay leaves.
step-5: bring to a boil and then reduce heat, cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
step-6: remove bay leaves from the soup.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: season both sides of chicken breasts with salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, oregano, and basil.
step-3: sear in an oiled pan over high heat until the outside is brown and crisp, about 5 minutes per side.
step-4: transfer chicken to a cutting board and dice.
step-5: place spaghetti in a greased 9x13 (23x32 cm) glass baking dish.
step-6: spread 2 cups (510g) of marinara over spaghetti.
step-7: layer on the chicken, remaining marinara, mozzarella, parmesan, and bread crumbs.
step-8: bake for 35 minutes.
step-9: in a bowl, combine broccoli, oil, salt, and pepper.
step-10: place on a baking sheet, and bake 15 minutes.

step-1: cut the chicken tenders into 1.5-inch (4-cm) pieces.
step-2: take a knife and carefully cut a hole into the chicken tenders.
step-3: make sure to not cut all the way to the other side.
step-4: stuff the holes with mozzarella cheese.
step-5: add garlic powder, dried basil, dried parsley, and salt to the panko bread crumbs.
step-6: batter the chicken in flour, egg, then panko bread crumb mixture.
step-7: add around 1-inch (2-cm) of oil to a pan and heat until around 350˚f (175˚c).
step-8: fry the chicken on both sides until fully cooked and golden brown.
step-9: serve with marinara sauce and garnish with more parmesan cheese.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: cut chicken breasts in half widthwise (pound thin if necessary) and season with salt and pepper.
step-3: coat the chicken in flour, egg, and finally in bread crumbs.
step-4: heat oil in a cast iron skillet and fry the chicken on both sides until brown (about 4 minutes each side).
step-5: set aside.
step-6: in a bowl, whisk one egg into the ricotta, then set aside.
step-7: in a casserole dish, spread ⅓ of the jar of marinara on the bottom, top with lasagna noodle overlapping with each noodle.
step-8: spread half of the ricotta mixture on top of the noodles and layer with chicken.
step-9: top the chicken with ½ cup (50 gram) of mozzarella and a ½ cup (50 gram) of parmesan.
step-10: continue layering in the same order and top with remaining cheeses.
step-11: cover with foil and bake for 45-60 minutes uncovering the lasagna for the last 10 minutes of baking.
step-12: serve with a sprinkle of fresh basil.

step-1: preheat oven to 350ºf (180ºc) and line a sheet tray with parchment paper.
step-2: debone, remove skin, and shred rotisserie chicken.
step-3: mix chicken with marinara sauce.
step-4: line toasted bread up on the sheet tray and evenly top with chicken mixture.
step-5: sprinkle with mozzarella.
step-6: bake for 5-10 minutes or until it is heated through and the cheese on top is melted.

step-1: in a food processor, add the chicken, salt, pepper, oregano, garlic powder, onion powder, and paprika, and pulse until thoroughly combined, with no large chunks.
step-2: spread the mixture evenly into the bottom of a plastic wrap-lined, 10-inch (25 cm) cake pan.
step-3: fold over the excess saran wrap on top, and press it into a flat shape.
step-4: freeze until completely frozen solid, 2-4 hours.
step-5: in 3 separate shallow dishes, distribute the flour, eggs, and bread crumbs.
step-6: unwrap the frozen chicken disc and dip it in the flour, shaking off any excess.
step-7: submerge it into the eggs, then cover it completely with the bread crumbs, pressing the bread crumbs into the chicken.
step-8: freeze for 15 minutes.
step-9: preheat oven to broil.
step-10: add oil to a large, deep pan halfway up the side to 400°f (200°c).
step-11: carefully lower the chicken disc into the oil with tongs, making sure it doesn’t splash.
step-12: if the bottom is getting more color than the top, flip the patty extremely carefully and fry the other side until a deep golden brown.
step-13: remove the chicken disc from the oil and transfer to a wire rack.
step-14: blot with paper towels to remove excess oil.
step-15: add the tomato sauce to the fried chicken disc, spreading it in an even layer.
step-16: lay the mozzarella over the sauce, then sprinkle with parmesan over the top.
step-17: broil for 5-8 minutes, or until the cheese is bubbly and golden brown.
step-18: top with basil, slice, and serve.

step-1: lightly season the chicken breast with salt and pepper, then slice it into strips about ½ inch (1.5 cm) in thickness.
step-2: dredge each piece of chicken in flour followed by egg and bread crumbs.
step-3: quickly fry chicken strips in ½ inch (1.5 cm) of oil over medium heat, cooking for about 30 seconds each side to color the breading.
step-4: set cooked strips aside to drain on paper towels.
step-5: (note: the chicken will not be fully cooked after this stage.)
step-6: on a clean surface, assemble the roll-ups.
step-7: start by laying a cooked lasagna noodle flat.
step-8: using a spoon, spread marinara sauce on one end of the noodle.
step-9: next, add a slice of mozzarella cheese on top of the sauce followed by a piece of chicken.
step-10: starting from the end with the sauce on it, roll up the noodle like a sleeping bag towards the un-sauced side.
step-11: place each roll-up into a large casserole dish that has been lightly covered with nonstick cooking spray.
step-12: pour remaining sauce over roll-ups, then generously cover with mozzarella cheese.
step-13: bake at 350˚f (180˚c) for 20 minutes until cheese is melted and edges of lasagna noodle are slightly crisped.
step-14: serve and garnish with parsley.

step-1: preheat oven to 325°f (190°c).
step-2: cut the chicken into strips.
step-3: in one medium-sized bowl, mix the bread crumbs, parmesan, salt, and pepper.
step-4: in another bowl, crack the eggs and whisk until scrambled.
step-5: coat the chicken in the egg, then in the bread crumbs, then repeat.
step-6: place the chicken tenders on a baking tray and bake for 20 minutes, flipping halfway through.
step-7: sprinkle each tender with mozzarella and bake again for 5 more minutes, or until cheese is melted.
step-8: serve with marinara.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: set a wire rack over a baking sheet.
step-3: grease another baking sheet with nonstick spray.
step-4: in a medium bowl, combine the chicken, salt, pepper, oregano, garlic powder, rosemary, and onion powder, and toss until evenly coated.
step-5: add the flour, eggs, and bread crumbs to 3 separate medium bowls.
step-6: coat a few pieces of chicken at a time in the flour, then the eggs, then the bread crumbs.
step-7: once coated, transfer to the wire rack.
step-8: bake for 25 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-9: arrange the bell peppers, cut-side up, on the greased baking sheet.
step-10: spoon half of the marinara sauce into the peppers.
step-11: sprinkle half of parmesan over the marinara.
step-12: add a few pieces of chicken to each pepper, then spoon over the rest of the marinara sauce, and sprinkle with the rest of the parmesan.
step-13: top each pepper with couple slices of mozzarella.
step-14: bake for 25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the peppers have softened.
step-15: serve immediately.

step-1: using the bumpy side of a meat mallet, pound each chicken breast until ½-inch (1 ¼ cm) thick.
step-2: season with salt and black pepper to taste.
step-3: add 1 cup (125 g) of flour, the eggs, and the plain bread crumbs to 3 separate shallow dishes.
step-4: season flour with salt, pepper, and the lemon zest.
step-5: stir to combine.
step-6: season the eggs with salt and pepper, and add 1 tablespoon of white wine.
step-7: stir to combine.
step-8: to the bread crumbs, add the panko, remaining 2 tablespoons flour, and parmesan.
step-9: stir to combine.
step-10: working 1 piece at a time, coat the chicken in the flour, shaking off any excess, then in the egg mixture, then in the bread crumbs.
step-11: transfer to a baking sheet lined with cling wrap and refrigerate for 10 minutes.
step-12: heat a large cast-iron skillet over medium heat.
step-13: add enough olive oil to come ¼ inch (6 mm) up the sides of the pan.
step-14: working in batches, fry the chicken until lightly browned, 2-3 minutes per side.
step-15: drain on paper towels.
step-16: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-17: wipe out the pan with a paper towel.
step-18: return to medium heat and add 3 tablespoons of olive oil, the garlic, red pepper flakes, and bay leaves.
step-19: cook until fragrant, 1-2 minutes.
step-20: add the remaining cup of white wine and the chicken stock.
step-21: cook until the liquid is reduced by half, stirring occasionally.
step-22: stir in the crushed tomatoes and tomato paste.
step-23: season with pepper, then add the oregano, crushing between your hands to release more flavor.
step-24: simmer the sauce for 5 minutes, until thickened slightly.
step-25: add the parsley and basil and stir to incorporate.
step-26: remove the bay leaves from the pan.
step-27: create a bit of space in the center, then return the chicken to the pan.
step-28: spoon the sauce over the chicken.
step-29: sprinkle the mozzarella and more oregano over the chicken pieces.
step-30: bake for 10-15 minutes, until the cheese is bubbly and melted and the chicken is cooked though.
step-31: set the broiler to high and broil for 1-2 minutes, until the cheese browns lightly.
step-32: serve the chicken with spaghetti that's been tossed in the excess sauce.
step-33: garnish with parsley and parmesan cheese.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180˚c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, combine bread crumbs, parsley garlic powder, onion powder, oregano, salt, and pepper to bread crumbs.
step-3: place flour and eggs in two other medium bowls.
step-4: roll the chicken breast in the flour, dusting off any excess.
step-5: dip the chicken into the egg, then place into the breadcrumbs, coating it completely.
step-6: heat the oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
step-7: once the oil begins to shimmer, fry the breaded chicken strips until both sides are golden brown.
step-8: remove from heat and drain on a paper towel.
step-9: slice the cooked chicken breast into ½-inch (1 cm) thick strips.
step-10: slice the top of the bread bowl off and scoop out the insides.
step-11: save the top of the bowl.
step-12: spoon and spread some of the marinara sauce on the bottom of the bowl, then layer on mozzarella, parmesan cheese, chicken strips, marinara, remaining mozzarella, parmesan, chicken strips, marinara, and remaining parmesan.
step-13: place the cap of the bread bowl on top.
step-14: wrap the bread bowl in foil, then weigh it down with a heavy object for 30 minutes.
step-15: in a small bowl, mix together butter, garlic, parsley, and parmesan cheese.
step-16: remove the foil from the bread bowl and brush the garlic butter mixture evenly over it.
step-17: bake for 30 minutes.
step-18: cool for 10 minutes and slice.
step-19: garnish with basil, if desired.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: slice the rolls in half lengthwise.
step-3: place the bottom half in a 9 x 13-inch (23 x 33-cm) rimmed baking dish.
step-4: spread the chicken evenly on top, followed by the marinara, mozzarella, and basil.
step-5: top with the remaining rolls.
step-6: mix the melted butter in a small bowl with the garlic, parsley, and parmesan.
step-7: brush the tops of the rolls with the butter mixture.
step-8: bake for 20 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown.
step-9: slice into individual sliders, then serve.

step-1: with a sharp knife, slice the squash in half.
step-2: (if the squash is too tough - puncture in several places forming a dotted line around the squash.
step-3: microwave for 3-5 minutes to soften.
step-4: allow to cool before cutting in half - following the dotted line).
step-5: scoop out the seeds - brush with oil, salt, and pepper.
step-6: roast face down in a preheated oven at 375˚f (190˚c) for 35-40 minutes (until a fork can easily pierce the skin).
step-7: meanwhile - slice the chicken breasts into strips.
step-8: season with salt and pepper.
step-9: place flour, beaten egg, and breadcrumbs into three separate bowls.
step-10: coat each strip with flour, then egg, and then roll in bread crumbs.
step-11: pour oil in a cast-iron skillet to come ¼ inch up the side.
step-12: heat the oil over medium-high heat.
step-13: fry the chicken strips (in batches if necessary) until golden brown on all sides and cooked through.
step-14: transfer to paper towels and remove pan from heat.
step-15: once the squash has finished roasting - remove from the oven and let it set for a few minutes before turing over and pulling at it with a fork.
step-16: shred the inside of each squash, being careful not to poke through the skin.
step-17: pour marinara sauce over shredded squash.
step-18: top with chicken strips, then more marinara, and finish with mozzarella and parmesan cheese, and a pinch of italian seasoning.
step-19: return to the oven to bake for 10-15 minutes until the cheese has melted.

step-1: slice the chicken breast into ½ inch (1 ¼ cm) thick strips.
step-2: place the flour, eggs, and bread crumbs into 3 separate bowls.
step-3: roll a chicken strip in the flour, dusting off excess.
step-4: dip the strip into the egg, then place into the bread crumbs, coating it completely.
step-5: repeat with the remaining chicken.
