step-6: heat the oil in a pan over medium heat to 350˚f (180˚c) and preheat oven to 350°f (180˚c).
step-7: fry the breaded chicken strips until both sides are golden brown.
step-8: remove from heat and drain on a paper towel.
step-9: slice the baguette into thirds or fourths (each baguette piece should be roughly the same length of the fried chicken strips).
step-10: hollow out the insides of the baguette pieces with a knife.
step-11: lay two slices of mozzarella on top of each other with a 1 inch (2 ½ cm) overlap.
step-12: place a chicken strip on the overlapping region, then fold the mozzarella tightly around the chicken.
step-13: push the rolled chicken strips into a baguette piece.
step-14: slice the stuffed baguette pieces into 1 inch (2 ½ cm) slices, then place them tightly side-by-side on a baking sheet lined with foil.
step-15: in a small bowl, mix together ingredients for garlic butter.
step-16: brush the garlic butter evenly over the baguette slices, making sure some drips in between the slices.
step-17: wrap the foil over the re-assembled baguette and bake for 20–25 minutes, until cheese is melted and the top is starting to brown.
step-18: remove the foil and serve with marinara!

step-1: in a food processor, combine the basil, parmesan, pine nuts, garlic, lemon juice, salt, pepper, and olive oil.
step-2: pulse until smooth texture.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: with a vegetable peeler, shave ribbons of the zucchini until you reach the seeds.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: slice the cherry tomatoes and set aside.
step-7: heat a 4-quart jumbo cooker over medium-high.
step-8: add a little oil, the chicken breasts, and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
step-9: cook until the chicken is cooked through and browned on all surfaces.
step-10: turn off the heat and add the cherry tomatoes, pesto, and zucchini ribbons.
step-11: toss until well combined and heated through.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-2: roll out the puff pastry sheets on a lightly floured surface to a 9x12-inch (23x30 cm) rectangles.
step-3: spread the pesto sauce over the sheets using a spatula or spoon.
step-4: top with the shredded chicken, parmesan, and salt.
step-5: starting from a short end, carefully roll up the puff pastry to form logs.
step-6: slice the logs into ½-inch (1 cm) rounds and arrange them on the prepared baking sheet, spacing 1 inch (2 cm) apart.
step-7: brush with egg wash.
step-8: bake for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-9: sprinkle with chopped parsley, then serve.

step-1: melt the butter in a large, tall saucepan.
step-2: add flour and whisk to ensure there are no lumps before adding the chicken stock.
step-3: cook out this mixture for 5-10 minutes while continuously stirring.
step-4: check the consistency by dipping the back of a spoon into the sauce and running your finger along the spoon.
step-5: you want the sauce to cling to the spoon and not run over the swipe you made.
step-6: continue to cook and stir the sauce over medium heat until you reach the correct consistency.
step-7: season with the salt, pepper, and cayenne (if using).
step-8: taste the sauce and see if your sauce needs more seasoning.
step-9: add the cream and stir to combine.
step-10: add the shredded chicken, potatoes, carrots, peas, and garlic to the sauce.
step-11: cook the vegetables in the sauce for two to three minutes.
step-12: transfer the filling into a clean bowl and chill in the fridge for one hour, or until cool.
step-13: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-14: roll out the puff pastry, using a bit of extra flour to ensure the pastry doesn't stick to your work surface.
step-15: use a bowl or plate about an inch (2 cm) larger than the dish you are cooking your pot pie in as a guide to cut out your pastry.
step-16: carefully spoon in your chilled filling into your dish.
step-17: break the egg in a small dish and add a tablespoon of water or cream.
step-18: whisk with a fork.
step-19: brush this egg wash on the edges of your dish.
step-20: brush a little of your egg wash on the rim of your dish.
step-21: optional, with a truffle slicer add into fill.
step-22: lay your pastry over the top, being careful not to stretch the pastry.
step-23: seal the edges of the pastry by lightly pushing it onto the rim of your dish to make sure it is secure.
step-24: brush the top and sides with more egg wash.
step-25: place your pot pies on a large baking sheet and bake for 25-35 minutes.
step-26: bake until your pastry is a nice golden, dark brown and there are no more grayish raw patches.
step-27: let cool for five minutes before serving.

step-1: heat a large pan over medium-high heat.
step-2: add the oil and the chicken breast.
step-3: season with salt and ¼ teaspoon black pepper, and cook for 6-8 minutes, stirring occasionally until the chicken is cooked through.
step-4: transfer the chicken to a medium bowl and return the pan to the stove.
step-5: reduce the heat to medium and melt the butter in the pan.
step-6: add the onion, carrot, and celery, cooking until the vegetables have softened and the onion is translucent, 8-10 minutes.
step-7: sprinkle in the flour, stirring well so there are no lumps.
step-8: add the garlic, parsley and thyme, and cook for 2-3 minutes more, until fragrant.
step-9: pour in the chicken broth and stir occasionally until the sauce has thickened, 3-5 minutes.
step-10: stir in the frozen peas and reserved chicken.
step-11: season with salt and pepper, then pour in the heavy cream.
step-12: stir to combine and cook until the peas have defrosted.
step-13: remove the pan from the heat.
step-14: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c)
step-15: lightly flour a clean work surface.
step-16: lay out 1 pie crust and lightly brush the top with water.
step-17: place another pie crust on top and lightly dust with flour.
step-18: using a rolling pin, gently roll out the dough in order to bind the 2 crusts, taking care not to make them thinner.
step-19: place a 5-inch (12 cm) metal bowl in the center of the crust and cut out a circle 2 inches (5 cm) larger than the bowl.
step-20: place the cut-out dough circle inside the bowl, making sure to fully press down so the dough is flush against the surface of the bowl.
step-21: fill the bowl with ¼ of the chicken mixture.
step-22: roll the excess pie dough into a large circle.
step-23: cover the filled bowl with the dough circle slightly larger than the diameter of the bowl.
step-24: press the edges of the dough together, then use scissors to trim any excess dough.
step-25: crimp the edges to close.
step-26: repeat with the remaining pie crusts to make 3 more bowls.
step-27: arrange the bowls on a baking sheet.
step-28: use a small knife to make small slits in the top crusts.
step-29: bake for about 45 minutes, until the tops are a deep golden brown.
step-30: let cool until the bowls are cool enough to handle.
step-31: to serve, place a plate on top of a pie, then invert onto the plate.
step-32: garnish with parsley.

step-1: heat oil in large pot on medium high heat.
step-2: bring in onion, celery, carrots, and garlic and cook until onions are translucent, about 5 minutes.
step-3: stir in butter and melt.
step-4: add in flour and stir until flour butter mixture coats vegetables and browns lightly.
step-5: add the chicken stock and half and half and stir to combine.
step-6: season with pepper, thyme, and nutmeg and allow to come to a boil.
step-7: reduce the heat to medium-low and add in corn, peas, and chicken and fully incorporate.
step-8: season with salt.
step-9: optional - garnish with cookie sized pieces of pie crust.

step-1: place two slices of provolone on a whole wheat tortilla, followed by lettuce, shredded chicken, sliced tomatoes and ranch dressing.
step-2: roll into a wrap and place in a reusable container with fruits and veggies for sides.

step-1: assemble the burritos by microwaving the flour tortilla for 20 seconds, and begin to layer burrito starting with refried beans, followed by the cooked rice, rotisserie chicken, and cheese.
step-2: fold in the left and right sides of the tortilla and roll it up from the bottom, tucking the bottom edge under the filling.
step-3: wrap in parchment paper and label.
step-4: freeze up to 1 month.
step-5: to reheat from frozen, wrap the burrito in a damp paper towel and microwave for 2-3 minutes, flipping halfway or until the center is hot.
step-6: let stand 1 minute before eating.

step-1: in a bowl, combine chicken, celery, onion, sliced tomatoes, apple, yogurt, salt and pepper.
step-2: spread the chicken salad on one of the pieces of bread and place the lettuce on the other piece.
step-3: top with desired condiments and bring the two pieces of bread together.
step-4: cut in half and place in a reusable container with some fruits and veggies.

step-1: in a bowl, mix together chicken, paprika, cayenne pepper, onion powder, garlic powder, pepper, salt, celery, chives, dill, lemon juice, mayonnaise, sour cream, and dijon mustard.
step-2: place chicken salad mixture on a slider bun.
step-3: top with bacon and lettuce.
step-4: place top bun.

step-1: cut sweet potato into thin slices, about ¼ inch (6 mm) thick.
step-2: place in toaster and set it to the maximum cook time.
step-3: when it pops, flip the sweet potato slices over and toast 1 more time.
step-4: depending on the strength of your toaster and your preferences, you may need to toast it 1 more time after that.
step-5: remove from toaster and let cool enough to handle.
step-6: spread chicken salad evenly across sweet potato toast.
step-7: garnish with green onion.

step-1: in a food processor, blend the peanut butter, coconut milk, spring onions, garlic, ginger, chilies, curry powder, cumin, turmeric, salt, soy sauce, and lime juice into a smooth paste; this should make about 2 cups.
step-2: reserve half of the marinade and pour the other half over the chicken thighs.
step-3: mix and chill for 2 hours or overnight.
step-4: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-5: line a baking tray with parchment paper.
step-6: skewer the marinated chicken onto bamboo skewers, then arrange the skewers so their ends rest on the edges of the baking tray, allowing the chicken to be suspended.
step-7: bake the chicken skewers for 15-20 minutes, until slightly dark brown on the edges and cooked through.
step-8: with no oil in the pan, toast the chopped peanuts on low to medium heat, stirring constantly until the peanuts turn golden brown, 2-3 minutes.
step-9: add in the reserved marinade and the coconut milk.
step-10: stir and cook until thick and very aromatic, 5-10 minutes.
step-11: serve the chicken skewers with the sauce on the side.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: cook sausage over medium-high until lightly browned, about 5-7 minutes, being sure to break up the meat into a fine mince.
step-3: remove cooked sausage from pan and wipe away excess fat with a paper towel.
step-4: add onion and sauté until softened and translucent, about 2 to 3 minutes.
step-5: add mushrooms, salt, and pepper and continue to cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.
step-6: add chopped spinach and cook until wilted and no extra liquid has accumulated in the bottom of the pan.
step-7: note: do your best to use the excessive moisture of the spinach and mushrooms to deglaze the bottom of the pan, scraping away any browned bits from cooking the sausage earlier.
step-8: once cooked, remove the spinach and mushroom mixture from the pan and combine it with the reserved cooked sausage.
step-9: stir to mix evenly.
step-10: combine eggs and milk.
step-11: lightly whisk until just combined.
step-12: add sausage and spinach mixture to the bottom of a prepared 9-inch (23cm) pie crust, making sure to spread it evenly.
step-13: pour in beaten eggs to fill the rest of the pie crust and top with a generous sprinkle of parmesan cheese.
step-14: bake at 350˚f (180˚c) for 25 minutes or until the eggs are set and the top is lightly browned.
step-15: allow to cool for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: season the chicken breasts with the salt, pepper, garlic, greek oregano, and olive oil.
step-3: place the chicken breasts in a large skillet on medium-high heat with a tablespoon of oil.
step-4: cook until the first side is a dark golden brown, about 5 minutes.
step-5: flip the chicken and cook the other side until equally brown, about 5 minutes.
step-6: turn the heat to low and cook the chicken until it’s cooked through about 10 more minutes.
step-7: set the chicken aside to cool and then slice it.
step-8: to a bowl, add the ricotta, chopped frozen spinach, feta cheese, chopped green onion, beaten eggs, dill, and pepper, and stir to combine.
step-9: place the butter into a large shallow dish.
step-10: take about 5 sheets of the thin phyllo dough and dip it in the butter.
step-11: place the buttered phyllo into a 9 inch (23 cm) springform pan.
step-12: make sure the dough complete covers the sides and hangs over the edges of the pan.
step-13: use as many sheets as needed to create a even layer all around.
step-14: spread half of the feta spinach mixture on the bottom of the springform pan on top of the phyllo dough.
step-15: shingle one layer of the sliced cooked chicken, and spread the other half of the spinach feta mixture.
step-16: make sure each layer is tightly pressed.
step-17: place the chopped tomatoes on the outer rim of the pie.
step-18: place a ring of chopped red onion, and then place chopped kalamata olives in the center.
step-19: fold the phyllo dough from the edges of the pan to the center and cover the top of the pie with 3 more batches of buttered phyllo.
step-20: cover the pie with aluminum foil and bake for 1 hour.
step-21: remove the aluminum foil cover and cook for about 20 more minutes, until the top is golden brown.
step-22: let rest at room temperature for at least 30 minutes.
step-23: remove the pie from the springform pan, slice, and serve.

step-1: heat oil in a large pot over high heat.
step-2: cook the chicken until no pink is showing.
step-3: add the garlic, bacon, spinach, salt, and pepper, cooking until spinach is wilted.
step-4: pour in the cream and bring to a boil.
step-5: add the pasta, cheese, and parsley, stirring until the pasta is coated evenly.

step-1: place the chicken breasts, salt, peppercorns, onion, whole garlic cloves, bay leaves, and water in a large pot.
step-2: cover the pot and bring to a simmer over medium heat.
step-3: once the water is simmering, cook for 10 minutes, until the chicken registers 165°f (74°c) when pierced with an instant-read thermometer.
step-4: transfer the chicken to a cutting board and reserve at least ¾ cup (180 ml) of the cooking liquid to use as broth.
step-5: using 2 forks, pull the chicken apart until shredded.
step-6: in a large nonstick pan, heat the oil over medium heat until shimmering.
step-7: add the minced garlic, cumin, paprika, chili powder, and oregano.
step-8: sauté until the oil is bubbling and very fragrant, about 2 minutes.
step-9: add the chicken broth and stir until the liquid has reduced and thickened slightly, about 7 minutes.
step-10: add the shredded chicken and mix until everything is well incorporated.
step-11: remove the pan from the heat and let the chicken cool for 5 minutes before spooning into the lettuce leaves.
step-12: top with shredded cheese and diced tomatoes

step-1: preheat oven to 190ºc (375ºf).
step-2: place all of the ingredients for the spice rub in a small bowl and mix to combine.
step-3: place chicken thighs in a large bowl and coat with the spice rub.
step-4: heat a very large cast iron skillet and drizzle in 2 tablespoons of olive oil.
step-5: place seasoned chicken thighs skin-side down and cook until the skin is brown and crispy, about 4–5 minutes.
step-6: then flip the thighs over and brown the other side for 4 minutes.
step-7: remove chicken from the pan.
step-8: in a large bowl, add baby potatoes, cherry tomatoes, shallots, and apricots.
step-9: drizzle with the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil and season to taste with salt and pepper.
step-10: mix until evenly coated.
step-11: place the vegetables into the bottom of the tagine and arrange the chicken, skin-side up, around the top, wedging a slice of lemon between each piece of chicken.
step-12: place the lid on the tagine and place in the oven for 1 hour and 40 minutes, or until chicken is 165ºf (75ºc) and falls off the bone.
step-13: garnish with fresh parsley and toasted almond slivers.

step-1: in a medium bowl, season the cubed chicken with salt and pepper.
step-2: add ¼ cup (of 60 ml) teriyaki sauce and mix until the chicken is well-coated.
step-3: cover with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes to 1 hour.
step-4: in a wok or deep skillet over medium-high heat, heat 2 tablespoons of cooking oil, then add the par-cooked noodles.
step-5: cook for 1-2 minutes, allowing the noodles to crisp, then flip and cook for another 1-2 minutes.
step-6: transfer to a plate and set aside.
step-7: in the same wok, heat 1 tablespoon of cooking oil, then add the chicken.
step-8: cook for 3-4 minutes, until browned on one side, then stir and cook for another 3-4 minutes, until fully cooked through.
step-9: set the chicken aside.
step-10: in the same wok, add 1 tablespoon of oil, the onion, and carrot.
step-11: cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the onions are translucent.
step-12: add the broccoli and cabbage.
step-13: stir and cook for 1-2 minutes, then season with salt and pepper and cook for 3 minutes more, until the vegetables are soft.
step-14: add the cooked chicken and crispy noodles back to the wok, along with the remaining ¼ cup (60 ml) teriyaki sauce.
step-15: toss well and cook for 2-3 minutes, until everything is well-combined.
step-16: garnish with sesame seeds.

step-1: in a small bowl or liquid measuring cup, add the soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, brown sugar, garlic, and cornstarch.
step-2: whisk to combine.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: heat a wok or large skillet with 3 inches (7 cm) of oil to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-5: pull the rice noodles apart into eight portions.
step-6: place one portion of noodles on a slotted spoon and carefully dip into the oil.
step-7: the noodles will immediately fry.
step-8: once puffed up, remove the noodles and transfer to a wire rack to drain.
step-9: repeat with the remaining noodles.
step-10: season the chicken with salt and pepper.
step-11: heat a wok or large skillet with 1 tablespoon of oil over medium-high heat.
step-12: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the chicken and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned and cooked through, about 5 minutes.
step-13: add the teriyaki sauce to the chicken and bring to a boil.
step-14: cook until the sauce has reduced by one third and the chicken is fully coated.
step-15: serve the chicken over the rice noodles with snap peas, radish slices, scallions, cilantro, and sesame seeds.

step-1: marinate the chicken in teriyaki sauce in the refrigerator for at least an hour.
step-2: in a wok or deep skillet, add the chicken in the teriyaki marinade and cook thoroughly over high heat.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: in the same pan, add the oil and cook onions, garlic, and carrots until onions are translucent.
step-5: add broccoli and cook an additional 3-4 minutes.
step-6: push all of the cooked vegetables to the side of the pan.
step-7: beat the eggs and pour into the cleared half of the pan.
step-8: scramble the eggs and mix with the rest of the vegetables.
step-9: add rice, cooked chicken, soy sauce, sesame oil, and pepper.
step-10: mix well and let the rice cook until slightly crispy.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper and set aside.
step-3: combine all ingredients for the meatballs in a bowl.
step-4: mix until all ingredients are well-blended.
step-5: use an ice cream scoop or a spoon and form into meatballs.
step-6: place on the baking sheet.
step-7: bake for 20-25 minutes (until lightly browned and the chicken is cooked through).
step-8: in the meantime, prepare the glaze!
step-9: pour soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, honey, sriracha, garlic, ginger, and brown sugar into a sauce pan.
step-10: turn on medium heat, and stir until the sugar has dissolved.
step-11: then, pour in the cornstarch slurry and whisk until the sauce has thickened (about 5 minutes).
step-12: add the meatballs to the sauce pan and evenly coat them with the teriyaki glaze.
step-13: serve over rice or serve on their own!
step-14: garnish with scallions and sesame seeds.

step-1: preheat the oven 220˚c (430˚f).
step-2: combine all the chicken tikka ingredients and marinate in the fridge for at least 1 hour.
step-3: skewer the marinated chicken pieces on bamboo skewers, then place them over a baking tray lined with parchment paper, making sure there is space underneath the chicken to help distribute the heat more evenly.
step-4: reserve the chicken tikka marinade for later use.
step-5: bake the chicken skewers for about 15 minutes, until slightly dark brown on the edges and cooked throughout.
step-6: heat oil in a large pot over medium heat, then sauté the onions with the herbs and spices until just browned.
step-7: add in the chopped tomatoes and fry till soft.
step-8: pour in the yogurt, water, and reserved tikka marinade, and mix it well with the vegetables and spices.
step-9: bring the mixture to a boil, add in the chicken and cook for a further 4-5 minutes.
step-10: set aside.
step-11: in a large pot, assemble your biryani in the following layers: ⅓ rice, ½ chicken curry, ½ caramelised onion, ½ coriander, ⅓ rice, oil, ½ of the saffron-infused water, ½ chicken curry, ⅓ rice, the rest of the saffron-infused water, ½ caramelised onion, and finally top with the remaining coriander.
step-12: simmer the biryani over a low heat for 10 minutes or until all the water is absorbed and the rice and chicken are heated throughout.

step-1: preheat oven to 180°c (350°f).
step-2: cut the chicken breasts into thin strips.
step-3: in a re-sealable bag, mix the marinade ingredients together and place the chicken strips inside.
step-4: make sure they are thoroughly covered and marinate in the fridge for 2 hours (or more if you want a stronger flavour).
step-5: remove the chicken from the marinade and cover in flour, then egg, then panko breadcrumbs.
step-6: bake for 25 minutes.

step-1: place chicken in a saucepan over medium heat with enough water to cover by 1 inch (3 cm).
step-2: add the smashed garlic and cloves.
step-3: simmer until the chicken is cooked through, 12-15 minutes.
step-4: remove the chicken from the pot, cool slightly, then shred with two forks.
step-5: place a cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat, until smoking.
step-6: add the tomatoes and roll slowly around until blackened on all sides, about 6 minutes.
step-7: add the seared tomatoes to a blender with chipotle peppers, chicken stock, cumin, and nutmeg.
step-8: blend until smooth.
step-9: heat the vegetable oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
step-10: add the garlic, onions, and chorizo.
step-11: cook 2-3 minutes until the onions have softened and the chorizo has rendered a little fat.
step-12: add the lettuce and sauté 2-3 additional minutes, until softened.
step-13: add the tomato-chili mixture and cook for 3 minutes, stirring constantly to incorporate.
step-14: add the shredded chicken and bring mixture to a simmer.
step-15: simmer, uncovered, until most of the liquid has cooked off, about 10-15 minutes.
step-16: season with salt and pepper to taste.
step-17: serve on warm corn tortillas with sliced avocado.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: with a sharp knife, slice the squash in half.
step-3: (if the squash is too tough - puncture in several places forming a dotted line around the squash.
step-4: microwave 3-5 minutes to soften.
step-5: allow to cool before cutting in half - following the dotted line).
step-6: scoop out the seeds, brush with oil, salt, and pepper, and place face down on a baking tray.
step-7: bake for 35-40 minutes or until a fork can easily pierce the skin.
step-8: heat olive oil in a large pan.
step-9: add chicken breasts (seasoned with salt and pepper) and garlic, and fully cook.
step-10: add tomatoes and spinach.
step-11: cook until spinach has wilted.
step-12: add marinara sauce.
step-13: stack the basil leaves and roll them up.
step-14: cut into slices and add to pan.
step-15: add crushed red pepper, and stir until the ingredients are fully incorporated.
step-16: once the squash has finished roasting, remove from the oven and let it sit for a few minutes before turning over and pulling at it with a fork.
step-17: (careful, there will be some steam!)
step-18: shred the inside of each squash, being careful not to poke through the skin.
step-19: pour the sauce over the shredded squash, top with fresh basil, and serve.

step-1: place diced onion, jalapeno and garlic in the bottom of a slow cooker.
step-2: place the chicken breasts on top of the veggies.
step-3: add all canned ingredients and seasonings to the chicken in the slow cooker.
step-4: top with the chicken stock.
step-5: set slow cooker to high and cook for 3 hours.
step-6: fill a large pot ⅔ full with vegetable oil and heat until it reaches 350°f (180°c).
step-7: carefully place the tortilla on top of the oil and gently press the tortilla down with a ladle.
step-8: fry tortilla until golden brown.
step-9: drain on a cooling rack.
step-10: when soup is done, remove chicken and dice it on a cutting board.
step-11: return diced chicken to the soup.
step-12: place fried tortilla bowl in a soup bowl and fill it with the soup.
step-13: top it off with cheese, avocado, cilantro and garnish with a lime wedge.

step-1: in a medium sauce pot over a medium heat, add oil, garlic and onion.
step-2: cook until onion starts to become translucent.
step-3: add tomatoes, green chiles, black beans, corn, salt, pepper, oregano, cumin, and chili powder.
step-4: cook until all ingredients are heated through, stirring occasionally.
step-5: add broth, stir and bring to a simmer.
step-6: add chicken and allow to heat through.
step-7: serve with a sprinkle of tortilla strips and cilantro.

step-1: in a medium pan, sauté minced garlic and ginger until fragrant.
step-2: add in diced chicken, salt and pepper to taste, then cook until about 80% done.
step-3: add mushrooms and cook off the moisture.
step-4: add cabbage until soft, then toss in carrots and scallions.
step-5: remove from heat.
step-6: fill egg roll wrapper with filling, fold and seal with egg wash, then deep fry until golden brown.
step-7: serve immediately with hoisin sauce or sauce of choice.

step-1: in a large pan on medium-high heat, add 1 tablespoon of oil.
step-2: once the oil is hot, add chicken, season with salt and pepper, and sauté until cooked through and browned.
step-3: remove cooked chicken from pan and set aside.
step-4: in the same pan, heat 1 tablespoon of oil and add mushrooms.
step-5: when the mushrooms start to soften, add broccoli florets and stir-fry until the broccoli is tender.
step-6: remove cooked mushrooms and broccoli from the pan and set aside.
step-7: add 1 tablespoon of oil to the pan and sauté garlic and ginger until fragrant.
step-8: add the remaining sauce ingredients and stir until smooth.
step-9: return the chicken and vegetables to the saucy pan, stir until heated through.
step-10: serve with hot rice or noodles.

step-1: combine the wet ingredients in a mixing bowl.
step-2: in another mixing bowl, sift together the dry ingredients.
step-3: add the wet to the dry and mix until smooth.
step-4: add the seasoned chicken to the waffle batter.
step-5: make sure the chicken is coated in the batter.
step-6: heat your waffle iron on the lowest setting.
step-7: spoon a piece of chicken and additional batter into each section.
step-8: cook on the lowest setting for approximately 10 minutes.

step-1: season chicken thighs with salt and pepper.
step-2: melt 2 tablespoons butter in a large oven-proof skillet over medium-high heat.
step-3: add chicken, skin-side down, and sear both sides until golden brown.
step-4: drain excess fat and set aside.
step-5: melt 1 tablespoons butter in the skillet.
step-6: add garlic.
step-7: stir until fragrant, then add chicken broth, heavy cream, sun-dried tomatoes, dried oregano, dried thyme, and fresh basil and reduce heat to low.
step-8: return chicken to the skillet and baste well.
step-9: bake at 400˚f (200˚c) for 25 minutes.
step-10: serve immediately and drizzle remaining broth mix over chicken.

step-1: heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium heat until shimmering.
step-2: add the tomato, scallions, onion, garlic, and salt, and cook, stirring occasionally.
step-3: add the chicken, and cook for 5 minutes or until the chicken is warmed through.
step-4: for the dough, mash the cooked yucca with a fork in a large bowl.
step-5: roll a 4-inch (10-cm) ball of yucca and place in the center of a piece of plastic wrap.
step-6: add another piece of plastic wrap over the dough and flatten to create a small circle.
step-7: roll out to a 6-inch (15-cm) round.
step-8: scoop 3 tablespoons of the chicken mixture onto the dough and add a couple of pieces of mozzarella over the chicken mixture.
step-9: fold over the dough to form an empanada and seal the edges.
step-10: repeat with the rest of the dough and filling.
step-11: heat 2 inches (5 cm) of oil in a large pan over high heat to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-12: place the empanadas in the oil and cook for 2-3 minutes or until brown on both sides.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the chickpeas, black beans, red onion, cherry tomatoes, fresh parsley, and fresh mint.
step-2: in a small bowl, mix together olive oil, vinegar, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
step-3: pour over the salad and toss to coat.
step-4: top with crumbled feta cheese.

step-1: heat the oil in a large stockpot over medium-high heat and add the onion and garlic.
step-2: sauté until soft, about 2-3 minutes.
step-3: add the curry powder mixture to the pot.
step-4: add half of the vegetable broth and potatoes, and stir to combine.
step-5: add the scallions and parsley.
step-6: season with pepper.
step-7: cook until the sauce is thick and the potatoes are almost tender, about 20 minutes.
step-8: add the chickpeas and remaining vegetable broth, and mix.
step-9: add the ghee and flour mixture to the pot and stir to incorporate.
step-10: cook on medium-low heat until the potatoes and chickpeas are tender and the sauce thickens, about 20 minutes.

step-1: in a medium nonstick saucepan, heat a drizzle of olive oil over medium heat.
step-2: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the mushrooms and tomatoes and cook for 3-4 minutes, until they start to release their juices.
step-3: season with salt and pepper.
step-4: add a bit more olive oil to the pan, then add the garlic and cook for 2 minutes, until fragrant.
step-5: add the spinach and cook for 3-4 minutes, until wilted.
step-6: remove the pan from the heat.
step-7: in a medium bowl, combine the chickpea flour, nutritional yeast, baking soda, garlic powder, turmeric, salt, black salt, apple cider vinegar, and almond milk, and whisk together until mostly smooth.
step-8: in a medium nonstick saucepan, heat a drizzle of olive oil over medium heat.
step-9: once the oil begins to shimmer, add a ½ cup (120 ml) of the omelet batter to the pan.
step-10: let cook for 5-7 minutes, or until several bubbles have formed on the surface.
step-11: spoon half of the vegetable filling onto one side of the omelet.
step-12: using a spatula, fold the omelet in half.
step-13: turn off the heat and cover the pan with a lid.
step-14: let the omelet steam for 5 minutes, until completely cooked through.
step-15: repeat with the remaining omelet batter and filling.
step-16: serve the omelets with salsa and fresh cilantro.

step-1: bring 4 cups of water to a boil.
step-2: gradually whisk in 2 cups of chickpea flour.
step-3: continue to whisk until the mixture is thickened to the consistency of thick oatmeal.
step-4: immediately transfer to a greased, baking dish.
step-5: [we used an 8x10 (20x25 cm), but a larger one will just produce thinner fries].
step-6: knock the dish on your work surface a few times to ensure that the mixture spreads evenly and to release any air bubbles.
step-7: press plastic wrap over the mixture to ensure a flat surface and refrigerate for 2 hours until it has set firm.
step-8: dipping sauce: in a medium bowl, combine greek yogurt, a pinch of salt, finely chopped parsley, finely chopped dill, clove garlic minced, and lemon juice.
step-9: invert the baking dish on a cutting board (you may have to pull at the edges to release the suction for it to fall out cleanly).
step-10: slice into streak fry sizes.
step-11: shallow fry in oil until each side is golden and crispy.
step-12: salt immediately after coming out of oil.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a skillet over medium heat, add cooking oil or water and onions.
step-3: cook until onions are translucent, stirring occasionally.
step-4: add the garlic and stir until fragrant.
step-5: transfer to a blender or food processor.
step-6: to the food processor, add the chickpeas, breadcrumbs, parsley, oregano, salt, pepper, red pepper flakes, and egg.
step-7: pulse until a dough forms.
step-8: use your hands to form 1-inch (2-cm) balls from the chickpea mixture.
step-9: place in rows on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-10: bake for 20 minutes, or until golden, flipping halfway.

step-1: in a medium mixing bowl, add chickpeas and mash with potato masher until a chunky texture is reached.
step-2: add the red onion, red pepper, vegan mayo, dijon mustard, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, pepper, and dill, and stir until well combined.
step-3: store chickpea salad in refrigerator for up to five days.
step-4: to assemble sandwich, spread mixture onto bread and top with leafy greens of choice.
step-5: wrap in parchment paper and secure with rubber band.

step-1: in large pot or dutch oven, add the coconut oil over medium heat.
step-2: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the onions and cook for about 4-5 minutes, or until onions are semi-translucent.
step-3: add in the garlic and ginger, and cook for 2-3 more minutes until fragrant.
step-4: then add sweet paprika, cumin, coriander, and cayenne, and cook for 2 more minutes until fragrant.
step-5: add in the chickpeas, sweet potatoes, crushed tomatoes, and vegetable broth, and bring to a boil.
step-6: reduce heat to medium-high and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until sweet potatoes are tender.
step-7: add in spinach and stir until wilted.
step-8: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat the oven to 325˚f (160˚c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, combine the egg yolks, water, oil, vanilla, and lemon zest.
step-3: whisk well to combine.
step-4: sift the flour and baking powder into a separate medium bowl.
step-5: add ¾ cup (150 grams) of sugar and salt and whisk to combine.
step-6: pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and whisk well.
step-7: in a large bowl, beat the egg whites and cream of tartar with an electric hand mixer until foamy.
step-8: gradually add the remaining sugar and beat until soft peaks form and the egg whites are glossy.
step-9: pour the egg yolk batter into the egg whites and fold to combine with a spatula.
step-10: divide the batter between 2 ungreased 8.5-inch (21 cm) round cake pans (not greasing will help the chiffon cakes rise).
step-11: bake for 40-50 minutes, then increase the temperature to 350˚f (180˚c) and bake for 10-15 minutes more, or until a toothpick inserted in the center of a cake comes out clean.
step-12: while the cakes are baking, make the buttercream frosting: combine the butter and about half of the sugar in a large bowl and cream with a hand mixer until combined.
step-13: add the rest of the sugar and beat to incorporate.
step-14: with the mixer running, slowly add the evaporated milk and beat until smooth.
step-15: remove the cakes from the oven and cool the cake upside down.
step-16: once cool to the touch, sliding an offset spatula around the edges to release the cakes from the pans.
step-17: cut off the tops of the cakes so the surfaces are flat and smooth.
step-18: set 1 cake on a cake platter or serving dish.
step-19: spread buttercream over the top of the cake with an offset spatula and sprinkle with some seasonal fruit.
step-20: cover the fruit with buttercream
step-21: place the other cake on top.
step-22: spread buttercream over the top, keeping the sides exposed, and decorate with seasonal fruit and edible flowers.

step-1: in a small pot, combine the guajillos, anchos, chiles de árbol, halved tomato, and water.
step-2: bring to a boil over [level] heat.
step-3: cover cover and cook for 10 minutes, or until the peppers are rehydrated and softened.
step-4: using a slotted spoon, transfer the peppers and tomato to a blender.
step-5: add the onion, garlic, salt, and about ½ cup (60 g) of the pepper cooking liquid.
step-6: blend until smooth, adding more liquid as needed if the sauce is too thick.
step-7: cut the corn tortillas into triangles.
step-8: add to a cast iron with around 2 cups (480 ml) of heated oil.
step-9: fry the tortilla triangles until golden and crispy.
step-10: leaving the chips in the pan, remove all but 2 tablespoons of the hot oil.
step-11: add the eggs to the pan and stir around with the chips.
step-12: once the eggs are almost set, pour in the chile sauce and stir until well-combined.
step-13: top the chilaquiles with queso fresco, red onion, avocado, and cilantro.
step-14: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: grease a 9-inch (23-cm) round baking pan with nonstick spray.
step-3: in a medium bowl, combine the bacon bits and chili powder.
step-4: on a lightly floured surface, roll out the crescent roll dough to a 12x6-inch (30x15 cm) rectangle.
step-5: brush the dough with the melted butter
step-6: sprinkle the bacon bits over the dough, leaving 1 inch (2 cm) of a long end empty for rolling.
step-7: starting with the other long end, roll into a tube.
step-8: slice the tube into 7 pieces and place in the prepared pan.
step-9: bake for 12-15 minutes, until the rolls are light golden brown.
step-10: drizzle with béchamel sauce to mimic icing.

step-1: fry the beef for a couple of minutes with the salt, pepper, and 5 spice.
step-2: take out and set aside.
step-3: in the same pan, fry the garlic and red chili for a few minutes before stirring in the chili sauce and soy sauce.
step-4: add the beef and noodles.
step-5: mix together for another couple of minutes.
step-6: serve with some red chili and spring onions.

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c)
step-2: on a baking sheet, place the 4 potatoes.
step-3: using a fork, puncture holes all around the potatoes.
step-4: bake for 1 hour until the potato gives when you press into it.
step-5: in a pot, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil.
step-6: add the onion, and stir until golden.
step-7: add the garlic and ground beef, breaking up the meat into the onions and garlic.
step-8: add the chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper, and stir to combine.
step-9: add the kidney beans, tomatoes, and green chilis, and stir to combine.
step-10: simmer for 10 minutes.
step-11: set aside
step-12: once the potatoes have cooled place one on a cutting board.
step-13: cut the potato in half lengthwise.
step-14: cut off one of the ends of the potato.
step-15: using a spoon, scoop out the insides of the potato making sure not to scoop out too much or the potato skin will be too thin.
step-16: with the remaining potatoes, cut them in half lengthwise and cut off both of the ends and scoop out the potato.
step-17: on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, place both ends.
step-18: place three of the skins alongside one potato end and place the other 3 potato skins alongside the other end
step-19: brush the potato skins with the rest of the olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
step-20: scoop the chili into the potato skins and packing it down into an even layer.
step-21: sprinkle the cheese over the potato skins.
step-22: bake for 5 minutes until melted.
step-23: top with sour cream and cilantro.

step-1: heat the olive oil in a large pot with a lid over medium heat until shimmering.
step-2: add the onion and garlic and sauté for 2 minutes, until translucent.
step-3: add the ground beef and cook until browned, about 7-10 minutes.
step-4: add the crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, brown sugar, salt, ground pepper, paprika, chili powder, ground cumin, and stir to combine.
step-5: add water and stir.
step-6: bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes.
step-7: set a wire cooling rack on top of a baking sheet.
step-8: place a metal 1-cup (240 ml) measuring cup upside down on top of the cooling rack.
step-9: in a medium non-stick skillet over medium heat, pour ⅓ cup (35 g) of parmesan in the center of the pan and spread out into a thin circle, about 5 inches across.
step-10: without disturbing the cheese, melt for 2-3 minutes, or until golden and fully melted.
step-11: once the cheese is fully melted, run a spatula along the edges of the cheese and shake the pan to loosen the cheese circle.
step-12: carefully slide the melted cheese over the inverted measuring cup to form a cheese bowl.
step-13: do not touch, it is extremely hot.
step-14: set aside and let cool completely, about ten minutes.
step-15: repeat with the rest of the parmesan to make 8 bowls.
step-16: lightly grease a large skillet over high heat, then add the beef patties (in batches, if necessary) and season generously with salt and pepper.
step-17: cook for 2 minutes without disturbing, then flip and cook for another 3 minutes, or until the internal temperature has reached at least 165˚f (75˚c).
step-18: to assemble, place a bottom burger bun on a plate and put a cheese bowl on top.
step-19: lay a burger patty inside the cheese bowl and top with a spoonful of chili, a sprinkle of shredded cheddar cheese, and the top bun.

step-1: in a bowl, add the chili and tomato sauce and stir to combine.
step-2: add a layer of the chili mixture to the bottom of a 9x9-inch (23x23-cm) baking pan.
step-3: top with a layer of tortillas, a layer of chili, and sprinkle with cheese.
step-4: repeat until all ingredients are used, making sure the top layer is cheese.
step-5: cover and refrigerate for at least 3 hours, up to overnight.
step-6: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-7: remove the casserole from the refrigerator and let sit for 10 minutes on your counter.
step-8: poke three toothpicks in the casserole, and cover with tin foil, so that the foil doesn’t touch the cheese layer.
step-9: bake for 30-40 minutes, or until cheese is melted.
step-10: cut and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: in a liquid measuring cup or medium bowl, whisk the eggs and milk until well-combined.
step-3: in a large bowl, add the flour, cornmeal, salt, baking powder, and baking soda, and whisk to combine.
step-4: make a well in the center of the dry ingredients, then pour in the wet ingredients and whisk until smooth.
step-5: add the melted butter and stir to combine.
step-6: grease a 9x13-inch (23x33-cm) glass baking dish with nonstick spray and line with parchment paper.
step-7: pour the cornbread batter into the pan, smoothing the top with a spatula.
step-8: bake for 25 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean.
step-9: let cool for about 10 minutes.
step-10: in a large pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
step-11: add the onion and cook until softened, stirring frequently, about 5 minutes.
step-12: add the ground beef and break apart with a wooden spoon into small pieces.
step-13: add the salt, pepper, paprika, garlic powder, chili powder, and cumin.
step-14: cook, stirring frequently, until the ground beef is cooked through, about 5 minutes
step-15: add the crushed tomatoes and stir.
step-16: simmer for 10 minutes.
step-17: using the bottom of a utensil with a handle that is about 1-inch (2 cm) in diameter, poke multiple holes in the cornbread.
step-18: pour the chili over the cornbread and smooth the top with a spatula.
step-19: sprinkle the cheese over the chili.
step-20: bake for 3 minutes, or until the cheese is melted.
step-21: slice and serve with sour cream, scallions, and cilantro

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: spread chili into a greased 11x7-inch (28 x 18 cm) glass baking dish.
step-3: unroll the dough and cut into four even strips.
step-4: cut the cheese sticks in half lengthwise.
step-5: place a hot dog in the center of a piece of dough.
step-6: place each half of the cheese stick on either side of the hot dog.
step-7: wrap the dough around the cheese and hot dog, overlapping slightly in the center.
step-8: repeat with remaining dough, hot dogs, and cheese.
step-9: place the wrapped hot dogs on top of the chili.
step-10: bake 15-20 minutes, until the dough is light golden.
step-11: add the butter to a microwave-safe bowl and microwave on high until melted.
step-12: stir in the garlic powder and parsley.
step-13: brush over the wrapped hot dogs.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f/180°c.
step-2: place the 8 hot dog buns in a 9x13 inch (22x33 cm) baking dish, then cut a rectangle in each hot dog bun, making sure to stay 1 centimeter from the edges.
step-3: push down on the bread cut-out and compact this portion of the bun tightly into the bottom of each bun, making sure to press down on the bottom edges as well.
step-4: this will help create a larger space for the fillings and reduce mess.
step-5: mix the butter, garlic, and parsley in a small bowl, then brush the buns and their hollowed insides with the garlic butter.
step-6: bake for 5 minutes to toast the buns as well as help the sides of the buns firm up so they don’t collapse under the weight of the fillings.
step-7: place a slice of cheddar cheese inside each bun, then spoon a bit of chili inside each one.
step-8: slide the hot dog snugly on top of the chili, then top with more chili.
step-9: bake for 20-25 minutes, until the cheese is golden brown and the chili has started to brown.
step-10: top with fresh parsley, then slice the hot dogs boats along their connected seams to serve.

step-1: heat oil in a large pot or dutch oven over medium heat.
step-2: add the onion and cook until translucent.
step-3: add the garlic and cook for two minutes.
step-4: add the ground beef and season with salt and pepper.
step-5: break up the beef with a wooden spoon, cooking until browned.
step-6: add in the tomato sauce, cumin, oregano, and chili powder.
step-7: stir until combined.
step-8: reduce the heat to low, cover and simmer for 1 hour.
step-9: remove lid and stir in kidney beans.
step-10: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-11: in a bowl, add the butter, garlic, parsley, and parmesan.
step-12: stir until combined.
step-13: place the dinner rolls in a baking dish.
step-14: use a knife to carve a circle in the top of each roll.
step-15: press down the bottom of the bun to create a denser bottom layer.
step-16: brush the rolls with the garlic butter and bake for 5 minutes, or until lightly toasted.
step-17: spoon the chilli into the holes of the toasted rolls.
step-18: sprinkle with cheddar cheese and bake for another 5 minutes, or until cheese has melted.
step-19: serve topped with sour cream and green onions.

step-1: cook 1 box of mac 'n' cheese according to instructions on box.
step-2: add cooked ground beef, cheddar cheese, kidney beans, green chilis, and chili powder, stir until fully incorporated.
step-3: top with desired garnish.
step-4: serve immediately.

step-1: heat a pan over medium-high heat.
step-2: add the ground beef and break up into smaller bits using a spoon or spatula.
step-3: add the cayenne, cumin, onion powder, garlic powder, pepper, and salt, then mix until evenly incorporated.
step-4: add ketchup.
step-5: mix thoroughly allowing beef to cook all the way through.
step-6: remove the pan from heat, and drain excess fat.
step-7: add the grated potatoes to a bowl, and add in the flour and 1 teaspoon of salt.
step-8: stir to combine.
step-9: using the palm of your hand, spread 1 tablespoon of the potatoes into a thin pancake.
step-10: add 1 teaspoon of the beef, then press a cheese cube into the middle.
step-11: fold potato over beef and cheese, then create a fist around the tot while using your opposite hand to flatten both sides, creating the cylindrical tot form.
step-12: heat vegetable oil over high heat until temperature reaches 360˚f (182˚c).
step-13: fry the tots in batches for about 5 minutes, until golden brown.
step-14: transfer fried tots to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.
step-15: serve immediately.

step-1: heat the oil in a large saucepan over a medium heat.
step-2: fry the garlic and ginger paste for a couple of minutes.
step-3: stir in the chili and onion and fry for about 5 minutes, until soft.
step-4: add the tomato, followed by the chili powder, turmeric, garam masala, salt, and pepper.
step-5: fry for another few minutes stirring continuously.
step-6: stir in the chicken and coriander and mix until evenly coated.
step-7: set the pan aside.
step-8: in a smaller pan over medium heat, place on a paratha.
step-9: spoon on some of the chicken mix and place another paratha on top.
step-10: carefully seal the sides with your fingers, being careful not to touch the pan.
step-11: cook for a few minutes on each side until crisp and golden brown.
step-12: slice the parathas in half and serve with chutneys, raitas, or any other dips of your choice.

step-1: heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
step-2: add the onion and bell pepper and cook for 2 minutes, until starting to soften.
step-3: add the ground beef and chili seasoning.
step-4: cook until the beef is cooked through, about 5 minutes.
step-5: remove the pan from the heat.
step-6: in a small saucepan, whisk together the milk and heavy cream.
step-7: bring to a boil, then remove from the heat.
step-8: in a small bowl, whisk together the water and cornstarch to form a slurry.
step-9: pour the slurry into milk mixture and whisk to combine.
step-10: put mixture back on the heat and bring to a simmer.
step-11: whisk in the cheese until fully melted and season with the salt.
step-12: add the diced tomatoes and green chiles and whisk to combine.
step-13: pour the queso over the chili mixture.
step-14: garnish with scallions and serve with corn chips for dipping.

step-1: preheat oven to 375ºf (190ºc).
step-2: cut hot dogs into thirds.
step-3: cut crescent roll triangles in half lengthwise so you have roughly 1-inch (2 ½ cm) by 5-inch (13 cm) triangle slices.
step-4: roll crescent dough around hot dog thirds, starting with the wider end of the dough closest to the hot dogs, making “pigs in blankets.”
step-5: arrange pigs in blankets around a 10-inch (25 cm) skillet in two tight circles, leaving a hole in the center of the skillet.
step-6: bake 15-20 minutes, until dough puffs up and becomes golden.
step-7: in another large skillet, sauté onions until translucent.
step-8: add the ground beef to the onions, then season with salt and pepper.
step-9: continue stirring ground beef until mostly cooked.
step-10: add the tomato sauce, ketchup, cumin, chili powder, and sugar to the ground beef and onions.
step-11: stir until everything is well mixed.
step-12: simmer 10 minutes.
step-13: when chili and the pigs-in-blankets skillet are both ready, spoon chili to fill the hole in center of the skillet.
step-14: top with shredded cheddar cheese.
step-15: bake another 5-10 minutes until cheese is well melted.
step-16: top with diced green onion and serve.

step-1: in a heavy bottom pot, brown the ground beef with the onions, pepper, and garlic on medium heat.
step-2: add the sauce and spices and bring to a simmer.
step-3: add the beans and simmer, covered, for 30 to 45 minutes.
step-4: serve warm with sour cream and cheddar cheese.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: in a small bowl, mix the chili powder, cumin, cayenne, salt, pepper, and olive oil with the lime juice.
step-3: using a basting brush, generously coat each side of the tilapia fillet with the marinade.
step-4: bake fish for 12 minutes in a preheated oven until edges begin to crisp and fish is moist and flaky.
step-5: while fish is baking, prepare the crema.
step-6: in a blender, combine avocado, cilantro, salt, pepper, lime juice, and yogurt.
step-7: blend until mixture is smooth.
step-8: serve tilapia topped with avocado crema and freshly chopped cilantro.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a bowl, toss the chickpeas with olive oil, chili powder, salt, pepper, lime zest, and lime juice.
step-3: transfer chickpeas to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and bake for 35 minutes, until crispy.

step-1: add the cut jicama, pineapple, cucumber, chili lime seasoning, and juice from the lime wedge in a resealable bag.
step-2: toss to coat.
step-3: serve with a lime wedge.

step-1: if baking, preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: soak wooden skewers in water for 5-10 minutes and set aside.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the chicken with the marinade ingredients and mix.
step-4: cover with plastic wrap and marinate in the fridge for at least an hour.
step-5: assemble skewers by adding red bell pepper first, followed by orange, yellow, and green bell peppers, red onion, and then marinated chicken.
step-6: repeat until skewer is full.
step-7: place skewers on a baking sheet and brush with remaining marinade.
step-8: bake or grill 20-30 minutes, until chicken is no longer pink.
step-9: garnish with fresh chopped cilantro.

step-1: place the avocado, cilantro, lime juice, water, and salt in a blender or food processor.
step-2: blend until smooth and set aside.
step-3: in a small bowl, combine the chili powder, cumin, oregano, salt, pepper, garlic, and lime juice.
step-4: rub the chili lime rub all over the steak in a thin, even layer.
step-5: grill the steak on either a grill or stove-top grill pan.
step-6: to get the “x” grill marks, sear the steak for 1 minute, then adjust about 90 degrees and grill for another minute.
step-7: flip the steak when you’ve achieved desired grill marks and repeat the process on the other side.
step-8: allow the steak to rest for 5-10 minutes once taken off the heat.
step-9: slice the steak thinly, against the grain of the meat.
step-10: prepare the tacos by topping the corn tortillas with a few strips of meat, salsa, the avocado cilantro lime sauce, and cilantro, and serve.

step-1: in a large pot, cook ground beef and onions over medium high heat until browned.
step-2: add minced garlic and cook for an additional two to three minutes.
step-3: carefully drain any excess fat.
step-4: add the diced tomatoes, kidney beans, black beans, chili powder, cumin, seasoned salt, and chicken broth.
step-5: stir, and bring to a boil.
step-6: add the pasta, and cook according to package instructions.
step-7: stir in the cheese, and cook for an additional five minutes, or until thickened.
step-8: serve with your favorite toppings.

step-1: heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat, until shimmering.
step-2: add the onion and cook until caramelized, about 10 minutes.
step-3: add the green bell pepper and cook until softened, about 3 minutes.
step-4: add the ground beef, break apart, and cook until no longer pink, about 5 minutes.
step-5: add the tomato, kidney beans, green chiles, tomato paste, cumin, pepper, salt, garlic powder, paprika, cayenne pepper, and lime juice.
step-6: mix thoroughly and let simmer for about 10 minutes.
step-7: remove the pan from the heat and set aside until ready to use.
step-8: in a large pot over medium-high heat, add the milk and macaroni.
step-9: stir continuously until the milk reaches a simmer and the pasta is cooked.
step-10: turn off the heat, and stir in the butter, salt, pepper, monterey jack, and cheddar cheeses.
step-11: mix until all of the ingredients are incorporated.
step-12: line a 9x13-inch (23x33 cm) casserole dish with parchment paper so the paper is hanging over the sides of the dish.
step-13: spread a third of the macaroni evenly on to the bottom of the dish and sprinkle half of the cheddar cheese over the top.
step-14: spread half of the chili over the cheese.
step-15: spread another third of macaroni over the chili, and sprinkle the remaining cup of cheddar cheese on top.
step-16: spread the rest of the chili over the cheese.
step-17: spread the rest of the macaroni over the chili.
step-18: cover the casserole dish with a piece of parchment paper.
step-19: freeze for at least 6 hours, up to 12 hours.
step-20: remove the casserole from the dish using the parchment paper to help you pull it out.
step-21: place on a work surface.
step-22: insert 9 skewers into one long side of the casserole 4 inches (10 cm) deep, spacing about 2 inches (5 cm) apart.
step-23: repeat on the other long side of the casserole.
step-24: cut the casserole in half vertically, then make 8 horizontal cuts in between the skewers.
step-25: crush the corn chips until they are a coarse sand-like texture, then pour onto a large plate.
step-26: put the flour and eggs in separate medium dishes.
step-27: place one of the pops in the flour, turning to coat on all sides, and tap off the excess flour.
step-28: place the pop in the egg and coat until there is no exposed flour.
step-29: place the pop in the crushed corn chips and coat.
step-30: repeat with the remaining pops.
step-31: heat the oil in a large pot until the temperature reaches 325˚f (165˚c).
step-32: fry the skewers 2 at a time for 8 minutes, until browned and crisp.
step-33: transfer to a wire rack or paper towels to drain.
step-34: sprinkle with cilantro and serve immediately.

step-1: in a food processor or blender, add the cucumber, avocado, greek yogurt, vegetable broth, lemon juice, apple cider vinegar, scallions, salt, and pepper.
step-2: blend until smooth and creamy.
step-3: chill for at least 30 minutes, or until ready to serve.

step-1: in a saucepan, cook the onion and 2 garlic cloves in a little oil.
step-2: after a minute or so, add the minced beef, breaking it up with a spoon.
step-3: when the mince has browned, stir in the chilli powder, cumin, ground coriander, and the plain flour.
step-4: stir in the beef stock, tomatoes, tomato purée, kidney beans, oregano, and salt.
step-5: place a bay leaf into the mixture, loosely cover and simmer for 30-45 minutes, stirring occasionally.
step-6: allow to cool some so you don’t burn yourself during the next bit!
step-7: preheat the oven to 200°c/400°f.
step-8: top and tail the baguette, then cut it into 3-4 equal rolls.
step-9: hollow out each roll, allowing a thin border of bread around the outside.
step-10: stuff each roll with chili using a teaspoon.
step-11: try to really fill them up.
step-12: make the garlic butter by stirring in 2 cloves of crushed garlic and a handful of parsley into the melted butter.
step-13: coat each stuffed roll with a generous helping of garlic butter.
step-14: top with a healthy portion of finely grated cheddar.
step-15: bake in the centre of the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, until the cheese is bubbly and melted.

step-1: combine all of your ingredients in a food processor and blitz.
in a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar together with an electric hand mixer for 5 minutes, or until light and fluffy.
step-2: add the egg, then 1 egg yolk, beating to incorporate after each addition.
step-3: add the almond extract and beat to combine.
step-4: sift the flour, baking soda, and salt into the bowl and beat for 3 minutes, or until a crumbly dough forms.
step-5: turn out the dough onto a sheet of plastic wrap and fold the wrap over the dough on all 4 sides to create a square dough block about ½ inch (1 ¼ cm) thick.
step-6: refrigerate the dough for 2 hours.
step-7: preheat the oven to 325˚f (165˚c).
step-8: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-9: unwrap the dough on a cutting board and cut into 25 cubes.
step-10: roll the dough cubes into balls, then flatten slightly and place on the prepared baking sheet.
step-11: in a small bowl, beat the remaining egg yolk with the water.
step-12: brush a thick layer of egg wash onto the cookies.
step-13: add the red food coloring to a small bowl.
step-14: dip the thicker end of a wooden chopstick into the food coloring and make a dot in the center of each cookie.
step-15: bake for 35 minutes, or until the cookies are golden.
step-16: let the cookies cool on a wire rack for 30 minutes before serving.

step-1: heat up 2 tablespoons of oil on low to medium heat.
step-2: sear the chicken until the outside turns golden brown.
step-3: season with salt and pepper.
step-4: take out the chicken, make sure you don’t clean the pot or you’d wipe away some deliciousness!
step-5: add another tablespoon of oil, fry the onions, carrots, and potatoes until soften.
step-6: add the chicken back in with the water.
step-7: bring to a boil then simmer for 10 minutes with the lid on.
step-8: add in the peas and curry paste, stir well.
step-9: serve with rice.

step-1: heat a wok over medium-high heat for 5 minutes.
step-2: add the oil then stir in eggs and fry until just cooked.
step-3: once cooked, remove eggs from the wok and set aside.
step-4: heat up the wok until smoking hot and pour in the oil.
step-5: add the chicken breast and fry until they are just cooked.
step-6: add the rice and keep frying until they turn slightly brown.
step-7: add the vegetables and fry everything together until they are thoroughly cooked.
step-8: pour in the soy sauce and stir.
step-9: add the cooked eggs back in and toss them around until they break into pieces.
step-10: add in the spring onions and serve.

step-1: make the red bean filling: in a medium bowl, combine the red beans with 1 cup (240 ml) of water.
step-2: cover with plastic wrap and soak overnight.
step-3: drain the red beans, then transfer to a small saucepan with the remaining 3 cups (720 ml) of water.
step-4: bring to a boil over medium-high heat, then cover and cook for 1 hour, until soft enough to mash with a fork.
step-5: add the sugar and cook, stirring frequently, until the liquid evaporates and a thick red bean paste forms.
step-6: transfer the red bean paste to a bowl.
step-7: cover with plastic wrap, pressing it directly onto the surface of the paste to prevent a skin from forming.
step-8: refrigerate until ready to use.
step-9: make the dough: in a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, whisk the hot water with the light brown sugar until the sugar dissolves.
step-10: add the glutinous rice flour to a medium bowl and use a spoon to create a small well in the center.
step-11: pour the sugar syrup into the well and stir for 5 minutes, until the dough is well combined and no longer sticks to the bowl.
step-12: lightly dust a clean surface with glutinous rice flour.
step-13: turn the dough out and knead for 5 minutes, until it forms a smooth, round ball.
step-14: use a little bit more flour or water as needed.
step-15: divide the dough into 8 pieces.
step-16: roll the pieces into small balls, then flatten into discs about ½-inch (1 ¼ cm) thick and 2½-inches (6.5 cm) in diameter.
step-17: place 1 teaspoon of red bean filling in the center of a piece of dough.
step-18: fold in the edges to cover the filling, then roll into a ball.
step-19: roll the ball in the sesame seeds until the dough is covered.
step-20: repeat with the remaining ingredients.
step-21: heat the vegetable oil in a large pot until it reaches 350°f (180°c).
step-22: fry the sesame balls for 15 minutes, stirring frequently, until golden brown.
step-23: transfer to a wire rack set over a baking sheet to drain and let cool for 15 minutes before serving.

step-1: in a large pan or wok, heat the oil over high.
step-2: fry the string beans until they start blistering.
step-3: remove the string beans.
step-4: in the same pan or wok, add the garlic, ginger, and scallions.
step-5: fry until fragrant.
step-6: add the mushrooms and ground pork.
step-7: fry until the pork is mostly done.
step-8: stir in the the dried red chilies and chili paste.
step-9: add the string beans back the pan/wok.
step-10: toss to combine everything.
step-11: add the soy sauce, rice wine, and a dash of white pepper.
step-12: serve!

step-1: heat the oil in a large sauce pan over a medium heat.
step-2: add the ribs and sear until all sides turn golden brown.
step-3: add in all the seasoning.
step-4: bring the liquid to a boil, reduce heat, and cover.
step-5: simmer the ribs for an hour to 90 minutes.
step-6: until the ribs become really tender.
step-7: once the ribs are cooked remove lid and reduce the sauce for 5 minutes.
step-8: serve drizzled with sauce.

step-1: cut the pork belly into roughly 1-inch (2 ½ cm) chunks.
step-2: bring the water to a boil in a pot, then add the pork, ginger, onion, and garlic, cooking for about 3-4 minutes.
step-3: remove the pork from the water and drain it on a plate lined with a paper towel.
step-4: discard the remaining water and vegetables.
step-5: after cleaning and drying the pot, heat it with the oil over high heat.
step-6: place the pork back in, cooking until browned.
step-7: the oil may pop and splash so be careful.
step-8: add the brown sugar, turning the heat to low.
step-9: stir continuously until the sugar has melted, caramelized, and coated the pork evenly.
step-10: immediately add the soy sauces and rice wine, stirring and cooking for about 5-6 minutes or until the liquid has reduced into a thick glaze.
step-11: add the water, stir, and cover the pot for about 45 minutes.
step-12: make sure the mixture is at a low simmer, not boiling.
step-13: check and stir every 10 minutes or so and add water if the pot is getting dry.
step-14: when the 45 minutes are up, remove the lid, checking to see if the sauce coats the pork in a very thick glaze.
step-15: if it is too runny, continue to stir, uncovered, until the liquid has reduced.
step-16: serve immediately over a bowl of rice and sprinkle with sliced green onions.

step-1: combine all marinade ingredients with the chicken breast and leave for 20 minutes.
step-2: coat the chicken breast first in flour, then eggs, and finally panko breadcrumbs.
step-3: in a medium-sized saucepan heat the oil to 170°c (325˚f).
step-4: deep fry the breaded chicken for about 3-4 minutes until the coating is golden brown.
step-5: in a small frying pan, combine the chicken stock, lemon juice, and sugar.
step-6: bring the mixture to a boil.
step-7: mix the corn flour with the water, then add the mixture to the frying pan to thicken the sauce.
step-8: add the chicken to the frying pan and coat with the lemon sauce.
step-9: serve on top of rice.
step-10: (we garnished ours with green onions and sesame seeds.)

step-1: combine all marinade ingredients with the chicken breast and leave to marinade in the fridge for 20 minutes.
step-2: coat the chicken breast first in flour, then eggs, and finally panko breadcrumbs.
step-3: in a medium-sized saucepan heat the oil to 170°c (325˚f).
step-4: deep fry the breaded chicken for about 3-4 minutes until the coating is golden brown and the chicken is cooked through.
step-5: in a small frying pan, combine the chicken stock, orange zests, orange juice, and sugar, then stir.
step-6: bring the mixture to a boil.
step-7: mix the cornflour with the water, then add the mixture to the pan to thicken the sauce.
step-8: add the chicken to the frying pan and coat with the orange sauce.
step-9: serve on top of rice and add toppings of your choice.

step-1: wrap tofu in two layers of paper towels and place on a plate.
step-2: put another plate on top of the tofu to weigh it down, and microwave for 2-3 minutes, or until drained.
step-3: after microwaving, carefully unwrap tofu and slice into ½-1 inch cubes.
step-4: pat each cube dry.
step-5: in a large nonstick skillet, heat vegetable oil and 1 teaspoon of sesame oil over medium-high heat.
step-6: once the oil is hot, add cubes of tofu and cook on all sides until golden brown, approximately 2-4 minutes per side, then remove from pan and set aside.
step-7: add broccoli to the hot pan and add vegetable broth.
step-8: cover with a lid and reduce heat to medium-low.
step-9: steam for 5 minutes.
step-10: remove lid and turn heat back up to medium-high.
step-11: add garlic, grated ginger, and ½ teaspoon sesame oil.
step-12: stir to soften.
step-13: add in soy sauce, agave, sesame seeds, and cornstarch slurry.
step-14: stir until thickened to desired consistency.
step-15: add tofu back into broccoli and sauce mixture.
step-16: serve over white rice and garnish with green onion and sesame seeds.

step-1: in a plastic bag, place chicken thighs and 3 tablespoons of the olive oil.
step-2: add the chipotle powder, garlic powder, cumin, and salt.
step-3: seal the plastic bag and massage the meat until fully coated.
step-4: transfer to the refrigerator to marinate for at least 1 hour, or overnight.
step-5: heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
step-6: place the marinated chicken thighs in the pan and cook for 5 minutes on each side, or until the chicken is cooked through.
step-7: cube the chicken thighs on a cutting board and set aside.
step-8: in a large bowl, place cooked brown rice, and top the chopped chicken thighs, green peppers, cherry tomatoes, black beans, corns, red onions, and cilantro.
step-9: drizzle 2 tablespoons of olive oil, lime juice, and season with salt and pepper over the bowl.
step-10: toss until well mixed.

step-1: place the chicken breasts, 2 teaspoons of salt, peppercorns, onion, whole garlic cloves, bay leaves, and water in a large pot.
step-2: cover the pot and bring to a simmer over medium heat.
step-3: once the water is simmering, cook for 10 minutes, until the chicken registers 165°f (74°c) when pierced with an instant-read thermometer.
step-4: transfer the chicken to a cutting board and discard the cooking liquid.
step-5: using 2 forks, pull the chicken apart until shredded.
step-6: in a large nonstick pan, heat the oil over medium-high heat until shimmering.
step-7: add the corn, bell pepper, and a pinch of salt and sauté until the vegetables have softened, about 2 minutes.
step-8: add the chipotle peppers and sauté until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
step-9: add the shredded chicken and mix until everything is well incorporated.
step-10: add the lime juice and mix to incorporate.
step-11: remove the pan from the heat and let the chicken cool for 5 minutes before spooning into the lettuce leaves.
step-12: top with a sprinkle of chopped cilantro.

step-1: add the olive oil to a pan over medium heat.
step-2: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the chickpeas and cook until slightly golden, stirring occasionally.
step-3: add soy sauce, chipotle chili powder, and garlic powder to the chickpeas and sauté for 3-4 more minutes, until golden brown.
step-4: serve on warm tortillas with desired taco toppings.

step-1: in a large bowl, mix the flour, cornmeal, baking powder, and salt.
step-2: mix and make a little well in the center.
step-3: add the milk, eggs, honey into the well, beat the eggs and liquid first, and then combine with the rest of the dry ingredients.
step-4: set aside until chili is almost finished.
step-5: in a large pot at medium high heat, add the beef, season with salt, pepper, cumin, chili powder, smoked paprika, cayenne, and cook until it is a deep brown color.
step-6: add the onion, red bell peppers garlic, and chopped chipotles, and a pinch of salt.
step-7: cook until caramelized and soft, about 10 minutes.
step-8: add the tomato paste and cook until the tomato paste gets dark and starts sticking to the bottom slightly.
step-9: add in the canned diced tomatoes, beef broth, black beans, kidney beans, and apple cider vinegar (optional).
step-10: stir until all is well incorporated.
step-11: bring to a boil, reduce heat to low to a simmer,
step-12: scoop and shape the cornbread batter into golf ball sized dumplings and place in the simmering chili.
step-13: put a lid on the chili and steam/simmer the dumplings 20 minutes or until the dumplings are cooked through.
step-14: serve with cheddar cheese, sour cream, and sliced scallions.

step-1: add the ingredients into a mason jar.
step-2: screw the lid on tightly and shake vigorously.
step-3: the dressing can remain in the fridge for 1-2 weeks.
step-4: pour over your favorite salad ingredients and enjoy!

step-1: cut chicken breast into bite-sized pieces and place them in a medium-sized bowl.
step-2: pour buttermilk and can of chiles over the chicken, making sure to get all of the adobo sauce out of the can.
step-3: mix well to incorporate.
step-4: cover and let marinate in the refrigerator for 2-4 hours.
step-5: in a separate bowl, mix together panko bread crumbs, chili powder, salt, pepper, and paprika.
step-6: remove chicken from the refrigerator and dredge the pieces in the bread crumb mixture for an even coat.
step-7: fry them in 350˚f (180˚c) oil until they are crispy and golden brown (about 2 minutes).
step-8: drain on paper towels.
step-9: garnish with an additional sprinkle of smoked paprika and serve.

step-1: on a cutting board, season the chicken all over with salt and pepper.
step-2: transfer the chicken to a large zip-top bag with the chopped chipotles and mix until the chicken is fully coated.
step-3: refrigerate for at least 2 hours, up to overnight.
step-4: heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
step-5: add the chicken and cook until golden brown, 4 minutes per side.
step-6: remove the chicken with tongs and place on a cutting board.
step-7: let cool for 5 minutes.
step-8: cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces.
step-9: transfer the chicken back to the pan over medium-high heat and cook, stirring frequently, for 2-3 minutes, until all pieces are browned.

step-1: on a cutting board, season the steak with salt and pepper on both sides.
step-2: place the steak in a zip-top bag and add the chipotle peppers, then toss to coat.
step-3: refrigerate for at least 2 hours, up to overnight.
step-4: heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
step-5: add the steak to the pan and cook for 5 minutes per side.
step-6: remove the steak from the pan and rest on a cutting board for 10 minutes.
step-7: cut into bite-size pieces.

step-1: lay out your puff pastry.
step-2: place your chocolate bar in the center, cut diagonal lines along the left and right side of the chocolate bar about an inch apart.
step-3: remove the corner pieces.
step-4: starting from the top, fold down the flap then alternate right and left until you are close to the bottom.
step-5: fold the bottom flap up and finish alternating between right and left.
step-6: tuck any extra puff pastry underneath.
step-7: place the braided puff pastry on parchment paper lined baking tray.
step-8: brush with egg wash and sprinkle crushed nuts over.
step-9: bake at 415°f (213°c) for 25 minutes or until golden brown.

step-1: spread chocolate almond butter on toast, and top with raspberries and coconut flakes.
put all ingredients into a blender and mix until smooth.
cut the bananas in half horizontally.
step-2: insert popsicle sticks in the middle of the banana halves.
step-3: transfer bananas to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, and freeze until solid.
step-4: in a tall glass or mixing cup, add chocolate and coconut oil.
step-5: microwave in 30-second intervals for 1 minute and a half, and mix until smooth.
step-6: place almonds onto a plate.
step-7: dip the bananas into the chocolate coating, then roll or sprinkle on toppings.
step-8: place bananas in freezer until the coating has hardened.

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine shiratamako, sugar, and water.
step-2: mix.
step-3: cover and microwave for 3 minutes.
step-4: let it sit for 1 minute, wrapped.
step-5: sprinkle your tabletop with enough potato starch to avoid sticking.
step-6: mix the mochi mixture and place on top of the starch.
step-7: using a rolling pin, stretch mochi out very thin (about ½ cm to 1 cm thickness).
step-8: set aside until it gets to room temperature.
step-9: in a large bowl, combine heavy cream, syrup, and chocolate powder.
step-10: whip until small peaks form.
step-11: add the diced chestnuts and fold them into the cream.
step-12: slice the mochi sheet into 12 even pieces.
step-13: or depending on the cookie used for the base, make sure to have 2 cm to fold under.
step-14: place a spoonful of cream on the cookie.
step-15: place one sheet of mochi over the cream and fold under the cookie.
step-16: garnish with more cocoa powder.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (175°c).
step-2: in a blender or food processor, combine avocado, eggs, honey and vanilla extract.
step-3: blend until smooth, scraping down sides as necessary.
step-4: in a large bowl, whisk the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
step-5: combine the wet and dry mixtures and fold until a batter forms.
step-6: pour batter into a greased 8x8 inch baking pan.
step-7: bake for 20-30 minutes.
step-8: allow to cool.

step-1: add the avocados to a blender or food processor, along with the cocoa powder, melted chocolate, almond milk, maple syrup, vanilla extract and salt.
step-2: blend until smooth, scraping down sides as necessary.
step-3: serve immediately, or chilled.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (220°c)
step-2: unfold the puff pastry.
step-3: spread the chocolate hazelnut spread onto the middle third.
step-4: arrange the sliced bananas on top of the spread in a single layer.
step-5: bananas may slightly overlap.
step-6: cut out a triangle of the top right corner of the pastry.
step-7: repeat on the other side.
step-8: cut diagonal slits along both sides of the pastry.
step-9: each will be around 1 inch (2 ½ cm) thick.
step-10: fold over the top piece of dough to partially cover the top row of bananas.
step-11: alternating both sides, fold the strips of pastry over the bananas, mimicking a braid pattern.
step-12: trim the excess dough on the sides, and fold over the bottom flap.
step-13: brush the top of the braided pastry with the beaten egg.
step-14: transfer to a parchment lined baking sheet for and bake 15 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown.
step-15: allow to rest for 10 minutes before slicing.

step-1: in a medium mixing bowl combine the brownie mix, oil and water.
step-2: mix well.
step-3: on a baking sheet, lay down a sheet of wax paper.
step-4: spoon on half the mixture, and spread out to be about ½ inch (1 cm) thick.
step-5: press 6 gram crackers into the mixture.
step-6: cover with remaining brownie batter.
step-7: bake at 350˚f (180˚c) for 15-20 minutes until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
step-8: let it cool before slicing out the graham crackers.
step-9: (there will be leftover bits of brownie in between the slices to enjoy now!
step-10: freeze the rectangular slices for one hour.
step-11: peel and slice 3 bananas before freezing.
step-12: in a blender, combine the bananas, vanilla, and maple syrup.
step-13: blend on high until creamy.
step-14: use a bag to squeeze the filling onto the crust.
step-15: top with another crust.

step-1: in a large bowl, add the melted butter, sugar, and eggs.
step-2: whisk to combine, then add the milk and whisk to incorporate.
step-3: sift in the flour and salt and whisk until smooth.
step-4: heat a small nonstick skillet over medium heat.
step-5: scoop a ¼ cup (60 g) of the batter into the pan.
step-6: swirl the pan around until the batter evenly coats the bottom.
step-7: cook until the surface begins to bubble slightly and the edges brown, about 3 minutes.
