step-8: flip the crepe and cook on the other side for another 1-2 minutes.
step-9: remove from the skillet and set aside to cool.
step-10: repeat with the remaining batter.
step-11: spread the chocolate hazelnut spread over the crepes.
step-12: roll up.
step-13: cut off each end, then cut the each roll in half crosswise.
step-14: to serve, set 3 rolls on a plate and top with 4 banana slices.
step-15: top with 3 more rolls perpendicular to the first stack, more bananas, and one more layer of crepe rolls.
step-16: top with whipped cream.
step-17: repeat with the rest of the crepes.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: make the banana custard: in a large bowl, mash the bananas.
step-3: add the eggs, milk, and heavy cream and stir to combine.
step-4: in a medium bowl, combine the sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, and vanilla and mix with a fork.
step-5: add the sugar mixture to the custard mixture and stir to combine.
step-6: add the cubed bread, chocolate chips, and pecans to the custard mixture and toss well to coat.
step-7: let soak for 10 minutes.
step-8: while the bread is soaking, make the caramel base: in a medium microwave-safe bowl, microwave the butter for about 2 minutes, stirring every 30 seconds, until melted and hot.
step-9: add the brown sugar and stir to combine.
step-10: microwave for another minute, stirring halfway, until the sugar is mostly dissolved.
step-11: add the salt, vanilla, and pecans and stir to combine.
step-12: pour the caramel into the bottom of a 9 (22 cm) x 13-inch (33 cm) baking dish and spread evenly.
step-13: arrange the bananas, cut side down, over the caramel.
step-14: spoon the brioche-custard mixture evenly over the bananas.
step-15: cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes, then uncover and bake for 40-45 minutes longer, until the custard is set.
step-16: remove from the oven and let cool for 5 minutes.
step-17: run a knife around the edges of the baking dish to loosen the bake, then invert onto a rectangular serving dish.
step-18: do not wait any longer than 5 minutes or the bake will stick to the pan.
step-19: slice and serve.

step-1: mash banana into a paste then add chocolate chips.
step-2: whisk together egg, oil, honey, milk, and vanilla extract in a small bowl.
step-3: whisk together flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt in a small bowl.
step-4: pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until combined.
step-5: grease 2 small mugs.
step-6: fill mugs half way with the chocolate batter.
step-7: divide the banana filling between the 2 mugs.
step-8: place remaining chocolate batter on top.
step-9: garnish with sliced banana.
step-10: microwave on high or 1 minute 10 seconds to 1 minute 25 seconds, or bake in 350˚f (180˚c) oven for 13-15 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a saucepan over medium heat, bring the butter brown sugar and corn syrup to a boil.
step-3: remove from heat
step-4: add the flour and nuts into the butter mixture.
step-5: stir until cooled, about 10 minutes.
step-6: on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet use a teaspoon to scoop 5 balls 5 inches (13 cm) apart onto the baking sheet.
step-7: bake for 6-7 minutes, until the edges are a deep golden color.
step-8: let the cookies cool for about 1 minute, until they are cool enough to handle but still flexible.
step-9: place the cookie over the backside of a muffin tin and gently form until the cookie is a cup shape.
step-10: wait until the cookie has hardened into the cup shape, then remove from the muffin tin, about 1 minute.
step-11: in a bowl microwave the chocolate in 20 second intervals stirring in between for 1 minute.
step-12: take one of the pecan lace cookie cups and dip the edge into the chocolate.
step-13: let cool.
step-14: scoop about 2 tablespoons of banana pudding into the pecan lace cookie cup.
step-15: place 3 slices of banana over the pudding.
step-16: drizzle the leftover melted chocolate over the bananas.
step-17: sprinkle nuts over the top.
step-18: serve immediately.

step-1: *”toffee”/dulce de leche can be purchase already prepared - or can be made at home through a process of heating sweetened condensed milk - recipes/instructions can be found online.
step-2: crush digestive biscuits in a large plastic bag.
step-3: pour into a large bowl and add banana and about half the can of dulce de leche.
step-4: use a fork to mash and incorporate the banana and toffee into the biscuit crumbs.
step-5: add additional toffee as needed - just enough to coat all the biscuit crumbs without it becoming too sticky.
step-6: form the mixture into 1 inch (2 ½ cm) balls and freeze for 15 minutes until firm.
step-7: microwave chocolate for 60 seconds - stopping after 30 seconds to check and stir.
step-8: remove balls from freezer and dip into the melted chocolate.
step-9: set on wax paper and sprinkle with additional biscuit crumbs (optional).
step-10: allow chocolate coating to harden (chill in fridge to speed up this process).
step-11: drizzle with additional toffee just before serving.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: line 3 baking sheets (work in batches if necessary) with parchment paper and grease with nonstick spray.
step-3: make the ladyfingers: in a large bowl, beat the egg whites and cream of tartar with an electric hand mixer until foamy.
step-4: gradually add ¼ cup sugar while continuing to beat until stiff peaks form.
step-5: in a medium bowl, beat together the egg yolks and remaining ½ cup sugar until thick and pale in color, about 3 minutes.
step-6: gently fold the yolks into egg white mixture with a rubber spatula.
step-7: sift in the flour and salt and fold to incorporate.
step-8: transfer the batter to a piping bag or zip-top bag fitted with a large round tip.
step-9: release the bottom from a 9-inch springform pan and set the ring in the center of a prepared baking sheet.
step-10: starting at the center of the ring and working your way outward, pipe the batter in a spiral pattern, about 1 centimeter thick, leaving a ½-inch border around the edge.
step-11: remove the ring.
step-12: with the remaining batter, pipe 40 3-inch (10-centimeter) long by 1-inch (2½-centimeter) wide cookies onto the remaining 2 prepared baking sheet.
step-13: bake the spiral and cookies for 15-17 minutes, until lightly golden around the edges.
step-14: do not allow to get too dark.
step-15: let cool completely.
step-16: make the chocolate mousse: in a large bowl, beat the cold heavy cream with an electric hand mixer until soft peaks form.
step-17: add the sugar and beat to incorporate.
step-18: in a medium bowl, pour the hot heavy cream over the chocolate.
step-19: stir with a rubber spatula until melted and smooth.
step-20: fold the chocolate mixture into the whipped cream until incorporated.
step-21: set the spiral cake base on the bottom of the springform pan and attach the ring.
step-22: there should be a small gap between the cake and the ring mold.
step-23: line the gap on the inside edge of the ring with the ladyfingers, flat sides facing in.
step-24: you want a snug fit so use as many ladyfingers as needed.
step-25: pour the chocolate mousse into the center and smooth in an even layer.
step-26: chill until set, at least 4 hours in the refrigerator or about 2 hours in the freezer.
step-27: garnish the charlotte with blackberries, raspberries, chocolate shavings, and mint sprigs.
step-28: release the springform and tie a ribbon around the outside of the charlotte.
step-29: remove the ribbon before slicing and serving.
step-30: refrigerate any leftovers for up to 2 days.

step-1: combine the yeast and warm milk and let sit until foamy, about 5 minutes.
step-2: in large mixing bowl, add the egg, egg yolks, vanilla, sugar, and honey and whisk to combine.
step-3: add in the milk and yeast mixture and whisk until fully incorporated.
step-4: gradually add in the flour and mix until fully incorporated.
step-5: gradually add in the butter and mix until fully incorporated.
step-6: cover with a towel and let rest for 30 minutes.
step-7: bring out the dough onto floured work surface and knead until smooth.
step-8: divide the dough into two equal parts and place in bowls and cover each with plastic wrap.
step-9: let the dough sit at room temperature for at least two hours, or when it has doubled in size.
step-10: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-11: for the chocolate sauce, combine bittersweet chocolate, butter, sugar, cocoa powder, cinnamon, espresso powder, and turbinado sugar in a medium sized mixing bowl and microwave for 1-2 minutes.
step-12: stir to combine and set aside.
step-13: once the dough has doubled in size, transfer to a floured work surface and roll both pieces of dough into a rectangle roughly 10x15-inches.
step-14: cover the dough with half of the chocolate sauce leaving an ½ inch - 1 inch of room on all sides.
step-15: gently roll the dough up and repeat with second piece of dough and remaining chocolate sauce.
step-16: using a bench scraper or a knife, carefully cut each log vertically in half making sure the seam is side down.
step-17: lay one piece of dough horizontally and lay another piece over it vertically so you have a rough ‘plus sign’.
step-18: lay another piece horizontally over the vertical piece and above the other horizontal piece.
step-19: lay the final piece vertically on the right of the other vertical piece having it go over the top horizontal piece but weaving it under the lower horizontal piece.
step-20: starting with the bottom vertical piece on the right side, bring it to the left layering it over the other vertical lower piece.
step-21: follow this method around the dough clockwise.
step-22: once returned to the bottom lower vertical pieces.
step-23: take the original piece you crossed over (the lower left vertical piece) and cross that over to the right layering it over the last piece you used.
step-24: continue this counterclockwise until back at the bottom or you are unable to layer the dough anymore.
step-25: tuck in the excess pieces of dough under the bread.
step-26: transfer the bread into a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and brush with egg wash.
step-27: bake for 35-45 minutes, until lightly browned and cooked through.

step-1: add chickpeas, maple syrup, milk of choice, vanilla, and cocoa powder to a food processor and blend until smooth.
step-2: top with shredded coconut and serve with your favorite fruit or dipping snack.

step-1: preheat oven to 300˚f (150˚c).
step-2: combine cereal and crushed pretzels in a large bowl.
step-3: in another large bowl, melt marshmallows and butter in the microwave for 1 minute & 30 seconds, stirring half way.
step-4: (time may vary depending on your microwave, so, keep an eye on it!)
step-5: combine cereal, pretzels and melted marshmallows.
step-6: mix well.
step-7: prepare a baking sheet with parchment paper and spray generously with non-stick cooking spray.
step-8: (you might want to spray your hands too!)
step-9: remove marshmallow mixture from the bowl and place onto the baking sheet.
step-10: spray another piece of parchment paper with non-stick spray and lay the sprayed side on top of the marshmallow mixture.
step-11: roll out with a rolling pin into a thin layer.
step-12: remove the top layer of parchment paper and evenly spread caramel over the marshmallow mixture.
step-13: pour chocolate chips over the caramel.
step-14: bake for 2 minutes, or until chocolate chips spread easily across the caramel.
step-15: carefully & tightly roll it up longways, peeling back the parchment paper as you go.
step-16: cover in plastic wrap & chill for 2-3 hours, or until it has firmed up nicely.
step-17: remove plastic wrap and parchment paper, and cut in 1-inch (2 cm) slices.

step-1: melt chocolate and water together in a pan on a low heat, stirring occasionally until melted.
step-2: add ice and water to a large bowl, then place the mixing bowl in the ice water.
step-3: pour the melted chocolate mixture into the mixing bowl in the ice bath.
step-4: using a hand blender, whisk chocolate mixture until it becomes fluffy and resembles whipped cream, do not over mix!
step-5: top with whipped cream and grated chocolate.
step-6: serve immediately.

step-1: open the chocolate pudding cups and spoon the pudding into a medium bowl.
step-2: place the pudding in the refrigerator and wash out the plastic cups.
step-3: using scissors, cut the cups down one side and across the bottom, leaving one side of the cup intact.
step-4: tape the cut edges together to seal the cups.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: place the chocolate chips in a medium microwave-safe bowl.
step-7: add the coconut oil and melt in the microwave in 30-second intervals for 1 minute total.
step-8: stir the chocolate until smooth.
step-9: spoon the melted chocolate into the plastic cups.
step-10: tilt the cups to coat the insides completely and pour any excess chocolate back into the bowl.
step-11: place the cups on a baking sheet and refrigerate until set, about 5 minutes.
step-12: add the cream cheese to a medium bowl with the sugar and vanilla.
step-13: stir until smooth and well-combined.
step-14: transfer to a piping bag or zip-top plastic bag with a corner cut off.
step-15: transfer the reserved chocolate pudding to another piping bag or zip-top plastic bag with a corner cut off.
step-16: peel the tape off the pudding cups and carefully remove the plastic from the chocolate cups.
step-17: flip the cups upright and pipe the chocolate pudding into the bottom of the cups.
step-18: top the pudding with the cheesecake mixture and your favorite dessert toppings, such as crushed peanuts, caramel sauce, crushed cookies, and/or strawberries.

step-1: preheat your oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-2: in a cast-iron skillet over medium-low heat, add the cherries, sugar, cornstarch, lemon juice, and salt.
step-3: mix to combine and stir for 5-10 minutes until the mixture starts to thicken.
step-4: let simmer for 5 minutes on low heat.
step-5: sprinkle the box cake mix over the cherry filling.
step-6: distribute the butter evenly over the top to ensure even baking.
step-7: bake for 45 minutes to an hour, until the top is golden brown.
step-8: serve warm with ice cream.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: line two 9x5-inch (23x13 cm) loaf pans with parchment paper and grease with nonstick spray.
step-3: in a large bowl, mash the bananas.
step-4: add the eggs and vegetable oil and whisk until smooth.
step-5: add the cake mix and chocolate chips and stir with a spatula to combine.
step-6: split and pour the batter into two loaf pans lined with parchment paper and nonstick baking spray.
step-7: bake for 30 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean when inserted in the middle.
step-8: cool before slicing and serve.

step-1: in a mason jar or sealable container, add the oats, milk, yogurt, cocoa powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, chia seeds, and banana.
step-2: stir together.
step-3: seal and place in the refrigerator overnight for up to five days.
step-4: top with additional banana slices, chocolate chips, and honey if desired.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: cut two bananas into half coins.
step-3: cut one banana into coins and line the bottom of a greased bundt pan.
step-4: in a bowl mix sugar and cinnamon, set aside.
step-5: cut each biscuit round in half and flatten into rounds.
step-6: stuff each round with one piece of the halved banana coins and chocolate chips.
step-7: close the round together by pinching at the seam and roll into a ball in your hands.
step-8: place the balls in the cinnamon sugar mix and gently toss to coat.
step-9: place half the balls in the pan.
step-10: in a saucepan over medium heat melt the butter and brown sugar until one, stirring occasionally.
step-11: set aside to cool.
step-12: pour half of the glaze on top.
step-13: sprinkle a handful of chocolate chips over top.
step-14: then place rest of the balls on top followed by the rest of the glaze.
step-15: bake for 40-50 minutes until the crust is a deep dark brown on top.
step-16: (if the top is browning too much you can cover it with aluminum foil.)
step-17: remove from oven and allow it to cool or about 15-30 minutes before turning it over onto a plate.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a large mixing bowl, use a fork to mash the ripe bananas.
step-3: whisk in the egg, followed by vegetable oil and milk.
step-4: mix until combined.
step-5: add in the yellow cake mix, being careful to not overmix.
step-6: use a rubber spatula to gently fold in the chocolate chips.
step-7: set aside.
step-8: in a shallow saucepan, set over medium heat, add the butter and brown sugar, and stir constantly with a wooden spoon until the mixture turns into golden brown syrup, about 5 minutes.
step-9: pour the syrup into a 9-inch (20-cm) round cake pan.
step-10: place the sliced bananas into a single layer on top of the syrup.
step-11: divide the cake batter among the banana pan, and another greased 9-inch (20-cm) cake pan.
step-12: bake for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean from the center.
step-13: once the banana bottom cake is cool to touch, invert onto a cooling rack set on top of a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-14: leave the second cake to cool to room temperature inside the pan.
step-15: in a large mixing bowl, whisk together the cream cheese and sugar until light and fluffy.
step-16: beat in the eggs, one at a time.
step-17: add in the sour cream and vanilla extract, and mix until combined.
step-18: pour the cheesecake batter into the cooled cake in the pan.
step-19: cover the bottom of the pan with two sheets of foil and place into a larger baking dish.
step-20: fill the baking dish with water until it comes 1 inch (2 cm) up the side on the cake pan.
step-21: bake for 1 hour.
step-22: turn the heat off and open the oven door and let cool for one hour.
step-23: refrigerate the cake for 4 hours.
step-24: to assemble, remove the cheesecake from the springform pan.
step-25: top the cake with the cooled banana fosters cake.

step-1: prepare the brownie mix according to package instructions, and pour the batter into a springform pan.
step-2: bake according to package instructions, and cool completely.
step-3: beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth.
step-4: fold in vanilla and whipped cream, then fold in the chocolate chips.
step-5: spread cream cheese mixture over the cooled brownie in the springform pan.
step-6: decorate with toppings of your choice, or just leave it plain!
step-7: refrigerate for at least 4 hours before serving.

step-1: combine cake mix, chocolate chips, oil, and eggs in a mixing bowl.
step-2: using an ice cream scoop or your hand, form golf ball-sized balls of cookie dough and transfer to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-3: bake at 350°f (180°c) for 10-12 minutes.

step-1: spread drained chickpeas onto a towel and pat dry.
step-2: remove chickpea shells.
step-3: place chickpeas, peanut butter, vanilla, honey, and salt into food processor.
step-4: mix halfway then add chickpea water to help consistency.
step-5: add chocolate chips to mixed dough.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, whisk together the brown sugar, granulated sugar, and melted butter, until evenly combined and light in color.
step-3: add in the eggs and vanilla, mixing until smooth.
step-4: add the flour and baking soda, folding the mixture until it forms a smooth dough.
step-5: fold in the chocolate chips until evenly combined.
step-6: using an ice cream scoop, scoop 6 balls of dough onto a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
step-7: bake for 12 minutes, then serve!
step-8: to save cookie dough for later use, scoop the dough into balls and place them side-by-side on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
step-9: wrap the tray with cling wrap, then freeze for up to one month.
step-10: to bake the frozen dough balls, remove desired number from the tray and bake in a preheated oven for 15 minutes at 375°f (190°c).

step-1: soak cashews in boiling water for two hours.
step-2: drain the cashews and blend in a food processor for 30 seconds.
step-3: pour in coconut oil and agave and blend for 1 minute.
step-4: scrape down sides and add in almond flour.
step-5: blend until smooth, approximately 2-5 minutes.
step-6: remove the mixture from the food processor and transfer to a food storage container and stir in chocolate chips.
step-7: store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

step-1: mix together oats, cinnamon, vanilla extract, nut butter, honey, and chocolate chips in a medium bowl until well-incorporated.
step-2: cover with plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator for an hour.
step-3: roll into balls the size of a ping pong ball.
step-4: refrigerate in tightly sealed container for up to one week.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the butter, vanilla, canola oil, sugar, and salt and beat with a hand mixer until smooth.
step-2: add the egg and mix until well incorporated.
step-3: add the cornstarch, flour, and chocolate chips.
step-4: using a spatula, mix well until fully combined.
step-5: cover the dough with plastic and chill in the fridge at least 30 minutes to overnight
step-6: grease a 6-cup muffin tin with nonstick spray.
step-7: divide the cookie dough into 12 portions.
step-8: take one and line the base and sides of a cup.
step-9: repeat with the remaining cups.
step-10: fill each cookie cup with a chocolate truffle.
step-11: take another portion of cookie dough, flatten with your fingers to create a 2-inch (5-cm) circle.
step-12: place the circle over the top of the filling, and press down the edges to make sure it seals to the other dough.
step-13: repeat with the remaining cookies.
step-14: chill in the fridge for 30 minutes.
step-15: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-16: bake for 15 minutes or until the edges are golden brown.
step-17: remove from the oven until cool to the touch, for 5 minutes.

step-1: mix together egg white, honey, and vanilla extract in a greased coffee mug.
step-2: add oat flour and baking powder and mix until combined.
step-3: add in chocolate chips.
step-4: microwave on high for 90 seconds (times may vary).

step-1: line an 8-inch (20 cm) square baking dish with parchment paper.
step-2: add the peanuts, dates, chocolate chips, salt, milk, and vanilla to a food processor and pulse until the mixture starts to clump together.
step-3: transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish and press into an even layer.
step-4: drizzle the top with melted chocolate, if desired.
step-5: chill for 1 hour.
step-6: remove the bars from the baking dish by lifting the parchment paper.
step-7: cut into 12 individual bars.
step-8: serve immediately or store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.

step-1: preheat oven to 325°f (160°c).
step-2: press ⅔ of the cookie dough into the bottom and up the sides of a small skillet or a small cake pan.
step-3: place the chocolate chunks in the middle of the cookie dough, then place the other flattened ⅓ of the cookie dough on top.
step-4: crimp the edges of the dough together to seal in the chocolate.
step-5: bake for 35-40 minutes.
step-6: serve warm with ice cream and caramel sauce.

step-1: in a large bowl mix together coconut, sugar, salt, vanilla, and condensed milk.
step-2: if the mixture is too dry add additional milk until it all just comes together.
step-3: roll the mixture into 1-inch (2.5 cm) balls and place on a wax paper lined baking sheet.
step-4: freeze for 15 minutes.
step-5: break apart chocolate bars and add to a microwave safe bowl.
step-6: microwave chocolate for 75 seconds, stopping every 30 seconds to check and stir.
step-7: remove the coconut balls from the freezer and individually roll in melted chocolate to coat.
step-8: place back on a wax paper lined tray and sprinkle with additional coconut and top with an almond (optional).

step-1: combine shredded coconut, coconut cream, maple syrup, and a pinch of salt to a food processor and blend until mixture becomes easily moldable.
step-2: you may have to press down the mixture and reblend a few times for this to happen.
step-3: pour mixture into an 8x8-inch (20x20-cm) pan lined with parchment or wax paper.
step-4: press down firmly with a rubber spatula and smooth mixture into an even layer.
step-5: freeze for 30 minutes.
step-6: prepare chocolate layer by combining dark chocolate chips and coconut cream in a bowl.
step-7: microwave in 15-second intervals, stirring mixture thoroughly in between.
step-8: pour chocolate mixture on top of the coconut cream layer and spread into an even layer with a rubber spatula.
step-9: sprinkle shredded coconut on top.
step-10: freeze for 1 hour, or until chocolate layer has set.
step-11: cut into 16 squares.

step-1: cut the bananas in half horizontally.
step-2: insert popsicle sticks in the middle of the banana halves.
step-3: transfer bananas to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, and freeze until solid.
step-4: in a tall glass or mixing cup, add chocolate and coconut oil.
step-5: microwave in 30-second intervals for 1 minute and a half, and mix until smooth.
step-6: place coconut onto a plate.
step-7: dip the bananas into the chocolate coating, then roll or sprinkle on toppings.
step-8: place bananas in freezer until the coating has hardened.

step-1: place the coconut milk, cocoa powder, and honey in a blender and blend until the mixture is smooth.
step-2: pour the coconut mixture into popsicle molds filled almost to the brim.
step-3: freeze the popsicles for at least 4 hours.
step-4: unmold the popsicles.

step-1: preheat oven to 350℉ (175˚c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper and grease with nonstick spray.
step-3: in a medium bowl, sift together the flour, cinnamon, salt, baking soda, and cocoa powder.
step-4: whisk to combine.
step-5: in a large bowl, cream together the butter and brown sugar with an electric hand mixer until fluffy.
step-6: add the eggs, 1 at a time, beating to incorporate each addition before adding the next.
step-7: add the vanilla and beat to combine.
step-8: add ½ of the flour mixture to the butter mixture and beat on low speed to incorporate.
step-9: add ½ of the coconut milk and beat again.
step-10: add the remaining flour, then the remaining coconut milk, and beat until fully incorporated.
step-11: pour the cake batter onto the prepared baking sheet and spread in an even layer.
step-12: bake for 20–25 minutes, or until the center is set and edges begin to pull away from the pan.
step-13: let cool completely.
step-14: once the cake is cooled, scoop the chocolate frosting on top and spread in an even layer.
step-15: sprinkle the shredded coconut on top.
step-16: slice and serve.

step-1: in a blender, combine the banana, oats, peanut butter, cocoa powder, shredded coconut, maple syrup, vanilla, and milk.
step-2: blend on high speed for 3 minutes, or until completely smooth.
step-3: transfer the chocolate coconut mixture to a small saucepan and heat over medium-low heat until just warmed through.
step-4: do not boil.
step-5: pour into a mug and serve immediately.
step-6: nutrition - chocolate coconut - calories: 946, total fat: 73 grams, sodium: 134 mg, total carbs: 70 grams, dietary fiber: 7 grams, sugars: 23 grams, protein: 16 grams

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: grease a rimmed baking sheet with nonstick spray.
step-3: combine the melted butter and 3 cups (600 g) of sugar in a large bowl and whisk to combine.
step-4: let sit for a minute to cool before adding the eggs, to avoid cooking them, then add 6 eggs and 2 tablespoons of vanilla and whisk to combine.
step-5: sift in the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
step-6: whisk until just combined.
step-7: use a spatula to fold in the chocolate chips.
step-8: pour the batter onto the prepared baking sheet, spreading to the edges with a spatula.
step-9: bake for 25 minutes, or until brownies appear be nearly fully cooked.
step-10: while the brownies are beginning to bake, beat together the cream cheese and the remaining sugar in a medium bowl with an electric hand mixer until there are no lumps.
step-11: add the remaining egg and remaining teaspoon of vanilla, beating until evenly combined.
step-12: after 25 minutes, remove the brownies from the oven and use the bottom of a ¼-cup (60 ml) measuring cup to make 24 evenly spaced indentations in the brownies.
step-13: carefully fill the indentations with cheesecake filling.
step-14: top each with a chocolate sandwich cookie.
step-15: return to the oven for 15 more minutes, until the cheesecake filling is set.
step-16: let cool, then cut into squares and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: crush cookies into crumbs, setting aside some crumbs for garnish.
step-3: add crushed cookies into a bowl and mix with melted butter.
step-4: pour crumbs into pie dish and pat down to form a crust.
step-5: bake crust for 5 minutes or until set.
step-6: in a bowl mix the cream cheese and peanut butter until smooth.
step-7: add in the whipped cream and powdered sugar, mix again until smooth.
step-8: pour mixture over crust and smooth out the top.
step-9: refrigerate or freeze until set, about 1 hour.
step-10: sprinkle the top with remaining cookie crumbs.
step-11: slice and serve.

step-1: in a plastic bag, crush the graham crackers finely with the back of a large pot or pan.
step-2: in a large bowl, combine graham crackers, ¼ cup (40g) confectioners’ sugar, salt, and melted butter, stirring until the mixture is the texture of wet sand.
step-3: dump the graham cracker mixture into a 9×9 inch (23 x 23 cm) baking dish lined with parchment paper.
step-4: press the mixture down with your hands to create an even layer.
step-5: freeze for 10 minutes.
step-6: in a separate bowl, combine cream cheese, 1 cup (160g) confectioner’s sugar, and vanilla, stirring until smooth.
step-7: spread the cream cheese mixture evenly on top of the graham cracker crust.
step-8: freeze for one hour.
step-9: transfer the frozen cheesecake onto a cutting board, peeling away the parchment paper.
step-10: slice 1-centimeter-wide (¹⁄₆₄ in) strips horizontally, then vertically, creating little cheesecake cubes.
step-11: in a medium bowl, microwave the chocolate in 20-second intervals, stirring in between, until melted and smooth.
step-12: dip the cheesecake cubes in the chocolate, dripping off excess, and set them on a tray lined with parchment paper.
step-13: repeat with the remaining cubes.
step-14: freeze for 15 minutes, then serve!

step-1: to make striped strawberries, melt 1 tablespoon of coconut oil with chocolate chips, repeat with the white chocolate chips.
step-2: insert toothpick into the top of a strawberry.
step-3: coat strawberry entirely in chocolate, alternating between white and dark.
step-4: chill strawberries for about 15 minutes or until hardened.
step-5: for white chocolate strawberries drizzle dark chocolate over the top in a quick back and forth motion.
step-6: for dark chocolate strawberries, do the same with white chocolate drizzle.
step-7: chill once more for 15 minutes or until hardened.
step-8: to make peanut strawberries.
step-9: melt 1 tablespoon of coconut oil with the chocolate chips, repeat with the white chocolate chips.
step-10: insert toothpick into the top of a strawberry.
step-11: put peanuts in a bag and smash with rolling pin or cast-iron pan until they are crumbly.
step-12: coat strawberry entirely in chocolate, alternating between white and dark.
step-13: dip strawberry, while the chocolate is still warm, into a bowl of nuts.
step-14: chill once more for 15 minutes or until hardened.
step-15: to make cookie-coated strawberries.
step-16: melt 1 tablespoon of coconut oil with the chocolate chips, repeat with the white chocolate chips.
step-17: insert toothpick into the top of a strawberry.
step-18: separate chocolate sandwich cookies in a bag and smash with rolling pin or cast iron pan until they are crumbly.
step-19: coat strawberry entirely in chocolate, alternating between white and dark.
step-20: dip strawberry, while the chocolate is still warm, into a bowl of cookie crumbs.
step-21: chill once more for 15 minutes or until hardened.
step-22: to make tuxedo strawberries.
step-23: melt 1 tablespoon of coconut oil with the chocolate chips, repeat with the white chocolate chips.
step-24: insert toothpick into the top of a strawberry.
step-25: coat strawberries entirely in white chocolate.
step-26: chill strawberries for about 15 minutes or until hardened.
step-27: to form the tuxedo, dip one side of the white chocolate coated strawberry into dark chocolate at an angle, going to the top of white chocolate coating.
step-28: repeat on the other side, leaving a white “v” in the center of the strawberry.
step-29: with a toothpick, draw a bowtie and buttons with remaining melted dark chocolate.
step-30: chill once more for 15 minutes or until hardened.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, prepare the cake batter.
step-3: divide the batter evenly among a lined muffin tin, filling halfway.
step-4: finely chop 8 of the strawberries.
step-5: spoon them evenly on top of the batter.
step-6: top with remaining batter, filling about ¾ of the way up.
step-7: bake for 20 minutes, then cool.
step-8: in a small bowl, microwave the chocolate chips in 20-second intervals, stirring in between, until the chocolate is melted and smooth.
step-9: dip the strawberries in the chocolate, then chill.
step-10: pipe the frosting onto each cupcake, then top with a chocolate-covered strawberry.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350ºf (175ºc).
step-2: open 2 prepackaged mini croissant rolls and chop them into 2 cm (1 inch) balls.
step-3: spray a medium-large baking pan with cooking spray and place the balls in the pan.
step-4: sprinkle the chocolate chips evenly over the dough.
step-5: in a large bowl, whisk cream cheese until smooth and creamy, then add the sugar, eggs, and vanilla and whisk together until smooth.
step-6: slowly the add milk to loosen the mixture without curdling the cream cheese.
step-7: pour the cream cheese mixture evenly over the dough, then let sit for 20 minutes (optional).
step-8: bake for 45-50 minutes, or until the middle is cooked through.
step-9: let cool for 10 minutes before serving
step-10: garnish with a nice scoop of vanilla ice cream.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (175˚c)
step-2: cut biscuits in half and cube the cream cheese (32 pieces).
step-3: flatten each biscuit and place one cube of cream cheese and a few chocolate chips in the center of each.
step-4: fold the biscuit dough around the cream cheese and chocolate and form into a ball.
step-5: in a large plastic bag combine white sugar and cinnamon.
step-6: add 6-8 dough balls to the bag, seal the bag, and shake until well coated.
step-7: repeat for the remainder of the stuffed dough pieces.
step-8: in a microwave safe bowl add brown sugar and butter.
step-9: microwave on high for 70 seconds - stopping halfway to stir.
step-10: remove from microwave and stir until it reaches a caramel consistency.
step-11: in a greased bundt pan, sprinkle half of the walnuts, half the dough pieces, and drizzle half the caramel glaze.
step-12: repeat with remaining walnuts, dough, and glaze.
step-13: bake for 30-35 minutes.
step-14: remove from oven and turn upside down onto a plate to cool for 10 minutes before lifting off the pan (this way the warm glaze runs back through and fully coats all the bread)

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (175°c).
step-2: place crackers on a greased, parchment paper-lined baking sheet so that the entire surface is covered.
step-3: in a saucepan, melt butter on low heat.
step-4: once melted, add brown sugar and turn heat to medium.
step-5: continue stirring until boiling, then boil for 3 minutes.
step-6: pour the caramel over the crackers, spreading evenly with a spatula.
step-7: bake for 5 minutes.
step-8: pour the chocolate chips over the crackers and cover with tin foil for 3 minutes.
step-9: remove the foil and spread the softened chocolate over the top evenly.
step-10: sprinkle with pecans, cover with foil, and freeze for 1 hour.
step-11: break the bark up into pieces.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: line a muffin tin with liners and cooking spray.
step-3: prepare cake mix according to its directions.
step-4: fill liners about ¾ of the way up with the cupcake batter.
step-5: bake for about 20-25 minutes.
step-6: a toothpick should come out dry when inserted.
step-7: allow the cupcakes to cool completely.
step-8: in a large bowl, combine the ricotta, mascarpone, powdered sugar, and vanilla.
step-9: mix until well combined.
step-10: fold in the mini chocolate chips.
step-11: cut a ½ inch (1.5cm) hole on the tip of a pastry or zip top bag and fill with the cannoli cream.
step-12: cut a circle in the center of each cupcake and press the center down into the bottom, creating a hole.
step-13: fill the cupcake with cannoli cream and use a spiraling motion to create a swirl of the cream on top of the cupcake.
step-14: put the cupcakes in the freezer for about 1 hour or until firm.
step-15: melt the dark chocolate and coconut oil together.
step-16: carefully, dip the tops of the cupcakes into the melted chocolate.
step-17: place in the refrigerator to firm up if need be.

step-1: make the taco shells: in a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs and sugar until combined.
step-2: add the milk, vanilla, and butter, and whisk until fully incorporated.
step-3: sift in the flour and cocoa powder.
step-4: whisk until smooth.
step-5: heat a small non-stick pan over medium-low heat, then add ⅓ cup (95 g) of batter at a time and tilt the pan to spread the batter evenly like a crepe.
step-6: cook until bubbles appear on the surface and the batter is set, about 6-8 minutes.
step-7: flip the taco shell and cook on other side for another 3-4 minutes, until cooked through.
step-8: if desired, remove the taco shell from pan and place on a grated cooling rack while still hot.
step-9: place a sheet of parchment over the shell and press into the rack, allowing the grate marks to set into the shell.
step-10: rotate the shell 90 degrees and press the cone into the grates again for a waffled look.
step-11: or, skip to the next step.
step-12: place the taco shells between the cups of an inverted muffin tin to form their shape.
step-13: let set for about 10 minutes, then freeze for 20 minutes to harden.
step-14: make the magic shell: combine the chocolate and coconut oil in a medium bowl and microwave for 2 minutes, stirring every 30 seconds until melted and shiny.
step-15: remove the taco shells from the freezer and use a spoon to coat the inside of each taco shell with melted magic shell.
step-16: return to the freezer for 20 minutes, until the magic shell hardens.
step-17: reserve the leftover magic shell.
step-18: add the ice cream to a piping bag fitted with a round tip or a zip-top bag with the corner cut off.
step-19: remove the shells from the freezer and pipe in the ice cream, filling the tacos.
step-20: smooth out the tops with a knife or rubber spatula.
step-21: freeze for 2 hours.
step-22: microwave the reserved magic shell, if needed, to re-melt.
step-23: remove the tacos from the freezer and dip the tops of each taco in the magic shell, then immediately sprinkle with the crushed peanuts.
step-24: serve immediately or return to the freezer until ready to eat.

step-1: peel orange into slices and insert lollipop sticks.
step-2: melt chocolate chips in microwave at 30-second intervals until the chocolate is easy to stir.
step-3: dip orange slices halfway in chocolate, and then in each topping of your choice.
step-4: if needed, chill oranges in the freezer for 5 minutes to help harden the chocolate.
step-5: *additional oranges can be used to increase serving size

step-1: in a large bowl, whip the cream until soft peaks form.
step-2: add the condensed milk and cocoa powder, then whip until smooth.
step-3: drizzle the dulce de leche on top.
step-4: carefully swirl in the dulce de leche, making sure it is not blended into the cream.
step-5: transfer the mixture to a baking pan or bowl, then freeze.
step-6: serve with more dulce de leche.

step-1: line 2 espresso cups or 2 small ramekins with softened butter followed by cocoa powder.
step-2: ensure all sides are coated with the cocoa as this will stabilise the sides of the soufflé when it rises.
step-3: in a large bowl, stir together the melted butter and melted chocolate until fully combined and smooth.
step-4: stir in the espresso powder, followed by the water.
step-5: stir in the egg yolk.
step-6: add in icing sugar.
step-7: stir until combined and smooth.
step-8: in a separate bowl, whisk the egg white until soft peaks form.
step-9: gradually add the caster sugar and whisk until stiff peaks form and they become glossy.
step-10: fold 2 tablespoons of the whipped egg whites into the chocolate mixture and fold until fully incorporated.
step-11: gradually fold in the remaining whipped egg whites.
step-12: be careful not to over stir, as this will knock the air out, which will stop the soufflé from rising to its full potential!
step-13: quickly pour the mixture into the prepared espresso cups or ramekins.
step-14: using a knife, carefully pull across the top of each soufflé so that the top is completely flat.
step-15: neaten the edges of the cups by running your thumb around the rim of the cup.
step-16: this will help the soufflé to rise straight.
step-17: chill the soufflés in the fridge for 30 minutes (optional) and then preheat the oven to 200°c (400°f).
step-18: bake for 15 minutes.
step-19: dust with a little cocoa powder and serve immediately.

step-1: preheat the oven to 300°f (150°c).
step-2: if your bananas aren’t already very ripe, place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-3: bake for 15-20 minutes, until they are nearly black.
step-4: be careful to not overcook or the bananas will leak.
step-5: let the bananas cool to room temperature.
step-6: increase the oven temperature to 350°f (180°c).
step-7: peel the bananas, then place them in a large bowl.
step-8: mash bananas using a hand mixer or fork.
step-9: add the egg, vegetable oil, sugar, milk, and vanilla.
step-10: beat until combined.
step-11: sift the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt into the banana mixture.
step-12: beat until just combined, being careful to not overmix.
step-13: use a rubber spatula to gently fold the chocolate sprinkles into the batter.
step-14: grease a 12-cup muffin tin with nonstick spray.
step-15: divide the batter among the cups.
step-16: bake for 20-25 minutes, until the tops are lightly browned and a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean.
step-17: place the chocolate chips in a heatproof liquid measuring cup.
step-18: pour over the hot heavy cream.
step-19: let sit for 1 minute, then stir until the chocolate is melted and smooth.
step-20: while the muffins are still warm, use the back of a wooden spoon to push down a hole into the center of each muffin.
step-21: allow to cool to room temperature.
step-22: fill the muffins with the chocolate ganache.
step-23: chill the muffins in the fridge for at least 1 hour, until the center has set.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, mash the bananas with a fork.
step-3: add in the oil, egg, sugar, and vanilla.
step-4: stir until combined.
step-5: add in the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon.
step-6: stir until just combined.
step-7: pour the banana bread batter into a greased loaf pan.
step-8: bake for 45-55 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean.
step-9: in a small saucepan, combine the cream milk and chocolate, and melt over low heat.
step-10: add the vanilla and stir to combine.
step-11: remove from heat, and cover with a lid.
step-12: let the banana bread cool in the pan for 30 minutes, then remove from the loaf pan and place on a serving dish.
step-13: using a knife cut a rectangle out of the top center of the loaf, leaving a 2- to 3-inch (5 cm to 7cm) perimeter of banana bread, making sure to not slice through the bread.
step-14: cut the rectangle into 2-inch (5-cm) slices.
step-15: gently pull out each slice one at a time.
step-16: press the crumbs into the base of the cut out bread.
step-17: reheat the chocolate if needed then pour the chocolate into the banana bread boat.
step-18: place sliced bananas, strawberries, and the inside of the banana bread around the fondue boat.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: on a large cutting board cut out 3 evenly spaced squares roughly half the width and ⅙ the length of the bread loaf.
step-3: take the 3 bread cut outs and slice them into 6 strips each.
step-4: on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet place bread and cut out bread strips.
step-5: combine butter and sugar and brush onto loaf.
step-6: add cinnamon to the sugar butter mixture and brush onto strips.
step-7: bake for 25 minutes removing the cinnamon toast strips after 10 minutes.
step-8: in a small saucepan combine dark chocolate and 1 ¼ cup (295 ml) heavy cream and stir until fully incorporated.
step-9: in a small saucepan combine milk chocolate and 1 cup heavy (235 ml) cream and stir until fully incorporated.
step-10: in a small saucepan combine white chocolate and remaining heavy cream and stir until fully incorporated.
step-11: place loaf on serving tray and fill each hole with one of the three fondues.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: prepare the brownie batter and pour into greased springform pan.
step-3: bake until set, about 20-25 minutes.
step-4: meanwhile, beat the cream cheese and sugar until incorporated.
step-5: add beaten eggs and vanilla, and beat again until smooth.
step-6: remove brownies and lower oven temperature to 325˚f (165˚c).
step-7: pour cheesecake batter over brownie bottom, and bake for 50 minutes until set and slightly jiggly.
step-8: remove cheesecake and refrigerate for 4 hours, or overnight.
step-9: heat or microwave whipping cream to just before boiling and pour over chocolate chips.
step-10: stir continuously until the chocolate is melted and smooth.
step-11: allow the ganache to sit for 10-15 minutes.
step-12: transfer cheesecake to a baking pan with a wire rack.
step-13: in a circular motion starting from the inside out, pour the ganache glaze over the cheesecake making sure to cover all sides.
step-14: allow ganache to cool and set for 30 minutes.

step-1: in a medium bowl, whisk the flour, cocoa powder, granulated sugar, baking powder, salt, vanilla, egg, and oil until smooth.
step-2: add the chocolate cake batter to a mini frying pan over low heat, and spread to smooth the top.
step-3: cover with a small plate and cook for 30 minutes, or until the cake is set.
step-4: serve with powdered sugar and berries (optional).

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, combine brownie mix, egg, oil, and water until creamy.
step-3: pour the brownie batter into a parchment-lined springform pan.
step-4: bake for 25-30 minutes, until center no longer wobbles.
step-5: leave the brownie base in the pan to cool completely.
step-6: whip the heavy cream until it makes soft peaks.
step-7: set aside.
step-8: pour water into a saucepan about half-full, and bring to a gentle simmer.
step-9: place a heat-safe bowl over the pot.
step-10: note: the bowl should be bigger than the saucepan so that the bottom of the bowl doesn’t come in contact with the simmering water.
step-11: add the chocolate pieces to the bowl and stir frequently until smooth.
step-12: set aside.
step-13: (be careful – the bowl may be hot.)
step-14: note: make sure the water isn’t boiling, or you can burn the chocolate.
step-15: separate the eggs and beat the egg whites until blended.
step-16: in a second heat-safe bowl, whisk the egg yolks until blended.
step-17: just like with the chocolate, place the bowl with the egg mixture on top of the gently simmering water, whisking heavily for about 2 minutes until it has a lighter color and a creamy texture.
step-18: set aside.
step-19: whisk granulated sugar into the egg mixture.
step-20: slowly stir in the melted chocolate.
step-21: carefully fold in the egg whites and the whipped cream until blended.
step-22: spread the chocolate mousse over the cooled brownie base in the springform pan.
step-23: in a glass bowl, microwave the white chocolate in 15-second increments and stir until melted.
step-24: pour the white chocolate into a plastic bag.
step-25: cut off the tip of one of the bag's corners.
step-26: drizzle white chocolate all over the cake.
step-27: using a toothpick or skewer, swirl white chocolate into the mousse in small circular motions to make a marbled pattern.
step-28: freeze overnight, or at least 6-8 hours.

step-1: in one large bowl, melt the dark chocolate.
step-2: keep warm and set aside.
step-3: in two bowls, melt the white chocolate, one bag per bowl.
step-4: add blue food gel to one bowl and purple food gel to another until you get the desired color.
step-5: keep warm and set aside while you prepare your baking sheet.
step-6: line the baking sheet, pour the dark chocolate, use a spatula to spread out to desired thickness.
step-7: use a knife or skewer and swirl the chocolate around until you get the desired look.
step-8: pour the blue dyed chocolate over the dark chocolate, then the purple dyed chocolate.
step-9: again, use a knife or skewer and swirl the chocolate around until you get the desired look.
step-10: sprinkle with star sprinkles.
step-11: set chocolate for at least two hours.
step-12: break apart.

step-1: sift the sugar, cocoa powder, flour, and salt into a large skillet or saucepan.
step-2: add the milk and whisk to combine.
step-3: cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, until slightly thickened, 7-10 minutes.
step-4: remove from the heat.
step-5: stir in the vanilla and butter until the butter is melted and well incorporated.
step-6: serve immediately over buttermilk biscuits, pound cake, ice cream, or as a dip for your favorite fruit.

step-1: note: if you have unroasted nuts, preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: spread hazelnuts onto a baking tray and bake for 10-12 minutes or until you can smell them.
step-3: in a food processor, blend roasted hazelnuts.
step-4: scrape down the sides when necessary.
step-5: once the hazelnuts have broken down and become crumbly, add unsweetened cocoa powder, maple syrup, and vanilla extract.
step-6: blend again and slowly add canola oil while still mixing.
step-7: add more canola oil if you want a creamier texture.
step-8: pour into a jar, store in a refrigerator and use within one month.

step-1: in a saucepan, combine water, sugar and canola (or rapeseed) oil.
step-2: bring to a boil then remove from heat.
step-3: add the flour and stir vigorously until mixture forms a smooth paste.
step-4: (make sure you beat out all bubbles.)
step-5: add the eggs and stir until mixture becomes smooth.
step-6: spoon the dough into a piping bag with a star-shaped tip.
step-7: note: really push the mixture down in the bag to eliminate air bubbles!
step-8: pipe strips onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-9: place in freezer for 45 minutes.
step-10: heat oil in a large pot to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-11: fry the churros until golden brown, then drain on paper towels.
step-12: using a straw, poke a hole through each churro to create room for the filling.
step-13: immediately sprinkle with a bit of cinnamon and sugar.
step-14: spoon chocolate hazelnut spread into a piping bag.
step-15: pipe filling into churros.

step-1: in a 12-ounce (375 ml) mug or larger, mix all ingredients (except the chocolate hazelnut spread) until just combined.
step-2: once combined, spoon the chocolate hazelnut spread on top of the batter.
step-3: microwave on high for 90 seconds to 2 minutes, watching to make sure it doesn’t spill over (depending on the size of the mug).
step-4: let cool one minute before eating.
step-5: top with additional chocolate hazelnut spread and powdered sugar (optional).

step-1: in a medium mixing bowl, whisk together ¾ cup (225 g) chocolate hazelnut spread and the eggs.
step-2: fold in the flour.
step-3: evenly distribute into two mugs.
step-4: microwave each mug for 2 minutes.
step-5: cool for 5 minutes.
step-6: frost with remaining chocolate hazelnut spread and serve warm.

step-1: use a spatula to spread the chocolate hazelnut spread evenly over 1 puff pastry sheet, leaving a ¼-inch (6 mm) border all around.
step-2: brush the border with egg wash.
step-3: place the other sheet of puff pastry on top.
step-4: cut the pastry sheets into 9 squares.
step-5: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-6: grease a baking sheet with nonstick spray.
step-7: take 1 square and make 5 even cuts crosswise across the center.
step-8: do not cut all the way through the edges.
step-9: take 2 fingers and place them under the first cut, then over the next.
step-10: repeat until your fingers reach all the way through the square.
step-11: use the other hand to feed the farthest corner through the gap your fingers created.
step-12: gently pull the corner all the way through to form a braid.
step-13: repeat with the rest of the squares.
step-14: transfer the braids to the prepared baking sheet and brush with egg wash.
step-15: bake for 14 minutes, or until golden brown.

step-1: fill a food processor with heavy cream, condensed milk, and unsweetened cocoa powder.
step-2: close the top and blend for 15 seconds.
step-3: use a funnel or carefully pour the ice cream mixture into a large squeeze bottle and tighten the lid.
step-4: layout a large thick cloth on top of your cooking area to protect the surface from the liquid nitrogen’s low temperature.
step-5: using insulated gloves, fill a stainless steel bowl with liquid nitrogen and set it on top of the thick insulated cloth.
step-6: use the squeeze bottle to squeeze the mix at a constant drip into the liquid nitrogen.
step-7: fill the bowl with droplets and allow the liquid nitrogen to boil off.
step-8: once all the liquid has boiled over from the bottom, serve.

step-1: pre-heat the oven to 150°c (300°f).
step-2: gently melt the chocolate and butter together over a bain-marie.
step-3: once combined, take off the heat.
step-4: stir in the eggs, egg yolks and sugar.
step-5: fold in the flour.
step-6: pour into the tart shell.
step-7: bake for 15 minutes.
step-8: meanwhile, prepare the meringue by whisking the egg whites with an electric hand whisk.
step-9: once foamy, gradually add in the sugar, followed by the vanilla and vinegar.
step-10: whisk until stiff peaks form.
step-11: gently fold in the cocoa powder.
step-12: spoon on top of the chocolate tart.
step-13: bake for 30 minutes.
step-14: cut into slices and serve.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the heavy cream and the sugar, beating with an electric mixer until soft peaks form when lifted from the bowl.
step-2: set aside two large spoonfuls of the whipped cream to garnish with at the end.
step-3: whisk the chocolate and hot cream in a separate bowl until smooth, then fold in the mixture into the cream with a spatula until no streaks remain.
step-4: split the chocolate cream mixture evenly between two martini glasses or your serving dish of choice, then chill for at least 1 hour.
step-5: garnish with a spoonful of whipped cream, raspberries, mint, and the chocolate cookie.

step-1: preheat oven to 300˚f (150˚c).
step-2: place cookies in plastic bag and crush them into a fine crumb using a rolling pin.
step-3: alternatively, a food processor can be used to crush the cookies.
step-4: pour the cookie crumbs into a medium bowl with the melted butter and brown sugar.
step-5: mix until the crumbs take on the character of a coarse, wet sand.
step-6: pour the crumbs into a 9-inch (23 cm) spring pan.
step-7: press the crumb firmly into the pan, making sure to coat the bottom evenly.
step-8: once the crust has been formed, place it in the refrigerator to firm up.
step-9: add cream cheese, melted chocolate, cocoa powder, and sugar to a large bowl and whisk, either by hand or with an electric mixer, until all the ingredients are incorporated.
step-10: note: if mixing by hand, it is recommended to microwave the cream cheese slightly before whisking in order to soften it up.
step-11: add vanilla extract and eggs, and continue to whisk until mixture is smooth and glossy.
step-12: in a separate bowl, combine heavy cream and powdered sugar.
step-13: whisk until the cream develops a mousse-y texture and soft peaks form.
step-14: adding a small amount at a time, carefully fold in the whipped cream into the cream cheese batter, being careful not to let the air out of the fluffy mixture.
step-15: fold just until incorporated.
step-16: once combined, pour the batter over the prepared cookie crust inside the springform pan.
step-17: use a spatula to smooth out the top.
step-18: give the pan a slight jiggle to release any large air bubbles that may be trapped in the batter.
step-19: place the filled pan on top of a sheet of aluminium foil and fold the foil up the sides on the outside of the pan.
step-20: then place the wrapped pan into a larger baking pan or dish lined with 2 paper towels at the bottom.
step-21: note: the aluminium foil will keep water from seeping into the bottom of the pan and the paper towels ensure that the heat is distributed evenly along the bottom of the pan.
step-22: fill the larger pan with about 1 inch (2 ½ cm) of hot water.
step-23: bake at 300˚f (150˚c) for 60-70 minutes--checking every 15-20 minutes to add more hot water to the larger dish, as necessary.
step-24: once out of the oven, immediately run a small sharp knife around the outside of the cheesecake to release it from the pan.
step-25: allow the cheesecake to cool completely before removing it from the pan.
step-26: prepare the ganache by combining chocolate chips with hot cream.
step-27: stir until chocolate is completely melted and ganache is smooth and glossy.
step-28: pour ganache evenly over the cooled cheesecake.
step-29: refrigerate the ganache covered cake for 30 minutes before cutting and serving.

step-1: lay the puff pastry out on a lightly floured surface and roll out to a 12-inch by 14-inch (30 cm by 35 cm) rectangle.
step-2: use a spatula to spread the chocolate hazelnut spread over the pastry, leaving a ¼-inch (6 mm) border of uncovered pastry.
step-3: roll each side of the sheet inward to meet in the middle.
step-4: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-5: grease a baking sheet with nonstick spray.
step-6: use a sharp knife to cut the roll into fourteen ¼-inch (6 mm) thick slices.
step-7: transfer to the prepared baking sheet and brush with egg wash.
step-8: bake for 12 minutes, or until golden brown.

step-1: in a large bowl, mix together yolks and sugar, while still whisking, add milk
step-2: carefully fold in whipped egg whites.
step-3: note: it's better to use a spoon rather than a whisk.
step-4: add and mix the melted butter and the vanilla.
step-5: in another large bowl, mix the sieved flour, cocoa powder, and the baking powder.
step-6: form a little well in the middle and pour the milk and eggs mixture.
step-7: stir until the batter is smooth.
step-8: mix in the chopped chocolate.
step-9: let the batter sit for 15-20 minutes.
step-10: to make the ganache, in a small saucepan, heat the heavy cream, without letting it boil.
step-11: take off the heat, mix with the chocolate chips until perfectly smooth.
step-12: over low to medium heat, pour ¼ cup (60 ml) of pancake batter on a well-oiled pan.
step-13: when bubbles start to form on the surface of the pancake, flip and cook it for a minute on the other side.
step-14: when the pancakes are ready, pour the chocolate ganache on top.
step-15: note: if the ganache has hardened while you were making the pancakes, you can microwave it for 15-20 seconds.
step-16: garnish with raspberries.

step-1: cut bananas into coins and place in freezer in a sealable bag.
step-2: freeze overnight or until solid.
step-3: place all ingredients into a food processor or blender and blend until smooth.
step-4: pour contents into a loaf or small pan.
step-5: freeze one hour or until solid.

step-1: melt peanut butter and honey together in the microwave, stirring every 15 seconds.
step-2: add cereal into the bowl and mix until fully coated.
step-3: let the mixture cool to room temperature.
step-4: add mini chocolate chips and mix just until combined.
step-5: line a baking dish with parchment paper and pour the cooled mixture into the pan.
step-6: press into the edges of the pan and top with more mini chocolate chips.
step-7: cool in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours.
step-8: cut and serve.

step-1: prepare brownie mix according to box instructions.
step-2: in a medium mixing bowl, combine together the peanut butter, powdered sugar, and melted butter.
step-3: distribute scoops of the peanut butter mixture on top of the brownie and flatten the mixture to achieve an even layer.
step-4: in a small bowl, combine the milk chocolate chips and butter.
step-5: microwave at 15-second intervals until melted, stirring after each interval.
step-6: pour the chocolate mixture on top of the brownies, then evenly spread to achieve a flat, even layer.
step-7: chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-8: slice and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, prepare the cake batter.
step-3: divide the batter evenly among a lined muffin tin, filling halfway.
step-4: place a peanut butter cup in each, then top with remaining batter, filling about ¾ of the way up.
step-5: bake for 20 minutes, then cool.
step-6: in a separate bowl, combine peanut butter and vanilla frosting, stirring until smooth.
step-7: then halve the remaining peanut butter cups.
step-8: pipe the frosting onto each cupcake, then top with the peanut butter cup halves.

step-1: add the angel food cake mix and chocolate cake mix to a jar.
step-2: place a cupcake liner over the cake mix and add the peanut butter chips and chocolate chips.
step-3: cover with the lid.
step-4: store in the pantry for up to 3 months.
step-5: when ready to eat, remove the lid and cupcake liner with the chips from the jar.
step-6: pour the water into the dry cake mix.
step-7: mix thoroughly, making sure to scrape the dry mix from the bottom of the jar.
step-8: microwave for 20 seconds.
step-9: pour the peanut butter and chocolate chips into the jar.
step-10: stir the chips into the cake gently, being careful not to push them to the bottom because they will naturally sink into the cake while cooking.
step-11: microwave for another 40 seconds, until cooked through.
step-12: top with whipped cream, chocolate syrup, and peanut butter chips, if desired.
step-13: serve immediately.

step-1: in a microwave-safe bowl, combine the dark chocolate and 5 tablespoons of coconut oil.
step-2: microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until melted.
step-3: add the vanilla and cbd oil and stir until combined.
step-4: the mixture should be smooth and pourable.
step-5: pour ½ of the chocolate mixture into the molds, enough to come about ⅓ of the way up the sides of each cup.
step-6: freeze for 15 minutes.
step-7: in a separate microwave-safe bowl, combine the peanut butter, honey, and remaining 2 tablespoons coconut oil.
step-8: microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until smooth and pourable.
step-9: pour the peanut butter mixture evenly over the chocolate layers in the molds.
step-10: make sure to leave enough room for the second layer of chocolate.
step-11: freeze for 10 minutes.
step-12: pour the remaining chocolate mixture evenly over the peanut butter layers in the molds, filling completely to the rim of each.
step-13: wipe off any excess that spills over the edges.
step-14: if desired, sprinkle the cups with hemp hearts for added crunch.
step-15: freeze for 1 hour, until set, then pop out of the molds.
step-16: the cups will keep in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 month.

step-1: add the oats, nut butter, banana, milk, and cocoa powder to a blender.
step-2: blend for 30 seconds.
step-3: scrape down the sides with a spoon or spatula, if needed, and blend for another 30 seconds.
step-4: pour into a mason jar or tumbler.
step-5: garnish with banana slices and additional oats, if desired.
step-6: refrigerate until ready to serve.

step-1: preheat your oven to 325°f (160°c).
step-2: combine the cookie dough, chocolate candies, and peanut butter cups until evenly distributed.
step-3: using an ice cream scoop, place 6 scoops of dough on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-4: bake for 14 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a bowl, beat cream cheese, sugar, and flour until smooth.
step-3: add eggs and mix until combined.
step-4: fold in melted chocolate and vanilla extract.
step-5: line a muffin tin with muffin liners.
step-6: place a peanut butter cup upside down in each cup.
step-7: fill cups ¾-full with cheesecake mixture.
step-8: bake 20 minutes, cool completely, and refrigerate for 3 hours.

step-1: cut the bananas in half horizontally.
step-2: insert popsicle sticks in the middle of the banana halves.
step-3: transfer bananas to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, and freeze until solid.
step-4: in a tall glass or mixing cup, add chocolate and coconut oil.
step-5: microwave in 30-second intervals for 1 minute and a half, and mix until smooth.
step-6: in a bowl, mix the peanut butter and almond milk until smooth.
step-7: dip the bananas into the chocolate coating, then drizzle the peanut butter sauce on the banana.
step-8: place bananas in freezer until the coating has hardened.

step-1: peel bananas and cut in half.
step-2: place popsicle sticks inside bananas and put on tray with parchment paper.
step-3: freeze for 1 to 3 hours depending on how firm you want your bananas to be.
step-4: heat peanut butter in microwave at 30 second intervals until liquified.
step-5: coat bananas in peanut butter and sprinkle with mini chocolate chips.
step-6: set aside and freeze for an additional 20 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f/220˚c.
step-2: in a medium-sized bowl, add dark chocolate and butter, and microwave at 15-second intervals, stirring after each interval until fully melted.
step-3: in a medium mixing bowl, whisk together eggs, sugar and vanilla, then pour in the chocolate mixture.
step-4: grease the inside of 4 ramekins with butter and lightly dust with cocoa powder.
step-5: place one ¼ cup (59 ml) scoop of batter into each ramekin, then follow with a small scoop of peanut butter (about 2 tbsp) in the center of each ramekin.
step-6: finish with another ¼ cup (59ml) scoop of the batter.
step-7: bake at 425˚f/220˚c for 10-12 minutes, or until sides are firm and center is soft.
step-8: using a kitchen towel to hold the ramekin, place the serving plate on top of the ramekin and turn the lava cake out onto the plate (gently shaking the ramekin if needed) until the cake comes out.

step-1: preheat the oven to 325°f (160°c).
step-2: make the brownie layer: in a large bowl, combine the brownie mix, eggs, vegetable oil, and water.
step-3: stir until the batter is smooth and thick.
step-4: pour the batter into an 8-inch (20-cm) springform pan and smooth the top with a spatula or knife.
step-5: bake for 25 minutes.
step-6: remove from oven and use a spatula to press down the top.
step-7: let cool to room temperature.
step-8: make the peanut butter mousse: in a small bowl combine the gelatin and water, and set aside.
step-9: in a large bowl, mix the peanut butter and powdered sugar until smooth and shiny.
step-10: microwave the gelatin mix for 10 seconds, then mix into the peanut butter until thick and lumpy.
step-11: gently fold in half the whipped cream.
step-12: once incorporated, fold in the remaining whipped cream.
step-13: pour into the springform pan over the brownie base and smooth the top with a spatula or knife.
step-14: freeze for 20 minutes.
step-15: make the chocolate mousse: in a small bowl, combine the gelatin and water, and set aside.
step-16: in a large bowl, combine the chocolate chips and heavy cream.
step-17: microwave in 20-second increments, stirring between each, until melted.
step-18: microwave the gelatin for 10 seconds, then add to chocolate mixture.
step-19: gently fold in half of the whipped cream.
step-20: once incorporated, fold in the remaining whipped cream.
step-21: pour the batter into the springform pan over the peanut butter layer and smooth with a spatula or knife.
step-22: freeze overnight.
step-23: remove cake from the freezer and release the springform.
step-24: cut the chocolate peanut butter cups into sixths and evenly place around the rim of the cake, or decorate as desired!
step-25: let the cake thaw for 15 minutes, then serve.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the peanut butter, honey, oats, and mini chocolate chips.
step-2: stir until all ingredients are fully incorporated.
step-3: in the palm of your hand, roll peanut butter mixture into a walnut sized ball.
step-4: place on a piece of parchment paper on a baking sheet and freeze for 20 minutes, or until firm, but not frozen.
step-5: once firm, dip the peanut butter balls into melted chocolate, coating the whole ball.
step-6: place back on the parchment and freeze again until chocolate is hardened.

step-1: in a bowl, mix the milk, egg, and peanut butter.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: in a separate bowl, combine flour, salt, and baking powder.
step-4: pour wet mixture into dry, add chocolate, and mix thoroughly.
step-5: pour pancake batter in ¼ cup (60 ml) amounts on a griddle or skillet over medium-high heat.
step-6: cook until bubbles pop on the surface of the pancake, then flip and cook the other side.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (175c).
step-2: spray a 9x9 inch (23x23cm) baking pan with cooking spray.
step-3: prepare and pour the chocolate cake batter into the prepared baking pan.
step-4: bake for 25-30 minutes until an inserted toothpick comes out clean.
step-5: in a large bowl, mix together cream cheese and peanut butter until smooth.
step-6: add condensed milk, whisking until there are no large lumps.
step-7: gradually whisk in the milk, until smooth.
step-8: using the back of a wooden spoon, poke 4 rows of 4 holes in the cake, making 16 holes total.
step-9: pour the peanut butter mixture over the cake and set until the cake has absorbed as much of the mixture as it can.
step-10: some of the mixture will still stay on top, which is okay.
step-11: freeze cake for 30 minutes, to slightly solidify the topping.
step-12: spread the whipped topping evenly over the chilled cake.
step-13: chill the cake anywhere from 3 hours to overnight.
step-14: slice, and garnish with peanut butter cups.

step-1: melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat, then add the marshmallows and stir until starting to melt.
step-2: add ⅓ cup (80 g) of peanut butter and stir until completely melted.
step-3: remove the pot from the heat.
step-4: add the popcorn to the pot and stir to coat completely.
step-5: let cool for 2 minutes.
step-6: grease a 9-inch (23-cm) springform pan with nonstick spray.
step-7: press the popcorn mixture into the pan using the bottom of a measuring cup, creating an even layer along the bottom and halfway up the sides.
step-8: set aside.
step-9: add the dark chocolate chips and milk chocolate chips to a medium bowl and melt in the microwave, stirring every 30 seconds, about 2 minutes total.
step-10: set aside to cool to room temperature.
step-11: in a separate medium bowl, whip the cream with an electric hand mixer until stiff peaks form, then add 3 tablespoons of powdered sugar and 1 teaspoon of vanilla and beat to incorporate.
step-12: fold the whipped cream into the cooled chocolate.
step-13: spoon the chocolate mixture into the popcorn crust.
step-14: spread evenly.
step-15: in a small bowl, combine the remaining ⅓ cup (80 g) peanut butter, 1 tablespoon powdered sugar, 1 teaspoon of vanilla, and the milk, stirring until smooth.
step-16: transfer to a small piping bag or zip-top bag.
step-17: pipe lines across the surface of the pie.
step-18: drag a toothpick through, perpendicular to the lines, alternating directions from top to bottom.
step-19: chill the pie in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours.
step-20: release the springform, then slice and serve.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the peanut butter, butter, powdered sugar, and milk, and use an electric hand mixer or whisk to beat until smooth.
step-2: crush the pretzels in a large plastic bag using a rolling pin or heavy pan.
step-3: transfer the crushed pretzels to a medium bowl, add the melted butter, and stir to combine.
step-4: press the pretzel mixture into an ice cube tray.
step-5: top with a tablespoon of melted milk chocolate.
step-6: spread a small amount of peanut butter on top of the chocolate making sure it does not touch the side of the ice cube tray.
step-7: top with another teaspoon of milk chocolate.
step-8: freeze for at least 2 hours or up to 1 week.
step-9: use a butter knife or offset spatula to loosen the chocolate from the ice cube tray.
step-10: flip the ice cube tray and let the pretzel bites fall out.
step-11: let the chocolate pretzel bites thaw for 20 minutes before serving.

step-1: in a microwave safe bowl, heat the natural peanut butter, honey, and vanilla extract for 1 minute.
step-2: mix well.
step-3: add the brown rice cereal to the mixture and combine.
step-4: after well combined, pour into a greased or parchment lined baking dish and evenly spread.
step-5: chill until solid.
step-6: in a microwave safe bowl, heat the dark chocolate and coconut oil.
step-7: mix well.
step-8: after the crispy mixture is solid, cut into pieces.
step-9: dip the bottoms of the bars into the dark chocolate.
step-10: drizzle remaining chocolate on top.
step-11: chill again until solid.
step-12: store in the refrigerator in an airtight container.

step-1: in a sauce pan, combine and mix 1 cup (240 gram) peanut butter and marshmallows over medium heat, stirring constantly.
step-2: lower the heat and cook until melted.
step-3: remove from heat.
step-4: add in, rice cereal, and chocolate candies.
step-5: mix until evenly combined.
step-6: turn mixture into buttered 9x9 (23x23x5cm) pan.
step-7: melt 2 cups (350g) of chocolate chips in a bowl in 30-second increments.
step-8: pour melted chocolate over pan and spread evenly.
step-9: melt 1 cup (240g) of peanut butter and drizzle over chocolate.
step-10: sprinkle ½ cup (100g) of chocolate candies over top.
step-11: chill for 2-4 hours.
step-12: cut into squares.

step-1: combine the banana, peanut butter, spiced rum, and chocolate ice cream in a blender.
step-2: blend until smooth.
step-3: top with whipped cream and chopped peanuts.

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (200˚c).
step-2: place a prepared pie crust into a 9-inch (23 cm) pie pan.
step-3: line a sheet of parchment paper over crust and place 4 spoons in pan or dried beans in on the parchment, weighing down the crust.
step-4: bake for 15 minutes.
step-5: in a medium sized heat-safe mixing bowl, mix eggs and sugar until combined.
step-6: bring bowl over pot filled with water on low heat and rest on top.
step-7: constantly beat egg mixture on low speed unit it reaches 160˚f (77˚c).
step-8: remove the bowl from the heat and stir as it cools.
step-9: add peppermint extract and melted chocolate.
step-10: stir until combined.
step-11: gradually beat in cubes of butter, stirring until combined.
step-12: gradually fold in whipped cream and mix until just incorporated.
step-13: carefully spoon filling into prepared pie crust and chill for at least 2 hours.
step-14: garnish with whipped cream, shaved chocolate, and crushed peppermints.

step-1: place graham crackers in a gallon-sized re-sealable plastic bag.
step-2: crush crackers with rolling pin until fine in texture.
step-3: in a bowl, combine crushed graham cracker with melted butter and mix well.
step-4: line a 9×9 inch (23x23 cm) pan with parchment paper.
step-5: fill pan with graham cracker crumbs and pat down to create one even, compressed crust.
step-6: place in freezer.
step-7: in a large bowl, combine ingredients for peppermint cream with hand mixer until a thick, uniform cream is formed.
step-8: remove pan from freezer and layer the peppermint cream on crust in one even layer.
step-9: freeze for at least 1 hour.
step-10: remove pan from freezer and cut the sheet sheet of peppermint cream and graham cracker into 36 squares (i.e.
step-11: 6 lengthwise cuts and 6 crosswise cuts).
step-12: place squares on a metal cooling rack.
step-13: in a small bowl, combine chocolate and coconut oil (the exact amount of coconut oil needed may vary based on the chocolate used).
step-14: microwave in 20-second intervals, stirring between each, until chocolate is fully melted.
step-15: top squares with melted chocolate.
step-16: chill squares in fridge or freezer until ready to eat.

step-1: combine pretzels, butter, and brown sugar.
step-2: press mixture into pie pan.
step-3: bake for 10 minutes or until golden.
step-4: let cool to room temperature.
step-5: whisk cornstarch, sugar, and salt in a medium saucepan.
step-6: mix in egg yolks and milk, and heat mixture on medium heat.
step-7: gently mix for about 6 minutes or until the mixture thickens like a pudding.
step-8: once thick, take the mixture off the heat and immediately add your chocolate, vanilla, butter, and lemon juice.
step-9: mix until ingredients are incorporated into a smooth pudding texture.
step-10: pour filling into the cooled crust and smooth with a spatula as desired.
step-11: (any extra filling can be saved in cups and eaten immediately, or chilled for pudding cups.)
step-12: let the pie chill in the fridge uncovered for at least 4 hours.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: prepare and bake chocolate cake according to package instructions.
step-3: let cool 10 minutes before poking even holes throughout the cake with a chopstick or the end of a wooden spoon.
step-4: distribute condensed milk over the entire cake, making sure it runs in the holes, followed by can of caramel.
step-5: slather on cream, making sure to smooth it out on top.
step-6: refrigerate at least 4 hours, or overnight.
step-7: slice cake into even rectangles and sprinkle chopped pretzels on top.
step-8: serve with a drizzle of caramel topping.

step-1: prepare chocolate and white cake mixes according to directions on the box.
step-2: note: it is recommended that you use the same brand of cake mix for each, and ensure they share a similar bake time.
step-3: divide prepared white cake batter into 4 separate bowls.
step-4: use food coloring to create vivid red, yellow, green, and blue batter.
step-5: in a greased bundt pan, spoon about ⅓ of the prepared chocolate cake mix onto the bottom.
step-6: using a tablespoon, carefully spoon a thin ring of red cake batter on top of the chocolate layer - being careful to keep it centered and ensure it does not spread to the edge of the pan.
step-7: repeat with yellow, green, and blue batter, carefully spooning each on top of the previous.
step-8: finish by carefully covering the colored layers with an additional ⅓ of the chocolate cake mix (leaving about ⅓ extra so as not to overfill the pan).
step-9: bake in a preheated oven for 35 minutes at 175°c (350°f).
step-10: remove from oven and allow cake to cool.
step-11: turn out onto a plate and decorate.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a large mixing bowl, combine dry ingredients for the base batter (flour, sugar, baking powder, salt).
step-3: in a second mixing bowl, combine the eggs and vegetable oil.
