step-4: add the wet mix to the dry mix, stirring constantly until smooth.
step-5: add the milk, and vanilla extract, stir until evenly mixed and the consistency is a thick liquid.
step-6: evenly divide the batter into two separate bowls.
step-7: add the cocoa powder to the first bowl.
step-8: mix thoroughly.
step-9: add the raspberry jam to other.
step-10: mix thoroughly.
step-11: in a greased 9-inch (23 cm) cake pan, alternate batters by placing ¼ cup (60 ml) of batter in the center and letting it spread out slightly before adding the other batter (similar to making pancakes).
step-12: continue this process until the batter is used up and the pan is full of alternating rings.
step-13: bake cake in a preheated oven for 25-35 minutes or until a wooden toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
step-14: while the cake is baking, to make the ganache; in a medium pot set over low heat, mix together heavy cream and chocolate until chocolate has melted and mixture is smooth.
step-15: let mix rest until consistency is thick and mix is cooled.
step-16: cool cake slightly, and then invert onto a wire rack to cool completely.
step-17: pour ganache over the baked and cooled cake starting in the middle and circling towards the edges coating it all.
step-18: once ganache is cooled on cake, garnish with fresh raspberries and powdered sugar.

step-1: place cookies into a ziplock bag and crush using a rolling pin until fine crumbs form.
step-2: pour cookie crumbs into a bowl with melted butter and mix until well combined.
step-3: pour crust mixture into a 9-inch (23 cm) springform cake pan.
step-4: use a measuring up to press the cookies to form an even base.
step-5: cover and chill in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours.
step-6: in a large bowl, whisk together cream cheese, sugar and vanilla until smooth.
step-7: heat the heavy cream until hot, then add the gelatin and let it rest for 1 minute.
step-8: slowly whisk in the heavy cream into the cream cheese until smooth.
step-9: working quickly, divide the cheesecake batter in 4 bowls with 3 cups in one bowl, 2 cups in a second, 2½ cups in the third, and 1 cup in the fourth.
step-10: in the second bowl, whisk in 1 tablespoon of melted chocolate.
step-11: in the third bowl, whisk in 3 tablespoons of melted chocolate, and in the fourth bowl, whisk in 2 tablespoons of chocolate.
step-12: each bowl should vary in color from one another.
step-13: to assemble the cheesecake, slowly pour the contents of bowl 1 into the center of the pan.
step-14: once batter has spread repeat with the remaining bowls in numerical order.
step-15: if your bowls have sat out too long, and aren't liquidy, microwave for 30 seconds before pouring.
step-16: cover the top of the pan tightly with plastic wrap and chill for 4 hours or overnight in the fridge before serving.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: sift the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt into a large bowl.
step-3: add the sugar and whisk to combine.
step-4: add the warm water, buttermilk, eggs, and vanilla and whisk until combined.
step-5: line 2 muffin tins with paper liners.
step-6: scoop the batter into prepared muffin tins, filling each cup a little more than halfway.
step-7: bake for about 20 minutes, until the tops of the cupcakes spring back when gently pressed.
step-8: let cool completely.
step-9: make the marshmallow filling: in a medium bowl, whip the heavy cream with an electric hand mixer until soft peaks form.
step-10: add the marshmallow cream and whip until stiff.
step-11: transfer the filling to a piping bag fitted with a medium round tip or a zip-top bag with a corner snipped off.
step-12: use the end of a whisk or another utensil to push down the center of each cupcake.
step-13: pipe the filling into the cupcakes, leveling off the tops if needed.
step-14: freeze for 15 minutes while you make the ganache and icing.
step-15: make the ganache: add the chocolate chips and heavy cream to a medium microwave-safe bowl.
step-16: microwave in 30-second increments, until melted.
step-17: mix together until smooth.
step-18: make the icing: in a medium bowl, stir together the powdered sugar and milk until smooth.
step-19: the icing should fall off the spatula in ribbons.
step-20: if it is too thin, add a bit more powdered sugar.
step-21: transfer the icing to a piping bag fitted with a small tip or a zip-top bag with a corner snipped off.
step-22: dip the top of each cupcake in the ganache, then set aside to dry for 10 minutes.
step-23: pipe icing curls across the center of the cupcakes and let dry for 15 minutes at room temperature.

step-1: roll out the puff pastry on a lightly floured surface to a 12-inch by 14-inch (30 cm by 35 cm) rectangle.
step-2: use a spatula to spread the chocolate hazelnut spread over half of the pastry.
step-3: fold other half of the pastry over the chocolate spread.
step-4: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-5: grease a baking sheet with nonstick spray.
step-6: slice lengthwise into twelve ½-inch (1 cm) wide strips.
step-7: hold the top of a strip with one hand and use your other hand to twist.
step-8: once the twist goes all the way up the strip, roll into a tight spiral.
step-9: repeat with the rest of the strips.
step-10: transfer the spirals to the prepared baking sheet and brush with egg wash.
step-11: bake for 12 minutes, or until golden brown.

step-1: using a serrated knife, cut the pint of ice cream crosswise into 3 equal discs.
step-2: lay out 3 chocolate cookies and place a pint slice on top of each.
step-3: place another chocolate cookie on top of each sandwich.
step-4: remove the ice cream packaging.
step-5: freeze for 30 minutes.
step-6: pour the sprinkles into a shallow dish.
step-7: remove the ice cream sandwiches from the freezer and roll the sides in the sprinkles, completely covering the ice cream.
step-8: freeze for 30 minutes more before serving.

step-1: preheat oven to 350ºf (175ºc).
step-2: open 1 can of dough and mold into balls, roll all of them to about ⅛ -inch (3.2mm) thick.
step-3: use a 10-inch (25cm) dish or pan to make a circle outline in the dough.
step-4: spread chocolate-hazelnut spread over the dough staying within the 10 inch (25cm) circle.
step-5: repeat this process 2 more times so you have 3 frosted 10-inch (25cm) layers.
step-6: pile them on top of each other.
step-7: repeat process for final can of dough but do not apply chocolate-hazelnut spread to it, place on top of 3 chocolate-hazelnut layers.
step-8: use your 10-inch dish or pan once more to cover your 4 layers, use a sharp knife to cut excess dough and make 4 layers into a 10-inch circle.
step-9: place a cup or mason jar in center of circle and use a sharp knife to cut layered dough into 16 equal parts or “petals”, leaving the center intact.
step-10: next, twist 2 petals away from each other, pull them out a bit past other petals and tuck them under themselves, pinching seams.
step-11: repeat this process for the rest of the petals.
step-12: transfer onto baking sheet.
step-13: whisk egg in small dish and brush star bread with it.
step-14: bake for 28-30 minutes or until bread is browned and baked through.
step-15: let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: cut the tops off the strawberries and cut into pieces.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: in a pot over low heat, combine egg yolks, heavy cream, sugar, and cornstarch.
step-5: turn the heat up to medium-high, whisking constantly to prevent any lumps.
step-6: once the mixture starts to thicken, add in the strawberries, stirring until smooth.
step-7: transfer the cream mixture into a bowl, covering the top with plastic wrap and pressing the wrap down onto the surface of the cream to prevent a skin from forming.
step-8: chill.
step-9: in a pot, combine the water and butter, bringing it to a boil.
step-10: add the flour and stir until the dough comes together in a ball.
step-11: remove from heat.
step-12: add in the vanilla and eggs one a time, stirring until the dough becomes a paste.
step-13: transfer the dough into a piping bag with a large round tip.
step-14: on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper, pipe 1-inch (2½ cm) mounds.
step-15: bake for 20 minutes until the pastry has risen considerably and the insides are dry.
step-16: transfer the chilled pastry cream into a piping bag with a small tip.
step-17: poke a hole in the center of the bottom of each cream puff and fill each puff with the pastry cream.
step-18: microwave the chocolate at 30-second intervals until smooth.
step-19: mix in coconut oil if using.
step-20: dip the top of each filled cream puff into the chocolate, dripping off any excess.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine flour, eggs, butter, and sugar, stirring until ingredients are slightly mixed.
step-2: add the milk ½ cup (120 ml) at a time, stirring vigorously, making sure the milk is completely incorporated into the batter and that the batter is smooth before adding more milk.
step-3: repeat with the rest of the milk.
step-4: the batter should be very liquidy and have no lumps.
step-5: in a pan over medium heat, pour ⅓ cup (95 grams) of the batter in the center and swirl the batter around the edges of the pan until set.
step-6: to know when the crepe is ready to flip, lift up one of the edges about ⅓ of the way.
step-7: the bottom side should be golden brown.
step-8: flip the crepe.
step-9: cook until the edges are starting to slightly crisp.
step-10: remove from heat and cover with a paper towel to make sure the crepes stay moist.
step-11: spread half of the chocolate hazelnut spread on half of the crepe.
step-12: lay half of the strawberries on the chocolate spread.
step-13: fold the other half of the crepe on top of the strawberries, then fold the crepe in half.
step-14: repeat with the other crepe.

step-1: cut the bananas in half horizontally.
step-2: insert popsicle sticks in the middle of the banana halves.
step-3: transfer bananas to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, and freeze until solid.
step-4: in a tall glass or mixing cup, add chocolate and coconut oil.
step-5: microwave in 30-second intervals for 1 minute and a half, and mix until smooth.
step-6: place strawberries onto a plate.
step-7: dip the bananas into the chocolate coating, then roll or sprinkle on toppings.
step-8: place bananas in freezer until the coating has hardened.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: cut the puff pastry into 6 equal rectangles.
step-3: taking one of the rectangles, cut diagonally to create 2 triangles.
step-4: taking one of the triangles make 2 cuts on each of the long sides of the triangles leaving 1 centimeter from the edge.
step-5: make sure the cuts do not touch at top point of the triangle and leave about 1-inch from the bottom edge of the triangle.
step-6: make 2 more cuts parallel and 1 centimeter from first 2 cuts.
step-7: make sure the cuts do not touch at top point of the triangle and leave about 1 inch from the bottom edge of the triangle.
step-8: make one vertical cut in the center of the triangle that does not touch any of the other cuts.
step-9: it should be 2 inches long and 1 inch from the bottom.
step-10: place 1 teaspoon of chocolate hazelnut spread on the bottom of the triangle where the dough is not cut.
step-11: place a piece of strawberry over the chocolate hazelnut spread.
step-12: fold one of the bottom corners over the strawberry and fold the other bottom corner over that corner, press down to seal.
step-13: repeat with the remaining pastry triangles.
step-14: bake for 15–20 minutes until pastry is golden brown and puffed.

step-1: in a saucepan over medium-high heat, add butter, brown sugar, salt, and water, and bring to a boil.
step-2: as soon as the butter has fully melted and the mixture begins to boil, reduce the heat to medium-low and add in flour.
step-3: using a wooden spoon, stir until the dough comes together to form a ball and there are no lumps.
step-4: remove from heat and let cool for 5 minutes before proceeding to the next step (to prevent accidentally cooking the eggs).
step-5: mix in the vanilla extract and add in the eggs, one at a time, being sure to fully incorporate each egg before adding the next.
step-6: once all the eggs are incorporated, transfer it to a piping bag with a large star tip.
step-7: on a nonstick baking sheet, pipe the dough in circles leaving a hole in the center.
step-8: place the chocolate chips in a ring and top with remaining dough, making sure there are no gaps in between each layer.
step-9: transfer the tray to the freezer and freeze until solid, about 3 hours or overnight.
step-10: heat oil in a deep pot to 350˚f (175˚c).
step-11: remove the baking tray from the freezer and use a butter knife to release the churro donuts.
step-12: return any extras to the freezer while you wait to fry.
step-13: fry the donuts in batches to avoid overcrowding the pan, until brown and the dough is cooked through.
step-14: drain on a paper towel before rolling in cinnamon sugar.

step-1: remove the tops from strawberries.
step-2: scope out the inside of the strawberry.
step-3: put melted chocolate in piping bag.
step-4: fill strawberry with melted chocolate.
step-5: place strawberry top back on.
step-6: chill for 5 minutes.
step-7: dip the strawberries in white chocolate.
step-8: add sprinkles immediately.

step-1: preheat the oven to 100°c (210°f).
step-2: in a bowl, separate the egg whites and whisk until soft peaks form.
step-3: gradually add the sugar in stages, as you whisk.
step-4: whisk in the vanilla extract and white wine vinegar.
step-5: keep whisking until stiff peaks form, or until you can tip the bowl upside down and the meringue holds its shape.
step-6: gently fold in the melted chocolate, taking care not to overmix.
step-7: spoon the meringue onto a baking tray lined with greaseproof paper.
step-8: bake for 60 minutes, until the meringue no longer sticks to the paper.
step-9: serve with raspberries and strawberries.

step-1: in a small bowl, combine the chocolate biscuit crumbs with the butter and sugar.
step-2: spoon into a mini cupcake tray and freeze for 10 minutes, until set.
step-3: pour the hot double cream and chocolate spread over the chocolate and allow the heat of the cream to melt the chocolate.
step-4: whisk to combine.
step-5: pour the ganache over the biscuit bases.
step-6: chill in the fridge for 1 hour, until set.
step-7: garnish with raspberries and a sprig of mint.

step-1: using the back of a wooden spoon, poke at least 3 rows of 4 holes in the cooked cake, making 12 holes total.
step-2: pour the dulce de leche over the cake and let settle into the holes for about 10 minutes.
step-3: some of the dulce de leche will still stay on top, which is okay.
step-4: if necessary, it can be reheated or mixed with a little milk to be thinned.
step-5: spread the chocolate frosting evenly on top of the cake.
step-6: sprinkle the chopped pecans and mini chocolate chips on top of the frosting, then drizzle with the caramel.
step-7: chill the cake for at least 3 hours or up to overnight.

step-1: cut the puff pastry sheet into quarters.
step-2: use a spatula to spread ⅛ cup (35 g) of chocolate hazelnut spread over a square, then roll it up.
step-3: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-4: grease a baking sheet with nonstick spray.
step-5: slice the roll in half lengthwise.
step-6: braid the halves around each other and use egg wash to seal the ends.
step-7: transfer the twists to the prepared baking sheet and brush with egg wash.
step-8: bake for 14 minutes, or until golden brown.

step-1: in a mixing bowl, combine chocolate with sweetened condensed milk and melt in the microwave in 15-second increments.
step-2: once chocolate is fully melted add in chopped walnuts and stir until combined.
step-3: pour chocolate mixture into a parchment paper-lined 8x8 inch (20x20 cm) baking tin.
step-4: chill for 2 hours or until the fudge is firm.
step-5: cut into bite-sized piece.

step-1: peel the cucumbers.
step-2: cut into discs, and then quarter the discs.
step-3: place in a large salad bowl.
step-4: cut tomatoes into quarters, lengthwise, and then rotate and cut into large chunks.
step-5: add to the salad bowl.
step-6: cut the red onion in half, removing the skin, stem, and bottom.
step-7: thinly slice and add to the bowl.
step-8: add the feta cheese, olive oil, red wine vinegar, salt, pepper, lemon juice, and olives to the salad bowl and toss gently.

step-1: in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, sauté the chorizo until cooked through for about 5 minutes.
step-2: use a slotted spoon to transfer the chorizo to a paper towel-lined plate and add the butter to the pan.
step-3: when the butter is melted, turn off the heat and whisk in the paprika.
step-4: in a medium bowl, combine the cheese, garlic, chives, and cilantro.
step-5: season with salt and pepper to taste.
step-6: roll the pizza dough pieces into balls.
step-7: dip each ball in the chorizo butter and toss in the cheese mixture to coat.
step-8: lightly grease a 9-inch (23 cm) cast iron skillet and add the balls and chorizo to the pan.
step-9: cover with plastic wrap or a kitchen towel and set aside to rise in a warm, draft-free space for 30 to 40 minutes.
step-10: preheat oven to 375°f (190˚c).
step-11: bake the bread until golden and bubbling for 30 to 35 minutes.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a pan over medium heat, lightly brown the chorizo for about 5-7 minutes to cook out excess fat (it does not have to be cooked through).
step-3: remove the chorizo from heat and drain any excess oil.
step-4: in a medium bowl, mix the chorizo, breadcrumbs, half of stock, poblano peppers, carrots, half of onions, cotija cheese, egg, egg yolk, cilantro, parsley, salt and pepper.
step-5: use your hands to roll the mixture into approximately 12-16 golf ball-sized meatballs.
step-6: transfer the meatballs to a baking sheet and bake for about 20 minutes.
step-7: in a dutch oven or heavy-bottomed pan over medium heat, add oil and sauté remaining onions and garlic until fragrant and translucent, about 5 minutes.
step-8: add the can of tomatoes and remaining stock.
step-9: tip: adding the stock into the empty can will ensure you don’t waste any tomatoes that may be left behind.
step-10: add the chipotles in adobo and simmer about 5 minutes.
step-11: add the meatballs, cover with lid slightly ajar, and simmer for about 30 minutes until the meatballs are cooked through.
step-12: while simmering, combine mayonnaise, jalapeño sauce, mint, salt, and pepper in a blender or food processor.
step-13: pulse until combined.
step-14: cut the slider buns in half.
step-15: spread the jalapeño aioli on the top half.
step-16: remove meatballs from skillet and place one on the bottom halves of each roll, then drizzle with some of the tomato sauce and sprinkle cheese on top.
step-17: sandwich the tops onto the meatballs and serve immediately.

step-1: heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
step-2: cook chorizo until slightly crispy.
step-3: add the onions and cook until translucent.
step-4: add the beef, salt, and pepper, cooking until no pink is showing.
step-5: pour in the tomato sauce, and cook until sauce thickens.
step-6: add the pasta, parmesan, and basil, stirring until the pasta is evenly coated.

step-1: using food safe gloves, dice the jalapeños, and cut the kernels off of the ears of corn.
step-2: preheat the oven to 350°f (180 °c).
step-3: grease a 9x13-inch (23x33-cm) baking pan with butter.
step-4: in a large bowl, whisk the cornstarch into the heavy cream until smooth.
step-5: add 1½ cups (150 g) of cheddar, the creamed corn, fresh corn, jalapeños, melted butter, eggs, and salt and stir well.
step-6: taste and add more salt if necessary.
step-7: pour the pudding into the baking pan and top with the remaining ½ cup cheddar.
step-8: bake until set, 45-50 minutes.
step-9: fire up the broiler and broil until the top is browned, 1-2 minutes.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: flip a baking sheet upside down and place a piece of parchment paper on top.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: in a medium bowl, combine the cream cheese, sour cream, and club house ranch dip seasoning.
step-5: stir until well mixed.
step-6: fold in the spinach.
step-7: set aside.
step-8: roll out the tube of pizza dough on a piece of parchment paper set on a flat surface.
step-9: using a pizza cutter or knife, cut from a bottom corner to the center of the top.
step-10: repeat on the other side so you have 1 full triangle and 2 halves of a triangle on either side.
step-11: transfer both side-triangle pieces to the prepared baking sheet.
step-12: pinch the middle seam to seal and stretch the dough to form a single triangle.
step-13: spread the spinach dip over a side of the triangle.
step-14: spread the pesto over the other side of the triangle.
step-15: flip the remaining dough triangle on top of the filling and remove the parchment from the top.
step-16: stretch the dough to cover completely.
step-17: using a pizza cutter or knife, make horizontal slices about 1 inch apart from the top to bottom, leaving the middle “trunk” of the tree intact.
step-18: pull the strips outwards and twist.
step-19: in a small bowl, mix the melted butter and garlic and brush over the tree.
step-20: sprinkle with the club house italian herbs and shredded parmesan cheese.
step-21: bake the tree for 12-15 minutes, or until golden brown and the cheese has melted.
step-22: serve with marinara sauce.

step-1: add the potatoes to a large pot and cover with cold water.
step-2: add the salt.
step-3: bring to a boil over high heat and cook until the potatoes are fork-tender, about 20 minutes longer.
step-4: drain and return to the pot.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: in a small pot over medium heat, bring the butter, cream, and garlic to a simmer.
step-7: once simmering, remove from the heat.
step-8: pour the cream mixture over the potatoes.
step-9: add the sour cream, then mash with a hand masher until the potatoes are creamy, but still very chunky.
step-10: season to taste with salt and pepper.
step-11: garnish with green onions, if desired.
step-12: note: any small waxy potato would work well in this recipe — such as yukon golds or new potatoes.

step-1: in a saucepan combine water, butter and salt, bring to boil.
step-2: add the flour and mix well.
step-3: cook for a few minutes while stirring and remove from heat.
step-4: add the eggs one by one, beating well between each addition.
step-5: transfer the dough to a bag with a nozzle and pipe a large spiral on the base of a springform pan.
step-6: freeze the base until it is firm.
step-7: preheat a large pot of oil to 350˚f (175˚c).
step-8: make sure the pot is wide enough for the entire churro base to fit!
step-9: fry the churro base until it is golden brown on both sides.
step-10: transfer it to a plate and sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon to taste.
step-11: place the churro base in the springform pan and reserve.
step-12: for the filling, in a bowl, beat the cream cheese, condensed milk, vanilla and hydrated gelatin until smooth.
step-13: then fold in the whipped cream.
step-14: pour the mixture on the churro base and refrigerate for 4 hours or until it is firm.
step-15: sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon to taste.

step-1: in a 1.5-quart saucepan over medium-high heat, add butter, brown sugar, salt, and water, and bring to a boil.
step-2: as soon as the butter has fully melted and the mixture begins to boil, reduce the heat to medium-low and add in flour.
step-3: using a wooden spoon, stir until the dough comes together to form a ball (about 1 minute).
step-4: remove from heat and let cool for 5 minutes before proceeding to the next step (to prevent accidentally cooking the eggs).
step-5: mix in the vanilla extract and add in the eggs, one at a time, being sure to fully incorporate each egg before adding the next.
step-6: once all the eggs are incorporated, transfer it to a piping bag with a small star tip.
step-7: invert a muffin tin and spray thoroughly with nonstick cooking spray.
step-8: pipe the dough around the inverted cups in spirals to form the bowls.
step-9: immediately transfer the tray to the freezer and freeze until solid (about 3 hours or overnight).
step-10: heat oil in a deep pot to 350˚f (175˚c).
step-11: remove the muffin tin from the freezer and flex it to release the churro bowls (you may need to also use a butter knife under the bottom edge to initially release them).
step-12: return any extras to the freezer while you wait to fry.
step-13: fry them in batches, until nicely browned, no more than 3 minutes at a time.
step-14: be sure to carefully turn them so they fry evenly.
step-15: once desired color is reached, remove them from the oil to a paper towel-lined plate.
step-16: dab off any excess oil then roll them in cinnamon sugar.
step-17: fill with your favorite ice cream and toppings.

step-1: in a large pot, bring the water, oil, and salt to a boil.
step-2: add the flour and turn the heat off.
step-3: quickly stir the flour until it forms a smooth paste/ball.
step-4: transfer the dough into a piping bag lined with a star tip.
step-5: pipe 6-inch (15 cm) spirals onto a sheet lined with parchment paper, starting from the middle and going around in a circle, making sure that there are no gaps between the loops.
step-6: repeat with the remaining dough.
step-7: freeze the circles for at least 2 hours.
step-8: heat oil in a pot over high heat.
step-9: fry the circles until light golden brown, then drain them on a paper towel.
step-10: mix the sugar and the cinnamon in a separate bowl.
step-11: coat each churro disc in the cinnamon sugar mix, shaking off any excess.
step-12: place a scoop of ice cream in between 2 churro discs.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: cut the puff pastry sheets in half, then use a rolling pin to roll each half out to 24 inches long x 8 inches wide.
step-3: brush the puff pastry sheets with the softened butter, then carefully roll them up into tight logs.
step-4: cut the logs in half lengthwise.
step-5: take each half and fold the smooth part of the dough inward to create a spiral shape.
step-6: place the spirals in a muffin tin and brush the tops with egg wash.
step-7: bake for 15 minutes on the top rack, then transfer to the bottom rack and bake for another 15 minutes.
step-8: combine the sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl.
step-9: remove the muffins from the oven.
step-10: once cool enough to handle, roll in the cinnamon sugar mixture.

step-1: peel the pear, cut in half and core.
step-2: add the cider, orange juice, star anise, cinnamon stick and vanilla extract to a small to medium pan.
step-3: bring to boil, then reduce to a simmer.
step-4: add the pear halves and poach at a low-medium heat for 10-20 minutes (until you can stick a knife through with no resistance).
step-5: remove the pear halves when cooked.
step-6: reduce the rest of the mixture over a medium heat until it is a thicker glaze.
step-7: serve the pears with a dollop of greek yogurt, a handful of toasted almonds and the glaze.

step-1: mix together all of the spices and seasoning
step-2: rub it onto the pork shoulder, make sure you get really stuck in there and all over the pork.
step-3: place the pork shoulder into a slow cooker and gently pour over the cider.
step-4: put the lid on and cook on low for 8-12 hours.
step-5: move the pork into a large bowl and shred using two forks.
step-6: we used toasted brioche buns and coleslaw, but you could add some bbq sauce or whatever you feel like.

step-1: place the brown rice, shredded chicken, roasted vegetables, pico de gallo, and yogurt in a bowl or resealable container.
step-2: garnish with chopped cilantro and the lime wedge.

step-1: heat preferred cooking oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
step-2: add chicken, season with salt and pepper, and cook until cooked through and no longer pink.
step-3: add lime juice and cilantro.
step-4: stir to combine.
step-5: remove chicken from pan, place on a plate, and set aside.
step-6: add a little more oil to pan if needed, then add red onion, bell pepper, and garlic.
step-7: stir to combine.
step-8: allow to cook until onion begins to turn transparent, stirring occasionally.
step-9: add riced cauliflower, corn, and chili powder.
step-10: cook until cauliflower is soft and remove from heat.
step-11: distribute black beans, chicken, and cauliflower mixture evenly between 4 containers.
step-12: top with a wedge of lime.
step-13: this meal prep can be refrigerated for up to 4 days.

step-1: in a medium saucepan, add the rice, bay leaves, and water and bring to a boil over high heat.
step-2: once boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 18 minutes.
step-3: remove the lid, fluff the rice with a fork, and cover.
step-4: let rest and absorb any steam for 10 minutes.
step-5: remove the bay leaves, then add the lime juice, lemon juice, salt, and cilantro.
step-6: stir to combine.

step-1: preheat your oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-2: slice pita bread into eighths and spread chips out on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-3: in a small bowl combine coconut oil, sugar, and cinnamon and brush onto both sides of the chips.
step-4: bake for 10-12 minutes until golden and crispy.
step-5: allow to cool.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a large cast-iron skillet, melt 1 teaspoon of coconut oil over medium-low heat.
step-3: add the diced apples and let caramelize slightly, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes.
step-4: remove the apples from the skillet and set aside.
step-5: melt the remaining teaspoon of coconut oil in the skillet, then add the quinoa and cook until it is well browned and smells toasty, about 10 minutes.
step-6: return the apples to the skillet, along with the walnuts.
step-7: stir to combine, then remove the skillet from the heat and let cool.
step-8: in a medium bowl, lightly beat the eggs, then add the almond milk, applesauce, maple syrup, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
step-9: whisk well to combine.
step-10: pour the wet ingredients into the skillet with the apple quinoa mixture.
step-11: arrange the sliced apple on top in a decorative pattern.
step-12: bake for 1 hour, until the liquid is absorbed and the quinoa is tender.
step-13: remove from the oven and let cool for at least 15 minutes before serving.
step-14: nutrition information, per serving - calories: 300, carbs: 45 grams, dietary fiber: 5 grams, sodium: 52 mg, total fat: 10 grams, total sugar: 21 grams, total protein: 8 grams

step-1: mash one banana to substitute for egg.
step-2: for chia or ground flax seeds, mix with water and let rest for 5-10 minutes.
step-3: add to the other wet ingredients.
step-4: mix well.
step-5: add flour, baking powder, and salt to wet ingredients until well combined.
step-6: measure out ¼ cup (60 ml) of batter and add to a skillet over low heat.
step-7: when bubbles start to form and edges start to come off the pan, flip the pancake.
step-8: cook an additional 2-3 minutes.
step-9: repeat with remaining batter.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: cut sweet potato into wedges.
step-3: place in large bowl.
step-4: heat up coconut oil in microwave in 15-second intervals until melted.
step-5: mix in brown sugar and cinnamon.
step-6: pour mixture into large bowl of sweet potatoes wedges.
step-7: mix together until evenly coated.
step-8: place on baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-9: bake for 30 minutes, or until soft.
step-10: for best results, flip halfway.
step-11: while wedges are baking, prepare dipping sauce by combining ingredients in a small bowl and set aside in the refrigerator until ready to use.

step-1: whisk eggs, cinnamon, vanilla and milk together in medium-large bowl to create egg wash.
step-2: in medium bowl mix cream cheese, heavy cream, powdered sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg and vanilla.
step-3: dunk 2 slices of bread in egg wash.
step-4: melt butter in a skillet on medium-low heat and cook bread for 2-3 minutes or until crumbs are crispy and bread is more solid, adding some additional butter to each toasted side.
step-5: add additional cinnamon to taste.
step-6: stack and drizzle with cream cheese mixture.

step-1: mix cream cheese, and sugar.
step-2: mix in the egg, vanilla extract, and cinnamon.
step-3: hollow the apple with a melon baller.
step-4: fill ⅔ of hollowed apple with cream cheese mixture.
step-5: bake 25-30 minutes at 176˚c (350˚f).
step-6: for maple pecan sauce, boil whipping cream and maple syrup until thick.
step-7: stir in pecans just before serving.
step-8: serve with crushed graham cracker (optional) and maple pecans sauce.

step-1: add the banana, oats, yogurt, cinnamon, agave, coffee, cashew milk, and ice to a blender.
step-2: blend until smooth.
step-3: serve in a glass topped with a sprinkle of cinnamon.

step-1: combine the black tea, orange peel, and cinnamon.
step-2: store in an airtight container for up to 1 month.
step-3: to brew, steep 1-2 teaspoons of the tea blend in 8 ounces (240 ml) of hot water for 5 minutes.
step-4: serve warm or over ice.

step-1: in a large bowl, add the melted butter, sugar, and eggs.
step-2: whisk to combine, then add the milk and whisk to incorporate.
step-3: sift in the flour and salt and whisk until smooth.
step-4: heat a small nonstick skillet over medium heat.
step-5: scoop ¼ cup (60 g) of the batter into the pan.
step-6: swirl the pan around until the batter evenly coats the bottom.
step-7: cook until the surface begins to bubble slightly and the edges brown, about 3 minutes.
step-8: flip the crepe and cook on the other side for another 1-2 minutes.
step-9: remove from the skillet and set aside to cool.
step-10: repeat with the remaining batter.
step-11: fold crepe in half 3 times, then cut out your desired shapes.
step-12: in a small bowl, mix together the cinnamon and sugar.
step-13: coat the leftover cut-out shapes with cinnamon sugar.
step-14: spread whipped cream on another crepe and sprinkle with cinnamon sugar.
step-15: unfold the the cut-out crepe and place on top of the whipped cream crepe.
step-16: place coated cut-out shapes on top of the crepe stack.
step-17: repeat with the rest of the crepes.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c) and spray a pie dish with nonstick oil.
step-2: peel and cut the apples into thin slices and place in a bowl.
step-3: add sugar, cinnamon and cornstarch to apples and stir.
step-4: cut each cinnamon roll in half and roll out with flour until thin.
step-5: layer the bottom of the pie dish with the flattened cinnamon rolls to create a bottom crust.
step-6: add the apples and layer the rest of the rolls on top to create a closed crust, pinch any holes together with your fingers.
step-7: cover with foil and bake for 35 minutes.
step-8: remove the foil and bake for another 10 minutes uncovered.
step-9: allow the pie to cool and drizzle with icing.

step-1: in a medium bowl, mix eggs, milk, cream, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and sugar.
step-2: whisk together.
step-3: cut each cinnamon roll into eight pieces, and stuff inside a greased muffin tin.
step-4: pour batter in each tin about ¾ of the way.
step-5: if you pour too much, the tin will overflow in the oven.
step-6: cover the tin and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, letting the cinnamon roll absorb the mixture.
step-7: bake at 350˚f (175˚c) for 35 minutes.
step-8: remove the muffin from the tin, top with icing and serve warm.

step-1: make box cake mix as instructed on the box.
step-2: fill cupcake wrappers about half way full with batter.
step-3: bake at 375°f (190°c) for six minutes.
step-4: cut orange cinnamon rolls in half.
step-5: place on top of cupcakes.
step-6: bake another 9 minutes, or until the cinnamon roll tops look fully cooked.

step-1: cut each cinnamon roll into 8 pieces.
step-2: in a separate bowl, whisk the eggs, milk, vanilla, and cinnamon.
step-3: set it aside.
step-4: pour the butter on the bottom of a 9 x 13 inch (22cm x 33cm) glass baking dish.
step-5: spread the cinnamon roll pieces evenly over the butter.
step-6: then pour the mixture over the cinnamon rolls.
step-7: pour 1 cup of maple syrup over the mixture.
step-8: bake at 375°f/190°c for 25 min.
step-9: top with the icing from the cinnamon rolls.

step-1: roll each slice of bread flat with a rolling pin.
step-2: carefully cut off crusts
step-3: in a bowl, combine melted butter, brown sugar, and 2 tablespoons cinnamon.
step-4: spread onto each bread slice, and roll up.
step-5: in a bowl, combine eggs, milk, ½ teaspoon cinnamon, and vanilla.
step-6: dip each roll-up in egg mixture, and pan fry in a buttered skillet until all sides are golden brown.

step-1: in a bowl, add the heavy cream and condensed milk and whip until soft peaks form.
step-2: add the cream cheese and mix until smooth.
step-3: freeze for 3-5 hours.
step-4: preheat oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-5: open the tubes of cinnamon rolls and save the frosting for later.
step-6: cut 3 of the cinnamon rolls in half.
step-7: unravel the cinnamon roll halves and full cinnamon rolls and roll together the halves with the whole rolls using your hands to create 6 long thin strips.
step-8: you’ll have one cinnamon roll left over and you can use that to make a small bowl, or save for later!
step-9: spray an inverted muffin tin with cooking spray and coil the cinnamon roll strip around the outside in order to create a bowl.
step-10: be sure to pinch the ridges together in order to prevent the bowl from separating while baking.
step-11: bake 7-10 minutes, or until the bowls are golden brown.
step-12: in a small bowl, add the icing from the cinnamon roll packages and melt for 20-30 seconds in a microwave.
step-13: carefully remove the cinnamon roll bowls from the tins and add 2 scoops of ice cream to each bowl.
step-14: top the ice cream with melted icing and ground cinnamon.

step-1: in a blender, blend the egg, milk, oats, baking powder, and greek yogurt.
step-2: in a squirt bottle, combine cinnamon, brown sugar, and coconut oil.
step-3: on a griddle or pan over medium-high heat, pour pancake batter in ¼ cup (60 ml) amounts.
step-4: drizzle cinnamon sugar mixture over the pancake.
step-5: when bubbles start to pop on the surface, flip and cook completely.

step-1: in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
step-2: in a small bowl or measuring cup, whisk together the almond milk and maple syrup.
step-3: add the wet ingredient to the dry and whisk to combine.
step-4: do not overmix.
step-5: in a small bowl, mix together the margarine, brown sugar, and cinnamon.
step-6: transfer to a pastry bag or plastic zip-top bag and snip off one corner.
step-7: lightly grease a large nonstick skillet or griddle and heat over medium heat.
step-8: when the pan shimmers, measure out ¼ cup (35 g) of the batter (or eyeball it) and pour it onto the skillet.
step-9: pipe a circular swirl of the cinnamon mixture into the batter.
step-10: repeat to fill the skillet.
step-11: when small bubbles appear in the center of the pancakes, after about 4 minutes, flip.
step-12: cook on the other side for about 1 minute more, until lightly browned and cooked through.
step-13: repeat with the remaining batter, adding more oil to the skillet between batches as needed.
step-14: in a small bowl, combine the confectioners’ sugar and water and whisk until smooth.
step-15: drizzle the pancakes with the glaze and serve.

step-1: prepare white cake mix according to the box instructions and bake according to the 9x13 inch (22cm x 33cm) dish instructions.
step-2: in a bowl, mix the butter, sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, and condensed milk until smooth.
step-3: with the end of a wooden spoon, poke 24 holes in the cooled white cake.
step-4: pour the butter mixture over the cake, smoothing it out into the holes.
step-5: cover with a layer of whipped topping.
step-6: chill for 4 hours.
step-7: slice cake and serve.

step-1: in a bowl, combine cream cheese, sugar, and cinnamon.
step-2: on a floured surface, flatten each cinnamon roll and spread cream cheese mixture on top.
step-3: cut flattened roll in half and place one half on top of the other.
step-4: repeat for the rest of the cinnamon rolls.
step-5: line a loaf pan with parchment paper.
step-6: lay the pan vertically on its side, and stack cinnamon rolls cut side facing the bottom of the pan.
step-7: cover the loaf pan loosely with foil.
step-8: bake at 325˚f(160˚c) 70 minutes, removing the foil for the last 10 minutes.
step-9: drizzle with the icing that comes with the cinnamon rolls.

step-1: slice off the top of each apple and hollow out using a melon baller - being careful not to cut through the sides and to leave a thicker base.
step-2: brush the inside of each apple with melted butter and a sprinkling of brown sugar and cinnamon.
step-3: place a cinnamon roll in each apple.
step-4: bake in a preheated oven at 350˚f (180˚c) for 15 minutes uncovered and then an additional 25-30 minutes covered loosely with foil.
step-5: remove from over and drizzle with icing.
step-6: serve warm.

step-1: place 4 cinnamon rolls in a preheated, greased waffle iron.
step-2: cook for 2-3 minutes, until golden brown.
step-3: serve with the reserved icing.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, combine the granulated sugar, brown sugar, cinnamon, and softened butter and blend until it becomes a spreadable paste.
step-3: roll out the pizza dough and evenly spread the filling over it.
step-4: roll the dough back up into a tube.
step-5: cut in half lengthwise.
step-6: twist the dough to form one long braid.
step-7: bring both ends together to create a circular shape.
step-8: bake for 35 minutes, or until the dough is cooked through.
step-9: in a medium bowl, beat together the cream cheese, melted butter, and vanilla with a hand mixer.
step-10: add the powdered sugar and continue beating until smooth.
step-11: drizzle the glaze over the cinnamon wreath.

step-1: lay your pizza dough flat on your work surface.
step-2: spread softened butter all over the dough, then sprinkle with cinnamon and sugar.
step-3: roll up the dough, split down the middle, and twist one half over the other with the layers exposed.
step-4: twist and join the dough into a circle.
step-5: place on parchment paper, brush on egg wash, and sprinkle more sugar on top.
step-6: bake at 350°f (180°c) for 40 to 45 minutes.
step-7: let the braid cool for a bit before dusting with powdered sugar.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a bowl, beat cream cheese until smooth.
step-3: then, add half of the sugar, egg, and vanilla, and beat until smooth.
step-4: roll out crescent dough and pinch the seams together.
step-5: next, in a small bowl, mix the remaining half of the sugar with the cinnamon.
step-6: in a greased 9×13-inch (33x23 cm) baking dish, sprinkle half of the cinnamon sugar.
step-7: lay down one crescent dough rectangle.
step-8: spread on cream cheese filling.
step-9: top with the other crescent dough rectangle, and sprinkle on the remaining cinnamon sugar.
step-10: bake 30 minutes.
step-11: cool completely, then cut into 12 squares.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: spread pizza dough out on a parchment-lined pan.
step-3: bake 10 minutes.
step-4: spread on melted butter.
step-5: combine cinnamon and sugar, and sprinkle over butter.
step-6: bake an additional 10 minutes.
step-7: slice and dip!

step-1: in a large bowl, stir together the water and 1 teaspoon sugar.
step-2: sprinkle the yeast over the water mixture and rest for 5 minutes, or until it becomes foamy.
step-3: sift together the flour, 2 tablespoons sugar, and the salt over the yeast mixture.
step-4: add the milk, 3 tablespoons melted butter, and the egg yolks.
step-5: stir until the dough comes together in a ball.
step-6: add more flour if dough is too sticky.
step-7: knead the dough for five minutes, or until the dough is smooth on the outside and springs back when pressed on with your fingers.
step-8: grease bowl with the oil, return the dough to the bowl, and cover with plastic wrap.
step-9: let rise for one hour at room temperature, or until the dough has doubled in size.
step-10: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-11: cut the dough into eight equal parts.
step-12: roll out each piece of dough into a long, thick strip.
step-13: fold a sheet of aluminum foil in half and, starting from the bottom right hand corner, roll into a cone shape, measuring 6 inches (15 cm) long and about ⅛-inch (3 mm) thick around the opening.
step-14: repeat to make 7 more cones.
step-15: wrap the dough strips around each aluminum cone.
step-16: arrange the cones point-up in a muffin tin.
step-17: brush with egg wash.
step-18: bake for 18-20 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-19: cool for 10 minutes.
step-20: on a large plate, mix the cinnamon with the remaining sugar.
step-21: brush the cones with the remaining melted butter.
step-22: carefully remove the aluminum foil.
step-23: roll the cone in cinnamon sugar.
step-24: fill the cone with melted chocolate, letting the excess drip out.
step-25: top with ice cream, or dip the edge in chocolate, then roll in rainbow sprinkles, if desired.
step-26: top with ice cream.

step-1: in a medium bowl, mix the cream cheese, ¼ cup (50 g) of sugar, 1 teaspoon of cinnamon, and the vanilla until smooth.
step-2: transfer the cream cheese mixture into a piping bag or plastic bag with a large round tip.
step-3: roll out the puff pastry until it’s ⅛-inch (½-cm) thick.
step-4: pipe the cream cheese mixture along one short edge of the pastry sheet, then roll up until just sealed.
step-5: use a knife to cut along the edge to create one roll.
step-6: repeat three more times, or until all the puff pastry is used.
step-7: begin to twist the first roll to create a swirl.
step-8: connect the next piece of dough by pinching to seal the edge to the end of the first piece.
step-9: continue to wrap and seal all pieces until finished.
step-10: using a spatula transfer the dough to the cake pan.
step-11: preheat the oven 350°f (180°c) to and grease an 8-inch (20-cm) round cake pan with nonstick spray.
step-12: in a small bowl, combine the melted butter with the remaining tablespoon of sugar and teaspoon of cinnamon.
step-13: brush the butter mixture over the dough.
step-14: bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the puff pastry is golden brown and cooked through.
step-15: in a liquid measuring cup or bowl, mix the powdered sugar and milk until smooth.
step-16: pour the glaze over the danish swirl.

step-1: soak cashews in boiling water for two hours.
step-2: drain the cashews and blend in a food processor for 30 seconds.
step-3: pour in coconut oil and 3 tablespoons of agave and blend for 1 minute.
step-4: scrape down sides and add in almond flour.
step-5: blend until smooth, approximately 2-5 minutes.
step-6: remove the mixture from the food processor and transfer to a food storage container.
step-7: in a small bowl, mix cinnamon and remaining agave until cinnamon is fully incorporated.
step-8: pour cinnamon mixture over dough and swirl around with a toothpick, knife, or skewer, then lightly stir with a spatula to distribute the cinnamon swirl.
step-9: store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

step-1: in a large mixing bowl, beat the sugars and eggs together until smooth.
step-2: add in the melted butter and whisk until smooth.
step-3: sift in the flour, soybean flour and baking powder and mix together.
step-4: rest the dough for 30 minutes.
step-5: roll the dough into ping pong sized balls using your hands.
step-6: in a deep saucepan, heat the oil to 190°c (370°f).
step-7: using a slotted spoon, carefully fry the balls in small batches.
step-8: transfer the doughnuts to a paper towel-lined plate.
step-9: prepare the cinnamon sugar by mixing the sugar and ground cinnamon together.
step-10: roll the doughnuts in the cinnamon sugar.
step-11: drizzle some brown sugar syrup on top.

step-1: in a large pot over medium heat, melt together 2 tablespoons of butter and 2 tablespoons of olive oil.
step-2: add the carrot, leek, onion, red bell pepper, fennel, green bell pepper, celery, and garlic.
step-3: season with salt and pepper.
step-4: stir and cook until the vegetables are softened, about 15 minutes.
step-5: scoop half of the matignon (sautéed minced vegetables) from the pan and set aside.
step-6: stir the tomato paste, basil, oregano, thyme, and cayenne into the remaining vegetables and cook until the tomato paste starts to brown, about 10 minutes.
step-7: next, add half of the white wine to deglaze the pan, stirring to loosen any bits stuck to the bottom of the pot.
step-8: add the fish stock, crushed tomatoes, and bay leaves.
step-9: stir together, bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes.
step-10: in a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium-high heat.
step-11: season all of the seafood with salt and pepper.
step-12: add the scallops to the pan and sear the first side until golden brown, 3 minutes.
step-13: flip and sear on the other side for another 3 minutes.
step-14: remove from the pan and set aside.
step-15: wipe out the pan if needed.
step-16: add more olive oil as needed, then add the shrimp to the pan and cook for 3 minutes on one side.
step-17: flip and cook on the other side for 3 minutes more.
step-18: set aside.
step-19: add more olive oil and the squid to the hot pan and sauté until cooked, 5 minutes.
step-20: add more olive oil and the halibut to the hot pan, along with the crushed garlic and remaining 2 tablespoons of butter.
step-21: sear the halibut on one side, then flip and cook on the other side for 3 minutes.
step-22: baste the fish with the melted garlic butter as the second side cooks.
step-23: remove from the pan and set aside.
step-24: add the clams and mussels to the pan, pour in the remaining cup of white white, then cover the pot and steam for 5 minutes, until the shellfish pop open.
step-25: remove the pan from the heat.
step-26: transfer all of the cooked seafood, along with the leftover shellfish steaming liquid and reserved matignon, to the simmering stew; or plate the seafood and reserved matignon artfully in wide bowls and pour the hot stew over the top.
step-27: serve with grilled sourdough bread and garnish with parsley.

step-1: to make the dressing, add the garlic, parsley, scallions, apple cider vinegar, honey, orange juice, dijon mustard, tahini, and salt to a blender.
step-2: blend until smooth.
step-3: with the blender running, slowly drizzle in the olive oil until the dressing is easily pourable.
step-4: set aside until ready to use.
step-5: minutes prior to serving the salad, add the kale to a large bowl and season with salt.
step-6: gently massage with your hands to break down the tough fibers and reduce bitterness.
step-7: add the red cabbage, apple, brussels sprouts, orange segments, pepitas, and pomegranate seeds.
step-8: toss well to combine.
step-9: serve in a bowl or plate and drizzle with dressing to taste.

step-1: combine water and sugar in a saucepan, bring mixture to a boil, then remove from heat and let cool.
step-2: squeeze fresh juice from 2 oranges, 2 lemons, and 4 limes into the cooled simple syrup, then stir.
step-3: using a mesh sieve, strain the citrus simple syrup into a large pitcher.
step-4: slice 1 orange, 1 lemon, 2 limes, and add the slices into the pitcher.
step-5: pour in tequila, wine, club soda, and give it all a good stir.
step-6: serve with ice and garnish with a slice of fruit.

step-1: cut the beef into cubes, then season generously with salt and pepper.
step-2: heat the canola oil in a large dutch oven or pot over medium high heat.
step-3: working in batches, sear the beef on all sides until well browned.
step-4: do not overcrowd the pan.
step-5: transfer the meat to a plate and set aside.
step-6: add the onion, celery, carrots, and garlic to the pan and cook until tender, about 5 minutes.
step-7: add the tomato paste to the center of the pot and cook for 1 minute.
step-8: stir the tomato paste into the vegetables and continue cooking until fragrant, about 5 minutes.
step-9: pour in the wine to deglaze the pan, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the pot with a wooden spoon.
step-10: add the beef stock and tomatoes and stir to combine, then add the rosemary, thyme, pepper, salt, and bay leaf.
step-11: return the beef to the pot, making sure it is submerged in the braising liquid.
step-12: bring to a boil, then cover, reduce the heat to low, and simmer until the meat is tender, about 3 hours.
step-13: shred larger pieces of beef with a fork or tongs.
step-14: serve the braised beef and sauce over cooked egg noodles.

step-1: in a pot over low heat, melt the butter, condensed milk, and cocoa powder, stirring continuously until you can see the bottom of the pot for 2-3 seconds when dragging a spatula through.
step-2: pour onto a greased plate, then chill for 1 hour.
step-3: shape and roll the chilled mixture into balls.
step-4: roll the balls in chocolate sprinkles.
step-5: serve and enjoy!

step-1: preheat the oven to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-2: line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
step-3: on a cutting board, slice the potatoes into matchsticks by quartering lengthwise.
step-4: cut the quarters lengthwise into ¼-inch slices, then cut into ¼-inch (6 mm) matchsticks.
step-5: place the potatoes in a large bowl.
step-6: drizzle with the olive oil and sprinkle with 1 teaspoon of salt and ½ teaspoon of pepper.
step-7: toss to coat.
step-8: arrange the fries evenly in 2 rows on each baking sheet so they are not touching.
step-9: bake for 25 minutes, flipping halfway through, until golden brown.
step-10: in a medium saucepan over medium heat, add the butter and flour.
step-11: whisk until the mixture is a golden brown.
step-12: add the beef stock, worcestershire, remaining ½ teaspoon of salt and remaining ½ teaspoon of pepper.
step-13: bring to a boil, whisking continuously.
step-14: add the water to the cornstarch in a small bowl and mix until dissolved.
step-15: add the cornstarch slurry to the gravy and stir until thickened.
step-16: remove from the heat and cover to keep the gravy hot.
step-17: transfer the baked fries to a large bowl, add the cheese curds, and pour the hot gravy over the top.
step-18: toss to coat.
step-19: transfer to a dish and serve immediately.

step-1: heat the olive oil until shimmering over medium heat in a large soup pot.
step-2: add the onion, carrots, celery, and 1 teaspoon each salt and pepper.
step-3: cooking, stirring frequently, until the vegetables are very soft, about 15 minutes.
step-4: add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
step-5: add the stock and bring to a boil.
step-6: make ahead: do not add the noodles or parsley.
step-7: cool and refrigerate the soup in an airtight container for four days, or in the freezer for up to two months.
step-8: reheat on the stove and add the noodles and parsley just before serving.
step-9: add the noodles and cook 6 minutes, then add the chicken and cook about 2 minutes more, until the noodles are cooked through and the chicken is warmed through.
step-10: season to taste with salt and pepper, then stir in the parsley.
step-11: serve topped with parmesan.

step-1: in a medium-sized pan, combine semisweet chocolate chips and heavy cream over low heat, mix until you achieve a smooth consistency.
step-2: pour mixture into a bread pan.
step-3: allow to sit in refrigerator for 1 hour or until mixture is solid.
step-4: with an ice cream scoop, form balls from the mixture (refreeze if truffle begins to melt).
step-5: roll in cocoa powder for topping.

step-1: in a large bowl, season the chicken with salt and pepper.
step-2: toss until well coated.
step-3: tie the thyme sprigs, bay leaves, and parsley stems together with kitchen twine to make a bouquet garni.
step-4: add the bouquet garni to the bowl with the chicken.
step-5: pour the wine over the chicken.
step-6: cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or, even better, overnight.
step-7: in a large dutch oven, cook the bacon over medium-low heat until the fat has rendered and the bacon is crisp, 15 minutes.
step-8: using a slotted spoon, transfer the bacon to a paper towel-lined plate, leaving any excess fat in the pot.
step-9: remove the chicken from the marinade, reserving the liquid, and place on a paper towel-lined sheet pan.
step-10: pat the chicken with more paper towels until completely dry.
step-11: heat the bacon fat over medium heat until nearly smoking.
step-12: working in batches, add the chicken legs skin-side down in a single layer and cook until well browned, 5 minutes per side.
step-13: remove the chicken from the pot and set aside.
step-14: add the carrots, onion, sliced mushrooms, and garlic to the pot.
step-15: cook until the vegetables are softened and lightly browned, about 10 minutes.
step-16: stir in the tomato paste and cook for 3 minutes, until darkened and fragrant.
step-17: then, sprinkle in the flour and cook for another minute, until incorporated.
step-18: pour the brandy into the pot and cook, scraping up any browned bits at the bottom of the pot, until the liquid has evaporated, 2 minutes.
step-19: add the reserved marinade, including the bouquet garni.
step-20: stir to incorporate, then bring to a boil and cook until the liquid is reduced by half, about 15 minutes
step-21: return the chicken and half the cooked bacon to the pot.
step-22: cover, reduce the heat to low, and simmer for 1 hour, until the chicken is tender and the sauce has thickened.
step-23: meanwhile, heat the olive oil and butter in a large, preferably nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
step-24: add the pearl onions and a pinch of salt and sugar.
step-25: cover, reduce the heat to low, and cook for 15 minutes, shaking the skillet often to move the onions around.
step-26: uncover, add the quartered mushrooms, and increase the heat to medium-high.
step-27: continue to cook until all the vegetables have softened, 5-8 minutes.
step-28: add the onions and mushrooms to the coq au vin.
step-29: sprinkle with chopped parsley and the reserved bacon.
step-30: serve with crusty bread.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: grease a 10-inch (25 cm) springform pan with nonstick spray.
step-3: line the inside edges of the pan with parchment paper.
step-4: in the bowl of a food processor, combine the graham crackers, 1 tablespoon of sugar, and the melted butter.
step-5: pulse to combine until the texture is similar to wet sand.
step-6: press the graham cracker crumbs into the prepared pan, using a measuring cup to compact in even layer.
step-7: bake for 8-10 minutes, until golden brown.
step-8: transfer to a wire rack and let cool to room temperature.
step-9: once cool, line the sides of the springform pan with parchment paper.
step-10: in a large bowl, combine the cream cheese, remaining 2 cups (400 g) of sugar, and the salt.
step-11: using an electric hand mixer, blend until well-combined and fluffy.
step-12: add the heavy cream and beat to incorporate.
step-13: add the sour cream, flour, salt, and vanilla bean seeds, and beat to combine.
step-14: add the eggs, 1 at a time, and mix until fully combined, making sure not to over-beat.
step-15: the mixture should be smooth and creamy.
step-16: pour the cream cheese mixture into the cooled crust.
step-17: wrap the outside of the springform pan tightly with foil and place the pan in a large baking dish.
step-18: fill the dish with 1 inch (2 cm) of boiling water.
step-19: gently transfer the baking dish to the oven and bake for 1 hour.
step-20: without opening the oven door, turn off the heat and let the cheesecake rest for 1 hour.
step-21: remove the springform pan from the baking dish and unwrap the foil.
step-22: run a paring knife gently around the outside of the cheesecake to loosen it from the sides of the pan.
step-23: cover the pan with plastic wrap and transfer to the refrigerator overnight.
step-24: remove the cheesecake from the refrigerator and release the springform pan.
step-25: remove the parchment paper lining.
step-26: top with fresh berries, if desired.
step-27: dip a knife into hot water for clean slices, then slice and serve.

step-1: place the eggs in a pot and fill with cold water until the eggs are just covered.
step-2: bring the pot to a boil, then cover, remove from heat, and let sit for about 12 minutes.
step-3: transfer the eggs to a bowl of ice water for about 3 minutes, then peel them and cut them in half.
step-4: transfer the egg yolks to a bowl, and set the cooked egg whites aside.
step-5: mix the mayonnaise, mustard, relish, salt, and pepper with the yolks and transfer to a piping bag.
step-6: (alternatively, use a zip-top bag with a corner cut off.)
step-7: pipe the mixture into the egg whites, garnish with paprika and parsley, and serve chilled.

step-1: soak the chickpeas in the water for at least one night, ensuring that the chickpeas are fully submerged.
step-2: drain the chickpeas in a colander.
step-3: line a baking sheet with paper towels and add the chickpeas.
step-4: cover with more paper towels and let dry for at least 2 hours.
step-5: add the dried chickpeas, parsley, cilantro, coriander, mint, 5 cloves of garlic, onion, paprika, 2 teaspoons of cumin, ground coriander, baking soda, toasted sesame seeds, salt, and pepper, in a blender and blend until smooth.
step-6: use your hands to form falafel the size of a ping pong ball.
step-7: heat oil to 320°f (160°c) in a large pot.
step-8: add the falafel in batches, and fry until golden brown, about 2 minutes.
step-9: to make tahini sauce, heat the sesame seeds in a frying pan over medium heat until the seeds brown slightly.
step-10: let cool for about 5 minutes and pour into a small blender or coffee grinder.
step-11: add the sesame oil and half of the olive oil and blend.
step-12: add the rest of the olive oil and blend again until you get a smooth mixture.
step-13: add ¼ teaspoon of cumin, 2 garlic cloves and lemon juice and blend.
step-14: serve the tahini sauce with falafel.

step-1: to a blender, add the ice, lemon zest, lemon sorbet, and lemonade.
step-2: blend until smooth.
step-3: serve immediately to drink or freeze for 30 minutes to eat with a spoon.

step-1: in a bowl, add the milk, sugar, and yeast together, stirring to combine.
step-2: in a separate bowl, add butter, eggs, and vanilla extract, stirring to combine.
step-3: add the milk mixture to the bowl with eggs, stirring to combine.
step-4: then add the flour in thirds, stirring between each addition.
step-5: pour the dough on a lightly floured surface and knead for 5 minutes until smooth.
step-6: gently press onto the dough with a finger and the dough should bounce back up from the indentation.
step-7: place the dough in an oiled bowl, and thinly cover the dough with oil.
step-8: cover the bowl with plastic wrap.
step-9: let the dough rise in a warm place for an hour or until doubled in size.
step-10: take the dough out and knead on a floured surface for 5 minutes until smooth.
step-11: place the dough in an oiled bowl and repeat with rise overnight in refrigerator.
step-12: roll out the dough on a floured surface until ¼ inch (6 mm) thick.
step-13: cut out the doughnuts and donut holes with a cookie cutter and piping tip, respectively.
step-14: melt enough shortening over medium heat to come up just 2 inches (5 cm) up on the side of a heavy fry pan.
step-15: once liquified, heat the shortening to 375°f (190°c)
step-16: fry for 45 seconds on each side or until golden brown.
step-17: in a bowl, combine the powdered sugar, dry milk powder, vanilla extract and water until smooth.
step-18: sieve the glaze.
step-19: dunk the donuts in the glaze or drizzle the glaze on top.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425 °f (220°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, add the oats, almonds, cinnamon, salt, coconut oil, vanilla extract, maple syrup, and honey.
step-3: mix until well combined.
step-4: transfer the mixture onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and spread into an even layer.
step-5: bake for 20 minutes.
step-6: carefully remove and allow to cool for 10 minutes.
step-7: break up the layer into chunks with your hands.
step-8: store in an airtight container for up to one month.
step-9: serve with greek yogurt and fresh berries, if desired.

step-1: divide the beef into 2 patties, each about ¾-inch (2 cm) thick and 3 ½ inches (9 cm) in diameter.
step-2: transfer the patties to a plate or a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
step-3: remove the patties from the fridge and season on both sides with salt and pepper.
step-4: heat a large cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat.
step-5: add the oil to the pan and swirl to evenly coat.
step-6: place the patties in the skillet and cook, undisturbed, on the first side for 5 minutes, until a brown crust forms.
step-7: flip the patties, top each with a slice of cheese (optional), and cook, undisturbed, until the patties are browned on the other side, the cheese is melted, and the meat is cooked through, about 5 minutes more for medium-well doneness.
step-8: remove the patties from the pan and transfer to a clean cutting board.
step-9: let rest for about 5 minutes.
step-10: place the burger patties on buns and serve with your favorite toppings and sauces.

step-1: preheat the oven to 325˚f (160˚c).
step-2: melt the butter in a medium pan over medium-low heat.
step-3: add the onion, garlic, and salt.
step-4: cook for 12-15 minutes, until the onions are caramelized.
step-5: remove from heat and transfer to a small bowl to cool completely.
step-6: using a fine-mesh strainer, drain crab meat over a bowl.
step-7: in a medium bowl, combine the cream cheese, sour cream, mayonnaise, worcestershire, hot sauce, old bay, and lemon juice.
step-8: using an electric mixer, beat together until well combined.
step-9: with a flexible spatula, fold in the onion mixture, ¾ cup (75 grams) cheddar cheese, and the crab meat.
step-10: transfer the dip to a 1-quart baking dish.
step-11: top evenly with the remaining cheddar cheese.
step-12: bake for 20-25 minutes, until the mixture is just beginning to bubble around the edges and the cheese is melted.
step-13: heat the broiler to low.
step-14: broil dip for 3 minutes, until the whole surface is bubbling and browned.
step-15: remove the dip from the oven.
step-16: let cool for at least 15 minutes, until set.
step-17: garnish the dip with old bay and chives.
step-18: serve with carrot sticks, celery sticks, crackers, and crostini.

step-1: add chickpeas, garlic, tahini, lemon juice, and seasonings to the bowl of a 2-quart food processor.
step-2: blend until smooth.
step-3: while blending, slowly add in the olive oil and water until hummus is creamy and smooth.
step-4: garnish with additional red pepper flakes, chopped parsley, and a drizzle of olive oil.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the dried chickpeas, ½ teaspoon baking soda, and 1½ quarts (1.4 l) of cold water water.
step-2: soak overnight.
step-3: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-4: drain the chickpeas and transfer to a baking sheet.
step-5: sprinkle with 2 teaspoons of baking soda and spread evenly on the sheet.
step-6: bake for 10 minutes.
step-7: transfer baked chickpeas to colander and rinse under cold water.
step-8: massage to remove excess baking soda and begin to loosen the skins.
step-9: in a large pot over high heat, add the rinsed chickpeas, remaining 1½ quarts (1.4 l) of water, and remaining ½ teaspoon of baking soda.
step-10: bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium.
step-11: with a slotted spoon or small sieve, skim away any foam and loose skins that rise to the surface of the water and discard.
step-12: this will ensure the hummus is extra creamy and smooth! continue this process, regularly skimming off any loose skins, for about 20 minutes.
step-13: add the garlic to the pot and continue to cook for another 25-30 minutes, until the chickpeas are very soft and easily fall apart.
step-14: drain the chickpeas and let sit for a few minutes to let any extra moisture drain off.
step-15: transfer the chickpeas to a food processor with the tahini, salt, cumin, and lemon juice.
step-16: process for 2-3 minutes, until the mixture is super smooth.
step-17: with the food processor still running, add the canola oil, hot water, and 2 tablespoons of olive oil.
step-18: continue to process for another 2-3 minutes.
step-19: don’t worry, you can’t over-process it! you want the hummus to be as smooth and creamy as possible.
step-20: to serve, spread the hummus in a wide, shallow bowl.
step-21: if desired, top with tahini sauce, olive oil, and garnish with parsley and aleppo-style pepper.

step-1: make the dough: in a medium bowl, combine the warm water, yeast, flour, and salt.
step-2: mix with a rubber spatula until well-combined and the dough comes together into a ball.
step-3: lightly flour a clean surface, then turn the dough out and knead for 1-2 minutes to smooth and encourage gluten development.
step-4: shape the dough into a ball.
step-5: drizzle the olive oil in a clean large bowl.
step-6: add the dough ball and turn to coat in the oil.
step-7: cover with a kitchen towel and let rise for 1 hour, or until doubled in size.
step-8: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-9: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-10: while the dough is rising, make the filling: add the sausage to a medium nonstick pan over medium heat and cook until no longer pink, 5-6 minutes.
step-11: add the onion, salt, and pepper and continue to cook until the sausage is browned, about 5 minutes more.
step-12: remove from the heat and let cool.
step-13: after the dough has risen, turn it out onto a lightly floured surface.
step-14: divide the dough into 4 portions, then roll each into and round about ¼-inch (½ cm) thick.
step-15: spread ¼ of the sauce over one half of each dough round, leaving a ½-inch (1 cm) border along the edge.
step-16: top each one with 2 slices of ham, 5 pepperoni, ¼ of the sausage and onion mixture, and ¼ cup (25 g) of mozzarella cheese.
step-17: lightly beat the egg with a pinch of salt.
step-18: brush the egg wash on the border of the dough, fold the other half over, and press the edges together.
step-19: starting from one corner, fold the dough over itself in a twist.
step-20: tuck the other corner underneath.
step-21: transfer the calzones to the prepared baking sheet.
step-22: brush lightly with egg wash and score the tops with a knife to allow steam to escape.
step-23: bake for 15-17 minutes, until golden brown.
step-24: let cool for 5 minutes.
step-25: serve the calzones with marinara sauce for dipping, if desired.

step-1: in a medium bowl, beat the eggs.
step-2: melt the butter in a medium frying pan over medium heat.
step-3: pour in the beaten eggs.
step-4: stir and shake the pan, moving the eggs around until a few curds form.
step-5: reduce the heat to low, then flatten the eggs until the still-runny egg covers the entire bottom of the pan.
step-6: add any fillings that you would like.
step-7: let the omelette cook until the eggs are fully set, 1-2 minutes, then gently roll the omelette and transfer to a plate.
step-8: the surface should be smooth with no color.
step-9: sprinkle with chives, if desired.

step-1: soak rice noodles in room temperature water 30 minutes prior to cooking.
step-2: in a small saucepan over medium-high heat, whisk together palm sugar, tamarind paste, and fish sauce.
step-3: bring to a boil, reduce heat, and reduce for 5 minutes until the sauce thickens and coats the back of a wooden spoon.
step-4: remove sauce from heat and set aside.
step-5: heat a cast-iron pan or wok over high heat.
step-6: add oil and chicken and cook for about two minutes until nearly cooked through and nicely seared on all sides.
step-7: add minced garlic, shallots, and turnips to the chicken and stir to incorporate.
step-8: move the chicken to the side of the pan and add the egg.
step-9: break the egg up with a spatula or wooden spoon and stir to scramble.
step-10: add soaked rice noodles and stir to evenly incorporate all ingredients, stirring for 1 to 2 minutes.
step-11: add 2 or 3 tablespoons of the reduced sauce and stir.
step-12: add tofu, chinese chives or green onions, and bean sprouts.
step-13: stir to incorporate and remove from heat.
step-14: serve immediately with lime, peanuts, more sprouts and chives, and red chiles, if desired.

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine the avocado, tomato, red onion, jalapeño, lime juice, salt, and pepper.
step-2: mix together until fully incorporated.
step-3: top with cilantro, if using.
step-4: serve with tortilla chips.

step-1: preheat your oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-2: slice pita bread into eighths and spread chips out on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-3: in a small bowl, combine the olive oil, garlic powder, salt, and pepper, and brush onto both sides of the chips.
step-4: bake for 10-12 minutes until golden and crispy.
step-5: allow to cool.

step-1: in a blender, combine the apple, wine, orange juice, and brandy and blend until smooth.
step-2: place 4 grape halves in each ice pop mold.
step-3: pour the mixture into the ice pop molds, seal with the lids, and add the ice pop sticks.
step-4: freeze until solid, at least 4 hours, or overnight.
step-5: carefully remove the ice pops from the molds.

step-1: preheat oven to 300°f (150°c).
step-2: separate the eggs into two bowls.
step-3: add the cream of tartar to the egg whites and whip into stiff peaks.
step-4: add the cream cheese or yogurt into the yolks and mix until combined.
step-5: fold half of the egg whites into the yolks until just combined.
step-6: add the rest and fold again until incorporated.
step-7: line a baking sheet with parchment paper and place six dollops of the mixture on the tray.
step-8: spread out the circles with a spatula to about ½ inch (1 cm) thick.
step-9: bake for 30 minutes or until golden.
step-10: allow to cool for at least 1 hour.

step-1: preheat the oven to 230°c (450°f).
step-2: separate the egg yolks from the egg whites.
step-3: save the yolks for later.
step-4: place the egg whites in a large bowl.
step-5: using an electric hand whisk, whisk on a high speed until soft peaks form.
step-6: fold in salt and pepper.
step-7: spoon the egg whites onto a baking tray and make a well in the middle, for the yolks to go in later.
step-8: bake for 8-10 minutes.
step-9: drop the yolks into the whites and bake for a further 3 minutes.
step-10: serve on toast or with sides of your choice.

step-1: place the eggs in a large pot and cover with 1 inch (2 cm) of cold water.
step-2: bring to a rolling boil, cover with the lid, and remove from heat.
step-3: let the eggs sit, covered for 8-10 minutes.
step-4: remove from water and immediately place in bath of ice water for a few minutes.
step-5: remove shells and cut the egg in half, vertically.
step-6: remove the yolk and place in a bowl.
step-7: set the cooked whites aside on a serving tray.
step-8: in the bowl with the yolks, add salt, pepper, tomatoes, chicken, bacon, mayonnaise, and mustard.
step-9: mash until everything is well incorporated.
step-10: gently fold in the diced avocado.
step-11: fill each cooked egg white with the mixture, and if you would like to get fancy, garnish with blue cheese and a small strip of bacon.

step-1: prepare 2 boxes of brownie mix according to instructions on box.
step-2: pour into a greased 9x9-inch (23x23-cm) square pan.
step-3: bake according to instructions on box.
step-4: cut each tray of brownies into 25 small squares.
step-5: form each brownie square into a ball, rolling in palms until smooth.
step-6: in a microwave-safe bowl, add the white chocolate chips and microwave in 30 second intervals until smooth, about 1 minute and 30 seconds total.
step-7: in a microwave-safe bowl, add the milk chocolate chips and microwave in 30 second intervals until smooth, about 1 minute and 30 seconds total.
step-8: turn a plastic sandwich bag inside out and hold it from the inside with one hand.
step-9: spoon the white chocolate into the bag.
step-10: turn the bag back out making sure chocolate does not fall out the opening.
step-11: seal it closed.
step-12: cut the corner of the bag, keeping in mind the more you cut off the larger your piping hole will be.
step-13: coat the brownie balls in the melted milk chocolate using a fork.
step-14: place on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and chill until chocolate has hardened, about 20 minutes.
step-15: place one of the milk chocolate brownie bites onto a clean surface.
step-16: using the white chocolate piping bag make one dot in the middle of the ball.
step-17: draw a circle around the dot.
step-18: draw a larger circle around the second circle.
step-19: using a toothpick starting from the inner dot drag the chocolate downward crossing each circle.
step-20: repeat 6 times.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: line a 12-cup muffin tin with paper liners.
step-3: prepare the cake mix according to the package instructions.
step-4: divide the cake batter between 3 medium bowls.
step-5: for the margarita cupcakes: add the zest of 1 lime a bowl of cake batter and whisk to combine.
step-6: for the mudslide cupcakes: add 2 teaspoons of cocoa powder to another bowl of cake batter and whisk to combine.
step-7: for the strawberry daiquiri cupcakes: add 2 tablespoons of strawberry jam to the last bowl of cake batter and whisk to combine.
step-8: pour the batters into the prepared tin.
step-9: bake the cupcakes according to the package instructions, about 15 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center of a cupcake comes out clean.
step-10: remove the cupcakes from the oven and poke the surface of each one with a toothpick at least 8 times.
step-11: for the margarita cupcakes: brush the tops of the cupcakes with 2 teaspoons of tequila.
step-12: for the mudslide cupcakes: brush the tops of the cupcakes with 2 teaspoons of coffee liqueur.
step-13: for the strawberry daiquiri cupcakes: brush the tops of the cupcakes with 2 teaspoons of rum.
step-14: divide the frosting evenly between 3 medium bowls.
step-15: for the margarita cupcakes: to one bowl, add the remaining zest of 1 lime, lime juice, and 2 teaspoons of tequila and stir to combine.
step-16: for the mudslide cupcakes: to another bowl, add the remaining 2 teaspoons of cocoa powder and 2 teaspoons of coffee liqueur and stir to combine.
step-17: for the strawberry daiquiri: to the last bowl, add the remaining 2 tablespoons of strawberry jam and 2 teaspoons of rum and stir to combine.
step-18: pipe each flavor of frosting onto the matching cupcakes.
step-19: sprinkle the margarita cupcakes with lime zest and the mudslide cupcakes with chocolate shavings.

step-1: make the crust: add the crispy rice cereal to a zip-top bag, seal, and crush into crumbs with a rolling pin.
step-2: transfer the crumbs to a large bowl.
step-3: in a medium bowl, combine the chocolate chips and butter.
step-4: microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring between, until melted and smooth, about 1 minute total.
step-5: pour the melted chocolate mixture over the cereal crumbs and stir to combine.
step-6: grease 9½-inch (24-centimeter) pie dish with nonstick spray.
step-7: pour the crust mixture into the dish and press into an even layer against the bottom and up the sides of the pan.
step-8: chill in the refrigerator while you make the mousse.
step-9: make the chocolate hazelnut mousse: microwave the chocolate hazelnut spread for 30 seconds.
step-10: set aside.
step-11: in a large bowl, beat the cold heavy cream with an electric hand mixer until soft peaks form.
step-12: add the sugar and beat to incorporate.
