step-13: using a rubber spatula, fold the warm chocolate hazelnut spread into the whipped cream until incorporated.
step-14: remove the crust from the refrigerator and pour in the mousse.
step-15: spread in an even layer.
step-16: cover the pie with plastic wrap and freeze for at least 6 hours, or overnight.
step-17: make the crispy rice topping: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-18: add the sugar to a medium nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
step-19: cook without stirring for 1-2 minutes, until the sugar begins to caramelize.
step-20: swirl it around in the pan to help caramelize evenly.
step-21: once the sugar is light amber in color, reduce the heat to low and add the butter.
step-22: use a rubber spatula to stir until the butter is melted, then turn off the heat.
step-23: add the crispy rice cereal and toasted hazelnuts and quickly stir to coat.
step-24: transfer the topping to the prepared baking sheet and sprinkle with the salt.
step-25: use two forks to separate the mixture into smaller chunks, being careful not to touch the hot sugar with your hands.
step-26: let cool completely, about 15 minutes.
step-27: the topping can be made 1 day ahead.
step-28: store in an airtight container once cooled.
step-29: when ready to serve, remove the pie from the freezer.
step-30: decorate the top with the crispy rice topping.
step-31: let the pie sit at room temperature for 10 minutes before slicing with a sharp knife.
step-32: warm the blade in hot water and wipe between each cut for clean slices.

step-1: peel bananas and cut in half.
step-2: place popsicle sticks inside bananas and put on tray with parchment paper.
step-3: freeze for 1 to 3 hours depending on how firm you want your bananas to be.
step-4: combine almonds and coconut into a bowl.
step-5: heat semi-sweet chocolate chips in microwave at 30 second intervals until liquified.
step-6: coat bananas in chocolate and sprinkle with the almond and coconut mixture.
step-7: chocolate will harden so move quickly!
step-8: serve immediately or set aside and freeze for an additional 10 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 325˚f (160˚c).
step-2: in medium bowl, add coconut flakes, soy sauce, maple syrup, and liquid smoke.
step-3: mix until thoroughly coated.
step-4: grease pan with coconut oil.
step-5: spread the coated coconut flakes in a thin layer onto a baking sheet.
step-6: bake for 10-15 minutes, flipping every five minutes until golden brown.
step-7: serve with your favorite dish.

step-1: in a pot over low heat, melt the butter, condensed milk, and coconut milk, stirring continuously until you can see the bottom of the pot for 2-3 seconds when dragging a spatula through.
step-2: pour onto a greased plate, then chill for 1 hour.
step-3: shape and roll the chilled mixture into balls.
step-4: roll the balls in coconut flakes.

step-1: pick through the clams and discard any that are open and do not close when firmly tapped–these clams are dead and should not be eaten.
step-2: add the rest to a colander.
step-3: rinse and scrub the remaining live clams to remove any sand or barnacles from the shells.
step-4: fill a bowl large enough to fit the colander with cold water and 3-4 tablespoons of salt for every 6 cups (1.5 liters) of water.
step-5: place the colander in the bowl of salt water and soak the clams for at least 1 hour, up to overnight, so they release any grit and sand.
step-6: the colander allows the grit to fall to the bottom of the bowl.
step-7: live clams will filter the water while they push out any impurities in the process.
step-8: transfer the clams in the colander to another large bowl of fresh water to desalt for 15-30 minutes.
step-9: grill the bread: slice the sourdough baguette into ½-inch (1 cm) pieces.
step-10: brush each slice with olive oil and sprinkle with salt.
step-11: toast the bread on a grill pan over medium-high heat until golden brown and crusty, about 2 minutes per side.
step-12: set aside.
step-13: make the coconut broth: melt the coconut oil in a wok or large pan over medium heat.
step-14: add the red onion and cook until it starts to become translucent, about 3 minutes.
step-15: firmly tap the lemongrass stalks with a wooden spoon to bruise, which helps release aroma and flavor during cooking.
step-16: trim the ends, then slice into approximately 4-inch (10 cm) pieces.
step-17: add the lemongrass to the wok, along with the ginger, garlic, and red pepper flakes.
step-18: cook until fragrant, about 3 minutes.
step-19: carefully pour in the white wine and stir to deglaze the pan.
step-20: bring to a simmer and cook until reduced by half, about 5 minutes.
step-21: add the brown sugar, fish sauce, vegetable broth, and coconut milk.
step-22: bring to a boil.
step-23: add the clams, return to a boil, and cook for 5-8 minutes, or until all of the clams are fully opened.
step-24: if any clams remain closed, discard them.
step-25: discard the lemongrass stalks and divide the clams and broth between serving bowls.
step-26: garnish with scallions and cilantro and serve with the grilled bread for dipping.

step-1: note: if you have unroasted nuts, preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: spread cashews onto a baking tray and bake for 10-12 minutes or until you can smell them.
step-3: in a food processor, blend raw cashews.
step-4: scrape down the sides when necessary.
step-5: nuts should turn into a ball then even out.
step-6: once the mixture looks creamy, add unsweetened coconut flakes and coconut oil.
step-7: blend until well combined.
step-8: pour into a jar, store in a refrigerator and use within one month.

step-1: working 1 at a time, set a coconut on its side on a cutting board.
step-2: first, remove the white husk from one end of the coconut to expose the brown shell underneath.
step-3: holding the coconut in place with one hand on the rounded end, carefully use the back end, or heel, of the knife to puncture the exposed coconut shell.
step-4: do not use any force other than the weight of the knife.
step-5: do this a few times, working in a circle until you can wedge your knife into the coconut shell and pop off the top.
step-6: drain the coconut water into a bowl and reserve for another use.
step-7: with the cut side of the coconut up, place the knife over the opening and cover the spine (dull side) of the knife with a folded kitchen towel.
step-8: using a meat mallet or other heavy kitchen utensil, like a rolling pin, whack the knife where the towel covers it.
step-9: repeat a few times until the coconut is cracked in half.
step-10: with a large spoon, scoop out the coconut meat.
step-11: if necessary, clean the coconut meat by trimming off any hard or woody pieces of the shell.
step-12: with a sharp knife, cut the cleaned coconut meat into 1 x ½-inch (2 ½ cm x 1 ¼ cm) strips.
step-13: in a medium bowl, toss together the coconut meat, mango, red onion, jalapeño, lime zest and juice, coconut milk, mint, and cilantro.
step-14: season with the salt, then stir again.
step-15: cover the bowl and let marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour, up to 3 hours.
step-16: serve the ceviche chilled with tortilla chips or in a tostada shell.

step-1: add the coconut milk, water, and sugar to a pot.
step-2: stir, and bring to boil.
step-3: turn down the heat and add the chai tea bags and cinnamon stick.
step-4: steep for 5 minutes at a low heat.
step-5: add two shots of rum and simmer for a further 2-3 minutes.

step-1: in a large mixing bowl, combine the chicken with the onion, scallions, garlic, cilantro, curry powder, thyme, parsley, salt, and pepper.
step-2: mix and let marinate for at least 1 hour in the refrigerator.
step-3: heat the oil in a medium skillet over medium heat until shimmering, and add the onion and garlic.
step-4: cook for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
step-5: add the curry powder and stir well, cooking for 3-4 minutes more.
step-6: add the scallions and coconut milk, increase the heat to medium-high, and cook for 8-10 minutes, until the coconut milk is boiling and begins to thicken.
step-7: add the marinated chicken and stir well.
step-8: cook the chicken for 5 minutes, or until starting to brown.
step-9: season with pepper.
step-10: add the chicken broth to the pot and stir.
step-11: bring to a rolling boil and cover the pot.
step-12: simmer for 30 minutes, until the sauce thickens into a gravy.
step-13: garnish with cilantro.

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: to make the cream filling whisk together egg yolks, half and half, and coconut milk in a medium saucepan over medium/low heat.
step-3: once combined, add in sugar and corn starch, stirring constantly until the mixture thickens and comes to a light boil.
step-4: remove from heat and mix in the shredded coconut and vanilla extract.
step-5: cover with plastic wrap and chill at least two hours.
step-6: to make the puff, combine the butter, water, coconut milk, and salt in a medium saucepan over medium heat.
step-7: allow all the butter to melt and bring the mixture to a boil.
step-8: as soon as the mixture begins to boil, reduce heat to medium-low and add in the flour.
step-9: using a wooden spoon, mix thoroughly to incorporate the flour.
step-10: continue stirring until the dough starts to pull away from the sides and a thin film forms on the bottom of the pan (about three minutes).
step-11: remove the mixture from heat and transfer to a large mixing bowl.
step-12: let the dough cool slightly.
step-13: add in the eggs, one at a time, being sure to fully incorporate each egg before adding the next.
step-14: once the dough comes together, transfer it to a piping bag.
step-15: pipe onto a parchment-paper-lined baking sheet into 1½-inch (3 ¾ cm) mounds.
step-16: smooth out any peaks/ridges cause by piping with a wet fingertip (this will ensure your puffs cook evenly and maintain a nice ball shape).
step-17: then brush the dough with egg wash and place in preheated oven.
step-18: bake for 15 minutes at 425˚f (220°c).
step-19: then, without opening the oven, reduce heat to 350˚ (180˚c) and bake for an additional 15 minutes.
step-20: remove puffs from oven.
step-21: using the tip of a knife, cut a small “x” into the bottom of each puff and transfer (“x” side up) to a cooling rack.
step-22: just before serving (or up to two hours in advance), pipe the cream filling into the cooled puffs.
step-23: sprinkle with powdered sugar.

step-1: in a food processor, pulse the cauliflower until it reaches your desired “rice” consistency.
step-2: in a large skillet over medium heat, heat oil, then add cauliflower rice and let cook for 5 minutes., stirring occasionally.
step-3: add coconut milk, lime juice and lime zest, combine well and allow to cook until the liquid has evaporated.
step-4: garnish with cilantro.

step-1: add the kale, banana, mango, kiwi, coconut oil, cinnamon, and turmeric to a resealable container.
step-2: cover and store in the freezer for up to 3 months.
step-3: when ready to prepare, add the contents from the container and the almond milk to a blender and blend until smooth.

step-1: in a bain-marie, melt the butter, sugar, and cocoa powder.
step-2: stir in the egg and keep stirring for a minute until the mix thickens.
step-3: remove the bowl from heat.
step-4: add the graham cracker crumbs, the almonds (chopped finely), and the coconut flakes.
step-5: when well mixed, pour into an 8x8 inch (20x20 cm) pan and flatten until you get an even layer.
step-6: cream the custard powder, softened butter, and coconut milk until smooth.
step-7: add the powdered sugar and the shredded coconut and mix until smooth.
step-8: pour the mixture on top of the crust and spread it until you get an even layer.
step-9: in a bain-marie, slowly melt the chocolate and the butter.
step-10: cool it down a little bit then pour it over middle layer.
step-11: chill the bars for at least 3 hours.
step-12: cut them into 9 even squares and sprinkle each one with shredded coconut.

step-1: gently heat the milk in a saucepan over a medium heat.
step-2: stir in the white chocolate, cinnamon, and rum.
step-3: take off the heat and pour into a tall glass.
step-4: top with whipped cream, marshmallows, and white chocolate shards.

step-1: in a small bowl, stir together the salt, pepper, garlic powder, and paprika.
step-2: place the shrimp on a cutting board and pat dry with paper towels.
step-3: season the shrimp on both sides with the spice mixture.
step-4: add the flour, eggs, and panko to 3 separate shallow bowls.
step-5: add the coconut flakes to the bread crumbs and stir to combine.
step-6: dredge the shrimp in the flour, shaking off any excess.
step-7: dip the floured shrimp in the beaten egg, then into the panko mixture.
step-8: transfer the breaded shrimp to a baking sheet until ready to fry.
step-9: heat 3 inches (7 ½ cm) of canola oil in a heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat until it reaches 350˚f (180˚c).
step-10: working in batches, fry the shrimp in the hot oil until golden brown on both sides, 2-3 minutes, turning halfway through.
step-11: transfer the shrimp to a wire rack to drain.
step-12: in a large bowl, whisk together the lime juice, lime zest, sesame oil, brown sugar, and sriracha.
step-13: using tongs, toss the rice noodles in the sauce until fully coated.
step-14: divide the noodles between 4 bowls.
step-15: top with the carrot ribbons, avocado, coconut shrimp, cucumber, basil, mint, cilantro, and scallions.
step-16: sprinkle with black sesame seeds, if using.

step-1: in a medium saucepan, combine the rice, bell pepper, carrots, jalapeño, 2 teaspoons salt, thai kitchen coconut milk, and water, then stir to combine.
step-2: turn the heat to medium-high and bring to a boil.
step-3: cover, reduce the heat to low, and simmer for 10–12 minutes or until the rice is tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
step-4: in a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
step-5: once the oil is almost smoking, lay each fillet in the pan.
step-6: sear until fish releases from pan with ease and is golden brown, about 5 minutes.
step-7: using a fish spatula, flip each fillet and sear on the other side until cooked through, about 3 minutes.
step-8: to serve, scoop rice onto each plate and top with a cod fillet.
step-9: serve with lime wedges.

step-1: in a large bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, sour cream, lemon juice, vinegar, honey, salt, and pepper.
step-2: add the green cabbage, red cabbage, and carrot, and toss to coat.
step-3: cover and chill until ready to serve.

step-1: heat water and milk in a pot over medium heat.
step-2: bring to a boil and add 4 eggs.
step-3: without stirring, add green onions and tomatoes.
step-4: let eggs cook for about 5 minutes, or until the egg yolks are just barely firm.
step-5: salt to taste (optional).
step-6: serve one egg per bowl and add broth.
step-7: garnish with cilantro and use bread to dip - we used sourdough, but any bread will do.

step-1: add water and red cabbage to a medium-size pot.
step-2: bring the water to a boil, then strain the cabbage in a sieve over a bowl to reserve the blue liquid.
step-3: pour the strained blue water into an ice tray.
step-4: you will be left with 1 cup (235 ml) of blue water.
step-5: reserve the water and freeze the ice tray for 6 hours, or overnight.
step-6: add the reserved blue water to a pot with the sugar and bring to a boil until the sugar has dissolved.
step-7: set aside.
step-8: combine the lime juice with 1½ (355 ml) cups of water and stir to combine.
step-9: pour the lime mixture into an ice tray and freeze for 6 hours, up to overnight.
step-10: add the blue ice cubes to a blender and blend until finely crushed.
step-11: put the crushed blue ice in a glass.
step-12: wash the blender well.
step-13: add the lime ice cubes and 8 mint leaves.
step-14: blend until finely crushed.
step-15: put the crushed lime and mint ice on top of the blue ice.
step-16: slowly pour the white rum and blue simple syrup.
step-17: top with a sprig of mint.

step-1: mix crushed graham crackers and butter in a bowl.
step-2: transfer the mixture to the bottom of a 9-inch (23 cm) springform pan, spread evenly.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: place each gelatin flavor in separate bowls, dissolve with ⅔ cup (160 ml) hot water, then, add more ⅔ cup (160 ml) cold water.
step-5: refrigerate for 2-3 hours or until set.
step-6: cut the gelatin into small pieces, reserve.
step-7: for the cream cheese filling in a bowl, mix condensed milk, cream, cream cheese until well combined.
step-8: hydrate the unflavored gelatin and microwave for 20 seconds to dissolve.
step-9: add the gelatin in the cream cheese mixture and mix well.
step-10: place the flavored gelatin pieces over the cheesecake crust.
step-11: pour the cream cheese mixture over the gelatin carefully.
step-12: refrigerate for 3-4 hours or until set.
step-13: garnish with mixed berry sauce.

step-1: in a large pot over medium heat, combine the butter, water, milk, sugar, and salt.
step-2: whisk until the butter is melted and the mixture is steaming, about 5 minutes.
step-3: quickly whisk the all-purpose and whole wheat flours and the baking powder into the hot milk mixture.
step-4: continue cooking, stirring constantly, for 5 more minutes.
step-5: remove the pot from heat and stir with a spatula to cool the dough.
step-6: when the dough is no longer hot to the touch, add the eggs one at a time, stirring to incorporate before adding the next.
step-7: add the vanilla and sprinkles and stir to distribute evenly.
step-8: transfer the dough to a piping bag or zip-top bag fitted with a large star tip.
step-9: on a parchment-lined baking sheet, pipe 4-inch (10-cm) circles of dough.
step-10: chill in the freezer until solid, about 20 minutes.
step-11: meanwhile, make the glaze: in a large bowl, combine the powdered sugar, milk, vanilla, and cream cheese.
step-12: whisk until smooth and runny.
step-13: set aside.
step-14: heat the oil in a large pot until it reaches 350°f (180°c).
step-15: carefully add the crullers to the hot oil.
step-16: fry about 3 at a time for 4-5 minutes, flipping halfway, until golden brown.
step-17: the fried crullers should feel much lighter than they were originally.
step-18: transfer the fried crullers to a wire rack set over a baking sheet.
step-19: while still warm, dip one side of the crullers in the glaze.
step-20: return to the wire rack and allow excess glaze to drip off.
step-21: top with sprinkles.

step-1: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-2: scoop the softened ice cream onto the baking sheet, distributing evenly.
step-3: use a large offset spatula to spread the ice cream in an even layer.
step-4: cover the ice cream with a second piece of parchment paper.
step-5: freeze for at least 6 hours, up to overnight.
step-6: place another baking sheet in the freezer to chill.
step-7: fill a bowl large enough to fit the cookie cutter with hot water.
step-8: remove the empty chilled baking sheet from the freezer and line with parchment paper.
step-9: remove the ice cream from the freezer.
step-10: peel the top layer of the parchment paper off the ice cream.
step-11: working quickly, dip the cookie cutter in the hot water and press into the ice cream to cut out shapes.
step-12: you may need to wiggle the cookie cutter around a little to get the shape to release.
step-13: use an offset spatula to transfer the shapes to the clean baking sheet.
step-14: return to the freezer.
step-15: fill a medium bowl with very hot water.
step-16: remove the ice cream pops from the freezer.
step-17: place a metal skewer into the hot water for 10 seconds.
step-18: working carefully and quickly, insert the skewer 3 inches (7 cm) into the base of a pineapple pop.
step-19: remove the skewer and immediately insert a popsicle stick into the space created by the skewer.
step-20: repeat with the remaining pops.
step-21: return the pops to the freezer for 1 hour.
step-22: while the pops set, make the magic shell.
step-23: in a wide and shallow microwave-safe dish, combine the white chocolate chips and coconut oil.
step-24: microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring between, until melted and smooth.
step-25: continue stirring the magic shell until it cools down, about 3 minutes.
step-26: add the yellow food coloring, a few drops at a time, and stir until a pale, buttercup yellow color is achieved.
step-27: remove the ice pops from the freezer.
step-28: pick up a pop by the stick and quickly dip the ice cream into the magic shell to coat completely.
step-29: sprinkle green sanding sugar over the top section of the pineapple to resemble the crown.
step-30: repeat with the remaining pops.
step-31: return the pops to the freezer for 10 minutes to set and harden completely.
step-32: store in the freezer until ready to eat.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, prepare the cake batter.
step-3: divide the batter evenly among a lined muffin tin, filling halfway.
step-4: place a small ball of cookie dough on each, then top with remaining batter, filling about ¾ of the way up.
step-5: bake for 20 minutes, then cool.
step-6: pipe the frosting onto each cupcake, then top with chocolate chips.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: prepare brownie mix according to package instructions.
step-3: sprinkle flour on a baking sheet and bake for 5 minutes to kill any lingering bacteria.
step-4: in a medium bowl mix together the flour, milk, sugar, butter, salt, and vanilla.
step-5: stir in chocolate chips.
step-6: pour cookie dough on top of baked and cooled brownies and spread evenly with a spatula.
step-7: cool in the refrigerator.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a bowl, mix the cream cheese and sugar until fluffy.
step-3: add sour cream and vanilla.
step-4: mix thoroughly.
step-5: add the eggs, one at a time, mixing thoroughly after each one.
step-6: press a package of pre-made cookie dough into a springform pan.
step-7: pour the cheesecake mixture in.
step-8: optional, drop half teaspoonfuls of cookie dough on top of the cheesecake batter.
step-9: bake for one hour, cool completely, then refrigerate overnight.
step-10: serve with chocolate syrup.

step-1: in a large bowl, beat together butter and brown sugar.
step-2: mix in cream cheese and white sugar until well combined.
step-3: add flour, baking soda, salt, and vanilla until dough is formed.
step-4: stir in mini chocolate chips.
step-5: roll cookie doughs into small balls and set aside.
step-6: in a small microwave-safe bowl melt chocolate chips.
step-7: (microwave for 60 seconds, check and stir every 15 seconds.)
step-8: line a muffin tin with lining cups.
step-9: spoon the melted chocolate into the bottom of each muffin cup.
step-10: place the cookie dough balls (slightly flattened) on top of the melted chocolate.
step-11: pour the remaining melted chocolate over the cookie dough balls.
step-12: gently shake the muffin tin to even out the chocolate.
step-13: chill in the fridge for at least 30 minutes.

step-1: in a medium bowl, add almond flour, coconut flour, and coconut sugar.
step-2: stir to combine.
step-3: add the nut butter and coconut oil.
step-4: combine until the mixture resembles cookie dough.
step-5: fold in dark chocolate chunks.
step-6: transfer the “cookie dough” into an 8x8-inch (20x20-cm) parchment paper-lined baking dish and mold it with your hands to fit the dish.
step-7: transfer to freezer while making the chocolate layer.
step-8: in a microwave safe bowl or measuring cup, melt chocolate and coconut oil and then pour on top of the cookie dough, making sure to spread it evenly across.
step-9: sprinkle with sea salt and freeze.
step-10: when ready, slice into squares, and serve.
step-11: try with different combinations.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (175˚c).
step-2: evenly spread the flour out on a sheet pan, and bake for 5 minutes to kill bacteria.
step-3: in a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar.
step-4: add the milk and vanilla, and mix until thoroughly incorporated.
step-5: add the baked flour and mix, and gently fold in chocolate chips.
step-6: using a small spoon, scoop out dime-sized rounds of the dough and transfer to a sheet pan.
step-7: freeze for a minimum of an hour.
step-8: in a large bowl, add the cream and condensed milk, then whip until soft peaks form.
step-9: fold in the frozen cookie dough, then transfer to a baking pan.
step-10: top with additional cookie dough chunks if desired.
step-11: freeze for 3-4 hours.

step-1: in a large bowl, mix together brown sugar and softened butter.
step-2: mix in vanilla extract and milk until well-combined.
step-3: add flour and salt, and continue mixing until you’ve reached a dough-like consistency.
step-4: spread the “dough” mixture evenly on the bottom of a parchment-lined 9 × 9 inch (22 x 22 cm) pan.
step-5: sprinkle about half of the chocolate morsels over the dough so that they are evenly distributed, and then press the morsels into the dough with a sheet of parchment paper.
step-6: scoop softened ice cream on top of the dough mixture, and spread evenly.
step-7: freeze overnight or until frozen.
step-8: in a small bowl, melt the remaining chocolate morsels with coconut oil until smooth.
step-9: lift ice cream out using the parchment, then cut into an 8 x 8 grid.
step-10: evenly coat each piece with the melted chocolate.
step-11: place back in the freezer for 30 minutes.

step-1: using a serrated knife, cut the pint of ice cream crosswise into 3 equal discs.
step-2: lay out 3 chocolate chip cookies and place a pint slice on top of each.
step-3: remove the ice cream packaging.
step-4: freeze for 30 minutes.
step-5: in a microwave-safe bowl, combine the chocolate chips and coconut oil, and microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring after each, until the chocolate is silky smooth.
step-6: let the chocolate cool to room temperature, about 5 minutes.
step-7: remove the ice cream and cookies from the freezer and use a spoon to drizzle chocolate on the top and off the sides of each ice cream slice.
step-8: top with the remaining 3 chocolate chip cookie and freeze for 30 minutes more before serving.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: prepare 1 box of yellow cake mix according to instructions on box.
step-3: add chocolate chips to the cake batter.
step-4: grease two 8-inch (20 cm) cake pans, and pour batter into each pan.
step-5: bake according to box instructions.
step-6: remove cake from pans and let cool.
step-7: prepare for the cookie dough by evenly spreading flour out on a baking tray and baking for 5 minutes.
step-8: this will cook out any potential bacteria in the raw flour.
step-9: in a large bowl, mix flour, sugar, butter, vanilla, milk, chocolate chips, and salt until combined evenly.
step-10: if flour is clumpy after baking, use a siever to help get out the clumps.
step-11: take a cake pan and line it with plastic wrap.
step-12: then fill the pan with half of the cookie dough mixture.
step-13: take the other half of the cookie dough mixture, and roll it into small balls to be used as a garnish.
step-14: refrigerate cookie dough layer and dough balls for 30 minutes.
step-15: in a large bowl, mix butter, powdered sugar, heavy cream, vanilla extract, and salt with hand mixer.
step-16: use a serrated knife to cut the round top off of the cake so the cakes are even and flat.
step-17: spread a light layer of buttercream at the center of the cake stand.
step-18: place the first cake on a cake stand, and spread a light layer of buttercream at the center.
step-19: remove cookie dough layer from the pan using the plastic wrap, and place layer on top of the cake.
step-20: spread a light layer of buttercream at the center of the cookie dough layer.
step-21: place second cake on top.
step-22: shave down the edges of the cake if necessary so that each layer evenly fits over the other.
step-23: add the remaining amount of buttercream to the top layer of cake, and frost the cake completely.
step-24: top with cookie dough balls.
step-25: slice and serve.

step-1: on a small baking sheet, bake the flour at 350˚f (180˚c) for 5 minute to kill potential bacteria.
step-2: in a large mixing bowl, combine flour, brown sugar, butter, milk, vanilla, salt, and chocolate chips.
step-3: mix well and freeze.
step-4: roll out prepared brownie and cut into 32 squares (8 rows of 4).
step-5: using a melon baller or your hands, form cookie dough into size of a truffle.
step-6: form brownie square around cookie dough and seal it around the ball of cookie dough.
step-7: dip brownie in bowl melted chocolate, covering the entire ball, then chill.

step-1: in a medium bowl, mix together the cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla until smooth.
step-2: ice the cookies with the cream cheese frosting
step-3: top with the fruit.

step-1: preheat the oven to 325˚f (160˚c).
step-2: place the sugar cookie dough sheet on a lightly floured surface.
step-3: sprinkle the flour over the dough and knead together.
step-4: roll out the dough to a ¼-inch (6-mm) thick square.
step-5: top with sprinkles and lightly roll out the dough again so the sprinkles become submerged in the dough.
step-6: place a spoon on top of the dough and trace its shape with a paring knife.
step-7: reroll the dough as needed to cut out 8 spoons.
step-8: arrange spoons upside-down on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-9: lightly grease with nonstick cooking spray.
step-10: place each cookie spoon cutout on top of a spoon.
step-11: lightly press down to mold.
step-12: bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the cookie dough is light brown.
step-13: cool for 10 minutes before carefully removing the cookies from the spoons.
step-14: microwave the milk chocolate chips and coconut oil together in a glass measuring cup or bowl in 30-second intervals, until the chips are completely melted.
step-15: dip each cookie spoon in chocolate and let dry on a wire rack for about 10 minutes.
step-16: serve with ice cream, if desired.

step-1: place the chocolate sandwich cookies inside a plastic bag and use a rolling pin to crush them into small chunks.
step-2: add of the crush cookies to the melted white chocolate and mix it together.
step-3: transfer the mixture to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, spreading in an even layer with a spatula.
step-4: sprinkle the remaining cookies over the top.
step-5: drizzle the chocolate over the bark.
step-6: freeze for at least 1 hour.
step-7: remove the bark from the freezer and break it into pieces.

step-1: press cookies into brownie batter before baking.
step-2: slice and serve.

step-1: add the angel food cake mix, crushed cookies, and white cake mix to a jar.
step-2: cover with the lid.
step-3: store in the pantry for up to 3 months.
step-4: when ready to eat, remove the lid from the jar.
step-5: pour the water into the dry cake mix.
step-6: mix thoroughly, making sure to scrape the dry mix from the bottom of the jar.
step-7: microwave for 60 seconds, until cooked through.
step-8: top with whipped cream, chocolate syrup, and crushed chocolate cookies, if desired.
step-9: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f(180°c).
step-2: in a mixing bowl blend, cream cheese, butter, and sugar until fully combined.
step-3: add flour to cream cheese mixture and continue to blend together until fully combined.
step-4: add crushed cookies to the mixture and gently fold together.
step-5: ensure the cheesecake batter is fully mixed.
step-6: cover with plastic wrap and chill in refrigerator for 30 minutes, or until batter is firm to touch.
step-7: roll batter into small balls and place on a parchment lined baking sheet.
step-8: using your fingers or a warm spoon press down on the dough balls to help form a cookie shape.
step-9: bake for 12-15 minutes or until cookies turn golden brown on the bottom.
step-10: place cookies on a cooling rack and rest for at least 5 minutes.

step-1: take 20 cookies and separate the cookies from the cream filling.
step-2: reserve the filling in a medium bowl and place the cookies in a food processor.
step-3: process the cookies until broken down to a fine dust, about 1 minute.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: chop the remaining 10 cookies into small pieces.
step-6: add the heavy cream to a large bowl.
step-7: using an electric hand mixer, beat the heavy cream until stiff peaks form, about 2 minutes.
step-8: to the bowl with the reserved cream filling, add the cream cheese.
step-9: using the hand mixer, beat together until smooth and creamy.
step-10: gently fold the whipped cream into the cream cheese mixture, then fold in the chopped cookies.
step-11: refrigerate until ready to assemble the sandwiches.
step-12: in a medium bowl, mix together the flour, cookie crumbs, baking powder, and salt.
step-13: in a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, sugar, vanilla, milk, and water.
step-14: sift the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients, about ⅓ at a time.
step-15: use a rubber spatula to stir the batter together.
step-16: transfer the batter to a 32-ounce (905 g) squeeze bottle with a wide tip (trimmed if necessary).
step-17: fill a small pot, no more than 6 inches (15 cm) wide, ⅔ of the way with canola oil and heat over medium heat until the temperature reaches 350˚f (180˚c).
step-18: starting from the outside and working inward, squeeze a 4-inch (10 cm) wide circle of batter in the center of the hot oil and in a circular fashion, fill in the center of the circle to create the funnel cake.
step-19: fry for 90 seconds on each side, until golden brown.
step-20: transfer to a paper towel-lined baking sheet to drain.
step-21: repeat with remaining batter.
step-22: scoop 2 ounces of filling onto a funnel cake and top with another cake.
step-23: repeat with the remaining cakes and filling.
step-24: dust with powdered sugar, then serve immediately.

step-1: place cookies in a resealable bag and crush with a wooden spoon until crumbs.
step-2: set aside
step-3: separate the egg whites into a bowl.
step-4: add in sugar, vanilla, melted butter, and salt.
step-5: mix until combined.
step-6: sift the flour and add it to the bowl along with the cookie crumbs and milk.
step-7: note: add more milk if too thick.
step-8: mix until combined.
step-9: heat a nonstick skillet over a medium heat and pour in a ¼ cup (60 ml) of batter.
step-10: swirl around the pan until coated.
step-11: cook until the surface begins to bubble and flip.
step-12: cook for another couple of minutes and then transfer to a baking tray.
step-13: quickly roll into a cone shape and hold until set (about a minute).
step-14: cool and top with your favorite ice cream and additional cookie crumbs.

step-1: preheat oven to 285ºf (140ºc).
step-2: in a medium bowl, beat the egg whites until frothy.
step-3: keep beating and slowly add sugar until stiff peaks form.
step-4: sift powdered sugar, cookie crumbs, almond flour, and cocoa powder over the egg whites.
step-5: fold the dry mixture into the egg whites completely, but make sure to not overmix or the macarons will not rise.
step-6: once the batter reaches a lava-like consistency, add the food coloring.
step-7: mix until just combined, without over mixing.
step-8: place the mixture into a piping bag or zip-top bag.
step-9: cut of the tip to pipe.
step-10: pipe 1½-inch (4 cm) dollops onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-11: tip: take a little batter to “glue” down the edges of the parchment paper so it stays put.
step-12: let the cookies rest at room temperature for 30 minutes to an hour, until they are no longer wet to the touch and a skin forms on top.
step-13: while resting, make the filling by mixing the butter, powdered sugar, cookie cream filling, vanilla, and milk in a bowl until smooth.
step-14: transfer to a piping bag and set aside until ready to fill.
step-15: when the cookies are dry to the touch, bake for 15-18 minutes until they have risen.
step-16: let rest for 10 minutes before filling.
step-17: to fill, pipe about about a tablespoon of the buttercream onto one macaron and place another on top.
step-18: macarons are best kept refrigerated until serving.

step-1: separate the cream from the chocolate sandwich cookies.
step-2: place the cookies in a plastic bag and the cream in a small bowl.
step-3: using a rolling pin, crush the cookies until they are finely ground.
step-4: microwave the cream from the chocolate sandwich cookies for 2 minutes.
step-5: in a chilled medium bowl, beat the heavy cream using a hand mixer until thick and frothy.
step-6: add the cream from the cookies and the powdered sugar.
step-7: beat until stiff peaks form.
step-8: fold in the chocolate sandwich cookie crumbs, saving some as topping for later.
step-9: spoon into a piping bag or plastic bag with a piping tip.
step-10: pipe into serving bowls or glasses.
step-11: top with remaining chocolate sandwich cookie crumbs and half of a chocolate sandwich cookie, if desired.
step-12: serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

step-1: using the back of a wooden spoon, poke at least 3 rows of 4 holes in the cooked cake, making 12 holes total.
step-2: in a large bowl, add the packet of cookies and cream pudding mix and the milk and whisk until there are no lumps.
step-3: add the whipped topping and the crushed chocolate cookies.
step-4: stir until well-combined and set aside.
step-5: pour the sweetened condensed milk over the cake and let settle into the holes for about 10 minutes.
step-6: some of the mixture will still stay on top, which is okay.
step-7: spread the pudding mixture mixture and smooth it out evenly.
step-8: sprinkle extra crushed cookies on top.
step-9: chill the cake for at least 3 hours or up to overnight.

step-1: add eggnog and sandwich cookies to a blender.
step-2: blend until well-combined.
step-3: add blended eggnog mixture and ice cream to slow cooker.
step-4: stir.
step-5: cook on high for 1 hour, stirring occasionally.
step-6: top with whipped cream and sprinkle on cookie crumbs.

step-1: in a medium bowl, mix white chocolate and coconut oil.
step-2: melt in microwave for 60 seconds.
step-3: stir every 15 seconds until melted.
step-4: add extract into melted chocolate.
step-5: place cereal in large bowl.
step-6: mix in melted chocolate and stir until evenly coated.
step-7: in a large plastic bag, add powdered sugar, cereal mix and the crushed cookies.
step-8: close and shake until each cereal is coated with sugar.

step-1: pour the cookies into a ziplock bag, fasten, and bash into crumbs using a rolling pin.
step-2: pour half of the cookie crumbs into a bowl and mix with the cream cheese.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: prepare the doughnut mixture by combining the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl.
step-5: make a well in the middle of the dry ingredients.
step-6: add the milk, melted butter, and sunflower oil into the well of dry ingredients.
step-7: mix together with a fork until a dough is formed.
step-8: start rolling the dough into golf ball-size balls and then flatten using your thumb.
step-9: spoon in a teaspoon of the cream cheese mixture and a square of chocolate.
step-10: close the dough with your hands, pinching the seams if necessary, and roll into a ball.
step-11: heat up the liter of sunflower oil in a pan until it reaches 375°f (190.5°c).
step-12: deep-fry the doughnut balls for about 4-5 minutes, until golden brown.
step-13: then leave donuts to drain and cool on a wiring rack or paper towel.
step-14: drizzle over the melted white chocolate and remaining half of the cookie crumbs.

step-1: preheat oven to 300°f (150°c).
step-2: separate sandwich cookies by gently twisting them apart.
step-3: put the cookies in one bowl and the filling in another.
step-4: in a saucepan over medium heat, heat heavy cream and cream filling, whisking until the filling has melted but stopping just before boil.
step-5: add vanilla and remove from heat.
step-6: cover and set aside.
step-7: in a bowl, whisk egg yolks and half of the sugar.
step-8: add the cream mixture a little at a time, tempering the egg yolks until all incorporated.
step-9: place ramekins on a baking pan and fill to the top with cream mixture.
step-10: in a ziplock bag, crush the cookies until fine.
step-11: sprinkle 1 tablespoon of the cookie crumbs over each ramekin.
step-12: fill the pan with boiling water.
step-13: bake for 45 minutes.
step-14: cover and refrigerate for 2 hours.
step-15: when set, add 2 teaspoons of sugar to the tops of the ramekins.
step-16: shake to make even, and broil or torch until the sugar is caramelized.

step-1: separate the cream center from the chocolate cookies, and set aside.
step-2: crush the chocolate cookies and set aside.
step-3: in a pot over low heat, melt the butter, condensed milk, and cream centers, stirring continuously until you can see the bottom of the pot for 2-3 seconds when dragging a spatula through.
step-4: pour onto a greased plate, then chill for 1 hour.
step-5: shape and roll the chilled mixture into balls.
step-6: roll the balls in the crushed chocolate cookies.

step-1: preheat oven to 325°f (165°c) and grease a 9x13 (23x33 cm) baking pan.
step-2: prepare the brownie mix in a bowl.
step-3: in a separate bowl, mix together the cream cheese and the sugar until there are no lumps.
step-4: add the egg and vanilla, stirring until evenly combined.
step-5: spread the brownie batter in an even layer on the bottom of the pan.
step-6: place 24 of the sandwich cookies in a single layer on top of the brownie batter.
step-7: to fill in the edges, cut 6 of the cookies in half and nudge those in.
step-8: pour the cheesecake batter on top, spreading it evenly over the cookies.
step-9: crush the remaining 6 cookies and sprinkle on top of the cheesecake batter.
step-10: bake for about 45 minutes, until the edges are slightly golden brown and the middle is slightly jiggly.
step-11: cool and chill for at least 2 hours.
step-12: slice and serve!

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, whisk together the cream cheese, powdered sugar, and vanilla extract, stirring until smooth.
step-3: pour half of the cake batter into the bottom of a greased bundt cake pan, smoothing it with a spatula.
step-4: with an ice cream scoop, scoop the cream cheese mixture evenly onto the cake batter, making sure that it does not touch the sides of the cake pan.
step-5: place a chocolate sandwich cookie on top of the cream cheese scoops, making a circle around the ring of the pan.
step-6: pour the rest of the cake batter on top of the cookies, smoothing it evenly.
step-7: bake for 45 minutes, then cool completely.
step-8: invert the cake onto a wire rack set on top of a baking tray.
step-9: to make the glaze, microwave the chocolate and the cream together in 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until the glaze is smooth and glossy.
step-10: pour the glaze over the cake, letting the excess drip off the wire rack and onto the baking tray.
step-11: once the glaze has set, slice the cake, and serve,

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: using a knife, separate the cream from the cookies, and place them in two separate bowls.
step-3: crush cookies in a blender or a food processor until fine.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: in a pot over low heat, combine egg yolks, half & half, sugar, and cornstarch.
step-6: turn the heat up to medium-high, whisking constantly to prevent any lumps.
step-7: once the mixture starts to thicken, add in half of the cookie cream, stirring until smooth.
step-8: transfer the cream mixture into a bowl, covering the top with plastic wrap and pressing the wrap down onto the surface of the cream to prevent a skin from forming.
step-9: chill.
step-10: in a pot, combine the water and butter, bringing it to a boil.
step-11: add the flour and ½ cup (40 grams) of the crushed cookie mixture, stirring until the dough comes together in a ball.
step-12: remove from heat.
step-13: add in the eggs one a time, stirring until the dough becomes a paste.
step-14: transfer the dough into a piping bag with a large round tip.
step-15: on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper, pipe 1-inch mounds.
step-16: bake for 20-25 minutes until the pastry has risen considerably and the insides are dry.
step-17: transfer the chilled pastry cream into a piping bag with a small tip.
step-18: poke a hole in the center of the bottom of each cream puff and fill each puff with the pastry cream.
step-19: microwave the remaining cookie cream for 30 seconds, stirring until smooth.
step-20: dip the top of each filled cream puff into the cookie cream, dripping off any excess.
step-21: sprinkle any remaining cookies crumbs on top of each cream puff.

step-1: separate oreos with a butter knife and place cookies in one bowl, and cream filling in another larger bowl.
step-2: crush cookies and set aside.
step-3: pour white chocolate chips into the bowl with the cream filling and melt in the microwave 20 seconds at a time, stirring each 20 seconds until melted.
step-4: pour 4 cups of cereal into a container that has a lid.
step-5: pour white chocolate mixture into the container and cover with the lid.
step-6: shake until well coated.
step-7: pour ½ cup powdered sugar into the container and shake again until well coated.
step-8: set aside.
step-9: melt chocolate chips and coconut oil in the microwave in 20 second increments.
step-10: stirring each 20 seconds until melted.
step-11: pour 4 more cups of cereal into another container that has a lid.
step-12: pour melted chocolate mixture over the cereal and cover with the lid.
step-13: shake until well coated in chocolate.
step-14: pour cocoa powder and the remailing ¼ cup of powdered sugar over chocolate coated cereal.
step-15: cover and shake again until well coated.
step-16: combine the chocolate-coated cereal, white chocolate-coated cereal, and crushed cookies in a bowl.
step-17: enjoy right away, or wrap in cellophane or other decorative bag for gifts!

step-1: preheat oven to 325°f (160°c).
step-2: take a golf ball-size handful of cookie dough and press it flat.
step-3: place a sandwich cookie in the center, then fold the cookie dough around the edges, making sure there are no gaps.
step-4: press and shape the dough around the cookie, then repeat with remaining dough and cookies.
step-5: place them on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, and bake for 14 minutes.

step-1: in a food processor, finely crush the cookies, reserving about 2 tablespoons of the mixture for sprinkling on top of the truffles.
step-2: in a large bowl, combine cookie crumbs and cream cheese, stirring until evenly mixed.
step-3: chill the mixture for about an hour or until the mixture can be rolled into a ball and hold its shape.
step-4: roll ping pong–sized balls with the mixture.
step-5: dip the truffles in the melted white chocolate and place on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
step-6: sprinkle some of the cookie crumbs on top of the chocolate-coated truffle before the chocolate hardens.
step-7: repeat with the rest of the truffles, reheating the chocolate if necessary.

step-1: crush the chocolate cookies in a resealable bag and pour into a large bowl.
step-2: reserve ¼ cup (25g) of the crushed cookies for topping.
step-3: pour melted butter into the large bowl and stir until combined.
step-4: spread out over the bottom of a parchment lined baking sheet, and press down to make a crust.
step-5: freeze for 30 minutes.
step-6: spread greek yogurt over the hardened cookie crust and top with the reserved crushed cookies.
step-7: freeze again for 3 hours or until frozen.
step-8: remove from baking sheet and break bark apart.

step-1: separate the cream and cookies from 15 chocolate sandwich cookies into 2 medium bowls.
step-2: place the cookie halves in a zip-top bag and crush with a rolling pin until fine crumbs form.
step-3: melt the cookie cream in the microwave for 30 seconds, or until melted.
step-4: in a large bowl, whip the heavy cream and vanilla until thickened and soft peaks form.
step-5: add the sweetened condensed milk, melted cookie cream, and cookie crumbs.
step-6: fold with a spatula until combined.
step-7: line a separate large bowl with the remaining sandwich cookies.
step-8: pour in the cream mixture and smooth the top to cover.
step-9: cover and freeze overnight, or until solid.
step-10: invert onto a serving plate, allowing the ice cream dome to release from the bowl.
step-11: slice and serve.

step-1: in a mixing bowl, combine chocolate with sweetened condensed milk and melt in the microwave in 15-second increments.
step-2: once chocolate is fully melted, add in chopped cookies and stir until combined.
step-3: pour chocolate mixture into a parchment paper-lined 8x8 inch (20x20 cm) baking tin.
step-4: chill for 2 hours or until the fudge is firm.
step-5: cut into bite-sized pieces.

step-1: combine cake mix, sandwich cookies, oil, and eggs in a mixing bowl.
step-2: using an ice cream scoop or your hand, form golf ball-sized balls of cookie dough and transfer to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-3: bake at 350°f (180°c) for 10-12 minutes.

step-1: in a large bowl, add the cream and condensed milk, then whip until soft peaks form.
step-2: add the cookies and gently fold to combine.
step-3: transfer mixture to a baking pan.
step-4: top with additional cookies if desired, then freeze for 3-4 hours.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, cream together the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar with an electric hand mixer.
step-3: add the eggs, one at a time, and beat until incorporated.
step-4: add the vanilla and beat until combined.
step-5: sift in the flour, cocoa powder, salt, and baking powder.
step-6: beat until combined.
step-7: divide the dough into 4 equal portions.
step-8: place a portion of dough between 2 sheets of parchment paper and roll out into a circle that is about 11 inches (27 cm) wide.
step-9: using a 10-inch (25 cm) springform pan as your guide, cut a 10-inch (25 cm) circle out of the dough
step-10: use a 3-inch (8-cm) ramekin as a guide to cut out the center, leaving a doughnut-shaped cookie.
step-11: reserve the dough scraps and transfer the cookie on the parchment paper to a baking sheet.
step-12: repeat with the remaining dough portions.
step-13: chill the cookie dough in the freezer for 10 minutes.
step-14: bake the cookies (in batches, if necessary) for 12-14 minutes, until crisp around the edges.
step-15: let cool completely.
step-16: reroll the dough scraps and use a cookie cutter to cut out 24 1½-inch-wide (4-cm) cookies.
step-17: transfer the cookies to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and chill in the freezer for 10 minutes.
step-18: bake the cookies for 7 minutes, until crisp.
step-19: let cool completely.
step-20: make the whipped cream: add the heavy cream to a large bowl.
step-21: with an electric hand mixer, whip the cream until soft peaks form, then add the sweetened condensed milk.
step-22: continue whipping until stiff peaks form.
step-23: transfer to a piping bag or zip-top bag fitted with a large round tip.
step-24: carefully place one of the large cookies on a serving platter.
step-25: pipe a layer of whipped cream on top of the cookie.
step-26: repeat with the remaining cookies and whipped cream, finishing with a layer of cream.
step-27: reserve any leftover whipped cream for sandwich cookie garnish.
step-28: chill the cake in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours or overnight.
step-29: after the cake has chilled, make sandwich cookies for decoration.
step-30: pipe a dollop of whipped cream onto a small cookie and sandwich with another cookie.
step-31: make 9 more cookie sandwiches.
step-32: place the remaining cookies in a plastic bag and use a rolling pin to smash into crumbs.
step-33: arrange the sandwich cookies evenly around the top edge of the cake.
step-34: sprinkle the cookie crumbs over the exposed whipped cream.
step-35: slice and serve.

step-1: take 24 cookie sandwiches and remove the filling from the center.
step-2: collect those in one small bowl, and collect the cookies in another small bowl.
step-3: place remaining cookies in a resealable bag and smash the cookies with a pan into fine crumbs.
step-4: save the white filling for later.
step-5: in a medium-sized pan, combine white chocolate chips, heavy cream, and cookie sandwich fillings over low heat.
step-6: mix until you achieve a smooth consistency.
step-7: pour mixture into a bread pan.
step-8: allow to sit in the refrigerator for an hour to cool down.
step-9: with an ice cream scoop, form balls from the mixture (refreeze if truffle begins to melt).
step-10: in a small bowl, melt semisweet chocolate.
step-11: on a cutting board, crush cookies.
step-12: dip the truffle in melted semisweet chocolate.
step-13: roll in cookie crumbs.
step-14: place back in the fridge for 10 minutes.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350ºf (175ºc).
step-2: carefully slice 3 gold potatoes into ⅛-inch (3 mm) slices using a knife or mandoline.
step-3: in a large bowl, mix chips with ingredients.
step-4: arrange chips on greased baking sheet
step-5: bake for 30-35 minutes.

step-1: in a small bowl, mix together the ranch dressing mix, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, and salt.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: melt the coconut oil in a large pot over medium heat.
step-4: add 3-4 popcorn kernels and cover with the lid.
step-5: once they pop, add the rest of the kernels and cover, shaking every 10 seconds, until they begin pop.
step-6: once the pops are more than 3 seconds apart, turn off the heat and let sit for 15 seconds to allow any final kernels to pop.
step-7: uncover and drizzle the olive oil over the popcorn.
step-8: carefully toss to coat.
step-9: sprinkle the cool ranch spice mixture over the popcorn and stir to coat evenly.
step-10: transfer to a bowl and eat immediately, or spread in a single layer on a baking sheet and let cool completely before storing in a sealed container for up to 2 days.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: peel and dice apples.
step-3: stir water and baking powder together in a small bowl.
step-4: combine the baking powder-water mixture, butter, brown sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt in a medium-size skillet over medium-high heat.
step-5: whisk together until combined and mixture has become thick and bubbly.
step-6: add apples and stir until they are fully coated and tender.
step-7: lay pastry out and flatten with rolling pin so that it is about ¼-inch (6cm) thick throughout.
step-8: slice pastry into 12 rectangles.
step-9: spoon apple mixture onto top 6 rectangles.
step-10: dip your finger in water and line the outer rim of each rectangle before sandwiching apple filling between two rectangles.
step-11: using a fork, press the sides around each rectangle to seal the filling in.
step-12: whisk an egg and brush it over the top of each pie then place them on a greased baking sheet.
step-13: using a knife, make 3 or 4 slits in each pie.
step-14: bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown.
step-15: fold a rectangle of parchment paper in half horizontally
step-16: take the bottom corners and fold up ¾ of the way and then ⅔ of the way.
step-17: flip the rectangle over and fold the left third into the center, taking the right third and folding it into the “wing” created by the middle fold.
step-18: flip this pocket over and use to hold and travel with an apple pie.

step-1: combine paprika, onion powder, salt, garlic powder, rosemary, pepper, and oregano in a small bowl and mix well.
step-2: reserve 1 tablespoon of the spice mix and set aside.
step-3: in a large ziplock bag, place the quartered chicken and spice mix.
step-4: marinate for 1 hour or overnight.
step-5: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-6: add the carrots, potatoes, and corn to a bowl and drizzle with oil and remaining 1 tablespoon of spice mix and toss until thoroughly coated.
step-7: heat a large pan with oil over high heat.
step-8: add the chicken pieces and cook until golden brown on both side.
step-9: set aside.
step-10: place the chicken and veggies on a sheet of aluminium foil.
step-11: top with butter and thyme.
step-12: fold the foil over the chicken and vegetables and cinch the edge so that no air can escape.
step-13: bake for 45 minutes, or chicken is completely cooked.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f/200°c.
step-2: add the warm water to a large bowl with the melted butter, sugar and yeast.
step-3: stir to help the yeast dissolve and let the mixture sit for 5 minutes, or until it becomes foamy on top.
step-4: add in the flour and salt (optional) to the yeast mixture.
step-5: use a mixing spoon to incorporate the wet and dry ingredients until it comes together into a sticky ball.
step-6: cover the dough with a towel and place in a warm part of your kitchen.
step-7: let rise for 1½ hours, or until it doubles in size.
step-8: remove the risen dough from the bowl and knead on the counter with extra flour until the dough becomes smooth on the surface and no longer sticky.
step-9: with a rolling pin, flatten the dough until it’s about a 7x12 inch (18x30 cm) rectangle, and slice into 12 strips.
step-10: if you don’t have a rolling pin, you can cut the dough into 12 portions and roll each into 7 inch (18 cm) logs with your hands.
step-11: place the dough on parchment paper-lined baking sheets with cooking spray.
step-12: brush melted butter and sprinkle garlic salt on the dough.
step-13: bake the breadsticks for 15 minutes or until golden brown.
step-14: when the breadsticks come out of the oven, serve immediately, or cool and store in the freezer for up to 6 months to eat at a later date.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, combine the creamed corn, zucchini, flour, garlic powder, paprika, salt, pepper, and cornmeal and stir until well combined.
step-3: grease a baking sheet with nonstick spray.
step-4: using a ¼ cup (30 grams) measuring cup, scoop the batter into pancakes on the baking sheet.
step-5: bake for 10 minutes.
step-6: flip and brush with olive oil, then bake for another 10-15 minutes, until golden brown.
step-7: serve with avocado crema and scallions.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: to make the cornbread, place the cornmeal in a large bowl and sift in the flour, salt, baking powder and baking soda, and whisk to combine.
step-3: in a separate bowl, beat together the eggs, buttermilk, milk and honey.
step-4: whisk the cornmeal mixture into the liquid mixture.
step-5: do not overwork the batter.
step-6: use a tablespoon of the melted butter to grease a 9” (23 cm) baking pan.
step-7: whisk the rest of the melted butter into the batter just until combined.
step-8: bake 35-40 mins until tester comes out clean.
step-9: set aside to cool.
step-10: turn oven down to 350°f (180°c).
step-11: in a cast iron pan, brown the chorizo until the fat is rendered out.
step-12: remove chorizo from pan and set aside.
step-13: remove half of the fat from the pan and discard.
step-14: in the same chorizo pan, add potatoes, onions, carrots, celery, garlic and saute until soft and caramelized.
step-15: place the cubed cornbread and hawaiian rolls on a baking sheet in a single layer.
step-16: toast in the oven until golden brown.
step-17: in a large bowl, mix together chorizo and cooked vegetables.
step-18: carefully mix in stock, adding in increments until moist but not wet to avoid mushy stuffing.
step-19: season to taste with salt and pepper.
step-20: place stuffing in a baking dish and top with a few slices of butter, place in the oven and bake for about 15 minutes.
step-21: garnish with chopped cilantro and serve immediately.

step-1: in a large saucepan over medium heat–melt the butter.
step-2: add the marshmallows and food coloring–stirring constantly–until the marshmallows have melted.
step-3: remove from heat and fold in corn flakes until all the cereal is coated.
step-4: drop onto wax paper until cool enough to touch (but still warm).
step-5: form cooled/warm clusters into wreaths and finish by pressing in cinnamon candies to decorate.

step-1: over a large bowl, crumble the cornbread into fine crumbs until you have about 2 cups (200 g) worth.
step-2: add the red pepper, green onion, mayonnaise, sour cream, parsley, cilantro, garlic, beaten eggs, old bay seasoning, olive oil, salt, pepper, and crab meat to the bowl.
step-3: break up the crab meat into fine pieces until it is all uniform in size.
step-4: mix all the ingredients together with your hands or a wooden spoon until evenly combined.
step-5: form the mixture into small patties, about 2.5 inches (6 cm) in diameter and ¾-inch (2 cm) thick and set aside.
step-6: add enough vegetable oil to a large skillet to come about ¼-inch (6 mm) up the sides.
step-7: heat the oil over medium-high heat until it reaches 350˚f (180˚c).
step-8: fry the crab cakes in batches, about 3-4 at a time.
step-9: cook on each side until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes.
step-10: transfer to a paper-towel lined plate to drain.
step-11: serve with your choice of dipping sauce, or they’re great just on their own!

step-1: first, make tia’s cornbread at least one day before serving the stuffing.
step-2: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-3: generously grease a 9-inch (23 cm) baking pan with 1 tablespoon of butter.
step-4: in a small bowl, mix the cornmeal, flour, baking powder, sugar and salt.
step-5: in another bowl, whisk together the melted butter, buttermilk, corn, honey and eggs.
step-6: using a rubber spatula, add the wet ingredients to the dry and mix just until combined.
step-7: do not overmix.
step-8: pour the batter into the prepared pan.
step-9: bake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 20 to 22 minutes.
step-10: let cool for at least 1 hour, then cut into 1-inch cubes for the stuffing.
step-11: for the stuffing, start by cutting the cornbread into cubes.
step-12: spread 4 cups of white bread cubes and 4 cups of the cornbread cubes in a single layer on a baking sheet and leave out overnight to dry out.
step-13: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-14: grease a 13x9x2-inch (33x23x2 cm) baking dish with butter and set aside.
step-15: transfer the bread cubes to a large bowl.
step-16: in a large sauté pan set over medium-high heat, melt 2 tablespoons butter.
step-17: add the onion, garlic, celery, fennel and sprinkle with the salt and cook until the vegetables are translucent, about 5 minutes.
step-18: add the mixture to the bowl of bread and mix.
step-19: in the same sauté pan, add the remaining 2 tablespoons butter and let brown for 30 seconds.
step-20: add the apples and nutmeg and sauté until the apples are tender, 3 to 4 minutes.
step-21: add the apples to the bread bowl and mix.
step-22: add the sausage to the pan and cook, breaking it up as it browns, 8 to 10 minutes.
step-23: transfer the sausage to the bread bowl and mix.
step-24: mix in the parsley and sage.
step-25: transfer the bread mixture to the buttered baking dish.
step-26: pour the chicken stock around the edges of the baking dish.
step-27: put the baking dish on the middle oven rack and bake at 400°f (200°c), uncovered for 40 minutes, until golden brown.

step-1: grease a waffle iron with melted butter or nonstick spray.
step-2: set the heat to medium.
step-3: in a large bowl, whisk together the melted butter, milk, vinegar, sugar, and egg.
step-4: add the flour, cornmeal, baking soda, baking powder, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper and whisk to incorporate.
step-5: fold in the cheddar cheese with a rubber spatula.
step-6: pour 1 scant cup (260 g) of batter onto the waffle iron and cook until golden brown, about 5 minutes.
step-7: repeat with the remaining batter.
step-8: serve the waffles warm and topped with chili, more cheddar cheese, sour cream, and green onions.

step-1: in a very large pot, combine the water, kosher salt, brown sugar, pink curing salt, garlic, ginger, cinnamon stick, bay leaves, mustard seeds, peppercorns, allspice berries, juniper berries, and cloves.
step-2: stir and bring to a boil over high heat.
step-3: once the brine is boiling, remove from the heat and add the ice to bring the temperature below 45˚f (7˚c).
step-4: place the brisket in a large plastic storage container with a lid.
step-5: pour the cooled brine over the meat.
step-6: cover and brine the beef in the refrigerator for 5–7 days, flipping once a day.
step-7: once the brisket is brined, remove the beef from the liquid and transfer to a pot large enough for it to sit flat on the bottom.
step-8: add the onion, celery, carrot, ginger beer, and beer.
step-9: bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and gently simmer for 2½–3 hours, or until the meat is fork-tender.
step-10: remove the meat from the pot and let cool.
step-11: if making corned beef and cabbage, reserve the cooking liquid.
step-12: otherwise, discard.
step-13: thinly slice the brisket against the grain for sandwiches or corned beef and cabbage, or dice for corned beef hash.
step-14: return the corned beef cooking liquid to a boil over medium-high heat.
step-15: (if starting with new cooking liquid, combine the chicken broth, water, chopped carrots, celery, and onion in a large pot and bring to a boil.)
step-16: once the cooking liquid is boiling, add the potatoes and cook for 10 minutes, until half-cooked.
step-17: add the halved carrots and cabbage, cover, and cook for 10–15 minutes more, until the vegetables are tender.
step-18: transfer the vegetables to a serving platter with the sliced brisket and ladle the cooking liquid over.

step-1: in a very large pot, combine the water, kosher salt, brown sugar, pink curing salt, garlic, ginger, cinnamon stick, bay leaves, mustard seeds, peppercorns, allspice berries, juniper berries, and cloves.
step-2: stir and bring to a boil over high heat.
step-3: once the brine is boiling, remove from the heat and add the ice to bring the temperature below 45˚f (7˚c).
step-4: place the brisket in a large plastic storage container with a lid.
step-5: pour the cooled brine over the meat.
step-6: cover and brine the beef in the refrigerator for 5–7 days, flipping once a day.
step-7: once the brisket is brined, remove the beef from the liquid and transfer to a pot large enough for it to sit flat on the bottom.
step-8: add the onion, celery, carrot, ginger beer, and beer.
step-9: bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and gently simmer for 2½–3 hours, or until the meat is fork-tender.
step-10: remove the meat from the pot and let cool.
step-11: if making corned beef and cabbage, reserve the cooking liquid.
step-12: otherwise, discard.
step-13: thinly slice the brisket against the grain for sandwiches or corned beef and cabbage, or dice for corned beef hash.
step-14: melt the butter in a large cast-iron skillet over medium heat.
step-15: add the potatoes and onion and season with salt and pepper.
step-16: cook for about 5 minutes, until lightly browned.
step-17: add the corned beef, garlic, paprika, and worcestershire sauce.
step-18: cook for another 1–2 minutes, until the beef is warmed through and slightly crisped.
step-19: remove the pan from the heat.
step-20: serve the hash with the eggs and garnish with chives.

step-1: in a very large pot, combine the water, kosher salt, brown sugar, pink curing salt, garlic, ginger, cinnamon stick, bay leaves, mustard seeds, peppercorns, allspice berries, juniper berries, and cloves.
step-2: stir and bring to a boil over high heat.
step-3: once the brine is boiling, remove from the heat and add the ice to bring the temperature below 45˚f (7˚c).
step-4: place the brisket in a large plastic storage container with a lid.
step-5: pour the cooled brine over the meat.
step-6: cover and brine the beef in the refrigerator for 5–7 days, flipping once a day.
step-7: once the brisket is brined, remove the beef from the liquid and transfer to a pot large enough for it to sit flat on the bottom.
step-8: add the onion, celery, carrot, ginger beer, and beer.
step-9: bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and gently simmer for 2½–3 hours, or until the meat is fork-tender.
step-10: remove the meat from the pot and let cool.
step-11: if making corned beef and cabbage, reserve the cooking liquid.
step-12: otherwise, discard.
step-13: spread the mustard on both sides of the toasted rye bread.
step-14: lay the corned beef and pickles on one slice of bread and top with the other slice.
step-15: cut the sandwich in half crosswise.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the eggs, melted butter, salt, and milk.
step-2: whisk well.
step-3: sift in the flour and cornmeal and slowly whisk to incorporate.
step-4: let the batter sit for at least 30 minutes, or up to 4 hours.
step-5: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-6: place 2 12-cup muffin tins in the oven as it preheats.
step-7: remove the hot muffin tins from the oven and brush with butter, then return to the oven for 5 minutes.
step-8: remove the muffin tins from the oven and distribute the batter evenly among the muffin cups, filling them almost to the rim.
step-9: bake for 15 minutes, then reduce the oven temperature to 350˚f (180˚c) and bake for 15 minutes more, until the popovers are lightly browned and puffed.
step-10: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat a grill or grill plate to medium heat.
step-2: drizzle the corn with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
step-3: mix to ensure all the ears are evenly coated.
step-4: place the corn on the grill.
step-5: close the lid to keep the temperature high, and let the corn cook for about 15 minutes per side, or until slightly charred on all sides.
step-6: remove the corn from the heat and set aside.
step-7: in a small bowl mix the chili powder and cayenne together.
step-8: in another small bowl, mix the lime juice and mayo together in a bowl, and spread or drizzle on the ears of corn.
step-9: sprinkle the spices over the corn.
step-10: top the corn with cotija cheese.

step-1: remove the outer leaves from the cauliflower and trim the stem so the cauliflower can sit upright on a cutting board.
step-2: using a serrated knife, carefully cut the cauliflower into 1-inch (2.5 cm) thick slabs.
step-3: reserve any florets that fall off as you are cutting.
step-4: you should get 3 to 4 “steaks.”
step-5: fill a large, shallow pan with 1½-2 inches (4-5 cm) of water.
step-6: bring to a gentle boil over medium heat.
step-7: add 2 teaspoons salt.
step-8: working in batches, gently lower cauliflower steaks into the water.
step-9: they should be just barely submerged.
step-10: cook for 4-5 minutes, until the stems can be pierced easily with a fork but are still slightly firm.
step-11: transfer the steaks to paper towels to drain.
step-12: repeat with the remaining steaks.
step-13: cook reserved florets for 2-3 minutes, until pierced easily with a fork.
step-14: drain cooking water from the pan and wipe dry.
step-15: melt the butter in the same pan over medium heat.
step-16: add the shallot and garlic and sauté until softened, about 2 minutes.
step-17: add the mushrooms, sage, thyme, and 1 teaspoon of salt and cook until the mushrooms begin to release their juices and brown, about 5 minutes.
step-18: stir in 3 tablespoons flour, mixing well to coat the mushrooms.
step-19: cook for 2-3 minutes, until the flour just starts to brown.
step-20: pour in 2 cups (480 ml) milk and stir well to incorporate.
step-21: bring to a gentle boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes, until the sauce thickens.
step-22: season with salt and pepper to taste.
step-23: remove from the heat and cover to keep warm until ready to serve.
step-24: in a shallow dish, mix together the remaining flour, the cornstarch, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, and 2 teaspoons salt.
step-25: in a separate shallow dish, whisk to combine the eggs with the remaining milk.
step-26: working in batches, dip the cauliflower steaks and florets in the flour mixture, turning to coat completely.
step-27: dip in the egg mixture, letting any excess egg drip off.
step-28: dredge once more in the flour mixture, shaking off any excess flour or clumps.
step-29: heat 1½ inches (3 cm) of canola oil in a large, high-sided pan until a deep-fry thermometer reaches 325˚f (160˚c).
step-30: working in batches, carefully lower 1-2 cauliflower steaks at a time into the hot oil.
step-31: cook for 3-4 minutes on one side, then flip and cook for another 2-3 minutes, until deep golden brown.
step-32: transfer to paper towels to drain and repeat with the remaining cauliflower steaks and florets.
step-33: pour the gravy over the cauliflower steaks and garnish with parsley and black pepper.
step-34: serve the florets with gravy in a small bowl, for dipping.

step-1: preheat the oven to 225˚f (110˚c).
step-2: set a steak in the center of a cutting board and cover with a piece of plastic wrap.
step-3: using a meat mallet, pound the steak evenly to ¼-inch (½ cm) thick.
step-4: season with salt and pepper on both sides.
step-5: repeat with the remaining meat.
step-6: in a wide, shallow dish, whisk together the eggs and 1 cup (240 ml) of milk.
step-7: in a separate shallow dish, mix together the 1 ½ cups (190 g) of flour, pepper, salt, garlic powder, onion powder, and paprika.
step-8: dredge the steaks in the flour mixture, then dip in the egg mixture, letting any excess egg drip off.
step-9: coat again in the flour mixture.
step-10: set aside for 10-15 minutes, until the coating has dried out a bit.
step-11: meanwhile, heat the oil in a 10-inch (25.5 cm) pan over medium-high heat until it reaches 375˚f (190˚c).
step-12: fry the steaks, 2 at a time, for 3 minutes, until golden brown and crispy.
step-13: flip and cook on the other side for 3 minutes more, until golden brown and cooked through when the internal temperature reaches 155˚-165˚f (170˚-175˚c).
step-14: transfer the steaks to a paper towel-lined plate or baking sheet and immediately season with salt.
step-15: once all of the steaks are done frying, transfer to the oven while you prepare the gravy.
step-16: pour the hot oil into a heatproof bowl and let cool before discarding.
step-17: leave any browned bits in the pan.
step-18: in the same pan, without wiping it out, melt the butter over medium heat.
step-19: add the remaining 3 tablespoons of flour, whisking to incorporate.
step-20: cook for 2-3 minutes, until the roux is a light brown color.
step-21: add the heavy cream and remaining milk.
step-22: bring to a simmer and cook, whisking constantly, until thickened, 5-7 minutes.
step-23: season with salt and pepper.
step-24: ladle the gravy over the steaks and serve with your favorite side dishes.

step-1: preheat oven to 450°f (230°c).
step-2: in a bowl, whisk together the dry biscuit ingredients.
step-3: cut in the butter and shortening until mixture is crumbly.
step-4: mix in buttermilk and knead until it forms a dough.
step-5: cut dough into 5 cylinders, 4 inches (10 cm) in diameter.
step-6: place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-7: bake 15-20 minutes, until golden brown.
step-8: in another bowl, mix the mayo, honey, and sriracha.
step-9: split the biscuits in half.
step-10: spread honey sriracha mayo on one half.
step-11: lay 3 slices of country ham on the other half.

step-1: in a 6-quart/6-liter dutch oven, cook chicken over medium-high heat until brown on both sides.
step-2: once chicken pieces are browned, remove and set aside.
step-3: add carrot and onion and cook until just tender, about 3 minutes.
step-4: add garlic and stir for another minute.
step-5: reduce heat to medium-low and add butter and flour, stirring constantly for 3 minutes to avoid lumps.
step-6: add chicken and any accumulated juices back to dutch oven and stir to coat in roux/vegetable mix.
step-7: add chicken broth, cream, thyme, and bay leaves and bring to a simmer.
step-8: once soup is at a simmer, add frozen peas and cover.
step-9: in a separate bowl, combine flour, baking powder, salt, pepper, and cream.
step-10: stir until mixture comes together into single mass of dough.
step-11: using a large spoon or ice cream scoop, form dough into small round balls about 1 inch in diameter (this dough mixture should yield 14-16 dumplings).
step-12: place dough balls into simmering soup (making sure they don’t touch), add fresh parsley, and cover.
step-13: let soup simmer for 15 minutes or until dumplings are cooked (they should pass the toothpick test).
step-14: ladle into bowl, giving 1-2 dumplings per serving.

step-1: in a large bowl, whisk together the shallot, parsley, chives, egg, mayonnaise, dijon mustard, lemon juice, worcestershire sauce, and cayenne if using.
step-2: add the crabmeat, season with salt and pepper and stir to combine.
step-3: add the breadcrumbs and mix just to combine.
step-4: form into 6 equal patties and place on a plate.
step-5: chill in the refrigerator for at least 15 minutes, up to 1 hour.
step-6: coat the cakes lightly with flour, and shake off any excess.
step-7: in a large skillet set over medium heat, melt the butter.
step-8: fry the crab cakes until golden and crisp, 3-4 minutes per side.
step-9: transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain slightly
step-10: serve warm with tartar sauce and lemon wedges.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (175°c) degrees.
step-2: line cookie sheet with foil & spray with non-stick cooking spray.
step-3: line crackers end to end on sheet, breaking crackers to fit the end if necessary.
step-4: in a saucepan, melt butter on low heat.
step-5: once melted, add brown sugar and turn heat to medium.
step-6: continue stirring until boiling – then boil for 3 minutes (set timer).
step-7: pour over crackers, spread evenly working quickly.
step-8: put sheet into oven – bake for 5 minutes.
step-9: remove – pour chocolate chips over top – place a sheet of foil over and let melt for 3 minutes.
step-10: spread melted chocolate over the top evenly.
step-11: add nuts to top – replace foil and refrigerate until set.
step-12: (can be frozen.)
step-13: break up into pieces.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, gently combine apples, lemon juice, cranberries, cornstarch, sugar, syrup, and cinnamon.
step-3: pour into a 9x13-inch (23x33cm) baking dish and bake for 30 minutes.
step-4: in another bowl, combine oats, brown sugar, flour, butter, and salt until well-incorporated.
step-5: sprinkle the oat topping evenly over the baked fruit and bake for another 15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown.
step-6: serve with ice cream on top.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: to make the flax eggs, mix together the flax meal and water in a small bowl.
step-4: let sit for at least 10 minutes to set.
step-5: in a large bowl, whisk together the coconut oil, granulated sugar, brown sugar, flax eggs, and almond extract until well-combined.
step-6: sift in the flour, baking powder, and baking soda, and stir with a spatula until combined.
step-7: fold in the oats, cranberries, and sliced almonds until incorporated.
step-8: use an ice cream scoop to scoop the cookies onto the prepared baking sheet, spacing about 2 inches (5 cm) apart.
step-9: bake for 20-22 minutes, until lightly golden around the edges.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: in a microwave-safe bowl, microwave orange juice for 30 seconds until warm.
step-3: add cranberries to juice and let it soak for 10 minutes.
step-4: in a medium bowl, combine cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla extract.
step-5: mix until smooth.
step-6: unfold puff pastry, and 1 inch (2 ½ cm) from the top, fill the middle row with cream cheese mixture, and top with the cranberries.
step-7: leave 1 inch (2 ½ cm) at the bottom.
step-8: with a knife, carefully slice diagonal strips on both sides, leaving 1 inch (2 ½ cm) from the top and bottom.
step-9: cut off the top and bottom excess pieces.
