step-10: fold the top inch (2 ½ cm) dough onto the filling, then lay the dough in a criss-cross pattern to form the braid.
step-11: before the last couple strips, fold up the bottom and lay the remaining strips over.
step-12: whisk an egg and brush it over the top of the braid.
step-13: add almonds or other nuts.
step-14: bake for 25 minutes
step-15: cut into desired size and drizzle the icing.

step-1: preheat the oven to 170°f (80°c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: in a food processor, combine the cranberries, lemon juice, lemon zest, and maple syrup.
step-4: process until smooth.
step-5: spread the puree on the prepared baking sheet into an 8x11-inch (20x28 cm) rectangle about ¹⁄₁₆ inch (1 mm) thick.
step-6: bake for 6 hours, or until no longer sticky to the touch.
step-7: let cool completely.
step-8: roll the fruit sheet in the parchment paper.
step-9: trim the ends, then slice crosswise into 1-inch (2 cm) pieces.

step-1: pour the champagne into an 8-ounce (125 ml) champagne flute.
step-2: add the dried cranberries, cranberry juice, and lemon juice to the glass.
step-3: garnish with a slice of lemon.
step-4: serve and enjoy!

step-1: add all ingredients to the pot and bring to boil.
step-2: bring down to a simmer for 20 minutes.

step-1: line an 8-inch (20 cm) square baking dish with parchment paper.
step-2: add the pecans, dates, cranberries, salt, milk, and vanilla to a food processor and pulse until the mixture starts to clump together.
step-3: transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish and press into an even layer.
step-4: chill for 1 hour.
step-5: remove the bars from the baking dish by lifting the parchment paper.
step-6: cut into 12 individual bars.
step-7: serve immediately or store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.

step-1: mix softened cream cheese, sharp cheddar, dried cranberries, pecans, and green onions until well-combined.
step-2: form into a ball, then roll in chopped pecans to coat.
step-3: serve with crackers of your choice.

step-1: in a blender, puree the apple juice, cranberry sauce, and salt until smooth.
step-2: pour the juice into a 4-quart jumbo cooker, add the cinnamon stick, and bring to a simmer over medium heat.
step-3: add the pears to the simmering juice, and cook, turning occasionally, until the pears are tender when pierced at the thickest part with a paring knife, 25-30 minutes.
step-4: remove the pan from the heat and let the pears cool completely in liquid, about 1 hour, or refrigerate in liquid for up to 2 days.
step-5: in a large bowl, beat the heavy cream, sugar, and vanilla with an electric hand mixer until medium peaks form.
step-6: divide the pear halves among 6 serving bowls and top each with a dollop of whipped cream and drizzle with some of the poaching liquid.
step-7: crumble 2 cookies over each bowl and serve.

step-1: add the cranberries to food processor and purée into a smooth paste.
step-2: add the cranberry purée to a small saucepan with the simple honey syrup and rosemary.
step-3: simmer over medium heat for 5 minutes, until slightly reduced.
step-4: let cool completely, then strain into an airtight glass container and store in the refrigerator for up to 2 months.
step-5: to serve, mix 1-2 tablespoons of cranberry rosemary syrup with 8 ounces of seltzer water in a glass over ice.
step-6:
nutrition, per 1 tablespoon 
calories: 16 
sugars: 4 grams

step-1: in a medium pot over medium-high heat, whisk together the water and cranberry sauce until combined.
step-2: bring to a boil, then transfer to a large bowl.
step-3: add the gelatin and whisk to dissolve.
step-4: add the vodka and whisk to combine.
step-5: strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve to remove any solids.
step-6: divide the mixture between small cups.
step-7: cover with plastic wrap, then let set in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours, or overnight.
step-8: garnish with orange twists.

step-1: in a blender, combine the cranberry sauce, frozen strawberries, banana, ice, milk, greens, and orange zest.
step-2: blend until smooth.

step-1: in a small bowl mix the cream cheese filling ingredients.
step-2: pour the cream cheese mixture onto brownie batter and swirl into batter with a knife.
step-3: bake according to package and serve.

step-1: in a large bowl, mix the egg, sugars, butter, sour cream, and vanilla.
step-2: add the bananas, mash into the mixture.
step-3: add flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and mix.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: in a large bowl, mix cream cheese, sugar, flour, and egg.
step-6: pour half of the bread batter into a 9x5 inch (22cm x 12cm) pan, pour the cream cheese filling, smooth into corners, top with remaining batter.
step-7: bake at 350°f / 180°c for about 50 mins.
step-8: baking times may vary, so keep an eye on the bread.
step-9: allow to cool for 15 mins.

step-1: preheat oven to 350f (180c).
step-2: to prepare the bread, combine egg, sugars, butter, sour cream and vanilla in a large mixing bowl.
step-3: whisk together.
step-4: add the bananas and mash together.
step-5: add flour, baking powder, baking soda and mix lightly to combine.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: to prepare the cream cheese filling, mix egg, cream cheese, sugar, and flour in a small bowl.
step-8: to assemble the muffins, spoon a layer of bread batter into a greased muffin tin.
step-9: then spoon a layer of cream cheese filling, then top off with another layer of bread batter.
step-10: bake for 20-25 minutes.
step-11: baking times may vary.
step-12: muffins are done when a tooth pick inserted in the center comes out clean.
step-13: allow muffins to cool for 15 mins.

step-1: start by activating the yeast.
step-2: add yeast and malt syrup to warm water, stir until dissolved.
step-3: once the yeast mix starts bubbling, you'll know the yeast is active.
step-4: combine the dry ingredients in a large mixing bowl.
step-5: add the activated yeast mix and form a loose dough in the bowl.
step-6: turn dough out onto your surface and knead until everything comes together nicely.
step-7: (if it’s too dry, add more water a little bit at a time.)
step-8: transfer dough to an oiled bowl, cover and let the dough rest for 45 minutes.
step-9: while the dough is resting, prep your cream cheese.
step-10: freeze cream cheese into 1 tbsp.
step-11: balls.
step-12: punch down dough after 45 minutes, knead the dough a few times.
step-13: pull a handful of dough, form into a ball then flatten and wrap around a frozen cream cheese ball.
step-14: repeat with the rest of the dough.
step-15: place bagel balls on a parchment paper, cover and let it rest for 20 minutes.
step-16: while the bagel balls are resting, bring your poaching liquid ingredients to a boil over medium heat.
step-17: take the rested bagel balls and boil in the poaching liquid for 15-20 seconds.
step-18: remove and place on parchment paper.
step-19: brush with egg wash and sprinkle desired bagel toppings.
step-20: bake in 325°f (160°c) preheated oven for 20 - 30 minutes until top is golden brown.

step-1: add the corn kernels to a large bowl.
step-2: in a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, combine water and sugar.
step-3: stir until the sugar dissolves, then add to the corn, along with the melted butter.
step-4: stir until evenly combined.
step-5: cover with a plate and microwave for 3 minutes.
step-6: in a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, combine the half and half and cornstarch.
step-7: remove the bowl from microwave, stir, cover, and microwave for 3 minutes more.
step-8: remove the bowl from the microwave and add the half and half mixture.
step-9: stir to combine.
step-10: microwave for 6 minutes, until the corn has softened.
step-11: let cool, then top with sliced scallions.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: in a 10-inch (25 cm) cast iron skillet set over medium heat, add the olive oil, garlic, and onion, and cook until the onion is softened, 5 to 7 minutes.
step-3: add the grated sweet potato, season with salt and pepper, and continue to cook until the sweet potato is tender, 8 to 10 minutes.
step-4: add the spinach and stir until wilted, about 1 minute, then fold in the leftover creamed corn, herbs, and cayenne, if using.
step-5: season again to taste and stir until warmed through, about 1 minute.
step-6: use the back of a wooden spoon to create four small indentations for the eggs and add each egg, being careful not to break the yolks.
step-7: sprinkle with parmesan cheese and place in the oven.
step-8: bake until the egg whites are just set and the top begins to turn golden, about 15 minutes.
step-9: sprinkled with flaky salt, additional herbs, and additional parmesan cheese.
step-10: serve immediately

step-1: in a large pan, sauté spinach until cooked then place in a strainer to drain excess water.
step-2: melt butter and cook onion until soft.
step-3: whisk in flour.
step-4: make sure there are no lumps.
step-5: add cream and milk, then stir until thickened.
step-6: return spinach to mixture.
step-7: add salt, nutmeg and pepper, then stir until fully incorporated.
step-8: hollow out a sourdough bowl, line the hole with mozzarella cheese, then spoon creamed spinach in.
step-9: spoon a dip in the middle, then crack an egg in the dip so it doesn’t fall out of the bowl.
step-10: bake at 350˚f (175˚c) for 25 minutes, until the egg is set and the white has solidified.
step-11: season with salt and pepper.

step-1: on a cutting board, peel the potatoes.
step-2: place the potatoes in a large bowl of cold water after peeling to prevent discoloration.
step-3: dice the potatoes into 1-inch (2-cm) cubes.
step-4: add the potatoes to a large pot of cold water, along with the salt.
step-5: bring to a soft boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 12 minutes, until the potatoes are fork-tender.
step-6: drain the potatoes in a colander, then return to the pot.
step-7: increase the heat to medium-high and stir the potatoes around for 2-3 minutes to evaporate any excess moisture.
step-8: transfer the potatoes to a large bowl and mash with a potato masher, potato ricer, or by pushing through a fine mesh sieve with a spatula.
step-9: add the melted butter and stir to incorporate, then season with salt to taste.
step-10: in a small saucepan, combine the heavy cream, rosemary, and garlic.
step-11: bring to a simmer over low heat, let simmer for a few minutes, then remove the pot from the heat and strain through a fine mesh sieve.
step-12: gradually add the cream mixture to the potatoes, a little at a time, stirring until fully incorporated.
step-13: top with a pat of butter, freshly ground black pepper, and a sprinkle with chives, or gravy, if desired.
step-14: serve warm.

step-1: add the potatoes, bay leaves, garlic, rosemary, and thyme to a large pot.
step-2: pour in the cream and milk, bring to a simmer over medium heat, and cook until the potatoes are fork-tender, about 20 minutes.
step-3: drain the potatoes, reserving the cooking liquid, and discard the herbs and garlic.
step-4: press the potatoes through a potato ricer into a large bowl.
step-5: add about 1½ cups of the reserved cooking liquid to the potatoes and stir until creamy.
step-6: add the butter, salt, and pepper, and stir to incorporate.
step-7: garnish with thyme leaves, if desired.
step-8: note: you can save any extra cooking liquid and use it to rehydrate leftover mashed potatoes the next day.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: using a sharp knife, make crosswise cuts in each potato, about ⅛ inch (3 mm) apart, stopping about ¼ inch (6 mm) from the bottom.
step-3: microwave your potatoes for 5 minutes per potato.
step-4: mix together melted butter, minced garlic, and minced parsley.
step-5: brush on the potato.
step-6: sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste.
step-7: insert 6-8 slices of bacon into the middle section of slots in the sliced potato.
step-8: transfer the potatoes to the oven and bake until the outsides are browned and crisp, about 30 minutes, basting with more butter if needed.
step-9: in a sauce pan, combine the milk, cream cheese, salt, and pepper.
step-10: heat and stir until well-combined and smooth.
step-11: add in the chopped chives to the cream cheese sauce.
step-12: stir and pour over the crispy potatoes.
step-13: add extra chives for garnish.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: slice into the chicken several times, about ½ cm (¼ inch) apart, but only cut about 85% of the way through, leaving the bottom intact.
step-3: cook the bacon over a medium heat until it starts to get crispy.
step-4: stir in the spring onions and cook for another minute or so.
step-5: add the cream cheese and cook until melted.
step-6: allow filling to cool to the touch, and then fill each segment of the chicken breast with about 1 teaspoon of the mixture.
step-7: bake in the centre of the oven for 18-22 minutes until the chicken is cooked through and the juices run clear.

step-1: heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
step-2: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the onion and cook for 3-4 minutes, until semi-translucent.
step-3: add the garlic, salt, and pepper and cook for 2-3 minutes more, until the garlic is fragrant.
step-4: add the mashed potatoes, broccoli, vegetable broth, and milk and bring to a boil.
step-5: cover and reduce the heat to low.
step-6: simmer for 20 minutes, or until the broccoli is tender.
step-7: use an immersion blender to blend the soup until smooth.
step-8: stir in the nutmeg, then ladle into bowls.

step-1: in a large pot or dutch oven over medium-high heat, cook the bacon until crispy.
step-2: add chicken and season with salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
step-3: cook until no pink is showing, then remove the chicken.
step-4: add onion and garlic and cook until softened.
step-5: when onions are caramelized, add spinach and cook until wilted
step-6: add milk and bring to boil.
step-7: add fettuccine into boiling mixture and cover.
step-8: cook fettuccine on medium heat until milk thickens and pasta is cooked (about 7 minutes).
step-9: mix back in the chicken.
step-10: stir in the pesto and parmesan.
step-11: garnish with parsley and additional parmesan

step-1: add onion, garlic, bell pepper, and jalapeño to a lightly oiled sauté pan.
step-2: season with salt and pepper, then cook until onions are translucent.
step-3: once veggies are fully cooked add in chicken, corn, cumin, and paprika.
step-4: mix together until fully combined.
step-5: remove chicken from the heat and place in a large mixing bowl.
step-6: add in cream cheese and mix until chicken becomes creamy.
step-7: using a medium-sized ice cream scooper.
step-8: scoop out 2 portions of creamy chicken and place on flour tortilla.
step-9: top with cheese blend then roll tightly into a burrito.
step-10: preheat oil to 325ºf (170ºc).
step-11: place burrito into shallow oil, flap side down to create a seal and cook for 2-3 minutes on both sides or until golden brown.
step-12: top with sour cream and pico de gallo.

step-1: in a deep skillet, fry the bacon until crispy.
step-2: remove to a paper towel to drain, and chop.
step-3: in the same skillet, cook the chicken with salt, pepper, italian seasoning, and paprika.
step-4: add garlic and cook until soft.
step-5: add spinach and tomatoes, and cook until spinach is wilted.
step-6: add the cream, parmesan, red chili flakes, and bring to a boil.
step-7: add the penne and bacon, and stir until fully coated in sauce.
step-8: serve with fresh parsley, parmesan, and red pepper flakes if desired.

step-1: in a deep skillet, fry the bacon until crispy.
step-2: remove to a paper towel to drain, then chop.
step-3: in the same skillet, add the chicken and season with salt, pepper, italian seasoning, and paprika.
step-4: cook until no longer pink inside.
step-5: add the garlic and cook until softened.
step-6: add spinach and tomatoes and cook until the spinach is wilted.
step-7: add the cream, parmesan, an red pepper flakes and bring to a boil.
step-8: add the penne and bacon, and stir until fully coated in sauce.
step-9: serve with parsley, parmesan, and red pepper flakes, if desired.

step-1: butterfly each chicken breast.
step-2: lay a piece of parchment paper on top and pound to about ¼ inch (6 mm) thick.
step-3: season generously on both sides with salt and pepper.
step-4: cut each breast in half lengthwise so you have 4 pieces of chicken.
step-5: add the flour to a wide, shallow dish.
step-6: dredge each piece of chicken in flour, shaking off the excess.
step-7: heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
step-8: fry the chicken until golden brown, about 3-4 minutes per side.
step-9: remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
step-10: pour the white wine into the pan and cook until reduced by half, about 1 minute.
step-11: add the butter, garlic, and capers and cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
step-12: stir in the lemon juice and chicken stock and cook for 5 minutes, until the sauce has slightly thickened.
step-13: stir in the cream, then return the chicken to the pan.
step-14: sprinkle with the parsley and turn the chicken to coat in the sauce.
step-15: simmer for 2 minutes, until the sauce thickens slightly, then remove from the heat.
step-16: serve the chicken and sauce over angel hair pasta.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the chicken thighs with the salt, pepper, garlic powder, dried thyme, dried parsley, and olive oil.
step-2: toss until well coated.
step-3: in a dutch oven over medium-high heat, add the chicken and cook until it’s golden brown on one side, then flip, and cook the other side, about10 minutes total.
step-4: remove the chicken and set aside.
step-5: to the pan, add the butter, carrots, onions, celery, mushrooms, and garlic.
step-6: season with salt and pepper, stir, and cook until the veggies are soft.
step-7: scoop out and set aside.
step-8: add the wild rice and the chicken broth to the pot.
step-9: bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, and cook the rice for 45 minutes, or until tender.
step-10: once the rice is cooked, stir in the parmesan, vegetables, heavy cream, and fresh thyme.
step-11: bring to a boil.
step-12: stir in the sour cream.
step-13: add the chicken back to the pan.
step-14: serve the chicken over the rice and garnish with grated parmesan and fresh parsley.

step-1: heat the coconut oil in a large nonstick skillet.
step-2: toss in the diced onion and salt and sauté for about 5 minutes.
step-3: sprinkle in the ground dried oregano and cumin.
step-4: add the minced chipotle and garlic and sauté until the garlic is fragrant, about 30 seconds.
step-5: pour in the milk and stir the mixture to combine.
step-6: you can use skim or low-fat milk instead of whole milk, but make sure to reduce it on a lower heat to avoid curdling the milk.
step-7: once the mixture has bubbled and reduced slightly, mix in the shredded chicken until evenly coated.
step-8: spoon the mixture evenly onto butter lettuce leaves.
step-9: top with pico de gallo or salsa and serve.

step-1: in a large, nonstick skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
step-2: toss in the garlic and sauté until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
step-3: add the shredded chicken, salt, sour cream, and lime juice.
step-4: mix until the chicken is evenly coated and the mixture has heated through.
step-5: stir in the cilantro and immediately remove from heat.
step-6: pour the chicken mixture into a large serving bowl and toast the tortillas in the seasoned pan, about 3 minutes per side.
step-7: divide the mixture evenly between tortillas, top with pico de gallo, and serve.

step-1: add cilantro, salt, pepper, coconut milk, lime juice and avocado oil into a mason jar and secure lid tightly.
step-2: shake vigorously until ingredients are mixed thoroughly.
step-3: store dressing in the fridge and use within 1-2 weeks.
step-4: you may need to shake up the ingredients again before each use.

step-1: in a large pot over medium heat, add the olive oil and onion and cook for 3-5 minutes until semi-translucent.
step-2: add the garlic and tomato paste and cook for 3 more minutes, stirring occasionally.
step-3: add the tomatoes and cook for 3-5 more minutes, until the skins begin to wrinkle and tomatoes begin to release liquid.
step-4: season with salt and pepper, than add in vegetable broth, non-dairy milk, and pasta and stir until combined.
step-5: bring to a boil, then cover, reduce heat, and let simmer for 10 minutes or until most liquid is absorbed.
step-6: add in spinach and stir until wilted.
step-7: add in the nutritional yeast and stir until combined.
step-8: remove from heat and serve immediately.

step-1: season the chicken evenly on both sides with 1½ tablespoons salt.
step-2: heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a shallow pan over medium-high heat.
step-3: add the chicken and sear for 3-4 minutes on each side.
step-4: remove chicken from the pan (it will not be fully cooked) and set aside.
step-5: wipe out the pan if it looks charred.
step-6: melt the butter in the pan over low heat.
step-7: add the garlic and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 1 minute, then whisk in flour.
step-8: pour in the chicken broth, whisking, then add french’s dijon mustard, ½ teaspoon salt, and ¼ teaspoon pepper, and whisk until smooth.
step-9: simmer sauce for 1-2 minutes, then stir in the heavy cream.
step-10: return the sauce to a simmer, place the chicken in the sauce, and cover the pan with a lid.
step-11: simmer until chicken is fully cooked through, 5–10 minutes.
step-12: remove chicken from the pan.
step-13: stir the minced parsley and lemon zest into the sauce, then taste for seasoning.
step-14: slice the chicken.
step-15: remove the sauce from the heat.
step-16: heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
step-17: when the oil is hot, add the mushrooms and season with salt to taste.
step-18: saute mushrooms, stirring occasionally, until golden brown, 7–10 minutes.
step-19: remove mushrooms from the pan.
step-20: heat remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil in the pan.
step-21: add asparagus and sauté, stirring occasionally, until tender, about 3 minutes.
step-22: season with salt to taste.
step-23: add the peas and cook 1 minute more.
step-24: place the vegetables on a plate.
step-25: top with sliced chicken and drizzle with the dijon sauce.
step-26: garnish with chopped parsley.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, combine the panko bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, salt, pepper, paprika, and garlic powder.
step-3: mix together with a fork.
step-4: season the chicken breasts on both sides with pepper and salt to taste.
step-5: add the flour and eggs to 2 separate medium bowls.
step-6: dip the chicken breasts in the flour and shake off the excess.
step-7: then, dip in the eggs.
step-8: finally, dip in the bread crumb mixture.
step-9: make sure the chicken is well-coated.
step-10: place the chicken breasts on a baking sheet and drizzle with the olive oil.
step-11: bake for 25 minutes, or until deep golden brown and a meat thermometer inserted in the thick part of a breast registers at least 165˚f (75˚c).
step-12: while the chicken is cooking, make the dressing: in a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, combine the sour cream, buttermilk, parmesan, garlic, lemon juice, apple cider vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
step-13: stir to combine.
step-14: if you prefer a thinner dressing, add a few more splashes of buttermilk.
step-15: to assemble the salad, add the mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, and red onion to a large bowl.
step-16: drizzle about ½ the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
step-17: slice the chicken, then serve on top of the salad and drizzle with more dressing.

step-1: in a 1.5-quart saucepan over medium heat, whisk together whole milk, heavy cream, powdered sugar, and espresso powder until hot.
step-2: small bubbles will appear around the edges and the mixture may start to steam.
step-3: do not allow the mixture to boil.
step-4: turn heat to low and stir in chopped chocolate until melted completely.
step-5: serve warm, topped with whipped cream.

step-1: add dark chocolate, maple syrup, vanilla extract, salt, sweet potato puree and almond milk to a medium saucepan over medium low heat.
step-2: whisk to combine and bring to a simmer, stirring occasionally to incorporate chocolate.
step-3: once mixture is smooth and heated through, remove from heat.
step-4: serve warm.

step-1: in a sauce pan, over medium-high heat, combine all taquito filling ingredients.
step-2: mix well and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
step-3: wrap tortillas in a damp towel and microwave for 15-20 seconds.
step-4: place about 2 tablespoons of filling across the tortilla about ⅓ of the way up from the bottom of the tortilla, and roll the tortilla around the filling.
step-5: heat about ¼ inch (½ cm) of oil over medium-high heat.
step-6: carefully, place 3-4 taquitos in the oil, and cook for 3 minutes on each side.
step-7: (frying them seam side down first helps them stay closed during frying!)
step-8: remove from the pan and drain excess oil on the taquito on a paper towel.
step-9: place cooked taquitos on a bed of lettuce and garnish with crema, cilantro, cotija, and avocado.

step-1: season chicken thighs with salt, pepper, and paprika.
step-2: melt 2 tbsp.
step-3: butter in a large oven-proof skillet over medium high heat.
step-4: add chicken, skin-side down, and sear both sides until golden brown.
step-5: drain excess fat and set aside.
step-6: melt 1 tbsp.
step-7: butter in the skillet.
step-8: add garlic, stir until fragrant, then add chicken broth, heavy cream, parmesan, lemon juice, thyme, and stir.
step-9: bring to boil, then reduce heat to low.
step-10: stir in spinach, simmer until spinach has wilted and the sauce has thickened.
step-11: return chicken to the skillet.
step-12: bake at 400˚f (200˚c) for 25 minutes.

step-1: fry the chicken over a medium heat and set aside.
step-2: give the pan a quick wipe with a paper towel
step-3: add butter to the same pan.
step-4: fry the onion and garlic until soft (about 3-5 minutes).
step-5: add the lemon zest and juice.
step-6: give the mixture a quick stir and add chilli flakes and thyme.
step-7: stir in the water and double cream.
step-8: add the spinach and allow it to cook for about a minute.
step-9: put the pre-cooked chicken back into the pan along with pasta.
step-10: allow to cook until al dente.
step-11: mix in the parmesan.
step-12: take off the hob and serve with extra parmesan, if you prefer.

step-1: on a cutting board, cut the chicken breasts in half, widthwise.
step-2: lay chicken flat and season both sides with salt and pepper.
step-3: gently coat the chicken pieces in the flour, shaking off any excess.
step-4: heat a skillet on medium-high heat and add the butter and oil, swirling together to coat the pan.
step-5: place the chicken breasts into the pan and cook for 3-5 minutes or until golden brown.
step-6: flip the chicken and cook the other side, another 3-5 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through.
step-7: remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
step-8: pour ¼ cup (60 ml) of the chicken stock in the pan and scrape up any bits that may have stuck to the bottom of the pan.
step-9: add the rest of the stock and the cream and stir.
step-10: season with salt and pepper, and add the lemon juice.
step-11: simmer for 5 minutes.
step-12: add the chicken back to the pan and top with sliced lemons.
step-13: spoon the sauce over the chicken.
step-14: remove from heat.
step-15: sauce will thicken as it cools.
step-16: serve with parsley and extra sauce.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: heat 1 tablespoon of coconut oil in a large ovenproof skillet over high heat.
step-3: liberally season both sides of the chicken breasts with salt and pepper before transferring to the hot skillet.
step-4: sear the chicken 2-3 minutes per side, just until it develops a golden-brown color.
step-5: remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
step-6: allow the pan to cool slightly before heating the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil over medium heat.
step-7: toss in the garlic and sautée until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
step-8: pour in the chicken broth, yogurt, lemon juice, and oregano and stir until the mixture is smooth.
step-9: let the mixture reduce for a few minutes until it has thickened.
step-10: pour in the spinach and sprinkle over another pinch of salt.
step-11: let the greens wilt down, stirring occasionally.
step-12: place the chicken breasts back into the pan and transfer the pan to the oven.
step-13: bake for 15 minutes or until the chicken is fully cooked.
step-14: serve chicken on a bed of the wilted spinach and top with a drizzle of the creamy sauce.

step-1: pour in heavy cream and scallions (reserve a couple scallions for garnishing).
step-2: stir to combine, then remove from the heat and set aside.
step-3: brush both sides of the pieces of bread with olive oil.
step-4: toast bread in a skillet over low heat until golden brown on both sides.

step-1: in a heated pot, melt butter and olive oil.
step-2: add garlic and shrimp, seasoning with salt and pepper.
step-3: cook until shrimp is pink, then put aside.
step-4: in the same pot, add milk, broth, and pasta.
step-5: cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, so that the pasta does not stick to each other.
step-6: once pasta is al dente, add in spinach, salt, pepper, seasoning, and cheese, and mix until spinach is wilted and everything is coated in the sauce.
step-7: add the shrimp back in and give it a stir until fully incorporated.
step-8: serve with some extra parmesan cheese, if desired.

step-1: to make the pesto, mix basil, garlic, pine nuts, parmesan, cold water, heavy cream, salt, and pepper in a food processor for about 30 seconds.
step-2: add in olive oil.
step-3: process until combined, set aside.
step-4: cook fusilli to very al dente, or about 3-4 minutes before the package instructs for cook time, then drain pasta.
step-5: halve cherry tomatoes.
step-6: in a skillet or casserole pan, mix fusilli, cherry tomatoes, and pesto.
step-7: top with grated parmesan and mozzarella balls.
step-8: bake at 400° fahrenheit for 10-15 minutes, or until mozzarella has melted.
step-9: garnish with additional parmesan and fresh basil.
step-10: serve immediately.

step-1: thinly sliced the potatoes, roughly ¼-inch (5mm) thick.
step-2: remove stems from kale and cut into ¾ inch-1 inch (2cm) pieces.
step-3: for the béchamel sauce, add butter and garlic to a saucepan on medium heat and sauté until aromatic.
step-4: add flour and mix until mixture browns slightly.
step-5: add milk, salt, and pepper and simmer on low heat until mixture thickens.
step-6: in a medium-sized oven dish, lay a hefty bed of kale adding olive oil, salt, and pepper and gently mixing.
step-7: starting from one side layer your potatoes across the kale covering the entire dish.
step-8: gently press the potatoes and kale mixture down to make more room in the dish.
step-9: drizzle half of the béchamel sauce across all of the potatoes.
step-10: repeat the process and add another layer of kale, olive oil, salt, pepper, and potatoes and cover with remaining sauce.
step-11: garnish to taste with parmesan, gruyère, and bread crumbs
step-12: bake at 350°f (180°c) for 30 minutes covered.
step-13: remove cover and bake an additional 30 minutes.

step-1: in a large pot, set on medium heat, add the olive oil and sauté the onions, celery, carrots, and garlic until they are soft, about 10-15 minutes.
step-2: add garlic and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.
step-3: add the ground beef and the sausages.
step-4: season with salt and pepper, and break up the meat with a spoon and frying until no longer pink.
step-5: next, add the tomato paste, italian seasoning, and red wine.
step-6: stir and reduce until the wine has almost completely evaporated.
step-7: now add all the remaining ingredients, except the parmesan and cream.
step-8: stir to ensure everything is well mixed.
step-9: simmer for 30 minutes to 3 hours.
step-10: the longer the simmer, the deeper and more concentrated the flavor.
step-11: stir in the parmesan and cream to the sausage bolognese.
step-12: add the cooked pasta to the sauce.
step-13: serve with more parmesan, if desired.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: remove the stems from the mushrooms.
step-3: place the top half on a baking sheet.
step-4: mince the stems.
step-5: melt the butter in a pan and add the minced stems and minced garlic.
step-6: stir and cook for 2 minutes.
step-7: add the spinach, cook until it wilts.
step-8: add the cream cheese, salt, and pepper.
step-9: stir until the cream cheese is melted and everything is well-combined.
step-10: take a spoonful of the spinach mixture and fill each mushroom top.
step-11: mix bread crumbs and parmesan cheese in a bowl and sprinkle the mixture on top of the dip stuffed mushrooms.
step-12: bake for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown.

step-1: spread the goat cheese on toast.
step-2: add sliced avocados, strawberries, and drizzle with balsamic vinegar.

step-1: use a peeler to thinly slice zucchini into “linguini” noodles.
step-2: set aside in a bowl and mix with salt.
step-3: let sit for 20 minutes to draw moisture out of the noodles.
step-4: drain the zucchini with a clean dish cloth or paper towels.
step-5: heat olive oil in a large skillet.
step-6: add in chicken breast, salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
step-7: cook until no longer pink.
step-8: add in zucchini noodles, cherry tomatoes, and dried basil.
step-9: cook for an additional minute and remove from heat.
step-10: set aside in a bowl.
step-11: heat olive oil for for the creamy sauce in the skillet.
step-12: add in garlic cloves and cook for about 30 seconds.
step-13: add in chicken broth to cool skillet, and reduce heat to low.
step-14: (this step is important: if skillet is too hot, the greek yogurt will curdle, so allow it to cool down before adding it in).
step-15: add in greek yogurt, parmesan, and dried basil.
step-16: mix until well combined.
step-17: add in the chicken, zoodles, and tomato mixture.
step-18: mix together and then remove from heat.
step-19: serve and garnish with fresh chopped basil, as desired.

step-1: melt butter in a large pot over medium-high heat.
step-2: cook the shrimp until pink.
step-3: add the tomato, green onion, chili powder, parsley, salt, and pepper, stirring until evenly mixed.
step-4: pour in the milk, bringing to a boil.
step-5: stir in the cooked pasta until well-coated.

step-1: season the chicken with the salt & pepper, making sure to mix it in evenly.
step-2: heat oil in a skillet over medium-low heat.
step-3: place the chicken thighs skin side down in the skillet and cook for about 13 minutes in order to crisp up the skin.
step-4: move the chicken around from time to time to ensure it cooks evenly.
step-5: the skin should be hard to the touch.
step-6: flip the chicken, then cook for about another 15 minutes until the chicken is fully cooked.
step-7: remove from pan.
step-8: add the garlic and onion, stirring until onions are translucent.
step-9: stir in the tomatoes and spinach until the spinach is wilted.
step-10: add the heavy cream, salt, and pepper, bringing to a boil.
step-11: add the parmesan cheese and parsley, stirring until the sauce has thickened slightly.
step-12: place the chicken back in the pan, spooning the sauce on top of the chicken.

step-1: in a small bowl, soak the cashews in water for 1 hour.
step-2: in a large soup pot, add the olive oil over medium heat.
step-3: add the onion and stir until translucent.
step-4: add the carrots, potatoes, garlic, and salt, and stir.
step-5: add 2 cups (480 ml) of vegetable broth, cover and simmer for 30 minutes.
step-6: transfer soup to a blender and blend until smooth.
step-7: set the soup aside and rinse out blender.
step-8: add remaining vegetable broth, cashews, nutritional yeast, paprika, and pepper, and blend until smooth.
step-9: combine the cashew mixture and “cheese” mixture in the soup pan and stir.
step-10: add the broccoli and stir to combine.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a large, microwave-safe bowl, whisk the yolks and ½ cup (100 g) of sugar until pale in color.
step-3: add the cornstarch and vanilla extract, and whisk well.
step-4: add the milk and whisk until fully combined.
step-5: loosely cover the bowl with plastic wrap and microwave for 4-6 minutes, whisking every 1-2 minutes, until the mixture becomes a thick custard.
step-6: re-cover with plastic wrap and chill for about 2 hours.
step-7: in a medium bowl, cream the softened butter and ½ cup (100 g) of sugar with a hand mixer until light and fluffy.
step-8: add the egg, and mix until fully incorporated.
step-9: add the flour and mix until the dough is crumbly, but holds together when squeezed.
step-10: wrap the dough in plastic wrap and chill in the fridge for 30 minutes.
step-11: once chilled, roll out the dough between two layers of parchment paper until it is ¼-inch (6 mm) thick.
step-12: cut out 6 2-inch (5 cm) diameter rounds of dough.
step-13: remove the excess dough and transfer the rings to a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-14: re-roll the leftover cookie dough to the ¼-inch (6 mm) thickness.
step-15: cut out 6 more 2-inch (5 cm) rounds, then cut a 1½-inch (4 cm) ring inside the 2-inch (5 cm) rounds.
step-16: transfer the whole rounds to the baking sheet, then remove the inner circles.
step-17: bake the cookies for 10 minutes, until pale and just barely cooked.
step-18: let sit at room temperature to cool for 30 minutes.
step-19: once the cookies are cool, transfer the chilled custard to a piping bag.
step-20: pipe the custard onto the circle-shaped cookies completely covering the surface.
step-21: place the ring-shaped cookies on top of the custard-topped cookies and press down gently to adhere.
step-22: add the remaining cup of sugar to a small pan and cook over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until the sugar melts and begins to caramelize.
step-23: make sure there are no lumps of sugar.
step-24: while the caramel is still hot, pour about 2 tablespoons over each cookie to fill the ring on top.
step-25: let the cookies cool completely.

step-1: pour the heavy cream into a 9x13-inch (23x33 cm) baking dish.
step-2: mix 1 cup of sugar (200 g) and the cinnamon in a small bowl and add to the cream, followed by the egg yolks and vanilla.
step-3: whisk well to combine.
step-4: dip each slice of bread into the cream mixture, coating both sides well.
step-5: place the dipped bread on the wire rack set over the baking sheet.
step-6: bake for 15 minutes, flip the bread over, then bake for another 15 minutes, until slightly crispy.
step-7: slice the strawberries into decorative shapes of your choosing.
step-8: for a strawberry rose, place a strawberry stem side down and carefully make thin slices around the outer edge of the strawberry, making sure not to cut all the way through.
step-9: continue cutting and rotating the strawberry until you get to the center.
step-10: fan out the “petals”.
step-11: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-12: line a baking sheet with parchment paper and set a wire rack on top.
step-13: for a strawberry fan, lay a strawberry on its flattest side.
step-14: tilt the knife at a 45˚ angle and make thin, angled slices through the strawberry, keeping the top of the strawberry connected and slicing all the way through the bottom of the berry.
step-15: fan out the slices.
step-16: sprinkle the remaining sugar on top of the bread and broil on high for 3 minutes, until the sugar has melted and browned, or carefully use a kitchen torch to brûlée the sugar.
step-17: top with whipped cream and strawberries and serve.

step-1: add the flour, caster sugar, cocoa powder, butter, eggs, baking powder and vanilla extract to a large bowl and whisk until smooth and thoroughly mixed.
step-2: transfer mixture to the bundt cake tin, smooth out then place 6 creme eggs upright around the circle.
step-3: make sure they don’t touch the bottom but are sunken in.
step-4: cover the creme eggs with the cake mix, then bake for 35 minutes at 180°c (350°f).
step-5: cool for 20 minutes.
step-6: remove cake from tin carefully, then pour melted chocolate over the top, covering completely.
step-7: cut 3-4 creme eggs in half and decorate over the top - the messier the better!

step-1: melt the butter, dark chocolate, milk chocolate, and golden syrup over a bain marie.
step-2: allow to cool for 5-10 minutes.
step-3: stir in the digestives, marshmallows and mini creme eggs until everything is coated.
step-4: transfer the mixture to a deep tray lined with baking paper.
step-5: melt 75g of the white chocolate and stir in some of the yellow food colouring until the desired colour is reached.
step-6: if it seizes on you, add a little bit of oil and stir it until it reaches a runny consistency again.
step-7: drizzle over the rocky road mixture.
step-8: melt the remaining white chocolate and drizzle that over too.
step-9: cut the creme eggs in half and press firmly into the mixture.
step-10: chill for at least two hours.
step-11: carve it up and eat!

step-1: in a large bowl, stir together the flour, sugar, eggs, and melted butter.
step-2: add ½ cup (120 ml) of milk at a time, stirring vigorously, making sure that each addition is completely incorporated and that the batter is smooth before adding more milk.
step-3: strain the batter through a fine mesh sieve into another large bowl.
step-4: the batter should be very liquidy and have no lumps.
step-5: rest in the fridge for at least 30 minutes, up to overnight.
step-6: in a medium nonstick pan over medium heat, pour ⅓ cup (80 ml) of the batter in the center, and swirl the batter around to reach the edges of the pan.
step-7: cook the crêpe until bubbles rise to the surface and the bottom is golden brown, about 3 minutes.
step-8: flip and cook on the other side until the edges start to crisp slightly, about 1 minute more.
step-9: transfer the crêpe to a wire rack to cool.
step-10: repeat with the remaining batter.
step-11: cut the crêpes in half.
step-12: spread chocolate hazelnut spread or whipped cream evenly over each crepe half, then place a slice of banana or strawberry half on the right edge.
step-13: fold up the bottom of the crêpe, then fold toward the left side to make triangular shape.
step-14: repeat with the remaining ingredients.
step-15: serve with whipped cream.

step-1: in a large pot over medium heat, melt butter completely, then add the marshmallows and stir until the marshmallows are melted and the butter is fully incorporated.
step-2: turn off the heat, add the rice cereal, and stir until combined.
step-3: line a baking sheet with parchment paper and grease with nonstick spray.
step-4: pour the crispie mixture into the pan and spread to the edges.
step-5: use a rolling pin to gently smooth out the crispies in an even layer.
step-6: cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, until completely cooled and set.
step-7: cut into bite-size pieces, or decorate with sugar sprinkles and create a sculpture with crispies!

step-1: in a medium cast iron skillet or pan, cook the bacon until almost brown, about 5 minutes.
step-2: add the onions and cook, stirring, until caramelized, about 10 minutes.
step-3: add the spinach and cook until wilted, about 3 minutes.
step-4: remove the pan from the heat.
step-5: place a chicken breast on a piece of plastic wrap.
step-6: cover with more plastic wrap and pound until thin.
step-7: repeat with remaining chicken breasts.
step-8: lay out a large piece of plastic wrap and layer the chicken on the plastic so the edges are overlapping slightly.
step-9: season with salt and pepper.
step-10: layer the ham, swiss cheese, and bacon-carmelized onion mixture over the chicken.
step-11: roll the chicken into a log tightly wrap in plastic, twisting the ends to seal.
step-12: refrigerate for 1 hour to set.
step-13: add the flour, eggs, and panko to 3 separate baking sheets or other wide, shallow dishes.
step-14: roll the chicken in the flour, then in the egg, and finally in the panko.
step-15: coat once more in the egg, then panko.
step-16: transfer the chicken roll to a greased baking sheet and bake at 375° (190 celsius) for 40 minutes, until golden brown.
step-17: make the creamy dijon sauce: in a small pot over medium heat, melt the butter.
step-18: add the garlic and cook until aromatic.
step-19: add the flour and cook until starting to brown.
step-20: whisk in the milk, then add the mustard and season with salt and pepper.
step-21: add the parmesan and cook until the sauce is thickened.
step-22: slice the chicken roll and serve with the sauce and fresh parsley.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: grease a 9x13-inch (23x33-cm) baking dish with non-stick cooking spray
step-3: peel the potatoes, then shred on the large holes of a box grater.
step-4: transfer to a large bowl of water and swirl around to remove excess starch.
step-5: drain and rinse, then place the potatoes in a clean kitchen towel and squeeze until they’re completely dry.
step-6: add the shredded potatoes to a clean, large bowl with the salt, pepper, garlic powder, cayenne, onion powder, parmesan cheese, and olive oil.
step-7: toss until fully combined.
step-8: transfer the potato mixture to the baking dish.
step-9: spread evenly.
step-10: bake for 1½ hours, or until the potatoes are tender throughout and golden brown on the top and bottom.
step-11: press the bottom of a glass into the potato mixture to create 6 evenly spaced wells.
step-12: shingle slices of cheddar cheese and ham around the wells, then crack an egg into each one.
step-13: bake for 15 minutes more, or until the cheese melts and the egg whites are set.
step-14: the egg yolks should still be slightly soft.
step-15: serve and sprinkle with chives, if desired.

step-1: in a large measuring cup, combine water and cornstarch.
step-2: stir until combined and add soy sauce, brown sugar, ginger, garlic, honey, sesame oil, and mirin.
step-3: mix well.
step-4: season sliced chicken breast with salt and pepper, then pour ¼ cup (60 ml) of the sauce over the sliced chicken just until covered, and set aside.
step-5: mix the sauce with the sliced chicken, cover, and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
step-6: in a large skillet over medium-high heat, pour the rest of the sauce and stir occasionally as it comes to a boil.
step-7: once boiling, reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened.
step-8: set aside in a bowl.
step-9: in the same skillet, add 1 tablespoon cooking oil and raise heat back to medium-high.
step-10: place sliced chicken pieces in the pan and cook for 3 minutes, flip, and cook an additional 3 minutes.
step-11: pour 1 tablespoon of the reduced sauce over the chicken and stir.
step-12: remove from the pan and set aside.
step-13: add the remaining cooking oil into the skillet and add the julienned vegetables.
step-14: season with salt and white pepper, and cook 3-4 minutes or until vegetables have softened.
step-15: add back the chicken and gradually add just enough sauce to coat the chicken and vegetables.
step-16: take ⅓ cup (65 g) of cooked rice and flatten out on a piece of plastic wrap.
step-17: layer the cooked chicken and vegetables in the center of the rice and wrap the rice around the fillings.
step-18: form into a square shape and repeat with the remainder of the rice and filling.
step-19: chill rice balls in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-20: dip the rice ball in beaten eggs, then coat with panko.
step-21: shake off any excess bread crumbs.
step-22: heat ½ inch (1 cm) oil in a skillet to 350˚f (180˚c) and fry for 3 minutes on each side or until golden and crispy.
step-23: move to a cooling rack, and season with salt.
step-24: cut in half and serve with the remaining sauce for dipping.

step-1: slice the steaks into thin strips and place into a small bowl.
step-2: add the cornflour, 5 spice, salt, and pepper.
step-3: mix until evenly coated.
step-4: carefully heat the oil in a deep saucepan until it reaches 190°c (375°f).
step-5: carefully place the beef strips into the oil and fry for about 4-5 minutes, until golden brown.
step-6: place on some tissue to soak up the excess oil and set a aside.
step-7: meanwhile, prepare the sauce by adding a tablespoon of oil to a frying pan.
step-8: frying the chilies, spring onion, and ginger over a medium heat for a few minutes.
step-9: add garlic paste and fry for another minute.
step-10: stir in the soy sauce, sweet chili sauce, red wine vinegar, and tomato ketchup until thick.
step-11: stir in the beef steaks until evenly coated.
step-12: garnish with spring onion and red chilies.

step-1: in a pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
step-2: add onions and peppers, and cook until translucent.
step-3: add garlic and rice, and cook until fragrant.
step-4: add white wine, stirring frequently.
step-5: slowly add hot chicken broth ½ cup at a time, stirring frequently for about 20 minutes, or until rice is al dente.
step-6: in a small bowl, combine chipotle powder, garlic powder, onion powder, coriander, smoked paprika, pepper, cumin, oregano, salt, and pepper.
step-7: add half of spice mixture to rice.
step-8: remove rice from heat.
step-9: mix in corn and cheese blend.
step-10: cool until room temperature, then chill in the fridge for at least 30 minutes.
step-11: while mixture is chilling, place avocados, greek yogurt, cilantro, lime juice, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in a food processor and blend until smooth.
step-12: place flour, eggs and bread crumbs in three separate bowls.
step-13: lightly beat eggs and add remaining spice mixture to bread crumbs.
step-14: drop a heaping spoonful of mixture into the flour.
step-15: coat with flour and shape it to about the size of a golf ball.
step-16: coat with egg, then dip in bread crumbs.
step-17: in a skillet, heat oil to 350°f (180˚c).
step-18: add well-coated rice balls to hot skillet.
step-19: fry for about 2 minutes on each side or until golden brown.
step-20: place fried rice balls on a plate lined with a paper towel to drain.
step-21: serve warm with avocado dipping sauce.
step-22: top with cilantro and queso fresco, if desired.

step-1: preheat the oven to 325˚f (160˚c).
step-2: make the cookies: in a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: in a larger bowl, add the butter and sugars.
step-5: mix (either by hand or using an electric mixer) until smooth.
step-6: add the egg, vanilla extract, and water to the butter mixture and mix until thoroughly incorporated.
step-7: add the chocolate chips and dry ingredients, then use a spatula to gently fold them together, being careful not to overmix.
step-8: using a small ice cream scoop or spoon, measure out 6 tablespoon-sized balls of dough and space them 2-3 inches (5-7 cm) apart on a prepared baking sheet.
step-9: bake the cookies for 18 minutes.
step-10: they should be thin with crispy edges when finished.
step-11: remove the cookies from the oven and allow them to cool for 5 minutes on the baking sheet before transferring them to a wired cooling rack.
step-12: bake off the second half of the dough and allow all the cookies to reach room temperature before proceeding.
step-13: once thoroughly cooled, place the baked cookies back in the oven, directly on the oven rack, and toast them at 325˚f (160˚c) for 7 minutes.
step-14: this will completely dry out the cookies leaving them very crispy and brittle.
step-15: carefully transfer all the toasted cookies to a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-16: using the back of a heavy spoon or measuring cup, firmly smack the top of the cookies.
step-17: set the baking sheet of shattered cookies aside.
step-18: make the bark: slowly melt 1 pound (455 g) of the baking chocolate either in a double boiler or in a glass bowl over just-simmering water.
step-19: allow the chocolate to melt undisturbed until about two-thirds of it has melted, then stir until it is completely smooth with no visible chunks.
step-20: remove the chocolate from the heat and allow it to cool for 10 minutes before adding in the remaining chocolate.
step-21: the residual heat will melt the solid chocolate.
step-22: mix until smooth.
step-23: arrange the shattered cookie pieces in a layer on the baking sheet.
step-24: pour the melted chocolate over the pieces and use a spatula to quickly and evenly spread the chocolate across the tops of the cookie pieces.
step-25: sprinkle with salt and any other desired toppings.
step-26: transfer the baking sheet to the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes for the chocolate to set.
step-27: once the bark is set, remove the baking sheet from the refrigerator and cover the bark with parchment paper.
step-28: use something heavy (like a meat tenderizer) to break the bark into snack-sized pieces.
step-29: serve the pieces immediately or store in the refrigerator until desired.

step-1: in a large pan, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat.
step-2: add the onion, garlic, salt, and pepper.
step-3: stir until softened, 3-4 minutes.
step-4: add the spinach and stir until wilted down.
step-5: remove the pan from the heat.
step-6: season the steak on all sides with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and paprika.
step-7: lay a piece of parchment paper over the cubed steak.
step-8: using a meat mallet or rolling pin, pound the steak until ¼-inch (6-mm) in thickness.
step-9: remove the parchment paper.
step-10: lay the slices on monterey jack evenly over the cube steak.
step-11: add the sauteed spinach mixture over the cheese.
step-12: gently roll up the steak, making sure to keep it as tightly wrapped as possible.
step-13: place the steak log on a sheet of plastic wrap.
step-14: wrap the steak up, tightly securing each side.
step-15: refrigerate the steak for 1 hour.
step-16: place the flour, eggs, and panko in three separate shallow dishes.
step-17: gently unwrap the steak roll from the plastic wrap.
step-18: dip it into the flour, dusting off any excess.
step-19: dip the steak roll into the eggs, into the panko, and then back into the eggs, and back into the panko.
step-20: preheat oven to 325˚f (160˚c).
step-21: fill a pot with tall sides with one inch (2 cm) of oil and heat to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-22: gently place the steak roll into the oil, and fry until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes.
step-23: gently turn the steak over with tongs, and fry until the other side is golden brown, about 2 minutes.
step-24: transfer the steak roll to a baking sheet.
step-25: bake for 25-30 minutes.
step-26: to a small pot on medium heat melt the butter, add garlic and the flour, mix the ingredients together until a loose paste forms and cook this mixture on low until it starts to darken just a bit, about 5 minutes.
step-27: add in the milk, salt, nutmeg, pepper, and whisk until smooth.
step-28: let the gravy come to a simmer, then take off the heat.
step-29: once the steak rolls are finished.
step-30: rest at room temperature for at least 10 minutes.
step-31: slice into four to six slices.
step-32: serve with mashed potatoes, green beans, carrots, corn and peppercorn gravy.

step-1: sprinkle the chicken breasts with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and onion powder, tossing to coat evenly.
step-2: on a cutting board, place a chicken breast between two sheets of plastic wrap and pound until about ½ inch (1 cm) thick with a meat mallet, rolling pin, or heavy pan.
step-3: remove the plastic wrap and place a layer of swiss cheese, then ham, then one more layer of swiss cheese.
step-4: evenly roll the chicken, and place onto a new sheet of plastic wrap.
step-5: wrap the chicken in the plastic wrap, twist the excess plastic, and roll the chicken while twisting the sides in to tighten and firm up the roll of chicken cordon bleu.
step-6: tie the excess and chill in the fridge to set for 30 minutes.
step-7: after the rolls are set, prepare large, wide dishes with flour, beaten egg, and bread crumbs.
step-8: dredge the chicken in the flour, egg, and then bread crumbs.
step-9: place the breaded chicken cordon bleu in a 325°f (170°c) pot of oil, and cook about 5 minutes per side or until the outside is an even golden brown.
step-10: if a good color is achieved and the chicken’s center is still not 165°f (74°c), you can finish the chicken in an oven at 325°f (170°c) until that temperature is reached.
step-11: in a 1.5-quart saucepan on medium heat, melt the butter and cook the garlic until soft.
step-12: add in flour, and whisk for 1 minute.
step-13: add in the milk, and whisk until fully combined with the roux.
step-14: continue whisking until the mixture comes to a simmer and has thickened.
step-15: add in the dijon mustard, salt, pepper, and parmesan cheese.
step-16: whisk to combine.
step-17: set aside.
step-18: slice chicken and serve drizzled with dijon sauce.

step-1: make the cabbage slaw: combine the cabbage, onion, tomato, cilantro, jalapeño, lime juice, and salt in a large bowl.
step-2: toss well, then set aside.
step-3: make the crispy fish: in a large bowl, combine the flour, old bay, and baking powder.
step-4: add the beer and whisk until smooth.
step-5: let sit for 15 minutes.
step-6: heat the vegetable oil in a large pot until it reaches 350°f (180°c).
step-7: coat the fish in the batter, then transfer to the oil and fry until golden on the outside and cooked through, 5-7 minutes.
step-8: drain the fish on a wire rack set over a baking sheet lined with paper towels.
step-9: make the avocado crema: add the avocados, sour cream, lime juice, and salt to a blender and blend until smooth.
step-10: to assemble the tacos, add a bit of the cabbage slaw to a warmed tortilla.
step-11: top with a piece of fried fish, avocado crema, and sliced radish.

step-1: in a medium bowl, add the salt, pepper, onion powder, garlic powder, paprika, cumin, oregano, and cayenne and mix until combined.
step-2: pour half of the spice mix into the flour, mixing until the spices are evenly distributed throughout the flour.
step-3: add the chicken to a bowl, and sprinkle the remaining spice blend over it.
step-4: mix until all the chicken pieces are evenly coated.
step-5: pour the buttermilk over the chicken, and stir until the residual spices from the chicken have blended in with the buttermilk to create a light orange color.
step-6: marinate the chicken in the fridge for 2 to 8 hours.
step-7: heat oil to about 325°f (170°c) in a large cast iron skillet.
step-8: dredge each piece of chicken into the flour, shaking off any excess.
step-9: dip them back into the buttermilk mixture, then back into the flour.
step-10: make sure to shake off excess flour or it’ll burn while frying.
step-11: fry 3-4 chicken pieces at a time, occasionally turning the pieces over.
step-12: cook for about 10-12 minutes, until golden brown and crispy.
step-13: rest the chicken pieces on a wire rack to let excess oil drain off.
step-14: drizzle with honey, then serve!

step-1: thoroughly wash the potatoes and peel the skin off.
step-2: cut into smaller pieces and place in a pot of cold water.
step-3: bring to a boil over medium high heat and allow potatoes to cook until they are soft.
step-4: place softened potatoes into a large bowl.
step-5: mix in sour cream, cumin, salt and pepper, and mash until well combined.
step-6: wrap the tortillas in a damp towel or paper towel and microwave for 15-20 seconds, so they don’t break.
step-7: on half of the tortilla, place about one tbsp.
step-8: of the potato mixture and spread it around.
step-9: fold the tortilla in half and repeat with the rest of the tortillas.
step-10: heat one inch of vegetable oil in a pan.
step-11: carefully, place the potato tacos in the pan, allowing them to cook for about two minutes on each side.
step-12: once they have developed a golden color, remove from oil and strain excess oil off on a paper towel.
step-13: serve with your favorite toppings.

step-1: in a large saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter.
step-2: add the marshmallows and stir until melted.
step-3: add the crispy rice cereal and stir to coat.
step-4: while the crispy rice cereal mix is still warm, transfer them to a greased 10-inch (25 cm) springform pan.
step-5: using a greased measuring cup, press down into the cereal to form to the pan.
step-6: press the edges against the springform pan to create walls.
step-7: set aside.
step-8: place the chocolate in a small microwave-safe bowl and pour the heavy cream on top.
step-9: microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring until melted, about 1 minute.
step-10: in a large bowl, mix the cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla until smooth.
step-11: pour in the melted chocolate and stir to incorporate.
step-12: add 1½ cups (90 g) of whipped cream to the chocolate mixture and fold with a spatula until combined.
step-13: pour the cheesecake mixture into the crispy rice base and smooth the top with a spatula.
step-14: refrigerate for 3-4 hours or overnight, until the cheesecake is set.
step-15: release the springform.
step-16: put the remaining cup of whipped cream in a piping bag fitted with a star tip and decorate the top of the cheesecake.
step-17: use a vegetable peeler to shave the chocolate into the middle of the cheesecake.
step-18: slice and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: in a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, salt, baking powder, and baking soda.
step-4: in a large bowl, whisk together the butter, brown sugar, and granulated sugar until smooth.
step-5: add the egg and vanilla, then whisk until well combined.
step-6: gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, using a rubber spatula to incorporate.
step-7: do not overmix.
step-8: fold in the rice cereal, chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, and oats.
step-9: cover the bowl with plastic wrap and chill the dough in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-10: scoop 1-tablespoon-sized balls of cookie dough onto the prepared baking sheet.
step-11: bake for 10 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-12: let cool on baking sheet for 1 minute before transferring to a wire rack.
step-13: sprinkle with flaky sea salt, if desired.

step-1: heat a large sauté pan over medium heat.
step-2: add olive oil, garlic, and chile flakes.
step-3: stir, cooking until the garlic is lightly golden and fragrant, about 2-3 minutes.
step-4: add the crushed tomatoes and season with salt, black pepper, and basil.
step-5: bring the sauce to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: on a clean work surface, butterfly the chicken breasts.
step-8: cover with plastic wrap, and use a rolling pin or meat mallet to pound out the chicken to ¼-inch (6-mm) thick.
step-9: season each side with salt and black pepper.
step-10: with the cut side of the chicken facing up, arrange a flat layer of 4 half slices of ham, followed by 4 half slices of mozzarella.
step-11: roll toward you, starting the with the thickest part of the chicken.
step-12: wrap tightly in plastic wrap and chill in the fridge for 30 minutes.
step-13: place the panko in a wide, shallow bowl, and add the parmesan cheese and oregano.
step-14: stir to incorporate.
step-15: prepare two more wide bowls with the flour and the beaten egg.
step-16: unwrap the chicken and dredge in the flour, eggs, then bread crumbs.
step-17: heat the oil in a large pot until it reaches 325°f (170°c).
step-18: add the chicken, two rolls at a time, and cook about 5 minutes per side or until the outside is an even golden brown.
step-19: if a good color is achieved and the chicken’s center is still not 165°f (74°c), you can finish cooking the chicken in an oven set to 325°f (170°c) until that temperature is reached.
step-20: place the fried chicken in an ovenproof dish.
step-21: spoon the tomato sauce over the top, saving some for serving.
step-22: arrange fresh mozzarella slices on top.
step-23: broil on the center rack for 8-10 minutes, until the cheese is melted and has small brown bubbles.
step-24: garnish with fresh basil and serve with the reserved tomato sauce alongside.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180˚c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: combine the chickpeas, olive oil, garlic, red pepper flakes, black pepper, and salt in a large bowl and toss to coat.
step-4: transfer the chickpeas to the baking sheet and bake until golden and crisp, 40-45 minutes, shaking halfway through cooking.

step-1: on a cutting board, slice each chicken breast into strips.
step-2: in a bowl, combine the buttermilk and sriracha and mix to combine.
step-3: add the chicken strips and submerge in the buttermilk mixture.
step-4: cover with plastic wrap.
step-5: or toss all of the ingredients into a resealable bag.
step-6: refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
step-7: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-8: in a shallow dish, add the panko, flour, salt, pepper, paprika, and seasoning salt and mix to combine.
step-9: dip the chicken strips in the panko mixture, ensuring they are fully coated.
step-10: line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper and brush with canola oil.
step-11: transfer the chicken to the baking sheet, and bake for 10 minutes.
step-12: flip the chicken over, and bake for an additional 10 minutes.
step-13: if desired, broil for 2-3 minutes to crisp up at the end.
step-14: transfer the chicken to a paper towel-lined plate to remove extra grease.

step-1: in a saucepan, combine the milk, double cream, onion, garlic and bay leaves and heat over a medium heat until it just starts to boil.
step-2: take off the heat and leave to infuse for 10 minutes.
step-3: pour the milk mixture through a sieve into a jug.
step-4: then, in a saucepan, gently melt the butter and add the flour.
step-5: stir together over a low-medium heat for 1 -2 minutes.
step-6: gradually add the milk in three parts whilst continually stirring.
step-7: continue to stir and bring the sauce to a gentle boil.
step-8: take off the heat and stir in the dijon mustard and ground nutmeg.
step-9: next, brush the two slices of bread with the melted butter and grill for about 5 minutes until golden brown.
step-10: take out of the grill and preheat the heat the oven to 180°c (350°f).
step-11: flip the slices of bread over and spread one slice with a thin layer of dijon mustard, followed by another layer of the béchamel sauce, followed by the cheese and then the ham.
step-12: place the other slice of bread on top and coat with more béchamel sauce and cheese.
step-13: bake for about 15 minutes, until the cheese is bubbling.
step-14: serve with fresh salad!

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: in a pot, heat the milk and vanilla bean pod and seeds over medium heat, bringing it to a boil.
step-3: once it begins to boil, turn off the heat and let steep for 15 minutes.
step-4: using a hand mixer, beat the egg yolks and sugar until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes.
step-5: add the cornstarch and mix until fully incorporated.
step-6: remove the vanilla bean pod from the milk.
step-7: add ½ cup (120 ml) of the milk to the egg yolk mixture and mix until well combined.
step-8: add the remaining milk mixture and beat until fully incorporated.
step-9: over medium heat, whisk the mixture constantly until thickened, about 7-10 minutes.
step-10: remove from the heat and add the butter, whisking to combine.
step-11: strain the custard into a bowl to ensure a creamy custard (optional).
step-12: cover the custard with plastic wrap, making sure that the plastic touches the custard, and chill for at least 2 hour.
step-13: in a large pot, bring the water, butter, salt, and sugar to a boil over high heat.
step-14: once the water begins to boil, remove the pot from the heat and immediately add the flour, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon until the liquid is absorbed and the mixture begins to form a ball.
step-15: return the pot to the heat and cook for another 30 seconds to remove excess moisture.
step-16: remove the pot from the heat.
step-17: working quickly, add the eggs, one at a time, stirring until fully incorporated.
step-18: continue stirring until the dough starts to pull away from the sides of the pan and is thick and glossy.
step-19: alternatively, you can use a stand mixer with the paddle attachment.
step-20: using a piping bag with a standard round tip, fill the bag with the batter.
step-21: place 1-inch (2 cm) dollops on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, spaced at least 1-inch (2 cm) apart.
step-22: use a wet fingertip to gently press down any points on the puffs.
step-23: brush the egg wash over the the puffs.
step-24: bake for 15 minutes.
step-25: reduce heat to 375˚f (190˚c), and bake for 15 minutes.
step-26: let puffs cool completely.
step-27: use the bottom of a wooden skewer to create an opening in the bottom of the cream puff shells, just big enough for a piping tip to insert.
step-28: fill a piping bag fitting with a small round tip with the custard.
step-29: gently fill the puff shells with the custard.
step-30: add the sugar, corn syrup, and water to a pan over medium heat.
step-31: bring to a boil and put the lid on, cooking for 5 minutes without moving.
step-32: remove the lid and cook for an additional 7-10 minutes, until the caramel is a deep amber color and reaches 300˚f (150˚c).
step-33: remove the pan from the heat and add the heavy cream, stirring vigorously.
step-34: working quickly, dip the cream puffs into the caramel and arrange on a serving platter in a circular pattern.
step-35: continue to stack caramel-dipped cream puffs in a tower shape.
step-36: once your tower is completed, dip a fork into the caramel sauce and drizzle it around the tower.

step-1: add the potatoes to a large pot with enough cold water to cover them.
step-2: bring to a boil over high heat and cook until tender when pierced with a fork, about 30 minutes.
step-3: drain the potatoes and transfer to a large bowl.
step-4: use a potato masher to mash the potatoes until there are no large chunks left.
step-5: add the garlic, parsley, parmesan cheese, 1 beaten egg, salt, and pepper.
step-6: mix well.
step-7: take a spoonful of potatoes and form into a patty.
step-8: place a cheese stick in the middle and wrap the potato around the cheese until it is evenly covered.
step-9: arrange the formed croquettes on a parchment-lined baking sheet and freeze for 30 minutes.
step-10: place the flour, 3 remaining eggs, and bread crumbs in 3 separate shallow bowls.
step-11: dredge the croquettes in the flour, shaking off any excess; then dredge in the egg and the bread crumbs.
step-12: heat the oil in a large pot until it reaches 350°f (180°c).
step-13: fry the croquettes for 3 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-14: transfer the croquettes to a wire rack set over paper towels to drain the excess oil.
step-15: let cool for a few minutes as they will be hot.
step-16: garnish with grated parmesan cheese and parsley and serve with marinara sauce alongside.

step-1: in a large bowl, add the tuna and avocado.
step-2: use a fork to smash the avocado and tuna together.
step-3: add the carrots, celery, red onion, dijon mustard, lemon juice, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
step-4: stir to combine.
step-5: lay a tortilla flat on a plate.
step-6: lay a lettuce leaf on the tortilla.
step-7: scoop ¼ of the tuna mixture into the center of the lettuce and spread down the middle.
step-8: top with cherry tomatoes and carefully roll the the tortilla to create a wrap.
step-9: repeat with the remaining ingredients.

step-1: in a small pot, season the water with a pinch of salt.
step-2: bring to a boil over high heat.
step-3: add the rinsed rice and return to a boil.
step-4: cover, reduce the heat to simmer, and cook for 20 minutes, until the water is absorbed and the rice is tender.
step-5: in a small bowl, stir together the sugar, salt, and rice vinegar.
step-6: microwave for 2 minutes, or until the sugar dissolves.
step-7: transfer the cooked rice to a medium bowl and pour the vinegar mixture over it, then stir well using a wooden spoon.
step-8: heat the canola oil in a medium pan over medium-high heat.
step-9: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the panko and cook, stirring frequently, until golden brown, 1-2 minutes.
step-10: season with salt and pepper, and remove from the heat.
step-11: in a small bowl, stir together the mayonnaise and sriracha until smooth.
step-12: to assemble the bowls, divide the seasoned rice between 2 serving bowls.
step-13: top with the crab, crispy panko, cucumber, radish, nori, scallions, sesame seeds, pickled ginger, and avocado.
step-14: drizzle the sriracha mayonnaise over the top.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: grease a baking sheet with nonstick spray.
step-3: drain, rinse, and dry the chickpeas.
step-4: spread on the prepared baking sheet in a single layer.
step-5: bake the chickpeas for 40-45 minutes, until golden and slightly dry.
step-6: remove from the oven and carefully transfer to a medium bowl.
step-7: keep the oven on.
step-8: add the olive oil, chili powder, garlic powder, and salt.
step-9: toss until the chickpeas are well coated.
step-10: return the chickpeas to the baking sheet and bake for another 10-15 minutes, until golden brown and crunchy.

step-1: remove crust from bread.
step-2: cut bread into large square pieces.
step-3: crush cornflakes in a baggie, pour into shallow dish, and set aside.
step-4: mix eggs, milks, brown sugar, cinnamon, and vanilla in a bowl.
step-5: heat skillet with about 1 tablespoon of butter.
step-6: dip bread into egg mixture on all sides.
step-7: coat in crushed cornflakes.
step-8: grill on all sides until golden brown in skillet.
step-9: immediately roll in cinnamon sugar mixture.
step-10: serve with syrup or chocolate sauce for dipping.

step-1: slice the jalapeños lengthwise down the center, taking care to cut through only one side and leaving the pepper as intact as possible.
step-2: remove the seeds.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the ground beef, taco seasoning, salt, pepper, and cilantro.
step-4: mix to combine.
step-5: heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
step-6: cook the onion for 1 minute, then add garlic and cook another minute
step-7: add the beef mixture and cook until browned, approximately 5 minutes.
step-8: remove from the heat and let cool completely.
step-9: in a clean, large bowl, combine the cooled beef mixture, shredded cheese, and cream cheese.
step-10: transfer the beef mixture to a piping bag or zip-top bag with a corner snipped off.
step-11: pipe the beef mixture into the jalapeños, then close the peppers.
step-12: heat a large pot filled with the oil until it reaches 325ºf (170ºc).
step-13: add the seasoned flour, eggs, and cornflakes to 3 separate shallow bowls.
step-14: dip the peppers in the egg, then the flour, followed by the egg again, and then the cornflakes.
step-15: dip once more in the egg and finish with a second dip in the cornflakes.
step-16: fry the peppers, in batches, for 2½ minutes until golden brown.
step-17: remove with a slotted spoon or tongs and drain on a wire cooling rack.
step-18: season the peppers well with salt and fresh lime juice.
step-19: serve warm with salsa for dipping.

step-1: set a wire rack over a baking sheet.
step-2: add the shrimp to a medium bowl.
step-3: cover with cold water and let sit until thawed, about 10 minutes.
step-4: drain the thawed shrimp on paper towels and pat dry.
step-5: place the cornstarch in a large bowl.
step-6: add the shrimp and toss until well-coated.
step-7: heat the oil in a wok or large pan until it reaches 400°f (200°c).
step-8: add the garlic and fry for 40 seconds-1 minute, until golden brown.
step-9: remove the garlic with a strainer or slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
step-10: fry the shrimp, about 6 at a time, for 2 minutes, or until light golden brown.
step-11: transfer to the wire rack to drain.
step-12: in a clean wok or large pan, add the ginger and red pepper flakes and toast for 2 minutes, until the ginger is starting to brown.
step-13: add the shrimp and toss to combine.
step-14: season with the salt and pepper and toss until well-coated.
step-15: transfer the shrimp to a plate and garnish with the scallions and fried garlic.
step-16: serve with rice.

step-1: preheat oven to 375º f.
step-2: in a large skillet, brown the ground beef and drain any remaining fat.
step-3: transfer to a bowl.
step-4: add taco seasoning, tomatoes and green chiles to the ground beef and stir to combine.
step-5: cut flour tortillas into a square shape and cut each into 4 smaller equally sized square pieces.
step-6: generously coat a standard size muffin tin with nonstick cooking spray.
step-7: line each cup of prepared muffin tin with a tortilla sheet.
step-8: add 1.5 tablespoons taco mixture.
step-9: top with 1 tablespoon of cheese.
step-10: press down and add another layer of tortilla sheet, taco mixture, and a final layer of cheese.
step-11: lightly brush the top edges of the tortilla with cooking oil.
step-12: bake 18-20 minutes until cups are heated through and edges are golden brown.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a large skillet over medium heat, heat the olive oil.
step-3: add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally until caramelized, about 10 minutes.
step-4: add the red bell pepper and jalapeño.
step-5: cook until softened, about 3 minutes.
step-6: add the ground beef, breaking apart with your spoon, and mix into the other ingredients.
step-7: add the taco seasoning and the lime juice.
step-8: mix thoroughly, cover, and refrigerate until ready to use.
step-9: on a cutting board, place the stack of tortillas.
step-10: cut off two round sides of the tortillas, leaving a 4-inch (10-cm) wide middle section.
step-11: cut the middle section in half vertically.
step-12: generously spray a bundt pan with nonstick spray.
step-13: place the middle strips of tortilla in the bundt pan in a fanning pattern.
step-14: each tortillas strip should slightly overlap the previous strip.
step-15: sprinkle half of the cheddar cheese on top of the tortillas.
step-16: spread half of the ground beef mixture on top of the cheese.
step-17: place a third of the round strips of tortilla on top of the ground beef mixture in a fanning pattern.
step-18: sprinkle half of the monterey jack on top of the tortillas.
step-19: sprinkle the tortilla chips on top of the cheese.
step-20: place another third of the round strips of tortilla on top of the chips in a fanning pattern.
step-21: sprinkle the rest of the cheddar cheese on top of the tortillas.
step-22: spread the rest of the ground beef mixture on top of the cheese.
step-23: sprinkle the rest of the monterey jack on top of the ground beef mixture.
step-24: place the rest of the tortillas on top of the cheese in a fanning pattern.
step-25: bake for 45 minutes until crispy and browned.
step-26: let cool for 20 minutes.
step-27: place a plate on top of the bundt pan, and invert the ring onto the plate.
step-28: slice and serve with salsa.

step-1: in a large mason jar, add the peanut butter, soy sauce and sriracha and stir to combine.
step-2: add the cabbage, broccoli florets, bell pepper, chives, carrots, peanuts, and lettuce and screw on the lid.
step-3: store in the refrigerator until ready to eat, up to 5 days.
step-4: give the mason jar a good shake to mix and use a fork or spoon to stir as needed.

step-1: cut the crust off of the bread and separate the pieces.
step-2: spread the nut butter on both sides of the bread, followed by the jam.
step-3: put the pieces of bread together and pinch all along the sides with your fingers, and then press the seam with a fork to make a seal.
