step-4: place in bento box followed by carrots, and blueberries.
step-5: pack bento box in a lunch box with a frozen water bottle to keep everything cold.

step-1: cut off the ends of the cuban bread, then slice in half.
step-2: add mustard, then ham, then pork, then cheese, then pickles, then place the bun on top.
step-3: place the sandwich on pan or griddle over low heat.
step-4: brush top with melted butter.
step-5: press the sandwich with a panini press, or if you don’t have a press use a heavy pot or pie dish and push down.
step-6: cook 5-10 minutes on each side or until golden brown and cheese is melted.

step-1: place the cucumber, mint, apple, honey, and avocado in a blender or food processor and blend until just combined.
step-2: add in the ice and continue to blend until the mixture is smooth.
step-3: serve immediately.

step-1: in a medium bowl, mix together cream cheese, smoked salmon, dill, garlic powder, and black pepper.
step-2: using a vegetable peeler or mandoline, peel the cucumbers lengthwise into thin slices.
step-3: discard the outer peel.
step-4: pat the peeled cucumber slices with paper towels to absorb any excess moisture.
step-5: spread a small spoonful of filling over a cucumber slice.
step-6: starting from one end, tightly roll the cucumber into a spiral.
step-7: repeat with remaining cucumber slices and filling.

step-1: slice then dice cucumber.
step-2: slice then dice tomatoes.
step-3: slice avocado and carefully remove stone.
step-4: scoop out inside and dice.
step-5: peel onion and remove tops.
step-6: then slice.
step-7: chop cilantro and place in a large salad bowl with previous ingredients.
step-8: toss with olive oil, lemon juice, salt and pepper.
step-9: serve in a bowl.

step-1: preheat oven to 450°f (230°c).
step-2: using a spiralizer, spiralize the potatoes.
step-3: spread the potatoes evenly in one single layer on a baking sheet.
step-4: drizzle the oil over the potatoes and sprinkle with salt, pepper, paprika, cumin, garlic powder, and chili powder.
step-5: bake for 25-30 minutes until crispy.
step-6: serve with ketchup!

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c) degrees.
step-2: in a large stock pot melt butter on medium heat and cook until it just starts to brown.
step-3: add cinnamon stick, cloves, and crushed cardamom pods and reduce heat to low.
step-4: cook until the spices are fragrant, about 3 minutes.
step-5: strain the spices from the butter and add the spiced butter back into the pot.
step-6: turn the heat up to medium and add onion, cook until caramelized.
step-7: add the garlic and saute for a minute until fragrant.
step-8: add shredded turkey, peas, carrots, gravy, garam masala, a bay leaf.
step-9: simmer for 10 minutes.
step-10: add the heavy cream and season to taste with salt and pepper.
step-11: pour the pot pie filling into a pie pan.
step-12: place spoonfuls of mashed potatoes around the pie pan.
step-13: place a sheet of puff pastry on top, crimping the edges to seal.
step-14: cut slits in the top to for steam.
step-15: in a small bowl, beat the egg with the tablespoon of water until totally combined.
step-16: brush the egg wash onto the puff pastry.
step-17: bake for 45 minutes, or until pastry is cooked through and golden browned on top.
step-18: remove from oven and let it rest for 10 minutes before serving.

step-1: in a large pot, melt the coconut oil over medium heat.
step-2: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the garlic and ginger and cook for 2-3 minutes, until fragrant.
step-3: add the red curry paste and cook another 2-3 minutes.
step-4: add the coconut milk and stir well until the curry paste is evenly distributed.
step-5: add the vegetable broth and bring to a boil.
step-6: once boiling, add the agave and rice noodles, and cook for 2 minutes, stirring frequently to prevent the noodles from sticking together.
step-7: add the tofu, broccoli, and bell pepper, and stir to combine.
step-8: cook for 3-5 more minutes, until the noodles are cooked and the broccoli is tender.
step-9: stir in the lime juice and add salt to taste.
step-10: garnish with cilantro and serve immediately.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c), or heat a large pot filled halfway with cooking oil to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: place a wire rack on top of a baking sheet.
step-3: in large pan, add the vegetable oil, onion, chicken, salt, pepper, cumin, curry powder, and cayenne.
step-4: cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the onion softens.
step-5: add the potatoes, peas and carrots, and milk and stir to combine.
step-6: cook for 10 minutes, stirring to break up the potatoes, until the curry thickens to the consistency of mashed potatoes.
step-7: remove the pan from the heat and let the curry cool for 30 minutes.
step-8: dust a clean surface with flour and roll out the puff pastry to flatten the seams.
step-9: using a wine glass, cut out 8 circles from each pastry sheet.
step-10: scoop 1 tablespoon of the cooled curry filling in the center of a puff pastry circle.
step-11: fold the puff pastry in half, press the edges together, and seal the edges in a folding and rolling motion.
step-12: if baking, place the curry puffs on the prepared baking sheet and brush with the egg wash.
step-13: bake for 15 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-14: if frying, add the curry puffs to the hot oil in batches and fry for 5 minutes, until golden brown.
step-15: let cool for 10 minutes before serving.

step-1: add the rice to a large nonreactive bowl that holds at least double the volume of the rice.
step-2: cover the rice by 2-3 inches (5- 7 ½ cm) with warm water and soak for 2 hours.
step-3: drain the rice and transfer to a steamer basket lined with cheesecloth.
step-4: set the steamer basket over a large pot with several inches of boiling water.
step-5: cover and steam the rice for 30 minutes, or until shiny and tender.
step-6: be careful that the pot doesn’t run dry during steaming; add more water if necessary.
step-7: while the rice steams, pour the coconut milk into a large heavy pot over medium heat and bring to a simmer.
step-8: make sure it does not boil.
step-9: once the coconut milk is simmering, add the sugar, curry powder, lime zest, and salt, and whisk to completely dissolve the sugar and salt in the hot coconut milk.
step-10: when the sticky rice is done, turn it out into a large dish and use a wooden spoon to mix in the coconut milk mixture.
step-11: let stand, covered, for 30 minutes-1 hour to allow the flavors to melt.
step-12: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-13: season the short ribs all over with salt and pepper.
step-14: heat the canola oil in a large dutch oven over high heat.
step-15: working in batches, sear the short ribs on all sides until golden brown, 5-6 minutes.
step-16: remove from the pot and set aside.
step-17: to the dutch oven, add the jalapeño, bay leaves, thyme, and parsley, and cook until fragrant, 1-2 minutes.
step-18: deglaze the pan with the red wine, scraping any browned bits from the bottom of the pot, then add the beef stock and orange juice.
step-19: return the short ribs back to the pan.
step-20: cover and braise in the oven for 3 hours, until the meat pulls apart easily with a fork.
step-21: set aside to cool slightly, then shred the short ribs with 2 forks.
step-22: using a 3-inch square mold, add a scoop of rice to the mold and spread in an even layer.
step-23: scoop in a layer of short rib, then cover with more rice.
step-24: garnish with sesame seeds.
step-25: unmold the rice and repeat with the remaining ingredients.
step-26: serve with lime wedges.

step-1: cut your sausage into slivers and brown in a pan on medium, with oil.
step-2: once cooked, set aside.
step-3: add your diced onion into the pan and brown them before adding your can of whole tomatoes, curry, paprika, mustard, and chili powder.
step-4: add salt and pepper to taste.
step-5: stew the ingredients together, mashing the whole tomatoes, and let simmer on low for 20 minutes.
step-6: place your sausage onto your hawaiian rolls, top with your relish and finish with a sprinkle of curry powder.

step-1: blend up all of the biscuits until they resemble bread crumbs, save ¼ (about 50g (¼ cup)) for later.
step-2: add the cream cheese and blend again for another 30 seconds or so until everything is combined but not a dough.
step-3: form the mixture into about 8 little balls using your hands and refrigerate on baking paper for 1 hour.
step-4: break the chocolate into small squares and melt it.
step-5: this can be done in the microwave by heating on full for 30 seconds at a time and stirring, repeating this process until creamy.
step-6: coat the custard cream balls with the chocolate and then with the leftover blended biscuits.
step-7: chill for another 30 minutes.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
step-3: chill a large bowl in the freezer.
step-4: add the melted chocolate to a small piping bag or zip-top bag and cut ⅛ inch (3 mm) off the tip of the bag.
step-5: pipe 10 sets of ears, eyes, noses, mouths, and paws onto 1 of the parchment-lined baking sheets.
step-6: chill in the refrigerator until ready to use.
step-7: make the puffs: in a medium pot, bring the butter, water, milk, sugar, and salt to a boil over high heat.
step-8: once the liquid begins to boil, remove the pot from the heat and immediately add the flour, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon until the liquid is absorbed and the mixture begins to form a ball.
step-9: return the pot to the heat and cook for another 30 seconds to remove excess moisture.
step-10: remove the pot from the heat.
step-11: working quickly, add the eggs one at a time, stirring until each one is fully incorporated before adding the next.
step-12: continue stirring until the dough starts to pull away from the sides of the pan and is thick and glossy.
step-13: transfer the batter to a piping bag or zip-top bag fitted with a round tip.
step-14: pipe 1-inch (2-cm) dollops of batter on the prepared baking sheet, spacing them at least 1-inch (2-cm) apart.
step-15: dip a fingertip in the egg wash and gently press down any points, then brush the egg wash lightly all over the puffs.
step-16: bake for 10 minutes.
step-17: reduce the oven temperature to 350˚f (180˚c), and continue to bake for 20 minutes more, until golden brown.
step-18: transfer the puffs to a wire rack and cool until able to handle.
step-19: cut the tops off of the puffs with a serrated knife.
step-20: let cool completely.
step-21: make the whipped cream: add the heavy cream and powdered sugar to the chilled bowl and beat with an electric hand mixer or whisk until stiff peaks form.
step-22: transfer the whipped cream to a piping bag or zip-top bag fitted with a round tip.
step-23: pipe mounds of whipped cream into the puffs.
step-24: add the tops of the puffs and decorate with the chocolate faces.

step-1: microwave candy melts for 60 seconds.
step-2: stir half way.
step-3: stick marshmallows on lollipop sticks and dip into candy melts.
step-4: set them aside until they have hardened.
step-5: decorate your monster marshmallows however you like.

step-1: grease an 8-inch (20 cm) tart pan generously with coconut oil.
step-2: add the almonds, cashews, dates, coconut, coconut milk, vanilla, and salt to a food processor and pulse until the nuts are finely ground and the crust starts to clump together.
step-3: transfer the crust to the tart pan and use your hands to press it into an even layer.
step-4: chill in the refrigerator while making the filling.
step-5: add the avocados, coconut butter, cornstarch, key lime zest, key lime juice, maple syrup, coconut milk, vanilla, and salt to a food processor and blend until smooth and fully combined.
step-6: pour the filling into the crust and spread into an even layer.
step-7: garnish with shredded coconut, if desired.
step-8: chill for at least 3 hours, or overnight, until the filling has fully set.

step-1: the night before you intend to make your “cheesecake,” place cashews in a bowl of water and let soak overnight.
step-2: to make the crust, add walnuts, almonds, dates, vanilla extract, water and salt to a food processor or blender and pulse until sticky mounds begin to form.
step-3: press the crust into a 7-inch (18 cm) springform pan lined with parchment paper.
step-4: drain the cashews well and add to the food processor.
step-5: blend until smooth.
step-6: scrape down the sides of the processor and add lime juice, maple syrup, vanilla extract and lime zest.
step-7: blend until smooth, adding the coconut oil half way.
step-8: spread about ⅓-½ of the mixture on top of your crust to make the first layer.
step-9: freeze for 30 minutes to set.
step-10: add blueberries to the remaining cashew mixture and blend until combined.
step-11: spread the rest of the mixture onto the cheesecake and garnish with fresh lime zest and blueberries.
step-12: cover with foil and freeze for 3 hours to set, then transfer to the fridge.

step-1: season the chicken all over with 1½ teaspoons salt and 1 teaspoon pepper.
step-2: heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
step-3: once the oil is shimmering, add the chicken breasts, 2 at a time, and cook for 4-5 minutes, until golden brown.
step-4: add more olive oil, if needed, and flip and cook on the other side for 4-5 minutes more, until golden brown and the internal temperature reads 165ºf (75˚c).
step-5: remove from the pan, set aside, and cover to keep warm while you repeat with the remaining chicken.
step-6: fill a large pot with water and bring to a boil over high heat.
step-7: once at a rolling boil, generously salt the water then add the fettuccine.
step-8: cook according to the package instructions.
step-9: drain and return to the pot.
step-10: meanwhile, heat the remaining 3 tablespoons of olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
step-11: once the oil is hot, add the shallots and garlic, season with a pinch of salt, and cook until the shallot is translucent, 3-4 minutes.
step-12: stir in the flour and whisk for 3-4 minutes, until golden brown.
step-13: add the coconut milk and chicken stock.
step-14: bring up to a low boil and cook for about 1 minute, then reduce the heat to low-medium and cook, stirring frequently, until thickened, about 10 minutes.
step-15: stir in the lemon juice and season with the remaining 2 teaspoons salt and 1½ teaspoons pepper.
step-16: pour the sauce over the fettuccine and toss well to coat.
step-17: slice the chicken.
step-18: divide the pasta between bowls and top with the chicken.
step-19: garnish with parsley and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a food processor, pulse rolled oats until finely ground.
step-3: add almonds and blend until finely chopped.
step-4: add unsweetened coconut flakes and salt.
step-5: pulse a few times.
step-6: add melted coconut oil and maple syrup until combined.
step-7: pour pie mixture into a greased 9x9-inch pie dish, spreading it evenly on the bottom and sides.
step-8: poke the crust with a fork several times.
step-9: bake for 20 minutes.
step-10: for the filling, add the avocados, coconut cream, cocoa powder,coconut milk, maple syrup, and salt to a blender and blend until smooth.
step-11: pour mixture into the cooled crust and spread an even layer.
step-12: place in the refrigerator for 4 hours or overnight.
step-13: for the coconut whipped cream, add the thick part of the coconut milk to a bowl.
step-14: using an electric mixer, beat the coconut milk until fluffy.
step-15: add vanilla extract and maple syrup and beat until well combined.
step-16: chill until ready to serve.
step-17: top with toasted coconut flakes.

step-1: grease 4 4-ounce (115 g) ramekins with coconut oil and set aside.
step-2: in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat, combine the dark chocolate, coconut cream, sugar, and instant espresso.
step-3: warm slowly, stirring occasionally, until the sugar is dissolved and the mixture is simmering.
step-4: add the agar agar to the hot water and stir until there are no lumps and the agar agar is fully dissolved.
step-5: pour the agar mixture into the warm coconut cream mixture and whisk to combine.
step-6: increase the heat to medium, bring to a gentle boil, and whisk continuously for 3 minutes, until thickened.
step-7: remove from the heat and immediately divide between the greased ramekins.
step-8: refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
step-9: (the agar will set at room temperature, but chilling the panna cotta in the fridge will expedite the process.)
step-10: when ready to serve, use an offset spatula or butter knife to carefully work around the edges of the ramekins to loosen the panna cotta.
step-11: invert onto serving plates and garnish with shaved dark chocolate and espresso beans.
step-12: nutrition - calories: 387, total fat: 31 grams, sodium: 19 grams, total carbs: 29 grams, dietary fiber: 8 grams, sugars: 21 grams, protein: 3 grams

step-1: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: grease a 6-indent donut pan with nonstick spray.
step-3: combine the flour, baking powder, and a pinch of salt in a medium bowl.
step-4: in a large bowl, combine the applesauce, almond milk, maple syrup, vanilla, and apple cider vinegar.
step-5: whisk until smooth.
step-6: using a spatula, fold the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients in two additions until thoroughly combined.
step-7: pour the batter into the donut pan and smooth the tops with a spatula.
step-8: bake for 15–20 minutes, or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted in a donut comes out clean.
step-9: let cool for 5–10 minutes, then invert onto a wire rack to cool completely.
step-10: combine the powdered sugar and cocoa powder in a wide, medium bowl.
step-11: add the almond milk, about 2 tablespoons at a time, until the glaze is smooth, but thick enough to set on top of the donuts.
step-12: dip the top of each donut in the glaze and return to baking rack to let any excess glaze drip off.
step-13: if using sprinkles, add them immediately after glazing the donuts.
step-14: work quickly, as the glaze will harden very fast.

step-1: grease 4 4-ounce (115 g) ramekins with coconut oil and set aside.
step-2: in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat, combine the coconut cream, sugar, and matcha powder.
step-3: warm slowly, stirring occasionally, until the sugar is dissolved and the mixture is simmering.
step-4: add the agar agar to hot water and stir until there are no lumps and the agar agar is fully dissolved.
step-5: pour the agar mixture into the warm coconut cream and whisk to combine.
step-6: increase the heat to medium, bring to a gentle boil, and whisk continuously for 3 minutes, until thickened.
step-7: remove from the heat and immediately divide between the greased ramekins.
step-8: refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
step-9: (the agar will set at room temperature, but chilling the panna cotta in the fridge will expedite the process.)
step-10: when ready to serve, use an offset spatula or butter knife to carefully work around the edges of the ramekins to loosen the panna cotta.
step-11: invert onto serving plates and garnish with coconut flakes.
step-12: nutrition - calories: 329, total fat: 27 grams, sodium: 16 mg, total carbs: 23 grams, dietary fiber: 7 grams, sugars: 16 grams, protein: 3 grams

step-1: the night before you intend to make the “cheesecake,” place the cashews in a medium bowl and cover with water.
step-2: soak overnight.
step-3: to make the crust, add the walnuts, almonds, dates, coconut, vanilla extract, water, and salt to a food processor or blender and pulse until sticky mounds begin to form.
step-4: press the crust into a 7-inch (18 cm) springform pan lined with parchment paper.
step-5: set aside at room temperature.
step-6: to make the cookie dough, add the flour, coconut oil, maple syrup, vanilla extract, and salt to a medium bowl.
step-7: stir until a soft dough forms.
step-8: fold in the chocolate chunks, then cover and chill in the refrigerator while you make the filling.
step-9: drain the cashews and add to a food processor, along with the maple syrup, coconut oil, lemon juice, and vanilla extract.
step-10: blend until completely smooth, scraping down the sides as needed.
step-11: remove the cookie dough from the refrigerator and use your hands to form ½-inch (1 cm) cookie dough balls.
step-12: sprinkle a handful of cookie dough balls over the crust, saving some for later.
step-13: pour the cashew filling gently and evenly over the cookie dough balls and crust.
step-14: gently spread the mixture to cover all of the cookie dough balls.
step-15: top with the remaining cookie dough balls, then cover and freeze for about 2 hours to set.
step-16: then, transfer to the refrigerator until ready to serve.

step-1: gently melt the butter over a low-medium heat.
step-2: add milk and 2 tablespoons of sunflower oil and mix together.
step-3: once combined, take off the heat and set aside.
step-4: in a separate bowl, combine the flour, half of the sugar, baking powder and salt with a fork.
step-5: make a well in the centre.
step-6: pour the butter mixture into the well.
step-7: combine gradually until a thick dough forms.
step-8: using your hands, roll dough into little flat balls and with your thumb, press a hole in the centre of each doughnut.
step-9: (you may need to flour your hands for this part to avoid getting sticky!)
step-10: heat up the litre of oil in a pan.
step-11: to know when it's hot enough, fry a little bit of bread in the oil.
step-12: if it goes brown and floats to the top, in 45-50 seconds the oil will be ready!
step-13: gently lay the doughnuts into the oil using a spatula.
step-14: fry for about 3-5 minutes on each side, until golden brown.
step-15: transfer the doughnuts onto some tissue paper to soak up any excess oil.
step-16: then roll into a bowl of the remaining sugar.

step-1: in a small saucepan, boil 3 cups (720 ml) of water.
step-2: pour the water over cashews and allow to sit for 15 minutes then drain in a colander.
step-3: in a blender or food processor combine cashews, ¾ cup (180 ml) water, onion nutritional yeast, garlic, rosemary, pepper, salt, and lemon juice.
step-4: blend until smooth.
step-5: pour mixture over cooked pasta and stir.
step-6: garnish with parsley.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: bring a small pot of water to a boil, then place a strainer over the top.
step-3: add the green beans to the strainer, cover, and steam for 10-15 minutes, or until fork-tender.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: heat a drizzle of olive oil in a medium pot over medium heat.
step-6: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the onion.
step-7: cook for 2 minutes, or until semi-translucent.
step-8: add the mushrooms and cook for 5-6 minutes, until they have released the majority of their juices.
step-9: add 2 tablespoons of olive oil, the garlic, and soy sauce.
step-10: cook for 2-3 minutes, until the garlic is fragrant.
step-11: stir in the flour to make a roux, then season with salt and pepper.
step-12: while stirring continuously, pour in the non-dairy milk and bring to a boil.
step-13: cook for 4-5 minutes, until the sauce has thickened.
step-14: stir in the green beans and ½ cup (75 g) of the fried onions, until combined.
step-15: transfer to a medium baking dish and sprinkle on the remaining cup of fried onions.
step-16: bake for 20 minutes, or until bubbling.
step-17: serve warm.

step-1: the night before you intend to make your key lime bars, place cashews in a bowl of water and let soak overnight.
step-2: add walnuts, coconut, dates, vanilla extract, water, and salt to a food processor or blender and pulse until sticky mounds begin to form.
step-3: press the crust into an 8x8-inch (20x20-cm) freezer-safe, parchment paper-lined pan.
step-4: drain the cashews well and add to the food processor.
step-5: blend until smooth.
step-6: scrape down the sides of the processor and add lime juice, maple syrup, vanilla extract, and lime zest.
step-7: blend until smooth, adding the coconut oil halfway.
step-8: spread the mixture on top of your crust and garnish with more lime zest and coconut.
step-9: cover with foil and freeze for 3 hours or until set.
step-10: remove from freezer, slice, and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-2: zest the lemon into a small bowl and set aside.
step-3: juice the lemon and set aside 1 teaspoon for the glaze.
step-4: combine the rest with ½ cup (120 ml) of almond milk and set aside for 5-10 minutes while you make the rest of the dough.
step-5: (the almond milk will curdle, that’s okay! this creates a dairy-free substitute for buttermilk.)
step-6: in a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, poppy seeds, and lavender.
step-7: whisk well.
step-8: add the coconut oil and cut it into the flour mixture with a pastry cutter, a fork, or your fingers until the flour mixture is crumbly and there are no large chunks left.
step-9: add the lemon zest, curdled almond milk, and egg.
step-10: fold the ingredients until the dough forms.
step-11: transfer the dough to a lightly floured surface.
step-12: sprinkle with just enough flour to keep the dough from sticking as you form it into a disc about 1½-2 inches (4-5 cm) thick.
step-13: cut the dough into 8 triangular scones.
step-14: transfer the scones to the prepared baking sheet, spacing evenly.
step-15: bake for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-16: let cool.
step-17: make the glaze: in a small bowl, combine powdered sugar, remaining 1-2 teaspoons of almond milk, and the reserved teaspoon of lemon juice.
step-18: whisk until smooth.
step-19: drizzle the glaze over the cooled scones and let it harden, 5-10 minutes.
step-20: serve with hot tea.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: cut the top edge of 1 head of garlic off, revealing each of the cloves inside the skin.
step-3: without removing the skin, place the head of garlic on a foil-lined baking sheet.
step-4: drizzle with olive oil.
step-5: wrap the garlic up in the foil, making sure it is tightly closed.
step-6: bake for 45 minutes, or until the garlic is browned and soft.
step-7: set aside to let cool.
step-8: (when you’re ready to add it to the “cheese” sauce, simply squeeze the cloves out of the skin from the uncut end of the bulb, using your fingers.)
step-9: to make the dairy-free “parmesan,” add the cashews, nutritional yeast, salt, and garlic powder to a food processor or blender.
step-10: pulse until you’ve reached a crumbly, “parmesan”-like consistency.
step-11: set aside.
step-12: to make the “cheese” sauce, add the cauliflower, butternut squash, onion, and carrots to a large pot of water.
step-13: bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to medium-low, cover and simmer for 15 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
step-14: remove the vegetables from the heat and drain, reserving ¼ cup (60 ml) of cooking liquid.
step-15: to a food processor or blender, add the drained vegetables, roasted garlic cloves, lemon juice, dijon mustard, nutritional yeast, turmeric, smoked paprika, nutmeg, salt, pepper, reserved cooking liquid, and almond milk.
step-16: blend until completely smooth, adjusting the seasoning to taste.
step-17: pour the sauce over cooked macaroni and stir to combine.
step-18: transfer to a large baking dish and sprinkle with “parmesan” and more paprika, if desired.
step-19: broil on high for 5-10 minutes, or until the top is golden brown.

step-1: in a medium bowl, beat the aquafaba with a hand mixer until foamy.
step-2: add the sugar and continue to beat until medium peaks form.
step-3: add the vanilla and lemon juice and continue to beat until stiff peaks form.
step-4: combine with melted chocolate.
step-5: distribute the mousse into 3 cups (720 g) and chill for at least 3 hours, or overnight.
step-6: garnish with strawberries or fruit of choice.

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine the flour, coconut oil, coconut sugar, and salt.
step-2: use a flexible spatula to combine the ingredients, mashing the contents thoroughly until a uniform dough forms.
step-3: transfer the dough to a floured silicone baking mat.
step-4: flour the top of the dough and the rolling pin and begin rolling out the crust into a circle about 12 inches (30 cm) wide.
step-5: if you do not have a silicone baking mat or other flexible surface, you can roll out the dough between two sheets of plastic wrap.
step-6: roll the baking mat and crust onto the rolling pin and transfer to a 10-inch (25-cm) tart pan.
step-7: unroll the baking mat over the pan, crust side down, and peel off the baking mat.
step-8: if the dough is sticking to the baking mat, transfer the baking mat and dough to the fridge for a few minutes, then try transferring the dough to the tart pan again.
step-9: press the crust against the bottom and sides of the tart pan.
step-10: roll the rolling pin across the top of the tart pan to cut off any excess dough.
step-11: refrigerate the crust for about 20 minutes while you prepare the filling, until the dough has firmed.
step-12: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-13: in a medium bowl, combine the coconut oil, coconut sugar, almond flour, arrowroot, cinnamon, and vanilla with an electric hand mixer.
step-14: pour in the milk and continue mixing until the filling is thick and well-mixed.
step-15: transfer the chilled tart crust to a baking sheet.
step-16: pour the filling into the crust and smooth into an even layer with a spatula.
step-17: arrange the peach slices over the filling in concentric circles.
step-18: bake for 25-30 minutes, until the crust begins to darken and the peaches start to dry out.
step-19: let the tart cool for at least 1 hour before unmolding.
step-20: slice and serve with ice cream, if desired.

step-1: add the cashews to a medium bowl.
step-2: pour in enough warm water to completely cover the cashews, then soak for at least 2 hours, or overnight.
step-3: drain.
step-4: grease 4 4-ounce ramekins with coconut oil and set aside.
step-5: add the cashews to a blender with the water and a pinch of salt.
step-6: blend on high speed for 2 minutes, or until very creamy.
step-7: in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat, combine the cashew cream, maple syrup, pumpkin puree, and pumpkin spice.
step-8: warm slowly, stirring occasionally, until the sugar is dissolved and the mixture is simmering.
step-9: add the agar agar to hot water and stir until there are no lumps and the agar agar is fully dissolved.
step-10: pour the agar mixture into the warm cashew cream and whisk to combine.
step-11: increase the heat to medium, bring to a gentle boil, and whisk continuously for 3 minutes, until thickened.
step-12: remove from the heat and immediately divide between the greased ramekins.
step-13: smooth the tops.
step-14: refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
step-15: (the agar will set at room temperature, but chilling the panna cotta in the fridge will expedite the process.)
step-16: when ready to serve, use an offset spatula or butter knife to carefully work around the edges of the ramekins to loosen the panna cotta.
step-17: invert onto serving plates and garnish with ground cinnamon and cinnamon sticks.

step-1: place the cashews in a medium bowl and cover with cold water.
step-2: let the cashews soak for at least for 4 hours, or overnight, until soft.
step-3: make the crust: using a food processor, pulse together the pecans, almond flour, dates, cinnamon, coconut oil, and a pinch of salt.
step-4: pulse until the pecans have been broken down into crumbs and the crust begins to stick together.
step-5: transfer the crust to a greased and parchment paper-lined 8-inch (20 cm) springform pan.
step-6: use your fingers to press the crust into the bottom of the pan in an even layer.
step-7: make the filling: drain the soaked cashews and place them in the bowl of the food processor.
step-8: add the coconut milk, lemon juice, coconut oil, maple syrup, and vanilla.
step-9: blend until very smooth, 5-7 minutes.
step-10: pour roughly ⅔ of the cashew filling over the crust.
step-11: use a spatula to gently spread the mixture to the sides, then tap and shake the pan on the counter to achieve a smooth, even layer.
step-12: freeze the pan while preparing the strawberry layer, about 10 minutes.
step-13: add the strawberries into the remaining cashew mixture in the food processor and puree until smooth, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed, about 5 minutes.
step-14: scrape the strawberry filling over the first layer.
step-15: use a spatula to gently push the layer out to the sides of the pan and tap and shake the pan on the counter to achieve a smooth, even layer.
step-16: top the cheesecake with sliced strawberries.
step-17: freeze the cheesecake until solid, at least 4 hours.
step-18: to serve, let the cheesecake thaw at room temperature for at least 10 minutes before slicing.

step-1: make the crust: add the whole wheat flour, almond flour, baking powder, salt, maple syrup, water, and coconut oil to a food processor.
step-2: pulse until crumbly.
step-3: transfer the dough to the prepared pie dish.
step-4: using a flat-bottomed measuring cup, press the dough against the bottom and sides of the dish.
step-5: using your fingers, form the edges of the crust, then press all the way around using the tines of a fork.
step-6: work quickly, as the heat from your hands will begin to melt the coconut oil and make the crust hard to work with
step-7: transfer the crust to the refrigerator to chill while you make the filling.
step-8: make the filling: in a medium pot over medium heat, combine the quartered strawberries, diced rhubarb, coconut sugar, water, and lemon zest.
step-9: stir and bring to gentle boil
step-10: add the cornstarch slurry and stir.
step-11: simmer until the filling thickens, stirring occasionally, about 8 minutes.
step-12: remove the filling from the heat and set aside to cool slightly.
step-13: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-14: grease a 9-inch (23 cm) pie dish.
step-15: remove the crust from the refrigerator and poke holes in the bottom with a fork.
step-16: carefully pour the filling into the crust.
step-17: decorate the top of the tart with sliced rhubarb and strawberries.
step-18: bake for 30-40 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown.
step-19: you can cover the edges of the crust with foil to prevent burning, then remove the foil for the last 10 minutes in the oven, if desired.
step-20: let cool, then slice and serve.

step-1: add the cashews to a medium bowl.
step-2: pour in enough warm water to completely cover the cashews, then soak for at least 2 hours, or overnight.
step-3: drain.
step-4: grease 4 4-ounce ramekins with coconut oil and set aside.
step-5: add the cashews to a blender with the water and a pinch of salt.
step-6: blend on high speed for 2 minutes, or until very creamy.
step-7: in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat, combine the cashew cream, sugar, and vanilla bean seeds.
step-8: warm slowly, stirring occasionally, until the sugar is dissolved and the mixture is simmering.
step-9: add the agar agar to the hot water and stir until there are no lumps and the agar agar is fully dissolved.
step-10: pour the agar mixture into the warm cashew cream and whisk to combine.
step-11: increase the heat to medium, bring to a gentle boil, and whisk continuously for 3 minutes, until thickened.
step-12: remove the cream from the heat and immediately divide between the greased ramekins.
step-13: smooth the tops.
step-14: refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or until ready to serve.
step-15: (the agar will set at room temperature, but chilling the panna cotta in the fridge will expedite the process.)
step-16: when ready to serve, use an offset spatula or butter knife to carefully work around the edges of the ramekins to loosen the panna cotta.
step-17: invert onto serving plates and garnish with fresh berries.

step-1: break the jackfruit into smaller pieces, discarding the core and any seeds.
step-2: place in a bowl and set aside.
step-3: heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium heat.
step-4: add the onion and cook for 5 minutes, until softened.
step-5: add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
step-6: add the mushrooms and jackfruit and cook for 5-8 minutes, until softened.
step-7: add the vegetable broth, soy sauce, dijon mustard, thyme, paprika, salt, and pepper.
step-8: stir to combine and bring to a boil.
step-9: add the arrowroot powder to the dairy-free milk and stir until dissolved.
step-10: add the mixture to the boiling stroganoff.
step-11: reduce the heat to medium-low and cook for 10 minutes, or until thickened, stirring occasionally.
step-12: serve the stroganoff over egg noodles and garnish with chives.

step-1: place the tofu in a small bowl lined with paper towels.
step-2: top with another paper towel and a bowl filled water for weight.
step-3: let sit for 15 minutes to extract some moisture from the tofu.
step-4: crumble the tofu into small pieces in a large bowl.
step-5: add the pork, beef, scallions, onion, kimchi, garlic, ginger, sesame oil, soy sauce, salt and pepper.
step-6: mix well with your hands.
step-7: in a small bowl, combine the egg and water.
step-8: put two teaspoons of filling in the middle of a dumpling wrapper.
step-9: using your finger, wet half of the outer rim of the wrapper with the egg and water mixture.
step-10: fold the wrapper in half.
step-11: using your fingertips, start make pleats to seal the mandu.
step-12: repeat with the rest of the wrappers and filling.
step-13: bring a large pot of water to boil over high heat.
step-14: once boiling, add 6-7 mandu at a time.
step-15: once the mandu start floating on the surface, boil for another 1-2 minutes.
step-16: remove the mandu from the water with a spider or slotted spoon and repeat with the rest of the dumplings.
step-17: serve with dipping sauce.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, mash bananas.
step-3: mix eggs, yogurt, honey, vanilla extract, and baking soda into mixture.
step-4: add flour, dark cocoa powder and mix.
step-5: add chocolate chips and gently fold into mixture.
step-6: pour the batter into a greased 9x5-inch (23x12 cm) bread pan.
step-7: bake for about 45 mins, or until a toothpick comes out clean from the middle of the bread.
step-8: (baking times may vary, so keep an eye on the bread.)
step-9: allow to cool for 15 minutes before serving!

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: mash bananas in a large bowl.
step-3: add eggs and combine thoroughly.
step-4: then mix together remaining wet ingredients: greek yogurt, milk, maple syrup, and vanilla.
step-5: next, add in dry ingredients and mix until fully incorporated.
step-6: fold chocolate chips into the mixture.
step-7: pour mixture into a greased muffin tin, filling each up about ⅔ full.
step-8: bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean from the center of the muffin.
step-9: allow to cool for 10 minutes.

step-1: line an 8-inch (20 cm) square pan with parchment paper.
step-2: in a food processor, combine the dates, almond butter, and coconut oil.
step-3: process until well combined, about 30 seconds.
step-4: add the puffed rice, cherries, and almonds and pulse 5-6 times—just enough so that everything is well incorporated.
step-5: transfer the mixture to the prepared pan and press into an even layer about ½ inch (1 ¼ cm) thick.
step-6: freeze for 15 minutes, until set.
step-7: meanwhile, pour the water into a small saucepan.
step-8: place a heatproof glass or metal bowl over the saucepan, making sure the water is not touching the bottom.
step-9: bring the water to a simmer, then add the chocolate to the warm bowl and let it melt, stirring slowly.
step-10: remove the bowl from the heat as soon as the chocolate is melted and smooth.
step-11: pour the melted chocolate over the date and cherry mixture and spread evenly with a spatula.
step-12: sprinkle with flaky salt.
step-13: return the pan to the freezer for another 20 minutes.
step-14: once set, cut into 16 bars.

step-1: cut bananas into coins and place in freezer in a sealable bag.
step-2: freeze overnight or until solid.
step-3: place all ingredients into a food processor or blender and blend until smooth.
step-4: pour contents into a loaf or small pan.
step-5: freeze one hour or until solid.

step-1: cut the ends off of zucchini and grate it on the large side of a box grater.
step-2: set aside 2 cups.
step-3: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-4: whisk together warm water and honey.
step-5: add eggs, yogurt, honey, and vanilla extract.
step-6: whisk.
step-7: add zucchini and whisk to combine.
step-8: add flour, baking soda, nutmeg, and salt.
step-9: mix to combine.
step-10: fold chocolate chips into the batter.
step-11: pour the batter into a greased 9×5-inch (23x12cm) bread pan.
step-12: top with flax seeds, as desired.
step-13: bake for 50-60 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean from the middle of the bread.
step-14: allow to cool for 15 minutes before serving!

step-1: note: for this recipe, be sure to use a no-stir, all-natural peanut butter.
step-2: using a natural peanut butter that separates may cause the ball mixture to be too loose.
step-3: in a medium bowl, add together the peanut butter, almond flour, honey, and vanilla extract.
step-4: mix until the mixture thickens and sticks together.
step-5: roll the mixture into balls half an inch (1 ¼ cm) in diameter.
step-6: in a small bowl, melt the dark chocolate chips in the microwave no more than 15 seconds at a time.
step-7: using a spoon or fork, dip the peanut butter balls in the melted chocolate and toss to fully coat.
step-8: transfer the balls to a wax or parchment paper-lined baking sheet and refrigerate at least one hour.

step-1: place wax paper on a large baking sheet.
step-2: slice bananas into ½-inch (1 cm) thick rounds.
step-3: spread peanut butter on a slice of banana, then top with another slice.
step-4: lay the bites on the prepared baking sheet and freeze until solid, for about an hour.
step-5: in a small bowl, melt dark chocolate with coconut oil until smooth.
step-6: remove frozen banana bites from the freezer.
step-7: dip the bites into the melted chocolate, place back on the wax paper.
step-8: freeze for an additional hour.
step-9: can be stored in an airtight container in the freezer for up to 2 weeks.

step-1: put all ingredients into a blender and mix until smooth.
in a microwave-safe bowl, combine the dark chocolate and 5 tablespoons of coconut oil.
step-2: microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until melted.
step-3: add the vanilla and stir until combined.
step-4: the mixture should be smooth and pourable.
step-5: pour ½ of the chocolate mixture into the molds, enough to cover the bottom of the mold and come about ⅓ of the way up the sides.
step-6: freeze for 15 minutes.
step-7: in another microwave safe bowl, mix together the peanut butter, honey, and remaining 2 tablespoons of coconut oil.
step-8: microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until smooth and pourable.
step-9: pour the peanut butter mixture evenly over the chocolate layers in the molds.
step-10: make sure to leave enough room for the second layer of chocolate.
step-11: freeze for 10 minutes.
step-12: pour the remaining chocolate on top of the peanut butter layer, up to the rims of the molds.
step-13: wipe off any excess that spills over the edges.
step-14: if desired, sprinkle the cups with hemp hearts for added crunch.
step-15: freeze for 1 hour, until set, then pop out of the molds.
step-16: the cups will keep in the refrigerator for up to 1 month.

step-1: in a medium-sized pan, combine dark chocolate chips and heavy cream over low heat.
step-2: mix until you achieve a smooth consistency.
step-3: pour mixture into a bread pan.
step-4: allow to sit in the refrigerator for an hour to cool down.
step-5: with an ice cream scoop form balls from the mixture (refreeze if truffle begins to melt).
step-6: in a small bowl, melt peanut butter.
step-7: on a cutting board, crush peanuts.
step-8: dip the truffle in melted peanut butter.
step-9: roll in crushed peanuts.
step-10: place back in the fridge for 10 minutes.

step-1: mix yogurt and honey in a bowl.
step-2: slowly mix in cocoa powder until fully incorporated.
step-3: pour mixture into a baking pan lined with parchment paper.
step-4: add desired amount of pretzels and drizzle in peanut butter.
step-5: freeze for 6 hours, or overnight, until frozen solid.
step-6: break yogurt bark into desired number of pieces.
step-7: serve cold, or store in a closed container in the freezer.

step-1: melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat.
step-2: add the marshmallows and stir constantly until smooth and melted.
step-3: add the rice cereal and stir until well coated.
step-4: transfer the mixture to a buttered 8-inch (20 cm) square baking pan and press into an even layer.
step-5: set aside to cool, about 1 hour.
step-6: once the rice cereal treats have cooled, use a heart-shaped cookie cutter to cut out shapes from the treats.
step-7: in a microwave-safe bowl, microwave the dark chocolate in 30-second intervals, stirring between, until melted and smooth.
step-8: line a baking sheet with wax paper.
step-9: dip half of each heart in the melted chocolate, then set on the baking sheet.
step-10: immediately, while the chocolate is still is warm, sprinkle the chocolate side with red sanding sugar and valentine’s sprinkles.
step-11: let cool until the chocolate hardens completely, 1-2 hours.

step-1: preheat oven to 325˚f (170˚c).
step-2: mash bananas in a large bowl.
step-3: add eggs and combine thoroughly.
step-4: then mix in the remaining wet ingredients: greek yogurt, maple syrup, and vanilla.
step-5: next, add the whole wheat flour and baking powder and mix until fully incorporated.
step-6: be careful not to over mix.
step-7: in a medium, microwave-safe bowl, microwave the chocolate chunks in 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until melted and smooth.
step-8: add a large scoop of the banana batter to the bowl of melted chocolate and fold until mixed well.
step-9: pour the banana batter and the chocolate batter alternately into a greased 9x5-inch (23x13 cm) bread pan.
step-10: these do not need to be even layers.
step-11: using a knife or a spoon, gently swirl the batters together.
step-12: bake for 40-45 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean from the center of the bread.
step-13: allow to cool for at least 15 minutes.

step-1: in a small bowl, pour the hot water over the dates.
step-2: allow the dates to soak for 10-15 mins.
step-3: this makes them easier to blend.
step-4: add the date and the water to a food processor and blend until smooth.
step-5: note: if your date puree is looking thick and chunky, add a few splashes of water while the food processor is running until the mixture thins out.
step-6: add the date mixture to a sauce pan over medium-low heat.
step-7: add the almond milk, vanilla extract, and salt, and mix to combine.
step-8: stir often for 8-10 minutes until thick.
step-9: use a melon baller to scoop out apple balls.
step-10: while the caramel cools, stick the apple balls onto the popsicle sticks.
step-11: dip the apple sticks into the caramel, roll in toppings (if desired), and allow to set in the fridge for 30 minutes.

step-1: in a large bowl, add the cashews and enough hot water to cover them.
step-2: let soak for at least 1 hour.
step-3: rinse and drain the cashews, then add them to a food processor or blender.
step-4: add the coconut cream, powdered sugar, maple syrup, coconut oil, lemon juice, vanilla extract, apple cider vinegar, and salt.
step-5: blend until completely smooth, scraping down the sides as necessary.
step-6: transfer the cashew frosting to a bowl and refrigerate while you bake the cake.
step-7: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-8: grease 3 separate 8-inch (20 cm) round cake pans and set aside.
step-9: in a large bowl, add the flour, brown sugar, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
step-10: whisk to combine.
step-11: in a separate large bowl, add the almond milk, coconut oil, applesauce, maple syrup, vanilla extract, and apple cider vinegar.
step-12: whisk to combine.
step-13: in two batches, add the dry mixture to the wet mixture, folding with a spatula until combined.
step-14: some clumps are okay.
step-15: add the grated carrots and raisins and fold them in.
step-16: divide the batter evenly between the 3 pre-greased cake pans and bake for 35 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean.
step-17: cool completely.
step-18: remove the cashew frosting from the fridge and mix it up well.
step-19: choose which cake will be your bottom layer and cover evenly with about ⅓ of the cashew frosting.
step-20: top with the second layer, frosting evenly again.
step-21: add the final layer and frost the top of the cake generously
step-22: grate a carrot over the top of the frosting and sprinkle with chopped walnuts for garnish.
step-23: refrigerate until ready to serve.

step-1: for the pizza sauce, melt the butter in a small saucepan and add the onion, salt, red pepper flakes, and oregano, and sauté until golden brown.
step-2: add the garlic, sugar, and crushed tomatoes, and simmer for roughly 20 minutes or until sauce thickens.
step-3: for the dough, combine the active dry yeast, sugar, and warm water together and let sit for one minute.
step-4: in a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, cornmeal, and salt.
step-5: add the yeast mixture and butter into the dry ingredients and stir until dough forms.
step-6: bring dough to floured surface and knead until dough forms into a ball.
step-7: move dough to large bowl drizzled with olive oil.
step-8: coat dough in oil and cover.
step-9: let rest for 1 hour.
step-10: remove dough and bring onto floured surface.
step-11: cut dough in half and begin working dough out, ensuring that it is at least 2 inches (5 cm) wider than your deep dish pan.
step-12: double wrap the remaining dough with plastic wrap and place in a resealable freezer bag.
step-13: freeze for up to a month.
step-14: preheat your oven to 425°f (215°c).
step-15: bring your dough into your oiled and floured deep dish pan.
step-16: using your hands press dough into sides of your dish making it as even as possible.
step-17: lay slices of mozzarella across the dough, covering the entire bottom.
step-18: add pieces of uncased italian sausage on top of the mozzarella and top with tomato sauce.
step-19: bake for 20-25 minutes or until crust starts to lightly brown and the cheese is melted.
step-20: garnish with parmesan, cut and serve.

step-1: in a bowl, add the cream cheese, vanilla, and ½ cup (80 g) of powdered sugar, and mix thoroughly.
step-2: on a cutting board, cut the stem off of the strawberry.
step-3: using a ¼ teaspoon, scoop out the center of the strawberry.
step-4: fill the center of the strawberry with the cream cheese filling.
step-5: repeat with the rest of the strawberries.
step-6: in a large bowl, combine the pancake mix, cocoa powder, sugar, salt, milk, and eggs.
step-7: mix thoroughly.
step-8: heat oil in a medium pot over medium heat until the temperature reaches 365˚f (185˚c).
step-9: using a fork, coat the stuffed strawberries in the batter.
step-10: fry 2 strawberries at a time, about two minutes.
step-11: remove the strawberries from the oil with a slotted spoon and transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.
step-12: dust with powdered sugar.

step-1: combine the sweet rice flour, cornstarch, and water in a mixing bowl.
step-2: turn out on table and knead to form a ball of dough.
step-3: grab a ping pong size of dough, create a well and fill with chocolate chips.
step-4: wrap the dough around the chocolate chips and form into a ball.
step-5: make sure to seal well and push out any air pockets.
step-6: if you don’t push out air pockets, they will pop and burst while frying.
step-7: deep fry until the outside is crispy and the mochi balls start floating.

step-1: heat cooking oil for deep-frying in a medium-size pan over medium heat.
step-2: cut the hard-boiled eggs in half lengthwise.
step-3: gently separate the cooked egg white from the yolk and remove to a medium bowl.
step-4: coat the cooked egg white in flour, eggs, and panko bread crumbs.
step-5: carefully place eggs into the hot oil.
step-6: fry for 2-3 minutes, flipping halfway through.
step-7: remove from pan and drain excess oil on a paper towel.
step-8: add mayonnaise, relish, mustard, hot sauce, salt, and pepper to the yolks and mash until smooth.
step-9: fill a piping bag or plastic sandwich bag with yolk mixture.
step-10: pipe mixture back into the fried egg white and dust with paprika.

step-1: cut the hot dog bun in half, keeping it together a little if you can.
step-2: roll the bun in sugar.
step-3: fry in hot oil for about 30 seconds each side,
step-4: allow to cool for 30 seconds, then fill with ice cream and cover in sauce!

step-1: cut the top of an onion and place it cut-side down.
step-2: using a sharp knife make 4 ½-inch (11.5 cm) cuts then go back and make 3 cuts in between each quarter.
step-3: flip the onion over and coax apart its layers or “petals”.
step-4: in a medium bowl, combine the eggs and the milk.
step-5: in large bowl combine flour, paprika, oregano, salt, garlic powder, and black pepper.
step-6: place the onion in it, coating every petal with egg wash.
step-7: place the onion in the dry mixture coating every petal.
step-8: coat the onion in the egg wash and dry mixture one more time.
step-9: heat canola oil to 375ºf (190ºc) in a deep-fryer or dutch oven.
step-10: place onion in the freezer for 10 minutes.
step-11: with tongs add the onion to the oil for 2 minutes or until it is browned and crispy.
step-12: move onion to plate covered in paper towels and allow to drain for 5 minutes.
step-13: meanwhile, in a small bowl combine sour cream, salt, pepper, paprika, mayonnaise, worcestershire sauce, and ketchup.

step-1: in a liquid measuring cup, sprinkle the yeast over the warm water.
step-2: set aside for 5 minutes to bloom.
step-3: in a bowl, add 3 cups (375 g) of the flour, parmesan, baking powder, salt, and sugar, and stir to combine.
step-4: add 2 tablespoons of the olive oil and stir to combine.
step-5: pour the yeast water over the flour mixture and stir until the dough forms into a ball.
step-6: use remaining flour for dusting the surface.
step-7: scrape the dough out of the bowl onto your floured surface.
step-8: knead the dough for about 10 minutes until the dough is tight and form the dough into a ball.
step-9: pour 1 tablespoon olive oil in a bowl.
step-10: place the dough in the bowl.
step-11: cover, let rise for 1 hour in a warm area, or until the dough has doubled in size.
step-12: flour the surface.
step-13: flip bowl over surface and let the dough fall out of the bowl.
step-14: cut the dough into 2-inch (5-cm) pieces.
step-15: roll into balls.
step-16: begin forming the dough into a circle about ½-inch (1 ¼-cm) thick and 5 inches(12-cm) wide, making sure the middle of the circle is not too thin.
step-17: repeat with the other balls of dough.
step-18: spoon 1 tablespoon of tomato sauce on to the center of the dough.
step-19: sprinkle 2 tablespoons mozzarella, then 1 tablespoon basil.
step-20: season with salt.
step-21: fold the dough over the fillings and seal.
step-22: pinch the edge of the dough together and fold back.
step-23: repeat with the rest of the dough.
step-24: heat 2 inches (5 cm) of oil until the temperature reaches 365˚f (185˚c).
step-25: fry the calzones 2 at a time for about 3 minutes on each side.
step-26: remove from oil and drain on a paper towel-lined plate.
step-27: place a bowl filled with the rest of the tomato sauce on the plate.
step-28: sprinkle with parsley.
step-29: serve immediately.

step-1: whisk the egg in a small bowl.
step-2: add ½ cup (60 g) of flour and the cold water and whisk to combine.
step-3: cover with plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator.
step-4: add the remaining flour to a shallow dish.
step-5: dredge each shrimp in the flour, shaking off any excess.
step-6: heat the oil in a large pot until it reaches 350°f (180˚c).
step-7: dip the floured shrimp into the chilled batter.
step-8: fry the shrimp until they float to the top and are golden brown in color.
step-9: use a slotted spoon to transfer the shrimp to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.
step-10: in a medium pan, combine the dashi, soy sauce, and mirin, and bring to a boil over high heat.
step-11: transfer to a small bowl.
step-12: to make the onigiri rice balls, first wet your palms with water and coat with a little bit of salt.
step-13: take a handful of rice and make an indent in the middle.
step-14: dip a shrimp into the soy sauce mixture, then place in the center of the rice.
step-15: wrap the rice around the shrimp, creating a triangle shape.
step-16: wrap a strip of seaweed around the rice ball.
step-17: repeat with remaining ingredients.

step-1: peel off the shrimp skin (leave the tail on) and salt and pepper the shrimp for seasoning.
step-2: cook the potatoes, mash them into small crumbs and add in butter and egg yolk.
step-3: (if the texture is too wet, go ahead and add in some flour.)
step-4: mix until smooth and then add in salt, pepper, paprika, and garlic powder for seasoning, mix well.
step-5: take about ⅓ cup mashed potato, form into a ball shape, poke a hole on the top, then put a shrimp inside, cover the shrimp well, and tighten the ball.
step-6: dip the ball into flour, egg wash, and panko, and make sure the ball is fully covered well with all three ingredients.
step-7: if needed, refrigerate the balls before frying.
step-8: heat the oil between 350ºf to 375ºf (180ºc to 190ºc), then fry the shrimp ball until the outside is golden brown.
step-9: let it cool down a bit, and then serve it right away with any kind of sauce.

step-1: in a large bowl, prepare marinade - mix soy sauce, hoisin sauce, honey, sriracha, rice vinegar, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, salt, pepper, and the ribs.
step-2: marinate for at least 1 hour in the refrigerator.
step-3: preheat oven to 275˚f (190˚c).
step-4: bake ribs on a baking sheet for 30 minutes.
step-5: make the sticky sauce in a saucepan by combining soy sauce, hoisin sauce, sesame oil, rice vinegar, and honey.
step-6: bring to a low boil, reduce heat, and simmer until sauce has thickened, about 30 minutes.
step-7: heat oil for frying to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-8: place ribs into the oil a few at a time and fry for 4 minutes, flipping them occasionally.
step-9: drain on a paper towel.
step-10: toss fried ribs in the sticky sauce and garnish with toasted sesame seeds and green onions.

step-1: disclaimer: deep frying a turkey can be dangerous if not done properly.
step-2: determine the amount of oil you will need before you start.
step-3: this turkey and pot required 4 ½ gallons (17 liter) of peanut oil, you may need more or less.
step-4: to determine the correct amount, place the turkey in the pot you will be using to fry.
step-5: fill it with water until it has just covered your turkey, that water level should also be at least 5 inches (13 cm) below the rim of your pot.
step-6: remove the turkey and see where the water levels off, this is the amount of oil you will need to fry the turkey.
step-7: if the oil level is not 5 inches (13 cm) below the rim of your pot, use a taller pot.
step-8: if too much oil is used, it will spill over when the turkey is lowered and cause a fire.
step-9: if you like, as a precaution, turn off the propane burner before you add the turkey to the hot oil.
step-10: in a large pot, container or cooler with a lid, combine salt, brown sugar and boiling water to make the brine.
step-11: once the salt and brown sugar have dissolved, cool down with ice.
step-12: place your turkey into the brine mixture, add more cold water to cover your turkey entirely.
step-13: weight down the turkey with something heavy and cover.
step-14: place the turkey in a cool place or refrigerator and let it brine for 8-16 hours.
step-15: remove the turkey from the brine, discard the brine.
step-16: pat dry the turkey.
step-17: make sure it’s entirely dry inside and out, border on very dry.
step-18: let it sit at room temp for 30 minutes prior to frying.
step-19: while the turkey is coming to room temp, prepare your deep frying pot.
step-20: the pot should be large enough to hold the turkey, oil and have enough room to contain the oil once it starts bubbling (recommend 30 quart/ 28-liter pot).
step-21: note: make sure the deep frying pot is clean and dry, any moisture in the pot will make the oil pop when it starts heating up.
step-22: pour the peanut oil into the pot.
step-23: you should have enough oil to just cover the turkey.
step-24: set over high heat on an outside propane burner.
step-25: bring the temperature of the oil to 350°f (180°c).
step-26: while the oil is heating up, prepare your turkey to submerge into the oil.
step-27: if you are using a turkey deep frying kit, use all the equipment provided (i.e.
step-28: hook/basket, s-hook, retrieval handle).
step-29: if not, take a stainless steel kitchen utensil with a wide bottom, long handle and looped top.
step-30: take the kitchen utensil and push the handle through the neck of the turkey.
step-31: you want the wide part of the utensil to rest inside the turkey cavity.
step-32: take an s-hook with a handle attachment and loop it through the loop part of the kitchen utensil.
step-33: wipe down the turkey again to make sure there is no moisture.
step-34: turkey is ready.
step-35: once the temperature of the oil has reached 350°f (180°c), slowly and gently lower the turkey into the oil.
step-36: slowly and gently.
step-37: fry the turkey for 3 minutes per pound (455 grams).
step-38: for a 15 lb (6.8 kg) turkey, this will take 45 minutes.
step-39: make sure the oil temp is maintained at 350°f (180°c).
step-40: after 45 minutes, turn off your propane burner and then gently remove the turkey from the oil.
step-41: place the turkey on a large baking sheet or carving board and check the temperature.
step-42: right out of the fryer, the breast meat should be at 150°f (65°c) and will reach 160°f (70°c) due to carry over cooking.
step-43: let the turkey rest for 30 minutes before carving.
step-44: note: oil will be hot for a few hours after frying.
step-45: do not touch or dispose of until fully cooled.

step-1: in a small bowl or glass jar, add the mixed nuts and bourbon.
step-2: cover with lid or plastic wrap and let sit overnight.
step-3: place graham crackers in a gallon-size freezer bag and smash with a rolling pin until the crackers have broken down into crumbs.
step-4: combine the brown sugar, butter, and vanilla until sugar is dissolved.
step-5: add in the crushed graham crackers, walnuts, and chocolate chips.
step-6: freeze for 10-15 minutes or until firm enough to roll.
step-7: form mixture into small balls, and freeze for another 20 minutes.
step-8: combine the melted chocolate and coconut oil.
step-9: coat the balls in melted chocolate mixture and top with walnuts.
step-10: chill for 1 hour.

step-1: heat the oil in a medium pot over medium heat until it reaches 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, combine the flour, cornflour, baking soda, and sugar.
step-3: whisk well.
step-4: add the milk and whisk to combine.
step-5: add the vanilla and whisk to incorporate.
step-6: dip the apple slices in the batter, letting the excess drip off.
step-7: fry the battered apples in the hot oil, 2 at a time, until golden brown on both sides.
step-8: drain on paper towels.
step-9: repeat with the sliced bananas, chocolate bars, and chocolate sandwich cookies.
step-10: dust the dessert pakoras with powdered sugar and drizzle with honey.
step-11: serve with strawberry and chocolate syrup for dipping.

step-1: chop 10-15 small yellow potatoes in half, and place on a baking sheet.
step-2: sprinkle with salt, and spray with cooking oil.
step-3: bake at 400˚f (200˚c) for 40 minutes, or until soft.
step-4: scoop out a small section of the potatoes to create a bowl.
step-5: (you can add these to the hummus center, or simply snack on them now!)
step-6: in a food processor, combine all remaining ingredients.
step-7: blend thoroughly.
step-8: add more water as needed until the mixture is smooth and creamy.
step-9: spoon mixture into a piping bag, and fill the potato cups.
step-10: use a ridged tip on the bag for a beautiful textured effect!
step-11: sprinkle with paprika or seasoning salt and chives.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375°f (190˚c).
step-2: in a small bowl, stir together the mustard, thyme, rosemary, salt, and pepper.
step-3: dry the pork tenderloin thoroughly with paper towels, then season with salt and pepper.
step-4: heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a square pan over medium-high heat.
step-5: add the tenderloin and cook, rotating 90˚ every 3-4 minutes, until golden brown all over (the tenderloin will not be cooked through at this point), about 12 minutes total.
step-6: remove the pan from the heat and use tongs to transfer the tenderloin to a cutting board.
step-7: brush the mustard mixture evenly over the top and sides of the tenderloin.
step-8: add the broccolini to the pan, and toss with the oil until coated evenly.
step-9: push the broccolini to the sides of the pan, just enough to make room for the tenderloin, then return the pork to the pan.
step-10: transfer the pan to the oven and roast, tossing the broccolini halfway through cooking, until an instant-read thermometer inserted in the thickest part of the pork reads 160°f (70˚c) and the broccolini is tender, 23-25 minutes.
step-11: while the pork cooks, heat the remaining tablespoon of olive oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat.
step-12: add the carrots, season with salt and pepper, and cook, tossing, until barely tender, about 6 minutes
step-13: drizzle with the honey and continue cooking, tossing often, until the honey is reduced to a thick glaze and the carrots are tender, 2 to 4 minutes more.
step-14: remove the skillet from the heat.
step-15: transfer the square pan to a rack and let the pork and broccolini rest for 10 minutes.
step-16: place the tenderloin on a cutting board and cut into ½-inch (1-cm) thick slices.
step-17: divide the pork and vegetables among 4 serving plates.
step-18: serve each with a lemon wedge and sprinkle with parsley.

step-1: preheat oven to 325°f (160°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, combine sugar, cocoa powder, and butter.
step-3: stir using a spatula or a wooden spoon.
step-4: it will be gritty.
step-5: combine vanilla and 1 egg.
step-6: mix until the egg is fully incorporated.
step-7: then mix in the other egg.
step-8: add flour and salt, and mix into the batter.
step-9: transfer into a baking dish and bake for 20 minutes and let it cool completely.
step-10: spread the chocolate frosting and then the gummy worms, followed by the cookie crumbs.

step-1: prepare 2 boxes of brownie mix according to instructions on box.
step-2: pour into a greased 9x9-inch (23x23-cm) square pan.
step-3: bake according to instructions on box.
step-4: cut each tray of brownies into 25 small squares.
step-5: form each brownie square into a ball, rolling in palms until smooth.
step-6: in a microwave-safe bowl, add the milk chocolate chips and microwave in 30 second intervals until smooth, about 1 minute and 30 seconds total.
step-7: turn a plastic sandwich bag inside out and hold it from the inside with one hand.
step-8: spoon ¼ of the milk chocolate into the bag.
step-9: turn the bag back out making sure chocolate does not fall out the opening.
step-10: seal it closed.
step-11: cut the corner of the bag, keeping in mind the more you cut off the larger your piping hole will be.
step-12: coat the brownie balls in the milk chocolate using a fork.
step-13: place on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and chill until chocolate has hardened, about 20 minutes.
step-14: place one of the milk chocolate brownie bites onto a clean surface.
step-15: using a chopstick, poke a hole into the brownie bit large enough for the worm to fit inside.
step-16: zig zag the milk chocolate around the hole.
step-17: coat the chocolate with chocolate sprinkles.
step-18: stick the worm in the hole.

step-1: toss the beef in the flour, seasoned salt, and pepper.
step-2: brown in batches in a skillet with oil on high heat.
step-3: in the same pan, cook garlic and onions until the onions are clear.
step-4: in the crockpot, layer the potatoes, carrots, celery, beef and onion mixture, and mushrooms.
step-5: pour in beef broth, paprika, and worcestershire.
step-6: cover and cook on low for 7 and a half hours.
step-7: while the stew is cooking, hollow out sourdough bread bowl.
step-8: use the hollowed out portion and toothpicks to create ears on the bread bowl.
step-9: ten minutes before serving, stir in a bag of frozen peas.
step-10: serve in the prepared bread bowl.

step-1: whisk the heavy cream, condensed milk, and salt in a bowl.
step-2: pour the mixture over a half sheet pan, or multiple quarter sheet pans.
step-3: make sure the ice cream base just barely covers the bottom.
step-4: it should be ¼-inch (1 cm) thick or less.
step-5: sprinkle any chopped-up toppings you would like.
step-6: with a whisk, mix the toppings into the ice cream base to ensure they’re evenly distributed.
step-7: freeze for at least 4 hours.
step-8: make sure to also put your scrapers and ice cream bowls in the freezer so the ice cream doesn’t melt while rolling.
step-9: after the ice cream is frozen solid, remove from the freezer and quickly place the metal spatula/paint scraper at an 45° angle against the edge of the pan, pushing carefully forward.
step-10: if the ice cream needs a little help forming, use a butter knife to push the sheet of cream into the roll.
step-11: place the rolled ice cream in a chilled bowl and top with any toppings you desire.

step-1: heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
step-2: add the bijol seasoning and cook for 3 minutes or until the oil turns reddish-orange and is aromatic.
step-3: set aside all but 2 tablespoons of the seasoned oil and return the pan to the heat.
step-4: add the red onion, garlic, beef, salt, pepper, and oregano and stir to combine.
step-5: cook until the meat is well browned, around 15 minutes.
step-6: add the tomato sauce and raisins.
step-7: bring to a boil, then cover and reduce the heat to low.
step-8: simmer for 30 minutes, or until all of the liquid evaporates and the meat is tender.
step-9: remove from the heat and let cool.
step-10: make the plantain dough: in a deep bowl, add the plantains, yuatía, chicken broth cubes, sazón goya powder, lime juice, some of the milk, bijol seasoning, and reserved bijol oil.
step-11: stir to combine, adding more milk as needed until the dough is seasoned to your taste, soft, tacky, and light orange in color.
step-12: lay a banana leaf on a clean work surface and brush the center with bijol oil.
step-13: scoop 3 tablespoons of the plantain dough into the center of the square and top with 2 tablespoons of the beef filling.
step-14: fold the banana leaf in half, then roll up and tuck in the ends to seal.
step-15: tie tightly with twine to secure.
step-16: repeat with the remaining ingredients.
step-17: bring a large pot of water to boil over medium heat and season with salt.
step-18: add the pasteles, cover, and cook for 40 minutes.
step-19: remove the pasteles from the pot.
step-20: unwrap and serve with ketchup and hot sauce.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚f).
step-2: in a circular cake pan, add half of the ground beef and season with half of the garlic powder, half of the onion powder, half of the pepper, and half of the salt.
step-3: mix to combine then press the beef into patty form.
step-4: bake for 12 minutes.
step-5: repeat this process for the second patty.
step-6: slice off the top of the sourdough loaf and scoop out the inside.
step-7: begin by laying down slices of cheese at the bottom, then add your first burger patty.
step-8: layer more cheese on top of the patty and continue by adding bacon, sauteed mushrooms & onions, spinach, and tomato.
step-9: add a second burger patty and repeat step 7.
step-10: place the top of the loaf back on the bread and wrap in aluminum foil.
step-11: on a level surface, use a heavy object to press the sandwich down for at least 30 minutes.
step-12: remove aluminum foil.
step-13: bake for 25 minutes.
step-14: slice and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: in a medium 8-inch (20-cm) cast-iron skillet, press down half of the ground beef with a spatula to mold into a patty.
step-3: season with salt and pepper.
step-4: place the cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat and sear the patty until browned, about 4 minutes on each side.
step-5: remove the patty from the skillet and set aside.
step-6: repeat with remaining beef.
step-7: return the pan to low heat and add the onion.
step-8: cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is caramelized, about 20 minutes.
step-9: add the garlic and spinach, stirring until the spinach is cooked down, about 5 minutes.
step-10: lay one sheet of puff pastry on a baking sheet and top with 1 patty.
step-11: layer 4 slices of cheese over the patty, then top with the caramelized onion mixture.
step-12: top with the remaining 4 slices of cheese and the other patty.
step-13: cover with the other sheet of puff pastry.
step-14: trim the edges of the pastry with a knife and discard.
step-15: crimp the edges of the pastry, then press with a fork to seal.
step-16: brush the top and sides of the pastry with the beaten egg and sprinkle with sesame seeds.
step-17: bake for 30 minutes, or until the pastry is golden brown and cooked through.
step-18: slice and serve with additional toppings of your choice.

step-1: roll out the sheet of puff pastry.
step-2: using a sharp knife, cut in half diagonally and then again horizontally to make 4 squares.
step-3: then cut each square diagonally to make 8 triangles.
step-4: layer the triangles on a lined baking tray to make a star shape.
step-5: in each triangle, spread on the chocolate spread (about ½ tablespoon per triangle will be enough).
step-6: then, in the middle, scatter on the grated chocolate, banana, strawberries, and flaked almonds in a circle shape.
step-7: fold over the triangles to meet in the middle.
step-8: glaze with some egg wash.
step-9: bake in the oven at 180°c (350°f) for 25 minutes.
step-10: cut out each triangle to make a serving.
step-11: drizzle on some dark melted chocolate, icing sugar or with leftover strawberries and banana.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: line a 9-inch (23 cm) square pan with parchment paper.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the cake mix, milk, oil, and egg.
step-4: add ½ cup (115 g) chopped dark chocolate and the chopped white chocolate and mix until combined.
step-5: spread the brownie batter in the prepared pan.
step-6: sprinkle the remaining chopped dark chocolate on top.
step-7: bake for 30 minutes until toothpick comes out clean when inserted in the middle.
step-8: let cool before slicing and serve.

step-1: soak cashews in boiling water for two hours.
step-2: drain the cashews and blend in a food processor for 30 seconds.
step-3: pour in coconut oil and agave, and chocolate, and continue to blend for 1 minute.
step-4: scrape down sides and add in almond flour.
step-5: blend until smooth, approximately 2-5 minutes.
step-6: remove from food processor and transfer to a food storage container and stir in chocolate chips.
step-7: store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

step-1: make the crust: in a medium bowl, use a fork to combine the graham cracker crumbs and the butter until they are the texture of wet sand.
step-2: transfer the crust to an 8-inch (20 cm) springform pan and use the bottom of a wine glass or other flat instrument to press against the bottom.
step-3: make the dark chocolate mousse: in a medium bowl, let the melted dark chocolate chips cool to room temperature, then use a spatula to gently fold in whipped cream.
step-4: pour the dark chocolate mousse over the crust and smooth out the top as much as possible, then freeze for 15 minutes.
step-5: make the milk chocolate mousse: in a medium bowl, let the melted milk chocolate chips cool to room temperature, then use a spatula to gently fold in whipped cream.
step-6: pour the milk chocolate mousse over the dark chocolate layer and smooth the top with a spatula.
step-7: freeze for 2 hours, or until the mousse is set.
step-8: take a vegetable peeler and press it down along the edge of the chocolate bar to create mini chocolate spirals.
step-9: make at least 2 tablespoons worth.
step-10: remove from the cake from the freezer and gently take the cake out of the springform pan.
step-11: sift the cocoa powder over the top of the cake, then sprinkle with the chocolate shavings.
step-12: pairs well with cabernet sauvignon.

step-1: in a saucepan over a medium heat, combine the butter, sugar, water, and salt ,and bring to a boil.
step-2: reduce the heat to medium-low, and mix in the flour with a wooden spoon until the dough comes together to form a soft ball.
step-3: take the saucepan off the heat and cool for 5 minutes, to prevent the eggs from curdling.
step-4: gradually mix in the eggs one by one.
step-5: add in the vanilla extract and rum, and mix until creamy.
step-6: spoon the mixture into a piping bag with a star nozzle.
step-7: pipe mini churros onto a baking tray, about the length of your index finger, and top with mini chocolate chips.
step-8: pipe another churro on top, so that no chocolate shows.
step-9: freeze for 20 minutes, until set.
step-10: in a large saucepan, heat up the oil until it reaches 375˚f (190˚c).
step-11: fry the churros in the oil for a few minutes, until slightly golden in color.
step-12: transfer to a paper towel-lined plate or a clean kitchen towel to drain.
step-13: combine the remaining sugar with the cinnamon.
step-14: coat each churro in the cinnamon sugar, then serve.

step-1: pat the shrimp dry with paper towels, then transfer to a medium bowl and season with salt and pepper.
step-2: in a separate medium bowl, whisk the eggs and soda water until combined.
step-3: add the cake flour and gently whisk, making sure the batter is still clumpy.
step-4: do not overmix.
step-5: heat the oil in a large pot until it reaches 350˚f (180˚c).
step-6: add the panko bread crumbs to a shallow bowl.
step-7: using a slotted spoon, dip the shrimp in the tempura batter, then toss in the panko, making sure to fully coat.
step-8: fry the shrimp in the hot oil, 5-6 at a time, until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes.
step-9: transfer to a wire rack to drain.
step-10: make the glaze: heat the oil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat.
step-11: add the garlic and ginger and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds, stirring frequently.
step-12: add the soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, brown sugar, and red pepper flakes.
step-13: stir until the mixture begins to simmer.
step-14: in a small bowl, combine the water and cornstarch.
step-15: add the cornstarch slurry to the saucepan and stir to combine.
step-16: cook until the glaze is reduced by half and looks thick and syrupy, about 5 minutes.
step-17: transfer the shrimp to a large bowl and pour the glaze over.
step-18: toss the shrimp gently to coat with the glaze.
step-19: serve the shrimp over rice and garnish with scallions.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: on a parchment-lined baking sheet, cover the bottom of the tray with half of the graham cracker halves.
