step-3: layer a piece of milk chocolate on top of each of the graham cracker, top each piece of chocolate with two marshmallow halves, and top the marshmallows with the remaining graham crackers.
step-4: bake for 5 minutes, or until the marshmallows soften.
step-5: press the top graham crackers to help reset any graham crackers that may have fallen or tilted during baking.
step-6: in the first column, layer dark chocolate on top of each graham cracker.
step-7: in the second column, layer pieces of the cookies ‘n’ cream bar on top of each graham cracker.
step-8: in the third column, layer peanut butter cups on top of each graham cracker.
step-9: in the fourth column, layer the mint chocolates on top of each graham cracker.
step-10: in the fifth column, layer the pieces of white chocolate on top of each graham cracker.
step-11: in the sixth column, layer the chocolate caramels on top of each graham cracker.
step-12: cover all columns with the remaining marshmallow halves.
step-13: bake for 8-10 minutes, or until the marshmallows are golden brown.

step-1: cover the potatoes with cold water and simmer until tender, about 20–25 minutes.
step-2: warm the chopped garlic in the butter over low heat until softened but not browned, about 10 minutes.
step-3: add the cream and bring to a boil.
step-4: coarsely mash the potato mixture and fold in the warm garlic mixture while the potatoes are still warm.
step-5: season to taste with salt and white pepper.
step-6: keep warm.
step-7: make the double-decker taco shell: on a griddle over low heat, sprinkle a tortilla with about 2 tablespoons shredded pepper jack cheese.
step-8: once the cheese melts, place the fried corn taco shell on the cheesy tortilla and press the tortillas together to create the double decker taco.
step-9: mix the warm potatoes with lime juice and place in the double decker taco.
step-10: top with 2–3 tablespoons of carrot pico de gallo.

step-1: combine the cumin, chili powder, garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper in a small bowl.
step-2: rub all over the steak.
step-3: heat a large sauté pan over high heat until very hot.
step-4: add a splash of vegetable oil.
step-5: add the steak to the pan and cook 3-4 minutes per side for medium, or cook to desired doneness.
step-6: remove from pan and let rest at least 10 minutes.
step-7: thinly slice against the grain.
step-8: preheat an oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-9: place the flour tortillas on baking sheets.
step-10: sprinkle each with a small amount of shredded cheese, then place one hard taco shell inside.
step-11: heat just until cheese melts, about 3-5 minutes.
step-12: heat a nonstick pan over medium heat and add butter.
step-13: scramble the eggs and season with salt and pepper.
step-14: to assemble, fill each double-decker shell with a few spoonfuls of scrambled eggs and a few slices of steak.
step-15: top with salsa, avocado, queso fresco, cilantro, and scallions.

step-1: cream butter, sugar, eggs and vanilla until fluffy.
step-2: add in irish cream and mix.
step-3: add flour, cocoa powder, instant coffee, baking soda and salt and mix until combined.
step-4: fold in chocolate chips.
step-5: refrigerate dough for 4-6 hours.
step-6: roll into balls.
step-7: set on a baking sheet.
step-8: bake at 350˚f (175˚c) for 10 minutes

step-1: add the butter, powdered sugar, and vanilla to a large bowl.
step-2: beat with an electric hand mixer on low speed until smooth and creamy.
step-3: add the eggs 1 at a time and beat on medium speed to incorporate, scraping down the sides of the bowl with a spatula halfway through.
step-4: add the salt and incorporate the flour in 3 additions, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed, until a dough forms.
step-5: turn the dough out onto a clean, floured surface and form into a ball.
step-6: cut the ball of dough in half.
step-7: cut one of the halves in half, and the other half into thirds, so you have 5 pieces total.
step-8: take one of the larger pieces and cover the rest with plastic wrap so they don’t dry out.
step-9: wearing gloves, add the yellow food coloring and knead into the dough until fully incorporated.
step-10: cover and set aside each piece of dough after working the color in.
step-11: dye the other large piece with red food coloring.
step-12: set aside one of the smaller pieces to remain plain.
step-13: remove a 1-tablespoon chunk from 1 of the 2 remaining pieces and dye with black food coloring.
step-14: dye the rest of that piece blue.
step-15: dye the remaining piece of dough green.
step-16: roll out 1 tablespoon of the the plain dough into a 6-inch-long (15-cm) rope.
step-17: roll the rest into a 6-inch-long (15-cm) log and cut crosswise into thirds.
step-18: shape the logs into 6-inch-long (15-cm) triangle wedges.
step-19: roll a third of the red dough into a 6-inch-long (15-cm) triangle wedge.
step-20: roll the blue piece into a 6-inch-long (15-cm) triangle wedge.
step-21: roll half of the green dough into a 6-inch-long (15-cm) triangle wedge.
step-22: form a beach ball shape by placing the plain rope in the middle and alternating the plain dough triangle wedges with the colored triangle wedges.
step-23: roll together to fuse, then wrap tightly in plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes while you assemble the other shape.
step-24: roll the remaining red dough into a 6-inch-long (15-cm) log, then shape into a triangle wedge.
step-25: roll the remaining green dough into a 6-inch-long (15-cm) log, then flatten.
step-26: place the red triangle on top and trim the edges with a bench scraper or knife.
step-27: cut the yellow dough in half.
step-28: set aside one half, then cut the other half in half again and roll into 2 6-inch-long (15-cm) logs and flatten slightly.
step-29: place the yellow pieces over each exposed side of the red dough, then pinch the yellow and green dough together to completely cover the red.
step-30: roll together to fuse, then wrap tightly in plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-31: use a ruler and a knife to score ¼-inch (6 mm) marks across both chilled logs.
step-32: cut into slices with a sharp knife, cleaning the knife after each slice, if necessary.
step-33: roll out the rest of the yellow dough to make a 6-inch (15-cm) by 12-inch (30-cm) rectangle.
step-34: build a single dough log by stacking alternating watermelon slices and beach ball slices over the center of the yellow dough.
step-35: wrap the yellow dough around the log, roll together to fuse, then wrap tightly in plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-36: preheat the oven to 300˚f (150˚c).
step-37: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-38: use a ruler and a knife to score ¼-inch (6 mm) marks across the chilled dough.
step-39: cut into slices with a sharp knife, cleaning the knife after each slice, if necessary.
step-40: each slice should have a beach ball side and a strawberry side.
step-41: set the cookies on the prepared baking sheet, strawberry-side up.
step-42: break off tiny pieces of the black dough, roll into seeds, and press onto the strawberries.
step-43: bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or just until they begin to start turning golden brown.
step-44: cool on a wire rack for 5-10 minutes before serving.

step-1: preheat oven to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-2: to a bowl or stand mixer, add the warm water, sugar, and yeast.
step-3: let the yeast proof for 5-15 minutes in a warm place until it is bubbling.
step-4: add in the flour and salt.
step-5: mix in the bowl until well combined and the dough comes together into a ball.
step-6: dump the dough onto a floured surface and knead briefly to smooth out the dough and develop gluten.
step-7: form the dough into a ball and place into a new, large greased bowl.
step-8: cover with a towel and let rise for one hour or until doubled in size.
step-9: remove the dough from the bowl, and cut 2-three ounce (85g) portions of the dough.
step-10: roll each portion out to a size slightly larger than a 9x13-inch (23x33 cm) baking sheet.
step-11: place the first rolled dough rectangle onto the greased baking sheet.
step-12: sprinkle a thick layer of mozzarella cheese onto the dough, then place the second sheet of dough on top to cover the cheese.
step-13: place string cheese into the edges of the dough, and fold the edges over the cheese, crimping the edges.
step-14: brush the dough with olive oil, salt, and pepper to taste.
step-15: bake for 20 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted inside.
step-16: quickly top the stuffed bottom crust with sauce and any extra toppings or cheese you would like.
step-17: bake until the toppings are heated through, and the cheese has started to brown 10-15 minutes.
step-18: transfer the pizza to a cutting board, slice, and serve.

step-1: in a small saucepan over medium heat, whisk together water and sugar.
step-2: bring to a gentle simmer, just until the sugar dissolves completely.
step-3: remove the pot from the heat, add the jalapeño, and cover the pot.
step-4: let infuse for at least 1 hour, or overnight in the refrigerator.
step-5: pour the syrup through a fine-mesh strainer into an airtight container.
step-6: store in the refrigerator for up to 3 months.
step-7: on a small plate, mix together the salt and chile powder.
step-8: run the lime wedge around the rim of a rocks glass.
step-9: dip the rim in the salt mixture.
step-10: fill with ice and set aside.
step-11: in a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the grapefruit juice, mezcal, campari, and 1 ounce jalapeño simple syrup.
step-12: shake vigorously for 20 seconds.
step-13: strain into the salt-rimmed glass.

step-1: spear each marshmallow with a pretzel stick.
step-2: on a hot skillet, melt the bottoms of the chocolate kisses for a few seconds.
step-3: stick the melted part to the marshmallow top.
step-4: let them set for a few minutes until hard.
step-5: melt the white chocolate in the microwave for 1 minute, stirring every 20 seconds until the chocolate is smooth.
step-6: add the blue food coloring and mix thoroughly.
step-7: with a spoon, smear the chocolate thickly over the marshmallow sides.
step-8: smooth the sides down with the back of the spoon; wiping away excess.
step-9: set each on wax paper to set.
step-10: with a icing tube, or piping bag, decorate them with the hebrew letters נ ,ג ,ה ,ש.

step-1: in a medium bowl, mix doce de leite and melted butter.
step-2: in a separate medium bowl, mix egg yolks and eggs.
step-3: once combined, mix in doce de leite mixture.
step-4: add in flour, a little at a time, to ensure everything is mixed evenly and the batter is smooth.
step-5: line ramekins with butter and flour.
step-6: pour out excess flour.
step-7: divide doce de leite batter in each ramekin.
step-8: leave about ¼ inches (6 ⅓mm) from the top.
step-9: bake the cakes for 425˚f (220˚c) for 12-14 minutes.
step-10: the cakes should be golden brown and should jiggle in the middle.
step-11: the more you bake, the less molten the center will be when you cut into it.
step-12: run a knife along the edges of the ramekin to loosen and invert onto a plate.
step-13: serve with ice cream or whipped cream.

step-1: cut the ends off the bananas, peel them, and slice them into thirds.
step-2: using a vegetable peeler, hollow out the inside of each banana piece, making sure not to cut through the bottom.
step-3: fill the banana pieces with dulce de leche.
step-4: freeze for at least 2 hours.
step-5: heat oil in a pot over high heat.
step-6: place the flour, eggs, and breadcrumbs in separate bowls.
step-7: roll the frozen bananas in the flour, then the eggs, then the breadcrumbs.
step-8: fry the bananas until golden brown.
step-9: roll the fried bananas in cinnamon sugar.
step-10: serve with ice cream!

step-1: in a mixing bowl, combine chocolate with sweetened condensed milk and melt in the microwave in 15-second increments.
step-2: once chocolate is fully melted pour into a parchment paper-lined 8x8 inch (20x20 cm) baking tin.
step-3: dollop your dulce de leche and make ribbons by swirling chocolate mixture.
step-4: chill for 2 hours or until the fudge is firm.
step-5: cut into bite-sized piece.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350º f / 175ºc.
step-2: mix flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt in a bowl and mix well.
step-3: in a separate bowl, mash the bananas.
step-4: add in butter and sugar, mix until smooth.
step-5: add in eggs and yogurt, mix until well-combined.
step-6: add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mix until smooth.
step-7: pour the batter into a buttered/oil-sprayed loaf pan.
step-8: drop dulce de leche on top of the batter, then swirl gently into the batter with the tip of the spoon or fork.
step-9: bake it for an hour and cool completely.
step-10: slice and enjoy!

step-1: make the dough: combine the flour and salt in a medium bowl.
step-2: gradually pour in the water, stirring with chopsticks to incorporate.
step-3: once the dough comes together in a ball, knead in the bowl for 5-8 minutes, until smooth.
step-4: cover with a damp towel and let rest in the bowl for 30 minutes
step-5: make the filling: in a medium bowl, combine the pork, green onion, egg, salt, five spice, sichuan pepper, ginger, soy sauce, and sesame oil.
step-6: using chopsticks, mix until well combined.
step-7: add the shrimp, wood ear mushrooms, and napa cabbage.
step-8: mix well.
step-9: on a lightly floured surface, turn out the dough and knead a few times.
step-10: stretch the dough into a 1-inch (2.5 cm) thick ring, then cut to make a rope.
step-11: divide the dough into 2-ounce (55 g) pieces, turning the rope 90 degrees after each cut to make triangle shapes.
step-12: lightly flour the dough portions.
step-13: working 1 at a time, pat each dough portion into a flat circle, then, using a small rolling pin, roll out into a thin circle.
step-14: add 1 tablespoon of the filling to the center of a dumpling wrapper.
step-15: fold the wrapper in half.
step-16: using your fingertips, make pleats to seal the dumpling.
step-17: press the edges firmly to fully seal the dumpling.
step-18: repeat with the remaining wrappers and filling.
step-19: bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
step-20: add the dumplings and cook for 10 minutes, or until the filling is cooked through
step-21: serve immediately with dipping sauce.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425°f (225°c).
step-2: in a small saucepan set over medium-low heat, add leftover cranberry sauce.
step-3: stir in the orange zest, lemon zest, and maple syrup.
step-4: season with a pinch of salt.
step-5: stir together and heat until warmed through.
step-6: remove the pan from the heat and set aside.
step-7: in a blender, combine the eggs, milk, flour, salt, and vanilla bean seeds.
step-8: blend until frothy, about 1 minute.
step-9: add the butter to a 10-inch (25 cm) cast iron skillet and place in the oven to melt.
step-10: once the butter is melted and bubbling, carefully remove the pan from the oven, tilting to coat the pan evenly.
step-11: dollop the cranberry sauce into the pan and pour the dutch baby batter overtop; immediately return the skillet to the oven.
step-12: bake until puffed and golden around the edges, 18 to 22 minutes.
step-13: remove the dutch baby from the oven and dust with confectioners’ sugar.
step-14: serve immediately with maple syrup, if desired.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the bread flour, 2 cups (200 g) of cheddar cheese, the chopped jalapeños, and salt.
step-2: stir well.
step-3: in a separate large bowl, combine the warm water and yeast.
step-4: pour the flour mixture on top of the water and use a silicone spatula to stir until the dough comes together.
step-5: with the spatula, fold the dough around the edges of the bowl toward the center, rotating the bowl each time and folding a total of 8 times.
step-6: cover with a kitchen towel and let rest in a warm place for 60 minutes, or until almost doubled in size.
step-7: using the spatula, fold the dough toward the center again 8 more times.
step-8: cover with the towel and let rest for 30 minutes.
step-9: add the dutch oven and lid to the oven, and preheat to 450˚f (230˚c) for 30 minutes.
step-10: lightly flour a clean work surface and your hands.
step-11: carefully peel the dough out of the bowl and onto the floured surface.
step-12: flip over and carefully brush away excess flour.
step-13: fold the edges of the dough towards the center 8 times, then flip over the dough and transfer to a piece of parchment paper.
step-14: brush the top of the dough with the olive oil, so the cheese will stick.
step-15: sprinkle the remaining ½ cup (50 g) of cheese on top.
step-16: use a sharp knife to score the bread with an “x”, which will allow steam to escape.
step-17: arrange the jalapeño rings on top of the cheese.
step-18: carefully remove the dutch oven from the oven and use the parchment to lift the bread into the pot.
step-19: cover with the lid and bake for 30 minutes, then remove the lid and bake for 20 more minutes, until the bread is golden brown.
step-20: carefully slide the bread out of the pot and onto a wire rack.
step-21: remove the parchment paper and let the bread cool for at least 1 hour before slicing.
step-22: slice the bread and serve as desired.

step-1: bring water to boil in a pot, then add the tea bags.
step-2: steep at a low temperature for 5 minutes.
step-3: add the lemon juice, honey, and whiskey and simmer for 5 more minutes.

step-1: heat the double cream to a simmer.
step-2: turn off heat and add your choice of tea.
step-3: steep until desired taste is achieved (about 30 minutes for us) and remove tea.
step-4: let cool completely.
step-5: add sugar and whip cream until stiff peaks appear.
step-6: place whipped cream into a piping bag and set aside.
step-7: to make the tea cup and saucer, shape the foil into a cup.
step-8: cut a long rectangle of puff pastry and wrap around the bottom side of the foil cup.
step-9: cut, fold, and press pastry until it covers the entire bottom of the foil, forming a full cup.
step-10: cut a second small strip of puff pastry to create the cup’s handle.
step-11: make two slits in the side of the pastry cup and shove the ends of the pastry handle into the slits.
step-12: to make the saucer, simply cut out a circle of pastry.
step-13: bake the cup and saucer at 400°f (200°c) until golden brown.
step-14: cut saucer in half and place cup on top.
step-15: pipe whipped cream into tea cup.

step-1: slice bananas and place in an airtight container.
step-2: freeze for at least two hours, preferably overnight.
step-3: place frozen banana slices in a food processor and blend until they reach the consistency of soft serve, about 4 minutes.
step-4: add cocoa powder and cinnamon.
step-5: blend until just combined.
step-6: serve immediately for soft-serve consistency or transfer to freezer for at least 2 hours for ice cream consistency.
step-7: garnish with strawberries.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: fill a large pot with water and boil.
step-3: add salt, baking soda, and potatoes, and stir.
step-4: return to a boil, reduce to a simmer, and cook for 10 minutes after returning to a boil.
step-5: a fork should easily pierce the potato pieces by the end.
step-6: drain and let sit one minute while moisture evaporates.
step-7: combine olive oil, rosemary (or thyme), garlic, and a few grinds of black pepper in a small saucepan and heat over medium heat.
step-8: stir constantly until garlic just begins to turn golden, about 2-3 minutes.
step-9: immediately strain oil through a fine-mesh strainer over the potatoes.
step-10: add salt and pepper to taste, and mix.
step-11: shake the pot that the potatoes are in so that they slam against all sides of the pot, this will loosen the outer layer of the potatoes to form a mashed layer around each potato piece.
step-12: transfer potatoes to a large rimmed baking sheet and separate them, spreading them out evenly.
step-13: transfer to oven and roast, without moving, for 30-35 minutes.
step-14: using a thin, flexible metal spatula flip potatoes.
step-15: continue roasting until potatoes are deep brown and crisp all over, turning and shaking them a few times during cooking, 30 to 40 minutes longer.
step-16: transfer potatoes to a large bowl and add the garlic-rosemary mixture (optional) and minced parsley.
step-17: toss to coat and season with more salt and pepper to taste.
step-18: serve immediately.

step-1: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-2: place a large heatproof bowl over a medium pot of simmering water, making sure the water doesn’t touch the bottom of the bowl.
step-3: add the chopped chocolate to the bowl and stir until fully melted, about 5 minutes.
step-4: pour the melted chocolate mixture onto the baking sheet.
step-5: use a spatula to smooth the chocolate into an even layer about ¼-inch (6 mm) thick.
step-6: sprinkle the melted chocolate with your toppings of choice.
step-7: sprinkle with sea salt.
step-8: freeze until firm to the touch, at least 20 minutes.
step-9: break the bark into pieces and serve.

step-1: in a large mixing bowl, combine the warm water, sugar, olive oil, and instant yeast.
step-2: add the flour and salt, and mix the dough together with a wooden spoon until it forms a ball.
step-3: then knead the dough for 1 minute, or until it feels smooth and springy.
step-4: cover the dough in the bowl with a kitchen towel or plastic wrap.
step-5: let rise in a warm place for 2 hours.
step-6: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-7: in a large bowl, add 10 eggs, ricotta, parsley, and pecorino romano.
step-8: whisk the mixture until smooth.
step-9: add the ham, pepperoni, provolone, hard salami, prosciutto, and bread crumbs.
step-10: fold in the cubed meats and cheeses.
step-11: the texture should be thick and slightly wet.
step-12: once the dough has doubled in size, dump it onto a floured surface, knead for 2 minutes, and shape it into a ball.
step-13: roll the dough out to a rough circle, about ¼-inch (½-cm) thick.
step-14: with a pizza cutter or knife, cut out a large disc that is 2 inches (5-cm) wider than a 9-inch (23-cm) springform pan or round baking dish.
step-15: with the rest of the dough, cut thick strips about 9 inches (23-cm) long and 1 inch (2 cm) thick.
step-16: transfer the dough disc into the springform pan or baking dish.
step-17: gently press the dough against the bottom and sides of the pan, allowing the excess to hang over the sides.
step-18: pour the egg, cheese, and meat mixture into the pan.
step-19: pack the filling down and smooth the top with a spatula.
step-20: weave the strips of dough on top to create a decorative pattern.
step-21: trim any excess dough, then fold and crimp the edges.
step-22: brush the top with egg wash.
step-23: bake the pizza rustica for 2 hours, or until the filling is cooked through and the pizza dough has browned.
step-24: let the the pizza rustica cool completely.
step-25: remove from the pan.
step-26: chill in the refrigerator overnight on a wire rack.

step-1: in a medium pot, combine the marshmallows and milk.
step-2: cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the marshmallows are completely melted, 5-7 minutes.
step-3: pour the marshmallow mixture over the chocolate in a medium heatproof bowl.
step-4: let sit for 2-3 minutes, then whisk until well combined and smooth.
step-5: divide the mixture between 4 serving cups.
step-6: chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour, or until set.
step-7: top with whipped cream and grated chocolate, if desired.

step-1: for the batter, mix together the flour, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
step-2: mix in the egg and buttermilk.
step-3: gradually stir in the milk.
step-4: next, core the apples and slice vertically into doughnut-size rings.
step-5: each apple should give you about 3 rings.
step-6: heat the oil in a deep frying pan to 180˚c (360°f).
step-7: evenly coat each apple slice in the batter mix.
step-8: carefully lay the doughnuts into the oil and fry for a few minutes on each side, until golden brown.
step-9: drain on paper towel before coating in sugar.

step-1: slice apples into rings.
step-2: remove centers (cookie cutters or tablespoons work well for this).
step-3: in a large bowl, mix flour with ginger ale until you have a thick batter.
step-4: batter rings.
step-5: fry in oil until golden brown
step-6: cover in a mixture of powdered sugar and cinnamon.

step-1: stir all of the ‘spice mix’ ingredients together.
step-2: roll the puff pastry out and cut some rough isosceles triangle shapes from it.
step-3: take a thick slice of apple, dip it into the melted butter and place on the end of the pastry.
step-4: scatter a teaspoon of brown sugar over the pastry.
step-5: pour some roughly chopped pecans on top of that.
step-6: sprinkle 1 teaspoon of spice mix over all of that.
step-7: starting at the apple segment, roll the pastry until everything is wrapped into a neat little package.
step-8: bake in the centre of a pre-heated oven for 25-30 minutes - 180°c (350°f) gas mark 4.
step-9: allow to cool for 3-5 minutes before eating because the contents are hot!

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, mix the flour and yogurt together until the dough comes together in a ball.
step-3: turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth, about 5 minutes.
step-4: using a bench scraper, divide the dough into 8 equal portions.
step-5: working 1 at a time, roll each portion of dough into a log about 4 inches (10 cm) long.
step-6: shape the log into a ring and transfer to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-7: brush the tops of the bagels with egg wash and generously season with salt.
step-8: bake for 17 minutes, or until the tops are golden brown and the bagels are cooked through.
step-9: day 1 - pizza bagel
step-10: servings: 1
step-11: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-12: spread the marinara sauce over the bagel halves.
step-13: sprinkle the mozzarella cheese over the sauce and top with the pepperoni.
step-14: place on a baking sheet and bake for 8 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the pepperoni is starting to crisp.
step-15: day 2 - breakfast bagel
step-16: servings: 2
step-17: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-18: place the cheddar cheese on one half of the bagel, then toast in the oven until melted, about 3 minutes.
step-19: layer the sausage patty and fried egg on other half of the toasted bagel, then top with the cheesy half.
step-20: day 3 - chicken
step-21: servings: 2
step-22: on one half of the bagel, layer the monterey jack cheese, ranch dressing, bacon, and chicken thighs.
step-23: top with the other bagel half.

step-1: remove the stem of the artichoke.
step-2: cut about 1 inch (2 cm) off the top of the artichoke.
step-3: take a pair of kitchen scissors and snip off the thorns on the tip of the artichoke petals.
step-4: take half a lemon and rub lemon juice over the cut portion of the artichoke to prevent it from browning.
step-5: drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
step-6: spread open the petals and rub minced garlic all over.
step-7: add the parsley and parmesan; make sure to get it in between the petals.
step-8: top with more pepper if desired.
step-9: wrap the artichoke in aluminum foil.
step-10: bake at 425°f (220°c) for one hour 20 minutes.
step-11: when done, serve with extra parsley, lemon wedge and your favorite dipping sauce.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180˚c).
step-2: oil a 9x9-inch (22x22-cm) baking dish with ½ tablespoon of the coconut oil and add 1½ cups (190 g) of the cranberries in a single layer.
step-3: in a large bowl, mix together the rolled oats, walnuts, ¼ cup (20 g) coconut flakes, cinnamon, ginger, and salt.
step-4: in a separate bowl, whisk together the remaining 2 tablespoons coconut oil, milk, maple syrup, egg, and vanilla.
step-5: pour the wet mixture into the dry mixture and stir just to combine.
step-6: pour the oat mixture over the cranberry layer in the baking dish and sprinkle with the remaining cranberries and coconut flakes.
step-7: bake until the top of the oatmeal is set, 30-40 minutes.
step-8: serve warm with milk or yogurt, flaky salt, and maple syrup, if desired.

step-1: in an oiled skillet over medium-high heat, sear the steak until cooked all the way through.
step-2: remove from the pan.
step-3: add a little more oil, then add the garlic and ginger to the pan.
step-4: sauté until soft.
step-5: add the sesame oil, soy sauce, brown sugar, honey, and beef broth.
step-6: stir until combined.
step-7: add the broccoli florets.
step-8: in a separate bowl, combine cornstarch and water.
step-9: add to broccoli mixture.
step-10: bring to a boil, until sauce has thickened.
step-11: add the beef back into the mixture, and serve over rice with sesame seeds, if desired.

step-1: pour the rinsed chickpeas onto half the area of a kitchen towel.
step-2: fold the other half of the towel on top of the beans, and rub them so that the skins start to come off.
step-3: place all of the peeled beans in the bowl of a food processor, along with the salt, cumin, garlic, and beets.
step-4: turn the processor on to break up the mixture.
step-5: with the food processor running, pour in the lemon juice and olive oil, and let the processor run until the mixture is smooth.
step-6: serve with your choice of dipping chips or veggies.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, whisk the eggs, heavy cream, salt, and pepper.
step-3: refrigerate until read to use.
step-4: in an oven-safe pan, cook bacon.
step-5: once fully cooked, take out the bacon and set aside.
step-6: add onions to the same pan and cook until translucent.
step-7: add tomatoes and spinach ,and cook for a couple minutes until spinach is slightly wilted.
step-8: add the bacon back into the pan.
step-9: blend together.
step-10: add the eggs and cheese into the pan.
step-11: give it a good stir, then bake for 15 minutes, or until the eggs do not jiggle in the middle.
step-12: top off with green onions, if desired.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c)
step-2: cut a large circle in the puff pastry sheet.
step-3: sprinkle on cheese, and lay on the bacon.
step-4: fold the edges of the puff pastry over themselves to make a rim—it doesn’t have to be perfect!
step-5: bake for 10 minutes.
step-6: remove from oven, and lay the tomatoes around the edge.
step-7: crack eggs into the middle.
step-8: bake for 15-20 additional minutes, depending on how runny you like your egg.
step-9: remove from oven, and sprinkle with salt, pepper, and chopped basil.
step-10: slice into pieces, however big you like!

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: cut each biscuit into 9 pieces.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: in a bowl, mix eggs, milk, pepper, salt, and chives.
step-5: in a 9x13 inch (23x33 cm) glass baking dish, evenly spread out the biscuit pieces and the ham.
step-6: pour the egg mixture over everything.
step-7: bake for 35 minutes.
step-8: to make the hollandaise combine the egg yolks, lemon juice, salt, and cayenne in a blender.
step-9: gradually add the hot butter until fully mixed.
step-10: slice and pour hollandaise sauce over the bake.
step-11: top with chives

step-1: marinate chicken breast in chili powder, turmeric, salt and pepper.
step-2: let it sit for 15 minutes.
step-3: brown chicken in 2 tbsp.
step-4: of butter, remove and set aside.
step-5: melt another 2 tbsp.
step-6: of butter over medium heat, add onions, garlic, garam masala, grated ginger, chili powder, ground cumin, cayenne pepper, cinnamon, salt and pepper.
step-7: cook until fragrant.
step-8: add the tomato sauce and bring to a simmer.
step-9: add the water and cream, bring back to a simmer.
step-10: return the chicken and simmer covered for another 10 -15 minutes.
step-11: stir in the last 2 tbsp of butter and additional salt and pepper to taste.
step-12: serve garnished with cilantro on top of rice.

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: add the diced butternut squash, chopped onion, whole garlic cloves, olive oil, salt, and pepper to a baking sheet, tossing until fully coated.
step-3: bake until the squash is golden brown and tender, about 30 minutes.
step-4: while the squash is in the oven, make the dough.
step-5: when the squash is finished cooking, add it to the food processor along with the brown sugar and parmesan cheese.
step-6: pulse until it becomes smooth.
step-7: set aside to chill.
step-8: rinse the bowl of the food processor.
step-9: to the bowl of a food processor, add the flour, eggs, and olive oil, and pulse until the dough comes together into a large ball and swirls around the processor.
step-10: remove the dough, wrap in plastic wrap, and rest it the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-11: cut 2 ounces of pasta dough from the ball and roll out into large, wide, thin sheets of pasta.
step-12: lay a sheet over an empty ice cube tray, and press the dough down gently into each of the holes.
step-13: fill each hole with a tablespoon of the butternut squash filling.
step-14: place a second sheet on top of the ice cube tray.
step-15: press down on all the sides of the raviolis.
step-16: flip the ice cup tray over to release the pasta and cut off any excess dough.
step-17: separate each ravioli with a knife or cutting tool.
step-18: gently place a few raviolis into boiling salted water and cook until the raviolis float and firm up slightly, 2-3 minutes.
step-19: scoop out the ravioli and set aside briefly to cook a new batch or dump out the water and start the hazelnut brown butter sauce.
step-20: in a pan, add 3 tablespoons of the butter, sage leaves, and hazelnuts.
step-21: cook until the butter browns deeply, the nuts are heated through, and the sage is fried and crispy.
step-22: turn off the heat and add the lemon juice and season to taste.
step-23: swirl in 2 more tablespoons more of chilled butter, to thicken the sauce.
step-24: add the cooked raviolis back in and toss gently to coat the pasta.
step-25: serve the pasta with brown butter sauce.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: heat a drizzle of olive oil in a 10-inch (25 cm) cast-iron skillet over medium heat.
step-3: add the asparagus, ½ teaspoon salt, and ½ teaspoon pepper.
step-4: sauté for 5-6 minutes, until the asparagus is bright green but still firm.
step-5: turn off the heat.
step-6: transfer the asparagus to a bowl and set aside to cool.
step-7: add the butter to the hot skillet and let it melt from the residual heat.
step-8: allow the pan to cool with the butter in it.
step-9: once the cast iron is mostly cooled (warm to the touch is okay), add the flour, ½ teaspoon salt, 1 teaspoon black pepper, baking powder, and ½ cup parmesan cheese, stirring with a spatula until the texture is sandy.
step-10: add the water and stir to combine.
step-11: using your hands, press the dough evenly over the bottom and about 2 inches (5 cm) up the sides of the pan.
step-12: use a fork to crimp the edges of the dough against the side of the pan.
step-13: set aside.
step-14: add the eggs and sour cream to a medium bowl.
step-15: whisk to combine.
step-16: add the half-and-half, remaining teaspoon of salt, and remaining ½ teaspoon pepper and whisk until fully incorporated.
step-17: scatter the cheddar cheese evenly over the crust.
step-18: arrange the asparagus over the cheese.
step-19: sprinkle the remaining ¼ cup (25 g) parmesan evenly over the asparagus.
step-20: slowly pour the egg mixture into the skillet.
step-21: do not overfill.
step-22: top with the cherry tomatoes, cut sides up.
step-23: carefully transfer the quiche to the oven and bake for 45-50 minutes, until the center is set and the edges are golden.
step-24: let cool for at least 30 minutes before serving.
step-25: serve the quiche straight from the pan.
step-26: note: use a spatula to cut, instead of a knife, so as not to scratch your pan.

step-1: in a pan over medium-high heat, melt butter, then add the chicken breast.
step-2: season with salt, pepper, oregano, and basil.
step-3: cook 8-10 minutes or until chicken is fully cooked.
step-4: remove from heat and set chicken aside.
step-5: in the same pan over medium heat, melt butter and add the garlic.
step-6: cook until the garlic begins to soften.
step-7: add half of the flour to the garlic and butter, stirring until incorporated.
step-8: then add the rest of the flour and stir.
step-9: pour in the milk a little bit at a time, stirring well in between, until fully incorporated and sauce begins to thicken.
step-10: season with salt, pepper, oregano, and basil, and stir well to incorporate.
step-11: add parmesan cheese and stir until melted.
step-12: pour the sauce over cooked penne pasta, add the chicken and mix well.
step-13: add parsley and extra parmesan.
step-14: mix well.

step-1: season the chicken breasts on both sides with salt and pepper.
step-2: heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium high heat.
step-3: place 4 pieces of the chicken in the skillet and sear until until golden-brown, about 1-3 minutes on each side.
step-4: transfer the chicken to a plate and repeat searing with the remaining chicken pieces.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: heat 1 tablespoon of oil in the empty skillet.
step-7: add the mushrooms and stir occasionally until most of the moisture has evaporated from the pan, about 8 minutes.
step-8: transfer the mushrooms to a plate and set aside.
step-9: heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil in the pan.
step-10: add the onions and bell peppers and season with salt and pepper.
step-11: stir occasionally until the onions and peppers have softened, about 2 minutes.
step-12: add in the garlic and rosemary and stir until the garlic is fragrant.
step-13: add in the tomatoes, red wine, and broth and stir until the sauce has thickened slightly.
step-14: add the mushrooms and chicken back into the sauce and bring to a low simmer.
step-15: cover and let cook until the chicken registers 165°f (74°c), about 5-8 minutes.
step-16: serve topped with basil.

step-1: make the basmati rice: melt the coconut oil in a small pot over medium heat.
step-2: add the cinnamon stick and cardamom pods and sauté for 2 minutes, until toasty and aromatic.
step-3: add the soaked basmati rice, water, and salt.
step-4: cover and cook for 10 minutes, until the rice is fluffy.
step-5: remove from the heat, fluff the rice with a fork, and remove the cinnamon sticks and cardamom pods.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: in a large pan, melt the coconut oil over medium heat.
step-8: add the onion and sauté, stirring occasionally for 10 minutes, until onion is light golden brown.
step-9: add the ginger and garlic and sauté for 1 minute, until toasty and aromatic.
step-10: add the tomato paste, turmeric, cumin, coriander, and cayenne and stir to combine.
step-11: add the yogurt and chicken thighs and season with salt and pepper.
step-12: cook for 5 minutes, or until the chicken is no longer pink on the outside.
step-13: add the water, cover, and cook for 10 minutes.
step-14: remove the lid and continue to cook, tossing the chicken occasionally, for 5 minutes or until the curry sauce has thickened to your liking.
step-15: serve the chicken and sauce over the rice with lime wedges and cilantro.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, combine spices to make fajita seasoning, or use store-bought.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine, onion, peppers, and chicken.
step-4: add oil and seasoning, and mix until seasoning is fully incorporated.
step-5: in a casserole dish, add rice and chicken broth.
step-6: then lay down all veggies and chicken.
step-7: cover the dish with foil and bake for 50-55 minutes until rice is fully cooked.
step-8: serve with tomatoes, cilantro, and cheese, if desired.

step-1: heat butter in a saucepan, fry corn until warm.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: soft-boil 2 eggs and set aside.
step-4: blanch the spinach and set aside.
step-5: bring chicken stock, garlic, ginger and scallions to a boil.
step-6: boil for 30 minutes.
step-7: add the chicken, simmer for 20 minutes.
step-8: remove, and set aside.
step-9: dissolve the miso paste in the chicken broth.
step-10: shred the chicken.
step-11: put everything together.
step-12: divide noodles between two bowls.
step-13: pour over chicken broth.
step-14: add the spinach, corn, shredded chicken, chopped scallions, soft-boiled egg and nori.

step-1: heat oil over medium, add garlic, chicken, salt and pepper.
step-2: stir and cook until the chicken has some color.
step-3: add the onion and bell pepper, cook until onions have slightly softened.
step-4: add the sweet paprika, chili flakes, chicken broth and crushed tomatoes.
step-5: simmer covered for 40 minutes.
step-6: take a ladle of the sauce and add to sour cream in a separate bowl.
step-7: mix until well combined.
step-8: add flour to the mix and stir.
step-9: once it is well combined, add the mix to the pot.
step-10: stir in the mix, cover and simmer for an additional 5 minutes or until it has thickened.
step-11: serve with pasta, rice or potatoes.

step-1: butterfly the chicken breast and pound it thin.
step-2: salt and pepper to taste.
step-3: dredge each piece in flour, shaking off the excess.
step-4: in a skillet over high heat, melt three tbsp.
step-5: butter, and brown the chicken, the browner and crispier the better, 3–5 minutes on each side.
step-6: remove chicken from the skillet, and, in the same pan, add chicken stock, lemon, and capers.
step-7: boil until the sauce reduces by ⅓, and return the chicken to the skillet.
step-8: spoon sauce over the chicken several times.
step-9: serve immediately, with the remaining sauce poured over the chicken.

step-1: heat olive oil in a large stock pot or dutch oven over medium-high heat.
step-2: add onion and cook until onion becomes translucent and begins to brown, about 3-5 minutes.
step-3: add garlic, ginger, and jalapeño.
step-4: continue to cook over medium heat until garlic is fragrant and jalapeño is tender, about 3-4 minutes.
step-5: add garam masala, turmeric, salt, and pepper then continue to cook for 1-2 minutes.
step-6: add tomatoes, chickpeas, and water.
step-7: stir to incorporate, making sure to use the spoon the scrape off any brown bits that have appeared on the bottom or sides of the pot.
step-8: as the tomatoes break down, the mixture should take on the texture of a thick stew.
step-9: add more water if needed before bringing everything to a simmer and then cover with a lid.
step-10: once covered, cook for 15 minutes while stirring occasionally.
step-11: remove lid, reduce heat to low and mix in the lemon juice and chopped cilantro.
step-12: cook over low heat 1-2 minutes until the cilantro has wilted and turned bright green.
step-13: serve over basmati rice or with a side of naan.

step-1: place all ingredients in a food processor or blender and blend until combined.
step-2: serve the chimichurri with your favorite steak, on chicken wings, roasted potatoes, or as a dressing for your favorite salad!

step-1: using a food processor or rolling pin, blitz the chocolate biscuits into fine crumbs.
step-2: mix in the melted butter.
step-3: divide the biscuit crumbs in 12 cases of a muffin tin.
step-4: freeze for 10 minutes, or until solid.
step-5: prepare the filling by gently heating the double cream over a low-medium heat.
step-6: once hot, throw in the chocolate and allow the heat of the cream to melt it.
step-7: whisk together until completely smooth.
step-8: pour the filling into the biscuit bases and garnish with the raspberries.
step-9: chill in the fridge for 2-3 hours, until set.
step-10: drizzle over the white and dark chocolate and sieve over the icing sugar.

step-1: pour the rinsed chickpeas onto half the area of a kitchen towel.
step-2: fold the other half of the towel on top of the beans, and rub them so that the skins start to come off.
step-3: place all of the peeled beans in the bowl of a food processor, along with the salt, cumin, and garlic.
step-4: turn the processor on to break up the mixture.
step-5: with the food processor running, pour in the lemon juice, olive oil, sesame oil, and water, and let the processor run until the mixture is smooth.
step-6: serve with your choice of dipping chips or veggies.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine green cabbage, red onion, sour cream, lime juice, and salt.
step-2: chill until ready to serve.
step-3: in a bowl, mix cayenne, garlic powder, cumin, salt, and pepper.
step-4: season each tilapia fillet on both sides with the seasoning mix.
step-5: over medium-high heat, cook 2 fillets at a time for 8 minutes, flipping halfway.
step-6: repeat for the remaining fillets.
step-7: using a fork, break apart the fillets into bite-size pieces.
step-8: right before serving, heat the corn tortillas in the pan over high heat.
step-9: remove from the pan and assemble the tacos with the cabbage slaw and tilapia.
step-10: garnish with cilantro and lime juice.

step-1: add the steak, soy sauce, pepper, and garlic to a ziplock bag.
step-2: remove air from the bag, seal, and rub steak in marinade.
step-3: marinate for at least 30 minutes.
step-4: preheat a medium-sized pan on high heat.
step-5: remove steak from marinade and pat dry.
step-6: coat pan with canola oil and add in steak.
step-7: cook on high heat, flipping the steak frequently until the internal temperature registers 135˚f (57˚c).
step-8: let rest for 5 minutes until cutting.
step-9: cut and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: in a small bowl, combine olive oil, both mustards, thyme, rosemary, lemon zest, salt, and pepper.
step-3: whisk and set aside.
step-4: cut four sheets of foil, about 14 inches (35 cm) long.
step-5: divide potatoes and carrots into 4 equal portions and add to the center of each foil.
step-6: drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
step-7: top each packet with the chicken.
step-8: using your fingers or a brush, work the mustard mixture onto the chicken.
step-9: top with lemon slices and fresh rosemary.
step-10: fold the sides of the foil over the chicken, covering completely and sealing the packets closed.
step-11: place foil packets in a single layer on a baking sheet.
step-12: place into oven and bake until the chicken is cooked through and the potatoes and carrots are tender, about 30 minutes.
step-13: cooking time may take longer depending on the thickness of the breast.

step-1: preheat oven to 375ºf (190ºc), and lightly grease a 12-cup nonstick muffin tin.
step-2: cut the pie crusts into 12 circles, 4½ inches (12 cm) in diameter.
step-3: press pie crust circles into the muffin tin cups.
step-4: bake for 10 minutes.
step-5: mix the ingredients for the broccoli cheddar.
step-6: mix the ingredients for the onion and pepper.
step-7: mix the ingredients for the tomato and goat cheese.
step-8: pour each filling over their own row of 4 crusts.
step-9: bake for 20-30 minutes, or until filling is fully cooked and no longer runny.
step-10: after removing from the oven, run a butter knife or thin spatula around each cup to prevent crust from sticking to the sides.
step-11: eat while still warm, or cool, then freeze in an airtight container for up to 1 month.
step-12: to reheat, microwave for 60-90 seconds.

step-1: mix together the ground beef, onions, scallions, soy sauce, garlic cloves, grated ginger, sesame oil, and white pepper.
step-2: place a spoonful of the ground beef mix into the center of the gyoza wrapper, brush the edges with egg wash, fold over, and press to seal.
step-3: fry the dumplings in oil until golden brown and crispy.
step-4: garnish with sriracha and chopped scallions.

step-1: in a bowl, combine your spices (paprika, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, black pepper, and salt).
step-2: rub the pork chops in the spices generously.
step-3: heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium/high heat.
step-4: when the oil is hot, add the pork chops.
step-5: cook for about 3-5 minutes on each side or until they have a nice caramelized brownness to them.
step-6: once you feel that they are looking browned, add a tablespoon of brown sugar to each pork chop.
step-7: turn each pork chop over, so both sides get some melted brown sugar.
step-8: (don’t add the brown sugar too early or else the sugar will burn and smoke up the room.)
step-9: bake at 350˚f (175˚c) for 15 minutes, making sure the pork chops are cooked through.
step-10: before serving, pour the glaze that’s formed in the pan over the chops.
step-11: serve with your vegetables of choice.

step-1: rinse fish inside and out with cold water, pat dry with paper towel.
step-2: stuff cavity with salt, pepper, lemon, parsley, or any favorite herbs or spices.
step-3: drizzle skin with olive oil.
step-4: place in a loose pouch of heavy duty aluminum foil and splash with white wine.
step-5: roll the foil shut so that liquid or air can’t escape but leave a space between the top of the fish and the top of the foil pouch.
step-6: cook on medium-high grill for 12-18 minutes depending on size of the fish.

step-1: cut the chicken into bite-size pieces.
step-2: season the chicken with turmeric, chili powder, cumin, garam masala, ginger, and white wine vinegar, and mix well.
step-3: heat oil in a pot over a medium heat.
step-4: add the chicken and cook until brown.
step-5: add the chili, chopped tomatoes, water, salt, and pepper.
step-6: mix well and bring to a boil.
step-7: simmer for 1 hour, until the sauce has thickened.
step-8: serve with rice and chopped coriander.

step-1: melt the chocolate and butter together in a saucepan over a medium heat.
step-2: stir in the cocoa powder, sugar, and vanilla extract.
step-3: take off the heat and whisk in the eggs one at a time.
step-4: tear off a piece of greaseproof paper and scrunch into a small ball.
step-5: pre-heat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-6: place the the paper balls in the centre of each hole in a muffin tin.
step-7: pour the chocolate doughnut mixture in the muffin tin holes, circling around the paper balls and being careful not to cover them.
step-8: bake in the oven for 8-10 minutes.
step-9: carefully take the doughnuts out of the muffin tin.
step-10: take out the paper balls with your fingers.
step-11: you should have a circle-shaped hole in each doughnut.
step-12: dip in some melted chocolate, followed by some sprinkles.

step-1: add the potatoes to a large pot of cool salted water.
step-2: bring the water to a boil and cook for 20-25 minutes, or until a fork can easily pierce a potato.
step-3: drain the potatoes and set aside until cool enough to handle but still warm.
step-4: using a peeler or your fingers, remove the skin from the potatoes.
step-5: in a medium bowl, mash the potatoes until all lumps are gone.
step-6: add the salt and pepper and mix well.
step-7: make a well in the center of the potatoes and crack an egg into it.
step-8: whisk the eggs briefly.
step-9: then, using your hands, gently mix it into the potatoes until evenly distributed.
step-10: put 1 cups of flour onto a clean surface and turn out the potato dough onto it, keeping the remaining ½ cup close by in case you need it.
step-11: working quickly and carefully, knead the dough, only incorporating as much flour as you need along the way until the dough loses stickiness and becomes more solid.
step-12: slice the dough into 4 parts.
step-13: roll out 1 part into a long rope, about 1 inch wide, cutting in half and working with 1 half at a time if the rope is becoming too long.
step-14: slice the rope into ½-inch squares and set aside on a lightly floured surface.
step-15: repeat with the remaining dough.
step-16: if desired, place a fork on your work surface and slide each gnocchi square from the base of the fork prongs to the top so they make a decorative shape.
step-17: bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and add the gnocchi in batches, stirring gently once or twice to ensure they are not sticking.
step-18: boil until they float to the surface; after another 15-30 seconds in the water, remove.
step-19: in a pan over medium heat, melt butter and add the sage.
step-20: add the gnocchi and toss until lightly golden.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-2: place the sweet potato, red potato, red onion, brussels sprouts, green beans, and carrots on the baking sheet in separate piles
step-3: drizzle everything with olive oil, then sprinkle with salt, pepper, thyme, and rosemary.
step-4: rub the seasoning into the vegetables until evenly coated and spread flat on the baking sheet, keeping the vegetables separate.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: in a small bowl, combine the mustard, honey, garlic, salt, and pepper, and whisk until smooth.
step-7: set aside.
step-8: place the chicken thighs skin-side down in a greased cast-iron skillet.
step-9: season with salt and pepper, then brush generously with the honey-mustard sauce.
step-10: flip the chicken thighs over and repeat, seasoning with salt and pepper, then brushing with the rest of the honey-mustard sauce.
step-11: place the vegetables and the chicken in the oven on separate racks.
step-12: bake for 30 minutes or until chicken reaches an internal temperature of 165°f (75°c) .
step-13: (optional: remove the vegetables once cooked and broil the chicken for 1-2 minutes, or until the skin crisps up.)
step-14: let everything cool, then distribute into resealable containers, mixing up the combination of vegetables so that you get something a little different each day.
step-15: cover and refrigerate for up to 4 days.

step-1: please be aware, you have to place the ice cube right in the chocolate as soon as you're able to remove it from its slot otherwise it will start to melt and the chocolate will not adhere
step-2: fill a 12-cup muffin tin with water.
step-3: place a popsicle stick into each muffin cup.
step-4: freeze until solid.
step-5: in a medium bowl, whisk together the cream cheese, peanut butter, 1½ teaspoons milk, ¼ teaspoon vanilla, ¼ cup powdered sugar, and salt until smooth.
step-6: fold in ¼ cup of whipped cream with spatula.
step-7: set aside.
step-8: separate the cream from 12 chocolate sandwich cookies into a separate medium bowl.
step-9: add the remaining 2 tablespoons powdered sugar, remaining 2 teaspoons milk, and remaining ¼ teaspoon vanilla to the bowl with the cream filling.
step-10: whisk until well-combined.
step-11: fold in the remaining cup of whipped cream with a spatula.
step-12: set aside.
step-13: transfer the cookies to a zip-top bag and break into crumbs with a rolling pin.
step-14: set aside.
step-15: in a small bowl, combine the chocolate pudding mix and cold milk.
step-16: whisk for 2 minutes, then let sit for 3 minutes, until the pudding thickens.
step-17: remove the muffin tin from the freezer.
step-18: give the ice a minute to melt down just enough to remove each ice mold from the muffin cups.
step-19: dip 4 of the ice discs into the melted milk chocolate, making sure not to fully submerge the ice disc.
step-20: set the chocolate-dipped ice discs onto a parchment-lined baking sheet or plate.
step-21: dip 4 of the ice discs in the melted white chocolate, and the remaining 4 discs in the melted dark chocolate.
step-22: once the chocolate has set, give the ice discs a minute to melt down slightly.
step-23: wiggle the ice disc out of the chocolate to reveal hollow chocolate cups.
step-24: pipe the peanut butter mousse into the milk chocolate cups.
step-25: top with chopped nuts and a mini peanut butter cup.
step-26: sprinkle chocolate sandwich cookie crumbs on the bottom of the white chocolate cups.
step-27: pipe the cookie cream filling on top of the crumbs.
step-28: garnish with more cookie crumbs and half of a chocolate sandwich cookie.
step-29: pipe the chocolate pudding mixture into the dark chocolate cups.
step-30: top each one with 3 raspberries and fresh mint leaves.

step-1: heat olive oil in a large pot over medium high heat.
step-2: add diced chicken breasts and andouille sausage.
step-3: add salt and pepper to taste, and cook thoroughly.
step-4: add crushed garlic and a diced jalapeño pepper.
step-5: note: leave the jalapeño seeds in for extra spice
step-6: stir in diced onion, peppers, celery until they’re soft.
step-7: add chicken stock, tomatoes, rice, cajun seasoning, bay leaf, dried thyme, cayenne pepper and stir.
step-8: cover and simmer stew for 30 minutes.
step-9: note: stir occasionally to make sure the rice doesn’t burn at the bottom of the pan.
step-10: once the rice is cooked, add in shrimp, season with salt and pepper, then continue simmering until the shrimp are cooked through.

step-1: cut each chicken breast in half crosswise, then cut the larger half again horizontally, creating 3 cutlets.
step-2: place the flour, salt, pepper, onion powder, and garlic powder into a wide shallow dish and stir to combine.
step-3: dredge the chicken pieces in the flour mixture, shaking gently to remove any extra flour and set aside.
step-4: heat oil and 2 tablespoons of butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
step-5: cook the chicken in batches to prevent overcrowding.
step-6: cook the chicken until golden brown, about 3 minutes.
step-7: flip and cook the other side, 3 minutes.
step-8: remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
step-9: in the same pan, add more oil or butter as needed.
step-10: add garlic, shallots, and the cremini mushrooms to the pan, stirring occasionally and scraping bottom the bottom of the pan until the mushrooms are soft and most of the liquid has evaporated, about 8 minutes.
step-11: deglaze the pan with the marsala wine and scrape all caramelized bits from the bottom of the pan.
step-12: add the chicken stock and lemon juice, and allow mixture to come to a boil.
step-13: reduce to simmer, and cook until the liquid has reduced by half.
step-14: this can take about 30min
step-15: remove the pan from the one top and add 2 tablespoons of cold butter and stir until the sauce is smooth and creamy.
step-16: return the pan to the one top and then add the cooked chicken to the sauce, let simmer for 5 more minutes.
step-17: make sure to flip the chicken halfway through.
step-18: sprinkle with parsley and serve with pasta, potatoes, or rice.

step-1: cut a piece of parchment paper in the shape of a square.
step-2: slice the onion thinly.
step-3: julienne the carrot.
step-4: cut the bottom of shimeji mushroom and tear into bite-sized pieces.
step-5: place the salmon at the center of the parchment paper.
step-6: season with salt and pepper.
step-7: place onion, carrot and shimeji in that order.
step-8: sprinkle sake and put the butter on top.
step-9: bring up the top and the bottom corner of the paper.
step-10: fold the top corner for 3 to 4 times.
step-11: twist the ends.
step-12: place the salmon packet on a microwave safe plate and microwave for 4 minutes, or cook in 350°f (180°c) oven for 20 min.
step-13: open the parchment paper carefully and drizzle soy sauce on top.

step-1: heat a medium nonstick pan over medium-high heat.
step-2: add the beaten egg to the pan and tilt the pan so the egg covers the bottom in a thin layer.
step-3: cook until the egg is firm, 3 minutes.
step-4: remove from the pan and let cool, then roll up.
step-5: in a liquid measuring cup, mix together the sugar, salt, and rice vinegar and microwave for 2 minutes, or until the solids fully dissolve.
step-6: pour the seasoned sushi vinegar over the cooked rice and gently toss the rice until it comes to room temperature.
step-7: place a sheet of nori on a cutting board.
step-8: dip your hands in water and then pick up about half of the seasoned sushi rice and gently arrange it over the nori, spreading evenly all the way to the corners.
step-9: top the rice with another nori sheet, then cut the the sushi crosswise into 4 even strips.
step-10: set aside.
step-11: place another sheet of nori on a sushi rolling mat.
step-12: place a quartered strip of cucumber on the bottom edge of the nori and another cucumber strip an inch above it.
step-13: place 2 of the sushi rice/nori strips on top of the cucumber.
step-14: place a strip of salmon in between the strips of nori.
step-15: then, place the rolled omelet on top of the salmon.
step-16: place 2 strips of tuna on either side of the omelet roll.
step-17: then, place another piece of salmon on top of the omelette.
step-18: place the last 2 strips of rice and nori over the salmon.
step-19: place another strip of cucumber over the top piece of nori and roll the sushi 90 degrees.
step-20: tuck the final piece of cucumber in place and continue to roll the sushi until the nori completely wraps around, making sure to keep the roll as square as possible.
step-21: cut the roll into slices and serve immediately with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger alongside.

step-1: in a medium bowl, mix cream cheese and nutella.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: roll out puff pastry sheet on a lightly floured surface.
step-4: divide into 9 equal squares.
step-5: scoop 1 tbsp.
step-6: of nutella filling onto the corner of each puff pastry square.
step-7: leave enough space for the edges to be crimped shut.
step-8: fold the square to form a triangle, crimp the edges shut.
step-9: set the turnovers on a lightly greased cookie pan.
step-10: prepare the egg wash by beating together one egg and 1 tbsp.
step-11: water.
step-12: brush the top of each turnover with the egg wash.
step-13: bake for 350˚f (175˚c ) for 25 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-14: allow to cool.
step-15: garnish by dusting powdered sugar and drizzling with melted nutella or chocolate syrup.

step-1: in a bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, and pepper.
step-2: push 3 tater tots in each cup of a non-stick muffin tin.
step-3: bake at 425°f (220°c) for 10 minutes.
step-4: remove from oven.
step-5: place your favorite omelette fillings in each muffin tin on top of the tater tots.
step-6: pour egg mixture into each muffin tin.
step-7: bake at 350°f (177°c) for 20 minutes, or until fully cooked!

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: pat dry the pork tenderloin and generously season with salt and pepper on all sides.
step-3: heat 2 tablespoons of canola oil in a large cast iron skillet over medium-high heat, until oil is shimmering and just starting to smoke.
step-4: place pork in the hot skillet and leave to sear until nice and browned on one side, about 1 ½ - 2 minutes.
step-5: flip and repeat, to sear on all sides.
step-6: remove the pork from the skillet, and set aside.
step-7: add 1 additional tablespoon of oil to skillet, or as needed.
step-8: add sliced onion to hot skillet.
step-9: toss to coat.
step-10: add garlic and apples, and continue to cook until apples and onion begin to soften.
step-11: pour cider over apples and onion, bring to a simmer.
step-12: place pork back in the skillet, on top of apple and onion mixture.
step-13: spoon cooking liquid over the pork and transfer the entire skillet to a preheated oven.
step-14: bake for 15-20 minutes until pork is cooked through.
step-15: (internal temperature reaches 145˚f (62˚c.)
step-16: remove skillet from the oven, allow the pork to rest for 10 minutes before slicing.
step-17: serve sliced pork over a bed of the apples and onions.

step-1: in a large pot on medium-high heat, gently heat the milk to a simmer.
step-2: add in the elbow macaroni.
step-3: cook until the pasta is tender.
step-4: once the noodles are cooked, turn off the heat.
step-5: add in the butter, cheddar, salt, and pepper.
step-6: fold these ingredients with the pasta until the cheese and butter melt into the milk to create a thick sauce.
step-7: sprinkle with parsley and serve!

step-1: slice chicken breast into cubes.
step-2: in a bowl, combine marinade ingredients.
step-3: add chicken and stir to coat.
step-4: let marinate at least 1 hour.
step-5: in a pan, heat oil on medium-high heat.
step-6: remove chicken from marinade with a slotted spoon, and cook all sides until golden brown, about 5 minutes.
step-7: add sauce ingredients to pan and bring to a boil, mixing continuously, until mixture thickens, about 5 minutes.
step-8: serve over rice if desired.

step-1: preheat the oven to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-2: season the steaks with salt and pepper on all sides.
step-3: heat a large cast iron pan over medium-high heat until just smoking.
step-4: add the butter and olive oil.
step-5: once the butter has melted, add the steaks and cook, without moving for three minutes.
step-6: use tongs to flip the steaks over.
step-7: add the rosemary, thyme, and garlic.
step-8: transfer the pan to the oven for 7 minutes for a medium steak.
step-9: using tongs, transfer the steaks to a cutting board.
step-10: let the steaks rest for at least 5 minutes.
step-11: slice and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a 9x18 inch (23x36 cm) glass baking dish, spread the peaches and syrup.
step-3: evenly sprinkle the cake mix over the peaches, and pat down.
step-4: lay the butter evenly over the cake mix.
step-5: bake for 45 minutes.
step-6: top with vanilla ice cream (optional).

step-1: heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat until shimmering.
step-2: add the onion and saute for about 3 minutes, until translucent.
step-3: add the garlic and saute for about 2 minutes, until fragrant.
step-4: add the curry powder, paprika, cayenne, cumin, allspice, ginger, salt, and pepper.
step-5: stir and cook for about 2 minutes until the spices are fragrant.
step-6: add the potatoes and mix well until well-coated in spices.
step-7: add the chickpeas and stir to incorporate.
step-8: add the broth, lemon juice, and tomatoes and stir, then pour in the coconut milk and stir to combine.
step-9: increase the heat to high and bring the mixture to a simmer.
step-10: once bubbling, reduce the heat to medium and cook for 15-20 minutes, until the potatoes are tender and easily pierced with a fork.
step-11: serve with cooked rice and naan and garnish with fresh cilantro.

step-1: pour the rinsed chickpeas onto half the area of a kitchen towel.
step-2: fold the other half of the towel on top of the beans, and rub them so that the skins start to come off.
step-3: place all of the peeled beans in the bowl of a food processor, along with the salt, cumin, garlic, and pesto.
step-4: turn the processor on to break up the mixture.
step-5: with the food processor running, pour in the lemon juice and water, and let the processor run until the mixture is smooth.
step-6: serve with your choice of dipping chips or veggies.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: cut pizza dough into 12 square pieces and place in a greased muffin tin.
step-3: place a spoonful of pizza sauce and some cheese into the bottom of each cup.
step-4: fill with your favorite pizza toppings and combinations!
step-5: bake for 20-25 minutes or until fully baked.
step-6: if the tops are getting too brown too quickly, cover the pan with foil and put back into the oven for the remainder of the cooking time.

step-1: note: we used about 600g of each, ravioli (1 ⅓lb) and bolognese sauce (2 ¼cup).
step-2: depending on your pan size this will vary.
step-3: cover the base of a deep dish baking tray with a layer of ravioli.
step-4: cover this with a thin layer of bolognese sauce, use the back of a spoon to spread it around evenly.
step-5: sprinkle a thin layer of grated cheddar over the bolognese sauce.
step-6: put down another layer of ravioli, followed by another layer of bolognese sauce.
step-7: cover all of this with a generous topping of more grated cheese.
step-8: cover the tray with tin foil and bake in the center of a pre-heated oven for 35 mins.
step-9: 200°c (400°f) gas mark 6.
step-10: remove the tin foil and bake for a further 8-10 minutes, or until the cheese on top has melted and browned a bit.

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine cream cheese, egg yolk, and pancake mix, whisk using a hand mixer until fully combined.
step-2: add heavy cream in two parts, whisking well in between.
step-3: in a separate bowl, whisk egg whites until firm peaks form, then add granulated sugar in three parts, whisking well in between.
step-4: gently fold egg whites into pancake mixture in three parts and stir until fully incorporated.
step-5: grease rice cooker bowl with melted butter and add cheese cake mixture.
step-6: cook for 70 minutes.
step-7: once cooked turn the cake out onto a plate, splinkle with powder suger.

step-1: pour the rinsed chickpeas onto half the area of a kitchen towel.
step-2: fold the other half of the towel on top of the beans, and rub them so that the skins start to come off.
step-3: place all of the peeled beans in the bowl of a food processor, along with the salt, cumin, garlic, and roasted red peppers.
step-4: turn the processor on to break up the mixture.
step-5: with the food processor running, pour in the lemon juice and olive oil, and let the processor run until the mixture is smooth.
step-6: serve with your choice of dipping chips or veggies.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c)
step-2: add potatoes to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-3: season with olive oil, thyme, salt, and pepper.
step-4: bake for 20 minutes.
step-5: to prepare salmon marinade, combine lemon juice, garlic, onion powder, paprika, thyme, parsley, and honey, and stir until evenly combined.
step-6: on the same baking tray, push the potatoes to one side of the tray and add salmon and asparagus.
step-7: season the salmon and asparagus with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
step-8: brush the marinade on the salmon.
step-9: top salmon with lemon slices and thyme springs.
step-10: bake for 12-14 minutes or until salmon is cooked.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200˚c).
step-2: place the zucchini, green and yellow bell peppers, mushrooms, grape tomatoes, corn, onion, black beans, and the minced garlic cloves on a baking sheet.
step-3: in a small bowl, combine the cumin, oregano, garlic powder, smoked paprika, onion powder, chili powder, and cayenne powder.
step-4: sprinkle the seasoning mix over the vegetables.
step-5: add salt and 2 tablespoons of olive oil and toss with your hands until the vegetables are well-coated.
step-6: place the red bell pepper halves, cut side down, on a second baking sheet.
step-7: bake the seasoned vegetables for 35 minutes, stirring halfway through, until tender.
step-8: bake the red bell peppers for 25 minutes, until soft.
step-9: transfer the roasted red bell peppers to a medium bowl and cover it with a plate to let them sweat for about 10 minutes, until the peels are easily removed from the flesh.
step-10: peel the red bell peppers.
step-11: transfer the flesh from the red bell peppers into a blender or food processor.
step-12: add the avocado, halved garlic cloves, remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil, lemon juice, a pinch of salt and pepper, and the red pepper flakes.
step-13: blend until smooth.
step-14: remove the roasted vegetables from the oven and sprinkle with cilantro, if using.
step-15: serve the roasted vegetables on corn tortillas with the sauce and sliced jalapeño, and lime wedges alongside.

step-1: halve the limes, then juice using a citrus press or a pair of kitchen tongs.
step-2: you should have about 1 cup (240 ml) total.
step-3: in a medium bowl, combine the shrimp, lime juice, salt, jalapeños, onion, and tomatoes.
step-4: mix well.
step-5: cover and refrigerate for about 4 hours, until the shrimp is opaque and firm.
step-6: serve the ceviche chilled.
step-7: garnish with cilantro, if desired, and serve with tortilla chips.

step-1: combine all sauce ingredients in slow cooker and stir.
step-2: set to high and cover while making meatballs, or for 30 minutes.
step-3: (or use pre-made/canned sauce.)
step-4: combine all meatball ingredients except the mozzarella in a large bowl.
step-5: using your hands, mix until fully combined.
step-6: take a golf ball sized piece of the ground beef mixture and place a piece of mozzarella in the middle.
step-7: press meat around the piece of cheese, fully enclosing it.
step-8: repeat until all meat is used.
step-9: place meatballs in slow cooker and submerge in sauce.
step-10: cover and cook on high for 2-2½ hours, or until meat is fully cooked.
step-11: serve by itself or over pasta.

step-1: put peach pie filling in slow cooker.
step-2: then top with cake mix, butter, and walnuts.
step-3: cook on high for 2-2.5 hours or until the cake part reaches desired consistency.
step-4: server a la mode with vanilla ice cream or your favorite whipped cream.

step-1: in a mixing bowl, combine the garlic, ginger, chili, honey, and soy sauce.
step-2: mix in the chicken drumsticks.
step-3: cover with cling film and leave to marinate in the fridge for 4-6 hours, or overnight.
step-4: fry the chicken in a large pan, on all sides for about 10-15 minutes, stirring often to prevent the marinade from burning, until golden brown.
step-5: remove from the pan and pour in the marinade.
step-6: bring to a boil and stir, until the marinade is thick and resembles a sauce.
step-7: throw the chicken back in the pan and fry for a further 5-10 minutes in the sauce, making sure each drumstick is evenly coated and cooked through.
step-8: garnish with sesame seeds and spring onions.

step-1: in a large heavy bottomed pot, brown the beef in a little bit of olive oil.
step-2: season with the salt and pepper.
step-3: once browned, remove the beef and set aside.
step-4: in the same pot, add the chopped onions.
step-5: cook until slightly softened.
step-6: add the browned beef back to the pan.
step-7: mix to incorporate.
step-8: add the kidney beans, crushed tomato, cumin, paprika, red pepper flakes, chili powder, water and stout beer.
step-9: give it stir.
step-10: bring to a boil.
step-11: cover and let it simmer for an hour.
step-12: serve with shredded cheddar, sour cream and chives.

step-1: in a large microwave-safe bowl, add the stuffing mix, then pour in the water and melted butter and stir until evenly mixed.
step-2: cover with a kitchen towel and microwave on full power for 2 minutes.
step-3: remove the bowl from the microwave, add the celery and apple, and stir until well mixed.
step-4: cover and microwave for 2 more minutes.
step-5: remove the bowl and stir, then cover and microwave for 1 minute more until stuffing is moist and a little crispy on the edges.

step-1: in a bowl, add the sugar, salt, and vinegar, and stir to combine.
step-2: microwave for 2 minutes, or until the sugar has dissolved.
step-3: transfer the rice onto a serving bowl and pour the vinegar mixture over the rice.
step-4: using a spatula fold in the vinegar into the rice.
step-5: have another person fan the rice while mixing to get it down to room temperature.
step-6: lay 4 sheets of nori onto two sheet pans.
step-7: spread half the rice mixture onto the nori on one sheet pan in an even layer.
step-8: repeat with the remaining sheet pan.
step-9: refrigerate uncovered for 30 minutes to an hour.
step-10: in a bowl, whisk the flour, cornstarch, baking powder, salt, and egg until smooth.
step-11: slowly add the ice water in a steady stream whisking until just mixed.
step-12: dip the shrimp in the batter until fully coated.
step-13: heat a large pot of oil to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-14: add shrimp to the pot and fry until golden brown, about 2 minutes.
step-15: transfer the shrimp to a wire rack to drain.
step-16: repeat with remaining shrimp.
step-17: once cool, season the shrimp with salt to taste.
step-18: remove the sheet pans with rice from the refrigerator.
step-19: place the first sheet of nori and rice onto a cutting board.
step-20: mentally divide the rice sheet into fourths.
step-21: on one fourth, place a layer of cucumber, a layer of avocado, and top with the crab.
step-22: on another fourth, place the sliced avocado and top with the shrimp tempura.
step-23: on another fourth, spread a layer of the cream cheese, then top with smoked salmon and a layer of avocado.
step-24: on the last fourth add a layer of cucumber and avocado.
step-25: gently invert the other sheet tray with rice onto the sheet tray with toppings, so that the edges are even.
step-26: cut the sushi into 16 even squares.
step-27: serve with teriyaki sauce, spicy mayonnaise, and soy sauce.

step-1: drain and dry the pickled cherry peppers, then cut off the tops and use a teaspoon to scoop out the seeds.
step-2: place a mozzarella ball inside of each one.
step-3: make the chicken mixture: in a large bowl, combine the ground chicken, egg, parmesan, milk, bread crumbs, onion, parsley, garlic powder, pepper, and salt.
step-4: mix well.
step-5: take a golf ball-size amount of the chicken mixture and pat it out flat in your palm.
step-6: place a stuffed cherry pepper in the center and wrap the chicken mixture around it until completely covered, rolling into a ball.
step-7: repeat with the remaining cherry peppers.
step-8: chill for 20 minutes.
step-9: preheat the oven to 450°f (230°c).
step-10: prepare for frying: add the bread crumbs to a medium bowl with the parmesan, dried parsley, garlic powder, and salt.
step-11: beat the eggs in a separate medium bowl.
step-12: add the flour to another medium bowl.
step-13: toss a chicken meatball in the flour, then coat in the eggs, then roll in the bread crumbs.
step-14: repeat with remaining meatballs.
step-15: heat a large pan with ¼ inch (6 ml) of canola oil over medium-high heat until the oil reaches 400°f (200˚c).
step-16: working in batches, fry the chicken meatballs for 1-2 minutes on each side, or until light golden brown.
step-17: once finished, blot dry with paper towels and transfer to a greased baking sheet.
step-18: dollop 1 tablespoon of marinara sauce on each ball, then top with a piece of mozzarella cheese.
step-19: bake for 8 minutes, or until meatballs are cooked through with an internal temperature of 165°f (75˚c).
step-20: sprinkle with parsley and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 450°f (230°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, mix together the crushed tomatoes, water, olive oil, basil, oregano, garlic, salt, pepper, and fusilli.
step-3: pour the pasta mixture into a greased roasting pan and smooth the top into an even layer.
step-4: line the top of the mixture with the sliced tomatoes and sprinkle with salt.
step-5: bake in the oven for 40-45 minutes, until the pasta is fully cooked.
step-6: serve and sprinkle with garnish of choice.

step-1: on a cutting board, cut the castella into ¼-inch (6 mm) slices.
step-2: in a bowl, use a hand mixer to combine the heavy cream and sugar.
step-3: add the greek yogurt and blend until stiff peaks form.
step-4: line a 7x7 inch (18x18 cm) bowl with plastic wrap and add the sliced kiwi to the bowl.
step-5: add a layer of whipped cream to cover the kiwi.
step-6: place the castella on the cream.
step-7: add half of the chopped orange and pineapple.
step-8: cover with a layer of whipped cream, and top with castella.
step-9: add the remaining half or orange and pineapple, top with whipped cream, and remaining castella.
step-10: cover the top layer in plastic wrap, and refrigerate for 3 hours.
step-11: place a plate on the opening of the bowl, and gently turn the bowl over, removing the plastic wrap.
step-12: slice the cake, and serve.

step-1: in a large mixing bowl, combine pasta, chickpeas, grape tomatoes, broccoli, carrots, red onion, and parsley.
step-2: in a small liquid measuring cup, combine olive oil, red wine vinegar, garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper, and whisk to combine.
step-3: pour dressing over pasta salad and stir until evenly distributed.
step-4: transfer pasta salad into 4 containers and refrigerate for up to 5 days.

step-1: in a small bowl, combine yogurt, spicy dijon, dill, chives, and honey.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: cut salmon into ½ inch (1¼ cm) cubes and transfer to a food processor.
step-4: pulse 5 times.
