step-5: add onion, dill, horseradish, honey, salt, and pepper and pulse a few more times to combine.
step-6: form mixture into 4 patties.
step-7: drizzle small amount of olive oil into frying pan and heat pan to medium-high.
step-8: cook patties for 3-4 minutes until browned.
step-9: flip and cook another 3-4 minutes until browned.
step-10: serve on your favorite multi-grain bread with yogurt dill sauce.

step-1: scoop the avocado into a medium bowl.
step-2: season with salt and add the lemon juice.
step-3: mash until smooth.
step-4: spread the avocado on the slice of toast.
step-5: top with the sliced banana and a drizzle of honey.

step-1: in a food processor, combine the edamame, paprika, cumin, garlic, tahini, lemon juice, water, moringa powder, and salt and puree until smooth.
step-2: drizzle the olive oil over the hummus.
step-3: serve with raw vegetables and crackers.
step-4: but before you enjoy, take a photo and post it on your ‘gram!

step-1: in a small bowl, combine 1 pack of gelatin and 2 tbsp of water.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: in a medium pot, combine sugar, cornstarch, light corn syrup, water, and salt.
step-4: mix together and bring to a boil.
step-5: heat mixture until it reaches 255°f (124°c), then turn off heat.
step-6: carefully mix in gelatin and remove from heat.
step-7: attach one end of a vinyl tube to a helium tank.
step-8: use a piece of tape to secure it in place.
step-9: dip the other end of your vinyl tube into your sugar mixture.
step-10: make sure the opening is completely covered in your mixture.
step-11: hold your tube over your mixture pointing down toward the pot.
step-12: carefully inflate by slowly filling it with helium.
step-13: as the balloon inflates, turn the tube upward to allow the balloon to form.
step-14: once filled have another person use a piece of string to capture your balloon.
step-15: carefully wrap the string at the base of your balloon on the tube, twist the string once wrapped.
step-16: as one person slowly pulls the vinyl tube away, the other person will use the string to scrape off the balloon base of the tube.
step-17: eat immediately.
step-18: the taffy balloon can be eaten on its own or popped, then wrapped around a stick for easier consumption.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: for the base dough, evenly spread flour out on a baking tray and bake for 5 minutes.
step-3: in a large bowl, mix flour, sugar, butter, vanilla, milk, and salt until combined evenly.
step-4: refrigerate mix for 30 minutes.
step-5: separate dough into 4 sections
step-6: for the chocolate chips, add one section of dough in a large bowl, mix in the chocolate chips and mini chocolate chips until combined.
step-7: for the cookies and cream, crush sandwich cookies in plastic bag until evenly separated.
step-8: place crushed sandwich cookies into a large bowl, and add in one section of dough mixing until combined.
step-9: for the peanut butter chocolate, add chocolate candies, chocolate peanut butter cups, and peanut butter, into a large bowl with one section of dough and mix until combined.
step-10: for the triple chocolate chunk, add melted chocolate into a large bowl with the last section of dough and mix until evenly combined and consistent color.
step-11: add the chocolate chips and white chocolate chips, then mix until combined.

step-1: to make the soup.
step-2: add canola oil and heat the pan over medium heat.
step-3: add ginger and cook until fragrant.
step-4: toss in shrimp and sauté both side until shrimp start to turn pink, but are not fully cooked.
step-5: add the carrot, onion, and bok choy stems, and sauté lightly.
step-6: add shiitake mushroom and stir.
step-7: add all the broth ingredients except slurry and bring it to a boil.
step-8: add bok choy leaves and slurry and bring to boil.
step-9: set aside.
step-10: make an edible rice bowl.
step-11: place a cup of rice onto a large piece of parchment paper and spread the rice.
step-12: put another piece of parchment paper on top and roll with a rolling pin.
step-13: once it is flat, remove the parchment paper on top and heat it with microwave for 3 minutes in order to dry it.
step-14: place it on a cooling rack to cool to touch.
step-15: once the rice sheet is cooled, put it in a mesh colander and shape it like a bowl.
step-16: fry the rice sheet in the mesh colander until golden brown.
step-17: pour warmed soup over the edible bowl while it is still hot.

step-1: sliced two cherry tomatoes.
step-2: mash ½ of 1 avocado with salt.
step-3: (use the other half for another toast.)
step-4: prepare bread in a toaster to desired crispiness.
step-5: in a pan, fry an egg sunny side up.
step-6: assemble the toast by spreading avocado on the toast, then the tomatoes and topping everything with the egg.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a measuring cup, beat the eggs until smooth.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: in a greased muffin tin, place your desired combination of fillings into each muffin cup.
step-5: season each cup with salt and pepper.
step-6: pour the beaten eggs into each muffin cup until the liquid almost reaches the top.
step-7: bake for 20 minutes, until set.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: fill a greased muffin tin with your favorite combination of fillings or use the ones we did!
step-3: whisk eggs in measuring cup and fill up each tin.
step-4: sprinkle with salt and pepper.
step-5: bake for about 30 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.

step-1: preheat the oven to 190°c (375°f).
step-2: cut the crusts off the bread.
step-3: slice the bacon in half lengthways, and wrap a piece around each crust.
step-4: place them on a baking tray.
step-5: brush cupcake tin with melted butter.
step-6: press the bread into the muffin tin, then brush more butter onto the bread.
step-7: bake the bacon soldiers for 10 minutes til they are about halfway cooked and starting to render their fat.
step-8: at the same time, bake bread cups for 10 minutes or until the bread is turning golden brown.
step-9: flip the bacon.
step-10: crack an egg into each bread cup.
step-11: season with salt and pepper.
step-12: bake the bacon soldiers for another 10-12 minutes until the bacon is crispy.
step-13: at the same time, bake the eggs for another 10-12 minutes until they are just cooked.
step-14: dip and enjoy!

step-1: peel the skin off the sweet potato, and coarsely grate on a box grater.
step-2: peel the onion, and coarsely grate on a box grater.
step-3: transfer the grated sweet potato and onion to a towel-lined bowl.
step-4: gently twist the towel, squeezing the liquid into an empty bowl and discard.
step-5: transfer the sweet potato and onion to a bowl, and sprinkle with salt, pepper, garlic powder, flour, and 1 egg.
step-6: gently stir to combine.
step-7: form large flat patties with your hands, approximately ⅓ cup of mixture each.
step-8: heat a 9.5" fry pan on medium heat and coat with oil.
step-9: add the sweet potato patties.
step-10: fry for 2-3 minutes, then gently flip.
step-11: immediately use a small cookie cutter to remove a hole in the middle of each fritter.
step-12: crack an egg in the hole, add a pinch of salt and pepper, then cover.
step-13: fry for 3-7 minutes, or until cooked to your preference.
step-14: uncover and serve with desired garnishes.

step-1: heat a frying pan over medium heat and grease with nonstick spray.
step-2: add the beaten eggs to the pan, cover, reduce the heat to low, and cook until the eggs are set, about 5 minutes.
step-3: remove the pan from the heat.
step-4: transfer the cooked egg disc to a cutting board and cut into ½-inch (1 cm) wide strips.
step-5: toss with any sauce or in soup for easy egg noodles.

step-1: slice the egg roll wrappers in half.
step-2: place a stick of string cheese on the edge of the egg roll wrapper, then fold the sides of the wrapper over the ends of the cheese.
step-3: wet the other edge of the wrapper with water, then roll it up tightly, pressing the edge to make sure it’s sealed.
step-4: repeat with the remaining wrappers and cheese.
step-5: heat oil in a pot.
step-6: fry the sticks until golden brown, then drain on a paper towel.
step-7: serve with marinara.

step-1: make the cookies: in a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, cream of tartar, and salt.
step-2: in another large bowl, beat the butter and sugar with a hand mixer on medium-high until light in color and fluffy in texture, 3-5 minutes.
step-3: add the egg and mix until incorporated.
step-4: mix in the lemon zest and vanilla, then add the flour mixture and mix with a spatula until just combined.
step-5: transfer the cookie dough to a clean work surface and divide into two balls.
step-6: flatten each into a 5-inch (12-cm) disc, wrap in plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, up to 3 days.
step-7: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-8: line two baking sheets with parchment paper.
step-9: on a lightly floured surface, roll out one of the dough discs into a ¼-inch (6 mm) thick circle.
step-10: use egg-shaped cookie cutters to cut out shapes and transfer to the prepared baking sheets.
step-11: bake until the cookies are golden around the edges, 6-8 minutes depending on the size.
step-12: cool for 1 minute on the baking sheets, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely before decorating.
step-13: repeat with the other dough disc.
step-14: make the icing: in a large bowl, beat the egg whites on high speed with a hand mixer until foamy.
step-15: reduce the speed to low and gradually add the sugar, beating until completely incorporated.
step-16: add the lemon juice and return the speed to high, beating until the icing is very stiff, 5-7 minutes.
step-17: divide the icing between four bowls and color three with food coloring of choice.
step-18: transfer the icings to piping bags or plastic bags fitted with round tips and decorate the cooled cookies.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: lightly grease a muffin tin.
step-3: then divide equally the spinach across 6 cups.
step-4: tomatoes, and egg whites across 6 cups.
step-5: dice the tomato, then fill the cups with the tomato and egg whites.
step-6: season with salt and pepper.
step-7: bake for 15 minutes, or until the whites have set.
step-8: serve hot.

step-1: preheat the oven to 325°f (170˚c).
step-2: line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper and grease with nonstick spray.
step-3: in a medium bowl, beat the egg whites and salt with an electric hand mixer until soft peaks form.
step-4: gradually add 2 tablespoons of granulated sugar and beat until stiff peaks form.
step-5: you should be able to turn the bowl upside down without anything falling out.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: in a large bowl, mix together the eggnog, vanilla, and remaining ⅓ cup (65 g) sugar until incorporated.
step-8: sift in the flour and and fold with a rubber spatula to combine.
step-9: fold in ⅓ of the egg whites until incorporated, then add the rest and fold until just combined.
step-10: transfer the dough to a piping bag or zip-top bag fitted with a medium round tip.
step-11: working quickly, pipe 12 4-inch (10 cm) long and 1-inch (2 cm) wide cookies onto each baking sheet.
step-12: bake for 15-17 minutes, until lightly golden around the edges.
step-13: do not allow to get too dark.
step-14: transfer the cookies to a wire rack and let cool completely.
step-15: use a sieve to sprinkle powdered sugar over the tops.
step-16: finish with a pinch of freshly grated nutmeg.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: peel the eggplant, then cut in half lengthwise.
step-3: scoop out the seeds, then chop into large pieces.
step-4: transfer to a steamer basket set over a large pot of simmering water, cover, and steam for 20 minutes, until the eggplant is very soft.
step-5: transfer the hot eggplant to the bowl of the food processor with 4 ounces (110 g) of semisweet chocolate chips, the unsweetened chocolate, maple syrup, and vanilla extract.
step-6: the heat from the eggplant will melt the chocolate.
step-7: blend on high speed for 2-3 minutes, until very smooth, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed.
step-8: in a medium bowl, beat the eggs, then add the almond flour, cocoa powder, and salt, and whisk to combine.
step-9: add the eggplant chocolate mixture and fold with a rubber spatula to combine.
step-10: fold in the remaining semisweet chocolate chips.
step-11: transfer the batter to a greased 8-inch (20-cm) square baking dish and smooth the top.
step-12: top with more chocolate chips, if desired.
step-13: bake for 35 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center of the brownies comes out clean.
step-14: let cool for 20 minutes before slicing.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: cut eggplant lengthwise, keeping it connected at the stem.
step-3: in a baking dish, place marinara sauce and spread to cover the bottom.
step-4: place the eggplant directly on the sauce.
step-5: slice the tomato and mozzarella into thin slices.
step-6: alternate tomatoes, basil, and cheese in each eggplant slice.
step-7: sprinkle salt, pepper, garlic, and olive oil, and cover with foil and bake for 50 minutes until eggplant is tender.
step-8: in a small bowl, combine panko, cheese, salt, and pepper.
step-9: place the panko mixture on top of the eggplant and bake uncovered for another 5 minutes.
step-10: or until the bread crumbs are golden brown.
step-11: cut into your desired size pieces.

step-1: combine chickpeas, garlic, lemon juice, tahini, cumin, and salt in a blender and blend until smooth.
step-2: slice eggplants into four 1-inch (2 ½ cm) slices.
step-3: sprinkle eggplant slices with salt and let sit for 20-30 minutes, then pat dry.
step-4: in a small bowl, stir together oil, paprika, garlic powder, red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper.
step-5: brush each side of the eggplant slices with the oil and spice mixture.
step-6: heat a pan or grill on medium-high heat and cook each eggplant slice for 3-4 minutes per side.
step-7: build your burger with the hummus sandwiched between two eggplant slices.

step-1: preheat oven to 350ºf (175ºc).
step-2: slice the ends the eggplants and slice them into ¼ -inch (½ cm) slices and lay them out on a baking sheet covered in parchment paper.
step-3: season with a pinch of salt on both sides of the eggplant slices and let them sweat for 20 minutes, then dry them with a paper towel.
step-4: once dried; add a pinch of pepper.
step-5: bake for 20 minutes, or until soft.
step-6: meanwhile, in a medium-size bowl, mix ricotta cheese, mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese, basil, and egg.
step-7: remove eggplant slices from the oven and turn oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-8: spoon about 2 tablespoons of the mixture onto eggplant slice then roll it up, repeating for all slices.
step-9: in a 11x17-inch (28 x 43cm) baking sheet, pour ½ of the marinara sauce, then add all the roll-ups seam down.
step-10: pour remaining ½ of marinara sauce, and top with basil and parmesan.
step-11: bake for 25 minutes, or until cheese is melted and golden brown.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a skillet over medium heat, add cooking oil or water and eggplant.
step-3: cook until eggplant begins to brown, stirring occasionally and adding water or vegetable broth as needed.
step-4: transfer to a blender or food processor.
step-5: to the same skillet, add more oil or water and the onion and celery.
step-6: cook until onions are translucent, stirring occasionally.
step-7: add the garlic and stir until fragrant.
step-8: transfer to the food processor with the eggplant.
step-9: pulse the food processor until the eggplant mixture is mostly combined, but still chunky.
step-10: transfer to a large bowl.
step-11: to the bowl, add the breadcrumbs, parmesan, parsley, basil, oregano, salt, and pepper and combinel.
step-12: add the egg and mix until a dough forms.
step-13: use your hands to form 1-inch (2-cm) balls from the eggplant mixture.
step-14: place in rows on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-15: bake for 20 minutes, or until golden, flipping halfway.

step-1: preheat oven to 250˚f (120˚c).
step-2: in a small bowl mix together the paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, cumin, oregano, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: on a cutting board, take one of the eggplants and cut off one end.
step-5: thinly slice the eggplant into ¹⁄₁₆th of an inch (1 mm) slices.
step-6: repeat with the rest of the eggplant.
step-7: generously spray a sheet tray with cooking oil spray.
step-8: place the eggplant slices on the sheet tray.
step-9: the slices will be touching but should not overlap.
step-10: lightly sprinkle each slice with the seasoning mix.
step-11: flip each eggplant slice.
step-12: spray the eggplant slices with more cooking oil spray.
step-13: lightly sprinkle the seasoning mixture over each eggplant slice.
step-14: bake for one hour, or until the chips are crisp.
step-15: in a pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
step-16: once the oil is hot, add the onion and pepper, and stir until caramelized.
step-17: add the chicken and the rest of the spice mixture leftover from the chips and mix thoroughly.
step-18: in a ovenproof dish or cast-iron skillet place, an ovenproof ramekin in the center.
step-19: remove eggplant chips from the sheet pan and place around the ramekin.
step-20: place chicken mixture on top of the chips.
step-21: sprinkle monterey jack cheese over the chicken.
step-22: sprinkle cheddar cheese over the monterey jack cheese.
step-23: broil on high for 5 minutes.
step-24: place dollops of guacamole over the nachos and top with pickled jalapeños.
step-25: pour salsa into the ramekin and sprinkle with cilantro.
step-26: serve immediately.

step-1: slice the eggplant and lay out on a paper towel lined baking sheet.
step-2: generously salt the eggplant on both sides and leave to sit for 30 minutes to soften and draw out excess moisture.
step-3: blot off the water and excess salt from the eggplant with additional paper towels.
step-4: in a medium mixing bowl add the basil, ricotta, mozzarella, parmesan, and one egg (beaten).
step-5: mix together.
step-6: picking two equal sized eggplant slices, sandwich about a tablespoon of the ricotta mixture between the slices and place on a wax paper lined baking tray.
step-7: freeze for 30 minutes to 1 hour.
step-8: in three separate bowls, place the flour, bread crumbs, and the remaining 3 eggs, beaten.
step-9: remove eggplant from the freezer and coat each first in flour, then egg, then bread crumbs.
step-10: coat once more in egg and a final time in the bread crumbs.
step-11: place back in the freezer while you prepare to fry.
step-12: in a large saucepan, heat oil to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-13: fry eggplant in batches, 3 at a time, until nicely browned on all sides.
step-14: remove and place on a paper towel lined plate to drain off any excess oil.
step-15: sprinkle with salt.
step-16: serve with marinara sauce.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: scoop out inside of eggplant leaving about ½-inch (1 cm) border inside.
step-3: chop the remaining eggplant and reserve.
step-4: brush the scooped out eggplants with olive oil, sprinkle with salt and pepper.
step-5: bake for 10-15 minutes.
step-6: heat olive oil in medium skillet over medium heat.
step-7: add onions and garlic to the pan.
step-8: cook until translucent.
step-9: add ground turkey and season with garlic powder, salt and pepper.
step-10: cook until the meat is browned.
step-11: add leftover eggplant pieces to ground turkey and onion.
step-12: cook for 5-8 minutes or until tender.
step-13: add marinara sauce and cook for another 3-5 minutes.
step-14: scoop meat sauce into the eggplants and sprinkle with mozzarella and parmesan.
step-15: bake for 10-15 minutes, or until cheese is melted.
step-16: sprinkle with basil and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-2: with a sharp knife, score a ring around each potato, just deep enough to break the skin.
step-3: place the potatoes in a medium pot of cold water.
step-4: bring to a boil and cook for about 8 minutes, until about halfway cooked.
step-5: drain the potatoes, and rinse with cold water.
step-6: peel off the skin.
step-7: cut the potatoes into ½-inch (1 cm) pieces and set aside.
step-8: divide the eggplant and bell peppers between 2 baking sheets and spread in an even layer.
step-9: drizzle with 4 tablespoons of olive oil, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
step-10: toss with your hands to coat.
step-11: bake for 25 minutes, flipping halfway through.
step-12: heat the remaining tablespoon of olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
step-13: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the onion and cook for 3-4 minutes, until semi-translucent.
step-14: add the tomato paste and stir until well distributed, then add the garlic, paprika, 1 teaspoon salt, and ¾ teaspoon pepper, and cook for another 2-3 minutes, until fragrant.
step-15: add the potatoes, chickpeas, and tomatoes, and stir to incorporate.
step-16: stir in the vegetable broth and cover.
step-17: reduce the heat to low and cook for 20 minutes, until the potatoes are tender.
step-18: add the roasted eggplant and bell pepper, and stir to combine.
step-19: cook for another 5-10 minutes, until the tomatoes have mostly broken down.
step-20: ladle into bowls, garnish with parsley, and serve.
step-21: or, transfer the stew to resealable containers and store in the fridge for up to 5 days or freezer for up to 3 months.

step-1: scoop out flesh of roasted eggplant into a medium sized mixing bowl.
step-2: add the garlic, lemon, salt, and olive oil.
step-3: mash together with a fork until loose puree forms.
step-4: garnish with parsley, sumac, and more olive oil.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: grease a baking sheet with nonstick spray or line with parchment paper.
step-3: cut each eggplant crosswise into ½-inch (1 cm) slices.
step-4: use a 1½-2-inch (3-5 cm) round cookie cutter to punch out the center of each slice.
step-5: in a large bowl, combine the bread crumbs, parmesan, garlic powder, paprika, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper.
step-6: add the eggs to a separate bowl and whisk.
step-7: add the flour to a third bowl.
step-8: dredge eggplant rings  in the following order: flour, eggs, and breading mixture.
step-9: make sure to coat all sides.
step-10: arrange the eggplant rings on the baking sheet.
step-11: bake for 10-15 minutes, flipping halfway through, until golden brown on both sides.
step-12: serve with your favorite dipping sauce.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: in a sauté pan, heat the olive oil and add the spinach and a pinch of salt.
step-3: sauté until wilted.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: butter the english muffin and toast in the oven for 5-10 minutes or until brown.
step-6: heat a pot of water over medium heat.
step-7: with a wooden spoon, swirl the water in the same direction.
step-8: quickly add the egg into the center of the swirling water, cover, and cook for 3-5 minutes or until egg white is set and yolk is still runny.
step-9: remove egg from water with a slotted spoon and set aside.
step-10: in a blender, add the egg yolks and pulse for one minute.
step-11: add in the lemon juice, salt, and cayenne and run the blender.
step-12: slowly add in the melted butter and continue to blend until the mixture lightens in color.
step-13: add more melted butter for thinner consistency.
step-14: assemble the benedict by layering the english muffin with the bacon, spinach, poached egg, and hollandaise sauce.
step-15: top with fresh chives.

step-1: preheat the broiler.
step-2: place the ham and muffins on a baking sheet.
step-3: tip: if your baking sheet is not large enough to hold everything at once, place a wire on top of the pan and arrange the remaining ham and english muffins on top of it.
step-4: broil for 2 minutes, until the english muffins are toasted and the ham starts to crisp.
step-5: remove the english muffins and ham from the oven.
step-6: slice the ham lengthwise, into ⅛-inch (3 mm) wide strips.
step-7: cover a small bowl, about 3 inches (7-cm) in diameter, with plastic wrap.
step-8: place a ham strip across the middle (the edge of the strip should come slightly over the lip of the bowl).
step-9: continue placing ham strips across the bowl, overlapping them in a spiral pattern.
step-10: repeat with three more small bowls and the remaining ham strips.
step-11: in a large pan over medium-high heat, melt 2 tablespoons of butter.
step-12: add the garlic and cook for 1 minute, until the garlic starts to brown.
step-13: add the spinach and stir until wilted to half its original volume, 3-4 minutes.
step-14: add the salt and pepper and stir for another minute.
step-15: remove from heat.
step-16: make the hollandaise sauce: in a blender, combine the eggs yolks, lemon juice, dijon mustard, and cayenne pepper.
step-17: blend on high for 5 seconds.
step-18: reduce the blender speed to low and pour in the melted butter in a thin, steady stream.
step-19: blend for 30 more seconds.
step-20: cover and keep warm.
step-21: fill a deep pan with enough water to cover 4 small, heat-safe bowls.
step-22: bring the water to a boil over high heat and use a pair of tongs to place the bowls in the water.
step-23: carefully drop an egg into each bowl.
step-24: cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the yolks are cooked to your desired firmness.
step-25: using tongs, remove the bowls from the water and drain.
step-26: place a poached egg inside each small bowl with the spiralized ham slices and top with spinach.
step-27: fold the ham slices over the spinach and place a buttered english muffin half on top.
step-28: place a plate over the bowl and invert.
step-29: remove the bowl and plastic wrap.
step-30: serve with hollandaise sauce and chives.

step-1: preheat oven to 450°f/230°c.
step-2: separate the eggs: egg whites in one bowl and egg yolks each into their own bowls.
step-3: using an electric mixer or whisk, mix the egg whites until thick and fluffy.
step-4: salt and pepper to taste.
step-5: fold in bacon, parmesan cheese, and chives.
step-6: do not overfold.
step-7: scoop onto baking tray and make an indent in the middle using the back of a spoon.
step-8: bake for 5-8 minutes or until egg whites start to brown.
step-9: place the egg yolks into center of the egg whites.
step-10: bake for 3 more minutes.

step-1: separate the yolk from egg whites.
step-2: in a chilled metal bowl, whisk the whites until stiff peaks form.
step-3: mix in whatever you want.
step-4: we use bacon, chives and parmesan cheese.
step-5: spoon the whites into even piles on a baking sheet and create a well in the center of each pile with the back of the spoon.
step-6: bake at 450°f (230°c) for 3 minutes.
step-7: put a yolk in each well, bake another 3 minutes at 450°f (230°c).

step-1: fill each compartment of an ice cube tray with 2-3 raspberry slices, a few sprigs of mint, and 2-3 blueberries each.
step-2: fill each to rim with water and freeze.
step-3: when ready to use, fill glass with however many cubes you’d like, and add your favorite beverage.
step-4: serve, feel fancy, and enjoy!

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: season the lamb shanks all over with salt and pepper.
step-3: heat the canola oil in a large dutch oven over medium-high heat.
step-4: sear 2 lamb shanks at a time until a dark brown crust forms on one side, 3-5 minutes.
step-5: sear the other sides of the meat until evenly browned.
step-6: remove the shanks from the pan and set aside.
step-7: remove all but 2 tablespoons of fat from the pan.
step-8: add the minced carrots, onion, celery, and minced garlic to the pot.
step-9: season with salt and pepper, and cook until the vegetables are deeply caramelized, 15-20 minutes.
step-10: add the tomato paste and cook until it browns and is aromatic, 5 minutes.
step-11: add the red wine and scrape the bottom of the pot to release the flavorful browned bits stuck to the bottom.
step-12: cook until the wine reduces by half and thickens slightly, 3 minutes.
step-13: add the chicken stock, orange juice, lemon juice, rosemary, thyme, and bay leaves.
step-14: stir and bring to a boil.
step-15: return the lamb shanks to the dutch oven, cover, and place in the oven for 2 hours, turning the shanks halfway through, until the lamb is tender and the braising liquid has thickened.
step-16: about halfway through the lamb cooking time, add the oblique-cut carrots, brussels sprouts, red pearl onions, and whole garlic cloves to a baking sheet.
step-17: drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
step-18: toss to combine.
step-19: roast in the oven for 1 hour, or until the vegetables are tender.
step-20: right after the potatoes finish boiling, drain and transfer to a large bowl.
step-21: season with plenty of salt and a bit of white pepper, and mash the potatoes until as smooth as possible.
step-22: fold in the butter, sour cream, and heavy cream until smooth and light.
step-23: make the citrus gremolata: in a small bowl, combine the parsley, lemon zest, flaky salt, garlic, chives, horseradish, and orange zest.
step-24: to serve, scoop mashed potatoes onto a plate.
step-25: add roasted vegetables and a lamb shank.
step-26: top with the braising liquid and citrus gremolata.

step-1: blanch the corn in a large pot of boiling water for 3 minutes.
step-2: remove the corn from the pot.
step-3: heat the canola oil in a medium pan over medium-high heat.
step-4: add the corn and cook, turning occasionally, until nicely browned on all sides.
step-5: transfer to a serving plate.
step-6: in a small bowl, combine the mayonnaise, sour cream, and lime juice.
step-7: brush all over the corn.
step-8: sprinkle the corn with the chipotle powder, cotija cheese, and cilantro.

step-1: preheat the oven to 190°c (375°f)
step-2: chop up the pumpkin into chunks and place on a baking tray.
step-3: drizzle over the oil, salt, pepper, and ground sage, and coat evenly with your hands.
step-4: roast in the oven for 20 minutes.
step-5: once cooked leave to cool slightly and blend ⅓ of the pumpkin, set aside.
step-6: for the sauce, in a large ovenproof pan, melt the butter over a medium-low heat.
step-7: gradually mix in the flour to create a roux.
step-8: add the milk in 4-5 parts stirring well in between.
step-9: continue to stir and cook the sauce for a further 5-10 minutes or until the sauce is simmering and thickened.
step-10: stir in the ground nutmeg, garlic powder, pepper, cheddar, and parmesan.
step-11: stir in the blended pumpkin.
step-12: stir in the remaining whole pumpkin and macaroni, mix until combined.
step-13: top with the cheddar, mozzarella, and parmesan.
step-14: grill for 10 minutes at 200°c (400°f) until the cheese is brown and bubbling.
step-15: serve.

step-1: smash the cooked potatoes with a fork or masher until the potatoes are light and fluffy.
step-2: add in all the rest of the ingredients and mix until a slightly crumbly dough forms.
step-3: transfer the dough to a floured surface and roll out to about ½ inch (1.25 centimeter) thick.
step-4: with a mason jar lid or cookie cutter, cut out circles from the dough.
step-5: shape them into any emoji or design you’d like with tools like spoons, straws, toothpicks, forks, and your fingers.
step-6: place the shaped emoji dough onto a parchment paper-lined sheet tray and chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-7: fry the emojis at 350°f (180°c) oil for 1-2 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-8: sprinkle with salt.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat and cook onions, garlic, and peppers until translucent.
step-3: add ground beef and taco seasoning, and cook until browned.
step-4: fill cooked shells with beef and place in a baking dish.
step-5: pour enchilada sauce over the stuffed shells and cover with cheese.
step-6: bake for 15 minutes or until cheese is browned.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: bring water to a boil.
step-3: cook the pasta shells until al dente.
step-4: drain, rinse with cold water, and set aside to cool.
step-5: pour the oil in a pan, then add the onions and cook on medium heat until softened.
step-6: add the green chiles, chicken, and spices and stir to combine.
step-7: cook on low heat for an additional 3-4 minutes.
step-8: place chicken mixture in a bowl.
step-9: add ricotta, queso fresco, and monterey jack and stir until all ingredients are well combined.
step-10: stuff each shell with a large spoonful of the mixture.
step-11: coat the bottom of a baking dish with a thin layer of green enchilada sauce.
step-12: place the pasta shells in the dish in a single layer.
step-13: cover with the rest of the enchilada sauce and some additional queso fresco and monterey jack.
step-14: bake at 375°f (190°c) for 30 minutes (or until the cheese has melted and the sauce begins to bubble around the edges).
step-15: top with scallions.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: in a small bowl, combine the olive oil, garlic, onion powder, cumin and paprika.
step-3: mix well.
step-4: arrange the butternut squash, mushrooms and brussels sprouts in separate piles on a baking sheet.
step-5: season the vegetables with salt and pepper and drizzle with the seasoned oil.
step-6: mix well with your hands.
step-7: bake for about 20-25 minutes, until tender.
step-8: to make the dressing, combine the tahini, maple syrup, apple cider, orange juice, water, and a pinch of salt and pepper in a small bowl.
step-9: mix well with a fork.
step-10: combine the quinoa, kale, butternut squash, mushrooms, brussels sprouts, lentils, red cabbage, beets, and walnuts in a large bowl and top with the tahini dressing and parsley.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, rub together the self-raising flour and cubed butter until you form fine crumbs.
step-3: mix in the sugar, baking powder, and salt, and make a well in the middle.
step-4: pour in the milk and gently mix together until just combined.
step-5: tip the dough onto a floured surface and knead for about a minute.
step-6: be careful not to over-knead the dough.
step-7: using a round cookie cutter or the rim of a glass, cut circles into the dough that are about 1-2 inches thick.
step-8: place onto a baking tray lined with parchment paper and coat the tops of the scones with the egg yolk.
step-9: bake for 12 minutes.
step-10: serve with clotted cream and jam.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a bowl, whisk the eggs, milk, salt, and pepper until smooth.
step-3: pour the batter into greased baking sheet
step-4: bake for 20 minutes.
step-5: place a layer of spinach on top of egg sheet until covered, leaving 2 inches (5 cm) free at the top.
step-6: place a layer of mozzarella on the spinach until covered, leaving 1 inch (2 cm) free at the bottom.
step-7: place a layer of ham on top of mozzarella until covered, leaving 1 inch (2 cm) free at the bottom.
step-8: place a layer of bacon on top of ham until covered, leaving 1 inch (2 cm) free at the bottom.
step-9: gently roll the egg roll up.
step-10: place the breakfast roll onto parchment paper and roll until fully covered.
step-11: bake for 10 minutes.
step-12: remove the parchment paper.
step-13: slice the breakfast roll and serve warm.

step-1: cut the tops off of strawberries and apply to the bottom of two pieces of meringue.
step-2: place a large scoop of ice cream on top of the strawberry side of one meringue and cover with second meringue to create a sandwich.

step-1: add the strawberries, two crushed meringue nests and double cream to a large mixing bowl, and whisk until thick.
step-2: transfer the mixture into shot glasses, then place lolly sticks into them.
step-3: freeze until solid.
step-4: take the pops out of the glass and dip in melted white chocolate, then roll in more crushed meringue.
step-5: freeze again if necessary.

step-1: cut the cauliflower in large florets.
step-2: transfer to a large bowl and set aside.
step-3: in a small bowl, combine the celery salt, oregano, cumin, onion powder, garlic powder, paprika, cayenne, salt, and pepper.
step-4: mix well.
step-5: in a medium bowl, add half of the spice mix to the flour.
step-6: add the cornstarch and mix.
step-7: in a separate medium bowl, combine the soy milk, apple cider vinegar, and hot sauce.
step-8: whisk.
step-9: pour the remaining spice mix over the cauliflower florets and mix.
step-10: pour the milk mixture over the cauliflower and mix well until they are coated.
step-11: cover with plastic wrap and chill for 1 hour minimum.
step-12: heat the vegetable oil in a large pan until it reaches 350°f (180°c).
step-13: toss each cauliflower floret in the flour mixture until well-coated, shaking off any excess.
step-14: dip them back in the remaining soy milk mixture in the bowl where they marinated, then again in the flour mixture.
step-15: fry the cauliflower for 4-5 minutes, until golden brown and crispy.
step-16: drain the pieces on a wire or paper towels.
step-17: let cool 5- 10 minutes before serving.

step-1: prepare 2 boxes of brownie mix according to instructions on box.
step-2: pour into a greased 9x9-inch (23x23-cm) square pan.
step-3: bake according to instructions on box.
step-4: cut each tray of brownies into 25 small squares.
step-5: form each brownie square into a ball, rolling in palms until smooth.
step-6: in a microwave-safe bowl, add the white chocolate chips and microwave in 30 second intervals until smooth, about 1 minute and 30 seconds total.
step-7: in a microwave-safe bowl, add the milk chocolate chips and microwave in 30 second intervals until smooth, about 1 minute and 30 seconds total.
step-8: turn a plastic sandwich bag inside out and hold it from the inside with one hand.
step-9: spoon the milk chocolate into the bag.
step-10: turn the bag back out making sure chocolate does not fall out the opening.
step-11: seal it closed.
step-12: cut the corner of the bag, keeping in mind the more you cut off the larger your piping hole will be.
step-13: coat the brownie balls in the melted white chocolate using a fork.
step-14: place on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and chill until chocolate has hardened, about 20 minutes.
step-15: place one of the white chocolate brownie bites onto a clean surface.
step-16: take one of the fruit bite size candies and crush it flat with the bottom a lid or bowl.
step-17: using the milk chocolate piping bag make a large dot on the center of the brownie bite.
step-18: press the crushed candy down onto the chocolate enough so the the chocolate makes a ring around the outside of the candy.
step-19: create another smaller dot on top of the center of the candy.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the ground beef, garlic powder, parsley, salt, pepper, and paprika.
step-2: in a ramekin, spread two-thirds of the beef patty evenly along the bottom and sides.
step-3: place the red pepper, pepper jack, and green pepper into the well.
step-4: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-5: place the rest of the beef patty on top and pat to flatten.
step-6: place the ramekin on a baking sheet along with the sesame bun, face down.
step-7: bake for 25 minutes.
step-8: assemble the burger with the sesame bun, guacamole, salsa, and sour cream.

step-1: in a shallow dish or medium bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lime juice, agave, 1 teaspoon of salt, the oregano, chili powder, and 2 teaspoons of cumin.
step-2: add the chicken and toss to coat well.
step-3: cover with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes, up to 4 hours.
step-4: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-5: remove the chicken from the marinade and place in a large oven-safe pot over medium-high heat, being careful not to overcrowd the pot.
step-6: cook for 3 minutes, or until golden brown, then flip and repeat on the other side.
step-7: remove the chicken from the pot and set aside.
step-8: add the onion and bell peppers to the pot.
step-9: cook for 2-3 minutes, or until starting to soften.
step-10: add the rice and chicken stock.
step-11: season with the remaining teaspoon of cumin, the pepper, and remaining 2 teaspoons of salt.
step-12: bring to a boil, then return the chicken thighs to the pot.
step-13: cover with a lid and transfer to the oven until the rice is tender, about 45 minutes.
step-14: garnish with a squeeze of lime juice and cilantro.

step-1: preheat the oven to 200°c (400°f) (gas mark 6).
step-2: dust a clean work surface with a sprinkling of flour, and roll half of the puff pastry into a large circle.
step-3: place the largest plate you have (a pizza tray also works) on top of the pastry and tear around the edges to create a clean circle.
step-4: repeat with the other half of the pastry.
step-5: fry the onions and mixed peppers until the onions are translucent.
step-6: add the pre-cooked shredded chicken (to make shredded chicken, simply season and bake some chicken breasts, put it into a bowl and tear it up with 2 forks).
step-7: stir in the fajita spice mix and allow to cool while you do the next step.
step-8: transfer one of the sheets to a baking tray, and spread the chicken fajita mix in an even layer, leaving about 1cm (0.5") free from the edge.
step-9: sprinkle a layer of cheese.
step-10: cover with the second layer of puff pastry.
step-11: place an egg cup (or a shot glass) in the center of the pastry and make 8-10 even cuts all the way around the pastry.
step-12: brush the beaten egg over the puff pastry.
step-13: twist each segment twice to make it resemble a sun-like shape.
step-14: bake for 18-22 minutes in the center of the oven, until deep golden brown and no grey patches remain on the pastry.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: slice into the chicken several times, about ½ cm (¼ inch) apart, but only cut about 85% of the way through, leaving the bottom intact.
step-3: cook the onions and peppers over a medium heat until softened, then stir in the fajita mix.
step-4: stir in the salsa and sprinkle the cheese over.
step-5: mix together until the cheese has melted.
step-6: allow to cool to the touch, and then fill each segment of the chicken breast with about 1 teaspoon of the mixture.
step-7: bake in the centre of the oven for 18-22 minutes until the chicken is cooked through and the juices run clear.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: fold the parchment paper in half, then open up.
step-3: thinly slice the peppers and onion and lay them on one half of the parchment paper.
step-4: drizzle on oil and sprinkle on salt & pepper.
step-5: lay the chicken on the peppers.
step-6: season with taco seasoning, salt and pepper, and spoon on salsa.
step-7: top with cheese.
step-8: fold the parchment paper over the chicken, and cinch the paper together by folding it over itself along the edges.
step-9: bake for 25-30 minutes or until internal temperature of chicken reaches 165˚f (75˚c).

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: in a nonstick baking dish, add the bell peppers, mushrooms, and onion.
step-3: in a small bowl, combine the chili powder, paprika, garlic powder, cumin, salt, and pepper.
step-4: pour the olive oil and half of the spice mix over the vegetables and toss well to coat.
step-5: bake the vegetables for about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until tender.
step-6: in a large pot of boiling water, cook the pasta according to the package instructions, until tender.
step-7: drain the pasta, reserving about 1 cup (240 ml) of cooking water.
step-8: return the drained pasta to the pot and add the roasted vegetables.
step-9: add the rest of the spice mix, the reserved pasta water, and the sour cream and mix to combine.
step-10: transfer the pasta mixture to the baking dish used for roasting the vegetables and spread evenly.
step-11: sprinkle the cheese over the top.
step-12: bake for about 15 minutes, until the cheese is golden brown.
step-13: let cool for about 5 minutes, then serve.
step-14: garnish with parsley, if desired.

step-1: fry the onion and chicken in a little oil until the onions are translucent and the chicken is cooked through.
step-2: add the fajita spice mix, salsa, cheese, and lime juice.
step-3: cook and stir until the cheese has melted and everything is combined.
step-4: slice the peppers into thick rings, remove all seeds, and place onto a tray lined with baking paper.
step-5: spoon the mixture into each pepper ring and freeze until set, approx 1-2 hours.
step-6: preheat the oven to 200°c (400°f).
step-7: dip the frozen pepper rings (which should now hold their shape) into the eggs and then the crushed taco shells.
step-8: place back on the baking tray and cook for 20-25 minutes, turning occasionally until browned and crispy.
step-9: serve with a selection of dips such as soured cream and chive, guacamole, and salsa.

step-1: combine chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, paprika, onion powder, oregano, salt, and pepper in a small bowl.
step-2: pour into a small glass container and secure with an airtight lid.
step-3: store up to 1 year.

step-1: heat the canola oil (for the veggies) in a pan over high heat.
step-2: cook the peppers, onion, salt, and pepper until soft and slightly caramelized.
step-3: transfer the cooked veggies to a bowl.
step-4: in the same bowl, mix in the cream cheese, cheddar, and pepper jack, stirring until evenly incorporated.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: in a separate bowl, combine the chicken with the salt, chili powder, cumin, and garlic powder, evenly distributing the spices over the chicken.
step-7: on a cutting board, slice a pocket in the chicken horizontally.
step-8: fill the pocket with a heaping spoonful of the veggie mixture.
step-9: press the edges of the chicken together to seal in the filling.
step-10: repeat with the remaining chicken.
step-11: heat the canola oil in a pan over medium heat.
step-12: cook the stuffed chicken for five minutes on each side, until cheese is melted and chicken is cooked through.
step-13: serve with salsa, sour cream, and guacamole!

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: add chickpeas, red onion, parsley, flour, garlic, lemon juice, cumin, coriander, salt and pepper to food processor and blend until smooth.
step-3: grease a 18x13-inch (46x33-cm) baking sheet with olive oil.
step-4: use a spatula to transfer falafel mixture to the pan.
step-5: using spatula and your hands, form the falafel mixture into a rectangle that is roughly the size of the slider buns.
step-6: bake falafel for 20-25 minutes or until crispy, flipping halfway through.
step-7: for the avocado hummus, add avocados, chickpeas, garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, salt and pepper to food processor and blend until chunky.
step-8: for the tahini sauce, whisk together tahini, water, garlic, lemon juice, salt and pepper in small mixing bowl.
step-9: keeping slider buns attached, cut them in half lengthwise with a serrated knife.
step-10: remove top half and set aside.
step-11: when falafel is done baking, remove from oven and place on top of bottom half of slider buns.
step-12: top falafel with one layer of avocado hummus, followed by one layer of tomatoes.
step-13: drizzle with tahini sauce.
step-14: cover with top half of slider buns and cut into 12 sliders.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425ºf (220ºc).
step-2: make the pesto: add the basil, pine nuts, garlic, olive oil, kale, parmesan, salt, and pepper to a blender, and blend until smooth.
step-3: add the butternut squash and beets to ¼ of a baking sheet.
step-4: drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
step-5: toss to coat.
step-6: add the tofu to another ¼ of the baking sheet and brush with pesto.
step-7: bake for 10 minutes, then remove from the oven.
step-8: flip the tofu, then add the cauliflower and broccoli to another ¼ of the baking sheet.
step-9: drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
step-10: toss to coat.
step-11: bake for 10 minutes, then remove from the oven.
step-12: add the kale to the remaining ¼ of the baking sheet.
step-13: drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
step-14: bake for 10 minutes, until the kale is crispy and all of the vegetables are tender.
step-15: add the quinoa to a bowl.
step-16: top with the tofu and vegetables and drizzle with pesto.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c)
step-2: in a large bowl, combine the warm water and salt.
step-3: stir until the salt is dissolved.
step-4: slowly add the arepa flour while stirring.
step-5: adjust the consistency as needed by adding more water or flour.
step-6: the dough is ready when it pulls away from the sides of the bowl and doesn’t stick to your fingers.
step-7: grab a fist-sized ball of the dough and pass it from one hand to the other to pat into an even, flattened round.
step-8: pay attention to the edges so as to not leave cracks.
step-9: heat the oil in a large cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat.
step-10: cook the arepas, flipping once, until golden brown in color, 5-7 minutes on each side
step-11: transfer the arepas to the oven and cook for 15 minutes.
step-12: make the chicken avocado salad: in a medium bowl, combine the shredded rotisserie chicken, avocados, lime juice, onion, bell pepper, garlic, mayonnaise, cilantro, salt, and pepper.
step-13: mix well to combine.
step-14: cut the arepas in half and stuff with the chicken avocado salad or your favorite fillings.

step-1: place the dried mushrooms in a medium bowl and pour in enough water to cover.
step-2: let soak for 20-30 minutes, or until the mushrooms are soft and plumped.
step-3: working over the bowl, squeeze any excess water from the mushrooms.
step-4: reserve the soaking liquid, and chop the mushrooms into bite-size pieces.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: trim and peel the beets, then grate on the large holes of a box grater.
step-7: you should have about 8 cups grated beets.
step-8: set aside.
step-9: make a bouquet garni: place the peppercorns, allspice, garlic, and bay leaves on a double-layer square of cheesecloth.
step-10: tie the ends of the cheesecloth around the spices and set aside.
step-11: in a large pot, heat the canola oil over medium heat.
step-12: add the leeks, onion, and celery.
step-13: season with salt and cook until the vegetables have softened, 5-8 minutes.
step-14: add the water, grated beets, chopped mushrooms and reserved soaking liquid, and the bouquet garni.
step-15: bring to a boil then lower the heat and simmer for 20-30 minutes, or until the beets are tender.
step-16: add the potato and season with a pinch of salt.
step-17: cook until potatoes are tender, 10-15 minutes, then add the carrots and cook until tender, 10 minutes more.
step-18: add the tomatoes, tomato sauce, and pickled beets.
step-19: cook for another 10 minutes, or until all of the vegetables are tender.
step-20: stir in the dill, then remove the pot from the heat.
step-21: ladle the borscht into bowls.
step-22: garnish with dill and serve with rye bread and sour cream, if using.

step-1: cut the cod fillet into 6-7 big finger shapes.
step-2: mix the parmesan with the panko breadcrumbs.
step-3: coat the fish fingers with flour, then egg, then breadcrumbs.
step-4: deep fry the fish fingers in 170˚c (325˚f) hot oil for about 2-3 minutes or until they turn golden brown and are cooked through.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: mix all the sauce ingredients well, set aside.
step-7: spread a thick layer of the tartar sauce onto a soft and fluffy slice of bread.
step-8: place some rocket leaves, romaine lettuce, and three chunky fish fingers, then flavour with a squeeze of lemon, salt, and pepper.
step-9: finish with a drizzle of ketchup and more tartar.
step-10: top with another slice of bread and serve.

step-1: peel the avocado, then slice very thinly crosswise.
step-2: starting from one end, fan out the sliced avocado in straight line, then curl into a ring shape.
step-3: spread the mayonnaise over the slice of toast.
step-4: top with the radish slices.
step-5: carefully transfer the avocado ring to the toast and decorate with edible flowers

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine the farro, lentils, tomatoes, cucumber, yellow pepper, red pepper, and parsley.
step-2: in a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, combine the olive oil, red wine vinegar, lemon juice, dijon mustard, garlic, italian seasoning, salt, and pepper, and whisk until well-combined.
step-3: pour the vinaigrette over the farro salad and toss until well-combined.
step-4: distribute the farro salad into airtight containers with the arugula, if using.
step-5: refrigerate for up to 5 days.

step-1: rinse the farro and add it to a medium saucepan.
step-2: add water until the farro is covered.
step-3: bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
step-4: once boiling, reduce the heat to medium, cover, and cook for 25 minutes, until the farro is tender
step-5: while the farro cooks, seed and chop the cucumber.
step-6: add it to a large bowl and sprinkle with salt.
step-7: let sit for 15-20 minutes.
step-8: rinse the cucumbers in cold water and drain well.
step-9: dice the tomatoes.
step-10: make the dressing: add the yogurt, lemon juice, oil, pepper, parsley, and dill to a large bowl and stir to combine.
step-11: add the farro, cucumbers, tomatoes, and scallions to the bowl with the dressing and toss to coat.
step-12: sprinkle with parsley.

step-1: add mint leaves and lime to a tall glass.
step-2: using a muddler or a spoon, mash the lime and mint well.
step-3: add sweetener, ice, and soda water.
step-4: stir to combine.
step-5: garnish with lime and mint.

step-1: to a pot with 2 cups (480 ml) of boiling water add the ramen seasoning packet and a tablespoon of butter.
step-2: stir until the butter melts and then add the ramen noodle cube and cook until the noodles become tender, 2 minutes.
step-3: pour the ramen into a bowl.
step-4: to the prepared ramen, add the soy sauce and stir to incorporate.
step-5: top with the nori, egg, bacon, scallions, and season with salt and pepper.
step-6: sprinkle with sesame seeds, if using.

step-1: blend up the malted milk biscuits and put them into a big mixing bowl.
step-2: fold in the rice cereal and the nutella.
step-3: take a big pinch of the mixture and roll into balls using your hands.
step-4: place the shaped mixture onto some baking paper and chill for 1 hour.
step-5: break up the chocolate and microwave it for 30 seconds, then stir.
step-6: microwave for another 30 seconds stirring again, add the butter and stir until you have a smooth mixture.
step-7: dip the nutella balls into the chocolate coating them generously and place back onto the baking paper.
step-8: chill for a further 30 minutes to 1 hour.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: place the acorn squash stem-side up on a cutting board and cut in half.
step-3: scoop out the seeds and pulp, and transfer to a bowl.
step-4: separate the seeds from the pulp.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: set the squash halves cut-side up on a baking sheet.
step-7: brush with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
step-8: bake for 40 minutes, or until almost cooked through.
step-9: in a small pot, combine the wild rice and 1¼ cups (300 ml) vegetable broth, and bring to a boil.
step-10: once boiling, cover and reduce the heat to low.
step-11: simmer for 45 minutes, or until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender.
step-12: rinse the squash seeds and dry on a dish towel (some residual moisture is okay).
step-13: transfer to a small bowl and add the chili powder, cumin, salt, and maple syrup.
step-14: mix until well-coated.
step-15: remove the squash from the oven and move to one side of the baking sheet.
step-16: using parchment paper, make a tray for the squash seeds.
step-17: spread the squash seeds on the tray.
step-18: bake for 15 minutes, stirring halfway through, until the squash is completely tender and the seeds are crispy.
step-19: heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
step-20: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the mushrooms and cook for 6-8 minutes, until they’ve released a good amount of liquid.
step-21: add the onion and cook for 3-4 minutes, until semi-translucent.
step-22: add a drizzle of olive oil and the garlic, rosemary, and thyme, and cook for 3-4 minutes, until fragrant.
step-23: deglaze the pan with the white wine and cook until most of the liquid has evaporated.
step-24: add the kale, salt, and pepper, and cook until the kale wilts and reduces in volume by about ¼.
step-25: add the remaining 2 tablespoons of vegetable broth and cook until kale is almost completely wilted and most of the liquid has evaporated.
step-26: stir in the wild rice and remove from the heat.
step-27: fill each squash half with the mushroom mixture and garnish with the squash seeds and pomegranate seeds.
step-28: (save leftover squash seeds for snacking!)

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: cut butternut squash in half lengthwise and scoop out seeds.
step-3: drizzle halves with 1-2 tablespoons olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper, to taste.
step-4: bake squash for 45-50 minutes until soft enough to scoop, but not completely cooked.
step-5: set aside to let cool.
step-6: in pot or sauté pan over medium heat, add one tablespoon olive oil.
step-7: then add onion and sauté until translucent.
step-8: add garlic and cook for 3 more minutes.
step-9: add chickpeas, thyme, sage, salt, and pepper.
step-10: then sauté until chickpeas are golden and spices are fragrant.
step-11: add quinoa to pan, stirring constantly, toast quinoa for 2-3 minutes.
step-12: add vegetable broth and bring to a boil.
step-13: then cover and reduce heat to a simmer.
step-14: let simmer for 15-20 minutes.
step-15: after 15-20 minutes, uncover and stir in kale.
step-16: then cover and let simmer for five more minutes or until kale is wilted.
step-17: stir in pumpkin seeds and dried cranberries and sauté for 3-5 more minutes.
step-18: remove pan from heat and set aside.
step-19: scoop out insides of squash leaving a 1-inch (2 cm) border around the edge.
step-20: then scoop quinoa mixture into squash halves until full.
step-21: carefully flip one squash half on top of the other.
step-22: using 5 pieces of cooking twine, carefully tie the two squash halves together into 6 equally spaced sections.
step-23: return stuffed squash to oven for 5-10 more minutes.
step-24: remove from oven and let rest 10 minutes.
step-25: to serve, cut thick slices using twine to hold squash halves together.

step-1: add all the burger ingredients, except for the feta, to a blender and blend until smooth.
step-2: (make sure your chickpeas are very dry first!)
step-3: divide mixture into four balls, then make an indent in the middle.
step-4: place a small block of feta in each indent and roll up again until the feta is completely covered.
step-5: fry in sunflower oil for 5 minutes until brown on each side.
step-6: add to a burger bun with lettuce, tomato, salsa, and coriander.

step-1: preheat oven to heat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, add the flour, sugar, salt, and mix together with a wooden spoon, until fully incorporated.
step-3: add the softened butter and continue to mix until the mixture looks crumbly and slightly wet, about 1 minute longer.
step-4: add vanilla and cream cheese and mix until dough just begins to form large clumps, about 30 seconds.
step-5: transfer the dough to the table and knead dough by hand until it becomes a cohesive ball.
step-6: wrap in plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-7: roll out the dough to ¼-inch (6 mm) thickness.
step-8: cut into the desired shape using cookie a cutter or a clean fidget spinner for the spinning part, and a water bottle cap to cut to make 2 center circles for each cookie.
step-9: take the extra dough and roll out again to ½-inch (1 cm) thickness.
step-10: with a straw, poke out small pegs that will act as dowels for the fidget spinner cookies.
step-11: with the same straw poke holes in the fidget spinner cookie centers and move it around in a circle widening the hole to be larger than the diameter of the pegs that were just punched out.
step-12: place all the shapes on parchment-lined baking sheet
step-13: bake until light golden brown, about 15 minutes, rotating baking sheet halfway through.
step-14: remove pegs after 7 minutes.
step-15: cool the cookies completely.
step-16: then decorate as you like with your favorite frosting or decorations.
step-17: use frosting, caramel, or royal icing as glue to attach a peg to the backside of one of the small circles, place the fidget spinner cookie base over the peg and attach the second circle cookie with more frosting.
step-18: let all the frosting dry before attempting to spin.

step-1: gently heat the milk in a saucepan over a medium heat.
step-2: stir in the dark chocolate, chili flakes, and brown sugar.
step-3: take off the heat and pour into a tall glass.
step-4: garnish with whipped cream, chilli flakes, and grated chocolate.

step-1: on a cutting board, pat the filet mignon dry with paper towels and let sit at room temperature for 20-30 minutes.
step-2: preheat the oven to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-3: generously season all sides of the filet mignon with salt and pepper.
step-4: heat a medium, oven-safe stainless steel or cast iron skillet over high heat for 5 minutes.
step-5: add the grapeseed oil.
step-6: once the oil beings to smoke, add the filet mignon to the pan.
step-7: cook without moving for 2-3 minutes, until a crust has formed.
step-8: use tongs to flip the steak over, then add the butter, rosemary, and garlic to the pan.
step-9: tilt the pan and spoon the butter continuously over the steak for 2-3 minutes.
step-10: transfer the pan to the oven for 7 minutes for a medium rare steak.
step-11: transfer the steak to a cutting board and let rest for at least 10 minutes before slicing.

step-1: combine the chicken with the other ingredients.
step-2: marinate for 2-10 hours.
step-3: fry all sides of the chicken drumsticks in a frying pan over a medium heat until the skin turns golden brown.
step-4: pour the marinade in the pan, put the lid on and simmer for 20 minutes.
step-5: turn the chicken and simmer with the lid off for another 20 minutes.
step-6: serve.

step-1: while the tortes are chilling, get started on the sandwiches.
step-2: assemble each sandwich and cut off the crusts.
step-3: lay out on a plate and leave to chill in the fridge.

step-1: in a large glass bowl, melt the marshmallows and butter in the microwave for 3 minutes.
step-2: stir to fully incorporate.
step-3: mix in the puffed rice cereal and stir until evenly coated.
step-4: add the fizzy rock candy and stir until well combined.
step-5: be sure to add the candy no sooner than this stage, for it may lose its “pop” if mixed with the hot marshmallow mixture.
step-6: spread the mixture in a 9x9-inch (23x23-cm) pan lined with parchment paper and press down to create an even layer.
step-7: top with fizzy rock candy.
step-8: dip 9 straws sticks in a bit of melted white chocolate and place them in 3 even rows across the baking tin.
step-9: let the white chocolate harden at room temperature for 30 minutes or in the refrigerator for 10 minutes.
step-10: remove the parchment paper and cut into 9 equal squares.
step-11: dip the treats into melted milk chocolate going half way up, and decorate with sprinkles and more rock candy.
step-12: place the completed pops on a parchment paper-lined sheet tray and let sit for about an hour until the chocolate is set.

step-1: add the potatoes to a bowl of cold water to remove excess starch and prevent discoloration.
step-2: pour oil to a depth of 6 inches (15 cm) in a large heavy pot.
step-3: heat over medium-high heat until oil reaches 325˚f (160˚c).
step-4: drain the potatoes and blot dry thoroughly with paper towels.
step-5: working in batches, fry the potatoes in the hot oil for about 5 minutes, or until pale golden.
step-6: with a slotted spoon or spider, transfer to a wire rack to drain.
step-7: season with salt.
step-8: increase the heat to high.
step-9: when the oil temperature reaches 375˚f (190˚c), return the fries to the pot and fry until golden brown.
step-10: transfer to the rack to drain again and season with more salt.
step-11: reduce the heat to medium-high to let the oil temperature reduce to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-12: pat the cod fillets dry with a paper towel.
step-13: season all over with salt and pepper.
step-14: add 1 cup (125 g) of flour to a plate.
step-15: dredge the cod in the flour, shaking off any excess.
step-16: in a large bowl, whisk to combine the remaining 1½ cups (185 g) of flour, 1 teaspoon salt, and baking powder.
step-17: gradually add the beer, whisking until smooth.
step-18: dip the dredged cod in the batter, turning to coat completely.
step-19: fry the cod in the hot oil until golden brown on all sides, 3-5 minutes.
step-20: transfer to a wire rack to drain for 3 minutes.
step-21: season with salt.
step-22: garnish the fish and chips with parsley and serve with lemon wedges, tartar sauce, ketchup, and malt vinegar.

step-1: preheat the oven to 200˚c (400˚f)
step-2: add all the rice ingredients in a small saucepan.
step-3: bring to a boil, then turn down to a very low simmer before covering with a tight-fitting lid.
step-4: cook for 15 minutes.
step-5: while the rice is simmering, prepare the fish.
step-6: take 2 large sheets of baking paper, about 20-30 cm (8-12 inches).
step-7: fold in half and cut out a heart shape.
step-8: place a piece of fish on the 1 side of the heart, top with half of the coriander stalks and half of the red onions.
step-9: fold the paper in half and double fold all round to seal in the fish, a bit like a pasty.
step-10: place on a baking tray and bake in the oven for 8 minutes.
step-11: once the fish is in the oven remove the rice from the heat and set aside for 5 minutes more.
step-12: this will further steam the rice, making it soft and sticky.
step-13: meanwhile prepare the dressing.
step-14: combine all the ingredients for the dressing, mix well.
step-15: serve with salads or seasonal vegetables.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: cut white fish fillets into 3x4-inch (8x10 cm) long strips.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: in a small bowl, combine bread crumbs, parsley, and lemon zest.
step-5: place the flour and eggs in two separate bowls.
step-6: coat each fish strip with the flour, then eggs, and then bread crumbs.
step-7: transfer strips to a baking sheet.
step-8: bake for 15 minutes, flipping halfway and until golden brown.
step-9: combine the avocados, yogurt, lime juice, olive oil, cilantro, salt, and pepper in a food processor and blend until smooth.
step-10: serve baked fish fingers with avocado dip.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a large pot or dutch oven, cook macaroni according to package directions, salting the water with 2 teaspoons of salt.
step-3: drain and return to the warm pot.
step-4: add butter to warm macaroni and mix until melted.
step-5: season with the remaining salt and pepper.
step-6: add half of the cheddar cheese, mozzarella, provolone, gouda, and feta cheese.
step-7: mix well.
step-8: add eggs and evaporated milk, mix until fully incorporated.
step-9: transfer to a 9x13-inch (23 x 33 cm) baking dish and top with the remaining cheddar cheese.
step-10: bake in a preheated oven for 40-45 minutes, until the top has nicely browned.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
step-4: using your hands or a pastry cutter, incorporate the butter into the dry ingredients, leaving large chunks.
step-5: fold in the buttermilk until a thick dough forms.
step-6: lightly flour a clean surface and dump the dough onto it.
step-7: bring the dough together until it comes together in one large piece.
step-8: roll out with a rolling pin to about 1 ½-2 inches (4-5 cm) thick.
step-9: using a biscuit cutter or small glass, cut out 2-3-inch (5-7 cm) rounds and place them on the prepared baking sheet.
step-10: it’s okay if the biscuits are touching.
step-11: bake for 18-20 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-12: brush the biscuits with melted butter.
step-13: serve as desired.

step-1: preheat oven to 480°f/250˚c.
step-2: fry the bacon and the onions in a pan.
step-3: mix fried onions, bacon, and sour cream in a bowl and season with pepper.
step-4: cut off the top of the bread and remove the inside with a spoon.
step-5: fill the bread with the sour cream mixture and cover with gruyère cheese.
step-6: spread butter on the leftover bread, cut into thick chunks, and place on a baking tray together with the bread bowl.
step-7: bake for 15 minutes or until the bread is crispy and the cheese golden brown.

step-1: preheat oven to 275°f (135°c) and grease a 9-inch (23 cm) springform pan.
step-2: in a large mixing bowl, add the chocolate and butter.
step-3: melt in the microwave at 15-second intervals.
step-4: stir often and make sure the chocolate doesn't burn, then set aside to cool for a few minutes
step-5: add the egg yolks and the orange zest to the chocolate mixture and stir to combine.
step-6: in a separate mixing bowl, beat the egg whites on high speed with an electric mixer until very white and foamy.
step-7: gradually add the sugar.
step-8: continue beating on high speed until soft peaks form.
step-9: gently fold ¼ of the egg white mixture to the chocolate mixture.
step-10: gently fold in the remaining egg white mixture.
step-11: be careful not to deflate the eggs.
step-12: stir until fully combined.
step-13: some streaks are fine.
step-14: pour into prepared pan.
step-15: bake in the oven for 45-50 minutes or until the sides of the cake gently pull away from the pan.
step-16: for the orange whipped cream, beat together heavy cream, orange extract, and sugar.
step-17: top with whipped cream and garnish with orange zest.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: grease a 12-cup muffin tin with cooking spray.
step-3: in a large bowl, thoroughly beat the eggs, then mix in the applesauce, greek yogurt, milk, maple syrup, and vanilla until evenly combined.
step-4: add 3 cups (240 g) of muesli, the baking powder, and salt.
step-5: mix well.
step-6: divide the batter between the muffin cups.
step-7: sprinkle the remaining 2 tablespoons of muesli over the tops of the muffins.
step-8: bake for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-9: let cool, then serve or store in the fridge for up to a week.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, combine cake mix, brownie mix, eggs, water, and vegetable oil, and whisk until batter is thick and smooth.
step-3: line an 8x7-inch (20x17-cm) terra-cotta pot with foil, ensuring the sides are smooth as possible.
step-4: pour batter inside, leave 3 inches of space between the batter and the top of the pot.
step-5: line a cupcake pan with green cupcake liners and fill each with about ¼ cup (32 g) of batter.
step-6: put the terra-cotta pot and cupcake pan in the oven at the same time.
step-7: place a small pan or oven safe dish under the terra-cotta pot to catch any possible overflow of batter.
step-8: bake cupcakes for 15 minutes.
step-9: bake cake for 45-60 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean.
step-10: in a medium bowl, combine 2 cups (455 g) buttercream frosting, 30 drops yellow food coloring, 10 drops red food coloring, and 4 drops brown food coloring to create a terra-cotta orange color.
step-11: in a separate bowl, combine 2 cups (455 g) of buttercream frosting and 1 drop of red food coloring to create a pale pink color.
step-12: use the foil to lift the cake out of the terracotta pot, and carefully peel off the foil.
step-13: use an angled icing spatula to evenly ice the sides of the cake with the terra-cotta orange frosting.
step-14: use the spatula or icing scraper to remove excess icing and create a smooth finish.
step-15: add an inch (2cm) more of frosting to top rim of the cake, about 1-inch (2 cm) in thickness.
step-16: use the spatula or icing scraper to smooth the sides to create the rim of the pot.
step-17: place a 2d piping tip inside a piping bag and fill it with the pale pink frosting.
step-18: twist the end of the piping bag and gently apply even pressure as you make a spiral design from the center out on each cupcake to create a rose.
step-19: place two toothpicks in the center of the cake and use them to attach a cupcake to the center.
step-20: repeat around the rim of the cake with 4 more cupcakes spaced about 2 inches (5 cm) apart.
step-21: fold extra green cupcake liners into quarters and place one between each cupcake.

step-1: in a medium bowl, add the vinegar, sugar, and salt to the cooked rice, and stir to combine.
step-2: transfer half of the rice to another medium bowl.
step-3: to one bowl, add the sesame seeds and stir to combine.
step-4: to the other bowl of rice, add the spicy cod roe, and stir to combine.
step-5: cut one sheet of seaweed into six equal rectangles.
step-6: put one of the cut seaweed sheets on a bamboo mat (makisu).
step-7: add two teaspoons of the cod roe rice on the seaweed, and roll into a cylinder.
step-8: repeat to make five rolls total.
step-9: transfer the rolls to the bamboo mat, placing the cheese-stuffed fish cake in the center.
step-10: use the bamboo mat to roll the rolls into one cylinder.
step-11: place pieces of cucumber between the cod roe-filled rolls.
step-12: use the remaining cut seaweed sheet to wrap around the cylinders, bundling them together.
step-13: on the large sheet of seaweed, use a spoon to evenly spread the sesame rice.
step-14: add the bundled flower roll to the bottom edge of the rice-covered seaweed sheet, and gently roll up.
step-15: cut the sushi into four equal sections.

step-1: add the dark chocolate into the heated heavy cream.
step-2: mix both together until the chocolate fully melts forming a chocolate ganache.
step-3: pour the ganache into mason jar lid rings that are laying on a parchment paper-lined sheet tray.
step-4: freeze the chocolate ganache for at least 15 minutes to firm up.
step-5: in a large bowl, add the egg yolks, sugar, and melted butter, whisk until smooth.
step-6: add in the milk, whisk again.
step-7: then sift in the flour, baking powder and salt.
step-8: whisk the dry ingredients into the wet until as smooth as possible.
step-9: small lumps are perfectly fine.
step-10: beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form and then fold them into the pancake batter until just combined.
step-11: in a small skillet, melt butter until bubbling and then add your pancake batter.
step-12: take chocolate ganache disc straight from the freezer and place on top of the batter and press in down to the center.
step-13: put another layer of batter over the top
step-14: cover the skillet with a lid and let the pancakes cook on low heat for 20-30 minutes or until the top has full set.
step-15: then flip the pancake and cook the other side for 2 minutes on medium heat to color the other side.
step-16: serve with butter, maple syrup, powdered sugar, or berries (optional).

step-1: mix together the egg yolks, sugar, milk, and pancake mix in a very large bowl until it is smooth with no large lumps.
step-2: in another large bowl, beat the egg whites with a hand mixer until stiff peaks form when lifted.
step-3: carefully fold the egg whites into the pancake batter, until just incorporated, making sure not to deflate the batter.
step-4: grease two 3.5-inch (9 cm) metal ring moulds and set them in the middle of a pan over the lowest heat possible.
step-5: fill the moulds about ¾ of the way full with the batter, then cover the pan and cook for about 10 minutes, until the center of the pancakes are slightly jiggly.
step-6: release the pancakes from the bottom of the pan with a spatula, then carefully flip them over, making sure not to spill any batter inside.
step-7: cover and cook for another 5 minutes, then serve with butter, syrup, and berries!

step-1: preheat oven to 320°f (160°c).
step-2: in a small pot over medium heat, whisk the milk, cream cheese, and butter until smooth.
step-3: remove from heat and cool.
step-4: in a large bowl, whisk the egg yolks until smooth, then slowly drizzle in the cream mixture, stirring until evenly combined.
step-5: sift in the flour and the cornstarch, whisking to make sure there are no lumps.
step-6: in another large bowl, beat the egg whites with a hand mixer until you see soft peaks when lifting the mixer up from the egg whites.
step-7: gradually add the sugar while continuing to beat until you see hard peaks when lifting the mixer up.
step-8: take about ¼ of the egg whites and fold them into the egg yolk mixture, then repeat with the remaining egg whites until the batter is evenly combined.
step-9: place a 4-inch (10-cm) parchment paper strip around the edge of a 9x3-inch (23 cm) cake pan that is already lined with parchment at the bottom.
step-10: if you are using a springform pan, make sure to wrap the bottom and sides completely in foil, twice, to prevent any leakage.
step-11: pour the batter into the parchment-lined pan and shake to release any large air bubbles.
step-12: place the filled pan into a larger baking pan or dish lined with 2 paper towels at the bottom.
step-13: the paper towels ensure that the heat is distributed evenly along the bottom of the pan.
step-14: fill the larger pan about 1-inch (2-cm) with hot water.
step-15: bake for 25 minutes, then reduce the heat to 280°f (135°c), and bake for another 55 minutes, until the cake has risen to almost double its height.
step-16: remove from oven, and carefully, invert the cake onto your dominant hand and peel off the paper.
step-17: be extremely careful, the cake will be hot.
step-18: you can also invert the cake onto a plate, but this will cause the cake to deflate more.
step-19: sprinkle the top of the cake with powdered sugar, slice, and serve with strawberries while still warm!

step-1: whisk together the flour and baking powder in a large bowl.
step-2: in a separate bowl, add the butter, milk, and egg yolks, stirring to combine.
step-3: in a third bowl, use a hand mixer to beat the egg whites until soft peaks form.
step-4: pour the milk mixture into the flour mixture and stir with rubber spatula until just combined.
step-5: add the beaten egg whites and gently fold to combine.
step-6: heat an 8-inch (20cm) nonstick skillet over low heat.
step-7: pour 1 ½ cups of pancake batter into the skillet, smooth out the top, then cover with a lid.
step-8: cook until golden brown on the bottom and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 20 minutes.
step-9: transfer the pancake to a plate and repeat, making 5 more pancakes with the remaining batter.
step-10: serve with maple syrup.

step-1: preheat the oven according to packaging instructions.
step-2: pour the cake mix into a bowl and add water.
step-3: mix well.
step-4: divide the mixture equally into three bowls and add a different food coloring to each one, mixing well.
step-5: in a parchment paper-lined cake pan, add each of the colored batters.
step-6: bake according to packaging instructions.
step-7: let cool and invert the cake pan onto a plate, removing the parchment paper.
step-8: in a skillet over medium heat, add water, marshmallows, powdered sugar, butter, and blue food coloring.
step-9: stir, and cook until the marshmallows melt completely and the color is even.
step-10: pour the marshmallow mixture over the cake, top with multi-colored sparks, and refrigerate for a minimum of 2 hours.
step-11: cut and serve

step-1: combine water, olive oil, honey, salt, flour, and yeast in a large bowl.
step-2: mix well and knead for 10-15 minutes until the dough is elastic.
step-3: transfer the dough into a well-oiled bowl.
