step-4: cover with a towel or plastic wrap and let rise once for 1 hour in a warm place, until the dough has doubled.
step-5: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-6: remove the dough from the bowl and stretch the dough into 9-inch (23 cm) circle.
step-7: place the dough into well greased 10-inch (25 cm) cast iron pan.
step-8: cover with towel or plastic wrap and rest for 30 minutes.
step-9: poke the top with your fingertips.
step-10: drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with rosemary, salt, and pepper.
step-11: bake in the oven for 20-30 minutes.
step-12: slice and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f/200˚c.
step-2: place red onion, broccoli, yellow bell pepper, baby carrots, and cherry tomatoes evenly on a baking tray.
step-3: (try not to let the vegetables overlap too much so they roast properly.)
step-4: season with olive oil, salt, and pepper (to taste).
step-5: add sprigs of thyme and garlic clove halves on top of the vegetables.
step-6: tear off four pieces of aluminum foil, approximately 12 in x 12 in (30 x 30 cm).
step-7: lay down the foil and place the chicken breast in the center for each one.
step-8: season both sides of the chicken with olive oil, salt, pepper, and paprika (all to taste).
step-9: add sprigs of thyme and garlic clove on top of each chicken breast.
step-10: bring the top and bottom edge of the foil into the center and fold a couple of times.
step-11: fold in the left and right sides a couple of times to seal the foil pack.
step-12: place all 4 chicken foil packs on a baking tray.
step-13: bake for 30 minutes.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: add the egg whites and vanilla extract to a medium bowl and use a whisk or hand mixer to beat until frothy, about 1 minute.
step-3: sift in the flour, sugar, and salt through a fine-mesh sieve.
step-4: using a spatula, gently incorporate into the batter until paste-like.
step-5: add the water, 1 tablespoon at a time, until the batter is smooth and falls into ribbons when the spatula is picked up.
step-6: place 1 tablespoon of batter onto a silpat-lined baking sheet and spread into a 3-inch (7-cm) circle.
step-7: repeat with another tablespoon of batter, making sure to only leave two circles on the silpat.
step-8: bake for 8 minutes, until the edges become golden brown.
step-9: working quickly, use a spatula to remove the cookies from the pan.
step-10: add a fortune in the middle, fold the cookies in half, then place the flat side on the lip of a cup, folding the edges down into a fortune cookie shape.
step-11: place the folded fortune cookies in a mini muffin tin until cooled to retain their shape.
step-12: repeat with remaining batter.

step-1: cook 1 box of mac 'n' cheese according to instructions on box.
step-2: add monterey jack cheese, mozzarella cheese, cheddar cheese, parmesan cheese and pepper, stir until fully incorporated.
step-3: top with desired garnish.
step-4: serve immediately.

step-1: pour the flour into a large bowl and make a well in the centre, crack the eggs into the well and mix everything together with a spoon or fork.
step-2: when the mixture has combined, knead the dough for 5 minutes.
step-3: form it into a ball, wrap it in cling film and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
step-4: while the dough is in the fridge, mix together the ricotta, cream cheese, mozzarella, cheddar, parsley and a sprinkling of salt and pepper to make the filling.
step-5: set aside until needed.
step-6: on a floured surface, roll half of the dough out as thin as you can using a rolling pin to make a long rectangular shape (if you have a pasta machine, use the 2nd thinnest setting) - keep the other half of the dough in cling film in the fridge to keep it fresh until you’re ready for it.
step-7: on one side, dollop tablespoons of the cheese filling onto the pasta, leaving at least a 1-2cm (⅓-¾ inch) gap in all directions.
step-8: brush the pasta that’s surrounding the filling with water or egg white.
step-9: fold the other side of the past over and on top of the filling, pushing down around each part to seal it in, creating a long strip of ravioli pieces.
step-10: use a knife or pizza cutter to cut around and create individual pieces of ravioli.
step-11: dust these pieces with flour and repeat from step 4 using the other half of the dough.
step-12: boil the pasta in salted water on a medium heat for 2-3 minutes until the pasta floats to the top, then drain.
step-13: melt the butter in a frying pan then add the pine nuts, cook for 2 minutes then add the rosemary - cook for a further minute or two until the pine nuts look toasted and the rosemary has just begun to brown and crisp up a bit.

step-1: using a marker, draw a frankenstein face on a glass jar.
step-2: add all ingredients (except the berries) to a blender and blend until smooth.
step-3: pour mixture into the glass jar and top with berries.

step-1: in a deep skillet, melt the butter and cook celery, carrots, and onion until tender.
step-2: pour in the flour, and mix in well.
step-3: stirring constantly, add in the milk and chicken broth a little at a time, alternating between the two.
step-4: bring to a boil and continue stirring until thickened.
step-5: add chicken, peas, salt, and pepper, and stir until combined.
step-6: remove from heat and cool.
step-7: roll out pie crust and use the foil pot pie dish as a template.
step-8: cut a piece of dough for the bottom of the dish that is about an inch (²¹⁄₂ cm) thicker than the widest rim of the dish, and a piece that is the same size as the rim.
step-9: (roll dough back out and repeat to make more pieces.)
step-10: place the larger piece of crust in the bottom of the foil dish, fill with the cooled pot pie filling, and top with the smaller crust piece.
step-11: pinch together, then seal together with a fork.
step-12: cut 4 small slits in the middle of the crust.
step-13: cover each pot pie with foil and freeze for up to 2 months.
step-14: to bake from frozen, preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c), and bake for 30 minutes with the foil on top.
step-15: remove the foil and bake for another 30 minutes or until golden brown.

step-1: combine all marinade ingredients in a liquid measuring cup.
step-2: place two chicken breasts in a freezer storage ziplock bag.
step-3: pour the marinade over the chicken, seal the bag and massage the chicken to coat in the marinade.
step-4: marinate the chicken for 15-30 minutes if cooking immediately, or place in the freezer for up to 3 months.
step-5: to cook frozen chicken, take the bag out of the freezer and thaw the chicken by placing it in the refrigerator overnight or by placing the bag in a bowl of water.
step-6: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-7: once thawed, place chicken on a baking sheet and bake for 25-30 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 165°f (75°c)

step-1: in a medium pan, add oil and garlic and cook until garlic is lightly browned.
step-2: add tofu by pulling pieces off to produce the full “scramble” effect.
step-3: add the turmeric, paprika, red pepper flakes, and nutritional yeast and stir to combine.
step-4: add the vegetable stock and cook until absorbed in the tofu.
step-5: drizzle with hot sauce if you desire.
step-6: spoon some of the scramble in the center of a tortilla and add any fillings you would like.
step-7: note: leave plenty of room on the ends otherwise food will spill out once it's folded up.
step-8: fold the left and right sides of the tortilla in toward the center, then roll the bottom (the end nearest you) up towards the top.
step-9: dampen a paper towel and wrap it around the burrito, mimicking the fold of the burrito itself.
step-10: do the same with parchment paper.
step-11: place your burritos in a plastic bag and freeze until breakfast.
step-12: note: save for up to 1 month.
step-13: when you are ready to eat, take one of the burritos out, remove parchment paper and microwave burrito (still in paper towel) in the microwave for 3 minutes.
step-14: allow to cool for 1 minute.

step-1: mix lime juice, olive oil, garlic, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper in small bowl or measuring cup.
step-2: place the chicken breasts in a large, gallon-sized freezer bag and pour the marinade over them.
step-3: add red onion and bell peppers to freezer bag.
step-4: seal freezer bag and ensure excess air is squeezed out.
step-5: gently mix contents together so that the marinade fully coats the chicken.
step-6: place in freezer and store up to 3 months.
step-7: when ready to enjoy, thaw completely and pour contents into slow cooker.
step-8: cook on low for 6 hours, or high for 3 hours, or until chicken is fully cooked.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180˚c).
step-2: spray a large baking sheet with cooking spray.
step-3: stack and slice the texas toast into thirds.
step-4: in a large bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, butter, vanilla, cinnamon, salt, and sugar.
step-5: dunk each strip of bread into the mixture, allow the excess to drip off, then place on prepared baking sheet.
step-6: repeat with remaining strips.
step-7: bake for 15-20 minutes, flipping halfway.
step-8: remove from oven and serve.
step-9: note: to freeze, let the sticks cool slightly and transfer baking sheet to freezer.
step-10: once frozen, after 1-2 hours, transfer to a freezer bag for easy storage.
step-11: to reheat, preheat oven to 350°f (180˚c) and bake for 10-15 minutes until heated through.
step-12: or transfer frozen sticks to a plate and microwave 45-60 seconds.

step-1: mix tomato sauce, garlic, thyme, oregano, salt, and pepper in small bowl or measuring cup.
step-2: in a large, gallon-sized freezer bag, add in tomatoes, carrots, zucchini, yellow squash, celery, white onion, and beans of choice.
step-3: pour the tomato sauce mixture over beans and vegetables.
step-4: seal freezer bag and ensure excess air is squeezed out.
step-5: place in freezer and store up to 3 months.
step-6: when ready to enjoy, thaw completely and pour contents into slow cooker.
step-7: add water or veggie broth.
step-8: cook on low for 6 hours, or high for 3 hours, or until carrots are tender.

step-1: mix soy sauce, honey, garlic, ginger, and pepper in small bowl or measuring cup.
step-2: place the chicken in a large, gallon-sized freezer bag.
step-3: pour marinade over chicken.
step-4: add broccoli, cauliflower, carrots, and red bell pepper to freezer bag.
step-5: seal freezer bag and ensure excess air is squeezed out.
step-6: gently mix contents together so that the marinade fully coats the chicken.
step-7: place in freezer and store up to 3 months.
step-8: when ready to enjoy, thaw completely and pour contents into slow cooker.
step-9: cook on low for 6 hours, or high for 3 hours, or until chicken is fully cooked.

step-1: mix onion powder, garlic powder, salt, pepper, parsley, and water in small bowl or measuring cup.
step-2: place the potatoes in a large, gallon-sized freezer bag.
step-3: top with the carrots, onion, and pot roast.
step-4: pour marinade over all the contents of the bag.
step-5: seal freezer bag and ensure excess air is squeezed out.
step-6: gently mix contents together so that the marinade reaches the potatoes.
step-7: place in freezer and store up to 3 months.
step-8: when ready to enjoy, thaw completely and pour contents into slow cooker.
step-9: cook on low for 8 hours, or high for 4 hours, or until roast is cooked and tender.

step-1: in a large pot, heat cooking oil over medium-high heat.
step-2: add onion and cook until translucent.
step-3: add the garlic and cook for 1 minute, stirring occasionally.
step-4: transfer mixture to a slow cooker.
step-5: add black beans, kidney beans, chickpeas, corn, diced tomatoes, and tomato paste into the slow cooker.
step-6: season with chili powder, cumin, paprika, cayenne, coriander, salt, vegetable stock, honey, and lentils.
step-7: stir and slow cook on high for 4 hours, or on low for 6 hours or until lentils have softened.
step-8: enjoy right away or freeze up to 6 months in an airtight container.
step-9: defrost in the refrigerator and reheat when ready to eat.

step-1: heat a large skillet over medium heat with a drizzle of olive oil.
step-2: add the onion and cook for 3 minutes, or until translucent.
step-3: add the bell peppers and mushrooms and season with salt.
step-4: sauté for 1-2 minutes, then cover and cook for 5 minutes, until the peppers and mushrooms are softened.
step-5: add the kale and cook until wilted.
step-6: remove the veggies from the pan and set aside.
step-7: wipe out the pan.
step-8: in a bowl, combine the eggs, milk, salt, and pepper.
step-9: whisk to combine.
step-10: set aside.
step-11: heat another drizzle of olive oil in the clean pan.
step-12: add the eggs and cook until scrambled to your liking.
step-13: remove from the heat.
step-14: lay a tortilla on a clean work surface.
step-15: add about ⅛ of the eggs and cooked vegetables, 2 ounces of beans, and ½ tablespoon each of the cheddar and monterey jack cheeses to the center.
step-16: fold in the sides of the tortilla, then roll into a burrito.
step-17: repeat with the remaining ingredients.
step-18: heat a clean skillet over medium-high heat.
step-19: sear the burritos on both sides, starting with the seam side, until the tortilla is brown and crisp.
step-20: wrap the burritos individually in foil or reusable beeswax wraps.
step-21: they will keep in the freezer for up to 3 weeks.
step-22: when ready to eat, unwrap a burrito and microwave for 3 minutes.
step-23: serve with salsa.
step-24:
calories: 345
total fat: 12 grams
total carbs: 41 grams
dietary fiber: 10 grams
sugars: 4 grams
protein: 20 grams

step-1: excluding the milk, combine all ingredients for each smoothie in a resealable bag and freeze.
step-2: note: they can be kept in the freezer for up to 6 months!
step-3: remove from freezer and pour your desired smoothie combination into the blender along with the milk.
step-4: blend until smooth, and add more milk if needed.

step-1: beat the eggs with the salt until the whites and the yolks are completely combined, with no spots of egg white remaining.
step-2: over medium-low heat, melt the butter in a skillet, then pour in the eggs.
step-3: using a rubber spatula, constantly scrape the bottom of the pan while shaking the pan in a circular motion to ensure that the eggs cook slowly, forming only small curds, about 1-2 minutes.
step-4: once you start to see the bottom of the pan for more than a second after scraping, push the eggs into a round circular shape.
step-5: cook until the edges solidify, then tilt the pan and carefully roll the omelette on itself.
step-6: invert onto a plate, then sprinkle with chives.
step-7: serve immediately.

step-1: mix together the patty ingredients until evenly combined.
step-2: form the beef into a round patty.
step-3: repeat with the remaining beef.
step-4: heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
step-5: cook the burgers for 3 minutes on the first side, flip, and place the slice of comté on top.
step-6: cook for 6 more minutes.
step-7: assemble the burgers on the buns with caramelized onions and arugula.

step-1: preheat oven to 325˚f (160˚c).
step-2: in a large pot over medium-low heat, heat olive oil and add butter.
step-3: once the butter is melted, stir the onions and coat with oil and butter.
step-4: cover and cook for 20 minutes, checking occasionally.
step-5: turn up the heat to medium-high.
step-6: add ½ tsp salt and sugar.
step-7: stir and keep cooking until onions are brown and caramelized.
step-8: (the bottom of the pan will develop some browning, it’s very important!)
step-9: stir in flour one tablespoon at a time and cook for about 30 seconds.
step-10: add 1 cup (235 ml) of the beef broth.
step-11: use a whisk to scrape up (deglaze) the browned bits stuck on the bottom of the pan.
step-12: add the remaining five cups of beef stock, wine, sage and bay leaf.
step-13: bring to a boil.
step-14: reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for 40 minutes.
step-15: in the meantime, cut the french bread or baguette into ½ inch (10 mm) thick pieces.
step-16: brush with oil on both sides and bake at 325˚f (160˚c) for 30 minutes, flipping halfway.
step-17: once they are done, increase oven temperature to 350˚f (175˚c).
step-18: add optional ingredients.
step-19: in an oven safe bowl, pour the onion soup, filling about ¾ of the way full.
step-20: top with a piece of baked french bread, and generously sprinkle swiss and parmesan on top.
step-21: bake for two to three minutes or until the cheese has melted completely and become slightly golden.

step-1: liberally season steak with salt and coarsely ground black pepper, being sure to generously coat the entire surface of the meat.
step-2: using your hands, press the seasoning into the meat create an even coating.
step-3: heat vegetable oil and 1 tablespoon of butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat until just smoking.
step-4: add the steak to the pan and sear on one side for 4 minutes.
step-5: turn and sear the other side for another 4 minutes, for medium-rare.
step-6: if steak has a fat-cap, be sure to sear it as well for 30 seconds to a minute.
step-7: once cooked to desired doneness, transfer steak to a cutting board to rest.
step-8: reduce heat to medium and add brandy.
step-9: allow brandy to cook down for about 1 minute while using a whisk to scrape off any browned bits leftover in the bottom of the pan.
step-10: once brandy has reduced by half, add cream and continue to whisk until combined.
step-11: add dijon mustard and butter and continue to cook until mixture begins to reduce and thicken, about 5-7 minutes.
step-12: the final pan sauce should have a rich consistency and coat the back of a spoon.
step-13: reduce heat to low and reserve.
step-14: once rested, slice steak into ½-inch (1.5cm) pieces.
step-15: pour cream sauce over the top and serve.

step-1: using a 9-inch (23 cm) pan, cut a circle out from the puff pastry.
step-2: using a fork, poke holes all over to provide ventilation.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: peel and quarter the apples, removing the stems and cores.
step-5: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-6: in a large saucepan over medium heat, distribute the sugar evenly and cook until a light amber color, stirring to help melt any lumps.
step-7: add the butter, stirring constantly until the color is a creamy light brown.
step-8: add the apples, making sure the juices from the apples help dissolve any caramel that sticks to the apples.
step-9: cook for about 15-20 minutes, making sure the apples are turned constantly so that they bathe in the caramel.
step-10: remove from heat when the caramel has reduced to completely glaze the apples and little remains in the bottom of the pan.
step-11: be sure not to burn the caramel, tasting it from time to time to ensure it does not taste bitter.
step-12: arrange the apples in concentric circles on the bottom of the pan.
step-13: press the apples tightly against each other, then pour the glaze over the top.
step-14: lay the circle of puff pastry on top.
step-15: tuck the puff pastry down the sides of the pan.
step-16: bake for 45-50 minutes, until the pastry is golden brown and firm.
step-17: cool for about 1 hour, then invert onto a plate.
step-18: slice, then serve with vanilla ice cream.

step-1: pre-heat the oven to 180°c (350°f).
step-2: prepare the lemon curd by whisking the egg yolks, whole eggs, sugar, lemon juice and lemon zest over a bain marie (a large bowl placed over a pan of simmering hot water).
step-3: once combined, mix in the butter and whisk the mixture for about 10 minutes, until thick.
step-4: pour into a pre-baked tart shell.
step-5: bake for 6 minutes.
step-6: whilst the tart is baking, prepare the raspberry chantilly by whipping the raspberries, sugar, vanilla extract and cream together.
step-7: leave the tart to cool before dusting with icing sugar.
step-8: serve with the raspberry chantilly, fresh raspberries and mint for garnish.

step-1: pre-heat the oven to 190°c (375°f).
step-2: roll out the puff pastry sheet.
step-3: place a 25-centimetre (9-inch) cake tin on the sheet of puff pastry and cut around the edges.
step-4: poke holes in the pastry with a fork and set aside.
step-5: prepare the strawberries by hulling them with a straw.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: pour the sugar in a large saucepan and cook over a medium heat, until the sugar has melted and reached a light brown colour.
step-8: stir in the butter until melted.
step-9: add the strawberries, coating evenly in the caramel.
step-10: arrange the strawberries in the buttered tin, followed by the puff pastry on top.
step-11: tuck the pastry down the sides of the tin.
step-12: bake for 45 minutes, until the pastry is golden brown.
step-13: leave to cool for 1-2 hours, then invert onto a plate.
step-14: slice and serve with a spoonful of crème fraîche.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: cut the loaf of bread in half crosswise.
step-4: flip one of the halves cut side up, and cut out the middle of the loaf, leaving about a ¼-inch (6 mm) border around the edge.
step-5: from the outside of the loaf, about ½ -1 inch (1-2 cm) up from the bottom of one of the 4 sides, make a cut straight through to remove the center of the loaf.
step-6: cut the center of the loaf in half and slice into approximately 1x3-inch (2x7-cm) cm sticks .
step-7: repeat with the second half of the loaf.
step-8: in a large bowl, whisk the eggs with the cinnamon, cream, and honey.
step-9: place the hollowed-out loaf on the prepared baking sheet and brush all over with the egg mixture.
step-10: in a medium bowl, crush the cinnamon crunch cereal into coarse crumbs.
step-11: dip the sliced toast sticks in the egg mixture, then dredge in the crushed cereal.
step-12: add to the baking sheet in a single layer.
step-13: bake for 20 minutes, until golden brown.
step-14: to assemble, filling the toasted, hollowed loaves with french toast sticks and berries.
step-15: top with whipped cream and a drizzle of honey.

step-1: combine oil, garlic, and onion, salt, and pepper in a large pot over medium heat for 3 minutes.
step-2: add red pepper, potato, and corn.
step-3: stir for another 2 or 3 minutes.
step-4: add vegetable broth, water, thyme, paprika, and bay leaf.
step-5: stir.
step-6: bring to a boil, place the lid on the pot, and simmer for 10 minutes.
step-7: add milk or milk alternative, and stir.
step-8: remove bay leaf.
step-9: allow to cool a little before serving.

step-1: in a medium pot combine the rice, water, sugar and salt.
step-2: cook on low heat for about 20 minutes or until all the rice absorbs the water.
step-3: add the coconut milk and vanilla.
step-4: the mixture should be moldable.
step-5: cook a few minutes longer if it’s too runny.
step-6: slice fruit of choice into long pieces.
step-7: *note: use a potato peeler to shave thin slices off the mango.
step-8: lay a bamboo rolling pad on a counter top, and place a square of wax paper over top.
step-9: spread the rice about ½ inch (1 cm) thick over the paper into approximately a 7x5 inch (17x12 cm) rectangle.
step-10: toast a ¼ cup (25g) of coconut shreds for 3 minutes.
step-11: lay the fruit pieces on the rice, and roll up carefully.
step-12: if rice sticks to the paper too much, try spreading it a little thicker.
step-13: coat the rolls with either the mango slices, or the toasted coconut.
step-14: slice each roll into 6 pieces.
step-15: with the rest of the rice, roll into balls (like nigiri).
step-16: place thin slices of kiki or strawberries over top with half a blackberry on top to look like fish eggs.
step-17: blend ¼ cup (25 g) raspberries with ¼ cup (60 ml) water to make a dipping sauce.

step-1: add the cilantro, parsley, garlic, olive oil, lime juice, red pepper flakes, and salt to a mortar and pestle, and crush until a smooth paste forms.
step-2: add to your favorite proteins, vegetables, and more!

step-1: add all the ingredients to a blender and mix on high.
step-2: pour into a bowl or half a hollowed out cantaloupe, and top with desired fruit and other toppings.

step-1: on a clean, sturdy work surface, turn out your chosen flour(s) and salt and make a large well in the middle with your hands.
step-2: whisk the eggs, egg yolks, and olive oil together in a medium bowl until combined, then pour the mixture into the well.
step-3: using the same fork, whisk the eggs, slowly incorporating more and more flour into the eggs by moving your fork along the edges of the well.
step-4: once almost all of the flour is incorporated, start bringing the dough together with your hands.
step-5: (the dough should be malleable, but not sticky--add more flour if the dough is sticking too much to your hands or the surface.
step-6: alternatively, if it’s too dry and tough, whisk another egg with 1 tablespoon of water and use your hand to sprinkle some of the mixture over the dough, continuing to do so until the dough is easier to knead.)
step-7: knead the dough for 7-10 minutes, until the dough is smooth and elastic.
step-8: when you poke the dough, it should spring back.
step-9: wrap the dough in plastic wrap and let rest at room temperature for 30 minutes to an hour, or until the dough does not spring back when poked.
step-10: unwrap the dough and cut into 8 equal pieces so that it’s easier to work with.
step-11: take 1 piece and wrap the rest in the plastic wrap so that they don’t dry out.
step-12: lightly flour your work surface, and begin rolling out the piece of dough into one long piece.
step-13: then, fold the top third down, and the bottom third over that, like a letter.
step-14: rotate the dough 90˚ and roll the piece back into a long shape.
step-15: this helps form a more even rectangular shape and makes the dough a little bit easier to work with.
step-16: continue rolling out the dough until it is very thin.
step-17: when you lift the dough, you should be able to see your hands through it.
step-18: fold the top and bottom of the rectangle to meet in the middle, then fold over again--this will make the dough easier to cut.
step-19: cut the dough to your ideal shape.
step-20: loosen or unravel the cut dough immediately, so it doesn’t stick, sprinkle with a bit of extra flour, or semolina, if using.
step-21: let the pasta sit out for about 30 minutes to dry out slightly.
step-22: bring a large pot of heavily salted water to a boil.
step-23: add the pasta and stir to ensure it doesn’t clump.
step-24: cook for 2-3 minutes, or 30 seconds to 1 minute after the pasta comes to the surface (fresh pasta will cook much faster than dried pasta!)
step-25: take out a noodle and taste for doneness.
step-26: once cooked to your liking, remove the pasta from the water, being sure to save at least 1 cup (240 ml) of the pasta cooking water.
step-27: add the cooked pasta into your preferred sauce and stir to coat, adding some of the reserved pasta water if needed to add a bit of body and silkiness to the sauce.

step-1: mash the bananas in a bowl.
step-2: stir in all-purpose flour, rice flour, baking soda and salt until mixed.
step-3: mix in sugar.
step-4: heat up cooking oil for deep frying in a small pan.
step-5: once the oil is hot, scoop up a spoonful, roughly a tablespoon, of batter into the frying pan.
step-6: deep fry until golden brown.
step-7: place the fritters on a paper towel to remove excess oil.
step-8: serve the fritters with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
step-9: drizzle with chocolate syrup and sweetened condensed milk.

step-1: in a large bowl, use an electric mixer to combine the cream cheese, lemon juice, and vanilla extract
step-2: once smooth, use a spatula to scrape down the sides of the bowl, then add the sugar and heavy cream.
step-3: mix on high speed for about 2 minutes, or until the batter is thick and smooth.
step-4: pour batter into a 13x9-inch (33x23-cm) baking dish lined with parchment paper.
step-5: use a spatula to spread the batter evenly and make the top as level as possible.
step-6: freeze for four hours.
step-7: fill a gallon-size plastic bag with the graham crackers.
step-8: use a rolling pin or meat mallet to crush the graham crackers until they are super-fine crumbs.
step-9: pour the flour, eggs, and graham cracker crumbs into 3 separate medium bowls.
step-10: heat the oil in a large pot until it reaches 350°f (180°c).
step-11: remove the cheesecake batter from the freezer and use the parchment paper to lift it out of the pan.
step-12: cut the cheesecake into 12 4x3-inch (10x7-cm) bars
step-13: take a piece of cheesecake and toss it in the flour.
step-14: tap off any excess flour, dip the piece in the egg, and then toss it in the graham cracker crumbs.
step-15: dip it back in the egg again, then toss in the graham cracker crumbs once more.
step-16: repeat with the remaining cheesecake pieces.
step-17: fry the breaded cheesecake, 2 or 3 bars at a time, until golden brown, 30–60 seconds.
step-18: drain the cheesecake bars on a wire rack or paper towels.
step-19: serve with strawberry sauce, whipped cream, and powdered sugar.

step-1: first, salt and pepper the chicken breast, dredge in flour, then egg and coat in panko.
step-2: deep-fry until chicken is done, brown and crispy.
step-3: slice and set aside.
step-4: in a small pan over medium heat, add onions, stock, soy sauce, sake, mirin, and sugar.
step-5: bring to a boil.
step-6: add the sliced fried chicken, pour in the eggs around the chicken.
step-7: cover with a lid and cook until eggs are at your desired doneness.
step-8: slide the egg and chicken over cooked rice, garnish with chopped scallions and shredded nori.

step-1: in a medium saucepan over high heat, add 2 cups (470 ml) of water and the salt.
step-2: bring to a simmer, stirring to dissolve all the salt.
step-3: remove from heat and pour into a larger pot/container.
step-4: add the ice water into the pot to cool.
step-5: add the chicken, cover, and refrigerate for 1 ½ hours.
step-6: prepare the chicken shake.
step-7: in a small bowl, whisk together all the chicken shake ingredients.
step-8: note: makes about 1 cup (110g) that will keep for 6 months.
step-9: store in a jar out of the light.
step-10: in a 9x13-inch (23x33 cm) baking dish, add buttermilk, coconut milk, and garlic.
step-11: add 1 tablespoon of chicken shake and whisk together.
step-12: remove the chicken from the saltwater, dab on paper towels to remove excess liquid, then add into the buttermilk marinade.
step-13: roll to coat each piece.
step-14: cover and refrigerate overnight.
step-15: fill a large cast iron pan ⅔-full with peanut oil over medium-high heat.
step-16: heat to 360˚f (182˚c).
step-17: while the oil is heating, coat the marinated chicken.
step-18: in a large bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, semolina flour, cornstarch, and white pepper.
step-19: remove the chicken from the marinade, allowing any excess to drip off, then roll in the flour mixture, packing it on so the chicken is completely coated.
step-20: set coated chicken on a wire rack over a baking sheet.
step-21: if the coating looks damp, roll it in the flour mixture again.
step-22: working in batches, fry the chicken until it is brown and golden on both sides and reaches an internal temperature of 165˚f (73˚c), about 10 minutes per batch.
step-23: note: adjust heat to keep the oil between 350-375˚f (180-190˚c).
step-24: drain on a rack set over a baking sheet.
step-25: rest 8-10 minutes.
step-26: fry the chicken a second time, only for about 3 minutes, to really crisp up the skin.
step-27: drain on a rack.
step-28: sprinkle with additional chicken shake.

step-1: add the butter to a pot over medium heat.
step-2: once the butter has melted, ddd the chicken and cook until no longer pink and cooked through, about 6-7 minutes.
step-3: add the sliced onion and cook until translucent and soft, about 4-5 minutes.
step-4: add diced carrots and peas and cook for 1-2 minutes.
step-5: sprinkle flour into the mixture.
step-6: stir until well blended, then season with salt and pepper.
step-7: add the milk and stir constantly until the mixture is thickened.
step-8: transfer the mixture into a shallow heat proof container.
step-9: cool until room temperature, then chill in the fridge for at least 1 hour.
step-10: drop a spoonful of mixture into the flour.
step-11: coat with flour and shape it to a flat ball shape.
step-12: coat with egg, then dip in panko bread crumbs.
step-13: heat oil in a pot to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-14: add the chicken pot pie balls in batches, frying until golden brown.

step-1: combine the sweet rice flour, cornstarch and water in a mixing bowl.
step-2: turn out on table and knead to form a ball of dough.
step-3: grab a ping pong size of dough, create a well.
step-4: fill with chocolate chips.
step-5: wrap the dough around the chocolate chips and form into a ball.
step-6: note: make sure to seal well and push out any air pockets.
step-7: if you don’t push out air pockets, they will pop and burst will frying.
step-8: deep fry until the outside is crispy and the mochi balls start floating.

step-1: in a large bowl, beat the cream cheese and vanilla with an electric hand mixer until smooth, then add the sugar and beat to incorporate
step-2: scrape down the sides of the bowl with a spatula, then add the heavy cream.
step-3: beat on high speed for about 2 minutes, or until the batter is thick and smooth.
step-4: freeze for 45 minutes.
step-5: use a small ice cream scoop to scoop out balls of batter and place on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-6: freeze for 2 hours.
step-7: add the cinnamon crunch cereal to a food processor and blend until super-fine crumbs form.
step-8: place the cinnamon crunch crumbs, flour, and eggs in 3 separate shallow bowls.
step-9: take a cheesecake ball and toss it in the flour.
step-10: tap off any excess flour, dip in the eggs, and then toss it in the cinnamon crunch crumbs.
step-11: dip it back in the egg again, then again in the cinnamon crunch crumbs.
step-12: repeat with the remaining cheesecake balls, placing them back on the baking sheet.
step-13: return to the freezer while the oil heats up, about 15 minutes.
step-14: heat the oil in a large pot until it reaches 350°f (180°c).
step-15: fry the cheesecake balls, 4 at a time, until golden brown, about 1 minute.
step-16: drain the cheesecake balls on a wire rack or paper towels.
step-17: sprinkle powdered sugar over the cheesecake bites and serve warm.

step-1: heat 2 inches (5 cm) of vegetable oil in a pot to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: chop granny smith apples, transfer to bowl, and pat dry with paper towel.
step-3: mix in 1 tbsp of flour, brown sugar, and cinnamon.
step-4: open your cinnamon rolls, dust your work space with flour, and reserve icing.
step-5: cut the cinnamon rolls in half and dust more flour to roll out each half into a 2x2 in (5x5 cm) square.
step-6: place a dollop of icing and apple mixture onto the square.
step-7: beat egg in a bowl and brush the sides of the square.
step-8: fold the square into a turnover shape and seal closed with your finger, making sure to get the air out from inside.
step-9: primp the edges with a fork.
step-10: place turnovers into oil and fry for about 2 minutes on each side or until golden brown.
step-11: toss in cinnamon sugar.
step-12: garnish with powdered sugar.

step-1: cut sweet potato into thin slices, about ¼ inch (6 mm) thick.
step-2: place in toaster and set it to the maximum cook time.
step-3: when it pops, flip the sweet potato slices over and toast 1 more time.
step-4: depending on the strength of your toaster and your preferences, you may need to toast it 1 more time after that.
step-5: remove from toaster and let cool enough to handle.
step-6: heat refried black beans.
step-7: spread the beans evenly across sweet potato toast, followed by the salsa.
step-8: top with a fried egg.
step-9: garnish with cilantro.

step-1: make the buttermilk ranch: in a medium bowl, whisk together the sour cream, mayonnaise, buttermilk, lemon juice, dill, pepper, onion powder, garlic powder, and salt.
step-2: refrigerate until ready to serve.
step-3: make the fried tomatoes: slice the tomatoes into ½-inch (1 ¼ cm) -thick slices.
step-4: lightly season the tomato slices on both sides with salt.
step-5: place ½ cup (60 g) of flour in a medium shallow bowl.
step-6: in a separate bowl, combine the cornmeal, remaining ½ cup (60 g) flour, the cayenne, garlic powder.
step-7: and the 1¼ teaspoons of salt and mix with a fork to combine.
step-8: in another medium, whisk the eggs and buttermilk together.
step-9: dredge each tomato slice in the plain flour, then in the egg mixture, then in the seasoned cornmeal mixture.
step-10: pour ½ inch (1 ¼ cm) of canola oil into a large skillet.
step-11: heat over medium-high heat until the temperature reaches 400ºf (200ºc).
step-12: working in batches, fry the tomatoes for 1 minute on each side, until golden brown.
step-13: do not overcook the tomatoes, or they will become mushy inside.
step-14: transfer the fried tomatoes to a paper towel-lined baking sheet and season with salt.
step-15: serve the fried tomatoes with the buttermilk ranch.

step-1: bring 3 quarts (3 l) of water to a boil and cook elbow pasta.
step-2: stir occasionally for 7 minutes, or until al dente.
step-3: in a saucepan over medium-low heat, melt butter completely and whisk in flour for 2 minutes to create a light roux.
step-4: add milk to the roux and season it with salt and pepper.
step-5: stir continuously until the sauce fully thickens.
step-6: gradually add cheese to your sauce and stir until fully combined.
step-7: add cooked pasta to your cheese sauce and stir until each noodle is fully coated.
step-8: remove mac ‘n’ cheese off the heat and pour onto a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-9: spread evenly and freeze for 2 hours in the freezer.
step-10: cut the frozen mac ‘n’ cheese into sticks.
step-11: batter sticks in flour, egg, and bread crumbs.
step-12: preheat a pot of oil to 325°f (170°c).
step-13: fry for 2-3 minutes or until golden brown, then drain on a paper towel.

step-1: in a small mixing bowl combine flour, garlic powder, onion powder, thyme, cayenne, paprika, salt, and pepper.
step-2: mix until evenly distributed.
step-3: place the sliced pickles in the flour, then egg wash, and then bread crumbs.
step-4: preheat oil to 350˚f (120˚c) in a pot.
step-5: fry the pickles for 3-5 minutes, or until browned and crispy on the outside.
step-6: for the ranch dressing, combine buttermilk, mayonnaise, sour cream, onion powder, garlic powder, dill, parsley, salt, and pepper in a small mixing bowl and stir until well combined.
step-7: use a toothpick to assemble the sliders with fried pickles, the ranch dressing, a meatball, lettuce, tomato, and one more pickle.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a bowl add the beef, sausage, salt, and pepper.
step-3: mix to combine.
step-4: spread the meat mixture onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-5: bake for 10 to 15 minutes until fully cooked.
step-6: in a bowl, add bread crumbs, garlic powder red pepper flakes, salt and parmesan.
step-7: stir to combine.
step-8: take one ravioli and dip in the whisked eggs, then dip into the bread crumb mixture.
step-9: repeat with the rest of the ravioli.
step-10: heat 1 inch (2 cm) of oil until the temperature reaches 350˚f (180˚c).
step-11: fry ravioli 4 at a time.
step-12: cut the cooked meat into 15 pieces.
step-13: place the fried ravioli on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet in a ring shape.
step-14: place 2 squares of cheese on the ravioli.
step-15: place a piece of meat on top.
step-16: place 2 more squares of cheese on the meat.
step-17: place a ravioli on top.
step-18: bake for 5 minutes until cheese is melted.
step-19: sprinkle with parsley and serve with tomato sauce for dipping.
step-20: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: grease a 12-cup muffin tin with nonstick spray.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the rice, onion, carrot, scallions, ginger, garlic, salt, rice vinegar, soy sauce, and eggs.
step-4: mix thoroughly.
step-5: add ¼ cup (30 grams) of the rice mixture to each cup of the prepared muffin tin.
step-6: use your fingers to press the rice around the sides of the cups, making indentations in the center.
step-7: bake for 35 minutes, until the cups have started to pull away from the pan and the edges are golden brown.
step-8: meanwhile, make the teriyaki chicken: in a large skillet over medium heat, add the olive oil, chicken, and salt.
step-9: cook until the chicken is no longer visibly pink, about 3 minutes.
step-10: add the garlic and ginger and stir.
step-11: add the soy sauce, honey, sesame seeds, cornstarch, and lime juice.
step-12: cook the sauce until thickened, about 4 minutes, stirring often.
step-13: remove the pan from the heat.
step-14: let rice cups cool slightly, then remove them from the muffin tin.
step-15: place 3-4 pieces of chicken in each cup, spoon some sauce over the top, and garnish with chopped scallions.
step-16: serve immediately.

step-1: mix the mango salsa.
step-2: in a mixing bowl, combine the mango, red onion, bell pepper, avocado, lime juice, and olive oil, salt and pepper to taste, and cilantro.
step-3: then, set aside.
step-4: next, it’s time to season the rice.
step-5: in a large mixing bowl, mix the cooked rice with rice vinegar, sugar, and salt.
step-6: set that mixture aside.
step-7: prepare the shrimp for deep-frying.
step-8: season the shrimp with salt and pepper.
step-9: coat the shrimp in flour, then eggs and, lastly, panko.
step-10: fry in oil until crispy and golden brown.
step-11: finally, it’s time to make the hand rolls.
step-12: first, place the nori sheet in your left hand.
step-13: second, spread some rice in the left third of the nori sheet.
step-14: then, layer on a few of the fried shrimp, spoon some of the mango salsa over and roll into a cone shape.

step-1: combine coconut cream, palm sugar and salt in a saucepan over medium heat.
step-2: once sugar has dissolved, remove from heat and set aside.
step-3: cut mango in half and scoop out insides using a glass.
step-4: cut into small cubes, set aside.
step-5: in a medium saucepan, bring the water to a boil over medium heat.
step-6: once boiling, add the sticky rice, lower the heat to a simmer.
step-7: cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until done.
step-8: transfer the rice into a mixing bowl.
step-9: pour the coconut cream mix over the sticky rice and let it absorb completely.
step-10: with well-oiled hands, grab a handful of the rice, flatten, place a piece of the mango inside and wrap the rice around it.
step-11: firmly press into a ball.
step-12: roll it in rice flour and deep fry until crispy and golden brown.
step-13: drizzle with condensed milk (optional).

step-1: in a large bowl, beat the cream cheese and powdered sugar together until smooth.
step-2: pour in the heavy cream and beat until the mixture has reached soft peaks.
step-3: add in the strawberries and beat until well-incorporated.
step-4: pour the mixture into 6 popsicle molds and insert popsicle sticks.
step-5: freeze at least 8 hours.
step-6: place vanilla wafers in a gallon-size freezer bag and smash with a rolling pin until the the cookies have broken down into crumbs.
step-7: coat the popsicles with egg wash, then with vanilla wafer crumbs and repeat for a second coating.
step-8: freeze for another 30 minutes.
step-9: while holding the end of the popsicle stick, dip the popsicle into the oil, heated to 375°f (190°c), and hold for 10 seconds.
step-10: be sure to wear heat-resistant gloves when frying the popsicles!
step-11: or use a reliable pair of tongs to hold the stick while frying.
step-12: immediately after pulling the popsicle from the oil, pat both sides with a paper towel to absorb excess oil.
step-13: freeze immediately until ready to serve.

step-1: add the frozen strawberries, lime juice, rum, sugar, and frozen rosé to a blender and blend until fully mixed.
step-2: you may have to do this in two batches.
step-3: divide between four glasses, and garnish with a strawberry.

step-1: preheat the oven to 300˚f (150˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, combine the walnuts, egg whites, sugar, and salt and mix with a rubber spatula until the walnuts are well-coated.
step-3: spread the walnut mixture evenly on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-4: bake for 30-40 minutes, stirring every 10 minutes, until the walnuts are crystallized.
step-5: cool completely.

step-1: arrange 12 cupcake liners in a muffin tin.
step-2: using a spoon, dollop two tablespoons of yogurt into the bottom of each liner.
step-3: top with blueberries and raspberries.
step-4: freeze for at least two hours.
step-5: remove cupcake liners before serving.

step-1: peel the bananas and slice into 1-inch (2 cm) slices.
step-2: spread the bananas on a parchment-lined baking sheet and freeze for 2 hours.
step-3: blend the frozen banana slices in a high-speed blender until they reach a smooth consistency.
step-4: add the vanilla and peanut butter and blend to combine.
step-5: transfer to a bowl or container and freeze for 1 hour, or until ready to serve.
step-6: scoop out ice cream.

step-1: in a large skillet over medium heat, cook bacon (in batches if necessary) until crispy.
step-2: remove the bacon to a paper towel lined plate - leave to cool.
step-3: in the same skillet - using leftover bacon grease (drain some if necessary) add the potatoes and season with salt and pepper.
step-4: in the same saucepan, cook sausage until browned and cooked through.
step-5: remove to a paper towel lined bowl.
step-6: reduce heat to medium/low and pour beaten eggs into the skillet.
step-7: fold and stir eggs occasionally until cooked but still soft and moist.
step-8: remove from pan.
step-9: while cooked ingredients are cooling slightly, gather flour tortillas, shredded cheese and sliced green onions (optional) and set them out on your table/workspace.
step-10: to assemble the burritos, lay out a tortilla and start with a base of eggs followed by desired toppings and finish with cheese.
step-11: to wrap, fold in both sides and then fold the bottom up and over all the ingredients.
step-12: roll up tightly.
step-13: note: if you find the tortillas are tearing, heat them up - a few at a time - for 20 seconds in the microwave before assembling.
step-14: wrap up in parchment paper.
step-15: place the parchment-wrapped burritos in a 1 gallon freezer bag and place in the freezer to store for up to one month.
step-16: to reheat: remove the frozen burrito from the freezer.
step-17: unwrap from parchment paper and wrap the frozen burrito up in a damp paper towel.
step-18: place on a microwave safe plate and microwave for 3 minutes.
step-19: remove from microwave and rest for one minute before unwrapping.
step-20: remove the paper towel, serve with hot sauce, salsa, or sour cream!

step-1: pour coffee into ice molds and freeze.
step-2: pour sweetened cream into ice molds and freeze.
step-3: whip the remaining sweetened cream and set aside.
step-4: take 4 cubes of frozen coffee and place in a blender, add 1.5 oz whiskey and blend until foamy.
step-5: add 2 cubes of frozen sweetened cream and 1 tablespoon of chocolate, blend.
step-6: top with whip cream and drizzle with more chocolate.

step-1: fill an ice cube tray with 2 cups (480 ml) of limeade.
step-2: freeze for at least 2 hours.
step-3: add the limeade cubes, remaining cup of limeade, orange juice, lime seltzer water, and lime juice to a blender and blend on high speed until smooth.
step-4: pour into glasses and garnish with lime wheels.

step-1: fill an ice cube tray with about 2 cups (480 ml) of orange juice.
step-2: freeze for at least 2 hours.
step-3: add the frozen orange juice cubes, remaining orange juice, and seltzer water to a blender and blend on high speed until smooth.
step-4: pour into glasses and garnish with orange wheels.

step-1: preheat oven to 450°f (230°c).
step-2: place a parchment paper-lined baking sheet in the oven.
step-3: to make four personal-sized pizzas, divide pizza dough into fourths.
step-4: roll out each piece of dough to desired thickness.
step-5: to par-bake the pizza rounds, arrange the pizza dough rounds on the hot baking sheet.
step-6: bake for 3-4 minutes or until dough looks puffy and dry.
step-7: dough should not be golden brown.
step-8: cool pizza rounds on a wire rack.
step-9: when cool, top your rounds with desired toppings.
step-10: place prepared pizzas on a baking sheet and freeze, uncovered, for 3 hours so the toppings adhere to one another.
step-11: wrap the now-frozen pizzas in plastic wrap and aluminum foil to prevent freezer burn.
step-12: label each pizza as desired and freeze for 1-2 months.
step-13: to bake frozen pizzas, preheat the oven to 450°f (230°c).
step-14: unwrap pizza and place directly on rack or parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-15: bake for 15-18 minutes, or until crust is brown and cheese is melted.
step-16: cool for 5 minutes.
step-17: cut into slices before serving.

step-1: in a blender mix all ingredients until smooth.
step-2: place six small paper cups on a baking tray and fill the cups with the smoothie and freeze for 15 minutes.
step-3: place one popsicle stick in the center of each cup and freeze again for one hour or until solid.
step-4: rip the paper cups from the popsicle and enjoy!

step-1: fill an ice cube tray with 2 cups (480 ml) of lemonade.
step-2: freeze for at least 2 hours.
step-3: add the lemonade cubes, strawberries, the remaining cup of lemonade, and lemon-lime soda to a blender and blend on high speed until smooth.
step-4: pour into glasses and garnish with strawberries.

step-1: fill half of an ice cube tray with 1 cup (240 ml) of pineapple juice.
step-2: fill the other half with 1 cup (240 ml) of coconut milk.
step-3: freeze for at least 2 hours.
step-4: add the frozen pineapple juice cubes, frozen coconut milk cubes, mango, remaining pineapple juice, and lemon-lime soda to a blender and blend on high speed until smooth.
step-5: pour into glasses and garnish with maraschino cherries.

step-1: combine greek yogurt, honey, and water in a small bowl and stir to combine.
step-2: dip the strawberries into the yogurt mixture, ensuring they are fully coated.
step-3: dip the yogurt-covered strawberries in the chopped almonds, and place on a parchment paper-lined sheet tray.
step-4: freeze for 2 hours.

step-1: heat peanut butter and honey in microwave for approximately 30 seconds, or until melted.
step-2: in a medium sized bowl, pour melted peanut butter and honey over granola and stir to combine.
step-3: spoon granola mix evenly into 12 lined muffin cups, pressing firmly into the bottom.
step-4: top each cup with about 1.5 ounces (45g or ⅓ of a single-serving container) of yogurt.
step-5: top each cup with strawberries, blueberries and dark chocolate chunks.
step-6: cover tightly with foil and freeze for at least 2 hours.
step-7: keep frozen and allow to thaw for a few minutes before eating.
step-8: wrap individually in foil for an easy on-the-go snack.

step-1: preheat oven to 400ºf (200ºc), and prepare two cookie sheets with parchment paper.
step-2: in a bowl, mix cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla until fully combined.
step-3: lightly flour the surface and roll out puff pastry on top to flatten.
step-4: cut each sheet of puff pastry into 9 equal squares.
step-5: on the top right and bottom left of the pastry, cut an l shape approximately ½ inch (1 cm) from the edge.
step-6: note: this l shape should reach all the way down and across the square, however both l shapes should not meet at the ends.
step-7: your pastry should look like a picture frame with two corners still intact.
step-8: take the upper right corner and fold down towards the inner bottom corner.
step-9: you will now have a diamond shape.
step-10: place 1 to 2 teaspoons of the cream cheese filling in the middle, then place berries on top.
step-11: repeat with the remaining pastry squares and place them onto the parchment covered baking sheet.
step-12: bake for 15-20 minutes or until pastry is golden brown and puffed.

step-1: blend together the banana, half of the strawberries, half of the blueberries, half of the raspberries, and all of the yogurt in a food processor.
step-2: remove the blade, then stir in the rest of the fruit.
step-3: pour this mixture into a bread tin and put 12 lollipop sticks in, evenly spaced apart.
step-4: freeze overnight.
step-5: allow to defrost for approx 15-20 minutes.
step-6: remove from tin, and cut the lollipops out with a sharp knife.

step-1: whisk together eggs, sugar and salt.
step-2: sift in flour and mix.
step-3: add melted butter and mix.
step-4: then gradually add the milk until no clumps remain.
step-5: in a nonstick skillet over medium heat, pour ¼ cup (60 ml) of crepe batter, and tip the pan in a circular motion to cover the entire bottom surface.
step-6: cook until the bottom surface of crepe begins to brown, then flip.
step-7: repeat until all of the crepe batter is used.
step-8: cool crepes.
step-9: combine cream cheese and sugar and whisk.
step-10: add gelatin and whisk until smooth.
step-11: add whipped cream and mix well.
step-12: stack crepes on top of each other, with cream and fruits (strawberry, kiwi, banana) between each layer.
step-13: wrap cake in plastic.
step-14: refrigerate for 4 hours.
step-15: top with sifted powdered sugar (optional).

step-1: preheat oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-2: in a medium bowl combine granola ingredients, stir until well mixed.
step-3: pour mixture onto a greased baking sheet.
step-4: bake for 40-45 minutes, tossing halfway through to ensure even baking.
step-5: save granola for up to 2 months, or use right away.
step-6: assemble parfaits in bowls or mason jars (great for on the go!).
step-7: layer yogurt with granola and your choice of assorted mixed fruits and/or nuts, alternating layers.

step-1: in a mason jar, layer the yogurt, berries and granola on top of one another until your desired serving is achieved.
take the fruit and stick the popsicle stick into the fruit.
step-2: dip fruit into yogurt and then dip it into the granola.

step-1: make the strawberry lemonade dip: add the greek yogurt, strawberries, mint, honey, lemon juice, and lemon zest to a blender.
step-2: blend until smooth.
step-3: transfer the dip to a small bowl and garnish with more lemon zest.
step-4: chill in the fridge while you assemble the rolls.
step-5: fill a medium shallow bowl with warm water and set near your work station.
step-6: dip a rice paper wrapper in the warm water for a few seconds, submerging completely.
step-7: remove and lay flat on a smooth, clean surface, such as a plate.
step-8: add your desired combination of sliced kiwi, sliced strawberries, sliced mango, raspberries, and sliced green apple to the middle of the wrapper.
step-9: be careful not to overfill, or rolling it will become difficult.
step-10: working quickly, before the rice paper dries out, fold both sides of the rice paper over the fruit to secure.
step-11: lift the bottom edge of the rice paper and carefully fold it over the top of the fruit, tucking it under on the other side, then gently roll until the fruit is completely covered and the top edge of the wrapper adheres to the spring roll.
step-12: repeat with the other ingredients.
step-13: set the spring roll aside and cover with a damp paper towel to keep fresh while you repeat with the remaining ingredients.
step-14: serve with the chilled dip.

step-1: make the simple syrup by dissolving one cup of sugar into one cup (240 ml) of water.
step-2: blend strawberries, pineapple, blackberries, raspberries, mango, wine, and simple syrup until well combined (you may have to do this in two batches).
step-3: pour mixture into a 9×9 inch (23x23 cm) glass pan, cover with plastic wrap, and freeze overnight.
step-4: scoop and serve with fresh strawberry (optional).

step-1: make the fruit: in a small pot, warm the orange juice over medium heat for 3 minutes.
step-2: add the dried apricots, golden raisins, dried cherries, raisins, dried figs, and dried cranberries.
step-3: simmer for 5 minutes, until the fruit absorbs some of the liquid.
step-4: transfer the fruit and their cooking liquid to a medium bowl and cover with plastic wrap.
step-5: soak and refrigerate for at least 6 hours or overnight, then drain.
step-6: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-7: make the cake batter: in a large bowl, cream the butter with an electric hand mixer until fluffy.
step-8: add the light and dark brown sugars and beat for 3 minutes, or until smooth and creamy.
step-9: add the eggs, 1 at a time, and beat until well combined.
step-10: add the vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice, and salt, and beat for 2 minutes, or until smooth.
step-11: add the flour, baking soda, pecans, lemon zest, and the soaked fruit, and fold with a rubber spatula until well incorporated.
step-12: grease 2 12-cup muffin tins with nonstick spray.
step-13: using a 2-tablespoon ice cream scoop, add a scoop of batter to each of the muffin cups.
step-14: bake for 20 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-15: let cool before icing.
step-16: make the icing: in a medium bowl, whisk together the powdered sugar and lemon juice until smooth.
step-17: drizzle the icing over the fruitcakes, then serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: grease the donut pans with nonstick spray.
step-3: in a medium bowl, combine the cereal and milk for the glaze.
step-4: set aside to soak while you make the donuts, about 20 minutes.
step-5: strain into a clean bowl, pressing on the cereal to extract as much milk as possible.
step-6: make the donuts: in a medium bowl, combine the flour, crushed cereal, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
step-7: stir to combine.
step-8: in a large bowl, whisk together the sugar, vegetable oil, eggs, milk, and vanilla.
step-9: add the dry ingredients and whisk until there are no lumps.
step-10: transfer the batter to a piping bag or zip-top bag with a corner cut off.
step-11: pipe the batter into the prepared donut pans.
step-12: leave about ¼ inch (6 ml) from the rim, so they don’t overflow.
step-13: bake for 9-10 minutes, until the donuts are just beginning to turn golden brown around the edges and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
step-14: let cool in the pan for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to continue cooling for about 20 minutes.
step-15: make the glaze: in a medium bowl, combine the powdered sugar and ¼ cup of the cereal milk.
step-16: whisk until smooth.
step-17: add the cereal for topping to a shallow dish.
step-18: once cooled, dip the tops of the donuts into the glaze, then into the cereal.
step-19: set on a wire rack set over a baking pan to dry for at least 20 minutes, until the glaze is no longer shiny.

step-1: for the soup, add the hot water, gelatin powder, soy sauce, and chicken stock to a medium bowl.
step-2: stir to combine.
step-3: pour into a shallow dish and chill in the refrigerator for 1 hour, until set.
step-4: when set, fluff and break up the jellied soup with a fork.
step-5: for the filling, combine the ground pork, green onion, mushrooms, ginger, garlic, sesame oil, and sake in a medium bowl.
step-6: mix with your hands until combined.
step-7: scoop a spoonful of filling onto the middle of a dumpling wrapper.
step-8: add a spoonful of soup jelly on top.
step-9: fold up the edges of the dumpling and pinch everything in the center.
step-10: repeat with the remaining dumpling wrappers and filling.
step-11: put a plate in a medium pan pan, and lay a piece of parchment paper over it.
step-12: set the dumplings on the plate and pour 150 milliliters (⅔ cup) water under the plate.
step-13: cover and steam for 5 minutes over medium heat.

step-1: heat a pan over medium-high heat.
step-2: add the sugar, cocoa powder, vanilla, and milk, and whisk until smooth.
step-3: bring to a boil, then remove from heat.
step-4: let the pan cool.
step-5: line a loaf pan with plastic wrap, or use popsicle molds.
step-6: pour mixture into pan.
step-7: freeze for about 5 hours, until firm enough to stick popsicle sticks in.
step-8: gently slide each popsicle stick into chocolate, leaving about 2 inches (5 cm) in between each stick.
step-9: continue with the next row.
step-10: there should be about 8 sticks per row, 16 popsicle sticks total.
step-11: continue to freeze for another 4 hours, until completely frozen.
step-12: remove the loaf pan from the freezer, and pull the plastic wrap upward releasing the chocolate.
step-13: you may need to use a spatula to help release chocolate from pan.
step-14: slice and serve immediately.

step-1: in a microwave-safe measuring cup, or in a small pot on the stove, heat the coconut milk until hot, but not boiling (about 2 minutes in the microwave).
step-2: place the dairy-free chocolate in a large bowl and pour the hot coconut milk over it, allowing the milk to melt the chocolate.
step-3: mix well to combine.
step-4: once the chocolate is melted, add the coconut oil and powdered sugar.
step-5: beat with a hand mixer or whisk until smooth.
step-6: cover and refrigerate overnight.
step-7: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-8: grease 3 separate 8-inch (20-cm) round cake pans and set aside.
step-9: in a large bowl, add the whole wheat flour, dark cocoa powder, sugar, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
step-10: whisk to combine and set aside.
step-11: in a separate large bowl, add the almond milk, coconut oil, applesauce, maple syrup, apple cider vinegar, and vanilla extract.
step-12: whisk to combine.
step-13: in two batches, add the dry mixture to the wet mixture, folding with a spatula until combined.
step-14: some clumps are okay.
step-15: divide the batter evenly between the 3 pre-greased cake pans and bake for 35–45 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out almost entirely clean.
step-16: cool completely.
step-17: remove the frosting from the fridge and mix it up well.
step-18: choose which cake will be your bottom layer and cover evenly with about 1 cup (115 g) of frosting.
step-19: top with the second layer, frosting evenly again.
step-20: add the final layer and frost the top and the sides of the cake generously, topping with berries of choice for garnish.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: prepare the yellow cake batter according to package instructions and pour into greased pan.
step-3: bake until a toothpick comes out clean, about 30 minutes.
step-4: cool to room temperature.
step-5: in a medium bowl, crumble the cake.
step-6: add vanilla frosting to give some moisture to the cake.
step-7: if it is too dry add more frosting.
step-8: using a small ice cream scoop, portion the cake and shape into a ball.
step-9: repeat with remaining cake.
step-10: dip a popsicle stick tip into the melted white chocolate and insert into the cake balls.
step-11: freeze for at least 30 minutes.
step-12: in a small bowl, add the 3 tablespoons of water and gelatin.
step-13: let bloom for 5 minutes.
step-14: in a medium saucepan, combine ¼ cup (60 ml) water, sugar, and condensed milk.
step-15: bring to a boil over high heat.
step-16: remove the pan from the heat and add the bloomed gelatin.
step-17: whisk until well combined.
step-18: add the white chocolate to a bowl.
step-19: pour the condensed milk mixture through a sieve into the bowl of chocolate and let it sit for 2 minutes to soften the chocolate.
step-20: using a emersion blender, blend the chocolate until smooth.
step-21: transfer the mixture into a deep container such as a mug.
step-22: squeeze light blue, purple, then navy food coloring into the mug or bowl without stirring.
step-23: dip the frozen cake pop into the chocolate and twist as you pull up creating a marbled pattern.
step-24: stick in a piece of styrofoam and dry the pop completely.
step-25: repeat with remaining cake pops.

step-1: make the star mixture: in a small bowl, combine the sugar pearls and hot water and whisk until the all of the balls are separated.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: make the water jelly: in a small bowl, combine the agar and sugar.
step-4: add the water to a small pan, then add the agar mixture and stir to combine.
step-5: cook over high heat until boiling.
step-6: reduce the heat to low and cook for 2 minutes.
step-7: meanwhile, fill a large bowl with ice and cold water.
step-8: move the pan to the ice bath and chill for 3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
step-9: pour the agar mixture into the ice ball tray.
step-10: chill in the refrigerator for 10 minutes.
step-11: make the blue jelly: in a small pan, combine the water, blue hawaii syrup, strawberry syrup, and agar and stir to combine.
step-12: cook over high heat until boiling.
step-13: reduce the heat to low and cook for 2 minutes.
step-14: move the pan to the ice bath and chill for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally.
step-15: using a skewer or toothpick, scratch the surface of the chilled water jelly.
step-16: pour the star mixture over the water jelly.
step-17: add the blue jelly and cover with the lid, and fridge for 30 minutes.
step-18: remove the raindrop cake from the tray.

step-1: prepare the cakes according to the package, or use your favorite cake recipe.
step-2: to make the buttercream, mix the butter, vanilla, milk, and powdered sugar in a bowl with a hand mixer.
step-3: once the cakes are baked and cooled, place one cake on a turntable.
step-4: if you don't have one, you can use a plate.
step-5: slice the top off the cakes to create a flat surface.
step-6: place a large dollop of the buttercream on the cake and spread to create an even middle layer of frosting.
step-7: place the second cake over the layer of buttercream.
step-8: frost the entire cake to create the crumb layer, creating a smooth surface.
step-9: place the cake in the freezer to keep cold.
step-10: for the glaze, boil the water, sugar, and condensed milk in a pot for 1 minute, then remove from heat.
step-11: bloom the gelatin in 8 cups (2 liters) of cold water for 5 minutes, then wring the gelatin sheets of excess water and mix into the sugar mixture.
step-12: pour the sugar mixture over the chocolate, letting it sit for 2-3 minutes to allow the chocolate to soften.
step-13: using an immersion blender, carefully blend the chocolate and the liquid, making sure that you are not blending in air bubbles by lifting up the blender too high.
step-14: pour the glaze through a sieve into a large bowl to remove any excess bubbles.
step-15: separate the glaze into 5 different bowls (one medium-sized bowl and four smaller bowls).
step-16: color the biggest bowl of glaze with black and navy blue food coloring, stir the coloring with the glaze until the color is distributed evenly.
step-17: in the next bowl, add the navy blue food coloring and stir.
step-18: in the next bowl, add the lighter blue food coloring and stir.
step-19: in the next bowl, add the purple food coloring and stir.
step-20: in the next bowl, add the pink food coloring and stir.
step-21: when you are ready to use the glaze, make sure each one is around 90-96°f (32-35°c).
step-22: microwave if necessary.
step-23: pour the colored glazes back into the biggest bowl of black and blue glaze.
step-24: swirl them gently with a spoon.
step-25: place the cake on a stand over a sheet tray to catch any excess glaze.
step-26: carefully pour the glaze over the cake.
step-27: dip a brush into the white food coloring and fling it onto the cake to create stars.

step-1: make the crust: in a large bowl, mix together the all-purpose flour, whole-wheat flour, and salt.
step-2: add the butter and, using your hands, work it into the flour until only pea-sized pieces remain.
step-3: continue working with your hands until the dough has a shaggy texture.
step-4: add the water, starting with 3 tablespoons, and mix until the dough is moist enough to hold together.
step-5: add more water as needed, 1 tablespoon at a time.
step-6: form the dough into a disc and wrap in plastic wrap.
step-7: refrigerate for 30-60 minutes.
step-8: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-9: make the filling: heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
step-10: once the oil is shimmering, add the mushrooms.
step-11: sauté for 3-5 minutes, until the mushrooms are beginning to brown lightly.
step-12: reduce the heat to medium and add the leeks, ½ teaspoon kosher salt, and ½ teaspoon pepper.
step-13: cook for another 3-5 minutes, until the leeks have softened slightly.
step-14: add the tomatoes and cook for 1 minute, until slightly softened.
step-15: add the spinach and sauté for 1-2 minutes, until just wilted.
step-16: remove the pan from the heat.
step-17: lightly dust a clean surface with flour.
step-18: roll out the dough, turning it frequently so it doesn’t stick, to a 12-inch (30 cm) round, about ⅛-inch (3 mm) thick.
step-19: gently transfer the crust to a 9-inch (22 cm) pie dish.
step-20: trim any excess dough around the edges.
step-21: fold the edges of dough back underneath itself, then crimp using an index finger knuckle on one hand and the thumb and index finger on the other hand.
step-22: crumple a piece of parchment paper, then spread it out in the center of the crust.
step-23: add the dried beans to the center and spread toward the sides of the crust--this will add weight to keep the crust from puffing up and hold up the walls while baking.
step-24: bake the crust for 15 minutes.
step-25: carefully remove the weights by lifting out the parchment paper, then bake for 5 minutes more, until the dough no longer looks raw.
step-26: carefully pour the silken tofu into a fine-mesh strainer set over a bowl.
step-27: let sit for 10 minutes to allow the excess water to drain.
step-28: add the tofu, nutritional yeast, remaining ½ teaspoon salt, remaining ½ teaspoon pepper, black salt, garlic powder, paprika, turmeric, and cayenne to a blender.
step-29: puree until smooth.
step-30: spread half the sautéed vegetables evenly over the bottom of the crust.
step-31: pour the tofu puree over the vegetables, then add the remaining vegetables on top..
step-32: bake for 40-45 minutes, until the center no longer jiggles and the crust is just beginning to brown.
step-33: let the quiche cool for at least 30 minutes before slicing to allow the filling to set.

step-1: boil the garbanzo beans until the skins come off.
step-2: remove the skins, drain.
step-3: combine all ingredients in a food processor.
step-4: blend until smooth adding small amounts of oil and water until desired consistency is achieved.
step-5: add more lemon or tahini if needed.
step-6: garnish with pine nuts and more oil!
step-7: eat with fresh vegetables or pita chips.

step-1: 2-3 hours before roasting, prepare the lamb.
step-2: use a small, sharp knife to make 15 to 20 incisions, each about 2 inches (5 cm) deep, through the fat cap on top of the meat.
step-3: thinly slice 3 cloves of garlic and use your fingers to press the slices into the incisions.
step-4: in a blender, combine the remaining 9 garlic cloves, the olive oil, mustard, lemon juice, rosemary leaves, thyme leaves, salt, and pepper.
step-5: blend until a paste forms.
step-6: spread the paste evenly all over the lamb.
step-7: let marinate at room temperature for 2 to 3 hours.
step-8: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-9: place the lamb on a roasting rack in a roasting pan and pour the wine into the bottom of the pan.
step-10: roast for 15 minutes.
step-11: remove the pan from the oven and reduce the heat to 325°f (160°c).
step-12: arrange the potatoes, cut side down, in the roasting pan and place the lamb on the rack on top.
step-13: roast for 2 hours, tossing the potatoes and basting the lamb with the roasting liquid halfway through.
step-14: transfer the potatoes to a platter, baste the lamb again with the remaining pan juices, and return the lamb to the oven.
step-15: continue to roast, basting often, until an instant-read thermometer inserted into thickest part of the leg reaches 130°f (for medium-rare), 45 minutes to 2 hours more, depending on thickness.
step-16: (as a general rule, the lamb should roast 20 minutes per pound for medium-rare).
step-17: transfer the lamb to a platter and set aside to rest for 20 minutes.
step-18: while the lamb rests, return the potatoes to the roasting pan, season with flaky salt, and warm in the oven until just heated through, about 20 minutes.
step-19: return the potatoes to the serving platter.
step-20: carve the lamb into ½-inch (1 cm) thick slices and arrange on the platter with the potatoes, garnished with rosemary and thyme sprigs.
step-21: serve with whole grain mustard alongside.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350ºf / 175ºc.
step-2: chop thyme, rosemary, and garlic together, then place in a large bowl.
step-3: add salt, pepper, chilli powder, olive oil, and lemon juice; mix well, then set aside.
step-4: if necessary, trim off some extra fat on the rack of lamb, then cut lamb into 4 pieces.
step-5: (you can also ask your butcher to prep it for you!)
step-6: place lamb in the spice mixture, then rub the spice mixture onto the lamb using your hands, covering all sides.
step-7: cover and chill in the fridge for 30 minutes.
step-8: heat oil in a large cast iron or skillet.
step-9: sear all sides of the lamb until meat is dark brown and crispy.
step-10: when it’s almost done, pour in red wine then remove from the heat.
step-11: roast the lamb in the oven for 10-15 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 145˚f / 63˚c
step-12: serve with roasted veggies.

step-1: wrap cauliflower in a clean dish towel, then turn it upside down and bang it against the surface of your counter until you feel the cauliflower crack (be sure to rotate to break it up on all sides).
step-2: pull florets off of stem and break the bigger florets into smaller pieces.
step-3: bring a large pot of water to boil over high heat.
step-4: add the cauliflower pieces to the pot and boil, covered, for 15-18 minutes.
step-5: drain the cauliflower.
step-6: mash the cauliflower with a fork until smooth.
step-7: mix in remaining ingredients.
step-8: allow to cool for 5 minutes.

step-1: cook the bacon in a large pot until crispy.
step-2: add the shrimp, salt, and pepper.
step-3: cook until the shrimp is pink throughout.
step-4: remove the shrimp and bacon.
step-5: add the onions, tomatoes, and garlic, cooking until the garlic is slightly starting to brown.
step-6: add the cream and bring to a boil.
step-7: toss in the fettuccine with the shrimp, bacon, parmesan cheese, and parsley, stirring until the cheese has completely melted and the sauce coats the shrimp and pasta nicely.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in the microwave, melt the 3 tablespoons of butter with 1 clove of garlic.
step-3: slice up a loaf of italian bread to about 1-inch (2 ½ cm) thickness.
step-4: top with melted garlic butter, italian seasoning, and parmesan cheese.
step-5: bake for approximately 15 minutes or until golden brown.
step-6: in a mixing bowl, combine the tomatoes, garlic, salt, pepper, basil, and olive oil and stir until everything is fully coated with olive oil.
step-7: top the garlic bread with desired amount of tomato mixture.
step-8: garnish with parmesan cheese.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350° f (180°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, combine the ground beef, egg, salt, pepper, garlic powder, parmesan, and chopped basil until thoroughly mixed.
step-3: take a golf ball-sized amount of the beef mixture and roll it into a ball.
step-4: repeat with the rest of the beef mixture, setting the meatballs aside on a plate.
step-5: heat oil in a pan over high heat.
step-6: sear meatballs on one side for about one to two minutes, then flip.
step-7: cook for another one to two minutes, then remove the meatballs from the pan and drain any excess fat.
step-8: pour the marinara sauce into the pan and place the meatballs in the sauce.
step-9: cook for about eight to 10 minutes, flipping the meatballs in the sauce until the sauce has reduced to a thick consistency.
step-10: remove from heat.
step-11: cut the 4×3 sheet of dinner rolls in half lengthwise.
step-12: arrange the bottom half into a 9×13 inch (23x33 cm) baking pan.
step-13: place the meatballs evenly in a 4×3 grid, putting one on each roll.
step-14: layer the mozzarella evenly on top.
step-15: cover with the top half of the dinner rolls.
step-16: in a small bowl, combine the melted butter, garlic, basil, and parmesan, stirring until evenly mixed.
step-17: pour the garlic butter mixture over the top of the sliders.
step-18: bake for 20 minutes until the rolls are golden brown and cheese is melted.
step-19: cut into individual sandwiches, and serve.

step-1: heat 1 tablespoon of sesame oil in a large, nonstick skillet over medium heat.
step-2: pour in the shrimp and season with ¼ teaspoon of the salt.
step-3: fry the shrimp for 1 minute on each side.
step-4: remove the shrimp from the pan and pour in the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil.
step-5: toss in the onion and remaining ¼ teaspoon of salt and sauté for a few minutes until they begin to soften.
step-6: add in the broccoli, garlic and soy sauce and sauté until the garlic is fragrant, about 30 seconds.
step-7: toss the shrimp back into the pan and mix until everything is well incorporated and the shrimp is fully cooked, about 1 minute.
step-8: divide the mixture evenly between 4 bowls.

step-1: season the chicken thighs with salt and pepper.
step-2: heat a cast-iron skillet or pan over medium-high heat, and add the chicken skin side down.
step-3: cook the chicken until it has a dark brown and crispy skin.
step-4: flip the chicken and cook until the chicken is cooked through, about 5 more minutes.
step-5: remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
step-6: add the garlic and onion to the remaining chicken fat and cook, stirring frequently until the onions are softened and caramelized.
step-7: add the brown sugar, chicken broth, thyme, and parsley and stir to combine.
step-8: bring the sauce to a boil and and cook for 1-2 minutes, until slightly reduced.
step-9: add the chicken back to the pan and coat it in the garlic brown sugar sauce.

step-1: preheat oven to 200°f (95°c).
step-2: generously season all sides of the steak with salt and pepper.
step-3: transfer to a wire rack on top of a baking sheet, then bake for about 45 minutes to an hour until the internal temperature reads about 125°f (51° c) for medium-rare.
step-4: adjust the bake time based on if you like your steak more rare or more well-done (you monster).
step-5: heat the canola oil in a pan over high heat until smoking.
step-6: do not use olive oil, as its smoke point is significantly lower than that of canola oil and will smoke before reaching the desired cooking temperature.
step-7: sear the steak for 30 seconds on the first side, then flip.
step-8: add the butter, garlic, rosemary, and thyme and swirl around the pan.
step-9: transfer the garlic and herbs on top of the steak and baste the steak with the butter using a large spoon.
step-10: baste for about 30 seconds, then flip and baste the other side for about 15 seconds.
step-11: turn the steak on its side and cook to render off any excess fat.
step-12: rest the steak on a cutting board or wire rack for about 10 minutes.
step-13: slicing the steak before the resting period has finished will result in a lot of the juices leaking out, which may not be desirable.
step-14: slice the steak into ½ -inch (1 ½ cm) strips, then fan out the slices and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a bowl, add the butter, garlic, and parsley and mix until fully combined.
step-3: shape butter into a log and wrap in plastic wrap.
step-4: freeze for 15 minutes.
step-5: on a cutting board, slice the chicken breasts in half horizontally.
step-6: wrap in plastic wrap and pound until the chicken is ⅛-inch (3 mm) thick.
