step-7: divide the butter into fourths.
step-8: season with salt and pepper.
step-9: place a portion of butter on the flattened chicken breast and roll it up, creating a log.
step-10: coat the rolled chicken in flour followed, by eggs and bread crumbs.
step-11: repeat once more.
step-12: cover the chicken in plastic wrap and chill for 15 minutes while the oil is heating.
step-13: fry in oil for 3-4 minutes, until edges are golden brown.
step-14: bake for 20-25 minutes.
step-15: let rest for 5 minutes before serving.

step-1: heat oil in a large pot over high heat.
step-2: cook garlic and chicken until no pink is showing.
step-3: add asparagus, tomatoes, carrots, salt, and pepper, cooking for about 2 minutes.
step-4: add pasta and parmesan, stirring until cheese is melted and evenly distributed.
step-5: serve.

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine the avocado, roasted garlic, tomato, chipotle peppers, lime juice, salt, and pepper.
step-2: mix together until fully incorporated.
step-3: serve with tortilla chips.

step-1: combine water, mustard, mayonnaise, basil, garlic, salt, and pepper.
step-2: mix until combined.
step-3: add tofu and refrigerate.
step-4: marinate for 1-3 hours.
step-5: prepare as desired!

step-1: add garlic, ginger, salt, pepper, sesame oil, rice vinegar, olive oil, and coconut aminos into a mason jar and secure lid tightly.
step-2: shake vigorously until ingredients are mixed thoroughly.
step-3: store dressing in the fridge and use within 1-2 weeks.
step-4: you may need to shake up the ingredients again before each use.

step-1: preheat oven to 250˚f (130˚c).
step-2: place wings in a large bowl and pat dry.
step-3: add the baking powder and salt to the wings.
step-4: stir to coat.
step-5: spray a baking rack with nonstick cooking spray and place on top of a foiled sheet pan.
step-6: distribute wings evenly on top, making sure none of them touch and they are all face-up.
step-7: bake for 35 minutes, then increase the temperature to 425˚f (220˚c) and bake for an additional 45 minutes, or until wings are crisp and golden.
step-8: (do not remove the wings from the oven when increasing temperature.)
step-9: for sauce, in a hot pan, melt butter.
step-10: add garlic and stir.
step-11: cook for 30 seconds, being careful not to burn the garlic.
step-12: stir in italian herb blend and salt.
step-13: cook for an additional 20 seconds.
step-14: add in fresh parsley and wings.
step-15: stir to coat.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: season lamb generously with salt and pepper.
step-3: heat a cast iron over medium high heat.
step-4: to the hot pan, add in 4 tablespoons of the the olive oil, along with the lamb and garlic.
step-5: sear all sides of the lamb until browned, about 3-4 minutes.
step-6: remove browned lamb, and place cooked lamb onto a baking sheet.
step-7: remove garlic and add to food processor with along with the breadcrumbs, parsley, parmesan, rosemary, and 1 tablespoon of olive oil.
step-8: pulse until combined.
step-9: pour onto a large plate.
step-10: brush the top and sides of the lamb with mustard.
step-11: coat the top and sides of the lamb with the breadcrumb mixture and roast in oven for 20-25 minutes.
step-12: allow to rest before slicing.

step-1: using a fork or knife, carefully poke holes along the middle of the squash.
step-2: microwave for 5 minutes so the squash softens and is easier to cut.
step-3: cut in half horizontally and scoop out the seeds.
step-4: drizzle olive oil, salt, and pepper.
step-5: place in the instant pot and secure the lid until you hear the beep.
step-6: tip: closing the lid can be tricky.
step-7: have the pressure knob at 11 o’clock and turn right.
step-8: set the pressure knob on the top of the lid to sealing.
step-9: select “manual” and reduce to 7 minutes.
step-10: it will say “on” in a few seconds.
step-11: note: the instant pot will need to warm up for 5-10 minutes.
step-12: steam will be released and a few minutes later, the time will start counting down.
step-13: while the squash is cooking, prepare the shrimp.
step-14: place the shrimp in a bowl and add the minced garlic, onion powder, parsley, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper.
step-15: mix until combined.
step-16: refrigerate until ready to cook.
step-17: once the 7 minutes is up, let the squash rest in the pot for 5 minutes.
step-18: it will count up and read “l 0:05”.
step-19: using a towel or mit, release the pressure knob from “sealing” to “venting”.
step-20: after the steam has been released, carefully take the squash out of the pot and let it rest in a bowl.
step-21: drain the excess liquid and clean the pot.
step-22: to cook the shrimp, select “saute” on the instant pot.
step-23: once it says “hot”, add the oil.
step-24: when the oil is shimmering, add the shrimp in a single layer (cook in batches if necessary).
step-25: cook for 3-5 minutes per side or until opaque.
step-26: press “cancel” and remove the shrimp.
step-27: using a fork, shred the inside of the squash.
step-28: serve the spaghetti squash and shrimp together.
step-29: if desired, top with parmesan cheese and fresh parsley.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (175°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, combine cream cheese, pepper, garlic powder, chives, provolone, and bacon, stirring until thoroughly mixed.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: season all sides of the pork chops with salt and pepper.
step-5: carefully cut a pocket through the side of the pork chop in order to create a cavity.
step-6: stuff the cavity with a generous spoonful of the cream cheese mixture and press around the edges of the pork to seal it in.
step-7: repeat with the remaining pork chops.
step-8: dip the stuffed pork chops in the flour, shaking off excess, then the egg, then the breadcrumbs.
step-9: repeat with the remaining pork chops.
step-10: heat the oil in a pan over medium heat.
step-11: fry the pork chops for about one to two minutes, then flip.
step-12: remove from the heat and bake for 15-20 minutes, until cheese is bubbling and starting to brown.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: cut pizza dough into 2-inch (5 cm) pieces and roll into balls.
step-3: in a bowl, add pizza dough balls, chicken, bacon, mozzarella, parmesan, parsley, pepper, garlic powder, olive oil, and alfredo sauce and mix to combine.
step-4: scoop mixture evenly into a greased bundt pan, or a 9-inch (23 cm) cake pan.
step-5: bake for 20 minutes, until top is golden and bubbling.
step-6: use a spatula help the ring out of the pan, then invert onto a plate.
step-7: place small bowl of alfredo sauce in the ring hole.
step-8: serve immediately.

step-1: for the dough, mix together the flour, yeast, and salt, and make a well in the middle.
step-2: pour the water and 1 teaspoon of olive oil into the well and mix together.
step-3: knead for about 7-10 minutes until the dough is springy.
step-4: line a bowl with the other teaspoon of olive oil, place the dough in the bowl, cover, and leave to rise in a warm place for 1 hour (or until doubled in size).
step-5: tear the dough into 9 separate balls and then roll into long tubes, folding over to make a knot.
step-6: place the knots on a baking tray.
step-7: bake in a 350°f (180°c) oven for 10 minutes.
step-8: prepare the garlic butter by mixing the butter, garlic, and parsley.
step-9: coat the knots with the butter mixture and bake for another 5 minutes.

step-1: melt butter in a pan over medium heat.
step-2: spread the shrimp around in the pan in a single layer, sprinkling the salt and pepper on top, then cook until the butter is starting to turn a dark brown.
step-3: flip the shrimp, add the garlic and chili flakes, and cook for about 15-30 seconds.
step-4: add the parsley and lemon juice, reducing the lemon juice down to a sauce, then remove from heat.
step-5: serve and enjoy!

step-1: in a medium bowl, add the potatoes and garlic and stir until evenly combined.
step-2: microwave for 13 minutes.
step-3: remove from the bowl from the microwave.
step-4: in a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, combine the milk, salt, and butter and stir to combine.
step-5: pour the milk mixture over the potatoes.
step-6: microwave for 2 minutes.
step-7: remove from the microwave and mash the potatoes with a fork.
step-8: add the pepper and stir to incorporate.
step-9: garnish with chives.

step-1: add potatoes to a large pot of salted water.
step-2: place over medium/high heat and bring to a boil.
step-3: cook until fork tender, about 15-20 minutes.
step-4: drain, peel, and mash potatoes until they reach a smooth consistency.
step-5: add remaining ingredients to mash and mix to incorporate.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: combine the almond flour, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and parmesan in a large bowl.
step-3: add the avocado oil and mix thoroughly with a fork.
step-4: add the ice water, 1 tablespoon at a time, and mix thoroughly, until small clumps form and the dough holds together when squeezed.
step-5: form the dough into a round, flattening the top and bottom as evenly as possible.
step-6: place the dough on a sheet of parchment paper and add another piece of parchment on top.
step-7: roll out the dough as evenly as possible, to between ¼- and ⅛-inch (6- and 3-mm) thick.
step-8: remove the top layer of parchment paper and place on a baking sheet.
step-9: you may need to press the edges of the dough to form an even rectangle.
step-10: using a cookie cutter or pizza cutter, slice the dough to desired size.
step-11: if using a cookie cutter, re-roll the excess dough and cut out more crackers.
step-12: if desired, use the blunt end of a skewer to poke holes in each of the crackers.
step-13: carefully place the crackers on the baking sheet.
step-14: if the dough is too warm, the crackers will break as you attempt to transfer them.
step-15: chill in the freezer for 10 minutes before proceeding if this happens.
step-16: bake for 15-20 minutes, flipping halfway, until golden brown.
step-17: let the crackers cool completely and serve as desired.
step-18: store up to 1 week at room temperature in an airtight container.

step-1: preheat your oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-2: slice pita bread into eighths and spread chips out on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-3: in a small bowl combine olive oil, parmesan cheese, garlic, and parsley, and brush onto both sides of the chips.
step-4: bake for 10-12 minutes until golden and crispy.
step-5: allow to cool.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c)
step-2: cook bacon in a cast iron pan over medium heat.
step-3: once bacon fat coats the pan, add the brussels sprouts, salt, pepper, apple cider vinegar, brown sugar, garlic.
step-4: stir until fully coated.
step-5: cook until the bottom of the brussel sprouts begin to brown on the bottom.
step-6: transfer the cast iron pan to the oven and roast for 20 minutes, or until tender, flipping the brussel sprouts over every 5 minutes or so.
step-7: sprinkle parmesan cheese evenly over the brussels sprouts, then place the pan back in the oven and bake for other 3 to 5 minutes.
step-8: sprinkle with additional bacon and chives then serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200˚c).
step-2: slice the top and bottom off of carrots then slice them in half, slice each half into thirds lengthwise.
step-3: in a large bowl, mix ingredients with carrot sticks.
step-4: spread on a baking sheet.
step-5: bake for 15-20 minutes (depending on how crispy you want them).
step-6: mix together ingredients for dipping sauce in a small bowl.
step-7: serve warm carrots with dipping sauce.
step-8: topped with parmesan and parsley.

step-1: in a food processor, pulse the broccoli florets and stems until they reach your desired “rice” consistency.
step-2: in pan over medium heat, add oil and garlic and cook for about 30 seconds.
step-3: add riced broccoli, salt, and pepper, and cook 5 minutes, or until tender.
step-4: add parmesan and stir to combine.
step-5: serve with a sprinkle of parmesan.

step-1: preheat oven to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-2: cut the head of cauliflower in half.
step-3: pluck bite-sized florets from each half.
step-4: trim bottoms of florets as necessary.
step-5: in a medium bowl, mix the parmesan crust ingredients.
step-6: in a separate bowl, whisk eggs.
step-7: dredge the cauliflower in the eggs, then garlic parmesan mixture.
step-8: lay the cauliflower on a baking sheet.
step-9: drizzle with olive oil, then season with salt and pepper.
step-10: bake for 20-30 minutes, until crispy and browned to your liking.
step-11: garnish with chopped parsley.

step-1: melt butter, add garlic, thyme, sage and rosemary.
step-2: sauté until fragrant.
step-3: remove the thyme, sage and rosemary.
step-4: add flour and stir.
step-5: add the milk, a little bit at a time, and whisk after each addition.
step-6: repeat until all the milk is gone.
step-7: keep whisking until it has thickened and coats the back of a spoon.
step-8: grease a 9×13 inch (22 x33 cm) pan.
step-9: cover bottom with a layer of pasta, half of the chicken, half of the peas, a ⅓ of the parmesan, a ⅓ water and ⅓ of the sauce.
step-10: repeat once.
step-11: top with noodles, remaining water and cheese.
step-12: cover with foil and bake for 40 minutes at 400°f (200°c).
step-13: remove the foil, sprinkle the top with breadcrumbs.
step-14: broil for 5-10 minutes or until golden brown.
step-15: serve with chopped parsley as garnish.

step-1: slice chicken breasts into bite-sized chunks.
step-2: combine the chicken with the salt, pepper, garlic powder, and chili powder, mixing until evenly seasoned.
step-3: place the flour and eggs into separate bowls.
step-4: dip a piece of chicken into the flour, then the egg, then back into the flour.
step-5: repeat with the rest of the chicken.
step-6: heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
step-7: fry the chicken pieces until deep-golden brown and crispy.
step-8: set aside on a paper towel to drain.
step-9: in a pan over medium heat, cook the butter, garlic, and parsley until garlic is barely starting to brown.
step-10: toss the chicken in the garlic butter mixture until evenly coated.
step-11: turn off the heat, then toss the chicken in the parmesan.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: combine the egg and the lemon juice.
step-3: in a separate bowl, combine the panko bread crumbs, parmesan, garlic powder, lemon zest, salt, and pepper.
step-4: coat the chicken tenders in flour and shake off any excess.
step-5: then dredge in the egg and lemon juice mixture and allow excess egg to drip off.
step-6: coat with the panko bread crumb mixture, turning until evenly coated.
step-7: lay chicken tenders flat on a baking sheet lined with aluminum foil and sprayed with nonstick cooking spray.
step-8: spray additional cooking spray over the chicken tenders to help them brown.
step-9: bake for 20-25 minutes (or until browned and chicken is cooked all the way through), flipping once halfway through.
step-10: serve with your favorite dip and some veggies for a fun appetizer or with garlic parmesan roasted vegetables for dinner!

step-1: preheat a grill or grill plate to medium heat.
step-2: drizzle the corn with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
step-3: mix to ensure all the ears are evenly coated.
step-4: place the corn on the grill.
step-5: close the lid to keep the temperature high, and let the corn cook for about 15 minutes per side, or until slightly charred on all sides.
step-6: remove the corn from the heat and set aside.
step-7: place the garlic and butter in a microwave-safe bowl and microwave for 1 minute, or until melted.
step-8: brush the garlic butter on the corn.
step-9: sprinkle with grated parmesan cheese.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: fold the parchment paper in half, then open up.
step-3: slice the zucchini into rounds and lay them on one half of the parchment paper.
step-4: mix the minced garlic and butter in a small bowl and spoon half of the garlic butter on top of the zucchini.
step-5: sprinkle with salt and pepper.
step-6: lay the chicken on the zucchini, season with salt and pepper and spoon on the rest of the garlic butter.
step-7: top with parmesan.
step-8: fold the parchment paper over the chicken, and cinch the paper together by folding it over itself along the edges.
step-9: bake for 25-30 minutes or until internal temperature of chicken reaches 165˚f (75˚c).

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f/175˚c.
step-2: slice up the potatoes about a quarter inch thick.
step-3: in a large bowl, mix the potatoes, heavy cream, parmesan cheese, garlic powder, salt, and pepper, and stir until all the potato chips are coated.
step-4: spray a muffin tin with cooking spray, then stack about 10-12 chips in each muffin cup.
step-5: place the potato stacks in the oven for about an hour or until they are fully browned.
step-6: allow to cool, then serve with sour cream.

step-1: preheat oven to 375ºf (190ºc).
step-2: slice potato in half then take the half and quarter it.
step-3: whisk 3 eggs in a small bowl.
step-4: combine remaining ingredients in a medium bowl.
step-5: coat each wedge in egg wash, then coat in dry mix, until entirely covered.
step-6: place on a greased baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes.
step-7: allow to cool for 5 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200ºc).
step-2: separate the crowns and snip off any leaves of the broccoli.
step-3: on a prepared baking sheet, combine broccoli and remaining ingredients.
step-4: mix evenly.
step-5: bake for 35-40 minutes.
step-6: allow to cool for 5 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: carefully dry the chickpeas.
step-3: removing the skins is optional and they will come off easily.
step-4: the drier you get them, the crunchier they’ll be!
step-5: in a medium bowl, add dried chickpeas, olive oil, garlic powder, herbs and parmesan.
step-6: toss well to coat evenly.
step-7: spread chickpeas out on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-8: roast for 15-20 minutes.
step-9: mix around on baking sheet and roast for additional 15-20 minutes, or until golden.
step-10: cool for 5-10 minutes.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: trim the stem off the artichoke to create a base and also one inch (2 ½ cm) from the top.
step-3: remove the leaves from the center of the artichoke and use a spoon to scrape out the hairs on the heart of the artichoke.
step-4: squeeze the juice of one small lemon on top.
step-5: in a saucepan, boil two inches (5 cm) of salted water.
step-6: place the artichokes in the pot cover and boil for 20 minutes, or until tender.
step-7: in a separate pan, melt the butter and saute the garlic until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
step-8: squeeze in the juice of one lemon.
step-9: add in the bread crumbs, salt, pepper, and parsley.
step-10: stir until combined.
step-11: place the artichokes on a pan and fill with bread crumb mixture and top with grated parmesan.
step-12: bake for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown.
step-13: serve with dipping sauce of choice.

step-1: preheat oven to 350° f (180°c).
step-2: cut the stems off of each of the mushrooms and finely chop them, setting the mushroom caps aside for later.
step-3: heat the oil in a pan over high heat.
step-4: cook the chopped stems with the garlic, salt, and pepper for about six to eight minutes, constantly stirring.
step-5: be careful not to burn the garlic.
step-6: remove from heat.
step-7: in a medium bowl, combine cooked stems, cream cheese, breadcrumbs, half of the parmesan, parsley, salt, and pepper, mixing until evenly combined.
step-8: the mixture should be extremely thick.
step-9: space out the mushroom caps evenly on a baking sheet, upside down.
step-10: spoon a generous amount of the cream cheese mixture on top of each mushroom.
step-11: top each mushroom with a sprinkle of parmesan cheese.
step-12: bake for 20 minutes.
step-13: garnish with a sprinkle of parsley, then serve!

step-1: preheat oven to 450ºf/230ºc.
step-2: cut off top and bottom of zucchinis and slice zucchinis into ½ - ¼ inch (1.27-0.63cm) slices.
step-3: in a small bowl, whisk eggs together.
step-4: in a large bowl, mix together bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, basil, red pepper flakes, pepper, garlic powder, and salt.
step-5: take a zucchini slice and dip it in egg wash, then coat it in bread crumb mix, coating all sides and patting mixture onto both side, then place the slice on a large baking sheet.
step-6: repeat for all slices.
step-7: bake in oven for 15-20 minutes or until chips are golden brown.
step-8: flip halfway through.
step-9: in a small bowl, mix together mayonnaise, lemon juice, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
step-10: dip chips in sauce and enjoy!

step-1: remove all leaves and cut the cauliflower into small florets.
step-2: place the florets in a food processor and blend until they are a rice-like texture.
step-3: be careful not to over process or it may turn mushy.
step-4: set aside, and drain excess moisture with a towel, if desired.
step-5: in a large saucepan over medium-high heat, cook the pork until no pink is showing, then add the garlic, onions, salt, pepper, soy sauce, and honey, stirring until the sauce has started to brown.
step-6: stir until most of the liquid has reduced, then add the cauliflower rice.
step-7: cook for about 3-4 minutes until the pork is incorporated evenly into the cauliflower.
step-8: spread the rice towards the edge of the pan, creating a well in the center.
step-9: pour the beaten eggs into the well, stirring only the eggs until they are cooked.
step-10: fold the eggs into the rice, then mix in the green onions

step-1: add the ingredients into a mason jar.
step-2: screw the lid on tightly and shake vigorously.
step-3: the dressing can remain in the fridge for 1–2 weeks.
step-4: pour over your favorite salad ingredients and enjoy!

step-1: melt the butter in a pot over medium heat.
step-2: cook the garlic until it starts to brown.
step-3: add the shrimp, salt, and pepper, cooking until shrimp is pink all the way through.
step-4: add the lemon juice, chili flakes, and parsley.
step-5: add the spaghetti, and toss until evenly coated.

step-1: in a bowl, season the steak with garlic, salt, and pepper, and stir thoroughly.
step-2: on soaked bamboo sticks, skewer on the seasoned steak cubes, then potatos and onions.
step-3: repeat until the skewer is full.
step-4: on a coal bbq, cook the steak skewers for 2-3 minutes a side for medium-rare and 4-5 minutes for well done.

step-1: heat oil in a large pot over high heat.
step-2: cook mushrooms, broccoli, garlic, peppers, oregano, salt, and pepper until the vegetables are tender.
step-3: add in the pasta and stir until evenly mixed.

step-1: make the gâteau invisible: peel the apples and remove the cores.
step-2: slice them very thinly.
step-3: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-4: in a medium bowl, whisk the eggs and sugar until pale.
step-5: add the milk and melted butter and mix well.
step-6: sift in the flour and combine.
step-7: add the sliced apples.
step-8: using a rubber spatula, coat the apples well with the batter.
step-9: spoon the apples into a parchment paper-lined loaf pan, then pour over the remaining batter.
step-10: top with sliced almonds.
step-11: bake for 40 minutes.
step-12: cover with a foil and bake another 10 minutes.
step-13: let cool, then remove the cake from the pan.
step-14: make the butter caramel sauce.
step-15: in a microwave-safe bowl, add the sugar and butter.
step-16: microwave 2 minutes or until sugar turns dark brown.
step-17: using oven mitts, very carefully take the bowl from the microwave.
step-18: the bowl and sugar will be extremely hot so be careful when you are handling them.
step-19: immediately add the cream and whisk well with a metal spoon or whisk (this will splatter a bit, but keep stirring!).
step-20: pour the caramel over the cake and serve.

step-1: in a large pot over medium heat, combine the milk, water, sugar, salt, and butter.
step-2: cook until the butter melts.
step-3: add the flour, all at once, and using a flexible spatula, stir until combined.
step-4: continue to mix until the dough pulls away from the sides of the pan and forms into a ball.
step-5: remove the pot from the heat and let cool for 2-3 minutes.
step-6: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-7: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-8: mix in the eggs, one by one, only adding the next once the previous is fully incorporated into the dough.
step-9: transfer the dough to a piping bag fitted with a large round tip or a zip-top bag with a corner snipped off.
step-10: pipe the dough straight down onto the prepared baking sheet in 1-inch (2 cm) circles, leaving 1 inch (2 cm) of space between each one.
step-11: you may need to use another baking sheet.
step-12: use a wet finger to press down any peaks.
step-13: bake for 25-30 minutes, until puffed and golden brown.
step-14: let the puffs cool completely on a wire rack.
step-15: make the filling: in a large bowl, use an electric hand mixer on high speed to beat the heavy cream until soft peaks form.
step-16: pour in the condensed milk and continue to beat until stiff peaks form.
step-17: add the food coloring and beat to incorporate.
step-18: transfer the cream to a piping bag with a pointed round tip or a zip-top bag with a corner snipped off.
step-19: add the white chocolate to a medium microwave-safe bowl and microwave until melted, stirring every 30 seconds, about 2 minutes total.
step-20: use a bamboo skewer to poke a hole in the top of each puff, then pipe in the pink or blue cream, filling each puff about ⅔ of the way.
step-21: dip the tops of the filled cream puffs in the white chocolate and decorate with sprinkles, if desired.
step-22: let cool on a wire rack until the chocolate sets.
step-23: arrange the cream puffs in a tower, then serve.

step-1: place a chicken breast between 2 sheets of plastic wrap.
step-2: pound evenly to about ¼-inch (½ cm) thick, then season both sides with salt and pepper.
step-3: place 4 snap peas and a few carrot slices at the bottom edge of the chicken, then roll up tightly and wrap in plastic wrap.
step-4: repeat with the remaining chicken and vegetables.
step-5: chill the chicken rolls in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
step-6: heat the sesame oil in a medium saucepan over high heat.
step-7: add the garlic and ginger and cook until they are toasty.
step-8: add the chicken stock, sugar, chile flakes, rice vinegar, soy sauce, tomato paste, and cornstarch slurry and whisk to combine.
step-9: cook until the sauce coats the back of a spoon and leaves a path when you run your finger through it.
step-10: remove from the heat and set aside.
step-11: heat the oil in a large pot until it reaches 350°f (180°c).
step-12: unwrap the chicken, then roll in the cornstarch until evenly coated.
step-13: fry two chicken rolls at a time for 5 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and the internal temperature reaches 165°f (75°c).
step-14: transfer the chicken to a wire rack to drain.
step-15: if the chicken is not cooked through by the time it is golden brown on the outside, bake in the oven at 325°f (170°c) until that temperature is reached.
step-16: slice the chicken rolls and serve with rice alongside.
step-17: pour the sauce over the chicken and sprinkle with sesame seeds and scallions for garnish.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine 1 cup rice wine (235 ml), ¼ cup (60 ml) of soy sauce, and cubed chicken thighs.
step-2: stir and cover with plastic wrap.
step-3: refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to an hour.
step-4: in a separate large bowl, combine 1 cup of flour (140 g) and 1 tablespoon of salt.
step-5: remove chicken from wine/soy marinade and place in flour mixture.
step-6: mix thoroughly, until all the chicken pieces are coated.
step-7: fill a dutch oven or large pot at least 2 inches (5 cm) deep with vegetable oil.
step-8: heat oil to 365˚f (185˚c).
step-9: place chicken pieces in frying oil, stirring occasionally.
step-10: fry until they are golden brown, roughly 4-5 minutes.
step-11: remove chicken from oil and set aside to drain on paper towels or a wire rack.
step-12: in a large skillet, bring one tablespoon of vegetable oil to medium-high heat.
step-13: add garlic and ginger, stirring frequently for one minute.
step-14: add dried chili pods.
step-15: continue stirring for 30 seconds before adding rice wine, soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, and sugar.
step-16: stir occasionally until mixture is bubbling.
step-17: add cornstarch slurry, stirring frequently.
step-18: the sauce should begin to thicken in a minute or less.
step-19: add cooked chicken pieces, stirring them to coat with the sauce.
step-20: remove from heat and garnish with green onions and rice.

step-1: chop the tempeh into chicken nugget-sized pieces and transfer to a mixing bowl.
step-2: add the cornstarch, paprika, ginger, garlic, sesame oil, rice wine, and soy sauce to the bowl.
step-3: mix until incorporated.
step-4: cover and chill in fridge for 1 hour minimum.
step-5: add oil to a pan on medium-high heat and pan-fry tempeh until browned on both sides.
step-6: remove from pan.
step-7: in the same pan, add in oil and sesame oil on medium-high heat.
step-8: add the garlic, ginger, and red pepper flakes, and cook until golden brown and aromatic, about 1 minute.
step-9: add the tomato paste and vegetable broth, and stir until incorporated.
step-10: add the soy sauce, rice vinegar, and honey, and stir until all are incorporated.
step-11: add the cornstarch slurry (mix the cornstarch with the water in a small bowl until paste forms) into sauce mixture and stir until sauce thickens.
step-12: return the tempeh to the pan and allow to incorporate with the sauce.
step-13: top with sesame seeds (optional).

step-1: cover cake in smooth layers of fondant.
step-2: cut the geode shape out of the side of the cake.
step-3: spread buttercream frosting all along the inside of the cut.
step-4: mix alcohol with food coloring until it reaches the desired shade of gray.
step-5: paint a thin dark line around the edge of the cut.
step-6: apply a row of piping gel in the center of the cut.
step-7: press rock candy into the piping gel, starting with the darkest shade.
step-8: continue laying out rows of piping gel and pressing in the rock candy, applying lighter colors and smaller pieces as you move farther out toward the edge of the cut.

step-1: sauté the bacon in a large pan over medium heat until golden brown, about 10 minutes.
step-2: remove the bacon from the pan with a slotted spoon, leaving as much grease as possible in the pan, and set aside to drain on paper towels.
step-3: in the pan with the bacon fat, sauté the onions until translucent, for about 5 minutes.
step-4: remove the onions from the pan, leaving behind any remaining bacon fat.
step-5: add the vegetable oil to the bacon fat and heat over medium-high heat.
step-6: add the potatoes to the pan.
step-7: season with salt and pepper and sauté the potatoes until they begin to get a golden crust, 15-20 minutes.
step-8: return the bacon and cooked onions to the pan and toss gently with the potatoes.
step-9: sauté for another 5 minutes, until everything is heated through and golden brown.
step-10: transfer to a serving bowl and garnish with parsley.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (205°c).
step-2: combine the eggs, sugar, salt, warm milk, vanilla, flour and melted butter in a blender or processor until smooth.
step-3: melt 2 tbsp.
step-4: butter in a skillet.
step-5: pour the batter into the skillet.
step-6: transfer skillet to the oven and bake at 400°f (205°c) for 25-30 minutes.
step-7: remove from skillet and let cool slightly on wire rack.
step-8: powder with sugar and serve with sliced strawberries.

step-1: add banana, pineapple, peaches, almond milk, and kale to a blender and blend on high until smooth.
add onions and 2 tablespoons of oil to a blender and pulse until smooth.
step-2: transfer to a medium bowl.
step-3: add the diced tomatoes, tomato paste, and habanero pepper to the blender, and pulse until smooth.
step-4: transfer to a separate medium bowl.
step-5: heat the remaining ⅓ cup (80 ml) of oil in a large, heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat.
step-6: once the oil is shimmering, add the onion puree and cook until the water has cooked out and the puree is starting to brown, about 10 minutes.
step-7: stir in the tomato puree and add the curry powder, garlic powder, ginger, dried herbs, and crushed bouillon cubes.
step-8: cook for 20-30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the stew has reduced by half and is deep red in color.
step-9: add the rice, mixed vegetables, and water.
step-10: bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover the pot with foil and a lid.
step-11: simmer for another 30 minutes, until the rice is cooked through and the liquid is absorbed.

step-1: preheat the oven to 300°f (150°c).
step-2: lay the ribs on a long sheet of aluminum foil.
step-3: combine the paprika, pepper, brown sugar, salt, garlic powder, onion powder, cumin, and chili powder in a small bowl, then cover the ribs evenly on both sides, pressing the rub into any cracks and smoothing out any large lumps.
step-4: wrap the foil around the ribs, making sure they’re completely sealed.
step-5: it’s important that the juices of the ribs stay inside the foil to keep the ribs moist during cooking.
step-6: use more sheets of foil if necessary.
step-7: bake the ribs for 3-3½ hours, until tender.
step-8: unwrap the ribs carefully, then wiggle the bones out slowly.
step-9: if you’re having trouble removing the bones, use a knife to make small cuts in the meat to aid their removal.
step-10: preheat the broiler on your oven.
step-11: combine the barbecue sauce and honey in a small bowl and brush both sides of the deboned slab of ribs generously, being sure to carefully handle the ribs since the meat will be super tender.
step-12: broil the ribs for about 5 minutes until the glaze is bubbling and starting to brown.
step-13: slice the bread loaf in half lengthwise, then butter both sides of the bread.
step-14: sprinkle sesame seeds on the outside of the bread, then toast under the broiler for a few minutes.
step-15: keep a careful eye on it as they will burn extremely quickly.
step-16: with two long spatulas or knives, carefully transfer the glazed ribs to the bottom bread half, then top with the caramelized onions, parsley, and the top half of bread.
step-17: cut into about 8 2-inch (5-cm) sandwiches, and serve.

step-1: in a pan, put the sweetened condensed milk, butter, and semisweet chocolate.
step-2: stir gently over low heat until the brigadeiro doesn’t stick to the bottom.
step-3: pour the brigadeiro in a big bowl and chill in the refrigerator for 4 hours.
step-4: with a spoon, unstick the corners of the the brigadeiro.
step-5: with buttered hands, remove the big brigadeiro and shape into a ball.
step-6: roll the big brigadeiro in chocolate sprinkles and serve in a shallow plate.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: grease a 12x4½- in (30x11-cm) baking pan and line with parchment paper.
step-3: make the shortbread: in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, granulated sugar, and salt.
step-4: add the butter.
step-5: use your hands to work it into the flour until a dough forms.
step-6: transfer to the prepared loaf pan and spread evenly.
step-7: cover with foil.
step-8: bake for 45 minutes, then remove the foil and bake for another 45-60 minutes, until light golden brown.
step-9: let cool completely.
step-10: make the caramel filling: in a medium, heavy-bottomed saucepan, combine the brown sugar, corn syrup, butter, cream, and salt.
step-11: over medium-high heat, bring the caramel to a boil and let cook for 5 minutes.
step-12: then, reduce the heat to low and cook for 10 more minutes, until slightly deeper golden in color.
step-13: remove the pot from the heat.
step-14: pour the caramel over the shortbread cookie.
step-15: let cool in the refrigerator for 2 hours or until set.
step-16: once the cookie has chilled, line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-17: make the chocolate ridges.
step-18: pour ⅓ of the melted chocolate onto the prepared baking sheet and spread into a 13x5-inch (33x12 cm) rectangle.
step-19: lift the cookie out of the pan using the parchment paper, and remove the paper.
step-20: place the cookie on top of the chocolate rectangle.
step-21: pour the remaining melted chocolate on top of the caramel.
step-22: spread the chocolate to the edges in a zig-zag motion to create textured ridges.
step-23: return to the refrigerator for 20 minutes, until the chocolate hardens.
step-24: while the cookie is chilling, make the chocolate glaze: add the chocolate chips and coconut oil to a medium microwave-safe bowl.
step-25: melt in the microwave in 30 seconds intervals, stirring between each, until smooth.
step-26: set aside to cool for 15 minutes.
step-27: remove the cookie from the refrigerator.
step-28: invert 2 jars or glasses on a baking sheet or piece of parchment paper.
step-29: set the cookie bar on the jars and pour the chocolate glaze over the cookie.
step-30: use a spatula to carefully push the chocolate over the edges of the cookie to coat the sides, being careful not to flatten the edges.
step-31: carefully return to the refrigerator to chill for at least 1 hour, until the chocolate is hardened.
step-32: keep refrigerated until ready to serve.
step-33: cut into ¾-inch (2 cm) thick slices with a sharp knife.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c) and position a rack at the bottom of the oven, removing the other rack.
step-2: grease the ramekin with the softened butter and pour in ¼ cup (50 g) of sugar.
step-3: tilt the ramekin to coat with sugar evenly, then pour out the excess and set the ramekin aside.
step-4: in a medium saucepan, scald the milk over medium heat.
step-5: just before boiling, remove the milk from the heat and whisk in the chopped chocolate until melted.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: in a large bowl, whisk together the egg yolks, ¼ cup (50 g) of sugar, the flour, salt, and vanilla, until smooth.
step-8: add ½ cup (120 ml) of the chocolate milk mixture to the yolks and whisk until combined.
step-9: this will temper the egg yolks so they don’t curdle when added to the rest of the chocolate mixture.
step-10: return the pan with the remaining chocolate milk mixture back to the stove over medium heat and pour in the chocolate egg yolk mixture.
step-11: whisk constantly until thick.
step-12: remove the chocolate pastry cream from the heat and transfer to a large bowl.
step-13: cover with plastic wrap, making sure the plastic touches the surface to prevent a skin from forming.
step-14: chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-15: in a large bowl, combine the egg whites and cream of tartar.
step-16: with an electric hand mixer, whip the egg whites until they turn opaque and leave trails.
step-17: gradually add the remaining ¼ cup (50 g) of sugar and beat until stiff peaks form.
step-18: spoon about 1 cup (240 ml) of the whites into the chocolate pastry cream.
step-19: fold until no white streaks remain.
step-20: gently fold in the rest of the whites in 2 additions, being careful not to deflate the whites.
step-21: once no white streaks are visible, transfer the batter to the prepared ramekin and smooth out the top.
step-22: run your thumb between the outside edge of the dish and the batter to create a border.
step-23: reduce the oven temperature to 375°f (190°c), then immediately place the soufflé in the oven and bake for 45-50 minutes, until the soufflé has risen over the edge of the dish.
step-24: do not open the oven while baking.
step-25: dust the soufflé with powdered sugar and top with whipped cream.

step-1: generously butter a 9-inch (23cm) cast iron or cake pan.
step-2: in a large bowl, whisk together warm milk, melted butter, and granulated sugar.
step-3: the mixture should be just warm, registering between 100-110˚f (40˚c).
step-4: if hotter, allow to cool slightly.
step-5: sprinkle the yeast evenly over the warm mixture and let sit for 1 minute.
step-6: add 4 cups (500 grams) of all-purpose flour to the milk mixture and mix with a wooden spoon until just combined.
step-7: cover the bowl with a towel or plastic wrap and set in a warm place to rise for 1 hour.
step-8: preheat oven to 325˚f (160˚c).
step-9: after 1 hour, the dough should have nearly doubled in size.
step-10: remove the towel and add an additional ¾ cup (95 grams) of flour, the baking powder, and salt.
step-11: stir well, then turn out onto a well-floured surface.
step-12: knead the dough lightly, adding additional flour as necessary, until the dough just loses its stickiness and does not stick to the surface.
step-13: roll the dough out into a large rectangle, about ½-inch (1.5 cm) thick.
step-14: fix corners to make sure they are sharp and even.
step-15: in a small bowl combine the filling ingredients and stir to combine.
step-16: spread the filling mixture evenly over the rolled out dough, spreading right to the edges.
step-17: using a pizza cutter, make 3 horizontal cuts to divide the dough into four long, evenly sized strips.
step-18: starting from the bottom, roll the first strip up right to left.
step-19: take the first roll and place it back on top of the next strip, starting again on the right side and rolling up right to left, building on the first.
step-20: continue with the remaining two strips until you have a giant cinnamon roll.
step-21: place the giant cinnamon roll in the prepared cast iron or cake pan and cover with plastic wrap.
step-22: place in a warm spot and leave to rise for 30 minutes.
step-23: the cinnamon roll should expand to the edges of the pan during this time.
step-24: bake for 45 minutes.
step-25: cover the cinnamon roll with foil to prevent the outside from burning, and bake for an additional 35 minutes.
step-26: while the cinnamon roll is baking, prepare the frosting.
step-27: in a medium-size mixing bowl, whisk together cream cheese, butter, vanilla, whole milk, and powdered sugar, until smooth.
step-28: remove the cinnamon roll from the oven and let cool in the pan for at least 20 minutes.
step-29: once cool, remove from pan and drizzle frosting over the roll before serving.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, whisk together the brown sugar, white sugar, and melted butter.
step-3: add in the eggs and vanilla, and whisk until combined.
step-4: add in the flour, baking powder, and salt, and mix together until just combined.
step-5: add in the chocolate chips and mix again.
step-6: spay two round pans with nonstick cooking spray and separate the cookie dough into each pan.
step-7: pat down the dough with a spatula until the surface is even, and bake for 35 minutes or until golden brown.
step-8: while the cookies are baking, place plastic wrap in a springform pan.
step-9: pour softened vanilla ice cream into the springform pan and spread evenly.
step-10: freeze until solid, about 1 hour.
step-11: once the cookies have baked and cooled, turn them over onto a tray.
step-12: place the ice cream disk on top of one half and cover with the other half.
step-13: with your hand press the mini chocolate chips to the outside of the cookie.
step-14: freeze again until solid.

step-1: preheat the oven to 325˚f (160˚c).
step-2: place cookie dough in a medium bowl and add the flour.
step-3: mix until the flour is incorporated.
step-4: the extra flour will help keep the cookie from running off of the bowl.
step-5: line a baking sheet with parchment paper, and wrap an ovenproof bowl in foil.
step-6: spray with nonstick spray and press the cookie dough onto the bowl until it is completely covered.
step-7: bake for 25 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-8: remove from oven and cool for 30 minutes with the bowl facing down.
step-9: once it has cooled, flip over, remove the ovenproof bowl, and allow the cookie to finish cooling.
step-10: meanwhile, microwave the chocolate chips with the coconut oil for 1 minute, stirring every 20 seconds, until the chocolate has fully melted.
step-11: pour the melted chocolate into the cookie bowl and spread it around until the inside of the bowl is fully covered, pouring the excess chocolate out.
step-12: freeze for 20 minutes, or until the chocolate has fully hardened.
step-13: fill with vanilla and chocolate ice cream, banana, strawberries, and whipped cream.

step-1: make mochi.
step-2: combine glutinous rice flour, sugar, matcha, and water in a microwave-safe bowl.
step-3: whisk until smooth.
step-4: cover and microwave for 3 minutes.
step-5: mix well with using a wooden spatula.
step-6: line a 10-inch (25 cm) bowl with plastic, set it aside, and sprinkle your tabletop with enough potato starch to avoid sticking.
step-7: mix the mochi mixture and place on top of the starch.
step-8: roll out the mochi larger than the bowl, about 15 inches (38 cm) across.
step-9: lay mochi over the plastic-lined bowl.
step-10: make the matcha ice cream.
step-11: in a large bowl, add heavy cream, condensed milk, and matcha.
step-12: using a hand mixer, whip until thickened to soft peaks.
step-13: add the ice cream mixture into the mochi-lined bowl.
step-14: take the excess mochi and lay it over the middle, encasing the ice cream.
step-15: cover with plastic.
step-16: freeze at least 6 hours or overnight.
step-17: bring the mochi ice cream to room temperature for 15-30 minutes before serving so mochi has time to soften.
step-18: garnish with extra matcha on top, if you please.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a large mixing bowl, combine the cake mix with the water, oil, and eggs, and stir until well combined.
step-3: transfer the mixture to a well-greased bundt pan.
step-4: bake for 35-45 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean.
step-5: heat the heavy cream in a small saucepan until just boiling.
step-6: transfer to a medium mixing bowl with the dark chocolate and mix until well combined.
step-7: invert the bundt cake onto a serving dish.
step-8: pour the chocolate ganache in the center hole, allowing it to overflow and cover all of the cake.
step-9: dust the cake with cocoa powder and allow ganache to rest for 30 minutes.

step-1: make the base cookie dough.
step-2: in a large bowl, whisk together the brown sugar, granulated sugar, salt, and butter until a paste has combined with no lumps.
step-3: whisk in the egg and vanilla, beating until light ribbons fall off the whisk.
step-4: sift in the flour and baking soda, then fold the mixture with a spatula, being careful not to overmix.
step-5: this will cause the gluten in the flour to toughen, which will result in cakier cookies.
step-6: divide the dough evenly between 6 medium bowls.
step-7: make chocolate chip cookie dough by adding the chocolate chips to the first bowl.
step-8: mix well and set aside.
step-9: make peanut butter cookie dough by adding the peanuts and peanut butter to the second bowl.
step-10: mix well and set aside.
step-11: make white chocolate macadamia nut cookie dough by adding the white chocolate chips and macadamia nuts to the third bowl.
step-12: mix well and set aside.
step-13: make chocolate candy cookie dough by adding chocolate candies to the fourth bowl.
step-14: mix well and set aside.
step-15: make double chocolate cookie dough by adding chocolate chips and cocoa powder to the fifth bowl.
step-16: mix well and set aside.
step-17: make caramel and pretzel cookie dough by adding chopped caramel and pretzels to the sixth bowl.
step-18: mix well and set aside.
step-19: line a 10-inch (30 cm) cast iron skillet with parchment paper.
step-20: make a triangular shape with the chocolate chip cookie dough and press into ⅙ of the pan.
step-21: repeat with the remaining doughs.
step-22: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-23: chill the pan for at least 30 minutes, up to overnight.
step-24: bake the cookie for 30-45 minutes or stick a toothpick into the center of the cookie and the toothpick comes out clean
step-25: cool the cookie for 10-15 minutes before slicing and serving.

step-1: in a large bowl, whisk together the water and sugar.
step-2: add the yeast and let rest for 5 minutes, until it starts to foam.
step-3: add the flour, salt, and 1 tablespoon of oil, and mix thoroughly until the dough comes together.
step-4: remove the dough, grease the bowl with the remaining tablespoon of olive oil, then return the dough to the bowl and cover with a dish towel or plastic wrap.
step-5: let sit in a warm place for 1 hour, until the dough has doubled in size.
step-6: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-7: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-8: using your fingers or a rolling pin, stretch or roll the dough out into a long, thin strip, about 30 inches (76 cm) long and 4 inches (10 cm) wide.
step-9: spread the softened cream cheese down the middle of the dough strip, leaving a 1-inch (2 cm) border on each end.
step-10: sprinkle the parmesan, chives, and black pepper over the first third of the cream cheese on the dough strip.
step-11: spread the pizza sauce over the middle third of cream cheese.
step-12: place the mozzarella and pepperoni over the sauce.
step-13: sprinkle the bacon and cheddar cheese over the cream cheese on the last third of the dough strip.
step-14: fold and pinch the dough around the cheese fillings along the entire strip, ensuring the ends are closed.
step-15: roll slightly to seal and lengthen.
step-16: carefully form a pretzel shape by taking the ends of the strip, making a “u” shape, twisting the ends around each other, and connecting the ends to the bottom of the “u” shape.
step-17: transfer the pretzel to the prepared baking sheet and brush with egg wash.
step-18: sprinkle with coarse salt.
step-19: bake for 25-30 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-20: cool for 10 minutes, then brush with melted butter before serving.

step-1: in a small bowl, place half of the chocolate chips.
step-2: melt in the microwave in 30 second intervals, stirring in between, until fully melted.
step-3: pour melted chocolate into a 10-inch (25 ½ cm) tart pan making sure to coat the entire pan, including all sides.
step-4: refrigerate until set.
step-5: in a large bowl, place the peanut butter, powdered sugar, and softened butter and mix until smooth.
step-6: pour the peanut butter into the tart pan and smooth the surface.
step-7: melt remaining chocolate and pour over the peanut butter.
step-8: smooth out the chocolate making sure it covers the entire surface.
step-9: refrigerate until set, about 1 hour.
step-10: slice and serve.

step-1: make the pumpkin pudding: place the pumpkin in a medium bowl, cover the bowl with plastic wrap, and microwave for 5 minutes, until the pumpkin starts to soften.
step-2: let cool.
step-3: in a microwave-proof ramekin, combine the water and gelatin and mix well.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: microwave the gelatin mixture for 10 seconds, then mix well.
step-6: combine the pumpkin, milk, heavy cream, maple syrup, and gelatin mixture in a blender.
step-7: blend until smooth.
step-8: place a medium bowl into a large bowl filled with ice.
step-9: strain the pumpkin mixture through a sieve into the medium bowl.
step-10: whisk until the mixture begins to thicken.
step-11: transfer the mixture to bundt pan and chill in the refrigerator for 2 hours.
step-12: make the chocolate ganache: heat the heavy cream in a small saucepan until just boiling.
step-13: transfer to a medium bowl with the chocolate and mix until well combined and smooth.
step-14: invert the pudding onto a serving dish.
step-15: pour the chocolate ganache in the center hole until it overflows over the pudding cake and dust the cake with cocoa powder.

step-1: to a large pot, add the 8 cups (1.9 l) of cold water and sprinkle in the agar agar powder.
step-2: whisk to combine.
step-3: let the agar dissolve in the water for about 5 minutes, whisking occasionally.
step-4: add the sugar and whisk again to combine.
step-5: place the pot over medium heat and bring to a simmer.
step-6: simmer for 3 minutes, until all of the agar and sugar have dissolved, then remove from the heat.
step-7: do not keep over the heat for too long or the agar will denature!
step-8: pour the agar mixture into a large glass or ceramic bowl with a smooth bottom.
step-9: refrigerate overnight, or until set.
step-10: make the brown sugar syrup: in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, combine the brown sugar and water.
step-11: stir to dissolve the sugar.
step-12: bring the syrup to a boil and remove the syrup from the heat, transfer to a liquid measuring cup, and refrigerate until cool and thickened, about 1 hour.
step-13: invert the raindrop cake onto a large plate or cutting board.
step-14: top with the roasted soybean flour and brown sugar syrup.
step-15: serve immediately.
step-16:
enjoy!

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a bowl, add the italian sausage, ground beef, bread crumbs, parsley, salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, parmesan, eggs, and milk, and mix until well combined.
step-3: line a large glass bowl with plastic wrap, and spray thoroughly with cooking spray.
step-4: spread the meat mixture along the bottom and sides of the bowl, about ½-inch (1 cm) thick.
step-5: sprinkle mozzarella in the base of the meat mixture, then top the spaghetti with sauce on top.
step-6: using the plastic wrap, form the meat into a large ball, ensuring there are no holes or cracks.
step-7: place ball on a foil-lined baking sheet.
step-8: bake for 40 minutes.
step-9: place a large spoon full of marinara in the center of a plate.
step-10: top with the spaghetti-stuffed meatball, marinara, parmesan, and basil.

step-1: preheat the oven to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-2: season the steaks with the salt, pepper, paprika, garlic powder, cumin, and cayenne, rubbing fully over the meat.
step-3: add oil to a skillet over medium-high heat and add the steaks.
step-4: cook the steaks for 3 minutes per side.
step-5: let the steaks rest for 10 minutes, and then cut into bite-sized pieces.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: spray a bundt pan with cooking spray and create three layers of nachos consisting of shredded cheddar cheese, sliced jalapeños, diced red onion, diced tomatoes, black beans, and the steak.
step-8: top with more cheese.
step-9: place into the oven to melt and heat up for about 10 minutes.
step-10: take a serving tray and place on top of the warm bundt pan and carefully invert the nacho ring onto the tray.
step-11: top with sour cream, guacamole, pico de gallo, or whatever else you would like.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, lay 5 of the bacon strips down back to back.
step-3: lifting up every other strip, fold about 1-inch (2 cm) the bacon back on itself.
step-4: lay another slice of bacon perpendicular to the strips and fold the flaps back over the horizontal strip of bacon.
step-5: repeat with the rest of the bacon until a tight weave has formed.
step-6: bake for 30 minutes, or until desired crispiness has been reached.
step-7: in a 10-inch (25 cm) cast iron skillet heat the butter over medium-low heat.
step-8: add the onions and cook until a deep gold color, about 45 minutes.
step-9: remove from heat.
step-10: in a bowl, mix together the beef, garlic powder, paprika, salt and pepper.
step-11: divide the beef mixture in half.
step-12: on a piece of parchment paper spread half of the meat into a large circle about 10 inches (25 cm) long and 1 inch (2 cm) thick.
step-13: repeat with the other half of meat on a separate piece of parchment paper.
step-14: sprinkle half of the cheddar and half of the monterey jack over one disk of ground beef, along with half of the parsley.
step-15: place the bacon lattice on top.
step-16: sprinkle the rest of the cheddar and monterey on top of the bacon lattice, along with the rest of the parsley.
step-17: top with the caramelized onions.
step-18: place the other circle of meat on directly on top.
step-19: begin pinching together the meat patties making sure the fillings are not coming out, until a giant burger is formed.
step-20: heat a greased 10 inch (25 cm) cast iron skillet over medium heat.
step-21: place the giant burger in the skillet carefully while peeling away the bottom piece of parchment.
step-22: cook for 5 minutes, until it is a deep brown color.
step-23: using a large plate, place it over the skillet.
step-24: while holding the plate in place flip the skillet so the burger falls onto to plate.
step-25: place the skillet back on the heat and slide the burger back into the pan so the cooked side is facing up now.
step-26: cook for another 5 minutes.
step-27: remove from heat and place skillet in the oven to finish cooking for 5 minutes
step-28: remove from pan using spatulas and place on a cutting board for serving.
step-29: cut into 8 or more pieces.
step-30: serve on a roll with lettuce and tomato.

step-1: make the black bean & corn burger mix: heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
step-2: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the onion and cook for 3-4 minutes, until semi-translucent.
step-3: add the garlic and carrots and cook for 2-3 minutes, until the carrots are partially tender.
step-4: add the cumin, chili powder, coriander, cayenne, salt, pepper, and soy sauce.
step-5: cook for 2-3 minutes more, until the carrots are tender.
step-6: remove from the heat and set aside.
step-7: add the black beans to a large bowl, and mash with a potato masher until mostly.
step-8: add the oats, corn, and carrot mixture and mix until well-combined.
step-9: grease a large baking sheet with cooking spray.
step-10: using a spoon and your hands, shape the black bean burger mix into a quarter circle shape.
step-11: make the chickpea, quinoa, & sun-dried tomato burger mix: in a food processor, combine the chickpeas, quinoa, bread crumbs, sun-dried tomatoes, tahini, parsley, garlic, salt, pepper, oregano, and basil.
step-12: pulse until smooth.
step-13: shape the chickpea, quinoa burger mix into a quarter circle next to the black bean burger mix.
step-14: add to the baking sheet with the other burger mix.
step-15: make the sweet potato & white bean burger mix: in a large bowl, combine the white beans and sweet potato, and mash with a potato masher until smooth.
step-16: add the onion, bread crumbs, nutritional yeast, parsley, lemon juice, red chile flakes, garlic powder, salt, and pepper, and mix until well-combined.
step-17: add to the baking sheet with the other burger mixes.
step-18: make the mushroom lentil burger mix: in a small bowl, combine the flax meal and water to make a flax egg.
step-19: set aside.
step-20: heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
step-21: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the mushrooms and cook until most of the juices have evaporated, 7-8 minutes.
step-22: add the soy sauce and paprika and cook for 2-3 more minutes.
step-23: transfer to a large bowl and set aside.
step-24: heat another tablespoon of olive oil in the pan over medium heat.
step-25: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the onion and cook for 3-5 minutes, until semi-translucent.
step-26: add the garlic and cook for 2 minutes, until fragrant.
step-27: add the salt and pepper, and cook for another 2 minutes.
step-28: transfer the onion mixture to a food processor and add the lentils, oats, and flax egg.
step-29: pulse until a chunky paste forms.
step-30: transfer the lentil mixture to the bowl with the mushrooms and mix until well-combined.
step-31: add to the baking sheet.
step-32: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-33: shape the burger mixes to match the size of your loaf of bread.
step-34: press the borders together to create one cohesive patty.
step-35: bake the patty for 20 minutes.
step-36: make the special sauce: in a small bowl, combine the vegan mayo, ketchup, mustard, salt, and pepper, and stir until combined.
step-37: transfer to a squeeze bottle.
step-38: remove the patty from the oven ,and top the mushroom lentil and black bean & corn sections with the vegan provolone cheese.
step-39: broil for 5 minutes, or until the cheese has melted.
step-40: with a large bread knife, slice the loaf of bread in half to make a giant bun.
step-41: with large spatulas or bench scrapers, transfer the veggie burger patty onto the bottom half of the bun.
step-42: spread the avocado crema on top of the the chickpea quinoa, sweet potato & white bean sections.
step-43: squeeze the special sauce onto the black bean & corn and mushroom lentil sections.
step-44: layer on the lettuce, tomatoes, and red onion, and top with the top bun.

step-1: make the filling: in a large bowl, combine the whipped cream and marshmallow fluff.
step-2: beat with an electric hand mixer until stiff peaks form.
step-3: use a serrated knife to carefully remove the domed top from the cakes, leaving a flat, even surface.
step-4: save the scraps for later – you can eat them with leftover melted chocolate or crumbled over ice cream.
step-5: spread the filling over the bottom cake, leaving about ¾-inch (2 cm) border around the edge.
step-6: place the other cake upside down on top of the filling.
step-7: trim the cake into a hexagon.
step-8: transfer the cake to a wire rack set over a baking sheet.
step-9: make the coating: fill a medium saucepan halfway with water.
step-10: bring to a boil, reduce the heat to medium-low.
step-11: combine the white chocolate chips and coconut oil in a medium heatproof bowl and set it over the pan (make sure the bottom of the bowl isn’t touching the water).
step-12: when the white chocolate and coconut oil begin to melt, mix together until smooth.
step-13: be careful, as the bowl will be very hot.
step-14: pour the melted white chocolate mixture over the cake.
step-15: use a knife to spread to the edges and down the sides.
step-16: once smooth, run a knife under the edges of the cake so it doesn’t stick to the rack and place the cake in the refrigerator until the coating is set, 10-15 minutes.
step-17: transfer the melted dark chocolate chips to a piping bag or zip-top bag with a corner snipped off.
step-18: carefully pipe chocolate zebra stripes onto the cake.
step-19: return to the refrigerator to set for 10-15 minutes.
step-20: remove the cake once the stripes are dry.
step-21: to serve, slowly and carefully slice with a serrated knife so the shell doesn’t crack.
step-22: score the slices with a paring knife before cutting to make it easier, if needed.

step-1: cut the lemons and limes in half and hollow them out.
step-2: leave aside.
step-3: soften gelatin leaves in tepid water for 5-10 mins, then remove and wring out.
step-4: boil the gelatin in 100ml (½ cup) of the tonic water until dissolved, then add sugar and stir.
step-5: remove from heat.
step-6: add the remainder of the cold tonic water.
step-7: zest some lemon and lime into the mixture and stir.
step-8: add the gin and stir.
step-9: pour mixture into the hollowed out lemon and lime halves.
step-10: refrigerate for 3-4 hours until set.
step-11: flip the lemons and limes over so that the rind is facing skyward, then cut in half.

step-1: place a large heatproof bowl over a pan of simmering water.
step-2: add the dark chocolate and double cream, melting and mixing completely.
step-3: add the gin, tonic, lime juice, lime zest, and butter, and mix.
step-4: remove from heat and refrigerate for 3 hours, or overnight.
step-5: use a melon baller or spoon to scoop out the truffle mixture and shape into small balls.
step-6: freeze for 30 minutes.
step-7: using a fork, dip the frozen truffle balls into melted white chocolate to coat.
step-8: drizzle with more white chocolate, and sprinkle with lime zest.
step-9: refrigerate for 30 minutes, or until solid.

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine the lime rinds and sugar.
step-2: toss to coat the rinds with the sugar, then cover.
step-3: let sit, stirring every 45 minutes, for about 4 hours, or until the sugar is completely dissolved and there’s syrup in the bottom of the bowl.
step-4: strain the syrup through a fine-mesh sieve or cheesecloth, pushing to extract as much liquid as possible.
step-5: store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 months.
step-6: in a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the rum, lime juice, simple syrup, and mint leaves.
step-7: shake vigorously for 20 seconds.
step-8: strain into a glass filled with ice and top with ginger beer.
step-9: garnish with the slice of lime and mint leaves.

step-1: heat 1 tablespoon of sesame oil in a large, non-stick skillet over medium heat.
step-2: pour in the shrimp and season with ¼ teaspoon of the salt.
step-3: fry the shrimp for 1 minute on each side.
step-4: remove the shrimp from the pan and pour in the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil.
step-5: toss in the mushrooms, asparagus, and remaining ¼ teaspoon of salt and sauté for a few minutes until they begin to soften.
step-6: add in the ginger and soy sauce and sauté until the ginger is fragrant, about 30 seconds.
step-7: toss the shrimp back into the pan and mix until everything is well incorporated and the shrimp is fully cooked, about 1 minute.
step-8: divide the mixture evenly between 4 bowls.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, whisk the melted butter, brown sugar, molasses, salt, cinnamon, ginger, and allspice until smooth.
step-3: whisk in the egg until combined.
step-4: fold in the baking powder, baking soda, and half of the flour.
step-5: add the rest of the flour until dough comes together.
step-6: wrap in plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-7: roll out the dough to ¼-inch (6 mm) thickness.
step-8: cut into the desired shape using small knife.
step-9: take the extra dough and roll out again to ¼-inch (6 mm) thickness.
step-10: continue to cut shapes until dough is used.
step-11: if dough gets too soft, transfer to fridge before rolling out.
step-12: transfer shapes to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and bake for 8-10 minutes.
step-13: carefully transfer the cookies to a baking rack and cool completely.
step-14: equally divide the powdered sugar in three bowls.
step-15: add two tablespoons of milk to each and whisk until smooth.
step-16: if too runny add more powdered sugar, if too thick add more milk.
step-17: add red food coloring to one bowl and green to the other.
step-18: transfer icings to three different piping bags with a thin tip.
step-19: decorate the cookies and allow to set before assembling.
step-20: fit the cookie pieces into each other to allow the cookies to stand.

step-1: gently heat the double cream in a saucepan for a few minutes.
step-2: turn off heat.
step-3: add the chocolate and allow the heat of the cream to melt it.
step-4: stir in the ginger and cinnamon.
step-5: leave to chill in the fridge for about 3 hours, or until completely set.
step-6: crush the ginger biscuits in a food processor until you form fine crumbs.
step-7: using a spoon, roll the set truffle mixture into little balls and then coat in the ginger biscuit crumbs.

step-1: preheat the oven to 200°c (400°f).
step-2: in a large bowl, whisk all the pancake ingredients together with a hand whisk until thoroughly combined.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: gently melt the butter in a cast-iron skillet over medium-low heat.
step-5: pour the pancake mixture into the middle of the pan.
step-6: bake in the oven for 25 minutes, until golden brown and risen.
step-7: coat with icing sugar and maple syrup.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-2: line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
step-3: in a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking soda, ginger, nutmeg, cinnamon, and salt.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: grease the bottom and sides of a heavy-bottomed pot (such as a dutch oven) with nonstick spray.
step-6: this will ensure the dough doesn’t stick to the pot as you turn it out.
step-7: melt the shortening in the greased pot over medium heat.
step-8: add the molasses and sugar, bring to a boil, then turn off the heat.
step-9: gradually stir in 4 cups (500 grams) of the flour mixture, 1 cup (125 grams) at a time, making sure to fully incorporate each addition before adding more.
step-10: you’ll have some of the flour mixture left over.
step-11: dust a work surface with some of the remaining flour mixture.
step-12: carefully turn the dough out onto the floured surface and work in the flour mixture.
step-13: (you don’t want the dough to be too crumbly.
step-14: you may have some flour mixture left over, which can be used for rolling out the dough.)
step-15: once the flour is incorporated, shape the dough into a 12-inch (30.5 cm) log and cut into 3 portions, 1 piece slightly larger than the others for the roof.
step-16: set aside the smaller pieces of dough in the pot (it still should be warm, but not hot), cover with plastic wrap, and put the lid on.
step-17: you’ll want to work with the dough while it’s warm as it tends to harden at room temperature.
step-18: if it hardens, simply microwave for about 30 seconds.
step-19: on the floured surface, roll out the larger piece of dough to a rectangle about ½-inch (1 ¼ cm) thick.
step-20: using a house template, cut the 2 pieces of the roof and set on a prepared baking sheet, spacing about 1 inch apart as the dough will expand while baking.
step-21: roll out the rest of the dough and cut out the front, back, and sides of the house using the templates.
step-22: place on a baking sheet.
step-23: wrap the leftover dough in plastic wrap and store at room temperature for up to 1 day.
step-24: microwave to soften and roll out to make decorations for the house or another gingerbread creation.
step-25: bake the gingerbread house pieces for 12-15 minutes, until they have hardened and baked through.
step-26: let cool completely.
step-27: make the royal icing: in a large bowl, beat the egg whites and cream of tartar with an electric hand mixer until frothy.
step-28: gradually add the powdered sugar, 1 cup (120 grams) at a time, until the icing is smooth and thick.
step-29: note: the icing is used for gluing the house together.
step-30: it’s very thick.
step-31: to use the icing for decorating, add about 1 teaspoon of water at a time to thin the icing to your desired consistency.
step-32: assemble the gingerbread house with the royal icing.
step-33: tip: put the roof pieces side by side with the underside up (and the eventual exposed part of the roof down).
step-34: “glue” a cut piece of a paper shopping bag across these two pieces with royal icing.
step-35: place two small glass bowls on either side of this upside-down roof to prop the pieces up into a “v” shape.
step-36: let dry completely.
step-37: when assembling, this will help ensure that your roof doesn’t slip down the sides of the house.
step-38: decorate the house with more royal icing and your desired decorations.

step-1: gently heat the double cream in a saucepan for a few minutes.
step-2: turn off heat.
step-3: add the chocolate and allow the heat of the cream to melt it.
step-4: stir in the ginger and cinnamon.
step-5: leave to chill in the fridge for about 3 hours, or until completely set.
step-6: crush the ginger biscuits in a food processor until you form fine crumbs.
step-7: using a spoon, roll the set truffle mixture into little balls and then coat in the ginger biscuit crumbs.

step-1: combine all ingredients in a medium mixing bowl.
step-2: once dough begins to form a ball in the center.
step-3: dust generously with flour.
step-4: separate into three sections to make rolling easier.
step-5: cover dough with plastic wrap or wax paper.
step-6: chill for at least 4 hours, or overnight.
step-7: dust a smooth surface with flour, and roll out a section of the dough to about ¼ inch (6 mm) thick.
step-8: use a gingerbread man cookie cutter, or a knife to slice out your wookiees.
step-9: wookiees are tall, so you may want to stretch out the head and feet!
step-10: place on parchment paper on a baking sheet, and score the cookie’s surface to look like fur.
step-11: bake at 350˚f (180˚c) for 10-12 min.
step-12: your wookiees will puff up quickly!
step-13: melt the chocolate and put into a piping bag.
step-14: add the bandolier, eyes and nose.
step-15: serve these soft and *chewie* wookiee cookies

step-1: in a medium bowl set over a medium pot of boiling water, melt the butter, cocoa powder, and sugar together.
step-2: add the egg and keep stirring for a minute until the mix thickens.
step-3: remove the bowl from the heat.
step-4: add the graham cracker crumbs, almonds, and coconut flakes.
step-5: mix well, then pour into an 8 x 8 inch (20 x 20 cm) pan and flatten to an even layer.
step-6: in a large bowl, cream the softened butter, custard powder, cinnamon, ginger, cloves, nutmeg, and heavy cream together until smooth.
step-7: add the powdered sugar and gingersnap crumbs and mix until smooth.
step-8: spread mixture on top of the crust and in an even layer.
step-9: make the ganache: in a medium bowl set over a medium pot of boiling water, slowly melt the chocolate and the butter.
step-10: let the ganache cool a bit, then pour it over the gingersnap layer.
step-11: chill the bars for at least 3 hours.
step-12: cut the bars into 9 even squares and sprinkle with coarse gingersnap crumbs.

step-1: skewer 3-4 pieces of chicken and green onions in an alternating pattern on a bamboo skewer.
step-2: repeat with remaining chicken & onions.
step-3: heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
step-4: sear 3-4 skewers at a time and flip when the undersides are golden brown.
step-5: in a medium pot, combine all ingredients for glaze and bring to a boil until the bubbles start to become sticky and glossy.
step-6: brush the glaze on the skewers evenly and cook for about 4 more minutes, flipping every minute and glazing occasionally.
step-7: cool, then serve with additional green onions on top!

step-1: divide the cream cheese frosting evenly between 3 medium bowls.
step-2: add each food coloring to a bowl of frosting and mix well.
step-3: set a sheet of plastic wrap on a flat surface and pour each frosting color into adjacent stripes.
step-4: fold the plastic wrap over the frosting and roll into a log shape.
step-5: chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
step-6: squeeze the frosting into a piping bag fitted with a star tip.
step-7: pipe the frosting onto the cupcakes.
step-8: using a pastry brush, sprinkle edible glitter over the frosting.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: grease a 9x5-inch (23x13-cm) loaf pan with nonstick spray.
step-3: cut the cauliflower into florets and add to a food processor.
step-4: pulse until the cauliflower reaches a “rice”-like consistency.
step-5: you should have 3-4 cups.
step-7: transfer the riced cauliflower to a large microwave-safe bowl and microwave for 4 minutes to steam the cauliflower and release its liquid.
step-8: let sit until cool enough to handle.
step-9: transfer the riced cauliflower to a bowl lined with cheesecloth or a tea towel.
step-10: tightly wrap the cauliflower and squeeze out all of the liquid, until it is dry and crumbles between your fingers.
step-11: set aside.
step-12: separate the yolks and whites of the eggs into two large bowls.
step-13: beat the whites with an electric hand mixer until stiff peaks form.
step-14: add about ¼ of the beaten whites to the bowl of yolks.
step-15: then, add the almond flour, parmesan, if using, garlic, baking powder, butter, and salt.
step-16: gently mix with a rubber spatula until combined.
step-17: add the remaining egg whites, dried cauliflower, and italian seasoning.
step-18: gently fold the ingredients together until just combined.
step-19: do not overmix, as this will break down the egg whites.
step-20: transfer the mixture to the prepared loaf pan and sprinkle the top with sesame seeds, parsley, and rosemary.
step-21: bake for 45-50 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown.
step-22: let cool, then slice and serve as desired.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper and lightly grease with nonstick spray.
step-3: heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
step-4: add the jalapeños and cook for 30 seconds, until starting to soften.
step-5: add the chicken, thyme, seasoned salt, parsley, dill, garlic powder, onion powder, and pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through, 8-10 minutes.
step-6: remove the pan from the heat.
step-7: transfer the chicken to a large bowl and use an electric hand mixer on low speed or 2 forks to shred the chicken.
step-8: return the shredded chicken to the pan and turn the heat to low.
step-9: add the cream cheese and parmesan and stir until melted.
step-10: remove the pan from the heat and set aside.
step-11: wrap the tortillas in a damp towel.
step-12: microwave for 45 seconds to soften.
step-13: add 1-2 tablespoons of filling to the center of a tortilla and roll the tortilla tightly around the filling.
step-14: place on the prepared baking sheet, seam-side down.
step-15: repeat with the remaining ingredients.
step-16: brush the melted butter over the taquitos.
step-17: bake the taquitos for 10 minutes, flip, then return to the oven for another 15 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy.
step-18: serve the taquitos with shredded lettuce, sour cream, and salsa.

step-1: pre-heat the oven to 180°c (350°f).
step-2: melt the chocolate and butter together in a saucepan over a medium heat.
step-3: stir in the cocoa powder, sugar and vanilla extract.
step-4: take off the heat and whisk in the eggs one at a time.
step-5: tear off a piece of greaseproof paper and scrunch into a small ball.
step-6: place the the paper balls in the centre of each hole in a muffin tin.
step-7: pour the chocolate doughnut mixture in the muffin tin holes, circling around the paper balls and being careful not to cover them.
step-8: bake in the oven for 8-10 minutes.
step-9: carefully take the doughnuts out of the muffin tin.
step-10: take out the paper balls with your fingers.
step-11: you should have a circle-shaped hole in each doughnut.
step-12: dip in some melted chocolate, followed by some sprinkles.

step-1: pour the water into a large bowl and add the yeast.
step-2: let sit for 2 minutes while the yeast activates.
step-3: the mixture should become foamy and some of the yeast will sink in the water.
step-4: add the eggs and oil.
step-5: whisk until smooth.
step-6: add the gluten-free pizza dough mix and stir with a wooden spoon until well-combined.
step-7: use a bowl scraper to divide the dough in half.
step-8: grease 2 medium bowls with olive oil.
step-9: place each dough half in a bowl and top with another drizzle of oil
step-10: toss the dough to evenly coat in oil, then cover the bowls with clean kitchen towels.
step-11: let rise for 20 minutes, until the dough has expanded, but not quite doubled in size.
step-12: heat a grill pan over high heat.
step-13: turn a dough portion onto a lightly floured pizza peel or other flat surface, like a cutting board or cookie sheet.
step-14: dust the dough with more flour and roll out into a 10-inch (25-cm) round, or whatever size will fit the pan you’re working with.
step-15: carefully slide the dough onto the grill pan.
step-16: grill each side for 6-8 minutes, until dark grill marks form.
step-17: remove from the heat.
step-18: repeat with the remaining dough.
step-19: top with your desired toppings, slice, and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c.)
step-2: using a food processor, grind the rolled oats until they have become a fine powder.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: in a large bowl, whisk the eggs until pale and foamy.
step-5: add the greek yogurt to the eggs and whisk until the mixture is smooth.
step-6: add in the honey, lemon juice, and lemon zest and whisk until well combined.
