step-7: sprinkle the oat flour, poppy seeds, baking powder, and salt.
step-8: fold the ingredients together until no dry oat flour appears.
step-9: pour the batter into a greased loaf pan.
step-10: bake for 30-35 minutes, until a golden-brown crust has started to form and the loaf springs back when touched.
step-11: let the loaf cool for 15 minute before removing it from the pan.
step-12: slice and serve.

step-1: place the oats in the bowl of a food processor or blender and pulse until finely ground.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the milk, egg, vanilla, ground oats, baking powder, and a pinch of salt and whisk until well incorporated and smooth.
step-4: for pancakes, pour ½ cup of batter in a nonstick skillet over medium heat.
step-5: fry until the sides begin to set, then flip the pancake and fry the other side for about 2 minutes.
step-6: remove from heat.
step-7: for waffles, pour 1 heaping cup of batter into a greased waffle iron set to high heat.
step-8: close the waffle press and cook until set, about 4 minutes.
step-9: carefully remove from waffle iron.
step-10: top the pancakes or waffles with maple syrup and fruit as desired.

step-1: add butternut squash to large pot of boiling water.
step-2: cook until fork-tender, 10-15 minutes.
step-3: drain the squash in a colander and add back to the pot.
step-4: add in the goat cheese, milk, rosemary, salt, and pepper.
step-5: mash until desired consistency is reached.

step-1: add cauliflower florets and salt to a bowl and microwave for 5-7 minutes, or until the florets become soft.
step-2: add flour, cornstarch, paprika, cayenne pepper, 2 cloves of minced garlic, salt, ginger, and 1 teaspoon soy sauce to a bowl.
step-3: mix until well combined.
step-4: add water to the bowl in small amounts until the batter is thick and smooth.
step-5: add the cauliflower and mix until fully coated.
step-6: heat oil in a pot to 425°f (220°c).
step-7: add the coated cauliflower florets and deep fry until golden brown.
step-8: transfer the fried cauliflower to a paper towel-lined plate, and sprinkle with salt.
step-9: in a cup or small bowl, make the cornstarch slurry.
step-10: combine the water and cornstarch and mix until well combined.
step-11: in a large pan, heat oil and saute garlic on medium high heat.
step-12: add the green onions and saute for 2-3 minutes.
step-13: add the bell peppers and sauté for 7 minutes, or until the peppers are soft.
step-14: add the vinegar, chili sauce, tomato sauce, soy sauce, and crushed pepper flakes, and mix well.
step-15: add small amounts of the cornstarch water to the mixture and stir until the water becomes translucent.
step-16: add as much as you’d like, depending on how much gravy you want, but only go up to ½ cup (120 ml) of water to 4 tablespoons of cornstarch for maximum flavor.
step-17: add the fried cauliflower and gently stir to coat it with the gravy.
step-18: add salt to taste and stir.
step-19: serve with rice and top with optional lemon juice.

step-1: in a bowl, whisk together the strawberries and double cream until they reach soft peaks.
step-2: sieve the flour and cocoa powder into a bowl.
step-3: crack an egg in the middle and add the melted butter.
step-4: whisk until combined.
step-5: slowly add the milk in three batches, whisking until perfectly smooth.
step-6: heat a small amount of butter over low heat in a nonstick frying pan.
step-7: pour in half of the mixture and swirl around until the pan is fully covered.
step-8: when you can see bubbles forming underneath the crepe, flip.
step-9: cook until the edges start to look dry and crisp.
step-10: repeat cooking steps with the remaining mixture and set aside to cool.
step-11: spread the strawberry cream onto one crepe and chocolate hazelnut spread on the other.
step-12: put the chocolate crepe on top of the strawberry one.
step-13: cut into 8 slices with a pizza cutter.
step-14: layer them on top of each other.
step-15: serve with strawberries and crushed hazelnuts.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425°f (220˚c).
step-2: heat the oil in a large pan over medium-high heat until shimmering.
step-3: add the ground lamb, season with salt and pepper, and fry for 5 minutes, until cooked through.
step-4: add the onion, carrots, garlic, thyme, and rosemary, stir, and cook for about 10 minutes, or until the veggies are softened and the meat is well-browned.
step-5: add the tomato paste and worcestershire sauce and stir to incorporate.
step-6: cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly, until the liquid evaporates and the meat is aromatic.
step-7: pour in the red wine and reduce until almost completely evaporated.
step-8: add the chicken stock, bring to a boil, and cook the meat until the stock has evaporated, 5 minutes.
step-9: meanwhile, cook the potatoes in a large pot of boiling salted water until tender.
step-10: drain, then return to the hot pan over low heat to dry out a bit.
step-11: transfer the potatoes to a large bowl and mash until smooth.
step-12: add salt, the butter, egg yolks, sour cream, and parmesan cheese.
step-13: fold until well combined.
step-14: transfer the potatoes to a piping bag or zip-top bag fitted with a star tip.
step-15: spoon the lamb mixture into a large baking dish.
step-16: pipe the golden mashed potatoes over the lamb.
step-17: bake for 30 minutes, until the potatoes are golden brown.

step-1: rehydrate goji berries in warm water.
step-2: cut stem-end of edible flower and insert goji berry.
step-3: for the blackberry base, combine gelatin and water, stir, then microwave for 10 seconds.
step-4: add soda to mixture, stir, and remove foam on top with a spoon.
step-5: cut blackberries into halves, then place berries and mint on bottom of transparent cup.
step-6: pour soda-gelatin mixture until berries are submerged, then refrigerate cup for at least 1 hour.
step-7: for the aquarium water, combine gelatin and water, stir, then microwave for 10 seconds.
step-8: pour this mixture into a bowl with the lemon juice and soda.
step-9: stir and remove foam on top with a spoon.
step-10: place bowl with aquarium water in an ice bath and stir continuously until mixture starts to thicken.
step-11: pour into cup with the set blackberry base.
step-12: plant chervil between berries and place berry-flower “fishes” in cup.
step-13: refrigerate until jelly hardens.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c) degrees.
step-2: lay a sheet of phyllo dough horizontally on a smooth, dry surface.
step-3: brush with melted butter.
step-4: place another sheet on top.
step-5: layer with butter.
step-6: continue until you have four sheets on top of each other.
step-7: layer the remaining sheets vertically.
step-8: make sure to butter each sheet.
step-9: place brie in the center of the sheets and top with raspberry preserves.
step-10: fold sheet corners over the brie.
step-11: brush with more melted butter and place on a cookie sheet.
step-12: bake at 400°f (200°c) between 25-30 minutes.
step-13: serve warm, with bread or crackers.

step-1: prepare brownie mix according to directions on the box.
step-2: in a medium mixing bowl add two egg whites and beat until stiff peaks form (about 2-3 minutes).
step-3: carefully fold in brown sugar until incorporated.
step-4: pour brownie mix into greased 9x9 inch (23x23 cm) baking pan.
step-5: top brownie mix with pecans, marshmallows, and chocolate chips.
step-6: spread brown sugar meringue evenly over brownie layer.
step-7: bake in preheated oven at 350˚f (175˚c) for 35 minutes.
step-8: if the top starts to brown too quickly - cover loosely with aluminum foil halfway through.
step-9: remove from oven and allow to cool completely at room temperature.

step-1: preheat oven to 320˚f/160˚c.
step-2: place cookies in a ziplock bag and crush with a wooden spoon until the cookies have fully become crumbs.
step-3: put them in a bowl.
step-4: add melted butter and milk, and mix well.
step-5: in a buttered 15-centimeter (6-inch) pie pan, add the crust mixture and press firmly to form an even layer.
step-6: chill in the fridge for about 30 minutes.
step-7: in a microwave-safe bowl, add the egg yolks and sugar.
step-8: whisk until pale.
step-9: add milk, vanilla, and cornstarch, and mix well.
step-10: microwave for 3 minutes and whisk after every minute.
step-11: add the cream cheese to the custard.
step-12: whisk until smooth.
step-13: add the custard batter into the chilled crust.
step-14: chill in the fridge for 30 minutes.
step-15: brush egg wash on top of the cake.
step-16: bake in the oven for 20 minutes.
step-17: once the cake is cool to the touch, serve immediately.
step-18: the cake will have gooey texture while it is warm.

step-1: fold a kitchen towel and set in the bottom of a large skillet.
step-2: fill with water and bring to a gentle simmer over medium heat.
step-3: place the chocolate in a small heatproof bowl.
step-4: set in the pan of simmering water and stir until the chocolate is completely melted, 3-5 minutes.
step-5: carefully remove the bowl from the water and set aside.
step-6: combine the egg whites and 1 tablespoon of sugar in a medium heatproof bowl.
step-7: set in the pan of simmering water and stir until the mixture reaches 140˚f (60˚c).
step-8: carefully remove the bowl from the water.
step-9: using an electric hand mixer, beat the egg white mixture until soft peaks form.
step-10: set aside.
step-11: set a medium heatproof bowl in the pan of simmering water.
step-12: in the bowl, combine the egg yolks, water, and remaining tablespoon of sugar.
step-13: beat with an electric hand mixer until foamy and the temperature reaches 160-170˚f (70-75˚c).
step-14: carefully remove the bowl from the water.
step-15: add the melted chocolate to the yolk mixture and mix with a rubber spatula until well combined.
step-16: add a scoop of the egg white mixture and stir to combine.
step-17: add rest of the egg white mixture and fold to incorporate.
step-18: divide the mixture between 4 serving cups.
step-19: chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour, or until set.
step-20: top with whipped cream and cocoa powder, if desired.

step-1: preheat oven to 200°f (95°c).
step-2: generously season all sides of the steak with salt and pepper.
step-3: transfer to a wire rack on top of a baking sheet, then bake for about 45 minutes to an hour until the internal temperature reads about 125°f (51° c) for medium-rare.
step-4: adjust the bake time based on if you like your steak more rare or more well-done.
step-5: heat the canola oil in a pan over high heat until smoking.
step-6: sear the steak for 30 seconds on the first side, then flip.
step-7: add the butter, garlic, rosemary, and thyme, and swirl around the pan.
step-8: transfer the garlic and herbs on top of the steak and baste the steak with the butter using a large spoon.
step-9: baste for about 30 seconds, then flip and baste the other side for about 15 seconds.
step-10: turn the steak on its side and cook to render off any excess fat.
step-11: rest the steak on a cutting board or wire rack for about 10 minutes.
step-12: slicing the steak before the resting period has finished will result in a lot of the juices leaking out, which may not be desirable.
step-13: slice the steak into ½ -inch (1 cm) strips, then fan out the slices and serve.

step-1: in a medium-sized pan on medium high heat melt 3 tablespoons butter and add shallots.
step-2: cook for 3-4 minutes.
step-3: add garlic and 1 more tablespoons of butter into pan and continue to cook for another 3-4 minutes, stirring frequently.
step-4: add milk, white pepper, and salt to pan and stir until incorporated.
step-5: transfer the shallot mixture to a food processor and process into a paste.
step-6: mash potatoes and incorporate shallot mixture and continue to mash until fully incorporated.
step-7: add olive oil to a large pan over medium heat and add in the mushrooms, cooking for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
step-8: add the asparagus to the pan and season with salt and pepper, cooking for 5 minutes.
step-9: on a cutting board, cut 4 slits into salmon skin roughly a ¼-inch (6 mm) apart, and ½-inch (12 mm) into the salmon.
step-10: season salmon with salt, pepper, and thyme.
step-11: add olive oil to a medium pan on medium-high heat and place the salmon skin-side down.
step-12: cook for 3-4 minutes or until a lighter pink color has reached ⅓-½ of the way up the side of the salmon.
step-13: flip salmon and immediately add the butter, garlic, and thyme.
step-14: stir the garlic and thyme around the pan to infuse the flavors and spoon the butter onto salmon.
step-15: allow salmon to cook through, roughly 2 more minutes.
step-16: transfer the salmon to a paper towel-lined plate.
step-17: add the potato puree to a plate, and top with mushrooms, asparagus, and salmon.

step-1: preheat the oven to 275˚f (135˚c).
step-2: line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
step-3: in a medium bowl, sift together the flour, salt, and baker’s ammonia.
step-4: in a separate medium bowl, cream together the butter and sugar with an electric hand mixer on low speed until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes.
step-5: add the vanilla and continue beating until fully combined.
step-6: add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and beat to incorporate.
step-7: roll about 1 ounce of dough at a time in your hands to make walnut-sized balls.
step-8: they will be small, about ½ inch (1 ¼ cm) wide.
step-9: place the balls of dough on the prepared baking sheets, leaving about 1 inch (2 ½ cm) of space between each cookie.
step-10: using a flat-bottomed measuring cup, gently press down on the cookies to flatten.
step-11: top each cookie with 3 chocolate chips, a single almond, or raisins.
step-12: bake the cookies for 30 minutes, or until the bottoms are light golden brown and the edges are crispy.

step-1: pour the granola into a food processor.
step-2: pulse until the granola is broken into small pieces.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: in a small saucepan, mix together the butter, honey, and brown sugar over medium-low heat.
step-5: stir until the butter is melted, the sugar is dissolved, and the mixture begins to bubble, about 5 minutes.
step-6: remove the pan from the heat and add ½ cup (60g) of the crushed granola.
step-7: if mixture is still too wet to shape, add more granola.
step-8: wrap 4 spoons tightly in aluminum foil.
step-9: lightly grease with nonstick cooking spray and set on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-10: when the granola mixture is cool enough to handle, mold onto the front of each foil-covered spoon.
step-11: freeze for 30 minutes.
step-12: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-13: place another piece of aluminum foil under the spoons.
step-14: fold it up around the edges of each spoon so the granola mold is nestled inside.
step-15: bake for 10 minutes.
step-16: cool the spoons for 10 minutes, then remove the granola spoons from the molds.
step-17: chill in the refrigerator for 20 minutes.
step-18: serve with yogurt, if desired.

step-1: preheat the oven to 170°f (80°c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: in a food processor, combine the grapes, lemon zest, lemon juice, and honey.
step-4: process until smooth.
step-5: transfer the puree to a medium pan over medium-high heat and cook for 15 minutes, until thickened.
step-6: spread the puree on the prepared baking sheet into an 8x11-inch (20x28-cm) rectangle about ¹⁄₁₆ inch (1 mm) thick.
step-7: bake for 6 hours, or until no longer sticky to the touch.
step-8: let cool completely.
step-9: roll the fruit sheet in the parchment paper.
step-10: trim the ends, then slice crosswise into 1-inch (2 cm) pieces.

step-1: pulverise the grapefruit peels in a coffee grinder or a blender.
step-2: in a medium bowl, combine ½ cup (60 g) of grapefruit powder with the baking soda and salt.
step-3: pour into a resealable closed container.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: pour gravy into an ice cube tray and freeze until the cubes are solid and can be removed easily.
step-3: place the potatoes into a pot with cold, salted water and bring to a boil and cook until the potatoes are fork-tender.
step-4: drain the potatoes until completely dry.
step-5: while still hot, mash the potatoes with a potato masher, fork, potato ricer, or food mill.
step-6: if the potatoes get too cold, reheat them in the oven or microwave until hot and dry again.
step-7: to the mashed potatoes, add the sour cream, butter, egg yolks, salt, pepper, and nutmeg.
step-8: fold the mixture together with a spatula until just incorporated, making sure not to overmix.
step-9: transfer the mixture to a piping bag or a zip-top bag with a star tip.
step-10: pipe a disc of the mashed potatoes on a parchment paper-lined sheet tray.
step-11: place an ice cube of frozen gravy in the center, and pipe more mashed potatoes around the gravy cube,
step-12: freeze until the potatoes are firm.
step-13: brush with egg wash until completely coated.
step-14: bake for 30 minutes, or until the potatoes are heated all the way through and golden brown.
step-15: serve while still hot.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: in a bowl, add the greek yogurt, cucumber, lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, and salt, and stir to combine.
step-3: place pita wedges on a baking sheet and bake until crisp, about 8 minutes.
step-4: in a bowl, add the lemon juice, 1 tablespoon olive oil, oregano, lemon zest, garlic, salt, black pepper, and chicken, and toss to coat.
step-5: heat remaining olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
step-6: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the chicken and cook until browned, about 5 minutes.
step-7: add the spinach, cherry tomatoes, red onion, cucumber, chicken, and pita chips together in a large bowl and drizzle with tzatziki dressing.

step-1: add the ingredients into a mason jar.
step-2: screw the lid on tightly and shake vigorously.
step-3: the dressing can remain in the fridge for 1-2 weeks.
step-4: pour over your favorite salad ingredients and enjoy!

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a large pan over medium heat, cook the green onions and garlic in the olive oil until soft.
step-3: add half the spinach, giving time for some to cook down before adding the rest.
step-4: once the spinach has cooked down, transfer to a medium mixing bowl to cool slightly.
step-5: add the feta, ricotta, egg, dill, parsley, salt and pepper, and mix until evenly spread.
step-6: set in refrigerator.
step-7: lay out one sheet of phyllo dough on a dry surface.
step-8: using a pastry brush, coat evenly with olive oil.
step-9: add another sheet of phyllo dough on top of the oiled sheet and repeat the oiling process.
step-10: continue until there is a stack of 4 oiled sheets.
step-11: repeat process on a new stack with remaining 4 sheets.
step-12: cut your dough into 4 sections using a pizza cutter.
step-13: with a single section, add a spoonful of your spinach mix and begin folding over your pastry, brushing each fold with oil.
step-14: repeat this process for the remaining sections.
step-15: bake in a preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown.

step-1: combine greek yogurt and mango in a food processor and puree until smooth.
step-2: spread mixture onto a parchment-lined sheet tray into an even ¼ inch (6 mm) layer.
step-3: top with sliced strawberries, shredded coconut, and lime zest.
step-4: freeze uncovered until frozen, about two hours.
step-5: break into pieces and serve immediately.
step-6: keep any uneaten bark in freezer.

step-1: add the spinach, banana, greek yogurt, ice, and water to a blender, and blend until smooth.
slice green pepper.
step-2: in a medium size bowl, combine greek yogurt, dried parsley, garlic powder, onion powder, pepper, salt, dried basil, and green onions.
step-3: mix until well combined.
step-4: to prepare the platter, cut an assortment of your favorite vegetables into the shape they are easiest to dip with.
step-5: (we used cauliflower, cucumber, green bell pepper, broccoli, celery, yellow bell pepper, carrots, red bell pepper, radishes, and cherry tomatoes.)
step-6: surrounding a bowl, lay vegetables on top of a bed of kale and fill the bowl with the dip.
step-7: optional: sprinkle with some green onions, dried minced garlic, and dried minced onion.

step-1: to an 8-inch (20 cm) microwave-safe pie dish, add the green beans and cream of mushroom soup, then sprinkle the fried onions evenly over the top.
step-2: microwave for 5 minutes at half power until onions have become a little crispy.
step-3: top with scallions and serve warm.

step-1: in a medium bowl, mix together green beans, soup, and french fried onions.
step-2: spray down a medium-sized baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray and arrange onion rings so that they are all 1.5-2 inches (4-5 cm) apart.
step-3: using a spoon or spatula, scoop soup/green bean mixture into the middle of each onion ring, making sure to fill each ring evenly before placing another onion ring on top and repeating the process.
step-4: (note: make sure to use the largest onion rings first as the base to your stacks, using the smaller rings later towards the top.)
step-5: bake stacks at 350˚f (180˚c) for 18-22 minutes or until onion rings are crisp and golden and green bean mixture is bubbling on top.
step-6: let cool for at least 5 minute before transferring to a plate to serve.

step-1: in a food processor, combine the spinach, parsley, and ½ cup (120 ml) milk, and process until evenly mixed.
step-2: in a large pot, bring water and 1 tbsp salt to a boil over high heat.
step-3: add the elbows and cook until al dente, roughly 6-7 minutes.
step-4: rinse with cold water and drain.
step-5: in a large pot, combine the butter and flour on medium-high heat, and stir until the mixture has become golden brown.
step-6: add 2 cups (470 ml) milk, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, pepper, and salt to the pot and stir until well incorporated.
step-7: add in the cheddar cheese and mix until well incorporated.
step-8: add in the spinach mixture and stir until fully incorporated and the green color is consistent.
step-9: mix in the pasta and pour into a casserole dish.
step-10: top the macaroni with mozzarella and broil for 5 minutes.

step-1: add spinach, peas, kiwi, and water, breast milk, or formula to a blender or food processor.
step-2: blend very well.
step-3: add more liquid as needed.
step-4: refrigerate up to 3 days or freeze up to 1 month.
step-5: note: check with your pediatrician before introducing new foods to children under 12 months.

step-1: add the spinach, almond butter, dates, chia seeds, banana, and avocado to a resealable container.
step-2: cover and store in the freezer for up to 3 months.
step-3: when ready to prepare, add the contents from the container and the almond milk to a blender and blend until smooth.

step-1: add the cucumber, apple, celery, lemon juice, ginger, and kale to a blender, and blend until smooth.
step-2: using a mesh strainer, strain the juice over a large liquid measuring cup to remove the pulp.
step-3: use a spoon to help stir the pulp and press out the liquid.
step-4: reserve the pulp to make pulp muffins.
step-5: chill the juice for at least 30 minutes (and keep up to 3 days).

step-1: in a large pan, add the butter, thyme and rosemary.
step-2: stir.
step-3: add the shrimp and cook for 3 minutes.
step-4: take them out of the pan and set aside.
step-5: sprinkle the flour and mix until it becomes slightly brown.
step-6: pour the warm milk slowly while mixing.
step-7: pour the warm milk slowly while mixing.
step-8: add salt, pepper, and ground nutmeg.
step-9: stir and add the chopped onion.
step-10: cook for 5 minutes.
step-11: add the fresh parsley and green onion (or chives).
step-12: blend everything with a mixer.
step-13: cook until the sauce is bubbling, turn off the heat.
step-14: add the shrimp.
step-15: stir and then add the lime juice
step-16: stir in the pasta.
step-17: serve right away.

step-1: throw all of the ‘base’ ingredients into a blender and whizz until smooth.
step-2: note: you can adapt this entire recipe as much or as little as you like, we chose to make one that looks super green with a somewhat neutral taste to let the toppings bring out the flavor.
step-3: pour the smoothie into a bowl, and top with your favorite toppings.
step-4: our suggested toppings are just that too, suggestions - be as creative as you like here - pecans, flax seeds, sliced peaches - whatever you like.
step-5: make a cool design too!

step-1: peel and slice the bananas, then freeze overnight.
step-2: add the frozen bananas, almond milk, matcha powder, and agave to a food processor or blender.
step-3: blend until smooth and thick.
step-4: transfer to a loaf pan and freeze for at least 2 hours.
step-5: serve topped with matcha powder.

step-1: combine orange juice, spinach, and other leafy greens into a blender and blend until consistency is smooth.
step-2: add cucumber and apple.
step-3: blend until smooth.
step-4: pour into a glass and serve right away, or chill in refrigerator, if preferred.

step-1: cut biscuits into small even pieces (about 9 per biscuit) and place in a bowl.
step-2: sprinkle sugar, flour, cinnamon, and salt over the dough bites.
step-3: mix well.
step-4: on the grill, using a disposable foil pan or grill proof pan, combine blueberries, strawberries, blackberries, raspberries, sugar, and cornstarch.
step-5: stir well and let cook until fruit starts to release its juices.
step-6: cover fruit with the cinnamon sugar-coated biscuit dough in as even a layer as possible.
step-7: cover pan tightly with foil and close the grill.
step-8: keeping the temperature at 350˚f (175˚c) grill for 20 minutes.
step-9: take the foil off pan and close grill again for 10 more minutes, or until dough is cooked through and golden brown.
step-10: (times and temperatures may vary based on grill).
step-11: remove from the grill & serve with a scoop of ice cream.

step-1: on a cutting board, butter each piece of bread with butter on one side.
step-2: flip the bread over and spread each piece of bread with mayonnaise.
step-3: place the cheese on the buttered side of one piece of bread.
step-4: top it with the second piece of bread, mayonnaise side out.
step-5: heat a nonstick pan over medium low heat.
step-6: place the sandwich on the pan, mayonnaise side down.
step-7: cook for 3-4 minutes, until golden brown.
step-8: using a spatula, flip the sandwich over and continue cooking until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes.

step-1: remove the top of the roll.
step-2: using a small knife cut around the inside of the bread (being careful not to cut through the sides) and scoop out the center of the roll - save this for later.
step-3: butter the inside of the roll and place 3-4 cheese slices around the inner edge of the bread bowl.
step-4: bake in a preheated oven at 375˚f (190˚c) until the cheese has melted.
step-5: cut the saved center of the roll in half.
step-6: butter both sides and create a cheese sandwich.
step-7: melt butter in a small skillet over medium heat and fry the sandwich until both sides are browned and the inner cheese has melted.
step-8: remove the bread bowl from the oven.
step-9: fill with tomato soup and serve with the grilled cheese.

step-1: on a cutting board, cut the crusts off of the bread.
step-2: press bread flat with hands or a rolling pin.
step-3: take one slice of cheddar cheese and cut it into 4 equal squares.
step-4: repeat with the swiss cheese.
step-5: cut the slices of ham into a square.
step-6: place one piece of flattened bread on a surface.
step-7: place 2 squares of cheddar so they are overlapping.
step-8: place the ham on top of the cheddar.
step-9: place 2 squares of the swiss on top of the ham so the are overlapping.
step-10: brush the edges of the bread with egg wash.
step-11: take the other flattened piece of bread and place it on top.
step-12: press down the edges.
step-13: using a fork press along the edges of the “ravioli” until the edges are sealed.
step-14: in a pan heat 1 tablespoon of butter until melted on medium heat.
step-15: place the “ravioli” in the pan.
step-16: cook for about 3 minutes on each side until golden and crispy.
step-17: remove from heat.
step-18: serve immediately with hot tomato soup.

step-1: cut crust off the slices of bread.
step-2: this makes the bread easier to roll and will hold the shape better.
step-3: flatten slices of bread with a rolling pin.
step-4: layer the slices of cheese on top of each slice of bread so that the cheese is offset from the bread by about 1 inch (2 ½ cm) vertically.
step-5: other fillings can be added here if desired.
step-6: roll each slice of bread with cheese vertically as tightly as possible without cracking the bread.
step-7: gently squeeze each roll to maintain its shape and set down on its seam.
step-8: melt the butter in a pan.
step-9: grill each roll starting with the seam side down on the hot pan.
step-10: rotate so that all sides are evenly golden brown.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: grease a 6-cup muffin tin with nonstick spray.
step-3: heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat until shimmering.
step-4: add the onion and sauté for 4-5 minutes, until the onion is translucent.
step-5: add the garlic and cook for another 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
step-6: add the ground beef and cook, breaking up with a wooden spoon, until browned, about 5 minutes.
step-7: drain any excess fat.
step-8: add the mustard powder, pepper, and salt.
step-9: stir to combine, then add the tomato sauce, and cook for 5 minutes until liquid is cooked down.
step-10: add the worcestershire sauce and ketchup and cook for 10 minutes, until most of the liquid has evaporated.
step-11: remove the pan from the heat.
step-12: slice the crusts off the bread.
step-13: quarter 2 of the slices to make small squares, leaving the remaining 6 slices whole.
step-14: press the whole slices of bread into the cups of the greased muffin tin, and brush with melted butter.
step-15: add 1 tablespoon of shredded cheddar cheese to each cup, and top with a quartered piece of bread.
step-16: brush the bread with melted butter.
step-17: bake for 10 minutes, until the cheese melted.
step-18: scoop 2 tablespoons of sloppy joe mixture into each cup, and top with another tablespoon of cheddar.
step-19: bake for another 5 minutes, until the cheese is melted and the cups are firm.
step-20: garnish with parsley and serve immediately.

step-1: fire up the grill.
step-2: cut peaches along the seam all the way around and remove pit from peaches.
step-3: put a saucepan over medium heat, and add pecans.
step-4: heat the pecans until they’re lightly toasted and fragrant, stirring often.
step-5: add butter and stir until melted then add the sugar and cinnamon, stirring until everything comes together and looks like a pecan pie sauce.
step-6: using a pastry brush, spread the sauce all over the peach halves.
step-7: slap them on the grill.
step-8: grill for 4-6 minutes per side, or until the peaches have softened and have nice grill marks.
step-9: serve each grilled peach half with a scoop of ice cream.
step-10: drizzle the pecans and sauce on top.

step-1: in a resealable bag or dish, add salmon, olive oil, salt, pepper, juice of one lemon, minced garlic, one thyme sprig, and one rosemary sprig.
step-2: seal, mix marinade around, being careful not to bruise the fish, and allow to marinate in the refrigerator for at least one hour.
step-3: preheat only half of the grill to medium-high heat for indirect grilling.
step-4: slice the two remaining lemons horizontally, so that you get six slices of lemon from each one, excluding the top and bottom.
step-5: bend each piece of asparagus until the woody end snaps off and discard it.
step-6: oil the grill with olive oil and place lemon slices over indirect heat (the side of the grill where the burners are not on).
step-7: lay salmon on top of the lemon slices and top with a sprig of rosemary on each fillet.
step-8: close the cover and grill for 20 minutes.
step-9: place the asparagus spears on the grill and brush with olive oil.
step-10: grill for 5 additional minutes.
step-11: sprinkle with parsley and serve.

step-1: microwave the corn on a microwave-safe plate on high for 7 minutes.
step-2: remove from the microwave, and grip the corn with a dish towel.
step-3: then cut off the bottom end with a serrated knife.
step-4: slide the corn out of the husk.
step-5: it should come out fairly easily with none of the silky string mess.
step-6: brush the corn with olive oil, then place on a cast iron grill pan or outdoor grill over medium-high heat.
step-7: grill for 5-6 minutes on each side, until the kernels are slightly charred.
step-8: insert the narrow end of an ear of corn into the center hole of a bundt pan.
step-9: holding the corn steady with one hand, saw off the kernels with a serrated knife.
step-10: the kernels will fall into the pan for easy collection.
step-11: make the cilantro-lime vinaigrette: combine the cilantro, olive oil, lime juice, garlic, chili powder, honey, salt, and pepper in a food processor and blend until smooth.
step-12: in a large bowl, add the pasta, corn, tomatoes, red onion, avocado, and vinaigrette, and mix until well-combined.

step-1: slice onion in quarters, and bell peppers in 1.5" (4cm) squares.
step-2: place each meat in a gallon sized plastic bag and cover with dry ingredients.
step-3: close the bag and shake until evenly coated.
step-4: prepare skewers by layering onion, bell pepper, and protein.
step-5: (be sure not to mix proteins on the same skewer, as they have different cook times.)
step-6: grill the skewers over medium-high heat, flipping once, until the protein’s internal temperatures are as follows: steak - 155ºf (70ºc), chicken - 165ºf (75ºc), shrimp - 145ºf (65ºc).

step-1: in a medium bowl, drizzle the corn with 2 tablespoons of olive oil and season with salt and pepper to taste.
step-2: massage the corn until fully coated.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: in a small bowl, combine the paprika, salt, brown sugar, chili powder, onion powder, cumin, garlic powder, chipotle powder, and black pepper and mix together.
step-5: sprinkle the dry rub all over both sides of the flank steak.
step-6: rub in the spices.
step-7: on a heated grill or grill pan greased with canola oil, add the seasoned flank steak and cook until it begins to char slightly, about 3 minutes each side.
step-8: remove from the grill and let rest for at least 15 minutes to cool and keep the juices inside.
step-9: add the seasoned corn to the grill pan.
step-10: cook until charred slightly, 3-5 minutes per side.
step-11: remove the corn from the grill and set aside to cool.
step-12: set a small bowl upside-down inside a large bowl.
step-13: stand the corn cobs on the small bowl and cut off the kernels.
step-14: remove the small bowl.
step-15: add the chiles, avocado, red onion, cherry tomatoes, jalapeños, lime juice, honey, salt, pepper, and the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil.
step-16: mix to combine.
step-17: cut the meat into ½ inch (1 cm) slices.
step-18: top with the corn salad and serve.

step-1: pat dry chicken and place in a large mixing bowl or plastic bag.
step-2: toss with cornstarch, garlic powder, and one teaspoon of kosher salt.
step-3: place chicken in a single layer on a cookie sheet or wire rack and refrigerate for at least an hour, up to overnight.
step-4: in a food processor or blender, combine chipotles, lime juice, honey, and the remaining salt.
step-5: puree until smooth.
step-6: set aside until ready to grill.
step-7: preheat grill to medium high heat.
step-8: grill wings until just starting to brown on the underside, about 5 minutes, then flip and repeat.
step-9: using a basting brush, coat the top side of the wings with chipotle puree.
step-10: flip and cook until exterior just starts to char.
step-11: baste the other side, flip and repeat.
step-12: remove wings from heat and let cool for at least 5 minutes.
step-13: serve with your preferred garnish and dipping sauce.

step-1: on a cutting board, halve the lemons and coat the cut sides with a thin layer of sugar.
step-2: place the lemons on an 11" griddle pan cut side down and cook them over medium-high heat for 6-8 minutes, until caramelized.
step-3: remove lemons from the griddle and rest them for 5-10 minutes.
step-4: juice lemons over a fine mesh strainer into a half gallon (2 liter) pitcher.
step-5: once all the lemons are juiced, add the white sugar, lemon rings, water, and ice (see note).
step-6: stir until the sugar is dissolved.
step-7: note: do not add the ice if preparing ahead of time.
step-8: add the ice immediately before serving.

step-1: make the pickled vegetables: set a large colander in a large bowl.
step-2: add the carrots and daikon to the colander.
step-3: toss with the salt, then add just enough water to cover the vegetables, about 6 cups (1.4 l).
step-4: let sit at room temperature for 30 minutes.
step-5: lift the colander out of the soaking liquid, then rinse the vegetables well.
step-6: shake the colander a few times to allow any excess water to drain away.
step-7: let the vegetables sit at room temperature for 30 minutes to dry out a bit.
step-8: add the sugar and vinegar to the bowl with the vegetables.
step-9: season to taste with more salt, if needed.
step-10: transfer to an airtight container and refrigerate overnight.
step-11: make the lemongrass pork: trim the bottoms and green tops from the lemongrass stalks.
step-12: slice the light parts in half lengthwise, then remove any tough outer layers.
step-13: mince and transfer to a medium bowl.
step-14: finely chop the onion and add to the bowl with the lemongrass.
step-15: in a large bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, fish sauce, sugar, wine, and pepper.
step-16: add the sliced pork butt to the marinade and toss to coat.
step-17: cover with plastic wrap and let marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour, up to 4 hours.
step-18: heat the canola oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
step-19: add the onion and lemongrass and cook until the onion is tender and beginning to brown, stirring constantly, about 10 minutes.
step-20: transfer to a bowl and set aside.
step-21: heat a large grill pan over medium-high heat.
step-22: working in batches, remove the pork from the marinade, letting any excess liquid to drip off, then grill the pork until lightly charred on both sides and just cooked through, about 2 minutes per side.
step-23: transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 10 minutes.
step-24: cut the pork into bite-sized pieces and transfer to a large bowl.
step-25: add the lemongrass and onion mixture and stir to combine.
step-26: to assemble, slice the toasted french rolls in half lengthwise almost all the way through, leaving a long end intact.
step-27: slather the bottom of the rolls with a generous amount of mayonnaise, then spread on a layer of pâté.
step-28: top with the pork mixture, cucumber, sliced onion, jalapeño, the pickled vegetables, and cilantro.
step-29: close the sandwiches and serve.

step-1: preheat griddler, fitted with the grill plates, to 425°f (220°c), and grease with nonstick spray.
step-2: using a sharp knife, slice the peaches in half, cutting around the pit.
step-3: twist the two halves to separate and discard the pits.
step-4: brush the cut sides of the peach halves with a bit of oil.
step-5: place the peaches, cut side down, on the griddler and close the press so that the top plate is touching all the peaches evenly.
step-6: cook for 4 minutes, until the peaches have developed dark grill marks.
step-7: transfer the peaches to a serving plate and top with greek yogurt, a drizzle of honey, and a sprinkle of granola.
step-8: garnish with mint leaves and serve.

step-1: add the balsamic vinegar, olive oil, honey, salt, and pepper to a bowl and mix until well combined.
step-2: reserve half for salad dressing.
step-3: halve the peaches and remove the pit.
step-4: lightly brush the cut side with balsamic vinaigrette.
step-5: grill for 5 minutes over medium high heat, or until browned.
step-6: on a cutting board, sprinkle the chicken with oil, salt, and pepper.
step-7: grill the chicken until browned on one side and flip.
step-8: brush with vinaigrette on cooked side and repeat once other side is browned.
step-9: prepare the peaches and chicken for the salad by slicing both.
step-10: add the grilled peaches and chicken to a bowl with the mixed greens, grape tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and pecans, and drizzle with the remaining balsamic vinaigrette.
step-11: mix thoroughly.

step-1: preheat grill over high heat for 5-10 minutes.
step-2: coat pizza dough with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil.
step-3: using your hands, rub oil onto outside of dough while carefully stretching it into a circle 12-14 inches (30-35 cm) in diameter.
step-4: place oiled pizza dough onto preheated grill and quickly brush the top with an additional tablespoon of olive oil.
step-5: close grill and allow pizza dough to cook for 3-4 minutes over high heat.
step-6: after 4 minutes, check on the pizza.
step-7: the dough should start to form large bubbles across the top.
step-8: using a large spatula or set of tongs, flip the dough over.
step-9: lower the heat to low and add the toppings to the pizza.
step-10: increase the heat back to high and close the grill.
step-11: cook pizza for 5-6 minutes, until cheese has melted and the bottom of the crust is lightly charred.

step-1: preheat the grill to 400˚f/200˚c.
step-2: thoroughly scrub the potatoes until they are clean and poke a few holes around the potato to vent.
step-3: wrap in aluminium foil and place on the grill to cook for 20 minutes over direct heat.
step-4: in the meantime, mix half of the cheddar cheese, cream cheese, and green onions until well-combined.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: remove the potatoes from the grill and let them rest until they are cool enough to handle.
step-7: unwrap the potato and cut off the ends so that it will stand up.
step-8: using a melon baller or a spoon, carve out the center of the potato, being careful not to make the walls too thin, and to leave a bit of thickness at the bottom as well.
step-9: fill the potato with the cheese mixture and wrap 2 slices of bacon around the potato.
step-10: secure the bacon with toothpicks if necessary.
step-11: lower the grill temperature to about 350˚f/175˚c and place potatoes over indirect heat on the grill for 30 minutes with the lid closed.
step-12: top with the remaining cheddar cheese and cook for another 15 minutes.
step-13: garnish with a dollop of sour cream and some green onions.

step-1: heat a grill to medium-high heat.
step-2: season the salmon with salt and pepper.
step-3: brush the grill grates with oil and place the salmon, skin side down on the oiled grates.
step-4: grill until lightly browned, 3-5 minutes, then gently flip and continue to cook until just opaque in center.
step-5: add the lemon halves to the grill, cut side down and grill until lightly charred, about 2 minutes.

step-1: in a large bowl, mix oil, salt, pepper, and paprika.
step-2: coat the salmon fillets with the marinade and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
step-3: grill the salmon on an 11" griddle pan on high heat for two minutes on each side.
step-4: in a separate bowl, lightly toss avocados, ¼ red onion, the juice from one lime, 1 tablespoon olive oil, and salt to taste.
step-5: spoon avocado salsa on top of the cooked salmon.
step-6: top with finely cut cilantro.

step-1: in a large bowl, season shrimp with paprika, garlic powder, oregano, cumin, red pepper flakes, and salt.
step-2: toss gently to combine.
step-3: using 2 bamboo or metal skewers, poke through the top and bottom of the shrimp and push down to the bottom of the skewer.
step-4: add 3 more shrimp to the same skewer and repeat until all of the shrimp are used.
step-5: right before you put the shrimp on the grill, brush each skewer with a generous amount of olive oil, to prevent sticking.
step-6: grill over high heat for 3 minutes, brush the top side with more olive oil, flip, and let cook for an additional 3 minutes.
step-7: remove from skewers & set aside for taco assembly.
step-8: in a bowl, combine all creamy cilantro sauce ingredients.
step-9: stir well to combine.
step-10: in a large bowl, combine green cabbage, red cabbage, and minced jalapeño.
step-11: pour half of the sour cream mixture over the cabbage, saving the other half for extra sauce to put on the tacos.
step-12: assemble the tacos on corn tortillas.
step-13: add the cabbage mixture, followed by the shrimp.
step-14: top with the creamy cilantro sauce, cilantro, and a squeeze of lime juice.

step-1: combine dijon mustard, honey, salt, pepper, oil, and balsamic vinaigrette in a small bowl and stir to combine.
step-2: note: you can also shake the ingredients in a jar with a secure lid.
step-3: slice the mozzarella into ¼-inch (6 mm) slices and toss them with olive oil in a bowl.
step-4: press each slice into the breadcrumbs to fully coat the entire surface.
step-5: lay the slices out on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and freeze for about 30 to 45 minutes.
step-6: cook each slice in a pan or grill about 2 minutes each side until breadcrumbs are golden and grill marks appear.
step-7: transfer each slice onto your salad and top with salad dressing.

step-1: preheat a grill or grill plate to medium-low heat.
step-2: sprinkle the paprika, garlic powder, chili powder, onion powder black pepper, and salt over the pineapple spears in a bowl.
step-3: mix until they are completely coated.
step-4: lay a slice of bacon at a slight diagonal angle on your work surface.
step-5: lay a second slice above it making sure they slightly overlapped in the middle.
step-6: place one hot dog and one thin pineapple spear near the bottom part of the first slice of bacon.
step-7: tuck the end of the bacon around the hot dog and pineapple and roll across the counter until they are completely encased.
step-8: use toothpicks if needed to get a tight seal.
step-9: place the hot dogs on the grill and cook gently until the bacon is crispy and the pineapple and hot dog are heated through, about 40 minutes.
step-10: flip halfway through.
step-11: place into hot dog buns, top with barbecue sauce, minced red onion, and minced jalapeño (optional).

step-1: combine dry rub ingredients in a small bowl and stir to combine.
step-2: evenly coat the tri tip with the dry rub and let rest at room temperature for 30 minutes.
step-3: in a small saucepan, bring glaze ingredients to a low boil over medium heat.
step-4: simmer for 3 minutes, stirring frequently.
step-5: heat a charcoal or gas grill to the medium heat.
step-6: grill steak for 4-5 minutes over direct heat, then flip and grill until internal temperature reaches 125°f (52°c) on a meat thermometer.
step-7: brush the steak with the brown sugar glaze, then flip the steak and repeat, about 1 minute per side.
step-8: do this until you’ve used up about half the glaze then remove meat from the grill.
step-9: let the steak rest for 10 minutes, then slice into ½-inch (1 cm) strips against the grain.
step-10: serve with remaining glaze on the side for drizzling or dipping.

step-1: cut zucchini and summer squash in half lengthwise.
step-2: remove the insides of the bell peppers and cut into large chunks.
step-3: remove the top and bottom from the red onion and slice horizontally into three pieces.
step-4: combine red wine vinegar, pepper, salt, oregano, and garlic.
step-5: whisk in the olive oil and coat vegetables in the dressing.
step-6: season the rib eye with salt and pepper.
step-7: grill steak over medium-high heat for 5-7 minutes on each side (times may vary depending on the grill and how well-done you like your steak).
step-8: add the vegetables to the grill and cook the zucchini and summer squash for 5-7 minutes on each side.
step-9: cook the bell peppers and onions 4-6 minutes each side (times may vary depending on the grill).
step-10: remove steak from the grill and let rest for 10 minutes.
step-11: slice the steak into strips.
step-12: cut vegetables into small pieces.
step-13: arrange vegetables and steak on a bed of mixed greens.
step-14: drizzle olive oil, red wine vinegar, salt, and pepper over the salad.

step-1: fiery
step-2: heat grill to high heat.
step-3: place wings on the grill and close lid.
step-4: grill for 8–10 minutes, then flip and grill for another 8–10 minutes (with the lid closed), or until wings are fully cooked through.
step-5: remove wings from grill.
step-6: squeeze with lime wedges and garnish with minced cilantro.
step-7: zesty
step-8: heat grill to high heat.
step-9: place wings on the grill and close lid.
step-10: grill for 8–10 minutes, then flip and grill for another 8–10 minutes (with the lid closed), or until wings are fully cooked through.
step-11: remove wings from grill.
step-12: squeeze with lemon wedges and garnish with basil leaves.
step-13: jazzy
step-14: heat grill to high heat.
step-15: place wings on the grill and close lid.
step-16: grill for 8–10 minutes, then flip and grill for another 8–10 minutes (with the lid closed), or until wings are fully cooked through.
step-17: remove wings from grill and set aside.
step-18: in a small pot over low heat, melt the butter.
step-19: add honey, apple cider vinegar, and salt and bring to a simmer.
step-20: remove from heat.
step-21: drizzle grilled wings with honey butter.
step-22: savory
step-23: heat grill to high heat.
step-24: place wings on the grill and close lid.
step-25: grill for 8–10 minutes, then flip and grill for another 8–10 minutes (with the lid closed), or until wings are fully cooked through.
step-26: remove wings from grill and set aside.
step-27: drizzle grilled wings with herb butter.

step-1: in a medium bowl, mash the avocados until desired consistency is reached.
step-2: add the onion, jalapeño, cilantro, and lime juice, and season with salt and pepper.
step-3: stir to combine.

step-1: spread guacamole on toast and sprinkle sun-dried tomatoes and feta on top.
place the eggs in a pot and fill with cold water until the eggs are just covered.
step-2: bring the pot to a boil, then cover, remove from heat, and let sit for about 12 minutes.
step-3: transfer the eggs to a bowl of ice water for about 3 minutes, then peel them and cut them in half.
step-4: transfer the egg yolks to a bowl, and set the cooked egg whites aside.
step-5: mix the avocado, cilantro, jalapeño, red onion, tomato, garlic, cumin, lime juice, and salt with the yolks and transfer to a piping bag.
step-6: (alternatively, use a zip-top bag with a corner cut off.)
step-7: pipe the mixture into the eggs, garnish with cilantro and crushed tortilla chips, and serve chilled.

step-1: place the eggs in a large pot and cover with 1 inch (2cm) of cold water.
step-2: cover with a lid.
step-3: bring to a rolling boil, and remove from heat.
step-4: let the eggs sit, covered for 8-10 minutes.
step-5: remove from water and immediately place in bath of ice water for a few minutes.
step-6: remove shells and cut the egg in half, vertically.
step-7: remove the yolk and place in a bowl.
step-8: set the cooked whites aside on a serving tray.
step-9: in the bowl with the yolks, add all the ingredients for guacamole.
step-10: mash until well incorporated.
step-11: spoon guacamole mixture into the bowls of the cooked egg whites.
step-12: garnish with a broken piece of a tortilla chip and cilantro.

step-1: in a medium mixing bowl, mash avocados with the juice of one lime.
step-2: mix in chopped tomato, cilantro, garlic, salt, and chili powder.
step-3: cut onion into ½-inch (1 cm) slices.
step-4: carefully separate the layers into individual rings.
step-5: on a wax paper–lined tray, lay out onion rings and fill each with guacamole.
step-6: place tray in freezer until solid (about one hour).
step-7: add flour, beaten eggs, and panko bread crumbs to three separate bowls.
step-8: remove frozen guacamole rings from freezer.
step-9: roll each first in flour, then egg, then bread crumbs.
step-10: coat once more in egg and a final time in bread crumbs.
step-11: in a large saucepan, heat oil to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-12: fry guacamole onion rings in batches until nicely browned on all sides.
step-13: place on paper towel–lined plate to drain off any excess oil.
step-14: sprinkle with salt and lime juice.
step-15: serve with sour cream.

step-1: in a medium cast iron skillet over medium-high heat, toast the pepitas and sesame seeds until aromatic and lightly browned, 2-4 minutes.
step-2: transfer the seeds to a small bowl and return the pan to the heat.
step-3: add the francese rolls to the pan and toast until charred on both sides, about 5 minutes.
step-4: transfer the charred bread to a pan and cover with water.
step-5: let soak for 1 hour.
step-6: add the tomatoes, tomatillos, ½ of an onion, pasilla, guajillo, and 1 clove of garlic to the pan and char on all sides, 10-20 minutes.
step-7: remove items as they become charred and set aside.
step-8: in a medium pot, combine the cubed pork, salt, ½ of an onion, 1 garlic clove, and the water.
step-9: bring to a boil, then cover and simmer for 1 hour, or until the pork is tender.
step-10: strain the pork from the broth and set both aside.
step-11: squeeze out as much water as possible from the soaked bread, then add to a blender with the toasted seeds, charred vegetables, pepper, and allspice.
step-12: blend until smooth.
step-13: set aside.
step-14: add the pork lard to a medium bowl and microwave for 2 minutes, until melted.
step-15: stir in the annatto paste until smooth.
step-16: set aside.
step-17: add the hot, peeled potatoes to a large roasting pan.
step-18: mash the potatoes until smooth.
step-19: add the melted lard mixture, half the of blended tomatillo sauce, and ½ of the instant corn masa.
step-20: mix with your hands until well combined.
step-21: season with salt.
step-22: the mixture should be red and somewhat tacky.
step-23: if the dough is too dry, add more of the sauce.
step-24: if too thin, add more corn masa.
step-25: to assemble the paches, lay a banana leaf on a clean work surface.
step-26: add a bit of potato dough to the center.
step-27: place some of the meat in the center, covering with the potato dough.
step-28: fold the leaf around the dough, then wrap with a second leaf and a piece of aluminum foil.
step-29: repeat with the remaining ingredients.
step-30: layer a base of banana leaves in a large pot and place the wrapped paches on top.
step-31: fill the pot halfway with water.
step-32: cover the top with more banana leaves and the lid, then steam over medium heat for 1 hour.
step-33: remove the paches from the pot and let cool slightly.

step-1: put pork, sake, salt, and sugar in a bowl.
step-2: mix until meat is sticky.
step-3: combine garlic, ginger, soy sauce, sesame oil, potato starch, cabbage, and chive.
step-4: mix them very well in a bowl.
step-5: scoop a spoonful of filling onto the middle of the gyoza skin.
step-6: apply water for skin edge with your finger.
step-7: fold in half and pinch pleats into the edges, then wrap up.
step-8: heat sesame oil in the pan and lay gyoza in single layer.
step-9: keep on medium heat for 2 minutes.
step-10: when gyoza turns brown, pour in slurry and put the lid on.
step-11: steam for 3 minutes.
step-12: take off the lid, put more sesame oil and cook over low heat.
step-13: cover a pan with a plate, turn over a pan.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: place the habanero peppers and garlic on the baking sheet.
step-4: drizzle with 1 tablespoon of olive oil and toss with tongs to coat.
step-5: note: do not touch the peppers with your bare hands.
step-6: roast for 10 minutes, until the edges of the peppers are brown.
step-7: add the remaining tablespoon of olive oil to a large pot over high heat.
step-8: add the carrot, onion, and salt.
step-9: cook for 4 minutes, until the vegetables are tender and glossy.
step-10: add the water, lime juice, white vinegar, and the roasted peppers and stir.
step-11: bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 10 minutes.
step-12: remove the pot from the heat and let cool.
step-13: pour the vegetable mixture into a blender and puree until smooth.
step-14: using a funnel, pour the sauce into a bottle or jar and store in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: line a 17-inch round or a 18x26-inch (45x66-cm) rectangular metal tray with parchment paper.
step-3: in a small bowl, mix together the flaxseed and water.
step-4: let sit for 5 minutes.
step-5: in a large bowl, combine the mashed sweet potato, almond flour, flax egg, salt, pepper, dried rosemary, and additional flaxseed.
step-6: the mixture will be thick and pasty.
step-7: spread the mixture onto the tray and flatten slightly.
step-8: place the sweet potato crust in the oven and bake for 30-35 minutes, until the edges are crisp and golden.
step-9: while the crust is baking, prepare the pesto.
step-10: add cashews, pistachios, fresh basil, cilantro, spinach, lemon juice, salt, pepper, garlic cloves, and olive oil to a food processor and process until mostly smooth with a bit of texture.
step-11: when the pizza crust is done baking, spread the pesto on top, then cover with bell peppers, cherry tomatoes, and red onions.
step-12: return the pizza to the oven and bake for 5 minutes more.
step-13: allow to cool for 10-15 minutes.
step-14: top with arugala.

step-1: to clean the chicken, rub all over with a handful of kosher salt, getting rid of any loose skin.
step-2: rinse the chicken well inside and out.
step-3: pat dry with paper towels.
step-4: remove any excess fat from the chicken and set aside for later.
step-5: season the chicken generously with salt.
step-6: stuff the chicken cavity with the ginger slices and scallions.
step-7: place the chicken in a large stock pot, cover with cold water by 1 inch (2 cm), and season with salt to taste.
step-8: bring to a boil over high heat, then immediately reduce the heat to low to maintain a simmer.
step-9: cover and cook for about 30 minutes, or until the internal temperature of the chicken reaches 165°f (75°c).
step-10: remove the pot from the heat.
step-11: remove the chicken from the pot, reserving the poaching liquid for later, and transfer to an ice bath for 5 minutes to stop the cooking process and to keep the chicken skin springy.
step-12: discard the ginger and green onion.
step-13: after it’s cooled, pat the chicken dry with paper towels and rub all over with sesame oil.
step-14: this will help prevent the chicken from drying out.
step-15: in a large wok or skillet, heat ¼ cup (60 ml) of sesame oil over medium-high heat.
step-16: add 2 tablespoons of reserved chopped chicken fat, the garlic, ginger, and salt, and fry until aromatic, about 10 minutes.
step-17: reserve ¼ of the fried garlic mixture, then add the rice to the remaining fried garlic and stir to coat.
step-18: cook for 3 minutes.
step-19: transfer the rice to a rice cooker and add 2 cups (480 ml) of reserved poaching broth.
step-20: steam the rice for 60 minutes, or until tender.
step-21: while the rice is cooking, carve the chicken for serving.
step-22: make the chili sauce: combine the sambal, sriracha, sugar, garlic, ginger, lime juice, and chicken broth in a small bowl and stir to incorporate.
step-23: make the ginger garlic sauce: in a small bowl, combine the ginger, garlic, salt, peanut oil, and rice vinegar, and stir to incorporate.
step-24: make the soy sauce: in a small bowl, combine the reserved fried garlic and ginger with the oyster sauce, dark soy sauce, light soy sauce, and chicken broth, and stir to incorporate.
step-25: serve the sliced chicken with the rice, dipping sauces, sliced cucumbers, and fresh cilantro

step-1: for the griot, add the cubed pork shoulder, salt, pepper, chopped onion, chopped shallots, chopped scallions, sliced bell pepper, sliced garlic, chicken bouillon cube, cloves, orange juice, lime juice, white wine vinegar, thyme sprigs, parsley, and the sliced scotch bonnet peppers to a large dutch oven off the heat.
step-2: with gloves on, mix the mixture thoroughly.
step-3: cover the pot and place in the refrigerator to marinate overnight.
step-4: for the pikliz, combine the shredded cabbage, grated carrot, 1 sliced bell pepper, 1 sliced onion, 3 sliced scallions, 1 sliced shallot, and 2 sliced scotch bonnets in a large bowl.
step-5: add the salt and freshly cracked black pepper.
step-6: put on gloves, and thoroughly mix using your hands.
step-7: pack the pikliz down into sterilized mason jars.
step-8: cover with the white wine vinegar.
step-9: put on the lid and store in the refrigerator for at least 12 hours to marinate.
step-10: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-11: place the dutch oven with the marinated pork on the stove.
step-12: add the 2 cups (480 ml) of water, and bring to a boil.
step-13: transfer the pork to the the oven to braise for 1½ hours or until cooked through and tender.
step-14: pick out all the pieces of pork and place on a paper towel-lined tray lined with paper towel to dry.
step-15: pat down the surface of the pork to make sure there is no moisture.
step-16: heat a pot of oil to 350°f (180°c).
step-17: add the pork in batches and fry until deep golden brown color, about 5-7 minutes.
step-18: transfer the pork to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.
step-19: serve with rice, beans, fried plantains, and the pikliz.

step-1: in a small bowl, mix together the olive oil, sweet chilli sauce, salt, and pepper.
step-2: on soaked bamboo sticks, skewer on the halloumi cubes, then courgette chunks and cherry tomatoes.
step-3: repeat until the skewer is full.
step-4: brush the sweet chilli oil mix onto to skewer.
step-5: on a coal bbq, cook the steak skewers for 2-3 minutes a side, until the cheese and vegetables are soft and turn golden brown.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: in a bowl, combine chicken, cream cheese, monterey jack, cheddar, buffalo sauce, and ranch.
step-3: on a lightly floured surface, roll out one can of pizza dough.
step-4: cut out triangles for eyes, and a mouth.
step-5: bake for 12 minutes, or until the pieces are golden brown, slightly risen and cooked through.
step-6: cut the remaining dough into 16 squares, place a cube of cheese on each one, and roll into balls.
step-7: place in a ring around the edges of a greased oven-safe skillet or dish.
step-8: fill the middle of the dish with the dip filling.
step-9: bake for 35 minutes.
step-10: coat all of the dough with melted butter.
step-11: place the dough face pieces on the dip.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, combine the sugar, vanilla, salt, and eggs.
step-3: beat with an electric hand mixer for 2-3 minutes, until pale in color.
step-4: add the canola oil and beat until incorporated.
step-5: in a medium bowl, mix together the flour and baking powder.
step-6: add half of the flour to the egg mixture and beat until almost completely combined.
step-7: add half of the milk and beat to incorporate.
step-8: add the remaining flour and then the rest of the milk and beat just until no flour streaks remain.
step-9: divide the batter between 3 medium bowls evenly.
step-10: add the orange food coloring to one bowl, the purple food coloring to another, and the black food coloring to the last.
step-11: sift the cocoa powder into the bowl with the black food coloring.
step-12: stir each batter well with a rubber spatula to combine.
step-13: grease a bundt pan and add ½ cup (120 ml) of batter at a time, alternating between colors to create a marbled effect, until all of the batter is used.
step-14: bake for 40-45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted near the center of the cake comes out clean.
step-15: let cool before decorating.
step-16: to make the glaze, add the powdered sugar and milk to a large bowl and whisk until thick and smooth.
step-17: transfer about 2 tablespoons of the glaze to a small bowl.
step-18: add orange food coloring to the large bowl of glaze and black food coloring to the small bowl.
step-19: mix well until the colors are smooth.
step-20: pour the orange glaze over the cake, coating evenly.
step-21: let dry for 5 minutes, then use a spoon to drizzle lines of black glaze over the cake to look like pumpkin ridges.
step-22: fill the center with candy corn and top with the green sugar cone as a “stem.”

step-1: preheat oven to 350ºf (175ºc).
step-2: chop your halloween candy into bite-size pieces.
step-3: in a large bowl, mix sugars and melted butter, whisk until mix turns lighter (around 8 minutes).
step-4: mix in eggs and vanilla, then salt and flour until completely blended.
step-5: mix in the candy.
step-6: bake for 45-50 minutes.
step-7: allow to cool.
step-8: cut into squares.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the beef, salt, pepper, garlic powder, mustard powder, cayenne, minced onion, eggs, bread crumbs, milk, parsley, and worcestershire sauce.
step-4: mix well until evenly combined.
step-5: split the meat mixture in half and place on the baking sheet.
step-6: shape each half into a “foot.”
step-7: press up to form an ankle and hollow out the top to make room for “ankle bones.” add the halved onion, cut side up, to each divot.
step-8: cut 5 toes on each foot and add the reserved slivers of onion to make “toenails.”
step-9: brush around the ankles with ketchup to look like “blood.”
step-10: bake for 1 hour, until the meat is cooked through.
step-11: serve warm.

step-1: in a skillet, cook hot dogs until golden brown.
step-2: with a knife, carefully make 3 slits in the middle of the hot dog, 3 towards the end of the hot dog, and cut the casing off of the tip of the hot dog to make it look like a finger.
step-3: spread ketchup in the hot dog buns, and place the hot dogs.

step-1: in a bowl, mix the beans and salsa.
step-2: put the sour cream in a plastic bag.
step-3: cut off the end of one corner of the bag.
step-4: spread the bean mixture onto a plate.
step-5: spread guacamole over the beans.
step-6: pipe out a bullseye pattern of sour cream over the guacamole.
step-7: run a toothpick through the sour cream from the center outward, until it looks like a spiderweb.
step-8: garnish with lettuce, chopped tomatoes, and black olives.
step-9: serve with tortilla chips.

step-1: fill each plastic glove with water until about 2 inches (5 cm) from the opening of the glove.
step-2: twist the opening and tie into a knot.
step-3: place in a tray, draping some gloves over others if you want some of the fingers to appear bent.
step-4: freeze for at least 4 hours, or overnight, until solid.
step-5: make the lychee eyeballs: place a blueberry inside each lychee.
step-6: use a toothpick to paint a bit of red food coloring on the outside of the lychees to mimic veins on an eyeball.
step-7: add the lychees to a large punch bowl.
step-8: pour in the cranberry juice, ginger ale, reserved lychee juice, and vodka, if using.
step-9: remove the gloves from the freezer and run under warm water for 15 seconds.
step-10: use scissors to cut off the knot and then slide the ice out of each glove and into the punch.
step-11: to serve, ladle punch and a couple eyeballs into glasses.

step-1: peel and slice hard boiled eggs lengthwise.
step-2: separate yolks into a separate bowl.
step-3: add mustard, mayonnaise, paprika, salt, and pepper to the yolks, and mix thoroughly.
step-4: fill a piping bag with the yolk mixture, and pipe into the empty egg whites.
step-5: sprinkle with paprika, and place a piece of chive to make it look like a pumpkin.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: lay out the bread on a work surface and use a glass or a rolling pin to flatten.
step-3: place a circle of ham in the middle of 4 slices of bread.
step-4: top with one circle of cheddar and another slice of ham.
step-5: place the remaining slices of bread on top and, using the lid of a mason jar or a cookie cutter, press down to create 4 pockets.
step-6: make sure the seams are closed, pinching to seal if necessary.
step-7: reserve the bread with the circle cut-outs.
step-8: place the pockets on a baking sheet.
step-9: in a small bowl, mix the melted butter and garlic.
step-10: brush the pockets with garlic butter.
step-11: bake for 15 minutes, or until toasted.
step-12: place the reserved bread on a baking sheet and brush with the remaining garlic butter.
step-13: crack 1 egg into each circle, and season with salt and pepper.
step-14: bake for 5 minutes, or until the yolk is cooked to your preference.
step-15: serve the egg bread with the ham and cheese pockets and sprinkle with chives.

step-1: on a cutting board, place one slice of cheddar cheese, place the slice of ham on top of the cheddar.
step-2: if the ham is not square, trim it to the same size as the slice of cheese.
step-3: scramble your leftover ham trimmings with onion, peppers, and eggs.
step-4: cut the ham and cheese into 4 equal squares.
step-5: repeat with the rest of the ham and cheese.
step-6: stack the ham and cheese until you have 10 layers of ham and 10 layers of cheese.
step-7: on a cutting board, peel the potatoes.
step-8: shred the potatoes into a large bowl lines with a thin towel.
step-9: once all of your potatoes are shredded, wrap the towel tightly and twist to squeeze out all of the water from the potatoes.
step-10: discard the potato water.
step-11: place the shredded potatoes into a clean bowl, add 1 teaspoon of salt, pepper, flour, and egg.
step-12: mix thoroughly.
step-13: wrap the potato mixture around the ham and cheese cube.
step-14: flatten each side to create a cube.
step-15: repeat with the rest of the cubes.
step-16: on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet place the hash brown cubes.
step-17: freeze for 2-3 hours or until solid.
step-18: heat 4 inches (10 cm) of oil in a large pot until the temperature reaches 350˚f (180˚c).
step-19: fry each cube for 4 minutes until golden brown.
step-20: place on a cooling rack or drain on paper towel.
step-21: let cool for 5 minutes.
step-22: sprinkle with the rest of the salt.
step-23: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 450ºf (230ºc), and line a sheet tray with parchment paper.
step-2: in a large bowl, mix the warm water, sugar, and yeast.
step-3: let sit for 5 minutes, or until the mixture becomes cloudy and slightly foamy.
step-4: add the flour, salt, and 1 tablespoon of oil to the bowl with the yeast mixture and stir until combined.
step-5: turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 3-5 minutes.
step-6: wipe the large bowl clean and lightly coat with remaining oil.
step-7: place the dough into the bowl and cover with plastic wrap and a dish towel
step-8: set in a warm place for 20 minutes, or until the dough has nearly doubled in size.
step-9: once risen, turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and stretch the dough into a 12x22-inch (30x56 cm) rectangle.
step-10: layer the ham and provolone in the center of the rectangle, lengthwise, leaving 1-2 inches (2 ½-5 cm) on the top and bottom.
step-11: slice the dough in half through the center, lengthwise.
step-12: fold each piece’s center edge towards the outer edge and pat down, creating a long roll-up.
step-13: slice each roll into 4-5 equal pieces.
step-14: pinch the edges closed on all the pieces and place on sheet tray.
step-15: brush the tops with olive oil and sprinkle with parmesan.
step-16: bake for 15-20 minutes, or until light golden brown.
step-17: serve immediately or allow to cool, then freeze in an airtight container up to 1-2 months.
step-18: to reheat, microwave for 45 seconds to 1 minute.

step-1: preheat oven 375ºf (190ºc)
step-2: add eggs, heavy cream, salt, pepper, onion powder, and garlic powder to a bowl and whisk to combine.
step-3: heat a saute pan to medium heat and spray with nonstick spray.
step-4: add the egg mixture and scramble until soft and almost fully cooked.
step-5: flatten out the puff pastry and cut it into thirds, then cut in half.
step-6: take one sheet of puff pastry and cut 3 strips with a paring knife, leaving about 1 inch (2 ½) on the end to hold it together.
step-7: braid the 3 strips gently.
step-8: on the second sheet of puff pastry, place ham, egg and cheese, making sure to leave some place around the edges.
step-9: place the braid on the top of the cheese and egg mixture, then brush with egg wash.
step-10: place braids on a lightly oil sprayed baking sheet.
step-11: bake 25-30 minutes or until pastry is risen and deep golden brown.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: roll out pizza dough into an 18x10-inch (45x25-cm) rectangle.
step-3: in a bowl, combine butter, garlic, parsley, and salt.
step-4: use a spatula to spread an even layer of the mixture over the dough.
step-5: sprinkle a generous handful of mozzarella and cheddar cheese in a square checkerboard pattern across the dough, making 20 squares.
step-6: place a piece of ham over each section of cheese.
step-7: cut the dough into 20 evenly sized squares and stack four on top of each other, alternating cheeses as you go.
step-8: there will be five stacks of four.
step-9: place stacks in an 8½x4½-inch (21x11-cm) bread pan.
step-10: bake for 35 minutes.

step-1: in a medium size bowl, whisk the eggs, salt, and parmesan until well combined.
step-2: in a medium size saucepan over medium-high heat, melt the butter and pour the egg mixture into the pan.
step-3: let the egg cook just until it starts to set, then add the ham, scallions, and cheddar cheese in the center of the egg wrap.
step-4: cover with a lid and cook for another 3 minutes, or until the egg is fully cooked through and the cheese is melted.
step-5: remove from the pan and fold in the egg wrap’s left and right sides, then roll from the bottom to the top to form a burrito.

step-1: cut a pocket into the side of the chicken breast.
step-2: season chicken with salt and pepper.
step-3: stack the two cheeses and spinach on top of the ham and roll up tightly.
step-4: stuff the chicken with the roll and press the edges of the chicken together to create a seal.
step-5: place the flour, eggs, and bread crumbs into 3 separate bowls.
step-6: being careful to keep the chicken from opening, dip the stuffed chicken in the flour, shaking off the excess.
step-7: then dip the floured chicken into the egg, then breadcrumbs, then egg and breadcrumbs again.
step-8: coat evenly and shake off any excess breading.
step-9: heat oil in a cast iron pan over medium heat and preheat oven to 375ºf (190°c).
step-10: fry the chicken until golden brown on both sides.
step-11: once the chicken is fried, place into a baking dish and bake for 20 minutes, or until the internal temperature of the chicken reaches a minimum of 165ºf (75ºc).

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c)
step-2: cut about ¾ of the way through the chicken horizontally, making sure not to cut through the other side.
step-3: flip the chicken open and flat.
step-4: lay a sheet of plastic wrap on top of the chicken and pound it flatter using a pot or a pan.
step-5: remove the plastic wrap.
step-6: season with the salt, pepper, and garlic powder, rubbing the seasoning in evenly.
step-7: lay 2-3 slices of ham over the chicken, followed by 4 slices of provolone cheese.
step-8: carefully roll the chicken up.
step-9: transfer the flour, eggs, and breadcrumbs into 3 separate bowls.
step-10: dip the chicken roll into the flour, tapping off any excess, and then into the egg, followed by the breadcrumbs.
step-11: place on a baking sheet
step-12: add the broccoli to the baking sheet, mixing it with the olive oil, salt, and pepper.
step-13: make sure to save a little oil to drizzle on top of the chicken.
step-14: bake for 20 minutes.
step-15: slice, then serve!

step-1: slice cucumber into large 1-inch (2 ½ cm) thick slices.
step-2: hollow out center of cucumber, leaving about ½ inch (1 cm) of cucumber inside.
step-3: roll deli meat strips into a small roll.
step-4: stuff cucumber pieces with deli meat, cheese, and carrots until center is filled.
step-5: refrigerate in tightly sealed container.

step-1: fill a small pot two-thirds full with water and bring to a boil.
step-2: with a paring knife, poke a small hole into the wider end of the egg.
step-3: with a spoon, gently lower eggs into the boiling water and boil for precisely 5 minutes.
step-4: cut the cheddar cheese into strips, 4 inches (10 cm) long, ¼ inch (½ cm) thick.
step-5: roll out a piece of white bread until flat and dense.
step-6: place a slice of ham on the bread, then top with a strip of cheddar.
step-7: roll up the bread (like a jelly roll) until cheese and ham are entirely covered.
step-8: fry the bread rolls for about 4 minutes in a buttered sauté pan over medium-high heat.
step-9: turn halfway through when rolls are lightly browned.
step-10: when eggs are done, carefully transfer them to a bowl of ice water.
step-11: meanwhile, use an egg carton to cut out egg holders for each egg.
step-12: take eggs out of ice water.
step-13: serve with the ham and cheese dunkers.

step-1: preheat oven broiler to high.
step-2: on a cutting board, butter all the toast and transfer to parchment paper-lined baking tray.
step-3: using a glass, cut a center hole out of 6 slices of bread.
step-4: broil bread for 5 minutes or until toasted.
step-5: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-6: for the bechamel sauce, melt butter in a saucepan and add in flour, whisking until color slightly darkens.
step-7: add in milk and simmer on low heat until reduced by half.
step-8: remove from heat and add salt, pepper, nutmeg, gruyere, and parmesan and stir until fully incorporated.
step-9: in a 9 x 13-inch baking tray lay out 6 pieces of toast.
step-10: top with a layer of 9 slices of cheese, then 6 slices of ham and 2 cups of spinach.
step-11: cover spinach with another layer of toast and top with a layer of 9 slices of cheese, then 6 slices of ham and 2 cups of spinach.
step-12: top the spinach with the 6 hollowed out bread slices.
step-13: crack an egg into each slice and cover the top layer with bechamel, leaving only the yolks exposed.
step-14: cover and bake for 35 minutes, or for an addition 10 minutes uncovered.

step-1: place a slice of bread in a preheated, greased waffle iron.
step-2: spread the eggs evenly on top.
step-3: sprinkle the chives over the eggs.
step-4: top with the ham, followed by the cheese.
step-5: place the second slice of bread on top.
step-6: cook for 3-5 minutes, until cheese is melted and the bread is golden brown, then serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: place the puff pastry sheets on top of each other on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-3: use a large bowl or plate to cut around the outside, and remove the excess dough.
step-4: remove the top piece of puff pastry and sprinkle half of the cheese on the bottom piece, followed by ham and the rest of the cheese.
step-5: place the other round of puff pastry on top.
step-6: place a mason jar, or glass in the middle of the puff pastry circle.
step-7: cut the dough up to the cup, creating strips all the way around.
step-8: twist each strip twice, so that it’s still attached to the center.
step-9: bake for 35-40 minutes or until the crust is golden brown.
step-10: mix the mayonnaise, mustard, honey, salt, pepper, and garlic powder together until well combined.
step-11: serve the ham and cheese twists with the dip.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: cut the puff pastry into six rectangles and place on a nonstick baking tray.
step-3: on one rectangle, place a slice of cheddar, 1 scrambled egg, and 2 pieces of ham.
