step-4: place a rectangle of pastry on top and seal the edges with a fork.
step-5: repeat with remaining pastry rectangles.
step-6: brush with egg wash.
step-7: bake for 15-20 minutes or until the pastry is flaky and golden.

step-1: in a wok or deep skillet, heat up the oil over high heat and cook onion, garlic, carrots, bell peppers, and ham until onions are translucent and ham is slightly browned.
step-2: push all of the cooked ham and vegetables to the side of the pan.
step-3: beat the eggs and pour into the cleared half of the pan.
step-4: scramble the eggs and mix with the rest of the vegetables.
step-5: add rice, soy sauce, pepper, and pineapple.
step-6: mix well and let the rice cook until slightly crispy.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: beat the butter and brown sugar together until fully mixed.
step-3: add 1 egg and mix until smooth.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: sift together the flour, baking powder, salt, and spices into a large bowl.
step-6: add the butter mixture made earlier and incorporate until a stiff dough is formed.
step-7: roll out between two pieces of clingfilm until about 3 mm (⅛ inch) thick.
step-8: refrigerate for 30 minutes.
step-9: cut out the shapes you would like with a cookie cutter and place on a baking tray lined with paper.
step-10: use a small cocktail stick to create a small hole in each biscuit for the ribbon.
step-11: bake for 8-10 minutes until golden brown.
step-12: cool on the tray for two minutes, opening up the hole again if closed while baking.
step-13: transfer to a wire rack and let cool completely.
step-14: decorate with chocolate or icing sugar, and use string/ribbon to hang off your tree.

step-1: marinate the chicken: add the chicken to a large bowl and season with the salt, pepper, garlic, cumin, smoked paprika, harissa paste, and the juice of 2 lemons.
step-2: toss until the chicken is well coated, then cover with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-3: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-4: add the potatoes to half of a baking sheet and drizzle with the olive oil.
step-5: season with salt, pepper, and the parsley and toss to coat.
step-6: arrange the marinated chicken pieces on the other side of the baking sheet.
step-7: roast the chicken and potatoes for 30 minutes.
step-8: meanwhile, make the sauce: in a small bowl, combine the greek yogurt, salt, pepper, parsley, honey, dill, sumac, and remaining ¼ cup (60 ml) lemon juice.
step-9: stir well until smooth, the set aside.
step-10: remove the baking sheet from the oven, toss the potatoes, then spread the leeks and lemon zest in an even layer over the potatoes.
step-11: return to the oven for another 20 minutes, or until the chicken is browned and cooked through and the vegetables are tender and slightly crispy.
step-12: serve the chicken over the potatoes and leeks and drizzle with the yogurt sauce.

step-1: within the skillet, divide the potatoes into two piles and place a large, circular cookie cutter ring around each pile.
step-2: scoop any potatoes that are outside of the cookie cutters into the center of the rings.
step-3: use a spatula to pat down the piles inside the rings to form patties.
step-4: turn heat down to low and cook until bottom of hash browns are crispy.
step-5: use tongs to remove cookie cutter rings and carefully flip the hash browns to crisp up the other side.
step-6: once crispy, remove from the pan.
step-7: in the same pan, add the baby spinach and wilt down over low heat.
step-8: remove spinach from the pan.
step-9: hollandaise: place egg yolks and lemon juice in a blender.
step-10: blend for 10 seconds, then slowly stream in the hot, melted butter (while blender is still running).
step-11: sauce will thicken by the time all of the butter has been added.
step-12: blend in salt.
step-13: assembly: place a hash brown on each plate.
step-14: top with spinach, then a poached egg.
step-15: spoon hollandaise over the eggs.
step-16: garnish with chives.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a large pan over medium heat, heat the olive oil until shimmering, then add the onion.
step-3: sauté the onion until golden and translucent, about 5 minutes.
step-4: add the garlic, ground beef, 1 teaspoon of salt, and ½ teaspoon of pepper.
step-5: break down with a spatula and cook until brown and cooked through.
step-6: add the spinach and stir until wilted.
step-7: remove the pan from the heat and set aside.
step-8: peel the potatoes and grate.
step-9: place the shredded potatoes in a kitchen towel over a bowl and wring out the water.
step-10: in another large bowl, add the shredded potato, egg, remaining teaspoon of salt, remaining ½ teaspoon of pepper, onion powder, garlic powder, and parmesan cheese.
step-11: mix until combined.
step-12: line a small bowl with plastic wrap.
step-13: place 1 cup (250 g) of the potato mixture in the bowl and use a spoon to spread the potatoes around the sides of the bowl.
step-14: sprinkle cheddar cheese on top of the potatoes and add a large spoonful of the beef mixture, being careful not to overfill.
step-15: pick up the sides of the plastic wrap and close the potatoes, twisting to create a sealed ball.
step-16: chill for 30 minutes.
step-17: place the potato balls on a greased baking sheet and bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the potatoes are crispy and brown.
step-18: serve topped with marinara sauce and parsley.

step-1: in a bowl, combine hash browns, one cup of cheddar (100 g), salt, pepper, and olive oil.
step-2: divide hash brown mixture into the cups of a 12-cup muffin tin.
step-3: press the hash browns down firmly along the shape of the cups.
step-4: bake at 400°f (200°c) for 20 minutes to set the cups.
step-5: crack an egg into each cup and sprinkle some salt, pepper, and the remaining cheddar on top.
step-6: bake again at 350°f (180°c) for 13-15 minutes, or until the egg whites have set.
step-7: after they have cooled, remove cups by running a knife along their edges.
step-8: serve with all the toppings you desire!

step-1: preheat waffle iron on high.
step-2: spray iron with cooking spray.
step-3: evenly spread half of the potato batter in the waffle iron and close.
step-4: cook for 5–7 minutes until nicely browned.
step-5: using a fork, remove hash-brown waffle from iron.
step-6: cook the second waffle using the rest of the potato batter.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c)
step-2: peel, halve, and core an apple of your choice.
step-3: honeycrisp and granny smith are both great options for baking.
step-4: make vertical slices in each apple 1 cm (⅓ inch) thick, stopping 2 cms (¾ inch) from the bottom of each apple half.
step-5: baste with a mixture of 1 tbsp melted butter, 1 tbsp brown sugar, and ½ tsp cinnamon.
step-6: bake at 400°f (205°c) for 20 minutes.
step-7: optional crumble topping.
step-8: cut frozen butter into small nibs.
step-9: toss in a combination of 3 tbsp ap flour and 1 tbsp white sugar until flour and sugar clump up around butter.
step-10: spoon the crumble topping on top of the apples.
step-11: bake an additional 15 minutes at 425°f (220°c).

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: place a rack in the upper third of the oven.
step-3: using a vegetable peeler, peel the skin and the white flesh directly beneath the skin from the butternut squash until the deep orange flesh is exposed.
step-4: leave the stem intact if possible.
step-5: cut the squash in half lengthwise.
step-6: remove the seeds and pulp.
step-7: place the squash cut-side down on a rimmed baking sheet and pour in the water.
step-8: bake the squash for 20 minutes, until the flesh is softened but not fully cooked.
step-9: this par-cooking will making the cutting much easier.
step-10: cool the squash until it can be safely handled with your bare hands.
step-11: place one squash half cut-side down on a cutting board.
step-12: using a sharp knife, carefully cut very thin slits, about ⅛-inch (3 mm) wide, about ¾ of the way through the squash, being careful not to cut all the way through.
step-13: repeat with the second half.
step-14: grease the baking sheet with olive oil and return the squash to the pan, cut-side down.
step-15: brush more olive oil all over the squash.
step-16: season with salt and pepper.
step-17: bake for another 35 minutes, until the squash is fork tender and golden brown on top.
step-18: while the squash finishes baking, make the sauce.
step-19: in a small saucepan over medium heat, warm 2 tablespoons of olive oil.
step-20: add the shallots, season with salt, and cook for 10-12 minutes, stirring, until they begin to caramelize.
step-21: add the mustard, maple syrup, and apple cider vinegar and whisk to combine.
step-22: simmer for 3 minutes, until the sauce is slightly reduced and thickened.
step-23: season with salt and pepper to taste.
step-24: remove from the heat.
step-25: drizzle the warm sauce over the butternut squash, making sure to get the sauce in between the slits as best you can.
step-26: top with the hazelnuts, pomegranate seeds, and chives.
step-27: serve warm.

step-1: season chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
step-2: make parallel cuts in each chicken breast without slicing all of the way through.
step-3: place chicken breasts in a large bowl.
step-4: add buttermilk and ranch seasoning mix to the bowl and stir until chicken is well-coated.
step-5: marinate in refrigerator for 4 hours, or overnight.
step-6: while chicken is marinating, place cheese puffs in a food processor or blender and pulse until finely ground.
step-7: pour into a large bowl.
step-8: using tongs or yours hands, toss each marinated chicken breast into cheese puff powder.
step-9: bend coated chicken breast to form a hollow circle.
step-10: use a toothpick to seal the ends together.
step-11: heat oil to 350°f (175°c) in a large skillet or pot.
step-12: carefully place each breast in the hot oil and cook for 4-5 minutes, or until internal temperature of chicken breast reaches 165°f (75°c).
step-13: remove the chicken breasts and transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.
step-14: serve with french fries, carrots, broccoli, and ranch dressing, if desired.

step-1: place the loaf of bread on a cutting board with a chopstick on either long side of the loaf.
step-2: make 9 equal slices crosswise through the loaf, using the chopsticks to keep from cutting all the way through.
step-3: cut around the sides of the bell peppers, discarding the centers with the ribs and seeds, then thinly slice.
step-4: season the flank steak all over with salt and pepper.
step-5: thinly slice the steak at a 45-degree angle into ½-inch (1 ¼ cm) thick pieces.
step-6: heat the oil in a large cast-iron skillet over high heat.
step-7: cook the steak for 4 minutes on each side, or until a nice brown crust forms.
step-8: remove the steak from the pan and set aside.
step-9: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-10: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-11: add the onion to the pan and cook for 5 minutes until it starts to soften and brown on the edges.
step-12: move the onions to one side of the pan and add the peppers to the other side.
step-13: season with salt and pepper to taste.
step-14: cook the peppers and onion for another 5 minutes, or until caramelized.
step-15: remove the pan from the heat.
step-16: set the sliced loaf of bread on the prepared baking sheet.
step-17: fold 9 provolone slices in half and place in between the slices of bread.
step-18: place 2 pieces of flank steak in every other slit.
step-19: place peppers and onion in the slits with the steak.
step-20: place the remaining 4 slices of provolone over the loaf of bread.
step-21: bake for 20 minutes, or until the cheese is browned.
step-22: pull apart the sandwich at the slits with just cheese.

step-1: cook the spinach on a medium heat in a splash of oil for 3-5 minutes until it is slightly wilted.
step-2: stir in the ricotta and cook for a further 30-60 seconds.
step-3: allow to cool.
step-4: cut slits into the chicken breasts about 1cm (½ inch) apart but don’t cut all the way through - about 75% of the way down is what you should aim for.
step-5: stuff all of the spinach and ricotta mixture into the slits.
step-6: season the chicken with salt and pepper.
step-7: grate the cheddar and sprinkle it generously on top.
step-8: shake the ground paprika over the chicken to add some colour and flavour.
step-9: bake in the centre of a pre-heated oven for 20-25 minutes 200°c (400°f, gas mark 6) until the cheese has melted and the juices are clear.

step-1: cut seven slits on the top of the chicken breast.
step-2: in each slit, spread 1 teaspoon of tomato puree, 1 mozzarella slice, and 1 salami slice.
step-3: sprinkle on the cheddar cheese and oregano.
step-4: bake for 20 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.
step-5: it should have an internal temperature of 165˚f (75˚c).

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
step-3: add shallots and garlic, cooking until translucent.
step-4: add mushrooms, salt, and pepper, cooking until mushrooms are golden brown.
step-5: remove from heat.
step-6: in a medium bowl, combine mushrooms, cream cheese, egg yolks, and chives, stirring until evenly incorporated.
step-7: set aside.
step-8: on a cutting board, season both sides of the steak with salt and pepper.
step-9: cut about ¾ of the way through the steak, making the incisions 1-inch (2 cm) part.
step-10: pack a spoonful of the mushrooms mixture into each cut in the steak.
step-11: heat the oil in a pan over high heat.
step-12: sear the steak for about 30 seconds, then bake for 10-15 minutes, depending on how you like your steak cooked.
step-13: slice and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: make a series of slices across the sweet potatoes from tip to tip about ¼ inch (6 mm) thick.
step-3: transfer to a greased baking dish.
step-4: brush potatoes with olive oil.
step-5: season with salt and pepper.
step-6: bake for 1 hour, or until sweet potatoes are soft.
step-7: dress one potato with maple syrup, pecans, rosemary, and cinnamon.
step-8: to one of the remaining potatoes, place thin slices of cheddar in between the potato slices and sprinkle with bacon.
step-9: to one of the remaining potatoes, dress with garlic, thyme, parsley, and parmesan.
step-10: place potatoes back in the oven for 10 minutes, or until cheese is melted.
step-11: while potatoes are cooking, combine yogurt, chipotle, lime, water, garlic, and salt into a small bowl.
step-12: set aside.
step-13: dress the last potato with avocado slices and the chipotle aioli.
step-14: garnish the potatoes to your liking.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: cut pizza dough into 8 sections on a floured surface.
step-3: with one section, roll out dough until flat and circular.
step-4: layer ham, swiss, pineapple, 1 tablespoon ricotta, and ½ tablespoon green onion.
step-5: fold one side of dough up and over ingredients, and seal calzone by crimping the edges together.
step-6: place on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-7: apply egg wash to outside of calzone and sprinkle with poppy seeds.
step-8: bake calzones at 400°f (200°c) for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: spread the hazelnuts on a baking sheet and toast for about 8 minutes, until fragrant and browned.
step-3: let cool, then remove the skins by gently rubbing with a kitchen towel.
step-4: increase the oven temperature to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-5: in a food processor, combine the buckwheat flour, hazelnuts, rosemary leaves, 3 tablespoons of maple syrup, and the salt.
step-6: pulse until the hazelnuts break down and the mixture resembles a coarse meal.
step-7: add the butter and pulse to combine, until no large chunks of butter remain.
step-8: press the crust into a 10-inch (25-cm) tart pan.
step-9: poke holes all over the bottom of the crust with a fork.
step-10: bake the crust for 10 minutes.
step-11: reduce the oven temperature to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-12: spread the orange marmalade over the bottom of the warm crust.
step-13: arrange the brie slices evenly over the marmalade.
step-14: shingle the pear slices neatly around the outside edge of the tart, packing them close together.
step-15: add a second layer around the outside edge, on top of the first layer.
step-16: there should be a circle left in the center of the tart.
step-17: begin tucking pear slices horizontally, skin-side up, around the edge of the inner circle.
step-18: work toward the center, using smaller slices as the circle gets smaller (the thinner the better here, they will bend and not break!).
step-19: once you get to the very middle, tuck a few small slices into the center to fill in.
step-20: using a pastry brush, lightly brush the remaining tablespoon of maple syrup over the pear slices.
step-21: bake for 40 minutes, until the pears have softened.
step-22: let cool for 10 minutes before slicing.
step-23: nutrition - calories: 226, total fat: 13 grams, sodium: 106 mg, total carbohydrates: 25 grams, dietary fiber: 4 grams, sugars: 13 grams, protein: 5 grams

step-1: in a medium bowl, soak raw hazelnuts in 2 cups (475 ml) of water overnight.
step-2: drain the bowl of water and place the hazelnuts in a blender.
step-3: add 1 tablespoon vanilla, 2 tablespoons honey, 2 tablespoons unsweetened cacao powder, 1 pinch of salt, and 4 cups (945 ml) of water to the blender.
step-4: blend the mixture on high for 90 seconds.
step-5: use a cheesecloth to strain the liquid into a pouring container.
step-6: (optional) refrigerate 1-2 hours or serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (175°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, mix butter and brown sugar.
step-3: beat in the egg and vanilla and continue blending for 2 minutes.
step-4: add the dry ingredients and mix until dough forms.
step-5: divide the dough in half.
step-6: place half of the dough in the baking tray, making sure the entire bottom is covered.
step-7: spread the hazelnut spread evenly, then add the dark chocolate on top.
step-8: spread marshmallow fluff on top of the chocolate.
step-9: (microwave the fluff for 30 seconds.
step-10: it will make it more spreadable.)
step-11: take the remaining dough and make small shingles to cover the the top.
step-12: bake for 35 minutes or until the top is golden brown.
step-13: cut into desired pieces and enjoy!

step-1: gently heat the hazelnut milk in a saucepan over a medium heat.
step-2: stir in the chopped up strawberries, cocoa butter, and maple syrup.
step-3: take off the heat and blend until smooth.
step-4: pour into a tall glass.
step-5: garnish with whipped coconut cream, strawberries, and icing sugar.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, combine flour, baking powder, and cocoa powder.
step-3: blend eggs, vanilla, honey, yogurt, banana, avocado, and spinach until pureed.
step-4: pour wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix just until combined.
step-5: fold in chocolate chips.
step-6: line muffin tin with baking cups/liners.
step-7: using an ice cream scooper or spoon, fill the muffin tin cups with the batter.
step-8: bake for 20 minutes, or until fully cooked.

step-1: heat the olive oil over a skillet and add chicken.
step-2: season with salt and pepper, and cook 5-8 minutes, or until no longer pink.
step-3: remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
step-4: in the same pan, add the garlic and sauté for one minute over medium heat.
step-5: sprinkle the flour over the garlic and slowly add in the chicken stock.
step-6: quickly stir to avoid lumps.
step-7: add in the skim milk, stir ,and allow to reach a boil to thicken sauce.
step-8: season with salt and pepper.
step-9: once the sauce is thickened, add in the spinach and stir until wilted.
step-10: remove from heat and add in the cooked penne, chicken, and parmesan.
step-11: stir to coat.
step-12: top with fresh parmesan.

step-1: preheat the oven to 325˚f (170˚c).
step-2: grease a baking sheet with cooking spray.
step-3: add the cashews to a food processor and pulse until finely ground.
step-4: add the oat flour, salt, maple syrup, milk, and vanilla to the food processor and blend until fully combined and the crust becomes very sticky and clumps together.
step-5: transfer the crust to the prepared baking sheet and use your hands to form it into the shape of a pizza, about ¼-inch (6 mm) thick.
step-6: bake for 10-15 minutes, or until the edges of the crust are just starting to turn golden brown.
step-7: let the crust cool completely, then chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-8: in a medium bowl, combine the greek yogurt, maple syrup, and vanilla.
step-9: top the crust with the greek yogurt mixture and spread evenly with a rubber spatula.
step-10: top with sliced fruit and sprinkle with lemon zest, if using.
step-11: slice with a knife or pizza cutter, then serve.

step-1: heat sesame oil in a skillet, and cook garlic until softened.
step-2: add the chicken, salt, and pepper, and sauté for 5 minutes.
step-3: add the carrots and broccoli, and sauté until tender.
step-4: add the rice, soy sauce, and peas, and mix thoroughly.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c.)
step-2: combine the greek yogurt, honey, and vanilla in a bowl.
step-3: transfer to a freezer-safe container and freeze for 2 hours, or until consistency is thick and creamy but still scoopable.
step-4: add the rolled oats to a bowl of a food processor and pulse until it becomes a flour-like consistency.
step-5: combine coconut oil, honey, vanilla, and egg in a large bowl.
step-6: add in oats, baking soda, and a pinch of salt and mix until thoroughly incorporated.
step-7: fold in chocolate chips.
step-8: using an ice cream scoop or a tablespoon, form 8 balls of cookie dough and place onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-9: using your hands or the back of a spoon, press down firmly on each ball to form a cookie shape.
step-10: bake for 8-10 minutes, or until golden brown on the edges.
step-11: let cool for about 10 minutes.
step-12: while the cookies are cooling, you may want to remove ice cream from the freezer and let sit out to soften.
step-13: flip cookies over so the flat sides are facing up.
step-14: add one scoop of frozen yogurt to 4 of the cookies.
step-15: use the remaining 4 cookies to form sandwiches by placing on top of the ice cream scoop and pressing down very gently to slowly spread out the ice cream.
step-16: feel free to use a spoon to smooth out the ice cream instead.
step-17: freeze for 1 hour, or to your liking.

step-1: in a large skillet over medium heat, cook turkey bacon according to package instructions.
step-2: remove and set to the side.
step-3: using the same skillet, add diced sweet potatoes and season with salt and pepper.
step-4: cook until soft.
step-5: remove from pan and set aside.
step-6: add diced red bell peppers and cook until softened.
step-7: remove from pan and set aside.
step-8: cook spinach, then set aside.
step-9: reduce heat to medium-low and pour in beaten eggs.
step-10: remove from pan once cooked.
step-11: to assemble the burritos, place down parchment paper, then put the tortilla on top.
step-12: add scrambled eggs, sweet potatoes, spinach, bell pepper, turkey bacon, and cheese.
step-13: fold the left and right side of the burrito in, then fold the bottom up and roll tightly.
step-14: roll burrito into parchment paper.
step-15: serve now or place into a bag or reusable container.
step-16: transfer to the freezer.
step-17: freeze for up to 1 month.
step-18: to reheat, remove burrito from parchment paper and wrap in a damp paper towel.
step-19: microwave for 3 minutes or until warm.
step-20: rest for one minute.

step-1: generously butter a 9-inch (23 cm) cast iron or cake pan.
step-2: in a large bowl, whisk together warm almond milk, melted coconut oil, and sugar.
step-3: the mixture should be just warm, registering between 100-110˚f (40˚c).
step-4: if hotter, allow to cool slightly.
step-5: sprinkle the yeast evenly over the warm mixture and let sit for 5 minutes.
step-6: add 4 cups (460 g) of whole wheat flour to the milk mixture and mix with a wooden spoon until just combined.
step-7: cover the bowl with a towel or plastic wrap and set in a warm place to rise for 1 hour.
step-8: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-9: in a small bowl combine the applesauce, brown sugar, and cinnamon, and stir to combine.
step-10: set aside.
step-11: remove the towel and add remaining whole wheat flour, baking powder, and salt.
step-12: stir well, then turn out onto a well-floured surface.
step-13: knead the dough lightly until the dough just loses its stickiness and does not stick to the surface.
step-14: roll the dough out into a large rectangle, about ¼-inch (½ cm) thick.
step-15: fix corners to make sure they are sharp and even.
step-16: spread the filling mixture evenly over the rolled out dough, spreading right to the edges.
step-17: gently roll the dough into a large log and slice it into 1-inch (2 cm) pieces.
step-18: place the cinnamon rolls in the greased cake pan, leaving some space between them, and bake for 30 minutes.
step-19: while the cinnamon roll is baking, prepare the frosting.
step-20: in a medium-size mixing bowl, whisk together the light cream cheese, coconut oil, vanilla extract, almond milk, and maple syrup, until smooth.
step-21: remove the cinnamon rolls from the oven and let cool in the pan for at least 15 minutes.
step-22: once cool, remove from pan and drizzle frosting over the rolls before serving.

step-1: fill a mason jar with soy sauce, sesame oil, pepper, mushrooms, carrots, spinach, noodles, and green onions.
step-2: adjust seasonings to taste.
step-3: store in the fridge for up to 5 days.
step-4: when you’re ready to serve, pour in the hot water or broth.
step-5: stir well.

step-1: fill a mason jar with soy sauce, sesame oil, pepper, mushrooms, carrots, spinach, noodles, and green onions.
step-2: adjust seasonings to taste.
step-3: store in the fridge for up to 5 days.
step-4: when you’re ready to serve, pour in the hot water or broth.
step-5: stir well.

step-1: add potatoes, carrot, and onion to a boiling pot of water.
step-2: cook for 10 minutes or until fork-tender.
step-3: reserve two cups of boiled water, and drain the rest through a colander.
step-4: add cooked vegetables, cashews, salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, and nutritional yeast.
step-5: put 1 cup (235 ml) of reserved boiled water into blend.
step-6: blend until well combined.
step-7: if a smoother texture is desired, add more of the boiled water.
step-8: pour mix over cooked pasta and coat evenly.
step-9: garnish with paprika (optional).

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: place graham crackers in a plastic bag and crush with a rolling pin until fine.
step-3: in a medium bowl, mix the cracker crumbs with the milk, stirring until the milk has incorporated completely into the crackers with the texture of slightly wet sand.
step-4: pour the cracker mixture into a 9 inch (23 cm) springform pan.
step-5: press down the crust evenly using the back of a flat measuring cup or spoon.
step-6: bake for 15 minutes, then cool.
step-7: reduce the heat to 300°f (150°c).
step-8: in a large bowl, whisk the cream cheese until there are no lumps.
step-9: add the honey, greek yogurt, eggs, vanilla, and cornstarch, mixing until smooth.
step-10: pour the cheesecake batter into the graham cracker crust.
step-11: spread evenly.
step-12: bake for about 1 hour, then cool for about 30 minutes.
step-13: top with fresh raspberries in a ring pattern on the top of the cheesecake.
step-14: chill until the cheesecake has set, 2-4 hours.
step-15: unmold, slice, then serve!

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: in a bowl, add the oats, brown sugar, salt, whole wheat flour, applesauce, and cinnamon and mix to combine.
step-3: pit and slice peaches.
step-4: in a separate bowl, add the peaches, brown sugar, cinnamon, cornstarch, and vanilla extract and mix to combine.
step-5: spread the peaches in an even layer in a skillet, and top with the oat mixture.
step-6: bake for 40-45 minutes, until the peaches are bubbling and the oats are golden brown.
step-7: slice and serve with a scoop of ice cream (optional).

step-1: add the brown rice, vegetable broth, and diced carrots to your instant pot.
step-2: stir until combined.
step-3: close the lid until you hear the beep.
step-4: tip: closing the lid can be tricky.
step-5: have the pressure knob at 11 o’clock and turn right.
step-6: turn pressure knob to “sealing”.
step-7: select manual and reduce the time to 24 minutes.
step-8: it will say “on” in a few seconds.
step-9: note: the instant pot will need to warm up for 5-10 minutes.
step-10: steam will be released and a few minutes later, the time will start counting down.
step-11: once the time goes off, carefully turn the pressure knob to “venting”.
step-12: let all of the stream release before opening the lid.
step-13: stir the rice, then transfer from the pot into a medium sized bowl and set aside.
step-14: select “saute” on the instant pot.
step-15: once it says “hot”, add the oil.
step-16: when the oil is shimmering, add the onion.
step-17: cook for around 1 minute until slightly opaque.
step-18: add the minced garlic, frozen peas, salt, and pepper.
step-19: mix until incorporated.
step-20: add rice mixture and stir until everything is combined.
step-21: make a well in the middle of the rice for the eggs.
step-22: pour the beaten eggs into the well, stirring only the eggs until they are cooked.
step-23: mix everything together.
step-24: top with scallions.

step-1: make the spiced seeds and nuts: in a small bowl, combine the hazelnuts, nigella seeds, sesame seeds, cinnamon, turmeric, crushed coriander, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, ground ginger, salt and pepper.
step-2: mix together and set aside for garnish.
step-3: these seeds and nuts will keep in an airtight container for up to 1 week.
step-4: make the soup: heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium hight heat.
step-5: add the carrot, onion, celery, parsnip, garlic, salt, and pepper.
step-6: stir and cook until the vegetables are fully softened, about 10 minutes.
step-7: add the broccoli, asparagus, and vegetable broth.
step-8: bring to a boil.
step-9: add the lemon juice, kale, spinach, and stir to wilt the greens in the hot soup.
step-10: do not cook the greens for longer than about 3 minutes.
step-11: once the greens have wilted, puree the soup to your desired consistency.
step-12: serve immediately.
step-13: top with coconut cream, chia seeds, avocado, and the spiced seeds and nuts.

step-1: mash bananas in a large bowl until smooth.
step-2: mix in eggs and vanilla until well combined, then mix in oats and cinnamon.
step-3: heat a skillet to medium and add in a scoop* of the pancake batter.
step-4: smooth out to form an even layer.
step-5: cook for about 2-3 minutes until you start to see bubbles releasing from the top of the batter.
step-6: flip and cook until the other side is golden brown, about 1-2 minutes.
step-7: garnish your pancakes with your favorite toppings! we used banana slices, chopped walnuts & maple syrup.
step-8: *note: use ½ cup for scooping the batter to yield 4 thicker pancakes; use ⅓ cup to yield 6 smaller pancakes.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, mash bananas.
step-3: mix eggs, yogurt, honey, vanilla extract, and baking soda into mixture.
step-4: add flour and mix.
step-5: add blueberries and gently fold into mixture.
step-6: pour the batter into a greased 9 x 5-inch (23 x 13 cm) bread pan.
step-7: bake for about 50 mins, or until a toothpick comes out clean from the middle of the bread.
step-8: (baking times may vary, so keep an eye on the bread.)
step-9: allow to cool for 15 minutes before serving.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f/180˚c.
step-2: combine dry ingredients of the crisp topping in a bowl.
step-3: then add in the wet ingredients and mix until evenly coated.
step-4: add blueberries to a medium-sized baking dish, then cover with the crisp topping.
step-5: bake 45-50 minutes, or until golden brown and blueberries start to bubble.
step-6: mix together greek yogurt and maple syrup in a measuring cup.
step-7: drizzle over your blueberry crisp.
step-8: serve and enjoy!

step-1: mash bananas in a large bowl until smooth.
step-2: mix in eggs and vanilla until well combined, then mix in oats.
step-3: fold in blueberries carefully.
step-4: heat a skillet to medium and add in a scoop of the pancake batter.
step-5: smooth out to form an even layer.
step-6: cook for about 2-3 minutes until you start to see bubbles releasing from the top of the batter.
step-7: flip and cook until the other side is golden brown, about 1-2 minutes.
step-8: garnish your pancakes with your favorite toppings! (we used greek yogurt, granola, fresh blueberries and maple syrup.

step-1: whisk together egg spinach, red pepper, salt and pepper.
step-2: heat a nonstick pan over a medium heat.
step-3: place a greased mason jar lid right side up on the pan.
step-4: slowly pour egg mixture into lid.
step-5: cover, cook for 3 minutes
step-6: remove cover.
step-7: using a fork pull the lid off of the egg.
step-8: flip egg, cook for another 3 minutes.
step-9: remove from heat once cooked through.
step-10: place egg patty on english muffin and top with sliced avocado.

step-1: add the ice, kiwis, strawberries, oat milk, and spinach to a blender.
step-2: blend on high speed until smooth.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: grate the broccoli with a coarse cheese grater.
step-3: transfer the grated bits to a medium bowl and season with a ¼ teaspoon of the salt.
step-4: mix the broccoli until well incorporated.
step-5: let the broccoli sit for 20 minutes until the salt has drawn out some of the moisture.
step-6: pour the broccoli into a clean kitchen towel and twist to strain as much liquid as you can.
step-7: place the grated broccoli back into a bowl and mix with the breadcrumbs, chives, cheddar, garlic, remaining ¼ teaspoon of salt, pepper, and egg, and mix until well combined.
step-8: form the mixture into 15 even sized tots and transfer to a parchment lined baking sheet.
step-9: bake for 20-24 minutes, flipping each halfway through.
step-10: serve with your choice of dipping sauce.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (175°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, whisk the eggs until light and fluffy.
step-3: add in the greek yogurt and whisk again until the mixture is smooth and fluffy.
step-4: pour in the maple syrup, milk, and vanilla extract.
step-5: beat the mixture again until smooth.
step-6: add the shredded carrots, whole wheat flour, baking powder, and cinnamon over the wet ingredients.
step-7: using a rubber spatula, fold the wet and dry ingredients together just until combined.
step-8: using a medium ice cream scoop, portion the batter into a greased 12-cup muffin tin.
step-9: bake for 20 minutes, until the muffins have risen and set.
step-10: for the frosting, beat the cream cheese in a small bowl until smooth.
step-11: add in the maple syrup and vanilla and beat again until the mixture is well combined.
step-12: once the muffins have cooled, use a small ice cream scoop to spoon a bit of the frosting on top of the muffins.
step-13: gently tap the muffins on the counter to smooth out the layer of frosting on top.

step-1: break down a head of cauliflower in a food processor until it’s the size of rice.
step-2: heat sesame oil over high.
step-3: add garlic and fry until fragrant.
step-4: add the beef, chicken, pork, shrimp or tofu and cook until 80% done.
step-5: add carrots and cauliflower, stir until thoroughly incorporated.
step-6: mix in peas.
step-7: push ingredients to the sides of the pan to create a well.
step-8: pour in 2 whisked eggs and let it set for 15 seconds.
step-9: scramble eggs and fold into the cauliflower rice.
step-10: season with white pepper and stir in soy sauce.
step-11: garnish with chopped green onions and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: grate the cauliflower with a coarse cheese grater.
step-3: transfer the grated bits to a medium bowl and season with a ¼ teaspoon of the salt.
step-4: mix the cauliflower until well incorporated.
step-5: let the cauliflower sit for 20 minutes until the salt has drawn out some of the moisture.
step-6: pour the cauliflower into a kitchen towel and twist to strain as much liquid as you can.
step-7: place the grated cauliflower back into a bowl and mix with the breadcrumbs, parsley, parmesan, garlic, remaining ¼ teaspoon of salt, pepper, and egg, and mix until well combined.
step-8: from the mixutre into 15 even sized tots and transfer to a parchment lined baking sheet.
step-9: bake for 20-24 minutes, flipping each halfway through.
step-10: serve with your choice of dipping sauce.

step-1: combine all ingredients except the chocolate chips into a food processor or high-speed blender, process until consistent color and completely smooth.
step-2: pour into a pan.
step-3: mix into dark chocolate chips and smooth into an even layer.
step-4: freeze 2 hours, or until frozen but still a little soft for scooping.
step-5: (if freezing overnight, cover with a lid or plastic wrap, but let it sit out at room temperature for about 5-10 minutes before scooping).
step-6: scoop into a bowl and top with your favorite toppings.

step-1: mash bananas in a large bowl until smooth.
step-2: mix in eggs until well combined, then mix in remaining ingredients.
step-3: heat a skillet to medium and add in a scoop of the pancake batter.
step-4: smooth out to form an even layer.
step-5: cook for about 2-3 minutes until you start to see bubbles releasing from the top of the batter.
step-6: flip and cook until the other side is golden brown, about 1-2 minutes.
step-7: garnish your pancakes with your favorite toppings! we used fresh strawberries and maple syrup.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: in a small bowl, mix together all of the fajita seasoning ingredients and set aside.
step-3: heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a large, ovenproof skillet.
step-4: toss in the bell peppers and onions and sprinkle on 2 teaspoons of the fajita seasoning.
step-5: sauté until the veggies have softened, about 6 minutes.
step-6: using a sharp knife, slice into the side of a chicken breast to form a large pocket, being careful not to cut all the way through.
step-7: spoon in some of the fajita pepper mixture so that the breast is comfortably stuffed.
step-8: season the chicken on both sides with fajita seasoning.
step-9: heat the remaining oil in the skillet and brown the chicken, about 4-5 minutes per side.
step-10: transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 10-15 minutes, until the meat is cooked through.
step-11: let the chicken rest for 5 minutes before slicing.

step-1: heat olive oil in a large stock-pot or dutch oven over medium-high heat until the oil begins to shimmer.
step-2: add onions, celery, carrot, and bell pepper.
step-3: cook for 4-5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until vegetables begin to soften.
step-4: add garlic, salt, and pepper, and continue to cook for an additional 10 minutes until vegetables are soft and the onions are translucent.
step-5: add cumin, black beans, vegetable stock, and the bay leaf.
step-6: bring to a boil then reduce to a simmer.
step-7: cover the pot and cook over low heat for 30 minutes until the beans are very tender.
step-8: remove the bay leaf.
step-9: transfer about 4 cups of the soup to a blender and puree until smooth, being careful not to splatter hot soup all over yourself and kitchen.
step-10: pour blended soup back into the pot and mix to incorporate.
step-11: keep over low heat until ready to serve.
step-12: garnish with fresh avocado, queso fresco, chopped cilantro, and tortilla chips.

step-1: combine all of the ingredients above in a blender and blitz until smooth.
step-2: refrigerate to make the soup as chilly as you like

step-1: combine ingredients into a food processor or high-speed blender.
step-2: pour into a pan and smooth into an even layer.
step-3: freeze for 2 hours, or until frozen but still a little soft for scooping.
step-4: (if freezing overnight, cover with a lid or plastic wrap, but let it sit out at room temperature for about 5-10 minutes before scooping).
step-5: scoop into a bowl and top with your favorite toppings.

step-1: combine ingredients into a food processor or high-speed blender, process until consistently green and smooth.
step-2: pour into a pan and smooth into an even layer.
step-3: freeze for 2 hours, or until frozen but still a little soft for scooping.
step-4: (if freezing overnight, cover with a lid or plastic wrap, but let it sit out at room temperature for about 5-10 minutes before scooping).
step-5: scoop into a bowl and top with your favorite toppings.

step-1: in a bowl, mix all ingredients except for the pita, tomatoes, and lettuce.
step-2: portion the chicken salad into 4 containers
step-3: lay the lettuce on top of the chicken salad and add the tomatoes.
step-4: refrigerate up to 4 days.
step-5: serve inside a pita.
step-6: (you can also toast your pita first for an added touch!)

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f/200°c.
step-2: place chicken breast on a baking sheet lined with aluminum foil or parchment paper.
step-3: top with olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, dill, and salt and pepper to season.
step-4: bake for 35-40 minutes until internal temperature reaches 165°f/75°c and the juices run clear.
step-5: add all dressing ingredients in a small bowl or cup and whisk until with a fork until combined.
step-6: slice thinly or cube chicken, cutting to your preference for topping the salad.
step-7: assemble your salad, starting with a base of romaine lettuce.
step-8: then top with chicken, cucumber, olives, red onion, tomatoes, feta, and the dressing.
step-9: toss to evenly incorporate ingredients

step-1: mash bananas in a large bowl until smooth.
step-2: mix in eggs and peanut butter until well combined, then mix in remaining ingredients.
step-3: heat a skillet to medium and add in a scoop of the pancake batter.
step-4: smooth out to form an even layer.
step-5: cook for about 2-3 minutes until you start to see bubbles releasing from the top of the batter.
step-6: flip and cook until the other side is golden brown, about 1-2 minutes.
step-7: garnish your pancakes with your favorite toppings! we used banana slices, dark chocolate chips and maple syrup.

step-1: add all ingredients into a slow cooker.
step-2: stir until combined.
step-3: cook on high for 4 hours or until all cheese is melted.

step-1: add all ingredients into a slow cooker and stir until combined
step-2: cook on high for 4 hours, or until all cheese is melted

step-1: combine ingredients into a food processor or high-speed blender, process until consistently pink and completely smooth
step-2: pour into a pan and smooth into an even layer.
step-3: freeze for 2 hours, or until frozen but still a little soft for scooping.

step-5: scoop into a bowl and top with your favorite toppings.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: grate the sweet potato with a coarse cheese grater.
step-3: transfer the grated bits to a medium bowl and season with a ¼ teaspoon of the salt.
step-4: mix the sweet potato until well incorporated.
step-5: let the sweet potato sit for 20 minutes until the salt has drawn out some of the moisture.
step-6: pour the sweet potato into a kitchen towel and twist to strain as much liquid as you can.
step-7: place the grated sweet potato back into a bowl and mix with the breadcrumbs, parsley, garlic, onion powder, remaining ¼ teaspoon of salt, pepper, and egg, and mix until well combined.
step-8: from the mixutre into 15 even sized tots and transfer to a parchment lined baking sheet.
step-9: bake for 20-24 minutes, flipping each halfway through..
step-10: serve with your choice of dipping sauce.

step-1: in a medium pot, combine the rice, water, coconut oil, and salt.
step-2: bring to a boil, then cover and simmer over low heat for 15-20 minutes, until the water is absorbed.
step-3: once finished cooking, remove the rice from the heat and fluff.
step-4: heat 3 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a large dutch oven over medium-high heat until shimmering.
step-5: add the onions and potatoes and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onions are caramelized and potatoes are golden brown around the edges, about 10 minutes.
step-6: reduce the heat to medium.
step-7: add the remaining tablespoon of oil, the tomato paste, ginger, and garlic.
step-8: cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
step-9: add the garam masala and curry powder and cook, stirring constantly, about 1 minute longer.
step-10: add cauliflower and cook, stirring constantly, until the spices coat the florets, about 2 minutes longer.
step-11: add the tomatoes, chickpeas, water, and salt and stir to combine.
step-12: increase the heat to medium-high and bring the mixture to a boil.
step-13: reduce the heat to medium.
step-14: simmer, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender, 10-15 minutes.
step-15: stir in the coconut milk and frozen peas.
step-16: cook until heated through, about 2 minutes longer.
step-17: remove from the heat.
step-18: meanwhile, in a large bowl, stir together the flour, salt, baking powder, and sugar.
step-19: create a well in the middle of the dry ingredients and pour in 1 tablespoon of melted ghee, the yogurt, skim milk, and a bit of the water.
step-20: mix until combined, adding more water as needed until the dough comes together.
step-21: transfer the dough to a lightly floured surface and knead until no longer sticky, then shape into a ball and divide into quarters.
step-22: roll out the dough portions to ¼ inch (6 mm) thick.
step-23: in a small bowl, combine the remaining tablespoon of melted ghee with the garlic.
step-24: heat a bit of ghee in a medium nonstick pan over medium-high heat.
step-25: add a dough round and brush with the ghee and garlic mixture.
step-26: cook for 3-4 minutes, until the dough bubbles up and forms a nice brown crust, then flip and cook on the other side.
step-27: repeat with the remaining dough.
step-28: serve the curry over the rice with the naan on the side.

step-1: lay out the potatoes, broccoli florets, and red pepper on a baking tray.
step-2: coat with the garlic powder, parsley, salt, pepper, and olive oil and mix together.
step-3: bake in the oven for 25 minutes at 350˚f (180°c).
step-4: coat with the parmesan.
step-5: mix together with the cooked couscous and olive oil.

step-1: preheat oven to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-2: cut eggplant and bell pepper into medium-sized pieces, being sure to remove the seeds, and spread them out on a baking sheet that has been lined with parchment paper.
step-3: lightly coat the vegetables with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
step-4: roast the vegetables for 20-25 minutes, until the edges begin to char and the skin blisters.
step-5: add roasted vegetables to a food processor along with the beans, garlic, parsley, lemon juice, and seasonings.
step-6: pulse until the ingredients are roughly chopped.
step-7: then, with the machine running, slowly pour in the remaining 4 tablespoons of olive oil into the food processor and blend until the mixture is smooth.
step-8: transfer mixture to a bowl and serve with freshly cut vegetables, crackers, or pita bread.
step-9: alternatively, the mixture can be placed into individual serving-sized containers and stored in the refrigerator for up to 4 days.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: grate the zucchini with a coarse cheese grater.
step-3: transfer the grated bits to a medium bowl and season with a ¼ teaspoon of the salt.
step-4: mix the zucchini until well incorporated.
step-5: let the zucchini sit for 20 minutes until the salt has drawn out some of the moisture.
step-6: pour the zucchini into a kitchen towel and twist to strain as much liquid as you can.
step-7: place the grated zucchini back into a bowl and mix with the breadcrumbs, green onions, garlic, onion powder, remaining ¼ teaspoon of salt, pepper, and egg, and mix until well combined.
step-8: from the mixture into 15 even sized tots and transfer to a parchment lined baking sheet.
step-9: bake for 20-24 minutes, flipping each halfway through.
step-10: serve with your choice of dipping sauce.

step-1: scoop the avocado into a medium bowl.
step-2: season with salt and add the lemon juice.
step-3: mash until smooth.
step-4: cut out the center of the bread with heart-shaped cookie cutter.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: melt the butter in a medium skillet over medium-low heat.
step-7: add the heart and cut-out piece of bread and toast until golden brown, 2-3 minutes.
step-8: flip the bread, then crack the egg into the cut-out.
step-9: cover and cook for 1-2 minutes, until the white is set and the yolk is runny, or to your desired doneness.
step-10: transfer to a plate and spread the avocado over the heart.

step-1: add the onion, garlic, jalapeño, chipotle peppers, cilantro, and tomatoes to a food processor.
step-2: puree until well combined, with no large pieces remaining, about 2 minutes.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: season the chicken thighs on both sides with salt and the oregano.
step-5: in a large pot, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium-high heat.
step-6: sear the chicken thighs for 4-5 minutes on each side, until golden brown.
step-7: transfer to a cutting board.
step-8: shred the chicken using 2 forks.
step-9: set aside.
step-10: add the remaining tablespoon of olive oil to the same pot if it appears dry.
step-11: pour the reserved puree into the pot.
step-12: cook over medium-high heat for 10 minutes, until the liquid has started to evaporate.
step-13: reduce the heat to medium and continue cooking until nearly all the moisture has been cooked out and the puree has reduced to a dark paste, stirring occasionally to prevent burning, about 20 minutes.
step-14: pour in the chicken stock and stir, scraping the bottom of the pan to incorporate any browned bits.
step-15: increase the heat to medium-high.
step-16: stir in the shredded chicken and bring to a simmer.
step-17: once the stock is simmering, stir in the hominy and bell pepper.
step-18: reduce the heat to medium and simmer for 5-10 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
step-19: add the lime juice and season with salt to taste.
step-20: serve the soup hot, with onion, cilantro, avocado, cotija cheese, tortilla strips, and lime wedges alongside for topping.

step-1: place the potatoes in a large pot with enough water to cover them by 2 inches (5 cm), cover, and bring to a boil over high heat.
step-2: once boiling, season with salt, reduce the heat to medium, and cook until the potatoes are tender, 25-30 minutes.
step-3: drain and set aside to cool.
step-4: in a large bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, lemon juice, dijon mustard, and paprika.
step-5: season with ½ teaspoon of salt and ½ teaspoon of pepper.
step-6: dice the potatoes and transfer to a separate large bowl, along with the onion, eggs, pickles, and chives.
step-7: season with salt and pepper to taste.
step-8: pour the sauce over the potatoes and toss to coat evenly.
step-9: sprinkle with chopped chives, for garnish.

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: on a cutting board, cut the root end of the beet so it lays flat on the surface.
step-3: place the beet on a piece of aluminum foil.
step-4: drizzle with 1 tablespoon of olive oil and season with ¼ teaspoon salt.
step-5: wrap the foil around the beet and pinch the top of the foil together until the beet is sealed in.
step-6: repeat with the other 2 beets.
step-7: on a sheet pan, place the onions, carrots, parsnips, and sweet potato.
step-8: drizzle with 3 tablespoons olive oil and season with ½ teaspoon pepper and ½ teaspoon salt.
step-9: toss the the vegetables until coated and spread them evenly in the pan.
step-10: create 3 circular spaces for the beets.
step-11: place the 3 beets on the pan.
step-12: bake for 1 hour until with vegetables begin to crisp and caramelize.
step-13: in a large bowl, add ½ cup (120 ml) of olive oil, balsamic vinegar, lemon juice,
step-14: dijon mustard, and garlic powder, and whisk until emulsified.
step-15: add the parsley and season with salt and pepper, stirring to combine.
step-16: add the mixed greens, roasted vegetables, and the beets to the bowl with the vinaigrette and toss until evenly incorporated.

step-1: in large pot or dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
step-2: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the mushrooms and cook for about 5 minutes, or until most of their juices have been released.
step-3: add the onions, carrots, and celery, and cook for 4-5 minutes, or until onions are semi-translucent.
step-4: add the garlic, rosemary, thyme, pepper, tomato paste, and soy sauce, and cook for 2-3 more minutes, until the herbs are fragrant.
step-5: add the flour and stir until fully incorporated.
step-6: add the wine and stir until mostly absorbed.
step-7: add the potatoes, vegetable broth, and bay leaves, and bring to a boil.
step-8: reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 45 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the potatoes are tender and the stew has thickened.
step-9: remove the bay leaves.

step-1: trim the root end and the tough, dark green top of the leek and remove any thick outer layers.
step-2: cut the leek in half lengthwise, then slice into ¼-inch (6-mm) thick half moons.
step-3: transfer to a bowl of water and shake around with your fingers to loosen any dirt or grit.
step-4: let the leeks sit in the water for a couple minutes to let any grit to sink to the bottom of the bowl.
step-5: carefully remove the cleaned leeks from the bowl, leaving the dirty water behind.
step-6: heat the olive oil in a large, heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat.
step-7: add the pancetta and cook until crispy and most of the fat has rendered, about 8 minutes.
step-8: add the leeks, carrots, celery, mushrooms, and garlic.
step-9: season with salt.
step-10: cook for 5-6 minutes, until the vegetables have released their juices and begin to soften.
step-11: add the thyme leaves, tomatoes, beans, and vegetable stock.
step-12: stir to combine, then bring to a boil, cover, and cook, stirring occasionally, for 20 minutes until slightly reduced and hot throughout.
step-13: season with more salt, to taste.
step-14: ladle into bowls and top with freshly grated parmesan cheese.
step-15: serve with crusty bread.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: cut up the vegetables and on a baking sheet, toss together the carrots, turnips, parsnips, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
step-3: roast the vegetables until crispy and tender, 30-35 minutes.
step-4: make the vinaigrette: in a small pan over medium-high heat, combine the schwartz black onion seeds and schwartz mustard seeds and toast, stirring continuously, until fragrant, about 3 minutes.
step-5: in a blender, combine the toasted spices, salt, mustard, apple cider vinegar, and honey.
step-6: blend on high speed until the spices are fully ground and the mixture is smooth.
step-7: with the blender running, slowly drizzle in the olive oil until emulsified.
step-8: transfer the roasted vegetables to a large bowl and pour in ⅓ cup (80 ml) of the dressing.
step-9: toss to coat.
step-10: in a separate large bowl, combine the arugula, bacon, and goat cheese.
step-11: drizzle with more dressing to taste, reserving the remaining dressing for another use, and toss to combine.
step-12: add the roasted vegetables and toss again.
step-13: divide between plates and serve.

step-1: using a serrated knife, slice the tomatoes into ½-inch (1 cm) thick rounds.
step-2: arrange the sliced tomatoes on a plate, alternating colors if desired.
step-3: drizzle with the olive oil and balsamic vinegar, and sprinkle the feta and parsley on top.

step-1: add the ingredients into a mason jar.
step-2: screw the lid on tightly and shake vigorously.

step-4: pour over your favorite salad ingredients and enjoy!

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).

step-3: pulse until mixture forms a dough like texture, about 2 minutes.
step-4: place 1 tablespoon of the broccoli mixture and press into a well greased muffin tin.
step-5: form the mixture into a cup, making the bottom and sides ½-inches (1 cm) thick.
step-6: bake for about 30 minutes until the edges are golden and crispy and the bottom is firm.
step-7: cool the broccoli cups.
step-8: once cooled, remove from the muffin tin.

step-10: fill the broccoli parmesan cups with the ricotta mixture.
step-11: top with slices of tomatoes and basil.
step-12: broccoli parmesan cups can be stored up to 3 days and can be reheated in the oven.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, add the potatoes, butter, shallot, garlic, salt, pepper, thyme, and rosemary.
step-3: toss to combine.

step-6: stir the potatoes, then bake for another 10-15 minutes, until golden brown.

step-1: to make the herb salt, pour all ingredients into a food processes and pulse until desired consistency.
step-2: let the steak rest at room temperature for 30 minutes prior to cooking.
step-3: this will help the steak cook more evenly.
step-4: season the steak liberally on both sides with the herb salt.
step-5: in a large cast-iron skillet, heat a drizzle of oil over medium-high heat until nearly smoking.
step-6: sear the steak for 4-5 minutes on each side, depending on thickness and your desired doneness.
step-7: sear on the sides for 1 minute each to crisp up the fat cap, if desired.
step-8: for medium-rare steak, the internal temperature should read 135˚f (57˚c).
step-9: let the steak rest for 10 minutes, then slice and serve.
step-10: strip steak - calories: 351 - total fat: 25 grams, sodium: 363 mg, total carbs: 0 grams, dietary fiber: 0 grams, sugars: 0 grams, protein: 29 grams

step-1: clean the herbs.
step-2: remove the leaves from the stems and dry thoroughly.
step-3: add the herbs and salt to a food processor.
step-4: pulse until the herbs are well-chopped but have not broken down into a paste.
step-5: transfer the herb salt to a resealable glass jar the salt will keep in the refrigerator for up to 6 months.
step-6: use for rubs, roasts, stews, soups, finishing salt, etc.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper and set a wire rack inside.
step-3: pat the chicken thighs dry with a paper towel.
step-4: generously season the chicken on both sides with the herb salt, rubbing underneath the skin.
step-5: let sit for 15-20 minutes to draw out the moisture from the chicken skin, which will result in crispier chicken.
step-6: after resting, pat the chicken thighs dry once more to remove any excess moisture.
step-7: drizzle the olive oil under the skin and rub into the chicken.
step-8: place the chicken thighs skin-side up on the wire rack.
step-9: bake for 30 minutes, until the skin is crispy and the internal temperature reaches 155-160˚f (68-71˚c).
step-10: let the thighs rest for 15 minutes to bring the internal temperature to 165˚f (75˚c) and to let the juices settle.

step-1: add the carrot tops and herb stems to a blender.
step-2: add the basil, olive oil, walnuts, parmesan, garlic, salt, and lemon juice.
step-3: blend on full speed until smooth.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: place the asparagus and cherry tomatoes on opposite sides of a large, rimmed baking sheet.
step-3: place the chicken breasts in the middle section of the baking sheet.
step-4: drizzle the veggies and chicken with the oil.
step-5: sprinkle on the salt, pepper, basil, thyme, and rosemary, ensuring all the ingredients are evenly coated in the oil and seasonings.
step-6: bake for 25 minutes or until chicken’s internal temperature reaches 165˚f (72˚c).
step-7: allow the chicken to rest for 5 minutes before slicing.
step-8: place the chicken breast on a plate with portions of the roasted veggies and serve.

step-1: stir yeast packet into water and allow yeast to bloom.
step-2: (a light foam should appear on top of the water after about 5 minutes.
step-3: this means the yeast is alive and active.)
step-4: add olive oil to water and mix.
step-5: in a large bowl, mix flour, salt, pepper, and herbs together.
step-6: once incorporated, create a small well in the middle and pour in the water/yeast/oil mixture.
step-7: mix by hand, wetting your working hand before mixing so the dough doesn’t stick to your fingers.
step-8: the water and flour should come together and form a rough dough that pulls away from the sides of the bowl.
step-9: note: if the dough is too sticky, add more flour in small increments, about 1 tablespoon at a time.
step-10: if the dough is too dry, add more water, 1 tablespoon at a time.
step-11: once the dough begins to come together, turn it out onto a lightly floured work surface and knead the dough until it forms a smooth ball.
step-12: coat the bowl the dough was initially mixed in with about a tablespoon of olive oil and place the dough ball inside.
step-13: give it a few turns to coat the dough in the oil.
step-14: cover and let the dough rise until it doubles in size about 1 hour.
step-15: while the dough rises, prepare a large baking sheet by generously coating it with olive oil.
step-16: once the dough has risen, turn it out onto the prepared baking sheet and flatten it out into a large rectangle.
step-17: using a knife or dough scraper, cut the dough into 4 evenly sized rectangles.
step-18: press the rectangles flat and arrange them with each one pressed into a corner of the baking sheet.
step-19: cover and let the dough rest for 20 to 30 minutes.
step-20: preheat the oven to 450˚f (230˚c) while the dough is resting.
step-21: depending on the temperature of your kitchen and activeness of the yeast, the 4 rectangles should have risen to be about an 1-inch (2 ½ cm) thick.
step-22: using your fingers, poke the the dough all over--creating small dimples across the surface.
step-23: generously coat the tops of the dough rectangles one last time with olive oil (some oil will pool inside of the divots we made with our fingers.
step-24: that’s ok!)
step-25: use a basting brush to ensure all of the dough gets covered with olive oil.
step-26: top the dough rectangles with your choice of toppings.
step-27: (we did four different combinations, including tomatoes with fresh rosemary, caramelized onions and parmesan cheese, mixed olive with gorgonzola cheese, and 3-cheese using parmesan, mozzarella, and gorgonzola.)
step-28: once finished with the toppings, liberally sprinkle the breads with a coarse salt.
step-29: bake at 450˚f (230˚c) for 20-25 minutes until golden brown.
step-30: allow the bread to cool for 10 minutes before cutting into equal pieces.

step-1: steep the tea in the hot water for 5 minutes.
step-2: froth the milk by adding it to a resealable jar.
step-3: shake vigorously until many bubbles form.
step-4: then, microwave the milk for 45 seconds to 1 minute, which will help create stable bubbles.
step-5: remove the tea, then stir in the agave and frothed milk.
step-6: dust the top with dried rose petals and hibiscus powder, if desired.

step-1: in a large bowl, season the beef with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and onion powder.

step-3: mix well with a spoon or your hands and form into patties.
step-4: either pan-fry or grill until cooked.
step-5: top with cheese and let it melt.
step-6: assemble burger with your favorite toppings.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: season the chicken thighs in a bowl with salt, pepper, garlic powder, paprika, dried basil, and dried oregano.
step-3: mix until thoroughly coated with the seasoning.
step-4: on high, heat olive oil in a ovenproof pot and place chicken thighs, skin-side down, in the hot oil.
step-5: cook 3-4 minutes or until the thighs develop brown crispy skin, and flip over.
step-6: cook an additional 2-3 minutes to brown the other side, and remove from the pot.
step-7: grate both zucchinis with a box grater.
step-8: add the grated zucchini into the pot, along with rice, garlic powder, salt, pepper, and chicken broth.
step-9: bring to a boil.
step-10: lay the chicken on top of the rice mixture and cover.
step-11: bake for 30 minutes or until the chicken’s internal temperature reads 165˚f (75˚c).
step-12: remove chicken and broil 1-2 minutes to crisp skin even more (optional).
step-13: serve chicken on bed of rice mixture.

step-1: add water, cauliflower, squash, and carrots in a pot over medium heat.
step-2: cover and cook until vegetables are tender.
step-3: add everything into a blender, including cooking water, and blend until smooth.
step-4: return blended veggies to the pot over medium heat, and add the milk, cheese, and cream cheese.
step-5: stir until smooth.
step-6: add macaroni, reduce heat, mix thoroughly, and cover for 20 minutes.

step-1: place shredded carrot and zucchini on a clean towel and wring out as much liquid as possible.
step-2: place strained carrot and zucchini in a bowl and add ground beef, ground pork, parmesan, onion, parsley, salt, pepper, garlic powder, breadcrumbs, and eggs.
step-3: mix until just combined.
step-4: grab about a ¼ cup (85 grams) of the mixture and roll into a ball.
step-5: either pan-fry the meatballs over medium-high heat until all sides are golden brown, about 10 minutes, and pour marinara sauce into the pan.
step-6: simmer for 10-15 minutes.
step-7: or you can bake them on a piece of parchment paper at 250˚f (180˚c) for 30-35 minutes, flipping after the first 15 minutes.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: grease a baking sheet with nonstick spray.
step-3: finely chop the tuscan kale.
step-4: mince the garlic.
step-5: heat a drizzle of olive oil in a medium pan over medium heat.

step-7: add the kale and cook until softened, about 3 minutes.
step-8: remove from the heat and set aside.
step-9: chop the sun-dried tomatoes and add to the kale mixture.

step-11: mix well.

step-13: place on the prepared baking sheet.

step-1: in a blender, combine the eggs, cottage cheese, molasses, honey, vanilla, oat flour, baking powder, ginger, nutmeg, cinnamon, allspice, cloves, and salt.
step-2: blend until well combined.
step-3: pour the mixture into a medium bowl and fold in the chia seeds.
step-4: heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
step-5: pour ¼ cup of batter into the pan and cook for 3 minutes, until bubbles start to form and the edges become golden brown.
step-6: flip and cook for 3 minutes more, until golden brown on the other side.
step-7: repeat with the remaining batter.
step-8: top the pancakes with whipped cream, orange segments, and your sweetener of choice.

step-1: if making the savory filling, preheat the oven to 450°f (230°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, toss together the onion, bell pepper, tomato, zucchini, eggplant, garlic, olive oil, thyme, salt, and pepper.
step-3: spread in an even layer on a large baking sheet.
step-4: roast the vegetables until they are soft and caramelized, about 18 minutes, flipping halfway through.
step-5: set aside to cool.
step-6: when cool enough to handle, pick the garlic from the vegetables and remove the skin.
step-7: add to a large bowl and mash into a paste.
step-8: add the goat cheese and stir to combine, then add the vegetables and toss to coat.
step-9: season with salt and pepper.
step-10: use immediately to fill the crepes, or store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
step-11: if making the sweet filling: in a small bowl, stir together the ricotta, strawberries, blackberries, lemon zest, and honey.
step-12: use immediately to fill crepes, or store in an airtight container in the refrigerator up to 3 days.
step-13: make the crepes: in a large bowl, combine the eggs, coconut milk, coconut flour, coconut oil, and salt.
step-14: using an immersion blender, blend the ingredients to form a smooth batter, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed.
step-15: preheat a 9-inch (22 cm) nonstick skillet or crepe pan over medium heat.
step-16: add just enough oil to coat the pan, about ½ teaspoon.
step-17: swirl the pan to coat evenly.
step-18: add ½ cup batter to the hot pan and swirl the pan around again until the batter evenly coats the bottom all the way to the edges.
step-19: cook for 4-5 minutes, or until the bottom of the crepe is golden brown in spots and the top is completely cooked through with no raw batter on the surface.
step-20: add ¼ cup of your preferred filling to the top left quarter of the crepe.
step-21: using a small spatula or spoon, evenly spread the filling over that section, leaving a ½-inch (1 ¼ cm) border along the outside edge.fold the bottom half of the crepe over the top half, then fold the right (unfilled) side over the left side to form a triangle.
step-22: use a rubber spatula to gently transfer the crepe to a plate.
step-23: repeat with the remaining batter and filling.
step-24: garnish the savory crepes with more thyme and the sweet crepes with whipped cream, quartered strawberries, blackberries, and honey.

step-1: combine the flour, water, and mirin in a bowl and whisk until combined.
step-2: brush oil on an electric griddle heated to 350˚f (180℃).
step-3: pour the batter onto the griddle into a paper-thin circle 8 inches (20 cm) wide.
step-4: place cabbage, tempura, bean sprouts, and scallions on top of the batter to fully cover it.
step-5: top with 4 slices of pork belly and drizzle a little batter on top.
step-6: gently flip the pancake using two okonomiyaki spatulas, and press down.
step-7: add oil to the griddle and add the yakisoba noodles.
step-8: drizzle with okonomi sauce and stir to coat all the noodles.
step-9: put cooked pancake with the cabbage on the noodles.
step-10: crack an egg on the griddle and scramble with the okonomi spatulas.
step-11: place the egg onto the yakisoba noodles and drizzle with okonomi sauce.
step-12: drizzle with mayonnaise, nori flakes, and bonito flakes.

step-1: set the pork belly on a rimmed baking sheet.
step-2: season all over with ½ cup (120 g) of salt and the sugar.
step-3: wrap tightly in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 24 hours.
step-4: when ready to cook the pork, preheat the oven to 250˚f (120˚c).
step-5: unwrap the pork belly and rinse off all the salt and sugar with cold water.
step-6: pat dry with paper towels, then place skin-side down on a baking sheet or large cutting board.
step-7: add the fennel seeds to a food processor and pulse until finely ground.
step-8: transfer to a small bowl and wipe out the processor.
step-9: to the clean food processor, add the rosemary, lemon zest, thyme, garlic, 2 teaspoons of salt, and the pepper, and pulse until finely chopped and well combined.
step-10: spread the garlic-herb paste evenly over the meat side of the pork belly.
step-11: place the pork loin parallel along a short side of the pork belly.
step-12: roll up the belly to encase the loin and position the roll seam-side down.
step-13: set a wire rack over a baking sheet and grease with nonstick spray.
step-14: arrange 8 30-inch (75 cm) long pieces of kitchen twine over the wire rack, spacing 1½ inches (4 cm) apart.
step-15: place the pork roll, seam-side down, across the center of the twine pieces.
step-16: starting with the centermost piece, tie the twine as tightly as you can around the pork roll, using 2 double knots.
step-17: work your way from the center toward either end to tie the rest of the twine.
step-18: cut off the excess twine.
step-19: add the other ½ cup (120 g) of salt to the bowl with the ground fennel seeds and stir to combine.
step-20: sprinkle over the pork roll and rub into the skin.
step-21: roast the porchetta for about 3 hours, until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center reaches 145˚f (63˚c).
step-22: remove from the oven.
step-23: increase the oven temperature to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-24: transfer the pork roll, still on the wire rack, to a cutting board.
step-25: pour any pan juices into a small bowl and skim off any fat.
step-26: set the porchetta on the wire rack over the baking sheet, then return to the oven and roast for about 30 minutes more, until the skin is bubbling, crisp, and golden.
step-27: transfer the porchetta to a cutting board and let rest for 20 minutes.
step-28: removed the twine and carve into ½-inch (1 ¼ cm) thick slices.
step-29: serve hot, with pan juices spooned over.

step-1: make the macaron batter: in a large bowl, whisk together the powdered sugar and almond meal.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: in a separate large bowl, beat the egg whites with an electric hand mixer until the egg whites stay stuck to the sides of the bowl when tilted.
step-4: add the granulated sugar and beat until soft peaks form.
step-5: gradually add the dry ingredients to the whipped egg whites and fold with a rubber spatula until just combined.
step-6: transfer half of the batter to another bowl.
step-7: make the gingerbread flavor: to one bowl, add the cloves, ginger, nutmeg, cinnamon, and allspice, and gently fold to combine.
step-8: make the red velvet flavor: to the other bowl, add the cocoa powder and red food coloring, and gently fold to combine.
step-9: transfer the batters to 2 separate piping bags or zip-top bags.
step-10: pipe a bit of batter in each of the 4 corners of the baking sheet, then lay a piece of parchment paper on top and press against the batter dots to seal.
step-11: pipe the batter onto the baking sheet in ¾-inch (2 cm) circles, spacing about ½ inches (1 ¼ cm) apart.
step-12: gently tap the baking sheet against the counter to release any air bubbles.
step-13: let the macarons rest at room temperature for 1 hour, until a skin forms on the surface.
step-14: preheat the oven to 300˚f (150˚c).
step-15: bake the macarons for 20 minutes.
step-16: make the filling: in a large bowl, cream together the butter and shortening until smooth.
step-17: add the salt, cloves, cinnamon, nutmeg, vanilla, and eggnog, and beat to incorporate.
step-18: add the powdered sugar, a bit at a time, and beat until well combined and the filling is smooth.
step-19: transfer the eggnog filling to a piping bag or zip-top bag.
step-20: pipe the filling onto a macaron, then sandwich with another macaron.
step-21: repeat with the remaining ingredients.
step-22: let the macarons rest in the refrigerator for at least 6 hours, or overnight.
step-23: to assemble the tower, insert a toothpick into the styrofoam cone, leaving ½-inch (1 ¼ cm) exposed.
step-24: gently press a macaron onto the toothpick.
step-25: repeat around the rest of the cone with the remaining macarons.

step-1: to make the shrimp marinade, combine all ingredients in a food processor and blend until chopped and well combined.
step-2: pour over the shrimp, cover and place in the refrigerator to marinate for 30 minutes.
step-3: to make herb paste, place all ingredients in a food processor and blend until finely chopped.
step-4: clean all the shellfish.
step-5: discard any dead mussels or clams.
step-6: soak the clams in cold water for 30 minutes and then scrub clean, then remove the beard of the mussels and scrub clean.
step-7: rinse the crab legs and break apart at the joint for smaller pieces.
step-8: in a large pot, heat a drizzle of olive oil and then add chorizo and cook until browned.
step-9: add the herb paste and cook for 2 minutes.
step-10: add beer to the pan and bring to a simmer.
step-11: cook until the liquid is reduced by half.
step-12: then add chicken stock and bring back to a simmer.
step-13: add lemon juice and season to taste with salt.
step-14: add the mussels, clams and crab legs to the broth, and place the corn on top.
step-15: cook until mussels and clams have opened and crab legs are steamed through, about 10 minutes.
step-16: while the seafood cooks, heat a large pan and fry the shrimp until pink and cooked through.
step-17: serve the shellfish and corn in a warmed cast iron pot, with some of the broth, garnished with cilantro sprigs.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: make the crust: in a large bowl, mix together the crushed graham crackers and melted butter until the mixture resembles wet sand.
step-3: pour onto a baking sheet and press into an even layer.
step-4: use a spatula to draw lines in the crust crosswise, dividing it into 4 even sections.
step-5: arrange the graham cracker quarters along the lines, then press down the crust around the crackers to secure.
step-6: bake for 8 minutes until lightly browned.
step-7: let cool to room temperature.
step-8: reduce the oven temperature to 225°f (105°c).
step-9: make the filling: in a large bowl, use an electric hand mixer on medium speed to whip the cream cheese and sugar until slightly fluffy, about 2 minutes.
step-10: add the eggs, 1 at a time.
step-11: mix in the sour cream and vanilla.
step-12: divide the filling evenly between 4 medium bowls.
step-13: in the first bowl, mix in the sweet potato puree, ¼ teaspoon of cinnamon, and the nutmeg.
step-14: in another bowl, whisk in the chocolate hazelnut spread.
step-15: in another bowl, whisk in ¼ teaspoon of cinnamon.
step-16: in the last bowl, mix in the pumpkin puree and the pumpkin pie spice.
step-17: pour each flavored filling into a section of the crust and smooth with a spatula.
step-18: scoop the apple pie filling over the cinnamon flavor and swirl into the filling with a skewer.
step-19: drizzle the melted semi-sweet chocolate over the chocolate flavor and swirl into the filling with a skewer.
step-20: sprinkle the chopped pecans over the pumpkin filling.
step-21: bake for 1 hour, until cheesecake is set.
step-22: let cool in the oven with the door open.
step-23: refrigerate overnight before slicing into wedges and serving.

step-1: pierce orange with cloves.
step-2: (if you have a tea infuser, tea bag or cheese cloth, you can use that to keep the spices under control).
step-3: pierce apple with allspice.
step-4: put the orange, apple, cinnamon sticks, apple cider, brown sugar and nutmeg into your slow cooker.
step-5: turn on high for 2 hours, then keep warm on low until you’re ready to drink.
step-6: drink as is or with a shot (or two) of whiskey, rum, etc.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: on a baking sheet, drizzle the butternut squash with olive oil, then season with salt and pepper.
step-3: toss to coat, then spread in an even layer.
step-4: roast for 20 minutes, stirring halfway, until the squash is tender and golden brown.
step-5: remove from the oven and set aside to cool.
step-6: on another baking sheet, spread out the kidney beans and chestnuts.
step-7: bake for 10 minutes, or until the excess moisture has released and the beans begin to crack down the middle.
step-8: remove from the oven and set aside to cool.
step-9: prepare the duxelle (mushroom mixture): in a large pan over medium heat, melt the butter.
step-10: once the butter begins to foam, add the shallot, mushrooms, thyme, and salt.
step-11: stir to combine and cook for 10-15 minutes, or until the liquid evaporates from the mushrooms and they begin to turn golden brown.
step-12: transfer the duxelle to a bowl and set aside to cool.
step-13: return the pan to the stove (no need to clean), and heat a drizzle of oil over medium heat.
step-14: add 2 cloves of minced garlic and the frozen spinach.
step-15: break the spinach up with a wooden spoon and sauté for 2 minutes, or until the garlic is toasted and the spinach is warmed through.
step-16: add the lemon juice, lemon zest, nutmeg, salt, and pepper.
step-17: transfer to a bowl and set aside to cool.
step-18: return the same pan back to the stove over medium-high heat and add a drizzle of oil.
step-19: when the oil is hot, add the onion, carrot, salt, and pepper.
