step-20: sauté for 5 minutes, or until the vegetables are softened and beginning to turn golden brown.
step-21: add the remaining 2 cloves of garlic and the sage and sauté for 1 minute more, or until the garlic is just fragrant.
step-22: add the balsamic vinegar, dijon mustard, and bread.
step-23: stir until the bread is well-coated, then remove from the heat and let cool slightly.
step-24: transfer the bread mixture to a food processor.
step-25: add in the roasted kidney beans and chestnuts and vegetable stock.
step-26: pulse a few times, until just combined.
step-27: (the mixture should be an even consistency but still have texture to it.
step-28: it should stick together when pressed in your palm).
step-29: transfer the bread mixture to a large bowl.
step-30: gently stir in the roasted butternut squash and season with more salt and pepper to taste.
step-31: increase the oven temperature to 425°f (220°c) and line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-32: on a lightly floured surface, roll each piece of puff pastry into rectangle slightly smaller than the prepared baking sheet.
step-33: transfer 1 piece of the pastry to the baking sheet and set the other piece aside.
step-34: assemble the wellington: spread the cooled duxelle lengthwise down the middle of the puff pastry on the baking sheet, creating a rectangle the size that you want your wellington to be.
step-35: make sure to leave about a 2-inch border at both ends of the pastry.
step-36: (you will be removing all excess dough and using it for decorations.)
step-37: next, arrange half of the bell peppers over the duxelle.
step-38: make sure they lay flat, only overlap on the edges, and completely cover the mushrooms.
step-39: top the bell pepper layer with the roasted squash and bread mixture by using your hands to pack the mixture into a loaf, making sure it doesn’t go over the edges of the peppers.
step-40: layer the remaining roasted peppers evenly over the bread mixture.
step-41: top the peppers with the spinach mixture.
step-42: (this will be a bit messy, but it’s okay, it’s part of the process!)
step-43: gently roll the second piece of pastry over the spinach layer, creating a blanket over all of the vegetable layers.
step-44: press the pastry gently around the filling to create a log shape.
step-45: trim the pastry so that there is about a 1-inch (2.5 cm) border around the log.
step-46: fold the bottom layer of the pastry over the top layer and seal the dough together with a decorative crimp.
step-47: cut decorative shapes from the dough scraps and arrange over the log.
step-48: using a paring knife, cut a few vents into your wellington to allow steam to escape.
step-49: you can hide the vents along the edges of your decorations.
step-50: generously brush the top and sides of the wellington with the beaten egg.
step-51: bake for 30 minutes, or until the pastry is golden brown and crispy.
step-52: let rest for 15 minutes before slicing and serving.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine all ingredients for the meatballs.
step-2: shape them into small balls and pan sear until the meatballs have a dark brown crust.
step-3: about 2 minutes on each side.
step-4: take out the meatballs and set aside.
step-5: use the same pot combine the soup ingredients and stew for 20 minutes or until the vegetables are soft.
step-6: using a blender, puree the veggies until the soup becomes a sauce.
step-7: add in the stock, pasta and meatballs and simmer for 5 minutes.

step-1: place fruit and spices into a slow cooker.
step-2: add 8 cups of water.
step-3: cook on high heat for 3-4 hours.
step-4: uncover the slow cooker, and mash the softened fruit with a potato masher.
step-5: cover again and cook on low for 1-2 hours.
step-6: strain out fruit and spices from the slow cooker into a cheesecloth in a bowl.
step-7: wait about 20-30 minutes for the cheesecloth to cool.
step-8: squeeze out cider from cheesecloth into the bowl.
step-9: pour the cider back into the slow cooker.
step-10: serve warm.

step-1: in a food processor, add the flour, yeast, salt, and sugar.
step-2: pulse until incorporated.
step-3: while running, slowly add the warm water until the dough balls up.
step-4: you may not need all the warm water.
step-5: carefully push the dough back into the blade’s path and continue to process for an additional 30 seconds or until the dough is firm and stretchy, but not sticky nor squishy.
step-6: gently round the dough into a ball and place in a lightly oiled bowl.
step-7: cover with a damp, warm towel for an hour or until the dough has doubled in size.
step-8: add the barley malt syrup to about 6 quarts of water and bring to a boil.
step-9: place a tray with about 2 quarts of water on the bottom shelf of the oven.
step-10: preheat to 425°f (220°c).
step-11: place the dough onto a lightly floured surface and divide into 6 equal pieces (roughly 5 ounces (140 g) a piece if you use a scale).
step-12: cover the pieces with a damp towel.
step-13: one at a time, form the dough into a ball, pinching the seams together at the bottom.
step-14: place the dough seam side down and–cupping your hand over the dough–apply gentle pressure, working the ball in circles until the seams on the bottom are smoothed out.
step-15: gently reshape the edges of the ball into a circle.
step-16: using your thumb, press down into the center of the ball to the counter.
step-17: working in a circle, carefully stretch the dough into a ring until the hole at the center is about 2 inches (5 cm) in diameter.
step-18: place the dough rings under a damp towel and let rise for 10 minutes.
step-19: working in batches of two, place the bagels in the boiling water/syrup.
step-20: they should float at the surface.
step-21: let them boil for 30 seconds, then flip and boil for an additional 30 seconds.
step-22: remove the bagels from the water/syrup and gently pat dry with a clean towel.
step-23: brush the tops with the beaten egg.
step-24: optionally, if you want toppings, dip the egg-washed side of the bagel into the mixture of your choice.
step-25: place the bagels on a parchment paper-covered baking sheet.
step-26: bake until golden brown, about 15 to 20 minutes.
step-27: transfer to a wire rack to cool.

step-1: roll half of the beef mince into a ball and pat it down until a finger thick, bigger than palm size patty.
step-2: repeat with remaining beef.
step-3: fry both patties with salt and pepper for 2 and a half minutes a side.
step-4: add 1 cheese single to one of the patties.
step-5: toast the burger buns on a dry pan on medium heat until one of the sides is golden brown.
step-6: mix all the sauce ingredients and set aside.
step-7: time to build this bad boy!
step-8: spread burger sauce on a bun, sprinkle diced onion, shredded lettuce, place the patty with cheese, place another slice of bun.
step-9: then more sauce, more onion, shredded lettuce, gherkin slices, another patty, and the last slice of bun!
step-10: dig in and get lovin’ it!

step-1: over medium heat, combine cheese with cornstarch and cayenne pepper.
step-2: once melted, slowly add garlic, milk, and chicken stock.
step-3: add finely chopped broccoli and allow to simmer about 5 minutes while making cheese toasts.
step-4: cover slices of baguette bread with shredded cheddar and broil for 3 minutes.

step-1: preheat the oven 220˚c (430˚f).
step-2: on a cutting board, slice the chicken into bite size pieces.
step-3: combine the chicken with the rest of the marinade ingredients in a bowl.
step-4: mix until evenly coated.
step-5: refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
step-6: skewer the marinated chicken pieces on bamboo skewers, then place them over a baking tray lined with parchment paper, making sure there is space underneath the chicken to help distribute the heat more evenly.
step-7: bake for about 15 minutes, until slightly dark brown on the edges.
step-8: heat butter in a large pot over medium heat, then sauté the onions and tomato purée, until tender but not browned.
step-9: add the spices and fry for about 30 seconds to release their aromatics and flavor, stirring constantly.
step-10: pour in the cream and mix it well with the onion and spices.
step-11: when the cream mixture is bubbling, add in the chicken and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
step-12: serve with rice and naan bread.

step-1: in a blender, combine the cashews, salt, onion powder, garlic powder, nutritional yeast, lemon juice, and 1 cup (235 ml) of water.
step-2: blend for 1 minute, until very smooth.
step-3: in a small pot, bring the remaining water to a boil over medium heat.
step-4: slowly add the agar-agar flakes while whisking continuously.
step-5: continue to whisk the mixture until thick, about 2 minutes.
step-6: allow the mixture to cool until the steam evaporates, then add to the blender with the other ingredients.
step-7: blend for 1 minute, until smooth.
step-8: pour the mixture into a medium bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or until thickened.
step-9: when ready to serve, invert the cashew cheese onto a plate.
step-10: slice or mash into cashew cheese spread and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: using a hand mixer or standing mixer, combine cheese, butter, and salt in a large bowl.
step-3: once combined, mix in the flour and add the ice water one tablespoon at a time.
step-4: the dough should hold together but crumble apart if you break it up in your hand.
step-5: if it seems too dry, add a little more ice water.
step-6: separate dough into two halves and pack together into discs.
step-7: wrap in parchment paper and chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-8: roll out dough to ⅛ of an inch (½ cm), pinching the cracks on the ends.
step-9: cut into 1 inch x 1 inch (2 ½ x 2 ½ cm) squares and pierce a hole in the middle of each square for ventilation during baking.
step-10: place the separated crackers on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-11: bake for 13 minutes, or until golden brown.

step-1: combine all marinade ingredients in a large bowl and whisk together.
step-2: add the chicken thighs and coat evenly.
step-3: cover and chill for at least 1 hour and up to 12 hours
step-4: prepare the sauce by adding all sauce ingredients to a small bowl.
step-5: mix together and chill until ready to serve.
step-6: adjust the oven rack about 6 inches (15 cm) from the top heat source in your oven, then preheat the broiler.
step-7: line a baking sheet with foil and a wire rack.
step-8: place chicken in single layer on prepared wire rack, with the smooth sides down.
step-9: broil until chicken is well browned and registers at least 165˚f (74˚c), about 16-20 minutes.
step-10: you may need to rotate the sheet pan halfway through if your broiler heats unevenly.
step-11: remove and rest the chicken for 5 minutes before handling, and turn off the oven.
step-12: while chicken rests, warm your pitas in the still-warm oven for a few minutes.
step-13: slice the chicken into thin strips and transfer to platter.
step-14: serve with sliced cucumbers, tomatoes, pickles, prepared yogurt sauce, and warm pita.

step-1: preheat oven to 500°f (260°c).
step-2: slice the chicken into bite-sized chunks.
step-3: combine the chicken with the rest of the chicken marinade ingredients in a bowl until evenly coated.
step-4: cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
step-5: skewer the marinated chicken pieces on bamboo skewers or wooden skewers, then place them over a baking tray lined with parchment paper, making sure there is space underneath the chicken to help distribute the heat more evenly.
step-6: bake for about 15 minutes until slightly dark brown on the edges.
step-7: heat oil in a large pot over medium heat, then sauté the onions, ginger, and garlic until tender but not browned.
step-8: fry the spices for about 30 seconds to release their aromatics and flavor, stirring constantly.
step-9: stir in the tomato puree.
step-10: add the tomato sauce and water, then bring to a boil and cook for about 5 minutes.
step-11: pour in the cream.
step-12: mix in the chicken, cooking for another 1-2 minutes.
step-13: serve with rice or naan bread and garnish with coriander!

step-1: wash and dry the herbs.
step-2: remove the parsley leaves from the thicker, woody stems, then finely chop with a sharp knife.
step-3: transfer 1 cup (40 g) to a medium bowl and save the rest of the herbs for another use.
step-4: remove the oregano leaves from the stems and roughly chop.
step-5: add ¼ cup (10 g) to the bowl with the parsley.
step-6: save any leftovers for another use.
step-7: peel the garlic cloves, then mince.
step-8: add to the bowl with the herbs.
step-9: peel and mince the shallot, then add to the bowl.
step-10: add the olive oil, red wine vinegar, salt, and red pepper flakes.
step-11: whisk well to combine.
step-12: add the lemon zest and whisk to incorporate.
step-13: let the chimichurri sit in the refrigerator, covered, for up to 24 hours.
step-14: serve over grilled veggies, steak, seafood, or grilled chicken thighs, use as a dip for crusty bread, or use as desired otherwise.
step-15: nutrition, per serving - calories: 191, total fat: 20 grams, sodium: 267 mg, total carb: 3 grams, dietary fiber: 1 gram, sugars: 1 gram, protein: 0 grams

step-1: preheat the oven to 160°c (320°f).
step-2: lightly score into the skin of the duck legs.
step-3: in boiling hot water, add vinegar and sugar.
step-4: stir.
step-5: submerge the duck legs in the glaze mix for 20 seconds.
step-6: pad dry the duck legs with kitchen roll.
step-7: mix well all the marinade ingredients.
step-8: give the duck legs a good rub in the marinade.
step-9: on a cooling rack set over a baking tray, place a bed of the marinade then put the duck legs on top.
step-10: make sure they are skin side up.
step-11: roast the duck legs for 30 minutes on 160°c (320°f).
step-12: turn up the oven to 200°c (400˚f) and roast the duck for another 20 minutes.
step-13: rest the duck legs for 10 minutes, then shred them with two forks.
step-14: serve with chinese pancakes, hoisin sauce, shredded spring onions, and sliced cucumber.

step-1: in a small bowl, combine ½ cup (85 g) chocolate chips and the heavy cream.
step-2: microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until melted and smooth, about 1 minute total.
step-3: cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until set, about 20 minutes.
step-4: in a large bowl, combine the remaining chocolate chips and coconut oil.
step-5: microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until melted and smooth, about 1 minute total.
step-6: wrap a 9x5-inch (22x12 cm) loaf pan in foil, keeping the foil taut across the top.
step-7: set nearby.
step-8: spoon about 2 tablespoons of the melted chocolate-coconut oil mixture into a cone, flip upside-down, and spin to coat the inside, letting excess chocolate drip back into the bowl.
step-9: poke the cone through the foil to prop upright, and repeat with the remaining cones.
step-10: chill in fridge until set, about 2 minutes.
step-11: once set, spoon some of the softened ice cream into the cones to fill, and smooth the tops.
step-12: place the cones in the freezer for 10 minutes, or until set.
step-13: scoop about a teaspoon of the ganache onto a spoon.
step-14: fill an ice cream scooper with the ice cream and create a hole in the middle with the end of a spoon.
step-15: place the ganache in the hole and place on top of a cone.
step-16: repeat with remaining cones.
step-17: set the cones on a baking sheet and freeze again for 30 minutes, or until solid.
step-18: using the remaining melted chocolate, dip the cones, turning to coat the ice cream.
step-19: while the chocolate is still wet, quickly dip the cones in the chopped peanuts to coat.

step-1: in a large bowl, mix the flour, water, milk, sugar, salt, yeast, and butter.
step-2: once the dough starts to clump, turn it out onto a clean counter.
step-3: lightly knead the dough and form it into a ball, making sure not to over-knead it.
step-4: cover the dough with plastic wrap and refrigerate for one hour.
step-5: slice the cold butter in thirds and place it onto a sheet of parchment paper..
step-6: place another piece of parchment on top of the butter, and beat it with a rolling pin.
step-7: keeping the parchment paper on the butter, use a rolling pin to roll the butter into a 7-inch (18 cm) square, ½-inch (1 cm) thick.
step-8: if necessary, use a knife to trim the edges and place the trimmings back on top of the butter and continue to roll into a square.
step-9: transfer the butter layer to the refrigerator.
step-10: to roll out the dough, lightly flour the counter.
step-11: place the dough on the counter, and push the rolling pin once vertically into the dough and once horizontally to form four quadrants.
step-12: roll out each corner and form a 10-inch (25 cm) square.
step-13: place the butter layer on top of the dough and fold the sides of the dough over the butter, enclosing it completely.
step-14: roll the dough with a rolling pin to seal the seams, making sure to lengthen the dough, rather than widening it.
step-15: transfer the dough to a baking sheet and cover with plastic wrap.
step-16: refrigerate for 1 hour.
step-17: roll out the dough on a floured surface until it’s 8x24 inches (20x61 cm).
step-18: fold the top half down to the middle, and brush off any excess flour.
step-19: fold the bottom half over the top and turn the dough clockwise to the left.
step-20: this completes the first turn.
step-21: cover and refrigerate for one hour.
step-22: roll out the dough again two more times, completing three turns in total and refrigerating for 1 hour in between each turn.
step-23: if at anytime the dough or butter begins to soften, stop and transfer back to the fridge.
step-24: after the final turn, cover the dough with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight.
step-25: to form the croissants, cut the dough in half.
step-26: place one half in the refrigerator.
step-27: flour the surface and roll out the dough into a long narrow strip, about 8x40 inches (20x101 cm).
step-28: with a knife, trim the edges of the dough.
step-29: cut the dough into 4 rectangles.
step-30: place the chocolate on the edge of the dough and roll tightly enclosing it in the dough.
step-31: place the croissants on a baking sheet, seam side down.
step-32: repeat with the other half of the dough.
step-33: brush the croissants with the beaten egg.
step-34: save the rest of the egg wash in the fridge for later.
step-35: place the croissants in a warm place to rise for 1-2 hours.
step-36: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-37: once the croissants have proofed, brush them with one more layer of egg wash.
step-38: bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through.

step-1: generously butter two disposable foil pie/cake pans.
step-2: in a large bowl, whisk together warm milk, melted butter, and granulated sugar.
step-3: the mixture should be just warm, registering between 100-110˚f (37-43˚c).
step-4: if it is hotter, allow to cool slightly.
step-5: sprinkle the yeast evenly over the warm mixture and let set for 1 minute.
step-6: add 4 cups (500g) of all-purpose flour to the milk mixture and mix with a wooden spoon until just combined.
step-7: cover the bowl with a towel or plastic wrap and set in a warm place to rise for 1 hour.
step-8: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-9: after 1 hour, the dough should have nearly doubled in size.
step-10: remove the towel and add an additional ¾ cup (95g) of flour, the baking powder, and salt.
step-11: stir well, then turn out onto a well-floured surface.
step-12: knead the dough lightly, adding additional flour as necessary, until the dough just loses its stickiness and does not stick to the surface.
step-13: roll the dough out into a large rectangle, about ½-inch (1 cm) thick.
step-14: fix corners to make sure they are sharp and even.
step-15: spread the softened butter evenly over the dough.
step-16: sprinkle evenly with brown sugar and a generous sprinkling of cinnamon.
step-17: press the mixture into the butter.
step-18: roll up the dough, forming a log, and pinch the seam closed.
step-19: place seam-side down.
step-20: trim off any unevenness on either end.
step-21: cut the log in half, then divide each half into 7 evenly sized pieces.
step-22: about 1½ inches (8cm) thick each.
step-23: place 7 cinnamon rolls in each cake pan, one in the center, six around the sides.
step-24: cover with plastic wrap and place in a warm place to rise for 30 minutes.
step-25: to prepare the frosting.
step-26: in a medium-size mixing bowl, whisk together cream cheese, butter, whole milk, vanilla, and powdered sugar, until smooth.
step-27: remove plastic wrap.
step-28: bake the cinnamon rolls in a preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, until golden brown.
step-29: while still warm, drizzle evenly with frosting.

step-1: heat heavy cream and vanilla extract in a sauce pan until hot, but not boiling.
step-2: in a medium bowl, whisk egg yolks and half of sugar until well mixed.
step-3: pour in the hot cream gradually, mixing continually.
step-4: pour hot water into a large roasting pan.
step-5: place six ramekins into the pan (the water should come roughly halfway up the sides of the ramekins).
step-6: pour the egg mixture into the ramekins and bake at 325˚f (165˚c) for 45 - 50 minutes.
step-7: the crème brûlée should be set, but still a little jiggly in the middle.
step-8: remove the ramekins from the roasting pan, allow to cool to room temperature, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least two hours and up to three days.
step-9: remove the crème brûlée from the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before browning the sugar on top.
step-10: spread a tablespoon of sugar on top of each crème brûlée.
step-11: using a torch, melt the sugar to for a crispy top.
step-12: if you don’t have a torch, you can broil the crème brûlée to melt the sugar.
step-13: keep an eye on it, to make sure you don’t over cook it.
step-14: allow the crème brûlée to sit for at least five minutes before serving.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: place the bread cubes on a greased baking sheet.
step-3: drizzle with the olive oil and season with the salt, garlic powder, and oregano.
step-4: toss until evenly coated
step-5: bake for 15 minutes, until golden brown and crisp.
step-6: use as croutons, or smash to make breadcrumbs.

step-1: combine warm milk (110-115˚f or 45˚c), butter, warm water (110-115˚f or 45˚c), and sugar in a large bowl and stir until mixed.
step-2: sprinkle yeast evenly over the top of the mixture and let sit for 1 minute.
step-3: add the salt, egg, and 4 cups (500g) of flour.
step-4: mix until the mixture just comes together and forms a dough.
step-5: cover for 30 minutes with a towel or plastic wrap.
step-6: uncover, and mix in the rest of the flour and turn out onto a well-floured surface.
step-7: knead until dough until it forms a smooth ball and loses some of its stickiness.
step-8: cover for 30 additional minutes with a towel or plastic wrap.
step-9: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-10: uncover, and roll dough into 16 equally sized balls, roughly the size of a tangerine.
step-11: ensure your rolls are smooth with no cracks.
step-12: place rolls onto greased cast iron pan and brush each with with water.
step-13: add desired toppings, or customize with your own!
step-14: honey butter - combine melted butter with honey and brush onto rolls.
step-15: jalapeño cheddar - top rolls with cheddar and diced jalapeño.
step-16: garlic parmesan - top rolls with a mixture of melted butter, parsley, garlic, and parmesan.
step-17: bacon cheddar chive - top rolls with cheddar, diced cooked bacon, and chives.
step-18: bake in a preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until rolls have lightly browned.

step-1: combine the flour, salt, and warm water and mix until well combined.
step-2: roll out dough on a floured surface and knead until smooth.
step-3: separate the dough into 4 equal parts.
step-4: roll out the piece into a thin log and divide into 6 or 8 pieces depend on the size of dumplings you want.
step-5: lightly flour the divided piece of dough and roll out piece to a thin circle roughly 4-inches (10 cm) in diameter.
step-6: keep the dumpling wrappers separated with parchment paper, and repeat with remaining dough.
step-7: combine cabbage, green onions, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, and sesame oil and mix until well incorporated.
step-8: for the pork filling, combine the ground pork with salt, pepper and 1 cup (125g) of the cabbage mixture and stir until well incorporated.
step-9: for the veggie filling combine mushrooms and carrot and microwave for 3 minutes, until soft.
step-10: add 1 cup (125g) of the cabbage mixture and stir until well incorporated.
step-11: for the shrimp filling, combine shrimp with 1 cup (125g) of the cabbage mixture and stir until well incorporated.
step-12: to assembly dumplings, add roughly 1 heaping tablespoon of filling into the center of a dumpling wrapper.
step-13: with your finger lightly coat 1 half of the outside of the wrapper with water.
step-14: seal the dumplings using your preferred method.
step-15: with pleating, start from one side and pleat the half of the dumpling closest to you, keeping the other half still.
step-16: heat oil on medium high in a pan and add a few dumplings, cooking them in batches.
step-17: once the bottom of the dumplings start to brown, add in a splash of water and cover witg a lid.
step-18: steam for roughly 5 minutes, or until dumplings are cooked and water has evaporated.
step-19: remove from pan.
step-20: to prepare the sauce, mix all of the sauce ingredients together.

step-1: in a bowl, mix the graham flour, butter, sugar, all purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda and cinnamon.
step-2: mix well.
step-3: add molasses to the milk, stir until fully combined and add it to the cookie dough.
step-4: mix with your hands until fully combined.
step-5: roll the dough using a rolling pin.
step-6: roll from the center to the edges, moving clockwise to achieve a uniform thickness all around.
step-7: preheat oven at 350ºf (180ºc)
step-8: once your dough is about ⅙ of an inch (4 mm) in thickness, proceed to cut out shapes with any cookie cutter of about the size of a quarter.
step-9: place your cookie on a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-10: bake for 15 minutes or until the cookies turn golden.
step-11: while the cookies cool, prepare the frosting by whipping the shortening, powdered sugar and the clear vanilla until fully combined.
step-12: add the sprinkles and combine using a spatula.
step-13: serve your cookies and frosting.

step-1: stir yeast packet into water and allow yeast to bloom.
step-2: in a large bowl, mix flour and salt by hand.
step-3: once incorporated, create a small well in the middle and pour in the water/yeast mixture.
step-4: mix by hand, wetting your working hand before mixing so the dough doesn’t stick to your fingers.
step-5: the water and flour should come together and a form rough dough that pulls away from the sides of the bowl.
step-6: note: if the dough is too sticky, add more flour in small increments, about 1 tablespoon at a time.
step-7: if the dough is too dry, add more water, 1 tablespoon at a time.
step-8: once the dough has come together, cover it and let it rise until it doubles in size (about 1 and a half to 2 hours).
step-9: uncover the dough and give it a few pokes with your finger.
step-10: if the dough has risen properly it should indent under the pressure of your fingers and slowly deflate.
step-11: using your hand or a rubber spatula fold the dough.
step-12: starting from the rim of the bowl, work the dough loose from the sides and fold it up and towards the center of the bowl.
step-13: turn the bowl 90 degrees, and repeat until all the dough has been pulled from the sides and folded towards the center.
step-14: once finished, cover and allow the dough to continue to rise for another 1.5-2 hours.
step-15: once the dough has doubled in size again, gently remove it from the bowl onto a lightly floured surface.
step-16: sprinkle a small amount of flour on top of the dough.
step-17: using your hands, begin to shape the loaf.
step-18: fold the dough under itself several times to form a ball, then claps together the seams of dough underneath.
step-19: place the dough seam-side down in a clean bowl that has been coated with olive oil and flour.
step-20: cover and let rise for 1 hour.
step-21: meanwhile, take a 6-quart (6 liters) dutch oven (or heavy cooking pot with oven-safe lid) and place it inside the oven.
step-22: preheat the oven to 450˚f (230˚c) and allow it to heat up with the pot inside for 45 minutes.
step-23: remove the pot from the oven and place it on a trivet or heat-safe surface.
step-24: (be careful!
step-25: it’ll be very hot.)
step-26: turn the proofed dough over onto a lightly floured surface and carefully place it inside of the pot.
step-27: cover with the lid and return the pot to the oven.
step-28: bake at 450˚f (230˚c) for 45 minutes, removing the lid for the last 15 minutes.
step-29: remove bread from pot and allow to cool for 10 minutes before cutting.

step-1: heat 3 cups (720 ml) of milk in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat until it is steaming, 5-6 minutes (do not allow it to come to a boil.)
step-2: while the milk is warming, whisk together the eggs, egg yolks, sugar, and a pinch of salt in a medium bowl until pale yellow in color, 1-2 minutes.
step-3: once the milk has begun to steam, slowly pour half into the egg mixture while continuously whisking so the eggs don’t scramble.
step-4: once combined, slowly pour the egg and milk mixture back into the saucepan.
step-5: keep warm over medium-low heat, stirring continuously for 15-20 minutes, until the mixture has thickened enough to coat the back of a spoon.
step-6: prepare an ice bath in a large bowl.
step-7: place a medium bowl in the ice bath and set a fine-mesh sieve on top.
step-8: pour the egg mixture through the sieve to remove any unwanted egg bits.
step-9: remove the sieve and add the remaining cup of milk and heavy cream, and stir to combine.
step-10: let cool for 20 minutes, stirring every 5.
step-11: add the rum, if desired, then cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
step-12: the eggnog will keep in the fridge for up to 3 days.
step-13: serve with freshly grated nutmeg on top.

step-1: to the bowl of a 2-quart food processor, add the chickpeas, onion, parsley, garlic, lemon juice, and spices.
step-2: pulse the ingredients together until just incorporated and they form a wet paste.
step-3: be careful not to overblend.
step-4: transfer the chickpea mixture to a large bowl and add the bread crumbs, mixing until just incorporated.
step-5: cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1-2 hours, or overnight.
step-6: remove the chilled falafel mixture from the refrigerator and shape into 1-inch balls.
step-7: the mixture should yield 18-20 balls.
step-8: in a large frying pan with high sides, heat about 1 inch of oil to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-9: fry the falafel balls in batches of 6 for 3 minutes, flipping halfway.
step-10: once they are golden brown and crispy, transfer them to a paper towel-lined plate and sprinkle with salt.
step-11: serve the falafel as desired, either as a sandwich, salad topping, or over a bed of greens with a side of tahini sauce.

step-1: blend up the malted milk biscuits and put them into a big mixing bowl.
step-2: fold in the rice krispies and the nutella.
step-3: take a big pinch of the mixture and roll into balls using your hands.
step-4: place the shaped mixture on to some baking paper and chill for 1 hour.
step-5: break up the chocolate and add to a bowl with the butter.
step-6: microwave in 30 second intervals, stirring until the mixture is smooth.
step-7: dip the nutella balls into the chocolate coating them generously and place back on to the baking paper.
step-8: chill for a further 30 minutes to 1 hour.

step-1: combine the tequila, limeade (or lemonade), and orange juice in your dish, give it a stir.
step-2: pop it in the freezer for at least five hours.
step-3: once it’s frozen into a solid, you’re ready to serve
step-4: take it out of the freezer and, using a spoon, scrape along the surface to pull up beautiful shards of frozen margarita (the motion is somewhere between scooping up ice cream and scraping off a car windshield in winter).
step-5: feel free to play around with the ratio on this — it’ll work with a bit less tequila and more juice, or a bit more tequila and less juice (whatever kind of party you’re looking for).
step-6: salted rim totally optional.

step-1: in a small bowl, whisk together the flax meal and 9 tablespoons of cold water.
step-2: set aside for 15 minutes, until thickened and gel-like.
step-3: meanwhile, in a medium bowl, mix together the brown rice flour, quinoa flour, xanthan gum, and salt.
step-4: create a well in the center of the mixture.
step-5: pour the flax mixture, remaining ¼ cup (60 ml) cold water, and olive oil into the well.
step-6: begin to mix dough together with spatula, then transfer the dough to a clean surface and knead until dough comes together and there are no dry spots remaining.
step-7: transfer dough back into bowl and cover.
step-8: let rest for 20 minutes to allow the flours and xanthan gum to hydrate.
step-9: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-10: bring a large pot of water to a rolling boil.
step-11: season generously with salt.
step-12: divide the dough into 6 equal pieces.
step-13: shape each piece into a flat rectangle.
step-14: working 1 portion at a time, lightly dust with flour and use a lightly floured rolling pin to roll out to a long, thin rectangle about 3 inches (7 cm) wide and 12 inches (30 cm) long and ¹⁄₁₆-inch (1 ½ cm) thick.
step-15: feed the rectangle through a pasta roller, starting on the thickest setting and gradually increasing the setting with each pass until the dough is approximately half as thick, but not so thin that it tears.
step-16: cut the pasta sheets in half.
step-17: feed each half through a fettuccine cutter and twirl each portion into nests on the prepared baking sheet while you cut the rest of the pasta.
step-18: boil the pasta for 2-3 minutes, until al dente but not falling apart.
step-19: drain the pasta and toss with the sauce of your choosing.

step-1: in a small bowl, add mustard, honey, olive oil, lemon juice, salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
step-2: stir until combined.
step-3: in a large bowl, add lettuce, onion, tomatoes, avocado, and chicken.
step-4: drizzle with honey mustard dressing and toss until evenly coated.
step-5: serve with hard-boiled egg.

step-1: cover a baking tray with greaseproof paper.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: mix the sugar, syrup, and honey together in a saucepan.
step-4: turn up the heat and slide a thermometer into the mixture.
step-5: heat till the sugar mixture reaches 275°f (140°c) and is brown and bubbling.
step-6: take the thermometer out and quickly whisk in the bicarbonate of soda.
step-7: pour the honeycomb into the prepared tray and leave to set.
step-8: do not touch the honeycomb at all throughout.
step-9: once set, smash up the honeycomb into bite-size pieces.
step-10: dip into the melted chocolate and chill.

step-1: make the filling: heat the oil in a medium pan over medium-high heat.
step-2: add the onion, garlic, ginger, and carrot.
step-3: cook for 4 minutes, or until the onion is slightly translucent.
step-4: add the ground pork and cook for about 6 minutes, or until cooked through.
step-5: add the water chestnuts, salt, pepper, and soy sauce.
step-6: stir for 2 minutes, then mix in the green onion and cilantro.
step-7: remove the pan from the heat and let cool.
step-8: heat about an inch (2 cm) of canola oil in a deep, medium frying pan until it reaches 300°f (150°c).
step-9: lay out one lumpia wrapper in a diamond shape and spoon 2 tablespoons of filling at the bottom of the wrapper, leaving about an inch and a half (3 cm) of space from the bottom point.
step-10: fold the bottom point over the filling, then fold in the edges to create an envelope shape.
step-11: roll the wrapper toward the top point.
step-12: brush the top point with egg wash and finish the roll to seal the end.
step-13: carefully place four to five lumpia at a time in the hot oil.
step-14: frying on each side for 1-2 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-15: note: if the lumpia are cooking too fast or burning, reduce the heat.
step-16: remove the lumpia from the oil and drain on a wire rack or paper towels.
step-17: sprinkle with a garnish of cilantro and serve with sweet chili dipping sauce.
step-18: optional: cut lumpia in half.

step-1: combine the rolled oats, raisins, peanuts, sunflower seeds, chia seeds, and cinnamon in a large bowl until evenly mixed.
step-2: store in airtight container for up to 6 months.
step-3: serve as desired.

step-1: in a large bowl, cream together 1 cup (225 grams) of softened butter with the white sugar and salt, until light and fluffy.
step-2: beat in eggs until fully incorporated.
step-3: sieve together the flour, cocoa powder, and baking soda into the mix.
step-4: blend well.
step-5: add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, and mix together until combined.
step-6: turn the dough out onto your surface and push together into a flat square.
step-7: wrap the dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour.
step-8: preheat oven to 325˚f (160˚c).
step-9: remove the dough from the fridge, and for ease of rolling out, divide the dough into 4 (this way the dough stays cool longer and prevents the need of re-chilling later on).
step-10: to roll out the dough, place a quarter of the dough between two sheets of parchment paper (alternatively the dough can be rolled out on a lightly floured surface - though the parchment is preferred as it prevents any additional flour from altering the color/appearance of the dark cookies).
step-11: roll the dough between the two sheets of parchment to ¼-inch (½ cm) thickness.
step-12: using a small round cookie cutter (alternatively, we found the rim of a champagne glass to be a perfect size!)
step-13: cut the dough into individual rounds and place on a large parchment-lined baking sheet, leaving at least ½-inch (1¼ cm) between each cookie.
step-14: pack together and re-roll out any scraps to cut additional cookies.
step-15: repeat with this process with each remaining ¼ of the dough.
step-16: bake in a preheated oven for 15 minutes.
step-17: if baking multiple trays at the same time, be sure to rotate the pans in the oven halfway through.
step-18: remove and transfer cookies to a cooling rack to cool completely.
step-19: to make the filling, combine ½ cup (115 grams) butter, powdered sugar, and vanilla in a medium mixing bowl.
step-20: beat together until light and fluffy.
step-21: assemble the cookies by spreading a generous scoop of the icing onto one of the cookies and sandwiching it with another.
step-22: give it a light squeeze and scrape any excess off to clear and even out the sides.
step-23: serve with a glass of milk.

step-1: fill a large stock-pot with water and bring to a boil.
step-2: carefully submerge mason jars with their tops in the boiling water and keep them submerged for at least 5 minutes until ready to use.
step-3: combine brine ingredients in a medium-sized saucepan and bring to a boil.
step-4: reduce to a simmer and allow brine to simmer for 2-4 minutes before removing from heat.
step-5: thoroughly wash all herbs and vegetables (cucumbers in this case) you intend to pickle before cutting them into the desired shape and size.
step-6: carefully place and arrange the herbs and vegetables inside of the mason jar.
step-7: pour the warm brine over the vegetables until the mason jar is just about full, making sure to completely submerge the items you want to get pickled.
step-8: seal the jar while the brine is still warm and allow to cool completely before placing in the fridge.
step-9: the pickles will reach their peak readiness in 10 days to 2 weeks and can be stored for up to two months.

step-1: cut puff pastry along fold lines and then in half, making 6 rectangular pieces.
step-2: coat edges of one section of pastry with egg wash (egg and milk whisked).
step-3: place desired amount of filling (we used equal parts of each jam) in the center and spread, leaving room on the edges.
step-4: then place a second piece of puff pastry on top, push the edges of the two pastry pieces together with your fingers and then press with a fork to seal.
step-5: bake on wax paper at 190°c (375°f) for 20-30 minutes or until golden brown and puffy.
step-6: for icing, mix all ingredients together.
step-7: add additional milk or sugar to achieve desired consistency.
step-8: apply to slightly cooked pastries.

step-1: in a large saucepan, bring the milk to a boil.
step-2: add lemon juice, stir and let sit for about 30 seconds.
step-3: remove the milk from the heat, let stand for about 15 minutes to curdle.
step-4: place a strainer over a deep bowl.
step-5: line the strainer with a cheese cloth of a clean kitchen towel.
step-6: pour the milk into the kitchen towel and let strain for about 30 minutes.
step-7: discard the liquid.
step-8: sauté spinach and garlic.
step-9: in a medium bowl, combine the ricotta and spinach.
step-10: salt to taste.
step-11: add one beaten egg.
step-12: spoon mixture in the center of a wonton wrapper.
step-13: moisten the edges of the wrapper with water.
step-14: top with another wonton wrapper.
step-15: gently seal around the filling in the center and the edges.
step-16: boil ravioli for two minutes.
step-17: drain ravioli and serve with your choice of sauce.

step-1: cream butter and sugar in a mixing bowl.
step-2: in a separate bowl, sift together flour, baking powder and salt.
step-3: add the dry ingredients to the creamed butter and sugar.
step-4: make sure it’s well incorporate, it will have a crumbly texture.
step-5: add the milk and vanilla.
step-6: bring together and refrigerate for 30 min.
step-7: melt the caramel with salt, heavy cream and vanilla in the microwave (2 min).
step-8: add the melted caramel to the the toasted coconut.
step-9: make sure to save about ¼ cup of the melted caramel.
step-10: the reserved caramel will be used to ‘glue’ the caramel coconut mix to the cookie.
step-11: roll out cookie dough and cut out your cookies.
step-12: place on a parchment paper and bake for 10-13 minutes at 350°f (175°c).
step-13: set aside to cool down.
step-14: once the cookie is cool enough to touch, add some of the reserved caramel to the top, then add a layer of caramel coconut.
step-15: dip in melted chocolate and drizzle chocolate over the top.
step-16: let chocolate set.

step-1: combine all the spice mix ingredients in a small bowl and mix well.
step-2: add the spice mix, bay leaves and water in a large pot and add the potatoes.
step-3: bring to a boil and 15 minutes.
step-4: add the corn and boil for 10 minutes.
step-5: add the sausage and cook for another 5 minutes.
step-6: take out a potato from the pot and check to see if it’s fully cooked.
step-7: if not, cook until potatoes are fully cooked.
step-8: stir in the shrimp and lemon juice, place the lid on the pot.
step-9: cook for 3 minutes.
step-10: drain the shrimp and serve with cocktail sauce and melted butter with garlic and parsley.

step-1: preheat oven to 450°f (230°c).
step-2: in a bowl, mix water, salt, and sugar until combined.
step-3: add yeast, and let rest 5 minutes until yeast starts to foam.
step-4: add flour and 2 tablespoons of oil, and mix thoroughly until a dough forms.
step-5: remove the dough and use the remaining oil to cover the bowl.
step-6: cover bowl with plastic wrap, and leave in a warm place for 1 hour.
step-7: cut dough into 8 pieces and roll them out into thin ropes, twisting the two ends to form a pretzel shape.
step-8: add baking soda to a large pot of water, and bring to a rolling boil.
step-9: boil each pretzel for 30 seconds per side.
step-10: transfer pretzels to a baking sheet, brush with egg wash, and sprinkle with salt.
step-11: bake for 10-15 minutes, until golden brown.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: spread the sunflower seeds on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-3: roast seeds for 8-10 minutes, stirring them halfway.
step-4: pour the seeds into a food processor and add the honey.
step-5: turn on the processor and blend until the seeds begin to clump up.
step-6: scrape down the sides and blend again.
step-7: slowly pour in the coconut oil and continue to blend in the processor until desired creaminess.
step-8: pour into a airtight container and store in the refrigerator.
step-9: use within 2 months of making.
step-10: tip: when ready to use, leave out on the counter to warm up to room temp for smooth spreading.

step-1: cook turkey sausages fully.
step-2: skewer a sausage.
step-3: run a knife around the sausage in a spiral down the full length of the sausage.
step-4: spread the sausage spiral down the skewer and coat in flour, egg wash, and bread crumbs.
step-5: fry in oil until golden brown.
step-6: let cool until safe to touch and remove from skewer.

step-1: reserve any parts that you are trimming off or peeling away (including tops, bottoms, skins, and stems) from the vegetables and herbs suggested above.
step-2: (avoid scraps from vegetables like brussels sprouts, broccoli, or cauliflower, as their strong flavors can overpower your stock.) place the scraps in a one-gallon airtight storage container, and keep them in the freezer for up to six months.
step-3: you can add many other vegetable and herb scraps, including corn cobs, winter squash, zucchini, summer squash, beet greens, fennel fronds, chard stems, lettuce, parsnips, green beans, pea pods, bell peppers, eggplant, asparagus, and herbs like dill, thyme, parsley, cilantro, and basil.
step-4: keep adding scraps until the storage container is full.
step-5: transfer the contents of the container into a large pot and fill three-quarters of the pot (or until the scraps just start to float) with water.
step-6: bring water to a boil and then let it simmer for 30 minutes.
step-7: using a sieve, strain the stock to remove the solids.
step-8: let stock cool completely.
step-9: stock can be refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 4 days, or frozen for up to 3 months.

step-1: in a bowl, add the milk, sugar, and yeast together and stir to combine.
step-2: in a separate bowl, add butter, eggs, and vanilla extract and mix well.
step-3: add the milk mixture to the bowl with eggs and mix well.
step-4: gradually add the flour, little by little, until fully incorporated.
step-5: place the dough on a lightly floured surface and knead for 5 minutes until smooth.
step-6: gently press the dough with a finger to ensure it springs back up from the indentation.
step-7: place the dough in an oiled bowl.
step-8: cover the dough lightly with oil.
step-9: cover the bowl with plastic wrap.
step-10: let the dough rise in a warm place for an hour or until doubled in size.
step-11: knead the dough one more time and place the dough in an oiled bowl.
step-12: once placed, cover with plastic wrap and let rest in the refrigerator overnight.
step-13: roll out the dough on a floured surface until ¼ inch (6 mm) thick.
step-14: cut out the doughnuts and doughnut holes with a cookie cutter and piping tip.
step-15: melt enough shortening over medium heat to come just 2 inches (5 cm) up on the side of a heavy pot.
step-16: once liquified, heat the shortening to 375°f (190°c).
step-17: fry the donuts in batches for 45 seconds on each side or until golden brown.
step-18: to make the glaze, combine the milk and sugar and stir until smooth.
step-19: to make the white chocolate ganache, add the chocolate chips to a bowl with warm heavy cream.
step-20: let it rest for about 5 minutes, or until the chocolate melts, and stir until smooth.
step-21: to make the pink ganache, add the chocolate chips and food colorant to a bowl with warm heavy cream.
step-22: let it rest for about 5 minutes, or until the chocolate melts, and stir until smooth.
step-23: to make the violet ganache, add the chocolate chips and food colorant to a bowl with warm heavy cream.
step-24: let it rest for about 5 minutes, or until the chocolate melts, and stir until smooth.
step-25: to make the milk chocolate ganache, add the chocolate chips to a bowl with warm heavy cream.
step-26: let it rest for about 5 minutes, or until the chocolate melts, and stir until smooth.
step-27: dunk or drizzle your doughnuts and top with sprinkles (optional).

step-1: create a small mountain of flour and, using a spoon, begin building a hole in the middle.
step-2: it should end up looking like a small volcano.
step-3: gradually add eggs in the volcano’s hole, and carefully incorporate eggs and flour.
step-4: once all ingredients have been mixed, knead the dough by pulling, stretching, and folding for about 3-5 minutes, or until it turns elastic and semi-easy to mold.
step-5: mold the dough into a sphere, and wrap it in plastic wrap and rest for 30 minutes, or until the dough becomes more relaxed, elastic, and much easier to mold.
step-6: cut the dough in four pieces.
step-7: grab the first one, and keep the other wrapped, or cover them with a slightly wet towel to keep them fresh.
step-8: flatten the first piece, and run it through the widest setting of your pasta maker.
step-9: increase the thinness number by one level each time you run the pasta through the machine.
step-10: once you can see your fingers through the dough, proceed to cut the fettuccine, or any shape you wish.
step-11: in a pot with boiling water and salt, cook the pasta for 2 minutes or until it feels tender to the bite.
step-12: serve with your favorite pasta sauce.

step-1: using a hand mixer, beat the egg whites in a large bowl until foamy.
step-2: add the cream of tartar and continue beating until soft peaks form.
step-3: in a medium bowl, beat the egg yolks with a hand mixer.
step-4: add the sugar a bit at a time and beat until thickened.
step-5: add the yolk mixture to the egg whites.
step-6: sift the cake flour, all-purpose flour, salt, and baking powder and add to the egg whites.
step-7: gently fold until fully combined.
step-8: add the butter and milk to a bowl or glass measuring cup and microwave for 20 seconds, or until the butter melts completely.
step-9: add the butter mixture and the vanilla to the batter and gently mix.
step-10: if you have the twinkie machine, you can simply pour in the batter and follow the machine’s instructions.
step-11: if you’re not using the twinkie machine to bake your twinkies, preheat the oven at 350ºf (180ºc).
step-12: if you are using diy molds, grab a sheet of tin foil, fold it in half, then in half again, and, using a small container or other twinkie-shaped item, mold the foil into an oblong shape.
step-13: trim the excess foil around the edges.
step-14: repeat to make 8-10 molds total.
step-15: fill the molds halfways and bake for 15 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the middle of the cake comes out clean.
step-16: if you are using a twinkie baking pan, fill each indent halfway and bake for about 13 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the middle of a cake comes out clean.
step-17: let the cakes cool down.
step-18: to make the filling, mix the marshmallow fluff and milk in a large bowl.
step-19: microwave for 20 seconds, then set aside to cool.
step-20: once the cakes are done, let cool.
step-21: fill a pastry bag with the filling.
step-22: use the tip to make 3 small holes in each cake, and squeeze in the filling.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the whole wheat flour, coconut sugar, and salt.
step-2: add the butter and use a pastry cutter to work it into the flour mixture, until the butter becomes about the size of peas.
step-3: work quickly to keep the dough cold.
step-4: add the ice water 1 tablespoon at a time and mix thoroughly until dough becomes crumbly and just hydrated enough to hold together.
step-5: pour the mixture onto a floured surface and form the dough into a disc with your hands.
step-6: cover and chill for 30 minutes.
step-7: meanwhile, make the jam: add the strawberries, blueberries, and coconut sugar to a small pot over low heat.
step-8: simmer for about 5 minutes, then mash the blueberries with a fork.
step-9: let simmer for another 5-10 minutes, until mixture starts to thicken to a jam-like consistency.
step-10: remove from the heat and let cool.
step-11: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-12: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-13: roll out the dough on a floured surface to about ¼- to ½-inch (6 mm to 13 mm) thick.
step-14: using a pizza cutter and a ruler, cut out 10 even rectangles, each about 3x4½ inches (7x12 cm) .
step-15: you may need to re-roll any excess dough to get all 10 rectangles.
step-16: place 5 of the rectangles on the prepared baking sheet and fill with a heaping tablespoon of the jam.
step-17: spread evenly in the center of the rectangles, stopping about 1 inch (2 cm) from the edges, to prevent leakage.
step-18: top with the remaining rectangles and gently press down the edges with a fork to seal the pastries.
step-19: use a pastry brush to gently brush the tops of each pastry with egg wash.
step-20: bake for 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-21: let cool completely.
step-22: if desired, make the glaze by whisking together the powdered sugar, vanilla, and milk in a medium bowl until a thick glaze forms.
step-23: use a spoon or rubber spatula to spread the glaze over the pastry tarts.
step-24: serve immediately or store in the fridge for up to 3 days.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220ºc).
step-2: slice the stem off of the brussels sprouts and then halve them.
step-3: on a prepared baking sheet, combine brussels sprouts and remaining ingredients.
step-4: mix evenly.
step-5: bake for 15-20 minutes.
step-6: allow to cool for 5 minutes.

step-1: in a large, shallow saucepan, combine the onion, garlic, and water.
step-2: cook over medium heat until the onion is translucent and softened, about 5 minutes.
step-3: add the ketchup, apple cider vinegar, honey, and mustard powder.
step-4: continue cooking for 20 minutes, until the sauce is thickened.
step-5: season with salt and pepper.
step-6: remove the pan from the heat.
step-7: using an immersion blender, puree the sauce until smooth.
step-8: let cool completely, about 25 minutes.
step-9: transfer to a clean airtight container and store in the refrigerator.
step-10: the barbecue sauce will keep for up to 4 days.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: in a bowl, combine flour, chili powder, salt, pepper, paprika, and garlic powder.
step-3: coat the wings in the flour evenly, shaking off any excess.
step-4: place the floured wings on a parchment paper–lined baking sheet and spread them out in a single layer.
step-5: bake for 45 minutes, flipping halfway through, until skin is crispy and golden brown.
step-6: preheat oven to 500°f (250°c).
step-7: in a separate bowl, combine the bbq sauce and the honey.
step-8: stir the cooked wings in the sauce and coat them evenly.
step-9: place the coated wings back onto the baking sheet and spread them in a single layer.
step-10: bake for 8 to 10 minutes, until sauce is bubbly and caramelized.
step-11: cool, then serve.

step-1: slice chicken breasts into bite-sized chunks.
step-2: combine the chicken with the salt, pepper, garlic powder, and chili powder, mixing until evenly seasoned.
step-3: place the flour and eggs into separate bowls.
step-4: dip a piece of chicken into the flour, then the egg, then back into the flour.
step-5: repeat with the rest of the chicken.
step-6: heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
step-7: fry the chicken pieces until deep-golden brown and crispy.
step-8: set aside on a paper towel to drain.
step-9: in a pan over medium heat, mix together the honey, water, hot sauce, ketchup, and chipotle powder.
step-10: bring the sauce to a simmer, and cook for one minute.
step-11: toss the chicken in the sauce until evenly glazed.

step-1: soak the skewers in water for 5-10 minutes and set aside.
step-2: if baking, preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-3: in a bowl with the chicken, add the ingredients for the marinade.
step-4: mix until coated.
step-5: cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes to 2 hours.
step-6: prepare the vegetables by cutting them into 1-inch (2 ½ cm) squares.
step-7: assemble the skewers starting with the red onion, followed by the bell peppers and chicken.
step-8: repeat three times.
step-9: place the prepared skewers on a baking sheet and brush with remaining marinade.
step-10: bake or grill for 20-30 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink.
step-11: sprinkle with parsley.

step-1: mix flour, garlic powder, pepper, and salt in a small bowl.
step-2: coat each chicken wing with a generous layer of the flour mixture.
step-3: pour ¼ inch (6 mm) of oil into a shallow pan, and bring it to a medium high heat.
step-4: in small batches, fry the chicken wings for 4 minutes on each side.
step-5: remove from the oil and let rest on a paper towel.
step-6: over medium-high heat, melt the butter and add the garlic and ginger.
step-7: add soy sauce, honey, and brown sugar to pan and reduce for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
step-8: add the fried wings directly into the sauce pan and stir until the wings are covered in the sauce, then sprinkle with sesame seeds.
step-9: serve with scallions on top.

step-1: in a 2-cup (480ml) liquid measuring cup, combine the ginger, garlic, soy sauce, and honey.
step-2: pour about ⅓ cup (80 ml) of sauce over the shrimp in a medium bowl and toss to coat.
step-3: reserve the rest of the sauce.
step-4: cover the shrimp with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes to 1 hour.
step-5: in a wok or deep skillet over medium-high heat, heat 2 tablespoons of cooking oil, then add the par-cooked noodles.
step-6: cook for 1-2 minutes, allowing the noodles to crisp, then flip and cook for another 1-2 minutes.
step-7: transfer to a plate and set aside.
step-8: in the same wok, heat 1 tablespoon of cooking oil, then add the onion, broccoli, carrots, and ⅓ cup (80 ml) of the sauce.
step-9: cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the onions are translucent.
step-10: add the cabbage and season with salt and pepper to taste.
step-11: cook for 2 minutes more, or until the vegetables have softened.
step-12: push the vegetables to one side of the wok and add the remaining cooking oil to the empty side, followed by the marinated shrimp.
step-13: cook for 1 minute without disturbing, then flip the shrimp over and cook for another 2 minutes, until the shrimp are pink and their tails have curled in.
step-14: mix the cooked shrimp with the vegetables and add the crispy chow mein noodles and the remaining sauce.
step-15: toss gently and cook for another 2-3 minutes, or until everything is well combined.
step-16: garnish with sliced scallions.

step-1: place shrimp in a sealable bag or medium bowl.
step-2: in a small bowl or measuring cup, mix marinade ingredients.
step-3: pour half of the marinade on the shrimp.
step-4: save the other half for later.
step-5: let the shrimp marinate in the refrigerator for at least 15 minutes.
step-6: in a medium pan, heat oil.
step-7: add shrimp to the pan, but discard the used marinade.
step-8: cook shrimp on one side for about a minute, then flip over.
step-9: pour in remaining marinade and cook until shrimp is cooked through and just firm.
step-10: remove the shrimp from the pan and let the marinade reduce.
step-11: serve the shrimp with sauce and garnish with green onion.

step-1: season ribs evenly with salt, pepper, paprika, and chili powder.
step-2: rub in on all sides.
step-3: add honey, soy sauce, and garlic to a large slow cooker.
step-4: transfer the ribs to slow cooker and turn them over in sauce until coated.
step-5: position the ribs so they are standing up, with the meatier side down, and so the meat side is against the walls of the slow cooker, with the bone sides facing in.
step-6: cover and cook on high for 4 hours, or low for 7 - 8 hours.
step-7: check after the allotted time, you want to make sure the meat is cooked through and tender.
step-8: remove the ribs and transfer to cutting board.
step-9: cut between the bones to separate into individual ribs.
step-10: serve with additional sauce from the slow cooker, as needed.

step-1: in a large glass bowl, combine water, vinegar, and salt, mixing until some salt is dissolved.
step-2: add chicken, cover, and refrigerate for 2-8 hours.
step-3: in a medium bowl, combine eggs, milk, and hot sauce to create the egg wash.
step-4: add flour to bowl and set aside.
step-5: remove chicken from brine, place in bowl and season.
step-6: transfer chicken to egg wash then the flour, coating evenly.
step-7: fry chicken in a large cast-iron pan for 10-15 minutes on each side.
step-8: place chicken on drying rack and let cool for 5 minutes.
step-9: mix honey and water together and lightly brush each piece of chicken.

step-1: mix yogurt and honey in a bowl.
step-2: pour mixture into a baking pan lined with parchment paper.
step-3: add desired amount of toppings.
step-4: freeze 6 hours, or overnight, until frozen solid.
step-5: break yogurt bark into desired number of pieces.
step-6: serve cold, or store in a closed container in the freezer.

step-1: preheat a grill or grill plate to medium heat.
step-2: drizzle the corn with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
step-3: mix to ensure all the ears are evenly coated.
step-4: place the corn on the grill.
step-5: close the lid to keep the temperature high, and let the corn cook for about 15 minutes per side, or until slightly charred on all sides.
step-6: remove the corn from the heat and set aside.
step-7: brush melted butter on the corn.
step-8: drizzle the corn with honey.
step-9: sprinkle the corn with a mixture of the chives, parsley, and thyme.

step-1: add the simple honey syrup and lavender to a small saucepan.
step-2: simmer over medium heat for 5 minutes, until slightly reduced.
step-3: let cool completely, then strain into an airtight glass container and store in the refrigerator for up to 2 months.
step-4: to serve, mix 1-2 tablespoons of honey lavender syrup with 8 ounces of seltzer water in a glass over ice.
step-5:
nutrition, per 1 tablespoon
calories: 16 
sugars: 4 grams

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: cover a sheet pan with aluminum foil and spray with nonstick cooking spray.
step-3: spread out your potatoes on the pan and drizzle with 1 tbsp.
step-4: olive oil and 1 tbsp.
step-5: lemon juice.
step-6: season with salt and pepper and sprinkle ½ tbsp.
step-7: thyme, and 1 clove minced garlic over the potatoes.
step-8: bake for 15 minutes, flip, then bake for another 10 minutes.
step-9: in the meantime, create your salmon glaze.
step-10: combine 2 tbsp.
step-11: lemon juice, 2 tbsp.
step-12: honey, 2 tsp ginger, 2 cloves minced garlic, and 1 tbsp.
step-13: thyme.
step-14: set aside.
step-15: take the potatoes out of the oven and push them to the top or side of your pan.
step-16: (don’t cramp them — make sure to still space them out a bit.)
step-17: place your salmon fillets on the pan.
step-18: season both sides with salt and pepper and brush on the glaze onto both sides, then top with lemon slices and sprigs of thyme.
step-19: place your asparagus on the pan and top with 1 tbsp.
step-20: olive oil, 1 tbsp.
step-21: lemon juice, salt and pepper, 1 clove minced garlic, and ½ tbsp.
step-22: of thyme.
step-23: bake for 8-10 minutes.
step-24: (the salmon should flake easily with a fork when it’s ready.)

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine all the ingredients for the chicken marinade.
step-2: toss in the chicken thighs and marinate for at least one hour.
step-3: in a cast-iron skillet, cook chicken on high heat until there is a nice sear on the surface of the chicken, and the inside is no longer pink.
step-4: roughly four minutes each side.
step-5: set chicken aside.
step-6: place chopped lettuce, tomatoes, red onion, and avocados in a large salad bowl.
step-7: slice cooked chicken thighs and add to the salad bowl.
step-8: in a small bowl, combine all the ingredients for the dressing.
step-9: mix well.
step-10: toss the salad with the dressing and serve immediately.

step-1: place sliced fruits in a large bowl.
step-2: in a small bowl, mix honey and lime juice.
step-3: pour syrup over the fruit and mix.

step-1: dressing: place all the ingredients in a food processor.
step-2: process for about 1 minute until emulsified.
step-3: mix olive oil, honey, ground cumin, paprika, garlic powder, zest, salt and pepper in a bowl.
step-4: add the shrimp to the bowl and toss to coat.
step-5: thread the shrimp onto skewers.
step-6: heat grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
step-7: place shrimp skewers and the corn on the grill and close the lid.
step-8: grill for 4 minutes, then flip skewers.
step-9: grill for 3 minutes on the second side, then take the skewers off the grill.
step-10: rotate corn to get light grill marks.
step-11: (corn will take about 5 minutes longer than the shrimp.) take the corn off the grill.
step-12: pull the shrimp off the skewers.
step-13: slice corn off the cob.
step-14: assemble the salad: on a platter, arrange the mixed baby greens.
step-15: scatter the tomatoes, radishes, and avocado on top.
step-16: add the shrimp and corn.
step-17: scatter sliced scallion over the salad.
step-18: drizzle with the dressing.
step-19: serve!

step-1: cut chicken breasts into cubes.
step-2: in a medium-sized bowl, combine chicken, salt, pepper, garlic, and ginger.
step-3: toss until evenly coated.
step-4: place flour and beaten eggs into two separate bowls.
step-5: roll each piece of chicken in flour.
step-6: then, dip each piece into the eggs until fully covered.
step-7: dip into flour one last time for another coat.
step-8: heat oil to 375°f (190°c) in a large pot over medium-high heat.
step-9: fry the coated chicken pieces, in batches, until golden and cooked through, about 10 minutes.
step-10: in a saucepan over medium heat, combine butter, honey, sriracha, soy sauce, and lime juice.
step-11: add chicken and stir until completely covered.
step-12: serve with ranch, blue cheese, or honey!

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f/200˚c.
step-2: break the head of cauliflower into bite-sized florets.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine flour, garlic powder and almond milk.
step-4: add the cauliflower florets and coat well.
step-5: transfer the coated florets onto a parchment-lined baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes.
step-6: remove the cauliflower from the oven and allow to cool for a few minutes.
step-7: once cool, transfer into a bowl, add honey mustard and coat well.
step-8: return cauliflower to the baking sheet and bake for 10 more minutes or until heated through.
step-9: serve with ranch or your favorite dipping sauce.

step-1: in a small bowl, add the olive oil, honey, stone ground mustard, dijon mustard, lemon, garlic, salt, and pepper.
step-2: whisk until smooth.
step-3: remove ½ of the marinade and refrigerate to use as a dressing.
step-4: add chicken thighs to remaining marinade and let it marinate for two hours.
step-5: add a teaspoon of olive oil to a nonstick pan.
step-6: sear chicken on each side until golden, crispy, and cooked through.
step-7: set aside and allow to rest.
step-8: put lettuce in a large bowl, add tomatoes, red onions, avocado slices, and hard-boiled egg.
step-9: slice chicken into strips and place in the salad.
step-10: add the remaining marinade to the salad and toss.
step-11: sprinkle bacon on top.

step-1: in a small bowl or liquid measuring cup, mix the honey, mustard, oil, garlic, salt, and pepper.
step-2: place the chicken thighs in a dish and pour the marinade over the chicken, reserving half for later.
step-3: flip the chicken thighs over, fully covering them in the marinade.
step-4: cover the dish with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes to an hour.
step-5: heat a large skillet over medium heat, and place the chicken thighs in the pan.
step-6: cook for five minutes on each side, or until the chicken is cooked through.
step-7: remove the chicken and set aside.
step-8: wipe the pan clean and place back on the heat.
step-9: add the chopped bacon to the pan and cook until crispy, about ten minutes.
step-10: transfer the bacon to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.
step-11: add three tablespoons of water to the reserved marinade and stir to combine.
step-12: slice the chicken into strips.
step-13: add the romaine, cherry tomatoes, red onion, avocado, cooked bacon, and chicken to a bowl and drizzle with the remaining honey mustard dressing.

step-1: place frozen tater tots on a baking sheet and bake at 450˚f (230˚c) for 20 minutes, or until crispy.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: in a large bowl, toss chicken thighs with 1 tablespoon whole grain mustard, salt, pepper, and 1 tablespoon olive oil.
step-4: in a cast iron skillet, cook on high heat until there is a nice brown sear on the surface of the chicken, and the inside is no longer pink.
step-5: roughly four minutes each side.
step-6: set chicken aside.
step-7: cook onions until caramelized.
step-8: set onions aside.
step-9: cut the chicken into bite-size cubes.
step-10: wipe the skillet of excess fat.
step-11: layer with cooked tater tots.
step-12: top with chicken.
step-13: in a small bowl, combine all ingredients for honey mustard dressing.
step-14: pour the dressing on the chicken and tots.
step-15: top with onion, then cheddar and monterey jack cheese.
step-16: broil from 5-10 minutes, or until cheese is melted.
step-17: load the dish with tomatoes, avocados, sour cream, and scallions.
step-18: serve immediately.

step-1: add the mustard, honey, apple cider vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper into a mason jar.
step-2: screw the lid on tightly and shake vigorously.
step-3: the dressing can remain in the fridge for 1–2 weeks.
step-4: pour over your favorite salad and enjoy!

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: add the chopped onion, garlic cloves, apple cider vinegar, mustard, orange juice, and cloves to a large roasting pan, stirring to combine.
step-3: place the ham on the roasting rack over the liquid.
step-4: trim off tough outer skin, then score the remaining fat in a crosshatch pattern.
step-5: cover the entire roasting rack with aluminum foil and bake for 1 hour.
step-6: remove the ham from the oven, and remove the foil.
step-7: baste the ham with the liquid, then remove the rack from the roasting pan and set aside.
step-8: remove all the whole cloves from the remaining liquid in the pan.
step-9: pour the remaining liquid into a pot, along with the honey, dijon mustard, worcestershire sauce, and brown sugar.
step-10: whisk to combine.
step-11: bring the mixture to a boil over medium high heat, then simmer until thick and reduced, about 10 minutes.
step-12: brush the glaze on to the ham then transfer back to the roasting rack.
step-13: bake the ham for 30-45 minutes, or until the glaze is caramelized and the ham reaches 145°f (65°c).
step-14: slice the ham, and serve.

step-1: in a small bowl, mix together the onion powder and salt.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: in a separate small bowl, mix together the mustard, vinegar, and honey.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: melt the coconut oil in a large pot over medium heat.
step-6: add 3-4 popcorn kernels and cover with the lid.
step-7: once they pop, add the rest of the kernels and cover, shaking every 10 seconds, until they begin pop.
step-8: once the pops are more than 3 seconds apart, turn off the heat and let sit for 15 seconds to allow any final kernels to pop.
step-9: uncover and drizzle the honey mustard mixture over the popcorn.
step-10: carefully toss to coat.
step-11: sprinkle the salt and onion powder mixture over the popcorn and stir to coat evenly.
step-12: transfer to a bowl and eat immediately, or spread in a single layer on a baking sheet and let cool completely before storing in a sealed container for up to 2 days.

step-1: add the ingredients into a mason jar.
step-2: screw the lid on tightly and shake vigorously.
step-3: the dressing can remain in the fridge for 1–2 weeks.
step-4: pour over your favorite salad ingredients and enjoy!

step-1: note: if you have unroasted nuts, preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: spread peanuts onto a baking tray and bake for 10-12 minutes or until you can smell them.
step-3: in a food processor, blend peanuts.
step-4: scrape down the sides when necessary.
step-5: when the peanuts have broken down and become crumbly, add in honey and salt while still blending.
step-6: the mixture will turn into a ball and eventually even out.
step-7: slowly add canola oil while still blending.
step-8: add more canola oil if you want a creamier texture.
step-9: pour into a jar, store in a refrigerator and use within one month.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the soy sauce, shaoxing, sesame oil, five spice, salt, garlic, ginger, bean curd, bean curd liquid, hoisin, and honey.
step-2: place the pork into the marinate, turn to coat completely, and cover with cling wrap.
step-3: marinate for at least 3 hours, or preferably overnight.
step-4: preheat the oven to 300°f (150°c).
step-5: line a baking sheet with parchment paper and set a wire rack on top.
step-6: transfer the pork shoulder from the marinade to the wire rack.
step-7: bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes until the edges are slightly charred.
step-8: pour the marinade through a strainer into a medium pot.
step-9: heat the marinade on medium heat until it reduces to ¼ of its original volume, about 10 minutes.
step-10: glaze the pork with the reduced marinade every 15 minutes.
step-11: when the pork is done, slice and serve with white rice and bok choy.

step-1: preheat oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-2: in a medium casserole dish, evenly coat the carrots in butter, honey, salt, and pepper.
step-3: bake for 25-30 minutes.

step-1: place salmon in a sealable bag or medium bowl.
step-2: in a small bowl or measuring cup, mix marinade ingredients.
step-3: pour half of the marinade on the salmon.
step-4: save the other half for later.
step-5: let the salmon marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
step-6: in a medium pan, heat oil.
step-7: add salmon to the pan, but discard the used marinade.
step-8: cook salmon on one side for about 2-3 minutes, then flip over and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes.
step-9: remove salmon from pan.
step-10: pour in remaining marinade and reduce.
step-11: serve the salmon with sauce and a side of veggies.
step-12: we used broccoli.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: in a small bowl, mix honey soy marinade ingredients.
step-3: lay the salmon on a baking sheet.
step-4: pour the marinade over the salmon.
step-5: lay the broccoli beside the salmon, but not touching.
step-6: drizzle olive oil over the broccoli, then season with salt and pepper.
step-7: bake for 10-12 minutes.
step-8: top with sliced green onions.

step-1: line a 9"x9" (23cmx23cm) baking dish with parchment paper and grease thoroughly.
step-2: set aside a metal whisk and one tablespoon of baking soda.
step-3: in a large saucepan (bigger the better - as this will more than triple in size) over medium/high heat–combine sugar, corn syrup, and water.
step-4: stir to incorporate, then leave to boil.
step-5: insert candy thermometer and continue to heat–without stirring–until the mixture reaches 300˚f (150˚c).
step-6: remove from heat and ~working quickly~…add the baking soda and quickly whisk into the sugar syrup (whisking for no more than five seconds–to prevent deflating the toffee).
step-7: the mixture will begin to expand, quickly pour it into the prepared pan and leave to set do not move for one to two hours.
step-8: once the toffee has cooled and set, remove from pan and using a blunt object, shatter the toffee into bite size pieces.
step-9: melt chocolate in a microwave safe bowl for 75-90 seconds.
step-10: make sure to stop and stir after every 30 seconds.
step-11: dip the toffee pieces in chocolate and place on a lined baking tray.
step-12: finish with a sprinkle of sea salt and place in the refrigerator to cool for 15 minutes.

step-1: combine water, sugar, lime juice, and lime zest in a pot over medium heat.
step-2: once the sugar has dissolved, simmer for 30 minutes and reduce.
step-3: pour simple syrup through a strainer and remove excess liquid, then let it cool to room temperature.
step-4: in a blender, combine simple syrup, honeydew, and the remaining lime juice.
step-5: blend until well-combined.
step-6: pour into an 8×8 inch (20x20 cm) baking dish and freeze for at least 12 hours.
step-7: take out of the freezer and let sit for 5-10 minutes before scooping.
step-8: serve.

step-1: cut honeydew in half and remove seeds.
step-2: cut into slices and remove fruit from the skin.
step-3: transfer melon pieces to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and freeze until hardened.
step-4: add the frozen melon and honey to a food processor and combine until evenly mixed.
step-5: transfer to a loaf pan and transfer to freezer until completely frozen.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f / 200˚c.
step-2: for the pastry, in a large bowl, sift flour, sugar, and salt.
step-3: then add softened butter.
step-4: bring the mixture together with your hands, careful not to knead the pastry dough too much or you will make the pastry tough.
step-5: whisk the egg yolks and add the 2 tablespoons of beaten yolk to the flour mixture.
step-6: bring together until smooth.
step-7: if the dough is too sticky, coating your hands with flour will help.
step-8: cover with plastic wrap and then refrigerate for 30 minutes, or until the dough is firm.
step-9: to make the custard filling, melt sugar and salt with hot water.
step-10: mix until dissolved then let cool.
step-11: add the rest of the beaten egg yolk.
step-12: stir in sugar water and also evaporated milk (if adding vanilla, add now).
step-13: stir and combine everything well.
step-14: strain the filling to ensure no lumps.
step-15: chill in the refrigerator.
step-16: take the dough out and divide into 16 equal portions.
step-17: spray the tart pan with a light coating of oil.
step-18: take one portion of your dough and roll it into a ball and place in your tart shell.
step-19: press the shell into the pan with your fingers.
step-20: try to make the wrapper uniform in thickness and avoid a thick bottom.
step-21: repeat to finish all.
step-22: pour the custard filling into the shells until it is about 80% full.
step-23: bake for 15 to 20 minutes until the surface becomes golden brown and a toothpick can stand in the egg tart.
step-24: cool down for several minutes and then take the egg tarts out of the pan.
step-25: serve while still warm.

step-1: in a blender, combine rice, almonds, and 1 cinnamon stick.
step-2: blend until rice is just broken up.
step-3: transfer rice mixture to bowl, soak in water overnight or at least 3 hours.
step-4: strain rice mixture and reserve water.
step-5: in a blender, combine rice mixture and evaporated milk.
step-6: blend until smooth.
step-7: strain resulting liquid, discard remnants.
step-8: whisk in condensed milk and vanilla.
step-9: add almond milk and reserved rice water.
step-10: pour horchata into popsicle mold.
step-11: freeze for 6 hours or until frozen.

step-1: cut flank steak into fajita size pieces and place in bowl.
step-2: add the taco seasoning, 1 teaspoon lime juice and salt.
step-3: let marinate for 30 minutes.
step-4: scoop avocado with a spoon and place in a bowl.
step-5: add 1 teaspoon lime juice, salt and mash with a fork until soft enough to whisk.
step-6: in a frying pan, add 1 tablespoon of canola oil and let heat for 30 seconds.
