step-7: add marinated meat and let cook for 20 minutes, stirring until meat is browned.
step-8: in a small saucepan heat condensed cheddar cheese for 3 minutes, stir throughout.
step-9: on a griddle warm up flour tortilla until soft.
step-10: add cooked meat, add half of guacamole, 2 tablespoons of sour cream, 1 bag of hot cheetos, and warm cheddar cheese.
step-11: wrap burrito up, fold ends in then each corner of the top side until you can roll the top side up.
step-12: slice in half, and enjoy!

step-1: cut flank steak into fajita size pieces and place in bowl.
step-2: add the taco seasoning, 1 teaspoon lime juice and salt.
step-3: let marinate for 30 minutes.
step-4: scoop avocado with a spoon and place in a bowl.
step-5: add 1 teaspoon lime juice, salt and mash with a fork until soft enough to whisk.
step-6: in a frying pan, add 1 tablespoon of canola oil and let heat for 30 seconds.
step-7: add marinated meat and let cook for 20 minutes, stirring until meat is browned.
step-8: in a small saucepan heat condensed cheddar cheese for 3 minutes, stir throughout.
step-9: heat a pot with oil and heat to 350ºf (180ºf).
step-10: add frozen french fries and let fry until they rise to the surface.
step-11: sprinkle with salt and let oil drain from fries and set on a plate.
step-12: add the rest of the guacamole, cooked meat, sour cream, hot cheetos, and warm cheddar cheese.

step-1: in a bowl, add the greek yogurt, lemon juice, green onions, salt, mustard, garlic, and black pepper, and whisk to combine.
step-2: add the flour, salt, and pepper to a wide, shallow bowl and stir to combine.
step-3: add the egg into another bowl, and whisk until beaten.
step-4: place bread crumbs in a third wide, shallow bowl.
step-5: dip the chicken in the flour, the egg, and then bread crumbs.
step-6: heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
step-7: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the chicken breast and cook until crispy and golden, about 3 minutes per side.
step-8: remove the chicken from the pan and toss in a bowl of buffalo sauce and honey.
step-9: slice the chicken into strips.
step-10: add the spinach, cabbage, tomatoes, and cucumber to a bowl and drizzle with the dressing.
step-11: top with the hot chicken.
step-12: toss to combine.

step-1: gently heat the milk in a saucepan over a medium heat.
step-2: stir in the dark chocolate, caramel, and sea salt.
step-3: take off the heat and pour into a tall glass.
step-4: top with whipped cream, caramel sauce, and dark chocolate shards.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugars with an electric hand mixer until light and fluffy.
step-3: beat in the egg, then add the melted chocolate chips and beat to incorporate.
step-4: sift in the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt.
step-5: beat until just combined.
step-6: scoop a rounded tablespoon of cookie dough into each cup of a mini muffin tin.
step-7: use your fingers to spread the dough evenly across the bottoms and up the sides of the cups, being careful not to spill over the edges.
step-8: bake for 8 minutes, until cookies have slightly puffed up.
step-9: let cool completely.
step-10: if the centers have puffed up, use the back of a wooden spoon to reshape.
step-11: prep the decorations: add 4 ounces (100 grams) of chocolate chips to a liquid measuring cup or heatproof bowl.
step-12: pour over the warm heavy cream and let sit for 1 minute, then stir until well combined and smooth.
step-13: pour the ganache into the cooled cookie cups until level with the tops.
step-14: decorate the tops of each cookie cup with mini marshmallows and let sit at room temperature until the ganache has firmed up about 1 hours.
step-15: in a liquid measuring cup or heatproof bowl, melt the remaining chocolate in the microwave, then allow to sit at room temperature until thickened, about 10-15 minutes.
step-16: use to scissors to cut the curved end of the mini candy canes into small handles.
step-17: use a knife to gently lift the cookie cups from the muffin tin so one side sticks up.
step-18: dip the ends of the candy cane handles into the cooled melted chocolate, then stick onto the sides of the cookie cups.
step-19: let set for at least 1 hour before serving.

step-1: in a saucepan set over medium heat, warm the heavy cream, condensed milk and cocoa powder, and bring to a simmer.
step-2: place chocolate chips in a heat-proof bowl, and pour on top the top cream mixture.
step-3: allow to stand for 1 minute before stirring to combine, until thick and smooth.
step-4: using a cookie scoop, spoon the mixture into a silicone mini muffin pan.
step-5: use a butter knife to smooth the tops as needed.
step-6: garnish the tops with the marshmallows.
step-7: insert a popsicle stick into the middle of each.
step-8: freeze for 2 hours, or refrigerate for 4 hours.
step-9: to serve, dissolve a stick into a mug of hot milk.

step-1: cut the hot cross buns in half and butter both sides.
step-2: sprinkle in half of the chocolate chips across all six buns and close.
step-3: place in a tin that gives them a snug fit.
step-4: whisk together the milk, egg and sugar in another bowl and pour over the buns.
step-5: sprinkle over the other half of the chocolate chips.
step-6: bake for 30 mins at 300°f convection (150°c fan).

step-1: cut the hot dog into six equal sized pieces.
step-2: then cut puff pastry into sections just large enough to wrap around the pieces of hot dog.
step-3: wrap the hot dogs with the cut puff pastry.
step-4: place them on a baking sheet or foil in two rows of 3 with just a little space between each.
step-5: top with cheese and scallions and bake at 400°f (204°c) for 25 minutes or until golden brown.

step-1: skewer a hot dog the long way.
step-2: cut a spiral by holding your knife at a diagonal to the hotdog and rolling it along your cutting board.
step-3: remove skewer and set aside.
step-4: cut a strip of puff pastry, it should be ½ inch (1 ³⁄₁₀ cm) wide and 1 and ½ in (4 cm) times the length of the hot dog you are using.
step-5: wind a strip of puff pastry into the spiral groove you just made on the hot dog.
step-6: bake at 375°f (190°c) for 20-30 minutes, until the dough is golden brown.
step-7: serve with condiments of choice.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a saucepan over medium heat bring the butter brown sugar and corn syrup to a boil.
step-3: remove from heat
step-4: add the flour and nuts into the butter mixture.
step-5: stir until cooled, about 10 minutes.
step-6: on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, use a teaspoon to scoop 5 balls 5 inches (13 cm) apart onto the baking sheet.
step-7: bake for 6-7 minutes, until the edges are a deep golden color.
step-8: let the cookies cool for about 1 minute, until they are cool enough to handle but still flexible.
step-9: place the cookie over the backside of a muffin tin and gently form until the cookie is a cup shape.
step-10: wait until the cookie has hardened into the cup shape then remove from the muffin tin, about 1 minute.
step-11: in a bowl, microwave the chocolate in 20-second intervals stirring in between for 1 minute.
step-12: take one of the pecan lace cookie cups and dip the edge into the chocolate.
step-13: let cool.
step-14: place one scoop of ice cream in the cookie cup, pour hot fudge over the ice cream, top with nuts.
step-15: serve immediately.

step-1: add all ingredients to the pot and bring to boil.
step-2: bring down to a simmer for 20 minutes.

step-1: add the hot water, lemon juice, honey, and star anise to a slow cooker.
step-2: stir to combine.
step-3: turn the heat to high, cover, and warm until the water begins to steam, about 30 minutes.
step-4: add the black tea bags and let steep for about 8 minutes.
step-5: remove the tea bags and reduce the heat setting to warm.
step-6: add the lemons and whiskey.
step-7: stir to combine.
step-8: ladle into mugs and garnish with lemon wedges.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: line baking sheets with parchment paper.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, and salt.
step-4: mix with a fork.
step-5: in a separate large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar with an electric hand mixer for 3-5 minutes, until the butter and sugar are fully combined, but before the mixture becomes fluffy.
step-6: add the egg and vanilla and beat to incorporate.
step-7: add the flour mixture and mix until just combined, but crumbly.
step-8: finish mixing with your hands until the dough comes together in a ball.
step-9: transfer the dough to a floured surface.
step-10: lightly flour the top of the dough and roll out to about ¼-inch thick.
step-11: use cookie cutters of your choice to punch out cookies.
step-12: place the cookie cut-outs on the prepared baking sheets.
step-13: bake for 8-10 minutes, until lightly browned around the edges.
step-14: let cool completely.
step-15: to make the royal icing: in a medium bowl, add the meringue powder to the powdered sugar.
step-16: whisk to combine.
step-17: add the vanilla and 4-6 tablespoons of water (depending on how runny or thick you’d like your icing.) whisk until completely combined.
step-18: divide the icing into smaller bowls and add any desired gel food colors.
step-19: immediately transfer to piping bags, or cover with plastic wrap.
step-20: do not leave the icing uncovered, as it will develop a film.
step-21: if this happens, add a small amount of water and whisk to incorporate.
step-22: decorate the cookies with royal icing as desired and let dry completely, at least 3-4 hours or overnight.

step-1: make the tempura batter: sift the flour into a large bowl.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: in a medium bowl, whisk together the egg and water until lightly frothy.
step-4: add the flour in 3 additions, stirring with chopsticks just to combine.
step-5: refrigerate until ready to use.
step-6: prepare the shrimp: trim the tails, then use your knife to scrape the dirt and water from the remaining tail shell.
step-7: cut small incisions crosswise on both the top and bottom of the shrimp.
step-8: this will prevent the shrimp from curling up as it cooks.
step-9: do not cut too deep, or the shrimp will fall apart.
step-10: pat the shrimp dry between paper towels, then refrigerate until ready to fry.
step-11: prepare the eggplant: trim the stem, then cut in half lengthwise.
step-12: leaving the top ½ inch (1 ¼ cm) intact, cut 5-6 ½-inch (¼ cm) thick slices down the length of the eggplant.
step-13: fry the kabocha squash: fill a medium pot about halfway with oil.
step-14: heat over medium heat until it reaches 320°f (160°c).
step-15: coat the kabocha wedges lightly with flour, dusting off any excess.
step-16: dip the wedges in the tempura batter.
step-17: fry in the hot oil for 4-5 minutes, or until tender.
step-18: let any excess oil drip off, then transfer to a wire rack set over a paper towel-lined baking sheet to drain.
step-19: fry the eggplant: increase the oil temperature to 340°f (170°c).
step-20: coat the eggplant lightly with flour, dusting off any excess.
step-21: dip in the tempura batter.
step-22: fry in the hot oil for 2-3 minutes, or until tender.
step-23: transfer to the wire rack to drain.
step-24: fry the shrimp: increase the oil temperature to 350°f (180°c).
step-25: lightly coat the shrimp with flour, dusting off any excess.
step-26: dip in the tempura batter.
step-27: add the shrimp to the hot oil.
step-28: dip your fingers into the tempura batter and drizzle over the shrimp.
step-29: this will make them extra crunchy.
step-30: fry the shrimp for 3-4 minutes, or until cooked through.
step-31: transfer to the wire rack to drain.
step-32: serve the tempura immediately with dipping sauce or seasoned salt alongside.

step-1: remove the tops/bottoms/skins/stems from any vegetables you are preparing (avoid vegetables like brussels sprouts, broccoli, or cauliflower as they will add a bitter taste to your stock) and place them in a ziplock bag - they can stay frozen up to 6 months.
step-2: note: you can add many other vegetable scraps (think sweet!)
step-3: - i.e.
step-4: corn cobs, winter squash, zucchini, and other squash, beet greens, fennel, chard, lettuce, parsnips, green beans, pea pods, bell peppers, eggplant, mushrooms, asparagus, and herbs like dill, thyme, parsley, cilantro, and basil.
step-5: continue like this until bag is full.
step-6: dump bag into pot and fill ¾ of the pot (or until scraps just start to float) with water.
step-7: bring water to a boil and then let it simmer for at least 30 minutes.
step-8: strain water out of stock.
step-9: refrigerate stock up to 4 days, or freeze up to 3 months.

step-1: in a glass bowl, add water and yeast.
step-2: mix the yeast into the water and let it sit for a couple minutes.
step-3: add in the rest of the ingredients for the starter.
step-4: mix well until everything is fully incorporated.
step-5: wrap the bowl with clear wrap, making sure not to tightly seal the bowl.
step-6: let the starter breathe a little and keep it in a dark place at room temperature.
step-7: stir every 12 hours until making the dough.
step-8: the starter will rise and shrink each day and you should see bubbles, letting you know that the yeast is being activated!
step-9: on day 5, combine all ingredients into a bowl, and knead for 10 minutes on low if using a machine; if kneading by hand, knead for 20 minutes until dough is stretchy yet doesn’t stick to your hands.
step-10: while the dough is kneading, store your starter for future use.
step-11: your starter will last forever as long as you maintain and care for it.
step-12: it can stay in the fridge and be fed once a week with a teaspoon of sugar.
step-13: to replenish your starter, simply add 1 cup of flour (125g) and ½ cup of water (120ml), mix, and place it back in the fridge.
step-14: leave it out overnight to get to room temperature before preparing the dough.
step-15: place kneaded dough into a large floured bowl with a towel over the top, then sprinkle flour and let it rise for 12 hours.
step-16: place risen dough onto a floured board and knead for a few minutes.
step-17: place it into a floured proofing basket or a medium bowl, sprinkle flour and let it rise for another 4 hours.
step-18: preheat oven to 480°f (250°c).
step-19: flip the dough onto a parchment paper, and transfer the dough and paper into a large cast-iron dutch oven.
step-20: score the top of the bread.
step-21: place the lid on top and bake for 30 minutes.
step-22: take the lid off and bake for another 15 minutes or until the crust is golden brown.
step-23: transfer onto a cooling rack and let it rest for an hour.
step-24: knock the bottom of the bread to listen for a hollow knock.

step-1: cut the head of cabbage in half lengthwise and slice off the ends.
step-2: quarter lengthwise, then slice crosswise into 2-inch (5 cm) pieces.
step-3: place the cabbage and salt in a large bowl.
step-4: using your hands, massage the salt into the cabbage until it starts to soften a bit.
step-5: cover with a kitchen towel and let stand for 1-2 hours.
step-6: rinse the cabbage thoroughly under cold water, then let drain in a colander.
step-7: meanwhile, chop the green onions into 1-inch (2 cm) pieces.
step-8: peel the ginger and garlic.
step-9: cut the daikon radish into matchsticks.
step-10: combine the rice, water, garlic, ginger, and soy sauce in a mason jar or medium bowl.
step-11: use an immersion blender or standing blender to make a smooth paste.
step-12: mix in the sugar and gochugaru, starting with 1 tablespoon for a mild flavor and up to 5 tablespoons to make it spicier.
step-13: gently squeeze any remaining water from the cabbage and transfer to a large bowl, along with the green onions and daikon.
step-14: toss to combine.
step-15: add the seasoning paste to the bowl.
step-16: wearing gloves if you’d like to protect your hands from stings, stains, and smells, gently massage the paste into the vegetables until they are thoroughly coated.
step-17: pack the kimchi into a large jar, pressing down until the seasoning paste rises to cover the vegetables and leaving at least 1 inch (2 ½ cm) of space at the top.
step-18: seal the jar with the lid.
step-19: eat the kimchi right away or, to ferment, let the jar stand in a dark place at room temperature for 2-14 days.
step-20: you may see bubbles inside and liquid may seep out of the jar; to be safe, place a bowl or plate under the jar to catch any overflow.
step-21: check the kimchi once a day.
step-22: when it reaches your desired flavor, transfer the jar to the refrigerator.
step-23: eat right away, or let sit for another week or 2 for the flavors to deepen.

step-1: add the dried shiitake mushrooms to a medium bowl and pour in enough water to cover.
step-2: cover with a dish towel and let hydrate for 8 hours, then rinse and drain the mushrooms 2-3 times.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: in a large pan over medium heat, dry sear the onions until caramelized on both sides, 10-15 minutes.
step-5: transfer to a bowl and repeat with the daikon radish and ginger.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: heat the oil in the pan.
step-8: add the oyster mushrooms and sauté until browned and caramelized, 6-8 minutes.
step-9: add the caramelized onions, daikon, ginger, oyster mushrooms, and soaked shiitake mushrooms to a large stock pot.
step-10: add the water and bring to a boil over high heat.
step-11: reduce the heat to low heat and cover.
step-12: simmer for at least 1 hour, or up to 8 hours.
step-13: the longer it cooks, the stronger the flavor of the broth will be.
step-14: season with salt to taste.
step-15: about 30 minutes before serving, combine the cinnamon stick, cloves, cardamom, star anise, coriander, and fennel in a fine-mesh sieve.
step-16: lower into the pot, resting the sieve on the edge, then cover and simmer for 15 minutes.
step-17: remove the spices and add the tofu to heat through, 10-15 minutes.
step-18: remove the pot from the heat.
step-19: remove the onions, daikon, and ginger from the pot.
step-20: (slice and add them back to the soup, if desired.)
step-21: add the noodles to serving bowls and ladle in the broth, mushrooms, and tofu.
step-22: garnish with red onion, bean sprouts, chili peppers, a squeeze of lime, and cilantro.

step-1: remove the tops/bottoms/skins/stems from any vegetables you are preparing (avoid vegetables like brussels sprouts, broccoli, or cauliflower as they will add a bitter taste to your stock) and place them in a ziplock bag - they can stay frozen up to 6 months.
step-2: note: you can add many other vegetable scraps (think sweet!) - i.e.
step-3: corn cobs, winter squash, zucchini, and other squash, beet greens, fennel, chard, lettuce, parsnips, green beans, pea pods, bell peppers, eggplant, mushrooms, asparagus, and herbs like dill, thyme, parsley, cilantro, and basil.
step-4: continue like this until bag is full.
step-5: dump bag into pot and fill ¾ of the pot (or until scraps just start to float) with water.
step-6: bring water to a boil and then let it simmer for at least 30 minutes.
step-7: strain water out of stock.
step-8: refrigerate stock up to 4 days, or freeze up to 3 months.

step-1: in a bowl wash the rice 3 times with water.
step-2: in a pot add rice and water and cover and bring it to boil.
step-3: reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
step-4: then take off heat and rest for another 15 minutes.
step-5: in a microwave safe bowl heat sugar, salt and vinegar for a minute or until the sugar is completely melted.
step-6: transfer the rice onto a serving bowl and pour the vinegar over the rice.
step-7: using a spatula fold in the vinegar and cut into the rice.
step-8: have another person fan the rice while mixing to get it down to room temperature.
step-9: prep the fix-ins.
step-10: slice tuna and chop until the meat is mashed together.
step-11: transfer into a small bowl.
step-12: mix in mayonnaise and sriracha sauce.
step-13: set aside
step-14: in a medium bowl marinate chicken with your favorite teriyaki sauce.
step-15: fully cook chicken and slice and set aside in a bowl.
step-16: cut imitation crab into small pieces.
step-17: mix in mayonnaise until fully coated.
step-18: set aside.
step-19: cut veggies into thin slices.
step-20: cut avocado into bite size pieces as well.
step-21: set up the table: after placing your rice and fix-ins place each sushi rolling station with a bamboo rolling mat.
step-22: set out a bowl of water so the rice does not stick to your hands.
step-23: have a cutting board close by with a knife.
step-24: let’s roll.
step-25: on the rolling mat place one sheet of nori.
step-26: there is a smooth side and a rough side.
step-27: the rough side will face up.
step-28: wet your hands and grab a handful of rice and place it on your nori.
step-29: spread the rice evenly throughout the nori without smushing the rice down.
step-30: leave space at the bottom.
step-31: (this extra sliver of nori will stick onto the rice when rolling.)
step-32: place the fix-in at the bottom row of the rice.
step-33: grabbing both nori and the mat roll the mat over so the extra space at the bottom touches the other side.
step-34: squeeze down to make a nice tight roll.
step-35: grab the mat and continue rolling over the rice until your roll is complete.
step-36: squeeze down along the way to keep the roll from holding its shape.
step-37: transfer your roll onto a cutting board.
step-38: have a damp towel close by for your knife.
step-39: before you cut give you knife a wipe.
step-40: note: this will prevent the rice from sticking to the knife.
step-41: cut your roll into desired sizes.
step-42: note: wrap mat with plastic wrap for inside out rolls.
step-43: repeat steps 13-20 for your veggie roll.
step-44: repeat steps 13-20 for your teriyaki chicken roll.
step-45: repeat steps 13-20 for your california roll.

step-1: preheat your oven to 375˚f (190˚c)
step-2: in vegetable oil, lightly fry your corn tortillas.
step-3: drain on a paper towel.
step-4: in a 9 inch (25cm) cast iron skillet, arrange your lightly fried tortillas so they cover the bottom of the skillet.
step-5: add black beans evenly over tortillas.
step-6: (some will fall in-between the tortillas, thats ok!)
step-7: sprinkle mexican blend cheese over the black beans.
step-8: add pico de gallo on top of the cheese.
step-9: using the back of a large spoon, create 6 wells in the pico de gallo for the eggs to rest in.
step-10: crack one egg into each well (6 wells for 6 eggs).
step-11: pour enchilada sauce over everything!
step-12: bake for 20-25 minutes.
step-13: check on it often to make sure your yolks don’t overcook!
step-14: top with your favorite huevos rancheros toppings.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: grease and line two 10-inch (25 cm) spring form pans with parchment paper.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the flour, nutmeg, ginger, cinnamon, baking soda, salt, and pecan.
step-4: whisk well.
step-5: in a separate large bowl, mash the bananas until smooth.
step-6: add the sugar, pineapple, oil, and eggs, and whisk until smooth.
step-7: add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients in two additions.
step-8: whisk to combine.
step-9: divide the cake batter between the prepared cake pans.
step-10: bake for 50 minutes, or until toothpick inserted in the middle of the cakes comes out clean.
step-11: make the frosting: in a medium bowl, beat the cream cheese until smooth.
step-12: add the butter, vanilla, salt and salt and whisk to combine.
step-13: add the powdered sugar and stir until smooth.
step-14: release the cakes from the springform pans and remove the parchment paper.
step-15: add a dollop of frosting to the center of cake stand and line with parchment paper.
step-16: place a layer of hummingbird cake on the cake stand.
step-17: spread ⅓ of the frosting over the top of the cake.
step-18: top with the other cake layer and spread with another layer of frosting.
step-19: use the remaining frosting to cover the sides of the cake, then run a bench scraper around the sides to clean off excess frosting.
step-20: decorate the border of the cake with chopped pecans.
step-21: slice and serve.

step-1: combine the chickpeas, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, cumin, and salt in a blender or food processor and blend until completely smooth.
step-2: transfer to an airtight container and store in the fridge up to 7 days.
step-3: peel and cut the carrots into spears.
step-4: serve with ⅓ cup (80 g) hummus.

step-1: spread hummus on toast.
step-2: top with sliced cucumbers and avocado.
step-3: sprinkle with salt and pepper.

step-1: preheat gas grill on high heat.
step-2: using a sharp knife, slice the avocados in half by cutting in a straight line around the pit.
step-3: place the avocado half containing the pit in your hand and face it away from you.
step-4: gently stick the tip of the knife into the side of the pit and carefully pry it out of the avocado.
step-5: for a ripe avocado, the pit will pop out with little effort.
step-6: you can hold a kitchen towel in your hand and place the avocado in the towel for added protection from the edge of your knife.
step-7: place the avocado halves on a tray.
step-8: using a pastry brush, brush oil on each of the avocado halves.
step-9: season avocados with salt.
step-10: place the avocados on the grill, flesh side down, and grill for 3-4 minutes, until grill marks appear.
step-11: remove the avocados and stuff with hummus, radishes, cucumber, and a pinch of paprika.

step-1: in small bowl, combine the goat cheese and balsamic vinegar and mix until well combined.
step-2: spread about 1 tablespoon of the goat cheese mixture on the top half of each ciabatta roll.
step-3: spread about 2 tablespoons of roasted garlic hummus on the bottom half of each roll.
step-4: on bottom half of each roll, layer 4 cucumber slices, 2 tomato slices, onion slices, and a handful of arugula.
step-5: cover with the top halves of rolls.
step-6: insert a toothpick into each sandwich to secure.
step-7: serve with chicken and wild rice soup.

step-1: slice apple into quarters, slicing around the core.
step-2: carefully carve a slice out of one of the quarters, careful not to slice all the way through and separate the apple.
step-3: this creates the “mouth.”
step-4: remove the center slice and spread the bottom half with nut butter.
step-5: press the sunflowers into the top side of the “mouth” to create the “teeth.”

step-1: spread out softened ice cream on a wax paper lined baking tray.
step-2: cover with wax paper and press down to evenly spread and smooth.
step-3: freeze overnight.
step-4: remove ice cream from tray, peel off the wax paper and cut into bite size squares.
step-5: return to the freezer until ready to dip.
step-6: microwave 2 cups (350 grams) of chocolate chips with ½ cup (100 grams) coconut oil for 90 seconds, stopping to stir every 30, until melted and smooth.
step-7: allow chocolate mixture to come to room temperature.
step-8: mix in rice cereal.
step-9: working quickly and in small batches, coat ice cream cubes in chocolate mixture and return to the freezer to harden up.

step-1: in a large bowl, crumble the cake into fine uniform crumbs.
step-2: add the vanilla frosting and mix thoroughly.
step-3: press 1 tablespoon of the cake mixture into each of the divots of an ice cube tray.
step-4: spread 1 tablespoon of vanilla ice cream over the cake.
step-5: sprinkle with 1 teaspoon of crushed cookies.
step-6: spread 1 tablespoon of chocolate ice cream on top (the ice cream might melt and mix slightly).
step-7: freeze for 30 minutes.
step-8: dip the ice pop sticks into 2 tablespoons of melted white chocolate and press them into the centers of the ice cream cake pops.
step-9: freeze for at least 8 hours, until solid.
step-10: to make the cake pop holder, cut 3 2-foot by 5-inch (½ meter by 13 cm) strips of foam board.
step-11: place tape in between each layer, one on top of the other, so you have 3 layers of foam board.
step-12: carefully create 24 ½-inch (1 cm) slits 2 inches (2 cm) apart with a precision knife.
step-13: cut deep enough so you puncture the second layer of foam board.
step-14: each cake pop should easily push into the board and stand upright.
step-15: use a butter knife or offset spatula to loosen the ice cream cake pops from the ice cube tray.
step-16: add the remaining melted white chocolate to a tall drinking glass.
step-17: working 1 at a time, pull each cake pop from the ice cube mold and dip into the melted white chocolate.
step-18: place the cake pops in the cake pop holder or on a plate and keep in the freezer until ready to serve.
step-19: decorate the cake pops with whipped cream and sprinkles, if desired.
step-20: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat your oven to 350˚f/175˚c.
step-2: combine melted ice cream and self-rising flour.
step-3: mix until well combined.
step-4: add any additional sprinkles, chocolate chips, or goodies to the batter.
step-5: line a loaf pan with parchment paper and grease with a nonstick spray.
step-6: pour batter into a loaf pan and spread evenly.
step-7: bake for 35-40 minutes.
step-8: (baking times and temperatures may vary from oven to oven.)
step-9: allow to cool fully before cutting.

step-1: open the pack of biscuit dough and cut each biscuit into halves.
step-2: take one half and press it into a flat and circular shape.
step-3: place a small spoonful of ice cream into the center of the dough.
step-4: carefully wrap the edges of the dough over the ice cream, creating a very tight seal.
step-5: repeat with the remaining biscuit dough and freeze them for 1 hour.
step-6: heat oil over medium-high heat.
step-7: fry the frozen dough balls until golden brown.
step-8: drain them on a paper towel.
step-9: freeze for another 30 minutes.
step-10: in a small bowl, combine powdered sugar and milk, stirring until smooth.
step-11: pour the glaze evenly over the donut holes.
step-12: serve immediately!

step-1: using a melon baller or a cookie scoop, scoop out balls of orange/mango sherbet or vanilla ice cream.
step-2: place on parchment and freeze for two hours.
step-3: these will be the “moons” inside the ice cream mooncake.
step-4: while the ice cream balls are freezing, prepare the biscuit crumbs.
step-5: crust one cup (100 g) of biscuits, add the melted butter, and stir until the biscuits crumbs are coated in butter and stick together when packed.
step-6: take your ice cream mold or cup, put down a layer of strawberry or coffee ice cream.
step-7: place a ball of orange/mango/vanilla into the center.
step-8: layer on more strawberry or coffee ice cream.
step-9: top it off with the biscuits crumbs and press down.
step-10: freeze for another two hours.
step-11: prepare the chocolate coating, melt the chocolate chips and coconut oil.
step-12: stir until combined and smooth.
step-13: set aside until it has cooled to room temp.
step-14: when ready, unmold your ice cream mooncakes.
step-15: pour the melted chocolate over.
step-16: freeze overnight.

step-1: in an 8x8-inch (20x20 cm) square baking dish, place a layer of ice cream sandwiches in aluminum foil-covered dish.
step-2: top layer of sandwiches with a layer of chocolate ice cream.
step-3: add another layer of ice cream sandwiches, and another layer of chocolate ice cream.
step-4: freeze for 1 hour.
step-5: crush sandwich cookies in a resealable bag.
step-6: for the icing, combine the crushed sandwich cookies and whipped topping until well mixed.
step-7: cover frozen cake with topping.
step-8: garnish with more crushed sandwich cookies and serve immediately or freeze.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, beat melted butter, eggs, sugar, and vanilla until frothy.
step-3: sift flour, cocoa powder, and salt into the bowl with the butter and eggs and mix just until combined.
step-4: pour into a well-greased bundt pan and bake for 25 minutes, then cool completely.
step-5: remove the brownie ring from the bundt pan and slice in half, horizontally.
step-6: place the top back in the cleaned bunt pan.
step-7: place ice cream scoops on top.
step-8: spread ice cream out and place the bottom piece of the brownie on top of that.
step-9: freeze until solid, remove from bundt pan and cut into pieces.

step-1: on a large cutting board, lay out 9 slices of bread in a 3x3 (7x7 cm) grid.
step-2: brush the melted butter where the bread slices will touch, then overlap the bread pieces until you have one large square of bread.
step-3: cover with another cutting board and a heavy pan to weigh it down and let sit for 10 minutes.
step-4: remove the pan and cutting board and roll the square with a rolling pin to flatten.
step-5: pour half of the hazelnut spread on the sheet of bread and spread evenly, leaving a 1-inch (1 cm) gap around the edges.
step-6: starting at the bottom, carefully roll up the bread to form a log and wrap in plastic wrap.
step-7: using the remaining 9 slices of bread and remaining hazelnut spread, make another log.
step-8: freeze for 20 minutes.
step-9: slice the chilled logs into ½-inch (1 cm) thick rounds.
step-10: there will be about 18 slices per log.
step-11: place the rolls from 1 log in a parchment-lined 10-inch (25-cm) springform pan.
step-12: slice any extra rolls into smaller pieces to fill in the gaps between the whole rolls.
step-13: place a sheet of parchment on top of the rolls and use a smaller cake pan to press the rolls together, creating a compressed layer.
step-14: remove the cake pan and parchment and freeze until solid, about 1 hour.
step-15: scoop softened ice cream on top of the rolls and spread evenly.
step-16: freeze until solid, about 1 hour.
step-17: add another layer of rolls from the second log on top of the ice cream layer, filling the gaps with smaller pieces of rolls again.
step-18: place a sheet of parchment paper on top and use the smaller cake pan to compress the rolls.
step-19: remove the pan and parchment and freeze for another hour.
step-20: remove from the springform pan, slice, and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-2: if using fresh dough, let sit out at room temperature for 30 minutes in a covered and lightly oiled bowl.
step-3: on a floured surface, take one half of the dough and roll it out into a rectangle, about ⅛ of an inch (3 mm) thick.
step-4: repeat with other half of dough and set aside.
step-5: lightly oil your ice cube tray if it’s hard plastic.
step-6: transfer the dough to cover the tray and press the dough down into every hole, holding for about 5 seconds to ensure the dough stretches properly.
step-7: if it tears, you can use excess dough to patch up any holes.
step-8: assemble each bite with approximately one teaspoon of sauce, such as marinara or pesto, one teaspoon of cheese, and desired toppings.
step-9: cover the prepared bites with remaining dough and roll over the ice cube tray with rolling pin to seal.
step-10: trim any excess dough and save for more pizza bites.
step-11: freeze the ice cube tray for about an hour, until the dough has set.
step-12: flip the tray onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet to release the bites.
step-13: if necessary, use a paring knife to gently loosen.
step-14: cut and separate the bites.
step-15: bake for 15-20 minutes, until the dough is golden brown and serve warm.

step-1: carefully scoop the solid layer from the can of chilled coconut milk into a medium bowl.
step-2: blend with an electric hand mixer until fluffy
step-3: add the powdered sugar and continue mixing until fully incorporated, scraping down the bowl as needed.
step-4: while mixer is still running, add in a splash of coconut milk from the can, and mix until cream is silky and just falls from a spoon.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: on a small plate, mix together the blue and white sugars.
step-7: pour 1 ounce pineapple juice into a small bowl.
step-8: dip the rim of a highball glass into the pineapple juice, then in the sugar mixture.
step-9: fill glass with ice.
step-10: in a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the rum, blue curaçao, and remaining 1 ounce pineapple juice.
step-11: shake vigorously for 20 seconds.
step-12: strain into the sugared highball glass and top with 2 tablespoons of the coconut whipped cream.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c)
step-2: pulse oats in a food processor or blender 10 times.
step-3: add pulsed oats, flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and nutmeg into a bowl.
step-4: in a large bowl, beat softened butter with a hand mixer until creamy, add brown and white sugars, then beat until fluffy.
step-5: next beat in vanilla and eggs 1 at a time.
step-6: pour the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients ⅓ at a time until it’s gone and dough forms.
step-7: fold in raisins or chocolate chunks.
step-8: take 1 tablespoon of dough and roll it into a ball.
step-9: then flatten into a cookie shape and put on a well-greased parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-10: bake 12-15 minutes.
step-11: (top rack = no brown bottoms, bottom rack = browned bottoms and a little more crispy).
step-12: cool completely and make the icing in the meantime.
step-13: combine powdered sugar, milk, and warm water in a shallow bowl.
step-14: once the cookies have cooled, dip into the icing or dab icing on with a pastry brush.
step-15: dry for 10 minutes or until icing has hardened.

step-1: heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
step-2: add the garlic, ginger, and scallions.
step-3: sauté for about 3 minutes, until very fragrant but not browned.
step-4: add the oregano, parsley, cayenne, turmeric, black pepper, and soy sauce.
step-5: cook for 2 minutes, until the herbs begin to wilt.
step-6: add the broccoli and cook until bright green and beginning to release some moisture, about 5 minutes.
step-7: add the chicken stock.
step-8: cover, reduce the heat to low, and simmer for about 10 minutes, until the broccoli starts to soften.
step-9: add the swiss chard and stir until wilted, about 30 seconds.
step-10: add the baby spinach, a few handfuls at a time.
step-11: cook until just wilted and stir to incorporate into the soup before adding more.
step-12: once the spinach is wilted and the broccoli stems can be easily pierced with a fork, remove the soup from the heat.
step-13: it is important not to overcook the greens, as they will begin to lose their vibrant color and nutrients.
step-14: cool the soup for 15 minutes, until it can be safely transferred to a high-speed blender, if using.
step-15: with a standing blender or immersion blender, puree the soup briefly to combine, then add the avocado, lemon juice, and salt and blend until creamy, with no lumps remaining.
step-16: enjoy the soup hot or cold, garnished with toasted pumpkin seeds and parsley, if desired.

step-1: add the clementines, banana, carrot, ginger, yogurt, honey, salt, and ice to a blender.
step-2: blend until smooth.
step-3: serve in a glass or in a bowl topped with fresh fruit.

step-1: in a large bowl, mix the powdered milk, flour, semolina, bicarbonate of soda, lemon juice, butter, and milk until thoroughly combined.
step-2: cover with plastic wrap and leave to rest for 15 minutes, until all the moisture is absorbed.
step-3: take a golf ball-sized portion of dough and roll into a ball.
step-4: repeat with remaining dough.
step-5: in a deep pot, heat the sunflower oil until it reaches 360°f (160°c).
step-6: fry the doughnuts for about 4 minutes, turning occasionally, until they are golden brown on all sides.
step-7: use a slotted spoon to transfer the fried doughnuts to a paper towel-lined plate.
step-8: add the sugar, water, and saffron to a saucepan over a medium heat, and stir.
step-9: once the sugar has dissolved and is syrupy (about 5-7 minutes), add the doughnuts to the pan, stirring to coat in the syrup.
step-10: let the doughnuts soak in the syrup for an hour.
step-11: remove the doughnuts and garnish with the almonds and pistachios.

step-1: remove the skin and cores of the mangoes and add the flesh to a blender.
step-2: add in all the ingredients apart from saffron.
step-3: blend till smooth.
step-4: serve with a pinch of saffron.

step-1: in a small bowl, combine the cold water and gelatin.
step-2: let the gelatin bloom for 5 minutes, until the water is mostly absorbed.
step-3: microwave for 20–30 seconds, or until the gelatin is melted.
step-4: combine the room temperature water and sugar in a medium pot.
step-5: bring to a low boil over medium-low heat.
step-6: pour the gelatin mixture into the boiling sugar water, whisking constantly to combine.
step-7: cook at a low boil for 5 minutes, until the sugar and gelatin are completely dissolved.
step-8: transfer the gelatin mixture to a 2-cup (480 ml) liquid measuring cup for easy pouring.
step-9: let sit for 5 minutes to cool slightly.
step-10: skim off any foam that rises to the top.
step-11: grease 6 cups of a muffin tin with nonstick spray.
step-12: evenly divide the gelatin mixture between the 6 greased cups of the muffin tin, about ¼ cup (30 grams) per section.
step-13: use the liquid food coloring to dye each section: for red, add 3 drops of red.
step-14: for green, add 3 drops of green.
step-15: for purple, add 1 drop of red and 1 drop of blue.
step-16: for blue, add 4 drops of blue.
step-17: for orange, add 1 drop of red and 3 drops of yellow.
step-18: for yellow, add 4 drops of yellow.
step-19: using a toothpick or clean fork, stir each section to combine.
step-20: carefully transfer the muffin tin to the refrigerator.
step-21: chill the gelatin until set, at least 4 hours or up to overnight.
step-22: line a baking sheet with parchment paper and grease with nonstick spray.
step-23: remove each gelatin cup and tear into ¾-inch (2 cm) square chunks, to resemble stones.
step-24: spread evenly on the prepared baking sheet, keeping each color separate.
step-25: let dry at room temperature for 2–3 days, until the outer layer becomes hard to the touch with a matte exterior.
step-26: note: if you want to use a cover to keep debris out, place in a baking dish and cover with plastic wrap with the corner left open so they can dry out but the plastic is not touching the stones.
step-27: when ready to assemble the cupcakes, add the frosting to a piping bag fitted with a ⅝-inch (1 ½ cm) round tip or a plastic zip-top bag with the corner cut off.
step-28: pipe the frosting onto the cupcakes.
step-29: using a fine-mesh sieve, lightly sprinkle edible gold luster dust over the frosted cupcakes.
step-30: place 2–3 colored stones on top of each cupcake.

step-1: in a small bowl, combine salt, pepper, paprika, cumin, and onion powder.
step-2: slice chicken breasts in half laterally to form 10 thin cutlets.
step-3: place the chicken cutlets between 2 sheets of plastic wrap and pound out to ¼-inch (6-mm) thick.
step-4: season the chicken with spice mix.
step-5: place the flour, eggs, and bread crumbs in 3 separate shallow dishes.
step-6: dredge each cutlet in the flour, then dip in the egg, bread crumbs, back in the egg, and in the bread crumbs once more.
step-7: place the chicken breasts around the border of a baking sheet, so half of each cutlet drapes over the side of the pan.
step-8: place a smaller baking sheet wrapped with plastic wrap in the middle of the larger pan.
step-9: fold the draped halves of the chicken over the smaller pan.
step-10: freeze for 8 hours or overnight.
step-11: heat the oil in a large pot until it reaches 375°f (190°c).
step-12: fry the chicken taco shells, 2 at a time, for 5 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-13: drain the chicken tacos on a wire rack set over a baking sheet.
step-14: fill the chicken tacos with lettuce, guacamole, and pico de gallo, and cheddar cheese.
step-15: garnish with cilantro and sour cream.

step-1: make the seasoning: combine the chicken bouillon, salt, and garlic powder in a 16-ounce (480 ml) mason jar.
step-2: stir with a fork until combined.
step-3: add the carrots, corn, chicken, yakisoba noodles, and scallions.
step-4: store in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.
step-5: when ready to eat, shake well to combine, then add hot water.
step-6: let sit for 2 minutes, then enjoy!

step-1: make the ginger simple syrup: in a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the sugar, water, and ginger.
step-2: bring to a low boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes, until the sugar is fully dissolved and the ginger is fragrant.
step-3: remove from heat and let cool for 5-10 minutes.
step-4: strain through a fine-mesh sieve (you should have ⅓ cup (80 ml) syrup).
step-5: fill a 10-cup pitcher halfway with ice.
step-6: pour in the ginger simple syrup, orange juice, and prosecco and stir to combine.
step-7: top with the bitter orange liqueur and club soda.
step-8: fill the pitcher with the orange slices.
step-9: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 180˚c (350˚f).
step-2: mix water, heavy cream, tomato sauce, pepper, and salt.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: in a baking pan, lay down one row of raw ramen noodles and cover with half the tomato sauce mixture.
step-5: layer ham slices, then cheese slices, and repeat.
step-6: sprinkle with parsley.
step-7: add another layer of raw ramen noodles and cover them with the rest of sauce.
step-8: top with another layer of ham and cheese, and sprinkle with parmesan cheese and oregano.
step-9: bake for 25 minutes, or until noodles are cooked through and cheese is golden brown.

step-1: place whole rolled oats into a large mixing bowl.
step-2: scoop 2 cups (200 grams) of the rolled oats into a separate bowl and process in a blender or food processor until it becomes a fine powder.
step-3: pour the blended oats into the bowl of whole rolled oats.
step-4: add salt and stir until evenly combined.
step-5: add desired flavor additions then place the instant oatmeal mixture into an airtight container or divide into ½ cup (50 gram) single-serve portions.
step-6: when ready to eat, pour the boiling water or milk.
step-7: stir to combine and let sit for 3 minutes.

step-1: on a cutting board, pat the chicken thighs dry with paper towels.
step-2: season chicken on both sides with 1 teaspoon salt and black pepper to taste.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: set instant pot to high on the sauté setting.
step-5: melt the butter in the pot, then add the onion and sauté until it begins to soften, 4 minutes.
step-6: add the garlic and ginger and cook until softened, stirring occasionally, 2 minutes.
step-7: add the remaining 3 teaspoons salt, the paprika, garam masala, and curry powder.
step-8: cook, stirring, until the spices are aromatic and toasted, about 1 minute.
step-9: add the crushed tomatoes and the chicken and stir to combine.
step-10: place the lid on the instant pot and seal to close.
step-11: set the machine to pressure cook on high and cook for 5 minutes.
step-12: turn off the instant pot and let it vent naturally for 10 minutes.
step-13: then turn the quick release seal to “vent” and allow any remaining steam to vent.
step-14: remove the lid.
step-15: using tongs, transfer the chicken to a cutting board.
step-16: when cool enough to handle, cut into bite-sized pieces.
step-17: set the machine to high on the sauté setting.
step-18: cook sauce until it is reduced by half, 10–15 minutes.
step-19: add the yogurt to the sauce and stir to combine.
step-20: return the chicken to the pot and stir to coat completely with sauce.
step-21: serve chicken with basmati rice and naan and garnish with cilantro.

step-1: to a 6-quart (5.5 liter) instant pot, add the chicken bones, carrots, celery, onion, garlic, rosemary, thyme, peppercorns, apple cider vinegar, and water, and stir to combine.
step-2: set the instant pot to high sauté and bring to a boil.
step-3: cook until any impurities foam to the surface, then carefully skim off the top with a large spoon.
step-4: place the lid on the pot and turn the venting valve to “sealing.” set to pressure cooking for 60 minutes.
step-5: release the pressure from the instant pot by switching the vent to “venting.” the hot steam will come out of the top, so make sure your hand is not over the release switch .
step-6: wait for the pressure to release and the instant pot to unlock before removing the lid.
step-7: strain the broth through a fine-mesh sieve lined with cheesecloth.
step-8: let cool completely before storing in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 6 days, or in the freezer for up to 6 months.

step-1: set the instant-pot to sauté.
step-2: add the ground beef and cook for 5-6 minutes, until no longer pink.
step-3: add the onion, garlic, salt, oregano, and red pepper flakes and cook for 3-4 minutes more, until the onions are translucent.
step-4: add the tomato sauce and stir to combine, then carefully remove the insert from the instant-pot.
step-5: let cool for 5 minutes, then transfer the tomato sauce to a bowl and wash and dry the insert.
step-6: in a medium bowl, combine the ricotta, 1 cup (100 g) of mozzarella, ½ cup (55 g) of parmesan, the parsley, and egg.
step-7: mix well.
step-8: add the olive oil to a 7-inch (17 cm) springform pan and brush in an even layer over the bottom.
step-9: arrange a layer of lasagna noodles on the bottom of the pan, breaking the noodles to fit if necessary.
step-10: top with a layer of sauce, then half of the ricotta mixture.
step-11: add another layer of noodles, sauce, and the rest of the ricotta.
step-12: finish with the remaining noodles and sauce.
step-13: cover the pan tightly with foil.
step-14: return the insert to the instant-pot and pour in the water.
step-15: place pan with the lasagna on a steamer rack trivet and carefully lower into the pot.
step-16: cover with the lid and twist to lock.
step-17: turn the steam valve to “sealing”.
step-18: set to high pressure and cook for 24 minutes (it will take about 5 minutes to heat and pressurize).
step-19: once the cook time is finished, vent naturally for 15 minutes, then turn the quick release steam valve to “venting” and when the float valve has fully dropped, open the pressure cooker and carefully lift out the lasagna.
step-20: remove the foil and sprinkle top of the lasagna with the remaining ½ cup (50 g) mozzarella and ¼ cup (25 g) parmesan.
step-21: turn the broiler to high.
step-22: broil the lasagna for 2-4 minutes, until the cheese on top is melted and golden brown.
step-23: let the lasagna cool for 10 minutes, then place on a serving plate and carefully release the springform.
step-24: slice and serve.

step-1: in a liquid measuring cup or medium bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, gochujang (adjust the quantity based on your preferred spice level), and honey.
step-2: place the short ribs in a deep baking dish or large bowl and season generously on both sides with salt and pepper.
step-3: pour the soy sauce mixture over the ribs.
step-4: cover with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour, up to overnight.
step-5: preheat a 6-quart (6 liter) instant pot on the high sauté setting.
step-6: once hot, add the coconut oil.
step-7: remove the short ribs from the marinade and let any excess marinade drip off.
step-8: reserve the marinade for later.
step-9: working in batches, add the short ribs to the instant pot and sear for 3-4 minutes on each side, until deeply caramelized.
step-10: transfer the short ribs to a baking sheet as they finish cooking and repeat with the remaining ribs.
step-11: after the short ribs are seared, add the pear, shallot, ginger, and garlic to the instant pot.
step-12: season with salt and pepper, and sauté for 4-5 minutes, or until the mixture is golden brown.
step-13: return the short ribs to the instant pot, then pour in the reserved marinade.
step-14: place the lid on the instant pot, make sure the lid is set to “sealing,” and change the setting to high pressure cooker.
step-15: set the timer for 20 minutes.
step-16: at the end of 20 minutes, carefully release the pressure from the instant pot by turning the knob from “sealing” to “venting,” making sure your hand is not over the release switch as the hot steam will come out of the top.
step-17: wait for the pressure to release and the instant pot to unlock before taking off the lid.
step-18: remove the short ribs from the pot and change the setting to high sauté.
step-19: bring the sauce to a simmer and cook for about 5 minutes, or until reduced to about 2 cups (480 ml)
step-20: add the cornstarch to the water and mix until completely dissolved.
step-21: add the slurry to the sauce and whisk continuously for another 3 minutes, or until the sauce thickens.
step-22: remove from the heat and let cool slightly.
step-23: skim off any excess oil from the top of the sauce, if desired.
step-24: serve the short ribs over white rice.
step-25: pour about ½ cup (120 ml) of the sauce over the ribs and serve the rest on the side.
step-26: garnish with toasted sesame seeds, cilantro, and scallions, and serve with kimchi, if desired.

step-1: in a small bowl, combine the sage, thyme, chives, ¼ cup (60 ml) oil, and a pinch of salt.
step-2: stir into a paste.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: generously season the chicken all over with salt and pepper.
step-5: then, using your fingers, gently release the skin over the chicken breast so that your fingers can slide between the skin and the breast meat.
step-6: spread half of the herb paste evenly between both breasts, then massage the skin with your fingers to push the herb paste to the places it didn’t reach.
step-7: reserve the remaining herb paste for later.
step-8: place 1 quartered lemon inside the cavity, then tie the legs together with kitchen twine.
step-9: tuck the wings under the chicken.
step-10: to a 6-quart instant-pot, add the onion, remaining 2 lemons, and the garlic.
step-11: place the chicken, breast-side up, on top, then pour in the chicken stock and sherry.
step-12: brush the remaining herb paste over the chicken.
step-13: cover with the instant pot lid, making sure the release valve is set to “sealing.” set the instant pot to high pressure cook for 25 minutes.
step-14: release the pressure from the instant pot by switching the vent from “sealing” to “venting,” making sure your hand is not over the top of the release switch, as the hot steam will come out of the top.
step-15: wait for the pressure to release and the instant pot to unlock before taking off the lid.
step-16: transfer the chicken from the instant pot onto a baking sheet.
step-17: if you would like crispier skin, set the broiler to high.
step-18: roast the chicken under the broiler for 3-4 minutes, or until the skin crisps and becomes a deep golden brown.
step-19: while the chicken skin crisps, turn the instant pot to high sauté mode.
step-20: bring the liquid in the pot to a boil and reduce by half, 5-6 minutes.
step-21: add the cornstarch to the water and whisk together until smooth.
step-22: when the sauce is reduced, whisk in the cornstarch slurry and continue to boil the gravy for another 2 minutes, or until the gravy is thick and coats the back of a spoon.
step-23: strain the gravy through a fine mesh sieve.
step-24: cut the chicken off the bone, place on a platter, and garnish with chives.
step-25: serve with the gravy.

step-1: make the mint simple syrup: in a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the water, sugar, and roughly chopped mint leaves.
step-2: bring to a low boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes, until the sugar is fully dissolved and the mint is fragrant.
step-3: remove from the heat and let cool for 5-10 minutes.
step-4: strain through a fine-mesh sieve.
step-5: store remaining mint syrup in the refrigerator for up to 1 month.
step-6: in a cocktail shaker, combine the cucumber rounds, lime juice, whole mint leaves, and 1 tablespoon of the mint simple syrup.
step-7: muddle for 1-2 minutes, until the cucumber and mint have released their flavors, but are not mushy.
step-8: pour in the vodka and fill the shaker halfway with ice.
step-9: shake vigorously for 30 seconds.
step-10: fill a collins glass with ice and pour in the strained cocktail.
step-11: garnish with the cucumber ribbons.

step-1: combine the coffee beans, whiskey, and coffee ice cream in a blender.
step-2: blend until smooth.
step-3: top with whipped cream and a cherry.

step-1: in a saucepan, melt the butter, brown sugar, golden syrup, and double cream over a low-medium heat and mix gently until combined.
step-2: once combined, place a sugar thermometer into the saucepan and heat the mixture until it reaches 116˚c (240˚f), stirring every now and then.
step-3: take off the heat and mix in the dark chocolate and irish cream.
step-4: pour into a baking tin and then pour the white chocolate in the middle.
step-5: using a cocktail stick or the handle of a spoon, swirl the white chocolate into the dark chocolate mixture.
step-6: chill in the fridge until solid.
step-7: cut into squares.

step-1: add garlic, oregano, parsley, basil, salt, pepper, white wine vinegar, and olive oil into a mason jar and secure lid tightly.
step-2: shake vigorously until ingredients are mixed thoroughly.
step-3: store dressing in the fridge and use within 1-2 weeks.
step-4: you may need to shake up the ingredients again before each use.

step-1: add the ingredients into a mason jar.
step-2: screw the lid on tightly and shake vigorously.
step-3: the dressing can remain in the fridge for 1-2 weeks.
step-4: pour over your favorite salad ingredients and enjoy!

step-1: combine oregano, basil, parsley, thyme, rosemary, garlic powder, and salt in a small bowl.
step-2: use whisk or the back of spoon to crush the dried herbs into a powder.
step-3: pour into a small glass container and secure with an airtight lid.
step-4: store up to 1 year.

step-1: heat olive oil and butter in a large pan over medium heat.
step-2: add onion, carrot, celery, and pancetta.
step-3: cook for around 10 minutes until the onions start to look translucent.
step-4: add the minced meats and brown all over, ensure the meat is fully broken up and no large chunks remain.
step-5: add salt and pepper to taste.
step-6: increase the heat, add the wine, and allow to evaporate for around 2-3 minutes.
step-7: in a large jug, dilute the tomato puree into the chicken stock and add to the pan, stir well.
step-8: reduce to a low heat, then cover and simmer for 2 hours.
step-9: check from time to time to ensure the sauce is not drying out.
step-10: if this occurs, add a small amount of stock.
step-11: cook desired pasta and toss in the bolognese.
step-12: top with parmesan cheese and serve.

step-1: for the guacamole: mash avocados with the lime juice.
step-2: add the rest of the ingredients and mix thoroughly.
step-3: for the queso: in a pot over medium heat, melt 1 tbsp.
step-4: butter and sauté scallions.
step-5: add cheese, milk and cornstarch, and mix until melted and smooth.
step-6: add green chiles and mix until combined.
step-7: serving: draw eyes and carve a sad mouth on a small pumpkin.
step-8: hollow out the inside and insert a bowl.
step-9: pour queso in the bowl and top with chopped tomatoes.
step-10: spoon guacamole coming out of the pumpkin’s mouth.
step-11: serve with chips!
step-12: spoon guacamole coming out of the pumpkin’s mouth.
step-13: serve with chips!

step-1: preheat oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-2: drain and rinse jackfruit, then cut jackfruit into smaller pieces, removing the core.
step-3: add olive oil, onions, garlic, salt, and pepper to a large frying pan or skillet over medium-high heat.
step-4: sauté until onions are tender and become translucent.
step-5: add jackfruit, chili powder, paprika, cumin, liquid smoke, salt, pepper, and liquid smoke, and stir.
step-6: add vegetable stock, cover, and cook another 10-15 minutes, until jackfruit is soft enough that it can be mashed.
step-7: mash jackfruit with potato masher or a couple of forks, until it looks pulled or shredded.
step-8: spread an even layer of pulled jackfruit across a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-9: bake for 25 minutes.
step-10: remove from oven and pour on vegan bbq sauce.
step-11: stir to combine.
step-12: place back in oven for 10 more minutes.
step-13: serve on warm tortillas with desired taco toppings.

step-1: heat the olive oil in a large pan over high heat, then add the jalapeños, onion, garlic, and salt.
step-2: stir and cook for 4 minutes.
step-3: add the water and vinegar.
step-4: reduce the heat to medium-low.
step-5: simmer for 20 minutes stirring continuously.
step-6: remove the pan from the heat and let cool.
step-7: pour the jalapeño mixture into a blender and puree until smooth.
step-8: using a funnel, pour the sauce into a bottle or jar and store in the refrigerator for up to 2 months.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the bread crumbs, cheddar cheese, eggs, ½ teaspoon of salt, and ½ teaspoon of pepper, and mix well.
step-2: grease a 24-cup mini muffin tin with nonstick spray and fill each cup with a heaping tablespoon of the bread crumb mixture.
step-3: press into the pan firmly to form wells.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: in another large bowl, combine the cream cheese, bacon, diced jalapeños, the remaining ½ teaspoon of salt, and remaining ½ teaspoon of pepper.
step-6: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-7: fill the bread crumb wells with a 2 tablespoons of the cream cheese mixture.
step-8: top each cup with a bit of shredded cheddar and a jalapeño slice.
step-9: bake for 10 minutes, or until the cups are golden brown.

step-1: to roast the jalapeños, cut fresh jalapeños in half, then place face down on a baking sheet.
step-2: broil jalapeños until the skins blacken and bubble up.
step-3: remove from broiler and peel outer skin, then dice.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: to prepare the dip, in a medium bowl, mix cream cheese and sour cream.
step-6: add cheddar cheese, ¾ cup (75 g) of the parmesan cheese, and diced jalapeños.
step-7: mix well.
step-8: in another medium bowl, mix bread crumbs, melted butter, the remaining parmesan cheese, and dried parsley.
step-9: spoon into 8x8 inch (20x20 cm) baking dish, or medium sized cast iron pan, spreading evenly.
step-10: sprinkle bread crumb topping evenly over jalapeño mixture.
step-11: bake at 400˚f (200˚c) for 20 minutes, or until hot and bread crumbs are golden brown.
step-12: serve with bread or crackers.

step-1: dice a jalapeño.
step-2: then add it in a medium bowl and mix with cream cheese and cheddar cheese.
step-3: salt your chicken breasts.
step-4: cut a pocket into the side of each chicken breast.
step-5: stuff the pockets evenly with the jalapeño mixture.
step-6: press the edges of the chicken together to seal the pocket.
step-7: separate the flour, eggs, and bread crumbs into 3 separate bowls.
step-8: dip the stuffed chicken in the flour, then the egg, then the bread crumbs, coating it evenly.
step-9: heat the oil in a large pan over medium heat.
step-10: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-11: fry the chicken until golden brown on both sides.
step-12: transfer the chicken to a baking dish, then bake for 20 minutes.
step-13: serve!

step-1: add the cream cheese, cheddar cheese, and monterey jack cheese, garlic powder, oregano, salt, and pepper to a bowl.
step-2: stir to combine.
step-3: add 1 tablespoon of water a time until the mixture is smooth enough to be a spreadable paste.
step-4: fill each jalapeño half with 1 tablespoon of the cheese mixture.
step-5: place a filled jalapeño on a wonton wrapper, fold over the side edges, then using the tip of your finger, wet the remaining edges of the wonton with water and continue to roll.
step-6: repeat with remaining jalapeños.
step-7: in a large pot, heat oil to 350˚f (180˚f).
step-8: fry the egg rolls in small batches until golden brown and crispy.
step-9: transfer the egg rolls to a paper towel-lined plate.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200˚c).
step-2: slice the jalapeños in half, then remove the seeds by scraping out the insides.
step-3: spread the cream cheese evenly among the jalapeño shells.
step-4: wrap each jalapeño in bacon.
step-5: place the bacon-wrapped jalapeños on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-6: bake for 20 minutes, until bacon is browned and peppers are tender.

step-1: in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and baking soda.
step-2: add the yogurt and ¼ teaspoon of cardamom.
step-3: add ½ cup (120 ml) of water and the orange food coloring.
step-4: the batter should have the consistency of a thick pancake batter.
step-5: add more water if needed.
step-6: cover and let rest in a warm place for 10-12 hours to ferment, or until small bubbles develop on top of the batter.
step-7: once the batter has fermented, add the sugar and ½ cup (120 ml) of water to a small saucepan.
step-8: bring to a boil over medium heat.
step-9: add the remaining ¼ teaspoon of cardamom, the saffron strands, and lemon juice.
step-10: simmer until a sticky syrup develops, about 5 minutes.
step-11: whisk the batter and add a tablespoon of water if the batter looks too thick.
step-12: transfer to a squeeze bottle or piping bag.
step-13: heat oil in a large skillet over medium-low until it reaches 350°f (180°c).
step-14: squeeze the batter into the hot oil, making small circular spiral shapes.
step-15: increase the heat to medium-high.
step-16: fry the dough shapes until they are crispy on both sides, about 5 minutes.
step-17: remove and immediately dip in the syrup mixture.
step-18: serve with rabri, if desired.

step-1: using a small spoon or a teaspoon measuring spoon, scoop out balls of jam and lay them on a sheet pan or plate lined with parchment paper.
step-2: pop the jam balls in the freezer for around a half hour, or until they’ve firmed up a bit.
step-3: in a mixing bowl, combine the peanut butter, one cup of oats, and powdered sugar, and mix them all together until they’re well combined.
step-4: grab a palmful of the peanut butter mixture (around the size of a golf ball) and then, using your hand and fingers, shape it into a mini pancake.
step-5: grab one of the firmed-up jam balls and twist it around until it’s even more of a sphere, then lay it in the middle of your mini peanut butter pancake.
step-6: using your fingers, lift up and pinch the edges of the peanut butter so that they’re coming up around the jam ball.
step-7: continue this until the peanut butter mixture totally encloses the jam and you’ve created a ball.
step-8: roll each ball in your hands so that it’s nice a smooth.
step-9: once you’ve created all of the balls, roll each one in oats and then pop in the refrigerator or freezer to chill.
step-10: (if you’re freezing, make sure to bring the balls back to room temperature before serving).

step-1: prepare the chicken by removing the backbone using a pair of kitchen shears or a sharp knife.
step-2: transfer the chicken to a baking sheet and and flatten it down to spread the chicken out as much as possible.
step-3: in a blender or food processor, combine the peppers, garlic, thyme, allspice, onions, brown sugar, nutmeg, ginger, olive oil, lime juice, vinegar, salt, and pepper.
step-4: blend until smooth.
step-5: pour the marinade over the chicken.
step-6: cover with foil or plastic wrap and marinate in the fridge for at least 3 hours or overnight.
step-7: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-8: remove the foil or plastic wrap and roast the chicken for 45-50 minutes, until cooked through.
step-9: rest for 10 minutes on a cutting board before carving and serving.

step-1: add the eggs, cream, icing sugar and vanilla extract to a bowl and whisk until smooth.
step-2: dip two slices of bread into the mix, soaking them thoroughly.
step-3: fry both slices until golden brown on both sides.
step-4: cut paper heart out of baking paper.
step-5: place paper heart on one slice of bread and cut a heart shaped hole into the bread using the paper as a guide.
step-6: spread jam on the other slice of bread, then place the bread with the heart on top of this slice.
step-7: place the paper heart back over the hole, and sprinkle with icing sugar.
step-8: then remove the paper heart.

step-1: cut chicken thigh to bite-size pieces and put in a plastic bag.
step-2: combine curry powder, sugar, grated garlic, grated ginger, soy sauce, and sake, and rub well.
step-3: marinate for 1 hour in the fridge.
step-4: in a bowl, combine flour and potato starch, and mix well.
step-5: dredge marinated chicken in mixture, shaking off excess.
step-6: fry chicken until golden brown, then drain on a paper towel.
step-7: place into the bento box.

step-1: heat water in a pot to a simmer, then add the potatoes, 1 teaspoon salt, and stir.
step-2: cover and simmer for about 10-15 minutes, until a fork can easily pierce the potatoes.
step-3: dry the potatoes on a towel, allowing them to steam to remove excess moisture, then transfer to a large bowl.
step-4: mash the potatoes until no large chunks remain.
step-5: add the ham, cheese, onions, the other teaspoon of salt, pepper, and milk.
step-6: mix until evenly incorporated.
step-7: shape the potato mixture into 2-inch (3cm) discs.
step-8: separate the flour, eggs, and bread crumbs into separate bowls.
step-9: dredge the croquettes into the flour, shaking off any excess, then dip them into the eggs, and then coat them evenly in the bread crumbs.
step-10: heat oil in a pot to 350°f (180°c).
step-11: fry 2-3 croquettes at a time until golden brown, then drain on a rack or paper towels with a sprinkle of salt.
step-12: cool, then serve with the cabbage and sauce!

step-1: in a large mixing bowl, add the eggs, sugar, salt, sake, mirin, and broth, and mix well.
step-2: heat a tamagoyaki pan at over medium heat.
step-3: brush a thin layer of oil on the pan.
step-4: pour ⅙ of egg mixture into pan and quickly swirl to cover the entire pan.
step-5: when the egg is set, gently roll the egg.
step-6: with the rolled egg still in the pan, pour in ⅙ of the egg mixture.
step-7: lift up the rolled egg and let the mixture to flow under it.
step-8: when the egg is set, roll the omelette toward you.
step-9: repeat, adding ⅙ of the mixture at a time, continuing to roll the egg into a large roll.
step-10: cut the tamagoyaki in half and pierce with a skewer.
step-11: serve with a shiso leaf, grated radish, and soy sauce.

step-1: combine the chicken with the garlic, ginger, soy, sake, sesame oil, and sugar in a bowl until evenly coated.
step-2: cover and refrigerate for about 1 hour.
step-3: heat oil in a pot over high heat until about 340°f (170°c).
step-4: give the chicken a stir to re-incorporate the marinade, then sprinkle the potato starch on top.
step-5: lightly toss until somewhat combined, but do not mix until each chicken piece is evenly coated because the uneven pockets of potato starch will give the chicken its signature unique texture.
step-6: fry half of the chicken at a time, until light golden and bubbly, about 5-7 minutes.
step-7: the oil temperature will drop to about 320°f (160°c).
step-8: rest the chicken on paper towels and increase the heat.
step-9: heat oil to about 390°f (200°c), then fry the chicken again for about 2-3 minutes until golden brown.
step-10: drain the chicken on paper towels.
step-11: serve with lemon and parsley.

step-1: season the pork chops on both sides with salt and pepper.
step-2: cut a large slit through the side of the pork chops.
step-3: place the cheese in the pocket of the pork chop.
step-4: place a slice of mozzarella on top of a shiso leaf, then fold it in half.
step-5: repeat with the remaining pork chops.
step-6: dredge the pork in the flour, shaking off excess.
step-7: dip the pork in the egg, then roll evenly in the bread crumbs then back into the egg, then back into the bread crumbs.
step-8: repeat with the other pork chops.
step-9: heat oil over medium-high heat until about 360°f (185˚c).
step-10: fry the pork chops one at a time until golden brown, then drain on a paper towel.
step-11: sauté the onions until translucent, then add the potatoes and carrots.
step-12: cook for about 1 minute, then add the water, bringing to a boil.
step-13: lower the heat and simmer for about 10 minutes.
step-14: add the curry paste, then stir until dissolved.
step-15: cook for another 10 minutes on low heat, then set aside.
step-16: slice the pork cutlets into ½-inch (1-cm) slices.
step-17: to serve, place the pork cutlet slices over the rice, then pour a generous serving of curry on half of the pork.

step-1: press ⅓ cup (75 g) of rice into the bottom of a greased 1 cup measure, then remove.
step-2: repeat with the rice until you have 6 buns.
step-3: in a pan over medium-high heat, fry the buns until lightly browned on both sides.
step-4: set aside on a paper towel.
step-5: mix together the the patty ingredients until evenly combined.
step-6: form the beef into 3 patties.
step-7: heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
step-8: cook the burgers for 3 minutes on the first side, flip, then cook for 6 more minutes.
step-9: assemble the burgers with the rice buns, beef gravy, egg, and green onions.
step-10: scallions.

step-1: put chicken thigh in a bag, add soy sauce, sake, mirin, garlic, ginger and marinate in the refrigerator for about 1 hour.
step-2: put potato starch powder and sift flour in the bowl and mix well.
step-3: heat frying oil to 350°f, add chicken and fry.
step-4: make mustard mayonnaise.
step-5: put mayonnaise, honey, japanese mustard, and miso in a bowl and mix well.
step-6: make rice buns.
step-7: put rice in a container.
step-8: wrapped in seran wrap, press with a small tool to shape it.
step-9: in the same way, create three more.
step-10: put the sesame oil in a frying pan and cook rice buns.
step-11: after they become golden, take them out.
step-12: green leaf on one side of chicken, cover with mayonnaise, put the rice bun on top,

step-1: add the cucumber, eggplant, okra, japanese ginger, shiso, soy sauce, mirin, vinegar, and sugar to a bowl and gently mix.
step-2: heat a pan over medium heat and add the chicken and sake.
step-3: cook until no longer pink and cooked through.
step-4: add salt, black pepper and green onion.
step-5: lightly fry, then set aside.
step-6: place lettuce on one side of the tortilla, then top with chicken, 1 tomato, and cheese.
step-7: top with the cucumber and eggplant mixture and fold over.

step-1: pour the coffee into an ice cube tray.
step-2: freeze for at least 4 hours, or overnight.
step-3: add the coffee ice cubes, half and half, chocolate chips, sugar, and coffee beans to a blender.
step-4: blend until smooth.
step-5: pour into glasses and top with whipped cream and crushed chocolate chips.

step-1: in a large skillet over high heat, combine the shiitake mushrooms and water and bring to a boil.
step-2: reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer until the mushrooms have plumped and become tender, about 20 minutes.
step-3: remove the pot from the heat and drain the mushrooms with a fine-mesh sieve lined with a couple layers of paper towels (this will catch any dirt that might have been on the mushrooms) set over a medium pot to catch the broth.
step-4: let the mushrooms cool slightly.
step-5: whisk the miso paste into the mushroom broth until dissolved.
step-6: cover the pot with a lid to keep the broth warm.
step-7: once the mushrooms are cool enough to handle, cut away and discard the stems, then finely dice the mushroom caps.
step-8: set aside.
step-9: heat 2 tablespoons of canola oil in a large pan over medium heat.
step-10: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the onion and ½ teaspoon of salt and cook, stirring frequently, until the onion is tender, 4-6 minutes.
step-11: add the garlic and ginger and cook until softened, stirring frequently, 1-2 minutes.
step-12: stir in the diced mushrooms.
step-13: stir in the rice and toast for 1-2 minutes, stirring frequently, until fragrant and starting to brown.
step-14: add the sake and cook until fully evaporated, stirring occasionally, 1-2 minutes.
step-15: reduce the heat to medium-low, add 1 cup of the warm mushroom broth, and stir to combine.
step-16: cook, stirring frequently, until the stock is fully absorbed.
step-17: continue to add the broth, ½ cup (120 ml) at a time, stirring continuously for 25-35 minutes total until the rice is al dente.
step-18: you may have some broth left over.
step-19: remove the pan from the heat and stir in the parmesan cheese.
step-20: gently stir in the green onions and season with salt to taste.
step-21: spread the risotto in an even layer on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-22: let cool slightly, then cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until completely cooled, at least 2 hours but up to overnight.
step-23: add the flour, eggs, and bread crumbs to 3 separate shallow dishes.
step-24: scoop heaping tablespoons of the cooled risotto mixture and roll into balls.
step-25: you should have about 25 total.
step-26: working 1 at a time, dredge the rice balls first in the flour, then in the eggs, and finally in the bread crumbs.
step-27: place the breaded rice balls back on the same baking sheet.
step-28: chill in the refrigerator while you heat the oil.
step-29: fill a large pot halfway with canola oil and heat over medium-high heat until it reaches 350°f (180°c).
step-30: working in batches, fry the rice balls in the hot oil until deep golden brown, 4-5 minutes, turning occasionally.
step-31: transfer to a wire rack set over a baking sheet to drain.
step-32: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375ºf (190ºc).
step-2: line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
step-3: in a food processor, combine the scallions, habanero peppers, garlic, ginger, brown sugar, soy sauce, allspice, cinnamon, and thyme.
step-4: puree until broken down into a into a thick paste, about 1 minute.
step-5: in a medium bowl, toss the chicken with 2-4 tablespoons of the jerk paste until well coated.
step-6: cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.
step-7: meanwhile, make the jerk sauce: combine 2-4 tablespoons of the jerk paste with the pineapple juice and ketchup.
step-8: season to taste with salt.
step-9: thread the skewers with 2 pieces each of the marinated chicken, red onion, bell pepper, and pineapple, alternating ingredients.
step-10: arrange the skewers on the prepared baking sheets.
step-11: season with salt.
step-12: brush about ⅓ cup (85 g) of the jerk sauce over the skewers.
step-13: reserve the remaining sauce.
step-14: roast the skewers for 22-25 minutes, turning halfway, until the chicken is cooked to an internal temperature of 165ºf (75ºc).
step-15: remove the baking sheets from the oven and discard the parchment paper, then return the skewers to the pans.
step-16: turn the broiler to high.
step-17: baste the skewers on all sides with the jerk sauce.
step-18: broil for 3-4 minutes, until the vegetables just begin to char and the sauce is slightly caramelized.
step-19: transfer the skewers to a platter.
step-20: squeeze the lime wedges over the hot skewers and garnish with the cilantro.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, and baking powder.
step-4: add the corn oil, vanilla, and eggs, and stir with a rubber spatula until the dough starts to come together.
step-5: use your hands to finish mixing the dough until well combined and thick.
step-6: if making strawberry mandelbrot, wet your hands with water and shape half of the dough into a rough oval on the prepared baking sheets.
step-7: pinch the edges of the dough up to create a well.
step-8: spread the strawberry jam in the center of the dough.
step-9: flatten the remaining dough and place on top of the strawberry jam.
step-10: leave a bit of extra dough in the bowl to fill in the cracks.
step-11: if making chocolate chip mandelbrot, fold the chocolate chips into the dough.
step-12: wet your hands with water and shape the dough into a rough oval on the prepared baking sheet.
