step-13: bake the mandelbrot for 25-35 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
step-14: let cool for 10 minutes, then transfer to a cutting board.
step-15: top with cinnamon sugar, if desired, then slice into 1-inch-wide pieces.
step-16: serve with additional strawberry jam, whipped cream, coffee, or ice cream, if desired.

step-1: make the stew: in a blender, combine the tomatoes, onion, bell pepper, and habanero.
step-2: blend until smooth.
step-3: pour the tomato puree into a medium pot set over medium-high heat.
step-4: add the bay leaf.
step-5: bring to boil and cook for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the water has cooked off and the sauce is reduced by about half.
step-6: add the vegetable oil and fry the sauce for 10-15 minutes more.
step-7: add the thyme and curry powder, then crumble in the maggi cubes.
step-8: cook for another 10 minutes.
step-9: remove from the heat and set aside.
step-10: make the risotto: heat the olive oil in a medium skillet over medium heat.
step-11: add the onion and cook for 3-5 minutes, until softened.
step-12: add the garlic and tomato paste and cook until the tomato paste is deep brick-red in color, about 5 minutes.
step-13: add the rice and sauté until well-coated with the tomato oil.
step-14: deglaze the pan with the wine and reduce until the pan is almost dry.
step-15: add 1 ladle of hot stock to the rice.
step-16: stir the rice until the stock is absorbed and the pan is almost dry.
step-17: continue adding stock, 1 ladle at a time, until the rice is tender, but still firm.
step-18: it should be moist and creamy, but not runny.
step-19: add the stew and stir to incorporate.
step-20: remove the risotto from the heat, then season with salt and stir in the butter, then stir until melted and well incorporated.
step-21: remove the risotto from the heat.
step-22: make the shrimp: in a medium bowl, toss the shrimp with the suya spice until well coated.
step-23: heat the olive oil in a medium skillet over medium heat.
step-24: add the garlic and prawns and cook, flipping once, until the prawns are pink and opaque, 4-5 minutes.
step-25: remove the pan from the heat and sprinkle the shrimp with the parsley.
step-26: divide the risotto between 2 warm serving plates.
step-27: top with the shrimp and serve with fried plantains alongside.

step-1: brush melted butter on the inside surfaces of the hamburger bun and place on a pan or griddle on low heat.
step-2: while the bun is toasting, flatten each beef patty so that it’s about ¼ inch (6 mm) thick.
step-3: place the cheese in the middle of one of the patties, then cover it with the other patty.
step-4: push the patties together and pinch the edges, assuring there are no holes for the cheese to seep through.
step-5: place meat on a griddle or pan over medium high heat.
step-6: cook 5-10 minutes per side or until cheesy juices start spilling out.
step-7: add pickles to the bottom half of the bun, followed by the onions.
step-8: then top it off with the cooked burger and top bun.
step-9: get your chompers ready!
step-10: but be careful - the cheese is super hot inside!

step-1: preheat the oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-2: make the flax eggs: combine the flax meal with the water and set aside for 10 minutes to gel.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the milk, maple syrup, flax eggs, applesauce, fruit and vegetable pulp, apple cider vinegar, and vanilla.
step-4: stir for about 30 seconds, until well-combined.
step-5: add the flour, oats, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
step-6: stir for about 30 seconds, until combined.
step-7: grease a 12-cup muffin tin with nonstick spray.
step-8: then, fill each cup with the batter about ¾ of the way full.
step-9: sprinkle the tops with oats.
step-10: bake for 20-25 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean.
step-11: let cool for at least 15 minutes, then serve.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the flour, sesame seeds, sugar, cinnamon, yeast, and salt.
step-2: stir with a fork, then add the ghee and warm water and beat with an electric hand mixer until a soft, pliable dough forms.
step-3: cover the bowl with plastic wrap and let the dough rest for 1 hour.
step-4: meanwhile, make the pistachio honey filling: in a small pot over medium heat, melt the ghee, then add the flour and stir until golden brown.
step-5: reduce the heat to low, add the sesame seeds and honey, and stir until thickened, about 5 minutes.
step-6: remove the pot from the heat, add the pistachios, and mix well to incorporate.
step-7: let the filling cool for 10 minutes, then form into 24 small balls.
step-8: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-9: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-10: once the dough has rested, roll into 24 balls.
step-11: press a ball of the pistachio filling into the center of a dough ball, then wrap in the dough and roll again into a ball that completely encases the filling.
step-12: repeat with the remaining dough and filling.
step-13: arrange the cookies on the prepared baking sheet.
step-14: press the cookies lightly into a mamoul tool, or make a crosshatch pattern using a fork.
step-15: bake the cookies for 18–20 minutes or until the bottoms are golden brown.
step-16: let the cookies cool on a wire rack.
step-17: when ready to serve, dust the cookies with powdered sugar.

step-1: position a rack in the center of the oven.
step-2: preheat the oven to 425°f/220°c.
step-3: separate egg yolk and egg whites into 2 bowls.
step-4: meanwhile, put the raisins and rum in a small bowl and steep for about 10 minutes.
step-5: put the crème fraîche, ½ cup sugar, egg yolks, raisins, and 1 tablespoon of the rum in a mixing bowl.
step-6: whisk until blended.
step-7: stir in the flour.
step-8: put the egg whites in a large, clean mixing bowl.
step-9: add the cream of tartar and salt.
step-10: with a hand-held electric mixer on medium speed, beat until thick and foamy.
step-11: then, still beating, gradually add 1 cup of sugar.
step-12: continue beating until soft peaks form when the beaters are lifted out.
step-13: drop a large scoop of the meringue onto the egg yolk batter.
step-14: with a flexible rubber spatula, gently fold the whites into the batter to lighten it.
step-15: scoop the remaining meringue over the batter and gently fold it in.
step-16: coat a medium ovenproof skillet with the butter.
step-17: sprinkle in sugar and shake and rotate to coat the butter.
step-18: tap out any excess.
step-19: gently scrape the batter into the prepared skillet.
step-20: smooth the top.
step-21: bake in the preheated oven until puffed, golden brown on top, and springy to a gentle touch at its center, 10 to 12 minutes.
step-22: while the batter bakes, in a nonreactive skillet stir together the berries, lemon juice, ¼ cup sugar, orange juice and zest, vanilla, and star anise.
step-23: cook over medium-low heat, stirring to help the sugar dissolve and mashing a few of the berries to help thicken the sauce.
step-24: divide the compote among serving plates.
step-25: with a large serving spoon, scoop up large dollops of the kaiserschmarren, distributing them evenly on top of the compote.
step-26: dust generously with confectioners sugar.
step-27: serve immediately.
step-28: bake in the preheated oven until puffed, golden brown on top, and springy to a gentle touch at its center, 10 to 12 minutes.

step-1: position a rack in the center of the oven.
step-2: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-3: separate egg yolk and egg whites into 2 bowls.
step-4: meanwhile, put the raisins and rum in a small bowl and steep for about 10 minutes.
step-5: put the crème fraîche, ½ cup sugar (100 g), egg yolks, raisins, and 1 tablespoon of the rum in a mixing bowl.
step-6: whisk until blended.
step-7: stir in the flour.
step-8: put the egg whites in a large, clean mixing bowl.
step-9: add the cream of tartar and salt.
step-10: with a hand-held electric mixer on medium speed, beat until thick and foamy.
step-11: then, still beating, gradually add 1 cup (200 g) of sugar.
step-12: continue beating until soft peaks form when the beaters are lifted out.
step-13: drop a large scoop of the meringue onto the egg yolk batter.
step-14: with a flexible rubber spatula, gently fold the whites into the batter to lighten it.
step-15: scoop the remaining meringue over the batter and gently fold it in.
step-16: coat a medium ovenproof skillet with the butter.
step-17: sprinkle in sugar and shake and rotate to coat the butter.
step-18: tap out any excess.
step-19: gently scrape the batter into the prepared skillet.
step-20: smooth the top.
step-21: bake in the preheated oven until puffed, golden brown on top, and springy to a gentle touch at its center, 10 to 12 minutes.
step-22: while the batter bakes, in a nonreactive skillet stir together the berries, lemon juice, ¼ cup (50 g) sugar, orange juice and zest, vanilla, and star anise.
step-23: cook over medium-low heat, stirring to help the sugar dissolve and mashing a few of the berries to help thicken the sauce.
step-24: divide the compote among serving plates.
step-25: with a large serving spoon, scoop up large dollops of the kaiserschmarren, distributing them evenly on top of the compote.
step-26: dust generously with confectioners sugar.
step-27: serve immediately.

step-1: whisk the egg in a small bowl.
step-2: add flour and the cold water, and whisk to combine.
step-3: cover with plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator.
step-4: to make the tempura, slice the eggplant in half lengthwise, then cut the bottom into 5 slices (be careful not to cut all the way through to the top).
step-5: add flour to a shallow dish.
step-6: coat the eggplant, pumpkin, green bell pepper, and shrimp in the flour, shaking off any excess.
step-7: heat the oil in a large pot until it reaches 350°f (180˚c).
step-8: dip the floured vegetables and shrimp into the batter.
step-9: fry the battered shrimp and vegetables until they float to the top and are golden brown in color.
step-10: use a slotted spoon to transfer them to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.
step-11: to make the kakiage, put the onion, carrot, japanese parsley and dried shrimp into a medium bowl.
step-12: add 2 tablespoons of flour and toss to coat.
step-13: pour the leftover tempura batter on the top and mix until evenly coated.
step-14: bring the oil in the pot back to 350°f (180˚c).
step-15: drop the kakiage by the spoonful into the oil and fry until golden brown in color.
step-16: use a slotted spoon to transfer them to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.
step-17: in a medium pan, combine the soy sauce, mirin and sugar, and bring to a boil over high heat for 2 minutes.
step-18: top the rice with kakiage and tempura and drizzle with the sauce.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: remove the kale leaves from the thick stems, and tear into bite-size pieces.
step-3: in a medium bowl, top kale with olive oil.
step-4: mix seasonings and add to the kale.
step-5: toss until fully coated.
step-6: arrange seasoned kale on a baking sheet.
step-7: bake for 10-15 minutes, until the edges are brown, but not burnt.
step-8: allow to cool to room temperature.

step-1: preheat the oven to 450°f (230°c).
step-2: whisk together the 3 egg yolks in a small mixing bowl and set aside.
step-3: note: you’ll have 4 yolks leftover.
step-4: you can either discard them, or freeze them for later use.
step-5: beat the seven egg whites (or nine egg whites) in a large mixing bowl with a large whisk until they form soft peaks.
step-6: add the yolks to the beaten whites and very gently whisk the mixture, just to combine.
step-7: set the eggs aside in the fridge while you cook the vegetables.
step-8: combine the cubed sweet potato with 1 cup water (235 ml) in a large, nonstick, oven-safe skillet over high heat.
step-9: bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer and cook, stirring occasionally, just until all the water has evaporated and the sweet potato is soft on the outside, about 8 minutes.
step-10: note: if you don’t have a large nonstick skillet, you can use a regular, oven-safe skillet.
step-11: just be sure to coat it thoroughly with oil.
step-12: as soon as the water is evaporated, add the olive oil and onion, stir together, and season with salt and pepper.
step-13: cook over medium heat, stirring often, until the onion starts to soften, about a minute.
step-14: add the chopped kale and cook, stirring often, until the kale is wilted and dark green, about 2 minutes more.
step-15: spread the vegetables evenly over the bottom of the skillet, then pour the egg mixture on top and spread it in an even layer.
step-16: bake in the preheated oven until the frittata is puffed, cooked through, and very lightly browned on top, 5 to 6 minutes.
step-17: let the frittata cool in the skillet for 5 minutes, then flip it onto a cutting board and cut it in half.
step-18: eat half for breakfast, with ½ a blood orange, cut into wedges.
step-19: for the leftovers, let the remaining half cool completely before storing in an airtight container in the fridge.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: add the sweet potatoes to a baking sheet.
step-3: sprinkle with the garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper, and drizzle with olive oil.
step-4: toss until the sweet potato is well-coated in the spices, then spread out evenly.
step-5: bake for 15 minutes, or until tender.
step-6: in a small bowl, add the pumpkin seeds, chili powder, 1 tablespoon maple syrup, and salt, and mix until well-combined.
step-7: spread the pumpkin seeds out on a baking sheet so they’re not touching each other.
step-8: add to the oven with the sweet potato and bake for 10 minutes, stirring halfway through, until toasted.
step-9: in a liquid measuring cup, combine the tahini, remaining tablespoon of maple syrup, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
step-10: mix well, then add 1 tablespoon of water at a time until desired consistency is reached.
step-11: in a large bowl, drizzle the kale with olive oil.
step-12: massage with your hands until the kale is tender and has reduced in volume by about a third.
step-13: add the quinoa, roasted sweet potatoes, red onion, and pumpkin seeds.
step-14: drizzle with tahini dressing and toss well.
step-15: serve with more dressing if desired.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the chicken, sake, sugar, soy sauce, ginger, and garlic.
step-2: mix well.
step-3: cover with plastic and marinate for at least 15 minutes in the fridge.
step-4: add the egg and potato starch to the chicken.
step-5: mix well.
step-6: heat the oil to 340˚f (170˚c).
step-7: fry the chicken until golden brown and fully cooked, 5-7 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 325°f (170°c).
step-2: in a bowl, combine the graham cracker crumbs and melted butter.
step-3: stir to combine.
step-4: pour the mixture into a 9-inch (23 cm) springform pan and press it evenly into the bottom and halfway up the sides.
step-5: transfer to the refrigerator to chill.
step-6: in a large bowl add the cream cheese, sugar, and milk.
step-7: with a hand mixer, beat until fluffy and fully incorporated.
step-8: add in the sour cream, flour, 2 teaspoons of the bourbon, and the two eggs and gently continue to mix until the cream cheese filling is smooth.
step-9: pour the mixture into the springform pan with the graham cracker crust and bake for 1 hour, or until the cheesecake no longer jiggles.
step-10: while the cheesecake is cooking, prepare the stove-top pecan pie filling.
step-11: in a bowl combine the brown sugar, cornstarch, and salt, stir together and pour into a medium saucepan on low heat.
step-12: pour in the egg yolks, maple syrup, and warm cream and whisk until smooth.
step-13: cook on low heat until the mixture thickens like a pudding, 5-10 minutes.
step-14: remove from the heat.
step-15: stir in the cold butter and the final teaspoon of bourbon and whisk until fully emulsified.
step-16: the pudding-like mixture should be around room temperature.
step-17: fold in the roasted, chopped pecans and then pour the mixture over the cooked cheesecake and spread it out as an even layer.
step-18: if you like, sprinkle with extra chopped pecans or garnish with whole pecans.
step-19: let the cheesecake chill in the refrigerator until completely set.
step-20: slice and serve cold or at room temperature.

step-1: make the pilau masala: in a medium bowl, combine the cumin, paprika, cardamom, black pepper, and cloves.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: heat a large pot over medium-high heat.
step-4: add the oil and red onion and sauté for 10-15 minutes, until dark brown.
step-5: add the garlic, ginger, serrano chile, pilau masala, beef stock cubes, cinnamon stick, and cilantro.
step-6: cook for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
step-7: add the beef and cook until browned, about 8 minutes.
step-8: add the tomatoes and cook for 4-5 minutes, until the tomatoes have released their liquid.
step-9: add the potatoes and the water.
step-10: bring to a boil and cook for 10 minutes.
step-11: add the rice, stir, and cover.
step-12: reduce the heat to medium-low and cook for 20 minutes, until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed.

step-1: in a large pan over medium-high heat, heat the olive oil.
step-2: once hot, add the ground beef.
step-3: use a spatula to break apart the meat and cook for 3 minutes.
step-4: add onion and cook until beef is brown and onion is translucent, about 4 minutes.
step-5: add the garlic, jalapeño, salt, pepper, coriander, cumin, and scallions to the meat.
step-6: cook for 2 minutes.
step-7: add the peas and cilantro, then cook for another 2 minutes.
step-8: remove the meat filling from the heat and let cool.
step-9: in a large bowl, combine the flour, salt, olive oil, and water.
step-10: use your hand or a spatula to mix together.
step-11: once the dough pulls away from sides of the bowl, transfer to a lightly floured surface and knead for 4 minutes or until the dough is smooth and soft.
step-12: shape dough into a ball and brush with olive oil.
step-13: cover with plastic wrap and a warm damp tea towel.
step-14: let rest for 30 minutes.
step-15: remove tea towel and plastic wrap and roll the dough out into a 10-inch (25-cm) long log.
step-16: cut into 10 even sections.
step-17: take one section and roll it into a ball.
step-18: place the ball on a lightly floured surface and use a rolling pin to roll it out into a thin circle about 10 inches (25-cm) in diameter.
step-19: repeat with the remaining dough.
step-20: stack the dough circles as you roll them out, sprinkling a bit of flour between each one and keeping them covered with plastic wrap so they don't dry out.
step-21: in a greased large pan over high heat, place one of the circles of dough and cook for 10 seconds on each side.
step-22: repeat with remaining dough.
step-23: cut one of the par-cooked dough circles into four quarters.
step-24: take one quarter and, with the round side closest to you, fold the bottom half to the right.
step-25: use the flour paste to seal the fold.
step-26: repeat with the left side, crossing over your previous fold to create a cone like pocket.
step-27: fill the pocket with meat filling, then fold the remaining tip of the dough towards you and seal with flour paste.
step-28: repeat with the remaining dough and filling.
step-29: in a large, deep pan, heat the canola oil to 350°f (180°c).
step-30: once the oil is at the correct temperature, carefully place 4-6 sambusas in the pan.
step-31: fry for about 5 minutes, flipping once, until light, golden brown.
step-32: remove from oil and drain on paper towels.

step-1: heat the oil in a large pan over medium-high heat, then add the red onion and cook for 5 minutes, until browned.
step-2: add the tomato, serrano, and garlic.
step-3: stir well, cover, and cook for 5 minutes, until the tomatoes have softened.
step-4: add the garam masala, turmeric, and cumin.
step-5: stir, reduce the heat to medium, and cook for another 10 minutes, or until the sauce clings to the potatoes and they soften slightly.
step-6: stir in the lemon juice and cilantro, then add the fries and salt.
step-7: toss well to coat.
step-8: serve immediately.

step-1: in a food processor, blitz the onion, chili, ginger and garlic together to make a paste.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: in a large pan, heat the oil over a medium heat.
step-4: add the fenugreek, turmeric, asafoetida, mustard seeds, and curry leaves to the pan, and fry for a couple of minutes.
step-5: add the paste and continue to cook for 2-3 minutes.
step-6: add the prawns and water.
step-7: cook until they start to turn pink.
step-8: pour in the coconut milk, salt, pepper, and lime juice, and cook for another few minutes.
step-9: serve with parathas, naan bread, and rice.

step-1: in a large, shallow saucepan, combine the tomato paste, brown sugar, molasses, garlic powder, onion powder, mustard powder, cinnamon, allspice, worcestershire sauce, vinegar, salt, and water.
step-2: bring to a low boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally to prevent burning.
step-3: cook for 25-30 minutes, until reduced by about a quarter.
step-4: the ketchup should be thick and spreadable.
step-5: let cool completely.
step-6: transfer to a clean, airtight container and store in the refrigerator.
step-7: the ketchup should keep for up to 3 weeks.

step-1: in a large pan over medium-high heat, cook the bacon for 6 minutes, or until crisp.
step-2: remove the bacon from the pan, pat off excess grease with a paper towel, then chop and set aside.
step-3: add the water to a medium pot and bring to a boil.
step-4: while the water heats up, chop the cauliflower into small pieces.
step-5: add 1 teaspoon of salt and the cauliflower to the boiling water, then cover and cook for 4 minutes, or until slightly tender.
step-6: drain the cauliflower and set aside.
step-7: in the same saucepan, combine the cream cheese, heavy cream, remaining teaspoon of salt, the cayenne, and paprika.
step-8: stir to combine, then cook for 4 minutes, until smooth and thick.
step-9: fold in the cauliflower, then add the cheddar cheese.
step-10: stir until the cheese has melted, then fold in the bacon.
step-11: scoop into serving bowls and garnish with parsley.

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine the mozzarella and cream cheese.
step-2: microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until the cheese is fully melted and the consistency is smooth, about 1 minute total.
step-3: let the mixture cool for a few minutes to prevent the egg from scrambling, then add the egg, almond flour, garlic, oregano, thyme, rosemary, salt, and pepper, and stir until thoroughly combined.
step-4: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-5: line a baking sheet with parchment paper or grease with nonstick spray.c
step-6: transfer the mixture to the baking sheet.
step-7: press and flatten firmly into an even layer about ¼-½-inch (½-1 ¼cm) thick.
step-8: bake for 10-15 minutes, until golden brown.
step-9: serve as desired: slice into chips, cut into breadsticks, or top with your favorite sauce and toppings to make a pizza.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
step-3: add the carrot and onion, and cook until the vegetables have softened slightly, 8-10 minutes.
step-4: add the beef and season with the oregano, red pepper flakes, and pepper.
step-5: use a wooden spoon to break the beef into smaller pieces, and cook until browned, about 10 minutes.
step-6: add the garlic and cook until fragrant, 2-3 minutes.
step-7: deglaze the pan with red wine, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of pan.
step-8: once the wine has reduced by half, stir in the crushed tomatoes.
step-9: cook until sauce has thickened, stirring frequently, about 10 minutes.
step-10: stir in the basil, then remove the sauce from the heat and let cool.
step-11: bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
step-12: working in batches, add the cabbage leaves, using tongs to submerge them in the water.
step-13: cook until the leaves have softened and are flexible, 1-2 minutes.
step-14: drain well and pat dry with a paper towels.
step-15: stir the egg into the cooled meat sauce.
step-16: place the largest cabbage leaf on the bottom of a 9-inch (23-cm) round baking dish.
step-17: line the exposed sides and bottom of the pan with more cabbage leaves.
step-18: spoon in ¼ of the meat sauce, spreading evenly.
step-19: dollop ¼ of the ricotta on top of the sauce.
step-20: cover with cabbage leaves.
step-21: repeat with the remaining sauce, ricotta, and cabbage to make 3 more layers.
step-22: fold any overhanging cabbage leaves toward the center of the pan.
step-23: bake on the middle rack of the oven for 1 hour, until lightly browned on top.
step-24: let cool for 20 minutes.
step-25: to serve, place a serving plate over the baking dish and invert the chou farci onto the plate.
step-26: remove the pan, then slice into wedges and serve.

step-1: add a tablespoon of olive oil to a skillet over medium-high heat.
step-2: once the oil begins to shimmer, add garlic and cook for 30 seconds, stirring constantly.
step-3: add the spinach and artichoke, and stir.
step-4: mix in cream cheese, mozzarella, and parmesan cheese, and stir until the cheeses are well incorporated.
step-5: remove from the heat and set aside.
step-6: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-7: sprinkle the chicken breasts with salt, pepper, onion powder, and garlic powder until evenly coated.
step-8: to pound out the chicken, take a chicken breast and butterfly it by slicing half way into it to open like a book, making sure not to slice all the way through.
step-9: cover the breast with parchment paper or plastic wrap.
step-10: gently pound the meat with a mallet or rolling pin until it is evenly flattened, about ¼ inch (6 mm) in thickness.
step-11: onto each pounded chicken breast, evenly add ¼ of the spinach-artichoke mixture, but making sure to not overfill the chicken.
step-12: carefully roll the chicken breast until the ends overlap and then place the chicken into a greased baking dish.
step-13: bake for 20 minutes or until the chicken is fully opaque and reaches at least 165°f (75°c).
step-14: serve with riced cauliflower, broccoli, or other low carb vegetables of your choice.
step-15: eat right away or refrigerate until ready to eat.

step-1: make the crust: crush the graham crackers by pulsing in a food processor, or place them in a large zip-top bag and use a rolling pin to crush into fine crumbs.
step-2: transfer the graham cracker crumbs to a medium bowl and add the shredded coconut.
step-3: mix to combine, then add the melted butter.
step-4: stir until the mixture has the texture of wet sand.
step-5: grease an 11-inch (28 cm) tart pan with nonstick spray.
step-6: pour the graham cracker mixture into the pan, then use a measuring cup to press the mixture around the pan in an even layer.
step-7: make the filling: in a large bowl, whip the cream cheese with an electric hand mixer or fork until smooth.
step-8: add the powdered sugar, lime zest, lime juice, vanilla, and heavy cream and continue to whip until stiff peaks form.
step-9: spread the filling over the crust, smoothing the top with a spatula, then freeze for 30 minutes.
step-10: remove the cheesecake from the freezer and unmold.
step-11: insert 8 popsicle sticks through the sides of the crust, spacing evenly.
step-12: decorate the top of the tart with whipped cream and key lime zest.
step-13: freeze for 4 hours.
step-14: cut the tart into 8 slices and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: combine the pie crust ingredients in a medium bowl and mix well.
step-3: in a paper cup-lined muffin tin, add 1 tablespoon of pie crust and press firmly with your fingers.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: in a medium bowl, whisk egg yolks, condensed milk and a pinch of salt.
step-6: add in the lime juice and combine well.
step-7: scoop the filling onto the crust in the tin, about ¼ cup (30 g) each.
step-8: bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes.
step-9: cool to room temperature.
step-10: freeze for 2 hours.
step-11: take out the paper liners and gently insert a wooden popsicle sticks in each pies.
step-12: freeze for 30 minutes.
step-13: dip frozen lime pie pop into melted chocolate.
step-14: put them on parchment paper-lined baking sheet and freeze for 15 minutes, or until the chocolate is set.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: place graham crackers in plastic bag and crush them into a fine crumb using a rolling pin.
step-3: alternatively, a food processor can be used to crush the crackers.
step-4: pour the graham cracker crumbs into a medium bowl with the melted butter and brown sugar.
step-5: mix until the crumbs take on the character of a coarse, wet sand.
step-6: pour the crumbs into a 9-inch (23 cm) pie dish.
step-7: press the crumb firmly into the dish, making sure to coat the bottom and sides of the dish evenly.
step-8: once the crust has been formed, place the pie dish into the refrigerator to firm up.
step-9: separate 6 eggs.
step-10: working with the yolks (reserve the whites for later), add the zest of 1 lime and whisk, either by hand or with an electric mixer, for 2 minutes.
step-11: add the can of condensed milk and continue to whisk until mixture is smooth and has a pale yellow color.
step-12: add in the ice cream and key lime juice.
step-13: continue to whisk for an additional 3-5 minutes.
step-14: the filling should be smooth and airy when finished.
step-15: pour the filling mixture into the refrigerated graham cracker crust and bake at 350˚f (180˚c) for 18-20 minutes, or until the edges of the crust begin to brown and the filling no longer jiggles when disturbed.
step-16: while the pie is baking, combine the reserved egg whites with corn syrup and about ¼ cup (50 grams) of the sugar and begin to whisk vigorously to form the meringue.
step-17: continue to add the sugar in small increments until all of it is incorporated.
step-18: continue to whisk until mixture thickens and stiff peaks form, about 7-10 minutes.
step-19: top the baked pie with the meringue.
step-20: using a rubber spatula, spread the meringue evenly over the top of the pie, making sure to cover all the visible areas of filling.
step-21: once covered, use the tip of the spatula to shape the meringue forming small peaks a valleys in the topping.
step-22: bake at 350˚ (180˚c) for an additional 7-10 minutes to toast the meringue topping.
step-23: allow to cool completely for at least 1 hour before cutting.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the chickpea flour, rice flour, cilantro, serrano peppers, ginger, garlic, salt, and water.
step-2: stir with a rubber spatula until smooth.
step-3: heat 1 inch (2 cm) of oil in a deep skillet over medium-high heat until it reaches 350˚f (180˚c).
step-4: working in batches, add the potatoes to the batter and toss to coat.
step-5: in batches, transfer the battered potatoes to the hot oil and fry until golden brown, flipping occasionally.
step-6: drain the fried potatoes on paper towels.
step-7: serve hot with tomato chutney or your chutney of choice.

step-1: scoop the avocado into a medium bowl.
step-2: season with salt and add the tabasco.
step-3: mash until smooth.
step-4: spread the avocado on the slice of toast.
step-5: sprinkle with the red pepper flakes and top with the fried egg.

step-1: preheat oven to 400ºf (200ºc)
step-2: in a medium bowl, add the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt, and stir to combine.
step-3: in a medium bowl or liquid measuring cup, add almond milk, apple cider vinegar, and vanilla, and stir to combine.
step-4: let it sit for 5-7 minutes.
step-5: pour the liquid mixture into the dry mixture and whisk until smooth.
step-6: let batter rest for 5 minutes.
step-7: pour the batter onto a baking sheet covered with parchment paper, smooth batter out so it is even on all sides.
step-8: add toppings of your choice
step-9: bake for 15 minutes
step-10: freeze for up to 1 month or serve warm with maple syrup.

step-1: drain kimchi and roughly chop.
step-2: add butter to a large skillet over medium-high heat.
step-3: when melted, add kimchi.
step-4: cook and stir for about 6 minutes until the edges of the kimchi start to turn a golden brown.
step-5: transfer to a bowl and let it cool down.
step-6: add the kimchi, cheese, and sesame seeds to a tortilla.
step-7: fold the tortilla in half.
step-8: pour oil into a large skillet over medium heat.
step-9: fry the quesadilla for about two minutes on each side, or until the tortilla has turned a golden brown and the cheese has melted.
step-10: serve with a garnish of diced green onions and sesame seeds.
step-11: slice into quarters.
step-12: note: experiment with proteins by adding beef, pork, or chicken to the quesadillas.
step-13: for even more of a korean influence, try adding korean bbq-style proteins!

step-1: chop kimchi and place in bowl, set aside.
step-2: in a medium saucepan, melt cheddar cheese part way (until it’s mostly soft but still clumpy).
step-3: add the sour cream.
step-4: melt and stir until the mixture is smooth.
step-5: add the red pepper powder and stir until evenly integrated.
step-6: add kimchi and simmer until evenly mixed and smooth.
step-7: the liquid from the kimchi may give the appearance that the queso is chunky, continue heating and stirring 5-10 minutes and it will smooth out.
step-8: serve garnished with chopped green onion.
step-9: goes great with chips, raw vegetables, or straight into the mouth via spoon.

step-1: crush the kiwi and lime juice in a jug.
step-2: add in simple syrup and stir.
step-3: serve ¼ of the fruit mix in a glass and add 1 shot of vodka.
step-4: top up with ice cubes and prosecco and garnish.

step-1: mix fruits together in a plastic bag.
step-2: seal bag and place in freezer for up to 6 months.
step-3: when ready, mix milk and fruit in a blender until consistency is smooth.

step-1: put fruit in a freezer bag.
step-2: seal and store in freezer for up to 8-12 months.
step-3: when ready to use, put milk and spinach into the blender first.
step-4: blend until the spinach is fully incorporated into the milk.
step-5: then add greek yogurt and frozen fruit and mix until consistency is smooth.

step-1: mix all ingredients together in a large bowl.
step-2: serve with chips or as a topping on your favorite meal.

step-1: blend all ingredients in a food processor or high-speed blender until thoroughly combined.
step-2: pour into a rectangular loaf pan and smooth into an even layer.
step-3: freeze for 2 hours, or until frozen but still a little soft for scooping.
step-4: (if freezing overnight, cover with a lid or plastic wrap, but let it sit out at room temperature for about 5-10 minutes before scooping.)
step-5: scoop into a bowl.

step-1: cut kiwis and strawberries into thin slices.
step-2: remove kiwi skin, and discard strawberry tops.
step-3: fill the popsicle mold with the fruit.
step-4: fill in the gaps of air with water.
step-5: freeze the popsicles for at least 5 hours.
step-6: take the frozen popsicles out of the ice molds and enjoy!

step-1: in a large bowl, whisk together the warm milk, butter, and sugar.
step-2: add the yeast and let the mixture sit for 10 minutes, until it becomes foamy.
step-3: add the salt and egg and whisk to combine.
step-4: add the flour.
step-5: mix with a spatula until the dough starts to come together.
step-6: knead the dough on a floured surface for 3-5 minutes.
step-7: drizzle a bit of oil into the bowl, then add the dough.
step-8: cover with a cloth or plastic wrap and let rest in warm place for 1 hour, or until the dough doubles in size.
step-9: sprinkle the dough with a bit of flour, then punch down to release the gas and knead it for a few minutes until the dough is soft and smooth.
step-10: cover again and let it sit for another 30 minutes, or doubled in size again.
step-11: heat oil in a deep skillet over medium-high heat until it reaches to 350°f (180°c).
step-12: transfer the dough to a clean surface, sprinkle with a bit of flour, and knead for 3-5 minutes, or until you have a soft, shiny, slightly sticky dough.
step-13: divide the dough into 12 equal parts and roll into balls.
step-14: set the balls on a plate and cover with plastic wrap.
step-15: working one at a time, roll a ball of dough out on your cutting board so it forms a rope 10-inches (25 cm) long and ½-inch (1 cm) in diameter.
step-16: place a hand on either end of the dough rope.
step-17: move one hand upward and the other downward so that the rope becomes twisted in between your hands as you roll it.
step-18: lift the dough, joining the 2 ends together to seal.
step-19: the tension in the dough will twist it as it hangs.
step-20: add more twists, if desired.
step-21: repeat with the remaining dough pieces.
step-22: allow the doughnuts to rise for 30 minutes on a tray or cutting board, flipping halfway.
step-23: reduce the heat under the skillet to medium.
step-24: gently lower each doughnut into the hot oil.
step-25: fry for 5 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-26: occasionally flip doughnuts over to ensure they are even in color.
step-27: drain on a wire rack.
step-28: in a small bowl, mix together 1 cup (200 g) of sugar and 2 tablespoons of cinnamon
step-29: distribute mixture onto a plate, and roll the doughnuts in the cinnamon sugar.
step-30: serve warm.

step-1: slice the beef as thinly as you can, then set aside in a large bowl.
step-2: having frozen or cold beef makes the slicing easier.
step-3: in a blender or food processor, blend the onion chunks, garlic, pear, spring onion pieces, brown sugar, pepper, soy sauce, and sesame oil until smooth.
step-4: pour the marinade over the beef, add the onions, then mix evenly.
step-5: cover with cling film and marinate for at least 30 minutes in the fridge.
step-6: heat canola oil in a skillet over high heat.
step-7: being careful not to crowd the pan, sear the marinated beef and onions until browned, then sprinkle with the spring onions and sesame seeds.
step-8: serve with the rice and side dishes!

step-1: combine marinade ingredients in a bowl.
step-2: pour marinade over ribs and let them marinate for at least four hours.
step-3: after marinating, place ribs on baking dish.
step-4: reserve the marinade for later.
step-5: bake ribs at 325°f (160°c) for two and a half to three hours.
step-6: pour the leftover marinade into a saucepan, add the honey, and bring to a boil to form a glaze.
step-7: set aside.
step-8: after two and half to three hours, remove the ribs from the oven.
step-9: pour the glaze over the ribs and broil for 5 to 10 minutes.
step-10: cut up the ribs, sprinkle sesame seeds over, and garnish with scallions.

step-1: in a small bowl, mix together the parmesan cheese, korean red pepper, sugar, and ramen seasoning.
step-2: cut the potatoes into ribboned curls using the ribbon blade on a spiralizer.
step-3: if you don’t have a spiralizer, insert a skewer into each potato and, working in a spiral motion, cut in the opposite direction you are turning the skewered potato, making a thin, even spiral all the way down the potato.
step-4: a spiralizer is recommended.
step-5: gather the potato curls together, then wrap each curl around a wooden skewer, spacing out the potato evenly.
step-6: set aside to dry for 5 minutes.
step-7: heat the canola oil in a deep pot until it reaches 350ºf (180ºc).
step-8: fry the potatoes until golden brown, 3-5 minutes, then drain on a paper towel-lined baking sheet.
step-9: while the tornado potatoes are still hot, season with salt and sprinkle with the cheese mixture.

step-1: preheat the oven to 450ºf (230ºc).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and soy milk, and whisk until smooth.
step-4: add the cauliflower florets to the batter and toss until fully coated.
step-5: transfer the coated cauliflower to the baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes, or until the coating looks dry.
step-6: meanwhile, in a medium saucepan over high heat, combine the soy sauce, agave, sesame oil, rice vinegar, garlic, ginger, and cornstarch, and stir until the mixture comes to a boil.
step-7: turn off the heat and let sit for 10 minutes to thicken.
step-8: remove the cauliflower from the oven and transfer to a large bowl to cool for 5 minutes.
step-9: leave the oven on.
step-10: add the sauce to the bowl and toss the cauliflower until completely coated, then return to a parchment-lined baking sheet and bake for another 10 minutes.
step-11: top the cauliflower with chives and sesame seeds, and serve over rice, if desired.

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine chicken with all the marinade ingredients in a bowl.
step-2: let marinate for at least 10 minutes.
step-3: in an oiled pan, cook chicken on medium-high heat until cooked through on both sides.
step-4: remove from pan.
step-5: add sesame oil, zucchini, and red pepper, and sauté in pan for 3 minutes.
step-6: add peanuts and sauté for another 3 minutes.
step-7: add dried chilies, garlic, ginger, and green onion, and sauté until vegetables are tender.
step-8: add chicken, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sugar, and cornstarch slurry, and sauté until well mixed.
step-9: garnish with more green onion and serve with rice.

step-1: soak the rice in 2 cups (480 ml) of water for about 2 hours.
step-2: add the chopped onion, 2 tablespoons slivered almonds, garlic, ginger, and 3 tablespoons of water to a food processor.
step-3: blend into a paste.
step-4: heat the oil in a large nonstick pan over medium heat.
step-5: add the sliced onions and fry until browned and crisp, about 10 minutes.
step-6: remove from the pan with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
step-7: add the raisins to the pan.
step-8: stir until they become plump, about 2 minutes, then remove and drain on paper towels.
step-9: add the lamb to the pan, in batches if necessary, and brown on all sides, about 5 minutes.
step-10: transfer the browned meat to a bowl and set aside.
step-11: reduce the heat to medium.
step-12: add the onion paste to the pan.
step-13: cook, stirring constantly, until the paste turns light brown.
step-14: if it sticks to the bottom of the pan, add a bit of water and keep stirring.
step-15: return the meat and any accumulated juices to the pan.
step-16: add 1¼ teaspoons of salt, the yogurt, and 1 cup (240 ml) of water.
step-17: cover, reduce the heat to low, and simmer for 30 minutes.
step-18: add the saffron threads to a small bowl with the milk and set aside.
step-19: bring a large pot of water to boil and add 1½ tablespoons of salt.
step-20: drain the rice and add to pot.
step-21: boil for 5 minutes, then immediately drain and rinse.
step-22: in a spice grinder or mortar and pestle, finely grind the cinnamon stick, cloves, peppercorns, cardamon, coriander, and cumin.
step-23: add the spices to the meat, along with the nutmeg and cayenne.
step-24: cover and continue cooking until the meat is tender, about 10 minutes.
step-25: if there is too much sauce, increase the heat to high, uncover, and stir to evaporate some of the liquid (there should about 1 cup (240 g) of sauce left in the meat).
step-26: preheat the oven to 300˚f (150˚c).
step-27: in a large dutch oven or deep casserole dish, layer half of the rice, the meat with its sauce, and the rest of the rice.
step-28: squeeze the lemon juice over rice.
step-29: using the end of a wooden spoon, poke holes all the way through the layers.
step-30: spoon a bit of the saffron and milk into each hole.
step-31: distribute the butter over the rice and sprinkle over most of the fried onions, reserving some for garnish.
step-32: cover the dish with foil, then top with a lid.
step-33: bake for 1 hour.
step-34: remove the biriyani from the oven and set aside for at least 15 minutes.
step-35: garnish with the eggs, raisins, remaining 3 tablespoons of slivered almonds, reserved fried onions, and cilantro.

step-1: place 3 cups (690 g) thai sticky rice in a medium bowl and cover with cold water by at least 1 inch (2 ½ cm).
step-2: cover with plastic wrap and soak overnight at room temperature.
step-3: after the rice has soaked, drain and set aside.
step-4: fill the large pot with 3 inches (7 cm) of water and bring to a steady simmer over medium-high heat.
step-5: cut out a circle of parchment paper large enough to line the steamer insert and come 2 inches (5 cm) up the sides.
step-6: place the parchment in the insert, add the rice, and spread in an even layer.
step-7: place the insert in the pot, cover with the lid, and steam until the rice is translucent and tender, 20-30 minutes.
step-8: turn off the heat, but keep the rice covered so it stays warm while you prepare the larb.
step-9: toast the remaining ⅓ cup (75 g) rice in a small pan over medium-high heat, stirring constantly, until light golden brown, about 5 minutes.
step-10: immediately pour the rice into a small bowl and let cool completely.
step-11: grind the toasted rice in a spice grinder or mortar and pestle until finely ground.
step-12: set aside.
step-13: heat the chicken stock in a wok or large pan over medium heat.
step-14: once the stock is steaming, add the pork.
step-15: break up the meat with a wooden spoon and cook gently, stirring occasionally, until just cooked through and no longer pink, 8-10 minutes.
step-16: turn off the heat and stir in the garlic, shallots, lemongrass, and galangal.
step-17: add the fish sauce, lime juice, chiles, scallions, mint, cilantro, and toasted rice to the pork mixture and stir to combine.
step-18: season with more fish sauce, if desired.
step-19: serve the larb with the sticky rice, cabbage leaves, cucumbers, bean sprouts, and lime wedges.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine bread flour, sugar, and butter.
step-2: use your hands to mix, until the mixture is the texture of breadcrumbs.
step-3: in a small jar, stir together the milk, yeast, and eggs.
step-4: pour three quarters of the liquid mixture on top of the dry ingredients and mix together.
step-5: add liquid, a tablespoon at a time, until the mixture forms a soft dough.
step-6: turn the mixture out onto a large, floured surface and knead for 10 minutes.
step-7: form the dough into a ball and place it in a clean mixing bowl covered with cling film.
step-8: set in a warm, dry place and let it rise for one hour.
step-9: combine the raisins and the hot tea in a small bowl and let the mixture sit for 45 minutes, then drain the raisins.
step-10: when the dough has risen, divide it into 16 equal sized pieces.
step-11: flatten each piece into a disk about 8cm in diameter, and place a teaspoon of cream cheese and a teaspoon of raisins in the centre.
step-12: form the disk into a ball, with the sultanas and cream cheese in the centre.
step-13: roll each ball in caster sugar, to coat.
step-14: place stuffed balls of dough into a cast iron skillet or round baking dish and cover with cling film.
step-15: set in a warm, dry place and let it rise for one hour.
step-16: bake in a 350°f/180°c fan oven/gas mark 6 for 45 to 50 minutes, until the bread is cooked through and golden on top.
step-17: while the bread cooks, make the glaze.
step-18: stir together icing sugar, cream cheese, and milk to combine.
step-19: if the mixture is too dry, add more milk a tablespoon at a time.
step-20: drizzle it all over the monkey bread.

step-1: cook the noodles according to package directions, omitting salt.
step-2: drain well and separate the noodles carefully.
step-3: cut the noodles into triangles and transfer to baking sheet.
step-4: in a small bowl, combine the water and 2 tablespoons of olive oil.
step-5: brush on both sides of noodles.
step-6: combine 2 teaspoons of salt, the dried oregano, dried basil, paprika, and garlic powder in a small bowl, and mix to combine.
step-7: sprinkle the seasoning mixture and ⅓ cup (35 g) of parmesan cheese over the noodles.
step-8: set aside.
step-9: heat the remaining tablespoon of olive oil and the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
step-10: add the minced onion, carrot, and celery.
step-11: cook, stirring occasionally, until golden brown, 5-10 minutes.
step-12: once the vegetables have caramelized, add the ground beef, italian sausage, ½ teaspoon of salt, ¼ teaspoon of pepper, and the tomato paste.
step-13: stir to combine, breaking up the meat.
step-14: cook until the meat has browned, 15-20 minutes.
step-15: add the red wine.
step-16: bring the sauce to a simmer, cover with a lid, and cook for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally, then set aside.
step-17: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-18: in a large bowl, mix together the ricotta, spinach, fresh basil, remaining cup of parmesan cheese, remaining teaspoon of salt, and remaining ½ teaspoon of pepper.
step-19: spread half of the meat sauce in the bottom of an ovenproof dish.
step-20: gently spread the ricotta cheese over the sauce.
step-21: spoon the remaining meat sauce over the ricotta and sprinkle mozzarella cheese on top.
step-22: bake the noodles and layered dip for 12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the noodle chips are crispy.
step-23: sprinkle more parmesan cheese on top of noodle chips, if desired.
step-24: sprinkle parsley on top of dip, if desired.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large pot over high heat.
step-3: add the onion and garlic.
step-4: cook until starting to brown, stirring occasionally, 3-4 minutes.
step-5: add the beef, salt, and pepper.
step-6: cook until all of the moisture has evaporated and the meat is starting to brown on the edges, breaking the meat up as you stir, 10-12 minutes.
step-7: add the tomato sauce and tomato paste, then reduce the heat to medium and bring the sauce to a simmer.
step-8: cook it down until the mixture becomes thick, about 15 minutes.
step-9: remove the pot from the heat and set aside.
step-10: in a small bowl, combine the ricotta, basil, egg, and parmesan.
step-11: stir until smooth.
step-12: set aside.
step-13: grease a large oven-safe metal bowl with the remaining tablespoon of olive oil, then lay about 25 lasagna noodles along the sides and bottom of the bowl, fanning them out in an overlapping pattern.
step-14: the ends of the noodles should hang over the sides of the bowl.
step-15: slice the remaining lasagna noodles in half crosswise.
step-16: these will serve as the layers between the meat and the cheese mixtures.
step-17: sprinkle half of the mozzarella into the bottom of the bowl on top of the noodles.
step-18: this will help bind the noodles together when cooked.
step-19: spread half of the meat mixture evenly over the mozzarella, then lay half of the cut noodles over the sauce
step-20: spread all of the ricotta mixture over the noodles, then layer with the rest of the noodles, then the rest of the mozzarella, and the rest of the meat sauce.
step-21: fold the edges of the lasagna noodles hanging over the sides of the bowl back towards the center, creating another overlapping pattern.
step-22: cover with foil and bake for about 45 minutes, until cooked through.
step-23: meanwhile, make the béchamel: in a saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter.
step-24: add the flour and cook, whisking continuously, for about 2 minutes until a paste forms.
step-25: add the hot milk and continue to whisk as the sauce thickens and comes to a boil.
step-26: season with salt and pepper and add the parmesan.
step-27: reduce the heat to low, and cook, still whisking, for 2-3 minutes more.
step-28: invert the lasagna dome onto a cutting board.
step-29: pour the béchamel sauce over the dome and top with basil.
step-30: slice the dome, then top with more parmesan and basil, if desired.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a large pot over high heat, add oil, onions, and garlic, and cook until they begin to brown, stirring occasionally, about 3-4 minutes.
step-3: add the beef, sausage, salt, and pepper, cooking until all of the moisture has evaporated and the meat is starting to brown on the edges, breaking the meat up as you stir, about 10-12 minutes.
step-4: add the tomato sauce, then reduce heat to medium, and bring to a high a simmer, cooking the sauce down until the mixture becomes extremely thick, almost paste-like, about 30 minutes.
step-5: remove from heat and set aside.
step-6: in a bowl, combine the ricotta, parmesan, basil, and egg, mixing until smooth.
step-7: set aside.
step-8: slice 6 of the lasagna noodles in half.
step-9: these will serve as the layers in between the meat and the cheese mixture.
step-10: spray a bundt pan with nonstick cooking spray, then lay about 10-12 noodles into the bottom of the pan, fanning them out in an overlapping pattern.
step-11: one end of the noodles should be just as tall as the center of the pan, and the other end of the noodles should hang over the sides of the pan.
step-12: sprinkle half of the mozzarella into the bottom of the pan on top of the noodles.
step-13: this will help bind the noodles together when cooked.
step-14: spread half of the meat mixture evenly in a ring over the top of the mozzarella, then lay half of the cut noodle pieces over the top to create a noodle layer.
step-15: spread all of the ricotta mixture over the noodles in an even ring, then layer with the rest of the noodles and the rest of the meat sauce.
step-16: fold the edges of the lasagna noodles hanging over the sides of the pan back towards the center, creating another overlapping pattern.
step-17: sprinkle the rest of the mozzarella evenly on top.
step-18: bake for approximately 45 minutes, or until the cheese is a deep golden brown.
step-19: cool for about an hour, then carefully invert the ring onto a cutting board.
step-20: slice the ring, then top with any extra parmesan and basil.
step-21: place a small bowl filled with marinara at the center of the ring, for dipping.

step-1: coat a 10-inch (25 cm) frying pan with olive oil.
step-2: add minced garlic and chopped onion, stirring consistently until lightly browned.
step-3: add ground beef, and stir to mix with onion and garlic.
step-4: once beef has begun to brown and water has been released drain water and fat then continue cooking until beef begins to brown and become tender and crispy.
step-5: add marinara sauce and mix together.
step-6: sprinkle salt and pepper to taste, remove heat.
step-7: add mozzarella.
step-8: stir until mozzarella binds to mixture.
step-9: while mixture cools boil four cups of water in medium pot and add lasagna noodles, lay them in across each other in a star formation so they do not bind together, stir regularly.
step-10: after eight to 10 minutes drain pasta and allow to cool for five minutes.
step-11: cut noodles down to 3- to 4-inch (8-10cm) slices and place mixture inside and roll.
step-12: place poppers in freezer for 12 minutes.
step-13: dip poppers in egg wash, flour, and bread crumbs, then once more in the egg wash and bread crumbs.
step-14: freeze for additional 12 minutes.
step-15: heat 3–4 inches (8-10cm) of canola oil at medium heat in a pot for 15 minutes — test by splashing drops of water into oil (it should sizzle).
step-16: place poppers in oil three or four at a time until they are golden brown on all sides, allow them to cool for 10–12 minutes and serve with marinara sauce as dip.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
step-3: add onions and garlic.
step-4: cook until softened.
step-5: add the ground beef, breaking it apart with a spoon, and stir until browned.
step-6: add the sausage, breaking it apart with a spoon, and stir until browned.
step-7: mix in 2 tablespoons of the parmesan, salt, pepper, 3 tablespoons basil, and 2 tablespoons parsley, and stir to combine.
step-8: add 2 cups (520 g) of the tomato sauce and the tomato paste.
step-9: continue stirring until the meat sauce is bubbling.
step-10: reduce heat to low, and cover the pot, simmering for 45 minutes.
step-11: mix together the ricotta, 2 tablespoons parsley, and 2 tablespoons basil.
step-12: place one of the lasagna noodles on a cutting board and cut in half crosswise.
step-13: set one half of the noodle aside for later.
step-14: evenly spread about 2 tablespoons of the ricotta mixture over the noodle half.
step-15: sprinkle 1 tablespoon mozzarella over the noodle.
step-16: starting from the cut end of the noodle roll upward being careful not to squeeze the mixture out of the noodle.
step-17: repeat with the remaining noodles.
step-18: place the spiral lasagna noodle in a greased muffin tin.
step-19: sprinkle about 3 tablespoons mozzarella around the noodle spiral.
step-20: pour 3 tablespoons of the meat sauce over the mozzarella around the noodle spiral.
step-21: place the other half of the lasagna noodle on a cutting board, and cut it lengthwise.
step-22: starting from the end of the noodle spiral, tuck the noodle strip into the spiral so the end of noodle spiral is on the outside.
step-23: wrap the noodle strip around the spiral while pushing it into the meat sauce.
step-24: repeat with the other noodle strip.
step-25: pour about 2 tablespoons of the sauce in between the noodle “petals”.
step-26: sprinkle with about 1 tablespoon of both mozzarella and parmesan.
step-27: bake for about 30 minutes, until the top of the noodles are golden and crispy.
step-28: let cool for about 5 minutes before removing from muffin tin.
step-29: serve over tomato sauce.

step-1: in a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
step-2: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the onion and cook for 3-4 minutes, until semi-translucent.
step-3: add the garlic, tomato paste, basil, and oregano, and cook for 2-3 more minutes, or until the onions are translucent and herbs are fragrant.
step-4: add the crushed tomatoes, vegetable broth, and lentils, and bring to a boil.
step-5: increase heat to medium-high and cook for 10 minutes or until lentils are halfway tender.
step-6: break apart the lasagna noodles into about 2-inch-long (5-cm) pieces and add to the pot.
step-7: let the soup cook for another 10-15 minutes, or until the pasta is al dente and the lentils are tender.
step-8: stir in the spinach and let wilt, then serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: cut the top off of each pepper and remove the seeds.
step-3: transfer to a square baking dish.
step-4: bake for 20 minutes, to soften.
step-5: heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a large pot, or dutch oven, over medium high heat.
step-6: add the onion and garlic, cook until softened.
step-7: add the ground beef, sausage, salt, and pepper.
step-8: cook until the meat has browned on all sides.
step-9: add the diced tomatoes and tomato sauce.
step-10: bring the mixture to a light simmer.
step-11: simmer for 5-10 minutes, remove from heat and set aside.
step-12: in a small bowl, combine ricotta, parmesan, basil, and egg.
step-13: mix together with a fork, set aside.
step-14: remove the peppers from the oven, drain any excess water that accumulated inside.
step-15: cut the lasagna noodles into quarters and set aside.
step-16: assemble the lasagna in each pepper.
step-17: alternate 2 tablespoons of sauce, 1 lasagna noodle, 2 tablespoons ricotta mixture, and 1 lasagna noodle until the peppers are full.
step-18: top with mozzarella cheese.
step-19: bake in preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, until the cheese is melted and slightly browned.
step-20: rest for 10 minutes before serving.

step-1: brown off the minced beef in a pan then add the onions.
step-2: cook this through for a minute or so then add the tomatoes, garlic, oregano and basil, then season with a little bit of salt and a good bit of pepper.
step-3: stir it all together and allow to simmer for a few minutes until the sauce has reduced slightly and everything is cooked well then set aside.
step-4: in a mixing bowl, add the ricotta, grated mozzarella, parmesan, parsley and egg.
step-5: season with salt and pepper.
step-6: mix this all up until it’s well combined.
step-7: preheat oven to 180°c (350°f) gas mark 4.
step-8: cut the lasagne sheets in half length ways and put them onto a baking tray.
step-9: put a few tablespoons of the tomato and beef mixture all the way down the sheet, leaving a bit of space on each end to help when you roll it.
step-10: don’t overfill this here, otherwise it’ll get messy!
step-11: place a layer of the cheese mixture on top of the beef mixture in the same way.
step-12: roll the lasagne sheets up to form little cylinders full of lovely stuff, if the filling spills out, just shove it back in.
step-13: top each roll-up with another tablespoon of both the beef and cheese then sprinkle a tablespoon of parmesan over all of it.
step-14: bake in the centre of the pre-heated oven for 12-15 minutes until the cheese mixture on top has browned slightly.

step-1: pour the honey into a medium, heavy saucepan and place over medium heat.
step-2: be sure to use a large enough pot because the honey can easily boil over.
step-3: add in the dried lavender and let the honey come to a boil.
step-4: let the honey boil for about 5 minutes to let the lavender infuse, then remove from the heat.
step-5: pour the honey through a mesh sieve into a heat-proof container.
step-6: allow the honey to cool, uncovered, until room temperature, at least 1 hour.

step-1: steep the lavender in the hot water for 7 minutes.
step-2: froth the milk by adding it to a resealable jar.
step-3: shake vigorously until many bubbles form.
step-4: then, microwave the milk for 45 seconds to 1 minute, which will help create stable bubbles.
step-5: remove the lavender, then stir in the agave and frothed milk.
step-6: top with more lavender, if desired.
step-7: nutrition, per serving - calories: 89, total fat: 2 grams, sodium: 69 mg, total carb: 18 grams, dietary fiber: 0 gram, sugars: 6 grams, protein: 4 grams

step-1: steep the tea and lavender in the hot water for 7 minutes.
step-2: froth the milk by adding it to a resealable jar.
step-3: shake vigorously until many bubbles form.
step-4: then, microwave the milk for 45 seconds to 1 minute, which will help create stable bubbles.
step-5: remove the tea, then stir in the frothed milk, vanilla, and agave.
step-6: dust with a bit of cinnamon, if desired.
step-7: nutrition, per serving - calories: 93, total fat: 2 grams, sodium: 69 mg, total carb: 14 grams, dietary fiber: 0 gram, sugars: 6 grams, protein: 4 grams

step-1: in a large saucepan heat the oil.
step-2: add the shallot and garlic and sauté until tender, 3 to 5 minutes.
step-3: add the black beans and mash until smooth.
step-4: season with ground cumin, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper.
step-5: spread the bean mixture in an even layer over the bottom of a 9-inch (25-cm) clear glass dish.
step-6: in a medium bowl, stir together the sour cream and lime juice and season with salt.
step-7: spread the sour cream mixture over the bean layer.
step-8: in another medium bowl, mash together the avocados, lime juice and zest, and season with salt.
step-9: spread the avocado mixture over the sour cream layer.
step-10: sprinkle with the cheese, tomatoes, olives, scallions, and cilantro.
step-11: serve with tortilla chips and hot sauce.

step-1: in a microwave-safe bowl, whisk the yolks and sugar until pale in color.
step-2: add cornstarch and whisk well.
step-3: add the vanilla extract and milk.
step-4: whisk until well combined.
step-5: loosely cover the bowl with plastic wrap and microwave for 4 minutes, stirring halfway through.
step-6: remove plastic and stir.
step-7: cover with a plastic wrap and chill at least 30 minutes.
step-8: cut the thawed puff pastry into three equal-sized rectangles.
step-9: pierce each piece of puff pastry with a fork.
step-10: heat a nonstick pan over low heat.
step-11: place the puff pastry in the pan and cook for 10 minutes.
step-12: flip the puff pastry sheets, and place a lid on the top of the pan.
step-13: cook for 10 minutes.
step-14: remove the lid and sprinkle 1 teaspoon of sugar on sheet of puff pastry.
step-15: flip the pastry over so that the sugared side is on the bottom.
step-16: bring the heat up to high.
step-17: place a piece of parchment paper over the puff pastry and weigh it down with another pan.
step-18: once the surface is caramelized, about 1-2 minutes, remove from the heat and let cool to room temperature on a cooling rack.
step-19: place the custard in a piping bag fitting with an large round tip.
step-20: pipe the custard on one sheet of puff pastry.
step-21: top with a layer of sliced strawberries, then pipe another row of custard.
step-22: top with another sheet of puff pastry, custard, sliced strawberries, custard, and the remaining puff pastry sheet.
step-23: dust the top with powdered sugar.

step-1: make the garlic sauce: add the garlic and salt to a food processor and process until completely smooth, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed.
step-2: with the processor running, slowly pour in ½ cup (120 ml) of olive oil and continue to process until smooth and creamy.
step-3: the mixture should begin to thicken as the oil emulsifies with the garlic.
step-4: pour in 2 tablespoons of lemon juice, while continuing to process, so that the lemon juice incorporates completely and the mixture does not separate.
step-5: add the remaining olive oil and 2 tablespoons lemon juice and process until very smooth.
step-6: transfer the sauce to a small bowl.
step-7: serve the fries with the garlic sauce and sprinkle with parsley.

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine rice, bacon, mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese, 1 cup (115 g) bread crumbs, and eggs, and mix well.
step-2: dip your hands into a bowl of water, then grab a handful of the rice and firmly press into a ball.
step-3: coat the rice balls in the remaining bread crumbs.
step-4: preheat oil in a pot to 350˚f (170˚c).
step-5: fry the rice balls for 3 - 5 minutes or until golden brown.
step-6: transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain, sprinkle with salt.
step-7: we recommend serving with marinara sauce.

step-1: combine the rice with 2 tablespoons of curry sauce.
step-2: mix in the flour, cheese, 1 egg yolk, and pepper.
step-3: roll into balls, make a well in the middle and place in some curry chicken.
step-4: secure the ball by rolling it in your hands again.
step-5: coat in the flour, egg yolk, breadcrumbs, then egg yolk, then breadcrumbs again.
step-6: heat the oil in a pan to 160°c (325°f).
step-7: fry the arancini for a few minutes, until golden brown.

step-1: pre-heat the oven to 150°c/300°f.
step-2: gently melt the chocolate and butter together over a bain-marie.
step-3: once combined, take off the heat.
step-4: stir in the eggs, egg yolks and sugar.
step-5: fold in the flour.
step-6: pour into the tart shell.
step-7: bake for 15 minutes.
step-8: meanwhile, prepare the meringue by whisking the egg whites with an electric hand whisk.
step-9: once foamy, gradually add in the sugar, followed by the vanilla and vinegar.
step-10: whisk until stiff peaks form.
step-11: spoon on top of the chocolate tart.
step-12: bake for 30 minutes.
step-13: cut into slices and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: grease a 9-inch (23 cm) springform pan with cooking spray.
step-3: make the cookie base: chop the candy into bite-size pieces, then transfer to a medium bowl and set aside.
step-4: in a large bowl, whisk together the brown sugar and granulated sugar.
step-5: add the butter and cream with an electric hand mixer until fluffy.
step-6: add the egg, vanilla, salt, and baking soda and mix with a rubber spatula to combine.
step-7: fold in the flour just until smooth, then add the candy pieces and fold to incorporate.
step-8: transfer the dough to the prepared springform pan and pat down in an even layer.
step-9: refrigerate until ready to use.
step-10: make the cheesecake filling: in a large bowl, combine the cream cheese and sugar.
step-11: beat with an electric hand mixer until smooth.
step-12: add the salt, vanilla, and eggs and beat to combine.
step-13: pour the filling over the chilled base and smooth the top.
step-14: bake 35-40 minutes, until the sides are golden but the center still jiggles slightly.
step-15: let cool to room temperature.
step-16: drizzle chocolate syrup in a spiral pattern over the cheesecake.
step-17: using a toothpick, draw lines outward from the center to create a spiderweb pattern.
step-18: un-mold the cheesecake, then slice and serve.

step-1: in a medium bowl, stir together the onion, vinegar, lemon juice, and 2 teaspoons of the mustard.
step-2: season with salt and pepper and set aside for 10 minutes.
step-3: begin to add the olive oil drop by drop, whisking constantly, until the mixture is emulsified.
step-4: add the dill and stir to combine.
step-5: transfer 3 tablespoons of the vinaigrette to another medium bowl and whisk the sour cream into the remaining vinaigrette.
step-6: add the chopped turkey and mix to combine.
step-7: gently toss the lettuce leaves in the reserved dressing.
step-8: spread four slices of the bread with ½ teaspoon mustard each.
step-9: divide the turkey between all four slices and top with the sliced cheese, dressed lettuce leaves, and the remaining bread slices.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: using a sharp knife, slice off the top and bottom of an acorn squash to create flat surfaces.
step-3: slice the squash in half and scoop out the seeds with a spoon.
step-4: place the squash halves on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-5: drizzle the squash with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
step-6: bake for 40 minutes, until the squash is tender and easily pierced with a paring knife.
step-7: then heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
step-8: toss in the onion, carrot, celery, salt, pepper, and rosemary and sauté until the vegetables are completely tender, about 8 minutes.
step-9: sprinkle in the garlic and sauté until fragrant, about 1 minute.
step-10: pour in the turkey leftovers and stir the mixture so that everything is evenly mixed.
step-11: pour the mixture into a large bowl and let it cool about 5 minutes.
step-12: crack in the eggs and mix so that everything is evenly coated.
step-13: spoon the turkey mixture into the squash halves.
step-14: bake for 20 minutes, until the turkey mixture has browned slightly.
step-15: serve and enjoy!

step-1: add all of the ingredients except for the raspberries in a clean mason jar.
step-2: stir everything together.
step-3: add the raspberries.
step-4: put a lid on the mason jar and refrigerate overnight in 40°f (5°c).

step-1: in a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the simple syrup, lemon juice, and basil.
step-2: simmer for 5 minutes, until slightly reduced.
step-3: remove from the heat and let cool completely.
step-4: once the lemon basil syrup is cool, strain into an airtight glass container and store in the refrigerator for up to 1 month.
step-5: to make the soda, pour 1 cup (240 ml) of seltzer water into a glass filled with ice and add 1-2 tablespoons of lemon basil syrup.
step-6: stir to combine.
step-7: garnish with lime wheels, if desired.
step-8:
nutrition, per 1 tablespoon:
calories: 20
sugars: 5

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: make the cake: in a medium bowl, whisk together the flour and baking powder.
step-3: in a large bowl, cream the butter, sugar, and salt with an electric hand mixer until fluffy, about 3 minutes.
step-4: add the eggs, one at a time, beating until fully incorporated before adding the next.
step-5: add the lemon zest, lemon juice, and vanilla and beat to combine.
step-6: add half the flour and beat to combine, then beat in the milk, then add the rest of the flour and beat just until incorporated.
step-7: scrape down the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula and make sure any floury spots are incorporated.
step-8: grease a 10-inch (25-cm) bundt pan with nonstick spray.
step-9: spoon the batter into the pan and smooth the top.
step-10: gently tap the pan against the counter to release any air bubbles.
step-11: bake the cake for 50 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
step-12: while the cake is baking, make the lemon glaze: in a small microwave-safe bowl, combine the sugar and lemon juice.
step-13: microwave for 1 minute, stirring halfway through, until the sugar is completely dissolved.
step-14: set aside.
step-15: make the lemon icing: sift the powdered sugar into a medium bowl.
step-16: add the lemon juice and whisk until smooth.
step-17: after the cake is done baking, let cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then invert onto a wire rack set over a baking sheet and remove the bundt pan.
step-18: use a knife to loosen the cake around the edges, if needed.
step-19: use a skewer or fork to poke holes all over the top and sides of the cake.
step-20: brush the cake with the lemon glaze.
step-21: if the glaze drips off, let the cake cool for a few more minutes, then continue brushing on the glaze.
step-22: let cool completely, at least 1 hour.
step-23: pour the icing over the top of the cake, letting it drip down the sides.
step-24: grate lemon zest over the icing.
step-25: let the glaze dry completely, about 30 minutes.
step-26: transfer the cake to a serving platter, slice, and serve.

step-1: season the chicken with the salt and pepper and fry with the olive oil.
step-2: after a few minutes, add the garlic.
step-3: fry the chicken with the garlic for another few minutes, then add the asparagus, lemon zest, and lemon juice.
step-4: stir again, before mixing in the soy sauce.
step-5: serve with rice and sprinkle with lemon zest on top.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: poke several holes into the spaghetti squash.
step-3: microwave on high for 5 minutes.
step-4: cut squash in half along the holes.
step-5: remove seeds with a spoon.
step-6: drizzle squash with olive oil, and season with salt and pepper.
step-7: place squash upside down on baking tray and bake for 40 minutes until soft.
step-8: let cool.
step-9: using a skillet, cook the chicken breast on medium-high heat with a little olive oil for 6-8 minutes until the chicken is golden brown and cooked through.
step-10: remove chicken from the pan and set aside.
step-11: sauté onion for a few minutes.
step-12: add garlic and cook for a minute.
step-13: add tomatoes and cook for a couple minutes.
step-14: cook until onions are translucent.
step-15: add lemon juice and chicken broth, and cook until the liquid partially reduces, about 20 minutes.
step-16: add chicken and cook for 2 minutes.
step-17: add spinach and cook for 2 minutes.
step-18: using a fork, shred the inside of the squash.
step-19: pour sauce over the squash.
step-20: serve immediately.

step-1: combine cake mix, oil, and eggs in a mixing bowl.
step-2: using an ice cream scoop or your hand, form golf ball-sized balls of cookie dough and transfer to a bowl of powdered sugar.
step-3: cover dough ball in powdered sugar and transfer to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-4: bake at 350°f (180°c) for 10-12 minutes.

step-1: remove any giblets etc.
step-2: from the cavity of the chicken, sometimes in a small bag.
step-3: stuff chicken with 1 sprig of rosemary, 1 lemon (quartered) and 4 cloves garlic.
step-4: season all sides of the chicken with salt and pepper.
step-5: remove both ends of a lemon, cut in half to create very thick slices.
step-6: line the bottom of the slow cooker with 4 lemon slices, 4 whole garlic cloves and a sprig of rosemary.
step-7: put the chicken in the slow cooker.
step-8: cut 2 garlic cloves in half and put all four pieces on top of the chicken along with the 2 remaining lemon slices.
step-9: garnish with 1-2 more sprigs of rosemary.
step-10: put the lid on the slow cooker and set to high for 4 hours.
step-11: place cooked chicken under the grill (broil) for 10 minutes to crisp the skin (optional).
step-12: allow chicken to rest for 10 minutes before carving and serving.
step-13: leftover juices in the slow cooker are mostly lemon juice with a bit of chicken fat and can be used sparingly as a strongly flavoured sauce.

step-1: combine the yerba mate, dried lemon peel, and ginger.
step-2: store in an airtight container for up to 1 month.
step-3: to brew, steep 1-2 teaspoons of the tea blend in 8 ounces (240 ml) of hot water for 5 minutes.
step-4: serve warm or over ice.

step-1: combine lemon juice, basil, salt, pepper, and garlic.
step-2: mix until combined.
step-3: add tofu and refrigerate.
step-4: marinate for 1-3 hours.
step-5: prepare as desired!

step-1: preheat oven to 325˚f (170˚c).
step-2: grease and line a 9-inch (23 cm) square baking dish with parchment paper and place on a baking sheet.
step-3: make the crust: combine the flour, powdered sugar, salt, and butter in a medium bowl, and use your hands to mix until a crumbly dough forms.
step-4: transfer the dough to the prepared pan, and use your hands to press it against the bottom and about 1 inch (2 cm) up the sides.
step-5: poke the bottom all over with a fork.
step-6: bake for 20 minutes, until light golden brown.
step-7: while the crust is baking, make the lemon filling: in a large bowl, whisk together the eggs and egg yolk.
step-8: add the granulated sugar, lemon juice, zest, and a pinch of salt, and whisk to combine.
step-9: whisk in the flour until just combined.
step-10: when the crust is done baking, remove it from the oven.
step-11: pour the lemon filling over the crust and carefully return it to the oven for 25 minutes, until the filling no longer jiggles and the center is mostly set.
step-12: while the filling bakes, make the meringue: in a clean, dry medium bowl, use an electric hand mixer to beat the egg white until stiff peaks form.
step-13: add about half of the sugar, whip for 30 seconds, then add the rest of the sugar and whip until combined.
step-14: transfer the meringue to a pastry bag fitted with a large tip or zip-top bag with a corner snipped off.
step-15: pipe 9 evenly-spaced dollops of meringue on top of the lemon bars.
step-16: return to the oven for 10-12 minutes, until the meringues are lightly browned.
step-17: let cool completely, then refrigerate for 1-2 hours.
step-18: slice into 9 bars.
step-19: serve chilled or at room temperature.

step-1: preheat the oven to 325ºf (170ºc).
step-2: in a medium bowl, cream the butter and slowly add the sugar.
step-3: beat until light and fluffy.
step-4: add the eggs one at a time, mixing until incorporated.
step-5: sift the flour and baking powder into the sugar mixture.
step-6: add salt and mix until just combined.
step-7: add the vanilla, milk, and lemon juice, and mix until incorporated.
step-8: scoop mixture into a lined cupcake tin about ¾ full.
step-9: bake 12-15 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out cleanly from the center of the cupcakes.
step-10: let cupcakes cool.
step-11: prepare the lemon curd by whisking the yolks and sugar in a heatproof bowl over a pot of simmering water.
step-12: once the sugar is dissolved, add the lemon juice and zest.
step-13: stir until the mixture thickens, about 10 minutes.
step-14: once the curd coats the back of a spoon, add the butter and stir until melted.
step-15: remove from the heat, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate.
step-16: make sure the cling film touches the surface of the curd so that a film doesn’t form on top.
step-17: prepare the frosting by whisking the egg whites and sugar in a heatproof bowl over simmering water until it thickens and the sugar dissolves completely.
step-18: tempering the eggs will ensure the frosting is food safe without being baked.
step-19: remove from the heat, add the cream of tartar, and beat about 10 minutes until soft peaks form.
step-20: using a piping tip or a knife, cut a hole into the top of the cupcakes and press down to make a well for the curd.
