step-21: add lemon curd into the cupcakes and frost them with the meringue.
step-22: torch the frosting or carefully broil for about 3 to 4 minutes.
step-23: be sure that you use foil cupcake liners if broiling!

step-1: peel the lemons with a peeler, making sure to avoid the white pith, which would make the oil bitter.
step-2: add the peels to a medium pot filled with the olive oil and stir.
step-3: let simmer over very low heat for 15-20 minutes.
step-4: strain out the peels.
step-5: transfer the infused oil to a bottle or other resealable container.
step-6: the oil will keep in the fridge for a few weeks.
step-7: if you see any signs of spoilage, discard it.

step-1: pre-heat the oven to 180°c (350˚f).
step-2: prepare the chicken coating by mixing together the breadcrumbs, parmesan, flour, lemon zest, garlic powder, parsley, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: cut the chicken into large nuggets and season with salt and pepper.
step-5: place each nugget into the egg yolk, then coat with the breadcrumb-parmesan mixture.
step-6: place on a baking tray.
step-7: bake for 10 minutes.
step-8: flip the chicken over and add the asparagus and tomatoes.
step-9: drizzle over the olive oil, lemon juice, parmesan, salt and parsley.
step-10: bake for 10 more minutes or until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are cooked but still firm.

step-1: preheat oven to 250˚f (130˚c).
step-2: place wings in a large bowl and pat dry.
step-3: add the baking powder and salt to the wings.
step-4: stir to coat.
step-5: spray a baking rack with nonstick cooking spray and place on top of a foiled sheet pan.
step-6: distribute wings evenly on top, making sure none of them touch and they are all face-up.
step-7: bake for 35 minutes, then increase the temperature to 425˚f (220˚c) and bake for an additional 45 minutes, or until wings are crisp and golden.
step-8: (do not remove the wings from the oven when increasing temperature.)
step-9: for sauce, in a hot pan, melt butter.
step-10: add lemon juice, pepper, and salt.
step-11: stir until combined.
step-12: add wings and stir to coat.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: break the head of cauliflower into bite-sized florets.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine olive oil, salt and pepper.
step-4: add the cauliflower and coat well.
step-5: transfer cauliflower to an oiled, parchment-lined baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes.
step-6: remove from oven and squeeze the juice of one lemon over the florets.
step-7: adding the lemon juice in the beginning prevents the cauliflower from getting soggy.
step-8: top with some more cracked pepper if you prefer.
step-9: bake for another 10 minutes or until heated through.
step-10: serve with aioli or your favorite dipping sauce.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: cut puff pastry sheets in half, then use a rolling pin to roll each half out to 24-inches (60-cm) long x 8-inches (20-cm) wide.
step-3: brush the puff pastry with the softened butter, then carefully roll them up into a tight log.
step-4: cut the log in half lengthwise.
step-5: take each half and fold the smooth part of the dough inward to create a spiral shape.
step-6: place spirals in a cupcake pan and brush the tops with egg wash.
step-7: bake for 15 minutes on the top rack, then transfer to the bottom rack and bake for an additional 15 minutes.
step-8: remove from the oven.
step-9: once cool, cut out the center of each cruffin and fill with lemon curd.
step-10: combine the powdered sugar with the lemon juice to make a glaze.
step-11: drizzle glaze over each cruffin and top with lemon zest.

step-1: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-2: make the candied lemons: in a high-walled, wide pan, combine the sugar and water.
step-3: bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring to dissolve the sugar.
step-4: add the lemon slices to the pan, making sure they are submerged in the syrup.
step-5: reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer until the lemons have softened and have started to caramelize, about 35 minutes.
step-6: gently transfer the lemon slices to the prepared baking sheet and let cool completely, about 20 minutes.
step-7: the candied lemons can be made up to 2 days in advance.
step-8: store in an airtight container in the refrigerator and bring to room temperature before using.
step-9: (the syrup can be strained, cooled, and kept in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.
step-10: try adding it to cocktails and desserts!)
step-11: make the cake: arrange a rack in the center of the oven.
step-12: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-13: grease a 9-inch (23 cm) nonstick springform pan with 1 tablespoon of butter.
step-14: add 3 tablespoons of flour to the greased pan and tilt to coat completely.
step-15: turn the pan over and tap out any excess flour.
step-16: set aside.
step-17: in a large bowl, beat the remaining butter with an electric hand mixer on high speed until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes.
step-18: with the mixer running, add the sugar and beat until evenly incorporated, about 3 minutes.
step-19: reduce the mixer speed to medium-low and add the eggs, 1 at a time, making sure to fully incorporate each before adding the next.
step-20: stir in the lemon extract and 1 teaspoon of lemon zest.
step-21: set aside.
step-22: in a medium bowl, whisk together the remaining cup of flour, the cornmeal, baking powder, and salt.
step-23: add the wet ingredients to the flour mixture and whisk until the batter is smooth, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed.
step-24: add the ricotta and stir just until combined, but do not overmix.
step-25: set the prepared pan on a baking sheet.
step-26: pour the batter into the pan and use a spatula to smooth the top.
step-27: bake for 45 minutes, or until the sides and top of the cake are golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
step-28: transfer the cake to a wire rack and let cool for at least 45 minutes.
step-29: once the cake begins to pull away from the sides of the pan, release the springform.
step-30: with a wide metal spatula, gently transfer the cooled cake to a cake platter.
step-31: dust the top of the cake with the powdered sugar.
step-32: top with the strawberries, blueberries, and lemon slices and sprinkle with the remaining teaspoon of lemon zest.

step-1: in a large mixing bowl, whisk together ricotta cheese, egg yolk, milk, vanilla extract, and lemon zest.
step-2: whisk until smooth, then add flour and baking powder.
step-3: mix this until fully combined.
step-4: in a separate mixing bowl, beat the egg whites on high speed with an electric mixer until very white and foamy, then gradually add sugar.
step-5: continue beating on high speed until hard peaks form.
step-6: gently fold ¼ of the egg whites into the lemon ricotta mixture.
step-7: gently fold in the remaining egg whites.
step-8: be careful not to deflate the eggs!
step-9: butter up a nonstick pan and pour in about ¼ cup (25g) worth of batter for each pancake.
step-10: cook for 2-3 minutes on each side or until golden brown on the edges.
step-11: in a pot or pan, cook blueberries, sugar, water, and lemon juice.
step-12: stir occasionally to prevent sticking and cook for about 8-10 minutes or until the compote reaches a thick consistency.
step-13: (compote will thicken once it cools, so to loosen it up just add a touch of hot water.)
step-14: serve hot compote over stack of pancakes and dust with powdered sugar.

step-1: preheat oven to 400ºf (200˚c).
step-2: in a 12-in (30-cm) oven-safe skillet, add the olive oil over medium heat.
step-3: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the brussels sprouts and cook, stirring occasionally, until crisp and lightly caramelized, 3 to 4 minutes.
step-4: add the garlic, ginger, and lemon zest.
step-5: cook until fragrant about 30 seconds.
step-6: transfer the skillet to the oven and roast for 10 minutes, or until tender.
step-7: remove from the oven.
step-8: preheat oven to broil.
step-9: in a blender or food processor, add the goat’s milk, goat cheese, mustard, and lemon juice, and pulse until smooth.
step-10: stir in the red pepper flakes.
step-11: add the basil to the skillet with the brussels sprouts.
step-12: add the goat’s milk mixture and stir to combine.
step-13: sprinkle with parmesan cheese and almonds.
step-14: broil for 2 to 3 minutes, or until the cheese has melted.
step-15: season with salt and pepper, and top with additional basil.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: heat a large skillet over medium heat then add 1 tablespoon of olive oil, shallot and garlic and sauté for 2-3 minutes, or until slightly golden brown then remove from heat.
step-3: to a food processor, add the garlic and shallot, lentils, egg, 1 teaspoon of olive oil, tomato paste, parsley, parmesan, bread crumbs, italian seasonings, salt, and pepper and pulse, mixing until just combined.
step-4: transfer the mixture to a medium-sized bowl.
step-5: use a cookie dough scoop to scoop out balls of mixture then carefully form into balls.
step-6: arrange on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-7: bake for 10-15 minutes.
step-8: remove meatballs from oven and allow to cool for 5-10 minutes.
step-9: serve with spaghetti.

step-1: in a medium bowl, soak the lentils in cold water for 3 hours.
step-2: preheat the oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-3: in a food processor, combine the lentils, carrot, corn, peas, vegan cheese, oregano, salt, pepper, red pepper flakes, and garlic, and pulse until well mixed.
step-4: take about 1 tablespoon worth of mixture and form it into a nugget with your hands.
step-5: pan fry with a small drizzle of oil over medium-high heat until both sides are golden brown, about 10 minutes.
step-6: or, you can bake them on a piece of parchment paper at 400˚f (200˚c) for 20 minutes, flipping after the first 10 minutes.
step-7: allow to cool 5 minutes.

step-1: preheat the oven to 325°f (160°c).
step-2: in small bowl, add the coconut flakes, soy sauce, maple syrup, and liquid smoke.
step-3: mix until well-combined.
step-4: spread evenly on a greased baking sheet, making sure the flakes aren’t touching as much as possible.
step-5: bake for 10-15 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes, until golden brown.
step-6: then remove from the oven and let cool for 10 minutes.
step-7: in a large bowl, combine the arugula, pears, lentils, and coconut bacon.
step-8: in a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, add the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper.
step-9: mix until well-combined.
step-10: drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss well.
step-11: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: add butternut squash, brussels sprouts, and red onion to to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-3: season with olive oil, salt, and pepper, and use hands to mix until seasoning is fully distributed.
step-4: bake for 20 minutes, flipping halfway through.
step-5: in a medium saucepan, add lentils and water, and bring to a boil.
step-6: reduce heat to a simmer and cover for 20-25 minutes or until lentils are tender.
step-7: drain excess water if necessary.
step-8: when vegetables are finished roasting, transfer to a mixing bowl and add lentils.
step-9: for the dressing, combine balsamic vinegar, maple syrup, salt, and pepper in liquid measuring cup and whisk until combined.
step-10: pour dressing over lentils and vegetables and toss until fully coated.
step-11: transfer lentil salad to two containers and refrigerate for up to 5 days.

step-1: in a large pot, sauté the diced red onion and minced garlic in 1 tablespoon of olive oil until translucent, about 5 minutes.
step-2: add the water, green lentils, and salt to the large pot.
step-3: bring to a boil.
step-4: cover with lid and simmer for 10 minutes.
step-5: to make the caramelized onions, heat a tablespoon of olive oil over low heat and add the onion slices, stirring occasionally until completely soft, dark brown, and caramelized.
step-6: note: this will take about 30 minutes.
step-7: the onions should become very dark and tacky when finished.
step-8: stir often to avoid burning.
step-9: add the rice, cumin, cinnamon, and bayleaf to the lentils.
step-10: stir.
step-11: cook covered for about 15 minutes, or until rice is cooked.
step-12: serve lentils and rice topped with the caramelized onions, chopped fresh parsley, lemon wedges, and greek yogurt if desired.

step-1: place lettuce into box.
step-2: place sliced peppers, carrots, edamame, and cashews inside lettuce.
step-3: peel oranges and place inside box.
step-4: pour sriracha into box.

step-1: remove the tofu from its packaging and drain.
step-2: wrap tofu in a kitchen towel and find a heavy object to place on top of tofu, leave it there for 10-20 minutes, until tofu feels more tender.
step-3: make the sauce: in a medium bowl, combine the water, soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, sriracha, brown sugar, rice wine vinegar, and scallions, and stir.
step-4: set ½ cup (120 ml) of the sauce aside.
step-5: crumble the tofu into the marinade, cover, and refrigerate for 1 hour.
step-6: in a medium wok or skillet over medium heat, add the sesame oil and onion, and cook 3 minutes, until onions are translucent.
step-7: add the mushrooms and garlic and cook for about 5 minutes, or until the mushrooms are tender.
step-8: add the marinated tofu to the pan and cook until the majority of marinade cooks off.
step-9: add the water chestnuts and scallions.
step-10: pour in the reserved sauce.
step-11: toss to coat and cook until just heated through.
step-12: transfer the tofu mixture to a medium bowl.
step-13: heat the canola oil in the same pan over high heat until a drop of water sizzles when flicked onto the oil.
step-14: fry the rice noodles for about 30 seconds, until puffed up.
step-15: transfer the fried noodles to paper towels to drain.
step-16: slice the core off the head of lettuce and separate into individual leaves.
step-17: serve with leaves of lettuce, rice noodles, and drizzle remaining sauce over top.

step-1: place the potatoes in a large pot and cover with cold water.
step-2: add the salt.
step-3: bring to a boil over high heat and cook until the potatoes are fork-tender, about 20 minutes longer.
step-4: drain the potatoes and press through a potato ricer into a large bowl.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: heat the butter, cream, and milk in a small pot over low heat until simmering.
step-7: pour the cream mixture over the potatoes and stir to combine.
step-8: season to taste with salt and pepper.
step-9: garnish with chives, if desired.
step-10: note: a potato ricer gives these potatoes a super fluffy texture, but you can use a hand masher if you don’t own one.

step-1: add the almond milk, egg yolks, maple syrup, vanilla, cinnamon, and nutmeg to a large bowl and whisk to combine.
step-2: pour the mixture into a medium pot and add the cloves, if using.
step-3: warm over low-medium heat for 10-15 minutes, until the temperature reaches 160˚f (70˚c).
step-4: stir constantly and don’t allow the mixture to come to a boil.
step-5: chill or serve warm.
step-6: garnish with cinnamon sticks and more nutmeg.
step-7:
calories: 201

step-1: sauté onion and garlic until fragrant.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: in a large pot, add vegetable broth, water, and cauliflower florets.
step-4: boil until cauliflower is tender.
step-5: drain the cauliflower, reserving 1 cup of the liquid for the next step.
step-6: in a food processor or blender, add cauliflower, reserved cooking liquid, almond milk, parmesan, sautéed onion and garlic, salt and pepper to taste.
step-7: blend until smooth.
step-8: (depending on the size of your blender, you may need to do this in batches.)
step-9: in a large skillet, heat cooking oil over medium-high heat.
step-10: add chicken, salt, pepper, and oregano to taste.
step-11: cook until chicken is no longer pink and remove from the skillet.
step-12: set aside.
step-13: add asparagus to the skillet and cook.
step-14: once asparagus has reached your desired doneness, add cooked pasta, the cooked chicken, and the cauliflower sauce.
step-15: combine well and heat through.
step-16: serve topped with fresh parsley.

step-1: heat the oil in a large pan over a medium heat.
step-2: add the chicken and season with the salt and pepper.
step-3: fry for 6-8 minutes or until cooked through.
step-4: take the chicken out and set aside.
step-5: fry the onions with the garlic and ginger for about 5 minutes.
step-6: stir in all the spices and fry for another 2 minutes.
step-7: stir in the water and passata sauce.
step-8: bring to a boil.
step-9: place a lid on top of the pan and simmer for 10 minutes.
step-10: stir in the cream and the yogurt.
step-11: add in the chicken and cook for another 5 minutes, until the sauce thickens slightly.
step-12: serve with rice, salad, and naan bread.

step-1: place nuts in the bowl of a food processor and pulse until chunky.
step-2: add in the oat flour, dark cocoa powder, honey, milk, and salt.
step-3: pulse until just thoroughly mixed.
step-4: add mixture to a greased pie tin and press down firmly to form the crust.
step-5: chill for 1 hour.
step-6: in a large bowl, combine greek yogurt, peanut butter, honey, vanilla, and salt until consistency is smooth.
step-7: add filling to pie crust and smooth into an even layer.
step-8: top with dark chocolate chips.
step-9: chill for at least 1 hour.

step-1: preheat oven to 450ºf (230˚c).
step-2: place the broccoli florets on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and drizzle with olive, cayenne, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper, and stir to combine.
step-3: bake for 15 to 20 minutes, tossing halfway through, until lightly charred.
step-4: bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over high heat.
step-5: add the pasta and cook until al dente.
step-6: before draining through a colander, reserve 1 cup (240 ml) of the pasta water.
step-7: return the pasta to the pot.
step-8: add the hummus, ½ cup (120 ml) of the pasta cooking water, lemon zest, lemon juice, butter, and parmesan and toss until a creamy sauce forms.
step-9: thin the sauce with more pasta cooking water, a little at a time, as needed.
step-10: add the basil, parsley, red pepper flakes, and remaining reserved water.
step-11: add the broccoli to the pasta, and toss gently with salt, and pepper.
step-12: serve immediately with extra parmesan, basil and parsley on top.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a large mixing bowl, combine the eggs, oil, pumpkin, honey, and water, and whisk until thoroughly combined.
step-3: sprinkle the whole wheat flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, baking soda, and salt over the wet ingredients and fold together until the batter is well combined.
step-4: pour the batter into a greased loaf pan and smooth the top into an even layer.
step-5: bake for 1 hour, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
step-6: let the loaf cool in the pan for 10 minutes before carefully unmolding.
step-7: let the loaf stand at room temperature for at least 1 hour before slicing.

step-1: make the cookie dough: in a large bowl, combine the flour, salt, cinnamon, oats and baking powder.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, or in a separate large bowl with an electric hand mixer, cream together the butter and sugar for about 2 minutes on medium speed, until well-combined.
step-4: add the eggs, 1 at a time, incorporating each egg before adding the next.
step-5: scrape down the sides of the bowl.
step-6: slowly add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture and beat until just combined.
step-7: scrape down the sides of the bowl if needed.
step-8: in a small bowl, combine the boiling water and baking soda.
step-9: add to the dough and beat thoroughly to combine.
step-10: chill the dough in the refrigerator for 4 hours.
step-11: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-12: make the maple buttercream: in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, or in a large bowl with an electric hand mixer, cream the butter on medium speed until smooth and pale in color.
step-13: scrape the sides of the bowl down with a spatula as needed.
step-14: with the mixer running, slowly drizzle the maple syrup into the butter.
step-15: beat until well-combined.
step-16: add the salt and vanilla.
step-17: mix well, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed.
step-18: add the powdered sugar and beat until well-combined.
step-19: set the buttercream aside.
step-20: scoop ¾-ounce (20 grams) balls of the chilled dough and onto a parchment-lined baking sheet, spacing about 3 inches apart.
step-21: (you may need to bake in multiple batches).
step-22: moisten your fingers with water and gently flatten each scoop of dough into an even round about ¼-inch (½ cm) thick.
step-23: bake the cookies for 8-10 minutes, until the edges are golden brown and the centers are dry, but still chewy and pliable.
step-24: using a small spatula, gently coax any overly spread cookies back into a round shape.
step-25: let the cookies cool completely.
step-26: fill a piping bag with the maple buttercream.
step-27: pipe a flat round of buttercream onto half of the cookies.
step-28: then, top with the other cookies.
step-29: freeze any extra cookies in an airtight container for up to 10 days.
step-30: exposure to moisture in the air both in the freezer and at room temperature will cause the cookies to get sticky and soggy.

step-1: to a tall glass, add lime slices and mint.
step-2: muddle until juicy.
step-3: add agave, rum, ice, and top with soda water.
step-4: stir to combine.
step-5: garnish with a lime wheel and a sprig of mint.

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine the cabbage and salt.
step-2: toss lightly.
step-3: let sit for 10 minutes to withdraw some moisture.
step-4: place a colander over a separate bowl.
step-5: transfer the cabbage to the colander squeeze out any moisture from the cabbage.
step-6: discard the water.
step-7: in a large bowl, combine the drained napa cabbage, ground pork, shiitake, scallions, sesame oil, ginger, remaining teaspoon of salt, and white pepper.
step-8: mix well with your hands.
step-9: put a tablespoon of filling in the middle of a dumpling wrapper.
step-10: using your finger, lightly wet half of the outer rim with water.
step-11: fold the wrapper in half.
step-12: using your fingertips, make pleats to seal the dumpling.
step-13: repeat with the remaining wrappers and filling.
step-14: in a large non-stick pan, heat the oil over medium heat.
step-15: place 8 dumplings in the pan and fry until the bottoms turn golden brown, about 5 minutes.
step-16: add ¼ cup water (60 ml) and cover.
step-17: cook for 7-10 minutes, or until the filling is cooked through.
step-18: repeat with the remaining dumplings.
step-19: serve immediately with dipping sauce.

step-1: cook chicken without any seasoning.
step-2: boil or steam potatoes.
step-3: steam green beans.
step-4: allow all to cool.
step-5: add potatoes, green beans, chicken, and water, breast milk, or formula to a blender or food processor.
step-6: blend very well.
step-7: add more liquid as needed.
step-8: refrigerate up to 4 days or freeze up to 1 month.
step-9: note: check with your pediatrician before introducing new foods to children under 12 months.

step-1: prepare 1 box of mac 'n' cheese according to instructions on box.
step-2: add cooked bacon, monterey jack cheese, mozzarella cheese and pepper, stir until fully incorporated.
step-3: top with desired garnish.
step-4: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat your oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, rub potatoes with salt, pepper, and olive oil.
step-3: bake in preheated oven for 40-50 minutes.
step-4: once cooled, peel and mash potatoes, and set aside.
step-5: heat oil in large pot over a medium-high heat.
step-6: add onion and garlic.
step-7: cook until translucent and garlic is fragant, about 5 minutes.
step-8: add butter and melt.
step-9: bring in flour and stir until mixture is lightly browned.
step-10: add in the chicken broth and cream cheese.
step-11: stir until fully incorporated
step-12: add in the mashed potatoes and combine.
step-13: season with salt and pepper.
step-14: garnish bowl with shredded cheese, bacon, and chives.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (176°c).
step-2: heat the oil in a pan over high heat.
step-3: cook the chicken with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and chili powder for two to three minutes.
step-4: add the barbecue sauce and cook until the sauce has reduced by about half, about five minutes.
step-5: remove from heat.
step-6: in a large skillet, spread out two large handfuls of tortilla chips.
step-7: layer with half of the barbecue chicken, followed by half of the cheese, onion, tomato, bacon, and parsley.
step-8: repeat with the remaining ingredients.
step-9: bake for 15 minutes.
step-10: drizzle the sour cream and sprinkle the avocado on top.
step-11: serve!

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: combine all ingredients in a 9x9 inch (23x23 cm) square baking dish and mix evenly.
step-3: bake for 30 minutes, flipping every 10 minutes and serve.

step-1: using a fork, poke holes on the top of the sweet potato.
step-2: microwave on high for 10 minutes, or until the potato can be easily pierced with a knife.
step-3: gently slice the sweet potato in half, lengthwise, and spread almond butter on each side.
step-4: top with banana slices, almonds, and blueberries, and drizzle with honey.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: melt chocolate and butter over a double boiler until melted.
step-3: add sugar and mix well.
step-4: add vanilla extract and salt.
step-5: whisk eggs one at a time until fully incorporated and batter is glossy.
step-6: fold in flour gently until smooth.
step-7: fold in add-ins.
step-8: pour into greased 9x13-inch (23x33-cm) pan.
step-9: bake 25–30 minutes until toothpick comes out clean.
step-10: to make the caramel crispy rice, melt all your ingredients in a medium-sized heavy bottom sauce pan until boiling.
step-11: cook for 3 minutes on medium heat while stirring to prevent burning.
step-12: toss cereal until coated evenly, spread evenly onto lined sheet tray and allow to cool.
step-13: for the chocolate sauce, microwave the chocolate chips and heavy cream in 30-second intervals until smooth.
step-14: allow brownies to cool 15 minutes before drizzling ganache, oreos, and caramel rice.
step-15: cut and serve.

step-1: cut cheddar cheese block into small cubes.
step-2: place cold mashed potatoes into a large mixing bowl.
step-3: add green onion, chopped bacon, garlic powder, black pepper, and 1 egg - mix well.
step-4: with lightly floured hands - pick up a tablespoon sized ball of potato mixture and flatten into a small pancake.
step-5: place a cube of cheddar in the center and wrap the potato mixture around the cheese.
step-6: repeat.
step-7: in three separate bowls, add flour, remaining egg (whisked) and breadcrumbs.
step-8: coat the potato ball in flour, then egg, then breadcrumbs.
step-9: coat once more with egg and once more with bread crumbs.
step-10: set aside - store in fridge while you wait to fry.
step-11: in a medium pan heat oil over medium/high heat (to approximately 350˚f (180˚c).
step-12: fry the potatoes in batches until browned on all sides.
step-13: transfer fried potato balls to paper towels to drain excess oil.
step-14: sprinkle with salt.
step-15: transfer to a baking tray and bake in a preheated oven for 5 minutes at 400˚f (200˚c).

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: heat a small saucepan over medium heat and add the oil and flour.
step-3: whisk together and cook gently until it resembles wet sand, about 1 minute.
step-4: add the tomato paste and whisk.
step-5: add chicken stock, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, oregano, salt and pepper.
step-6: stir.
step-7: bring up to a simmer and cook about 5 minutes until sauce thickens.
step-8: remove from heat and set aside.
step-9: reserve ½ cup (120 ml).
step-10: toss the shredded chicken with about ½ cup (120 ml) of the reserved sauce.
step-11: place a layer of tortilla chips in a skillet or bake dish.
step-12: add a layer of cheese and half the chicken mixture.
step-13: drizzle some enchilada sauce over the top.
step-14: add a second layer of tortilla chips followed by another layer of cheese and the remaining chicken.
step-15: drizzle with sauce.
step-16: bake for 8-10 minutes until cheese is melted.
step-17: top with sour cream, diced tomato, cilantro, and crumbled queso fresco.
step-18: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: add the chicken breast to a bowl and season with salt, chili powder, garlic powder, and cumin.
step-3: in a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons vegetable oil and cook chicken until slightly charred and no longer pink.
step-4: cook chicken in batches to avoid overcrowding the pan.
step-5: remove cooked chicken from the skillet, and transfer into a bowl.
step-6: heat another tablespoon of oil, add the onions and cook for a couple minutes until onions are slightly translucent.
step-7: add the garlic and peppers and cook slightly, then remove from heat.
step-8: transfer garlic and peppers to the chicken bowl, then top with lime juice.
step-9: lay down half the tortilla chips on the skillet, followed by half the fajita mixture, and top with pepper jack and cheddar cheese.
step-10: repeat with the remaining ingredients.
step-11: bake until the cheese has melted, about 15 minutes.
step-12: add your choice of topping (optional).

step-1: place the eggs in a pot and fill with cold water until the eggs are just covered.
step-2: bring the pot to a boil, then cover, remove from heat, and let sit for about 12 minutes.
step-3: transfer the eggs to a bowl of ice water for about 3 minutes, then peel them and cut them in half.
step-4: transfer the egg yolks to a bowl, and set the cooked egg whites aside.
step-5: mix the sour cream, bacon, chives, cheddar cheese, salt, and pepper with the yolks and transfer to a piping bag.
step-6: (alternatively, use a zip-top bag with a corner cut off.)
step-7: pipe the mixture into the eggs, garnish with the bacon and chives, and serve chilled.

step-1: in a large bowl, mash the potatoes until there are no lumps.
step-2: add the cheddar cheese, cream cheese, bacon, scallions, salt, pepper, and onion powder.
step-3: mix until smooth.
step-4: transfer the mixture to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-5: smooth out the top.
step-6: lay a 1-inch (2-cm) square of cheddar cheese in the center of a slice of ham.
step-7: fold the edges of the ham over the cheese, making a tight parcel.
step-8: repeat with the remaining ham and cheese.
step-9: press a ham-and-cheese square into the potato mixture, making sure to leave 1 inch (2-cm) of space on all sides.
step-10: repeat with the rest of the squares.
step-11: push the potato mixture around to cover up and seal the tops of the ham squares, then smooth out again.
step-12: freeze for 30 minutes, then slice the mixture into squares so each square has a ham square in the middle.
step-13: place the flour, eggs, and panko into 3 separate medium bowls.
step-14: dip a square into the flour, shaking off any excess.
step-15: dredge in the egg, then in the panko.
step-16: repeat with the remaining squares.
step-17: heat the oil in a large pot until it reaches 350°f (180°c).
step-18: fry the potato squares two at a time until golden brown, about 4-5 minutes, then drain on paper towels.
step-19: garnish the potato dippers with shredded parmesan cheese and chopped parsley.
step-20: serve warm.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: lay 2 chopsticks about 2-3 inches apart on a cutting board.
step-3: place a potato lengthwise between the chopsticks, making sure the potato touches the cutting board.
step-4: make ¼-inch slices across the potato, making sure you do not cut through the bottom of the potato.
step-5: the chopsticks will help serve as a bumper of sorts to prevent this from happening.
step-6: repeat with the second potato.
step-7: transfer the potatoes to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper, then brush the butter evenly on both of the potatoes.
step-8: sprinkle a bit of salt and pepper on top of the potatoes, then bake for about 30 minutes until the slices of each potato have started to separate and crisp up.
step-9: to have a better separation between the slices, pull the slices apart before they are baked.
step-10: remove the potatoes and lower the oven heat to 350°f (180°c).
step-11: place a square of cheddar cheese in between the slits in the potatoes, then return to the oven and bake for about 10 minutes, until the cheese is melted and starting to bubble.
step-12: garnish each potato with a dollop of sour cream, bacon, and green onions.
step-13: serve and enjoy!

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: cut the potatoes widthwise about ⅛ inch (8 mm) apart, and ¼ inch (6 mm) from the bottom.
step-3: soak the potatoes in water for at least 15-20 minutes to remove some of the starch in the potatoes and to allow the cuts to open wider.
step-4: in a large bowl, mix together the cream cheese, 2 cups (200g) of cheddar, bacon, sour cream, and green onions.
step-5: once finished soaking, dry the potatoes off and place them around the inner rim of a larger cast-iron skillet.
step-6: heavily brush the potatoes with olive oil.
step-7: sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste.
step-8: place the skillet in the oven for an hour, or until the potatoes are cooked through and crispy on the top.
step-9: once finished, fill the middle of the skillet with the bacon cheddar dip.
step-10: top with the remaining cheddar cheese.
step-11: continue baking at 400˚f (200˚c) for 10-15 minutes or until the cheese is melted and golden brown .

step-1: in a large bowl combine mashed potatoes, bacon, chives, parmesan cheese, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
step-2: spray a 12-cup muffin pan with cooking spray.
step-3: divide the mashed potatoes evenly into each cup.
step-4: make a hole in the center of each mashed potato cup.
step-5: add shredded cheddar to the center of each cup.
step-6: bake mashed potato cups at 400ºf (200ºc) for 30-35 minutes or until outside is crispy and brown.
step-7: top with a dollop of sour cream, chives and bacon crumbs.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine cooked potatoes, sour cream, green onions, bacon, salt, and pepper.
step-2: mash the ingredients together until most of the potatoes are mashed.
step-3: (some chunks are good!)
step-4: cut cheese into ¼-inch (6 mm) strips.
step-5: take a spoonful of potatoes and make a ball.
step-6: place the cheese strip in the middle and wrap the potato around the cheese until it is evenly covered.
step-7: dredge the sticks in flour, egg, and panko.
step-8: option 1 - if you're going to bake, preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-9: option 1 - to bake: transfer dredged sticks onto baking sheet and drizzle olive oil and salt.
step-10: option 2 - fry in oil that is heated at 350°f (180°c) for 3 minutes or until golden brown.
step-11: option 1 - bake for 15 minutes or until cheese is completely melted in the middle and the outside is a light golden brown.
step-12: option 2 - transfer from oil to drying rack and season with salt.
step-13: let it cool for a few minutes as they will be hot.

step-1: combine the sour cream, cream cheese, and ranch seasoning in a large bowl and stir until smooth.
step-2: add in the cheddar cheese and stir until well-blended.
step-3: lastly, add in the crumbled bacon and the green onions and stir.
step-4: top off with extra green onions, bacon, and cheese and serve with potato chips, potato wedges, or fries!

step-1: preheat an oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: place a flour tortilla over an oven-safe bowl.
step-3: place another oven-safe bowl over it.
step-4: bake for 15 minutes.
step-5: remove the bowls and set the tortilla bowl aside.
step-6: in a shallow container, place olive oil, lime juice, cumin, paprika, garlic powder chili powder and salt.
step-7: mix well.
step-8: place the flank steak in the spice mixture, rubbing until fully coated.
step-9: marinate for 1 hour in the refrigerator.
step-10: heat a cast iron pan or stainless steel pan over high heat.
step-11: coat with olive oil and add the steak and sear for 6-8 minutes.
step-12: rest the meat for 5 minutes.
step-13: cut them into a bite size.
step-14: set aside.
step-15: in a medium size saucepan, melt the butter.
step-16: add the onion and cook until translucent, about 4-5 minutes.
step-17: add the jalapeños and cook for 3 minutes.
step-18: add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
step-19: sprinkle in the flour, and cook for 3 minutes, stirring constantly.
step-20: add milk and cook until the mixture has thickened, about 3-4 minutes.
step-21: add the cheddar cheese ½ cup (50 g) at a time.
step-22: stir constantly until the cheese is completely melted.
step-23: on a flat plate, spread tortilla chips.
step-24: place the tortilla bowl on top.
step-25: pour in the queso and top with chopped steak, chopped tomatoes, guacamole, sour cream and cilantro.

step-1: make the crust: in a large bowl, mix together the all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, and salt.
step-2: add the butter and, using a pastry cutter, work it into the flour until only pea-sized pieces remain.
step-3: add the water, starting with 3 tablespoons, and mix the dough with your fingers until it is moist enough to hold together.
step-4: add more water as needed, 1 tablespoon at a time.
step-5: turn the dough onto a clean surface, form into a disc, and wrap with plastic wrap.
step-6: refrigerate for 30-60 minutes.
step-7: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-8: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-9: while the dough is resting, make the filling: add 2 tablespoons of olive oil and the garlic cloves to a large, high-walled skillet over medium heat.
step-10: cook for 3 minutes, until the garlic just begins to brown.
step-11: add the onion and ½ teaspoon of salt.
step-12: cook for 20-25 minutes, until the onion is caramelized.
step-13: remove from the pan and set aside to cool in a bowl.
step-14: to the same pan, add the potatoes, ½ teaspoon of salt, and the water.
step-15: increase the heat to medium-high, cover, and cook for 3-5 minutes, until the potatoes are almost fully cooked and the water is nearly evaporated.
step-16: remove the lid and cook for 2 minutes more to completely evaporate the water.
step-17: remove potatoes from the pan and set aside to cool.
step-18: to the same pan, add the remaining tablespoon of olive oil, the red pepper flakes, and chard stems.
step-19: reduce the heat to medium and cook for 3 minutes, until the stems are softened.
step-20: add the chard leaves and remaining ½ teaspoon of salt and cook for 5 minutes, until wilted and reduced in volume by half.
step-21: remove the pan from the heat.
step-22: remove the garlic cloves from the caramelized onions and transfer to a small bowl.
step-23: mash with the back of a fork, then add to the softened goat cheese and stir to combine.
step-24: stir the onions into the pan with the sautéed chard.
step-25: assemble the crostata: roll the dough out on a lightly floured surface into a 12-inch (30 cm) wide circle, about ⅛ inch (3 mm) thick.
step-26: transfer the dough to the prepared baking sheet.
step-27: spread ½ cup (110 g) of the garlic goat cheese over the center of the dough, leaving a 2-inch (50 cm) border around the edges.
step-28: arrange half of the potatoes, slightly overlapping, over the goat cheese, then top with half of the swiss chard and onion mixture.
step-29: repeat with remaining potatoes and chard mixture.
step-30: fold the edges of the crust up and over the filling to create a rustic look.
step-31: brush the crust with the beaten egg.
step-32: top with dollops of the remaining goat cheese.
step-33: bake the crostata for 45-50 minutes, until the crust is golden brown.
step-34: let cool for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

step-1: preheat oven to 400ºf.
step-2: in a bowl, toss cauliflower with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
step-3: spread in an even layer on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-4: roast for 20–25 minutes, stirring halfway through, until edges of the cauliflower start to brown and florets are tender.
step-5: remove from oven, let cool for a few minutes, then transfer to a large bowl.
step-6: slice hard-boiled eggs in half, then slice each half into 4 pieces.
step-7: roughly chop the bacon slices.
step-8: add the eggs and bacon to the bowl, along with cheddar cheese and scallions.
step-9: in a separate bowl, whisk dressing ingredients together until smooth.
step-10: pour dressing over cauliflower and toss to coat everything well.
step-11: garnish with extra sliced scallions before serving.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: evenly slice sweet potatoes into rounds.
step-3: in a medium-sized bowl, toss rounds with 1 tablespoon of olive oil, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper until well-coated.
step-4: lay rounds flat on a parchment-lined baking sheet and set aside.
step-5: on a second parchment-lined baking sheet, season chicken breast with olive oil, salt, and pepper, to taste.
step-6: wrap the parchment around the chicken, folding at the edges.
step-7: bake the sweet potatoes and the chicken in the oven for 20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and juices run clear.
step-8: allow both to cool.
step-9: then, shred the chicken using two forks.
step-10: line the bottom of a medium-sized skillet with the sweet potato rounds.
step-11: top with shredded chicken, black beans, jalapeño if desired, and cheese.
step-12: broil for 5-10 minutes or until toppings are heated through and cheese is melted.
step-13: garnish with avocado, pico de gallo, and green onion, if desired.
step-14: serve immediately.

step-1: pierce each sweet potato a few times and bake at 400˚f (200˚c) for 50 minutes, or until soft.
step-2: let potatoes cool then cut in half lengthwise.
step-3: scoop out potato flesh leaving a thin layer of sweet potato inside, and add flesh to a medium bowl.
step-4: place skins back on baking sheet, drizzle with olive oil and bake at 400˚f (200˚c) for 10 minutes.
step-5: mash sweet potato flesh with milk, salt, and pepper until smooth and creamy.
step-6: remove sweet potato skins from oven, fill each with an equal amount of potato mixture and top with cheese.
step-7: bake at 400˚f (200˚c) for 15 minutes until the cheese is melted.
step-8: remove skins from oven and top with crumbled bacon.
step-9: serve with sour cream and chives.

step-1: preheat oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-2: take potatoes and poke them on all sides with a fork, then place on a parchment-lined baking tray
step-3: bake for 50 minutes, or until fork tender.
step-4: allow potatoes to cool, then cut off either end and cut in half lengthwise.
step-5: scoop out potato flesh leaving a thin layer of sweet potato inside, and add flesh to a medium bowl.
step-6: place skins back on baking sheet, drizzle with olive oil.
step-7: bake skins at 400˚f (200˚c) for 10 minutes.
step-8: mash sweet potato flesh with milk, salt, and pepper until smooth and creamy.
step-9: remove sweet potato skins from oven, fill each with an equal amount of potato mixture and top with cheese and diced tomatoes.
step-10: bake at 400˚f (200˚c) for 15 minutes until the cheese is melted.
step-11: allow to cool 5 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (175˚c).
step-2: in a large pot, over medium-high heat, bring lentils, broth, salt, pepper, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, and oregano to a boil.
step-3: once boiling, reduce to a simmer, cover and cook for 35 minutes.
step-4: once cooked, mix in the corn and black beans.
step-5: on a baking sheet, place a layer of tortilla chips, followed by the lentil mixture and cheese.
step-6: add another layer of tortilla chips, lentils, and cheese.
step-7: bake for 8-10 minutes, or until the cheese has melted.
step-8: top with lettuce, tomatoes, red onion, jalapeños, and guacamole, and cilantro.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: boil the lobster tails in salted water until just cooked through, about 12 minutes.
step-3: -- cook 1 minute per ounce (28g).
step-4: when cool, remove the meat and dice.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: toss the breadcrumbs with 1 tablespoon melted butter, 2 tablespoons parmesan cheese, and black pepper.
step-7: cook the pasta in salted boiling water until al dente, about 7 minutes.
step-8: drain and set aside.
step-9: in a large sauce pan, melt the butter over medium-low heat.
step-10: add the flour and whisk, cook about a minute.
step-11: add the cognac and whisk.
step-12: the mixture will thicken immediately.
step-13: slowly add the milk, while whisking.
step-14: increase the heat to medium and stir occasionally until it starts to bubble.
step-15: the sauce will thicken enough to coat the back of a spoon.
step-16: when it reaches this stage, add salt and pepper to taste.
step-17: add the sharp cheddar, comte and parmesan cheeses, one handful at a time, whisking to incorporate.
step-18: when one handful is melted, add the next.
step-19: when all the shredded cheese has been added, add the mascarpone and stir.
step-20: remove from heat.
step-21: toss the cooked pasta with the sauce and ½ of the lobster, reserving about ½ for the top.
step-22: pour into a bake dish, and top with reserved lobster and buttered breadcrumbs.
step-23: bake until golden brown and bubbly, about 10 minutes.
step-24: serve immediately.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the celery, ⅓ cup (80 g) of the mayonnaise, lemon zest, lemon juice, and chives.
step-2: season with salt and pepper.
step-3: stir in the lobster meat just to combine.
step-4: brush the inside of the hotdog buns with the remaining 2 tablespoons mayonnaise.
step-5: toast in a large skillet set over medium heat.

step-1: form “burger buns” with the leftover rice.
step-2: firmly pack rice into your desired thickness.
step-3: pan fry until both sides are lightly crisped.
step-4: brush soy sauce on both sides of the rice buns and continue to fry until it gets some color.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: form burger patties with ground beef, panko, onions, oyster sauce, worcestershire sauce and garlic.
step-7: heat pan over medium.
step-8: fry patties to your desired doneness.
step-9: set aside.
step-10: in the same pan, add mushrooms.
step-11: cook until soft.
step-12: pour in beef stock and soy sauce.
step-13: thicken with cornstarch slurry.
step-14: optional: if using eggs, preparing them sunny-side up or over easy will go well with this loco moco rice burger.
step-15: put the burger together.
step-16: start with the rice “bun,” then the beef patty, cover with gravy, top with an egg, sprinkle on some scallions, and top with another rice “bun.”

step-1: place salmon on a wire rack and season with salt on both sides.
step-2: cover and refrigerate for 2 hours.
step-3: take cured salmon out of the refrigerator, rinse and pat dry.
step-4: slice into cubes.
step-5: set aside in a bowl.
step-6: dice the cucumber and add into the bowl with the salmon.
step-7: dice the tomato and add into the bowl.
step-8: slice the scallion and add into the bowl.
step-9: dice the onion and add it into the bowl.
step-10: mix until combined.
step-11: in another bowl, combine the ingredients for the shoyu sauce.
step-12: add sugar as early as possible so all the grains are dissolved.
step-13: spoon shoyu dressing on poke bowl.
step-14: mix to coat.
step-15: in a small bowl, add cooked rice, top with poke ingredients, and spoon additional shoyu dressing to taste.
step-16: slice nori into small strips.
step-17: garnish with sliced nori and serve immediately!

step-1: in a blender or food processor, combine the yogurt, lime juice, pepper, and chili powder and pulse to combine.
step-2: add ½ of the avocado and blend until creamy.
step-3: in a medium bowl, combine the chicken, yogurt sauce, celery, the remaining ½ avocado, onion, and salt.
step-4: mix until well combined.
step-5: serve on low-carb bread and garnish with cilantro, or as desired.

step-1: in a large bowl, season the sirloin liberally with salt and pepper.
step-2: toss to coat.
step-3: heat a bit of oil in a large pot over medium-high heat until shimmering.
step-4: place half of the cubed meat in the pan, spacing out to avoid overcrowding.
step-5: sear on each side for 1 minute, until well-browned.
step-6: transfer the seared beef to a bowl and repeat with the remaining meat.
step-7: reduce the heat to medium.
step-8: add the onion, mushrooms, and a pinch of salt.
step-9: sauté until all of moisture has been release from the mushrooms and evaporated and the onions have caramelized, about 12 minutes.
step-10: add the beef broth and scrape up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan.
step-11: once the liquid has thickened slightly, mix a few tablespoons of the hot broth with the sour cream in a small bowl--this will temper the sour cream and keep it from curdling.
step-12: add the sour cream mixture to the broth and mix until incorporated.
step-13: once the liquid has thickened slightly, add the seasoned sirloin and any juices that have collected in the bowl.
step-14: stir the the contents of the pot until the meat has cooked through, about 5 minutes.
step-15: use a vegetable peeler to slice the zucchini into ribbons.
step-16: heat a drizzle of oil in a medium pan over medium-high heat.
step-17: add the zucchini ribbons and a pinch of salt and toss until the zucchini has wilted slightly, about 1 minute.
step-18: immediately transfer the zucchini to serving dishes to stop cooking.
step-19: top the zucchini with the stroganoff and a sprinkle of chives.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: make the biscuits: in a medium bowl, add the almond flour, baking powder, and salt.
step-4: whisk to combine.
step-5: in a separate large bowl, add the greek yogurt, eggs, and honey.
step-6: whisk to combine.
step-7: sift the dry ingredients through a fine-mesh sieve into the wet ingredients.
step-8: mix to combine until fluffy.
step-9: do not overmix.
step-10: using a large ice cream scoop or a large spoon, scoop dough onto the lined baking sheet, spacing evenly.
step-11: you should have about 6 biscuits.
step-12: (if the oven is not ready, keep biscuits in the refrigerator so that they do not spread out and flatten.)
step-13: bake for 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-14: make the gravy: drizzle a bit of oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat, then add the sausage and cook 7-10 minutes, or until browned.
step-15: reduce the heat to medium-low and add ¼ cup (25 g) of almond flour, the cayenne, paprika, rosemary, sage, salt, and pepper.
step-16: stir to combine, then add the milk.
step-17: simmer the gravy until it reaches your desired consistency, stirring occasionally.
step-18: you can add up to ¼ cup (25 g) more almond flour for a thicker, heartier gravy.
step-19: serve the gravy hot, poured over a warm biscuit.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: carefully separate 6 eggs, placing the yolks in a large bowl and the the whites in a medium size bowl.
step-3: place the 2 whole eggs in the large bowl with the yolks and add the oil.
step-4: beat together with a fork or whisk until smooth.
step-5: add the almond flour, baking powder, and a pinch of salt to the egg yolk mixture.
step-6: stir the mixture with a spatula until well incorporated and set aside.
step-7: add the cream of tartar to the egg whites and beat with a hand mixer until stiff peaks form.
step-8: use a rubber spatula to transfer ⅓ of the whipped egg whites to the almond mixture and gently fold the batter together.
step-9: add the next ⅓ of the whites to the batter and fold in until smooth.
step-10: gently fold in the remaining egg whites just until the batter is smooth and no white streaks remain.
step-11: line the bottom of an ungreased loaf pan with parchment paper and pour in the batter.
step-12: bake for 40 minutes, until the top has set and formed a golden crust.
step-13: let the loaf cool for 10 minutes before running a thin knife along the inside of the pan to release the sides of the loaf.
step-14: gently unmold the loaf from the pan and remove the parchment paper on the bottom.
step-15: let the cake cool at room temperature for 1 hour before slicing.

step-1: 1, preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: mix the shredded mozzarella and almond flour in a medium microwaveable bowl.
step-3: stir until combined, then add the cream cheese.
step-4: microwave for 1 minute.
step-5: take out and stir until a dough-like texture forms.
step-6: add the egg, cumin, and chili powder.
step-7: mix until everything is well incorporated.
step-8: place the dough between 2 sheets of parchment paper.
step-9: using a rolling pin, flatten dough into a thin layer.
step-10: the thinner the layer, the crispier the chips are!
step-11: take off the top parchment paper layer.
step-12: transfer the dough with the bottom piece of parchment paper to a baking sheet.
step-13: bake for 12-15 minutes, or until browned on the top.
step-14: remove from the oven and cut into squares with a pizza cutter or knife.
step-15: serve with your favorite dip.
step-16:
92 total carbs
65 dietary fiber
27 net carbs per serving
06g net carbs per serving (about 10 chips)

step-1: place the lime juice, water, avocado, greek yogurt, salt, and pepper in a blender and blend until smooth.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: add oil to a pan over medium heat.
step-4: add onions and peppers and cook until nearly soft, about 5 minutes.
step-5: add spinach and cheese and stir for another 2 to 3 minutes.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: add oil to a pan over medium heat.
step-8: add the egg whites to the pan and season with salt and pepper.
step-9: cook until set, about 2 minutes.
step-10: flip the eggs and let set for about 1 minute.
step-11: fill the egg whites with the pepper, onion, spinach, and cheese mixture.
step-12: roll up the egg white omelette.
step-13: top with avocado dressing, tomato, and cilantro.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: cut off the ends of the eggplant, then slice lengthwise about ⅛-inch (3-mm) thick.
step-3: sprinkle the eggplant slices with sea salt on both sides and let sit for 10 minutes to draw out moisture.
step-4: pat dry with paper towels to remove excess liquid.
step-5: lightly grease a griddle pan with olive oil and heat over medium heat.
step-6: grill the eggplant slices for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until grill marks are visible.
step-7: remove from the pan and set aside.
step-8: in a medium saucepan, heat a drizzle of olive oil over medium-low heat, then add the garlic and red pepper flakes.
step-9: sauté for about 3 minutes, until the garlic is fragrant but not browned.
step-10: add the crushed tomatoes and 1 teaspoon of salt, stirring well to incorporate the garlic and red pepper.
step-11: simmer for 10 minutes, reducing the heat if the sauce begins to bubble too much.
step-12: add the basil and stir to combine.
step-13: remove from the heat and set aside.
step-14: in a medium bowl, beat the egg, then add the ricotta, 1½ cups (150 g) of mozzarella, ¾ cup (80 g) of parmesan, and the italian seasoning.
step-15: mix well to combine.
step-16: assemble the lasagna.
step-17: in a 9x13-inch (23x33-cm) baking dish, add enough sauce to cover the bottom of the dish and spread in an even layer.
step-18: add a layer of eggplant slices, covering the bottom of the dish completely.
step-19: it’s okay if the eggplant slices overlap slightly.
step-20: add a layer of the ricotta mixture and spread in a thin, even layer.
step-21: repeat with the remaining ingredients, finishing with a layer of sauce.
step-22: sprinkle the remaining mozzarella and parmesan on top.
step-23: bake for 45 minutes, until cheese is fully melted.
step-24: turn the broiler on high and broil for 5 minutes, or until the cheese on top is browned and bubbly.
step-25: remove the lasagna from the oven and let rest for 15-20 minutes before serving to give the lasagna time to set.
step-26: serve garnished with fresh basil.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375°f (190˚c).
step-2: trim the ends off the eggplant, then slice into ½-inch (2-cm) thick rounds.
step-3: transfer the rounds to a baking sheet lined with paper towels and sprinkle with salt on both sides.
step-4: let sit for 10 minutes for the salt to draw out excess moisture from the eggplant.
step-5: in a medium bowl, whisk together the almond meal, italian seasoning, and a pinch of salt.
step-6: beat the eggs in another medium bowl with a splash of water.
step-7: add the rice flour to another medium bowl.
step-8: coat the salted eggplant rounds in the rice flour, then in the egg, letting any excess drip off, then in the seasoned almond meal.
step-9: set the rounds on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-10: lightly drizzle on both sides with olive oil.
step-11: bake the eggplant, flipping halfway through for even browning, for 30 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-12: while the eggplant is baking, make the sauce: heat a drizzle of olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat.
step-13: add the garlic and red pepper flakes and cook for 3-4 minutes, until the garlic is fragrant.
step-14: reduce the heat if the garlic is browning too quickly.
step-15: add the crushed tomatoes and stir to combine.
step-16: cover and simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent the bottom from scorching.
step-17: add the basil and stir to incorporate.
step-18: to assemble, spread a bit of sauce in the bottom of a 9x13-inch (23x33-cm) baking dish, then add a layer of baked eggplant.
step-19: top with more sauce and sprinkle with the mozzarella and parmesan cheese.
step-20: repeat with the remaining ingredients, using another baking dish if needed to make another single layer of eggplant.
step-21: bake for 10 minutes, then turn the broiler on high and cook for another 3 minutes, until the cheese is browned and bubbling.
step-22: serve garnished with more basil.
step-23: nutrition, per serving - calories: 424, total fat: 21 grams, sodium: 666 mg, total carbs: 41 grams, dietary fiber: 9 grams, net carbs: 32 grams, sugars: 12 grams, protein: 22 grams

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: melt mozzarella and cream cheese together in the microwave for 1 minute, stirring every 20 seconds, or until fully melted.
step-3: combine almond (or coconut) flour, baking powder, garlic powder, italian seasoning, and egg.
step-4: mix well, then stir in the melted mozzarella until fully incorporated.
step-5: stir in cheddar, then shape into a ball, cover, and chill for 30 minutes in the refrigerator.
step-6: dust a cutting board with a handful of almond (or coconut) flour.
step-7: cut dough into 4 even pieces and roll each piece into a ball.
step-8: cut each ball in half and place cut side down on a greased baking sheet.
step-9: bake for 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-10: assemble with desired sandwich toppings.

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: melt ¾ cup (75 g) mozzarella and cream cheese together in the microwave for 1 minute, stirring every 20 seconds, or until fully melted.
step-3: combine almond (or coconut) flour, baking powder, garlic powder, italian seasoning, and egg.
step-4: mix well, then stir in the melted mozzarella until fully incorporated.
step-5: shape into a ball, cover, and chill for 30 minutes in the refrigerator.
step-6: place chilled dough on a floured piece of parchment paper.
step-7: roll out into a circle about ¼- to ½-inch (6 to 13-mm) thick.
step-8: bake for 10 minutes, just until it starts to get golden brown.
step-9: top with tomato sauce, remaining mozzarella, and pepperoni, then bake again for another 5 minutes or until the cheese has melted.

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: melt ¾ cup (75 g) mozzarella and cream cheese together in the microwave for 1 minute, stirring every 20 seconds, or until fully melted.
step-3: combine almond (or coconut) flour, baking powder, garlic powder, 1 teaspoon italian seasoning, and egg.
step-4: mix well, then stir in the melted mozzarella until fully incorporated.
step-5: shape into a ball, cover, and chill for 30 minutes in the refrigerator.
step-6: dust a cutting board with a handful of almond (or coconut) flour.
step-7: cut dough into 4 even pieces and roll each piece into a log shape about 6 inches (15 cm) long.
step-8: place on a greased baking sheet.
step-9: sprinkle the rest of the mozzarella on top and a pinch of italian seasoning on each breadstick.
step-10: bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.

step-1: line an 8-inch (20 cm) square baking dish with parchment paper to hang over the edges.
step-2: make the crust: in a medium bowl, combine the almond flour, coconut oil, honey, cinnamon, and salt.
step-3: mix with a spatula until smooth.
step-4: transfer the crust to the baking dish.
step-5: use a spatula to smooth the crust into a thin, even layer covering the bottom of the pan.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: make the filling: open the cans of coconut milk and use a spoon to scoop the thick cream at the top of the can into a medium bowl.
step-8: set aside the remaining liquid for another use, such as in smoothies, soups, or sauces.
step-9: beat the coconut cream with a hand mixer until very fluffy, about 5 minutes.
step-10: add the lime juice and honey.
step-11: continue to beat until smooth and fluffy, about 2 minutes.
step-12: pour the filling over the crust and use a spatula to smooth out the top.
step-13: top with the lime zest.
step-14: freeze for at least 2 hours, until the filling has set.
step-15: grab the parchment on both sides and lift the frozen bar from the baking dish.
step-16: you may need to use a knife to release the edges or turn the dish upside down on a cutting board and tap on the bottom to release the block.
step-17: quickly cut the block into 16 2-inch (5-cm) square bars.

step-1: trim the ends of the zucchini, then use a vegetable peeler to peel into thin, flat noodles.
step-2: repeat with the sweet potato and daikon radish.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: in a wok or large pan over medium-high heat, combine the brown sugar, fish sauce, tamarind paste, 3 cloves of garlic, and the water.
step-5: cook until the sugar has dissolved and the sauce is slightly thickened, about 3 minutes.
step-6: remove the pan from the heat and transfer the pad thai sauce to a bowl until ready to use.
step-7: wipe out the pan.
step-8: heat a drizzle of coconut oil in the same pan over medium-high heat.
step-9: add the chicken thighs and cook for 4 minutes on each side, until browned and cooked through.
step-10: remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
step-11: add a bit more coconut oil to the pan, if needed, then add the shallot, chili paste, and remaining 3 cloves of garlic.
step-12: cook until the shallots are softened and the aromatics are fragrant, 2 minutes.
step-13: add the peanuts and bean sprouts, and cook for 1 minute, until the sprouts are softened.
step-14: add half of the reserved pad thai sauce and cook until thickened, 3 minutes.
step-15: add the vegetable noodles and chicken, and stir to coat with the sauce, adding more as needed.
step-16: add the cilantro, toss, and cook for 30-60 seconds, until the noodles are just warmed through but not soggy.
step-17: serve immediately garnished with more cilantro, bean sprouts, peanuts, and lime wedges.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: spread the sliced onion on half of the baking sheet and arrange tomatoes on the other half.
step-4: drizzle each side with 1 tablespoon olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
step-5: toss to coat.
step-6: roast in the oven for 10-15 minutes, or until the onion is caramelized and the tomatoes are browned in spots and just beginning to burst.
step-7: remove from oven and let cool.
step-8: in a small bowl, whisk together the shallot, dijon mustard, worcestershire sauce, honey, extra-virgin olive oil, red wine vinegar, salt, and pepper.
step-9: refrigerate until ready to use.
step-10: liberally season the steak all over with salt and pepper.
step-11: heat a cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat.
step-12: add the remaining tablespoon of olive oil to the hot skillet.
step-13: when the oil is smoking, add the steak to the pan.
step-14: sear for 5 minutes, or until a deep golden brown crust forms.
step-15: flip the steak and cook another 5 minutes on the other side.
step-16: sear the sides of the steak until golden brown, another 3-4 minutes total.
step-17: transfer the pan with the steak to the preheated oven for about 5 minutes, or until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of the steak reads 125-130˚f (51-54˚c) for medium-rare.
step-18: remove the steak from the oven and let rest for 10 minutes before slicing.
step-19: add the lettuce to a large bowl.
step-20: add the roasted tomatoes, roasted onion, walnuts, gorgonzola, and sliced steak.
step-21: toss well.
step-22: divide the salad between serving bowl and drizzle over the dressing.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: for the ground beef filling, combine ground beef, onion, garlic, tomato paste, tomato, egg, chili flakes, oregano, basil, sage, pepper, and salt in a large mixing bowl until fulling incorporated.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: remove the whole stem from the cauliflower making sure to leave the head fully intact.
step-5: boil the cauliflower in a pot of water over high heat for 8-10 minutes or until fork-tender.
step-6: remove the cauliflower from the pot and place on parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-7: carefully remove any remaining stem making sure there is space for the filling.
step-8: fill the head of cauliflower with ground beef mixture making sure to press the filling into the head of cauliflower.
step-9: cover inverted head of cauliflower with aluminum foil and bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until ground beef mixture is cooked through.
step-10: preheat oven to broil.
step-11: for the bechamel, melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat.
step-12: mix in flour and stir until mixture lightly browns, about 2 minutes.
step-13: stir in the milk and allow mixture to thicken, about 5 minutes.
step-14: add in the parmesan, salt, and pepper and mix until fully incorporated and has the consistency of a thick batter.
step-15: remove aluminum foil from stuffed cauliflower.
step-16: cover the cauliflower in bechamel sauce and a sprinkle of parmesan cheese.
step-17: broil for 5 minutes or until bechamel lightly browns.
step-18: garnish with more parmesan and fresh parsley.

step-1: make the crust: in a food processor, blend the oats into a coarse powder.
step-2: add the butter to a medium saucepan over medium heat and cook until nutty brown in color, 5-6 minutes.
step-3: once the butter has browned, add the ground oats, flour, salt, and water, and mix to combine.
step-4: let cool for 5 minutes.
step-5: transfer the crust mixture to a 9-inch (20 cm) tart pan, spreading evenly across the bottom and up the sides.
step-6: chill for 30 minutes.
step-7: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-8: make the filling: place the apples in a large microwave-safe bowl and squeeze the lemon juice over, then toss to coat.
step-9: microwave for 4 minutes.
step-10: cover with a plate and let steam for 5 minutes.
step-11: season the apples with the cinnamon and nutmeg, and toss to coat.
step-12: spread the applesauce over the bottom of the crust.
step-13: starting from the outside and working inward, arrange the apples in the pan in a circular pattern with the curved side up.
step-14: begin with the larger slices, overlapping slightly, and continue until the entire crust is filled.
step-15: brush the apples with the melted butter.
step-16: bake for 1 hour, checking occasionally.
step-17: if the edges are browning too quickly, cover gently with foil to prevent further browning as the tart cooks through.
step-18: if using, microwave the apricot jam for 20-30 seconds to melt.
step-19: use a pastry brush to paint the apricot jam over the warm tart for a nice, shiny finish.
step-20: let the tart cool to room temperature before slicing and serving.

step-1: boil water, add macaroni and cook until al dente
step-2: melt butter in a pan and mix 2 tsp flour into it.
step-3: add the milk gradually.
step-4: add both cheeses and cook until melted and the sauce is thick
step-5: season with salt and pepper.
step-6: add cooked macaroni and thoroughly cover.
step-7: refrigerate mixture for one hour.
step-8: take mixture out and form into balls on another plate.
step-9: refrigerate for 2 hours.
step-10: dip the solid balls in egg wash, then breadcrumbs.
step-11: fry in hot pan of oil until golden brown on both sides.

step-1: prepare macaroni according to package directions.
step-2: drain the macaroni in a colander and return to the pot.
step-3: add butter, cheddar cheese, parmesan cheese, american cheese, milk, salt, mustard powder, cayenne to the pot.
step-4: turn heat up to medium-low and stir until cheeses are melted and all ingredients are well combined.
step-5: remove the pot from the heat and pour onto a parchment paper-lined sheet tray.
step-6: spread evenly with a spatula, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
step-7: once cooled, use a ring mold or rounded container roughly 4-inches (10 cm) in diameter to cut out 6-8 “buns.”
step-8: place flour, eggs, and bread crumbs in three separate bowls.
step-9: dip each macaroni bun in flour, then egg, and finally bread crumbs, coating evenly.
step-10: preheat vegetable oil to 350°f (175°c).
step-11: place the macaroni buns gently in oil and fry 3-4 minutes, until golden brown.
step-12: remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towel-lined plate.
step-13: season hamburger patties liberally with salt and pepper.
step-14: in a cast-iron skillet over high heat, sear patties to desired doneness, flipping halfway through.
step-15: place burger between two mac and cheese buns and top with sliced onions and tomatoes.

step-1: preheat oven at 350°f (180°c).
step-2: mix the ground meat with the onion, parsley, egg, garlic, bread crumbs, salt, pepper, and cumin.
step-3: grab a tablespoon of beef, place ½ tablespoon of cream cheese and cover it with the beef to make a meatball.
step-4: add oil to a pan and cook the meatballs over low heat, let cool and remove excess fat.
step-5: in a muffin tin, place a spoonful of macaroni and cheese and distribute to make a cup, place a meatball in the center and add more macaroni on top.
step-6: add parmesan cheese to taste.
step-7: bake for 20 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: cook macaroni “al dente” according to package directions.
step-3: drain with cold water.
step-4: in a bowl, combine cottage cheese, cheese, sour cream, egg, and salt.
step-5: fold in macaroni.
step-6: grease a 2-quart (2 liters) casserole dish with coconut oil.
step-7: spoon mixture into casserole dish and sprinkle with extra cheese and paprika.
step-8: bake for 45 minutes.

step-1: in a large pot over medium heat, add butter and allow to melt.
step-2: once melted, add onion and cook until soft.
step-3: add flour, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and paprika, and stir until combined.
step-4: slowly add in milk, whisking as you pour.
step-5: cook for 3-5 minutes, whisking frequently until thickened.
step-6: add nutritional yeast and whisk to combine.
step-7: add cooked pasta to the sauce and combine well, adding a little more milk if necessary to reach desired creaminess and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f/200˚c.
step-2: remove macaroni and cheese (still frozen) from the packaging.
step-3: using a sharp knife, carefully cut into 8 equal-sized sticks.
step-4: unroll pizza dough.
step-5: using a pizza cutter, cut into 8 strips.
step-6: working quickly, wrap each mac and cheese stick with pizza dough, making sure not to leave any parts uncovered, and place onto greased baking sheet.
step-7: brush each with olive oil, sprinkle with parmesan cheese and italian seasoning
step-8: bake for 18-20 minutes, or until dough is cooked and golden brown.
step-9: remove from oven, allow to cool slightly.

step-1: combine pasta, water, and 1 pinch of salt in a microwave-safe mug and stir to combine.
step-2: microwave on high for 4-5 minutes, or until ninety percent of water has been absorbed.
step-3: add almond milk, vegan butter, nutritional yeast, and 1 pinch of salt, and stir well until combined.
step-4: microwave for 30 more seconds.
step-5: stir again and sprinkle on paprika to taste.

step-1: crush cheese puffs into a fine powder and set aside.
step-2: in a saucepan over medium heat, add the butter.
step-3: once the butter is melted, add milk, cheddar, mozzarella, and cream cheese.
step-4: whisk until all the cheese has melted and sauce is smooth.
step-5: pour cheese sauce over cooked pasta, stirring to ensure thorough coverage of the noodles.
step-6: cover and refrigerate the cheese-coated pasta for at least 2 hours, allowing for it to cool completely and for the cheese sauce to bind the pasta together.
step-7: this recipe also works well with leftover mac ‘n’ cheese.
step-8: using your hands, take the chilled mac ‘n’ cheese and form it into 1-inch (2 ½ cm) balls.
step-9: dredge the balls in flour, followed by egg before finally coating them in the powdered cheese puffs.
step-10: heat the oil to 350˚f (180˚c) and fry the mac ‘n’ cheese balls until the outside is crispy, about 2 minutes.
step-11: once done frying, transfer to a wire rack to drain.
step-12: lightly sprinkle with salt before serving.

step-1: make the macarons: in the bowl of a food processor, combine the powdered sugar, almond flour, and ½ teaspoon of salt, and process on low speed, until extra fine.
step-2: sift the almond flour mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a large bowl.
step-3: in a separate large bowl, beat the egg whites and the remaining ½ teaspoon of salt with an electric hand mixer until soft peaks form.
step-4: gradually add the granulated sugar until fully incorporated.
step-5: continue to beat until stiff peaks form (you should be able to turn the bowl upside down without anything falling out).
step-6: add the vanilla and beat until incorporated.
step-7: add the food coloring and beat until just combined.
step-8: add about ⅓ of the sifted almond flour mixture at a time to the beaten egg whites and use a spatula to gently fold until combined.
step-9: after the last addition of almond flour, continue to fold slowly until the batter falls into ribbons and you can make a figure 8 while holding the spatula up.
step-10: transfer the macaron batter into a piping bag fitted with a round tip.
step-11: place 4 dots of the batter in each corner of a rimmed baking sheet, and place a piece of parchment paper over it, using the batter to help adhere the parchment to the baking sheet.
step-12: pipe the macarons onto the parchment paper in 1½-inch (3-cm) circles, spacing at least 1-inch (2-cm) apart.
step-13: tap the baking sheet on a flat surface 5 times to release any air bubbles.
step-14: let the macarons sit at room temperature for 30 minutes to 1 hour, until dry to the touch.
step-15: preheat the oven to 300˚f (150˚c).
step-16: bake the macarons for 17 minutes, until the feet are well-risen and the macarons don’t stick to the parchment paper.
step-17: transfer the macarons to a wire rack to cool completely before filling.
step-18: make the buttercream: in a large bowl, add the butter and beat with a mixer for 1 minute until light and fluffy.
step-19: sift in the powdered sugar and beat until fully incorporated.
step-20: add the vanilla and beat to combine.
step-21: add the cream, 1 tablespoon at a time, and beat to combine, until desired consistency is reached.
step-22: transfer the buttercream to a piping bag fitted with a round tip.
step-23: add a dollop of buttercream to one macaron shell.
step-24: top it with another macaron shell to create a sandwich.
step-25: repeat with remaining macaron shells and buttercream.
step-26: place in an airtight container for 24 hours to “bloom”.

step-1: line a large baking tray with parchment paper.
step-2: in a medium mixing bowl, beat the egg whites with an electric hand mixer on medium speed until soft peaks form.
step-3: add ⅓ of the granulated sugar and with mixer on high, continue to beat until egg whites are stiff peaks.
step-4: add another ⅓ of the sugar and beat again until egg whites are back to stiff peaks.
step-5: repeat with last ⅓ of sugar, beating until whites are shiny and fluffy.
step-6: using a fine mesh strainer, sift together the almond flour, confectioners sugar, and espresso powder into the bowl with the egg whites.
step-7: discard any large pieces that remain in the strainer.
step-8: with a rubber scraper, fold the mixture into the egg whites, about 35-45 strokes, or until the batter falls on itself but a slight peak remains (do not overmix or batter will be too thin and runny).
step-9: fill a piping bag fitted with a round tip.
step-10: pipe batter onto prepared baking tray into 1 ½ inch (4 cm) disks.
step-11: lift and drop the baking tray onto a hard surface 2-3 times to smooth out the batter and knock out any air bubbles.
step-12: allow cookies to rest at room temperature for one hour, until a skin forms on the surface of the cookies.
step-13: preheat oven to 285˚f (140˚c)
step-14: to make the filling, beat the butter, confectioners sugar and vanilla extract until light and fluffy.
step-15: set aside.
step-16: after about one hour, gently brush the top a cookie with your finger to check that a skin has formed.
step-17: the batter should not stick to your finger, if it does, allow to set for an additional 15 minutes.
step-18: bake cookies in preheated oven for 15 minutes, or until the cookies peel away from the parchment when lifted.
step-19: allow the cookie shells to cool completely.
step-20: pipe the buttercream frosting onto the bottom side of a cooled shell and sandwich together with a similarly sized cookie.
step-21: dust with optional cocoa powder and serve.
step-22: *store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

step-1: melt the milk chocolate in the microwave in 20-second intervals, stirring until smooth.
step-2: open the fillable ornament and coat the inside with a lightly oiled paper towel.
step-3: pour the melted chocolate into one of the halves.
step-4: close the ornament, rotating the ball so that the chocolate evenly coats the entire surface.
step-5: continue slowly rotating for 5 minutes.
step-6: you may have to shake it a bit to get the chocolate to fill any holes.
step-7: place the ball in the freezer, then flip it after 2 minutes.
step-8: continue to flip it every few minutes, 2-3 more times.
step-9: the chocolate should be set by then.
step-10: freeze for 30 minutes.
step-11: remove the ball from the freezer.
step-12: carefully open the ornament and remove the ball.
step-13: work quickly and avoid touching the ball for too long with your warm hands.
step-14: if you want to be extra careful, immediately after unmolding, place the ball back in the freezer for a few minutes.
step-15: dip or run a flat-bottomed bowl in boiling water, then dry the entire bowl.
step-16: invert the bowl onto a flat surface, then place one side of the frozen chocolate ball on the hot bowl.
step-17: twist back and forth with a gentle motion, making sure that you’re not applying too much pressure to the ball, as it is very fragile.
step-18: use a paper towel to help insulate the ball from your warm fingers.
step-19: you may have to reheat and wipe off the bowl a few times as it will cool down a bit.
step-20: place the ball back in the freezer.
