step-21: on a large plate, stack the brownies on top of each other, then surround them with berries.
step-22: place a scoop of ice cream on top of the brownies, then slowly place the chocolate ball on top.
step-23: to cover up any holes or imperfections along the seam where the ball touches the plate, surround the base of the ball with more berries.
step-24: microwave the dark chocolate with the heavy cream in 20-second intervals until smooth and glossy.
step-25: pour the chocolate sauce over the ball in a circular motion.

step-1: in a microwave safe bowl, microwave the candy corn for 90 seconds, stopping to stir every 30 seconds, until smooth.
step-2: immediately add the peanut butter and mix together.
step-3: using a teaspoon, form mixture into little balls and place them on wax paper.
step-4: freeze for 15 minutes.
step-5: melt the chocolate chips in a microwave safe bowl - 90 seconds, stopping to stir every 30 seconds, until smooth.
step-6: roll the cooled balls in chocolate and return to wax paper.
step-7: decorate with additional chocolate, candy melts, or melted candy corn (optional) and place in the fridge to firm.

step-1: blanch the corn in a large pot of boiling water for 3 minutes.
step-2: remove the corn from the pot.
step-3: let the corn cool slightly, then slice crosswise into 2-inch (5 cm) pieces, about 4 per cob.
step-4: in a medium pot, melt the butter over medium heat.
step-5: add the tomato and cook until softened.
step-6: add the serrano chili, ground coriander, green chile powder, and turmeric and stir well.
step-7: add the coconut milk and bring to a simmer.
step-8: add the corn and lemon juice and stir well.
step-9: transfer the corn and sauce to a serving bowl and garnish with cilantro.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a wok or large skillet, pour the red wine.
step-3: add garlic and onion, and sauté until tender.
step-4: add the pork, and cook thoroughly.
step-5: add the cinnamon, 2 tablespoons mint, pepper, and parsley, and mix together.
step-6: in a small saucepan, melt butter.
step-7: add flour a little at a time, mixing constantly, until it forms a paste.
step-8: add milk a little at a time, whisking constantly, until fully combined.
step-9: add paprika, and stir until thickened.
step-10: in a large casserole dish, lay down half the ziti.
step-11: sprinkle on 1 cup (50g) of halloumi and 2 tablespoons mint.
step-12: top with entire pork mixture, then the remaining halloumi, mint, and pasta.
step-13: top entire mixture with the sauce, and cover with foil.
step-14: to prevent foil sticking to the sauce, place a toothpick in each corner of the dish to prop the foil up.
step-15: bake 45 minutes, then broil for 5-10 minutes.
step-16: let cool 15 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 325°f/160°c.
step-2: in a bowl, whisk the coconut oil and maple syrup until combined.
step-3: add the eggs, milk, and vanilla extract, and whisk until combined.
step-4: fold in the bananas, cinnamon, baking soda, salt, and flour.
step-5: bake 20-25 minutes.
step-6: cover and store up to 2 days.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c)
step-2: in a bowl, whisk all wet ingredients until fully combined.
step-3: add the dry ingredients and mix thoroughly.
step-4: divide mixture amongst the lined cups of a muffin tin.
step-5: top each muffin with berries.
step-6: bake 25 minutes.
step-7: store covered up to 2 days.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine bacon, 2 cups (200 grams) of cheese, onions, and garlic powder.
step-2: distribute half of the mixture to a small bowl.
step-3: spoon a heaping spoonful of bacon mixture at the bottom of each tortilla.
step-4: fold the ends of the tortilla over the mixture and continue to roll, tightly.
step-5: place tortillas seam side down into a greased casserole dish.
step-6: in medium bowl, whisk together remaining bacon mixture, 6 eggs, milk, salt, and pepper.
step-7: pour egg mixture over the top of the rolled tortillas.
step-8: cover with foil, and store in fridge overnight, or until ready to bake.
step-9: preheat oven to 350°f (180˚c).
step-10: bake enchiladas for 35-40 minutes, or until eggs are fully cooked.
step-11: remove the foil and top enchiladas with 1 ½ cups (150 grams) of shredded cheese.
step-12: bake for an additional 5 minutes, or until cheese is melted.
step-13: top with cilantro and avocado, if desired.
step-14: serve warm with tomatoes and salsa, if desired.

step-1: in a skillet thoroughly cook the sausage and eggs.
step-2: place mixture in the center of a flour tortilla.
step-3: top with cheese, and fold the edges inward to form a sealed pocket.
step-4: heat on a skillet, seam-side down.
step-5: flip and cook until golden brown.
step-6: or, freeze up to 1 month.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f/220°c.
step-2: in a bowl, combine hash browns, cheese, salt, pepper, and oil.
step-3: pack into the bottom half of the cups of a greased muffin tin.
step-4: bake for 15-20 minutes, until golden brown.
step-5: in a separate bowl, whisk eggs with the bacon, salt, and pepper.
step-6: pour into the top half of each muffin cup.
step-7: bake 15 minutes.
step-8: freeze up to 1 month.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: in a skillet, melt butter, and cook onion, garlic, carrots, and celery until tender.
step-3: transfer to a 9" x 13" (23 cm x 33 cm) disposable casserole dish, or split among 2 smaller dishes.
step-4: add chicken, rice, soup, stock, salt, and pepper.
step-5: mix thoroughly, and cover with foil.
step-6: bake for 30 minutes.
step-7: remove foil, top with bread crumbs if desired, and bake an additional 10 minutes.
step-8: or, bake for 30 minutes, let cool completely, cover, and freeze up to 2 months.
step-9: to reheat, let thaw in the refrigerator during the day.
step-10: bake as directed above.

step-1: in a large mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, and salt.
step-2: add the bread and toss so that all of the bread is saturated with liquid.
step-3: refrigerate the mixture and let it sit for at least 2 hours and up to overnight.
step-4: when you’re ready to bake the strata, preheat the oven to 375°f.
step-5: take the egg and bread mixture out of the fridge and add the tomatoes, chickpeas, basil, and goat cheese to the mixing bowl.
step-6: toss everything together to thoroughly combine.
step-7: heat olive oil in a large, oven-safe skillet over medium heat.
step-8: swirl the oil to coat the bottom and at least an inch up the sides.
step-9: pour the combined ingredients into the skillet, then use a spatula to spread everything evenly over the skillet, pressing the bread into a flat, even layer.
step-10: bake the strata in the preheated oven until the eggs are completely set and the edges are golden brown, 35 to 40 minutes.
step-11: take the strata out of the oven and let it sit in the pan for at least 15 minutes.
step-12: flip the cooled strata out of the pan and onto a cutting board, then slice it into four portions.
step-13: eat immediately, or let the strata cool completely before storing in an airtight container in the fridge.
step-14: note: to reheat the strata: microwave for 1 minute on high, or reheat in a 375°f oven for 5 minutes, just to heat through.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: cook lasagna noodles al dente.
step-3: in a skillet over medium heat, cook beef, sausage, onion, salt, and pepper until fully cooked.
step-4: add spinach and 1 cup of marinara sauce, and let simmer.
step-5: remove from heat.
step-6: in a bowl, combine ricotta, italian seasoning, and egg.
step-7: spread mixture over each lasagna noodle, then top with meat mixture.
step-8: roll up tightly and place in a disposable casserole dish.
step-9: let cool completely, then freeze up to 4 days.
step-10: to bake, let thaw in the refrigerator during the day.
step-11: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-12: top with remaining 2 cups of marinara, cover tightly, and bake for 40 minutes.
step-13: uncover, and top with mozzarella and parmesan.
step-14: broil an additional 5 minutes or until cheese is melted to your preference.

step-1: in a jar, layer yogurt, granola, and berries.
step-2: top with honey (optional).
step-3: refrigerate up to 2 days.
step-4: if you don’t want soggy granola, wait til you’re ready to eat the parfait to add it.

step-1: preheat the oven to 190°c (375°f).
step-2: place the pork in a bowl along with all the marinade ingredients.
step-3: combine and leave to marinade for 6-8 hours.
step-4: place the pork belly on a grill tray.
step-5: roast the pork belly in the oven for 20 minutes, turning halfway through.

step-1: heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
step-2: add the onion, green pepper, cilantro, and garlic.
step-3: cook until the onions are translucent, about 5 minutes.
step-4: add the cooking wine, diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, sofrito, recaito, spanish olives, cumin, salt, and pepper.
step-5: stir for 2-3 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
step-6: add the stew beef.
step-7: increase the heat to high and cook for 2-3 minutes, until the meat is cooked through.
step-8: add the chicken broth and water.
step-9: stir to combine.
step-10: add the chicken, corn, potatoes, and yuca.
step-11: stir well.
step-12: cover and cook over medium-high heat for about 45 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the meat is tender and the potatoes are softened.
step-13: reduce the heat to low and add the plantains.
step-14: simmer uncovered for 15 minutes, until the plantains are tender.
step-15: garnish the soup with cilantro and serve with halved avocados, rice, and lime wedges, if desired.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a medium saucepan over low heat combine peaches, cornstarch, water, lemon zest, lemon juice, and ½ cup sugar in a medium saucepan.
step-3: raise the heat to medium and cook until thick and bubbly, stirring often.
step-4: add the flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, and baking powder to a sieve and sift into a large bowl.
step-5: in a small bowl, combine sugar, milk, vanilla extract, almond extract, and 1 tablespoon of melted butter and stir to combine.
step-6: pour the wet ingredients into the dry and mix well.
step-7: grease a 12x8 inch (30x20 cm) (4.8 quart) baking dish with the remaining butter.
step-8: pour the batter into the bottom of the greased baking dish and smooth into an even layer with a spatula.
step-9: transfer the peaches gently by placing them on top of the batter.
step-10: do not stir.
step-11: bake for 50 minutes to 1 hour or until golden brown.
step-12: serve warm and enjoy!

step-1: in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, cardamom, and salt.
step-2: make a well in the center, then use a rubber spatula to mix in the egg and coconut milk until the dough comes together.
step-3: turn the dough out onto a floured surface and knead until smooth.
step-4: dive the dough into 4 portions.
step-5: roll out 1 portion of dough into a circle about ¼-inch (6 ml) thick.
step-6: cut into 8 triangles.
step-7: repeat with the remaining dough portions.
step-8: heat the oil in a large pot until it reaches 350˚f (180˚c).
step-9: working in batches, fry the mandazi for 2-3 minutes per side, until golden brown.
step-10: drain on paper towels.
step-11: serve as breakfast or a snack with 5.
step-12: kenyan coffee or chai.

step-1: crush the mango and basil in a jug.
step-2: add in simple syrup and stir.
step-3: serve ¼ of the fruit mix in a glass and add 1 shot of vodka.
step-4: top up with ice cubes and prosecco and garnish.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375ºf (190ºc).
step-2: generously coat a 12-cup muffin tin with nonstick spray.
step-3: stack the tortillas and cut off the edges so the tortillas are square.
step-4: then, quarter the squares so you have 12 small tortilla pieces.
step-5: press a tortilla square into each cup of the prepared muffin tin.
step-6: bake for about 10 minutes, until the edges of the tortillas are golden brown.
step-7: let cool for 5 minutes.
step-8: fill each cup with 1 tablespoon of avocado and 1 tablespoon of mango and top with 1 teaspoon of salsa verde.
step-9: garnish with cilantro

step-1: add avocado, blueberries, mango, and water, breast milk, or formula to a blender or food processor.
step-2: blend very well.
step-3: add more liquid as needed.
step-4: refrigerate up to 3 days or freeze up to 1 month.
step-5: note: check with your pediatrician before introducing new foods to children under 12 months.

step-1: to a blender add the mangos, mango sorbet, and lemonade.
step-2: blend until smooth
step-3: serve immediately to drink or freeze for 30 minutes to eat with a spoon!

step-1: preheat oven to 75˚c (165˚f) (or as low as your oven will go!)
step-2: chop the mango and squeeze into a glass.
step-3: blend the mango flesh until it forms a thick paste, a few bits are totally acceptable.
step-4: spread an even, thin layer of the fruit onto a baking tray lined with baking paper, smooth it out using a spatula or cake knife.
step-5: bake in the centre of an oven for 3.5 hours.
step-6: the mango should be a tiny bit springy but not too juicy or too dry, the edges will probably dry out more than the centre.
step-7: take the baking paper out of the tray and cut off the super dry edges on each side.
step-8: roll up the mango, including the baking paper and cut into segments about 1.5 inches (4 cm) apart.

step-1: add mangoes, cucumber, onion, green bell pepper, cilantro, lime juice, champagne vinegar, and salt to a food processor or blender.
step-2: while blending, slowly add the olive oil and continue blending until the mixture has reached your desired consistency.
step-3: transfer the soup to a large bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or overnight, to allow the flavors to deepen.
step-4: serve the soup chilled and garnish with a slice of cucumber, a slice of lime, and a sprig of cilantro.

step-1: place mango and honey in a food processor or blender and puree into a thick, smooth sauce.
step-2: pour the sauce onto a baking tray lined with a silicone baking mat and smooth into a thin, even layer.
step-3: bake for 6 hours at 175ºf (80ºc), until entire surface is just dry to the touch.
step-4: once cool, turn the baking mat onto a cutting board and remove the silicone baking mat.
step-5: roll the fruit sheet and cut into 1-inch (2 cm) pieces.
step-6: note: if your fruit sheet comes out a bit too dry and you worry that rolling will cause it to crack, simply cover the surface with a few damp paper towels for a few minutes and try again.
step-7: the moisture will rehydrate your fruit sheet just enough to be a flexible consistency.

step-1: cut the mango in half lengthwise, around the pit.
step-2: press the mango halves down along the edge of glass to separate the flesh from the skin.
step-3: add the mango to a blender, along with the sugar, milk, and yogurt.
step-4: blend until smooth.
step-5: pour the mango lassi into a glass.

step-1: preheat your oven to 190°c (375°f).
step-2: place biscuits into a ziplock bag and crush using a rolling pin until crumbled.
step-3: pour crumbs into a bowl, along with sugar and melted butter and mix until well combined.
step-4: pour crust mix into a 9-inch (23 cm) springform cake pan.
step-5: use a measuring up to press into the base and partially up the sides.
step-6: bake for 8-10 minutes, until lightly golden.
step-7: set aside to cool.
step-8: using a blender, puree mangos until smooth.
step-9: set aside.
step-10: in a large bowl, whisk together cream cheese and sugar until smooth.
step-11: add the eggs and egg yolk one at a time until combined.
step-12: mix in 500 milliliters (2 cups) mango puree, and lime zest, whisking until combined.
step-13: pour cheesecake filling into cooled crust.
step-14: lower oven to 160°c (325°f) bake for 1 hour.
step-15: remove cheesecake from oven and allow to rest for 15 minutes.
step-16: centre will still by jiggly.
step-17: increase temperature to 190°c (375°f).
step-18: in a small bowl, combine sour cream, 1 tablespoon sugar, and lime juice.
step-19: spread the sweetened sour cream on top of the cheesecake.
step-20: use remaining mango puree to decorate the top.
step-21: create your own pattern of dots, using a toothpick to swirl the pattern.
step-22: return cheesecake to the oven and bake for an additional 20 minutes.
step-23: turn the oven off and allow the cheesecake to cool inside with the oven door cracked for 1 hour.
step-24: cover the top of the pan with clingfilm and chill overnight in the fridge before serving.

step-1: combine all the ingredients above in a large bowl.
step-2: mix the dressing ingredients together and spread over fruit, mix well.

step-1: in a large bowl, whip the cream until soft peaks form.
step-2: add the condensed milk and passionfruit juice, then whip until smooth.
step-3: fold in the mango.
step-4: transfer the mixture to a baking pan or bowl, then freeze.
step-5: serve with more mango.

step-1: combine all ingredients in a blender, and mix until fully blended.
step-2: serve and garnish with a pineapple wedge.

step-1: in a large pitcher, combine the pineapples, mangoes, wine, brandy, and pineapple juice.
step-2: stir until mixed.
step-3: chill for at least 4 hours.
step-4: add the soda, then serve with a pineapple wedge on each glass.

step-1: pour all ingredients into a blender and blend until smooth.
step-2: garnish.

step-1: combine water, sugar, and mangoes in a pot over medium heat.
step-2: once the sugar has dissolved, simmer for 30 minutes and reduce.
step-3: pour simple syrup through a strainer and remove excess liquid, then let it cool to room temperature.
step-4: in a blender, combine simple syrup, pineapple, and the remaining mango.
step-5: blend until well-combined.
step-6: pour into an 8×8 inch (20x20 cm) baking dish and freeze for at least 12 hours.
step-7: take out of the freezer and let sit for 5-10 minutes before scooping.
step-8: serve.

step-1: mix all ingredients together in a large bowl.
step-2: serve with chips or as a topping on your favorite meal.

step-1: preheat gas grill on high heat.
step-2: using a sharp knife, slice the avocados in half by cutting in a straight line around the pit.
step-3: place the avocado half containing the pit in your hand and face it away from you.
step-4: gently stick the tip of the knife into the side of the pit and carefully pry it out of the avocado.
step-5: for a ripe avocado, the pit will pop out with little effort.
step-6: you can hold a kitchen towel in your hand and place the avocado in the towel for added protection from the edge of your knife.
step-7: place the avocado halves on a tray.
step-8: using a pastry brush, brush oil on each of the avocado halves.
step-9: place the avocados on the grill, flesh side down, and grill for 3-4 minutes, until grill marks appear.
step-10: remove the avocados and brush with honey.
step-11: in a small bowl, mix the mango, onions, jalapeños, cilantro, lime juice, and salt until well combined.
step-12: spoon the salsa into the avocados and serve.

step-1: in a large pot over high heat, combine the rice and water.
step-2: cover, bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low.
step-3: stir, re-cover and cook for 20 minutes.
step-4: remove the pot from the heat and set aside.
step-5: on a cutting board, cut a mango ¼-inch (6-mm) away from the stem on both sides.
step-6: take one side of the mango and make 3-4 cuts vertically and horizontally to create a grid.
step-7: put pressure on the skin side of the mango so the mango cubes pop out.
step-8: cut off all of the cubes of mango.
step-9: repeat with the rest of the mangoes.
step-10: set aside until ready to use.
step-11: in a medium saucepan over high heat, combine the coconut cream, sugar, and salt.
step-12: bring to a boil.
step-13: reduce the heat to low and cover for 10 minutes.
step-14: once sauce has thickened slightly, remove from the heat and set aside.
step-15: line a small bowl with plastic wrap.
step-16: scoop about 2 tablespoons of rice onto the plastic wrap.
step-17: push the rice against the sides of the bowl to create an even layer.
step-18: place 3 cubes of mango inside the rice.
step-19: using the plastic wrap, form the rice into a ball and twist the plastic wrap tightly.
step-20: unwrap and repeat with the rest of the rice and mango.
step-21: arrange the rice balls in a pile and pour the coconut cream sauce over them.
step-22: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, beat the egg.
step-3: add the butter and sugar, and mix.
step-4: add the flour and mix until combined.
step-5: the dough will be crumbly in your hand.
step-6: transfer the crust mixture into a greased 8-inch (20 cm) tart pan one handful at a time, pressing it down to create an even, thin layer over the entire pan, about ¼ inch (6 mm).
step-7: note: freeze and save remaining pie crust crumble for later.
step-8: prick the crust with a fork to prevent it from puffing up in the oven.
step-9: bake the crust for 30-40 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-10: on a cutting board, cut a half inch (1 cm) off the bottom and top off the mango to give it a flat base.
step-11: standing it upright, make exterior slices from the top to bottom to take the skin off.
step-12: remove the meat from the sides and thinly slice.
step-13: in a medium bowl, combine the cream cheese, greek yogurt, orange zest, sugar, orange juice, and vanilla extract.
step-14: mix thoroughly.
step-15: transfer the yogurt mixture to the cooled tart crust.
step-16: starting from the outer edge, place mango slices in a circular pattern, making full rotations all the way to the center.
step-17: chill the fruit tart for at least an hour.

step-1: place the sliced onions in a medium bowl with a heavy pinch of salt and vinegar.
step-2: let soak while preparing the other ingredients, about 1 hour.
step-3: peel the plantains and cut into quarters.
step-4: place the plantains in a large pot with enough water to cover them by 1 inch (2 cm).
step-5: add salt to taste.
step-6: bring the plantains to a boil over high heat and cook until they are very tender, about 30 minutes.
step-7: meanwhile, in a medium skillet, heat the canola oil to 350°f (180°c) over high heat.
step-8: coat each slice of dominican frying cheese in flour, and then place the slices in 1¾ cups (420 ml) canola oil and fry until both sides are golden brown, about 3 minutes.
step-9: remove from skillet and transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.
step-10: add another tablespoon of oil to the skillet and fry the salami until brown and crispy on both sides, 4 minutes.
step-11: remove from the skillet, transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.
step-12: wipe out the skillet, and add another tablespoon of oil to the pan.
step-13: pour in the onions and their soaking liquid.
step-14: sauté until the onions are soft and bright pink, about 10 minutes.
step-15: once the plantains are tender, scoop them out from the water and place in a separate large bowl, and keep the starchy boiling liquid warm on the stove.
step-16: add the butter and about 1 cup (240 ml) of the hot starchy plantain liquid.
step-17: mash the cooked plantains together until it is creamy and smooth.
step-18: add more liquid as needed.
step-19: serve the mangú with the fried cheese, fried salami, avocado, and fried eggs.
step-20: garnish with pickled onions.

step-1: lay 3 slices of bacon on a greased pan.
step-2: bake for 20 minutes at 400°f (200°c), flip once halfway through.
step-3: dab off any extra oil and brush maple syrup on both sides of the bacon.
step-4: bake for an additional 3-5 minutes (until the bacon is crispy).
step-5: cut up the bacon into small pieces and set aside for garnishing the soup later.
step-6: melt 1 tbsp.
step-7: of butter.
step-8: add in the onion, stir, and cook on medium heat until fragrant.
step-9: add in the sweet potatoes, chicken broth, and spices.
step-10: cover and bring to a boil.
step-11: let simmer for 15-20 minutes until the potatoes have softened.
step-12: add 2 tbsp of maple syrup and stir.
step-13: then blend with an immersion blender or transfer to a blender and blend in batches until smooth and well-combined.
step-14: serve up and garnish with heavy cream (optional), the maple bacon, and a sprinkle of cinnamon (optional).

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: carefully dry the chickpeas.
step-3: removing the skins is optional and they will come off easily.
step-4: the drier you get them, the crunchier they’ll be!
step-5: in a medium bowl, add dried chickpeas, olive oil, maple syrup, salt and cinnamon.
step-6: toss well to coat evenly.
step-7: spread chickpeas out on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-8: roast for 15-20 minutes.
step-9: mix around on baking sheet and roast for additional 15-20 minutes, or until browned.
step-10: cool for 5-10 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: place brussels sprouts and baby carrots separately on a foil-lined baking sheet with room in the center for the pork.
step-3: drizzle with olive oil.
step-4: sprinkle with sea salt and pepper.
step-5: mix to combine.
step-6: place pork in center of baking sheet.
step-7: sprinkle with sea salt and pepper.
step-8: rub to combine and add the rosemary sprigs on top of the pork.
step-9: bake in oven for 40 minutes, or until internal temperature of the pork reaches 145˚f (63˚c).
step-10: let pork rest 5-10 minutes.
step-11: while pork is resting, mix olive oil, balsamic vinegar, and maple syrup in a small saucepan.
step-12: cook on medium heat until sauce thickens and reduces by ⅓, about 3-4 minutes.
step-13: immediately spoon reduced sauce on the pork.

step-1: for the salmon, heat vegetable oil on medium-high in a cast-iron skillet.
step-2: for the broccoli, fill a medium pot halfway with water.
step-3: add a dash of salt and start boiling water.
step-4: in the meantime, whisk together maple syrup, orange juice, soy sauce, garlic, salt, and pepper in a medium bowl.
step-5: set aside 2 tablespoons for topping later.
step-6: place salmon fillets inside the bowl and make sure each side is covered with sauce.
step-7: sear the salmon 2-3 minutes on each side.
step-8: brush the tops with the sauce set aside.
step-9: with the pot of water boiling, add the broccoli and cover lid.
step-10: blanch for 2 minutes.
step-11: drain under cold water to stop the cooking.
step-12: in the drained pot of broccoli, stir in butter, soy sauce, red pepper flakes, some lemon zest, and garlic on low heat.
step-13: mix until broccoli is well-coated.
step-14: on each plate, serve a filet of salmon and scoop of broccoli.
step-15: top with reserved marinade and sprinkle parsley for garnish.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: peel the apple and cut in half.
step-3: using a melon baller, carve out the core of the apple halves.
step-4: using a sharp knife, make vertical incisions into the apple, about a quarter of an inch apart, without cutting all the way through the apple halves.
step-5: (you can use a set of chopsticks as safety bumpers to make sure that your knife can’t cut all the way through.)
step-6: in a small bowl, mix together the maple syrup, nutmeg, and cinnamon.
step-7: use a pastry brush to coat the apple halves with the maple spice mixture.
step-8: bake for 30 minutes until the apples are tender and lightly browned.
step-9: top each apple half with a small scoop of frozen yogurt and a sprinkle of chopped almonds and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: add the acorn squash to a baking sheet and season with salt, pepper, maple syrup, and two tablespoons of olive oil.
step-3: toss to coat, then spread in a single layer.
step-4: bake for one hour, or until the squash is tender and golden brown.
step-5: heat the remaining two tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
step-6: add the onion, celery, fennel, and garlic and season with salt and pepper.
step-7: cook until soft, about 10 minutes.
step-8: add the sausage and sage, stir, and cook until the vegetables are fully softened and the meat is browned.
step-9: transfer the sausage and vegetable mixture to a large rectangle baking dish.
step-10: add the roasted squash, cubed bread, cranberries, and hazelnuts.
step-11: toss to combine.
step-12: in a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, whisk together the eggs, chicken broth, pepper, and salt.
step-13: pour the egg mixture over the stuffing, then toss well to distribute and coat everything evenly.
step-14: bake for 1 hour, or until the stuffing puffs up, browns, and dries slightly.
step-15: let sit for 10 minutes before serving.

step-1: place butter, french’s spicy brown mustard, maple syrup, apple cider vinegar, orange juice, ½ teaspoon salt, and paprika in a small pot.
step-2: heat over low heat and whisk until butter has fully melted and the sauce starts to simmer.
step-3: continue simmering for a few minutes until sauce reduces to a glaze.
step-4: remove from heat and set aside.
step-5: rub salmon with olive oil and sprinkle evenly with 1 teaspoon salt.
step-6: drizzle with a bit of the glaze.
step-7: heat an oiled grill pan (or heat up a grill) over high heat.
step-8: when hot, place the salmon flesh-side down into the pan.
step-9: cook until the salmon has clear grill marks, then carefully flip to cook on the other side.
step-10: brush with more glaze.
step-11: once salmon is cooked to your liking, remove from pan.
step-12: for salsa, lightly toss peach, avocado, jalapeño, cilantro, lime juice, and pinch of salt in bowl.
step-13: top the salmon fillets with the peach-avocado salsa and serve immediately.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: grease and line 3 9-inch (20 cm) round cake pans with parchment paper.
step-3: set aside 1 bowl of cake batter – this will be the white part of the cake.
step-4: add 2 teaspoons of red food coloring to another bowl of batter, mixing until fully incorporated.
step-5: add 2 teaspoons of blue food coloring to the last bowl of batter, mixing until fully incorporated.
step-6: take 1 cup (115 g) of each batter and carefully pour into each of the 3 cake pans.
step-7: repeat, alternating colors, until all of the batter is used.
step-8: gently stir to blend the colors in each pan.
step-9: bake according to package instructions, or until a toothpick inserted in the center of a cake comes out clean.
step-10: line a baking sheet with parchment paper and lay 3 wooden skewers 4 inches (10 cm) apart.
step-11: in a small heat-proof bowl, melt the red hard candies in the microwave for 1 minute.
step-12: using a small spoon, carefully drizzle the red candy in a star pattern over the skewers.
step-13: cool for 5 minutes.
step-14: in another small glass bowl, melt the blue hard candies in the microwave for 1 minute.
step-15: using a small spoon, carefully drizzle the blue candy in a star pattern over the red candy.
step-16: cool for 10 minutes before gently prying away from the parchment.
step-17: remove all the cakes from the pans and let cool completely before continuing.
step-18: with a serrated knife, removed the domed tops from each cake layer and set aside the excess cake.
step-19: place a dab of frosting on a cake stand or an inverted plate.
step-20: place a layer of cake on the cake wheel, then evenly spread frosting on top.
step-21: place the next layer of cake on top of the frosted layer, and spread frosting on top.
step-22: add the last cake layer.
step-23: add 1 cup (115 g) of frosting on top of the cake, spreading evenly across the top and sides with a spatula.
step-24: dab the blue and red frosting around the sides cake, alternating from top to bottom, about 3 inches (7 cm) apart.
step-25: using a spatula, smear the red and blue frosting onto the sides of the cake.
step-26: place the firework skewers on top of the cake.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: in a medium-size bowl mix together the beef, pork, bread crumbs, onion, parsley, garlic, eggs, salt, and pepper until just combined.
step-3: take a walnut size of the meat mixture and roll into a ball.
step-4: repeat with remaining meat and transfer to an oiled rack on a sheet tray.
step-5: bake meatballs for 15 minutes, until golden brown.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: add a little oil to a pan on medium-high heat and cook the onions and garlic until they are deeply caramelized.
step-8: add in the oregano, parsley, basil, red pepper flakes, tomato paste, and tomato sauce.
step-9: stir the mixture and bring to a simmer for 5 minutes.
step-10: add the meatballs and coat them with the sauce.
step-11: sprinkle with parmesan cheese, poke with toothpicks, and serve!

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: add the piloncillo and water to a small saucepan over medium heat and cook for 10 minutes, until the sugar is completely dissolved and big brown bubbles form.
step-4: remove from the heat and set aside to cool.
step-5: sift the flour, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon into a large bowl.
step-6: add the butter and mash into the flour with a fork until combined.
step-7: add the orange zest and stir to incorporate.
step-8: push the dry ingredients to the sides of the bowl to make a well.
step-9: add the vanilla, 1 egg, and cooled piloncillo syrup to the center.
step-10: using a fork, slowly mix the dry ingredients into the center until everything is evenly combined.
step-11: cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate the dough for 30 minutes.
step-12: lightly flour a clean surface and roll out the dough to a rectangle about ¼ inch (6 ½ mm) thick.
step-13: re-roll any dough scraps and cut out more cookies.
step-14: using a 2½-inch (6 ½ cm) pig cookie cutter, cut out cookies and transfer to the prepared baking sheet.
step-15: beat the remaining egg, then brush over the cookies.
step-16: bake for 8–10 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
step-17: let the cookies cool before serving.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: unwrap hershey’s kisses.
step-3: set aside for later.
step-4: lightly dampen marshmallows by patting down with a wet paper towel, or dipping them into a small bowl of water.
step-5: coat well in sprinkles.
step-6: set aside to dry.
step-7: combine flour, baking soda, and salt.
step-8: mix together butter and sugar until creamy.
step-9: add egg, vanilla, and milk.
step-10: mix until well combined.
step-11: add flour mixture and combine well.
step-12: scoop tablespoon-sized amounts onto a parchment-lined cookie sheet.
step-13: bake for 10-12 minutes.
step-14: make a small indention.
step-15: place a marshmallow in the divot.
step-16: bake for 2 - 2½ minutes.
step-17: remove from oven and press hershey’s kisses in the center of the marshmallow.
step-18: let cool.

step-1: crush all graham crackers into large chunks.
step-2: around the size of a quarter works best.
step-3: microwave marshmallows and butter together in a large bowl for about two minutes, stopping to stir after one and a half minutes.
step-4: marshmallows should still be a little fluffy, but fully combined with the butter.
step-5: add graham crackers to marshmallows and mix until crackers are well coated.
step-6: place mixture in a large dish and spread evenly.
step-7: microwave chocolate chips for 60 seconds, stopping after 30 seconds to check and stir.
step-8: if still not melted, microwave in 15 second increments until melted.
step-9: cover with melted chocolate.
step-10: cut into equal pieces.

step-1: preheat oven to 180°c (350°f).
step-2: spread out the fries on a baking tray and bake for 20 minutes.
step-3: while the fries are baking, prepare the masala.
step-4: heat a large skillet over medium heat and add the oil and butter.
step-5: stir in the ginger garlic paste and fry for a couple of minutes.
step-6: add the onion and fry for a few minutes until soft.
step-7: sprinkle in the chili powder, ground cumin, ground coriander, salt, and lemon juice and stir continuously for another minute.
step-8: pour in the chopped tomatoes and fry for several more minutes, until the sauce has thickened.
step-9: add the fries to the pan and stir until evenly coated.
step-10: drizzle some yogurt on top and garnish with fresh coriander.

step-1: in a pot over high heat, add the potatoes and garlic and cover with cold water.
step-2: bring the potatoes to a boil, reduce the heat and simmer until fork tender, about 20 minutes.
step-3: drain the potatoes in a colander and return to the pot.
step-4: add the butter, milk, salt and pepper.
step-5: mash until smooth.
step-6: add in the parsley and mix until combined.
step-7: transfer the potatoes to a piping bag or ziplock bag.
step-8: on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, place the provolone slices.
step-9: pipe the mashed potatoes on top of the rounds starting from the outside to the center of the cheese.
step-10: freeze until solid, about 1 hour.
step-11: place the egg and panko in two bowls.
step-12: place the frozen potato round in the egg ensuring it’s completely submerged.
step-13: place the potato round in the panko and flip to cover completely.
step-14: if necessary repeat process putting potato back into the egg and once more in the panko.
step-15: in a large pot, heat oil to 350°f (180°c).
step-16: place the potato in oil and fry until both sides are golden brown, about 2 minutes per side.
step-17: set the mashed potato rounds on a wire rack to drain.
step-18: in a bowl, add the ground beef, season with salt, onion powder, and pepper.
step-19: mix until combined.
step-20: form patties with your hand about the size of your palm.
step-21: lay the bacon two strips overlapping and two strips perpendicular.
step-22: place the burger patty on the bacon and fold over the bacon strips, trimming if necessary.
step-23: heat a pan over medium heat and add the bacon patties and cook until cooked through.
step-24: assemble the burger by placing one potato “bun” on the bottom.
step-25: spread with ketchup or your favorite sauce.
step-26: build with lettuce, patty, red onion and top potato bun.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: place butter crackers in a food processor and blend until they are a fine, sandy texture.
step-3: transfer to a small mixing bowl.
step-4: add egg and melted butter to the crumbled crackers.
step-5: stir until crumbs become a clumpy, wet sand texture.
step-6: place the cracker mixture in the base of a 9-inch (22-inch) pie dish to create the crust.
step-7: use a measuring cup to smooth the surface.
step-8: once the surface is smooth, use a fork to prick the base and sides of the crust.
step-9: bake for 10 minutes.
step-10: remove from oven and let cool for 10 minutes.
step-11: mash russet potatoes in a large mixing bowl.
step-12: once thoroughly mashed, add butter, ¼ cup(60 gram) sour cream, milk, salt and pepper and mix together with large spoon or spatula.
step-13: spread half of the mashed potatoes over the cooled cracker crust, about ¼-inch in thickness.
step-14: cover mashed potatoes with a layer of cheddar cheese, making sure to save some for the top.
step-15: spread the other half of mashed potatoes over the cheese layer.
step-16: sprinkle bacon bits and remaining cheese over the top.
step-17: bake for 20 minutes.
step-18: serve with sour cream and green onions.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: place cooked potatoes into a large bowl.
step-3: add butter, salt, pepper, parmesan, and a splash of milk.
step-4: mash and add more milk gradually until the potatoes are the desired texture.
step-5: set aside and let cool.
step-6: prepare the glaze by mixing ketchup, brown sugar, onion powder, mustard powder, and paprika in a bowl.
step-7: reserve half in a separate bowl to glaze once cooked.
step-8: add oil in a skillet over medium heat, followed by onions and garlic.
step-9: cook until onions are translucent and fragrant.
step-10: set aside in a bowl to cool before adding to the meat mixture.
step-11: in a large bowl, combine ground beef, salt, pepper, worcestershire sauce, parmesan, parsley, cooled onions & garlic, egg, breadcrumbs and milk.
step-12: mix until combined.
step-13: using a spoon or ice cream scooper, scoop the meat mixture and place into a greased 12 cup cupcake baking tin.
step-14: using your fingers, spread the meat from the center to make a cup.
step-15: fill the middle with a small spoonful of mashed potatoes, and cover back up with the meat mixture.
step-16: generously brush half of the reserved glaze on top of the meatloaf cups generously.
step-17: bake for 25 minutes, reapplying the glaze halfway through.
step-18: once they are done cooking, brush with the remaining glaze that has not been used on the raw meatloaves.

step-1: add the potatoes, garlic cloves, and 1 teaspoon of salt to a pot and cover with water.
step-2: bring to a boil over high heat, until the potatoes are fork-tender.
step-3: drain the potatoes and garlic in a colander, and transfer to a bowl.
step-4: use a fork or potato masher to mash the potatoes.
step-5: add ½ tablespoon of butter, sour cream, parmesan, and 2 teaspoons of salt to the potatoes and stir to combine.
step-6: in a small pan, on medium heat, add 1 tablespoon of butter.
step-7: add the shallot, a pinch of salt, and pepper and stir.
step-8: once the shallots are golden brown, add the thyme and remove from the heat.
step-9: add the shallot mixture to the bowl of potatoes and mix to combine.
step-10: place 1 tablespoon of the potato mixture in the center of a wonton wrapper.
step-11: wet the tip of your finger and brush the edges of the wrapper, folding it in half on the diagonal, pressing down to secure both sides.
step-12: repeat with the remaining potato mixture.
step-13: in a large pot, heat oil to 350˚f (180˚f).
step-14: fry the wontons in small batches until golden brown.
step-15: transfer the wontons to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.
step-16: serve with sour cream.

step-1: in a large mason jar, combine the basil, garlic, pine nuts, salt, pepper, parmesan, lemon juice, and olive oil.
step-2: shake to combine.
step-3: store in the fridge for up to a week.
step-4: add to a hot pan with food as you wish!

step-1: in a large mason jar, combine the melted butter, minced garlic, grated parmesan, white pepper, sour cream, heavy cream, and salt.
step-2: shake to combine.
step-3: store in the fridge for up to a week
step-4: add to a hot pan with food as you wish!

step-1: in a large mason jar, combine the honey, molasses, onion powder, garlic powder, smoked paprika, black pepper, salt, worcestershire sauce, dijon mustard, apple cider vinegar, and ketchup, and shake to combine.
step-2: store in the fridge for up to a week
step-3: add to a hot pan with food as you wish!

step-1: in a large mason jar, combine the tahini, basil, cilantro, parsley, cumin, black pepper, salt, lemon juice, honey, olive oil, and water.
step-2: shake to combine.
step-3: store in the fridge for up to a week
step-4: add to a hot pan with food, or serve over salad as you wish!

step-1: in a large mason jar, combine the tomato paste, salt, garlic powder, onion powder, cumin, chile powder, chipotle peppers, masa harina, dark cocoa powder, almond butter, and chicken broth.
step-2: shake to combine.
step-3: store in the fridge for up to a week

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper, season chicken with olive oil, salt, pepper, and oregano.
step-3: on a separate baking sheet lined with parchment paper, add veggies and season with olive oil, salt, pepper, chili powder, and oregano.
step-4: bake chicken and veggies in the oven for 15 minutes.
step-5: meanwhile, on a separate baking sheet lined with parchment paper, add shrimp and season with olive oil, salt, pepper, chili powder, oregano, and lime juice.
step-6: remove roasted veggies from oven.
step-7: add the shrimp to the oven and cook with the chicken for 5-7 minutes, or until both the shrimp and chicken are fully cooked.
step-8: prepare chili lime vinaigrette dressing and split the dressing between two quart-sized mason jars.
step-9: add roasted veggies to both mason jars and then add shrimp on top.
step-10: you may need to push everything down in the jar gently to make room for the mixed greens.
step-11: fill the top with as much mixed greens as you can fit and close jar with lid.
step-12: set aside in fridge.
step-13: prepare lemon pepper vinaigrette dressing and split between two quart-sized mason jars.
step-14: add in fresh veggies and top with sliced chicken.
step-15: fill the top with as much mixed greens as you can fit and close jar with lid.
step-16: store both salads in the fridge for up to 4 days.
step-17: to serve, pour out contents into a large bowl and mix everything together.

step-1: in a large mason jar, combine the tomato paste, garlic, salt, pepper, basil, oregano, parsley, and crushed tomatoes.
step-2: shake to combine.
step-3: store in the fridge for up to a week
step-4: add to a hot pan with food as you wish!

step-1: in a large mason jar, combine the sesame oil, scallions, garlic, ginger, sesame seeds, sugar, soy sauce, mirin, and sake.
step-2: shake to combine.
step-3: store in the fridge for up to a week
step-4: add to a hot pan with food as you wish!

step-1: in a large mason jar, combine the peanut butter, garlic, ginger, fish sauce, soy sauce, scallions, sriracha, and water.
step-2: shake to combine.
step-3: store in the fridge for up to a week
step-4: add to a hot pan with food as you wish!

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: lay out 12 mason jar lid rings upside down on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-3: spray rings thoroughly with cooking spray.
step-4: mix cans of beans, bbq sauce, seasoned salt, egg, and panko in food processor until it becomes a thick paste.
step-5: mix cornbread batter/mix - it should be fairly thick
step-6: fill 4 rings with bean mix (they can be compacted to the rim of the ring).
step-7: fill 8 rings with cornbread batter.
step-8: (do not completely fill.
step-9: leave a small amount of room at the top to allow for rise, making sure the spread batter evenly throughout ring.)
step-10: bake 20-25 minutes or until cornbread is golden brown and burgers are lightly browned.
step-11: mix all ingredients for the spicy mayo and store in a refrigerator until ready to use.
step-12: assemble burger including any additional ingredients desired (we used sautéed kale, but also suggest collard greens or spinach).

step-1: in a large mason jar, combine the green curry paste, sugar, turmeric, fish sauce, and coconut milk.
step-2: shake to combine.
step-3: store in the fridge for up to a week
step-4: add to a hot pan with food as you wish!

step-1: put all ingredients into a blender and mix until smooth.
step-2: serve in a glass and garnish with toppings (optional).

step-1: in a medium bowl, mix the yogurt, almond milk, vanilla, honey, chia seeds, and matcha powder together until well combined.
step-2: pour the mixture into an airtight container and refrigerate, covered for 4 hours.
step-3: spoon the pudding into desired serving dish and top with chocolate shavings and a dusting of matcha powder.

step-1: start with the filling.
step-2: pour the milk into a small saucepan, and sprinkle over the cornstarch, whisk until combined.
step-3: next, add the honey and sugar stirring continuously over a low heat.
step-4: when the milk mixture almost starts to boil it will thicken and get a bit lumpy, don't panic!
step-5: just keep stirring until it smooths out.
step-6: continue to stir the now thick milk mixture over the heat for an additional 1-2 minutes, to cook out the cornstarch flavor.
step-7: take off the heat and pour into a bowl or shallow dish.
step-8: cover the mixture with cling wrap, pushing it all the way to the top of the custard to prevent a film from forming and chill this in the refrigerator until cold.
step-9: next, make the cake by combining the sugar, honey, matcha powder, and eggs in a large bowl.
step-10: mix until it almost triples in size, is lighter in color, and becomes thick and fluffy.
step-11: this will take about 7-10 minutes.
step-12: if you dribble some of the batter on itself it should hold a "ribbon" shape for 4-5 seconds.
step-13: once the batter has reached the correct consistency sift over the cake flour, and gently fold the flour in until all combined.
step-14: heat your oven to 350˚f (175˚c) and butter your baking sheet.
step-15: place a piece of parchment paper (a few inches larger than your baking sheet) onto your baking sheet.
step-16: using a rubber scraper (or your hand) push out any bubbles.
step-17: pour the batter into the prepared baking sheet and bake for 8-10 minutes.
step-18: note: you'll know it's done when the cake is slightly risen, turning just a bit golden, and you can smell it.
step-19: also, if you gently press your fingertips on the surface of the cake, and no indentations are left, it's done.
step-20: in a clean bowl, whip the heavy cream with electric beaters until it is thick and pretty stiff, little peaks should form when you lift the beaters.
step-21: grab your chilled custard from the fridge.
step-22: add one tsp of vanilla extract.
step-23: take the same beaters and whisk your custard, it will look funny at first, but after a few moments it will become nice and smooth.
step-24: fold the whipped cream into the custard until they are combined.
step-25: cool your cake for 2-3 minutes on the baking sheet.
step-26: lay a fresh sheet of parchment beside your cake and sprinkle it with powdered sugar.
step-27: lift the cake with the sides of the parchment onto your table.
step-28: flip the cake onto the sugared parchment paper.
step-29: remove parchment paper from the flipped cake.
step-30: slather the filling onto your cake.
step-31: roll it up, using the parchment to help.
step-32: wrap the whole thing in cling wrap and chill for two hours before slicing.
step-33: slice into pieces of your desired thickness and serve.

step-1: add the matcha to a mug and pour in the hot water and agave.
step-2: whisk with a small whisk or a matcha whisk, until tiny bubbles form on the surface.
step-3: froth the milk by adding it to a resealable jar.
step-4: shake vigorously until many bubbles form.
step-5: then, microwave the milk for 45 seconds to 1 minute, which will help create stable bubbles.
step-6: pour the milk into the tea.
step-7: dust the top with more matcha, if desired.
step-8: nutrition, per serving - calories: 178, total fat: 5 grams, sodium: 129 mg, total carb: 25 grams, dietary fiber: 0 gram, sugars: 12 grams, protein: 9 grams

step-1: put the biscuit in a ziplock bag and crush it finely.
step-2: put it in a bowl, add melted butter and milk and mix.
step-3: place mixture in a 20 cm (7 in) spring-loaded mold and make shape with holding it firmly with your fingers.
step-4: put it in a refrigerator and cool it (about 30 minutes).
step-5: place gelatin in a heat-resistant small dish, add water and let it set.
step-6: add sugar to the cream cheese and mix well.
step-7: put yogurt and heavy cream and mix well.
step-8: heat gelatin for about 30 seconds in a 600 w microwave oven and mix thoroughly every fifteen seconds.
step-9: when the gelatin becomes liquid, filter it into mixture and mix well.
step-10: divide mixture into two equal parts, add matcha melted with hot water to one side, and mix well.
step-11: pour half the amount of white filling into the bottom of the mold, put in a freezer for 15 minutes and solidify.
step-12: pour half of the filling containing the matcha into the mold and cool for 15 minutes.
step-13: repeat this until the remaining filling gets set up
step-14: cool in a refrigerator for about 3 hours.
step-15: remove the cake from the mold, put it on the dish, sprinkle the tea strainer on the surface and sprinkle matcha.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a medium mixing bowl, beat the egg whites with an electric hand mixer on medium speed until soft peaks form.
step-3: add ½ of the granulated sugar and with mixer on high, continue to beat until egg whites are stiff peaks.
step-4: repeat with last ½ of sugar, beating until whites are shiny and fluffy.
step-5: using a fine mesh strainer, sieve the almond flour, powdered sugar, and matcha into the bowl with the egg whites.
step-6: discard any large pieces that remain in the strainer.
step-7: fold until just combined
step-8: fill a piping bag with the macaron mixture and pipe 1½-inch (4 cm) dollops onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-9: let the cookies rest until they are no longer wet to the touch and a skin forms on top (can be up to 1 hour).
step-10: while resting, make the filling by mixing the cream cheese, powdered sugar and milk in a bowl until smooth.
step-11: transfer to a piping bag and set aside until ready to fill.
step-12: when the cookies are dry to the touch, bake at 300˚f (150˚c) for 15 minutes.
step-13: let rest for 10 minutes, or until cool before filling.
step-14: pipe the cream cheese mixture on the macron and sandwich with another one.

step-1: put agar, sugar and green tea in the bowl and mix.
step-2: place water and mixture in a small pan, mix it, and heat on high to a boil.
step-3: boil it for 2 minutes with a low heat.
step-4: apply small pan to a bigger pot filled with ice water.
step-5: chill while mixing for about 3 minutes
step-6: pour mixture into the round ice ball tray.
step-7: put it in the refrigerator for about 1 hour and cool it.
step-8: gently take it out from the ice tray and put it on a dish
step-9: pour brown sugar syrup and soybean flour to taste.

step-1: in a small saucepan over low heat, combine the simple syrup and matcha.
step-2: simmer for 1 minute, then remove from the heat and let cool completely.
step-3: once the matcha syrup is cool, strain into an airtight glass container and store in the refrigerator for up to 1 month.
step-4: to make the soda, pour 1 cup (240 ml) of seltzer water into a glass filled with ice and add 1-2 tablespoons of matcha syrup.
step-5: stir to combine.
step-6:
nutrition, per 1 tablespoon:
calories: 36
sugars: 9 grams

step-1: heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
step-2: toss in the onion with a pinch of salt and sauté until the onions have softened, about 3 minutes.
step-3: move the onions to the sides of the pan to create an open space in the middle.
step-4: add the cubed chicken into the center of the pan, season with salt and pepper, and sauté until the chicken has cooked almost all the way through.
step-5: add the garlic and mix until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
step-6: pour over salsa, black beans, and rice, and mix until everything in the pan is evenly combined.
step-7: let the mixture simmer for 5 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
step-8: divide the mixture equally into 4-6 bowls and sprinkle over some thinly sliced green onions.

step-1: heat a large skillet with 2 tablespoons of olive oil on medium-high heat.
step-2: add in diced chicken breast, followed by 1 teaspoon salt, 1 teaspoon pepper, and 1 teaspoon oregano.
step-3: cook until no longer pink.
step-4: remove chicken from skillet and set aside.
step-5: add carrots to skillet and sauté for 2-3 minutes until tender.
step-6: add in zucchini and yellow squash, and sauté for an additional minute until they become slightly translucent.
step-7: add in the kale, followed by 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1 teaspoon pepper.
step-8: sauté until kale begins to wilt.
step-9: move veggies aside with spatula and add in garlic.
step-10: sauté for about 30 seconds and then combine with the veggies.
step-11: (this works best if you add garlic to the center of the skillet where there is more heat.)
step-12: add in the cooked rotini pasta and chicken, followed by 1 teaspoon oregano and mix until evenly incorporated.
step-13: remove skillet from heat.
step-14: if using plastic tupperware for your weekday meal prep, allow pasta to cool for about 10 minutes before filling the containers.
step-15: refrigerate up to 4 days.
step-16: or serve immediately for a family dinner.

step-1: heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet.
step-2: toss in the asparagus, season with a bit of salt, and sautée until the begin to soften, about 3 minutes.
step-3: pour on the pesto, pasta, and chicken and stir to combine.
step-4: toss in the cherry tomatoes and give everything a stir to combine and warm through.
step-5: distribute pasta mixture evenly between 4 tupperware containers.
step-6: top with parsley for garnish.
step-7: can be refrigerated up to 4 days.

step-1: to start, prep your milkshake glass or vessel.
step-2: pick something tall and slender and chill it in the freezer for 10 minutes before you start.
step-3: this will keep the shake cool and the frosting from melting.
step-4: spread a nice, thick layer of frosting around the rim of your glass, going down 2-3 inches (5-7 cm).
step-5: now, this is where the fun starts: stick your favorite candies and treats all around the frosted rim—candy, doughnuts, cookies, sprinkles...anything goes.
step-6: freeze for 10 minutes.
step-7: now, make the milkshake.
step-8: combine the strawberry ice cream, vanilla ice cream, strawberries, marshmallow fluff, milk, and vanilla in a blender and blend until smooth and creamy.
step-9: pour the shake into the decorated glass, top it with a hefty dose of whipped cream, and add whatever else you got! animal crackers? fetch, yes! cotton candy? bring it! a lollipop the size of your face? why not?! a slice of cake made with rainbows and smiles? do it… we dare you.

step-1: place a slice of bread on top of a piece of plastic wrap on large cutting board.
step-2: brush the right edge of the bread with egg wash and place the left edge of another slice of bread over the brushed edge, pressing together firmly.
step-3: repeat with the rest of the bread so you have a rectangle of 4 slices across and 3 slices down.
step-4: using a rolling pin, roll out the bread so all of the pieces of bread are sealed together.
step-5: spread mayonnaise over the bread, then arrange the sliced provolone across, starting about ¼ of the way up the bread.
step-6: layer on the mortadella, ham, capicola, pepperoni, salami, and peperoncini.
step-7: starting at the bottom, roll the sandwich tightly, then cover snugly with plastic wrap.
step-8: chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-9: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-10: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-11: in a small bowl, melt the butter in the microwave for 1 minute, stirring every 15 seconds, or until fully melted.
step-12: mix in the garlic powder and italian seasoning.
step-13: transfer the sandwich roll to the baking sheet.
step-14: brush the outside with the garlic butter and bake for 18-20 minutes or until golden brown.
step-15: let the roll sit for 5 minutes before cutting into thick slices.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: in a food processor add the broccoli, 1 cup (110g) of parmesan, 1 clove of garlic, and 1 tablespoon of olive oil.
step-3: pulse until mixture forms a dough like texture, about 2 minutes.
step-4: place 1 tablespoon of the broccoli mixture and press into a well greased muffin tin.
step-5: form the mixture into a cup, making the bottom and sides ½-inches (1 cm) thick.
step-6: bake for about 30 minutes until the edges are golden and crispy and the bottom is firm.
step-7: cool the broccoli cups.
step-8: once cooled, remove from the muffin tin.
step-9: heat the oven to broil.
step-10: heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
step-11: add onions and garlic and cook until softened.
step-12: add the ground beef, breaking it apart with a wooden spoon, and stir until browned.
step-13: add the sausage, breaking it apart with a spoon, and stir until browned.
step-14: mix in 2 tablespoons of the parmesan, salt, pepper, 3 tablespoons of the basil, and 2 tablespoons of the parsley, and stir to combine.
step-15: add the tomato sauce and the tomato paste.
step-16: continue stirring until the meat sauce is bubbling.
step-17: reduce heat to low, and cover the pot, simmering for 45 minutes.
step-18: place about a ¼ cup (65 g) of the ragu in the broccoli parmesan cups.
step-19: top with mozzarella cheese.
step-20: broil for 2 minutes until cheese is melted.
step-21: top with the rest of the basil.
step-22: broccoli parmesan cups can be stored up to 3 days and can be reheated in the oven.

step-1: preheat oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-2: in a bowl, mix the ground beef, egg, parmesan cheese, parsley, salt, and pepper.
step-3: take a piece of the meat mixture of about the size of a ping pong ball and slightly flatten it.
step-4: add a piece of mozzarella cheese in the center, and seal it with your hands.
step-5: bake for 15 minutes.
step-6: cover a meat ball with a layer of mashed potatoes, and mold it with your hands, continue molding it into a ball.
step-7: dip the meatball in a bowl of flour.
step-8: repeat with remaining meatballs.
step-9: heat the oil to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-10: fry the mashed potato-covered meatballs in batches until golden brown.
step-11: transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.
step-12: sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve with marinara sauce.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine beef, sausage, salt, garlic powder, pepper, basil, half of the parmesan, egg, bread crumbs, water.
step-2: it works well to squish the mixture with your hands.
step-3: shape the meatballs into balls roughly larger than a golf ball, or desired size.
step-4: coat a large pan with olive oil and bring to a medium-high heat.
step-5: brown the meatballs on all sides.
step-6: set aside meatballs and remove excess grease.
step-7: return the meatballs to the hot pan, add marinara sauce and simmer for 15 minutes, or until meatballs are cooked through.
step-8: cut a long rectangle through the top of the bread loaf and partially unstuff the loaf.
step-9: layer the bottom of the loaf with half the mozzarella, cooked meatballs, sauce, then top with the rest of the mozzarella and parmesan.
step-10: bake for 25 minutes at 350˚f (180˚c).

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: add the oil to a pan on medium-high heat and cook the onions and garlic until deeply caramelized.
step-3: mix in tomato sauce, tomato paste, red pepper flakes, dried basil and oregano.
step-4: bring to a simmer for 5 minutes.
step-5: add pre-cooked meatballs and coat them with sauce.
step-6: remove sauce from heat.
step-7: roll out three rectangles of puff pastry.
step-8: one should be 16-inches (41 cm) long, one 22-inches (56 cm) long and the third, 28-inches (71 cm) long.
step-9: all three should be about 6-inches (15 cm) wide.
step-10: sprinkle the shredded mozzarella cheese in a line across the bottom of each strip, then place meatballs on top in a line about 1-inch (2 cm) apart from each other.
step-11: roll pastry over the meatballs.
step-12: then take the smallest roll and wrap it around a small oven safe bowl placed on top of a baking sheet.
step-13: make sure the ends of the pastry meet and pat together to connect.
step-14: take a knife and press down the puff pastry between each meatball creating a small opening on either side of the puff pastry.
step-15: make a small cut between each meatball just below the top of the puff pastry so that the roll is still connected.
step-16: repeat this step again with the medium roll and largest roll, wrapping them around each other.
step-17: add marinara sauce to the oven safe bowl.
step-18: brush egg wash over the entire ring and sprinkle the shredded parmesan cheese on top.
step-19: cover sauce with foil.
step-20: bake for 25 minutes.
step-21: serve warm.

step-1: marinara sauce: in a large saucepan, heat the olive oil.
step-2: add onion and garlic and saute for 5 minutes, until translucent.
step-3: stir in tomatoes, salt, pepper, and basil.
step-4: simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
step-5: remove basil sprigs and set sauce aside.
step-6: in a small bowl, stir together breadcrumbs and milk and set aside.
step-7: in a large bowl, whisk together egg, parmesan, salt and pepper.
step-8: stir in ground beef, onions, and wet breadcrumbs.
step-9: combine well, but do not over-mix.
step-10: with oiled hands, roll the meat into golf-sized balls.
step-11: heat a skillet with a drizzle of olive oil.
step-12: brown meatballs on all sides, then remove from pan.
step-13: preheat oven to 350ºf (180º c).
step-14: lay out a lasagna noodle horizontally on a cutting board.
step-15: spread a tablespoon of ricotta onto the noodle.
step-16: lay a mozzarella slice on one end of the noodle and place a meatball on top of the cheese.
step-17: roll up the noodle with the meatball and cheese inside.
step-18: place meatball bomb into the baking dish, with the meatball showing.
step-19: repeat with the rest of the meatballs and noodles.
step-20: ladle approximately ⅔rds of the marinara sauce into a 9x13-inch (23x33-cm) baking dish.
step-21: place the meatball rolls on top of the marinara sauce.
step-22: bake dish for 25 minutes, until top is lightly browned and meatballs are cooked through completely.
step-23: remove from oven, garnish with parsley and serve with reserved marinara on the side.

step-1: in a large bowl, add the beef, pork, onion, garlic, bread crumbs, beaten eggs, salt, pepper, dried basil, dried oregano, and dried parsley, red pepper flakes.
step-2: mix together to combine.
step-3: pick up 2 ounces (55 g) of meat, press into a flat patty on the palm of your hand.
step-4: place a mozzarella stick into the center of the patty and wrap the meatball mixture around it to seal it inside.
step-5: repeat with the rest of the mixture.
step-6: take the meatball-wrapped stick of cheese and dredge it in the flour, coat it in beaten egg, and then roll it in bread crumbs.
step-7: repeat with the rest.
step-8: place a batch of the sticks into oil at 325°f (180°c), and cook until the outside is golden brown and the beef is cooked through, 5 minutes.
step-9: then remove the mozzarella sticks from the fryer and drain on a wire rack.
step-10: season with salt.
step-11: serve the meatball mozzarella sticks with marinara sauce.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: slice the baguette into 1-inch (3cm) chunks, then transfer to a 9x13 (23 x 33cm) baking dish.
step-3: toss the bread in half of the marinara, then sprinkle with half of the mozzarella on top.
step-4: nestle the meatballs into the bread mixture evenly, then cover with the remaining marinara and mozzarella.
step-5: sprinkle ¾ of the parmesan on top, saving the rest for garnish.
step-6: bake for 20 minutes until the cheese has melted and is starting to brown.
step-7: serve with the remaining parmesan and basil.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: cut pizza dough into 8 sections on a floured surface.
step-3: with one section, roll out dough until flat and circular.
step-4: spread 1 tablespoon of marinara on flattened dough.
step-5: wrap up two meatballs in a slice of mozzarella and place them in the center of the dough.
step-6: sprinkle with ½ tablespoon parmesan cheese and some fresh basil.
step-7: fold one side of dough up and over ingredients, and seal calzone by crimping the edges together.
step-8: place on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-9: apply egg wash to outside of calzone and sprinkle with black pepper.
step-10: bake calzones for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl add the ground beef, italian sausage, garlic, parsley, parmesan cheese, salt, pepper, bread crumbs, eggs, and milk and mix until thoroughly combined.
step-3: roll the mixture into 5 ounce meatballs.
step-4: add 1 tablespoon of olive oil to a pan over medium heat and brown the meatballs on both sides for 15 minutes total.
step-5: slice the rolls in half lengthwise.
step-6: place the bottom half on a 9 x 13-inch (23 x 33cm) baking dish.
step-7: spoon a little marinara sauce on each bun.
step-8: top a meatball on each roll, add another spoonful of sauce, and top with mozzarella cheese.
step-9: place the remaining half of the rolls on top and lightly brush them with oil.
step-10: combine the parmesan cheese and the italian seasoning in a small bowl and sprinkle it over the buns.
step-11: bake for 15 minutes.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, mix the ground beef, egg, onion, bread crumbs, parmesan, parsley, garlic, salt, pepper, and oregano.
step-3: roll the mixture into golf ball-sized meatballs.
step-4: in a medium cast iron or nonstick skillet, heat oil over medium heat
step-5: working in batches cook the meatballs until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: on a sheet of parchment paper, press the pizza dough into a large circle, about 12 inches (30-cm) in diameter.
step-8: cut 8 evenly spaced 2-inch (5-cm) slits on the edge of the dough.
step-9: place one meatball on the edge of the dough between 2 slits.
step-10: pull the corners of the dough around the meatball and press into the dough, sealing the meatball in a dough pocket.
step-11: repeat with the remaining meatballs.
step-12: with the help of a friend, transfer the pizza and parchment to a baking sheet.
step-13: spoon marinara sauce into the middle of the pizza and spread evenly.
step-14: sprinkle mozzarella over the sauce, or add your favorite pizza toppings! brush the dough around the meatballs with olive oil.
step-15: bake for 25 minutes, or until the cheese is bubbly and the dough is golden and just cooked through.
step-16: slice with a pizza cutter and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180˚c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, mix the ground beef, bread crumbs, parsley, egg, salt, and pepper.
step-3: pinch off a ball of the mixture, roll between your hands to make ping-pong ball-sized meatballs.
step-4: cook the meatballs over medium heat, turning to brown each side.
step-5: remove from heat and drain on a paper towel.
step-6: slice the baguette into thirds or fourths (each baguette piece should be roughly the same length of two meatballs).
step-7: hollow out the insides of the baguette pieces with a knife.
step-8: lay two slices of mozzarella on top of each other with a 1-inch (2 ½ cm) overlap.
step-9: place two meatballs on the overlapping region, then fold the mozzarella tightly around the meatballs.
step-10: push the rolled meatballs and cheese into a baguette piece.
step-11: slice the stuffed baguette pieces into 1-inch (2 ½ cm) slices, then place them tightly side-by-side on a baking sheet lined with foil.
step-12: in a small bowl, mix together ingredients for garlic butter.
step-13: brush the garlic butter evenly over the baguette slices, making sure some drips in between the slices.
step-14: wrap the foil over the re-assembled baguette and bake for 15–20 minutes, until cheese is melted and the top is starting to brown.
step-15: remove the foil and serve with marinara.

step-1: on a cutting board, peel the onions, and cut into ½-inch (1 ¼-cm) rings.
step-2: separate the rings.
step-3: sort the onion rings into four cones, starting with a big ring and going up to a small one.
step-4: place the flour, eggs, and panko in 3 separate medium bowls.
step-5: dip an onion ring into the flour, shaking off any excess.
step-6: dip it into the eggs, then the panko, then back into the eggs, and into the panko again.
step-7: place the onion ring on a greased, parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-8: repeat with remaining onion rings, creating four stacked cones on the tray.
step-9: freeze the onions ring cones for 1-3 hours.
step-10: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-11: in a medium bowl, mix the ground beef, onion, garlic, parmesan, panko, parsley, worcestershire, egg, salt, and pepper with your hands until fully combined.
step-12: take a baseball-size handful of the meat mixture and roll it into a ball.
step-13: transfer to a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-14: repeat with the remaining meat mixture, creating four meatballs total.
step-15: bake for 18 minutes.
step-16: heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat until it reaches 350˚f (180˚c).
step-17: gently lower one frozen onion ring cone into the oil.
step-18: fry until golden brown all over, 2-4 minutes.
step-19: remove the cone with a slotted spoon and transfer to a wire rack set over paper towels to drain.
step-20: repeat with the remaining onion ring cones.
step-21: add 1 meatball to each onion ring cone.
step-22: top with marinara sauce, grated parmesan cheese, and basil.

step-1: in a medium bowl, mix together the beef, pork, bread crumbs, onion, parmesan cheese, garlic, parsley, eggs, salt, and pepper until just combined.
step-2: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-3: take a walnut-sized portion of the meat mixture and roll into a ball.
step-4: repeat with remaining meat and transfer to an oiled wire rack set over a baking sheet.
step-5: bake the meatballs for 10 minutes, until golden brown.
step-6: make the ricotta-herb mixture: combine the ricotta cheese, basil, parsley, parmesan cheese, and salt in a medium bowl and mix well.
step-7: stuff a tablespoon of ricotta mixture into a jumbo shells, then stuff a meatball into the shells.
step-8: spread the marinara sauce in the bottom of a 9x13-inch (23x33-cm) casserole dish, then lay in the stuffed shells.
step-9: sprinkle parmesan cheese on top.
step-10: bake for 10 minutes, until the marinara sauce is warm.
step-11: top with chopped basil.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: cut each refrigerated biscuit into 8 pieces.
step-3: place in a greased 9x13 inch (23x33 cm) baking dish.
step-4: pour on the sauce, and stir to coat all sides of the biscuits.
step-5: place the meatballs on top of the mixture.
step-6: top with the shredded cheese, and bake for 35 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, combine the ground beef, eggs, bread crumbs, ¼ cup (10 g) parsley, 3 cloves garlic, salt, and pepper.
step-3: shape the ground beef mixture into golf ball-sized balls.
step-4: heat a cast-iron pan or skillet with oil over medium-high heat.
step-5: cook the meatballs until browned on all sides.
step-6: transfer meatballs to a plate then remove pan from heat
step-7: place the soft rolls in a baking sheet.
step-8: cut the top of the rolls with a knife and press the inside down to create a boat.
step-9: mix together the melted butter, 3 cloves garlic, and 2 tablespoons of parsley.
step-10: brush the rolls with the garlic butter.
step-11: bake for 5 minutes, or until toasted.
step-12: place two slices of mozzarella in the rolls.
step-13: place a spoonful of marinara on top of the cheese.
step-14: place three meatballs in the boat and top with more marinara.
step-15: bake for 25 minutes, or until cheese is melted.
step-16: top with parmesan.

step-1: cover a plastic skull with plastic food wrap.
step-2: use thin slices of prosciutto to cover the plastic skull.
step-3: leave the eye sockets, nose hole and teeth uncovered.
step-4: carefully make an incision on the plastic around the eye sockets.
step-5: insert pickled olives in the sockets to create the eyes.
step-6: place the meathead on a platter and add cheese and crackers.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the mushrooms, cannellini beans, onion, bread crumbs, ½ cup (15 grams) of parsley, 3 cloves of minced garlic, the dried rosemary, worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, nutmeg, liquid smoke, salt, and pepper and mix well.
step-2: roll the mushroom mixture into golf ball-sized balls.
step-3: heat the canola oil in a large pot over medium-high heat until shimmering.
step-4: place the balls in the pot and cook for 1 minute on each side until browned all over, 3-4 minutes total.
step-5: add the marinara sauce and stir to coat the balls.
step-6: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-7: slice the rolls in half lengthwise.
step-8: place the bottom half on a 9x13-inch (23x33-cm) rimmed baking sheet.
step-9: place the meatballs on top, followed by any remaining marinara sauce in the pot, then the mozzarella.
step-10: top with the top half of the rolls.
step-11: mix the melted butter in a small bowl with the remaining tablespoon of minced garlic, the parmesan, and remaining teaspoon of parsley.
step-12: brush the tops of the rolls with the butter mixture.
step-13: bake for 15 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown.
step-14: slice into individual sliders, then serve.

step-1: heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
step-2: add the onion and cook until translucent, 3-4 minutes.
step-3: add the garlic and cook for about 2 minutes until it is fragrant.
step-4: add the yellow bell peppers, red bell peppers, and green beans.
step-5: cook stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes until tender.
step-6: add the rice, smoked paprika, sweet paprika, tomato paste, salt, and pepper.
step-7: stir until incorporated.
step-8: cook for 1-2 minutes until the rice starts to sizzle.
step-9: add the canned tomatoes.
step-10: cook for 5 minutes until the liquid has evaporated slightly.
step-11: add the vegetable broth, saffron threads (crush the saffron threads between your fingertips), and bay leaves.
step-12: bring to a boil on high heat.
step-13: continue cooking, stirring occasionally, until most of the liquid is absorbed by the rice, about 10 minutes.
step-14: add in the peas, artichokes, and sausage, if using.
step-15: cover the pan, reduce the heat to low, and cook for 10 minutes.
step-16: remove the pan from the heat and let sit covered for 10 minutes.
step-17: sprinkle the fresh parsley.

step-1: in a medium skillet, heat a drizzle of olive oil over medium heat.
step-2: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the onion and cook for 2-3 minutes, until semi-translucent.
step-3: add the bell pepper and cook for another 2-3 minutes, until the onion is translucent.
step-4: add the garlic, chili powder, cumin, paprika, and salt and cook 2-3 minutes more, until the garlic is soft and fragrant.
step-5: season with salt.
step-6: add the textured vegetable protein, vegetable broth, and tomato sauce and stir well until combined.
step-7: cover and cook for 15 minutes, until most of the liquid has been absorbed.
step-8: remove the lid and add the worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, brown sugar, and yellow mustard.
step-9: mix to combine and cook for 3-4 more minutes, until the remaining liquid has been absorbed.
step-10: serve on hamburger buns.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a bowl, mix together the meatloaf ingredients.
step-3: line a muffin tin with cupcake liners.
step-4: fill the muffin liners with the meatloaf mixture and pat down to form a dome.
step-5: bake meatloaf cupcakes for 25-30 minutes or until cooked through.
step-6: in a saucepan over medium heat, add the potatoes, water to cover the potatoes, and salt.
step-7: bring potatoes to a boil, then reduce the heat and cover.
step-8: simmer for 15-20 minutes or until potatoes are fork-tender.
step-9: drain the water and add in the butter and milk.
step-10: mash the potatoes with a fork until smooth.
step-11: fill a ziplock bag with the mashed potatoes.
step-12: pipe the potatoes onto each meatloaf cupcake to resemble frosting.
step-13: sprinkle with parsley.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: grease 2 8-inch (20 cm) round cake pans with nonstick spray.
step-3: heat the oil in a medium pan over medium heat.
step-4: add the celery, onion, and carrot and sauté until translucent, about 10 minutes.
step-5: set aside to cool.
step-6: in a large bowl, combine the ground beef, dijon mustard, paprika, worcestershire sauce, tomato paste, eggs, panko, milk, and salt (if using).
step-7: stir to combine, add the cooled sautéed veggies, and mix until homogeneous.
step-8: divide the meatloaf between the prepared pans and spread the mixture evenly.
step-9: bake for 20-25 minutes, until golden brown.
step-10: let cool for 30 minutes.
step-11: add 1 meatloaf layer to a serving plate.
step-12: spread a thin layer of tomato paste over the top.
