step-13: add 2 cups (500 g) of mashed potatoes to the center and spread evenly.
step-14: top with the other meatloaf layer and spread with a layer of tomato paste and 2 cups (500 g) mashed potatoes.
step-15: use an offset spatula to cover the sides of the “cake” and spread the potatoes over the whole cake in an even layer.
step-16: add another cup (250 g) of mashed potatoes to the top of the cake and spread evenly over the whole cake.
step-17: add the remaining mashed potatoes to a piping bag fitted with a star tip.
step-18: pipe rosettes around the base and top of the cake.
step-19: slice and serve.

step-1: place cucumbers, tomatoes, and grams into box.
step-2: place pita chips into box along with a scoop of hummus.
step-3: refrigerate until ready to eat.

step-1: in a medium skillet, heat a drizzle of olive oil over medium heat.
step-2: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the kale and cook for 3-4 minutes, until semi-wilted.
step-3: season with a pinch of salt.
step-4: add a splash of water and continue to cook for 3-4 minutes until the kale is mostly wilted.
step-5: add another drizzle of olive oil and the garlic, pine nuts, and red pepper flakes to the pan.
step-6: cook for another 3-4 minutes until the garlic is fragrant and the pine nuts are toasted.
step-7: add the sun-dried tomatoes and cook for 2-3 more minutes until the kale is completely wilted and tender.
step-8: transfer the kale mixture to a bowl and set aside.
step-9: in the same pan, add a drizzle of oil from the jar of sun-dried tomatoes.
step-10: heat the flatbreads, 1 at a time, for 2-3 minutes on each side until golden brown.
step-11: transfer the flatbreads to a cutting board and spread with the hummus.
step-12: spoon the kale mixture on top and cut into quarters.
step-13: sprinkle with more red pepper flakes, if desired, and serve.

step-1: in a large mason jar, add the olive oil, red wine vinegar, lemon juice, garlic, pepper, and salt.
step-2: stir or swirl to combine.
step-3: add the bell pepper, chickpeas, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, lentils, and parsley and screw on the lid.
step-4: store in the refrigerator until ready to eat, up to 5 days
step-5: give the mason jar a good shake to mix and use a fork or spoon to stir as needed.

step-1: make the hummus: add the chickpeas to a food processor with the garlic, paprika, salt, cumin, lemon juice, 2 tablespoons of olive oil, and the water.
step-2: pulse until creamy.
step-3: transfer the hummus to a container and top with more olive oil and red pepper flakes.
step-4: the hummus will keep in the refrigerator for up to 4 days.
step-5: make the mediterranean bowl: heat a large skillet over medium heat.
step-6: once hot, add 1 tablespoon of olive oil.
step-7: pour the quinoa into the skillet and toast for 3-4 minutes, or until light golden brown.
step-8: add the vegetable broth, thyme, tarragon, parsley, juice of 1 lemon, and salt and stir to combine.
step-9: bring to a boil, then cover, reduce the heat to low, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the liquid is absorbed and the quinoa is fluffy.
step-10: remove the pan from the heat.
step-11: slice the cucumbers, halve the tomatoes, chop the olives, and dice the onion.
step-12: place all of the vegetables in a medium bowl.
step-13: add the parsley, remaining tablespoon of olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
step-14: stir to combine.
step-15: to assemble a bowl, add ¼ of the quinoa, ¼ of the vegetables, and ¼ of the hummus to a resealable container.
step-16: top the vegetables with crumbled feta.
step-17: store the bowls in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

step-1: combine all the ingredients above in a large bowl.
step-2: mix the dressing ingredients together and spread over fruit, mix well.

step-1: using a melon baller or a teaspoon, scoop out rounds of watermelon and cantaloupe and place in a large bowl.
step-2: season with a pinch of salt.
step-3: in a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, combine the greek yogurt, olive oil, water, and lemon juice.
step-4: stir until smooth.
step-5: serve the melon in bowls and top with the dressing and fresh mint leaves.

step-1: make the sage simple syrup: in a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the water, sugar, and chopped sage leaves.
step-2: bring to a low boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes, until the sugar is fully dissolved and the sage is fragrant.
step-3: remove from the heat and let cool for 5-10 minutes.
step-4: strain through a fine-mesh sieve.
step-5: store remaining sage syrup in the refrigerator for up to 1 month.
step-6: in a cocktail shaker filled halfway with ice, combine the gin, grapefruit juice, and 1 tablespoon of sage simple syrup.
step-7: shake vigorously for 30 seconds.
step-8: strain into a coupe glass.
step-9: garnish with sage leaves.

step-1: to a large pot, add the cubed pork shoulder, onions, avocado leaves, pepper, salt, garlic, and bay leaves.
step-2: add enough cold water to cover all the meat.
step-3: bring to a boil over high heat, then continue to boil for 20 minutes.
step-4: add the orange juice, milk, and cola, return to a boil, and simmer until the liquid has reduced by half, about 1 hour.
step-5: add the lard, let it melt, then boil off the rest of the liquid until the meat begins to fry, 1 hour more.
step-6: once the meat turns dark golden brown and is crispy, scoop it out of the pot and onto a paper bag or paper towel-lined baking sheet to drain.
step-7: serve with corn tortillas, guacamole, pickled vegetables, cilantro, lime wedges, cilantro rice, and pinto beans.

step-1: mix together the patty ingredients until combined.
step-2: form the beef mixture into 3 round patties.
step-3: heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
step-4: cook the burgers for 3 minutes on the first side, flip, and place a slice of manchego cheese on top.
step-5: cook for 6 more minutes until the cheese is melted.
step-6: assemble the burgers on the buns with guacamole, cotija, pico de gallo, and sour cream.

step-1: place the dry corn husks in a baking dish.
step-2: pour hot water over the husks to cover.
step-3: weigh the husks down so they are completely submerged and let soak for 2 hours, or until pliable.
step-4: add the tomatoes, onion, guajillos, pasillas, garlic, and 4 cups (960 ml) of water to a small pot.
step-5: cover, bring to a boil, and cook for 10 minutes, or until the vegetables have softened.
step-6: transfer the vegetables to a blender, add salt and pepper to taste, the cumin, and about ½ cup (60 ml) of the cooking liquid.
step-7: blend until smooth.
step-8: set aside.
step-9: heat the canola oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
step-10: add the pork and season with salt and pepper.
step-11: fry the pork until well-browned and most of the fat has evaporated.
step-12: drain any excess fat, if necessary.
step-13: add the sauce to the pan with the pork, bring to a boil, cover, and let simmer until tender, about 1 hour.
step-14: remove from the heat and let cool.
step-15: in a small bowl, combine the baking soda, baking powder, and 1 tablespoon water.
step-16: stir to dissolve, then set aside.
step-17: add the lard to a large bowl.
step-18: with an electric hand mixer, whip the lard until light and fluffy, about 5 minutes.
step-19: add the masa and baking soda mixture and mix with your hands until smooth, about 5 minutes.
step-20: it should be spreadable but still hold its shape.
step-21: drain the soaked corn husks.
step-22: place 1 husk on a clean surface and add 1-2 tablespoons of masa to the center of the husk.
step-23: spread with the back of the spoon to about ¼ inch (¾ cm) from the edges.
step-24: place 1 tablespoon of meat in the center.
step-25: roll the corn husk over the filling from left to right and fold the top down to create a little pocket.
step-26: set aside.
step-27: repeat with the remaining ingredients.
step-28: place the tamales, open ends up, in a steamer basket set over a large pot of boiling water.
step-29: cover with a clean kitchen towel and the lid.
step-30: let steam for 1 hour, then turn off the heat and let the tamales rest for 1 hour more.
step-31: unwrap the tamales and serve with salsa verde.

step-1: in a medium bowl, mix the masa flour and ½ cup (120 ml) of water together with your hands.
step-2: once combined, add the rest of the water and knead until the dough forms a smooth ball.
step-3: heat a large pan or griddle over medium-high heat.
step-4: pat the dough out into 6 flat circles.
step-5: fry the dough, turning frequently, until just lightly brown about 5 minutes.
step-6: once the dough is cooked, shape the sopes by pinching the sides up to form a wall around the edge.
step-7: set aside to cool.
step-8: rip the stems off the dried chiles and discard the seeds.
step-9: rinse the chiles, if necessary.
step-10: add the chiles to a small pot of water and bring to a boil over high heat.
step-11: once boiling, remove the pot from the heat.
step-12: transfer the chiles and their cooking liquid to a blender and add 1 teaspoon of salt and the garlic.
step-13: blend until smooth.
step-14: set aside.
step-15: add the tomatoes to a small pot of water and bring to a boil.
step-16: cook until the tomato skins split, then remove from the heat and drain, reserving ½ cup (120 ml) of the tomato water.
step-17: transfer the tomatoes to a blender with the reserved cooking liquid, oregano, and ½ teaspoon of salt.
step-18: blend until smooth.
step-19: set aside.
step-20: heat a large pan or griddle over medium-high heat.
step-21: add the skirt steak and season with the meat seasoning and remaining teaspoon of salt.
step-22: cook the meat, flipping frequently until seared and cooked through, about 10 minutes.
step-23: transfer the meat to a cutting board and cut into small pieces.
step-24: set aside.
step-25: heat the corn oil in a deep, large pan over high heat.
step-26: dip the sopes in the chile sauce, turning to coat completely.
step-27: once the oil is hot, fry the sopes, flipping frequently, until golden brown, about 5 minutes.
step-28: drain the sopes on paper towels or a wire rack.
step-29: to serve, fill the sopes with refried beans, carne asada, shredded lettuce, tomato sauce, mexican crema, and queso fresco.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: slice the pork shoulder into about 1-cm (½ inch) slices, then transfer to a large dish or bowl.
step-3: in a bowl, combine the achiote powder, chili powder, garlic powder, oregano, cumin, salt, pepper, vinegar, and pineapple juice, mashing and stirring until smooth with no lumps.
step-4: pour the marinade over the pork, then toss the pork slices to make sure that they are all coated on all sides.
step-5: wrap the dish/bowl in cling film then marinate the pork for at least 2 hours, up to 3-5 days in the refrigerator.
step-6: on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or foil, place down a slice or two of the pineapple.
step-7: take a wooden skewer and push it directly in the middle of the pineapple.
step-8: remove the pork from the fridge and push the slices through the skewer, layering one after the other until there is a 2-cm (1 inch) gap at the top.
step-9: push another pineapple slice on top.
step-10: bake for about an hour and a half, until slightly charred on the outside and deep red.
step-11: rest the meat for about 10 minutes, then carve off thin slices of the pork.
step-12: slice off thin pieces of the roasted pineapples as well.
step-13: to assemble and serve, place some pork on the tortillas, followed by a few pieces of pineapple, a sprinkle of onions, a pinch of cilantro, then a small spoonful of the salsa.
step-14: top with a squeeze of lime juice (optional).

step-1: poke holes in the potato with a fork, then rub with oil and salt.
step-2: place the bacon slices on the same plate as the potato, microwave for 7-9 minutes until the bacon is crispy and the potato is tender.
step-3: make sure the bacon does not burn.
step-4: crumble the bacon after it’s cooled down.
step-5: slice the potato in half, then use a fork to fluff up the insides.
step-6: sprinkle the cheese on top, then microwave for another 30 seconds.
step-7: top with sour cream, the crushed bacon bits, and the chives.

step-1: combine all ingredients in a microwaveable mug.
step-2: cook for 2-3 minutes, making sure the egg doesn’t bubble over.
step-3: stir halfway through the cooking process.

step-1: mix the chicken with the barbecue sauce, then spread evenly over a bed of tortilla chips.
step-2: spread the pico de gallo, cheese, and green onions evenly on top, then microwave for about 1-2 minutes until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
step-3: dollop with some guacamole and sour cream, then serve.

step-1: microwave the tortillas on a plate until slightly crispy.
step-2: they will dry out a bit as they cool.
step-3: mix the chicken, peppers, and taco seasoning in a bowl until evenly combined, then cook for about 1-2 minutes until the peppers are soft.
step-4: spread the mixture evenly on one tortilla, cover evenly with the cheese, then top with the other tortilla.
step-5: cook for another 30 seconds to 1 minute, slice, then serve.

step-1: mix the macaroni, water, and salt in a microwaveable mug.
step-2: microwave for 2-3 minutes, then stir.
step-3: add the milk, cheese, salt, and pepper, then stir.
step-4: microwave for another 30 seconds, stir, and garnish with a sprinkle of chives.

step-1: in a bowl, combine the rice, water, soy sauce, sesame oil, and bacon.
step-2: stir, then microwave, covered, for about 6-8 minutes until the rice is fully cooked.
step-3: mix the frozen peas and carrots into the rice.
step-4: in a microwaveable mug, beat the eggs with the salt.
step-5: microwave the eggs and the rice again for about 1-2 minutes, until the eggs are fully cooked.
step-6: break up the egg into small bits, then mix it in with the rice.
step-7: garnish with scallions, then serve!

step-1: in a small bowl, mix the ricotta, spinach, parsley, one tablespoon of parmesan, salt, and pepper until combined.
step-2: in the glass container, spread a layer of tomato sauce.
step-3: top the tomato sauce with the lasagna noodles.
step-4: cover the noodles with a layer of the ricotta mixture, then mozzarella.
step-5: continue with another layer of noodles, ricotta, tomato sauce, then mozzarella.
step-6: repeat.
step-7: cover the top layer of lasagna noodles with more tomato sauce and a layer of mozzarella and parmesan.
step-8: place the lid on the glass container, without sealing it closed.
step-9: microwave for 7 minutes or until the cheese is melted through.
step-10: remove from the microwave carefully, the container will be hot!
step-11: allow to cool and refrigerate, or serve immediately.

step-1: on a large plate, arrange the sausage and the ham in a circle, then place a microwaveable mug in the center.
step-2: crack the eggs into the mug, season with salt, pepper, and add a splash of milk.
step-3: stir until evenly mixed.
step-4: microwave the entire plate for about 2 minutes until the egg is cooked through, making sure it does not bubble over.
step-5: remove the plate and microwave the bacon strips on a separate plate for about 4-7 minutes.
step-6: check the bacon at 4 minutes, then every minute or so to make sure it doesn’t burn.
step-7: drain the bacon of its fat, then set aside.
step-8: invert the mug with the egg, then slice the egg cylinder into 5 equal rounds.
step-9: you may have to run a knife around the mug first to ensure that the egg comes loose in one solid piece.
step-10: to assemble, layer your sandwich as you’d like with the meat, egg, cheese, and spinach.
step-11: wrap each sandwich in a damp paper towel, then with parchment paper.
step-12: place the sandwiches in a large zip top bag, then freeze for up until 1 month.
step-13: when ready to eat, remove a sandwich from the freezer, unwrap the parchment, and microwave for about 2 minutes.
step-14: cool for 1 minute, then unwrap the paper towel.

step-1: slice the spaghetti squash in half.
step-2: if you’re having difficult, poke some holes with a knife, then microwave for 5 minutes.
step-3: scoop out the seeds and innards with a spoon, then rub oil, salt, and pepper all over the surface.
step-4: microwave for about 10-15 minutes until the squash is tender and pulls away from the skin easily.
step-5: using a fork, shred the squash into noodle-like strands.
step-6: microwave the meatballs with the pasta sauce, covered, for about 2 minutes or until the meatballs are fully heated through.
step-7: spoon the meatballs and sauce on top of each spaghetti squash half, garnish with the parmesan and parsley.

step-1: top a pita with marinara sauce, mozzarella, tomato, salt, and pepper.
step-2: microwave for one minute.
step-3: serve with fresh basil and balsamic reduction.

step-1: wrap the corn in a damp paper towel, and microwave for 5 minutes.
step-2: allow to cool for 5 minutes.
step-3: brush the corn with melted butter and sprinkle with salt (optional).

step-1: crack the egg into the mug then season with salt and pepper.
step-2: beat the egg.
step-3: place the mug in the microwave and cover with a wet paper towel.
step-4: cook for approximately 30-40 seconds.
step-5: toast the english muffin.
step-6: then top with the egg, tomato, avocado, and spinach.

step-1: in a bowl, combine the rice, water, sesame oil, and soy sauce.
step-2: stir, then microwave, covered, for approximately 6-8 minutes until the rice is fully cooked.
step-3: mix the frozen vegetables into the rice.
step-4: in a microwaveable mug, beat the eggs.
step-5: microwave the eggs and the rice again for approximately 1-2 minutes, until the eggs are fully cooked.
step-6: break up the egg into small bits, then mix it in with the rice.
step-7: top with scallions, and serve.

step-1: in a bowl, combine the rice, water, and olive oil.
step-2: stir, then microwave, covered, for 6-8 minutes until the rice is fully cooked.
step-3: carefully remove the lid, then add black beans, tomatoes, salt, and pepper.
step-4: stir to combine.
step-5: top with avocado and cilantro if desired.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: slice the pitas in half to make 4 thin rounds.
step-3: place the pitas on a nonstick sheet pan.
step-4: brush with 2 tablespoons of olive oil and season with salt.
step-5: bake for about 5 minutes, until the outside is golden brown.
step-6: let cool until they become crispy.
step-7: make 3 cuts lengthwise on each of the romaine hearts, remove the stems, and chop into smaller pieces.
step-8: rinse, drain, and add to a large salad bowl.
step-9: seed the cucumber, dice it, and add it to the salad bowl.
step-10: cut the tomatoes in half and add them to the salad bowl.
step-11: mince the scallions and add them to the salad bowl.
step-12: add the radishes, bell pepper, parsley, and mint to the salad bowl and toss to combine.
step-13: in a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, combine the remaining ½ cup (120 ml) of oil, the lemon juice, white wine vinegar, garlic, sumac, allspice, salt, and pepper and whisk until well-combined.
step-14: pour the dressing over the salad.
step-15: break the crispy pitas into small pieces and add to the salad.
step-16: toss well.

step-1: make the crepes by melting the butter and allowing it to brown slightly.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: in the same pot, warm the milk.
step-4: remove from heat.
step-5: in a bowl, whisk flour, cocoa powder, and sugar.
step-6: mix in eggs.
step-7: gradually mix in butter and warm milk.
step-8: chill.
step-9: on a nonstick skillet over medium heat, pour ¼ cup (60 ml) of crepe batter, and tip the pan to cover the entire bottom surface.
step-10: cook until bottom surface of crepe begins to brown, then flip.
step-11: cool crepe.
step-12: repeat until all of the crepe batter is used.
step-13: stack crepes on top of each other, with whipped cream between each layer.
step-14: once assembled, trim edges for a cleaner look, if desired.
step-15: for the ganache, bring the heavy cream and sugar to a boil, and pour over chocolate and butter.
step-16: let cool.
step-17: spread over the crepe cake.
step-18: top with sifted powdered sugar (optional).

step-1: spoon a tablespoon of mincemeat onto the middle of a slice of white bread and cover it with another slice to make a sandwich.
step-2: cut a circular shape in the sandwich with a glass, making sure the edges are well sealed.
step-3: repeat for more doughnuts.
step-4: to make the egg wash, add the eggs, milk, flour and icing sugar to a large bowl and whisk until smooth.
step-5: dip the doughnuts into the mixture, then fry in oil at 190°c/375°f until golden brown on both sides.
step-6: roll the doughnut in icing sugar.

step-1: in a heavy bottom pot, combine the olive oil, onion, celery, and carrots over medium heat.
step-2: cook until the carrots soften and the onions become slightly translucent.
step-3: add the garlic and salt, and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
step-4: add the green beans, sauce, and water, and bring to a boil.
step-5: add the beans and macaroni and cook for about 9-10 minutes until the macaroni is al dente.
step-6: serve warm with parmesan and basil.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: in a small bowl, mix together the cake mix and 2 tablespoons of melted butter until the mixture is crumbly.
step-3: pour 1 tablespoon of melted butter into the bottom of two small cast-iron skillets.
step-4: arrange the apple slices in each skillet, ensuring the bottom is covered.
step-5: sprinkle cake mixture over the apples.
step-6: bake for 20 minutes, or until top appears crispy and edges are bubbling.
step-7: cool for 10 minutes.

step-1: use a melon scooper to scoop out mini apple balls.
step-2: repeat until entire apple is carved.
step-3: insert a popsicle stick on the side with the skin.
step-4: dip the apple ball in caramel.
step-5: dip again in preferred toppings.
step-6: the video includes: peanuts, pretzels, oreos, cookies, caramel corn, and m&m’s.

step-1: to begin, peel, halve, and core your apples (melon ballers make a good tool for coring halved apples).
step-2: you’ll need one apple for every two tarts.
step-3: in a medium sauce pan, about 3 quarts (1 liter), slowly heat sugar.
step-4: you’ll want to stir frequently until it dissolves into a brown syrup.
step-5: melt 1 tablespoon of butter into the sugar, stirring frequently.
step-6: add a dash of salt and the juice from ½ lemon.
step-7: lower the heat as low as it will go and add your apple halves.
step-8: toss to coat with caramel and let simmer 5–10 minutes until tender, flipping once.
step-9: cut puff pastry into circles to fit just within the top of your muffin tin.
step-10: place apple halves curve-side down in a large muffin tin.
step-11: pour remaining caramel over each apple half.
step-12: top with a circle of puff pastry to fit just inside the muffin tin.
step-13: bake 14–20 minutes at 450°f (230°c).
step-14: invert muffin pan onto baking sheet immediately.
step-15: serve with vanilla ice cream.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: generously brush butter onto both sides of the tortillas.
step-3: using a circular cookie cutter or a mason jar lid, cut the tortillas into small circles.
step-4: flip a 12-cup muffin tin over and place a cut-out piece of tortilla in the space between two cups, so that they make a mini taco shape.
step-5: one muffin tin will fit 17 mini tacos.
step-6: bake for 5-8 minutes, or until just turning golden brown and crispy.
step-7: (times and temperatures may vary based on oven.)
step-8: make sure to check on them every couple of minutes to make sure they don’t burn.
step-9: shred a rotisserie chicken, removing all bones and skin.
step-10: place shredded chicken in a large pan over medium-high heat and add salsa.
step-11: stir well to combine.
step-12: serve along with your favorite taco toppings.

step-1: place shredded chicken in a reusable container and fold flour tortillas and place on top of the chicken.
step-2: add onions, tortillas, cooked spanish rice, black beans, lettuce, and cheese using cupcake tin liners to separate toppings.
step-3: place salsa in a small reusable container.

step-1: in a large mixing bowl, beat the sugars and eggs together until smooth.
step-2: add in the melted butter and whisk until smooth.
step-3: sift in the flour, soybean flour and baking powder and mix together.
step-4: rest the dough for 30 minutes.
step-5: roll the dough into ping pong sized balls using your hands.
step-6: in a deep saucepan, heat the oil to 190°c (370°f).
step-7: using a slotted spoon, carefully fry the balls in small batches.
step-8: transfer the doughnuts to a paper towel-lined plate.
step-9: prepare the cinnamon sugar by mixing the sugar and ground cinnamon together.
step-10: roll the doughnuts in the cinnamon sugar.
step-11: drizzle some brown sugar syrup on top.

step-1: roll out the pie crust and cut to a rectangle shape.
step-2: cover with your desired amount of melted butter, sugar, and cinnamon.
step-3: roll the crust up.
step-4: cut into little discs.
step-5: bake at 350°f (180°c) for 10-15 minutes, depending on how thick you cut them.
step-6: in a bowl, mix powdered sugar with milk until it becomes a glaze.
step-7: add milk if you want a thinner consistency.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: roll out pie crusts into a rectangle shape.
step-3: brush the rolled out pie crust with melted butter.
step-4: in a small bowl, mix together cinnamon and sugar and sprinkle on top of butter.
step-5: carefully roll the pie crust up with your fingers.
step-6: slice the log into small discs and arrange on parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-7: bake for 12-15 minutes, until golden brown.
step-8: in a liquid measuring cup, mix together powder sugar, vanilla, and milk.
step-9: add more milk for a thinner consistency.

step-1: separate the icing from the chocolate sandwich cookies.
step-2: reserve the icing and put the cookies in a resealable plastic bag.
step-3: pound the cookies with a rolling pin until they reach a fine crumble.
step-4: transfer to a small bowl.
step-5: mix with the butter until well combined.
step-6: evenly distribute the crumble mixture into a 6-cup muffin tin lined with cupcake liners and firmly press the crumbs to form an even crust in each cup.
step-7: in a medium bowl, combine the cream, condensed milk, vanilla extract, and the sandwich cookie icing.
step-8: whisk the ingredients until soft peaks form.
step-9: gently form in the cookies.
step-10: transfer the mixture to the muffin tin.
step-11: freeze for 4 hours, or until the ice cream has solidified.
step-12: remove the cupcake liners.

step-1: in a medium sized mixing bowl, whisk together dry ingredients.
step-2: then add the egg and milk.
step-3: stir until batter is smooth with no lumps and chill in refrigerator for 25 minutes.
step-4: cut the hot dogs into ⅓ pieces and coat in flour to help batter to stick to the dogs.
step-5: preheat oil to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-6: dunk flour battered hot dogs into corn dog batter by using a fork.
step-7: make sure to fully coat the dogs before frying in the oil.
step-8: fry at 350ºf (180ºc) for 3-4 minutes or until golden brown.
step-9: for even cooking use a slotted steel spoon or a pair of tongs to rotate the floating corn dogs.
step-10: dry off excess oil with paper towels.
step-11: serve with side of veggies or fruit.

step-1: preheat the oven to 180°c (350°f).
step-2: smash the digestives in a bag with a rolling pin until they become fine crumbs.
step-3: alternatively you can use a food processor.
step-4: pour in a bowl and combine with the melted butter.
step-5: distribute the biscuit base evenly into a greased cupcake tray.
step-6: each tray should be ¼ full with the biscuit base.
step-7: bake for 10 minutes.
step-8: prepare the cheesecake filling by whipping the cream cheese and sour cream together.
step-9: whisk in the sugar, eggs, and vanilla until smooth.
step-10: remove cupcake tray from the oven and top each biscuit base with the filling.
step-11: bake for 18 minutes and then allow to cool.
step-12: for the crème brûlée topping, scatter on a teaspoon of sugar over each cheesecake.
step-13: ensure the sugar is evening distributed and any excess is knocked off.
step-14: using a blow torch, carefully melt the sugar using swirling motions until bubbling and caramelized.
step-15: leave to cool for 2 minutes for the sugar to cool and harden.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (218°c)
step-2: in a large bowl mix marinara sauce, parmesan cheese, pepper, salt, and oregano.
step-3: lightly oil a 12-cup muffin tin or coat with nonstick spray.
step-4: lay tortilla on a flat surface.
step-5: using an empty can, cut 3-4 medium circles, pressing firmly enough in a rocking motion to cut through the tortilla.
step-6: fit tortilla circle into each of 12 muffin cup.
step-7: scoop 1 tablespoon pizza sauce into each muffin cup.
step-8: sprinkle with mozzarella cheese.
step-9: top with mini pepperonis.
step-10: place into oven and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until cheese has melted.
step-11: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 220°c (430°f).
step-2: using a cup or mug with roughly the same diameter as the bottoms of your muffin tin, cut out 3 circles of puff pastry dough.
step-3: make sure you cut the circles out as closely as possible to save dough.
step-4: with the remaining dough, cut out strips to wrap around the inside of the muffin tin cups.
step-5: the strips should be about three centimeters (1 inch) wider than the depth of the muffin tin cups.
step-6: rub oil in the bottom of 3 to 4 cups in the center of your muffin tin.
step-7: place the puff pastry dough circles at the bottom of the cups, then wrap the dough strips along the walls of the cups.
step-8: note: the dough strips should come up a couple of centimeters (about an inch) taller than the wall of each muffin tin cup.
step-9: using your fingers, pinch and press the beginning and end of the strips together and then press the edges of the strips down near the edges of the circles to create one cohesive dough cup.
step-10: crack one egg into each dough cup and then season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
step-11: working carefully, pinch small sections of the tops of each dough wall together, crimping around the edge so that you bend the dough closer to the center and make five crimped crests on the top of each pie.
step-12: you want to build a top to the pies but there will still be a circle in the middle with exposed egg.
step-13: place the muffin tin on a center rack in the oven and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the puff pastry is golden brown and the egg looks set.
step-14: remove from muffin tin.

step-1: preheat oven to 300˚f (150˚c).
step-2: place gingersnaps in bottom of each liner, then set aside.
step-3: beat cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla until fluffy.
step-4: add eggs one at a time.
step-5: add in the sour cream, molasses, and spices.
step-6: pour mixture over gingersnaps.
step-7: bake for 20 minutes.
step-8: sprinkle with crushed gingersnaps.

step-1: preheat the oven to 325°f (170°c).
step-2: make the filling: whisk the egg yolks and lime zest in a medium bowl until tinted light green, about 2 minutes.
step-3: beat in the lime juice and condensed milk, then set aside at room temperature to thicken.
step-4: make the crust: crush the graham crackers in a zip-top bag, then mix in the sugar and butter.
step-5: divide the crumbs between a 6-cup muffin tin and press down to form crusts.
step-6: bake for 8 minutes or until golden brown.
step-7: let cool for 15 minutes.
step-8: pour filling into the crusts, then bake until the center is slightly jiggly, 15-17 minutes.
step-9: let cool to room temperature, then cover and refrigerate until chilled, 2-3 hours.
step-10: make the whipped cream: in a large bowl, beat the heavy cream with an electric hand mixer and slowly add the sugar.
step-11: once soft peaks form, add the lime zest, then whip until firm peaks form.
step-12: top the mini pies with whipped cream.

step-1: make the olive salad: add the olives, red peppers, capers, pepper, italian seasoning, celery seeds, red pepper flakes, and giardiniera to a food processor and pulse until coarsely chopped.
step-2: transfer to a medium bowl and whisk in the olive oil.
step-3: cover and set aside.
step-4: make the muffalettas: cut off the top ⅓ of each boule and set aside.
step-5: carefully remove the inside of the loaf, leaving about a ½-inch-thick (1 ¼ cm) layer of bread behind.
step-6: reserve the bread scraps for another use.
step-7: add a large spoonful of olive salad to the bottom of the bread bowls and spread evenly.
step-8: layer 4 slices of salami, 4 slices of mortadella, 4 slices of sopressata, and 2 slices of provolone in each loaf.
step-9: top with another layer of olive salad and spread evenly.
step-10: cover with the bread tops.
step-11: cover tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, up to overnight.
step-12: when ready to serve, slice the muffalettas into quarters.

step-1: in a saucepan, melt ¼ cup (55g) of butter and stir in the coconut milk and condensed milk.
step-2: add the grated yam (ube) to the mixture and break it down until the mixture is smooth.
step-3: be careful not to burn the ube.
step-4: remove from the heat, set aside and let the mixture cool.
step-5: in a medium bowl, mix the cream cheese, ¼ cup (55g) of butter, and sugar.
step-6: add the whipped cream and mix until creamy.
step-7: add two cups of the ube mixture and stir until all the ingredients are mixed.
step-8: in a small bowl, mix the crushed graham crackers and ¼ cup (55g) melted butter.
step-9: line a muffin tin with liners, pack the crust on the bottom of each liner.
step-10: top with cheesecake mixture.
step-11: freeze for at least an hour.
step-12: remove from the muffin tins, remove the liner, and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 325˚f (170˚c).
step-2: saute bacon in a medium-sized frying pan.
step-3: add squash and onion, until the onions are translucent and the squash golden brown.
step-4: season with sage, salt, and pepper.
step-5: set aside to cool.
step-6: roll out pie crust into an even thin layer.
step-7: with a 6-inch (15 cm) diameter bowl, cut out 6 circles.
step-8: fill a 6-cup cupcake tin with the cutouts.
step-9: mix eggs, sour cream, and milk.
step-10: season with salt and pepper.
step-11: add the onion-pumpkin-bacon mixture into the cups.
step-12: carefully pour egg mixture into every cup.
step-13: decorate pies with leftover pie crust, if desired.
step-14: cover edges and decoration with egg wash.
step-15: bake for 40 minutes or until egg mixture is cooked through and crust is golden brown.
step-16: (cover top with aluminum foil for the last 10 minutes if decoration gets too dark.)

step-1: form peanut butter sandwiches with ritz crackers.
step-2: place them in the bottom of each cup of a muffin tin.
step-3: in a large bowl beat together cream cheese and sugar.
step-4: then add peanut butter, sour cream, vanilla, 2 eggs, and beat again.
step-5: pour mixture over each peanut butter sandwich until each cup is ¾ full.
step-6: top with crushed ritz cracker.
step-7: bake for 22 minutes at 275°f (135°c).
step-8: let cool completely and then refrigerate 2 hours.

step-1: preheat oven to 375º f/ 190ºc.
step-2: for the filling, use a hand mixer and mix unsalted butter and sugar together.
step-3: add chopped pecans and vanilla extract and stir thoroughly.
step-4: for the tart shell, using hand mixer, blend cream cheese and unsalted butter together.
step-5: add flour and continue with the mixer until the dough looks like popcorn.
step-6: stop mixer and use hands to knead the dough.
step-7: roll each piece by hand into a ball and flatten.
step-8: shape each to fit the mini muffin pan.
step-9: fill tarts with filling.
step-10: bake for 20-25 minutes.
step-11: remove and let it cool in the mini muffin pan for 5 – 10 minutes.
step-12: remove from pan and serve warm.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: add the oil to a large pot over high heat.
step-3: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the chicken, and stir until cooked through, about 7 minutes.
step-4: transfer the chicken to a bowl.
step-5: melt butter in the same pot.
step-6: add the onions and carrots and stir until softened, about 8 minutes.
step-7: add the flour, stirring to combine.
step-8: slowly add the milk and chicken broth, alternating between the two, stirring continuously and bringing to a boil.
step-9: add the cooked chicken, peas, salt, and pepper, and stir until thoroughly mixed.
step-10: remove from heat and let cool.
step-11: lay out puff pastry sheets and use a small 6-inch (15 cm) bowl to cut circles out of it.
step-12: place dough circles in a nonstick muffin tin and fill with pot pie mixture.
step-13: using remaining puff pastry, cut ⅛-inch (3 mm) strips of dough, and make a lattice top for each muffin cup.
step-14: brush the lattice tops with the egg.
step-15: bake for 15 minutes, until golden brown.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c) and pre-cook all ingredients except for the ground pork and bacon.
step-2: in a large bowl, season the ground pork with salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne, and paprika.
step-3: add the egg and mix until just combined.
step-4: line a loaf pan with parchment paper and place ⅔ of the ground pork mixture into the pan.
step-5: push down in the center and up the sides to make a well, making sure to keep the walls pretty thick.
step-6: you don’t have to use the whole loaf pan.
step-7: place the pork chop, halved breakfast sausage links, deli ham, breakfast sausage patties, pulled pork, and smoked sausage link inside the well.
step-8: flatten the remaining ⅓ of the ground pork and place on top as a “lid”.
step-9: seal the edges well.
step-10: bake for 30 minutes.
step-11: on a large piece of parchment paper or plastic wrap, weave together the bacon strips until you have a bacon lattice twice as long and twice as wide as the pork loaf.
step-12: place the pork loaf in the middle of the bacon weave and wrap the bacon around it.
step-13: tuck any excess bacon underneath the loaf.
step-14: bake for another 30 minutes, or until the bacon is crispy.
step-15: let rest for 10 minutes before cutting.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, mix the cream cheese, pumpkin puree, brown sugar, maple syrup, graham cracker crumbs, and pumpkin pie spice.
step-3: cut out pumpkin shapes from the crust with a pumpkin cookie cutter.
step-4: arrange them on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-5: brush the beaten egg over half of the pumpkin shapes.
step-6: spoon a heaping teaspoon of pumpkin mixture onto the center of each shape.
step-7: place the other half of the pumpkin shapes on top of the bottom pumpkin shape and the pumpkin mixture.
step-8: press along the edges with your fingers.
step-9: using a fork, seal the edges of each pumpkin completely and lightly prick the tops.
step-10: brush the top of the pumpkins with the beaten egg.
step-11: bake for 25 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-12: cool mini pies on a wire rack.
step-13: in a large measuring cup, combine powdered sugar, vanilla extract, and pumpkin pie spice.
step-14: add milk one tablespoon at a time until you reach a smooth consistency.
step-15: drizzle the glaze over each mini pie.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f/180˚c.
step-2: steam the cauliflower for 8 minutes, or until softened.
step-3: let cool and drain.
step-4: with a potato masher or hand blender, mash the cauliflower, garlic, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: in a cast-iron pan, heat a little olive oil and sauté the onions and carrots until they begin to soften, about 3-4 minutes.
step-7: add the garlic and sauté for 1 minute.
step-8: add the ground turkey, salt, pepper, thyme, and rosemary and cook until turkey is browned and cooked through, about 3-4 minutes.
step-9: add flour and stir to combine.
step-10: add the tomato paste and broth while whisking.
step-11: add the peas and corn and cook until hot, about 5 minutes.
step-12: in a lined 12-cup muffin tray, evenly portion out the turkey mixture, followed by the mashed cauliflower.
step-13: sprinkle with cheese, as desired.
step-14: bake for 10-15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and has started to brown.

step-1: in a medium saucepan, add the butter, water, and salt over medium heat.
step-2: allow all the butter to melt and bring the mixture to a boil.
step-3: as soon as the mixture begins to boil, reduce heat to medium-low and add in the flour and graham cracker crumbs.
step-4: using a wooden spoon, mix thoroughly to combine.
step-5: continue stirring (about two minutes).
step-6: the dough should form into a ball and easily pull away from the sided of the pan.
step-7: remove the mixture from heat and leave to cool for 5 minutes.
step-8: add in the eggs to the cooled dough, one at a time, being sure to fully incorporate each egg before adding the next.
step-9: (the eggs will initially be difficult to incorporate into the dough - but continue stirring vigorously and they will eventually come together to form a smooth shiny dough)
step-10: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c)
step-11: once the dough comes together, transfer it to a piping bag and pipe onto a parchment-paper-lined baking sheet into 2-3 inch (5-7cm) logs.
step-12: smooth out any peaks/tails caused by piping with a wet fingertip (this will ensure your eclairs cook evenly and maintain an even shape)
step-13: brush the eclairs with beaten egg.
step-14: bake in a preheated oven for 10 minutes at 425˚f.
step-15: then, without opening the oven, reduce heat to 350˚ (175˚c) and bake for an additional 15 minutes.
step-16: remove eclairs from oven.
step-17: using the tip of a knife, cut a small “x” into the bottom of each eclair and transfer (“x” side up) to a cooling rack.
step-18: (this will allow any excess steam/moisture to escape ensuring your eclairs maintain their shape).
step-19: fill a piping bag fitted with a narrow tip with marshmallow fluff.
step-20: just before serving, pipe the fluff into the cooled eclairs.
step-21: break apart chocolate and add to a small microwave safe bowl.
step-22: to a separate, small microwave safe bowl, add the heavy cream.
step-23: microwave the cream for one minute.
step-24: remove and immediately pour the hot cream over the chocolate pieces.
step-25: stir until the chocolate has melted and a nice ganache has formed.
step-26: (if necessary place the bowl with chocolate and cream in the microwave for 10 second increments, stirring after each until smooth).
step-27: dip the top side of the filled eclairs into the melted chocolate.
step-28: sprinkle with additional graham cracker crumbs and top with mini marshmallows (if you have a kitchen torch you can “toast” the marshmallows to make them super cute).
step-29: best served immediately!

step-1: in a medium-sized bowl, combine all filling ingredients until smooth.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: roll out pie crust.
step-4: spread butter, cinnamon, and sugar over pie crust.
step-5: using a cup or a cookie cutter, cut 4-inch (10 cm) circles from the pie crust.
step-6: scoop about 2 tablespoons of the potato mixture into half of the cut-out crusts.
step-7: using the other half of the circles, place them on top of the circles that have potatoes on them.
step-8: press the edges down with a fork to seal.
step-9: brush with egg wash.
step-10: bake 400°f (200°c) for 20 minutes or until golden brown.
step-11: sprinkle with powdered sugar.

step-1: wash potatoes thoroughly and poke holes in each with a fork.
step-2: place into a large bowl.
step-3: sprinkle with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
step-4: make sure each potato is evenly coated.
step-5: place on a baking sheet covered with foil.
step-6: bake at 425˚f (220˚c) for 35 minutes, or until potatoes are tender enough that a fork can go through the center flesh easily.
step-7: let cool for 10 minutes or until potatoes can be handled comfortably.
step-8: cut off tips of both ends of each potato.
step-9: using a melon baller or metal teaspoon, carve out the center each potato.
step-10: set the tips and carvings aside in a large bowl to use as the filling.
step-11: (you may want to dice up the tips first so that they will mash easier).
step-12: melt butter and mix into the large bowl with the potato filling.
step-13: mash the potatoes with a fork until consistency is smooth.
step-14: mix in sour cream, cheddar cheese, bacon, green onion, salt, and pepper and stir until well combined.
step-15: using a small spoon, stuff each of the hollowed out potatoes with the filling.
step-16: bake at reduced temperature 375˚f(190˚c) for 5-7 minutes.
step-17: top each potato with cheddar cheese and bacon.
step-18: return to oven and bake for 3-5 minutes or until cheese is melted.
step-19: garnish with green onion.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, mash the ripe bananas.
step-3: add the eggs, oil, sugar, and cinnamon, and mix thoroughly.
step-4: add the flour and mix thoroughly.
step-5: in a saucepan over low heat, melt the butter, then mix the brown sugar until dissolved.
step-6: increase heat and bring mixture to a boil.
step-7: remove the saucepan from the heat, and divide caramel between the cups of a greased muffin tin.
step-8: lay a banana slice in each cup, then fill cups ¾ full with banana batter.
step-9: bake 20-25 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.
step-10: serve with vanilla ice cream.

step-1: peel and dice apples and put them in a large bowl.
step-2: set apple peel aside for decoration, if desired.
step-3: add lemon juice, sugar, and almonds, and mix.
step-4: roll out half of the puff pastry until thin, and cut into three even, long slices.
step-5: coat the slices with cream.
step-6: spread half the apple mixture on all three slices, covering three quarters and leaving about an inch (2 ½ cm) empty at the sides.
step-7: brush all the edges except the bottom one with water.
step-8: roll the dough over the apple mixture from bottom to top, until you have even rolls.
step-9: pinch the sides of the rolls to seal them with dough.
step-10: cut rolls in the middle and transfer with the closed side down into a greased muffin pan.
step-11: repeat with second half of puff pastry and apple mixture until you have 12 strudels.
step-12: mix vanilla powder with half of the milk described in package, usually 1 ½ cups (355 ml).
step-13: pour 2-3 tablespoons into each strudel.
step-14: spread egg wash over strudels.
step-15: bake at 400˚f(200˚c) for 25-30 minutes, until golden brown.
step-16: take strudels out of the pan and dust with powdered sugar.
step-17: the leftover apple peel can be rolled into “roses” for decoration.

step-1: preheat oven to 160°c (325˚f).
step-2: mix the flour, sugar, softened butter, baking powder, and eggs in a bowl until smooth, using a hand mixer.
step-3: grease a muffin tin and fill each hole about ¾ of the way up with the cake mixture.
step-4: bake for 25 minutes until golden and springy.
step-5: allow to cool.
step-6: cut sponges in half and spread jam on the bottom half.
step-7: pipe a spot of whipped cream in the centre, then in a circle around that.
step-8: place the top half back on and sprinkle with icing sugar.

step-1: in a cocktail shaker, or a tall glass, muddle raspberries, blueberries, and mint.
step-2: add lime juice, sweetener, and ice, and shake until well combined.
step-3: if you do not have a cocktail shaker, simply pour back and forth between two glasses until combined.
step-4: strain mixture over ice and top with a splash of soda water.
step-5: garnish with berries and mint.

step-1: add the avocados to a blender or food processor, along with honey, coconut milk, peppermint extract and salt.
step-2: blend until smooth, scraping down sides as necessary.
step-3: pour mixture into a freezer-safe dish and fold in the chocolate chunks.
step-4: freeze for at least 2-3 hours.
step-5: if freezing overnight, allow to defrost for 10-15 minutes for easier scooping.

step-1: preheat oven to 325°f (160°c).
step-2: combine the cookie dough, cocoa powder, and mint chocolate chunks until evenly distributed.
step-3: using an ice cream scoop, place 6 scoops of dough on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-4: bake for 14 minutes.

step-1: peel and slice the bananas, then freeze overnight.
step-2: add frozen bananas, fresh mint, cacao nibs, almond milk, and agave to a food processor or blender.
step-3: blend until smooth and stick.
step-4: transfer to a loaf pan and freeze for at least 2 hours.
step-5: serve with your favorite toppings.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: prepare the brownie batter according to the package instructions.
step-3: pour the batter into a greased 9-inch (22 cm) round cake pan.
step-4: bake according to the package instructions, about 30 minutes, until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.
step-5: let cool completely.
step-6: in a large bowl, beat the cold heavy cream with an electric hand mixer until soft peaks form.
step-7: fold in the peppermint extract, sugar, and green food coloring with a rubber spatula until incorporated.
step-8: in a medium bowl, pour the hot heavy cream over the white chocolate chips.
step-9: let sit for 1 minute, then stir with a rubber spatula until smooth.
step-10: fold the white chocolate mixture into the whipped cream until no streaks remain.
step-11: fold in the mini chocolate chips and crushed mint chocolate cookies.
step-12: line a 10-inch (25 cm) diameter bowl with the whole mint chocolate cookies.
step-13: carefully pour the whipped cream mixture over the cookies and spread evenly.
step-14: place the brownie upside down on top and lightly press into the cream.
step-15: cover and freeze until solid, at least 5 hours or overnight.
step-16: invert the bowl onto a serving plate and let the the ice cream dome to release from the bowl.
step-17: slice and serve, garnished with fresh mint.

step-1: in a blender, combine frozen bananas, dairy-free ice cream, cocoa powder, fresh mint, dairy-free milk, and ice cubes.
step-2: blend until combined.

step-1: in a medium bowl, mix coconut oil and chocolate.
step-2: melt in microwave for 60 seconds.
step-3: stir every 15 seconds until melted.
step-4: add extract into melted chocolate.
step-5: place cereal in large bowl.
step-6: mix in melted chocolate and stir until evenly coated.
step-7: in a large plastic bag, add powdered sugar and cocoa powder.
step-8: close and shake until each cereal is coated with sugar.
step-9: add in mint chocolate candies.

step-1: microwave the chocolate chips for 30 seconds.
step-2: stir and microwave for an additional 30 seconds.
step-3: stir again.
step-4: chips should be fully melted.
step-5: top one cracker with melted chocolate and shredded coconut.
step-6: place lollipop stick on cracker and top with more white chocolate and a second cracker, making a sandwich.
step-7: repeat as many times as desired and freeze the pops until the the chocolate is hard.
step-8: melt more chocolate and add some mint extract (about ½ tsp per pound of chocolate) and coconut oil (about 1 tbsp.
step-9: per pound of chocolate).
step-10: dip pops in chocolate and swirl until completely coated.
step-11: carefully cut holes in the ritz box to hold your lollipops.
step-12: freeze until hard.
step-13: use the orange and black frosting to decorate your lollipops.

step-1: pour the champagne into an 8-ounce (235 ml) champagne flute.
step-2: add the lemon juice, 1 slice of lemon, and the mint tea to the glass.
step-3: garnish with a sprig of mint and serve.

step-1: bloom gelatin by mixing gelatin into cold water and letting it sit for at least 5 minutes.
step-2: heat granulated sugar, corn syrup, and water on a stove top to a boil.
step-3: in a bowl, combine the white chocolate chips, sweetened condensed milk, and solidified gelatin.
step-4: pour the hot sugar mixture over the chocolate, condensed milk, and gelatin.
step-5: cover with a cloth until chocolate is soft.
step-6: mix thoroughly until all chocolate is completely melted.
step-7: add desired color and titanium dioxide to the hot mixture.
step-8: mix until there are no air bubbles.
step-9: let mixture cool to 90°f (33°c), then pour over the frozen cake.
step-10: note, this recipe works best on a cake covered in a frozen mousse, but will also work with a cake covered in frozen buttercream frosting.

step-1: boil the water, sugar, and condensed milk in a pot for 1 minute, then remove from heat.
step-2: bloom the gelatin sheets in 8 cups (2 liters) of cold water for 5 minutes, then wring the gelatin sheets of excess water and mix into the sugar mixture.
step-3: pour the liquid over the chocolate, letting it sit for 2-3 minutes to allow the chocolate to soften.
step-4: using an immersion blender, carefully blend the chocolate and the liquid, making sure that you are not blending in air bubbles by lifting up the blender too high.
step-5: it’s okay to go slow, just make sure it’s all blended with as little bubbles as possible, which will show up in the final product.
step-6: sieve the mix into a large jug or vertical container to remove any excess bubbles.
step-7: if there are still bubbles, continue to sieve back and forth.
step-8: a trick to remove air bubbles from the surface is to manually pop them with a toothpick or to press cling film into the surface and remove the bubbles.
step-9: separate the glaze into different containers and color them to your desire.
step-10: we used red and white for this cake.
step-11: blend the coloring with the glaze until the color is distributed evenly, then cover each container with the cling film, pressing the film into the glaze to ensure that there is no skin when you are ready to use the glaze.
step-12: when you are ready to use the glaze, make sure each one is around 90-96°f, then pour the colored glazes back into one container.
step-13: swirl them if you’d like, then glaze your cake!

step-1: spread the jam evenly into the bottom of a round 8-inch (20 cm) cake pan, then place one of the cake rounds on top.
step-2: freeze completely.
step-3: in a 9-inch by 3-inch (23 cm 8 cm) by silicone round cake mold, pour ⅔ of the chocolate mousse then tap the mold on the table to release any air bubbles.
step-4: place the frozen cake & jam disc on top of the mousse, jam-side down.
step-5: press the cake down slightly, then cover it with the rest of the mousse.
step-6: place the 2nd cake round on top, pressing down until the mousse rises to the level of the cake.
step-7: carefully transfer to a freezer and freeze overnight.
step-8: it is vital that the cake is 100% frozen through.
step-9: place a can on top of a baking sheet, then carefully unmold the cake onto the can.
step-10: make sure to work quickly and that the glaze is already prepared.
step-11: when the mirror glaze is between 90 and 96°f (32 - 35°c) , pour the glaze over the cake in a circular motion, making sure to start in the center and work your way outwards.
step-12: you only have one chance to glaze the cake, since the glaze will start to set due to the cold temperature of the cake, so do not pour a 2nd round of glaze after the first one.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with a reusable baking mat or parchment paper.
step-3: in a small bowl, stir together the butter, miso, ginger, garlic, and sesame oil.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: arrange the potatoes on the prepared baking sheet.
step-6: season with salt and pepper and drizzle with ½ tablespoon sunflower oil.
step-7: toss to coat.
step-8: roast the potatoes until tender, 10-12 minutes.
step-9: while the potatoes roast, sear the sea bass.
step-10: pat each fillet dry with a clean kitchen towel or paper towel and season on both sides with salt and pepper.
step-11: heat 2 tablespoons of sunflower oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat.
step-12: once the oil is nearly smoking, add the sea bass, skin-side down, and cook until the skin is crispy, 3-4 minutes.
step-13: flip and sear the other side until golden brown, about 3 minutes.
step-14: remove the fish from the pan.
step-15: remove the potatoes from the oven, leaving the oven on.
step-16: move the potatoes to a quarter of the pan.
step-17: place the fish, skin-side down, on the other quarter and spread the bok choy on the empty half.
step-18: brush the miso butter over each fish fillet, then flip and brush more on the skin side.
step-19: drizzle the remaining ½ tablespoon sunflower oil over the bok choy and season with salt and pepper.
step-20: toss to coat.
step-21: return the baking sheet to the oven and bake until the fish is completely opaque and just cooked through, 8-10 minutes.
step-22: the internal temperature should reach 145°f (63°c).
step-23: divide the fish, potatoes, and bok choy between 2 plates.
step-24: garnish with sesame seeds and serve immediately.

step-1: in a small bowl, combine miso, sugar, sake and mirin.
step-2: in a shallow container, combine the marinade and salmon.
step-3: marinate at least 30 minutes in the fridge.
step-4: heat the pan over medium low heat.
step-5: place a parchment paper in a pan.
step-6: place salmon on top of the parchment paper so salmon doesn’t burn.
step-7: cook 6-7 minutes both side or salmon gets the nice grill mark and color becomes opaque.

step-1: using extreme caution, cut the tofu into cubes, trim snow peas.
step-2: cut mushroom ends
step-3: in a medium size saucepan, add dashi and bring it to a boil.
step-4: add tofu, snow peas, and enoki, for 3 minutes.
step-5: turn of the heat.
step-6: in a small dish, place miso.
step-7: add a small amount of dashi and dissolve the miso.
step-8: pour over dissolved miso into the pot.
step-9: turn back the heat and warm up the soup, right before it boils.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: in medium bowl, mix the sweet potatoes with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
step-3: in a separate medium bowl mix the peppers with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
step-4: transfer the potatoes and peppers to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-5: on a separate piece of parchment paper, place the chicken then add olive oil, garlic, salt and pepper and rub until the chicken is fully coated.
step-6: seal the chicken in the parchment paper by folding it in half then twisting the open ends together.
step-7: place the chicken onto the baking sheet and bake for 25 minutes.
step-8: carefully remove the chicken.
step-9: on a cutting board, cube the chicken.
step-10: in a medium bowl add the tahini, garlic, salt, pepper, lemon juice, and water.
step-11: mix well then divide the tahini sauce into 2 single-serve containers.
step-12: add salsa to 2 single-serve containers.
step-13: to assemble the chicken burrito bowl, add half of the brown rice, half of the chicken, half of the peppers, half of the black beans, and half of the tomatoes.
step-14: serve with salsa.
step-15: to assemble the vegetarian wrap, add the remaining brown rice, half of the sweet potatoes, half of the peppers, remainder of the black beans, half of the remaining tomatoes, and a whole wheat tortilla.
step-16: serve with salsa.
step-17: to assemble the chicken pita pocket, add half of the quinoa, half of the chicken, half of the chickpeas, remaining tomatoes, half of the cucumbers, ½ of the lettuce, and a whole wheat pita.
step-18: serve with tahini sauce.
step-19: to assemble the vegetarian grain bowl, add remaining quinoa, remaining sweet potatoes, remaining chickpeas, remaining tomatoes, remaining cucumbers, and remaining lettuce.
step-20: serve with tahini sauce.
step-21: store in fridge for up to one week then remove and reheat when ready to eat.

step-1: in a medium bowl, cream the butter and sugar with a hand mixer until light and fluffy.
step-2: add the egg and vanilla extract and mix until fully incorporated.
step-3: add the flour, baking soda, and baking powder, and mix until the dough is crumbly, but holds together when squeezed.
step-4: split the base dough in half, add your desired mix-ins, and incorporate them fully.
step-5: we used chocolate hazelnut spread and cocoa powder for one half and peanut butter for the other.
step-6: roll out each dough between two sheets of parchment paper until it’s ¼-inch (6-mm) thick.
step-7: chill both doughs for 30 minutes.
step-8: place one half of flavored dough on top of the other and start to roll up the doughs into a swirl.
step-9: wrap the roll in plastic wrap and chill in the fridge until solid, about 4 hours.
step-10: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-11: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-12: once chilled, unwrap the dough, slice into ½-inch (1 cm) thick coins, and place them on the baking sheet at least 2 inches (5 cm) apart, as the cookies will spread while baking.
step-13: bake the cookies for 10 minutes.
step-14: let cool at room temperature for about 30 minutes.
step-15: try additional combinations.

step-1: place the coconut milk, blueberries, strawberries, raspberries, and honey in a blender and blend until the mixture is smooth.
step-2: pour the coconut mixture into popsicle molds filled almost to the brim.
step-3: freeze the popsicles for at least 4 hours.
step-4: unmold the popsicles.

step-1: make the crepes by sifting the flour, salt, and sugar and then slowly stir in the egg, and butter.
step-2: slowly add the milk into the mixture.
step-3: in a nonstick pan over medium heat, pour in ⅓ cup (80ml) of the batter and turn it to cover the whole surface.
step-4: cook until the bottom is brown and flip.
step-5: repeat until you’re all out of crepe batter.
step-6: set the crepes aside to cool.
step-7: lay out a crepe and spread the berries in a quarter section.
step-8: fold the crepe in half and then slowly roll it into a cone.
step-9: top with more berries if desired, whipped cream, and powdered sugar.

step-1: add the kale, banana, blackberries, blueberries, oats, ginger, and chia seeds to a resealable container.
step-2: cover and store in the freezer for up to 3 months.
step-3: when ready to prepare, add the contents from the container and the almond milk to a blender and blend until smooth.

step-1: whisk eggs, cinnamon, vanilla and milk together in medium-large bowl to create egg wash.
step-2: dunk bread in egg wash.
step-3: melt butter in a skillet on medium-low heat and cook bread for 2-3 minutes.
step-4: mix berries, sugar, and lemon juice in medium pan over low heat crushing and stirring berries until they form a thick sauce.
step-5: lay out slices and spread compote in between each slice then on top.
step-6: garnish with confectioners sugar (optional).

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: slice bread into quarters.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: in a large bowl, combine honey and warm water.
step-5: whisk until the honey dissolves.
step-6: add milk, eggs, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and salt.
step-7: whisk until well-combined.
step-8: pour the bread into a greased 9x13 (23x33 cm) baking dish.
step-9: top with the egg mixture.
step-10: toss the bread and egg mixture together to evenly coat the bread.
step-11: let the bread soak for 20 minutes.
step-12: add the blueberries, raspberries, and blackberries evenly on top of the bread.
step-13: bake for 45-50 minutes until golden brown and slightly crispy around the edges and top.
step-14: note: times & temperatures may vary based on oven.
step-15: serve with maple syrup on top (optional).

step-1: to a blender add the blackberries, blueberries, raspberry sorbet, and lemonade.
step-2: blend until smooth.
step-3: serve immediately to drink or freeze for 30 minutes to eat with a spoon.

step-1: combine all ingredients in a blender, and mix until fully blended.
step-2: serve and garnish with a strawberry.

step-1: combine all ingredients in a food processor until smooth.
step-2: transfer to an 8x8-inch (20x20 cm) glass dish.
step-3: freeze for at least 2 hours.

step-1: in a large pitcher, combine the blackberries, strawberries, blueberries, red wine, brandy, and apple juice.
step-2: stir until mixed.
step-3: chill for at least 4 hours.
step-4: add the lemon-lime soda, then serve with a strawberry on each glass.

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: pour pancake mix, milk, and eggs into a bowl and mix just until combined.
step-3: pour batter onto a parchment-lined baking sheet and spread to the edges.
step-4: place strawberry slices on top of the batter, followed by the blueberries and raspberries.
step-5: bake for 15 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-6: cut into squares and serve immediately, or freeze up to 1 month.
step-7: to reheat, place on a microwave-safe plate and heat for 20 seconds per pancake on the plate.

step-1: preheat your oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-2: in a cast-iron skillet over medium-low heat, add the berries, sugar, cornstarch, and lemon juice.
step-3: mix to combine and stir for 5-10 minutes until the mixture starts to thicken.
step-4: let simmer for 5 minutes on low heat.
step-5: sprinkle the box cake mix over the berry filling.
step-6: distribute the butter evenly over the top to ensure even baking.
step-7: bake for 45 minutes to an hour, until the top is golden brown.
step-8: serve warm with ice cream.

step-1: combine all ingredients into a blender.
step-2: mix until consistency is smooth.
step-3: serve.

step-1: for the dressing, push a straw through the strawberries from the tip to the green top to remove the hull.
step-2: (or you can cut it off with a knife!)
step-3: add the rest of the dressing ingredients.
step-4: blend until smooth.
step-5: refrigerate.
step-6: cut strawberries, apple, and onion into slices.
step-7: combine all the salad ingredients in a large bowl.
step-8: drizzle with desired amount of dressing and toss to coat.
step-9: (spinach wilts easily, don’t add dressing until ready to eat!)
step-10: sprinkle feta cheese on top and serve.

step-1: in a blender, mix fruit until consistency is smooth.
step-2: add in yogurt and blend until fully mixed.
step-3: pour mixture into a baking pan lined with parchment paper.
step-4: add desired amount of toppings.
step-5: freeze for 6 hours, or overnight, until frozen solid.
step-6: break yogurt bark into desired numbers of pieces.
step-7: serve cold, or store in a closed container in the freezer.

step-1: in a small bowl, combine the water and flax meal and stir to combine.
step-2: let sit for 10 minutes.
step-3: set aside until ready to use.
step-4: preheat the oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-5: in a food processor, combine the broccoli and carrots, and pulse until shredded.
step-6: add the cauliflower and pulse until shredded.
step-7: add the salt, pepper, onion powder, garlic, and flax egg, and pulse until well combined.
step-8: add 1¼ cups (145 g) of the bread crumbs and mix.
step-9: take about 1 tablespoon of the mixture and form it into a nugget with your hands.
step-10: repeat with remaining mixture.
step-11: coat the nuggets on both sides with the remaining ¾ cup (85 g) of bread crumbs.
step-12: pan fry with a small drizzle of oil over medium-high heat until both sides are golden brown, about 10 minutes.
step-13: or, you can bake them on a piece of parchment paper for 20 minutes, flipping after the first 10 minutes.
step-14: allow to cool for 5 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: on a cutting board, grate the zucchini, sweet potato, carrot, and broccoli with a coarse cheese grater.
step-3: transfer the grated vegetables to a medium bowl and season with ½ teaspoon of salt.
step-4: mix until well incorporated.
step-5: let the vegetables sit for 20 minutes until the salt has drawn out some of the moisture.
step-6: transfer the grated veggies into a kitchen towel and twist to strain as much liquid as you can.
step-7: place the grated veggies back into a bowl and mix with the parmesan, panko, pepper, remaining salt, onion powder, garlic powder, olive oil, and egg.
step-8: mix until well combined.
step-9: form the mixture into 20-25 even-sized tots and transfer to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-10: bake for 20-30 minutes or until tots are golden brown, flipping each halfway through.
step-11: serve with your choice of dipping sauce.

step-1: put all ingredients into a blender and mix until smooth.
step-2: serve in a glass and garnish with toppings (optional).

step-1: cut each biscuit into 4 pieces and place in a large bowl.
step-2: in a separate bowl, whisk the eggs, milk, vanilla extract, and instant coffee until well-blended.
step-3: pour the liquid mixture over the biscuits and stir to coat.
step-4: spoon half of the biscuit and liquid mixture into a greased 9x9-inch (22cm x 22cm) baking dish.
step-5: place the chocolate bars on top and cover with the remaining half of the biscuit mixture.
step-6: bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the biscuits are no longer doughy on the inside and there is no more liquid.
step-7: cool for 10 minutes and serve with a dollop of whipped cream and drizzle of chocolate syrup.

step-1: add all ingredients to slow cooker and stir.
step-2: cook on high for 1 hour, stirring occasionally.
step-3: top with whipped cream and sprinkle on cocoa powder.

step-1: in a bain-marie, melt the butter, sugar, and cocoa powder.
step-2: stir in the egg and keep stirring for a minute until the mix thickens.
step-3: remove the bowl from heat.
step-4: add the graham cracker crumbs, the almonds (chopped finely), and the coconut flakes.
step-5: when well mixed, pour into an 8x8 inch (20x20 cm) pan and flatten until you get an even layer.
step-6: cream the custard powder, softened butter, cream, and instant coffee until smooth.
step-7: add the powdered sugar and mix until smooth.
step-8: pour mixture on top of the crust and spread it until you get an even layer.
step-9: in a bain marie, slowly melt the chocolate and the butter.
step-10: cool it down a little bit then pour it over middle layer.
step-11: chill the bars for at least 3 hours.
step-12: cut them into 9 even squares and sprinkle each one with cocoa powder.

step-1: divide red bean paste into 20 and make it into small balls.
step-2: add shiratamako, sugar, and water in a medium bowl.
step-3: knead until firm and smooth.
step-4: if it is too dry, add more water.
step-5: pull off a portion of dough and flatten.
step-6: wrap the each sweet bean ball and roll into a ball.
step-7: the size of the ball should be slightly smaller than your takoyaki pan.
step-8: evenly coat with toasted sesame seeds.
step-9: cook the sesame balls in a greased takoyaki pan.
step-10: continue rolling the balls to cook evenly.
step-11: cook until the dough turn into translucent, approximately 5 -7 minutes.
step-12: serve immediately.

step-1: slice the chicken breasts in half lengthways.
step-2: put all of the ingredients into a ziplock bag and stir them all about so everything is coated and mixed up.
step-3: marinate for at least 4 hours, but try to leave them over night if you have the time.
step-4: cook the chicken as you usually would, we used a griddle pan on a medium heat for about 6-7 minutes on each side, but these can go in a regular pan, the oven or even on the bbq!
step-5: don’t forget to give it one last squeeze of lemon juice to give it that extra kick!

step-1: in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, combine the water, butter, 2 tablespoons sugar, and the salt, and bring to a boil.
step-2: as soon as the mixture begins to boil, reduce the heat to medium-low and add the flour.
step-3: using a wooden spoon, stir until the dough comes together to form a ball, about 1 minute.
step-4: remove the pan from the heat and let cool for 5 minutes before proceeding to avoid accidentally cooking the eggs.
step-5: mix in the eggs, 1 at a time, fully incorporating each egg before adding the next.
step-6: then add the vanilla.
step-7: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-8: transfer the dough to a piping bag fitted with a closed star tip.
step-9: pipe 18 1½-inch (3 cm) spiral rounds onto the baking sheet.
step-10: top each with a milk chocolate truffle.
step-11: pipe the dough in a spiral to cover the truffles, being careful to completely seal the chocolate.
step-12: immediately transfer the tray to the freezer and freeze for 1 hour, until solid.
step-13: heat the oil in a deep pot until it reaches 350˚f (180˚c).
step-14: fry in batches of 4 until nicely browned, about 3 minutes, turning so they fry evenly.
step-15: drain on a cooling rack, or paper towel-lined plate and dab off any excess oil.
step-16: combine the remaining ½ cup sugar (100 g) and the cinnamon in a small bowl.
step-17: roll the warm churro bombs in the mixture to coat.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c)
step-2: take two cinnamon roll dough packs and press them flat into circles.
step-3: for the filling: in a medium bowl, mix together the cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla, stirring until smooth.
step-4: add the milk and stir until there are no lumps.
step-5: freeze cream cheese mixture for about 1 hour until it sets and is frozen but not too hard.
step-6: scoop out a large spoonful of the mixture and place it in the center of one of the cinnamon roll dough circles.
step-7: fold the edges of the dough up the sides of the cream cheese scoop.
step-8: place the other flattened dough circle on top, using a spoon to tuck the edges underneath.
step-9: repeat with the remaining dough and cream cheese.
step-10: place the sealed dough balls upside down in a 9x9 (23x23) cake pan with the seams facing upwards.
step-11: bake for 20–25 minutes until the rolls are golden brown and puffed.
step-12: drizzle the reserved icing on top of the rolls, and serve while warm.

step-1: in a large bowl, prepare the brownie mix.
step-2: spray 2 ramekins with the cooking spray.
step-3: place a spoonful of the brownie batter into each ramekin, then place two chocolate truffles in each dish.
step-4: spoon more brownie batter over the top of the truffles, until the ramekin is about ¾-full.
step-5: smooth the batter evenly over the truffles.
step-6: bake for 25 minutes, then cool for another 25 minutes.
step-7: on the serving plate, place the berries and the mint in a corner.
step-8: to ensure that the brownie comes loose, run a knife around the edges of each ramekin before inverting the dish onto the center of each plate.
step-9: serve with ice cream and a drizzle of chocolate sauce.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: add the grapes to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and sprinkle with sugar and thyme.
step-3: bake for 45-55 minutes.
step-4: cool completely.
step-5: in the bowl of a food processor, add the graham crackers and pulse until finely crumbled.
step-6: transfer the graham cracker crumbs to a bowl with the powdered sugar, melted butter, and cinnamon, and stir to combine.
step-7: press the graham cracker mixture into an 8- or 9-inch pie dish, pressing an even layer on the bottom and sides of the dish.
step-8: bake for 10 minutes.
step-9: let crust cool completely before filling.
step-10: in a bowl, add the cream cheese, eggs, sugar, and vanilla extract, and blend until smooth with a hand mixer.
step-11: pour the cream cheese mixture into the cooled crust, and bake for 10 minutes.
step-12: remove and cool for at least 5 minutes.
step-13: in a bowl, add the sour cream, sugar, and vanilla extract in a bowl and mix to combine.
step-14: spread the sour cream mixture on top of the pie in an even layer and bake for 10 minutes.
step-15: remove and cool at room temperature.
step-16: refrigerate for at least 4 hours, until chilled.
step-17: top with the roasted grapes.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: prepare a 9-inch (22 cm) round cake pan with a 3½- inch (8 cm) ramekin in the center and set nearby.
step-3: melt the butter in a large pan over medium-low heat.
step-4: add the onion and sauté until caramelized, stirring occasionally for about 15 minutes.
step-5: remove the pan from the heat.
step-6: take a golf ball-sized piece of pizza dough and flatten it out with your fingers.
step-7: stuff the dough with about a teaspoon of caramelized onions and cooked bacon.
step-8: close the dough ball by pinching at the seam and roll into a ball in your hands.
step-9: repeat with the remaining dough and fillings.
step-10: dip each stuffed ball in the melted butter.
step-11: place the stuffed balls in the prepared cake pan, stacking them around the ramekin.
step-12: bake for 30 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-13: remove from the oven and reduce the oven temperature to 350˚f (180°c).
step-14: remove the ramekin with tongs (it will be hot!).
step-15: place the wheel of brie in the center.
step-16: return the pan to the oven for 10 minutes more, or until the brie is soft.
step-17: brush the monkey bread with more melted butter and sprinkle the bread and cheese with chives.
step-18: serve with vegetables like broccoli, potatoes, and mushrooms for dipping.

step-1: add the moringa powder to the cooked oatmeal and stir to combine.
step-2: serve in a bowl with the toppings of your choice.
step-3: but before that, take a photo and post it on instagram.

step-1: add the strawberries, banana, spinach, non-dairy milk, and moringa to a blender and blend until smooth.
step-2: pour into a glass or a bowl and add your desired toppings, such as fresh berries, shredded coconut, or bee pollen.
step-3: take a photo and post it on your instagram!

step-1: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-2: in a medium bowl, combine the white chocolate chips and coconut oil.
step-3: microwave on medium power in 30-second intervals, stirring between, until melted and smooth.
step-4: dip the strawberries in melted white chocolate, then place on the prepared baking sheet.
step-5: let set at room temperature for at least 1 hour.
step-6: divide the frosting evenly between 3 small bowls.
step-7: use gel food coloring to color each bowl of frosting pastel purple, orange, and pink.
step-8: add the purple frosting to a piping bag fitted with a large closed star piping tip.
step-9: starting in center, pipe the frosting on a standard cupcake, spiraling from the center out toward the edge.
step-10: frost 2 more cupcakes with purple frosting.
step-11: add the orange frosting a piping bag fitted with a small closed star piping tip.
step-12: starting in the center of a mini cupcake, pipe a small star.
step-13: repeat, working your way outward, until the top is filled.
step-14: repeat with remaining mini cupcakes.
step-15: add the pink frosting to a piping bag fitted with a large closed star piping tip.
step-16: starting in the center and working outward, pipe the frosting onto the remaining 3 standard cupcakes.
step-17: chill the cupcakes for 20 minutes, or until ready to assemble.
step-18: prepare the flower pot by nestling the flower foam inside in multiple pieces.
step-19: lightly crumple sheets of parchment in your hands, then uncrumple and stuff into the areas around the foam so the ends stick up and out of the flower pot.
step-20: to assemble the bouquet, slide a gumdrop about 1 inch (2.5 cm) down each skewer; this will keep the cupcakes and strawberries from sliding down.
step-21: slide a large cupcake onto a skewer.
step-22: press the bottom end of the skewer through the foam so the cupcake is upright.
step-23: use varying lengths of skewers, trimming as needed and add more skewered cupcakes and strawberries until the bouquet is full.
step-24: (you may have leftover strawberries.) add more paper as needed.
step-25: note: keep the larger cupcakes mostly upright in the container.
step-26: save the smaller, less heavy cupcakes and strawberries for decorating the sides.
step-27: store in the refrigerator until ready to eat.

step-1: peel and cut onions into 1-centimeter (½ inch) rings.
step-2: separate the rings.
step-3: slice the mozzarella into 4 even strips.
step-4: place a smaller onion ring in the center of a larger one.
