step-5: fill the gap between the rings with the mozzarella strips.
step-6: for extra cheesiness, use two layers of cheese.
step-7: repeat with remaining onion rings and freeze for 1 hour.
step-8: place the flour, eggs, and breadcrumbs into three separate bowls.
step-9: coat each prepared ring in the flour first.
step-10: then dip into the egg, then the breadcrumbs, then the egg again, and one last time into the breadcrumbs.
step-11: repeat with the remaining onion rings and place in freezer.
step-12: fill a large pot with oil and set over medium high heat until it reaches 350˚f (175˚c).
step-13: fry the rings until golden brown, being careful not to fry them for too long as the cheese may ooze out completely.
step-14: drain on a paper towel, then serve with marinara!

step-1: preheat a waffle maker to medium heat.
step-2: cut the mozzarella into four equal slices, then cut each slice in half into square chunks, making eight chunks total.
step-3: place the flour, beaten eggs, and bread crumbs into three separate bowls.
step-4: dredge a mozzarella square in the flour, shaking off the excess, then dip into the beaten egg.
step-5: roll it in the bread crumbs, making sure that it is completely coated.
step-6: put the breaded mozzarella on a plate; repeat with the remaining mozzarella chunks.
step-7: spray the waffle iron on both sides with cooking spray.
step-8: cook the mozzarella squares in the waffle iron for about two minutes, until the bread crumbs are golden brown and the cheese is starting to bubble.
step-9: garnish with scallions and serve with marinara!

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, mix together the milk, eggs, and melted butter.
step-3: fold in the flour, cornmeal, baking powder, salt, and sugar, until blended.
step-4: divide the cheese sticks into 5 cubes each so there are 25 cubes.
step-5: spray a 12-cup muffin pan with cooking spray.
step-6: spoon 2 tablespoons of mixture into each cup.
step-7: place 2 of the mozzarella cubes in the center of each cup, then cover the cover with additional batter, until the cup is ¾ full.
step-8: bake for 15 minutes.
step-9: allow to cool for 5 minutes while you eat the remaining cheese cube.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f/190˚c.
step-2: prepare sauce in a small bowl and set aside.
step-3: combine all other ingredients (except for the cheese) in a large bowl until evenly distributed.
step-4: add in half of the meatloaf mixture to a greased loaf pan and flatten to form an even layer.
step-5: add slices of cheese to form a thin layer on top of the meatloaf.
step-6: fill loaf pan with remainder of meatloaf, smoothing out the final top layer.
step-7: top meatloaf with half of the tomato sauce mixture, using a spoon or rubber spatula to cover the top evenly.
step-8: reserve the other half of the tomato sauce.
step-9: bake for 1 hour, or until the internal temperature reads 160˚f/70˚c when poked with a meat thermometer.
step-10: when the meatloaf is ready, heat your tomato sauce in the microwave or on a skillet, and drizzle on top of your meatloaf.
step-11: garnish with fresh chopped parsley.
step-12: serve with your favorite sides.
step-13: (we used mashed sweet potatoes and asparagus.)

step-1: preheat oven to 350ºf/180ºc
step-2: in a medium-sized bowl, mash a ripened banana until mostly smooth.
step-3: add egg and stir
step-4: add honey, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, vanilla and greek yogurt, and mix.
step-5: fold in the oats and lastly incorporate the milk.
step-6: fill each cup of a greased six-cup muffin tin a quarter of the way full.
step-7: in each respective cup, add strawberries, apple, blueberries, blackberries, raspberries, and almonds, then fill cups to the top with the rest of batter.
step-8: bake 30 minutes or until risen slightly and turning dark and a bit crunchy on the edges.
step-9: allow to cool for 5 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-2: in a greased muffin tin, place your desired combination of fillings into each muffin cup.
step-3: in a measuring cup, add salt and pepper to eggs and beat the eggs until smooth.
step-4: season each cup with salt and pepper.
step-5: pour the beaten eggs into each muffin cup until the liquid almost reaches the top.
step-6: bake at 350°f (180°c) for 20 minutes, until set.

step-1: preheat oven to 300°f (150°c).
step-2: crack twelve eggs, and separate the yolks and egg whites into separate bowls.
step-3: spray a mini muffin tin with nonstick spray.
step-4: pour each yolk and egg white into its own mini muffin tin hole.
step-5: place the tin into a baking dish with a tinfoil ring, wire wrack, or a towel to keep the muffin tin from touching the bottom of the baking dish directly (so the eggs steam gently in the oven and don’t turn brown).
step-6: cover the eggs and the baking dish tightly with aluminum foil.
step-7: make sure the foil tents up so it doesn’t touch any of the eggs.
step-8: lift one edge of the foil and pour in boiling water ⅓ way up the muffin tin and re-cover with foil.
step-9: place the eggs in the oven for 13 minutes.
step-10: check to make sure the egg whites and yolks are both fully cooked.
step-11: remove foil and muffin tin from baking dish and let cool.
step-12: with a thin knife, remove the egg yolks and egg whites from the tin.
step-13: set the egg whites aside.
step-14: in a bowl, combine the cooked egg yolks, greek yogurt, relish, mustard, hot sauce, salt, and pepper.
step-15: mix with a fork until well combined.
step-16: place the mixture in a piping bag with a desirable tip and pipe the yolk mixture onto the cooked egg whites.
step-17: sprinkle with paprika and chopped parsley.

step-1: in a medium-sized bowl, mash a ripened banana until mostly smooth.
step-2: add honey and vanilla, stir.
step-3: add salt, cinnamon, and oats.
step-4: mix well.
step-5: press 2 tablespoons of mix into each cup, form a cup-shape.
step-6: refrigerate 1 hour and preheat oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-7: bake granola cups for 30 minutes.
step-8: allow to cool for 5 minutes and add a tablespoon of yogurt to each cup along with any preferred toppings.

step-1: in a large pot over medium-low heat or a slow cooker, combine the simple syrup, star anise, cinnamon sticks, brandy, orange juice, orange, lemon, lime, and red wine.
step-2: stir well, cover, and simmer over low heat for at least 20 minutes, until warmed through.
step-3: ladle the sangria into mugs and garnish with lime wedges.

step-1: add the red wine, pineapple juice, and sugar to a slow cooker.
step-2: whisk to dissolve the sugar.
step-3: add the sliced oranges, cinnamon sticks, cloves, peppercorns, and ginger.
step-4: turn the heat to high, cover, and warm for 30-60 minutes, until steaming.
step-5: once steaming, reduce the heat setting to warm.
step-6: ladle into mugs and garnish with orange wheels.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: roll out the pizza dough to a 14x14-inch (35x35-cm) square, about ¼-inch (6 mm) thick.
step-4: arrange 4 of the ham slices on the left third of pizza dough, leaving a 2-inch (5 cm) space at the top.
step-5: place the mozzarella slices on top of the ham.
step-6: place the remaining ham slices on top of the mozzarella.
step-7: spread spinach artichoke dip on the middle third of the pizza dough, leaving 2 inches (5 cm) at the top.
step-8: spread tomato sauce on the last third of pizza dough, still leaving 2 inches (5 cm) at the top.
step-9: sprinkle half of the shredded mozzarella over the tomato sauce.
step-10: place half the pepperoni slices on top of the shredded mozzarella.
step-11: sprinkle the remaining shredded mozzarella on top of pepperoni.
step-12: followed by the remaining pepperoni on top of the shredded mozzarella.
step-13: starting with the edge closest to you, roll up the pizza dough.
step-14: place the roll seam-side down on the baking sheet.
step-15: cut 9 even 2-inch (5-cm) slits across the top of the roll.
step-16: in a medium bowl, combine the melted butter, parsley, and garlic powder.
step-17: brush the garlic butter mixture over the roll.
step-18: bake for 20 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-19: slice and serve.

step-1: combine mint, chamomile, rose petals, and lavender in a bowl.
step-2: scoop 2 tablespoons, or desired amount, into each tea bag and seal completely.
step-3: store in an airtight container and use as you’d like.

step-1: peel the avocado half, then slice lengthwise.
step-2: spread the mayonnaise over the toast.
step-3: top with the sliced avocado, bacon, and tomato.
step-4: sprinkle with the everything bagel seasoning.

step-1: fill a quart-sized wide-mouth jar with orange peels.
step-2: completely cover the orange peels with the vinegar.
step-3: cover and let sit for 1-2 days.
step-4: strain out the peels and compost them.
step-5: fill spray bottle halfway with the orange-infused vinegar and fill the other half with water.

step-1: prepare 2 boxes of brownie mix according to instructions on box.
step-2: pour into a greased 9x9-inch (23x23-cm) square pan.
step-3: bake according to instructions on box.
step-4: cut each tray of brownies into 25 small squares.
step-5: form each brownie square into a ball, rolling in palms until smooth.
step-6: in a microwave-safe bowl, add the white chocolate chips and microwave in 30 second intervals until smooth, about 1 minute and 30 seconds total.
step-7: in a microwave-safe bowl, add the milk chocolate chips and microwave in 30 second intervals until smooth, about 1 minute and 30 seconds total.
step-8: turn a plastic sandwich bag inside out and hold it from the inside with one hand.
step-9: spoon ¼ of the white chocolate into the bag.
step-10: turn the bag back out making sure chocolate does not fall out the opening.
step-11: seal it closed.
step-12: cut the corner of the bag, keeping in mind the more you cut off the larger your piping hole will be.
step-13: repeat with all of the milk chocolate.
step-14: coat the brownie balls in the melted white chocolate using a fork.
step-15: place on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and chill until chocolate has hardened, about 20 minutes.
step-16: place one of the white chocolate brownie bites onto a clean surface.
step-17: cut the white tips off 2 candy corns, cut each of those tips in half, these will be your mummy’s teeth.
step-18: using the milk chocolate pipe 2 dots on the upper half of the brownie bite for the eyes.
step-19: using the white chocolate pipe a line for the mouth.
step-20: evenly place each candy corn piece for each tooth on the line.
step-21: zig zag the white chocolate around the brownie bite making sure not to cover the eyes or teeth.
step-22: inspiration: https://www.pillsburybaking.com/recipes/chocolate-covered-brownie-bites-4025

step-1: in a medium-sized frying pan combine oil, mushrooms, thyme, and salt, then mix.
step-2: allow to cook about 5 minutes.
step-3: add the garlic, cook for 6-8 more minutes minutes until mushrooms are sufficiently cooked through and beginning to crisp up.
step-4: set mushroom mixture aside.
step-5: combine vegetable stock and water in pan, bring to a boil, then add quinoa and cover.
step-6: simmer for 12-15 minutes.
step-7: add mushroom mixture to quinoa and garnish with grated cheese of your choice (optional).

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: to make the flax egg, combine the flax meal and water in a small bowl and stir.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: in a large saucepan, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat.
step-5: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the mushrooms and cook until most of the juices have evaporated, 7-8 minutes.
step-6: add the soy sauce and paprika and cook for 2-3 more minutes.
step-7: set aside in a large bowl.
step-8: heat another tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat.
step-9: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the onion and cook for 3-5 minutes, until semi-translucent.
step-10: add the garlic and cook for 2 minutes.
step-11: add the salt and pepper and cook for another 2 minutes.
step-12: transfer the onion to a food processor, then add the lentils, oats, and flax egg.
step-13: pulse until chunky, about 10-15 pulses.
step-14: transfer the lentil mixture to the bowl with the mushrooms.
step-15: mix well, using your hands if needed, then shape into 5 patties.
step-16: place on a baking sheet and cover with plastic wrap, then freeze for 20 minutes.
step-17: while the patties are freezing, prepare the fries.
step-18: in a medium bowl, toss the potatoes, a drizzle of olive oil, the paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper until well-coated.
step-19: spread the fries on a baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes.
step-20: remove the patties from freezer.
step-21: in a large saucepan, heat the remaining tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat.
step-22: once the oil begins to shimmer, add 2-3 patties, careful not to overcrowd the pan.
step-23: cook for 5 minutes, then flip and cook for 5 minutes on other side.
step-24: repeat with the remaining patties.
step-25: to assemble the burgers, top each bun with a patty, then layer on dijon mustard, tomato slices, and arugula.
step-26: serve the fries with ketchup.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a skillet over medium heat, add cooking oil or water and mushrooms.
step-3: cook down until mushrooms begin to brown, stirring occasionally.
step-4: add the onion and cook until onions are translucent.
step-5: add the garlic and stir until fragrant.
step-6: transfer to a large bowl.
step-7: to the mushroom mixture, add breadcrumbs, oats, parsley, parmesan, oregano, rosemary, thyme, salt, pepper, and cayenne, and stir to combine.
step-8: add eggs and mix well.
step-9: cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or overnight.
step-10: when ready, use your hands to form 1-inch (2-cm) balls from the mushroom mixture.
step-11: place in rows on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-12: bake for 20 minutes, or until golden, flipping halfway.

step-1: add the stock to a medium pot and bring to a boil over high heat.
step-2: once the stock is boiling, reduce the heat to low or remove the pan from the heat and keep nearby.
step-3: heat the olive oil in a wide, tall pot over medium heat.
step-4: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the shallot and cook, stirring frequently, until translucent.
step-5: add the shiitake mushrooms and butter.
step-6: cook, stirring occasionally, until the mushrooms have cooked down.
step-7: add the garlic, thyme, salt, and pepper, stir, and cook for 1 minute, until the butter has melted and the garlic is aromatic.
step-8: add the rice and stir until fully coated in the mushroom mixture.
step-9: let the rice toast for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
step-10: add the white wine and cook until the wine has evaporated, stirring occasionally.
step-11: add 1 cup (240 ml) of the hot stock and stir to combine.
step-12: cook, stirring frequently, until the stock is fully absorbed.
step-13: continue to add the stock, ½ cup (120 ml) at a time, stirring continuously, until the broth is fully absorbed, for 15-20 minutes.
step-14: depending on how fast the rice cooks, there may be leftover stock.
step-15: once the rice is al dente, remove from the heat.
step-16: add the parmesan and stir to combine.
step-17: top with parsley, parmesan, salt, and pepper.

step-1: blend dried shiitake in blender until it becomes a fine powder.
step-2: pour into a pot filled with filtered water, bring to a boil, then lower the heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
step-3: keep broth warm while preparing the risotto.
step-4: sauté oyster mushrooms in grapeseed oil until brown edges have formed.
step-5: add thyme, garlic, and 1 tablespoon of butter to help caramelize.
step-6: once they have caramelized, salt, to taste, and reserve.
step-7: sweat the shallots in olive oil until tender, about 5 minutes, then add butter and sushi rice.
step-8: toast rice while stirring frequently.
step-9: add bay leaf, garlic clove, and pour white wine over toasted rice and cook until the wine has been absorbed, then continue stirring.
step-10: over medium heat, add 2 cups (470 ml) of warm mushroom stock at a time, stirring occasionally and adding more stock as it gets absorbed by the rice.
step-11: the rice should absorb 6-8 cups (1.4-1.9 liters) of stock.
step-12: taste the rice throughout to make sure it cooks just until it is tender, or al dente.
step-13: add frozen peas and stir.
step-14: salt the risotto, to taste, and remove the garlic clove and bay leaf.
step-15: add ¼ cup (60g) butter, truffle oil, rayu oil, sautéed mushrooms (optional: save some for garnish), pine nuts, and parmesan.
step-16: stir until well incorporated.
step-17: garnish with reserved mushrooms, pine nuts, wood sorrel, parmesan, and drizzle with olive oil.

step-1: sauté the bacon in a large pot over medium-high heat for about 3 minutes, until crispy.
step-2: add the sausage meat and red pepper flakes and sauté for about 10 minutes, until the meat is cooked through.
step-3: remove from the pan and set aside.
step-4: in the same pot, sauté the onion over medium heat for 2-3 minutes, until translucent.
step-5: add the garlic and sauté for 2 minutes, until fragrant.
step-6: add the mushrooms and cook for 2-3 minutes, until they start to release some of their liquid.
step-7: add the wine, salt, and pepper and stir to combine.
step-8: cook for 7-8 minutes, until the wine has reduced by half and the mushrooms are tender.
step-9: add the spaghetti and sausage mixture and toss to combine.
step-10: add the parmesan, pasta water, and spinach and stir.
step-11: cook until the pasta is warmed through and the parmesan has melted.

step-1: in a large pot, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat.
step-2: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the onion and cook for 3-4 minutes, until semi-translucent.
step-3: add the mushrooms and cook until most of the juices have evaporated.
step-4: with your spoon, make a space in the center of the pot.
step-5: drizzle in the remaining tablespoon of olive oil and add the garlic, thyme, pepper, and salt.
step-6: cook for 2-3 minutes, until fragrant.
step-7: then, add the white wine and vegan worcestershire sauce and stir until incorporated.
step-8: add flour and stir until fully combined.
step-9: then add the vegetable broth, almond milk, and pasta, and stir until well-combined.
step-10: cover and increase the heat to medium-high.
step-11: let cook for 10-15 minutes, or until the liquid is creamy and pasta is cooked.
step-12: serve immediately, garnished with parsley.

step-1: add mushrooms to food processor and pulse until a crumbly consistency is formed, making sure not to over-pulse.
step-2: heat olive oil in pan over medium heat.
step-3: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the onion and garlic and sauté until the onion is translucent.
step-4: add the mushrooms and saute for 8-10 minutes, or until most water has evaporated.
step-5: add soy sauce, cumin, chili powder and pepper.
step-6: sauté for 5 more minutes, or until desired consistency is reached.
step-7: serve on warm tortillas with desired taco toppings.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: add mushrooms to a food processor and pulse until a crumbly consistency is formed, about 10-12 times.
step-3: be careful not to over-process.
step-4: add 2 tablespoons olive oil to medium-sized sauté pan.
step-5: add sliced onion and sauté for 3-5 minutes.
step-6: then add vegetable broth and sauté until translucent and most of the broth has evaporated.
step-7: add minced garlic to pan and sauté for 3 more minutes, or until fragrant.
step-8: add mushrooms to pans along with soy sauce, and sauté until most water had evaporated, approximately 10-12 minutes.
step-9: add a drizzle of olive oil to pan and sauté fresh thyme in oil until fragrant; then incorporate into rest of mixture.
step-10: add in spinach and sauté until wilted.
step-11: use a rolling pin to roll out puff pastry sheet into 18x13-inch (46x33 cm) rectangle.
step-12: spray 18x13-inch (46x33 cm) baking sheet with non-stick cooking spray, then transfer puff pastry to baking sheet.
step-13: in center of puff pastry rectangle, layer potato slices in rows of two or three.
step-14: make sure to leave a border of 1½ inches (4 cm) of pastry on either end of top and bottom.
step-15: layer mushroom mixture on top of potato slices about ¾-inch (2 cm) thick.
step-16: repeat layering the potato and mushroom once more, then finish with a layer of potatoes on top.
step-17: fold one side of puff pastry over layers of filling, then repeat with opposite side of pastry.
step-18: fold in two small ends on top and bottom of wellington and make sure all pastry is sealed and no inside filling is exposed.
step-19: decorate wellington to your liking.
step-20: then in ramekin or small bowl, combine one tablespoon non-dairy milk with one tablespoon olive oil.
step-21: using small brush, brush wellington with mixture until completely coated.
step-22: make air vents.
step-23: bake wellington for 35-40 minutes until golden brown and puffy.
step-24: let rest 10 minutes before cutting into thick slices.
step-25: serve with vegetarian gravy.

step-1: heat the oil in a large pot over high heat and swirl to evenly coat.
step-2: add the onion, garlic, and jalapeño.
step-3: cook, stirring, until softened, 4 minutes.
step-4: add the cumin, coriander, and chili powder.
step-5: cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
step-6: add the tomatoes, season with salt and pepper.
step-7: cook, stirring, until softened and their liquid is almost evaporated, 4 minutes.
step-8: pour in the beer and bring to a boil.
step-9: add the mussels, immediately cover the pot, and cook, occasionally shaking the pot, until all mussels are opened, 6 minutes.
step-10: sprinkle the mussels with the chopped cilantro leaves, then divide among 4 bowls.
step-11: garnish with whole cilantro leaves and serve the mussels while hot with lime wedges for squeezing and bread for soaking up the cooking broth.

step-1: mix together baked beans and tikka masala sauce and pour evenly on naan bread.
step-2: add grated cheese on top.
step-3: bake for 10 mins at 190°c (375°f).
step-4: make a dent in the melted cheese with an egg, then crack into the dent.
step-5: bake for another ten mins at 190°c (375°f).
step-6: cut into four pieces.

step-1: trim the excess fat off the sides of the chicken breast.
step-2: using a knife, score the chicken longways, cutting halfway through the chicken to help it cook more rapidly.
step-3: in a medium-sized mixing bowl, crack the eggs and whisk with the milk.
step-4: in a separate medium-sized mixing bowl, add the bread crumbs.
step-5: dip each chicken breast in the egg mixture, covering it completely, then transfer to the bread crumbs and coat completely.
step-6: repeat this process one more time.
step-7: transfer to a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-8: fit a dutch oven with thermometer and pour in oil for frying.
step-9: heat over medium-high until thermometer registers 340˚f (170˚c).
step-10: set the chicken breasts in, in batches, and fry for 2-3 minutes until golden brown.
step-11: place fried chicken on a wire rack set over a baking sheet, to drain.
step-12: sprinkle with salt.
step-13: prepare the spicy pepper oil in a small mixing bowl by whisking together all the spices with the sunflower oil, until all the spices have dissolved into the oil.
step-14: set aside.
step-15: transfer the fried chicken to the brioche buns.
step-16: whisk together the spicy oil so none of the seasoning settles to the bottom.
step-17: drizzle 2 tablespoons over each chicken breast.
step-18: add 3 bread and butter pickles on top of the chicken and place the top bun.

step-1: combine all master spice mix ingredients and separate into three equal portions.
step-2: in a large bowl combine chicken wings, ⅓ master spice mix, the buttermilk.
step-3: cover and chill for as long as possible (4 hours to overnight).
step-4: rinse the brined wing pieces and pat dry.
step-5: mix the flour with another ⅓ of the master spice mix.
step-6: dredge the chicken wing pieces in the flour/spice mixture.
step-7: shake off any excess.
step-8: set aside.
step-9: heat your oil to 325˚f (170˚c).
step-10: fry the wings for 8-10 minutes, until the internal temperature reaches 165˚f (74˚c).
step-11: the wings will splatter so its a good idea to have a lid nearby!
step-12: take the wings out and drain on a paper bag or paper towels.
step-13: place the lard in a saucepan and sprinkle over the last ⅓ of your master spice mix.
step-14: once the lard is melted and warm, stir the mixture, and take it off the heat.
step-15: immediately baste your fried wings with the lard/spice mix and serve right away!

step-1: preheat your oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-2: in a medium bowl, mix 1 package of the brownie mix, half of the oil, half of the water, and one egg until just combined.
step-3: pour the mix into a half sheet pan lined with parchment paper, and spread with a spatula until even.
step-4: repeat with the other brownie mix and bake for 13 to 15 minutes, until the brownies are fudgy yet firm, and let cool.
step-5: once cool, cut one pan of the brownies into 4 rectangular shapes, 8 triangular shapes, and one circle.
step-6: line a large glass mixing bowl with plastic wrap and fit the brownies into it like a puzzle, placing the circular one on the bottom and working around it.
step-7: once the inside is covered, press down firmly on all the brownies until the outer shell forms.
step-8: make sure there are no openings in the outer layer.
step-9: scoop the strawberry ice cream onto the brownie shell and smooth with a spatula.
step-10: cover with plastic wrap and press a smaller bowl into the ice cream.
step-11: freeze for 3 hours, until the strawberry layer is solid.
step-12: unwrap and repeat with the vanilla ice cream, covering it well and pressing the smallest bowl into it and freezing for two hours.
step-13: while freezing, cut a circle into the other pan of brownies the circumference of the large bowl.
step-14: uncover the now frozen vanilla layer, fill the divot with chocolate ice cream, and cover with the cut circle of brownie.
step-15: eat the brownie leftovers or save for another bombe!
step-16: press the circle to secure it and freeze the completed bombe for one hour.
step-17: carefully remove the bombe from the freezer and flip it over onto a cutting board or serving platter.
step-18: it may need to thaw a couple minutes before it dislodges from the bowl.
step-19: once you can lift the bowl up easily, uncover the dome-shaped bombe and dust with cocoa powder.

step-1: in a blender, combine frozen bananas, dairy-free vanilla ice cream, dairy-free milk, and ice cubes.
step-2: blend until combined.
step-3: evenly distribute mixture into 3 cups, rough ¾ cup (200 ml) each.
step-4: set one cup to the side.
step-5: add one mixture back in the blender and add strawberries.
step-6: mix until well blended and set aside.
step-7: add the last mixture in the blender and add cocoa powder.
step-8: mix until well blended and set aside.
step-9: in a cup, pour chocolate mixture first.
step-10: using a spoon, pour the strawberry mixture onto the spoon and spread it around the glass.
step-11: using a spoon, pour the vanilla mixture on top.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper and grease with nonstick spray.
step-3: in a large bowl, whisk the eggs until pale and foamy, about 2 minutes.
step-4: add the sugar, oil, and vanilla.
step-5: whisk again until incorporated.
step-6: add the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt.
step-7: mix with a spatula until combined.
step-8: pour the batter onto the baking sheet.
step-9: bake for 12 minutes until the cake is set.
step-10: lay out a kitchen towel and sprinkle with cocoa powder.
step-11: once the cake is done, invert it onto the towel, remove the parchment, and lift the towel to roll the cake into a log.
step-12: the towel will wrap into the cake.
step-13: place in the refrigerator for 1 hour to cool.
step-14: place the cake on the counter and unroll.
step-15: place ice cream scoops on the cake in an even line, starting with chocolate, then the strawberry and vanilla.
step-16: smooth each line of ice cream out, being careful not to mix the flavors.
step-17: tightly roll the cake back up, this time without the towel.
step-18: freeze the cake for at least 3 hours, or overnight.
step-19: place the chocolate chips in a medium bowl.
step-20: pour the hot cream over the chocolate and stir until melted and smooth.
step-21: place the cake on a rack set over a baking sheet.
step-22: pour the ganache over the cake in an even layer.
step-23: place cake in the freezer for 30 minutes, or until the ganache is set.

step-1: prepare brownie mix, vanilla cake mix, and strawberry cake mix according to packaged instructions.
step-2: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-3: place cones in each well of muffin tin.
step-4: fill each ice cream cone with 1 tablespoon of brownie batter.
step-5: top the brownie batter with 1 tablespoon of strawberry cake batter followed by 1 tablespoon of vanilla cake batter.
step-6: bake for 20-22 minutes, or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
step-7: in a large mixing bowl, beat butter until creamy.
step-8: gradually add in the powdered sugar.
step-9: add vanilla extract and 3-5 tablespoons milk until you reach thick and smooth consistency.
step-10: transfer frosting to piping bag and add a dollop to each cone like a soft serve ice cream.
step-11: top with cherries and sprinkles.

step-1: in an aluminium loaf pan, spread the chocolate ice cream evenly across the bottom.
step-2: the layer should be a little less than 1 inch (2 ½ cm) thick.
step-3: place the loaf pan in the freezer for 10-15 minutes to allow the ice cream to firm up.
step-4: repeat step 1 for both the vanilla and strawberry ice cream until the loaf pan is filled with the 3 layers.
step-5: return the loaf pan to the freezer and allow it to freeze completely, about 2 hours.
step-6: prepare toppings before removing the loaf pan from the freezer.
step-7: combine the chocolate with the coconut oil and melt by microwaving, stirring every 20 seconds, until fully melted.
step-8: add crispy rice to melted chocolate if desired.
step-9: remove the loaf pan from the freezer and transfer to a cutting board.
step-10: take the popsicle sticks and press them firmly into the top of the ice cream, spacing them about 1 inch (2 ½ cm) apart.
step-11: using a pair of scissors, quickly cut the outer rim of the aluminium pan.
step-12: this should allow you to peel it away and reveal the layered block of ice cream.
step-13: once the pan is removed, cut the ice cream between the sticks making 8-9 individual pops.
step-14: dip the pops in the melted chocolate and transfer them to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-15: decorate with desired toppings.
step-16: once finished decorating, transfer the ice cream pops to the freezer until ready to serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 300˚f (150˚c).
step-2: add almond meal and powdered sugar to a bowl and mix to combine.
step-3: using a hand mixer, beat the egg whites until they stick to the bowl.
step-4: add the sugar to the whipped egg whites and beat until stiff peaks form.
step-5: gently fold the powdered sugar with almond meal into the whipped egg whites.
step-6: divide the batter in half.
step-7: in one bowl, gently fold in cocoa powder.
step-8: in the other bowl, add in the strained raspberry jam and red liquid food coloring and stir to combine.
step-9: transfer the batters into separate piping bags and pipe directly onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-10: bake for 20 minutes.
step-11: in a bowl, add the melted white chocolate chips and cream cheese and stir to combine.
step-12: put the chocolate filling in a piping bag and pipe filling onto the macaron shells.
step-13: sandwich the macarons together.
step-14: refrigerate macarons for another 2 hours before serving.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, whisk the eggs until light yellow and frothy.
step-3: add the water, oil, cake mix, sour cream, and stir until combined.
step-4: separate the batter into three bowls.
step-5: add the cocoa powder to one of the bowls of batter, and stir until combined.
step-6: pour the chocolate batter into a piping bag, cut off the tip off of the piping bag.
step-7: add the strawberry gelatin powder to one of the bowls of batter, and stir until combined.
step-8: pour the strawberry batter into a piping bag, cut off the tip off of the piping bag.
step-9: pour the rest of the vanilla batter into a piping bag, cut off the tip off of the piping bag.
step-10: pipe the strawberry onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, starting in the upper left corner.
step-11: pipe 3 1-inch (2 cm) lines of batter diagonally across the pan, beginning with the strawberry, following with the chocolate, then the vanilla.
step-12: continue this pattern until you have filled the entire baking sheet.
step-13: tap pan on the counter 3 times to release any air bubbles.
step-14: bake for 7 minutes.
step-15: while warm, flip cake carefully onto a large dish towel.
step-16: while still warm, roll with the towel tightly but carefully.
step-17: set aside to cool for at least 30 minutes.
step-18: unroll the cake carefully, and peel away the parchment paper.
step-19: spread the vanilla frosting evenly on the cake.
step-20: gently roll the cake up making sure not to roll too tight or the frosting will come out of the sides of the cake roll.

step-1: in a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, water, coconut milk, eggs, salt, and turmeric until smooth.
step-2: (if any clumps remain, run mixture through a sieve.)
step-3: using a sharp-pointed knife (a corkscrew or nail works just as well), poke three holes in the cap of a plastic water bottle.
step-4: fill the bottle with your pancake batter.
step-5: heat a very lightly greased nonstick skillet over medium heat.
step-6: working quickly, invert the water bottle and drizzle the batter in quick circular motions forming a netlike pattern.
step-7: allow the pancake to cook for one to two minutes.
step-8: do not flip and watch closely so it doesn’t burn.
step-9: remove from pan, fold in the sides, and roll up.
step-10: serve with curry.

step-1: place a fine mesh strainer over a medium bowl and strain the 4 cans of minced clams, separating the meat from the juices.
step-2: using a 6-quart dutch oven or pot of similar size, fry bacon over medium-high heat until fat renders and the edges begin to crisp.
step-3: add onion and sauté until softened and translucent, about 3 to 5 minutes.
step-4: reduce heat to low and add carrots, celery and flour, stirring constantly for 3-5 minutes to avoid lumps.
step-5: add black pepper, thyme, reserved clam juices, chicken stock, diced potatoes, and bay leaf.
step-6: stir to incorporate, then cover and bring to a boil.
step-7: reduce heat to a simmer and let cook until potatoes are tender, about 15 to 20 minutes.
step-8: remove bay leaf and add cream.
step-9: allow chowder to simmer for an additional 10-20 minutes until soup has thickened to an appropriate consistency.
step-10: add in reserved clam meat and cook for an additional 2-4 minutes.
step-11: remove from heat and serve with oyster crackers

step-1: make the cookies: in a small saucepan, bring the champagne to a boil and reduce by half, about 5 minutes.
step-2: in a liquid measuring cup or microwave-safe bowl, microwave the heavy cream until boiling.
step-3: pour the hot heavy cream and half of the heated champagne over the white chocolate chips in a heatproof bowl and let rest for 1 minute.
step-4: whisk until smooth.
step-5: add 4 tbsp of unsalted butter and whisk until melted and well combined.
step-6: cover and chill in the refrigerator for 2 hours.
step-7: in a large bowl, cream the remaining cup of unsalted butter and the powdered sugar with an electric hand mixer until fluffy.
step-8: add the vanilla and beat to combine.
step-9: add the flour, 1 cup at a time, and beat until just incorporated.
step-10: to the last addition, add the salt.
step-11: add the walnuts and beat to incorporate.
step-12: using your hands, press the dough together in a ball and wrap in plastic wrap.
step-13: refrigerate the dough at least 30 minutes.
step-14: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-15: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-16: use a 2 tablespoon (1 ounce) scoop to scoop balls of cookie dough onto the prepared baking sheet.
step-17: pat each ball into a disc in your palm and fill with 1 teaspoon of the white chocolate ganache.
step-18: fold the edges in to completely cover the ganache and roll back into a ball.
step-19: once all of the cookies are filled, refrigerate for 15 minutes.
step-20: bake the cookies for 15 minutes, until set and not too browned.
step-21: let cool.
step-22: make the glaze: microwave the heavy cream until boiling.
step-23: pour the hot heavy cream and the remaining reduced champagne over the semisweet chocolate chips in a heatproof bowl and whisk until smooth.
step-24: dip the cooled cookies in the chocolate ganache and sprinkle with edible gold dust.

step-1: preheat the oven to 160°c (325°f).
step-2: melt the sugar and butter together in a pan on a low-medium heat.
step-3: turn off the heat and stir in the chocolate until melted.
step-4: stir in the eggs and then the flour.
step-5: stir in a bag of mcvitie's nibbles.
step-6: pour the mixture into a 20 cm (8-inch) square brownie tray and bake for 10-15 minutes until the top is just beginning to set.
step-7: while these are cooking, make the cheesecake topping.
step-8: whisk together the cream cheese and sugar.
step-9: whisk in the eggs and vanilla extract.
step-10: pour this mixture on top of the part-baked brownies.
step-11: top with another bag of mcvitie's nibbles.
step-12: bake for another 30-35 minutes.
step-13: allow to cool in the fridge for at least 2 hours, then chop into bites.

step-1: make the vigorón: to prepare the yucca, use a sharp knife to cut off the root ends, cut in half crosswise, then carefully peel off the tough brown skin and inner pink layer.
step-2: cut the peeled piece into quarters lengthwise.
step-3: you can also buy frozen yucca that is already peeled.
step-4: add the cold water to a large pot.
step-5: place the yucca in the pot and add 1 teaspoon of salt and the lime juice.
step-6: bring to a boil over high heat.
step-7: once boiling, reduce the heat to medium and maintain a gentle boil for 25 minutes, or until the yucca is tender but not falling apart.
step-8: remove the yucca from the pot and set aside until cool enough to touch.
step-9: remove the woody vein from the middle of the yucca pieces and set aside for serving.
step-10: bring another large pot of water to boil.
step-11: blanch the cabbage for 50-60 seconds, then remove from the pot and pat dry.
step-12: do not overcook.
step-13: in a large bowl, combine the tomatoes, onion, remaining teaspoon of salt, and distilled vinegar.
step-14: add the blanched cabbage and toss to combine.
step-15: set aside for serving.
step-16: make the tajadas: heat the canola oil in a large skillet until it reaches 325˚f (170˚c).
step-17: in small batches, carefully fry the sliced plantains for 45 seconds, flipping halfway, until they are lightly golden and a bright yellow in color.
step-18: drain over a wire rack or paper towels and season with salt.
step-19: to assemble, place cooked yucca on a cabbage leaf, followed by the tomato, onion, and cabbage salad.
step-20: top with pork rinds and serve the tajadas alongside.

step-1: heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a 6-quart dutch oven over medium- high heat.
step-2: add the chicken, paprika, black pepper, garlic powder, cajun seasoning, cayenne, and salt.
step-3: stir to coat.
step-4: once chicken is fully cooked, about 5 minutes, add the sausages and cook for 3 minutes.
step-5: remove the chicken and sausage from the pot and set aside.
step-6: using the same pot, add 1 tablespoon of oil to the pot.
step-7: add the onion, celery, green pepper, jalapeño, garlic, and 1 teaspoon of salt.
step-8: cook until vegetables are soft and tender, scraping any brown bits on the bottom of the pot, about 8-10 minutes.
step-9: add chicken stock, crushed tomatoes, cooked rice, and bay leaves.
step-10: stir well and add the chicken and sausage back into the pot.
step-11: bring to a simmer.
step-12: put the lid on and continue simmering for 10 minutes.
step-13: stir in the shrimp.
step-14: put the lid back on and cook for 5 minutes, or until shrimp are cooked through.

step-1: in a food processor or blender, combine 4 chopped plum tomatoes, red bell peppers, chopped red onion, habanero peppers, garlic cloves, tomato paste, 1 tablespoon salt, 1 teaspoon pepper, and water.
step-2: puree until smooth.
step-3: heat vegetable oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
step-4: add the remaining tomato, sliced onion, remaining salt, and remaining pepper.
step-5: sauté until fragrant.
step-6: add steak, rosemary, paprika, curry powder, and bullion cubes.
step-7: cook until the steak is golden brown and cooked through, about 10 minutes.
step-8: add the blended tomato and pepper mixture and the bay leaf.
step-9: bring to a boil over high heat.
step-10: cover and simmer at low heat for 20 minutes, until the stew has thickened.
step-11: fish out the bay leaf.
step-12: remove stew from heat and let sit 10 minutes.
step-13: serve with white rice and fried plantains.
step-14: garnish with scallions and parsley, if desired.

step-1: in a bowl, add the potatoes, and fill the bowl with water until the potatoes are covered.
step-2: microwave on the potato setting for 10 minutes.
step-3: the potatoes are done when you can pierce through them with a fork.
step-4: leave in water, and set aside until ready to use.
step-5: in a large pot over medium heat, add the olive oil and 3 tablespoons of curry powder, and mix thoroughly.
step-6: add the cubed chicken and the onions to the pot, and mix thoroughly until chicken is cooked through, about 5 minutes.
step-7: add the peas, red bell peppers, green beans, carrots, and jalapeño pepper, and mix thoroughly.
step-8: add the reserved potatoes, along with 6 cups (1.4 l) of the water the potatoes were cooked in to the pot, and mix thoroughly.
step-9: add the salt, pepper, and the rest of the curry powder, and mix thoroughly.
step-10: bring the curry to a boil, cover, and reduce heat to low.
step-11: simmer the curry for one hour on low heat.
step-12: remove from heat.
step-13: serve with jasmine rice garnished with parsley.

step-1: heat the oil in a medium nonstick pan over medium heat.
step-2: add the onion, garlic, pepper, salt, and chili flakes, and cook for a 1-2 minutes, but don’t let the onions brown.
step-3: add the tomatoes, sardines, and baked beans, and cook for 4-5 minutes until the liquid reduces a bit.
step-4: stir in the eggs and cook for about 2-3 minutes.
step-5: remove the pan from the heat.
step-6: place a pat of butter on 3-4 potatoes, then spoon the egg mixture on top.

step-1: in a bowl, mix honey with peanut butter.
step-2: microwave for 45 seconds, stirring every 15 seconds, or until melted.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine oat cereal, ½ of the yogurt chips (save the other half for later), chopped almonds, and dried cranberries.
step-4: pour the melted honey mixture into the bowl and stir until well mixed.
step-5: pour into an 8x8 (20x20 cm) baking pan lined with parchment paper, and gently flatten the mixture evenly around the pan.
step-6: freeze for 30 minutes.
step-7: once the mixture has hardened enough, cut it into 8 pieces.
step-8: melt the other half of the yogurt chips in the microwave for 15 seconds at a time, until melted.
step-9: (optional: adding 1 tsp of coconut oil will help with the melting process)
step-10: dip the bottom of the bars in the melted yogurt chips and place on a piece of parchment paper.
step-11: freeze for another 15 minutes.
step-12: wrap each bar in parchment paper & store in the refrigerator or freezer for up to 3 months.

step-1: in a bowl, thoroughly mix graham cracker crumbs, brown sugar, salt, and butter.
step-2: press evenly into a springform pan.
step-3: chill.
step-4: in a medium bowl, place cream cheese and beat with hand beaters until smooth.
step-5: gently pour in cream, adding gradually while stirring, until it’s fully incorporated.
step-6: add sugar, vanilla, and salt, then beat until very smooth.
step-7: don't forget to scrape the sides.
step-8: gradually add cocoa powder into the smooth cream-cheese mixture and beat on medium speed until it’s fully incorporated.
step-9: pour onto chilled crust and smooth out the top.
step-10: freeze for 3 hours or refrigerate overnight.
step-11: before serving, pour pie filling over the cheesecake.

step-1: throw the biscuits into a food processor and mix until you have fine crumbs.
step-2: stir in the butter.
step-3: pour into a greased springform tin and spread to make sure the base is even.
step-4: chill for 10 minutes.
step-5: while the biscuit base is chilling, prepare the filling by whipping the cream cheese and double cream until you have soft peaks.
step-6: fold in the melted white chocolate and vanilla extract.
step-7: pour and spread on top of the biscuit base.
step-8: place the berries on top.
step-9: chill for 1 hour.

step-1: mix butter, peanut butter, and powdered sugar until well blended.
step-2: more or less powdered sugar can be used to make mixture more or less dry.
step-3: make 1 inch balls and freeze for about 20 minutes or until firm.
step-4: microwave chocolate chips for 60 seconds, stopping every 15 seconds to check and stir.
step-5: adding some vegetable shortening can make the chocolate thinner and easier work with.
step-6: remove balls from freezer and dip most of the way into the chocolate, coating all but a small circle on top.
step-7: using a toothpick for this works well but simply dipping it in and pulling it out with a fork also works.
step-8: place completed buckeyes on wax paper and allow to harden.
step-9: refrigerate if needed.

step-1: in a bowl, combine the graham cracker, sugar, and butter.
step-2: stir.
step-3: add in 1 cup (240g) of peanut butter and mix until combined.
step-4: line a 9x9 (22x22 cm) or 8x8 (20x20 cm) pan with foil.
step-5: spread on the peanut butter mixture.
step-6: melt the chocolate chips with the 2 tbsp.
step-7: of peanut butter, and spread on top of the graham cracker mixture.
step-8: refrigerate for 3 hours.
step-9: remove from pan, cut, and serve.

step-1: place graham crackers into a plastic bag and crush them into fine crumbs with a rolling pin.
step-2: pour the graham cracker crumbs into a bowl and combine with melted butter, mixing until the texture is like slightly wet sand.
step-3: press the graham cracker crumbs in an even layer into the bottom of a 9-inch (23 cm) springform pan.
step-4: refrigerate.
step-5: in a large bowl, mix together softened cream cheese until smooth.
step-6: add the powdered sugar and continue to mix until there are no lumps.
step-7: add the vanilla and melted chocolate and mix until the color is even.
step-8: pour the mixture over the graham cracker crust in the springform pan.
step-9: using a spatula or spoon, smooth the top.
step-10: refrigerate.
step-11: in a large bowl, mix together melted peanut butter and confectioner’s sugar.
step-12: pour mixture over cheesecake in springform pan.
step-13: use a knife or spatula to spread evenly and smooth the top.
step-14: refrigerate for 2-4 hours.

step-1: mix butter, peanut butter, m&m’s, and powdered sugar until well blended.
step-2: more or less powdered sugar can be used to make mixture more or less dry.
step-3: make 1 inch (2 ½ cm) balls and freeze for about 20 minutes or until firm.
step-4: microwave chocolate chips for 60 seconds, stopping every 15 seconds to check and stir.
step-5: tip: adding some vegetable shortening can make the chocolate thinner and easier work with.
step-6: remove balls from freezer and dip into the chocolate.
step-7: place on wax paper, top with m&m’s (optional) and allow to harden.
step-8: refrigerate if needed.

step-1: line a baking sheet with parchment paper and grease with nonstick cooking spray.
step-2: spread the chocolate hazelnut spread into an even rectangle, leaving ¼ inch (6 mm) between each cracker.
step-3: place 20 graham cracker halves on top of chocolate hazelnut mixture and freeze until solid, about 30 minutes.
step-4: cut between the graham cracker pieces with a knife.
step-5: lay a cutting board on top of the graham crackers and invert the baking sheet.
step-6: carefully peel the parchment paper from the chocolate hazelnut layer.
step-7: return to freezer until ready to build cake.
step-8: in a large bowl, combine the instant pudding and milk, and whisk until fully incorporated.
step-9: allow to set for at least five minutes.
step-10: in a medium bowl, combine the cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla, and mix until fully incorporated.
step-11: fold in the melted chocolate until fully incorporated.
step-12: add the cream cheese mixture to the pudding mixture and stir until fully combined.
step-13: add three quarters of the pudding mixture to the bottom of a 10-inch (25-cm) greased springform pan.
step-14: make a ring along the edge of the pan with the chocolate hazelnut graham crackers pressing them until they are even with the top of the pan.
step-15: leave a ¼ to ½–inch (2 to 6-cm) gap and make another ring using plain graham cracker pieces.
step-16: repeat, alternating between chocolate hazelnut and plain graham crackers, until you reach the center.
step-17: fill the pan with the remaining pudding mixture and spread evenly across the top.
step-18: freeze the cake for at least 4 hours.
step-19: release the chilled cake from the pan and frost with chocolate frosting.
step-20: garnish with raspberries, crushed graham crackers, and chocolate shavings.

step-1: separate the cream from the cookies into 2 different bowls.
step-2: place the cookies into a plastic bag and crush them into fine crumbs with a rolling pin.
step-3: set aside ½ cup (50g) of the crumbs for later.
step-4: pour the cookie crumbs into a bowl and combine with the melted butter, mixing until the texture is like slightly wet sand.
step-5: press the cookie crumbs in an even layer into the bottom of a 9-inch (23 cm) springform pan.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: in a medium pot over low heat, mix together the cream cheese, sugar, the cream from the cookies, and vanilla extract, stirring until there are no lumps.
step-8: in a measuring cup, mix the milk with the gelatin until dissolved.
step-9: pour the milk into the cream cheese mixture, stirring constantly until the mixture starts to bubble slightly.
step-10: remove from heat.
step-11: pour the mixture over the cookie crust in the springform pan.
step-12: using a spatula or a spoon, smooth the top.
step-13: sift the saved cookie crumbs on top of the cheesecake in an even layer, then refrigerate for at least 4 hours.
step-14: unclasp the ring of the springform pan, slice, then serve!

step-1: in a large microwave-safe bowl, add the butter and peanut butter.
step-2: microwave for 1 minute.
step-3: using a fork, stir together the melted butter and peanut butter until smooth.
step-4: microwave additional 20 seconds, as needed.
step-5: add the powdered sugar and rice cereal to the bowl.
step-6: gently mix together until fully incorporated.
step-7: using your hands, roll the mixture into approximately 30-40 1-inch balls (2 ½ cm).
step-8: place them on a wax paper-lined baking sheet and freeze for 15 minutes.
step-9: in a small microwave-safe bowl, add the chocolate chunks.
step-10: microwave for 60-75 seconds, stopping to check and stir every 30 seconds.
step-11: drop the frozen balls in the melted chocolate one at a time, use a fork to roll around to ensure an even coating.
step-12: place back on a wax paper-lined baking sheet.
step-13: garnish with additional rice cereal while the chocolate is still warm.
step-14: chill until the chocolate has set.

step-1: crush cookies and mix with butter.
step-2: spread mixture over pie pan, pressing down to make a compact crust.
step-3: refrigerate crust while making filling.
step-4: mix filling ingredients, (dulce de leche, cream cheese, and vanilla extract) until smooth.
step-5: in a separate bowl whip the heavy milk.
step-6: mix whipped cream into filling ingredients.
step-7: spread mixture over pie crust.
step-8: refrigerate the pie for at least 4 hours or overnight.
step-9: (if you’re in a hurry, you could also freeze the pie for 1-2 hours.)
step-10: top with strawberries, cut, and serve.

step-1: add the granola to a food processor and process until fine crumbs form.
step-2: add the melted coconut oil and pulse to combine.
step-3: grease a 9-inch (23 cm) pie dish with the solid coconut oil.
step-4: pour the granola mixture into the dish and press the crumbs firmly with the bottom of a measuring cup, making sure to cover the bottom and sides of the dish evenly.
step-5: place the pie dish into the refrigerator to firm up for an hour.
step-6: meanwhile, combine the strawberries, blackberries, raspberries, blueberries, sugar, ½ cup (120 ml) water, and the lemon juice in a medium saucepan.
step-7: cook for 4-5 minutes.
step-8: or until the sugar is dissolved and the berries begin to release their juices, creating a loose, deep red mixture.
step-9: in a small bowl, mix the cornstarch and remaining 3 tablespoons of water into a smooth paste.
step-10: add the cornstarch mixture to the berries and cook for another 2 minutes, until the filling thickens.
step-11: remove from the heat and let cool for 5 minutes.
step-12: remove the chilled pie crust from the refrigerator and pour in the berry compote.
step-13: spread the filling evenly.
step-14: chill the pie in the refrigerator for at least for 1 hour before serving.
step-15: garnish with fresh berries to your taste.

step-1: crush cookies and mix with melted butter.
step-2: spread mixture over pie pan.
step-3: refrigerate crust while making filling.
step-4: mix nutella, cream cheese, and whipped topping until smooth.
step-5: spread mixture over pie crust.
step-6: decorate the pie then refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
step-7: the pie can also be served frozen.

step-1: place the peanut butter and coconut oil in a medium microwaveable bowl.
step-2: microwave for 30 seconds.
step-3: stir to combine.
step-4: add the vanilla and stir.
step-5: add the unsweetened shredded coconut flakes and mix until evenly coated.
step-6: dollop the mixture on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-7: each cookie should be around 1½ inches (4 cm) wide.
step-8: freeze until solid, about 15-20 minutes.
step-9: store in the refrigerator in an airtight container or bag.
step-10:
56.03g total carbs
37.5g dietary fiber
18.53g net carbs/per serving
18.53g/8 cookies = 2.31g net carbs per cookie

step-1: in a large mixing bowl beat together powdered sugar, cream cheese, and peanut butter.
step-2: fold in half of the whipped topping.
step-3: crush half a graham cracker into the bottom or a jam jar.
step-4: drizzle a layer off hard shell over the graham cracker (this will firm up and act as a barrier to ensure the graham crackers stay crunchy).
step-5: spoon in the peanut butter pie mixture, filling the jam jar ¾ of the way.
step-6: top off with whipped topping and additional toppings to your liking.
step-7: chill the jars in the fridge for at least 1 hour before serving.

step-1: in a bowl, combine the graham cracker crumbs and melted butter.
step-2: transfer the graham cracker mixture to a 9-inch (23 cm) springform pan, creating an even base that goes up 1-inch (2 cm) on the sides.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the cream cheese and heavy cream and beat until smooth, 3-4 minutes.
step-4: add the sugar, pumpkin, cinnamon and vanilla and beat until smooth and fluffy.
step-5: pour the cream cheese mixture into the springform pan, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for 6-8 hours.
step-6: top with whipped cream, slice, and serve!

step-1: mix the cheesecake filling ingredients in a large bowl.
step-2: add cream cheese, granulated sugar, brown sugar, pumpkin puree, vanilla extract, cinnamon, nutmeg and whipped topping together and blend.
step-3: to make the crust, melt butter then add the mini marshmallows.
step-4: stir in the crispy rice cereal and mix well.
step-5: butter up a dish (or use cooking spray).
step-6: spread the crispy rice cereal mix in the dish and form a crust.
step-7: spread the cheesecake filling over the crispy rice crust.
step-8: chill for at least two hours
step-9: serve with whipped topping.

step-1: place graham crackers in a zipper storage bag and crush with a rolling pin until the cookies are fully crushed.
step-2: transfer the graham cracker crumbs to a bowl, and add in the sugar, cinnamon, and salt, stirring to combine.
step-3: add in the melted butter and mix well.
step-4: in a buttered 6-inch (15 cm) springform pan, add the graham cracker mixture and press firmly to form an even layer.
step-5: chill in the fridge for 30 minutes.
step-6: in a medium size bowl, combine softened ice cream, half of the marshmallows, and chocolate chips.
step-7: pour over the graham cracker crust and freeze over night.
step-8: microwave the chocolate and heavy cream together in 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until the glaze is smooth and glossy.
step-9: pour the ganache over the ice cream cake.
step-10: freeze for 30 minutes.
step-11: in a medium bowl, combine rum and remaining half of the marshmallows.
step-12: let sit for 15 minutes.
step-13: pour the marshmallows over the ice cream cake.
step-14: using a torch, brown the marshmallows on top of the cake.
step-15: slice and serve.

step-1: place graham crackers in a plastic bag and crush them into fine crumbs using a rolling pin.
step-2: alternatively, a food processor can be used to crush the crackers.
step-3: pour the graham cracker crumbs into a medium bowl with the melted butter.
step-4: mix until the crumbs take on the character of a coarse, wet sand.
step-5: pour the crumbs into a 9-inch (23 cm) pie dish.
step-6: press the crumbs firmly into the dish, making sure to coat the bottom and sides of the dish evenly.
step-7: once the crust has been formed, place the pie dish into the refrigerator to firm up.
step-8: in a medium-sized bowl, whisk together cream cheese and maple syrup.
step-9: once combined, pour the mixture into pie crust and return it to refrigerator to chill.
step-10: meanwhile, add half of the blueberries and strawberries to a saucepan over medium heat.
step-11: then add the lemon juice, sugar, and half of the water.
step-12: cook for 2-4 minutes or until sugar is dissolved and berries begin to expel their juice, creating a loose, deep-red mixture.
step-13: in a small bowl or ramekin, mix cornstarch and remaining water into a smooth paste.
step-14: add the cornstarch mixture to the berries and cook for an additional 2 minutes, until the filling thickens.
step-15: remove from heat and set aside, allowing the mixture to cool for 5 minutes.
step-16: remove the chilled pie crust with the cream cheese layer from the refrigerator.
step-17: take the remaining blueberries and strawberries and evenly distribute them over the top of the cream cheese layer.
step-18: next, pour the cooked berry mixture over the top of the fresh fruit and cream cheese, filling in the rest of the pie crust.
step-19: spread the filling evenly.
step-20: chill the pie completely in the refrigerator for 1.5-2 hours before serving.

step-1: in a small bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs and brown sugar.
step-2: add the melted butter and whisk to combine.
step-3: press the graham cracker crumb mixture into the bottom of an 8-inch (20-cm) springform pan, using a measuring cup to pat the surface smooth.
step-4: chill in refrigerator for at least 2 hours or until firm.
step-5: in a large bowl, combine cream cheese, brown sugar, sugar, milk, and vanilla using a whisk or hand mixer.
step-6: line a 8-inch (20-cm) glass mixing bowl with plastic wrap.
step-7: starting from the center, lay strawberries in an overlapping, circular fashion, making sure they make good contact and are sticking to the plastic wrap.
step-8: repeat the circular pattern up until roughly ½ inch (1-cm) from the top of the bowl.
step-9: pour two thirds of cheesecake mixture into strawberry-lined bowl.
step-10: press the whole strawberries into cheesecake mixture to form a layer.
step-11: cover the whole strawberries with the remaining cheesecake mixture.
step-12: carefully lift set graham cracker crust onto cheesecake mixture.
step-13: cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours.
step-14: carefully invert bowl onto cutting board.
step-15: lift bowl and remove plastic wrap.
step-16: transfer to cutting board and slice into wedges.
step-17: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180˚c).
step-2: oil a 9x9-inch (23x23-cm) baking dish with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil and add the bread cubes in a single layer.
step-3: in a large skillet set over medium heat, add the remaining 2 tablespoons of the olive oil.
step-4: add the onions and garlic and cook until tender and starting to turn golden, 10-15 minutes.
step-5: in 2-3 batches, add the spinach and cook, tossing to wilt, 1-2 minutes.
step-6: stir in the lemon zest and red pepper flakes and season with salt and pepper.
step-7: cook another 30 seconds then remove the pan from the heat and set aside to cool slightly.
step-8: in a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, egg whites, milk, and mustard.
step-9: season with salt and pepper and stir in ¼ cup (30 g) of the parmesan.
step-10: add the spinach mixture into the eggs.
step-11: stir in chives.
step-12: transfer to the baking dish and mix gently to combine making sure the mixture is in an even layer.
step-13: top with remaining parmesan.
step-14: bake until the eggs are just set and the mixture doesn’t jiggle when you gently shake the pan, 35-40 minutes.
step-15: serve warm or at room temperature.

step-1: place the rice in a sieve and rinse under water 4-5 times, until the rice runs clear water is clear.
step-2: place the rice and water in a pot and bring to a boil.
step-3: once the water is a rolling boil, put a lid on top and cook for 15 minutes on low heat.
step-4: turn off the heat and let it sit for 10 minutes.
step-5: in a small saucepan over medium heat, add 250ml (1 cup) red vinegar, monk fruit sweetener, salt, and mirin and kombu.
step-6: once the sweetner and salt are dissolved add 50ml (¼ cup) of the vinegar.
step-7: set aside to cool to room temperature.
step-8: place the cooked rice in a wooden tub or a large bowl.
step-9: sprinkle 150ml (½ cup) sushi vinegar evenly over the rice while the rice is still hot and mix with a wooden spoon.
step-10: cover the rice with a wet tea towel and cool until close to body temperature.
step-11: save leftover sushi vinegar for next time.
step-12: place 1-2 tablespoons of rice in a small cup.
step-13: spray soy sauce on the rice.
step-14: sprinkle some crumbled seaweed on top.
step-15: top with thinly sliced fresh seafood or your favorite toppings.

step-1: in a blender or food processor, add boiled potatoes, carrots, olive oil, water, lemon juice, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and nutritional yeast.
step-2: blend until smooth, adding more liquid as necessary to reach desired consistency.
step-3: serve immediately with chips or raw veggies.

step-1: mix eggs, mirin and salt well.
step-2: heat a tamagoyaki pan at low heat.
step-3: brush a thin layer of oil on the pan.
step-4: wipe off excess with a paper towel.
step-5: pour ¼ of egg mixture into pan and quickly swirl to cover the entire pan.
step-6: when the egg is set, put a sheet of nori and cheese on top.
step-7: roll the egg.
step-8: pour in ¼ of the egg mixture, lift up the cooked egg roll and let the mixture to flow under it.
step-9: when the egg is set, roll the omelette toward you.
step-10: repeat this procedure one more time.
step-11: cut the omelette into bite sized pieces, garnish with mayonnaise and tobiko.

step-1: add the sweet potatoes and potatoes to a large pot and cover with cold water.
step-2: add the salt.
step-3: bring to a boil over high heat and cook until the potatoes are fork-tender, about 20 minutes longer.
step-4: drain and transfer the potatoes to a large bowl.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: in a small pot over low heat, bring the butter, cream, and milk to a simmer.
step-7: once simmering, remove from the heat.
step-8: pour the cream mixture over the potatoes and mash with a hand masher until smooth.
step-9: season to taste with pepper and salt.
step-10: garnish with chives, if desired.
step-11: note: russet potatoes gives these a lighter texture compared your typical sweet potato mash, but you can swap them out with two additional pounds of sweet potatoes if you’d prefer to keep it classic.

step-1: make the sauce: in a medium bowl, whisk together the tahini, apple cider vinegar, lemon juice, maple syrup, garlic, water, salt, and pepper.
step-2: reserve half of the sauce for serving and add the tofu to the bowl with the remaining sauce.
step-3: toss to coat.
step-4: marinate for 15 minutes.
step-5: heat a tablespoon of oil in a small pot over medium heat.
step-6: cook the tofu until golden brown, about 5 minutes on each side.
step-7: remove the tofu from the pan, then slice.
step-8: add the quinoa and vegetable stock to the same pot.
step-9: stir the quinoa and bring to a boil over high heat.
step-10: then, reduce the heat to low and place a strainer over the simmering quinoa.
step-11: add the cherry tomatoes, carrot, yellow pepper, snap peas, red onion, and purple cabbage to the strainer.
step-12: sprinkle with salt.
step-13: cover and cook for 20 minutes, until the quinoa is cooked and the veggies are tender.
step-14: remove the pot from the heat, fluff the quinoa and divide into 2 bowls, then add the veggies and tofu.
step-15: pour the reserved sauce over.

step-1: preheat the oven to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-2: combine the minced garlic, salt, and pepper in a medium bowl.
step-3: rub the mixture on the inside cavity of the suckling pig.
step-4: stuff the lemongrass, onion, green onions, and longanisa inside the cavity.
step-5: sew the cavity shut with butcher’s twine.
step-6: transfer the pig to a large baking sheet.
step-7: brush the pig with soy sauce and cover the ears and tail with aluminum foil.
step-8: roast for 30 minutes, then reduce the heat to 350˚f (180˚c) and continue to cook for 2½ hours, or until the internal temperature reaches 160˚f (70˚c) and the skin is crispy.
step-9: remove the pig from the oven and reserve the pan drippings for the pancit.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180˚c).
step-2: grease a 10-inch (25-cm) springform pan with coconut oil.
step-3: make the crust: in a food processor, pulse together the graham crackers, dates, coconut oil, and salt until the dates are completely broken down and a moist, sand-like texture is achieved.
step-4: the crust should easily hold together when pinched between your fingers.
step-5: transfer the crust mixture to the prepared springform pan.
step-6: using the bottom of a measuring cup or another flat-bottomed glass, pack down the crust against the bottom and about 1 inch (2 cm) up the sides of the pan.
step-7: bake the crust for 15 minutes, or until toasted and crisp around the edges.
step-8: remove from the oven and set aside to cool for about 20 minutes while you prepare the filling.
step-9: leave the oven on.
step-10: clean out the food processor, then make the cheesecake layer: add the tofu, coconut cream, coconut oil, maple syrup, lemon juice, arrowroot powder, salt, and vanilla bean seeds to the food processor and blend on high speed for 1-3 minutes, or until completely smooth.
step-11: pour all but 1 cup (225 g) of the mixture over the cooled crust and shake gently to smooth.
step-12: freeze for 30 minutes.
step-13: this will make it easier to add the pumpkin layer.
step-14: make the pumpkin layer: to the reserved cheesecake mixture in the processor, add the pumpkin puree, coconut cream, maple syrup, arrowroot powder, and pumpkin spice, and blend on high for 1 minute, until smooth.
step-15: remove the pan from the freezer and gently spoon the pumpkin mixture over the cheesecake layer.
step-16: smooth out the top using a rubber spatula or the back of a spoon.
step-17: wrap the outside of the pan in foil.
step-18: this will prevent water from the water bath from leaking in to the pan.
step-19: place the springform pan in a large, deep baking dish and fill with hot water about halfway up the sides of the springform.
step-20: this will create steam inside the oven that will help the cheesecake bake evenly.
step-21: carefully transfer the pan to the oven.
step-22: bake the cheesecake for 1 hour, then turn off the oven and, without opening the door, leave the cheesecake inside for 30 minutes.
step-23: remove from the oven and let cool, then cover and chill in the refrigerator for at least 6 hours, or overnight.
step-24: release the springform, then slice and serve the chilled cheesecake.
step-25: garnish with dark chocolate shavings.

step-1: spread nutella on both slices of white bread.
step-2: cut marshmallows in half and place on one side of the bread.
step-3: close sandwich.
step-4: whisk together 2 eggs and the double cream.
step-5: dip nutella marshmallow sandwich in mixture.
step-6: fry in butter until both sides are golden brown.

step-1: crush 4 paçoca pieces in a bowl, then mix in the sweetened condensed milk to form a paste.
step-2: in a large bowl, whip the heavy cream until soft peaks form, then fold in the paçoca mixture until evenly combined.
step-3: transfer the cream mixture into a square baking dish, then crumble the remaining 4 paçoca over the top.
step-4: spoon the nutella over the mixture in large dollops, then taking a knife, swirl the nutella and paçoca into the cream with a figure-8 motion.
step-5: freeze for at least 4 hours.

step-1: in a liquid measuring cup, combine the mustard, maple syrup, ginger, garlic, sesame seeds, cayenne, apple cider vinegar, lemon juice, and olive oil.
step-2: whisk until fully incorporated.
step-3: season to taste with salt and pepper.
step-4: add the kale, carrots, red cabbage, broccoli, red cabbage, bell pepper, avocado, walnuts, and parsley to a large serving bowl.
step-5: pour desired amount of dressing over the salad and toss until everything is well coated.
step-6: garnish with more toasted sesame seeds

step-1: place the rolled oats in a blender.
step-2: add salt to taste.
step-3: for sweetness, add the vanilla extract and/or the pitted dates, if you’d like.
step-4: add the water and blend on high for 1 minute.
step-5: double strain the liquid into a medium-sized container using a cheesecloth-lined strainer.
step-6: serve immediately or refrigerate in a sealed container for up to 3 days.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-2: in a large bowl, mix the butter and brown sugar until well combined.
step-3: add the molasses, vanilla, and eggs, and whisk thoroughly.
step-4: sift in the flour, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon.
step-5: mix until just combined.
step-6: add the oats and mix until incorporated.
step-7: be careful not to overmix the batter or it might result in tougher cookies.
step-8: using an ice cream scoop (or about 2 tablespoons), scoop out cookies onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper, leaving about 3 inches (8 cm) between each one.
step-9: bake for 7-9 minutes.
step-10: the cookies will still be very soft, so be sure to let them cool thoroughly.
step-11: while cooling, make the filling by beating the butter, milk, vanilla, and marshmallow fluff until well combined.
step-12: once the cookies are cooled, put a spoonful of the filling on one cookie and sandwich with another.
step-13: repeat until all the sandwiches are made.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: mash banana in a large bowl until smooth and mix in all wet ingredients.
step-3: stir in dry ingredients until thoroughly mixed.
step-4: pour batter into greased muffin tin, filling each tin about ⅔ full.
step-5: top each muffin with toppings.
step-6: bake for about 30 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.

step-1: add the instant oatmeal, ground flaxseed, chia seeds, and honey to a medium bowl and mix until thoroughly combined
step-2: add your favorite mix-ins.
step-3: to make the peanut butter “monster”, add in the crushed pretzels, m&m’s, and peanut butter.
step-4: stir to combine.
step-5: to make the chocolate hazelnut, add in the chopped hazelnuts and hazelnut spread.
step-6: stir to combine.
step-7: to make the almond berry, add in the dried cranberries and almond butter.
step-8: stir to combine.
step-9: to make the coconut cookie add in the chopped cashews, coconut flakes, and cookie butter.
step-10: stir to combine
step-11: roll the mixture into tablespoon-sized balls.
step-12: let sit at room temperature for 2-4 hours.
step-13: store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1 week.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f/175°c.
step-2: in a medium bowl, mash the bananas into a paste.
step-3: pour in the honey and almond extract, and mix until well combined.
step-4: sprinkle on the rolled oats and cinnamon and mix until incorporated.
step-5: evenly divide the oats into a greased 12-cup muffin tin.
step-6: use your fingers to mold the oats into a cup shape in each of the muffin cups.

step-8: remove the oatmeal cups from the muffin tin and place them on a serving plate.
step-9: place a spoonful of yogurt in each cup and top with your choice of toppings.

step-1: spread drained chickpeas onto a towel and pat dry.

step-4: mix halfway then add chickpea water to help consistency.
step-5: add oats, raisins, and cinnamon to mixed dough.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).

step-1: place almond flour and dates in a food processor and pulse until sticky.

step-6: store in an airtight container for up to 1 week.

step-1: mix oats, almond butter and honey in a large bowl.

step-3: mix.

step-5: mold mixture into bite-sized balls.
step-6: serve immediately.

step-1: add potatoes, green beans, kale, and water, breast milk, or formula to a blender or food processor.

step-1: make the pie dough: in a large bowl, whisk together flour, cinnamon, and salt.
step-2: using a pastry blender or two knives, cut shortening into the flour until the shortening breaks down into pea-sized pieces.
step-3: add the ice water, 1 tablespoon at a time, and stir gentle until the dough starts to come together.
step-4: dump the dough onto a work surface lined with 2 large pieces of plastic wrap.
step-5: shape dough into a disc and wrap tightly with the plastic wrap.
step-6: chill the dough in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes.
step-7: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c)
step-8: make the filling: in a small bowl, mix together the sugar, cinnamon, ginger, cloves, and salt.
step-9: in a large bowl, whisk the eggs.
step-10: add the pumpkin and sugar-spice mix and whisk to combine.
step-11: slowly whisk in the evaporated milk until incorporated.
step-12: once the dough has chilled, lightly flour a clean surface.
step-13: roll out the dough to a ¼-inch (6 mm)-thick round.
step-14: keep the surface and rolling pin floured as needed so the dough doesn’t stick.
step-15: transfer the dough to a 9½-inch pie pan (24 cm).
step-16: tuck the edges under and crimp.
step-17: note: the key to flaky pie crust is to handle it as little and as gently as possible.
step-18: handle it only as much as is absolutely necessary to mix, shape, and roll out.
step-19: pour the filling into the pie shell.
step-20: bake the pie for 15 minutes, then reduce the oven temperature to 350˚f (180˚c) and bake for another 40 minutes, or until the center jiggles slightly.
step-21: cool the pie on a wire rack for 2 hours.
step-22: slice and serve with whipped cream or ice cream.

step-1: add moringa powder, sea salt, and olive oil to a bowl of popcorn.

step-1: add the milk or water, yogurt, bananas, and ⅓ of the strawberries in a high-speed blender until smooth.

step-7: pour the smoothie in the glass filling it up ¾ of the way.
step-8: smooth the surface with a spoon.
step-9: finish by adding remaining raspberries to the smoothie and blend until smooth..
step-10: pour the remaining smoothie into the glass to create the final layer.
step-11: smooth the layer with a spoon.
step-12: top smoothie with edible flowers and coconut flakes.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).

step-1: preheat oven to 375ºf (190ºc).

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).

step-1: preheat oven to 275°f/140°c.

step-1: in a mixing bowl, mix salad dressing, balsamic vinegar, honey and red pepper flakes, set aside.

step-1: mix together all sauce ingredients in a small bowl.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190˚c).

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: cut vegetables.

step-1: make the brine: combine the water, bay leaves, garlic, peppercorns, and salt in a medium pot over medium heat and stir until the salt is dissolved.
step-2: remove the brine from heat and stir in the ice cubes.
step-3: once the brine is cooled, add the pork chops to a glass dish and pour the brine over.
step-4: chill in the refrigerator for 1-10 hours.
step-5: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-6: remove the pork chops from the brine and pat dry.
step-7: season generously with salt and pepper on both sides.
step-8: heat the oil in a large cast iron or other ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat until nearly smoking.
step-9: add the pork chops and sear without disturbing until caramelized and browned on the first side, about 2 minutes, then flip and sear on the other side.
step-10: remove the pork chops from the pan and set aside.
step-11: add the shallots to the pan and cook until they begin to soften and caramelize, stirring occasionally, about 2 minutes.
step-12: add the turnips and season with salt, then spread in an even layer and let caramelize, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes.
step-13: stir in the mustard and sage.
step-14: cook for 1 minute more.
step-15: pour in the apple cider and chicken stock.
step-16: bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low-medium and simmer until the liquid is reduced by half, about 7 minutes.
step-17: add the collard greens and stir to incorporate.
step-18: nestle the pork chops into the sauce, making sure that they are partly submerged.
step-19: transfer the pan to the oven and cook for about 12 minutes, until the internal temperature of the pork chops reaches 135˚f (57˚c).
step-20: remove from the oven and let rest for 10 minutes as the internal temperature continues to climb to 145˚f (63˚c).
step-21: divide the pork chops, vegetables, and sauce between plates and serve.
step-22:

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f/200˚c.

step-1: preheat oven to 450°f (230°c).

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).

step-1: preheat the oven to 400ºf (200ºc) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

step-10: garnish the salmon with sesame seeds and serve immediately.

step-1: season the chicken with pepper and cumin powder to taste.
step-2: on a medium-low heat, cook the chicken in some oil with the onion for 3 to 4 minutes stirring and turning occasionally.
step-3: add the cherry tomatoes, the water, the chickpeas, the harissa paste, the honey and the courgette.
step-4: simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally until the sauce slightly thickens.
