step-1: preheat oven to 450°f (230˚c).
step-2: place two sheets of paper towels on a cutting board and put tofu on top, then put two sheets of paper towels on top of the tofu.
step-3: place heavy books, cast iron pans, etc.
step-4: on top of tofu for at least 20 minutes to drain water.
step-5: in a small bowl, mix marinade ingredients and pour marinade over tofu, then refrigerate for an hour.
step-6: fold the parchment paper in half, then open up.
step-7: place carrots, red pepper, and broccoli on parchment paper, and drizzle on oil and sprinkle on salt and pepper.
step-8: lay the tofu on the veggies, and cinch the paper together by folding it over itself along the edges.
step-9: bake in the oven for 10 minutes or until tofu is golden brown.
step-10: serve over rice or pasta, with a sprinkle of scallions.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: line a baking tray with aluminum foil.
step-3: lay out the 3 chicken breasts in the middle of the baking tray.
step-4: spread the zucchini evenly on one end and the cherry tomatoes on the other.
step-5: sprinkle the olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper evenly over everything.
step-6: toss veggies to coat.
step-7: pour the jar of pesto evenly over the chicken breasts and top with mozzarella cheese.
step-8: bake in a preheated oven for 25-30 minutes.
step-9: rest chicken 10 minutes before serving.
step-10: lay chicken on bed of vegetables and sprinkle mozzarella to serve.

step-1: mix together all sauce ingredients in a small bowl.
step-2: heat oil over a nonstick pan and add pork stirring until cooked.
step-3: pour sauce in pan and stir to coat meat.
step-4: once the sauce is bubbling, add the veggies to the pan and stir again to coat.
step-5: cook until meat is cooked through and veggies are soft.
step-6: serve over rice or alone.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: in a small bowl, mix together the honey, soy sauce, ginger, salt, and pepper until combined.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: on a parchment-lined baking sheet, arrange the yellow squash, red onion, bell pepper, asparagus, and salmon fillets in rows in an even layer.
step-5: drizzle oil on the yellow squash, red onion, bell pepper, and asparagus, and season with salt and pepper.
step-6: pour the honey ginger sauce over the salmon fillets.
step-7: bake for 15 minutes, until the salmon is cooked and the veggies have softened slightly.
step-8: plate salmon with veggies on the side and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: add the sweet potatoes, lemon slices, green beans, olive oil, rosemary, thyme, garlic, salt, and pepper to a large bowl (or parchment paper-lined sheet tray) and toss until fully coated.
step-3: transfer to a parchment paper-lined sheet tray and place the chicken breast on top of the vegetables (if you tossed your vegetables in a bowl).
step-4: season the chicken breast with salt, pepper, and paprika.
step-5: bake until vegetables are tender and chicken is cooked through, about 20 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: add sweet potatoes, cauliflower, and brussels sprouts to a baking tray.
step-3: sprinkle with olive oil, salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
step-4: mix until well coated.
step-5: bake for 25-30 minutes.
step-6: serve with mixed greens now or refrigerate in airtight container up to 3-5 days.

step-1: preheat oven to 325°f (160°c).
step-2: pour oil into a small, oven-safe skillet.
step-3: place the spinach and garlic in the skillet, season with a pinch of salt and pepper, and mix well so that everything is evenly coated.
step-4: place the salmon on 1 side of the pan, then form a well on the other side and crack an egg, making sure it stays intact.
step-5: season the tops of the salmon and the egg with another pinch of salt and pepper.
step-6: bake for 20-25 minutes, until the salmon reaches an internal temperature of 140°f (60°c).
step-7: (the temperature will continue to rise once it rests out of the oven.)
step-8: squeeze a bit of fresh lemon juice over the salmon fillet for more flavor and let the salmon rest for 5 minutes before serving.
step-9: note: if you want a runny egg yolk, follow steps 1-3, then place the skillet in the preheated oven.
step-10: halfway through the cooking process (about 10 minutes in), crack a cold egg into the well of the spinach and replace the skillet in the oven for another 10-15 minutes.
step-11: the salmon will be cooked through, the egg white will show color, and the yolk will be gloriously runny.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: cover a sheet pan with foil or parchment paper.
step-3: spread out potatoes on the pan and drizzle with olive oil.
step-4: season with salt, pepper, 2 cloves of garlic, and 1 tablespoon lemon juice.
step-5: bake for 30 minutes.
step-6: make salmon glaze.
step-7: combine salt, pepper, 1 tablespoon thyme, 2 garlic cloves, ginger, 2 tablespoons of olive oil, and 2 tablespoons of lemon juice.
step-8: mix well.
step-9: remove potatoes from the oven and push them to the top or side of your pan.
step-10: place your salmon fillets on the pan.
step-11: brush both sides of the salmon with the glaze.
step-12: place asparagus on the pan and top with 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
step-13: sprinkle 1 tablespoon of thyme on the asparagus and potatoes.
step-14: bake for 10-12 minutes.
step-15: (the salmon should flake easily with a fork when it’s ready.)

step-1: mix together all sauce ingredients in a small bowl.
step-2: heat oil over a nonstick pan and add shrimp stirring until cooked.
step-3: pour sauce in pan and stir to coat meat.
step-4: once the sauce is bubbling, add the veggies to the pan and stir again to coat.
step-5: cook until meat is cooked through and veggies are soft.
step-6: serve over rice or alone.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: wrap the tortillas in foil and place on the corner of a baking sheet.
step-3: add the bell peppers, red onion, and shrimp to the sheet and season with olive oil, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cumin, and lime.
step-4: toss to coat.
step-5: place in the oven and bake for 10 minutes, flipping the shrimp halfway through.
step-6: serve with warm tortillas, salsa, guacamole, cilantro, and lime.

step-1: heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat.
step-2: dice chicken breasts and cook thoroughly.
step-3: add salt and pepper to taste.
step-4: add crushed garlic and a diced jalapeño pepper (leave the jalapeño seeds in for extra spice).
step-5: stir in quinoa, vegetable broth, beans, tomatoes, corn, chili powder and cumin; season with salt and pepper to taste.
step-6: cover and simmer until quinoa is cooked through, roughly 30 minutes.
step-7: stir in diced avocado, cilantro, and lime juice.
step-8: serve garnished with extra cilantro.

step-1: fry the onions, garlic, chilli, and red pepper with a little olive oil.
step-2: add the chorizo after a minute.
step-3: stir in the turmeric, salt, pepper, and long grain rice.
step-4: pour in the water and simmer for 20 minutes.
step-5: stir in the peas and prawns until prawns are pink and no longer translucent, about 3-4 minutes.

step-1: dice the sweet potato
step-2: heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
step-3: add the diced sweet potato, cover, and cook, stirring occasionally, for about 10 minutes, or until it begins to soften.
step-4: while the sweet potato cooks, dice the red onion and mince the garlic.
step-5: add to the skillet
step-6: dice and seed the bell peppers and add to the skillet
step-7: dice the jalapeño, if using, and add
step-8: chop the green onion and rosemary, if using fresh, and add to skillet.
step-9: cover and cook for about 5 minutes, or until the sweet potato is tender.
step-10: create 4 wells in the vegetable mixture, not too close to the edges of the skillet, but far enough apart that they aren't touching.
step-11: crack 1 egg into each well.
step-12: cover and cook for 3-5 minutes more, or the eggs are cooked to your liking.
step-13: breakfast is served!

step-1: in a 4-quart chicken fryer, heat approximately 1 tablespoon olive oil over medium-high heat and cook the onions until they begin to soften.
step-2: add garlic and stir for 30 seconds.
step-3: add the ground beef and 1 tablespoon of taco seasoning.
step-4: using your spatula, break up the ground beef and stir until cooked.
step-5: drain the excess liquid from the pan.
step-6: add water, beef stock, pasta, tomatoes, and 1 tablespoon of taco seasoning back to the pan.
step-7: stir to combine.
step-8: cook over low heat for 15 minutes, stirring twice to keep the pasta from sticking to the bottom of the pan.
step-9: increase heat to medium after 15 minutes, and stir pasta until most of the liquid is gone.
step-10: turn off heat and add the shredded cheese.
step-11: stir until cheese is completely melted.
step-12: top with green onions.

step-1: preheat oven to 400º f (200ºc).
step-2: in a medium-sized saucepan over medium heat, whisk together soy sauce, water, garlic, cornstarch, and honey.
step-3: allow sauce to begin bubbling and then stir until sauce thickens.
step-4: remove from heat.
step-5: spoon a little of the teriyaki sauce onto the center of a large parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-6: lay chicken on top of sauce.
step-7: lay bell pepper, broccoli, green beans, and carrots out on either side of the chicken.
step-8: season vegetables and chicken with salt and pepper to taste.
step-9: coat everything well with teriyaki sauce.
step-10: bake 20 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear.
step-11: remove pan from oven and allow to cool.
step-12: slice chicken into strips.
step-13: distribute chicken and vegetables evenly between 4 tupperware containers, separating vegetables for 4 different dishes, if desired.
step-14: drizzle remaining sauce over chicken and garnish with sesame seeds and green onion.
step-15: refrigerate up to 4 days.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: on a baking sheet, combine broccoli, carrots, oil, salt, and pepper.
step-3: mix thoroughly to make sure all vegetables are coated, and then arrange them in the center of the tray in a flat layer.
step-4: lay the two salmon fillets on the vegetables.
step-5: in a medium bowl, combine brown sugar, soy sauce, honey, and sesame seeds.
step-6: mix until there are no lumps.
step-7: spread the glaze evenly on top of the two salmon fillets.
step-8: bake for 12 minutes.
step-9: take the salmon fillets off the vegetables and set aside.
step-10: toss the vegetables in the roasting juices.
step-11: glaze the salmon with any remaining juices.
step-12: serve!

step-1: arrange an oven rack in the center of the oven, then preheat to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: toss the onion, carrots, and kale in a 12-inch (30 cm) cast iron skillet with 2 tablespoons of olive oil, salt, and pepper until well coated.
step-3: pour the white wine over the vegetables.
step-4: season the chicken all over with salt and pepper, then brush with the remaining tablespoon of olive oil.
step-5: stuff the rosemary, thyme, and lemon inside the cavity, tie the legs closed with kitchen twine, and tuck the wings underneath the bird.
step-6: place the chicken, breast-side up, on top of the vegetables in the skillet.
step-7: roast the chicken for 1 hour, rotating the pan halfway through cooking.
step-8: the chicken is done when it is golden brown, the skin is crispy, and an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thigh registers 165˚f (70˚c).
step-9: remove from the oven and let the chicken rest for 15 minutes.
step-10: carve the chicken, then plate alongside the vegetables.
step-11: pour the pan drippings over the top and serve immediately.

step-1: in a 5-quart dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
step-2: add the onion and cook 3-4 minutes until soft and slightly transparent.
step-3: add the bacon and stir constantly until it starts to crisp.
step-4: add the mushrooms and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
step-5: add the arborio rice and cook for one minute, stirring constantly so the oil coats the grains.
step-6: stir in the white wine and simmer 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
step-7: add one cup (235ml) of the chicken stock and simmer over medium heat for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
step-8: once the rice absorbs most of the liquid, continue to add 1-2 cups (235-470ml) of stock at a time until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is cooked through, about 25-30 minutes total.
step-9: note: the risotto should be al dente and fall back in on itself when you run the spoon along the bottom of the pot.
step-10: stir in the parmesan cheese and remove from the heat.
step-11: serve and garnish with extra parmesan cheese.

step-1: place all of the ingredients except for the parmesan into a large pot.
step-2: cook on a high heat for 2 minutes, submerging the spaghetti into the water once it’s softened enough.
step-3: lower the temperature to a medium/low heat and toss and stir continuously until the liquid reduces down into a thick sauce.
step-4: serve with more fresh basil and top with parmesan.

step-1: trim stems off of broccoli heads and chop into small florets.
step-2: in a large pot, combine butter and onion and sauté until translucent.
step-3: add flour and stir on medium heat until mixture lightly browns.
step-4: stir in the half-and-half and mix until contents reach a simmer.
step-5: add the veggie or chicken stock and simmer on low heat for 5-10 minutes.
step-6: mix in the broccoli, carrots, salt, pepper, and nutmeg.
step-7: simmer on low heat for 10-15 minutes.
step-8: add the cheddar cheese and stir until cheese is melted and combines with other ingredients.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: to prep cut off both ends of the butternut squash and poke 10-15 air vents with a fork.
step-3: microwave on high for 3-4 minutes.
step-4: peel the skin off of the squash.
step-5: the skin should peel right off!
step-6: once peeled, cut into 1x1-inch (2x2-cm) cubes.
step-7: in a large dutch oven or oven-safe pot, sauté onion in olive oil for 3-4 minutes or until semi-translucent.
step-8: add garlic and sauté for 2 more minutes.
step-9: add the thyme and cook for 2 minutes, until fragrant.
step-10: add arborio rice and sauté until lightly toasted, then stir in salt, pepper and white wine.
step-11: stir in butternut squash and and vegetable broth and bring to a boil.
step-12: cover pot and transfer to oven.
step-13: bake for 15-20 minutes, until liquid is absorbed.
step-14: garnish with parsley and serve immediately

step-1: rub chicken breasts with olive oil and then the cajun spice mix (store-bought or homemade)
step-2: sear the chicken breasts on each side for about 2 minutes, then remove from the pan.
step-3: add some more oil and fry the onions and peppers until softened.
step-4: add the black beans and fry for a couple of minutes.
step-5: add the rice and fry for a further minute.
step-6: place the chicken back on and cover in chopped tomatoes.
step-7: add chicken stock and more cajun spice (to taste).
step-8: bring to boil, then cover and simmer for 25 minutes.

step-1: in a small bowl, combine all spices for the cajun seasoning and mix together.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: store any extra in an airtight container for future use.
step-4: in a heavy bottom pot (such as a dutch oven), heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat.
step-5: add the sliced chicken and 2½ tablespoons of the prepared cajun seasoning.
step-6: add the andouille sausage and cook until the chicken is no longer pink, about 4-5 minutes.
step-7: remove the meat from the pot and add the remaining olive oil.
step-8: add the garlic, diced peppers and onions and cook until the onions are transparent and softened, about 5 minutes.
step-9: add the milk and stir so that the seasoning is incorporated into the liquid.
step-10: turn the heat to high and bring to a boil.
step-11: add the uncooked fettuccine, stirring constantly until the noodles are al dente, about 10 minutes.
step-12: on low heat, add the meat back in and stir so that it’s evenly incorporated.
step-13: add the cheese and parsley, and stir.
step-14: remove from the heat.

step-1: pour olive oil into the pot.
step-2: add diced chicken breast to the pot, cover with cajun seasoning, and stir until the chicken is evenly seasoned.
step-3: add sliced sausage and stir.
step-4: cook the meat on medium heat for 5-10 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
step-5: once the meat is cooked, add in the garlic, onion, peppers, and mushrooms, and stir.
step-6: continue stirring for 3-5 minutes as the veggies cook down.
step-7: add the dry pasta to the pot (if using long, thin noodles, break in half), then pour in the chicken broth.
step-8: stir until everything is well-mixed.
step-9: cover the pot and bring to a boil.
step-10: once boiling, keep covered bring the heat down to a simmer for 10 minutes (stirring every two minutes).
step-11: note: if there still extra chicken broth, you can discard it, cook longer until the liquid evaporates, or add a little cornstarch to thicken the liquid.
step-12: lastly, add heavy cream and parmesan and stir until your pasta is well blended.
step-13: stir in parmesan cheese.
step-14: garnish with green onions, more parmesan, a sprinkle of cajun seasoning (if you want some extra spice), and salt and pepper to taste.

step-1: in a large pot over a medium-high heat, add ground beef, onions, garlic, salt, pepper, worcestershire sauce, and ketchup.
step-2: break up the beef to incorporate the seasonings and cook until browned, about 6-7 minutes.
step-3: pour in the beef broth and one cup of water and bring to a simmer.
step-4: add the pasta and simmer for 20 minutes or until the pasta is cooked throughout and the broth has cooked down, stirring occasionally.
step-5: pour in the milk and cheese.
step-6: stir until the cheese has melted.
step-7: serve garnished with some sliced green onions

step-1: in a pot, heat the oil and brown the chicken.
step-2: add garlic, and sauté for about a minute.
step-3: add broth, cream, and pasta, and bring to a boil.
step-4: cover and reduce the heat to a simmer for 15-20 min.
step-5: turn off heat and stir in parmesan cheese.
step-6: top with parsley if desired.

step-1: heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large pot on medium heat.
step-2: add chicken, salt and pepper, and brown - make sure to cook through.
step-3: set chicken aside.
step-4: add 1 tablespoon olive oil and the onion into the pot and stir.
step-5: cook down for 1-2 minutes.
step-6: add mushrooms and garlic, and stir to incorporate with the onion.
step-7: season with salt and pepper to taste as well as thyme and paprika.
step-8: stir to evenly season.
step-9: add chicken broth and heavy cream to the pot and stir.
step-10: bring to a boil, then add the farfalle pasta.
step-11: cook according to package instructions, being sure to stir every 1-2 minutes to keep the pasta from clumping together.
step-12: (cook time may be a little longer in this recipe than when the pasta is boiled in water.)
step-13: when the farfalle pasta is al dente, add the spinach and chicken and stir until the spinach cooks down and incorporates.
step-14: add parmesan and stir until it’s well-incorporated and you’re left with a smooth sauce.
step-15: top off with extra parmesan and serve.

step-1: in a large pot on medium-high heat, add bacon.
step-2: cook until the fat has rendered and the bacon is crispy.
step-3: remove bacon from pot and set aside.
step-4: leave bacon fat in pan.
step-5: season chicken with salt and pepper and place skin-side down in the pot.
step-6: cook until the chicken gets a dark golden crispy skin.
step-7: flip and cook on the other side until the chicken is cooked through.
step-8: remove from pot and set aside.
step-9: add the red onion, asparagus, and garlic to the pot and until the asparagus is almost tender.
step-10: remove from pot.
step-11: add the pasta and chicken broth to the pot.
step-12: bring to a boil, and cook for 9-12 minutes or until the pasta is al dente.
step-13: stir occasionally.
step-14: when the pasta is almost tender.
step-15: lower the heat and add in the milk, goat cheese, cooked vegetables, cooked bacon, and sun-dried tomatoes.
step-16: stir to incorporate.
step-17: add the chicken back to the pot.
step-18: sprinkle with chopped parsley and bring to the table to serve.

step-1: in a large bowl, season the chicken legs with salt, pepper, 5 cloves of minced garlic, the thyme, rosemary, oregano, and 2 tablespoons of olive oil.
step-2: toss to fully coat the chicken, then cover with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-3: prepare the swiss chard.
step-4: cut out the thick stems.
step-5: stack the leaves, roll up, then thinly slice into ribbons.
step-6: slice the roll in half.
step-7: transfer to a bowl and set aside.
step-8: slice the chard stems on the bias.
step-9: transfer to a medium glass or nonreactive metal bowl and set aside.
step-10: in a large skillet, combine the sugar, 1 tablespoon of salt, the cinnamon stick, cloves, mustard seeds, allspice, bay leaves, peppercorns, coriander seeds, and red pepper flakes.
step-11: add the white wine vinegar and water, and stir well.
step-12: heat the pan over high heat, bring to a boil, and cook for 5 minutes.
step-13: place a strainer over the bowl of sliced chard stems.
step-14: pour the boiling pickling liquid over the stems and discard the solids.
step-15: let the stems pickle until the liquid has cooled and the stems have softened, about 30 minutes.
step-16: wipe out the skillet, then heat over medium-high heat with the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil until the oil is shimmering.
step-17: sear the chicken, skin-side down, until the skin is dark golden brown, 5-7 minutes.
step-18: flip and cook on the other side for another 5-7 minutes.
step-19: transfer to a plate and set aside.
step-20: add the onion, remaining 5 cloves of minced garlic, salt, and pepper.
step-21: cook, stirring, until the onion is softened and golden brown, about 10 minutes.
step-22: add the lemon juice, swiss chard leaves, and couscous.
step-23: cook until the greens wilt, about 2 minutes.
step-24: add the chicken stock and bring to a boil.
step-25: sprinkle in the capers and return the chicken to the pan, submerging in the cooking liquid.
step-26: cover, reduce the heat to low, and simmer for about 15 minutes, until the couscous has puffed up and become tender.
step-27: remove the pan from the heat.
step-28: serve with the pickled chard stems, feta cheese, and parsley.

step-1: in a bowl, mix soy sauce, ginger, garlic, oyster sauce, sesame oil, sugar, red pepper flakes, and pepper.
step-2: place chicken cubes into a re-sealable plastic bag pour half of the marinade into the bag and save the rest for later.
step-3: let the chicken marinate in the refrigerator for at least an hour.
step-4: pour the marinated chicken into a large pot and cook over medium-high heat.
step-5: remove chicken from the pot.
step-6: add sesame oil to the bottom of the pot and add the onion, celery, carrots, and cabbage.
step-7: sauté until the onions are translucent.
step-8: place both of the ramen noodle bricks into the bottom of the pot.
step-9: pour in chicken broth over the noodles.
step-10: cover the noodles with the vegetables as much as possible.
step-11: cover the pot with a lid and simmer for 5-7 minutes or until the noodles are cooked through.
step-12: break up the noodles and add back the chicken, and pour in the rest of the marinade from earlier.
step-13: garnish with scallions.

step-1: heat oil in a large pot over high heat
step-2: add chicken and cook until no pink is visible, about 5-6 minutes, then take the chicken out.
step-3: add the bell peppers and onion, cooking until the onion is translucent, about 6 minutes.
step-4: add the chicken back to the pot with salt, pepper, chili powder, cumin, and garlic powder, stirring until evenly coated, about 30 seconds.
step-5: add the milk and the penne, stirring constantly to prevent any pasta from sticking.
step-6: cook for about 20 minutes until pasta is cooked and the milk has reduced to a thick sauce that coats the pasta.
step-7: add the cheese and mix until melted.

step-1: fry sliced onions and garlic in oil until softened.
step-2: add sliced chicken breasts and fry until no longer pink.
step-3: add tomatoes, fry for a couple minutes.
step-4: add korma pasta, stir in and cook for 30 seconds.
step-5: add the rice and cook for 30 more seconds.
step-6: add stock cube, raisins and 500ml (2 ¼ cups) water.
step-7: cover with foil and cook for 15 minutes.
step-8: check chicken, if dry 5 minutes in and add more water if necessary.
step-9: uncover, stir in pine nuts and spinach until wilted.
step-10: serve with yogurt and coriander.

step-1: cook the bacon in a large pot over medium-high heat until crispy.
step-2: add the chicken and cook until no pink is showing.
step-3: remove the chicken.
step-4: cook the spinach, garlic, salt, and pepper with the bacon until the spinach has wilted.
step-5: put the chicken back in, add the milk, then stir.
step-6: bring the milk to a boil, then add the pasta.
step-7: stir constantly for about 10 minutes until the pasta is cooked.
step-8: add the parmesan, then mix until the cheese has melted.
step-9: serve!

step-1: fry the onion and garlic in a little oil for 3 minutes.
step-2: add all of the spices, the salt, the ginger and cook for a further 2 minutes.
step-3: add the tomatoes, the lentils and coconut cream, cover and simmer on a low heat for 15 minutes until the lentils are tender.
step-4: stir in the broccoli and cook for a further 4 minutes.
step-5: stir in the chickpeas, spinach, and lemon juice and cook a further 3 minutes until the spinach is slightly wilted.
step-6: serve with natural yogurt and some chopped coriander.

step-1: in a skillet, heat a small amount of oil on medium–high heat.
step-2: add chicken and season with salt and pepper.
step-3: cook the chicken thoroughly, about 6-8 minutes.
step-4: remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
step-5: add remaining olive oil to the skillet.
step-6: add onion and peppers and sauté for 5-7 minutes.
step-7: add garlic and cook for an additional minute.
step-8: add the chicken broth, lime juice, black beans, tomatoes, rice, salt, and pepper and stir to combine.
step-9: reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until rice is cooked through.
step-10: add chicken back to the pot.
step-11: add cilantro and combine.
step-12: serve immediately.

step-1: make the cheese cubes: in a medium bowl, stir together the ricotta, cream cheese, parmesan, egg, salt, and pepper until smooth.
step-2: grease an ice cube tray with nonstick spray.
step-3: spoon the ricotta mixture evenly into the cups in the tray.
step-4: cover with plastic wrap and freeze until the cheese mixture is firm, at least 4 hours or up to 3 days.
step-5: make the lasagna: heat a large pot over medium-high heat.
step-6: add the olive oil and butter to the pot and swirl to evenly coat.
step-7: add the onion, celery, and carrot and cook, stirring frequently, until softened and starting to caramelize, 10 minutes.
step-8: add the ground beef, pork, and lamb and cook, stirring to break up the meat, until no longer pink, 12 minutes.
step-9: season with salt and pepper.
step-10: add the red wine and cook, stirring, until completely evaporated, 3 minutes.
step-11: add the tomato paste and garlic, and cook, stirring frequently, until lightly caramelized, about 3 minutes.
step-12: pour in the crushed tomatoes, reduce the heat to medium, and cook the sauce, stirring, until slightly reduced, 6-8 minutes.
step-13: unmold the frozen cheese cubes, then distribute them evenly throughout the simmering meat sauce.
step-14: using your fingers or a pair of tongs, insert the noodle pieces vertically in the sauce around the pot.
step-15: cover the pot.
step-16: cook for 18 minutes, then uncover the pot and use a spatula to push down the exposed noodles so they are covered in sauce.
step-17: cover and cook for 18 minutes more, until the noodles are tender.
step-18: remove the lid and sprinkle the mozzarella and parmesan cheese over the top.
step-19: cover and cook until the cheese is melted, about 5 minutes.
step-20: remove the pot from the heat.
step-21: sprinkle the lasagna with parsley and more parmesan, if desired, and serve with garlic bread alongside.

step-1: heat half of the oil in a large pot.
step-2: add in the chicken, season with half of the seasoned salt and pepper, and cook.
step-3: once the chicken is nicely browned and cooked through, remove it from the pan.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: add in remaining oil, onion, and broccoli.
step-6: cover for 2 minutes.
step-7: season with remaining seasoned salt and pepper.
step-8: cook and stir until the onions begin to become translucent.
step-9: pour in milk and bring to a boil.
step-10: stir periodically so the bottom does not burn.
step-11: once milk is bubbling, add pasta and stir frequently until pasta reaches your desired doneness (approximately 10 minutes at medium heat).
step-12: add in parmesan and mozzarella.
step-13: stir until cheese is melted.
step-14: stir in chicken until well incorporated.

step-1: in a large pot, crisp the bacon on medium heat.
step-2: drain excess grease so there’s about 3 tablespoons left in the pot.
step-3: add in the chicken, season with half of the seasoned salt and pepper, and cook.
step-4: once the chicken is nicely browned, remove it from the pan but leave the bacon.
step-5: add in the onion and asparagus.
step-6: stir until the onions begin to become translucent.
step-7: add the garlic and spinach.
step-8: stir until spinach is wilted.
step-9: add in the sun-dried tomatoes and season with remaining salt and pepper.
step-10: pour milk over veggie and bacon mixture, and bring to a boil.
step-11: stir periodically so the bottom does not burn.
step-12: once milk is bubbling, add pasta and stir frequently until pasta reaches your desired doneness (approximately 10 minutes at medium heat).
step-13: stir in chicken and parmesan cheese and mix until cheese is melted.

step-1: heat a large pot over medium-high heat.
step-2: add 2 tablespoons of olive oil and chicken breast.
step-3: season with salt and pepper to taste.
step-4: cook until chicken is no longer pink.
step-5: remove and set aside.
step-6: add the remaining tablespoon of oil, and the mushrooms and onion.
step-7: season with salt and pepper to taste.
step-8: cook until onions are browned, stirring occasionally.
step-9: return the chicken to the pot.
step-10: add the stock, cream, wine, and pasta and bring up to a simmer.
step-11: add the pasta and cover.
step-12: *marsala wine can be purchased at most grocery stores near the dessert or sweet wines and gives the dish a distinct flavor.
step-13: however, if you can’t get your hands on marsala, you can substitute 1 cup of white wine plus 1 ½ tablespoons of brandy.
step-14: simmer until pasta is tender, about 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
step-15: when pasta is tender, stir in parmesan cheese until smooth.
step-16: remove from heat.
step-17: garnish with fresh parsley.

step-1: preheat oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-2: put oil in a cast-iron skillet over medium heat.
step-3: add garlic and onion to skillet and stir until garlic is slightly golden and onion has softened.
step-4: add pepper and sauté 2-3 minutes or until peppers have softened.
step-5: add tomatoes and sauté 1 minute.
step-6: remove sauteed vegetables and set aside.
step-7: pour water into the skillet and wait for it to come to a boil.
step-8: add rice and stir for 12-15 minutes until rice is fluffier but still slightly tender.
step-9: make a circle in the center of the rice and add your sautéed vegetables and black beans to the skillet and mix.
step-10: add cilantro, tomato sauce, chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper, and stir.
step-11: add cheese on top (optional).
step-12: bake in a preheated oven for 20-25 minutes.
step-13: allow to cool for 5 minutes.
step-14: garnish with cilantro and avocado (optional).

step-1: add the sausage to a large pot on medium high.
step-2: cook until browned.
step-3: remove temporarily from the pot.
step-4: add sliced fennel, onion, garlic, oregano, salt and pepper.
step-5: cook until the onions and fennel are golden and caramelized.
step-6: add the tomato paste, chopped tomatoes, and meat.
step-7: stir and cook until the tomato paste has darkened and is aromatic.
step-8: bring to a boil, reduce to simmer, and cook until the sauce thickens slightly.
step-9: add the cooked pasta, the grated parmesan, and the mozzarella pearls.
step-10: stir until well combined and heated through.
step-11: garnish with fennel fronds, (the green leaves of the fennel bulb).

step-1: heat unsalted butter in a large skillet over medium high heat.
step-2: add garlic and cook, stirring frequently, until fragrant, about 1-2 minutes.
step-3: add in the chicken broth, milk, and fettuccine.
step-4: season with salt and pepper.
step-5: bring the pot to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, until pasta is cooked through, about 18-20 minutes.
step-6: stir in parmesan.
step-7: if the mixture is too thick, add more milk as needed until desired consistency is reached.
step-8: serve immediately, and top with parsley.

step-1: in a 6-quart dutch oven, bring 4 quarts of salted water to a boil over medium-high heat.
step-2: add spaghetti, cooking about 6-7 minutes until al dente.
step-3: drain and set aside.
step-4: return the dutch oven to the stovetop and heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat.
step-5: add the shrimp, salt, and ½ teaspoon of the red pepper flakes.
step-6: spread evenly across the bottom of the pot and cook until the bottoms pink and slightly brown, about 45-60 seconds.
step-7: flip and repeat until shrimp are just cooked through.
step-8: remove the shrimp and place in a small bowl to the side.
step-9: reduce heat to medium-low, and add additional 1 tablespoon of oil to the pot, as needed.
step-10: add onion and garlic to the oil and cook until onions have softened, about 3-5 minutes.
step-11: stir frequently to ensure the garlic does not burn.
step-12: add the diced tomatoes, remaining 1 teaspoon of salt, sugar, remaining 1 teaspoon red pepper flakes, oregano, and white wine.
step-13: stir and bring the sauce up to a simmer.
step-14: simmer for 5-10 minutes until the sauce has thickened.
step-15: return the shrimp (and any accumulated juices) to the sauce.
step-16: add the parsley, stirring to incorporate.
step-17: add the cooked spaghetti back into the pot, toss until evenly coated and heated, then remove from heat.
step-18: serve immediately.

step-1: in a 6-quart dutch oven, heat olive oil.
step-2: add mushrooms and season with salt and pepper.
step-3: add the onions and garlic.
step-4: cook until onions are translucent.
step-5: add the ground beef and cook until brown.
step-6: stir in the paprika.
step-7: add beef stock and egg noodles.
step-8: give it a stir and cover.
step-9: simmer for 15-20 minutes.
step-10: lower the heat.
step-11: add the sour cream and cornstarch slurry.
step-12: stir until thickened.
step-13: serve and garnish with parsley.

step-1: in a 6-quart (5.7 liters) dutch oven, cook bacon over medium-high heat until fat is rendered out and the pieces begin to get crispy.
step-2: add onion, carrot, and celery, and cook until just tender, about 3 minutes.
step-3: reduce heat to medium and add flour, stirring constantly for 1-2 minutes to avoid lumps.
step-4: add ham, potatoes, thyme, and black pepper.
step-5: stir to coat the meat and potatoes in the roux/vegetable mix.
step-6: add the chicken broth and bay leaves.
step-7: cover and bring to a boil.
step-8: then reduce heat to medium-low and cook covered for 25-30 minutes.
step-9: remove bay leaves and stir in cream.
step-10: return to a simmer and serve.

step-1: in a big pot, add the olive oil, the garlic, the onion and mix it well.
step-2: add the hot dog sausages and mix it well.
step-3: add the tomatoes and mix it well.
step-4: add the seasoning: sugar, salt and pepper.
step-5: mix it well.
step-6: add the heavy milk and mix it.
step-7: add the raw penne pasta, the water and mix it well.
step-8: let it cook for 15 minutes, stirring each 5 minutes for the pasta not to stick on the bottom.
step-9: turn off the heat, add the green onions, mix it and close the pan lid.
step-10: wait 5 minutes with the pan closed before serving.
step-11: serve with parmesan cheese to taste.

step-1: in a large pot, boil water and add pasta.
step-2: cook (stirring frequently) until al dente.
step-3: drain and set pasta aside.
step-4: in the same pan, heat olive oil and 2 tablespoons of butter.
step-5: add garlic and crushed red pepper, cook until fragrant.
step-6: toss in shrimp, salt and pepper to taste, and stir until shrimp start to turn pink, but are not fully cooked.
step-7: add oregano and spinach, cook until wilted.
step-8: return cooked pasta to the pot, add remaining butter, parmesan, and parsley.
step-9: stir until well mixed and the butter is melted.
step-10: when the shrimp are cooked, add lemon juice, mix once more, then serve while hot.

step-1: preheat your oven to 350˚f (175˚c).
step-2: combine lemon pepper, paprika, and 2 cloves of minced garlic in a small bowl.
step-3: in a large oven-proof pot, heat olive oil on medium heat.
step-4: season both sides of the chicken and place in the pot skin side down.
step-5: cook for three minutes, turn the heat up to medium high and cook for an additional two minutes (or until browned).
step-6: turn the chicken over and cook for another 3-4 minutes.
step-7: remove chicken from the pot and set aside.
step-8: (don’t worry!
step-9: it will finish cooking when you put it in the oven.)
step-10: with a paper towel, carefully wipe out excess fat, leaving the seasoning.
step-11: on medium high, melt two tbsp.
step-12: of butter in the pot and add the diced onions and the rest of the minced garlic.
step-13: cook until onions are translucent (1-2 minutes).
step-14: add the rice and stir until it becomes translucent (1-2 minutes).
step-15: pour in the white wine and let it cook until most of the wine has evaporated (about two minutes).
step-16: add the chicken broth, one cup of milk, and a dash of pepper and stir.
step-17: bring it to a simmer.
step-18: place the chicken back into the pot.
step-19: cover with a lid or foil and bake for 30 minutes (remove lid after 20 minutes).
step-20: remove the chicken from the pot and broil on high for 2-3 minutes or until the skin has nicely browned.
step-21: add the other two tbsp.
step-22: butter, parmesan, ½ cup (118 ml) of milk and parsley to the rice.
step-23: stir until well combined.
step-24: return the chicken on top of the rice.

step-1: in a large pot, cook the pasta according to the package instructions.
step-2: drain and set aside.
step-3: heat the olive oil in the same pot over medium heat.
step-4: add the onion and sauté until translucent, about 2 minutes.
step-5: stir in the carrots, celery, mushrooms, salt, and pepper.
step-6: sauté until mushrooms have cooked down and are turning golden, about 5 minutes.
step-7: add the wine and simmer until most of the liquid is absorbed, about 4 minutes.
step-8: add the garlic and stir to combine, then add the diced tomatoes, tomato paste, broth, lentils, basil, oregano, rosemary, and baking soda.
step-9: stir to combine.
step-10: bring to a boil, then cover, reduce the heat to low, and simmer for 40 minutes, until the bolognese is thickened.
step-11: serve the bolognese over the pasta, or, for a lighter option, use zucchini noodles or spaghetti squash.
step-12: garnish with parsley.

step-1: in a medium saucepan, combine quinoa and water, and bring to a boil over high heat.
step-2: reduce heat to low, cover with a lid, and simmer for 10 minutes.
step-3: add in salsa and cumin, and cover for 5 more minutes or until quinoa is fluffy.
step-4: add in black beans, corn, salt, and olive oil, and stir until combined.
step-5: for the avocado dressing, combine avocado, garlic, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper in liquid measuring cup and whisk until smooth.
step-6: whisk in water a little bit at a time until desired consistency is reached.
step-7: for extra smooth consistency, process all ingredients in blender or food processor.
step-8: portion out into 4 containers and refrigerate for up to 5 days.

step-1: cook noodles according to package instructions.
step-2: toss with 1 tbsp.
step-3: of sesame oil and set aside.
step-4: pour ½ tbsp.
step-5: of sesame oil into your pot and add two lightly beaten eggs.
step-6: when the eggs are finished cooking, set aside.
step-7: pour another ½ tbsp.
step-8: of sesame oil into the pot and add 1 diced chicken breast.
step-9: set aside once chicken is fully cooked.
step-10: add shallots to the pot (no need for sesame oil first - there should be enough moisture leftover from cooking the chicken) and cook until lightly browned and fragrant.
step-11: then, add your noodles, eggs, and chicken back into the pot.
step-12: pour in pad thai sauce (use a pre-made mixture or make your own mixture of equal parts fish oil, rice vinegar, soy sauce, brown sugar, lime juice, and sriracha).
step-13: top with bean sprouts, crushed peanuts, green onions, and cilantro, and stir until well blended.
step-14: dish up and garnish with extra peanuts, green onions, and cilantro.

step-1: in a pot over high heat, combine broth, linguine, broccoli, asparagus, onion, garlic, red pepper flakes, salt, pepper, and olive oil.
step-2: stir.
step-3: add the mushrooms and bring to a boil.
step-4: once at a boil, reduce heat to medium and cook the pasta for 10 minutes, continuously tossing with tongs.
step-5: add the heavy cream, parmesan, and parsley, and toss for an additional 3 minutes.
step-6: if the liquid hasn’t been completely absorbed, let the pasta sit off the heat for an additional few minutes.

step-1: for the pesto, add garlic, basil, salt, pepper, and walnuts into the bowl of a food processor.
step-2: turn on the food processor and slowly add the olive oil in a steady stream and puree thoroughly.
step-3: add the parmesan and pulse to incorporate.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: in a large pot, heat olive oil on medium-high heat.
step-6: season chicken and brown on both sides.
step-7: cook thoroughly for 8-10 minutes.
step-8: remove chicken from pan and set aside.
step-9: sauté garlic for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant.
step-10: add the chicken broth, sun-dried tomatoes, pasta, salt, and red pepper flakes and mix until combined.
step-11: cover.
step-12: bring liquid to a boil.
step-13: reduce heat and simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until pasta is al dente.
step-14: add spinach and stir until wilted.
step-15: add cooked chicken and pesto.
step-16: serve immediately.

step-1: bring a large pot of water to a rolling boil, add a generous amount of salt, and cook pasta 2 minutes less than the package instructions.
step-2: strain pasta and set aside.
step-3: toss with a small amount of oil to prevent sticking
step-4: in the same pot, heat 1 tbsp of olive oil and fry sausages, working in batches as needed, until deeply browned on all sides.
step-5: remove sausages, slice in ¾-inch rings, and set aside.
step-6: sauté all of the bell peppers, onion, and garlic for about 2 minutes.
step-7: add the canned tomatoes, all of the spices, and the sausage slices to the pot.
step-8: simmer about 10 minutes.
step-9: add the pasta back to the pot and stir gently until all the ingredients are coated in the sauce.
step-10: continue simmering until pasta is al dente.
step-11: serve with grated parmesan.

step-1: in a large pot, heat the butter over medium-high heat until browned.
step-2: toss in the shrimp and season with salt and black pepper.
step-3: sear just until pink on both sides.
step-4: remove the shrimp from the pot and set aside.
step-5: sauté the garlic and bacon until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
step-6: add in the spinach and stir until it begins to wilt.
step-7: pour in the heavy cream and stir the pot to combine.
step-8: let the sauce come up to a simmer and reduce until thick and creamy, about 5 minutes.
step-9: toss in the fettuccine, sprinkle over the parmesan cheese.
step-10: sprinkle in the parsley and add the shrimp back to the pot.
step-11: toss until everything has warmed through.
step-12: remove from heat and serve.
step-13: top with a sprinkle of fresh parsley.

step-1: bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over high heat and cook the pasta according to the package instructions.
step-2: reserve ¾ cup (175 ml) of pasta cooking water, then drain the pasta in a colander and place the pot back on the stove over medium heat
step-3: to the pot, add the olive oil, onion, red pepper flakes, and garlic.
step-4: cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
step-5: add the tomatoes and reserved pasta water, and simmer until reduced by half, about 4 minutes.
step-6: season with the salt and pepper.
step-7: add the pasta back to the pot, along with the shredded chicken and spinach, and stir to combine and wilt the spinach.
step-8: store the leftovers in the fridge for the rest of the week.
step-9: *vegan/vegetarian substitution: omit the shredded chicken.

step-1: boil water in a large pot over high heat.
step-2: add 2 tablespoons of salt to water and add pasta.
step-3: cook pasta until almost al dente, or for 1-2 minutes less than the recommended cook time.
step-4: drain.
step-5: heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large pot on medium heat.
step-6: add chicken, salt, and pepper.
step-7: brown chicken, making sure to cook through.
step-8: set chicken aside.
step-9: add 2 tablespoon olive oil, garlic, and red chili flakes into the pot and stir.
step-10: add crushed tomatoes, stirring for a few minutes.
step-11: add cream, stirring until incorporated.
step-12: add spinach and stir until the spinach cooks down and incorporates.
step-13: add chicken, pasta, and parmesan, stirring until pasta is evenly coated.
step-14: garnish with more parmesan cheese and serve!

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the ground beef, breadcrumbs, onion, egg, salt, and pepper, mixing until evenly combined.
step-2: heat the canola oil in a pot over medium-high heat.
step-3: take about a golf-ball size of the meatball mixture and roll it into balls.
step-4: place the meatballs into the pot, cooking for one minute.
step-5: flip the meatballs.
step-6: add the beef broth, milk, salt, pepper, and worcestershire sauce and give it a stir.
step-7: bring the liquid to a boil, then add the egg noodles.
step-8: stir constantly until the pasta is cooked and the liquid has reduced to a sauce that coats the noodles, about seven to eight minutes.
step-9: add the parmesan and the parsley, stirring until the cheese is melted.

step-1: heat olive oil in a large stockpot over medium-high heat.
step-2: add ground beef, yellow onions, and taco seasoning.
step-3: cook until beef has browned, about 3-5 minutes, making sure to crumble the beef as it cooks.
step-4: stir in tomato paste and diced tomatoes, then stir.
step-5: add spaghetti and 3 cups water.
step-6: bring to a boil; cover, reduce heat, and simmer until pasta is cooked through, about 15 minutes.
step-7: remove from heat and top with cheddar cheese, mozzarella cheese, roma tomato, and cilantro.
step-8: mix until cheese is melted.
step-9: serve immediately.
step-10: garnish with additional tomato and cilantro, if desired.

step-1: make the pesto cashew cream cubes: in a blender, combine the cashews, olive oil, basil, nutritional yeast, lemon juice, salt, onion powder, garlic powder, pepper, and garlic.
step-2: blend until smooth.
step-3: grease an ice cube tray with nonstick spray.
step-4: spoon the pesto into the cups in the tray.
step-5: cover with plastic wrap and freeze until the cubes are firm, at least 4 hours or up to 3 days.
step-6: make the lasagna: heat a large pot over medium-high heat.
step-7: add ¼ cup (60 ml) of olive oil to the pot and swirl to evenly coat.
step-8: add the eggplant and cook, stirring occasionally, until very soft and caramelized, 30 minutes.
step-9: transfer the eggplant to a bowl and set aside.
step-10: add the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil to the pot.
step-11: then, add the carrot, celery, and onion, and cook, stirring, until softened and starting to caramelize, 10 minutes.
step-12: season with salt and pepper.
step-13: add the wine and cook, stirring, until completely evaporated, about 4 minutes.
step-14: add the tomato paste and garlic, and cook, stirring, until lightly caramelized, about 2 minutes over medium heat.
step-15: stir in the reserved eggplant, vegetable stock, and crushed tomatoes and stir to combine.
step-16: remove the pesto cubes from the ice cube tray, and immediately distribute the frozen pesto cubes throughout the eggplant sauce.
step-17: using your fingers or a pair of tongs, insert the noodle pieces vertically in the sauce around the pot.
step-18: cover the pot.
step-19: reduce the heat to medium-low, and cook for 18 minutes, then uncover the pot and use a spatula to push down the exposed noodles so they are covered in sauce.
step-20: cover and cook for 18 minutes more, until the noodles are tender.
step-21: uncover and sprinkle the mozzarella over the top of the lasagna.
step-22: cover again and cook until the cheese is melted, about 5 minutes.
step-23: remove the pot from the heat.
step-24: sprinkle the lasagna with parsley and serve with garlic bread alongside.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the mushrooms, beans, onion, bread crumbs, parsley, garlic, dried rosemary, worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, nutmeg, liquid smoke, salt, and pepper.
step-2: mix well with a fork, mashing the beans a bit to form a paste.
step-3: heat the canola oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
step-4: roll the “meatball” mixture and into golf ball-sized balls.
step-5: place the balls in the pot and cook for 1 minute on each side until browned.
step-6: add the vegetable broth, coconut milk, worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, and flour, and gently stir until evenly combined.
step-7: bring the liquid to a boil, then add the pasta.
step-8: stir constantly until the pasta is cooked and the liquid has reduced to a sauce that coats the noodles and meatballs, 7-8 minutes.
step-9: garnish with parsley.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c)
step-2: heat oil over a cast-iron skillet.
step-3: add the cubed chicken, season with salt and pepper.
step-4: cook until no longer pink.
step-5: remove chicken and set aside.
step-6: to the same skillet, add the onions and garlic.
step-7: sauté until translucent.
step-8: add potatoes and sauté about 5 minutes.
step-9: add peas and carrots, and stir again.
step-10: add the butter to the vegetable and allow to melt.
step-11: sprinkle the flour, covering the vegetables, and quickly stir to avoid lumps.
step-12: pour in chicken broth and bring to a boil to thicken sauce.
step-13: season with salt and pepper.
step-14: remove from heat.
step-15: place pie dough over the chicken and vegetable mixture, and seal along the edges of the skillet with your fingers.
step-16: bake for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown.

step-1: add olive to a large pan over medium heat.
step-2: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the mushrooms and cook until tender, 5 to 6 minutes.
step-3: transfer the mushrooms to a plate.
step-4: in the same pan, add the butter.
step-5: add the onion, ground beef, and garlic powder.
step-6: stir until the meat is browned, breaking it up as you stir.
step-7: drain any excess fat and return the pan to the stove.
step-8: add the flour and paprika.
step-9: stir until thick, about 1 to 2 minutes.
step-10: add the sherry, and stir, scraping up any brown bits from the bottom of the pan.
step-11: add the beef broth and bring the mixture to a boil.
step-12: add the egg noodles, salt, and pepper.
step-13: reduce the heat to simmer.
step-14: cover the pan with a lid.
step-15: stir often, until the noodles are tender, about 8 to 10 minutes.
step-16: return the mushrooms to the pan and stir to combine.
step-17: add the sour cream and stir.
step-18: top with chopped parsley.

step-1: assemble potatoes, carrots, onion, and garlic on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-2: drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with rosemary, and half the black pepper and salt.
step-3: roll around and rub to coat everything evenly.
step-4: sprinkle remaining salt and pepper on either side of each chicken thigh.
step-5: arrange chicken thighs skin-side up on top of the vegetables.
step-6: roast at 425˚f (220˚c) for about 40-50 minutes or until the chicken reads 165˚f (73˚c) internal temperature and skin is crispy.

step-1: set the nori sheet on a clean work surface.
step-2: season the rice with a pinch of salt.
step-3: place half of the rice in the center of the nori and sprinkle with sesame seeds.
step-4: place the cooked salmon and shiso leaf on top.
step-5: top with the remaining rice, then wrap the nori into a square and flip upside down.
step-6: let rest about 1 minute.
step-7: cut in half.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: grease a baking sheet with nonstick spray or line with parchment paper.
step-3: cut the onion crosswise into ½-inch (1 cm) slices and gently push apart each layer to get individual rings.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: in a large bowl, combine the bread crumbs, parmesan, garlic powder, paprika, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper.
step-6: add the eggs to a separate large bowl.
step-7: add the flour to a third large bowl.
step-8: dredge the onion rings in the flour, then the eggs, then finally in the bread crumb mixture, making sure to coat all sides.
step-9: arrange the onion rings on the baking sheet.
step-10: bake for 10-15 minutes, flipping halfway through, until golden brown on both sides.
step-11: serve with your favorite dipping sauce.

step-1: combine the egg, white pepper and salt in a mixing bowl.
step-2: add the cubed chicken breast, make sure it’s coated with the egg mixture.
step-3: in another bowl, combine corn starch and flour.
step-4: add the coated chicken to the flour mixture.
step-5: stir to coat.
step-6: working in batches, fry the coated chicken until golden and done.
step-7: remove with a slotted spoon and set aside.
step-8: in a large pan or wok, add oil, garlic, ginger and red chili flakes.
step-9: stir fry until fragrant.
step-10: add rice wine and stir for a few seconds.
step-11: proceed to add all of the other sauce ingredients, including soy sauce, vinegar, water, sugar and orange zest.
step-12: add the fried chicken.
step-13: stir to coat in sauce.
step-14: thicken the sauce with the cornstarch slurry.
step-15: garnish with chopped scallions and serve with rice.

step-1: in a large nonstick skillet, heat a small amount of cooking oil.
step-2: add chicken.
step-3: season with salt and pepper and cook until browned, about 5 minutes.
step-4: remove from pan and set aside.
step-5: add carrots and broccoli and cook for 1 minute.
step-6: add bell pepper and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes.
step-7: remove ingredients from pan and set aside.
step-8: add orange juice, soy sauce, honey, rice vinegar, garlic, ginger, and cornstarch.
step-9: whisk.
step-10: simmer until sauce starts to thicken, about 5 minutes.
step-11: add chicken back into pan.
step-12: serve over cooked veggies.

step-1: cut orange in half.
step-2: with a paring knife, carefully cut along the entire edge.
step-3: with a spoon, scoop out the "meat" and set aside in a bowl.
step-4: repeat for all oranges.
step-5: this will yield 6 empty orange halves.
step-6: juice the orange, reserve for the cake mix.
step-7: pre heat oven to 350°f (175°c).
step-8: in a medium bowl, combine cake mix, eggs, oil and freshly squeezed orange juice.
step-9: mix until the batter has no lumps.
step-10: place the orange cups into a muffin tin and fill with ¼ cup (60 g) of the chocolate batter.
step-11: bake 25 minutes.
step-12: in a medium bowl, blend cream cheese, vanilla extract and orange zest until nice and smooth.
step-13: add butter and mix on medium high for a couple of minutes.
step-14: add powdered sugar and mix until the frosting is uniformly smooth.
step-15: put icing into a piping bag.
step-16: let cup cakes cool down.
step-17: top the cakes with icing.
step-18: sprinkle extra orange zest on top for garnish.

step-1: place the coconut milk, orange juice, and honey in a blender and blend until the mixture is smooth.
step-2: pour the coconut mixture into popsicle molds filled almost to the brim.
step-3: freeze the popsicles for at least 4 hours.
step-4: unmold the popsicles.

step-1: preheat oven to 475°f (240°c).
step-2: in a bowl, combine all ingredients for the meatballs.
step-3: mix until all ingredients are incorporated.
step-4: using your hands or a spoon, roll a bit of the meat mixture in between your hands until a meatball is formed.
step-5: place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-6: next to the meatballs, spread assorted veggies and lightly with drizzle oil, salt, and pepper.
step-7: bake at for 15 minutes, or until meatballs are cooked through and vegetables are soft.
step-8: in a microwave-safe bowl, add all the ingredients for the orange sauce.
step-9: stir orange sauce until well combined.
step-10: microwave for 1 minute, stirring at 30 seconds.
step-11: put veggies and meatballs over a bowl of rice and pour the sauce as desired.

step-1: place the orange juice, orange, mango, and carrots in a blender or food processor and blend until just combined.
step-2: add in the ice and continue to blend until the mixture is smooth.
step-3: serve immediately.

step-1: add tofu and maple syrup to a mixing bowl and whisk together until smooth and no large lumps are present.
step-2: transfer tofu mixture to ice tray and use a rubber spatula to evenly spread the mixture into each of the cube slots.
step-3: freeze completely.
step-4: place orange, mango, peach, 4 tofu cubes, and milk in a blender, making sure that the cubes sit on top of the fruit.
step-5: blend until smooth.
step-6: serve immediately.

step-1: pour the champagne into an 8-ounce (235 ml) champagne flute.
step-2: add the pomegranate juice, pomegranate seeds, and orange juice to the glass.
step-3: drop in a slice of orange.
step-4: garnish with another slice of orange and serve.

step-1: in a large bowl, whisk together all of the filling ingredients until smooth.
step-2: cut the oranges in half and squeeze the juice out while keeping the skin intact as much as you can.
step-3: fill each orange half with the filling and then freeze for at least one hour.
step-4: (placing them in small dishes on a baking tray will help keep their shape, but they will probably be fine if you don’t have enough little dishes).
step-5: soften for 15-30 minutes at room temperature before serving.

step-1: combine soda water and orange juice, and serve.
in a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the simple syrup, orange juice, and vanilla.
step-2: simmer for 5 minutes, until slightly reduced.
step-3: remove from the heat and let cool completely.
step-4: once the syrup is cool, strain into an airtight glass container and store in the refrigerator for up to 1 month.
step-5: to make the soda, pour 1 cup (240 ml) of seltzer water into a glass filled with ice and add 1-2 tablespoons of syrup.
step-6: stir to combine.
step-7: garnish with orange wheels, if desired.
step-8:
nutrition, per 1 tablespoon:
calories: 20
sugar: 5 grams

step-1: quarter the flaky biscuit dough.
step-2: take one quarter and flatten with your finger.
step-3: place a mini oreo in the center and close the biscuit dough around it.
step-4: make sure to seal the seam as much as possible.
step-5: repeat with the rest of the biscuit dough.
step-6: fry the doughnut holes until golden brown.
step-7: set aside to cool down.
step-8: combine powder sugar and whole milk to form the glaze.
step-9: dip the fried doughnut holes in the glaze.
step-10: sprinkle crushed oreo cookies over the top while the glaze is still wet.

step-1: on a cutting board, cut chicken into 1x1-inch (2x2-cm) cubes and set aside.
step-2: in a medium mixing bowl, combine salt, white pepper, cornstarch, and flour.
step-3: whisk to combine.
step-4: add the egg, water, and oil until it reaches the consistency of pancake batter.
step-5: add the chicken to the batter and refrigerate at least 30 minutes.
step-6: heat oil in a wok or heavy bottom pan to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-7: gently add the chicken and cook for 5-6 minutes until lightly golden brown.
step-8: remove the chicken from the pan and transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.
step-9: set a heavy bottomed pot over medium- high heat and add the oil.
step-10: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the red pepper flakes, ginger, and garlic, and cook for 30 seconds, stirring constantly.
step-11: add the sugar and brown sugar, and stir to combine.
step-12: add in the orange juice and allow the sugars to begin to dissolve in the liquid, stirring occasionally.
step-13: add in the vinegar and soy sauce, and stir to combine.
step-14: add the cornstarch and water together and whisk to combine.
step-15: add to the pan and stir.
step-16: continue to cook the sauce until maple syrup consistency is achieved.
step-17: add in the fried chicken and stir until completely coated in the sauce.
step-18: top with sesame oil.

step-1: preheat oven to 275˚f (140˚c).
step-2: season the ribs with salt, black pepper, paprika, cayenne pepper, oregano, and brown sugar.
step-3: rub in the seasonings evenly on both sides.
step-4: place the ribs on a baking sheet lined with foil.
step-5: cover the ribs with foil.
step-6: bake for 2 hours.
step-7: increase the oven temperature to 500˚f (260˚c).
step-8: carefully uncover the ribs.
step-9: spread bbq sauce evenly on top of the ribs.
step-10: place green beans on the sides of the pan.
step-11: season the green beans with salt.
step-12: bake for 10 minutes.
step-13: transfer the ribs to a cutting board.
step-14: cut between the bones to separate into individual ribs.
step-15: serve with green beans.

step-1: in a mason jar or sealable container, add the oats, almond milk, yogurt, almond butter, honey, chia seeds, cinnamon, and peaches.
step-2: make sure the oats and almond milk are at the bottom of the container so that they properly soak.
step-3: seal and place in the refrigerator overnight.
step-4: enjoy as is, or pour the ingredients into a blender with the additional almond milk and blend until smooth.
step-5: pour the mixture back into the mason jar and take your overnight oats on the go.

step-1: in a large bowl, add the eggs, half & half, brown sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, and pinch of salt.
step-2: whisk to combine.
step-3: line bread in a greased 9x13-inch (23x33 cm) baking dish, overlapping slightly.
step-4: pour the egg mixture over the bread.
step-5: cover the baking dish in foil and refrigerate overnight.
step-6: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-7: in a bowl, add the butter, brown sugar, pecans, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
step-8: stir to combine.
step-9: remove the baking dish from the refrigerator and remove the foil.
step-10: top the french toast with the praline, and place foil back on
step-11: bake for 40 minutes.
step-12: remove foil, and bake for an additional 20 minutes, or until puffed and slightly golden.
step-13: serve with maple syrup.

step-1: scoop the avocado into a medium bowl.
step-2: season with salt and add the lemon juice.
step-3: mash until smooth.
step-4: spread the mayonnaise over 1 slice of toast.
step-5: spread the avocado on top, then add the cucumber slices and tomato slice.
step-6: top with the remaining piece of toast.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180˚c).
step-2: brush a 9x9-inch (23x23-cm) baking dish with the olive oil.
step-3: in a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, and chives.
step-4: season with salt and pepper.
step-5: add the egg mixture to the baking dish and bake until just set in the middle, 15-20 minutes.
step-6: cut into 9 squares.
step-7: for kids, layer one slice of cheese on top of one of the english muffin halves.
step-8: top with a frittata square.
step-9: spread the remaining english muffin half with mustard, and sandwich together.
step-10: for adults, layer one slice of cheese on top of one of the english muffin halves.
step-11: top with a frittata square, roasted red pepper slices, and arugula.
step-12: spread the remaining english muffin half with mustard, and sandwich together.

step-1: in a small pan, pour the sweetened condensed milk, milk, cornstarch, heavy cream, and the paçocas.
step-2: dissolve the cornstarch in the milk before putting in the pan.
step-3: cook over medium heat and mix well until it becomes creamy.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: repeat the process with the chocolate pudding.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: in a square tray, put a layer of graham crackers soaked in milk, then a layer of the paçoca pudding, then cover with the graham crackers soaked in milk.
step-8: add a layer of the semisweet chocolate pudding.
step-9: repeat until the tray is full.
step-10: melt the semisweet chocolate with the heavy cream on the microwave for 1 minute or until it melts completely.
step-11: spread the ganache over the trifle and refrigerate for 4 hours.
step-12: spread crumbled paçocas over the trifle.

step-1: in a bowl, mix the popped popcorn with the crushed pacocas.
step-2: add the melted chocolate and stir until the popcorn is fully coated.
step-3: add the marshmallows and mix.
step-4: divide in smaller paper bags or just serve in a big bowl.

step-1: soak rice noodles in room temperature water 30 minutes prior to cooking.
step-2: in a small saucepan over medium-high heat, whisk together palm sugar, tamarind paste, and fish sauce.
step-3: bring to a boil, reduce heat, and reduce for 5 minutes until the sauce thickens and coats the back of a wooden spoon.
step-4: remove sauce from heat and set aside.
step-5: heat a cast-iron pan or wok over high heat.
step-6: add pork belly and sear for about 3 minutes.
step-7: add oil, minced garlic, shallots, and turnips, and stir to incorporate.
step-8: move the pork belly to the side of the pan and add the egg.
step-9: break the egg up with a spatula or wooden spoon and stir to scramble.
step-10: add soaked rice noodles and stir to evenly incorporate all ingredients, stirring for 1 to 2 minutes.
step-11: add 2 or 3 tablespoons of the reduced sauce and stir.
step-12: add tofu, chinese chives or green onions, and bean sprouts.
step-13: stir to incorporate and remove from heat.
step-14: when plating, make a divot in the center of the noodles and add the egg yolk.
step-15: serve immediately with lime, peanuts, more sprouts and chives, and red chiles, if desired.

step-1: preheat oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-2: with a sharp knife, slice the squash in half.
step-3: if the squash is too tough, puncture in several places forming a dotted line around the squash.
step-4: microwave for 3-5 minutes to soften.
step-5: allow to cool before cutting in half.
step-6: scoop out the seeds, brush with oil, and sprinkle with salt, and pepper.
step-7: bake for 40-45 minutes, or until a fork can easily pierce the skin.
step-8: meanwhile, combine water, soy sauce, sesame oil, honey, lime juice, sriracha, peanut butter, ginger, and garlic in a bowl, stirring to combine.
step-9: remove squash from the oven, with a fork pull at the edges to produce that stringy “spaghetti” quality.
step-10: in a bowl combine “spaghetti” with cucumber, carrots, peppers, green onions, onions, peanuts, cilantro, and sauce.
step-11: add mixture back to the hollowed out spaghetti squash halves.
step-12: serve in the squash, and top garnish with cilantro and peanuts.

step-1: in a mortar and pestle or a spice grinder, crush the pomegranate and cumin seeds, then transfer to a medium bowl.
step-2: add the chickpea flour, black pepper, cayenne, coriander, baking powder, and salt, and stir to combine.
step-3: mix in the yogurt, water, and cilantro, and stir until evenly incorporated.
step-4: a few lumps are okay.
step-5: rest for 15 minutes to let the flour hydrate.
step-6: heat the oil in a large pot until it reaches 350°f (180°c).
step-7: mix the onions and sliced jalapeños into the batter.
step-8: dip the slices of potato, eggplant, and the whole jalapenos into the batter.
step-9: try to get the onions and other bits in the batter stuck to the dipped veggies to create more texture.
step-10: fry the dipped vegetables, making sure not to overcrowd the pot, until deep golden brown, about 3-4 minutes.
step-11: drain on a wire rack or paper towels, then salt the pakoras while they are still hot.
step-12: dip in mint chutney, tamarind sauce, and/or ketchup.

step-1: add the flank steak, coconut aminos, and lime juice to a bowl, and toss to combine.
step-2: set aside to marinate for 10 minutes.
step-3: heat 1 tablespoon of oil over medium-high heat in a large nonstick skillet.
step-4: place half the meat in the skillet and sear for 1 minute on each side.
step-5: place the seared steak in a clean bowl and repeat with the second batch, draining excess liquid from the skillet as needed.
step-6: once all of the meat has been seared and removed from the pan, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil in the pan.
step-7: add in the carrots and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
step-8: add the napa cabbage to the pan and quickly toss with the carrots.
step-9: move the cabbage and carrots away from the center of the pan and sprinkle in the scallions, ginger, and garlic.
step-10: stir the mixture in the center of the pan until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
step-11: mix all contents of the pan together and toss in the meat.
step-12: pour in the coconut aminos, lime juice, and tapioca flour.
step-13: stir the contents of the pan until well combined and the sauce has thickened, about 1-2 minutes.
step-14: remove from heat.
step-15: divided the mixture between bowls filled with napa cabbage and garnish with scallions.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: in a medium-size bowl, combine almond flour, sliced almonds, coconut oil, maple syrup, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: divide the blueberries evenly among ramekins.
step-5: squeeze the lemon juice over the blueberries.
step-6: sprinkle the almond mixture over the blueberries.
step-7: bake for 30-35 minutes, or until browned.
step-8: let cool before serving.
step-9: garnish to your liking.

step-1: in a small microwave-safe bowl, microwave chocolate on medium-high heat in 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until chocolate is melted.
step-2: let cool.
step-3: in a medium-size bowl, add the coconut cream, coconut milk, honey, and vanilla.
step-4: whisk until incorporated.
step-5: fold in the melted chocolate.
step-6: divide evenly among ramekins.
step-7: refrigerate for 1 hour.
step-8: garnish to your liking.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: microwave chocolate and coconut oil in 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until melted.
step-3: let cool to room temperature.
step-4: in a separate bowl, add eggs, honey, vanilla, and salt.
step-5: with a hand-mixer, beat for 3-5 minutes, or until frothy.
step-6: add half of the chocolate mixture to the egg mixture.
step-7: fold until incorporated.
step-8: add remaining half and repeat.
step-9: divide mixture evenly among lightly greased 4-inch (10 cm) ramekins.
step-10: place ramekins onto a baking tray.
step-11: place tray onto the top oven rack.
step-12: fill the bottom of the baking tray with an inch (2 ½ cm) of water.
step-13: bake for 20 minutes, or until the center of the torte is set and no longer jiggly.
step-14: let cool before serving.
step-15: garnish to your liking.

step-1: in a medium-size bowl filled with water, add cashews.
step-2: refrigerate overnight.
step-3: discard cashew water.
step-4: in a food processor, place cashews, strawberries, banana, honey, coconut oil, lemon juice, and vanilla extract.
step-5: process until smooth.
step-6: remove and set aside.
step-7: in the food processor, place almonds, dates, coconut, vanilla, and salt.
step-8: pulse until mixture resembles a coarse crumble.
step-9: divide the crust mixture evenly among lightly greased ramekins.
step-10: press the mixture into the bottom and sides of the ramekins.
step-11: evenly divide strawberry filling among the ramekins.
step-12: refrigerate for 1 hour.
step-13: garnish to your liking.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: brush the melted butter evenly over the puff pastry.
step-3: sprinkle half the sugar on the pastry, then spread it around evenly.
step-4: using a rolling pin, roll the pastry into a rectangle, pressing the sugar into the pastry.
step-5: flip the pastry, then repeat the process, brushing with butter and rolling in the rest of the sugar.
step-6: starting from the shorter edges, roll them tightly towards the middle.
step-7: wrap in cling film and chill for about 30 minutes.
step-8: remove the cling film and push one of the rolls directly on top of the other.
step-9: trim off the uneven ends of the pastry, then slice 1-centimeter (½ inch) cookie rounds.
step-10: they should look like smushed hearts.
step-11: place the slices on a baking tray lined with parchment paper about 2 inches (5 cm) apart to allow for expansion.
step-12: bake for 15 minutes, flipping them halfway, until the sugar is caramelized and the cookies are golden brown.
step-13: cool and serve!

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine the grapefruit rinds and sugar.
step-2: toss to coat the rinds with the sugar, then cover.
step-3: let sit, stirring every 45 minutes, for about 4 hours, or until the sugar is completely dissolved and there’s syrup in the bottom of the bowl.
step-4: strain the syrup through a fine-mesh sieve or cheesecloth, pushing to extract as much syrup as possible.
step-5: store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 weeks.
step-6: in a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the tequila, lime juice, and simple syrup.
step-7: shake vigorously for 20 seconds.
step-8: strain into a glass filled with ice and top with club soda.
step-9: garnish with the grapefruit wedge.

step-1: heat oil in a pan over medium heat until it begins to shimmer.
step-2: add the broccoli and sprinkle with salt, stirring to coat in the oil.
step-3: cook for 5 minutes, without moving the broccoli.
step-4: add chicken stock and place a lid on the pan, and cook for 1 minute.
step-5: remove the lid and add the garlic and red pepper flakes.
step-6: stir, cooking for 1 minute.

step-1: blanch the cabbage leaves in boiling water for 3 minutes, then transfer directly to a large bowl of ice water.
step-2: remove the tough stem, finely dice and set aside.
step-3: in a medium bowl, combine the ground pork, ground beef, diced cabbage stems, onion, egg, salt, and pepper, and mix until well-combined.
step-4: divide into four equal parts.
step-5: fold the mozzarella slices in half and roll them up.
step-6: form each portion of meat into a patty.
step-7: add a roll of cheese to each patty and form the meat around the cheese so it is completely encased.
step-8: put a meat patty on a cabbage leaf, fold in front and right side, and roll up.
step-9: fold the left side inwards towards the meat filling to seal.
step-10: repeat with the remaining meat and cabbage.
step-11: heat a bit of oil in a medium pan over medium heat.
step-12: add thecabbage rolls and fry for 3 minutes, until browned on one side.
step-13: turn cabbage rolls over and add the water, bullion, and butter.
step-14: once the water is boiling, add the canned tomatoes.
step-15: cover and cook for 15 minutes.
step-16: season with salt and pepper.
step-17: sprinkle with parmesan cheese and parsley, then serve.

step-1: heat oil in a nonstick skillet.
step-2: season salmon with salt and pepper.
step-3: lay the salmon on the skillet and watch the color rise to about two-thirds of the way up the salmon.
step-4: flip the salmon once and cook until done to taste, roughly 2-4 minutes longer.
step-5: serve with lemon and thyme (optional).

step-1: make the shrimp cakes: add the shrimp to a food processor and pulse 4-5 times, until minced but not mushy.
step-2: in a large bowl, mix together the shrimp, shallot, jalapeño, eggs, panko, chives, lemon zest, paprika, cayenne, a pinch of salt, the lemon juice, and worcestershire sauce until well combined.
step-3: using a 1-ounce (30-g) scoop, portion out the shrimp mixture and gently flatten into patties.
step-4: heat the oil in a medium skillet over medium heat.
step-5: cook the patties, in batches if necessary, for 2-3 minutes on each side, until golden brown and the internal temperature reaches 145˚f (63˚c).
step-6: transfer the cooked patties to a paper towel-lined plate to drain and season lightly with salt.
step-7: make the roasted red pepper sauce: add the peppers, red wine vinegar, almonds, shallot, garlic, and a pinch of salt to a blender.
step-8: blend for 30 seconds, until smooth.
step-9: with the blender running, slowly stream in the olive oil to emulsify.
step-10: thin with the reserved red pepper liquid, if necessary.
step-11: assemble the salad: add the arugula and watercress to a large bowl.
step-12: add a drizzle of olive oil, the lemon juice, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
step-13: toss well.
step-14: divide the salad between serving bowls and top with the shrimp cakes and roasted red pepper sauce.
step-15: nutrition: shrimp cakes - per serving: 4 cakes - calories: 393, total fat: 20 grams, sodium: 1419 mg (shrimp is a naturally high source of sodium), total carb: 21 grams, dietary fiber: 2 grams, sugars: 3 grams, protein: 32 grams
step-16: nutrition: salad - per serving: 2 cups - calories: 38, total fat: 4 grams, sodium: 39 mg, total carb: 2 grams, dietary fiber: 0 grams, sugars: 1 gram, protein: 1 gram
step-17: nutrition: red pepper sauce - per serving: ~ ¼ cup - calories: 176, total fat: 17 grams, sodium: 36 mg, total carb: 6 grams, dietary fiber: 1 gram, sugars: 3 grams, protein: 1 gram,
step-18: nutrition: total recipe - per serving - calories: 607, total fat: 41, sodium: 1535 mg (shrimp is a naturally high source of sodium), total carb: 29 grams, dietary fiber: 3 grams, sugars: 7 grams, protein: 34 grams

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine the hot water, gelatin, soy sauce, and chicken stock and mix well.
step-2: transfer the soup to a shallow heatproof tray and chill in the refrigerator for 1 hour, or until set.
step-3: when set, fluff the soup and break up with a fork.
step-4: add the flour and baking powder to a medium bowl.
step-5: pour the hot water over the flour mixture, and mix the dough gently to combine.
step-6: using your hands, knead the dough until it becomes smooth and elastic.
step-7: cover the bowl with plastic wrap and rest for at least 30 minutes at room temperature.
step-8: for the filling, combine the ground pork, green onion, shiitake mushroom, ginger, garlic, sugar, sake, sesame oil, and soy sauce until well mixed.
step-9: roll the dough into a log.
step-10: divide it into 16 pieces.
step-11: take one piece and shape into a ball, then roll into flat round using a rolling pin.
step-12: put a spoonful of filling and soup gelatin into the center of the dough.
step-13: pinch the top a couple times to close the dumpling.
step-14: repeat with the remaining dough and fillings.
step-15: heat the oil in a medium pan over medium heat.
step-16: set the dumplings in a pan, seam side down, pour in the water, and cover.
step-17: steam the dumplings for 12 minutes.
step-18: add the sesame oil in the pan, increase the heat to high, and cook until the bottoms of the dumplings are crisp.
step-19: serve with sesame seeds and sliced green onion.
