step-1: blend all ingredients in a blender until completely combined.
step-2: divide among all the cups of a greased muffin tin, cups will be about ⅓ full.
step-3: bake at 400°f/200°c for 13-15 minutes.
step-4: pancakes will puff up super big, then deflate when you remove them from the oven.
step-5: fill with whatever you want—fresh fruit and syrup, bacon and eggs, sausage, or jam and whipped cream.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (190˚c).
step-2: add the butter and sugar to a bowl and stir to combine.
step-3: add in the eggs and vanilla extract and whisk to combine until smooth.
step-4: stir in the melted chocolate, followed by the cocoa powder and pancake mix, stirring until well combined.
step-5: gently fold in the chopped dark chocolate to the batter.
step-6: pour batter into a parchment paper-lined 8x8-inch (20x20 cm) pan, and bake for 20-25 minutes.
step-7: cool for 5 minutes.
step-8: top with powdered sugar, cut, and serve.

step-1: sieve the flour, cocoa powder, icing sugar and salt into a large bowl
step-2: make a well in the centre and whisk in the eggs
step-3: combine the milk and water and slowly add it to the mixture while continuing to whisk.
step-4: melt a small knob of butter in a large frying pan on a medium heat.
step-5: spoon a ladle full of the mixture onto the pan and swirl it around to get a nice thin layer of batter.
step-6: cook for approx.
step-7: 2.5 minutes and flip the pancake once.
step-8: note: you can go for it the cool way, or just use a spatula, we’re not judging you.
step-9: cook further for 60 more seconds and remove from the heat.
step-10: pour the frozen raspberries into a pot and cook, along with 3 tbsp of water on the lowest setting with the lid on for 5-6 minutes.
step-11: (you can also use fresh raspberries with 5-6 tbsp of water.)
step-12: spoon a dollop of ice cream into the center of the pancake, and pour over a few spoons of the raspberries.
step-13: wrap the pancake up around the ice cream and use a strawberry lace to tie it all together.

step-1: in a wok or heavy-bottomed skillet, heat the oil over high heat until shimmering.
step-2: add the chopped pork skin and cook until crisp, about 2-3 minutes.
step-3: remove from the pan.
step-4: add the garlic to the pan and cook until slightly browned, but not burnt, about 2 minutes.
step-5: add the onion and sauté for 2 minutes, until translucent.
step-6: add the celery and carrot, and sauté for 2 minutes more, until tender.
step-7: add the lechon, longanisa, and soy sauce, and sauté for 2-3 minutes, until liquid is fully absorbed.
step-8: add the noodles and lechon drippings, and cook until the liquid has been absorbed, 2-3 minutes.
step-9: season with the salt, pepper, and lemon juice.
step-10: remove the pan from the heat.
step-11: serve the pancit lechon in bowls, garnished with the crumbled pork skin, chicharrón, and chives.

step-1: to make crémet d’anjou, in a microwave-proof ramekin, combine water and gelatin, and mix well.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: in a medium bowl, combine cream cheese and sugar with a hand mixer.
step-4: microwave the gelatin mixture for 30 seconds, mix every 15 seconds.
step-5: pour the gelatin mixture into the cream cheese mixture.
step-6: add greek yogurt, lemon juice into cream cheese mixture and whisk until smooth.
step-7: in another bowl, whip heavy cream with a hand mixer until stiff peaks form.
step-8: then mix the whipped cream and cream cheese mixture together.
step-9: lay a layer of kitchen paper into a ramekin.
step-10: scoop the mixture into the kitchen paper then twist the top of the paper and tie it with a rubber ring to drain the mixture.
step-11: refrigerate for at least 3 hours.
step-12: to make the panda’s face parts, combine chocolate and cereal until they are coated evenly.
step-13: line the cereal out onto parchment paper and set aside until set.
step-14: to make the berry sauce, in a saucepan over a medium heat, combine mixed berries, sugar, and lemon juice.
step-15: when the sauce comes to a boil, remove from the heat.
step-16: put a tablespoon of the sauce on a plate.
step-17: remove kitchen paper from harden cheese and place next to sauce.
step-18: make up the panda’s face with chocolate coated cereal and leftover chocolate.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, evenly season chicken thighs with salt, pepper, paprika, and parsley.
step-3: on high, heat olive oil in a oven-proof pot and place chicken thighs, skin-side down, in the hot oil.
step-4: cook 5-6 minutes or the thighs develop brown crispy skin and flip over.
step-5: cook an additional 5-6 minutes to brown the other side and remove from the pot.
step-6: add the garlic and onions to the pot, and cook until the onions are transparent.
step-7: pour in the rice and chicken broth to the pot and season with salt and pepper.
step-8: stir well, bringing to a boil.
step-9: add the chicken thighs back into the pot, skin-side up, on top of the rice, bring back to a boil and cover with a lid.
step-10: bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the rice is fully cooked.
step-11: note: for a crispy skin, remove chicken thighs and broil.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200ºc).
step-2: slice the top and bottom off of the carrots (hold knife diagonally while slicing to make fancy carrot slices).
step-3: on a prepared baking sheet, combine carrots and remaining ingredients.
step-4: mix evenly.
step-5: bake for 20-25 minutes.
step-6: allow to cool for 5 minutes.

step-1: bring a large pot of water to a boil.
step-2: generously salt the water.
step-3: cook pasta for 8-9 minutes, or until al dente, and drain.
step-4: in a skillet over medium heat, add olive oil.
step-5: add the onion and cook until lightly browned and softened, about 3-4 minutes.
step-6: add garlic, rosemary, thyme, smoked paprika, salt and pepper.
step-7: stir and cook an additional 2 minutes.
step-8: add the shrimp and let them cook for 3 minutes.
step-9: flip and cook for another 3 minutes.
step-10: add the white wine and lemon juice.
step-11: cook until the wine has reduced.
step-12: add the cooked pasta to the skillet and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: season the chicken breasts with paprika, salt, and pepper.
step-3: place in a shallow dish and add 2 tablespoons of the oil, 1 teaspoon of the mustard, the garlic, and half the lemon zest.
step-4: toss until the chicken breasts are fully coated, then cover the dish and marinate at least 30 minutes, up to overnight.
step-5: on a baking sheet, toss the potato halves with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil.
step-6: season with salt and pepper and roast until tender and golden, 25 to 30 minutes.
step-7: heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large skillet over medium-high.
step-8: remove the chicken breasts from the marinade, and working in two batches, cook until golden brown on one side, 6 to 8 minutes.
step-9: flip each breast and continue to cook until the chicken is cooked through, 2 to 4 minutes longer.
step-10: transfer to a serving platter and repeat with the remaining oil and breasts.
step-11: in a small bowl, stir together the yogurt with the remaining 1 teaspoon mustard, lemon zest, salt, pepper and the parsley.
step-12: serve the chicken with the yogurt and potato wedges.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: fold the parchment paper in half, then open up.
step-3: on one half of the parchment, arrange the sliced potatoes.
step-4: in a small bowl, combine the butter, garlic, and parsley.
step-5: drizzle half of the garlic butter mixture over the potatoes.
step-6: season with salt and pepper.
step-7: lay the salmon over the potatoes, and drizzle over the remaining garlic butter.
step-8: season with salt and pepper.
step-9: fold the parchment paper over the salmon, and cinch the paper together by folding it over itself along the edges.
step-10: bake for 30 minutes or until internal temperature of salmon reaches 145˚f (63˚c).

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: fold the parchment paper in half, then open up.
step-3: on one half, lay down the asparagus.
step-4: drizzle on oil and sprinkle on salt & pepper.
step-5: lay the salmon on the asparagus, and add more oil, salt, and pepper.
step-6: place the onion, lemon, and dill on the salmon.
step-7: fold the parchment paper over the salmon, and cinch the paper together by folding it over itself along the edges.
step-8: bake for 20 minutes or until internal temperature of salmon reaches 145˚f (63˚c).

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: fold the parchment paper in half, then open up.
step-3: on one half, lay down the broccoli and carrots.
step-4: drizzle on oil and sprinkle on salt & pepper.
step-5: lay the salmon on the veggies, and pour on teriyaki sauce.
step-6: fold the parchment paper over the salmon, and cinch the paper together by folding it over itself along the edges.
step-7: bake for 20 minutes or until internal temperature of salmon reaches 145˚f (63˚c).

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: fold the parchment paper in half, then open up.
step-3: on one half, lay down the green beans.
step-4: drizzle on oil and sprinkle on salt & pepper.
step-5: lay the salmon on the green beans, and spread on the pesto.
step-6: top with tomatoes.
step-7: fold the parchment paper over the salmon, and cinch the paper together by folding it over itself along the edges.
step-8: bake for 20 minutes or until internal temperature of salmon reaches 145˚f (63˚c).

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: fold the parchment paper in half, then open up.
step-3: lay down the salmon.
step-4: drizzle oil and sprinkle salt and pepper.
step-5: lay lemon slices and thyme on top of the salmon.
step-6: fold the parchment paper over the salmon, and cinch the paper together by folding it over itself along the edges.
step-7: bake for 13-15 minutes or until internal temperature of salmon reaches 145˚f (65˚c).

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: place the parmesan cheese by the tablespoonful in small piles on the baking sheet.
step-4: flatten the piles out evenly and sprinkle dried basil over the cheese.
step-5: bake for 5-7 minutes, or until golden brown and the edges start to crisp up.
step-6:
0.33g total carbs
0.3g dietary fiber
0.30g net carbs per serving (12 crisps)

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, mix the parmesan crust ingredients.
step-3: in a separate bowl, whisk egg.
step-4: dredge the salmon in the egg, then parmesan.
step-5: lay the salmon on a baking sheet.
step-6: lay asparagus beside the salmon.
step-7: drizzle with olive oil, then season with salt and pepper.
step-8: bake for 10-12 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 180°c (350°f).
step-2: peel and quarter the potatoes.
step-3: place in a bowl, add 2 tablespoons of the goose fat and mix so that the potatoes are evenly covered.
step-4: mix in the parmesan, garlic, rosemary, salt, and pepper and ensure all potatoes are evenly covered.
step-5: add 1 tablespoon of goose fat to a baking tray and cook for 10 minutes in the oven, making sure the oil is hot.
step-6: add the potatoes.
step-7: cook for 1 hour, flipping every 15 minutes to ensure they are evenly browned.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: break the head of cauliflower into bite-sized florets.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine panko, parmesan, salt and herbs.
step-4: in a small bowl, whisk the eggs.
step-5: coat each floret in egg, then the parmesan-herb mixture and place on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-6: bake for 30 minutes or until crispy and golden.
step-7: serve with marinara or your favorite dipping sauce.

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚f).
step-2: in a bowl or ziploc bag, add the cauliflower florets and olive oil and stir until fully combined.
step-3: add the garlic powder, salt, breadcrumbs, and parmesan.
step-4: stir until fully coated.
step-5: spread the cauliflower on a greased, foil-lined baking sheet.
step-6: bake for 20 minutes.
step-7: stir the cauliflower and bake for an additional 10.

step-1: pour a cup of sugar (200g) and ⅓ cups (80ml) of passion fruit juice into a saucepan over a medium heat.
step-2: let the sugar melt and form a golden color.
step-3: don't over stir.
step-4: take off the heat.
step-5: spoon the caramel into each ramekin, and swirl it around so the bottom is covered.
step-6: set aside to cool.
step-7: in another saucepan, heat heavy cream, whole milk, vanilla extract, and two tablespoons of passion fruit juice.
step-8: stir until well mixed and hot.
step-9: in a large bowl, mix egg yolks, eggs, and gradually pour in the hot passion fruit cream mixture until fully incorporated.
step-10: pour the mixture through a sieve to make the mixture smooth.
step-11: place the ramekins into a large roasting pan.
step-12: pour hot water into the pan to come roughly halfway up the sides of the ramekins.
step-13: pour the mixture into the ramekins and bake at 350˚f (180˚c) for 45 minutes.
step-14: let the flan cool outside the oven, and then refrigerate it for at least two hours.
step-15: when you're ready to serve the flan, run a knife around the edges to loosen, place a dish over the top of the ramekin and quickly invert it.

step-1: trim the ends of the eggplant, then slice into ½-inch (1 ¼ cm) thick rounds.
step-2: lay the eggplant rounds on a paper towel and season generously on both sides with salt.
step-3: let rest for 10 minutes to draw out excess moisture.
step-4: after 10 minutes, pat the eggplant rounds with a paper towel to remove the moisture.
step-5: heat a griddle pan over medium-high heat and grease with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil, or your oil of choice.
step-6: grill the eggplant for about 2 minutes on each side, or until grill marks are formed.
step-7: set aside to cool, then cut into bite-size pieces.
step-8: heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
step-9: when the oil is hot, add the smashed garlic and cook until fragrant and lightly browned but not burnt, flipping as needed.
step-10: remove the garlic from the oil and set aside to cool, then mince.
step-11: to the garlic oil, add the chopped tomatoes.
step-12: cook for 5-10 minutes, or until caramelized.
step-13: add the reserved tomato juice and simmer until reduced to a sauce-like consistency, 5-8 minutes.
step-14: add ½ teaspoon salt, the red pepper flakes, and the minced fried garlic.
step-15: stir well, reduce the heat to low, and simmer while you make the pasta.
step-16: in a large pot of boiling water, cook the pasta according to the package instructions.
step-17: drain and return to the pot.
step-18: pour the tomato sauce over the hot pasta.
step-19: add the eggplant, ricotta salata, and fresh basil.
step-20: toss until well combined.
step-21: serve immediately.

step-1: mix all ingredients in a bowl.
step-2: pack with strawberries and blueberries.

step-1: in a large bowl, sift together the flour, salt, baking powder, and sugar and whisk to combine.
step-2: add the corn oil and whisk until well combined.
step-3: in a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, lightly beat together the eggs.
step-4: add the milk.
step-5: gradually add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients.
step-6: mix until the dough begins to come together in a ball.
step-7: transfer the dough to a lightly floured surface and knead for 10 minutes, until smooth.
step-8: place the dough in a floured bowl.
step-9: cover with a kitchen towel or plastic wrap and let it rest for 45 minutes, or until dough has nearly doubled in size.
step-10: roll the dough into about 25 smaller balls, or fewer if you prefer larger pasteles.
step-11: transfer to a baking sheet and cover with a kitchen towel so the dough balls don’t dry out as you roll them out.
step-12: working 1 at a time, roll each dough ball out into ⅛-inch (3 mm) thick ovals.
step-13: use an inverted bowl to cut out circles about 4-5 inches (10-13 cm) in diameter.
step-14: discard the dough scraps.
step-15: add about a tablespoon of oaxaca cheese to the center of each circle.
step-16: lightly wet the edge of the dough with water, then fold in half and seal using the repulgue technique or an empanada mold cutter.
step-17: fill a large pot with canola oil and heat to 360°f (182°c).
step-18: add several pasteles at a time to the hot oil and fry for about 5 minutes, or until crisp and golden brown.
step-19: drain on paper towels.
step-20: dust the hot pasteles with powdered sugar.
step-21: serve with api, if desired.

step-1: heat ¼ cup (60 ml) of olive oil in a medium pot over medium-high heat.
step-2: add the pork, olives, sofrito, 1 tablespoon of annatto seasoning, salt, the beef broth cube, and water.
step-3: bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer for 1 hour, or until the pork is tender.
step-4: remove from the heat and let cool.
step-5: grate the yuca on the small holes of a box grater.
step-6: add to a large bowl filled with water as you are grating so the yuca doesn’t turn brown.
step-7: drain and rinse the yuca, then wrap in a towel and squeeze to extract excess liquid until fully dry.
step-8: add the dry grated yuca to a large bowl with the remaining cup of olive oil, the beef broth, salt to taste, and the remaining 3-4 tablespoons of annatto seasoning.
step-9: mix well with your hands to combine.
step-10: cut the banana leaves into 24 10 x 12-inch (25x30 cm) rectangles.
step-11: cut parchment paper into rectangles of the same size.
step-12: turn a burner on the stove to high heat.
step-13: one at a time, pass the banana leaves evenly over the flame for 1 minute or until the banana leaves turn brighter green and become pliable.
step-14: to assemble the pasteles, stack a banana leaf over a piece of parchment on a clean work surface.
step-15: spread a bit of the pork cooking liquid over the leaf so that the pastel won’t stick.
step-16: add about ½ cup (105 g) of the yuca mixture and spread into a square shape.
step-17: top with about a tablespoon of meat.
step-18: to seal, fold the banana leaf and parchment paper in half from bottom to top, then fold the top back over the center and tuck in the sides.
step-19: tie with butcher’s twine to secure.
step-20: repeat with the remaining ingredients.
step-21: bring a large pot of water to boil and season with 2 teaspoons of salt.
step-22: add the pasteles, cover, and cook for 30-40 minutes, or until the yuca mixture is firm.
step-23: remove the pasteles from the water.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: mix the brown sugar and mustard in a small bowl.
step-3: score the pre-cooked ham and brush the mustard mixture over the ham.
step-4: roast the ham for 20 minutes.
step-5: wrap the ham in crescent roll dough.
step-6: place the wrapped ham on parchment-lined baking sheet and brush with egg wash. bake for another 20 minutes.
step-7: while the ham is baking, make the apple cider sauce.
step-8: in a medium pot, bring the apple cider, cider vinegar, honey, mustard, and chili powder to a boil over medium-high heat.
step-9: reduce the heat to medium-low and let the sauce thicken.
step-10: slice the ham and serve with the apple cider sauce.

step-1: cut sweet potato into thin slices, about ¼ inch (6 mm) thick.
step-2: place in toaster and set it to the maximum cook time.
step-3: when it pops, flip the sweet potato slices over and toast 1 more time.
step-4: depending on the strength of your toaster and your preferences, you may need to toast it 1 more time after that.
step-5: remove from toaster and let cool enough to handle.
step-6: spread peanut butter evenly across sweet potato toast and top with sliced banana.
step-7: sprinkle with cinnamon.

step-1: in a large bowl, add the melted butter, sugar, and eggs.
step-2: whisk to combine, then add the milk and whisk to incorporate.
step-3: sift in the flour and salt and whisk until smooth.
step-4: heat a small nonstick skillet over medium heat.
step-5: scoop ¼ cup (60 g) of the batter into the pan.
step-6: swirl the pan around until the batter evenly coats the bottom.
step-7: cook until the surface begins to bubble slightly and the edges brown, about 3 minutes.
step-8: flip the crepe and cook on the other side for another 1-2 minutes.
step-9: remove from the skillet and set aside to cool.
step-10: repeat with the remaining batter.
step-11: place a crepe on a plate and spread some peanut butter in the center.
step-12: fold in the edges to make a small square pouch.
step-13: top with another crepe, fill with raspberry jam, and fold to make a pouch.
step-14: top with one more crepe, fill with peanut butter, and fold.
step-15: cut another crepe into thin strips, separate the strips, then place a dollop of jam onto the center of each strip and fold each end of the strip to meet the jam in the center.
step-16: place the folded strips on top of each other to create a bow.
step-17: top with a raspberry and place on top of the peanut butter and jam pouches.
step-18: repeat with the rest of the crepes.

step-1: in a mason jar or sealable container, add the oats, milk, yogurt, jam, nut butter, vanilla extract, chia seeds, and strawberries, and stir together.
step-2: seal and place in the refrigerator overnight for up to five days.
step-3: top with additional strawberries, if desired.

step-1: spread nut or sunflower butter and jelly on a tortilla.
step-2: top with the second tortilla, and cut into triangles.
step-3: serve with a hard-boiled egg, blueberries, and strawberries.

step-1: add the flour, sugar, baking powder, milk, softened butter and beaten eggs to a large mixing bowl, and mix until a smooth batter is formed.
step-2: grease two cake tins and cover in flour.
step-3: divide the cake mixture between the two cake tins
step-4: bake the two cakes for 20 minutes at 190°c (375°f) until golden brown and springy to touch.
step-5: to make the peanut butter icing, add the softened butter, icing sugar and peanut butter into a mixing bowl, and beat until smooth.
step-6: remove the first sponge from the cake tin and spread strawberry jam onto the underside.
step-7: remove the second sponge from the cake tin and spread the peanut butter icing onto the top.
step-8: place the jam covered sponge on top of the peanut butter covered sponge.
step-9: sprinkle cake with icing sugar.

step-1: boil or steam potatoes.
step-2: steam zucchini and peas.
step-3: allow to cool.
step-4: add potatoes, zucchini, and peas to a blender or food processor.
step-5: blend very well.
step-6: add water, breast milk or formula to create a more liquid consistency if needed.
step-7: refrigerate up to 4 days or freeze up to 1 month.
step-8: note: check with your pediatrician before introducing new foods to children under 12 months.

step-1: add the peaches and honey to a food processor and combine until evenly mixed.
step-2: transfer to a loaf pan and transfer to freezer until completely frozen.

step-1: in the bowl of a food processor, add the flour, sugar, and salt, and pulse to combine.
step-2: add the cubed butter and pulse until the butter is incorporated and the size of peas.
step-3: add the buttermilk and pulse until the dough just comes together.
step-4: gather the dough into a ball and wrap in plastic wrap.
step-5: refrigerate for one hour.
step-6: in a medium bowl, combine the peaches, blackberries, brown sugar, bourbon (or vanilla extract), corn starch, lemon zest, cinnamon, and pinch of salt.
step-7: set aside.
step-8: remove the pie dough from the refrigerator.
step-9: divide into two equal halves and roll each half out to ⅛-inch (3 cm) thick.
step-10: transfer one round of pie dough to a pie plate and trim the edges making sure none hangs over the edge.
step-11: chill in the refrigerator until ready to use.
step-12: with the second pie crust, cut out 20 ½-inch (1 cm) long strips.
step-13: fill the pie plate with the peach and blueberry mixture, then make a herringbone or lattice crust with the remaining crust strips.
step-14: in a bowl, whisk the egg and water until well combined.
step-15: brush the top of the crust with the egg wash, and sprinkle with turbinado sugar.
step-16: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-17: chill the pie in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-18: bake the pie for 50 to 55 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown.
step-19: let pie sit at room temperature for at least 3 hours before serving.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in an 8-inch (20cm) square parchment paper-lined baking dish, arrange the biscuits side by side to cover the bottom of the dish, forming a sheet.
step-3: bake for 20 minutes or until biscuits are golden brown.
step-4: slice the peaches, discarding the pits.
step-5: destem and pit the cherries.
step-6: in a large skillet, combine peaches, cherries, blueberries, ½ cup (125 grams) of the sugar, water, and lemon juice.
step-7: heat to a simmer.
step-8: cook for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
step-9: remove from heat.
step-10: in a large bowl, beat the heavy cream with a whisk or electric mixer until frothy.
step-11: add remaining ¼ cup (62 grams) of sugar.
step-12: continue to beat until the whipped cream forms soft peaks.
step-13: remove the sheet of biscuits from the dish.
step-14: slice in half lengthwise, like a bagel.
step-15: spoon the fruit mixture onto the bottom half of the biscuits, reserving some of the liquid.
step-16: replace the top half of the biscuits.
step-17: carefully separate into individual portions (the syrup will still be quite warm!)
step-18: spoon whipped cream over the top and drizzle with reserved fruit syrup.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (175°c).
step-2: separate cinnamon rolls and cut into 1 inch (2 ½cm) pieces.
step-3: place the cinnamon roll pieces into a medium bowl and set aside.
step-4: cut each peach into 8-12 wedges.
step-5: place in a medium bowl and add cornstarch and cinnamon and mix to coat each peach.
step-6: in a baking dish place half of the cinnamon rolls down on the bottom.
step-7: then add half of the peaches on top.
step-8: repeat and add the rest of the ingredients.
step-9: drizzle the icing packet from the cinnamon roll tube over the cobbler.
step-10: bake for 30 minutes.
step-11: serve warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and a mint leaf (optional).

step-1: add the butter and peaches to a pan over medium-low heat and cook until the butter has melted and peaches are glossy.
step-2: in a small bowl mix together the brown sugar, cinnamon, 1 tablespoon flour, and nutmeg.
step-3: sprinkle the sugar mixture over the peaches.
step-4: mix to combine and stir for 5-10 minutes until the mixture starts to thicken.
step-5: remove from heat and set aside to cool.
step-6: on a floured surface, roll out the pizza dough to ¼-inch (0.63-cm) thick.
step-7: cut the dough into 20 rectangles.
step-8: spoon 1 tablespoon of the peach filling onto a cut piece of dough.
step-9: fold the dough over lengthwise and crimp the edges so the filling is well sealed.
step-10: repeat with remaining dough and filling.
step-11: heat oil in a large pot to 350°f (180°c).
step-12: working in batches, fry beignets for 3-4 minutes each, flipping halfway, until puffy and golden brown.
step-13: transfer beignets to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.
step-14: dust with powdered sugar.

step-1: alternate avocado and peach slices on the toast.
step-2: top with feta cheese.

step-1: in a large pitcher, pour hot water over tea bags letting steep 5 minutes.
step-2: bring syrup ingredients to boil, then reduce heat to medium.
step-3: strain syrup through a fine strainer to remove fruit pieces.
step-4: add syrup and whiskey to tea, then chill until ready to serve.
step-5: serve over ice, with sliced peaches, sliced lemons and a mint sprig.

step-1: put all ingredients into a blender and mix until smooth.
preheat oven to 425°f/220°c.
step-2: roll out aluminum foil into a cone.
step-3: make 4 cones for 1 pie sheet.
step-4: cut pie sheet into quarters.
step-5: place cone at one end of the sheet and roll dough onto the cone.
step-6: using a fork crimp the ends of the pie dough.
step-7: bake 5-10 minutes until the dough is set.
step-8: let it cool before pulling out the aluminum foil.
step-9: in a medium bowl, combine all ingredients and mix.
step-10: place pie cone in a mug for stability and spoon in the fruit mixture.
step-11: turn oven down to 400°f/200°c and bake for 15 minutes or until the fruit is soft.
step-12: top it with ice cream and your favorite topping.

step-1: in a mason jar or sealable container, add the oats, milk, yogurt, nut butter, honey, chia seeds, cinnamon, and peaches.
step-2: stir together.
step-3: seal and place in the refrigerator overnight for up to five days.
step-4: top with additional peach slices, if desired.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, combine flour, salt, and sugar.
step-3: add the coconut oil to the dry ingredients and mix together using a fork or your fingers.
step-4: add the cold water to the dough, a little at a time, and continue to mix until dough forms a ball.
step-5: cut dough into two equal parts and flatten them into 1-inch (2 ½ cm) thick disks.
step-6: wrap the disks in plastic wrap and chill for one hour.
step-7: add the peach preserves and butter to a small microwave-safe bowl and heat in the microwave for about 20 seconds or until butter has melted.
step-8: stir to combine.
step-9: dice the peaches and put them in a medium bowl.
step-10: add the preserve mixture, lemon juice, and cinnamon to the peaches and mix until peaches are well-coated.
step-11: remove one of the dough disks from the refrigerator.
step-12: lightly flour your work surface, dough, and rolling pin.
step-13: roll out the dough to form a large rectangle about ⅛-inch (3 mm) thick.
step-14: cut the dough into an even number of small rectangles.
step-15: beat the egg in a small bowl.
step-16: brush the edges of half of the rectangles with the egg wash.
step-17: spoon one tablespoon of the peach mixture into the center of each brushed rectangle.
step-18: place another rectangle of the same size over the one with the filling.
step-19: lightly press down.
step-20: use a fork to seal the edges around each rectangle, then lightly poke the tops of each rectangle a few times.
step-21: brush the edges and tops of the dough with the egg wash.
step-22: place the pockets on parchment-lined baking sheets and place in the freezer as you repeat the same process with the other dough disk.
step-23: bake for 30-35 minutes or until dough is golden brown.
step-24: for the glaze, mix together powdered sugar and milk until smooth.
step-25: drizzle peach pockets with glaze and serve.

step-1: in a pitcher add diced peaches, mint, sugar, and lime juice.
step-2: mudlle for 1 minute, or until sugar has dissolved.
step-3: to the pitcher add rum and rose.
step-4: stir to combine.
step-5: add ice to each serving glass, then top with the rosé mojito (rosito).
step-6: add a peach slice to the rim of each glass.

step-1: preheat your oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-2: in a cast-iron skillet over medium-low heat, add the peaches, sugar, cornstarch, lemon juice, and salt.
step-3: mix to combine and stir for 5-10 minutes until the mixture starts to thicken.
step-4: let simmer for 5 minutes on low heat.
step-5: sprinkle the box cake mix over the apple filling.
step-6: add the nuts and evenly distribute the sliced butter over the top to ensure even baking.
step-7: bake for 45 minutes to an hour, until the top is golden brown.
step-8: serve warm with ice cream.

step-1: blend all ingredients in a food processor or high-speed blender until thoroughly combined.
step-2: pour into a rectangular loaf pan and smooth into an even layer.
step-3: freeze for 2 hours, or until frozen but still a little soft for scooping.
step-4: (if freezing overnight, cover with a lid or plastic wrap, but let it sit out at room temperature for about 5-10 minutes before scooping.)
step-5: scoop into a bowl.

step-1: grease and line the sides of a 9-inch (20 cm) round springform pan with parchment paper.
step-2: add the shortbread cookies to a food processor.
step-3: pulse until finely crushed.
step-4: add the melted butter and pulse until combined.
step-5: transfer the cookie crumb mixture to the springform pan.
step-6: use a spatula or measuring cup to press the cookie crumbs down to form an even base.
step-7: freeze for 10 minutes.
step-8: add 2-3 quartered peaches (depending on size) to a food processor.
step-9: blend until smooth.
step-10: strain through a fine-mesh sieve.
step-11: in a small bowl, combine ½ cup (120 ml) cold water and 2 packets of gelatin.
step-12: let the gelatin bloom for 5 minutes, until the water is mostly absorbed.
step-13: microwave for 20–30 seconds, or until the gelatin is melted.
step-14: in a large bowl, beat the cream cheese, 1¼ cups (250 g) sugar, the vanilla, and lemon juice together with an electric hand mixer until combined.
step-15: add the heavy cream and melted gelatin and beat for another 2-3 minutes, until well combined and fluffy.
step-16: spread half the cheesecake mixture over the chilled cookie crust.
step-17: freeze for 10 minutes.
step-18: mix 1 cup (255 g) of the strained peach puree and orange food coloring, if desired, into the remaining cheesecake mixture.
step-19: carefully pour the mixture over the first layer of cheesecake.
step-20: spread evenly and freeze for another 10 minutes.
step-21: in a small bowl, combine the remaining ½ cup (120 ml) cold water with the remaining 2 packages of gelatin.
step-22: let the gelatin bloom for 5 minutes, until the water is mostly absorbed.
step-23: microwave for 20–30 seconds, or until the gelatin is melted.
step-24: combine the gelatin mixture, hot water, and the remaining ⅔ cup (135 g) sugar and whisk to dissolve the sugar.
step-25: slowly pour into the prosecco and stir to combine.
step-26: let sit for 5 minutes to cool slightly.
step-27: skim off any foam that rises to the top.
step-28: set aside.
step-29: starting from the outside and working inward, arrange the sliced peaches over the peach cheesecake layer in a circular pattern with the curved sides facing out.
step-30: begin with the larger slices, overlapping slightly, and continue until the entire surface is filled.
step-31: spoon half of the prosecco gelatin over the peaches.
step-32: carefully transfer to the refrigerator and let set for 30 minutes.
step-33: pour the remaining prosecco gelatin over the peaches up to the rim of the pan.
step-34: chill in the refrigerator for at least 6 hours, or overnight.
step-35: release the springform and remove the parchment, then slice and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: grease a 9x13-inch (23x33cm) baking dish with nonstick spray.
step-3: pour the white cake batter into the baking dish.
step-4: bake for 25 minutes, or until the center is cooked through.
step-5: in a medium bowl, whisk together the peaches, condensed milk, and heavy cream.
step-6: use the whisk to break up the peaches.
step-7: remove cake from oven and let cool for 30 minutes or until room temperature.
step-8: once the cake is cool, use the rounded end of a wooden spoon to poke 6 rows of 5 holes in the cake.
step-9: tip: clean off the end of the wooden spoon after every other hole to prevent making cracks in the cake.
step-10: pour the peach mixture over the cake and use a spatula to spread it, filling all of the holes.
step-11: some of the mixture will stay on top of the cake.
step-12: chill in the fridge for 1 hour.
step-13: remove the cake from the fridge and use a spatula to cover the cake in whipped cream.
step-14: then, arrange the peach slices on top in 5 rows of 11 slices.
step-15: pairs well with chardonnay.

step-1: spread peanut butter on the toast and top with sliced banana.
step-2: sprinkle with cinnamon.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a bowl, use a fork to mash the bananas.
step-3: add the sugar, ½ cup (115 g) of butter, and vanilla, and whisk until combined.
step-4: add the flour, salt, and cocoa powder, and whisk until fully incorporated.
step-5: use the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter to grease a 9x9-inch (23x23 cm) baking tray.
step-6: use the remaining 1 tablespoon of cocoa powder to dust every side of the baking tray.
step-7: pour batter into prepared baking dish.
step-8: use a spoon to add dollops of peanut butter on top of the batter.
step-9: use a butter knife to swirl the peanut butter into the brownie batter.
step-10: bake for 25-30 minutes, until center no longer jiggles when pan is shaken.
step-11: allow brownies to cool completely before cutting.

step-1: pour the coffee into an ice cube tray.
step-2: freeze for at least 4 hours, or overnight.
step-3: add the coffee ice cubes, peanut butter, milk, chocolate syrup, and banana to a blender.
step-4: blend until smooth.
step-5: pour into glasses and top with whipped cream and chocolate syrup.

step-1: in a medium bowl, mix the peanut butter and greek yogurt together until smooth.
step-2: add in the almond milk, vanilla, honey, and chia seeds and mix until well combined.
step-3: pour the mixture into an airtight container and refrigerate, covered for 4 hours.
step-4: spoon the pudding into desired serving dish and top with sliced banana, roasted peanuts, and crunchy granola clusters.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: on a cutting board, cut the baguette in half lengthwise, then slice into 1-inch (2 ½ cm) pieces.
step-3: in a bowl, whisk together the eggs, ½ cup heavy cream, the vanilla, and cinnamon.
step-4: add the bread to the egg mixture and stir until evenly coated.
step-5: heat a large cast-iron skillet over low heat.
step-6: add the butter, brown sugar, and remaining ½ cup of heavy cream.
step-7: whisk to combine and cook until bubbling, about 3 minutes.
step-8: whisk in the peanut butter until fully incorporated and bubbling, about 3 minutes.
step-9: add the sliced bananas and stir to coat.
step-10: pour the bread mixture over sauce into skillet and spread evenly
step-11: bake for 30 minutes, until golden and crispy.
step-12: let the skillet cool for about 5 minutes, then cover with large plate.
step-13: holding one hand over the plate, gently flip the skillet upside-down, allowing the french toast to release from the pan with the banana layer on top.
step-14: slice and serve.

step-1: slice up your bananas into 1-inch (2 cm) slices.
step-2: spread on parchment paper on a baking sheet and freeze slices for 2 hours.
step-3: blend frozen slices in a powerful blender until it reaches a smooth consistency.
step-4: mix in remaining ingredients.
step-5: transfer to a small bowl or container and freeze for one hour, or until ready to serve.
step-6: scoop out ice cream.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, mix together flour, oats, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.
step-3: in another bowl, mash bananas then add peanut butter, honey, greek yogurt, almond milk, egg, and vanilla extract.
step-4: add wet ingredients to dry ingredients and mix until well combined.
step-5: line the muffin tin with liners and evenly pour mixture into the cups.
step-6: bake for 15 minutes.
step-7: for the peanut butter drizzle, combine peanut butter, honey, and almond milk.
step-8: top muffins with peanut butter drizzle and crushed peanuts (optional).

step-1: using the back of a wooden spoon, poke at least 3 rows of 4 holes in the cooked cake, making 12 holes total.
step-2: in a large bowl, mix 2 mashed bananas, 1 cup of the melted peanut butter, and the sweetened condensed milk; if needed, add extra milk to loosen the mixture.
step-3: pour the mixture over the cake and let it settle into the holes for about 10 minutes.
step-4: some of the mixture will stay on top, which is okay.
step-5: spread the whipped topping evenly over the cake.
step-6: place sliced bananas on the topping, drizzle the remaining ½ cup of melted peanut butter on top, and sprinkle with the roasted peanuts.
step-7: chill the cake for at least 3 hours or up to overnight.

step-1: in a bowl, add the greek yogurt and honey and stir to combine.
step-2: transfer 3 tablespoons of the mixture into 6 lined muffin tins.
step-3: microwave the peanut butter for 15 seconds.
step-4: spoon 1 tablespoon of the softened peanut butter over each yogurt cup.
step-5: sprinkle blueberries over the yogurt cups.
step-6: freeze until solid, about 2 hours.

step-1: in a mixing bowl, combine chocolate with sweetened condensed milk and melt in the microwave in 15-second increments.
step-2: once chocolate is fully melted pour into a parchment paper-lined 8x8 inch (20x20 cm) baking tin.
step-3: chill for 10 minutes.
step-4: add peanut butter and spread evenly.
step-5: chill for 2 hours or until the fudge is firm.
step-6: cut into bite-sized piece.

step-1: pour the peanut butter and honey into a bowl.
step-2: microwave in 30-second intervals until melted.
step-3: mix in the corn flakes, puffed rice cereal, and raisins.
step-4: transfer mixture to a parchment-lined 8x8inch (20x20cm) baking pan.
step-5: top with mini chocolate chips (optional).
step-6: chill until firm.
step-7: cut bars into sizes of your choice, wrap in parchment paper, and store in a sealed ziplock in the fridge or freezer for up to 3 months.

step-1: in a medium bowl, mix chocolate and peanut butter.
step-2: melt in microwave for 60 seconds.
step-3: stir every 15 seconds until melted.
step-4: place cereal in large bowl.
step-5: add extract into melted chocolate then mix with cereal and stir until evenly coated.
step-6: in a large plastic bag, add powdered sugar and cereal mix.
step-7: close and shake until each cereal is coated with sugar.
step-8: add in desired candies.

step-1: in a microwave-safe bowl, microwave the candy corn for 90 seconds, stopping to stir every 30 seconds, until smooth.
step-2: immediately add the peanut butter and mix together.
step-3: using a teaspoon, form mixture into little balls and place them on wax paper.
step-4: freeze for 15 minutes.
step-5: melt the chocolate chips in a microwave-safe bowl for 90 seconds, stopping to stir every 30 seconds, until smooth.
step-6: roll the cooled balls in chocolate and return to wax paper.
step-7: decorate with additional chocolate, candy melts, or melted candy corn (optional) and place in the fridge to firm.

step-1: combine cake mix, peanut butter, peanut butter cups, oil, and eggs in a mixing bowl.
step-2: using an ice cream scoop or your hand, form golf ball-sized balls of cookie dough and transfer to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-3: bake at 350°f (180°c) for 10-12 minutes.

step-1: in a bowl, add the butter and brown sugar, and stir to combine.
step-2: add the egg and mix until fully incorporated.
step-3: stir in the peanut butter and vanilla.
step-4: add the flour, salt, and baking soda.
step-5: gently fold in the peanut butter cups.
step-6: chill dough for at least 1 hour.
step-7: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-8: once dough is chilled, scoop out a ball about 2 inches (5 cm) wide.
step-9: place on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, leaving about 2-inches (5 cm) in between each ball of dough.
step-10: bake for 8 to 10 minutes, until bottom edges of cookies are golden.
step-11: let cookies cool.
step-12: can be stored in an airtight container up to 5 days.

step-1: soak cashews in boiling water for two hours.
step-2: drain the cashews and blend in a food processor for 30 seconds.
step-3: pour in coconut oil and agave and blend for 1 minute.
step-4: scrape down sides and add in almond flour and peanut butter.
step-5: blend until smooth, approximately 2-5 minutes.
step-6: remove the mixture from the food processor and transfer to a food storage container.
step-7: store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

step-1: combine peanut butter, melted coconut oil, powdered sugar, honey, salt, and vanilla extract in a bowl until all ingredients are well-combined.
step-2: pour into a container lined with wax paper and smooth out the surface with a spoon
step-3: freeze for at least 1 hour and take the fudge out of the freezer just before serving.
step-4: note: leftovers should be stored in an airtight container in the freezer.

step-1: cut each biscuit into 4 equal sections and roll each into a small ball between your hands.
step-2: in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, heat oil to about 350˚f (180˚c).
step-3: fry doughnut holes in batches for 3-5 minutes, or until golden on all sides.
step-4: allow doughnut holes to cool and prepare jelly in piping bag with small circular tip.
step-5: inject each doughnut with roughly 1 teaspoon of jelly, or until filled.
step-6: in a small bowl, combine melted butter, peanut butter, and powdered sugar.
step-7: whisk together until smooth.
step-8: dip each hole into the glaze, or warm the glaze slightly in the microwave and pour over each hole.
step-9: allow glaze to set.

step-1: using the lid of a wide mouth mason jar, carve out rounds into both slices of bread, remove the crusts.
step-2: spread peanut butter evenly across one side of one of the rounds and spread jelly evenly across one side of the other round.
step-3: place peanut butter round and jelly round together to create the “body” of the spider.
step-4: place 4 pretzel sticks into the left side of the sandwich and 4 pretzel sticks into the right side, creating the “spider legs.”
step-5: place raisins on the sandwich to create the “eyes.”

step-1: combine all ingredients in a small bowl and mix until thoroughly combined.
step-2: chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-3: use a spoon or tablespoon to evenly divide the mixture into 6 balls.
step-4: use your hands to form the ball.
step-5: enjoy one now and save the rest for later by storing them in a sealed container in the refrigerator up to 1 week.

step-1: place apples into box.
step-2: place celery and pretzels into box.
step-3: scoop peanut butter into box.

step-1: in a medium sauce pot over medium heat, combine nut butter, pumpkin, coconut oil, maple syrup, vanilla extract, pumpkin pie spice, and salt.
step-2: stir until smooth.
step-3: pour onto a parchment paper-lined 8x8-inch (20x20cm) baking dish and smooth out evenly.
step-4: sprinkle with sea salt for garnish (optional), cover and freeze for at least 2 hours, then switch to refrigerator for storage.
step-5: cut into squares.
step-6: serve chilled.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: place the peanut butter cups in an even layer on the bottom of a large skillet or nonstick pan.
step-3: place the marshmallows in a single layer on top.
step-4: bake for 20 minutes until marshmallows are golden brown.
step-5: serve with graham crackers for dipping.

step-1: in a medium bowl, whisk together the peanut butter, honey, cinnamon, and vanilla.
step-2: cut off the stems from the the strawberries, then slice.
step-3: slice the banana.
step-4: on a cutting board, lay out the tortilla and spread ½ of the peanut butter mixture across the top ½ of the tortilla.
step-5: arrange strawberry and banana slices over the peanut butter, then fold the other side of the tortilla over the fruit.
step-6: repeat with the remaining ingredients
step-7: in a large pan over medium heat, melt ½ tablespoon butter.
step-8: place the quesadilla in the hot pan and cook until golden, about 2 minutes.
step-9: flip and continue cooking until golden on the other side, 1–2 minutes more.
step-10: remove from the heat and repeat with the other quesadilla.
step-11: cut each quesadilla into 4 pieces, then serve.

step-1: in a large mixing bowl, combine peanut butter, powdered sugar, vanilla, and rice cereal.
step-2: mix well and freeze.
step-3: roll out prepared brownie and cut into 32 squares (8 rows of 4).
step-4: using a melon baller or your hands, form peanut butter mixture into size of a truffle.
step-5: form brownie square around mixture and seal it around the peanut butter ball.
step-6: dip brownie in melted chocolate, covering the entire ball.
step-7: using a spoon, drizzle warm peanut butter over the brownies and chill.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: in another bowl, beat softened butter, sugar, and brown sugar until creamy.
step-5: add vanilla extract and egg, and beat until combined.
step-6: add the flour mixture and stir until all of the flour is incorporated.
step-7: pour in the chocolate chips, and stir.
step-8: pour ½ of the cookie dough into a greased oven-proof skillet and press it into the pan.
step-9: spread peanut butter over the dough and top with the other half of the cookie dough.
step-10: press the dough so it covers the peanut butter.
step-11: bake for 35-40 minutes or until the edges are golden brown (baking times & temperatures may vary).
step-12: cut into slices and serve warm with ice cream.

step-1: swirl peanut butter into brownie batter and bake according to package.
step-2: slice and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 325˚f (170˚c).
step-2: in a small mixing bowl, combine peanut butter, coconut oil, maple syrup, vanilla extract, and salt.
step-3: mix until combined.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: place chocolate and coconut oil in a medium-sized microwave safe bowl.
step-6: microwave on high for 15 second intervals stirring in between until chocolate is melted.
step-7: let cool.
step-8: add eggs, maple syrup, brown sugar, and vanilla extract.
step-9: mix until combined.
step-10: add flour, baking powder, and salt.
step-11: mix until combined.
step-12: pour brownie batter into a greased, parchment lined, 8 inch by 8 inch (20 cm by 20 cm) baking pan making sure that the parchment is overlapping the pan.
step-13: pour peanut butter mixture in several stripes across the top of the brownie batter.
step-14: with a knife, swirl the peanut butter mixture into the brownie batter.
step-15: bake for 25-30 minutes.
step-16: let cool before cutting.

step-1: in a medium bowl, whisk together peanut butter, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, sriracha, water, minced ginger, minced garlic, and brown sugar.
step-2: bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
step-3: cook pasta according to instructions on the box.
step-4: drain and run cooked pasta under cold water to cool.
step-5: combine pasta with sliced vegetables.
step-6: pour the dressing over the pasta and vegetables and mix well.
step-7: cover and chill for at least one hour before serving.
step-8: garnish with chopped cilantro and peanuts.

step-1: steep the chai tea bags in the warm milk for 3-5 minutes.
step-2: in a blender, combine the chai tea milk, pear, honey, vanilla, and cinnamon.
step-3: blend on high speed for 3 minutes, or until completely smooth.
step-4: transfer the chai pear mixture to a small saucepan and heat over medium-low heat until just warmed through.
step-5: do not boil.
step-6: pour into a mug and serve immediately.
step-7: nutrition - calories: 308, total fat: 5 grams, sodium: 132 mg, total carbs: 60 grams, dietary fiber: 7 grams, sugars: 35 grams, protein: 9 grams

step-1: cut sweet potato into thin slices, about ¼ inch (6 mm) thick.
step-2: place in toaster and set it to the maximum cook time.
step-3: when it pops, flip the sweet potato slices over and toast 1 more time.
step-4: depending on the strength of your toaster and your preferences, you may need to toast it 1 more time after that.
step-5: remove from toaster and let cool enough to handle.
step-6: spread ricotta evenly across sweet potato toast.
step-7: slice pear thinly and place on top of ricotta.
step-8: drizzle with honey.

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine the cranberries, almond butter, maple syrup, and vanilla, and stir until smooth.
step-2: add the oats, pecans, and salt, and mix until evenly distributed.
step-3: chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-4: use a tablespoon to scoop out the mixture, then roll into balls with your hands.
step-5: store in the refrigerator in an airtight container for up to 1 week.

step-1: in a medium bowl, soak raw pecans in 2 cups (475 ml) of water overnight
step-2: drain the bowl of water and place the almonds in a blender.
step-3: add 1 tablespoon vanilla, 1 tablespoon honey, salt, 1 tablespoon of unsweetened cacao powder, and 4 cups (945 ml) of water to the blender.
step-4: blend the mixture on high for 90 seconds.
step-5: use a cheesecloth to strain the liquid into a pouring container.
step-6: (optional) refrigerate 1-2 hours or serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 325°f (170°c).
step-2: in a bowl, combine the graham cracker crumbs and melted butter.
step-3: stir to combine.
step-4: pour the mixture into a 9-inch (23 cm) springform pan and press it evenly into the bottom and halfway up the sides.
step-5: transfer to the refrigerator to chill.
step-6: in a large bowl add the cream cheese, sugar, and milk.
step-7: with a hand mixer, beat until fluffy and fully incorporated.
step-8: add in the sour cream, flour, 2 teaspoons of the vanilla extract, and the two eggs and gently continue to mix until the cream cheese filling is smooth.
step-9: pour the mixture into the springform pan with the graham cracker crust and bake for 1 hour, or until the cheesecake no longer jiggles.
step-10: while the cheesecake is cooking, prepare the stove-top pecan pie filling.
step-11: in a bowl combine the brown sugar, cornstarch, and salt, stir together and pour into a medium saucepan on low heat.
step-12: pour in the egg yolks, maple syrup, and warm cream and whisk until smooth.
step-13: cook on low heat until the mixture thickens like a pudding, 5-10 minutes.
step-14: remove from the heat.
step-15: stir in the cold butter and the final teaspoon of vanilla extract and whisk until fully emulsified.
step-16: the pudding-like mixture should be around room temperature.
step-17: fold in the roasted, chopped pecans and then pour the mixture over the cooked cheesecake and spread it out as an even layer.
step-18: if you like, sprinkle with extra chopped pecans or garnish with whole pecans.
step-19: let the cheesecake chill in the refrigerator until completely set.
step-20: slice and serve cold or at room temperature.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: line a 8x4-inch (20x10 cm) loaf pan with parchment paper and generously grease the pan.
step-3: slice the vanilla pound cake as the same thickness as a ghost shaped cookie cutter.
step-4: cut out the cake with using a ghost-shaped cookie cutter.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: in a medium bowl, combine pound cake mix, cocoa powder, butter, melted chocolate, milk, and eggs.
step-7: mix until well combined.
step-8: in the lined and greased loaf pan, add ⅓ of the batter.
step-9: line the cut out ghost-shaped pound cake in the middle of the pan.
step-10: pour rest of the batter over the ghost-shaped cake.
step-11: smooth the top and bake for 35-40 minutes, or until inserted toothpick comes out clean.
step-12: cool completely on cooling rack

step-1: place duck breast in pan to marinate.
step-2: rub oil, salt, garlic, soy sauce, rice wine, and five-spice powder into the duck breasts.
step-3: let it marinate for 30 minutes.
step-4: add one tbsp.
step-5: of oil to a hot skillet over medium heat.
step-6: add the duck breasts skin side down, cook until the skin is browned and crispy (can take up to 8-10 minutes, depending on your heat).
step-7: flip the duck so skin side is up.
step-8: place the skillet under the broiler for five minutes to further crisp the skin.
step-9: be careful not to burn the skin.
step-10: remove from oven and let it rest for five minutes before slicing.
step-11: spread hoisin sauce over the flour tortilla, layer on the rice, duck slices, cucumbers, and scallions.
step-12: wrap it all up.

step-1: heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet.
step-2: add onion and 1 clove of garlic, and cook until onions are translucent.
step-3: add tomato sauce and mix to combine with onion and garlic.
step-4: add vodka, dried basil, red pepper flakes, and salt.
step-5: let this to simmer for 2 minutes to allow most of the alcohol to burn off.
step-6: add heavy cream and stir until fully combined.
step-7: the sauce will turn into a beautiful light orange creamy mixture.
step-8: add cooked pasta to vodka sauce and mix until noodles are fully coated in sauce.
step-9: cover with a lid and let simmer for 5 minutes or until the sauce has reduced by half.
step-10: garnish with basil.

step-1: heat oil in a large pot over high heat.
step-2: cook onion until translucent.
step-3: add beef, salt, and pepper, cooking until all the moisture has evaporated and the beef is browned.
step-4: add crushed tomatoes, vodka, and chili flakes, stirring and cooking until half of the liquid has evaporated and the sauce has reduced.
step-5: add cream, stirring until evenly incorporated.
step-6: stir in pasta until evenly coated.
step-7: serve with parsley and parmesan.

step-1: in a large pot over medium heat, add the olive oil and onion, and cook until the onion is slightly translucent.
step-2: add the garlic, salt, and vodka, and cook for about 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
step-3: add the tomato sauce and heavy cream, and bring to a boil.
step-4: add the cooked penne and stir until the sauce evenly coats the pasta.
step-5: serve warm with parmesan and parsley.

step-1: heat a large sauté pan over medium heat.
step-2: add the olive oil and onion, and cook until the onion is translucent, 8-10 minutes.
step-3: add the chile flakes and garlic, and cook for another 2 minutes, until fragrant.
step-4: stir in tomatoes and simmer uncovered for 20 minutes.
step-5: bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
step-6: cook the pasta according to package instructions.
step-7: save ½ cup (120 ml) of pasta water, then drain.
step-8: add the drained pasta to the sauce.
step-9: stir well, adding a little pasta water if needed to loosen the sauce.
step-10: season with salt to taste.

step-1: in a heavy pot, add the chicken stock, butter, and milk, and bring to a simmer over medium heat.
step-2: gradually add in the grits a little at a time, stirring until creamy.
step-3: remove from the heat.
step-4: add oil to a large pan over medium-high heat.
step-5: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the garlic and cook until aromatic, about 30 seconds.
step-6: add in the red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, green bell pepper, red onion, and scotch bonnet pepper, and cook until onions are translucent.
step-7: add in the okra and cook for 1 minute.
step-8: add in the diced tomatoes and juices, jerk spice, and chicken stock, and simmer on low heat for 10 minutes.
step-9: season the stew with salt and sugar.
step-10: place shrimp on top of the okra stew.
step-11: after two minutes, flip the shrimp and cook for 1-2 minutes, until cooked through.
step-12: sprinkle the stew with chopped parsley.
step-13: serve the shrimp stew over the grits.

step-1: place the mini candy canes in a zip top bag and use a rolling pin to crush them into small chunks.
step-2: transfer to a medium bowl.
step-3: in a separate medium bowl, stir the peppermint extract into the melted chocolate chips.
step-4: pour onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and spread evenly with a spatula.
step-5: freeze for 5 minutes.
step-6: take the pan out of the freezer and pour the melted white chocolate over the chocolate, spreading evenly with a spatula.
step-7: sprinkle the crushed mini candy canes over the white chocolate.
step-8: freeze for at least 1 hour.
step-9: remove the bark from the freezer and break into pieces.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180˚c).
step-2: line 2 large baking sheets with parchment paper or nonstick baking mats.
step-3: bring a small pot of water to a simmer.
step-4: add the chocolate chips, butter, and peppermint extract to a medium heatproof bowl and place over the simmering water.
step-5: melt, stirring often until smooth, about 10 minutes.
step-6: remove the bowl from the heat and set aside.
step-7: in a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, salt, dutch-process cocoa powder, and black cocoa powder.
step-8: whisk to combine.
step-9: add the eggs to the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment or a large bowl with an electric hand mixer and whip on high speed until foamy, about 1 minute.
step-10: continue mixing while slowly adding the granulated and brown sugar until the mixture is pale and falls into ribbons, about 9 minutes.
step-11: add the melted chocolate mixture to the whipped eggs and mix on low speed until just combined.
step-12: add the dry ingredients and mix again until smooth.
step-13: using an ice cream scoop, immediately scoop the cookies onto the prepared baking sheets and smooth the tops with your finger.
step-14: bake for 8 minutes, then remove the cookies from the oven and sprinkle the tops with crushed candy canes.
step-15: return the cookies to the oven and bake for another 4 minutes, until the tops are cracked and shiny.
step-16: remove from the oven and immediately smack the baking sheets against the countertop, then let the cookies cool completely on the pans.
step-17: note: if black cocoa powder is not available in your grocery store, cookies can be made using 3 tablespoons of dutch-process cocoa powder; simply swapping the black cocoa for the dutch-process.

step-1: combine the peppermint leaves, rosehips, and hibiscus flowers.
step-2: store in an airtight container for up to 1 month.
step-3: to brew, steep 1-2 teaspoons of the tea blend in 8 ounces (240 ml) of hot water for 5 minutes.
step-4: serve warm or over ice.

step-1: in a saucepan set over medium heat, warm the heavy cream, condensed milk, and peppermint extract and bring to a simmer.
step-2: place chocolate chips in a heat-proof bowl, and pour on top the top cream mixture.
step-3: allow to stand for 1 minute before stirring to combine.
step-4: using a cookie scoop, spoon the mixture into a silicone mini muffin pan.
step-5: garnish each with crushed peppermint candies.
step-6: allow to sit at room temperature for 20 minutes, then insert a popsicle stick into the middle of each.
step-7: freeze for 2 hours, or refrigerate for 4 hours.
step-8: to serve, dissolve a stick into a mug of hot milk.

step-1: empty contents of jar, mix to make sure ingredients are well combined.
step-2: to make, mix ¼ cup (50 g) of cocoa mix with 1 cup (235 ml) of hot water.

step-1: make the ganache filling: in a medium bowl, combine the chocolate chips and heavy cream.
step-2: microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring between, until melted and smooth, about 1 minute total.
step-3: set aside to cool for at least 1 hour.
step-4: make the macarons: in the bowl of a food processor, combine the powdered sugar, almond flour, and ½ teaspoon of salt.
step-5: process on low speed until very finely ground.
step-6: sift the almond flour mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a large bowl.
step-7: set aside.
step-8: in a separate large bowl, beat the egg whites and the remaining ½ teaspoon of salt with an electric hand mixer until soft peaks form.
step-9: gradually add the granulated sugar until fully incorporated.
step-10: continue to beat until stiff peaks form (you should be able to turn the bowl upside down without anything falling out).
step-11: add about ⅓ of the sifted almond flour mixture at a time to the beaten egg whites and use a rubber spatula to gently fold until combined.
step-12: after the last addition of almond flour, add the peppermint extract.
step-13: continue to fold slowly until the batter falls into ribbons and you can make a figure 8 while holding the spatula up.
step-14: set a piping bag or zip-top bag fitted with a round tip in a tall drinking glass.
step-15: dip a skewer or toothpick in the red gel food coloring and paint 2 stripes on opposite sides of the inside of the piping bag.
step-16: transfer the macaron batter to the bag.
step-17: pipe 4 small dollops of batter in each corner of a rimmed baking sheet, then lay a piece of parchment paper over it, using the batter to help adhere the parchment to the baking sheet.
step-18: pipe the macarons onto the parchment paper in 2-inch (5-cm) circles, spacing at least 1-inch (2.5-cm) apart.
step-19: tap the baking sheet on a flat surface 5 times to release any air bubbles.
step-20: if there are any points on the top of the macarons, let sit for 5 minutes after tapping the pan, then, with a slightly moistened finger, lightly pat down the peaks.
step-21: let the macarons sit at room temperature for 30–60 minutes, until dry to the touch.
step-22: preheat the oven to 300˚f (150˚c).
step-23: bake the macarons for 20 minutes, until the feet are well risen and the macarons don’t stick to the parchment paper.
step-24: transfer the macarons to a wire rack to cool completely before filling.
step-25: transfer the cooled ganache to a piping bag or zip-top bag fitted with a round tip.
step-26: pipe a dollop of ganache onto a macaron shell.
step-27: top with another macaron shell to create a sandwich.
step-28: repeat with remaining macarons and ganache.
step-29: roll the edges of the macarons in the crushed candy canes.
step-30: if desired, place the macarons in an airtight container for 24 hours to “bloom” before serving, or serve immediately.

step-1: separate egg white and egg yolk into two small bowls.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: in a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, salt, and 1 teaspoon instant espresso powder.
step-4: add the butter and work into the flour mixture with your fingertips until it reaches a sandy consistency.
step-5: add the egg yolk, vanilla extract, and white wine.
step-6: mix together first with a wooden spoon, then finish by kneading it out on a lightly floured surface with your hands until the dough comes together and becomes smooth.
step-7: form into a ball and cover with plastic wrap.
step-8: refrigerate dough for 30 minutes to an hour.
step-9: form into a ball and cover with plastic wrap.
step-10: refrigerate dough for 30 minutes to an hour.
step-11: to make the filling: in a medium bowl whisk together the ricotta cheese, powdered sugar, cocoa powder, and ¾ teaspoon instant espresso powder.
step-12: refrigerate until ready to pipe.
step-13: if the ricotta is especially wet, first remove excess moisture by patting it down with paper towels.
step-14: remove the chilled dough and divide in half.
step-15: roll out to as thin as possible on a lightly floured surface.
step-16: using a small bowl, cookie cutter, or jar lid, cut into circles (re-rolling the circles and re-cutting if necessary to reach desired thinness).
step-17: wrap dough around a lightly greased cannoli form and seal with egg white.
step-18: heat oil to 350˚f (175˚c) and carefully lower the cannoli forms into the hot oil.
step-19: fry until golden on all sides.
step-20: remove from oil and set on paper towel to drain and cool.
step-21: using a small bowl, cookie cutter, or jar lid, cut into circles (re-rolling the circles and re-cutting if necessary to reach desired thinness).
step-22: remove the cooled pastry and dip ends in melted chocolate and roll in crushed candy canes.
step-23: place on wax paper to set.
step-24: wrap dough around a lightly greased cannoli form and seal with egg white.
step-25: before serving, pipe the ricotta mixture into the cannoli.
step-26: dust with powdered sugar.

step-1: put candy canes in a sealed zip bag.
step-2: beat with a rolling pin or heavy object until crumbled into tiny pieces.
step-3: add eggnog, candy canes, and chocolate to slow cooker and stir.
step-4: cook on high for 1 hour, stirring occasionally.
step-5: top with whipped cream and sprinkle with candy cane pieces.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: spread pizza dough out on a parchment-lined pan.
step-3: bake 10 minutes.
step-4: top with marinara, cheese, and pepperoni.
step-5: bake an additional 10 minutes.
step-6: slice and dip!

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the ground beef, garlic powder, onion powder, basil, rosemary, and thyme.
step-2: in a ramekin, spread two-thirds of the beef patty evenly along the bottom and sides.
step-3: place the red onions, two-third of shredded mozzarella, and one pepperoni into the well.
step-4: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-5: place the rest of beef patty on top and pat to flatten.
step-6: place the remaining mozzarella and three pepperonis on top.
step-7: bake for 25 minutes.
step-8: assemble the burger with the sesame bun.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: cut the puff pastry into six rectangles and place on a nonstick baking tray.
step-3: on one rectangle, spread a tablespoon of marinara, avoiding the edges of the pastry.
step-4: top with pepperoni slices and cheese.
step-5: place a rectangle of pastry on top and seal the edges with a fork.
step-6: repeat with remaining pastry rectangles.
step-7: brush the pockets with egg wash.
step-8: bake for 15-20 minutes or until the pastry is flaky and golden.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a liquid measuring cup, sprinkle the yeast over the warm water.
step-3: set aside for 5 minutes to bloom.
step-4: in a bowl, add 3 cups (375 g) of the flour, parmesan, baking powder, salt, and sugar and stir to combine.
step-5: add 2 tablespoons of the olive oil and stir to combine.
step-6: pour the yeast water over the flour mixture and stir until the dough forms into a ball.
step-7: use ¼ cup (30 g) of flour for dusting the surface.
step-8: scrape the dough out of the bowl onto your floured surface.
step-9: knead the dough for about 10 minutes until the dough is tight.
step-10: you may need to sprinkle a little flour while you're kneading if the dough is too sticky.
step-11: form the dough into a ball.
step-12: pour 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a bowl.
step-13: place the dough in the bowl.
step-14: cover, let rise for 1 hour in a warm area, or until the dough has doubled in size.
step-15: flour the surface.
step-16: flip bowl over surface and let the dough fall out of the bowl.
step-17: divide the dough into 3 equal balls.
step-18: begin forming the dough into a circle about ½-inch (1 cm) thick and 8 inches (20 cm) wide, making sure the middle of the circle is not too thin.
step-19: repeat with the other 2 balls of dough.
step-20: sprinkle the cornmeal on a baking sheet.
step-21: place dough on the baking sheet.
step-22: place 4 slices of pepperoni on the dough in the center.
step-23: place 4 slices of the provolone over the pepperoni.
step-24: spread half of the tomato sauce around the edge of the dough.
step-25: sprinkle 1½ cups (150 g) of mozzarella over the sauce around the edge of the circle.
step-26: place the second circle of dough over the first and tuck the edges underneath the first layer of dough.
step-27: repeat with the pepperoni, provolone, tomato sauce, and mozzarella.
step-28: place the third layer of dough over the second.
step-29: tuck the edges underneath.
step-30: with a knife make one vertical cut in the center of the pizza, making sure you cut through all of the layers.
step-31: make another horizontal cut, then 2 diagonal cuts so you have 8 triangles to fold over.
step-32: begin folding back each layer, creating an opening in the center.
step-33: repeat 7 more times.
step-34: brush the ring with olive oil and bake for 40 minutes.
step-35: cover with foil and continue to bake for 20 minutes.
step-36: place a bowl filled with the rest of the tomato sauce in the center of the ring.

step-1: place eggs in a pot.
step-2: cover with cold water until the eggs are covered by about 1 inch of water.
step-3: bring to a boil, uncovered.
step-4: once boiling, take off the heat.
step-5: cover and cook for 4-16 minutes, depending on preference (4-6 minutes for soft-boiled, 8-10 minutes for medium-boiled, 12-16 minutes for hard-boiled).
step-6: in the meantime, fill a large bowl with ice and cold water, creating an ice bath.
step-7: once eggs reach desired cook-time, immediately remove the eggs from pot and place in the ice bath.
step-8: allow eggs to cool for 10-15 minutes.
step-9: to peel, lightly tap the eggs on a flat surface, then gently roll back and forth (taking extra care with soft-boiled eggs).
step-10: pull away the loosened shell and peel any remaining pieces.
step-11: serve as is or incorporate into your favorite recipe that requires hard-boiled eggs.

step-1: remove the chicken’s backbone by using a pair of kitchen scissors.
step-2: turn it over and flatten it down to spread the chicken out as much as possible.
step-3: blend together all of the marinade ingredients in a food processor and spread half of it over the chicken.
step-4: cover and marinate in the fridge for at least 3 hours or overnight.
step-5: roast in the centre of a preheated oven for 60 minutes at 200°c (400°f), or until the thickest part of the thigh is 75°c.
step-6: once the chicken is cooked through, allow to rest for 10 minutes before serving.
step-7: simmer the other half of the marinade for 2-3 minutes to make the peri peri sauce.
step-8: use as a dip for your chicken or mix some into mayonnaise or hummus!
step-9: to make peri peri chips, just shake some smoked paprika, chili powder, garlic powder and white pepper into your chips!

step-1: heat the oil in a mini frying pan over low heat.
step-2: place the pizza dough in the pan and let brown, 3-5 minutes.
step-3: flip the dough and use a spatula to press the dough against the bottom of the pan and up the sides.
step-4: spread marinara sauce in the center of the dough and top with mozzarella cheese and pepperoni.
step-5: cook for 10 minutes, until the dough is crispy and cheese is melted.

step-1: in a small measuring cup, mix together the garlic, ginger, sesame oil, honey, and soy sauce.
step-2: whisk to combine.
step-3: pour about 2 tablespoons of the sauce over the chicken in a small bowl and set the rest aside for serving.
step-4: toss the chicken in the sauce to coat.
step-5: heat a tablespoon of oil in a small pot over medium heat.
step-6: cook the chicken until golden brown on one side, then flip and cook the other side until the chicken reaches an internal temperature of at least 165°f (75°c), about 10 minutes total.
step-7: remove the chicken breast from the pan.
step-8: let rest for 5 minutes, then slice.
step-9: add the quinoa and chicken stock to the same pot.
step-10: stir the quinoa and bring to a boil on high heat.
step-11: then, reduce the heat to low and place a strainer over the simmering quinoa.
step-12: to the strainer, add the carrot, snap peas, red cabbage, bell pepper, broccoli, and the egg.
step-13: sprinkle with salt.
step-14: cover the pot and cook for 20 minutes.
step-15: remove the food from the heat, fluff the quinoa and add the chicken and veggies.
step-16: top with the sliced avocado and the cooked egg.
step-17: pour on the rest of the reserved sauce, and garnish with scallions and toasted sesame seeds.

step-1: heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large pan over high heat.
step-2: add the steak, season with salt and pepper, and cook until browned, 5-6 minutes.
step-3: remove from the pan.
step-4: heat the remaining tablespoon of oil in the same pan, then add the red onion and cook for about 5 minutes, until softened and browned.
step-5: add the tomato, garlic, and aji amarillo paste, and cook for another 5-7 minutes, until the tomatoes have released some of their juices, but are still intact.
step-6: add the soy sauce and vinegar and stir to combine, let cook for 1 minute.
step-7: add the steak, fries, and cilantro.
step-8: toss gently to coat the fries in the sauce.
step-9: serve with rice, if desired.

step-1: use a spiralizer to cut the zucchini into zoodles.
step-2: add the zoodles to a serving bowl and set aside.
step-3: make the pesto: in a food processor or blender, add the spinach, basil, pine nuts, parmesan, garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
step-4: blend to desired consistency, adding more olive oil as needed.
step-5: scoop the pesto over the zucchini noodles, then add the cherry tomatoes and prosciutto.
step-6: toss until the zoodles are well-coated.
step-7: sprinkle with parmesan and garnish with basil and lemon wedges.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: place chicken breast in a baking dish.
step-3: season chicken with salt and pepper, to taste.
step-4: spread pesto on each chicken breast.
step-5: layer tomatoes on top of the chicken.
step-6: top with mozzarella cheese.
step-7: bake for 40 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: cut pizza dough into eighths.
step-3: (each ball of dough should yield 8 even-sized pieces of dough, for a total of 16).
step-4: using your hands, roll each piece of dough into a thin strip about 7 inches (18cm) long.
step-5: then carefully tie them into a knot, tucking the loose ends of dough underneath.
step-6: place each tied knot on a baking sheet or casserole dish with high sides, nestling them close together in a 4x4 grid.
step-7: once all the knots are placed in the dish, cover and let rest for 10 minutes.
step-8: uncover and bake for 12 minutes or until the slider buns are golden brown and no doughy grey bits remain.
step-9: once the knots are out of the oven, lower the oven temperature to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-10: allow the knots to cool, carefully remove them from the baking dish and cut the grid horizontally,creating both a top and bottom piece.
step-11: note: it’s helpful to hold the knots together with a towel on top while cutting them horizontally, as the motion of the knife might cause some of them to pull apart.
step-12: return the bottom half of the knot-grid to the original baking dish.
step-13: evenly layer the bread with cooked chicken, followed by the pesto and mozzarella cheese.
step-14: place the top half of the garlic knots on top.
step-15: mix together melted butter, garlic, and parsley.
step-16: brush mixture liberally over the top of the knots.
step-17: bake at 350˚f (180˚c) for an additional 10 minutes until the tops of the knots are golden brown and cheese is melted.
step-18: pull apart for individual sliders.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: in a food processor add the broccoli, parmesan, 1 clove of garlic, 1egg and 1 tablespoon of olive oil.
step-3: pulse until mixture forms a dough like texture, about 2 minutes.
step-4: place 1 tablespoon of the broccoli mixture and press into a well greased muffin tin.
step-5: form the mixture into a cup, making the bottom and sides ½-inches (1 cm) thick.
step-6: bake for about 30 minutes until the edges are golden and crispy and the bottom is firm.
step-7: cool the broccoli cups.
step-8: once cooled, remove from the muffin tin.
step-9: heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet medium heat.
step-10: add the chicken and season with salt and pepper, and cook until golden on all sides.
step-11: add the pesto and stir to combine.
step-12: remove from the heat.
step-13: fill the broccoli parmesan cups with the pesto chicken.
step-14: top with slices of tomatoes and basil.
step-15: broccoli parmesan cups can be stored up to 3 days and can be reheated in the oven.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f/200°c.
step-2: using a fork, pierce holes along one side of the spaghetti squash.
step-3: microwave the squash for 5 minutes to make it easier to cut open.
step-4: using a sharp knife, cut the squash in half lengthwise and scrape out the seeds with a spoon.
step-5: transfer the squash to a roasting pan and drizzle with oil.
step-6: season the flesh with salt and pepper, and flip the squash so that the cavity faces down on the pan.
step-7: bake for 40 minutes until the squash is easily pierced with a knife.
step-8: once out of the oven, use a fork to pull the threads out of the spaghetti squash.
step-9: heat 1 tablespoon of oil over medium-high heat in a large, nonstick skillet.
step-10: season the chicken thighs with salt and pepper and sear them on each side for about 4 minutes.
