step-11: remove the chicken from the pan and allow it to rest for 5 minutes before slicing into cubes.
step-12: toss the green beans into the pan and sauté until they’ve started to soften.
step-13: add in the spaghetti squash, pesto, and chicken, and toss until well combined.
step-14: after the mixture is heated through, toss in the cherry tomatoes and give the pan one last toss to help everything come together.
step-15: remove from heat and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: form a rope with one package of pizza dough about 12 inches (30 cm) long, then press flat.
step-3: spread half of the pesto evenly on flattened dough, then sprinkle half of the mozzarella on top of the pesto.
step-4: place half of the chicken on top of the mozzarella.
step-5: pinch the dough closed, and squeeze together, making sure the ingredients are not coming out.
step-6: fold the stuffed dough rope into a zigzag shape.
step-7: repeat with second package of dough.
step-8: transfer one stuffed dough to a greased loaf pan.
step-9: mix together melted butter, garlic powder, onion powder, pepper, and parsley.
step-10: spoon half of the garlic butter over first layer of stuffed dough.
step-11: place second stuffed dough on top.
step-12: spoon the rest the garlic butter over the top .
step-13: sprinkle parmesan cheese over the top of the loaf.
step-14: bake for 30 minutes.
step-15: cover the loaf pan with foil, then bake for an additional 30 minutes.
step-16: remove from loaf pan and let cool.
step-17: top with parsley (optional), slice and serve.

step-1: combine all ingredients in a small bowl.
step-2: mix thoroughly.
step-3: serve.

step-1: add the basil, olive oil, parmesan, almond butter, lemon juice, garlic, lemon zest, salt, and pepper to a blender.
step-2: blend until smooth and set aside.
step-3: cook the pasta according to the package instructions.
step-4: drain and transfer the pasta to a large serving bowl.
step-5: add the grape tomatoes, yellow tomatoes, red onion, and mozzarella balls to the pasta.
step-6: pour the pesto sauce over the pasta.
step-7: toss the ingredients together.
step-8: serve warm in a bowl.
step-9:
enjoy!

adapted from the minimalist kitchen by melissa coleman.

step-1: cut biscuit dough in half.
step-2: flatten dough.
step-3: spread a teaspoon of pesto in the center of the dough, then place a mozzarella cube on top
step-4: pinch the sides around the cheese so the pesto and cheese are completely encased by the dough.
step-5: place stuffed dough balls in a cast iron pan.
step-6: crush garlic and mix with melted butter.
step-7: brush the garlic butter over each ball.
step-8: bake for 20 minutes at 400˚f (200˚c) or until the dough is golden brown.
step-9: serve warm.

step-1: spread pesto on toast.
step-2: top with sliced avocado and shaved parmesan cheese.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180˚c).
step-2: in a medium-sized mixing bowl, combine parmesan cheese, pesto, salt, and pepper.
step-3: spoon cheese mixture into a greased mini muffin tin.
step-4: bake 5-8 minutes, or until cheese is melted and edges are slightly brown.
step-5: cool for 10 minutes.

step-1: mix all ingredients in a bowl.
step-2: serve with a hard-boiled egg and sliced bell pepper.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: combine pasta, broccoli, yellow squash, cherry tomatoes, and pesto in freezer and oven safe baking tray.
step-3: sprinkle mozzarella cheese on top (optional).
step-4: if freezing, cover baking tray with heavy duty foil or thick plastic wrap and store in the freezer for up to 3 months.
step-5: when ready to enjoy, remove from freezer and let thaw.
step-6: bake uncovered for 10-15 minutes.
step-7: top with fresh basil and serve.

step-1: in a food processor, add the basil, arugula, ⅓ cup (80 ml) olive oil, the walnuts, lemon juice, ¾ teaspoon salt, the garlic, ¼ teaspoon pepper, and the water, and pulse until smooth.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: heat the remaining tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
step-4: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the zucchini and cook for 3-4 minutes, until slightly tender.
step-5: season with salt and pepper and cook for another 2 minutes, until lightly browned.
step-6: add the white beans and sun-dried tomatoes and cook for 3-4 more minutes, until the beans begin to crisp.
step-7: add the pine nuts and cook for 2-3 more minutes, until toasted.
step-8: transfer the zucchini mixture to a medium bowl with the quinoa.
step-9: add the pesto and stir until well-combined.
step-10: distribute the quinoa into airtight containers and refrigerate for up to 5 days.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: in a small bowl lined with a strainer, strain the pesto.
step-4: set aside the pesto and pesto oil.
step-5: gently unfold and unroll 1 sheet of puff pastry.
step-6: roll out to 11 inches (28 cm) by 16 inches (40 cm).
step-7: transfer the puff pastry to the baking sheet.
step-8: spread half of the pesto onto the middle of the puff pastry in the shape of the salmon fillet.
step-9: place the salmon on top of the pesto.
step-10: season with salt and pepper.
step-11: spread more pesto on top of the salmon.
step-12: place the other sheet of puff pastry on top of the salmon and press around the salmon fillet to seal.
step-13: cut a fish silhouette around the salmon and remove the excess puff pastry.
step-14: unfold the head flap of the fish pastry.
step-15: brush pesto on the puff pastry and layer a small piece of puff pastry on top of the pesto.
step-16: repeat once more and refold the head flap.
step-17: seal the edges by pressing onto the seams of the fish silhouette.
step-18: use a knife to make indents for the head and fin details.
step-19: use the tip of the spoon to create indents of the scales.
step-20: brush the pastry with egg wash.
step-21: bake for 40 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-22: in a small bowl combine the pesto oil and basil.
step-23: brush the pastry with the basil pesto oil.
step-24: slice and serve while hot.

step-1: on a cutting board, salt and pepper both sides of each chicken breast with approximately ½ teaspoon salt and ½ teaspoon pepper, per side.
step-2: slice each chicken breast horizontally along the side to create a pocket for the filling.
step-3: stuff each breast with approximately one third of mozzarella cheese, one tablespoon pesto and four sundried tomatoes.
step-4: if the chicken breast does not close fully with the filling, try securing with a wooden toothpick.
step-5: heat oil in a skillet over medium heat.
step-6: pan fry for about 5-8 minutes, per side, depending on the size of the chicken breasts, until the cheese is melted and the chicken is cooked through.
step-7: serve warm.

step-1: warm the tortillas in the microwave in 30-second intervals, until flexible.
step-2: transfer to a clean work surface.
step-3: spread on half the pesto on each tortilla.
step-4: divide the tomatoes, turkey, spinach, and provolone between the tortillas.
step-5: wrap the tortillas tightly in plastic wrap and rest for 30 minutes.
step-6: stick 6 toothpicks 1-inch (2 cm) apart into the wraps along the seam.
step-7: slice between the toothpicks and serve.

step-1: cook fusilli ( or rotini) in boiling salted water until it’s al dente.
step-2: reserve 1 cup (235 ml) of the pasta water before draining.
step-3: add basil, garlic, pine nuts, salt, and pepper to a food processor or blender and pulse to start to break up the ingredients.
step-4: add water and a splash of the olive oil to get things started.
step-5: scrape down the sides of processor bowl to ensure everything is being incorporated evenly.
step-6: put the top back on, turn on the food processor, and slowly drizzle the remaining olive oil through the hole on the top of the food processor until emulsified in the sauce.
step-7: pour the pesto into a bowl, then stir in the parmesan.
step-8: (the heat of the food processor will start to melt the cheese, so adding it afterwards retains a nice texture)
step-9: drain the pasta and transfer to large bowl or pan.
step-10: add pesto and a splash of pasta water, stirring to incorporate.
step-11: add parmesan and another splash of pasta water.
step-12: top off with more cheese and basil before serving.

step-1: season the sushi rice with the rice vinegar, fanning and stirring until room temperature.
step-2: on the rolling mat place one sheet of nori with the rough side facing upwards.
step-3: wet your hands and grab a handful of rice and place it on the nori.
step-4: spread the rice evenly throughout the nori without smushing the rice down.
step-5: arrange, in a horizontal row 1 inch (2 cm) from the bottom, smoked salmon, cream cheese, and cucumber.
step-6: grabbing both nori and the mat, roll the mat over the filling so the extra space at the bottom touches the other side, squeezing down to make a nice tight roll.
step-7: squeeze down along the way to keep the roll from holding its shape.
step-8: transfer the roll onto a cutting board.
step-9: rub a knife on a damp paper towel before slicing the roll into six equal portions.

step-1: slice the italian roll 3 quarters of the way through so it can fold open.
step-2: cook the chip steak in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
step-3: stir while cooking to make sure the meat cooks on all sides.
step-4: place the open roll face down on top of the meat, then flip the whole thing over so the meat is inside.
step-5: add cheese whiz and grilled onions.

step-1: chop the green pepper, onion, mushrooms and thinly slice the rib eye steak.
step-2: sautè chopped pepper and onions in a skillet with oil over medium heat for 5 mins.
step-3: add mushrooms and cook another 5 minutes.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: in another skillet, cook the sliced rib eye (the meat will cook in it’s own fat so no oil necessary!)
step-6: once meat is cooked through, add the pepper mixture, season with salt to taste, pepper to taste, and garlic powder to taste.
step-7: add milk and cream.
step-8: bring to a light boil, stirring frequently, until mixture thickens.
step-9: remove from heat.
step-10: cut thawed pastry dough into 3-inch (7.5 cm) squares.
step-11: place in a greased muffin tray.
step-12: fill with ¼ cup cheesesteak mix and bake for 10-12 minutes at 400°f (200°c).
step-13: take out of oven and cover with grated provolone cheese.
step-14: return to oven until cheese is melted.

step-1: combine tomatoes, onion, jalapeño, garlic, cilantro, salt, pepper, and lime juice in a small bowl and stir.
step-2: transfer to an airtight container and store in the fridge up to 6 days.

step-1: sift the flour and salt together into a large bowl.
step-2: using only your fingertips, pinch the cubes of butter into the flour, breaking up the butter as you go, until no large lumps remain.
step-3: shake the bowl to force the large chunks of butter to the surface.
step-4: if you have warm hands or this is taking too long, you can chill the bowl into the refrigerator for 20 minutes to cool back down--you don’t want this to be greasy at all!
step-5: mix the egg yolks and ice water together in a small bowl with a fork until evenly combined.
step-6: add the liquid to the flour mixture, reserving ¼ or so in case you don’t need all of it--you don’t want the pastry to be too wet.
step-7: quickly mix everything together with a dinner fork until the dough just starts to come together.
step-8: add more liquid to the driest parts of the dough if needed.
step-9: the dough is ready when it holds together in a ball when squeezed in your palm.
step-10: transfer the dough to a clean work surface and bring the dough together.
step-11: you don’t want to overwork the dough, but you need to work it enough that it is a cohesive disc with no real cracks or very dry bits.
step-12: wrap the dough disc in plastic wrap and chill for 30 minutes.
step-13: the dough can sit in the fridge for up to 4 days, otherwise double wrap in plastic or in a zip top bag and store in the freezer for up to 3 months.
step-14: lightly flour your work surface and unwrap a disc of chilled dough.
step-15: flour the top of the dough.
step-16: using a rolling pin, push down on the dough, giving it a quarter turn every few smushes, to spread the dough evenly and ensure it doesn’t stick to the surface.
step-17: start to roll out the dough, continuing to turn.
step-18: if any cracks form, smush them back together.
step-19: roll out the dough to a circle about ⅛-inch (3 mm) thick.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220˚c).
step-2: slice the puff pastry into 6 even rectangles.
step-3: place a slice of cheddar on top of each puff pastry piece.
step-4: place a hot dog on the cheddar, then roll it up.
step-5: slice each roll into 3 even pieces, and arrange the pieces evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper with a 1-inch gap between the pieces.
step-6: bake for 15 minutes, until golden brown and flaky.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: roll out the puff pastry into a square shape and brush the surface with egg wash.
step-3: cut the puff pastry sheet into 6 equal rectangles.
step-4: place a hot dog on the bottom of each pastry rectangle, then roll it up tightly.
step-5: slice each rolled hot dog into 3 equal segments.
step-6: repeat with the remaining puff pastry and hot dogs.
step-7: in a large springform pan, place a circular wall of the hot dog pieces around the circumference of the edge.
step-8: stack a second row of rolled hot dogs on top, so that they go up the entire side of the pan.
step-9: build a 3-way wall with more hot dogs that all meet in the center to create 3 holes for the dips.
step-10: carefully place each dip into each open space, spreading them out evenly and making sure the walls don’t move.
step-11: cover with foil and bake for 1 hour and 45 minutes.
step-12: remove the foil and bake uncovered for another 30 minutes until the pastry is crispy.
step-13: cool until warm to the touch.
step-14: unclasp the springform pan.

step-1: bring pizza dough to room temperature.
step-2: cut the dough into strips and stretch/roll out.
step-3: roll up mini hotdogs in pizza dough so the dough wraps around twice - leaving the ends sticking out and cutting off any excess.
step-4: place on a lightly greased baking sheet until ready to boil.
step-5: bring water to a light boil.
step-6: add in baking soda.
step-7: once dissolved, boil wrapped hot dogs in water mixture for 20-30 seconds each (working in small batches).
step-8: remove and place back on baking tray.
step-9: brush each lightly with beaten egg and sprinkle with sea salt.
step-10: bake in a preheated oven at 425˚f (220˚c) for 15-20 minutes until the dough is nicely browned.

step-1: preheat the oven to 180˚c (350˚f).
step-2: cut the rashers in half lengthwise, and roll the sausages in them.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: lay out the sheet of puff pastry and coat with some egg wash.
step-5: cut into 12 squares.
step-6: in each square, sprinkle on some cheese, followed by a sausage wrapped in bacon.
step-7: roll in the pastry.
step-8: pierce some holes on top of each roll and coat with more egg wash. top with black onion seeds.
step-9: bake for 20 minutes, or until golden brown and the sausages are cooked through.

step-1: preheat grill to high heat.
step-2: to make the piña colada sauce, add the cream of coconut, crushed pineapple, sour cream, and coconut flakes to a bowl and stir to combine.
step-3: add the ground beef to a bowl with ¼ cup of teriyaki sauce and mix to combine.
step-4: form the ground beef into 4 burger patties.
step-5: brush each burger patty with melted butter, and sprinkle each side with salt and pepper.
step-6: brush the brioche buns with butter.
step-7: grill the pineapple until grill marks form, about 2 minutes.
step-8: flip the pineapple slices over, and grill for 2 more minutes.
step-9: grill the burgers for 4-7 minutes, brushing them with additional teriyaki sauce.
step-10: flip the burgers and continue cooking for 3-6 minutes.
step-11: place the cheese on the burgers and cook until melted, 1 minute.
step-12: toast the buns on the grill, 30 seconds.
step-13: add ⅓ cup (75 g) of the piña colada sauce to a bowl along with the mayonnaise, and stir to combine.
step-14: reserving the rest of the piña colada sauce for future use.
step-15: spread the piña colada and mayonnaise mixture on the buns.
step-16: top with a burger patty, pineapple slice, and bacon.

step-1: whisk the melted butter and sugar together until noticeably thicker in consistency (about 3 minutes).
step-2: add the eggs, coconut rum, pineapple juice and coconut cream and whisk again until combined.
step-3: in a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, bicarbonate of soda and salt.
step-4: add gradually to the butter and rum mixture, mixing each time.
step-5: pour the cake batter into a jug and then pour into 12 cupcake cases, about ¾ of the way up.
step-6: bake for 15-18 minutes at 180°c (350˚f).
step-7: once the cupcakes are out and have cooled, prepare the topping.
step-8: whisk the icing sugar, butter, double cream, coconut rum and pineapple juice together until thick and creamy.
step-9: using a piping bag or zip top bag with a small corner cut off, pipe the topping onto the cupcakes and decorate with some dessicated coconut, cherries and a straw.

step-1: in a blender, combine frozen pineapples, frozen bananas, dairy-free ice cream, coconut flakes, dairy-free milk, and ice cubes.
step-2: blend until combined.

step-1: using a pineapple corer, core the pineapple and slice the pineapple into chunks.
step-2: place the pineapple chunks flat on a baking sheet and freeze solid, about 2 hours.
step-3: in a blender, add the frozen pineapple, coconut cream, coconut milk, white rum, ice, and lime juice.
step-4: place the blender back in the freezer for 20 minutes or until thickened.
step-5: blend one more time until fully incorporated.
step-6: pour piña colada back into the pineapple.
step-7: top with a maraschino cherry.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: generously grease a 9 (22 cm) x 4 (10 cm) loaf pan with oil.
step-3: in a large bowl, sift together the flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, cardamom, ginger, cloves, and salt.
step-4: add the oats and whisk to combine.
step-5: in a separate large bowl, combine the shredded carrots, pineapple, eggs, and melted butter.
step-6: mix well.
step-7: add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir until there are no dry clumps left.
step-8: gently fold in the walnuts, if using.
step-9: pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan and smooth the top.
step-10: bake for 1 hour, until a toothpick inserted in the center of the bread comes out clean.
step-11: while the bread is baking, make the greek yogurt “frosting”: in a small bowl, combine the greek yogurt, maple syrup, and 2 tablespoons of the reserved pineapple juice.
step-12: stir until well incorporated.
step-13: chill in the refrigerator until ready to use.
step-14: remove the bread from the oven and allow to cool for 10 minutes, until safe to handle.
step-15: remove from the loaf pan and let cool completely on a wire rack.
step-16: slice the bread and serve with a smear of frosting.

step-1: cut pineapple into thin slices.
step-2: add coconut shavings and pineapple to the popsicle molds.
step-3: fill in the gaps of air with water.
step-4: freeze the popsicles for at least 5 hours.
step-5: take the frozen popsicles out of the ice molds and enjoy!

step-1: using a sharp knife carefully cut the pineapple in half lengthways.
step-2: using the tip of a knife, cut around the edge of the pineapple being careful not to cut through the skin.
step-3: slice down and across the pineapple flesh then scoop out the pineapple cubes with a spoon.
step-4: discard the core and set the flesh aside.
step-5: in a large wok, heat 2 tablespoons of oil over a medium heat.
step-6: fry the beaten eggs in a hot wok.
step-7: once cooked, push the eggs to a side and add in the prawns to the other side.
step-8: fry until the prawns are just cooked.
step-9: remove eggs and prawns from the wok and set aside.
step-10: heat the wok until smoking hot and pour in 6 tablespoons of oil.
step-11: add the garlic, chilli, and onion and stir until fragrant.
step-12: add in the rice and vegetables, and fry until rice turns slightly brown and the veggies are thoroughly cooked.
step-13: add the cooked eggs and prawns, add in the fish sauce and the prepared pineapple flesh and stir until everything is well mixed together.
step-14: serve in the empty pineapple halves, along with some lime juice and spring onions.

step-1: mix fruits together in a plastic bag.
step-2: seal bag and place in freezer for up to 6 months.
step-3: when ready, mix milk and fruit in a blender until consistency is smooth.

step-1: place the gammon joint in a large pot and add the onions and pineapple juice.
step-2: bring to a boil over high heat.
step-3: once boiling, reduce the heat to medium, cover, and simmer for 70 minutes.
step-4: (gammon joints need to cook for 40 minutes per kilo (2 ¼ lbs), so if you are using a smaller or large gammon joint, adjust the cooking time accordingly.)
step-5: once cooked, carefully remove the gammon joint from the pan and place on a baking sheet to cool slightly.
step-6: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-7: make the glaze: in a small pan over a medium heat, combine the dijon mustard, pineapple juice, and maple syrup and bring to a boil.
step-8: cook for 10 minutes, or until slightly reduced and glossy.
step-9: carefully remove the skin from the gammon joint, using a small paring knife to help ease the fat away from the skin.
step-10: be sure to leave a small layer of fat on top of the gammon.
step-11: score the fat in a diamond pattern and push a clove into each cross section.
step-12: liberally brush the gammon joint with the glaze, making sure to reserve at least half of the glaze.
step-13: roast the gammon joint for 40 minutes, glazing again halfway through.
step-14: carve and serve.

step-1: put fruit in a freezer bag.
step-2: seal and store in freezer for up to 3 months.
step-3: when ready to use, put milk, greek yogurt, and frozen fruit into a blender and mix until consistency is smooth.

step-1: in a large, nonstick skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
step-2: toss in the onion and salt and sauté for 2 minutes.
step-3: add in the chili powder, paprika, and garlic.
step-4: toast for 1 minute.
step-5: add in the pineapple and chicken and mix so the chicken is well-coated and warmed through.
step-6: pour the chicken mixture into a large serving bowl.
step-7: toast the tortillas in the seasoned pan, about 3 minutes per side.
step-8: divide the mixture evenly between tortillas, top with diced red onion and cilantro, and serve.

step-1: put frozen pineapple, banana, coconut milk, orange juice, and water into blender and blend until smooth.
step-2: serve over ice.

step-1: make the simple syrup: in a small saucepan, combine the sugar, rosemary, and water.
step-2: bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
step-3: once boiling, cook for 2-3 minutes, until the sugar has dissolved and the rosemary is fragrant.
step-4: remove from the heat.
step-5: strain the herb syrup through a fine-mesh sieve set over a blender.
step-6: add the pineapple and lemon juice.
step-7: blend on high speed until smooth.
step-8: divide the mixture between 6 ice pop molds.
step-9: freeze until solid, at least 6 hours.

step-1: mix all ingredients together in a large bowl.
step-2: serve with chips or as a topping on your favorite meal.

step-1: blend all ingredients in a food processor or high-speed blender until thoroughly combined.
step-2: pour into a rectangular loaf pan and smooth into an even layer.
step-3: freeze for 2 hours, or until frozen but still a little soft for scooping.
step-4: (if freezing overnight, cover with a lid or plastic wrap, but let it sit out at room temperature for about 5-10 minutes before scooping.)
step-5: scoop into a bowl.

step-1: preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: cut pineapple in half lengthwise, cutting from root through the leaves.
step-3: hollow out the pineapple by slicing around the perimeter, leaving a ½ inch (1 ¼ cm) border.
step-4: slice the pineapple inside the cut border, and scoop out with a spoon.
step-5: repeat with the other half and set aside, as this will be the serving bowl for the salmon.
step-6: add pineapple and water to a blender and blend until smooth.
step-7: pour pineapple purée into a saucepan set over medium heat.
step-8: add sugar, chile flakes, salt, and garlic to the pan and bring to a simmer.
step-9: stir frequently until sauce has become lighter in color and slightly thickened.
step-10: in a separate small bowl, combine cornstarch with water to make a slurry.
step-11: add the slurry to the sauce, cooking until sauce has thickened, about 4-7 minutes.
step-12: remove the pan from the heat.
step-13: place the salmon on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and cover each fillet with the sauce
step-14: bake for 12-15 minutes, depending on your desired doneness.
step-15: serve in the pineapple bowls over rice with extra pineapple sweet chile sauce on the side.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the chicken with 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1 tablespoon cornstarch, and 1 egg.
step-2: cover and marinate in the fridge for 20 minutes.
step-3: cut the pineapple in half lengthwise and carefully cube the fruit in each half, leaving the outside of the pineapple intact.
step-4: scoop out the cubed pineapple and set aside.
step-5: place the remaining cup of cornstarch in a separate large bowl and toss the marinated chicken pieces until liberally coated.
step-6: shake off excess.
step-7: fill medium pot halfway with oil and heat until the oil reaches 350˚f (180°c).
step-8: fry the chicken for 4-5 minutes, until the coating is golden brown and the chicken is cooked throughout.
step-9: transfer to a wire rack set over paper towels to drain.
step-10: to make the sauce, heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a medium frying pan over a medium heat.
step-11: sauté the bell pepper and onion for 2-3 minutes, until softened.
step-12: add the garlic and ginger, and cook until fragrant.
step-13: add the vinegar, sugar, and ketchup, and stir.
step-14: bring the mixture to a boil.
step-15: add the pineapple cubes and warm thorough.
step-16: add the chicken to the frying pan and toss to coat with the sauce.
step-17: scoop the mixture into the hollowed out pineapple along with a scoop of rice.
step-18: garnish with scallions and sesame seeds.

step-1: to a large mixing bowl, add flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and sugar.
step-2: mix until thoroughly combined.
step-3: create a small well in the middle of the dry ingredients.
step-4: add milk, half of the reserved pineapple juice, melted butter, and vanilla extract.
step-5: whisk until ingredients combine to form a lumpy batter.
step-6: set aside while you make the pineapple syrup.
step-7: add the remaining butter to small sauce pan over medium heat.
step-8: once butter is melted, add brown sugar, the remaining pineapple juice, and rum (optional).
step-9: bring ingredients to a boil allowing for the sugar to melt and caramelize.
step-10: once mixture is smooth and has the consistency of syrup, remove from heat and set aside.
step-11: melt a small amount of butter in a frying pan over medium heat and add a slice of pineapple.
step-12: cook pineapple ring until lightly caramelized on one side, about 2 minutes, before flipping it.
step-13: once flipped, fill the core of the pineapple with 1-2 maraschino cherries before pouring about ¼ cup (30 grams) of the pancake batter over.
step-14: cook until the edges start to set and the top begins to bubble, about 2 minutes, before carefully flipping the pancake--revealing the pineapple underneath.
step-15: cook for an additional 90 seconds to 2 minutes until the pancake is cooked through.
step-16: store cooked pancakes in a 200˚f (90˚c) oven until ready to serve.
step-17: serve pancakes warm with reserved pineapple syrup.

step-1: to make the simple syrup, bring the sugar and water to a boil in a saucepan.
step-2: wait until they’re completely combined, then set aside to cool.
step-3: squeeze the juice out of all the grapefruits, and combine with the tequila and the simple syrup you just made.
step-4: wet the rim of your glasses (you can do this with a slice of grapefruit), and dip in sugar.
step-5: serve over ice!

step-1: fry the chicken in a little oil for a few minutes until cooked through.
step-2: stir in the cream cheese until it’s melted.
step-3: stir in the piri piri sauce.
step-4: transfer all of this to an oven-safe dish and top with grated cheese.
step-5: grill (broil) for 5 minutes or until the cheese is bubbly.
step-6: serve with a selection of crackers.

step-1: place 1 cup of cracked pistachios into a blender.
step-2: add 1 tablespoon of vanilla, 3 tablespoons of honey, 1 pinch of salt, and 4 cups water to the blender.
step-3: blend the mixture on high for 90 seconds.
step-4: use a cheesecloth to strain the liquid into a pouring container.
step-5: (optional) refrigerate 1-2 hours or serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 450ºf (230ºc), and line a sheet tray with parchment paper.
step-2: in a large bowl, mix the warm water, sugar, and yeast.
step-3: let sit for 5 minutes, or until the mixture becomes cloudy and slightly foamy.
step-4: add the flour, salt, and 1 tablespoon of oil to the bowl with the yeast mixture and stir until combined.
step-5: turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 3-5 minutes.
step-6: wipe the large bowl clean and lightly coat with remaining oil.
step-7: place the dough into the bowl and cover with plastic wrap and a dish towel.
step-8: set in a warm place for 20 minutes, or until the dough has nearly doubled in size.
step-9: once risen, turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and stretch the dough into a 12x22-inch (30x56 cm) rectangle.
step-10: layer the marinara, mozzarella, and pepperoni in the center of the rectangle, lengthwise, leaving 1-2 inches (2 ½-5 cm) on the top and bottom.
step-11: slice the dough in half through the center, lengthwise.
step-12: fold each piece’s center edge towards the outer edge and pat down, creating a long roll-up.
step-13: slice each roll into 4-5 equal pieces.
step-14: pinch the edges closed on all the pieces and place on sheet tray.
step-15: brush the tops with olive oil and sprinkle with cheese.
step-16: bake for 15-20 minutes, or until light golden brown.
step-17: serve immediately or allow to cool, then freeze in an airtight container up to 1-2 months.
step-18: to reheat, microwave for 45 seconds to 1 minute.

step-1: cut each biscuit in half.
step-2: press each half into a circle with your thumb.
step-3: place a small dollop of marinara sauce, 1 pepperoni, and 1 cube of mozzarella on each biscuit round.
step-4: bring the edges up and over, pressing them together and being sure to leave no gaps for the filling to leak out.
step-5: lay the pizza bombs on a baking sheet lined with greased parchment paper.
step-6: combine melted butter, garlic, salt and pepper, and italian seasoning in a small bowl.
step-7: brush the butter mixture onto each pizza bomb and top with parmesan.
step-8: bake at 375°f (190°c) for 15-20 minutes or until biscuits have nicely browned.
step-9: once pizza bombs are cool enough to handle, serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: lay out puff pastry.
step-3: place 4 slices of mozzarella and then 12 slices of pepperoni in the center of the dough.
step-4: cut diagonal lines along the left and right side of the cheese and pepperoni about a 1-inch (2 ½ cm) apart.
step-5: remove the corner pieces.
step-6: starting from the top, fold down the flap then alternate right and left until the bottom.
step-7: fold the bottom flap up and finish alternating between right and left.
step-8: place the braided puff pastry on a parchment paper lined baking tray.
step-9: in a small bowl, combine butter, garlic, parsley, and parmesan cheese.
step-10: brush all over until the top of the braid is fully coated.
step-11: bake for 20 - 25 minutes or until golden brown.
step-12: slice and serve.

step-1: cut a long rectangle through the top of the baguette and partially unstuff the baguette.
step-2: line the bottom of the inside with mozzarella cheese, spoon pizza sauce on top of the cheese, add another layer of cheese, then lay the pepperoni slices on top and tuck the edges inside the bread.
step-3: bake for 25 minutes at 350˚f (175˚c).
step-4: cut and serve while still warm.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (175˚c).
step-2: slice the top of the bread boule off and remove the insides.
step-3: spread ½ cup of the marinara on the bottom of the boule, then layer with half of the mozzarella, 5 ounces of the pepperoni, onions, basil, sausage, peppers, the other ½ cup of marinara, the remaining mozzarella, and half of the white cheddar, and place the cap of the bread boule on top.
step-4: wrap the bread bowl in foil, then press with a heavy object for 30 minutes.
step-5: remove the foil and sprinkle the remaining cheddar and pepperoni on top.
step-6: bake for 30 minutes, until cheese is golden brown.
step-7: cool for 10 minutes and slice.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180˚c).
step-2: in a medium-sized mixing bowl, combine mozzarella cheese, basil, oregano, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
step-3: spoon cheese mixture into a greased mini muffin tin.
step-4: top with pepperoni.
step-5: bake for 5-8 minutes or until cheese is melted and edges are slightly brown.
step-6: cool for 10 minutes.
step-7: serve with marinara sauce, if desired.

step-1: “bloom” the yeast by sprinkling the sugar and yeast in the warm water.
step-2: let sit for 10 minutes, until bubbles form on the surface.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the flour and salt.
step-4: make a well in the middle and add the olive oil and bloomed yeast mixture.
step-5: using a spoon, mix until a shaggy dough begins to form.
step-6: once the flour is mostly hydrated, turn the dough out onto a clean work surface and knead for 10-15 minutes.
step-7: the dough should be soft, smooth, and bouncy.
step-8: form the dough into a taut round.
step-9: grease a clean, large bowl with olive oil and place the dough inside, turning to coat with the oil.
step-10: cover with plastic wrap.
step-11: let rise for at least an hour, or up to 24 hours.
step-12: punch down the dough and turn it out onto a lightly floured work surface.
step-13: knead for another minute or so, then cut into 4 equal portions and shape into rounds.
step-14: lightly flour the dough, then cover with a kitchen towel and let rest for another 30 minutes to an hour while you prepare the sauce and any other ingredients.
step-15: preheat the oven as high as your oven will allow, between 450-500˚f (230-260˚c).
step-16: place a pizza stone, heavy baking sheet (turn upside down so the surface is flat), or cast iron skillet in the oven.
step-17: meanwhile, make the tomato sauce: add the salt to the can of tomatoes and puree with an immersion blender, or transfer to a blender or food processor, and puree until smooth.
step-18: once the dough has rested, take a portion and start by poking the surface with your fingertips, until bubbles form and do not deflate.
step-19: then, stretch and press the dough into a thin round.
step-20: make it thinner than you think it should be, as it will slightly shrink and puff up during baking.
step-21: sprinkle semolina onto an upside down baking sheet and place the stretched crust onto it.
step-22: add the sauce and ingredients of your choice.
step-23: slide the pizza onto the preheated pizza stone or pan.
step-24: bake for 15 minutes, or until the crust and cheese are golden brown.
step-25: add any garnish of your preference.

step-1: whizz together the flour and water in a food processor for a minute or so until it clumps together to form a single ball.
step-2: you might need to add a little bit more water or flour to get the consistency right.
step-3: (dough should be soft, but not sticky!)
step-4: preheat the grill (broiler) on high.
step-5: on a floured surface, roll out the dough to about 1 cm (½ inch) thick.
step-6: place pizza dough onto a well-oiled, oven-safe frying pan on high heat.
step-7: while the bottom is cooking on the hob, top the pizza with the sauce, cheese, pepperoni herbs and whatever else you like.
step-8: (try your best to not over-top it or else it can fall apart or get soggy.)
step-9: continue cooking on high until the edges of the crust start browning and crisping.
step-10: place the pan under the grill and cook the toppings until the cheese is bubbly and browning.
step-11: slice.
step-12: if you’re quick, you can actually have this from-scratch pizza on your plate (and in you mouth) quicker than it takes to cook a pre-made frozen pizza.

step-1: preheat oven to 375ºf (190ºc).
step-2: over medium-high heat, cook italian sausage until browned, then remove from pan and set aside.
step-3: in the same pan, cook onion until translucent, then add bell peppers and garlic.
step-4: cook until the veggies are soft, about 10 minutes.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: in a 9 x13-inch (23cm x 33cm) baking dish, begin to assemble the lasagna by spreading a thin layer of sauce on the bottom of the pan.
step-7: then, layer ingredients in the following order: noodles, ricotta, sausage, veggies, mozzarella, sauce, noodles, ricotta, pepperoni, basil, mozzarella, sauce, noodles, marinara, mozzarella, veggies, sausage, and pepperoni.
step-8: place pan on a sheet tray and bake for 45-55 minutes, or until bubbling and starting to brown around the edges.

step-1: in a large bowl combine flour, 1½ tablespoons salt, and sugar.
step-2: in a medium bowl, combine water, yeast, and 1 tablespoon of olive oil.
step-3: stir well and let rest for 2 minutes.
step-4: add yeast mixture to flour mixture and combine using your hands or a stand mixer with a dough hook, at least two minutes.
step-5: let dough rest for 20 minutes, uncovered, at room temperature.
step-6: on a floured work surface, separate dough into 4 even portions.
step-7: work each into a circular ball, then place the balls onto a baking sheet lined with wax paper.
step-8: cover with a damp towel and rest, refrigerated, for at least 4 hours.
step-9: in a blender or food processor, combine tomatoes, 2 tablespoons of olive oil, 1 tablespoon of salt, and garlic.
step-10: process until smooth.
step-11: preheat oven to 550°f/290°c.
step-12: place a pizza stone or large cast-iron griddle on the center rack.
step-13: heat for at least 45 minutes.
step-14: on a floured work surface, use your fingertips to create a ring around the outside (your crust) of one of the risen balls of dough.
step-15: using the pads of your fingers, gently flatten out the dough inside the ring.
step-16: gently lift up the dough and let it hang off your knuckles, stretching itself out with its own weight.
step-17: slowly rotate the circle of dough, continuing to let it stretch off your knuckles.
step-18: go all the way around the circle once, taking care not to let it hang too long in one place and stretch too thin.
step-19: using a large spoon, spread a thin layer of sauce across the dough, leaving room for the crust.
step-20: evenly place three slices of mozzarella on top of the sauce, then sprinkle a handful of torn basil leaves evenly over your pizza.
step-21: or top with whatever you desire: sausage, peppers, onions… just about anything can be a pizza topping!
step-22: carefully slide the pizza onto a floured sheet or pizza peel and place on top of your stone or griddle in the oven.
step-23: cook for 7 to 10 minutes, until the cheese is bubbly and the top of the crust is just beginning to blacken.
step-24: remove from oven and let cool for 3-4 minutes before slicing.

step-1: in a small mixing bowl, whisk the warm water, yeast, and sugar together.
step-2: place in a warm place for 10 minutes, or until yeast is foamy.
step-3: in a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour and salt.
step-4: make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and add the yeast mixture and olive oil.
step-5: stir the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients until the dough comes together and becomes difficult to stir.
step-6: turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until the dough is smooth, about 5 minutes.
step-7: add small amounts of flour as necessary to prevent sticking.
step-8: transfer the dough to a large bowl coated with olive oil.
step-9: cover with a towel and let rise in a warm place for 1-2 hours, until the dough has doubled in size.
step-10: once the dough has doubled in size, remove the towel and punch the dough down.
step-11: turn out onto a lightly floured surface and divide the dough into 6-8 pieces, and shape each into a small ball.
step-12: place the formed balls onto a baking sheet and rest, covered, for 15 minutes.
step-13: to shape the individual pizzas, press out the dough balls onto a lightly floured surface.
step-14: create a slightly thicker rim around the outside of the dough and continue to stretch into a 9- to 10-inch (23-25 cm) round.
step-15: heat a large cast-iron pan over medium heat, until the pan just begins to smoke, about 5 minutes.
step-16: carefully transfer a stretched pizza round onto the hot pan.
step-17: leave to cook for 2-3 minutes (the dough should begin bubbling up) until lightly tanned with a few dark spots.
step-18: flip and continue to cook on the other side for 1-2 minutes longer, until the crust is completely dry.
step-19: remove the dough to rest on a wire rack and repeat with remaining dough.
step-20: to finish the pizzas, top each crust with tomato sauce and fresh mozzarella.
step-21: transfer to the oven and broil for 7 or 8 minutes, until the cheese has melted and the crust has developed a nice char in spots.
step-22: watch closely and move to a lower rack if necessary.
step-23: finish each pizza with fresh basil, a drizzle of olive oil, and a sprinkle of salt.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (190°c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, add the pancake mix, butter, and 1 egg and mix until combined.
step-3: press about 1 tablespoon of dough into a greased 12-portion muffin pan.
step-4: sprinkle basil, oregano, garlic powder, pepperoni, mozzarella cheese, and tomatoes over the dough.
step-5: in a large measuring cup, whisk together 2 eggs, milk, and heavy cream.
step-6: pour mixture over the other ingredients in each muffin slot.
step-7: top with parmesan cheese.
step-8: bake 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-9: cool for 5 minutes.
step-10: serve with marinara sauce for dipping.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f/175°c.
step-2: in a large pan or skillet, lay down half of the tortilla chips, followed by the marinara, mozzarella, mushrooms, green pepper, red onion, sausage, and diced pepperoni.
step-3: bake for 15 minutes, until cheese is melted.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: lightly flour a clean surface.
step-4: roll out the pizza dough and cut into 4 strips, then cut each strip into 8 triangles.
step-5: transfer the triangles to the prepared baking sheet.
step-6: in a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, oregano, garlic powder and crushed red pepper.
step-7: brush the seasoned oil over the pizza dough triangles.
step-8: bake for 10 minutes, or until the chips are crispy and golden brown.
step-9: remove the chips from the oven and leave the oven on.
step-10: layer half of the chips in a large cast iron skillet or on a baking sheet.
step-11: spoon on half of the marinara sauce, then top with half of the mozzarella, pepperoni, italian sausage, and tomatoes.
step-12: layer on the remaining ingredients.
step-13: bake for 5 minutes, or until the cheese is melted.
step-14: top the nachos with freshly grated parmesan cheese and the basil, then serve.

step-1: cut onion into 2 cm (1 inch) slices.
step-2: carefully separate the layers into individual rings.
step-3: on a tray lined with baking paper, lay out onion rings and place a slice of pepperoni in the centre, pushing the pepperoni slice down to take the shape of the onion and make a bowl.
step-4: layer in a tablespoon of pizza sauce, mozzarella, some parmesan, and a sprinkle of oregano.
step-5: place tray in freezer until solid (about two hours).
step-6: add flour, beaten eggs, and panko breadcrumbs to three separate bowls.
step-7: stir paprika and oregano into the flour
step-8: remove frozen pizza rings from freezer.
step-9: roll each first in seasoned flour, then egg, then breadcrumbs.
step-10: in a large saucepan, heat oil to 180˚c (350°f).
step-11: fry pizza onion rings in batches until nicely browned on all sides, about 3 minutes.
step-12: place on paper towel-lined plate to drain off any excess oil.
step-13: sprinkle with more dried oregano.

step-1: preheat the oven to 200°c/400°f/gas mark 6.
step-2: thinly slice the potatoes.
step-3: toss potatoes in the salt, pepper, garlic powder, and olive oil until evenly coated.
step-4: place on a tray and bake for 20-25 minutes until slightly crispy, turning halfway through the bake time.
step-5: lower the oven temperature to 180°c/350°f/gas mark 4.
step-6: place half of the potatoes into a round, oven proof cake tin.
step-7: top with half of the pizza sauce, and then half of the other toppings.
step-8: make another layer with all the toppings again.
step-9: finish off the dish with a bit more cheese and the pepperoni slices if you’re using them.
step-10: bake for 15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and turning golden brown.

step-1: place the two sheets of puff pastry on a parchment paper lined baking tray.
step-2: cut out equal size circles.
step-3: remove the top sheet.
step-4: on the bottom sheet, spread pizza sauce and shredded cheese.
step-5: place the other sheet of puff pastry on top.
step-6: take a glass and place it in the center of the circle.
step-7: using a knife or scissors, cut strips away from the edge of the glass.
step-8: take each strip and twist.
step-9: brush egg wash over the top of the puff pastry.
step-10: bake at 400°f (204°c) for 20-25 minutes.

step-1: cut off a piece of pizza dough and roll out over a floured surface until it's about 8 inches (20 cm) long.
step-2: try to get the dough as thin as possible.
step-3: cover lightly in pizza sauce.
step-4: place pepperoni at one end, so that the pepperoni aligns with the bottom of the dough.
step-5: place the second pepperoni piece so that it overlaps with the first piece, and is placed sightly higher than the bottom line of the dough.
step-6: continue layering pepperoni so that each one overlaps a bit less than the previous piece, and follows an upward angle.
step-7: sprinkle the bottom half with low moisture mozzarella cheese, and beginning from the end with the most pepperoni, roll the dough into a lose coil.
step-8: place in a muffin tin, with the pepperoni facing up.
step-9: if opting for the vegetarian version, peel long strips of skin off a tomato.
step-10: (video shows center ring being cut but you can peel strips from top to bottom to use more of the tomato)
step-11: bake at 400°f/ 204°c for 20-25 minutes, or until pepperoni edges are crispy and the dough is fully cooked through.
step-12: remove from the oven and let cool.
step-13: lay over a bed of basil leaves (for taste and presentation).

step-1: soak the wooden skewers in water for at least 30 minutes to prevent burning.
step-2: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c) and line 4 baking sheets, or as many as you have, with parchment paper.
step-3: make the pepperoni pizza sticks: in a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, garlic powder, and italian seasoning.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: unroll the pizza dough on a lightly floured surface and cut into 8 strips.
step-6: fold 5 pepperoni slices into quarters and thread onto a wooden skewer, spacing about 1 inch (2 ½ cm) apart.
step-7: repeat to make 8 skewers total.
step-8: starting at the pointed end of a skewer, weave a dough strip down around the pepperoni slices, pinching at the bottom to secure, and set on a prepared baking sheet.
step-9: repeat with the remaining skewers.
step-10: brush the skewers with the seasoned oil and sprinkle with the parmesan cheese.
step-11: bake the skewers for 10-12 minutes, rotating halfway through, until the dough is golden brown.
step-12: serve with pizza sauce for dipping.
step-13: make the vegetarian pizza sticks: spread the mushrooms, onion, and bell pepper in an even layer on a baking sheet.
step-14: season with salt, pepper, and the red pepper flakes and drizzle with 2 tablespoons of olive oil.
step-15: toss to coat.
step-16: roast the vegetables for 15 minutes, until the mushrooms are golden brown.
step-17: remove from the oven and set aside to cool.
step-18: unroll the pizza dough on a lightly floured surface and cut into 8 strips.
step-19: thread 1 piece of each vegetable onto the skewers to make 1 stack, spacing the stacks about 1 inch (2 ½ cm) apart (you should have about 4 stacks per skewer).
step-20: repeat to make 8 skewers total.
step-21: starting at the pointed end of the skewer, weave a dough strip down around the vegetables, pinching at the bottom to secure, and set on a prepared baking sheet.
step-22: repeat with the remaining skewers.
step-23: brush the skewers with the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil and sprinkle with the mozzarella cheese.
step-24: bake the skewers for 10-12 minutes, rotating halfway through, until the dough is golden brown.
step-25: serve with ranch dressing for dipping.
step-26: make the margherita pizza skewers: unroll the pizza dough on a lightly floured surface and cut into 8 strips.
step-27: thread 5 cherry tomatoes onto a skewer, spacing about 1 inch (2 ½ cm) apart.
step-28: repeat to make 8 skewers total.
step-29: starting at the pointed end of the skewer, weave a dough strip down around the tomatoes, pinching at the bottom to secure, and set on a prepared baking sheet.
step-30: repeat with the remaining skewers.
step-31: brush the skewers with the olive oil and sprinkle with the mozzarella cheese.
step-32: bake the skewers for 10-12 minutes, rotating halfway through, until the dough is golden brown.
step-33: garnish with the basil and serve with pesto for dipping.

step-1: top one piece of bread with marinara sauce, mozzarella cheese, and pepperoni.
step-2: cover with a second piece of bread and butter both slices of bread from edge to edge.
step-3: place in preheated toastie machine and cook until bread is golden brown.
step-4: (if the toastie is not browning evenly, flip half way through).
step-5: remove from toastie and slice in half.

step-1: cut block of mozzarella into small cubes, about a ½ inch (1½ cm).
step-2: cut pepperoni in half.
step-3: in a mixing bowl, combine hash browns, italian seasoning, salt, garlic powder, and egg.
step-4: mix well.
step-5: grab a small handful of the hash brown mixture and flatten out in the palm of your hand.
step-6: place 1 or 2 slices of pepperoni and a cube of cheese on top.
step-7: fold the hash brown mixture around the cheese and pepperoni.
step-8: squeeze and compress until the mixture completely covers the filling and stays in a cylindrical form.
step-9: repeat until all of the mixture is used.
step-10: freeze tots for 20+ minutes.
step-11: in a large saucepan, heat oil to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-12: fry tots in batches, three at a time, until golden brown.
step-13: drain on paper towel.
step-14: serve immediately with marinara sauce.

step-1: slice the pizza dough into 8 equal pieces, then press each piece flat.
step-2: place 4 pieces of dough into a preheated, greased waffle iron.
step-3: spread one tablespoon of marinara, ¼ cup (25 grams) of mozzarella, and 3 slices of pepperoni on each piece of dough.
step-4: top with the 4 remaining pieces of dough and seal.
step-5: cook for 3-5 minutes, until golden brown, then serve.

step-1: bring a pot of water to a boil, then reduce to a simmer to reach poaching temperature, between 160–180°f (71–82°c).
step-2: stir the water in a clockwise direction to create a whirlpool.
step-3: once the water slows down slightly, crack the egg into the center of the whirlpool.
step-4: let the egg cook until the white fully sets and the yolk is no longer runny, 3-5 minutes.
step-5: remove the egg with a slotted spoon, pat dry on paper towels, sprinkle salt and pepper (optional).
step-6: serve with your favorite breakfast items.

step-1: heat oil over medium heat, add garlic and onions and cook until onions have softened and garlic is fragrant.
step-2: add the crushed tomatoes, worcestershire sauce, cayenne pepper, cumin and paprika.
step-3: stir to incorporate.
step-4: add dice tomato and cook until sauce has thickened.
step-5: using a spoon, create wells for the eggs, crack an egg into each well.
step-6: cover and cook for another 5-8 minutes, until the egg whites are cooked but the yolk is still a bit runny.
step-7: garnish with parsley and feta cheese.

step-1: fill a pan with enough water to submerge a fillet.
step-2: bring the water to a simmer.
step-3: add salt, peppercorns, sliced lemon, and thyme to water.
step-4: add salmon, cover the pan, and cook for 20 minutes.
step-5: remove salmon from pan, and season with salt, pepper, and fresh lemon.

step-1: grease a baking sheet with nonstick spray.
step-2: in a medium pot over high heat, add the milk and vegetable broth and bring to a boil.
step-3: whisk in the polenta and reduce the heat to low, whisking continuously for about 5 minutes, or until all the liquid has been absorbed and the polenta is creamy.
step-4: add the butter, salt, pepper, oregano, thyme, and rosemary and stir until well-combined.
step-5: transfer the polenta to the prepared baking sheet and spread out evenly with a spatula.
step-6: chill for at least 2 hours or up to 3 days to set.
step-7: if baking, preheat the oven to 425ºf (220ºc).
step-8: make the aioli: combine the mayonnaise, garlic, parsley, and lemon juice, salt, and pepper in a small bowl and mix until well-combined.
step-9: chill until ready to use.
step-10: carefully flip the baking sheet onto a cutting board to release the polenta.
step-11: slice in half lengthwise, and then cut into 22 equal-sized fries, each about 4 inches (10 cm) long and 1 inch (2 ½ cm) wide.
step-12: if baking, use a spatula to transfer the fries onto wire racks set over 2 baking sheets.
step-13: brush each fry generously with olive oil.
step-14: bake for 30 minutes, flipping halfway through and brushing with more oil, until golden brown.
step-15: if frying, heat the canola oil in a large pot until it reaches 375ºf (190ºc).
step-16: using a large spider, submerge 2 fries at a time into the oil and fry for 2-4 minutes, until golden brown and crispy.
step-17: remove from the oil and transfer to a plate lined with paper towels to cool for at least 5 minutes.
step-18: serve the fries with aioli.

step-1: make the pickled tomato salsa: bring a medium pot of water to boil and set an ice bath nearby.
step-2: remove the cores from the tomatoes and score an “x” on the undersides.
step-3: blanch for 15 seconds in the boiling water, then immediately transfer to the ice bath to stop the cooking.
step-4: peel the skins with a paring knife, then seed and chop the tomatoes.
step-5: in a large bowl, toss the tomatoes with the scallions and serrano chiles.
step-6: in a medium saucepan, bring the vinegar to a boil.
step-7: add the sugar and salt and cook until dissolved, about 1 minute.
step-8: remove the pan from the heat and set aside.
step-9: heat the olive oil in a separate medium saucepan over medium heat until just smoking.
step-10: add the ginger, garlic, mustard seeds, cayenne, cumin, turmeric, and peppercorns and cook, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon, until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
step-11: pour the spice mixture over the tomatoes, followed by the vinegar mixture.
step-12: stir to combine, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for 3-4 hours or several days.
step-13: make the chicken: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-14: season the chicken all over with salt and pepper.
step-15: heat the oil in a large cast iron pan over high heat.
step-16: add the chicken skin-side down and cook for about 9 minutes, until the skin is golden brown and releases easily from the pan.
step-17: flip the chicken and finish cooking in the oven for 10 minutes, until cooked through.
step-18: make the cilantro sauce.
step-19: melt the butter in a medium skillet over medium heat.
step-20: add the shallots and season with salt, then cook until starting to brown.
step-21: add the mushrooms and cook until soft and golden, about 10 minutes.
step-22: add the cilantro stems and leaves, reserving about ½ a bunch of leaves for later on.
step-23: add the cumin and jalapeños, reduce the heat to low, and cook for 5 minutes.
step-24: add the chicken stock.
step-25: increase the heat to high and cook until the liquid is reduced by half.
step-26: add the cream and return to a boil.
step-27: remove the pan from the heat.
step-28: transfer the sauce to a blender with the reserved cilantro leaves and puree.
step-29: return the sauce to the pan.
step-30: whisk the egg yolks, sugar, and vinegar together in a small bowl.
step-31: while continuing to whisk, pour 1 cup (290 g) of the sauce into the egg mixture to temper.
step-32: add the egg mixture to the pan and cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until the sauce is thick and smooth.
step-33: arrange the chicken over a bed of your favorite rice and spoon the cilantro sauce over.
step-34: garnish with the pickled tomato salsa, scallions, and cilantro leaves.
step-35: serve immediately.

step-1: cut the pomegranate in half, and hit it over a bowl with a wooden spoon to release the seeds.
step-2: squeeze half a lemon over the pomegranate seeds.
step-3: pour a half cup of water over the seeds and lemon juice, and spoon the mixture into ice tray of choice.
step-4: freeze the cubes for an hour or until solid.
step-5: in a glass, put one cube and then top with champagne.
step-6: watch the drink transform while the ice cube melts.

step-1: in a large pitcher, combine the pear, pomegranate seeds, simple syrup, pomegranate juice, brandy, and red wine.
step-2: stir well, then chill until ready to serve, up to 2 days.
step-3: immediately before serving, add the ginger beer, and stir to incorporate.
step-4: pour into glasses and garnish with candied ginger.

step-1: add the flour to a large bowl.
step-2: sprinkle the oil over the flour and mix with your hands.
step-3: the mixture should feel like sand.
step-4: add a bit of water at a time and knead into the flour.
step-5: when the dough is ready, it should form a ball and not stick to your fingers.
step-6: cover the dough with damp towel so it doesn’t dry out.
step-7: heat the oil in a deep pot until it reaches 350˚f (170˚c).
step-8: form the dough into ping-pong size balls.
step-9: dip the balls into a small bowl of canola oil and roll them out into flat 2-inch (5 cm) circle shapes.
step-10: immediately drop the rolled dough into the oil.
step-11: use a spider to keep the dough submerged in the oil.
step-12: once it is puffed up, turn over and cook other side.
step-13: fry until golden brown, 2-3 minutes.
step-14: aloo: melt the ghee in a large pot over medium heat.
step-15: once the ghee is completely melted, add the cumin seeds and toast until aromatic, 2-3 minutes.
step-16: add the onion and ginger to the pot.
step-17: cover and cook until the onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
step-18: add the turmeric and mix well.
step-19: add the chopped tomato and season with salt.
step-20: cover and cook until the tomato is very soft, about 10 minutes.
step-21: add the curry powder and mix well.
step-22: add the potatoes and peas, and mix well to incorporate.
step-23: add the water, cover, and cook for 10 minutes, or until the soup thickens.
step-24: garnish with cilantro.

step-1: prepare the spice marinade by mixing all the spices together with the chicken.
step-2: cover with cling film and leave to marinate for 1 hour.
step-3: next, prepare the spice coating by mixing the bread crumbs, chili powder, turmeric, cumin, coriander, salt and pepper together.
step-4: coat each chicken piece in egg wash, followed by the spice coating.
step-5: heat the oil in a deep saucepan to 350°f (180°c).
step-6: carefully place each chicken piece in the oil using a slotted spoon and fry for about 3-4 minutes, until golden brown and cooked through.
step-7: serve with salad and favourite dips of your choice.

step-1: sprinkle nutritional yeast over prepared popcorn.
in a medium bowl, add seasoned flour ingredients.
step-2: mix well.
step-3: place half of the flour mixture into a large zip lock bag, reserve the rest.
step-4: add the shrimp to the bag and shake until each shrimp is coated with flour.
step-5: shake off any excess flour.
step-6: in a separate bowl, add egg, milk, and cajun seasoning.
step-7: mix well.
step-8: dredge the floured shrimp in the egg mixture, then coat with the fresh seasoned flour mixture.
step-9: heat oil at 350°f (180°c).
step-10: fry shrimp for a few minutes until golden brown and cooked through.
step-11: serve with your favorite dipping sauce.

step-1: in a small bowl combine bread crumbs, nutritional yeast, paprika, and garlic powder.
step-2: preheat the oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-3: slice the tofu in half to form two thinner slabs.
step-4: wrap the tofu in paper towels and place a heavy object on top.
step-5: let drain for 10 minutes.
step-6: slice the drained tofu into cubes.
step-7: coat the tofu cubes in mayonnaise and then coat in bread crumb mixture.
step-8: place nuggets on a wire rack over a baking sheet.
step-9: bake for 40 minutes.
step-10: allow to cool 5 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-2: cook the onion and the garlic, until translucent.
step-3: add the washed spinach.
step-4: cook until wilted.
step-5: add the cream cheese, salt, and pepper, and stir until melted.
step-6: set aside and allow to cool.
step-7: make a slit on the side of the pork chop, making a pocket but not cutting all the way through.
step-8: fill the pork chop with the spinach mixture.
step-9: season with salt and pepper both sides.
step-10: in a hot pan, sear the pork chop, until golden brown on both sides.
step-11: move pork chop to a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes, or until pork is cooked through.
step-12: serve with your favorite side - we chose mashed potatoes!

step-1: slice the pork tenderloin into equal medallions, roughly ¼ inch (6 mm).
step-2: pound the cutlets thin.
step-3: slice into slider size, roughly 3 square inches (7 ½ cm).
step-4: mix flour, salt, and pepper in one bowl.
step-5: whisk two eggs in another bowl.
step-6: pour bread crumbs in the third bowl.
step-7: dredge each cutlet in the flour mix, then egg mix, then breadcrumbs.
step-8: heat up cooking oil in a large pan.
step-9: fry the cutlets until they are golden brown.
step-10: set cutlets on a paper towel to remove excess grease.
step-11: melt butter in a skillet over medium heat.
step-12: add sliced onions and cook until starting to brown.
step-13: pour beer and stir occasionally.
step-14: when the liquid is gone, the onions are ready.
step-15: stack your sliders: pork, lemon juice, cheese, onion, sliced red cabbage, pork, and insert a toothpick to hold the slider together.
step-16: serve with dressing of choice (optional).

step-1: slice the stem off of the peppers so that they will stand steadily when flipped upside down.
step-2: slice the peppers into quarters from the bottom to the top around the core and seeds.
step-3: slice each quarter into 1-inch (2 ½ cm) thick slices.
step-4: transfer to a large bowl.
step-5: add ½ teaspoon salt, ¼ teaspoon cumin, ½ teaspoon smoked paprika, 1 teaspoon chili powder, and ½ teaspoon red pepper flakes.
step-6: toss to coat the peppers evenly in the spices and set aside.
step-7: remove the stems from the portobello mushrooms and slice into 1-inch-wide (2 cm) pieces, then transfer a large bowl.
step-8: add the remaining ½ teaspoon salt, ½ teaspoon chili powder, ½ teaspoon smoked paprika, ¼ teaspoon cumin, and ½ teaspoon red pepper flakes.
step-9: toss to coat the mushrooms evenly in the spices and set aside.
step-10: thinly slice the onion.
step-11: heat oil in a large cast-iron pan over medium-high heat.
step-12: add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until translucent, about 3 minutes.
step-13: add the garlic and bell peppers, and cook for about 5 more minutes, stirring constantly until peppers are tender.
step-14: remove the pepper and onion mixture from the pan and set aside.
step-15: add the mushrooms to the skillet and cook until the mushrooms are tender, stirring constantly, about 5 minutes
step-16: divide the brown rice between 4 food storage containers.
step-17: top each container with pico de gallo, black beans, corn, cheddar cheese, the cooked bell peppers and onions, and the sliced portobello.
step-18: garnish with an avocado slice, a lime wedge, and cilantro.
step-19: store in the refrigerator for up to 4 days.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, microwave black beans for 1 minute, or until softened.
step-3: add salt and garlic.
step-4: mash until black beans are finely mashed.
step-5: add mushrooms, walnuts, and parsley.
step-6: in a small bowl, mix ground flax and water and stir until thoroughly combined.
step-7: add flax mixture to the mushroom mixture and mix thoroughly.
step-8: using a ½ cup (120 ml) measuring cup, portion 5 patties from the mixture.
step-9: place onto a lightly greased parchment-lined sheet pan.
step-10: bake for 30 minutes, or until firm and browned, flipping over halfway through.
step-11: serve burgers with your favorite fixins.

step-1: preheat oven to 220°c (425°f).
step-2: in a small pan, place the sugar, water, and cinnamon stick.
step-3: simmer for 3 minutes and set aside.
step-4: combine milk and cream in a saucepan and place over a medium heat.
step-5: bring mixture to a boil, then remove from the heat and set aside.
step-6: to a large bowl, add the egg yolks, whole egg, vanilla extract, and corn flour.
step-7: whisk until fully combined and no lumps remain.
step-8: temper the egg mixture by introducing the hot milk and cream in two 100 milliliter batches, then whisk.
step-9: return mixture to the saucepan and place over a low-medium heat.
step-10: whisk continually until mixture thickens.
step-11: turn off heat.
step-12: remove cinnamon stick from the syrup and slowly trickle into the custard, whisking continually.
step-13: lightly flour a work surface and cut puff pastry into 12 equal pieces.
step-14: to a lightly greased muffin tin, push each piece of puff pastry down and up into the sides of the muffin holes until evenly distributed.
step-15: pour custard into each muffin tin so each one is three quarters full.
step-16: bake for 16-20 minutes until golden and brown.
step-17: serve warm with a dusting of icing sugar and a sprinkle of cinnamon.

step-1: pat the chuck roast dry with paper towels.
step-2: season on all sides with salt and pepper.
step-3: put the instant pot on “saute”.
step-4: once it says “hot”, add the oil.
step-5: when the oil is shimmering, add the chuck roast.
step-6: sear the meat until brown, about 3-5 minutes per side.
step-7: add the onion, carrots, and beef broth to the pot.
step-8: mix around until evenly distributed.
step-9: set the pressure knob to “sealing” and close the lid until it beeps.
step-10: tip: closing the lid can be tricky.
step-11: have the pressure knob at 11 o’clock and turn right.
step-12: select “manual” and increase to 50 minutes.
step-13: it will say “on” in a few seconds.
step-14: note: the instant pot will need to warm up for 5-10 minutes.
step-15: steam will be released and a few minutes later, the time will start counting down.
step-16: after the time has expired, let the pot roast rest in the pot for 10 minutes.
step-17: it will count up and read “l 0:10”.
step-18: using a towel or mit, release the pressure knob from “sealing” to “venting”.
step-19: after the steam has been released, carefully take out the roast and veggies and transfer to a plate or cutting board, only leaving the liquid in the pot.
step-20: cover the roast and veggies with foil.
step-21: set the instant pot to “saute” and once the liquid comes to a boil, add the flour.
step-22: whisk until mixed in and sauce has thickened, about 1-2 minutes.
step-23: hit “cancel” and remove the pot.
step-24: pour the sauce into another small bowl and cover to keep warm.
step-25: then clean out the instant pot.
step-26: place the cauliflower florets in the pot.
step-27: pour in the beef broth.
step-28: seal the lid and set the pressure knob to “sealing”.
step-29: select “manual” and set time to 5 minutes.
step-30: once time is up, using a towel or mit, release the pressure knob from “sealing” to “venting”.
step-31: after steam has been released, carefully remove pot and dump out the liquid.
step-32: using a potato masher or fork, mash the cauliflower until smooth.
step-33: add the salt, pepper, garlic, and sour cream.
step-34: stir until everything is combined.
step-35: serve with pot roast and gravy.

step-1: preheat oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-2: thinly slice potatoes.
step-3: soak potatoes in just enough cold water to cover the potatoes for 10 minutes.
step-4: then pat dry.
step-5: in a medium bowl, mix together heavy cream, salt, italian seasoning, black pepper and melted butter.
step-6: add potato slices and evenly coat every piece in the cream mixture.
step-7: line baking tray with parchment paper and place one sheet of puff pastry.
step-8: with a fork, evenly poke the entire sheet.
step-9: place shredded or grated parmesan cheese on the puff pastry.
step-10: then layer each potato slice to cover the sheet, leaving ½ inch on all sides.
step-11: with 2 spoons, scoop small amounts of goat cheese on top of the potatoes.
step-12: season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
step-13: bake for 30 minutes or until the crust is golden brown.
step-14: with a peeler hold the bottom of the asparagus and carefully peel from bottom to the tip.
step-15: peel twice on one side, then flip over to peel the other side.
step-16: it will give you a even ribbon.
step-17: put all the asparagus ribbons into a bowl and mix in salt, pepper, olive oil and lemon juice.
step-18: toss the ribbons until evenly coated.
step-19: place the asparagus ribbons on top of the freshly baked potato tart, then slice.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: tear off 8 12-inch (30 cm) square sheets of foil.
step-3: stack 2 sheets of foil and fold in the long sides, then the short sides, to make a tray.
step-4: repeat with the remaining foil and set the trays in an 18 x 13-inch (45 x 33 cm) baking sheet.
step-5: make the cheddar broccoli potatoes: in a large bowl, season the potatoes with the salt and pepper and toss to coat.
step-6: add the bacon, 1 cup of broccoli (150 g), and the nacho cheese sauce.
step-7: mix until the potatoes are fully coated.
step-8: pour the mixture into 1 section of the prepared pan.
step-9: sprinkle the cheddar cheese and remaining cup of broccoli on top.
step-10: make the creamy spinach potatoes: in a medium microwave-safe bowl, mix together the cream cheese, heavy cream, ½ cup (150 g) mozzarella cheese, and the spinach.
step-11: microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring between, until the cheese is completely melted, about 1 minute total.
step-12: in a large bowl, season the potatoes with the salt and pepper and toss to coat.
step-13: add the spinach mixture and mix until the potatoes are fully coated.
step-14: pour the mixture into another section of the prepared pan.
step-15: sprinkle the remaining ½ cup (50 g) mozzarella on top.
step-16: make the chili potatoes: in a large bowl, season the potatoes with the chili powder, pepper, and salt and toss to coat.
step-17: add the chili and mix until the potatoes are fully coated.
step-18: pour the mixture into another section of the prepared pan and sprinkle the cheddar cheese on top.
step-19: make the pizza potatoes: in a large bowl, season the potatoes with the salt, pepper, and oregano.
step-20: add the marinara sauce and mix until the potatoes are fully coated.
step-21: pour the mixture into the last section of the prepared pan and sprinkle the mozzarella cheese on top.
step-22: arrange pepperoni on top.
step-23: bake for 45 minutes, until the potatoes are tender.
step-24: serve immediately, or portion into reusable containers and store in the fridge for up to 4 days.
step-25: to reheat, place portion in a microwave-safe container.
step-26: place in microwave and cook for 2-3 minutes.
step-27: if contents are not heated through, continue cooking in 30-second intervals.

step-1: peel and chop the potatoes very finely.
step-2: place in a bowl, cover with cold water, and leave until ready to fry.
step-3: to make the batter, mix the chickpea flour, turmeric, chili powder, pepper, salt bicarbonate of soda, chillies, and coriander.
step-4: gradually add the water while whisking to form a smooth batter.
step-5: heat a pot of oil to 160˚c (320°f).
step-6: drain the potato slices and dip in the batter.
step-7: fry in vegetable oil until golden brown (around 3-4 minutes).
step-8: serve with spicy ketchup.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: in a large ziploc bag, add the flour, salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, and stir to combine.
step-3: in a wide dish, beat the eggs
step-4: in a separate ziploc bag, crush your favorite type of potato chip.
step-5: to bread the chicken, first place the chicken slices in the bag of seasoned flour and shake until completely coated, then pour the chicken into the egg mixture and stir with a slotted spoon until completely coated.
step-6: place the egg-coated chicken and place into the bag of crushed chips and shake until they are completely coated.
step-7: pour the potato chip-coated chicken onto a parchment paper-lined sheet tray.
step-8: bake for 25 minutes, or until the chicken reaches an internal temperature of 165°f (74°c) and is golden brown.
step-9: serve with your favorite dipping sauce.

step-1: add enough oil to a large dutch oven or heavy-bottomed pot to come about halfway up the sides.
step-2: heat the oil until it reaches 375˚f (190˚c).
step-3: slice the onions ¾-inch (19 cm) thick and separate into individual rings.
step-4: place the original potato chips in a resealable plastic bag and crush into crumbs.
step-5: transfer to a shallow bowl and repeat with the sour cream and onion and bbq chips, adding each flavor to a separate bowl.
step-6: add the flour and eggs to 2 more shallow bowls.
step-7: to the eggs, add the buttermilk and a pinch of salt and pepper and beat to combine.
step-8: add 1 teaspoon salt and 1 teaspoon pepper to the flour and mix to combine.
step-9: with one hand, dredge an onion ring in the flour mixture and gently shake off any excess.
step-10: with the other hand, dip the onion ring in the egg mixture and let any excess drip off.
step-11: dip once more in the flour, then the egg.
step-12: dip the onion ring in 1 of the 3 chip flavors, ensuring that the ring is coated thoroughly.
step-13: set on a baking sheet and repeat with the remaining onion rings, coating about ⅓ of the rings in each chip flavor.
step-14: working in batches, fry the onion rings in the hot oil for 2-3 minutes, until golden brown.
step-15: watch carefully, as the onion rings will cook quickly.
step-16: transfer to a wire rack to drain.
step-17: sprinkle the onion rings with parsley and serve with your favorite dipping sauces.

step-1: smush the crisps into little bits.
step-2: cut the chicken breast into small bite sized chunks.
step-3: one at a time, add a piece of chicken to the bag and shake it around a bit.
step-4: squeeze to help the the crisps stick to the chicken.
step-5: continue until you have either run out of chicken or crisps! (don’t eat any leftover crisps that have come into contact with the raw chicken).
step-6: place the coated chicken onto a baking tray.
step-7: bake in the centre of a pre-heated oven for 12 minutes at 200°c/400°f
step-8: serve with ketchup, mayo or whatever you like!

step-1: preheat the oven to 500ºf (260ºc).
step-2: make the crust: in a large microwave-safe bowl, microwave the hash browns on high power for 5-6 minutes, until you can separate the shredded potato pieces with your fingers but they still hold their shape.
step-3: transfer the shredded potatoes to a clean dish towel set over a medium bowl.
step-4: wring the towel to squeeze any excess liquid from the potatoes.
step-5: add the drained potatoes to a large bowl with the eggs, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and oregano and stir until everything is well incorporated.
step-6: the mixture should look like mashed potatoes, with a few shredded potato pieces remaining.
step-7: line a 12-inch (30 cm) round pizza pan with parchment paper.
step-8: transfer the potato mixture to the pan and shape it into a crust, pressing down so that it’s an even thickness with a lip around the outer edge.
step-9: brush the entire crust with olive oil.
step-10: bake for 22-25 minutes, until the crust is beginning to brown and is firm to the touch.
step-11: remove from the oven.
step-12: reduce the oven temperature to 325ºf (160ºc).
step-13: add the toppings: scatter the monterey jack cheese evenly over the crust.
step-14: top with the breakfast sausage.
step-15: carefully add the eggs, spacing evenly around the pizza.
step-16: season the eggs with salt and pepper.
step-17: bake the pizza for 10-12 minutes, until the egg whites are set and the yolks are still a bit runny.
step-18: top with the scallions and hot sauce, if using, then slice into wedges.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: thinly slice the potatoes using a mandoline and a hand guard.
step-3: fill the bowl of sliced potatoes with water to rinse off excess starch.
step-4: drain the potatoes through colander and transfer back into the bowl.
step-5: add the salt, garlic powder, and black pepper, and mix thoroughly until fully coated.
step-6: assemble the potato slices in heart shape onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-7: place a sheet of parchment paper on top of the potatoes, and add a pan with heavy ovenproof weight, such as a cast-iron pan.
step-8: bake for 50 minutes.
step-9: remove the parchment paper, baking sheet, and weight on top of the potatoes.
step-10: for the classic toppings, add tomato sauce, mozzarella, fresh mozzarella, and basil in the upper left corner of the potato heart.
step-11: for barbeque chicken toppings, add tomato sauce, mozzarella, cheddar, red onion, bbq chicken, parsley, and bacon in the lower left corner of the potato heart.
step-12: for supreme combo toppings, add tomato sauce, mozzarella, pepperoni, italian sausage, mushroom, white onion, and green pepper in the lower right corner of the potato heart.
step-13: for spinach artichoke toppings, add the spinach artichoke dip in the upper right corner of the potato heart.
step-14: bake for 10 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: thinly slice the potatoes with a knife or mandoline.
step-3: put the sliced potatoes in a bowl and drizzle with olive oil, 1 teaspoon of salt, ¼ teaspoon of pepper, and parmesan and use your hands or a spoon to evenly coat the potato slices.
step-4: lay the potato slices in a pie dish starting from the middle and working your way out, overlapping the potato slices.
step-5: line the edge of the pie dish with overlapping potato slices.
step-6: fill in any gaps with leftover potato slices.
