step-7: bake the potatoes for 15 minutes or until the potatoes are just cooked and not yet brown.
step-8: in a bowl, whisk the eggs, milk, tomato, green onions, bacon, cheddar cheese, 1 teaspoon of salt, ¼ teaspoon of pepper, and garlic powder.
step-9: slowly pour the egg mixture over the potatoes, if the potatoes begin to lift up, stop and press them down with a spoon.
step-10: bake the quiche for 30 minutes or until the eggs are set and the potatoes are brown.
step-11: slice and serve.

step-1: note: cats should only consume these kitty-friendly ingredients in moderation.
step-2: preheat the oven to 180ºc (350ºf).
step-3: in a bowl, mix the mashed potato, peas, corn, carrots, ham and half of the parmesan cheese.
step-4: mix well.
step-5: mix the breadcrumbs and remaining parmesan cheese together.
step-6: dip each shrimp in egg, then breadcrumbs.
step-7: place in a baking tray.
step-8: drizzle olive oil on top.
step-9: bake for 10 minutes or until the breadcrumbs turn golden and the prawns are cooked through.
step-10: grease a regular-size muffin mold, and a mini one.
step-11: add some of the potato mix until the molds are full.
step-12: using your fingers, mold a hole in the middle of the cups.
step-13: place a whole shrimp in the hole of the regular-size cups.
step-14: add half a shrimp to the mini cups.
step-15: add mexican blend cheese (or cheddar) to your cups, and lightly sprinkle the mini cups.
step-16: bake for 10 minutes or until the cheese on top turns golden.
step-17: add sour cream and cilantro to your cups.
step-18: sprinkle catnip on your cat’s mini cups.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: with a mandolin or a sharp knife, carefully cut the potatoes into ¹⁄₁₆-inch (1 mm) thick slices.
step-3: add the potato slices to a large bowl and cover with water.
step-4: toss the potatoes around to remove excess starch, then drain.
step-5: add 1 teaspoon of salt, the pepper, paprika, and garlic powder and toss the potatoes until evenly coated.
step-6: add the oil to a small bowl.
step-7: dip a paper towel in the oil and grease the cups of a 12-cup muffin tin.
step-8: arrange 5 potatoes around the sides of a muffin cup, overlapping slightly.
step-9: place 1 slice on the bottom to create a flower.
step-10: repeat with the remaining potato slices.
step-11: sprinkle shredded cheese over the potato cups.
step-12: bake for 10 minutes.
step-13: remove the potato cups from the oven and reduce the oven temperature to 300°f (150°c).
step-14: sprinkle bacon over the cheese.
step-15: add an egg to each cup.
step-16: sprinkle with salt.
step-17: bake for another 20-25 minutes, or until the egg whites are mostly cooked.
step-18: serve warm.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: slice the peeled potatoes into ½ centimeter (¼ inch) slices.
step-3: season the potatoes with salt and pepper, tossing them to make sure they’re coated evenly.
step-4: press a layer of potatoes evenly into the bottom of a greased, square baking pan.
step-5: place half of the ham slices evenly on top of the potatoes, followed by half of the sliced cheese.
step-6: follow with another layer of potatoes, then the remaining ham and sliced cheese.
step-7: sprinkle the bacon and parsley evenly on top of the sliced cheese, and place one final layer of potatoes on top.
step-8: sprinkle the shredded cheese on top of the potatoes, then press it into an even layer.
step-9: in a small bowl, mix the heavy cream and eggs.
step-10: pour on top of the shredded cheese.
step-11: bake for about 40 minutes, until the cheese is a deep golden brown.
step-12: cool slightly, slice, then serve!

step-1: using a food processor fitted with a grater blade or the large holes of a box grater, grate the onion.
step-2: transfer to a bowl and set aside.
step-3: grate the potatoes in the food processor or on a box grater.
step-4: line a large bowl with paper towels or a clean kitchen towel.
step-5: squeeze the excess liquid from the potatoes into the bowl.
step-6: drain the liquid, then add the potatoes to the bowl, along with the grated onion, and toss to combine.
step-7: add the flour, salt, and eggs and stir to combine.
step-8: heat 2 inches (5 cm) of vegetable oil in a heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat until it reaches 350˚f (180˚c).
step-9: dollop about ¼ cup (30 g) of the latke mixture at a time into the hot oil and spread to make pancakes, about 3 inches in diameter.
step-10: do not overcrowd the pan.
step-11: reduce the heat to medium and fry until the latkes are browned on the bottom and the edges are crispy, 3-5 minutes.
step-12: flip and cook on the other side for about 5 minutes more, until browned and crispy.
step-13: transfer the latkes to a paper towel-lined plate to drain and repeat with the remaining batter.
step-14: serve the latkes with cinnamon applesauce and sour cream.

step-1: melt butter on medium heat in a large pot.
step-2: add the chopped leeks and stir until coated with butter.
step-3: cover the pot and lower heat, cook for around 10 minutes until the leeks have softened.
step-4: increase to medium-high.
step-5: add garlic, potatoes, salt, and pepper.
step-6: cook for 1 minute, then add vegetable broth, water, thyme, and bay leaf.
step-7: bring to a boil.
step-8: lower heat and cover pot with a lid and simmer for 15 minutes, or until potatoes are tender and easily speared by a fork.
step-9: uncover and remove thyme and bay leaf.
step-10: use an immersion or countertop blender to blend the soup until smooth.
step-11: stir in chives and hot sauce (optional).
step-12: allow to cool 2 minutes and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: using a mandolin and a hand guard, thinly slice the potatoes into a large mixing bowl.
step-3: add olive oil, garlic powder, thyme, rosemary, pepper, and salt to the sliced potatoes and toss with tongs until evenly coated.
step-4: on a cutting board, lay out two pieces of bacon overlapping each other vertically.
step-5: line the bacon with the sliced potatoes, making sure each potato is overlapping.
step-6: starting at one end, gently roll up the bacon, creating a potato rose.
step-7: place the rolled potato roses in a greased muffin tin.
step-8: repeat with the remaining bacon strips and potatoes.
step-9: bake for 20 minutes.
step-10: cover the roses with tin foil, and bake for an additional 30 minutes.
step-11: top the roses with thyme and parmesan.
step-12: bake for an addition 5-10 minutes uncovered.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: thoroughly wash potatoes, cut in half, and slice into wedges.
step-3: toss wedges in olive oil and seasonings.
step-4: place on a baking sheet, skin side down.
step-5: bake 40-50 minutes.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: grease and line a 8-inch (20 cm) square baking dish with parchment paper.
step-3: in a food processor, combine the bananas, black beans, cocoa powder, almond butter, almond flour, salt, baking powder, and vanilla.
step-4: pulse until smooth.
step-5: pour the batter into the prepared baking dish.
step-6: sprinkle the dark chocolate chips over the top.
step-7: bake for 25 minutes, or until the brownies are set.
step-8: let cool, then slice into 12 pieces.
step-9: enjoy the brownies immediately, or store in the fridge for 1 week or in the freezer for up to 1 month.

step-1: add the lemon juice, garlic, herbs, salt, and pepper into the melted butter and mix well.
step-2: on soaked bamboo sticks, skewer on the prawns and asparagus.
step-3: repeat until the skewer is full.
step-4: brush the butter mix onto to skewer.
step-5: on a coal bbq, cook the steak skewers for 1-2 minutes a side, until the prawns turn pink and are cooked through.

step-1: layer the raspberries, blueberries, strawberries, chia seeds, spinach, cinnamon, and almond butter in a mason jar.
step-2: store in the freezer for up to 5 days.
step-3: when ready to serve, add the milk or water to a blender then add the contents of the mason jar.
step-4: blend until smooth.
step-5: pour smoothie back into the jar.

step-1: scoop the avocado into a medium bowl.
step-2: season with salt and add the lemon juice.
step-3: mash until smooth.
step-4: spread the avocado on the slice of toast.
step-5: line 8 chickpeas at the top of the toast, then 6 edamame underneath, then repeat with the remaining chickpeas and edamame.

step-1: cut chicken breasts into 2 inch (5 cm) pieces.
step-2: mix pretzels and cheese in food processor.
step-3: add pepper to flour and mix in a separate bowl.
step-4: whisk eggs in another bowl, and pour cheese/pretzel mix in a third.
step-5: bread chicken by first covering in flour, then dipping in egg, and finally coating in pretzel/ cheese mix.
step-6: fry in vegetable oil.
step-7: flip several times until fully cooked.
step-8: serve with ketchup or your favorite dipping sauce!

step-1: preheat the oven to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-2: dust the cutting board with flour, and cut the pizza dough into 4 equal pieces.
step-3: roll each piece of dough out until it’s a 12-inch (30 ½ cm) rope.
step-4: it’s okay if the dough naturally shrinks.
step-5: take the rolled out dough and wrap it around a hot dog in a spiraling motion, leaving room on the ends.
step-6: in a pot, combine the baking soda with the water and bring it to a boil.
step-7: cook each pretzel dog in the solution for 30 seconds each.
step-8: remove with a slotted spoon and transfer to a baking tray.
step-9: brush each pretzel dog with the egg wash.
step-10: top the pretzels with your toppings of choice.
step-11: for sea salt, sprinkle the salt on top.
step-12: for jalapeño cheddar, top the pretzel with cheddar cheese, then follow with jalapeños.
step-13: for garlic butter, combine the butter, garlic, and parsley, and brush on top.
step-14: for pizza, top with mozzarella and follow with pepperoni.
step-15: bake in the oven for 12-15 minutes, or until it reaches a deep golden brown.

step-1: preheat oven to 300°f (150˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, whisk together the melted butter, worcestershire sauce, sesame seeds, garlic powder, onion powder, sesame seeds, salt, and black pepper.
step-3: add the pretzels and toss to coat.
step-4: transfer to a baking sheet and spread evenly.
step-5: bake until the pretzels are crisp and the seeds golden, stirring often, 10-15 minutes.
step-6: set aside to cool completely.
step-7: in a food processor combine the cheese, garlic, worcestershire sauce, mustard, paprika, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper, and pulse to combine.
step-8: with the processor running, slowly pour in the beer, blending until the mixture is smooth and spreadable.
step-9: season with salt, pepper, and cayenne to taste.
step-10: transfer the beer cheese to a serving bowl and cover with plastic wrap.
step-11: refrigerate for at least 2 hours or up to overnight.
step-12: serve beer cheese with pretzels.

step-1: slice the italian loaf, cutting slices about an inch (2 cm) in thickness.
step-2: (make sure the bread is room temperature for the best taste!)
step-3: place 8 slices of capicola, all stacked on top of each other, on a pan or griddle.
step-4: cook over medium heat for 3-4 minutes.
step-5: flip the capicola over and add the provolone cheese.
step-6: cook until the cheese melts.
step-7: place the capicola and cheese on one slice of bread.
step-8: top with fries, coleslaw, tomato slices, and top with the other slice of bread.

step-1: preheat oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-2: with a sharp knife, slice the squash in half.
step-3: if the squash is too tough, puncture in several places forming a dotted line around the squash.
step-4: microwave for 3-5 minutes to soften.
step-5: allow to cool before cutting in half.
step-6: scoop out the seeds, brush with oil, and sprinkle with salt, and pepper.
step-7: bake for 40-45 minutes, or until a fork can easily pierce the skin.
step-8: meanwhile, in a pan combine oil, garlic, and onion over medium heat, and sautè until onions are translucent.
step-9: add mushrooms and cook for 3 minutes.
step-10: add the broccoli, asparagus, squash, tomatoes, salt, and pepper and cook until almost cooked through.
step-11: add the milk/ milk alternative until warmed through.
step-12: add the vegetarian parmesan and mix until evenly spread throughout vegetables.
step-13: add the lemon juice and stir to combine.
step-14: remove squash from the oven, with a fork pull at the edges to produce that stringy “spaghetti” quality.
step-15: in the pan combine “spaghetti” with vegetables.
step-16: return to the squash and top with parmesan.

step-1: on a cutting board, thoroughly blot the prime rib with paper towels to absorb any moisture.
step-2: generously season the prime rib all over with salt and pepper.
step-3: place the prime rib in dish with tall sides and set in the refrigerator uncovered to rest for at least 2-4 hours, or overnight.
step-4: transfer the prime rib to a roasting rack set inside a roasting pan and let come to room temperature for 1 hour before roasting.
step-5: preheat the oven to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-6: roast the prime rib for 30 minutes.
step-7: reduce the oven temperature to 325˚f (160˚c).
step-8: continue roasting the rib for 11 minutes per pound, until the internal temperature of the roast reaches 120˚f-125˚f (45-50˚c), for medium rare.
step-9: remove the rib from the oven, tent with foil, and let rest for 30 minutes.
step-10: transfer the roast to a cutting board and carve.

step-1: preheat oven to 500°f (260°c).
step-2: mix together the butter, garlic, herbs, salt, and pepper in a bowl until evenly combined.
step-3: rub the herb butter all over the rib roast, then place on a roasting tray with a rack.
step-4: bake for 5 minutes per pound (10 minutes per kilo) of meat, so a 5-pound (2.2 kg) roast would bake for 25 minutes.
step-5: turn off the heat and let the rib roast sit in the oven for 2 hours, making sure you do not open the oven door or else the residual heat will escape.
step-6: once the 2 hours are up, remove the roast from the pan and pour the pan drippings into a saucepan over medium heat.
step-7: add the flour, whisking until there are no lumps, then add the beef stock, stirring and bringing the sauce to a boil.
step-8: remove from heat and strain the sauce into a gravy dish.
step-9: carve the prime rib into ¾-inch (20 mm) slices.
step-10: serve with the mashed potatoes, green beans, and sauce!

step-1: combine milk, yogurt, and frozen fruit into a blender and mix until consistency is smooth.
preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: to make the flax eggs, combine the flax meal and water in a small bowl and mix well.
step-3: set aside for 10 minutes to thicken.
step-4: in a large bowl, combine the oats, quinoa, baking powder, salt, maple syrup, coconut oil, vanilla, flax eggs, and bananas, and mix until well-combined.
step-5: divide the base dough equally between 4 medium bowls.
step-6: add the peanut butter and chocolate chips to a bowl and mix until combined.
step-7: add the apple, walnuts, cinnamon, and nutmeg to another bowl and mix until combined.
step-8: add the carrots, cinnamon, nutmeg, and almond butter to another bowl and mix until combined.
step-9: add the almond butter, strawberries, raspberries, and blueberries to the last bowl and mix until combined.
step-10: grease 2, 9x13-inch (23x33-cm) baking pans with nonstick spray.
step-11: transfer the bar mixtures to the pans, packing each mixture into half of a pan with a spoon or spatula.
step-12: bake for 25-30 minutes, until the edges are slightly golden brown.
step-13: remove the pans from the oven and let the bars cool for 20 minutes, then refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 5 days.
step-14: gently cut each flavor into 6 bars, then remove from the pans with a spatula.

step-1: preheat oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-2: combine marinade ingredients in a small bowl and whisk to combine.
step-3: add the marinade and tofu to a container and marinate for at least 30 minutes, up to a day.
step-4: lay sweet potato, onion, and garlic on a baking sheet and drizzle with oil, salt, and pepper.
step-5: bake for 20-25 minutes.
step-6: add the chickpeas, salt, pepper, chili powder, and garlic powder to a bowl and stir to combine.
step-7: transfer chickpeas to a skillet and cook over medium heat for about 10 minutes.
step-8: set chickpeas aside.
step-9: fry the tofu in the same pan for about 10 minutes on each side.
step-10: slice tofu to your preference.
step-11: combine the quinoa, greens, sweet potatoes, onions, chickpeas, carrots, tofu, and avocado in a medium-large bowl and top off with lemon juice

step-1: in a large pot, over medium heat, combine oil, garlic, onion, pepper, jalapeño, salt, pepper, cayenne pepper, chili powder, and cumin.
step-2: sauté until onion is translucent, 5-6 minutes.
step-3: add tomatoes, crushed tomatoes, vegetable broth, water, quinoa, kidney beans, pinto beans, and black beans.
step-4: bring to a boil.
step-5: cover and reduce to a simmer for 25-30 minutes.
step-6: add corn, lime juice, oregano, and cilantro, cover again and simmer for 5 minutes.
step-7: allow to cool 2 minutes.
step-8: serve topped with avocado and cilantro.

step-1: make the avocado dressing: in a blender, combine the avocado, lime juice, olive oil, garlic, pepper, salt, and water, and blend until smooth.
step-2: heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
step-3: add the onion and sauté until translucent, 3 minutes.
step-4: add the garlic, tofu, paprika, cumin, and chili powder, and stir to combine.
step-5: add the soy sauce, stir, and cook for 3 minutes more, until tofu mixture is evenly heated.
step-6: transfer the tofu to a medium bowl and set aside.
step-7: add more oil to the pan if needed, then add the sweet potatoes, ½ teaspoon salt, and ½ teaspoon pepper.
step-8: stir, cover, and cook for about 5 minutes, until sweet potatoes are tender.
step-9: remove the sweet potato from the pan and set aside.
step-10: add the chickpeas, garlic powder, chili powder, remaining ¼ teaspoon salt, and remaining ¼ teaspoon pepper.
step-11: stir and cook for about 5 minutes, until the chickpeas are crispy.
step-12: remove chickpeas and set aside.
step-13: reduce the heat to medium-low, add a tortilla to the pan and sprinkle with ½ cup cheese, then cover with another tortilla.
step-14: cook until the cheese melts, about 3 minutes, flipping once halfway through.
step-15: repeat with the remaining tortillas and cheese.
step-16: transfer the tortillas to plates and fill with with spinach, tofu, tomatoes, black beans, corn, sweet potatoes, and chickpeas.
step-17: drizzle with avocado dressing.
step-18: fold in the left and right sides of the tortillas and roll up from the bottom, tucking the bottom edges under the filling.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400℉ (200℃).
step-2: spray a baking sheet with nonstick spray.
step-3: reserve a few broccoli florets, then place the remaining broccoli, chickpeas, brussels sprouts, sweet potato, and tofu on the baking sheet in individual piles.
step-4: drizzle with the olive oil and season with salt, pepper, and chili powder.
step-5: bake for 25 minutes, until the vegetables are tender and the tofu is browned.
step-6: in a large mason jar, combine the hummus, lemon juice, olive oil, thyme, salt, pepper, and water.
step-7: stir to combine.
step-8: add the reserved raw broccoli, the roasted broccoli, chickpeas, brussels sprouts, sweet potato, tofu, and spinach and screw on the lid.
step-9: store in the refrigerator until ready to eat, up to 5 days.
step-10: give the mason jar a good shake to mix and use a fork or spoon to stir as needed.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: make three vertical cuts from top to bottom of each puff pastry sheet.
step-3: the cuts should be about 2.5-inches (6-cm) apart.
step-4: repeat horizontally to make 18 squares.
step-5: brush a square pastry lightly with water then place another square on top of it.
step-6: cut off any uneven edges.
step-7: repeat with the remaining squares.
step-8: place the square pairs about 1-inch apart on a baking sheet, and brush the top of each with the egg wash.
step-9: bake for 20 minutes or until pastry is a pale golden color.
step-10: remove from oven and let cool.
step-11: in a large pan, combine olive oil, peppers, salt and pepper.
step-12: cook for 8 minutes or until the peppers have softened.
step-13: cut a rectangle in the middle of each square puff pastry and push it down.
step-14: fill the inside of the puff with a thin layer of bacon, cheddar cheese, and peppers.
step-15: use a small spoon or utensil to push the layers down.
step-16: carefully crack an egg on top.
step-17: bake for an additional 20 minutes or until egg white is no longer translucent or runny.
step-18: serve with pepper and chives.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: in a pan over medium heat, melt butter.
step-3: add the garlic and onions, cooking until translucent.
step-4: add the spinach, salt, and pepper, cooking until spinach is wilted.
step-5: add the breadcrumbs, cream cheese, parmesan, and dill, stirring until mixture is evenly combined.
step-6: remove from heat and set aside.
step-7: on a cutting board, smooth out the sheet of puff pastry.
step-8: place the salmon in the middle of the pastry and season both sides with salt and pepper.
step-9: place several spoonfuls of the spinach mixture on top of the salmon, smoothing it out so that it does not spill over the sides.
step-10: fold the edges of the puff pastry over the salmon and spinach, starting with the longer sides and then the shorter ends.
step-11: trim any excess pastry from the ends, then fold the ends on top.
step-12: flip the puff pastry-wrapped salmon over and transfer for a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-13: brush the beaten egg on the top and sides of the pastry.
step-14: score the top of the pastry with a knife, cutting shallow diagonal lines to create a crosshatch pattern.
step-15: brush the top again with the egg wash.
step-16: bake for 20-25 minutes, until pastry is golden brown.
step-17: slice, then serve!

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: on a cutting board, divide the dough into 10 equal balls.
step-3: begin rolling a ball of dough into a 6-inch (15-cm) tube and flatten until the strip of dough is about ⅛-inch (⅓-cm)thick.
step-4: place 5 pieces of string cheese on the strip of dough, spacing about ½ an inch ( 1 ¼-cm) apart.
step-5: pull up the dough to wrap around the pieces of mozzarella and seal together.
step-6: roll the cheese-stuffed tube of dough to close any remaining holes in the dough.
step-7: repeat with the dough and cheese.
step-8: on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, arrange 5 of the tubes of dough horizontally.
step-9: weave in the remaining tubes of dough vertically between the horizontal tubes.
step-10: in a small bowl, mix together the olive oil, garlic powder, and parmesan.
step-11: brush the mixture all over the dough.
step-12: bake for 30 minutes, until golden brown.
step-13: sprinkle with parsley and serve immediately, with marinara sauce for dipping.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: grease a 9-inch (23-cm) springform pan with nonstick spray.
step-3: in a large bowl, add the chicken, broccoli, half of mozzarella, the parmesan, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and half of alfredo sauce.
step-4: mix thoroughly.
step-5: place one of the lasagna noodles vertically on a cutting board.
step-6: scoop a spoonful of the chicken mixture onto the noodle and spread.
step-7: starting with the end closest to you, roll up the noodle, being careful not to squeeze any of the filling out of the sides.
step-8: cut the rolled noodle in half crosswise.
step-9: repeat with the rest of the noodles and filling.
step-10: place the rolls wavy side up in a greased 9-inch (23-cm) springform pan.
step-11: sprinkle with the rest of the mozzarella cheese.
step-12: bake for 20 minutes, until the cheese starts to brown.
step-13: release the pan and garnish the rolls with parsley.
step-14: serve immediately, with warm alfredo sauce alongside for dipping.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: cut each biscuit into 6 pieces.
step-3: in a bowl, combine biscuits with the rest of the ingredients.
step-4: place 3-4 pieces of biscuit into each cup of a greased muffin tin.
step-5: bake 15 minutes or until biscuits are golden brown and cooked through.

step-1: combine the flour, salt, and yeast together, then form a well in the centre.
step-2: add the water and 1 teaspoon of the olive oil and stir until the mixture holds together.
step-3: turn onto a floured surface and knead for 7-10 minutes.
step-4: put the dough into a bowl greased with olive oil, cover with cling film, and allow to rise in a warm place for 1 hour.
step-5: knead the dough again for another minute or so, then form the mixture into 18 even-sized balls.
step-6: coat each dough ball in a generous helping of pesto.
step-7: place the dough balls into a large cake tin, cover and rise for another hour.
step-8: preheat the oven to 180°c (350°f).
step-9: cover the dough balls with the cheddar and mozzarella.
step-10: bake for 20-25 minutes.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the chicken, onion, red bell pepper, jalapeño, ½ cup (50 g) of monterey jack cheese, ½ cup (50 g) of cheddar cheese, the lime juice, and taco seasoning.
step-2: mix thoroughly.
step-3: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-4: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-5: place one of the tortillas on a cutting board.
step-6: scoop 2 tablespoons of the chicken mixture onto the bottom edge of the tortilla.
step-7: roll up the tortilla tightly, leaving the edges untucked, and cut in half crosswise.
step-8: repeat with the rest of the tortillas and filling.
step-9: arrange the flautas in a circle on the baking sheet.
step-10: sprinkle with half of the remaining cheddar and monterey jack cheese.
step-11: place a second layer of flautas on top of the first so they are overlapping.
step-12: sprinkle with the rest of the cheese.
step-13: place the rest of the flautas on top for a third layer.
step-14: bake for 30 minutes until golden brown and crisp.
step-15: sprinkle with cilantro and serve immediately with guacamole and salsa for dipping.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f / 190°c
step-2: cut biscuits into fourths, and place in a large mixing bowl.
step-3: add the butter, garlic powder, parsley, and mozzarella, and mix with your hands, coating all of the biscuit pieces.
step-4: place the pieces in a muffin tin, 3 pieces per tin (you’ll have 2 extra—just use them in whichever tin you want).
step-5: bake for 15 minutes.
step-6: best served fresh out of the oven!

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: cut brie into cubes.
step-3: open biscuit dough and separate into individual biscuit pieces.
step-4: using your hands (or a knife for extra precision), tear each piece of biscuit dough into 2-3 pieces.
step-5: flatten the torn dough in the palm of your hand and place 1-2 pieces of brie in the middle.
step-6: pinch dough around the cheese, then roll together until it forms a small ball with the cheese inside.
step-7: repeat until all of the dough and cheese have been rolled together.
step-8: place cheese-filled doughballs into a standard bundt pan that has been generously coated with nonstick spray, spacing them out evenly.
step-9: once a layer of dough has been placed into the pan, sprinkle generously with ⅓ of the thyme and rosemary.
step-10: after the sprinkling of herbs, spoon in about ⅓ of the can of cranberry sauce.
step-11: repeat this (dough, herbs, sauce) pattern until all of the ingredients have been layered evenly in the pan.
step-12: bake in preheated oven for 40 minutes.
step-13: loaf should be fragrant with cheese and cranberry sauce should be bubbling on top when removed.
step-14: let cool for 10 minutes before covering and inverting the bread onto a large serving dish.

step-1: sprinkle flour onto a clean work surface.
step-2: lay out the puff pastry sheets next to each other and sprinkle more flour onto a rolling pin.
step-3: roll out the pastry, connecting the 2 sheets, until you have a 20x15-inch (50x30-cm) rectangle about ⅛-inch (3 mm) thick.
step-4: use a pizza cutter or sharp knife to cut the puff pastry into 32 even squares.
step-5: dollop a teaspoon of marinara sauce on top of each pastry square.
step-6: place a pre-cooked meatball in the middle of each square.
step-7: wrap the puff pastry dough around each meatball to form balls.
step-8: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-9: in a medium bowl, combine the butter, garlic, and parsley.
step-10: place half of the pastry meatballs into a bundt pan.
step-11: brush the tops of the balls with garlic butter and sprinkle with half of the mozzarella cheese.
step-12: add the rest of the meatballs on top, brush with garlic butter, and finish with the rest of the cheese.
step-13: reserve the remaining garlic butter.
step-14: bake for 40 minutes.
step-15: brush the balls at the top of the pan with garlic butter, then invert the meatball ring onto a wire rack-lined baking sheet.
step-16: brush the top of the ring with more garlic butter.
step-17: sprinkle mozzarella on top of the ring.
step-18: bake for another 20 minutes until pastry is lightly golden brown.
step-19: brush the surface of the ring with leftover butter mixture.
step-20: transfer to a serving platter and place a small bowl of marinara sauce in the middle of the monkey bread.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: mix all the ricotta, mozzarella, parmesan, oregano, garlic, basil, chili flakes (optional), salt, and pepper until smooth.
step-3: unfold a jumbo shell, turning it inside out, and gently fill it with 1-2 tablespoons of the cheese mixture.
step-4: refold the shell and set aside.
step-5: repeat with the rest of the pasta shells.
step-6: in a circular dish, place a layer of marinara sauce that completely covers the bottom of the pan.
step-7: place the shells, cheese side up in the pan in a spiralling pattern.
step-8: pour a little extra marinara sauce within the spiral and top the whole pan with mozzarella cheese.
step-9: bake for 15 minutes, or until the sauce is bubbling and the cheese is a golden brown.
step-10: pull apart with your fingers.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: place the eggplant on a non-stick baking sheet and prick all over with a fork.
step-3: bake for 20 minutes, until the skin is wrinkled.
step-4: reduce the oven temperature to 180°f (80°c).
step-5: transfer the eggplant to a large bowl and cover.
step-6: let cool and sweat for 10-15 minutes, until the skin peels off easily, and they are cool enough to handle.
step-7: trim the stems from the eggplant and remove the skin completely.
step-8: tear the eggplant flesh into thin strips and set aside.
step-9: in a small bowl, combine the cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, paprika, smoked paprika, cayenne, brown sugar, salt, and pepper and mix well.
step-10: add the eggplant strips to a non-stick baking sheet and sprinkle with the spice mix.
step-11: mix well with your hands to coat.
step-12: bake for 45-50 minutes, until the ends of the eggplant strips start to dry out.
step-13: increase the oven temperature to 250°f (120°c)
step-14: pour the barbecue sauce over the eggplant and toss well to coat.
step-15: bake for 15 minutes more, until the sauce has been absorbed by the eggplant.
step-16: pile the eggplant on the buns and top with coleslaw, if desired.

step-1: place pork, onion, and seasonings into a 6-quart slow cooker.
step-2: mix to coat meat in seasonings.
step-3: add ketchup and mustard, spreading evenly over the outside of the meat.
step-4: set slow cooker to high and cook for 4 hours, until the meat pulls apart easily.
step-5: alternatively, the meat can be cooked on the low setting for 8 hours.
step-6: remove meat from slow cooker and transfer it to a bowl or cutting board.
step-7: using two forks, shred the meat into bite-sized pieces.
step-8: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-9: using a cast-iron pan or other oven-safe dish, assemble the nachos layer by layer.
step-10: chips, then pork, onion, bbq sauce, and cheese.
step-11: repeat as desired for additional layers.
step-12: bake for 8-10 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbling.
step-13: top with sour cream, salsa, and cilantro.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, whisk together the milk, butter, honey, and eggs until combined.
step-3: in a separate large bowl, mix the flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, and salt until combined.
step-4: pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until smooth.
step-5: grease a 6-cup muffin tin with nonstick spray.
step-6: using an ice cream scoop or measuring cup, spoon about ¼ cup (70 g) of batter into each cup.
step-7: spoon about 1 tablespoon of pulled pork in the center of the batter.
step-8: top the pork with another ¼ cup (70 g) of batter to cover, using a spoon to spread the batter over the pork if necessary.
step-9: sprinkle about 1 tablespoon of cheddar cheese over each muffin.
step-10: bake for 25 minutes, or until the tops of the muffins spring back when touched.
step-11: remove the muffins from the tin and top with barbecue sauce and coleslaw.

step-1: make the starter: in a small pot over low heat, combine the water, milk, and flour.
step-2: stir continuously until a loose paste forms.
step-3: remove the pot from the heat and transfer the mixture to a small bowl.
step-4: cover with plastic wrap, pressing it directly onto the surface of the starter, and refrigerate for 1 hour, or until cool.
step-5: make the dough: in a large bowl, add 2½ cups (300 g) of flour, the sugar, salt, and yeast, and whisk to combine.
step-6: in a large measuring cup, whisk together the milk, egg, butter, and chilled starter mixture.
step-7: gradually pour the milk mixture into the bowl of dry ingredients, using your hands to combine.
step-8: the dough will be very sticky at this point.
step-9: if the dough is too wet to knead, gradually add ¾ cup (90 g) of flour, a few tablespoons at a time, until you can knead the dough into a loose ball.
step-10: continue to knead the dough for 20 minutes.
step-11: cover your hands with the vegetable oil and form the dough into a taut ball.
step-12: place the dough into a clean large bowl.
step-13: cover with a towel and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size, 60-90 minutes.
step-14: transfer the dough to a clean surface and press out to a 9-inch (23 cm) square.
step-15: divide the dough into 9 equal squares.
step-16: flatten a portion of dough into a circle.
step-17: place 2 tablespoons of pulled pork in the center.
step-18: pinch the edges of the dough together to seal.
step-19: gently roll the dough into a ball and place in a greased 9-inch (23 cm) square baking dish.
step-20: repeat with the remaining dough.
step-21: cover with a towel and let rise for 45 minutes.
step-22: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-23: brush the buns with the egg and milk mixture.
step-24: bake the buns for 25 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-25: let the buns sit in the pan for 10 minutes.
step-26: invert the buns onto a serving plate, and pull apart.

step-1: layer bottom of crock pot with onion and lay pork loin on top.
step-2: season with salt, pepper, and garlic.
step-3: top with bbq sauce.
step-4: cook on high for 4 hours or low for 8 hours.
step-5: "pull apart” the pork loin using two forks.
step-6: cover and let sit and move on to sweet potatoes.
step-7: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-8: using a fork, poke holes down one side of each sweet potato.
step-9: microwave for 3-5 minutes, or until softened.
step-10: let sweet potatoes cool before handling.
step-11: next, cut sweet potatoes in half and carve out the centers with a spoon, leaving a rim around the outside of each sweet potato.
step-12: place sweet potatoes on a baking sheet covered in parchment paper, drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
step-13: bake for 20 minutes.
step-14: add shredded carrots and purple cabbage to the shredded pork and combine.
step-15: fill sweet potatoes with pork, drizzle with bbq sauce, and garnish with green onion.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a large mixing bowl, whisk together pumpkin puree, eggs, sugar, vegetable oil, and vanilla until combined.
step-3: sift in the flour, baking powder, baking soda, pumpkin pie spice, and salt.
step-4: using a wooden spoon, mix together until just combined.
step-5: be careful to not overmix.
step-6: lightly coat a spring form pan with nonstick cooking spray, and pour batter into the pan, spreading an even layer.
step-7: bake for 35-45 minutes until center comes out clean when tested.
step-8: allow to cool completely in the pan.
step-9: in a large mixing bowl, whisk together cream cheese, sugar, pumpkin spice, and vanilla extract.
step-10: add in whipping cream and beat for an additional 2-3 minutes.
step-11: spread cheesecake mixture onto the cooled pumpkin bread, spreading evenly.
step-12: cover and chill in the fridge for at least 4 hours before serving.
step-13: cut and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: make the maple cream cheese filling: in a medium bowl, combine the cream cheese, lemon juice, vanilla, and maple syrup.
step-3: stir until smooth and creamy.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: make the pumpkin cake: sift the flour into a large bowl and add the brown sugar, cinnamon, allspice, nutmeg, ginger, cloves, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
step-6: whisk to combine.
step-7: in a medium bowl, combine the pumpkin puree, vegetable oil, water, and vanilla.
step-8: whisk well.
step-9: gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, folding with a rubber spatula just until combined.
step-10: do not overmix the batter.
step-11: generously grease a bundt pan with nonstick spray.
step-12: add 3 cups (675 g) of pumpkin batter to the pan and spread evenly.
step-13: then, scoop the cream cheese filling over the batter, making a ring.
step-14: top with the remaining batter and spread to cover the filling.
step-15: bake for 45 minutes, until a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean.
step-16: remove the cake from the oven and let cool for 15 minutes before inverting to remove from the pan.
step-17: slice and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 325˚f (160˚c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, combine the melted butter and crushed graham crackers.
step-3: stir until the mixture develops a wet sand texture.
step-4: cover the bottom of a greased 9 x13-inch (23x33 cm) baking pan with the graham cracker mixture and spread evenly.
step-5: chill.
step-6: in a large bowl, combine the cream cheese, eggs, vanilla, and sugar.
step-7: stir until mixture is smooth.
step-8: spread half of the cheesecake batter into the chilled baking pan, smoothing the top, and freeze.
step-9: add the pumpkin puree to the remaining cheesecake batter and stir until incorporated.
step-10: spoon the pumpkin cheesecake mixture over frozen cheesecake mixture and spread evenly.
step-11: bake for 30 minutes.
step-12: make the crumb topping: in a medium bowl, combine the butter, flour, brown sugar, and cinnamon.
step-13: stir until all ingredients are evenly incorporated and the mixture develops a wet sand texture.
step-14: top the cheesecake with the crumble topping and bake for another 25 minutes.
step-15: allow the cheesecake to cool at room temperature.
step-16: for best results refrigerate overnight once completely cooled, then slice and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: prepare your favorite type of brownie batter or use a boxed variety.
step-3: transfer the batter to a greased 9x13-inch (23x33 cm) baking dish.
step-4: sprinkle in the chopped leftover candy and place in the oven to bake for 25 minutes or until cooked through.
step-5: let cool completely.
step-6: to the warmed heavy cream, add a package of gelatin and allow it to bloom for 1-3 minutes.
step-7: to a large bowl, add the cream cheese, sugar, pumpkin pie spice, vanilla extract, pumpkin puree, warm cream with gelatin.
step-8: stir to combine.
step-9: pour the mixture over the brownies and let cool in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours, or until set.
step-10: slice the brownies, drizzle with chocolate syrup, and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: cut off the top third of pumpkin.
step-4: remove the pumpkin seeds and pulp (reserve the seeds for another use).
step-5: drizzle the inside of the pumpkin with 1 tablespoon of olive and sprinkle with a pinch of salt.
step-6: place the pumpkin on the baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes until slightly softened.
step-7: while the pumpkin is baking, make the chili: heat the remaining tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet with a lid over medium heat, until shimmering.
step-8: add the onion and garlic, and sauté for 2 minutes, until translucent.
step-9: add the ground beef and cook until browned, 7-10 minutes.
step-10: add the kidney beans, tomatoes, tomato paste, salt, pepper, chili powder, paprika, cinnamon, cumin, and water, and stir to combine.
step-11: cook for 5 minutes.
step-12: reduce the heat to low, add the cream cheese and 1 cup of monterey jack, and stir until incorporated.
step-13: remove from the heat.
step-14: once the pumpkin is done baking, remove from the oven and turn the oven to broil.
step-15: carefully pour the chili cheese dip into the pumpkin.
step-16: sprinkle the remaining cup of monterey jack cheese on top, all the way to the edge of the pumpkin.
step-17: return to the oven and broil for 2-4 minutes, until the cheese is golden brown.
step-18: watch carefully to make sure it doesn’t burn.
step-19: remove the pumpkin from the oven and let cool for 5 minutes.
step-20: using oven mitts or kitchen towels, carefully move the pumpkin to a serving platter.
step-21: top with chopped chives and serve with chips and crudités for dipping.

step-1: preheat oven 350˚f (180˚f).
step-2: in a bowl, add the milk, egg, honey, pumpkin puree, cinnamon, nutmeg, and vanilla until combined.
step-3: stir in the oats and chocolate chips.
step-4: transfer the oat mixture to 15 silicone muffin cups, or a muffin tin lined with cupcake liners.
step-5: bake for 30 minutes, until light golden on top.
step-6: store in the refrigerator for up to 5 days, or in the freezer for up to 3 months.

step-1: mix the brown sugar and oil.
step-2: add eggs and pumpkin, and mix.
step-3: add flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, pumpkin pie spice, cinnamon, and mix.
step-4: stir in chocolate chips and scoop (or pipe) 2 tbsp at a time onto a baking sheet.
step-5: beat the cream cheese and butter until smooth.
step-6: mix in powdered sugar and vanilla extract.
step-7: spread onto half of the cooled cookies, and top with the rest of the cookies.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: cook the pasta according to package instructions.
step-3: in the meantime, prepare the sauce.
step-4: place saucepan on medium heat.
step-5: coat with olive oil, then pour in shallots and cook until they begin to soften (3-5 minutes).
step-6: add sage and thyme, stir, and cook until fragrant.
step-7: bring heat down to low and add the pumpkin and ricotta.
step-8: stir until well-combined.
step-9: add milk, stir, add parmesan, stir.
step-10: add brown sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, and pepper, stir well-blended.
step-11: combine the sauce with cooked pasta and stir until evenly distributed.
step-12: scoop the pasta into a baking dish or a pumpkin, like we did!
step-13: top off with mozzarella cheese.
step-14: bake covered for 15-20 minutes (until cheese has melted).
step-15: then broil for a quick 2-3 minutes if you want the cheese on top to brown and get toasty.
step-16: keep on eye on it while it’s broiling to make sure you don’t overdo it.
step-17: serve immediately, before it gets cold.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180˚c).
step-2: in a bowl, mix the dry ingredients thoroughly.
step-3: add the eggs and pumpkin, and mix.
step-4: gradually add the evaporated milk, mixing constantly.
step-5: with a jar lid, cut 12 4-inch (10 cm) circles out of the pie crust.
step-6: press into each of the cups of a greased muffin tin.
step-7: pierce the bottoms of the crust gently with a fork.
step-8: fill each pie crust to the top with filling.
step-9: bake for 20-30 minutes, until top of crust becomes golden brown.
step-10: add your favorite ice cream or whipped cream with a pinch of cinnamon powder.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: gut 6-8 small pumpkins, and place on a baking sheet.
step-3: combine all crust ingredients in a medium sized bowl.
step-4: it should be the consistency of peanut butter, or more runny.
step-5: spread over the inside of the mini pumpkin - the moisture will aid in softening the pumpkin while cooking.
step-6: combine all filling ingredients in a large bowl.
step-7: mix until smooth.
step-8: use a plastic bag to squeeze into the pumpkins.
step-9: bake for about 40 minutes, or until the pumpkins begin to pucker, and the tops darken.
step-10: combine coconut cream and powdered sugar, and beat or whip for three minutes.
step-11: (for fluffier whipped cream, use thicker coconut cream, and chill for 1 hour).
step-12: drizzle cream over top of hot pumpkin.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the eggs, pumpkin puree, granulated sugar, brown sugar, cream, vanilla, milk, and salt.
step-2: whisk until smooth.
step-3: add the cinnamon, ginger, cloves, and nutmeg, and whisk to incorporate.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: lightly grease a 9x13-inch (22x33 cm) baking dish with nonstick spray.
step-6: add the cubed bread to the dish in an even layer, then pour the pumpkin mixture on top.
step-7: let sit at room temperature for 30 minutes, or for up to 24 hours in the refrigerator, to let the bread to soak up the liquid.
step-8: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-9: just before baking, toss the bread cubes to redistribute the liquid.
step-10: cover and bake for about 30 minutes, then remove the lid and bake for another 30 minutes, until the pudding is set and beginning to brown.
step-11: top with the pecans and candied ginger.
step-12: serve warm with whipped cream or ice cream.

step-1: shape squares of aluminum foil into cones by placing a finger in the center of the square, and folding up all the sides around it.
step-2: you may use another square to wrap the cone up to create a smooth surface.
step-3: spray each cone well, and place on a baking sheet.
step-4: slice the puff pastry into one-inch (2 ½cm) strips, and brush them with a little water to make them sticky.
step-5: carefully coil the dough around each cone.
step-6: pinch off the tip to seal them.
step-7: bake at 400˚f/ 204˚c for 15 minutes, or until the dough begins to tan, and the cone holds it’s shape.
step-8: while cones are baking, mix together pumpkin puree, sugar, evaporated milk, salt, pumpkin sauce, and eggs together.
step-9: remove the foil, and place the cones upright in a small glass, or a popover pan.
step-10: use a piping bag or spoon to fill the cones with pumpkin filling.
step-11: bake again at 400˚f/204˚c for 30-45 minutes, or until the filling sets, and begins to darken.
step-12: bake time will vary depending on the size of you cones.
step-13: allow the cones to cool for 20 minutes.
step-14: top with whipped cream, or vanilla ice cream and pumpkin spice.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: gently lay the rolled-out pie crust in a pie dish.
step-4: trim the excess dough around the sides.
step-5: tuck the dough under the edge, and crimp the edges using the index finger knuckle on one hand and the thumb and index finger on your other hand.
step-6: chill in the refrigerator for 14-20 minutes.
step-7: after chilling the crust, crumple a piece of parchment paper, then spread it out in the center of the crust.
step-8: add dried chickpeas or baking beans to the center and spread toward the sides of the crust--this will add weight to keep the crust from puffing up and hold up the walls.
step-9: bake the crust for 15-20 minutes, until slightly golden and there are no raw doughy spots.
step-10: cut the sugar pumpkin into 8 wedges.
step-11: use a paring knife or spoon remove all of the seeds and pulp.
step-12: place the pumpkin on the prepared baking sheet and dry roast for 15-20 minutes, until tender.
step-13: let the pumpkin cool slightly, then peel off the skin using your hands or a spoon.
step-14: increase the oven temperature to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-15: add 16 ounces (455 g) of the pumpkin to a food processor, along with the cinnamon, allspice, cloves, ginger, nutmeg, salt, vanilla, granulated sugar, brown sugar, eggs, egg yolk, and half-and-half.
step-16: puree until very smooth, 6-8 minutes.
step-17: pour the filling into the prebaked crust.
step-18: brush the edges of the crust with egg wash.
step-19: bake the pie for 15 minutes, then reduce the oven temperature to 350˚f (180˚c) and continue to bake for 30-35 minutes more, until the edges are set but the center still jiggles slightly when shaken.
step-20: let cool at room temp for at least 2 hours, or in the fridge overnight
step-21: slice and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: gently lay the rolled-out pie crust in a 10-inch (25-cm) pie dish.
step-3: trim the excess dough around the sides.
step-4: tuck the dough under the edge, and crimp the edges using the index finger knuckle on one hand and the thumb and index finger on your other hand.
step-5: chill in the refrigerator for 14-20 minutes.
step-6: make the filling: add the pumpkin puree, cinnamon, allspice, cloves, ginger, nutmeg, and salt to a medium bowl and mix until combined.
step-7: spread the pumpkin puree mixture onto a baking sheet in an even layer.
step-8: bake for 12-15 minutes, until it looks slightly dried out.
step-9: increase the oven temperature to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-10: scrape the puree into a large bowl and add the granulated sugar, dark brown sugar, vanilla, eggs, egg yolk, and half-and-half.
step-11: whisk until smooth and well combined.
step-12: after chilling the crust, crumple a piece of parchment paper, then spread it out in the center of the crust.
step-13: add dried chickpeas or baking beans to the center and spread toward the sides of the crust--this will add weight to keep the crust from puffing up and hold up the walls.
step-14: bake the crust for 15-20 minutes, until slightly golden and there are no raw doughy spots.
step-15: increase the oven temperature to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-16: pour the filling into the prebaked crust.
step-17: brush the edges of the crust with egg wash.
step-18: bake the pie for 15 minutes, then reduce the oven temperature to 350˚f (180˚c) and continue to bake for 30-35 minutes more, until the edges are set but the center still jiggles slightly when shaken.
step-19: let cool at room temp for at least 2 hours, or in the fridge overnight.
step-20: slice and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (215˚c).
step-2: in a large mixing bowl, combine pumpkin with cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, ginger, and salt and stir until evenly mixed.
step-3: add the eggs, maple syrup, heavy cream, and vanilla.
step-4: slowly stir until evenly incorporated.
step-5: place the pie crust in a 9-inch (23 cm) pie pan and shape.
step-6: carefully pour pie filling into pan.
step-7: bake for 15 minutes at 425˚f (215˚c).
step-8: reduce heat to 350˚f (175˚c) and bake for 40 minutes.
step-9: for the crumble, combine pecans, maple syrup, and salt.
step-10: stir until well combined.
step-11: place pecans on a parchment paper-lined baking tray and bake for 10-12 minutes at 350˚f (175˚c).
step-12: once cooled, crush the caramelized pecans in a plastic bag.
step-13: add 1 tablespoon of maple syrup to crushed pecans and top cooled pie.

step-1: in a medium pot over medium heat, add the oil, onion, garlic, red pepper flakes, and dried sage and cook until onions are translucent, stirring occasionally.
step-2: add almond milk, pumpkin, salt, pepper, and nutmeg.
step-3: combine until a smooth, creamy sauce forms.
step-4: allow to heat through.
step-5: add prepared pasta and combine.
step-6: serve hot.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
step-3: use a sharp knife to carefully cut a circle around the stem of the pumpkin and remove the top.
step-4: use an ice cream scoop to scoop out the pumpkin seeds and flesh of the pumpkin and transfer to a bowl.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: cut the pumpkin into large pieces and and transfer to one of the baking sheets.
step-7: brush with olive oil and season with salt and pepper to taste.
step-8: bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until pumpkin is fork tender.
step-9: separate the pumpkin seeds from the flesh and rinse and dry them.
step-10: add the pumpkin seeds to the other baking sheet.
step-11: drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper to taste.
step-12: bake for 20 minutes, stirring halfway through, until golden brown and crunchy.
step-13: in a food processor, combine the arugula, basil, roasted pumpkin seeds, garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, water, and salt and process until smooth.
step-14: serve with your favorite roasted vegetables.

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine the pumpkin puree, almond butter, maple syrup, and vanilla, and stir until smooth.
step-2: add the oats, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, and salt, and mix until evenly distributed.
step-3: chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-4: use a tablespoon to scoop out the mixture, then roll into balls with your hands.
step-5: store in the refrigerator in an airtight container for up to 1 week.

step-1: preheat the oven to 200°c (400°f).
step-2: prepare the pumpkin by cutting into bite-size chunks and placing in a baking tin with the butter and sugar.
step-3: bake for 30 minutes, until soft.
step-4: turn down the oven to 180°c (350°f) and leave the pumpkin to cool.
step-5: blend the chocolate biscuits in a processor to form fine crumbs.
step-6: stir in the butter.
step-7: pour the biscuit base into a nonstick springform tin and set aside.
step-8: mix together the pumpkin, cream cheese, sugar, double cream, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, and cloves.
step-9: stir in the eggs.
step-10: pour over the biscuit base.
step-11: bake in the oven for 1 hour.
step-12: leave to cool.
step-13: spread over the whipped cream and sprinkle on the cocoa powder on top.

step-1: combine all ingredients in a medium sauce pot and heat through, making sure not to boil, stirring occasionally.
step-2: serve hot, or over ice!
step-3: top with whipped cream (optional).

step-1: note: make your own pumpkin pie spice by mixing 2 tablespoons cinnamon, 1 tablespoon ginger, 1 tablespoon nutmeg, and ½ tablespoon cloves; use 2 teaspoons in the dough, and 3 tablespoons in the topping mixture.
step-2: in a large bowl, mix together flour, sugar, baking powder, pumpkin pie spice, and salt.
step-3: in a separate bowl, mix together pumpkin puree, egg, and butter.
step-4: pour wet mixture into dry mixture and stir together with rubber spatula until fully incorporated.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: heat oil in a frying pan to 325˚f (160˚c).
step-7: while oil is heating, use your hands to shape and roll the pumpkin donut dough into balls.
step-8: (greasing your hands with oil will make this process much easier).
step-9: fry the dough balls until golden brown, about 4-5 minutes.
step-10: (for best results, fry only 3-4 at a time).
step-11: drain them on a paper towel and immediately transfer to bowl of the pumpkin pie spice-sugar mix.
step-12: gently toss to coat.

step-1: preheat the oven to 170°f (80°c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: in the food processor, combine the pumpkin puree, cloves, ginger, nutmeg, cinnamon, and dark brown sugar.
step-4: process until smooth.
step-5: spread the puree on the prepared baking sheet into an 8x11-inch (20x28-cm) rectangle about ¹⁄₁₆ inch (1 mm) thick.
step-6: bake for 6 hours, or until no longer sticky to the touch.
step-7: let cool completely.
step-8: roll the fruit sheet in the parchment paper.
step-9: trim the ends, then slice crosswise into 6 1-inch (2-cm) pieces.

step-1: generously butter two cast-iron pans or disposable foil cake pans.
step-2: in a large bowl, whisk together warm milk, melted butter, and sugar.
step-3: the mixture should be just warm, registering between 100-110˚f (37-43˚c).
step-4: if it is hotter, allow to cool slightly.
step-5: sprinkle the yeast evenly over the warm milk mixture and let set for 1 minute.
step-6: add 4 cups (500g) of flour to the milk mixture and mix with a wooden spoon until just combined.
step-7: cover the bowl with a towel or plastic wrap and set in a warm place to rise for 1 hour.
step-8: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-9: after 1 hour, the dough should have nearly doubled in size.
step-10: remove the towel and add an additional ¾ cup (95g) of flour, baking powder, and salt.
step-11: stir well, then turn out onto a well-floured surface.
step-12: knead the dough lightly, adding additional flour as necessary, until the dough just loses its stickiness and does not stick to the surface.
step-13: roll the dough out into a large rectangle, about ½-inch (1 cm) thick.
step-14: fix corners to make sure they are sharp and even.
step-15: in a medium bowl, combine softened butter, brown sugar, and pumpkin spice mix, and stir well.
step-16: spread the mixture onto the rolled dough.
step-17: roll up the dough, forming a log, and pinch the seam closed.
step-18: place seam-side down.
step-19: trim off any unevenness on either end.
step-20: cut the log in half, then divide each half into 7 evenly sized pieces, about 1½ inches (4 cm) thick.
step-21: place 7 cinnamon rolls in each skillet or cake pan, one in the center, six around the sides.
step-22: cover with plastic wrap and place in a warm place to rise for 30 minutes.
step-23: to prepare the frosting, in a medium-size mixing bowl, whisk together powdered sugar, coffee, and milk until smooth.
step-24: remove plastic wrap, and bake the cinnamon rolls in a preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, until golden brown.
step-25: while still warm, drizzle evenly with frosting.

step-1: coat muffin tin with cooking spray then place cookie dough in muffin tin (2 tbsp.
step-2: in each cup).
step-3: bake according to package directions.
step-4: for the filling, beat cream cheese and sweetened condensed milk until there are no lumps.
step-5: add pumpkin pie spice and heavy cream, and mix thoroughly.
step-6: optional: add 4 drops of yellow and 3 drops of red food coloring to make it orange.
step-7: let cool completely, then make ‘cups’ by pressing down on each cookie with the bottom of a clean spice container.
step-8: fill cookie cups and top with whipped cream.

step-1: melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat.
step-2: add the onion and cook for 4-6 minutes, until translucent.
step-3: add the jalapeño and stir for 4 minutes, until soft.
step-4: add the garlic and cook for about 1 minute.
step-5: sprinkle in the cornstarch and stir for two minutes.
step-6: add the evaporated milk and stir for 3 minutes, or until the mixture thickens.
step-7: slowly add the cheese ½ cup (50 g) at a time.
step-8: stir constantly until the cheese is completely melted.
step-9: remove the queso from the heat.
step-10: line a baking sheet with parchment paper, then pour the queso over it.
step-11: use a spatula to spread the queso in an even layer about an ⅛ inch (3 mm) thick.
step-12: freeze for three hours.
step-13: remove the queso from the freezer and transfer to a cutting board.
step-14: carefully cut the queso horizontally into 7 rows, about 2½-inches (6-cm) apart.
step-15: at the end of the bottom row, cut a triangle.
step-16: continue cutting triangles down the length of the row.
step-17: repeat with the remaining rows.
step-18: place the flour, eggs, and tortilla chip crumbs in 3 separate medium bowls.
step-19: heat the oil in a large pot until it reaches 350°f (180°c).
step-20: toss a triangle of queso in the flour.
step-21: tap off any excess flour, then dip the piece in the egg, then toss it in the tortilla chip crumbs.
step-22: repeat with the remaining queso chips.
step-23: fry the breaded queso chips 3-4 at a time, until golden brown, 15–30 seconds.
step-24: drain the chips on a wire rack or paper towels.
step-25: garnish with cilantro.
step-26: serve with guacamole, pico de gallo, and sour cream.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a pan over medium-high heat, cook the chorizo until brown.
step-3: add the onions, mushrooms, salt, and pepper, cooking until the chorizo is deep brown and the onions and mushrooms are crispy.
step-4: remove from heat.
step-5: slice across the top of the bread in 1-inch (2 ½ cm) lines, being careful not to cut all the way through.
step-6: rotate the bread 90 degrees and repeat, creating a grid pattern across the bread.
step-7: sprinkle half of the cheese evenly between the cracks of the bread.
step-8: spoon the chorizo mixture on top of the cheese inside the bread, then add the remaining half of the cheese.
step-9: be sure that you fill as many cracks as possible.
step-10: in a small bowl, mix together the melted butter, garlic, parsley, and parmesan.
step-11: brush the garlic butter mixture evenly over the top of the bread.
step-12: bake for 20 minutes, until the cheese is golden brown and melted.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, combine the hash browns, lightly beaten eggs, onion powder, pepper, paprika, garlic powder, and salt.
step-3: mix well.
step-4: grease a nonstick bundt pan with cooking spray.
step-5: add ⅔ of the hash brown mixture to the bundt pan and press evenly against the bottom and sides of the pan.
step-6: carefully pour the queso over the hash browns and spread evenly.
step-7: add the chorizo on top of the queso and spread out, then top with the soft-scrambled eggs.
step-8: add the remaining hash browns and spread evenly to cover the fillings.
step-9: place the bundt pan on a baking sheet and bake for 1 hour
step-10: remove the bundt pan from the oven.
step-11: let sit for 10 minutes, then carefully invert onto a serving plate.
step-12: slice into wedges and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (177°c).
step-2: on a floured surface, trim the pie crusts to fit a 9x9-inch (23x23-cm) square pan.
step-3: overlap the pie crusts slightly and use a rolling pin to roll out until smooth.
step-4: place the large pie crust onto the parchment paper-lined square pan, so that the edges hang over the sides of the pan
step-5: line the asparagus stalks along the edge of the pan.
step-6: cover the asparagus border with pie the crust, trimming any excess.
step-7: place a parchment paper square at the base of the pie crust and add dried beans.
step-8: bake the pie crust for 40 minutes.
step-9: in a bowl, whisk the eggs.
step-10: add in the asparagus, zucchini, tomatoes, mozzarella, pepper, salt, and heavy cream, whisking to combine.
step-11: pour the mixture into the baked pie crust and bake for another 40 minutes.
step-12: on a sheet of parchment paper, assemble the ham and cheese lattice.
step-13: lay the lattice on top of the quiche.
step-14: bake for another 20 minutes.
step-15: remove the parchment paper and cut the quiche into 9 servings.

step-1: place the rice noodles in a large heatproof bowl.
step-2: cover with warm water and soak for 20 minutes, until softened.
step-3: while the noodles are soaking, heat a large pot over medium-high heat.
step-4: toast the black peppercorns, coriander seeds, and star anise pods for 2 minutes, until fragrant.
step-5: while the seeds are toasting, peel the ginger and cut into pieces.
step-6: trim the ends off the green onions, then chop 5 inches off the bases and save the remaining green tops for later.
step-7: add the ginger and green onion bases to the pot and cook for 2 minutes, or until fragrant.
step-8: add the water, chicken broth, and chicken breasts.
step-9: increase the heat to high, cover, and bring to a simmer.
step-10: cook for 5 more minutes, then check the chicken every minute until cooked through.
step-11: remove from the heat.
step-12: while the broth heats up, thinly slice the green onion tops.
step-13: cut the lime into wedges.
step-14: thinly slice the jalapeño.
step-15: after 20 minutes of soaking, drain the rice noodles, then return to the bowl.
step-16: remove the chicken from the broth.
step-17: strain the broth over the noodles.
step-18: pour the noodles and broth back into the pot over high heat, then add the fish sauce.
step-19: cover and cook for 3 minutes.
step-20: shred the chicken.
step-21: divide the noodles between four serving bowls and top with the shredded chicken, jalapeño, bean sprouts, and thai basil.
step-22: ladle the hot pho broth over the noodles.
step-23: add a squeeze of lime, green onions, and any other favorite toppings.

step-1: slice avocado.
step-2: slice tomato.
step-3: split english muffin and place the halves face up on a baking sheet.
step-4: cover with avocado, tomato, and top with two slices of mozzarella cheese.
step-5: season with cayenne pepper, to taste.
step-6: broil until cheese is melted and starts to brown.
step-7: season each melt with salt and pepper to taste.

step-1: prepare your jar(s).
step-2: wash with hot, soapy water and dry completely before proceeding.
step-3: cut the vegetable scraps into bite-size pieces, if necessary.
step-4: fill the jar with the vegetable pieces, leaving about ½ inch of space at the top.
step-5: in a large pot, combine the vinegar, salt, peppercorns, red pepper flakes (if using), bay leaves, garlic, mustard seeds, and sugar.
step-6: bring to a boil over high heat, and stir until the sugar and salt are completely dissolved.
step-7: add the ice to the pot and stir until melted, to cool the pickling liquid.
step-8: pour the cooled pickling liquid over the vegetables to cover completely.
step-9: cover the jars with a tight-fitting lid and shake to distribute the spices.
step-10: the pickles will keep in the refrigerator for up to 1 month.
step-11: serve with sandwiches, tacos, salads, or as desired.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c)
step-2: make the farro: in a medium pot, combine the farro and water, then bring to a boil over high heat.
step-3: reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20-25 minutes, until the water is absorbed and the farro is tender.
step-4: make the roasted veggies: cut the potatoes in half.
step-5: arrange on half of a baking sheet and spread the carrots on the other half.
step-6: drizzle with olive oil, then season with the garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
step-7: toss until well coated.
step-8: bake for 10 minutes.
step-9: remove the baking sheet from the oven and add the broccoli.
step-10: drizzle with olive oil and season with salt, garlic powder, and pepper.
step-11: bake for another 15-20 minutes, until all of the veggies are fork tender.
step-12: make the marinated tofu: in a small bowl, combine the olive oil, thyme, oregano, garlic, salt, and pepper.
step-13: add the tofu and stir until well coated.
step-14: set aside for 10 minutes.
step-15: spread out the tofu on half of a baking sheet.
step-16: bake for 20 minutes, then remove from oven and flip.
step-17: make the roasted chickpeas: add the chickpeas to the other side of the baking sheet with the tofu.
step-18: drizzle with olive oil and season with salt, paprika, and chili powder.
step-19: toss until well coated.
step-20: bake for another 15 minutes, until the chickpeas are crispy.
step-21: make the lemon tahini dressing: in a liquid measuring cup, combine the tahini, water, olive oil, lemon juice, and salt and whisk until well combined.
step-22: to assemble the grain bowl, top the farro with the roasted veggies, tofu, and chickpeas.
step-23: drizzle with the tahini dressing.

step-1: in a small saucepan over medium heat, bring the water and orange juice to a boil.
step-2: add the quinoa, reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 12 minutes, until the quinoa is tender and the liquid is absorbed.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: add the lemon juice and agave to a large mason jar and stir to combine.
step-5: add the blueberries, strawberries, banana, blackberries, and cooked quinoa to the jar and screw on the lid.
step-6: store in the refrigerator until ready to eat, up to 5 days
step-7: give the mason jar a good shake to mix and use a fork or spoon to stir as needed.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f/200˚c.
step-2: in a large bowl add the quinoa, beans, tomato, paste, and seasonings.
step-3: using a potato masher, mash the ingredients until thoroughly mixed together.
step-4: take a quarter of quinoa-bean mixture and shape it into a patty using your hands.
step-5: repeat with the remaining mixture to create four patties.
step-6: place the patties on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-7: top with mozzarella, and bake for 12-15 minutes.
step-8: place the patties on buns, and top with tomato sauce, shredded parmesan, and fresh basil.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: cut the top off of each pepper and remove the seeds and ribs.
step-3: transfer to a baking dish.
step-4: bake for 20 minutes, until softened.
step-5: heat the oil in a large pot or dutch oven over medium-high heat.
step-6: add the onion and cook for about 2 minutes, until softened and translucent.
step-7: add the garlic and cook for about 1 minute, until fragrant.
step-8: add the zucchini, eggplant, tomatoes, thyme, rosemary, basil, salt, and pepper and stir to combine.
step-9: cover, reduce the heat to medium, and simmer for about 30 minutes, until very tender but not mushy, stirring occasionally.
step-10: in a small bowl, combine the flour, parmesan, and oregano.
step-11: add the butter and mix with your fingers until the butter has broken down into small pieces and the mixture is crumbly.
step-12: fill each pepper with the quinoa and vegetables, then top with the crumble mixture.
step-13: bake for 25-30 minutes, until the tops are golden brown.
step-14: garnish with fresh basil.

step-1: preheat the oven to 325°f (165°c.)
step-2: in a medium bowl, add the chia seeds and water.
step-3: mix until well combined then let stand for 5 minutes until a gelatinous texture is reached.
step-4: in a large bowl add the quinoa, pumpkin seeds, sesame seeds, salt, pepper, and chia seed mixture.
step-5: transfer the mixture onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet with spatula.
step-6: spread into an even layer.
step-7: bake for 30 minutes.
step-8: remove from oven then cut into desired cracker shapes.
step-9: carefully flip each cracker.
step-10: bake for 25 minutes.
step-11: remove and allow to cool for 10 minutes.
step-12: store in an airtight container for up to one month.
step-13: add hummus, if desired.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: wash and dry the peppers.
step-3: using a sharp knife, take off their tops and remove the seeds and pith.
step-4: arrange the peppers in an oven-safe dish so that they stand upright.
step-5: bake the peppers for 20 minutes.
step-6: while the peppers are baking, begin cooking the quinoa.
step-7: add olive oil to a medium-sized pot or dutch oven with a lid.
step-8: add onion and cook over medium heat until tender, about 3 minutes, or until starting to become tender.
step-9: add garlic and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
step-10: add spices and quinoa.
step-11: sauté the quinoa for 1-2 minutes before adding the the vegetable stock.
step-12: add the vegetable stock.
step-13: bring to a boil over high heat for 2 minutes.
step-14: reduce heat to a low simmer and cook covered for 20 minutes or until the quinoa is cooked and has absorbed all the remaining liquid.
step-15: remove the pot from the heat and add in the beans, corn, cheese, and enchilada sauce.
step-16: mix everything together thoroughly.
step-17: spoon the quinoa mixture into the pre-baked peppers, being sure to press the mixture firmly into the peppers.
step-18: generously top with cheese and return to the oven for an additional 20 minutes.
step-19: allow the peppers to cool for 5 minutes before serving.
step-20: garnish with toppings of your choice.

step-1: in a medium pot, cook quinoa according to package instructions in 2 cups of water.
step-2: once cooked, fluff with a fork, then set aside.
step-3: in a large pan, heat oil, then sauté garlic and ginger until fragrant.
step-4: add mushrooms, broccoli, and carrots.
step-5: stir until vegetables are tender.
step-6: return cooked quinoa to the pan.
step-7: add peas and stir until well-mixed.
step-8: create a space in the middle of the pan, add the eggs and scramble.
step-9: once the egg is cooked, stir it in with the rest of the dish.
step-10: add the soy sauce and give the dish a final stir.
step-11: serve while hot.
step-12: garnish with sliced scallions (optional).
step-13: serve while hot.
step-14: garnish with sliced scallions (optional).

step-1: thinly slice all the fresh radishes.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: cut the avocado in half, and use a knife to slice the inside, then scoop out the avocado into a bowl.
step-4: mash the avocado with lime, salt and pepper.
step-5: spread the mixture on some toasted bread.
step-6: top the avocado toast with the sliced radishes and any other garnishes you would like.
step-7: sprinkle with salt and cracked pepper.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine marshmallows and butter.
step-2: microwave for 2 minutes, stirring after 1 minute.
step-3: add rice cereal to the melted marshmallows and stir until fully mixed.
step-4: spoon the rice cereal and marshmallow mix onto the bottom of a springform pan, pressing down all edges to create a smooth surface.
step-5: set aside in the fridge.
step-6: in a large bowl, blend the cream cheese and lemon juice until combined.
step-7: add in heavy cream, vanilla, and sugar and mix until it becomes smooth and silky, with soft peaks.
step-8: pour the cream cheese mixture on top of the rice cereal and marshmallow mix base, using a spatula to create a smooth top.
step-9: chill for 3 hours.
step-10: remove pan and top with more cereal.
step-11: slice and serve.

step-1: in a bowl, whisk flour and sugar.
step-2: mix in eggs, then gradually mix in butter and warm milk, alternating between the two.
step-3: evenly divide the batter into 6 bowls.
step-4: add a few drops of food coloring to each bowl, and whisk until fully incorporated and the batter is colored.
step-5: on a nonstick skillet over medium heat, pour ⅓ of the purple crepe batter, and tip the pan to cover the entire bottom surface.
step-6: cook the crepe begins to gently bubble and cook through, then flip.
step-7: repeat until all of the different color crepe batter is used.
step-8: stack crepes on top of each other, starting with purple, then blue, green, yellow, orange, and red, with whipped cream between each layer.
step-9: cover the crepe cake in whipped cream, so that it’s fully white on the outside.
step-10: slice, and serve.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the milk and water.
step-2: on top of the liquid, add the flour, sugar, salt, yeast, and cubed butter.
step-3: mix just until the dough comes together, but don’t overmix.
step-4: set aside ¼ of the dough and transfer the rest to a lightly floured surface.
step-5: knead until the flour is fully incorporated.
step-6: shape into a ball, place in a large bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and let rest at room temperature for 2 hours.
step-7: divide the reserved quarter of dough into 5 equal pieces.
step-8: add a few drop of different colored food coloring to each one.
step-9: wearing food-safe gloves so you don’t stain your skin, work each color into the dough.
step-10: shape the colored dough into balls, place on a plate, and cover with plastic.
step-11: let rest for 2 hours at room temperature.
step-12: transfer the large piece of rested dough to a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-13: shape into an 8x11-inch (20x27 cm) rectangle, cover with plastic wrap, and chill in the refrigerator overnight.
step-14: transfer the colored dough to another parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-15: shape into 2x3-inch (5x7 cm) rectangles, cover with plastic wrap, and chill overnight.
step-16: transfer the plain rested dough to a clean, lightly floured surface.
step-17: roll into a 16x8-inch (40x20 cm) rectangle.
step-18: pat the edges with a knife to straighten.
step-19: place the butter rectangle at the center of the dough rectangle.
step-20: fold the top and bottom of the dough over to cover the butter, pinching the center seam and sides to seal.
step-21: rotate 90° and roll out to a large rectangle, about 8x18 inches (20x45 cm).
step-22: flatten the edges.
step-23: fold the top and bottom edges to meet in the center of the dough.
step-24: fold over once more, then freeze for 30 minutes.
step-25: roll out the dough again to a large rectangle, about 24x8 inches (60x20 cm).
step-26: brush off any excess flour.
step-27: fold the dough in thirds, brush again, then freeze for another 30 minutes.
step-28: cut the chilled, colored doughs in half lengthwise.
step-29: roll into ropes about 10 inches (25 cm) long.
step-30: brush the ropes with water and line up together, in rainbow order or as desired.
step-31: press together.
step-32: lightly dust with flour and roll out into a rectangle roughly the same size as the plain dough.
step-33: brush the plain dough with water, then lay on the colored dough sheet on top.
step-34: roll out into a large, 13x21-inch (33x53 cm) rectangle and about ¼-inch (6 mm) thick.
step-35: cut the dough into 10 triangles with bases that are about 4 inches (10 cm) wide.
step-36: lay the dough triangles colored side down, and starting with the wide end, gently roll up.
step-37: place the croissants on a parchment-lined baking sheet, seam-side down.
step-38: cover with plastic wrap and let proof at room temperature for 2 hours.
step-40: brush the croissants with egg wash.
step-41: bake for 20-25 minutes, until golden brown.
step-42: let cool on a wire rack.

step-1: prepare the brussels sprouts, carrots, and beets using the grating insert or a box grater.
step-2: add to a 3-quart (2.8-liter) mixing bowl.
step-3: thinly slice the radishes with the slicing insert or a sharp knife and add to the bowl with the rest of the vegetables.
step-4: thinly slice the red onion and add to the bowl with the cauliflower and apple.
step-5: season with salt and toss to combine.
step-6: roughly chop the pistachios.
step-7: in a small sauté pan over medium heat, toast the pistachios until they are lightly browned and smell nutty, 3-5 minutes.
step-8: make the dressing: in a blender, combine the apple cider vinegar, tahini, maple syrup, cayenne, and garlic.
step-9: blend until smooth.
step-10: with the blender running, drizzle in the olive oil to emulsify.
step-11: add water as needed to thin the dressing to your desired consistency.
step-12: add the poppy seeds and pulse to incorporate.
step-13: toss the slaw with the dressing.
step-14: top with the toasted pistachios.
step-15: serve immediately or cover with the lid and take to go.
step-16: the slaw will keep for 2 hours at room temperature, or in the refrigerator for 1 day with the dressing or 3 days without.
step-17: nutrition information, per serving: calories: 241, fiber: 5 grams, total fat: 17 grams, total protein: 6 grams, sugars: 11 grams, carbs: 20 grams

step-1: quarter the strawberries and place into a large bowl.
step-2: dice the mango and place on top of the strawberries.
step-3: peel and dice the kiwi.
step-4: add into the bowl.
step-5: slice bananas and place in the bowl.
step-6: add in the blueberries.
step-7: in a small bowl mix honey and lime juice.
step-8: pour syrup over the fruit and mix.
step-9: mix well.
