step-1: season chicken breasts with salt, pepper, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, oregano, and olive oil.
step-2: cook over medium heat for about 10 minutes on each side or until internal temperature reaches 165˚f (75˚c).
step-3: remove from pan and slice breast into pieces.
step-4: in a bowl, mix sour cream, cilantro, pepper, salt, and lime juice.
step-5: set aside until you are ready to serve.
step-6: in a salad bowl, assemble the salad with the romaine on the bottom.
step-7: top with red onion, tomatoes, orange bell peppers, corn, cilantro, and jalapeños.
step-8: add the chicken strips.
step-9: gently toss salad with the sour cream dressing.
step-10: garnish with avocado slices and tortilla strips.

step-1: make the roasted red pepper hummus: combine the chickpeas, roasted red peppers, tahini, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, paprika, and salt in a food processor and pulse until smooth.
step-2: transfer to a small bowl and wash out the food processor.
step-3: make the sun-dried tomato hummus: combine the chickpeas, sun-dried tomatoes, tahini, olive oil, garlic, salt, and lemon juice in a food processor and pulse until smooth.
step-4: transfer to a small bowl and wash out the food processor.
step-5: make the turmeric garlic hummus: combine the chickpeas, tahini, olive oil, garlic, turmeric, lemon juice, and salt in a food processor and pulse until smooth.
step-6: transfer to a small bowl and wash out the food processor.
step-7: make the spinach and artichoke hummus: combine the chickpeas, spinach, artichoke hearts, tahini, olive oil, garlic, lemon juice, and salt in a food processor and process until smooth.
step-8: transfer to a small bowl and wash out the food processor.
step-9: make the purple sweet potato hummus: combine the chickpeas, purple sweet potatoes, tahini, olive oil, garlic, lemon juice, and salt in a food processor and process until smooth.
step-10: add 2-3 tablespoon of water, as needed, if the hummus seems too thick.
step-11: transfer to a small bowl and wash out the food processor.
step-12: make the beet hummus: combine the chickpeas, beets, tahini, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, and salt in a food processor and process until smooth.
step-13: transfer to a small bowl.
step-14: to assemble, spoon each hummus color in six strips in a medium to large baking or serving dish.
step-15: use a spatula or bench scraper to help separate the sections.
step-16: serve with carrots, crackers, and pita bread.

step-1: in a small bowl, combine half of the warm water and the brown sugar.
step-2: add the active dry yeast and let foam without stirring for about 8 minutes.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the pureed beets, 2 tablespoons of olive oil, salt, 2 cups (250 g) of flour, and the yeast mixture.
step-4: rinse the yeast mixture bowl with the remaining warm water to get all the yeast, and pour into the large bowl.
step-5: mix with your hands and gradually add in the reamining flour until the dough comes together in a ball and is not moist to the touch.
step-6: transfer the dough to a floured surface and knead for about 5 minutes, until it becomes smooth and bouncy and does not stick to the surface.
step-7: add flour as needed.
step-8: pour the remaining tablespoon of olive oil in a clean large bowl and rub around with your fingers.
step-9: place the dough in the bowl and turn to coat with the oil.
step-10: cover with a kitchen towel or a plastic wrap and let rise for at least 1 hour at room temperature (preferably warm).
step-11: the dough should double in size.
step-12: preheat the oven to 500°f (260°c).
step-13: grease a nonstick baking sheet with the olive oil.
step-14: place the dough on a floured surface and divide in half.
step-15: save one dough half for later.
step-16: it will keep in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks in a bowl covered tightly with plastic wrap.
step-17: using a rolling pin, flatten the remaining ball of dough into a rectangular shape that will approximately fit on the baking sheet.
step-18: transfer the dough to baking sheet and stretch as needed to cover the pan.
step-19: leaving a 1-inch (2 cm) border all around the sides, spread the pizza sauce over the dough and sprinkle with mozzarella.
step-20: add strips of cherry tomatoes, orange bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, spinach, and roasted purple sweet potatoes.
step-21: season with salt, pepper, and oregano.
step-22: bake for 7-10 minutes, until the veggies are tender and the crust is cooked.
step-23: sprinkle with fresh basil, then slice and serve.

step-1: pour yeast evenly over the warm water and let it bloom for 5 minutes.
step-2: in a bowl, combine cake mix and 2 cups of flour, then pour in the yeast mixture.
step-3: stir until it starts to come together, then add the sprinkles.
step-4: gently knead the dough together into a ball.
step-5: cover with a towel and let the dough rise for 1 hour in a warm place.
step-6: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-7: place dough on a floured surface and sprinkle with remaining ¼ cup of flour.
step-8: knead until it is no longer sticky (some extra flour may be needed).
step-9: roll out the dough into an oval shape and spread butter on one side of the dough.
step-10: then, dust with cinnamon, brown sugar, and rainbow sprinkles.
step-11: starting at the bottom of the widest end, roll dough and cut into 1½- to 2-inch pieces and place in a baking dish.
step-12: cover with plastic wrap, and rest for 30 minutes.
step-13: bake for 15 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-14: to make the frosting, mix powdered sugar and milk in a bowl until smooth.
step-15: drizzle rolls with frosting and extra sprinkles.

step-1: preheat the oven to 200°f (95°c).
step-2: line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
step-3: add the sugar to a baking sheet and bake for 7 minutes.
step-4: the edges may begin to caramelize – this is good! remove the sugar from the oven and leave the oven on.
step-5: in a large clean, dry bowl, whip the egg whites with an electric hand mixer on low speed until foamy, then add the salt.
step-6: continue whipping on high speed until medium peaks form.
step-7: add the toasted sugar to the egg whites 1 tablespoon at a time, increasing the mixer speed gradually as you add more sugar.
step-8: once all of the sugar is incorporated, continue whipping for 5-7 minutes, until the meringue is very thick and shiny.
step-9: add in vanilla, just whipping until incorporated.
step-10: prop open a piping bag or zip-top bag in a tall drinking glass.
step-11: using wooden skewers, lightly paint 2 thin stripes of different-colored gel food coloring on opposite sides of the bag.
step-12: paint additional bags with more colors, if desired.
step-13: fill each bag with the meringue batter, dividing evenly amongst different colors, if using.
step-14: pipe 1-inch (2-cm) wide “kisses” of meringue onto a baking sheet about ½ inch (1 cm) apart.
step-15: bake for about 1 hour, or until you can easily lift a kiss off of the paper.
step-16: cool the meringues on the baking sheet at room temperature until no longer warm.
step-17: to fill, pipe buttercream icing around the edge of a cookie and place a small dollop of jam in the center.
step-18: sandwich with another cookie.

step-1: combine the basil, pine nuts, parmesan, garlic, ½ cup (120 ml) of olive oil, ricotta, salt, and pepper in a food processor and puree until blended and smooth.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: using a vegetable peeler, peel the zucchini, yellow squash and carrots into ribbons.
step-4: cut the eggplant lengthwise into thin slices, then slice in half lengthwise.
step-5: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-6: grease a 9-inch (23 cm) tart dish with butter using a piece of parchment paper.
step-7: lay the puff pastry in the tart dish and delicately press it flat against the bottom and up the sides.
step-8: crimp any dough hanging over the edges and prick the bottom all over with a fork.
step-9: lay a piece of parchment paper over the pastry and pour the rice evenly on top.
step-10: the rice helps keep the bottom of the crust from rising while baking.
step-11: parbake the crust for about 15 minutes, until the puff pastry starts to cook.
step-12: carefully lift the parchment paper to remove the rice (save for using in other recipes or discard).
step-13: increase the oven temperature to 400°f (200°c).
step-14: spread the ricotta pesto mixture evenly on the bottom of the tart.
step-15: starting from the outside, line the walls of the tart with the veggie ribbons, alternating veggies, until the entire shell is filled.
step-16: sprinkle the oregano on top and brush with olive oil.
step-17: season with salt and pepper to taste.
step-18: bake for 35-40 minutes, until the veggies are tender.
step-19: let cool for a few minutes.
step-20: slice and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-2: place cauliflower pieces into bowl of food processor and pulse for 30 seconds, or until cauliflower is the texture of cornmeal.
step-3: transfer cauliflower to a microwave-safe bowl and microwave on high for 4 minutes.
step-4: let cool.
step-5: transfer the cooked cauliflower into a clean dish towel and wring out the excess water.
step-6: discard water.
step-7: place cauliflower into a bowl.
step-8: add oregano, basil, garlic powder, sea salt, red pepper flakes, and egg.
step-9: mix thoroughly by hand.
step-10: transfer cauliflower mixture onto a greased parchment-lined pizza tray or cookie sheet.
step-11: pat out the dough into a disk approximately ¼-inch thick.
step-12: bake for 8-10 minutes.
step-13: remove from oven.
step-14: spread a layer of pizza sauce on the crust.
step-15: add cheese (optional).
step-16: top with your favorite rainbow vegetables.
step-17: bake for 8- 10 minutes, or until the spinach is wilted and the cheese is melted.

step-1: in the bowl of a food processor, add the drained chickpeas, salt, pepper, cumin, tahini paste, lemon juice, and olive oil and pureé until smooth.
step-2: on a whole wheat tortilla, spoon on some hummus and add slices of red pepper, carrot, yellow pepper, cucumber, and purple cabbage.
step-3: wrap up the tortilla, and cut into slices to make the pinwheels.
step-4: repeat with remaining ingredients.
step-5: slice and serve.

step-1: season the sushi rice with the rice vinegar, fanning and stirring until room temperature.
step-2: on the rolling mat place one sheet of nori with the rough side facing upwards.
step-3: wet your hands and grab a handful of rice and place it on your nori.
step-4: sprinkle with seasame seeds (optional).
step-5: spread the rice evenly throughout the nori without smushing the rice down.
step-6: flip so the nori is facing upwards.
step-7: arrange, in a horizontal row 1 inch (2 cm) from the bottom, bell peppers, cucumbers, and avocado slices.
step-8: grabbing both nori and the mat, roll the mat over the filling so the extra space at the bottom touches the other side, squeezing down to make a nice tight roll.
step-9: squeeze down along the way to keep the roll from holding its shape.
step-10: transfer the roll onto a cutting board.
step-11: rub a knife on a damp paper towel before slicing the roll into six equal portions.

step-1: on a cutting board, chop head of lettuce.
step-2: in a large bowl, combine the romaine lettuce, cherry tomatoes, shredded carrots, yellow bell pepper, cucumber, and diced red onion.
step-3: to make the dressing, combine the red wine vinegar, honey, dijon mustard, dried oregano, garlic, salt, and pepper in a medium bowl, and whisk together until the dressing is thick.
step-4: pour the dressing over the salad just before serving.

step-1: in a small bowl, add one whole egg, one egg yolk, parmesan cheese, and pepper to taste.
step-2: whisk with fork until well combined.
step-3: cut two strips of bacon crosswise into half-inch strips.
step-4: fry until cooked but not yet crispy.
step-5: boil water and cook ramen very al dente, or just until it can be loosened from it’s block form.
step-6: add 1-2 tablespoons of olive oil to the bacon and stir, lifting any bacon bits that are stuck to the pan.
step-7: once the oil is hot, remove the pan from heat.
step-8: pour a small amount of the water the ramen was cooked in and stir.
step-9: add the ramen noodles and stir some more, coating the noodles in the bacon/olive oil mixture.
step-10: next, add the egg mixture, making sure to pour it onto the noodles and not straight onto the pan.
step-11: stir vigorously.
step-12: the heat from the pan and ingredients need to turn the egg mixture into a creamy sauce.
step-13: but, if the eggs get too hot they will cook too much and become scrabbled eggs.
step-14: add additional ramen water as needed to create a smooth but creamy sauce.
step-15: plate and top with additional parmesan cheese and pepper.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: carefully dry the chickpeas.
step-3: removing the skins is optional and they will come off easily.
step-4: the drier you get them, the crunchier they’ll be!
step-5: in a medium bowl, add dried chickpeas, olive oil, thyme, parsley, onion, dill, garlic powder and pepper.
step-6: toss well to coat evenly.
step-7: spread chickpeas out on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-8: roast for 15-20 minutes.
step-9: mix around on baking sheet and roast for additional 15-20 minutes, or until golden.
step-10: cool for 5-10 minutes.

step-1: crush the raspberries and lemon juice in a jug.
step-2: add in simple syrup and stir.
step-3: serve ¼ of the fruit mix in a glass and add 1 shot of vodka.
step-4: top up with ice cubes and prosecco and garnish.

step-1: add dijon mustard, raspberries, lemon juice, red wine vinegar, balsamic vinegar, and olive oil into a mason jar and secure lid tightly.
step-2: shake vigorously until ingredients are mixed thoroughly.
step-3: store dressing in the fridge and use within 1-2 weeks.
step-4: you may need to shake up the ingredients again before each use.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: grease an 8-inch (20 cm) springform pan with melted coconut oil.
step-3: add the graham crackers and salt to food processor and process until completely broken down with a sand-like texture.
step-4: transfer the graham cracker crumbs to a medium bowl and add 5 tablespoons melted coconut oil.
step-5: stir to combine.
step-6: the mixture should hold together when pressed between 2 fingers.
step-7: using the bottom of a drinking glass, press the crust into the bottom of the prepared springform pan.
step-8: bake for 10 minutes, until golden brown.
step-9: remove from the oven and let cool.
step-10: leave the oven on.
step-11: add the thawed frozen raspberries to a food processor and blend for 15 seconds, until smooth.
step-12: strain the raspberry puree through a fine-mesh sieve into a medium bowl and discard the seeds.
step-13: transfer ⅓ cup (40 grams) to a squeeze bottle to use for garnish and set the bottle and bowl aside.
step-14: in a medium microwave-safe bowl, combine the chocolate and solid coconut oil.
step-15: microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until completely melted and smooth.
step-16: set aside.
step-17: in a clean food processor, combine the yogurt, eggs, vanilla, sugar, and cornstarch.
step-18: process until smooth, about 20 seconds.
step-19: add 1½ cups (365 grams) of the yogurt mixture to a medium bowl.
step-20: add another 1½ cups (365 grams ) to the bowl with the melted chocolate and the remaining 1½ cups (365 grams) to the bowl with the raspberry puree.
step-21: add 2 teaspoons of melted coconut oil to the bowl with the plain yogurt mixture and the remaining 2 teaspoons melted coconut oil to the bowl with the raspberry puree.
step-22: stir each bowl to combine.
step-23: to assemble the cheesecake, pour the chocolate layer over the graham cracker crust and smooth the top with a spatula.
step-24: freeze for 10 minutes.
step-25: pour the vanilla layer over the chocolate layer and smooth the top with a spatula.
step-26: freeze for another 10 minutes.
step-27: pour the raspberry layer on top of the vanilla layer and smooth with a spatula.
step-28: squeeze a few dots of the reserved raspberry puree on top and use a toothpick to swirl the puree in a decorative pattern.
step-29: wrap the bottom of the pan tightly with foil and place in a high-walled baking dish.
step-30: pour about 1 inch (2 ½ centimeters) of warm water into the baking dish.
step-31: bake the cheesecake for 35 minutes, until the edges are set but the center still jiggles slightly.
step-32: if the top begins to brown, lightly cover with foil for the remaining bake time.
step-33: remove from the oven and carefully remove the springform pan from the water bath.
step-34: cool the cheesecake completely in the refrigerator for 3-4 hours, or overnight.
step-35: when ready to serve, release the springform.
step-36: top the cheesecake with fresh raspberries, chocolate shavings, and raspberry puree.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: cut the puff pastry into 9 equal squares.
step-3: taking one of the squares, place 1 teaspoon of raspberry jam in the center.
step-4: brush egg wash on each side of the square.
step-5: take each corner and bring them together the seal the jam inside the dough
step-6: flip so the pinched side is on the underside.
step-7: flatten with the palm of your hand until the patty is about 1-inch thick.
step-8: make 8 even cuts around the circle making sure the cuts do not touch in the center.
step-9: take 2 of the cut sections and turn them inward to create the heart shape.
step-10: repeat with the other 6 sections.
step-11: repeat with the remaining pastry squares.
step-12: bake for 15–20 minutes until pastry is golden brown and puffed.
step-13: serve with a sprinkle of powdered sugar.

step-1: strain fresh lemon juice.
step-2: pour ⅙ of lemon juice in each slot of the popsicle mold.
step-3: fill the mold with raspberries.
step-4: fill in the gaps of air with water.
step-5: freeze the popsicles for at least 5 hours.
step-6: take the frozen popsicles out of the ice molds and enjoy!

step-1: in a large pitcher, combine the raspberries, lemon slices, white wine, white rum, and lemonade.
step-2: stir and refrigerate for at least 3 hours, or overnight.
step-3: place 1-2 small scoops of raspberry sorbet in a glass.
step-4: remove the sangria from the refrigerator and pour it over the sorbet.
step-5: stir with a spoon to combine.
step-6: garnish with fresh raspberries and a lemon slice.

step-1: combine water, sugar, and raspberries in a pot over medium heat.
step-2: once the sugar has dissolved, simmer for 30 minutes and reduce.
step-3: pour simple syrup through a strainer and remove excess liquid, then let it cool to room temperature.
step-4: in a blender, combine simple syrup, the remaining raspberries, and lemon juice.
step-5: blend until well-combined.
step-6: pour into an 8×8 inch (20x20 cm) baking dish and freeze for at least 12 hours.
step-7: take out of the freezer and let sit for 5-10 minutes before scooping.
step-8: serve.

step-1: in a blender, combine the mango, ½ cup (60 g) raspberries, the rosé, lemon-lime soda, and triple sec and blend until smooth.
step-2: place 2 raspberries in each ice pop mold.
step-3: pour the mixture into the ice pop molds, seal with the lids, and add the ice pop sticks.
step-4: freeze until solid, at least 4 hours, or overnight.
step-5: carefully remove the ice pops from the molds.

step-1: throw the lime wedges, raspberries, mint, and sugar into a glass and then, using a muddler or wooden spoon, press down on the ingredients to mush them all together and get all of the juice out of the lime wedges.
step-2: add ice and pour in rum (you can just eyeball the amount, if you don’t have something handy to measure) and then top the glass off with club soda.
step-3: if you want it a little more or less sweet, you can always add slightly more or slightly less sugar.
step-4: it’s also delicious with less rum, or no rum at all.
step-5: stir well and top with fresh mint.

step-1: mix together egg white, honey, and raspberry jam in a greased coffee mug.
step-2: add oat flour and baking powder and mix until combined.
step-3: add in fresh raspberries.
step-4: microwave on high for 90 seconds (times may vary).

step-1: combine all ingredients in a blender, and mix until fully blended.
step-2: serve and garnish with a slice of peach.

step-1: in a large pitcher, combine the peaches, raspberries, rosé, rum, and peach nectar.
step-2: stir until mixed.
step-3: chill for at least 4 hours.
step-4: add the champagne, then serve with a peach slice on each glass.

step-1: place all ingredients in a glass and muddle to infuse flavors.
step-2: strain and serve.

step-1: make the raspberry jam: in a medium pot over medium heat, combine the raspberries, sugar, and lemon juice.
step-2: cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until thickened.
step-3: remove from the heat and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before assembling the cookies.
step-4: make the cookies: in a medium bowl, mix together the all-purpose flour and almond flour.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: in a large bowl, cream together the butter, sugar, salt, lemon zest, and vanilla with an electric hand mixer until fluffy, about 3 minutes.
step-7: add the poppy seeds and beat for 1 minute to distribute evenly.
step-8: add the egg and beat for 1–2 minutes, until well incorporated.
step-9: pour in the flour mixture and fold with a spatula, just until no streaks of flour remain.
step-10: wrap the dough in plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour or until firm.
step-11: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-12: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-13: unwrap the dough on a floured surface and dust the top of the dough with more flour.
step-14: roll out the dough to ¼-inch (½ cm) thickness.
step-15: using a 2½-inch (6 ⅓ cm) round cookie cutter with ridged edges, cut out cookies, chilling and re-rolling the dough as needed to cut out more cookies.
step-16: you should have about 38 total.
step-17: use a ½-inch (1 ¼ cm) cutter to cut out the centers of half of the cookies.
step-18: transfer cookies to the prepared baking sheet.
step-19: bake the cookies for 12 minutes or until the edges are golden brown.
step-20: let cool completely.
step-21: to assemble, spread 1 teaspoon of jam onto the whole cookies.
step-22: top with the cut-out cookies.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: cut the puff pastry into 9 equal squares.
step-3: taking one of the squares, cut in the middle of each corner making sure your cuts do not touch in the center.
step-4: place ½ teaspoon of hazelnut spread in the center.
step-5: fold each corner to the center and press down until the pastry sticks.
step-6: brush each side of the fold with egg wash.
step-7: brush each side of the fold with egg wash.
step-8: pinch the corners of each fold together to create a petal shape, creating 4 petals.
step-9: place a raspberry in the center.
step-10: repeat with the remaining pastry squares.
step-11: bake for 15–20 minutes, until pastry is golden brown and puffed.
step-12: serve with a sprinkle of powdered sugar.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: cut puff pastry sheets in half, then use a rolling pin to roll each half out to 24-inches (60-cm) long x 8-inches (20-cm) wide.
step-3: brush the puff pastry with the softened butter, then carefully roll them up into a tight log.
step-4: cut the log in half lengthwise.
step-5: take each half and fold the smooth part of the dough inward to create a spiral shape.
step-6: place spirals in a cupcake pan and brush the tops with egg wash.
step-7: bake for 15 minutes on the top rack, then transfer to the bottom rack and bake for an additional 15 minutes.
step-8: remove from the oven.
step-9: once cool, cut out the center of each cruffin and fill with raspberry jam.
step-10: top with a raspberry and sifted powdered sugar.

step-1: put agar and sugar in the bowl and mix.
step-2: place water and mixture a small pan, mix it, and heat with a high heat.
step-3: boil it for 2 minutes with a low heat.
step-4: put small pan larger pot with ice water, chill while mixing for about 3 minutes.
step-5: place the raspberry in a round ice-making dish and pour mixture into it.
step-6: put it in the refrigerator for about 1 hour to cool it.
step-7: gently take it out from the ice tray and put it on a dish.
step-8: 8, serve with brown sugary syrup and soybean flour.

step-1: for the crust, whirl biscuits and melted butter in a food processor until a chunky crumb develops.
step-2: then dump the buttery cookie crumble into a springform pan, spreading the mixture evenly over the bottom and pushing it up against the edges so a nice crust develops.
step-3: for the ripple, combine raspberries, sugar, and water in a pot over medium heat.
step-4: bring the mixture to a steady simmer, and let it bubble for 20-40 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the raspberries break down and it thickens into a cohesive sauce.
step-5: for the filling, whisk together cream cheese and condensed milk, adding the extract along the way.
step-6: whisk until the ingredients are combined and the mixture is smooth.
step-7: pour the filling over the crust, spreading it evenly.
step-8: then add several dabs of the raspberry mixture on top.
step-9: run a couple of toothpicks or a skewer through the filling, from raspberry dab to raspberry dab, creating swirls throughout.
step-10: refrigerate for at least 3 hours.

step-1: blend all ingredients in a food processor or high-speed blender until thoroughly combined.
step-2: pour into a rectangular loaf pan and smooth into an even layer.
step-3: freeze for 2 hours, or until frozen but still a little soft for scooping.
step-4: (if freezing overnight, cover with a lid or plastic wrap, but let it sit out at room temperature for about 5-10 minutes before scooping.)
step-5: scoop into a bowl.

step-1: peel and slice the bananas, then freeze overnight.
step-2: add the frozen bananas, raspberries, almond milk, and vanilla to a food processor or blender.
step-3: blend until smooth and thick.
step-4: transfer to a loaf pan and freeze for at least 2 hours.
step-5: serve with your favorite toppings.

step-1: steam pears and allow to cool.
step-2: add pears and raspberries to a blender or food processor.
step-3: blend very well, until seeds are broken down.
step-4: refrigerate up to 3 days or freeze up to 1 month.
step-5: note: check with your pediatrician before introducing new foods to children under 12 months.

step-1: preheat the oven for 375˚f/190˚c.
step-2: slice the eggplants, roma tomatoes, squash, and zucchini into approximately ¹⁄₁₆-inch/1 ½-mm rounds, then set aside.
step-3: heat olive oil in a 12-inch/30-cm oven safe pan over medium-high heat.
step-4: sauté onions, garlic, and bell peppers until soft, about 10 minutes.
step-5: season with salt and pepper, then add crushed tomatoes.
step-6: stir until ingredients are fully incorporated.
step-7: remove from heat, then add basil.
step-8: stir once more, then smooth the surface of the sauce with your spatula.
step-9: arrange the sliced veggies in alternating patterns, (e.g.
step-10: eggplant, tomato, squash, zucchini) on top of the sauce from the outer edge to the inside of the pan.
step-11: season with salt and pepper.
step-12: mix herb seasoning and pour over the vegetables.
step-13: cover the pan with tin foil and bake for 40 minutes.
step-14: after 40 minutes, uncover, then bake for an additional 20 minutes.
step-15: the vegetables should be soft.
step-16: serve while hot as a main dish, or as a side dish.
step-17: the ratatouille is also excellent the next day.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: add 2 tablespoons of olive oil to a skillet on medium-high heat.
step-3: once warmed, add the onion, bell peppers, 4 minced garlic cloves, salt, and pepper.
step-4: cook, stirring occasionally, until golden brown and caramelized.
step-5: add the eggplant, yellow squash, zucchini, tomato paste, dried oregano, and 1 tablespoon of thyme, and more salt and pepper.
step-6: cook until the vegetables are soft and the tomato paste deepens in color and starts to stick to the bottom.
step-7: add the diced tomatoes and bring the mixture to a simmer.
step-8: cook on low for at least 30 minutes.
step-9: set aside to prepare the rest of the lasagna layers.
step-10: in a large bowl, mix together the ricotta, mozzarella, basil, parsley, salt, pepper and egg.
step-11: set aside.
step-12: to a bowl, add the sliced japanese eggplant, yellow squash, zucchini, roma tomatoes, garlic, 1 tablespoon thyme, salt, pepper, and 2 tablespoons olive oil, and gently toss to combine.
step-13: in a 9x13-inch (23x33 cm) glass baking pan, add a layer of the ratatouille to the bottom.
step-14: top with lasagna noodles, and spread a layer of the ricotta mixture, then shingle alternating slices of the marinated vegetables.
step-15: repeat with another layer of ratatouille, noodles, ricotta, and on the top shingle the vegetables.
step-16: bake for 30 minutes, or until the cheese and sauce are bubbling slightly and the sliced vegetables on top have browned to your liking.
step-17: slice and serve.

step-1: heat a bit of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
step-2: add the eggplant, season with salt and pepper, and cook, stirring occasionally, until golden brown and softened, 5-10 minutes.
step-3: remove from the pan and drain on paper towels.
step-4: heat more oil in the pan, then add the bell peppers.
step-5: cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, 2-3 minutes.
step-6: add the onion and garlic and cook, stirring, until the onions are soft and golden, about 3 minutes.
step-7: remove the peppers and onions from the pan.
step-8: add the yellow squash and zucchini, season with salt and pepper, and cook squash have cooked down a bit, about 5 minutes.
step-9: add the thyme and tomatoes, season with more salt, then add the lemon juice.
step-10: increase the heat to high and cook until mixture is sizzling.
step-11: cook, stirring occasionally, until the tomatoes start to release their juices, about 2 minutes
step-12: return the eggplant and pepper mixture to the pan, stir to combine, then remove the pan from the heat.
step-13: add the quinoa and water to a large skillet and stir to combine.
step-14: bring to a boil, then cover and reduce the heat to low.
step-15: simmer until the liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes.
step-16: spoon the vegetables over quinoa and sprinkle the basil on top.
step-17: serve warm.

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine the pecans with the water and liquid aminos.
step-2: soak for 3 hours, then drain.
step-3: make the pico de gallo: in a medium bowl, combine the tomatoes, onion, cilantro, garlic, salt, pepper, and lime juice and mix well.
step-4: set aside until ready to serve the tacos.
step-5: slice the mango flesh off of the pit, then cube.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: add the drained pecans to a food processor with the mushrooms, green and red bell peppers, red onion, jalapeño, taco seasoning, garlic and herb seasoning, and lime juice.
step-8: pulse a few times until the mixture is well chopped and resembles ground meat.
step-9: do not over-process.
step-10: serve the pecan “meat” in butter lettuce leaves.
step-11: top with pico de gallo, jalapeño, mango, cilantro, avocado, lime juice, and tajín seasoning.

step-1: heat 1 tablespoon of sesame oil in a large, nonstick skillet over medium heat.
step-2: pour in the shrimp and season with ¼ teaspoon of the salt.
step-3: fry the shrimp for 1 minute on each side.
step-4: remove the shrimp from the pan and pour in the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil.
step-5: toss in the red bell pepper, remaining ¼ teaspoon of salt, and red pepper flakes and sauté for a few minutes until they begin to soften.
step-6: add in the soy sauce and sauté about 1 more minute.
step-7: toss the shrimp back into the pan and mix until everything is well incorporated and the shrimp is fully cooked, about 1 minute.
step-8: divide the mixture evenly between 4 bowls and top with green onion.

step-1: in a medium saucepan, bring the water to a rolling boil, season with salt, and add the peppers.
step-2: cover and cook for 6-7 minutes, until a knife easily pierces the peppers.
step-3: use a slotted spoon to remove the peppers from the water and transfer to a blender.
step-4: reserve the water.
step-5: add peppers, pepper, and 1 cup (235 ml) of reserved pepper stock to the blender blend until a smooth consistency is reached.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the cake mix, flour, water, and yeast.
step-2: pour mixture onto a lightly-floured surface and knead until smooth for 5 minutes.
step-3: place dough in a large oiled bowl, brush the top of the dough lightly with oil, and let rise for an hour in a warm area.
step-4: punch down the dough and roll out on a floured surface to a rectangular shape about 1 centimeter (½ inch) thick.
step-5: brush the melted butter evenly over the dough until covered.
step-6: in a small bowl, combine the brown sugar and cinnamon.
step-7: sprinkle the cinnamon sugar evenly over the dough.
step-8: roll up the dough from the bottom to the top.
step-9: cut the dough into nine even pieces and place them in a 9-inch (23 cm) square baking pan greased with nonstick spray.
step-10: let the dough rise for another hour.
step-11: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-12: bake the cinnamon rolls for 30 minutes until toothpick comes out clean.
step-13: release the cinnamon rolls from the pan and place on a wire rack set over a baking sheet.
step-14: pour the cream cheese frosting evenly over the top.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: mix everything except the powdered sugar into a bowl (batter will be thick).
step-3: spoon into balls and roll in the powdered sugar.
step-4: place on cookie sheets leaving about 2 inches (5 cm) between cookies.
step-5: level with a glass.
step-6: bake for 8 to 10 minutes until cookies brown slightly on the edges.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, prepare the red velvet cake batter.
step-3: in a separate bowl, combine cream cheese, powdered sugar, and vanilla, stirring until there are no lumps.
step-4: divide the batter evenly among a lined muffin tin, filling halfway.
step-5: spoon some of the cream cheese mixture onto the batter.
step-6: top with remaining batter, filling about ¾ of the way up.
step-7: bake for 20 minutes, then cool.
step-8: pipe the cream cheese frosting onto each cupcake, then top with red velvet crumbs.

step-1: in a pot over medium-high heat, bring water, sugar, and butter to a boil.
step-2: add in the flour and the cake mix and stir vigorously until mixture has no streaks.
step-3: remove from heat and add the eggs, stirring until the dough becomes a ball.
step-4: transfer dough to a piping bag with a size 9 star tip.
step-5: pipe 3 to 4 inches (7-10cm) strips of the dough on a baking sheet.
step-6: freeze for 30 minutes.
step-7: heat the canola oil in a pot over medium-high heat.
step-8: fry the red velvet churros for about three to four minutes.
step-9: remove from oil and drain on paper towels.
step-10: using a straw, poke a hole through the centers of the churros to hollow out a cavity for the filling.
step-11: on a plate, combine the cinnamon and the sugar and mix until it is a uniform color.
step-12: roll the hollowed out churros in the cinnamon sugar.
step-13: in a medium bowl, combine the cream cheese, confectioners' sugar, and vanilla, stirring until smooth.
step-14: transfer filling into a piping bag with a round tip.
step-15: pipe the filling into the churros and serve.

step-1: combine cake mix, chocolate chips, oil, and eggs in a mixing bowl.
step-2: using an ice cream scoop or your hand, form golf ball-sized balls of cookie dough and transfer to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-3: bake at 350°f (180°c) for 10-12 minutes.

step-1: make the dough: in a large bowl, combine the warm milk, melted butter, and granulated sugar.
step-2: add the yeast, baking powder, salt, and 2 cups (250 g) of flour.
step-3: stir to combine.
step-4: add 2 more cups (250 g) of flour and stir until the dough comes together.
step-5: flour a clean surface with the remaining cup of flour.
step-6: coat your hands with flour.
step-7: dump the dough out onto the floured surface and knead until smooth, about 10 minutes.
step-8: place the dough in a large oiled bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and let rise for 2 hours in a warm area until it’s doubled in size.
step-9: make the filling: in a medium bowl, combine the cream cheese, powdered sugar, lemon juice, lemon zest, and vanilla extract until smooth.
step-10: in a medium bowl, combine the raspberry jam with one tablespoon of the cream cheese filling.
step-11: in a small bowl, combine the blueberry jam with one teaspoon of the cream cheese filling.
step-12: once the dough has risen, lightly flour a clean surface and roll the dough out to a 10x15-inch (25x38-cm) rectangle, about ¼ inch (6 mm) thick.
step-13: brush about 5 inches (13 cm) of the roll with the cream cheese filling, about 8 inches (20 cm) of the roll with the raspberry filling, and about 1½ inches (3 cm) with the blueberry filling.
step-14: set aside the leftover cream cheese filling.
step-15: starting from the bottom, roll up the dough and cut into 9 equal pieces.
step-16: grease a 9-inch (23 cm) square baking dish with nonstick spray and line with parchment paper.
step-17: place the rolls in the pan, with the blueberry roll and 2 raspberry rolls in the top row, 3 cream cheese rolls in the middle row, and 3 raspberry rolls in the bottom row, to look like an american flag.
step-18: cover the rolls with a kitchen towel and let rise for 1 hour in a warm area, until doubled in size.
step-19: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-20: bake the rolls for 25 minutes, or until golden brown on top.
step-21: remove the rolls from the baking dish.
step-22: microwave the reserved cream cheese filling for about 30 seconds, until pourable.
step-23: drizzle on top of the rolls.

step-1: fill popsicle mold or muffin tin with a thick layer of greek yogurt.
step-2: add in strawberries and blueberries.
step-3: you can either layer them or mix them around to distribute the fruit throughout.
step-4: cover with top layer of greek yogurt and use a spatula or a spoon to flatten the surface.
step-5: place popsicle sticks in the center of the molds or muffin tin and place in the freezer for 2 hours or until frozen to your liking.
step-6: if using a muffin tin, you might want to let the froyo freeze before placing in popsicle sticks so that they don’t fall over.
step-7: remove from popsicle molds or muffin tin.

step-1: preheat oven to 250˚f (125˚c).
step-2: clean the ribs (remove membrane or score) and pat dry.
step-3: place the ribs in a foil-lined roasting pan, and season both sides with salt and pepper.
step-4: add about ¼ inch (6mm) of water (about ½ cup (120 ml)) to the pan.
step-5: seal the top of the roasting pan with foil and bake for 2 hours or until ribs are very tender.
step-6: place wine, brown sugar, vinegar, tomato sauce, tomato paste, and allspice in a saucepan.
step-7: simmer the sauce for at least 45 minutes and season to taste.
step-8: the sauce should be rich and thick.
step-9: raise oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-10: remove ribs from roasting pan.
step-11: pour off all fat and water, and baste ribs with sauce.
step-12: bake an additional 20-30 minutes.
step-13: (you can stop and re-baste halfway through.)
step-14: cut ribs and serve with additional sauce.

step-1: pour the red wine and water into a medium pan.
step-2: season with salt.
step-3: bring the mixture to a boil and add the spaghetti.
step-4: cook until most of the red wine is absorbed by the pasta, 8-10 minutes.
step-5: transfer the pasta to a medium bowl.
step-6: melt the butter in the same skillet over medium heat.
step-7: add the garlic, pine nuts, and red pepper flakes.
step-8: cook the sauce until the butter starts to brown, then add the pasta.
step-9: mix the sauce and pasta together.
step-10: sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

step-1: measure ¼ cup (60 ml) of wine and set aside.
step-2: combine the water and the remainder of the bottle of wine in a large pot and bring to a boil.
step-3: once boiling, add spaghetti and cook (stirring frequently) until al dente, about 7 minutes.
step-4: reserve ¼ cup (60 ml) of the cooking liquid and drain the spaghetti.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: in a large skillet, heat the olive oil on medium heat.
step-7: add the garlic and red pepper flakes and cook for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally.
step-8: add the reserved cooking liquid and reserved wine to the skillet and bring to a simmer.
step-9: add the pasta and toss to coat with the sauce.
step-10: add the butter and stir until it melts into the pasta.
step-11: add salt and pepper, parmesan, and parsley.
step-12: stir to combine.
step-13: serve on its own or top with more parmesan and parsley and open up another bottle of wine!

step-1: combine the water, tea bag, and lavender buds in a small saucepan over medium-high heat.
step-2: bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 3-4 minutes, until the liquid is slightly reduced and the lavender is fragrant.
step-3: strain to remove lavender buds.
step-4: in a mug, stir to combine the strained tea, honey, and whiskey.
step-5: finish with a squeeze of lemon and garnish with a lemon slice and a few lavender buds.

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine cayenne pepper, paprika, garlic powder, mustard powder, black pepper, and onion powder, and mix well.
step-2: in a large bowl, place chicken and pat dry.
step-3: add 5 tablespoons of the spice mix and salt, and mix well, making sure all the chicken is fully coated.
step-4: cover with plastic wrap and rest in the fridge for at least 30 minutes, up to 24 hours.
step-5: in a small saucepan, combine canola oil, 2 tablespoons of the spice mix, and brown sugar over medium heat and stir until the brown sugar dissolves, about 2-3 minutes.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: in a medium-size bowl, add the buttermilk and hot sauce, and mix well.
step-8: dredge each piece of chicken into the flour, shaking off any excess.
step-9: dip them into the buttermilk mixture, then back into the flour.
step-10: heat oil to 325°f (170°c) in a deep pot.
step-11: fry 3-4 chicken pieces at a time, making sure to not overcrowd the pot, for 10-12 minutes, until golden brown and crispy.
step-12: transfer the fried chicken to a wire rack over a baking sheet and brush with the spicy oil dust with the remaining spice mixture.
step-13: place on a slice of white bread and top with dill pickle.

step-1: make the compound butter: in a medium bowl, mix together the butter, blue cheese, chives, salt, and pepper until well combined.
step-2: transfer the butter to a piece of plastic wrap and roll into a log.
step-3: refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or until ready to use.
step-4: make the fried onions: in a shallow bowl, combine the onions and buttermilk and let sit at room temperature for 1 hour.
step-5: in a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, paprika, salt, and pepper.
step-6: dip the buttermilk-coated onions into the flour mixture, shaking off any excess.
step-7: fill a large skillet with high sides with the canola oil.
step-8: heat the oil over medium-high heat until it reaches 375˚f (190˚c).
step-9: once the oil is hot, add the onions in batches and fry for 3 minutes, until golden brown.
step-10: transfer the onions to a wire rack to drain and season with salt.
step-11: generously season the steaks all over with salt and pepper.
step-12: add the olive oil to a large cast-iron or stainless-steel pan over high heat.
step-13: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the steaks and cook, without disturbing, until a brown crust forms, about 7 minutes.
step-14: flip the steaks and continue to cook for 7 minutes more, until the steak is browned on both sides.
step-15: sear the sides of the steak to render any fat.
step-16: add the butter and thyme to the pan.
step-17: tilt the pan toward you and baste the steaks with the melted butter for 2 minutes, until the internal temperature reaches 135°f (60°c) for medium rare.
step-18: serve the steak with the crispy onions and blue cheese compound butter.

step-1: pat the steaks dry with a paper towel.
step-2: season generously on both sides with the salt and black pepper.
step-3: add the olive oil and 1 tablespoon of butter to a nonstick or stainless steel pan over medium-high heat.
step-4: sear the steaks, one at a time, until a golden brown crust forms, about 5 minutes per side.
step-5: if the pan gets too dry, add a bit more olive oil.
step-6: transfer the seared steaks to a cutting board to rest.
step-7: add the shallots, capers, and remaining ½ tablespoon of butter to the pan.
step-8: cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the capers crisp slightly.
step-9: deglaze the pan with the wine.
step-10: cook until reduced by half, about 30-60 seconds.
step-11: add the mustard and cream and adjust seasoning to taste.
step-12: slice the steak into ¼-inch (6 mm) pieces and transfer to serving plates.
step-13: pour the sauce over the steak and garnish with sliced chives.
step-14: serve with roasted potatoes and a side salad.

step-1: rinse the rice in a sieve three times, or until the water runs clear.
step-2: add the water and salt to a saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat.
step-3: add the rice and stir, letting the water come to a boil again.
step-4: place the lid on the saucepan and lower the heat to a simmer.
step-5: simmer for 18 minutes.
step-6: turn off the heat and let the rice steam for 5 minutes.
step-7: fluff the rice with a fork.

step-1: cut rice cakes into smaller pieces.
step-2: place rice cakes and the cooled hardboiled egg in the box.
step-3: place the avocado into the box and pour some red pepper flakes into a separate section.
step-4: refrigerate until ready to eat.

step-1: put washed rice, garlic, ginger, salt, chicken bouillon, and water in a rice cooker pot and mix well.
step-2: add chicken thigh to the pot skin-side down, and place the scallion over the chicken.
step-3: cook for 30 minutes, or until the rice and chicken are cooked through.
step-4: for sauce, combine scallion, white sugar, sesame oil, grated garlic, grated ginger, soy sauce, vinegar, miso, and red chili flakes.
step-5: mix well.
step-6: when the rice is ready, remove scallion and chicken.
step-7: stir the rice well to fluff it up and slice the chicken.
step-8: press cooked rice into a bowl to make a dome shape.
step-9: then turn the bowl upside down onto the serving plate.
step-10: serve the sliced chicken with cilantro, tomatoes, and lemon, and pour the sauce over to your preference.

step-1: combine the blue velvet cake ingredients in a mixing bowl.
step-2: mix until smooth.
step-3: pour cake batter into your rice cooker bowl.
step-4: place bowl into rice cooker and let it slow cook for 90 minutes.
step-5: note: all rice cookers are different.
step-6: check the doneness of your cake with a toothpick.
step-7: if you insert the toothpick, then remove it, and it is clean, the cake is done.
step-8: once the cake is done cooking, remove from rice cooker and let it sit for 15 minutes to cool down.
step-9: flip over and out and cut in half.
step-10: chill in the refrigerator so it’s easier to ice.
step-11: combine frosting ingredients in a bowl.
step-12: mix until smooth.
step-13: start with the bottom half of the cake, spread some of the frosting and add a few blueberries (optional).
step-14: top with the other half of the cake.
step-15: frost the cake however you like.
step-16: add some chocolate shavings (optional).

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the cream cheese and 100 g (½ cup) of the sugar.
step-2: add the eggs and whisk until combined.
step-3: zest one half of the orange over the batter.
step-4: add the lemon juice and whisk to combine.
step-5: add the pancake mix and melted butter, and whisk until the batter is smooth.
step-6: brush the bowl of the rice cooker with melted butter.
step-7: sprinkle the remaining tablespoon of sugar on the inside of the bowl so that it is well coated.
step-8: slice the orange into 7 thin slices and lay on the inside of the bowl.
step-9: pour the batter over the oranges, and cook for 40 minutes.
step-10: remove the bowl of the rice cooker and place a plate over the top.
step-11: carefully flip the bowl upside-down so that the cake slides onto on the plate with the orange slices on top.

step-1: in a large bowl, use a spatula to mix the sugar and cream cheese until well-combined.
step-2: whisk in the eggs until there are no lumps remaining.
step-3: stir in the pineapple juice, melted butter, and pancake mix until the batter is thick and smooth.
step-4: make the caramel sauce: in a small saucepan over medium-high heat, melt the butter, then add the brown sugar.
step-5: stir rapidly for 2 to 3 minutes.
step-6: remove from the heat once mixture starts to boil and thicken.
step-7: pour the caramel sauce into the bottom of a 1-liter rice cooker bowl insert.
step-8: place one pineapple slice in the middle of the rice cooker bowl, then arrange the other slices in a ring around it.
step-9: place one maraschino cherry in the center of each pineapple slice.
step-10: pour the cake batter over the pineapple slices and shake to smooth out the top of the batter.
step-11: cook for 60 minutes.
step-12: remove the bowl insert from the rice cooker and invert the cake onto a plate.
step-13: slice and serve, topped with vanilla ice cream if desired.

step-1: in a large bowl, add butter and marshmallow.
step-2: microwave for 2 minutes.
step-3: stir at 1 minute.
step-4: add the cereal and stir until the marshmallow evenly coats the cereal.
step-5: using a ice cream scoop, form treats into balls.
step-6: take a wafer cone and dip it in melted chocolate and then immediately sprinkle anything you desire.
step-7: place the rice krispy balls into the cone.

step-1: in a blender or food processor, blend all of the sweet chili sauce ingredients together.
step-2: pour into a saucepan and bring to a boil.
step-3: add the cornstarch slurry (dissolve 1 tbsp.
step-4: of cornstarch in 2 tbsp.
step-5: of water), stir and remove from heat.
step-6: set aside until ready to use.
step-7: place a colander over a large mixing bowl.
step-8: add the rice noodles, pour the boiling water over and let it sit and soften for 10 minutes.
step-9: drain, discard water and add the noodles to mixing bowl.
step-10: using a pair of kitchen scissors, cut the noodles so they are easier to manage.
step-11: add the carrots, scallions, ginger, sesame oil, beaten eggs.
step-12: mix well.
step-13: grab a handful of noodles and place into your heated pan.
step-14: using your spatula, flatten the noodles.
step-15: pan-fry until both sides are golden brown and crispy.
step-16: serve with the sweet chili sauce.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: place 5-inch (10 cm) greased cookie cutters on a greased baking pan.
step-3: fill the bottom of each cookie cutter with ½-inch (1 cm) of brownie batter.
step-4: bake for 15 minutes, or until cooked through.
step-5: remove from the oven and let the brownies cool
step-6: in a medium bowl combine chocolate chips and hot heavy cream.
step-7: let stand for 1 minute, then stir until the ganache is a smooth, silky consistency.
step-8: fill each cookie cutter with a layer of raspberries, then pour the chocolate ganache over the top of the raspberries until it fills in the cookie cutters.
step-9: refrigerate for 2 hours, or until the ganache is set.
step-10: remove from the fridge and gently push the bottom of the brownies until they pop out of the cookie cutters.
step-11: sift powdered sugar over the top and serve.
step-12: pairs well with merlot.

step-1: spread ricotta over toast, and top with sliced apples and a drizzle of honey.
mix the eggs with the milk and sugar.
step-2: spread all the bread slices with ricotta cheese, and top half of the bread slices with mini chocolate chips.
step-3: sandwich each chocolate chip half with a plain ricotta half, and drench both sides in the egg mixture.
step-4: coat a medium heat skillet with butter, and cook the bread until slightly brown and all the egg is cooked.
step-5: to make the syrup combine all syrup ingredients in a saucepan, and bring to a boil.
step-6: let the liquid reduce by about a third, until the mixture is thick like a syrup.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the ground pork, cabbage, nira chives, shiitake, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, sesame oil, sake, salt, and black pepper.
step-2: mix well with your hands.
step-3: place a teaspoon of filling in the middle of a dumpling wrapper.
step-4: using your finger, lightly wet the half of the outer rim with water.
step-5: fold the wrapper in half.
step-6: using your fingertips, make pleats to seal the dumpling.
step-7: repeat with the remaining wrappers and filling.
step-8: in a large nonstick frying pan, heat the sesame oil over medium heat.
step-9: add the 20-22 dumplings in a circle.
step-10: fry for 1-3 minutes.
step-11: combine the flour and the water in a small bowl or measuring cup.
step-12: pour into the pan and cover.
step-13: steam the dumplings until the water is mostly evapolated, 7-8 minutes.
step-14: remove the lid and continue cooking until the water is completely evaporated.
step-15: place a plate on top of gyoza.
step-16: flip the pan upside down while pressing the plate to invert the dumplings.
step-17: cook the remaining dumplings.
step-18: serve with dipping sauce.

step-1: melt the butter in a 5qt-pot over medium heat.
step-2: add chili, and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
step-3: add the onion and saute until translucent, about 5 minutes.
step-4: add the crushed garlic and ginger and cook for 2-3 minutes, until fragrant.
step-5: stirring occasionally.
step-6: reduce the heat to low, cover, and cook until the onion is completely softened, about 10 minutes.
step-7: stir occasionally to make sure bottom doesn’t burn.
step-8: add the tomato puree.
step-9: stir well and cover again.
step-10: cook until tomato looks like it’s almost separating, and is reduced in volume by half, about 10 minutes.
step-11: add the coriander and paneer masala.
step-12: stir well.
step-13: add the red bell pepper and cook until the pepper is half-cooked, about 5 minutes.
step-14: add the salt, cover again, and cook for another 5 minutes.
step-15: add the heavy cream.
step-16: stir well, then add the cubed paneer and cover.
step-17: cook for 25 minutes all the ingredients are tender.
step-18: garnish with cilantro and serve with naan or rice.

step-1: remove the giblets from the chicken cavity.
step-2: pat the chicken dry all over with paper towels, including the cavity.
step-3: generously season the entire chicken with salt and pepper.
step-4: with the tip of a toothpick, poke the skin of the chicken all over, creating at least 20 tiny holes.
step-5: transfer the chicken to a rimmed baking dish and let sit in the refrigerator, uncovered, for 8-12 hours.
step-6: preheat the oven to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-7: remove the chicken from the refrigerator and let it warm to room temperature for 1 hour.
step-8: truss the chicken legs.
step-9: using butcher’s twine, tie the legs together, then slip the twine under each leg, pull up to the top of the chicken, and flip the bird over.
step-10: pull the twine under the wings, loop around the neck, and then tie to secure and cut off any excess twine.
step-11: flip the bird over again and tuck the wings under the breasts.
step-12: set the chicken, breast-side up, on a roasting rack set over a roasting pan.
step-13: roast for 1 hour, or until a meat thermometer inserted in the thickest part of the chicken reaches 165˚f (75˚c).
step-14: let the chicken rest at room temperature for 20 minutes.
step-15: to carve, remove the twine.
step-16: using a sharp knife, cut between the leg and the breast.
step-17: when you reach the joint, bend it back and cut right through.
step-18: twist off the wings.
step-19: to remove the breasts, cut straight down along the keel bone.
step-20: then, angling your knife outward, remove the breast.
step-21: break the legs down into thighs and drumsticks, if desired.
step-22: pull off the oysters from the underside of the chicken.
step-23: if you’d like, make chicken stock from the carcass.
step-24: add the carcass to a large pot with onions, celery, carrots, garlic, and other aromatics of your choice.
step-25: cover with water and bring to a boil over high heat.
step-26: reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 8 hours, skimming off the fat as needed.
step-27: store in the fridge for a few days or freeze for a few months.

step-1: create the herb rub in a food processor.
step-2: pulse the olive oil, rosemary, garlic, shallots, thyme, pepper and salt together until you have a thick paste.
step-3: spread out the leg of lamb and rub half of the herb rub all over the exposed side of the lamb.
step-4: roll up and securely tie the leg of lamb together with kitchen twine.
step-5: in the roasting pan, spread out the carrots, onions, potatoes, garlic cloves, salt, pepper, and oil.
step-6: rest the leg of lamb on top of the vegetables.
step-7: pour the rest of the herb rub all over the leg of lamb, spread out so it coats evenly.
step-8: roast at 450°f (230°c) for 50 - 60 minutes or until the internal temperature reads 130°f (55°c) for medium rare.
step-9: remove the leg of lamb and let it rest of 20 minutes before you remove the kitchen twine to carve.
step-10: serve with the roasted vegetables.

step-1: preheat oven to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-2: on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, cover broccoli in olive oil and toss to coat evenly.
step-3: season with salt and lemon zest and roast for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned.
step-4: serve with tahini sauce.

step-1: cut the stems off the brussels sprouts, then cut into quarters.
step-2: put the brussels sprouts into a mixing bowl and add garlic powder, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
step-3: lightly grease the baking sheet with oil and spread evenly.
step-4: bake for 20-25 minutes at 400°f (200°c).
step-5: for the dressing, mix the greek yogurt, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, dijon mustard, minced garlic, salt, and pepper.
step-6: in a large mixing bowl, add mixed greens, shredded carrots, sliced almonds, dried cranberries, shredded parmesan, and the roasted brussels sprouts.
step-7: pour dressing over the salad and mix well.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: add butternut squash and onion to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, and season with olive oil, salt, pepper, and nutmeg.
step-3: roast for 25-30 minutes, or until tender.
step-4: add roasted squash and onion to a food processor or blender.
step-5: add vegetable broth, almond milk, and blend until smooth.
step-6: in a large sauce pot over medium heat, add olive oil, garlic, red pepper flakes, and sage.
step-7: cook for about 1 minute, or until fragrant.
step-8: add squash puree and bring to a simmer, stirring occasionally.
step-9: add cooked pasta and steamed broccoli and stir to combine.
step-10: top with parmesan, and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: add the carrots to a sheet pan, and toss with olive oil, salt, pepper, and maple syrup.
step-3: roast for 20 minutes.
step-4: top with parsley.

step-1: make the crispy chickpeas: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, combine the chickpeas, curry powder, garlic powder, onion powder, coriander, turmeric, and salt, and toss to coat the chickpeas.
step-3: transfer the chickpeas to a small baking sheet and spread in an even layer.
step-4: bake for 30 minutes, or until the chickpeas are crispy.
step-5: remove from the oven and let cool.
step-6: make the soup: increase the oven temperature to 450˚f (220˚c).
step-7: add the cauliflower florets to a medium bowl with the melted coconut oil, salt, and pepper.
step-8: toss to coat, then transfer the cauliflower to a baking sheet.
step-9: roast for 25 minutes, until browned and tender.
step-10: melt the remaining 2 tablespoons of coconut oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat.
step-11: add the onion and jalapeño, and cook until the onion begins to caramelize, about 2 minutes.
step-12: add the garlic and continue to cook for 2 minutes more, until the garlic is toasted and fragrant.
step-13: add the curry paste and cook for 1 minute, stirring to dissolve.
step-14: add the coconut milk and vegetable broth and season with salt and pepper.
step-15: remove from the heat.
step-16: add the roasted cauliflower to a blender with the broth and puree until smooth.
step-17: ladle the soup into bowls.
step-18: top with the crispy chickpeas, scallions, and cilantro, and serve with lime wedges.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the cauliflower, carrots, cumin, paprika, salt, pepper and olive oil.
step-4: toss until well-coated.
step-5: spread the vegetables on the baking sheet in a single layer and roast for 20-25 minutes, until the carrots are tender.
step-6: make the dressing: in a medium bowl, whisk together the tahini, garlic, lemon juice, and water.
step-7: while whisking, slowly drizzle in the olive oil until the dressing is emulsified.
step-8: season with salt and pepper.
step-9: in a large bowl, mix together the onion and parsley.
step-10: add the roasted cauliflower and carrots, and toss well.
step-11: drizzle the salad with the dressing, then serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 450˚f (220˚c).
step-2: in a mixing bowl combine the cauliflower, olive oil, cumin, turmeric, chili powder, and salt and mix with tongs until evenly coated.
step-3: place seasoned cauliflower on parchment lined baking sheet and roast in preheated oven for 15 minutes or until lightly browned.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, mix together the chickpeas, olive oil, paprika, and garlic salt.
step-3: spread the chickpeas onto a baking sheet in one layer.
step-4: bake for 25-30 minutes, until the chickpeas are crisp.
step-5: dice the cucumber and add to a large bowl.
step-6: toss in the mixed greens, cucumber, tomatoes, avocado, roasted chickpeas, extra virgin olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper, and mix until well combined.
step-7: divide between individual bowls and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375°f (190˚c).
step-2: prepare the delicata squash.
step-3: using a long, sharp knife, remove the ends of the squash, then cut in half lengthwise.
step-4: scoop out the seeds and pulp.
step-5: rinse and reserve the seeds.
step-6: lay each half of the squash down on its cut side and cut into ½-inch (1-cm) thick slices.
step-7: place the squash in the 3 quart prep bowl along with 1 tablespoon of olive oil and 1 teaspoon of salt.
step-8: cover the bowl with the lid and shake to fully coat the squash.
step-9: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-10: transfer the squash to the baking sheet, spread in a single layer, and roast for 20 minutes.
step-11: while the squash is roasting, remove the fennel fronds and bottom end and thinly slice the bulb.
step-12: add to the bowl with 1 tablespoon of olive oil and ½ teaspoon of salt.
step-13: cover and shake well to coat.
step-14: after 20 minutes, remove the baking sheet with the squash from the oven and add the fennel, spreading evenly.
step-15: return to the oven for another 20 minutes, until the squash is tender and slightly browned and the fennel is tender and caramelized.
step-16: add the delicata seeds to the 1½ quart prep bowl.
step-17: depending on how many seeds there are, add the remaining tablespoon of olive oil, a pinch of salt, and ½-1 teaspoon smoked paprika.
step-18: cover the bowl with the lid and shake to coat the seeds well.
step-19: line a small baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-20: spread the seeds in a single layer and add to the oven for the last 10 minutes while the squash and fennel finish roasting, until golden brown.
step-21: make the vinaigrette: in a small bowl, add the apple cider vinegar, lemon juice, honey, dijon, and garlic.
step-22: whisk to combine, then season with salt and pepper.
step-23: slowly stream in the olive oil, whisking to emulsify.
step-24: season with more salt, if needed.
step-25: in a large bowl, assemble the salad.
step-26: add the kale, farro, and chickpeas, then the roasted delicata and fennel, and finally the goat cheese.
step-27: toss to combine.
step-28: top with the roasted squash seeds.
step-29: add the salad to a serving bowl and drizzle with the vinaigrette.
step-30: leftover salad will keep in the fridge for up to 4 days.
step-31: nutrition (without dressing) per serving - calories: 275, total fat: 10 grams, total carbs: 40 grams, dietary fiber: 10 grams, sugars: 8 grams, protein: 11 grams
step-32: nutrition – apple cider vinaigrette per serving - serving size: 2 tablespoons - calories: 122, total fat: 11 grams, total carbs: 6 grams, dietary fiber: 0 grams, sugars: 5 grams, protein: 0 grams

step-1: preheat the oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-2: slice the tops off the eggplants, then slice them in half lengthwise.
step-3: cut each half once more lengthwise.
step-4: lay the slices on their flat sides and cut lengthwise into thirds.
step-5: finally, slice horizontally to form cubes.
step-6: transfer to a baking sheet, drizzle with the olive oil, salt, and pepper.
step-7: bake for 25 minutes, stirring halfway through, until golden brown.
step-8: in a large saucepan, heat the coconut oil over high hat.
step-9: add the onions, stir for 1 minute, then reduce the heat to medium-low and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onions are golden brown, about 8 minutes.
step-10: stir in the chili powder, cardamom, and smoked paprika.
step-11: cook until fragrant, about 1 minute
step-12: stir in the ground coriander, ½ teaspoon of black pepper, turmeric, garlic, and ginger.
step-13: cook for a few minutes more, stirring constantly.
step-14: add the chopped tomatoes, coconut milk, water, and the roasted eggplant.
step-15: bring the curry to a simmer, then reduce to low heat, cover, and simmer for 25 minutes.
step-16: the sauce should reduce and thicken slightly.
step-17: serve the curry warm over rice, topped with chopped cilantro.

step-1: place the potatoes in a large pot of salted water and bring to a boil over high heat.
step-2: boil for 5-7 minutes, then drain in a colander.
step-3: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-4: thoroughly dry the par-boiled potatoes with a paper towel.
step-5: on a cutting board, quarter the potatoes.
step-6: place the potatoes in a large bowl, drizzle with olive oil, and season with salt, pepper, and rosemary, stirring until well-coated.
step-7: transfer the potatoes to a parchment-lined baking sheet and spread in an even layer.
step-8: roast for 35-45 minutes, until crispy.

step-1: remove the stem from each sprout and cut in half.
step-2: place the brussels sprouts in a large bowl.
step-3: add the rest of the ingredients to the bowl and toss to cover.
step-4: spread the sprouts onto a baking sheet.
step-5: bake in a 400˚f (200˚c) oven for 20 minutes.
step-6: flip the sprouts, then bake for an additional 20 minutes or until the sprouts are fork-tender and golden.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: cut potatoes in half, then slice.
step-3: place the potatoes in a large bowl.
step-4: drizzle olive oil and toss to coat.
step-5: in a small bowl, mix salt, garlic powder, italian seasoning, and paprika.
step-6: sprinkle seasoning on potatoes and toss to coat.
step-7: spread the potatoes on a baking sheet.
step-8: bake for 30 minutes.
step-9: remove from the oven, sprinkle with parmesan and pepper.
step-10: bake for an additional 20 minutes.
step-11: sprinkle potatoes with fresh parsley and serve while hot.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: place the peppers on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, until peppers are fragrant and the skin has charred.
step-3: allow peppers to cool before peeling away the charred skin.
step-4: add roasted peppers, chickpeas, garlic, tahini, lemon juice, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper to the bowl of a 2-quart food processor.
step-5: blend until smooth.
step-6: while blending, slowly add in the olive oil until hummus is creamy and smooth.
step-7: garnish with finely chopped bell pepper and a drizzle of olive oil.

step-1: in a medium-sized pot or dutch oven over medium heat, add the olive oil and onion and cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally, until semi translucent.
step-2: add the garlic and cook for 2-3 minutes.
step-3: transfer onion and garlic to blender.
step-4: add the soaked cashews, red pepper, nutritional yeast, tomato paste, cornstarch, salt, paprika, ground mustard, turmeric, and vegetable broth, and blend until smooth.
step-5: transfer sauce back into pot and cook until thickened, about 5 minutes.
step-6: add pasta to the pot and stir until sauce is evenly distributed.
step-7: top with smoked paprika and serve immediately.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200˚c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: toss the cauliflower, broccoli, carrots, and olive oil together on the baking sheet until everything is well-coated.
step-4: season with salt, pepper, and garlic and toss to distribute.
step-5: bake until the vegetables are tender and starting to brown, about 20 minutes.
step-6: once cooled, transfer to an airtight container and store in the fridge.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: add cut vegetables to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-3: drizzle in olive oil and sprinkle with seasonings to your preference.
step-4: bake for 10 minutes.
step-5: move veggies to the side to make space in the center of the baking sheet and add shrimp in a single layer.
step-6: drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with seasonings and lime juice to your preference.
step-7: bake for 5-8 minutes, until shrimp is fully cooked.
step-8: be careful not to overcook.
step-9: mix dressing ingredients together in a small bowl.
step-10: in a large salad bowl, combine mixed greens, roasted shrimp, veggies, and vinaigrette dressing together.
step-11: serve and enjoy!

step-1: preheat the oven at 350°f (180°c).
step-2: while it’s heating, chop zucchini, eggplant, onion, and garlic.
step-3: then toss them in a large bowl with salt, pepper, and oil.
step-4: transfer to a foil-lined sheet tray.
step-5: bake for 40 minutes, stirring every 10 minutes.
step-6: meanwhile, score a small ‘x’ into the bottom of each tomato and microwave them in a bowl for 7 to 10 minutes.
step-7: once cooled, peel the skin off and roughly dice them.
step-8: after 40 minutes of cooking, increase oven to 400°f (205°c), add the tomatoes, and bake for an additional 25 minutes.
step-9: let cool, then store in covered container in fridge.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: place sweet potatoes and chicken breast on a parchment paper-lined sheet tray and season with olive oil, salt, pepper, and paprika.
step-3: bake until chicken is cooked through and sweet potatoes are tender, 15-18 minutes.
step-4: slice the chicken breast.
step-5: in a measuring cup, add the olive oil, apple cider vinegar, honey, mustard, salt, pepper, and cinnamon and whisk to combine.
step-6: toss the sweet potatoes and sliced chicken with the sliced apples, feta, and walnuts and drizzle with vinaigrette.

step-1: preheat oven to 450°f (230˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, add the brussels sprouts, onion, olive oil, salt, and pepper, and mix to combine.
step-3: transfer to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and add pears.
step-4: bake for 15 minutes.
step-5: stir once, then back for an additional 10-15 minutes, until the brussels sprouts are golden brown and have started to crisp and the pears have caramelized.
step-6: squeeze the lemon over the brussels sprouts and drizzle with the honey.
step-7: add the dried cranberries and stir to combine.
step-8: bake for an additional 25-35 minutes.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425°f (220˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, add the white onion, red wine vinegar, lemon juice, lemon zest, and mustard.
step-3: season with salt and pepper, and stir to combine.
step-4: in a large bowl, toss together 3 tablespoons of the olive oil, broccoli, fennel, garlic, and red pepper flakes.
step-5: spread the broccoli onto a large baking sheet and season with salt and pepper.
step-6: bake, tossing the vegetables occasionally, until tender and golden, 25 to 30 minutes.
step-7: remove the garlic from the baking sheet, and finely chop.
step-8: add the minced garlic to the onion mixture.
step-9: whisking constantly, slowly add the remaining ¼ cup (60 ml) of the olive oil to the onion mixture until an emulsified dressing forms.
step-10: whisk in the fennel fronds.
step-11: add the beans and roasted vegetables, and toss to combine.
step-12: season with salt and pepper to taste.
step-13: top with the chopped eggs and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: add the zucchini, sweet potato, tomatoes, onion, and corn to the baking sheet.
step-4: drizzle with the lemon juice and 2 tablespoons of olive oil, then season with garlic salt and pepper.
step-5: toss to coat evenly, keeping the vegetables separate on the pan.
step-6: roast for 15-20 minutes, or until fork tender.
step-7: transfer the roasted vegetables to a large bowl, and add the quinoa.
step-8: toss well.
step-9: in a small bowl, mix together the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil and apple cider vinegar.
step-10: pour over the veggies and quinoa, and toss to coat.
step-11: garnish with parsley.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, mix the butternut squash, bell pepper, brussels sprouts, dried oregano, salt, pepper, and olive oil until the veggies are evenly coated.
step-3: pour the vegetables onto a baking sheet in one even layer and roast for 40 minutes.
step-4: to make the dressing, place the avocado, garlic, lime juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper in a blender or food processor and blend until the mixture is light and creamy.
step-5: to assemble the salad, place a handful of mixed greens on a plate and top with the roasted veggies.
step-6: spoon on the avocado dressing and serve!

step-1: preheat oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-2: combine all vegetables (except spinach) in large bowl and stir.
step-3: add salt, pepper, oregano, and olive oil for the salad and stir.
step-4: spread vegetables on baking sheet and bake for 40 minutes.
step-5: to prepare the dressing, combine olive oil, balsamic vinaigrette, and maple syrup in a small bowl and stir until well-combined.
step-6: in a bowl, add spinach and any other greens you prefer.
step-7: sprinkle roasted vegetables and feta cheese over the top.
step-8: drizzle dressing over salad.

step-1: preheat grill to medium heat.
step-2: combine the oil, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and pepper, stirring until mixed.
step-3: slide a zucchini slice down the skewer, followed by pieces of mushroom, red onion, and peppers, until there is a 1-inch gap at the top of the skewer.
step-4: brush each skewer liberally with the oil mixture.
step-5: repeat with the remaining skewers and vegetables.
step-6: grill the skewers for 12-18 minutes with the lid closed, flipping halfway.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper, add carrots, potatoes, yellow squash, and zucchini.
step-3: drizzle with olive oil and season with salt, pepper, oregano, and garlic, and mix to evenly coat the coat the vegetables.
step-4: *note: you may need to quarter the potatoes if they are too thick so they roast faster.
step-5: bake for 25-30 minutes, until the vegetables are golden brown.
step-6: make the chimichurri dressing: combine the cilantro, parsley, garlic, salt, pepper, olive oil, lime juice, and red wine vinegar in a food processor and blend until smooth.
step-7: add a large handful of greens to a large bowl.
step-8: top with the roasted vegetables and sliced radishes.
step-9: pour over the chimichurri dressing and toss until evenly distributed.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: spread the broccolini, squash, and red onion on a baking sheet.
step-3: drizzle with 2 tablespoons of olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
step-4: toss to coat.
step-5: roast the vegetables for 20 minutes, until the broccolini is beginning to crisp and the squash and onions are tender.
step-6: remove from the oven and set aside.
step-7: while the vegetables are roasting, make the spinach pesto: in a food processor, combine the spinach, walnuts, lemon zest, garlic, lemon juice, and red pepper flakes.
step-8: with the processor running, slowly stream in the remaining ½ cup of olive oil until the pesto reaches a smooth, thick, and spreadable consistency.
step-9: cook the orzo according to package instructions.
step-10: add ¾ cup of the pesto to the warm orzo and toss to coat.
step-11: mix in the roasted vegetables and more pesto to taste.
step-12: serve warm or chilled.

step-1: prepare the brownie mix batter according to package instructions.
step-2: add nuts to your brownie mix batter.
step-3: mix thoroughly.
step-4: pour into baking pan.
step-5: bake the brownie mix according to package instructions.
step-6: remove from the oven, and top with marshmallows.
step-7: broil for 30 seconds, until the marshmallows are toasty.
step-8: serve with a drizzle of chocolate syrup.

step-1: in one bowl, beat the heavy cream until stiff peaks form.
step-2: in a separate bowl, mix the root beer, milk, and pudding mix until thick.
step-3: fold the heavy cream into the pudding mixture.
step-4: pour into prepared graham cracker crust.
step-5: freeze for four hours or refrigerate overnight.
step-6: serve with your favorite topping!
step-7: (we used whipped cream and sprinkles.)

step-1: in a pitcher or large bowl, add tequila, lime juice, simple syrup, and rosé.
step-2: stir to combine.
step-3: pour the himalayan salt into a shallow dish.
step-4: wet the rim of the servings glasses, and dip each into the salt.
step-5: add ice to each serving glass (optional), then top with the rosé margarita (rosarita).
step-6: serve with a lime wedge.

step-1: heat wine in a microwave-safe container for 1 minute, or until hot.
step-2: mix sugar and gelatin into the wine and stir with a whisk until dissolved.
step-3: pour mixture into molds.
step-4: add fruit if desired.
step-5: refrigerate for 1 hour.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the chopped shrimp, ground pork, sake, salt, soy sauce, ginger, garlic, sugar, and chinese chives and mix until thoroughly combined.
step-2: using your finger, rub the right edge of a dumpling wrapper with water.
step-3: lay another dumpling wrapper over the edge so that it slightly overlaps, sealing tightly.
step-4: repeat with 2 more wrappers.
step-5: scoop a spoonful of filling onto the middle of each dumpling wrapper.
step-6: wet the edges of the wrappers and fold each wrapper over from top to bottom, ensuring that the edges are still overlapped, sealing tightly.
step-7: gently roll the dumplings from one end to the other, starting from the left side, creating a flower shape.
step-8: repeat with the remaining dumpling wrappers and fillings to create 8 rose dumplings in total
step-9: heat 1 tablespoon of sesame oil in a medium pan over medium-high heat.
step-10: add the dumplings to the pan and cook for 2 minutes, until the bottoms begin to brown.
step-11: add a splash of water to the pan and cover with the lid.
step-12: steam for 10 minutes.
step-13: remove the lid and drizzle with the remaining tablespoon of sesame oil.
step-14: cook on low heat for 3 minutes.
