step-15: make the sauce: in a small bowl, combine the rice vinegar, soy sauce, and chili oil.
step-16: remove the dumplings from the pan and serve with the sauce on the side

step-1: place 1 cup of rosé (240 ml) in a small saucepan over medium heat.
step-2: bring to a simmer and cook until reduced by half, about 5 minutes.
step-3: remove the pan from the heat.
step-4: in a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, combine the gelatin powder and remaining rosé wine.
step-5: let sit for 5 minutes.
step-6: the gelatin should give off a “blooming” effect, thickening the mixture.
step-7: add the gelatin mixture to the saucepan with the concentrated rosé.
step-8: add the sugar and return the pan to medium-low heat, whisking continuously.
step-9: do not let the mixture boil.
step-10: cook until the gelatin is dissolved, about 5 minutes.
step-11: the mixture should have a syrupy consistency, similar to maple syrup.
step-12: remove the pan from the heat.
step-13: add a drop of pink food coloring, if desired.
step-14: use a squeeze bottle, spouted measuring cup, or dropper to distribute the mixture into the gummy bear molds.
step-15: if you don’t have a gummy bear mold, pour the mixture into a parchment-lined, 8-inch (20 cm), square baking pan.
step-16: refrigerate for 90 minutes, or until set.
step-17: carefully pop the bears out of the molds or, if using a baking pan, cut into small squares with a pizza cutter.
step-18: store in airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

step-1: to a cocktail shaker, add blackberries and rosemary.
step-2: muddle until juicy.
step-3: add agave, vodka, and ice.
step-4: attach cocktail shaker lid and shake well.
step-5: strain blackberry mixture over a copper mug filled with ice.
step-6: top with ginger beer, and squeeze a slice of lime into it.

step-1: in a cocktail shaker or a tall glass, muddle blackberries and rosemary.
step-2: add sweetener and ice, shake until well combined.
step-3: (if you do not have a cocktail shaker, simply pour back and forth between two glasses until combined.)
step-4: strain mixture over ice and add ginger beer and a squeeze of lime to taste.
step-5: garnish with blackberries and a sprig of rosemary.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, combine the almond flour, salt, pepper, and rosemary.
step-3: add the olive oil and mix thoroughly with a fork.
step-4: add the ice water, 1 tablespoon at a time, and mix thoroughly, until small clumps form and the dough holds together when squeezed.
step-5: form the dough into a round, flattening the top and bottom as evenly as possible.
step-6: place the dough on a sheet of parchment paper and add another piece of parchment on top.
step-7: roll out the dough as evenly as possible, to between ¼- and ⅛-inch (6- and 3-mm) thick.
step-8: remove the top layer of parchment paper and place on a baking sheet.
step-9: you may need to press the edges of the dough to form an even rectangle.
step-10: using a cookie cutter or pizza cutter, slice the dough to desired size.
step-11: if using a cookie cutter, re-roll the excess dough and cut out more crackers.
step-12: if desired, use the blunt end of a skewer to poke holes in each of the crackers.
step-13: carefully place the crackers on the baking sheet.
step-14: if the dough is too warm, the crackers will break as you attempt to transfer them.
step-15: chill in the freezer for 10 minutes before proceeding if this happens.
step-16: bake for 15-20 minutes, flipping halfway, until golden brown.
step-17: let the crackers cool completely and serve as desired.
step-18: store up to 1 week at room temperature in an airtight container.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200ºc).
step-2: slice the top and bottom off of the sweet potatoes, and slice potatoes in half crosswise.
step-3: rest each half on the broader end, then slice 3 times vertically and horizontally.
step-4: turn the potatoes on their side and make 4 or five more slices, to form cubes.
step-5: transfer the sweet potatoes to a baking sheet, then add the oil, rosemary, salt, and pepper.
step-6: toss to coat evenly.
step-7: bake for 35-40 minutes, until the sweet potatoes are tender and starting to brown around the edges.
step-8: let cool for 5 minutes.
step-9: garnish with chopped parsley before serving.

step-1: heat a drizzle of olive oil in a large pan over medium heat until just shimmering.
step-2: add the sweet potato, onion, garlic, and rosemary.
step-3: season with salt and pepper.
step-4: cook, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes, until the sweet potato is softened and browned.
step-5: remove from the heat and let cool.
step-6: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-7: grease a 12-cup muffin tin with nonstick spray.
step-8: make the batter: in a large bowl, stir together the whole wheat flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, pepper, and sugar.
step-9: set aside.
step-10: in a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, buttermilk, and butter.
step-11: add the cooled sweet potato mixture to the egg mixture and stir to combine.
step-12: pour the egg mixture into the dry ingredients and fold to combine, being careful not to overmix.
step-13: using an ice cream scoop, divide the batter between the muffin cups, filling almost completely.
step-14: bake for 18 minutes, rotating the muffin tin halfway through baking, until browned on top and a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean.
step-15: let cool for 10 minutes before removing the muffins from the tin.
step-16: serve or store in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.
step-17: nutrition, per muffin - calories: 159, total fat: 8 grams, sodium: 393 mg, total carbs: 18 grams, dietary fiber: 3 grams, sugars: 2 grams, protein: 5 grams

step-1: in a large pot, heat the canola oil over medium heat.
step-2: once the oil is shimmering, add the onion, celery, and garlic and sauté until translucent and tender, about 5 minutes.
step-3: add the carrots and continue cooking for another 2 minutes, until all of the vegetables are heated through.
step-4: add the chicken broth, salt, pepper, garlic powder, dill, chives, and parsley.
step-5: bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for about 30 minutes, until vegetables are tender.
step-6: when ready to serve, add the matzo balls to the simmering soup and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes.
step-7: ladle into bowls.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a saucepan, melt butter over medium-high heat.
step-3: add chocolate, and whisk to combine.
step-4: remove from heat.
step-5: in a bowl, combine sugar and cornstarch.
step-6: pour in chocolate mixture, and mix thoroughly.
step-7: add the eggs, and mix thoroughly.
step-8: refrigerate mixture overnight.
step-9: line 4 souffle tins or 4 ceramic ramekins with parchment paper, and grease thoroughly.
step-10: divide mixture among the tins, and bake for 28-30 minutes.
step-11: serve with ice cream.

step-1: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-2: with a sharp knife, divide the cake crosswise into thirds, about 3 inches (7 cm) each.
step-3: slice the domed tops off of each piece.
step-4: very carefully slice each piece of cake into 4 even layers.
step-5: stack the layers in sets of 2 (there should be 6 stacks) with the bottom facing up on the prepared baking sheet.
step-6: each set of stacks will be a different color cube (white, yellow, green, orange, red, and blue)--write in marker on the parchment paper to label each stack.
step-7: open each set of layers like a book.
step-8: spread a layer of vanilla frosting on each slice.
step-9: for the white cubes, stack the slices, frosted sides touching.
step-10: for the yellow cubes, sprinkle with the lemon zest, then stack the slices, frosted sides touching.
step-11: for the green cubes, sprinkle with the lime zest, then stack the slices, frosted sides touching.
step-12: for the orange cubes, spread the orange marmalade on one piece and stack the slices.
step-13: for the red cubes, spread the strawberry jam on one piece and stack the slices.
step-14: for the blue cubes, spread the blueberry jam on one piece and stack the slices.
step-15: freeze for at least 30 minutes.
step-16: make the marshmallow fondant: in a large microwave-safe bowl, combine the marshmallows and water.
step-17: microwave on medium power for 2-3 minutes, stirring every 30 seconds, until the marshmallows are completely melted.
step-18: add the softened butter and use a silicone spatula to stir until combined.
step-19: add 5 cups (550 g) of powdered sugar to a separate large bowl and make a well in the center.
step-20: pour in the marshmallow mixture.
step-21: stir to combine.
step-22: when it is mostly combined, grease your hands with nonstick spray and knead to bring the fondant together into a ball in the bowl.
step-23: add more powdered sugar as needed if the fondant is sticking to your hands.
step-24: grease a clean work surface and your hands with more nonstick spray.
step-25: turn the fondant out onto the greased surface.
step-26: if it gets too dry, add a bit more water.
step-27: use more nonstick spray if the fondant is sticking to the surface.
step-28: continue kneading for 8-10 minutes, until the fondant is smooth and holds its shape.
step-29: divide the fondant into 6 even pieces, spray with nonstick spray, and cover with plastic wrap so they don’t dry out.
step-30: using the gel food coloring, dye 5 of the pieces green, blue, orange, red, and yellow by kneading each gel color into 1 section of fondant.
step-31: leave the remaining piece white.
step-32: spray again with nonstick spray and cover with plastic wrap.
step-33: remove the cake stacks from the freezer.
step-34: using a sharp knife and a ruler to measure, slice each stack into 9 ¾-inch (22 cm) cubes.
step-35: return to the marked baking sheet and separate into individual pieces, then freeze again for at least 30 minutes.
step-36: roll the green fondant into a log, then cut into 9 equal pieces.
step-37: grease the pieces you aren’t using yet with nonstick spray and cover with plastic wrap.
step-38: sprinkle a piece of fondant with powdered sugar and roll out to a ¼-inch-thick (6 mm) square.
step-39: remove the green cake cubes from the freezer.
step-40: cover a cube with the rolled out fondant on 5 sides, removing the excess fondant with a knife.
step-41: repeat with the remaining fondant and cake cubes.
step-42: to assemble the cake, stack 9 cubes of varying color on a plate, spaced about ¼ inch (6 mm) apart.
step-43: place a piece of chocolate squarely on top of the cubes.
step-44: carefully stack another 9 cubes on top of the chocolate.
step-45: place another chocolate square on top of the cubes, slightly askew.
step-46: stack 9 more cubes on top of the chocolate.

step-1: in a cocktail shaker, combine the ice, orange marmalade, lime juice, and rum.
step-2: cover with the lid and shake vigorously for 30 seconds.
step-3: strain into desired serving glass.
step-4: garnish with a lime wedge.

step-1: peel the pears and cut the bottoms out, but leave the stems intact.
step-2: mix the water, sugar, rum, and vanilla in a large pot.
step-3: set to medium heat.
step-4: add the pears.
step-5: cover with a lid and simmer for about 40 minutes, turning occasionally.
step-6: cook until soft and golden (this can take less time depending on the ripeness of your pears.
step-7: scoop out the pears and place upright on a dish.
step-8: at this point you can cook the liquid longer until it becomes a syrup, or ladle a small amount directly onto the pears right away.
step-9: add optional ice cream.
step-10: melt some dark chocolate and spoon it onto the pear or your favorite toppings like nuts!

step-1: peel potatoes.
step-2: cut them into 1-inch (2 ½ cm) slices and boil them in salted water for 25 minutes or until they are tender.
step-3: after boiling, take them out and let them cool for 10 minutes, allowing them to steam to remove excess moisture.
step-4: mash potatoes until no lumps remain.
step-5: add eggs, salt, nutmeg, and 2 cups (250 grams) flour, and knead into a dough.
step-6: if dough is too sticky, add more flour until it holds its shape but is still smooth.
step-7: put a piece of dough on a floured surface and roll into a 1-inch (2.5 cm) thick log.
step-8: cut in 1-inch (2.5 cm) pieces and roll them carefully in your floured palm for a noodle shape.
step-9: repeat with the remainder of the dough.
step-10: boil noodles in a large pot with salted water.
step-11: stir carefully once or twice to make sure noodles don’t stick to bottom of the pan.
step-12: once they float on the surface, they are cooked and ready to be taken out.
step-13: in a medium-sized pan, melt the butter.
step-14: add noodles and bacon and fry until both are golden brown on all sides.
step-15: add chicken broth and white wine and let reduce for a few minutes until sauce becomes slightly creamy.
step-16: top with green onions before serving.

step-1: place the potatoes in a large pot, cover with enough cold water to cover the potatoes by 2 inches (5 cm), and bring to a boil.
step-2: season with ½ teaspoon salt, reduce the heat to medium, cover, and cook until the potatoes are fork-tender, 10-15 minutes.
step-3: drain and set aside to cool slightly.
step-4: in a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook the bacon for five minutes or until crispy.
step-5: transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.
step-6: add the onion to the bacon fat in the pan.
step-7: cook until tender and golden, about 10 minutes.
step-8: remove the pan from the heat.
step-9: in a large bowl, whisk together the vinegar and mustard.
step-10: season with the remaining teaspoon of salt and the pepper.
step-11: add the potatoes, bacon, and onions.
step-12: toss to coat.
step-13: stir in the chives.
step-14: serve warm.

step-1: cut the tops off fresh strawberries.
step-2: crush graham crackers.
step-3: place strawberry on a skewer then dip in heated marshmallow fluff (or make your own by melting down a cup of marshmallows).
step-4: roast over a fire or grill.
step-5: top with chocolate syrup and graham cracker crumbles.

step-1: spread drained chickpeas onto a towel and pat dry.
step-2: remove chickpea shells.
step-3: place chickpeas, peanut butter, vanilla, honey, and salt into food processor.
step-4: mix halfway then add chickpea water to help consistency.
step-5: add chocolate chips, marshmallows, and graham cracker crumbs to mixed dough.

step-1: line the inside of a waffle cone with peanut butter.
step-2: fill with mini marshmallows and chocolate chips.
step-3: wrap in aluminum foil.
step-4: place on a grill and cover for 2 minutes, flip at the 1 minute mark.
step-5: remove with tongs and let cool.
step-6: unwrap foil and remove cone.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine flour, eggs, butter, and sugar, stirring until ingredients are slightly mixed.
step-2: add the milk ½ cup (120 ml) at a time, stirring vigorously, making sure the milk is completely incorporated into the batter and that the batter is smooth before adding more milk.
step-3: repeat with the rest of the milk.
step-4: the batter should be very liquidy and have no lumps.
step-5: in a pan over medium heat, pour ⅓ cup (95 g) of the batter in the center and swirl the batter around the edges of the pan until set.
step-6: to know when the crepe is ready to flip, lift up one of the edges about ⅓ of the way.
step-7: the bottom side should be golden brown.
step-8: flip the crepe.
step-9: cook until the edges are starting to slightly crisp.
step-10: remove from heat and cover with a paper towel to make sure the crepes stay moist.
step-11: add graham crackers, chocolate, and marshmallows to crepe.
step-12: fold crepe over twice.
step-13: bake at 350˚f (175˚c) for 10 minutes.
step-14: remove from heat and cool.
step-15: serve with chocolate syrup and crumbled graham crackers.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (175°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, combine ingredients for the box cake mix.
step-3: transfer them into cupcake tins and bake for 20 minutes.
step-4: let them cool completely.
step-5: in a large bowl, combine powdered sugar, vanilla, marshmallow cream, and butter.
step-6: mix until frosting forms.
step-7: place into a piping bag or plastic bag and cut the corner.
step-8: pipe on the frosting and top it off with the graham cracker crumbs.

step-1: whisk eggs, cinnamon, vanilla and milk together in medium-large bowl to create egg wash.
step-2: crush graham crackers into crumbs.
step-3: dunk bread in egg wash then cover in crumbs until evenly coated.
step-4: melt butter in a skillet on medium-low heat and cook bread for 2-3 minutes or until crumbs are crispy and bread is more solid.
step-5: once you flip them over once spread fluff on one slice and melted chocolate on the other.
step-6: press slices together and stack.
step-7: garnish with mini marshmallows, mini chocolate chips (optional) and chocolate syrup.

step-1: add the pesto to the bottom of a 16-ounce (480 ml) mason jar.
step-2: add the tortellini, salami, tomato, basil, and parmesan.
step-3: store in the refrigerator for 2-3 days.
step-4: when ready to eat, shake well to combine.

step-1: for the garlic smashed potatoes
step-2: boil potatoes in a medium pot for 15-20 minutes or until tender.
step-3: place boiled potatoes on a parchment covered oven tray and smash each potato down leaving the skin intact.
step-4: mix melted butter, garlic, salt and pepper and brush mixture onto potatoes.
step-5: bake at 425˚f (220˚c) for 15-20 minutes or until crispy.
step-6: garnish with thyme.
step-7: for the herb crusted salmon
step-8: in a small bowl combine parsley, chives, dill, olive oil, garlic, salt, pepper and lemon juice.
step-9: place salmon and asparagus on parchment covered oven tray.
step-10: drizzle with olive oil and garnish with salt and pepper.
step-11: spoon herb mix onto salmon fillets and coat evenly.
step-12: bake at 425˚f (220˚c) for 12-14 minutes.
step-13: for the chocolate peanut butter skillet brownie
step-14: in a medium mixing bowl, combine brownie mix, oil, water, and an egg and stir until evenly mixed.
step-15: transfer mix into skillet.
step-16: spoon softened peanut butter into skillet and mix in using a knife.
step-17: bake at 350˚f (180˚c) for 10-15 minutes or until toothpick comes out of the brownie clear.
step-18: if desired, garnish with ice cream.

step-1: in a square baking dish, combine the soy sauce, balsamic vinegar, oil, and garlic, and whisk to combine.
step-2: put 2 of the salmon fillets in the soy and balsamic mixture, making sure all sides are coated.
step-3: transfer to the refrigerator, marinading for 30 minutes to 2 hours.
step-4: preheat oven to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-5: in a small bowl, mix together the paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper.
step-6: evenly coat the remaining 2 salmon filets with the spice rub.
step-7: place the salmon and vegetables on a parchment paper-lined baking tray.
step-8: drizzle olive oil and sprinkle salt and pepper to taste over the vegetables.
step-9: bake for 11 minutes per inch (2 ½ cm) of salmon thickness.
step-10: divide the salmon and vegetables into 4 containers, mix and matching the vegetables to your liking.
step-11: refrigerate for up to 3 days.

step-1: add the rice to a fine mesh strainer and submerge in a bowl filled with water.
step-2: shake the rice a few times to remove excess starch.
step-3: transfer the rice to a medium pot and add 1 cup (240 ml) of water.
step-4: cover the pot and bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
step-5: once boiling, reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 10 minutes.
step-6: remove the pan from the heat and let stand for 15 minutes.
step-7: remove the lid and fluff the rice with a fork or rice paddle.
step-8: transfer the rice to a large bowl.
step-9: mix together the rice vinegar, sugar, and salt and pour over the rice while still hot.
step-10: gently fold the rice to incorporate.
step-11: cover and set aside until ready to assemble the bowl.
step-12: using a very sharp knife, gently slice the salmon fillet into ½-inch (1 cm) cubes.
step-13: it may be easier to slice if you place the salmon in the freezer for a few minutes to help it firm up.
step-14: just before assembly, place the salmon in a bowl and season with the soy sauce and lemon juice.
step-15: to assemble, place a few spoonfuls of rice into a medium bowl (use any leftover rice for another poke bowl or sushi).
step-16: top the rice with the seasoned salmon, avocado, cucumber, ginger, green onions, nori sheets, toasted sesame seeds, and black sesame seeds.

step-1: in a bowl, combine rice, salmon flake, and shiso.
step-2: wet your hands with water and shape rice into a circle.
step-3: place into the bento box.

step-1: finely dice the shallot and add it to a medium bowl.
step-2: mince the garlic and add it to the bowl with the shallot.
step-3: chiffonade the basil, chop the parsley, and add to the bowl.
step-4: quarter the cherry tomatoes and add them to the bowl with the herbs, along with the chili flakes, a pinch of salt and pepper, the juice of one lemon, and the olive oil.
step-5: stir to combine.
step-6: heat a bit of oil in a medium skillet over medium heat.
step-7: season the salmon fillets with salt and pepper.
step-8: when the oil is shimmering, sear the salmon on one side until golden brown.
step-9: flip and cook until the other side is golden brown and the fish is cooked through.
step-10: remove the salmon from the heat and wipe out the skillet.
step-11: cut the squash, zucchini, carrots, and watermelon radishes in half, if needed, then spiralize.
step-12: heat a bit of oil in the pan over medium heat until simmering.
step-13: add the vegetable noodles to the pan and season with salt and pepper.
step-14: saute until tender, about 2 minutes.
step-15: divide the vegetable noodles between two plates.
step-16: place a piece of salmon on each bed of noodles, then top with tomato sauce.

step-1: mix together parsley, walnuts, garlic, 3 tbsp lemon juice, olive oil, and pepper.
step-2: stir until fully incorporated.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: mix together pepper, salt, and cayenne pepper.
step-5: rub filet of salmon with seasonings.
step-6: in a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil.
step-7: place salmon skin side down.
step-8: cook for 5 minutes.
step-9: flip salmon, then cook for another 5 minutes
step-10: pour ¼ cup (60 ml) lemon juice over salmon.
step-11: cook for 3 more minutes until lemon juice has reduced.
step-12: remove salmon from heat.
step-13: spread the parsley walnut mixture over salmon.
step-14: serve immediately.

step-1: combine 50g (1½ cups) of crushed up salt and vinegar crisps with flour, baking soda, beer, and some salt.
step-2: mix together.
step-3: dip fish into batter and then coat in more crushed crisps.
step-4: fry in oil.
step-5: serve with your favorite dipping sauce.

step-1: liberally pepper the beef tenderloin on all sides.
step-2: brown all sides of the beef tenderloin, set aside so its comes to room temperature.
step-3: in a large mixing bowl, combine the salt, rosemary and water.
step-4: you want the consistency of wet, packable sand.
step-5: spread a thin layer of the salt on your baking sheet.
step-6: place the beef tenderloin on top and cover the with remaining salt.
step-7: make sure the entire beef tenderloin is covered in the salt mix.
step-8: bake at 250°f (120°c) for 45-60 minutes or until the internal temperature is about 120°f (48°c) for medium rare.
step-9: remove and let it rest in the salt crust for 15 minutes.
step-10: using the back of the spoon, crack the salt crust and remove.
step-11: brush away any excess salt and remove the beef tenderloin.
step-12: slice and serve with roasted vegetables.

step-1: carefully slice 3 gold potatoes into ⅛ inch (3 mm) slices using a knife or mandoline.
step-2: in a large bowl, coat chips with vinegar so all are submerged, allow to sit for 30 minutes (the longer they sit the more vinegary they will taste).
step-3: preheat the oven to 350ºf (175ºc).
step-4: drain the chips and then mix in salt and pepper.
step-5: arrange chips on greased baking sheet.
step-6: bake for 30-35 minutes.

step-1: in a large saucepan, gently melt the sugar over a low-medium heat, swirling the pan consistently until it reaches a golden amber colour.
step-2: stir in the butter until melted.
step-3: stir in the double cream and allow to boil for 1 minute.
step-4: stir in the sea salt and then remove from the heat.
step-5: allow to cool before pouring in a clean, sterilized jar.
step-6: store in the fridge for up to 2 weeks.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, combine the apple slices, lemon juice, flour, sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
step-3: toss until the apples are well coated.
step-4: lay 1 of the pie crusts in a 9-inch (23-cm) pie dish.
step-5: add the apple slices to the bottom of the crust.
step-6: place the other pie crust over the apple slices.
step-7: trim any extra dough from the edges.
step-8: press the rounded edge of spoon facedown around the edge, making shallow indentations to crimp the crusts together.
step-9: cut 4 slits in the top of the pie for ventilation, then brush with the beaten egg.
step-10: bake the pie for 50-60 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and no grey-ish or undercooked pastry remains.
step-11: let cool completely.
step-12: in a medium saucepan, combine the heavy cream, brown sugar, and honey.
step-13: cook over medium heat until the sugar is dissolved, about 2 minutes.
step-14: whisk in the butter and bring to a boil.
step-15: reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the caramel reaches a thick consistency.
step-16: let the caramel sauce cool for 5 minutes, then pour over the pie.
step-17: sprinkle with flaky sea salt.
step-18: slice and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 300˚f (150˚c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: add the sliced almonds and 3 ounces of the coconut flakes to the prepared baking sheet and toast for 15 minutes, or until golden and fragrant.
step-4: increase the oven temperature to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-5: line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
step-6: add the toasted coconut and half of the toasted almonds to a food processor and process until broken down into fine crumbs.
step-7: add the flour and salt, and process until combined.
step-8: in a medium bowl, combine the butter, sugar, and vanilla, and beat with an electric hand mixer until fully combined and the sugar is dissolved.
step-9: add the egg and beat to incorporate.
step-10: fold in the flour mixture with a rubber spatula until no dry spots remain.
step-11: divide the dough into 18 equal balls and arrange 9 on each baking sheet.
step-12: using the bottom of a wooden spoon, poke a hole in the center of each dough ball.
step-13: chill the dough balls for 30 minutes.
step-14: in a small bowl, combine the reserved toasted almonds with the remaining 3 ounces of coconut flakes.
step-15: mix with a fork to combine.
step-16: roll the chilled dough balls in the almond coconut mixture to coat the outside.
step-17: bake the cookies for 12 minutes, or until set.
step-18: let cool completely.
step-19: in a small pot over low heat, combine the caramel candies and heavy cream.
step-20: cook, stirring frequently, until melted.
step-21: remove from the heat.
step-22: fill the centers of each cookie with the caramel mixture.
step-23: drizzle melted chocolate over the cookies, then sprinkle with flaky sea salt.

step-1: preheat oven to /350˚f (180°c).
step-2: in a small saucepan, add the sugar and water, carefully swirling the pan to make sure the water is covering all the sugar.
step-3: cook on a medium heat for 5 minutes, or until a deep amber colour, without stirring.
step-4: turn off the heat and add the double cream, whisking until smooth.
step-5: stir in the salt and cool.
step-6: in a large bowl, add the eggs, milk, sugar, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and most of the cooled salted caramel sauce and whisk until smooth.
step-7: placed the chopped white bread into a greased heatproof dish and pour over the egg mixture.
step-8: sprinkle over chopped pecans and bake for 45 minutes.
step-9: (if the top of the bread is burning, cover with foil halfway through baking.)
step-10: serve with icing sugar and leftover salted caramel sauce.

step-1: gently heat the milk in a saucepan over a medium heat.
step-2: stir in the dark chocolate, caramel, and sea salt.
step-3: take off the heat and pour into a tall glass.
step-4: top with whipped cream, caramel sauce, and dark chocolate shards.

step-1: in a saucepan set over medium heat, warm the heavy cream and ¾ cup caramel sauce, and bring to a simmer.
step-2: place chocolate chips in a heat-proof bowl, and pour on top the top cream mixture.
step-3: allow to stand for 1 minute before stirring to combine.
step-4: using a cookie scoop, spoon the mixture into a silicone mini muffin pan.
step-5: chill in the freeze for 20 minutes.
step-6: drizzle tops with remaining caramel sauce and a sprinkle of sea salt flakes.
step-7: insert a popsicle stick into the middle of each.
step-8: freeze for 2 hours, or refrigerate for 4 hours.
step-9: to serve, dissolve a stick into a mug of hot milk.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a bowl, mix butter, and sugar until very fluffy (about 10 minutes).
step-3: add vanilla and half of the flour.
step-4: mix.
step-5: add the rest of the flour.
step-6: mix.
step-7: stir in potato chips, and roll dough into 1-inch (2 ½ cm) balls.
step-8: bake for 15-20 minutes, until the edges turn brown.
step-9: in a saucepan, melt the caramels with the heavy cream.
step-10: drizzle over cookies, and immediately top with coarse sea salt.

step-1: line a square, loose-bottom 20-cm (8-in) baking tray with parchment paper.
step-2: first make the almond biscuit layer: blend all of the ingredients except the ground almonds in the blender until the nuts and coconut are finely chopped.
step-3: add the ground almonds then pulse until fully incorporated.
step-4: the mixture should be sticky.
step-5: press the almond mixture into the base of the baking tray, making sure it’s an even layer all over.
step-6: pop the tray into the freezer and get on with the caramel layer.
step-7: rinse out the blender.
step-8: blend all of the ingredients in the blender until the mixture is as smooth as possible.
step-9: remove the tray from the freezer and spread the caramel layer over the top evenly.
step-10: pop the tray back into the freezer to set for around 2 hours.
step-11: after the 2 hours, remove the tray from the freezer and place the toppings on.
step-12: carefully remove the bars from the tin, then cut it into 12-14 bars.
step-13: run your knife under hot water between each cut to make it easier.
step-14: place the bars onto a baking tray and back into the freezer while you make the coating.
step-15: mix the chocolate coating ingredients together in a small mixing bowl until smooth.
step-16: remove the bars from the freezer and drizzle the coating over the top of each bar.
step-17: top each bar with a couple of pretzels or a sprinkling of flaked almonds.
step-18: serve straight away or store in the freezer for up to 2 months.
step-19: serve straight from the freezer.

step-1: add all ingredients to slow cooker and stir.
step-2: cook on high for 1 hour, stirring occasionally.
step-3: top with whipped cream and drizzle caramel on top.

step-1: to make the ​malted cookie dough, in a large bowl, cream together the butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar, and salt with a wooden spoon until a light paste forms.
step-2: add the heavy cream, molasses, corn syrup, and vanilla and stir until smooth.
step-3: sift in the toasted flour and malt powder, then mix until there are no lumps.
step-4: fold in the chocolate until evenly distributed.
step-5: spread the cookie dough evenly in a parchment-lined baking dish until it’s about ½-inch (1 cm) thick, then freeze until solid, about 1 hour.
step-6: cut the cookie dough into ½-inch (1 cm) cubes and freeze for later use.
step-7: it keeps up to 1 month.
step-8: to make the molasses vanilla ice cream base, combine the sugar, dry milk powder, salt, and xanthan gum in a small bowl, and stir well.
step-9: in a medium pot over medium heat, combine the milk, corn syrup, and molasses, whisking until combined.
step-10: add the sugar mixture and whisk vigorously until there are no lumps.
step-11: cook for 2-3 minutes, until the sugar is dissolved, then remove the pot from the heat.
step-12: pour the mixture into a large liquid measuring cup or medium bowl, then mix in the cream and vanilla.
step-13: cover and refrigerate for at least 6 hours before churning.
step-14: it can be stored in the fridge for up to 1 week or in the freezer for up to 3 months.
step-15: to make the malted fudge, mix the water and malt powder together in small pot.
step-16: add the corn syrup, heavy cream, butter, and salt.
step-17: heat the pot over medium-high heat until the butter is completely melted and the mixture comes to a boil.
step-18: remove the pot from the heat and add the cocoa powder and chopped chocolate, whisking thoroughly until the chocolate is fully melted and the mixture is silky.
step-19: transfer to an airtight container and store in the fridge for up to 1 week.
step-20: pour the ice cream base into an ice cream maker and turn on the machine.
step-21: churn just until it has the texture of soft serve, 25-35 minutes, depending on the machine.
step-22: fold in half of the cookie dough cubes until well-distributed.
step-23: alternate spooning layers of the ice cream and ​a few generous dollops of the fudge into a loaf pan.
step-24: cover with plastic wrap and store in the coldest part of your freezer for at least 6 hours before scooping and serving.
step-25: the ice cream will keep up to 6 months.

step-1: crush graham crackers into a fine crumb and pour into a medium mixing bowl (break up any remaining large pieces).
step-2: add the mini chocolate chips, ¼ tsp salt, and marshmallow fluff.
step-3: mix until well combined.
step-4: roll the mixture into 1-inch (2 ½ cm) balls and place on a wax paper lined baking sheet.
step-5: freeze for 15 minutes.
step-6: break apart chocolate bars and add to a microwave safe bowl.
step-7: microwave chocolate for 75 seconds, stopping every 30 seconds to check and stir.
step-8: remove balls from the freezer and individually roll in melted chocolate to coat.
step-9: place back on a wax paper lined tray and sprinkle with coarse salt.
step-10: chill until firm.

step-1: break the fish in pieces, removing any bones, and place in large saucepan with the water and lemons.
step-2: boil over medium-high heat for 10-15 minutes.
step-3: taste the fish at this point to check the salt level.
step-4: if it is still too salty, repeat step 1.
step-5: drain and shred the fish with your fingers.
step-6: heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
step-7: add the onion, garlic, scallions, bell peppers, tomatoes, and parsley, and cook for 1-2 minutes.
step-8: add the saltfish and cook for another 5 minutes.
step-9: season with black pepper and lime juice, and garnish with cilantro.
step-10: serve with sliced avocado.

step-1: add the sugar to a large pot fitted with a candy thermometer.
step-2: sift in the cornstarch and whisk into the sugar until well-combined.
step-3: add the butter, corn syrup, salt, water, vanilla, and flavor extract of choice to the pot.
step-4: whisk to combine, then turn the heat to medium and cook until the mixture reaches 250°f (120°c).
step-5: add the food coloring and stir to combine.
step-6: pour the candy into a greased heatproof dish and cool until you are able to handle it, 5-10 minutes.
step-7: stretch the mixture out 12 inches (30 cm) (or further) and fold it over itself again and again for 10-15 minutes.
step-8: the taffy will turn from translucent to opaque.
step-9: when the taffy becomes harder to pull, roll it to about a 30-inch (76-cm) long and 1-inch (2-cm) thick log on a greased surface.
step-10: cut the log in half.
step-11: then slice the taffy into bite-size chunks.
step-12: wrap each piece of taffy in a square of parchment paper and twist the ends to seal.

step-1: make the curtido: in a large bowl, combine the cabbage, onion, and carrots.
step-2: pour the boiling water over the vegetables and toss.
step-3: let sit for 10 minutes, then drain.
step-4: in a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, combine the vinegar, oregano, and salt.
step-5: pour over the slaw and toss to coat.
step-6: once thoroughly mixed, transfer the curtido any any leftover liquid in the bowl to an airtight jar or container.
step-7: chill for at least 20 minutes in the refrigerator, or chill overnight for best results.
step-8: make the chicharrón: heat the vegetable oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
step-9: add the pork shoulder and salt.
step-10: cook for 15 minutes without disturbing.
step-11: if the pork is browning too quickly, reduce the heat to medium.
step-12: turn the pork over and let cook on the other side for 10 minutes more, or until crispy and golden brown.
step-13: transfer the pork to a food processor and add the tomato, green bell pepper, and onion.
step-14: pulse until a thick paste forms.
step-15: the mixture should not be watery.
step-16: set aside.
step-17: make the pupusa dough: in a large bowl, whisk together the masa harina and salt, then add the water.
step-18: use your hands to mix until the dough comes together with a clay-like texture.
step-19: fill a small bowl with water and a bit of oil and set near your work station.
step-20: you’ll wet your fingers with the mixture as you work to keep the dough from sticking to your hands.
step-21: take a golf ball-sized portion of dough and roll into a ball, then flatten into an even round.
step-22: fill the dough round with ½ tablespoon chicharrón paste, 1 teaspoon refried beans, and 1 teaspoon mozzarella cheese.
step-23: fold the dough over the filling until it’s completely sealed.
step-24: then, pat out the ball between your hands until flat.
step-25: if the pupusa cracks, patch it with a bit of dough and a little oil.
step-26: repeat with the remaining ingredients.
step-27: heat a large pan or griddle over medium heat.
step-28: brush with vegetable oil, then place 2-3 pupusas on the pan and cook for 2-4 minutes, or until the bottoms are golden brown.
step-29: flip and cook on the other side for 2-4 minutes more, until golden brown and warmed through.
step-30: repeat with the remaining pupusas.
step-31: serve the pupusas with curtido.

step-1: make the filling: in a large bowl, combine the ground chicken, red onion, scallions, cilantro, garlic, ginger, turmeric, chili powder, garam masala, ghee, and olive oil.
step-2: mix well with your hands.
step-3: place a tablespoon of filling in the middle of a dumpling wrapper.
step-4: using your finger, lightly wet the outer rim with water.
step-5: pinch the top of the wrapper, using your fingers to pleat and tighten as you close so it looks like a little pouch.
step-6: repeat with the remaining wrappers and filling.
step-7: bring a large pot filled a third of the way with water to boil over high heat and top with a dumpling steamer basket.
step-8: line the basket with cabbage leaves.
step-9: steam the momos in batches for 12-15 minutes, until the wrapper becomes slightly translucent.
step-10: make the dipping sauce: in a medium saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
step-11: add the tomatoes, thai chilies, garlic, ginger, turmeric, and szechuan peppers.
step-12: season with salt.
step-13: cook, stirring occasionally, until the tomato is softened, for 5 minutes.
step-14: remove the pan from the heat, and let cool for 5-10 minutes.
step-15: transfer the tomato mixture to a blender and add the sesame seeds and cilantro.
step-16: blend until smooth.
step-17: serve the momos with the dipping chutney.

step-1: heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
step-2: add the onion, carrot, and celery, stirring occasionally, until the onions are translucent, 3-5 minutes.
step-3: add a bit more oil, if needed, then add the garlic, a pinch of salt, 2 bay leaves, and the tomato paste.
step-4: stir until the tomato paste begins to caramelize on the bottom of the pan, 1-2 minutes.
step-5: add the canned tomatoes and break them apart with tongs or the back of a wooden spoon.
step-6: add the parmesan rind and basil, burying them into the sauce.
step-7: reduce the heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes until the sauce has thickened and the flavors have developed.
step-8: remove and discard the parmesan rind, bay leaves, and basil.
step-9: set the sauce aside to cool.
step-10: prepare the rice.
step-11: in a large pot over medium-high heat, add the rice and stock and stir to combine.
step-12: add the 2 remaining bay leaves and a pinch of salt.
step-13: bring to a boil, then immediately cover and reduce down to a simmer.
step-14: simmer for 15 minutes without removing the lid.
step-15: after 15 minutes remove from the rice from the heat, stir, and transfer to a large bowl to cool for 5-10 minutes.
step-16: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c)
step-17: once the rice has cooled, taste to check if it needs more salt, then add the eggs and grated parmesan cheese.
step-18: mix thoroughly with your hands.
step-19: generously coat the inside of a bundt pan with butter.
step-20: add the breadcrumbs and tilt the pan around to coat.
step-21: once well-coated, tap out excess crumbs into a bowl and reserve.
step-22: using your hands, line the bundt pan with an even layer of the rice, bringing it up to about ½ an inch (1 cm) from the top of the pan.
step-23: tear apart the mozzarella and layer it over the rice.
step-24: cover with a layer of tomato sauce.
step-25: top with a layer of rice mixture and smooth with the back of a spoon to seal in the sauce completely.
step-26: top with reserved bread crumbs and brush with oil or spray with cooking spray to ensure a nice crust forms.
step-27: bake for 30-35 minutes, until golden brown and edges have crisped up..
step-28: remove from the oven and cool for about 10 minutes before flipping out of the pan.
step-29: fill the cavity with any remaining tomato sauce and garnish with basil, parmesan, and a drizzle of olive oil.
step-30: slice and serve.

step-1: fill a deep pot or skillet with enough oil to come 2 inches (5 cm) from the top of the pan.
step-2: heat the oil over medium heat until it reaches 350°f (180°c).
step-3: in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking soda, and salt.
step-4: stir in the eggs, milk, and orange juice.
step-5: mix until a thick batter forms.
step-6: add the orange zest and mix to incorporate.
step-7: using a cookie scoop or tablespoon, drop ping pong ball-size dough balls into the hot oil.
step-8: fry for about 5-7 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-9: the doughnuts should float to the surface when they are done.
step-10: drain on a paper towel-lined plate.
step-11: serve hot.

step-1: in a food processor, combine the red onion, scallions, garlic, ginger, curry powder, turmeric, cumin, salt, soy sauce, lemongrass, lime juice, coconut milk, peanut oil, and peanut butter.
step-2: purée until smooth.
step-3: divide the sauce between 2 small bowls.
step-4: add the chopped peanuts to one of the bowls and stir to combine.
step-5: cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to use.
step-6: pour the remaining sauce over the cubed beef in a medium bowl.
step-7: toss well to coat.
step-8: cover the bowl with plastic wrap and let marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours, up 6 hours.
step-9: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-10: line a 9-inch (23 cm) square baking dish with parchment paper.
step-11: thread the beef cubes onto skewers and set over the baking dish.
step-12: bake for 20 minutes, until the beef is seared and juicy.
step-13: serve the satay beef with the reserved sauce alongside.

step-1: using a sharp knife cut off the very top and bottom of each squash to create a flat base on each side (being careful not to cut through the center cavity).
step-2: slice the squash in half, scrape out seeds to create individual bowls for the stuffing.
step-3: drizzle each squash half with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
step-4: roast in a preheated oven at 400˚f (200˚c) for 40-50 minutes - or until fork tender.
step-5: while squash is roasting - in a large fry pan over medium heat - heat oil and add onion, celery, salt, pepper, and rosemary.
step-6: cook until onions begin to soften.
step-7: add garlic and sausage, until sausage is browned on all sides.
step-8: add apple until slightly softened.
step-9: finally mix in bread crumbs and parmesan cheese just until incorporated.
step-10: remove from heat.
step-11: once squash has finished roasting (when you can easily poke it with a fork) remove from oven and fill each with prepared stuffing mixture.
step-12: return to oven for 20 minutes - adding a sprinkle of parmesan cheese to the top for the final 5 minutes.

step-1: layer the potatoes on the bottom of a greased slow cooker.
step-2: add the sausage, green bell peppers, onion, and spinach.
step-3: in a large bowl or measuring cup whisk together the eggs, garlic powder, salt, pepper, and milk.
step-4: pour egg mixture over the potatoes, sausage, and vegetables.
step-5: top with cheddar cheese.
step-6: cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours
step-7: carefully remove lid and serve filling on a tortilla and add salsa.

step-1: mix sausage, salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, and dried parsley in a bowl until well combined.
step-2: grease a muffin tin and start to form shells with the sausage mix.
step-3: cover the sides and leave room in the middle for the eggs.
step-4: in a separate bowl, mix the eggs, salt, and pepper.
step-5: pour egg mixture into the middle of each cup.
step-6: top with shredded cheese, tomatoes, spinach, or toppings of your choice.
step-7: bake at 350°f (180°c) for 30 minutes.

step-1: roll each slice of bread flat with a rolling pin.
step-2: carefully cut off the crusts.
step-3: place sausage at the edge of the bread, and roll up.
step-4: in a bowl, combine eggs, milk, cinnamon, and vanilla.
step-5: dip each roll-up in egg mixture, and pan fry in a buttered skillet until all sides are golden brown.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a cast-iron skillet, break up the ground sausage into small chunks and brown over medium-high heat until sausage is cooked through and no longer pink.
step-3: reduce heat to medium-low.
step-4: sprinkle the flour over the sausage and stir until the flour has absorbed all of the sausage fat and is lightly coating the sausage pieces.
step-5: add the milk in several increments while whisking.
step-6: add thyme, sage, cayenne pepper, black pepper, and salt.
step-7: cook the gravy for 5-10 minutes, frequently stirring until the gravy thickens.
step-8: let cool.
step-9: fill a well-greased ice cube tray with the gravy.
step-10: (if you do not have an ice cube tray, pour the gravy onto a greased parchment-lined ½ cookie sheet.)
step-11: freeze for 20 minutes.
step-12: with your thumb, make a divot in the center of each biscuit.
step-13: place a cube of gravy into each divot.
step-14: fold the sides of the biscuit dough around the gravy cube pinching the dough together at the top.
step-15: turn the dough balls upside down.
step-16: with the palm of your hand, roll the biscuit ball around in a clockwise motion on your table surface to smooth out the dough balls.
step-17: place the biscuits on a parchment lined ½ cookie sheet making sure the dough seams are on the bottom.
step-18: brush with egg wash.
step-19: bake for 20-30 minutes.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: heat olive oil in a pan and add sliced peppers and onions.
step-3: stir and add italian seasoning and garlic.
step-4: cook until peppers and onions are soft and set aside to cool.
step-5: in the same pan, brown the sausage until it’s fully cooked and remove from heat to cool.
step-6: roll out pizza dough into an oval about 14 inches (35 cm) wide and about 8 inches (20 cm) long.
step-7: place rolled-out dough on a piece of parchment paper.
step-8: along the center of the dough, layer the sausage, peppers, ham, salami, provolone, and mozzarella.
step-9: fold the longer sides in first, one at a time, and pinch the edges to seal.
step-10: cut off any excess dough and pinch together.
step-11: flip it over and apply an egg wash to the outside of the dough.
step-12: carefully, make two to three inch slits on the top for ventilation.
step-13: bake for 30 minutes, or until golden (times & temperatures may vary depending on the oven).
step-14: cut into 2 inch (5 cm) pieces & serve with marinara sauce for dipping.

step-1: peel the potatoes and put in a large pan with water along with the sausages.
step-2: cook until the potatoes are tender enough to be mashed.
step-3: drain and mash the potatoes.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: chop the sausages and set aside.
step-6: in a large pan, add the butter, ½ grated onion, mashed potatoes, and milk.
step-7: mix until it becomes a puree.
step-8: season with salt and pepper.
step-9: set aside.
step-10: in a large pan, put the oil, chopped onion, green chilli and mix until the onion is transparent.
step-11: add the chopped sausage, tomatoes, and salt.
step-12: cook until the tomatoes are soft and become a sauce.
step-13: sprinkle in the parsley and green onions.
step-14: mix gently.
step-15: set aside.
step-16: preheat the oven to 200ºc (400ºf).
step-17: in a large, oven-safe casserole dish, smooth a layer of half the potato puree, a layer sausage sauce, mozzarella, then the remaining potato puree.
step-18: sprinkle the top with parmesan cheese and chopped parsley.
step-19: bake for 35 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the top layer is turning it is golden.

step-1: to a large dutch oven on medium heat, add the olive oil and heat it until it shimmers.
step-2: add the hot italian sausage, cook until the the first side browns deeply, flip and cook on the other side until the sausage is fully cooked, 15 minutes.
step-3: remove the sausages from the pan and slice when they cool down.
step-4: to the leftover pan drippings, add the chopped yellow onion, minced garlic, salt, pepper, dried basil, dried oregano, and dried parsley.
step-5: cook until the onions are caramelized and soft.
step-6: about 10 minutes.
step-7: add the tomato paste and cook until the tomato paste darkens slightly.
step-8: add in the diced tomatoes and the sausage slices into the pan, stir, and let the sauce come to a simmer.
step-9: add in half the grated parmesan, spinach, the cooked pasta, and stir to combine.
step-10: spoon in fresh dollaps of the ricotta cheese, garnish with fresh basil, more grated parmesan, and serve!

step-1: bring a medium pot of water to a boil.
step-2: add 5 eggs and boil for six minutes.
step-3: remove from heat and immediately transfer eggs to an ice water bath to cool (this will prevent the eggs from cooking further and will ensure a nice soft boiled egg)
step-4: combine sausage, green onions, garlic, mustard, salt, and pepper.
step-5: peel the cooled eggs and roll in flour.
step-6: press out the sausage mixture into patties and wrap around the floured eggs.
step-7: whisk the remaining 2 eggs together to form an egg wash.
step-8: roll your sausage-wrapped egg in flour, then egg wash, and finish in the seasoned bread crumbs.
step-9: repeat for each egg.
step-10: heat oil to 300˚f (150˚c) and fry each egg for about 3 minutes, until browned on all sides.
step-11: transfer fried eggs to a baking tray and finish cooking in a preheated oven for 5 minutes at 200˚c (400˚f).

step-1: combine all ingredients in a blender.
preheat oven to 375°f (190˚c.)
step-2: in a skillet, cook and crumble the ground beef with garlic powder, onion, powder, salt, & pepper.
step-3: remove from pan and drain.
step-4: in the same pan, melt the butter, and mix with the flour until it forms a paste.
step-5: add the milk gradually, and bring to a boil, until it thickens into a creamy sauce.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: in a bowl, mix the rigatoni with the eggs.
step-8: divide between two 9x13 inch (23x33 centimeter) baking dishes.
step-9: layer on the marinara, ground beef, mozzarella, white sauce, and parmesan.
step-10: bake both for 30-35 minutes, or until cheese is melted and golden brown.
step-11: cool and freeze extra casserole up to 2 months.
step-12: (to cook, transfer to the refrigerator overnight.
step-13: bake covered at 375°f(190°c) for 40 minutes.
step-14: remove cover and bake an additional 10 minutes.)

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a bowl, mix the flour, eggs, ½ cup (120 ml) of milk, and salt, until smooth.
step-3: add in the remaining milk and mix again until the batter is thin and smooth.
step-4: heat a nonstick pan over medium heat.
step-5: add the butter and onions to the pan.
step-6: cook until browned.
step-7: add garlic, spinach, and salt, and stir until spinach is wilted.
step-8: remove the spinach mixture and clean the pan.
step-9: return the pan to medium heat and add ¼-½ cup of the batter into the pan.
step-10: swirl the batter to coat the pan and leave on the heat until the sides start to lift up from the pan.
step-11: using a spatula flip the crepe over and cook through, about 2 minutes.
step-12: repeat with remaining batter.
step-13: lay the crepes on a baking sheet.
step-14: place one slice of cheese in the middle of a crepe.
step-15: top the cheese with 2 slices of ham and the spinach mixture.
step-16: top with a fried egg and fold the edges over the egg, pressing down to make sure the sides stay in place.
step-17: repeat with other crepe.
step-18: bake the crepes for 5 minutes or until yolk is at the desired consistency.

step-1: preheat oven to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-2: place a 12-inch (30 cm) cast-iron pan in the oven and let heat up until ready to use.
step-3: in a bowl, add the chickpea flour, water, 2 tablespoons of olive oil, and salt, and whisk to combine.
step-4: cover the bowl with a towel or plastic wrap and let rest at room temperature for at least 30 minutes.
step-5: preheat the oven to broil.
step-6: carefully remove the hot cast-iron pan from the oven, and pour in the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil, swirling the pan so that the bottom is fully coated.
step-7: gently pour in the chickpea flour batter into the pan, swirling the pan so that the batter covers the entire pan.
step-8: place the cast iron pan in the oven and broil for 5-8 minutes, until the edges are crisp and top is cooked through.
step-9: sprinkle with flaky sea salt, pepper, and rosemary.
step-10: slice and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-2: place a 12-inch (30 cm) cast iron pan in the oven and let heat up until ready to use.
step-3: in a bowl, add the chickpea flour, water, 2 tablespoons of olive oil, salt, and whisk to combine.
step-4: cover the bowl with a towel or plastic wrap and let rest at room temperature for at least 30 minutes.
step-5: preheat the oven to broil.
step-6: carefully remove the hot cast iron pan from the oven, and pour in the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil, swirling the pan so that the bottom is fully coated.
step-7: gently pour in the chickpea flour batter into the pan, swirling the pan so that the batter covers the entire pan.
step-8: place the cast iron pan in the oven and broil for 5 minutes.
step-9: remove the cast iron pan and top with marinara sauce, leaving a 1-inch (2 cm) border of the crust.
step-10: top with shredded mozzarella and red pepper flakes.
step-11: broil for 2-3 more minutes, until the cheese has melted.
step-12: sprinkle with flaky sea salt and basil.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: in a medium-sized mixing bowl, combine the ricotta, spinach, artichokes, salt, and pepper, and mix until fully incorporated.
step-3: lay a sheet of puff pastry dough over the ice cube tray and carefully press into the dough forming it to the ice tray.
step-4: place the shredded mozzarella, pepperonis, and marinara in the first four cube divots.
step-5: place the roasted red peppers, pesto, and mozzarella pearls in the middle four cube divots.
step-6: spoon the ricotta mixture into the last 4 cube divots.
step-7: place the other sheet of puff pastry over the ice cube tray and use a rolling pin to seal it.
step-8: chill for at least 10 minutes.
step-9: on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, invert the ice cube tray releasing the puff pastry pockets.
step-10: using a knife, cut any excess dough from the sides.
step-11: using a fork, press into the the edges of the pastry and seal.
step-12: brush the pastry with butter and bake for 30 minutes.

step-1: combine chickpeas, pumpkin, olive oil, garlic, salt, paprika, rosemary and lemon juice in a food processor or blender, and blend until smooth.
step-2: add more olive oil or water as necessary to reach desired consistency.
step-3: serve with pita chips.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: cut sweet potato into wedges.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: prepare breading mixture in a large bowl and set aside.
step-5: whisk 2 eggs in a separate bowl.
step-6: dip wedges, one by one, in the egg mixture followed by the breading mixture and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-7: bake for 30-35 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-8: for best results, flip halfway.
step-9: while wedges are baking, prepare the avocado dipping sauce by mashing the avocado with a fork until consistency is smooth and then adding the other ingredients.
step-10: (you may also use a high speed blender or food processor.)

step-1: brush pizza dough with sesame oil.
step-2: liberally spread scallions.
step-3: salt and white pepper the pizza dough.
step-4: cut pizza dough into 6 x 10 inch (15 x 25 cm) pieces.
step-5: roll and coil.
step-6: rest covered with a damp towel for an hour.
step-7: after an hour, flatten each coil of dough, roll out as flat as possible.
step-8: fry on medium heat until both sides are golden brown (5 minutes).
step-9: then cut into quarters.
step-10: mix the ingredients for the dipping sauce into a small bowl.
step-11: serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: pour 1 tablespoon of oil into a medium skillet over medium heat and sauté the onion, mushrooms, and spinach for about 5-7 minutes, or until the onions begin to turn translucent.
step-3: add 1 tablespoon of garlic, salt, and pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, until all the liquid evaporates and the mixture becomes a thick paste.
step-4: remove from the pan and let cool completely.
step-5: generously season the rib eye all over with salt and pepper.
step-6: heat the oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat.
step-7: sear the meat for 3-5 minutes on all sides, until a crust has formed all over.
step-8: let rest on a wire rack for 10 minutes.
step-9: arrange overlapping sheets of plastic wrap until you have a surface twice the length and width of the rib eye.
step-10: lay overlapping strips of prosciutto on the plastic in an even layer, making sure the prosciutto sheet is large enough to cover the rib eye.
step-11: spread the cooled mushroom mixture evenly over the prosciutto.
step-12: in a small bowl, stir together the mayonnaise, remaining ½ tablespoon minced garlic, ½ teaspoon salt, the thyme, and lemon juice.
step-13: generously brush the rib eye with the garlic mayo, then place the rib eye in the center of the prosciutto-mushroom sheet.
step-14: keeping everything even and tight, wrap the rib eye with the prosciutto, using the plastic wrap to help wrap it tightly and to seal the ends.
step-15: tuck the ends of the plastic wrap underneath the wrapped rib eye to keep its shape and chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-16: using a knife or mandoline, carefully cut the potatoes into slices ⅛-inch (3 mm) thick and lay on paper towels.
step-17: sprinkle the potato slices with salt and let sit for 10 minutes to draw out any excess moisture.
step-18: pat the potatoes dry.
step-19: evenly sprinkle 1 cup (115 g) of parmesan cheese over a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-20: arrange the potato slices in overlapping rows over the parmesan until the pan is covered.
step-21: sprinkle the remaining cup of parmesan evenly over the potatoes.
step-22: bake for 30 minutes, until slightly golden and the potatoes are still flexible.
step-23: remove the potatoes from the oven and increase the heat to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-24: place the chilled, prosciutto-wrapped rib eye in the center of the potato sheet.
step-25: fold the potatoes over the rib eye and peel back the parchment.
step-26: sprinkle parmesan under the seam (it will help seal the potato layer) and all over the top.
step-27: loosely cover the pan with foil and bake for 30 minutes.
step-28: remove the foil and bake for 20 minutes more, or until the potatoes are golden brown and the internal temperature of the beef is at least 135°f (57°c) for medium-rare.
step-29: rest for 10 minutes before slicing.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: using a mandolin, slice the red potatoes to about 3 millimeter-thick slices.
step-3: slice the gold potatoes to about 5-6 millimeters thick.
step-4: in a large bowl, combine the red potatoes with the salt, pepper, and heavy cream, and stir until evenly coated.
step-5: butter an oven-safe, 8 or 9-inch, stainless steel mixing bowl.
step-6: starting from the center, lay the red potatoes in an overlapping, circular fashion, making sure they make good contact and are sticking to the bowl.
step-7: repeat the circular pattern up until roughly ½-inch from the top of the bowl.
step-8: place the sliced gold potatoes into the cream, stirring until fully coated with cream.
step-9: shake off the excess cream, then layer the potato slices at the bottom of the bowl, building in a similar circular fashion.
step-10: after 2-3 rotations, place down 2 slices of cheddar.
step-11: to fill the gaps, you might need to cut 2 more slices into halves and use those strips near the edges.
step-12: layer another 2 rotations of gold potatoes.
step-13: place the strips of bacon in a single layer across the potatoes.
step-14: layer another 2 rotations of gold potatoes.
step-15: sprinkle the chives in an even layer across the potatoes.
step-16: layer another 2 rotations of gold potatoes.
step-17: fan out the rest of the cheddar slices in a circular pattern on top of the potatoes.
step-18: layer another 2 rotations of gold potatoes.
step-19: place the circle of puff pastry on top, pressing it lightly into the potatoes.
step-20: bake, uncovered, for 1 hour and 30 minutes.
step-21: if the pastry or the edges of potatoes near the top are starting to get too dark, cover the dish with foil and continue baking.
step-22: cool until the bottom of the dish is no longer warm.
step-23: while the potatoes bake, prepare the garlic cream sauce by transferring the cream from the soaked potatoes into a medium saucepan or pot.
step-24: add the onion powder, garlic powder, and parmesan, stirring while bringing to a boil.
step-25: set aside and reheat when serving.
step-26: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-27: run a knife along the sides of the bowl to make sure the potatoes are release, then invert it onto a baking tray.
step-28: bake for another 10 minutes or so, until the slices start to turn golden brown and slightly crispy.
step-29: transfer the dome to a cutting board, then slice into wedges.
step-30: serve with the cream sauce, a sprinkle of chives.

step-1: in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat until shimmering.
step-2: add the onion and cook until golden, about 5 minutes.
step-3: add the ground beef and break apart, then cook for 3 minutes until the meat is no longer pink.
step-4: add the pepper, salt, garlic powder, paprika, and tomatoes.
step-5: mix thoroughly.
step-6: add the spinach and cook until just wilted, about 2 minutes.
step-7: remove the pan from the heat, cover, and set aside until ready to use.
step-8: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-9: peel the potatoes and cut into ⅛-inch (3 mm) thick slices.
step-10: in a 9x5-inch (23x13-cm) loaf pan, arrange overlapping potato slices on the bottom of the pan so the entire bottom is covered.
step-11: line the perimeter of the pan with overlapping potato slices.
step-12: place 2 slices of mozzarella over the bottom layer of potatoes.
step-13: cut 5 slices of mozzarella in half.
step-14: place 2 half slices of cheese against the potatoes on both of the longer sides of the pan and one half on both of the shorter sides.
step-15: place one half in each of the corners of the pan.
step-16: spread ⅓ of the beef mixture on top of the cheese.
step-17: arrange another layer of overlapping potato slices over the beef mixture.
step-18: place 2 more slices of cheese on top of the potatoes.
step-19: spread another third of the beef mixture over the cheese, then add another layer of potatoes.
step-20: place 2 more slices of cheese on top of the potatoes.
step-21: spread the rest of the beef mixture on top of the cheese.
step-22: tuck potato slices around the sides of the pan until all of the gaps are filled.
step-23: place the last 2 slices of cheese on top of the beef mixture.
step-24: cover the cheese with overlapping potato slices.
step-25: bake for 90 minutes, until the top is golden brown and crisp.
step-26: let cool a bit.
step-27: place a cutting board over the loaf pan and invert the loaf.
step-28: slice and garnish with parsley.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: using a knife or mandolin cut the potatoes into slices ⅛-inch (3 mm) thick.
step-3: on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, sprinkle half of the parmesan cheese and spread until it is evenly covering the parchment paper.
step-4: place the potatoes over the parmesan so each potato is overlapping the previous potato both vertically and horizontally.
step-5: continue until the entire pan is filled with potatoes.
step-6: sprinkle to rest of the parmesan evenly over the potatoes.
step-7: season with 1 teaspoon of salt.
step-8: bake for 30 minutes, until golden and the potatoes are flexible and slightly crispy.
step-9: in a skillet heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat.
step-10: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the onions, and cook until caramelized, about 15 minutes.
step-11: add the beef break up and mix with the onion until cooked.
step-12: mix in the tomatoes, 3 tablespoons of parsley, paprika, 1 teaspoon of salt, and pepper.
step-13: stir, cooking until the beef is browned and cooked through.
step-14: remove from heat.
step-15: in a skillet heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat.
step-16: add the spinach, cook until wilted.
step-17: add 1 teaspoon of salt and the garlic.
step-18: stir to combine.
step-19: remove from heat.
step-20: in a bowl combine the spinach mixture and the ricotta.
step-21: set aside.
step-22: evenly spread the spinach mixture over the cooked potato sheet.
step-23: evenly spread the beef mixture over the spinach.
step-24: sprinkle mozzarella over the beef.
step-25: take one end of the potato sheet holding the parchment paper begin rolling upward, making sure the ingredients are not coming out the ends.
step-26: once the it is completely rolled place the potato roll on the parchment paper and bake for 15 minutes.
step-27: sprinkle with parsley for garnish.
step-28: slice and serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a small pot, melt the butter and fry the garlic until it’s just starting to brown.
step-3: add the flour, salt and pepper.
step-4: whisk until there are no lumps.
step-5: slowly drizzle in the milk while constantly whisking to make sure the mixture is smooth.
step-6: bring to a boil, then remove from heat.
step-7: slice the potatoes into about ⅛-inch (3 mm) thick slices, then fan them out in a small baking dish.
step-8: pour the sauce on top of the potatoes, then sprinkle with parmesan.
step-9: bake for about 1 hour, until the top is bubbly and golden brown.
step-10: sprinkle chopped parsley on top, then serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (180°c).
step-2: using a mandolin, slice the sweet potato and add an even layer of slices to a baking dish.
step-3: heat a pan over medium heat then add the olive oil.
step-4: add onion then saute for 3-4 minutes.
step-5: add garlic then saute for 1-2 minutes.
step-6: add flour then cook until well combined.
step-7: add the stock then whisk until well combined.
step-8: add the milk, salt, pepper, and half of the thyme.
step-9: whisk until combined then simmer for 1-2 minutes.
step-10: remove from heat and set aside.
step-11: pour half of the cream sauce on top of the potatoes.
step-12: sprinkle the cheddar and parmesan cheeses.
step-13: add an even layer of potato slices on top.
step-14: top with the remaining cream sauce and cheddar cheese.
step-15: cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake for 20 minutes.
step-16: carefully remove and allow to cool for 5-10 minutes.
step-17: sprinkle with the remaining thyme, if desired and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-2: line a 10-inch (25-cm) springform pan with parchment paper.
step-3: carefully slice the zucchini, potatoes, and carrots very thinly with a mandoline or a sharp knife.
step-4: watch your fingers!
step-5: in a large bowl, combine the eggs, melted butter, and milk, and whisk until combined.
step-6: add the nutmeg, basil, thyme, salt, pepper, and flour, and whisk well.
step-7: add the sliced veggies to the batter and stir well until the slices are well-coated.
step-8: add half of the vegetables slices to the prepared pan and flatten with a spoon.
step-9: sprinkle the cheese over the vegetables.
step-10: top with the rest of the vegetables and cover the pan with aluminum foil.
step-11: bake for about 1½ hours, until the vegetables are fully cooked and tender.
step-12: let cool for at least 10 minutes, and release the springform, slice, and serve.

step-1: for the whole wheat sandwiches, assemble your desired combination of cheese and deli meat on slices of whole wheat bread.
step-2: pack the sandwiches in lunch containers with condiment packets.
step-3: for the wraps, place the lettuce and your desired assortment of cheese and deli meat on the whole wheat tortilla and wrap it closed.
step-4: cut the wrap in half and pack in lunch container with condiment packets.
step-5: for the dry snacks, store the wheat crackers, pretzels, and cheese crackers in individual snack containers.
step-6: store in the cupboard.
step-7: to assemble the lunch containers, fill with your desired assortments of sandwiches, wraps, fruit, and vegetables.
step-8: store in the fridge for up to 5 days.
step-9: to prepare for school in the morning, pack an insulated lunch container with one of the lunch containers, a snack container, and a bottle filled with your little one’s favorite drink.

step-1: crack the eggs into a small bowl and whisk to combine.
step-2: heat the olive oil in a medium nonstick pan over medium heat until shimmering and add the beaten eggs, salt, and pepper.
step-3: using a rubber spatula, stir the eggs often until firm, roughly 3 minutes.
step-4: divide the eggs between the tortillas.
step-5: top each taco with pico de gallo, black beans, and cilantro.

step-1: preheat gas grill on high heat.
step-2: using a sharp knife, slice the avocados in half by cutting in a straight line around the pit.
step-3: place the avocado half containing the pit in your hand and face it away from you.
step-4: gently stick the tip of the knife into the side of the pit and carefully pry it out of the avocado.
step-5: for a ripe avocado, the pit will pop out with little effort.
step-6: you can hold a kitchen towel in your hand and place the avocado in the towel for added protection from the edge of your knife.
step-7: place the avocado halves on a tray.
step-8: using a pastry brush, brush oil on each of the avocado halves.
step-9: season avocados with salt.
step-10: place the avocados on the grill, flesh side down, and grill for 3-4 minutes, until grill marks appear.
step-11: remove the avocados and stuff with scrambled eggs, bacon crumbles, and sriracha sauce.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: spread the bread in a single layer on a rimmed baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes, until lightly toasted.
step-3: let cool to room temperature.
step-4: leave the oven on.
step-5: add the toasted bread to a food processor and pulse until finely ground.
step-6: you should have about 4 cups (460 g) of bread crumbs.
step-7: in a large bowl, combine the bread crumbs, 4 tablespoons of melted butter, the cheddar cheese, and 1 teaspoon of salt and toss to combine.
step-8: set aside.
step-9: in a medium pot, combine 4 cups (960 ml) of white wine and a generous pinch of salt and bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
step-10: add the shrimp and cook until bright pink, about 1 minute.
step-11: use a spider or slotted spoon to transfer the shrimp to a colander to drain.
step-12: return the wine to a boil.
step-13: add the scallops and cook until just opaque, about 2 minutes.
step-14: transfer the scallops to a colander to drain.
step-15: chop the shrimp and scallops into bite-size pieces.
step-16: transfer to large bowl, along with the crab and 1 teaspoon of salt.
step-17: toss to combine.
step-18: in a liquid measuring cup or medium bowl, whisk together the half-and-half, 3 tablespoons of melted butter, the flour, worcestershire sauce, paprika, lemon juice, ketchup, remaining tablespoon of white wine, and remaining teaspoon of salt.
step-19: brush the remaining tablespoon of melted butter in a 9 x 13-inch (22 x 33 cm) baking dish.
step-20: scatter the artichokes in an even layer over the bottom of the baking dish.
step-21: scoop the seafood mixture over the artichokes.
step-22: pour the sauce over the seafood.
step-23: top with the bread crumb mixture.
step-24: bake the casserole for 20-25 minutes, or until bubbling and golden brown.
step-25: top with chives and serve with lemon wedges.

step-1: pat dry the duck breasts with a paper towel.
step-2: score the duck skin with sharp knife, making sure to not cut into the flesh.
step-3: season the duck breasts on both sides with salt and pepper.
step-4: add the potatoes to a pot of water and bring to a boil over high heat.
step-5: cook for 15-20 minutes, until fork-tender.
step-6: drain the potatoes in a colander.
step-7: using the bottom of a ramekin or your palm, gently smash the potatoes.
step-8: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-9: starting with a cold and dry oven-safe skillet, place the duck breasts skin side down.
step-10: cook for 12-15 minutes over medium heat.
step-11: flip the breasts over and sear the other side for 1 minute.
step-12: flip to the skin side down, and transfer the skillet to the oven.
step-13: roast for 4 minutes for medium-rare, or 6 minutes for medium.
step-14: rest the duck skin-side up for 10 minutes.
step-15: do not discard the fat in the pan.
step-16: in a small pot, combine the red wine, chicken stock, orange juice, and honey and reduce by half over medium heat.
step-17: fry the potatoes with remaining duck fat in the pan, until golden brown, 5-6 minutes.
step-18: season with salt, pepper and rosemary.
step-19: slice the duck ½-inch (1 cm) pieces.
step-20: serve with the sauce and the potatoes.

step-1: preheat the oven to 180˚c (350˚f).
step-2: lightly score the duck skin with a sharp knife.
step-3: make sure not to cut through to the flesh.
step-4: season each side of the duck breast with 1 teaspoon of salt and pepper each.
step-5: fry the duck breast skin side down on medium heat for 3 to 4 minutes with the garlic and rosemaries.
step-6: flip and fry the other side for 1 minute.
step-7: put the duck breast in the oven for 6-8 minutes for medium rare; 10 minutes for medium well.
step-8: rest for 6 minutes before serving.
step-9: for the mashed potato, chuck all the ingredients in the boiled potato, mix well.
step-10: for the red wine jus, use the pan you fried the duck breasts in.
step-11: take out the rosemary stalks, crush the garlic with a fork.
step-12: fry the garlic for a minute or two on medium low heat.
step-13: add in the flour and fry for another minute or until all the fat in the pan have binded to the flour.
step-14: add in the rest of the ingredients, mix well and keep simmering on a low heat for 10 minutes or until it becomes a glossy thick sauce.
step-15: to impress your guests with your presentation game, pipe the mashed potato with a piping bag into a golf ball size mound.
step-16: shape using the back of a spoon.
step-17: place the duck breast, drizzle with the jus and decorate with orange zest and rosemary.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: in a small bowl, combine the garlic, maple syrup, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
step-3: brush the marinade over the salmon fillets.
step-4: cover with plastic wrap and marinate in the fridge for 1 hour.
step-5: in a medium bowl, combine the chickpeas, 2 tablespoons of olive oil, the smoked paprika, turmeric, pepper, cumin, salt, cayenne, and cinnamon.
step-6: toss to combine.
step-7: set aside.
step-8: add the butternut squash and sweet potatoes to a baking sheet.
step-9: season with salt and pepper and drizzle with 2 tablespoons of olive oil.
step-10: bake for 1 hour, or until the vegetables are soft.
step-11: pour the spiced chickpeas onto a second sheet pan and spread out into an even layer.
step-12: toss to coat.
step-13: bake for 40 minutes, or until chickpeas are browned and crispy.
step-14: in a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, combine the tahini, maple syrup, garlic, lemon juice, remaining ¼ cup of olive oil, salt, and pepper.
step-15: whisk well.
step-16: in a large bowl, add the chopped kale, roasted squash and sweet potatoes, barley, roasted chickpeas, shallot, pecans, and tahini dressing.
step-17: toss to combine.
step-18: heat the canola oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
step-19: in batches, sear the salmon skin-side down for 3 minutes, then flip and cook on the other side for 3 minutes.
step-20: arrange the salad on a platter and top with the seared salmon.

step-1: pat the scallops dry with a paper towel.
step-2: season with salt and pepper.
step-3: in a large skillet set over medium-high heat, add the oil.
step-4: when the oil is hot, add the scallops and cook until golden brown on one side, 2-3 minutes.
step-5: gently turn the scallops, and add the butter and garlic to the pan.
step-6: continue to cook, spooning the butter over the scallops until they are cooked through, about 3 minutes more.
step-7: add the white wine, cook another 10 seconds.
step-8: serve with chives.

step-1: add the shrimp to a mesh strainer set in a bowl of cool water and let sit for about 10 minutes to defrost.
step-2: in a medium bowl, combine the defrosted shrimp, olive oil, garlic, salt, pepper, and lemon zest.
step-3: toss until the shrimp are well coated.
step-4: heat a medium pan over medium heat.
step-5: add the shrimp to the pan and cook for about 1 minute on each side, until pink, opaque, and firm.
step-6: remove from the pan and set aside to cool.
step-7: make the vinaigrette: in a liquid measuring cup, combine the shallot, vinegar, honey, mustard, salt, and pepper.
step-8: whisk until fully incorporated.
step-9: while whisking, slowly stream in the olive oil until completely emulsified.
step-10: to assemble the salad, add the mesclun greens to a large bowl.
step-11: top with the cooked shrimp, quinoa, cherry tomatoes, avocado, chickpeas, and green onions.
step-12: drizzle with the vinaigrette, then toss to combine.

step-1: add the salt crystals and peppercorns to a mortar and pestle, and crush into a fine powder.
