step-2: add the chili powder, paprika, onion powder, and garlic powder, and mix until well combined.
step-3: sprinkle on vegetables, popcorn, and more!

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: add the walnuts and pepitas to the prepared baking sheet.
step-4: toast in the oven for 10 minutes, until golden brown and fragrant.
step-5: in a medium bowl, mix together the toasted walnuts and pepitas, chia seeds, figs, flaxseeds, oats, pumpkin spice, and salt.
step-6: in a large bowl, whisk together the pumpkin puree, almond milk, olive oil, and maple syrup.
step-7: then, add the flaxseed meal and dry ingredients and stir with a spatula to incorporate.
step-8: the “dough” will be moist and somewhat loose.
step-9: transfer the batter to a 9x5-inch (23x13 cm) loaf pan, packing it into the pan.
step-10: cover with plastic wrap and let sit at room temperature for 2 hours.
step-11: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-12: bake for 1 hour and 20 minutes.
step-13: the loaf will become very browned during baking.
step-14: remove from the oven and let cool for 15-20 minutes before slicing.
step-15: nutrition calories: 411 fat: 19 grams sodium : 373mg carbs: 31 grams fiber: 8 grams sugars: 18 grams protein: 7 grams

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (175°c).
step-2: in food processor, combine pinto beans, garlic, soy sauce, and olive oil.
step-3: process until smooth.
step-4: in medium-sized mixing bowl, combine vital wheat gluten, nutritional yeast, garlic powder, onion powder, sage, rosemary, thyme, and pepper.
step-5: add in bean mixture and stir until combined.
step-6: make a well in the the mixture and pour in vegetable broth.
step-7: mix until dough gets thick.
step-8: once thick enough, use your hands to knead dough.
step-9: form dough into log, approximately 10 inches (25 cm) long and 5 inches (13 cm) thick.
step-10: roll up log in parchment paper, then in aluminum foil.
step-11: bake for 1 hour, flipping roast every 20 minutes.
step-12: remove from oven and let rest for 10 minutes before slicing.
step-13: serve with vegetarian gravy.

step-1: preheat the oven to pie crust or biscuit package specification.
step-2: in a large pot over medium heat, heat the oil.
step-3: add the onion and carrots and cook 5 minutes, or until the onions begin to turn translucent.
step-4: add the garlic, celery, and mushrooms and cook another 5 minutes, or until tender.
step-5: add the salt, pepper, italian seasoning, and arrowroot starch.
step-6: stir to combine.
step-7: add the lemon juice, vegetable broth, almond milk, broccoli, and chicken.
step-8: stir to combine.
step-9: add more arrowroot, if necessary, to reach desired thickness.
step-10: remove mixture from heat and allow to cool.
step-11: to make one family-style pie: place one pie crust into an ungreased 9-inch (23-cm) pie dish.
step-12: fill with the vegetable mixture.
step-13: top with the second pie crust, folding under any excess crust and crimping the edges with a fork.
step-14: brush the crust evenly with beaten egg.
step-15: cut a few slits in the top crust.
step-16: bake according to pie crust packaging.
step-17: cut and serve warm.
step-18: to make individual pies: arrange 6 or more ramekins or bowls on a baking sheet.
step-19: scoop the vegetable mixture into the ramekins.
step-20: top each ramekin with 1 uncooked biscuit.
step-21: bake according to biscuit packaging.

step-1: remove all leaves and cut the cauliflower into small florets.
step-2: place the florets in a food processor and blend until they are a rice-like texture.
step-3: be careful not to over process or it may turn mushy.
step-4: set aside, and drain excess moisture with a towel, if desired.
step-5: in a large saucepan over medium-high heat, cook the chicken until no pink is showing.
step-6: add the peas, carrots, soy sauce, and black pepper.
step-7: stir until most of the liquid has reduced, then add the cauliflower rice.
step-8: cook for about 3-4 minutes until the vegetables and chicken are incorporated evenly into the cauliflower.
step-9: spread the rice towards the edge of the pan, creating a well in the center.
step-10: pour the beaten eggs into the well, stirring only the eggs until they are cooked.
step-11: fold the eggs into the rice, then mix in the sesame seeds.

step-1: in a blender, combine the peanut butter, soy sauce, sesame oil, rice vinegar, water, brown sugar, garlic, and ginger and blend until smooth.
step-2: in a large bowl, add the spaghetti, carrots, cabbage, and edamame and pour over the peanut sauce.
step-3: use tongs to mix well, until sauce is fully incorporated.
step-4: transfer to bowls and top with peanuts, black sesame seeds, and scallion.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: using a sharp knife, cut off the top and bottom of the orange, then cut away the peel from the sides.
step-3: slice alongside the membrane of the orange to remove each segment until the orange is fully supremed.
step-4: in a large bowl, mix the orange supremes, napa cabbage, red cabbage, carrots, green onions, oil, rice vinegar, 1 tablespoon of the sesame seeds, and season with salt and pepper.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: season the salmon fillets on both sides with salt, pepper, and the remaining 1 tablespoon of sesame seeds.
step-7: transfer the fillets to a greased rimmed baking sheet.
step-8: bake for 8-12 minutes, until the salmon has just started to form a golden crust.
step-9: plate the salmon and slaw on a plate with a few lemon wedges, if desired.
step-10: sprinkle over a pinch of sesame seeds and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: combine the almond flour, salt, pepper, and sesame seeds in a large bowl.
step-3: add the avocado oil and mix thoroughly with a fork.
step-4: add the ice water, 1 tablespoon at a time, and mix thoroughly, until small clumps form and the dough holds together when squeezed.
step-5: form the dough into a round, flattening the top and bottom as evenly as possible.
step-6: place the dough on a sheet of parchment paper and add another piece of parchment on top.
step-7: roll out the dough as evenly as possible, to between ¼- and ⅛-inch (6- and 3-mm) thick.
step-8: remove the top layer of parchment paper and place on a baking sheet.
step-9: you may need to press the edges of the dough to form an even rectangle.
step-10: using a cookie cutter or pizza cutter, slice the dough to desired size.
step-11: if using a cookie cutter, re-roll the excess dough and cut out more crackers.
step-12: if desired, use the blunt end of a skewer to poke holes in each of the crackers.
step-13: carefully place the crackers on the baking sheet.
step-14: if the dough is too warm, the crackers will break as you attempt to transfer them.
step-15: chill in the freezer for 10 minutes before proceeding if this happens.
step-16: bake for 15-20 minutes, flipping halfway, until golden brown.
step-17: let the crackers cool completely and serve as desired.
step-18: store up to 1 week at room temperature in an airtight container.

step-1: preheat oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-2: cut flour tortillas into large squares and then divide each into quarters, making 4 smaller equally sized square pieces, per flour tortilla.
step-3: generously coat a standard-size muffin tin with nonstick cooking spray.
step-4: line each cup of prepared muffin tin with a tortilla sheet.
step-5: spoon a tablespoon of refried beans into each sheet.
step-6: sprinkle shredded cheese over each sheet.
step-7: place another sheet on top of the bean/cheese mixture and press so it flattens.
step-8: bake for 15 minutes.
step-9: spoon in a tablespoon of guacamole, sour cream, and salsa into each cup then top with green onions and tomato.

step-1: scoop the avocado into a medium bowl.
step-2: season with salt and add the lemon juice.
step-3: mash until smooth.
step-4: cut the slice of toast in half crosswise, then spread the avocado on the toast.
step-5: top with the mozzarella, tomatoes, basil, and flaky salt.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: grease 2 baking sheets with nonstick spray and line with parchment paper.
step-3: make the cornbread: in a medium bowl whisk the buttermilk, eggs, and melted butter until smooth.
step-4: in a large bowl, combine the flour, cornmeal, salt, sugar, baking powder, and baking soda, and whisk to combine.
step-5: add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until fully incorporated.
step-6: divide the batter between the prepared baking sheets, and use a spatula to smooth the top.
step-7: bake for 15 minutes, until golden brown.
step-8: meanwhile, make the barbecue sauce: add the ketchup, worcestershire, apple cider vinegar, dijon mustard, paprika, brown sugar, and black pepper to a medium saucepan over medium heat and whisk to combine.
step-9: bring the sauce to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
step-10: make the coleslaw: in a large bowl, add the mayonnaise, dijon mustard, pepper, apple cider vinegar, paprika, and salt, and whisk to combine.
step-11: add the green cabbage, red cabbage, and shredded carrots, and stir until fully coated.
step-12: add the shredded chicken to a large bowl, and pour the barbecue sauce over the chicken, stirring until fully coated.
step-13: invert one of the cornbread sheets onto a large cutting board and peel off the parchment paper.
step-14: spread the chicken over the cornbread in an even layer.
step-15: top with the slaw.
step-16: invert the other cornbread sheet on top of the slaw and peel off the parchment paper.
step-17: slice into 12 equal pieces.
step-18: top each piece with 2 pickle slices and secure with toothpicks.

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, combine pancake mix, eggs and milk being careful not to over-mix.
step-3: divide batter evenly onto two parchment paper-lined 17x11 inch baking sheets.
step-4: spread evenly and bake for 15 minutes.
step-5: in a large bowl, combine eggs, milk, salt and pepper.
step-6: pour the eggs onto a parchment paper-lined 17x11 inch baking sheet.
step-7: spread evenly and bake for 15-17 minutes.
step-8: line another 18x13 inch baking sheet with parchment paper and spread out the sausage from corner to corner.
step-9: decrease oven temperature to 350˚f (180˚c) and bake for 20 minutes.
step-10: drain fat, and sprinkle cheese on top of the sausage.
step-11: bake for another 5 minutes at the same temperature.
step-12: on a cutting board, layer the sandwich starting with a pancake, followed by sausage, egg, and the second pancake.
step-13: slice into breakfast size sandwiches and serve immediately, or wrap in parchment and freeze in a container for up to 1 month.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: onto a greased and parchment paper-lined sheet tray, place the pizza dough and spread into the corners of the tray.
step-3: sprinkle the dough with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
step-4: bake in the oven for 20 minutes or until the crust is golden brown.
step-5: remove from the oven and let cool.
step-6: in a mixing bowl, add the tomatoes, garlic, basil, parsley, olive oil, salt, and pepper and stir to combine.
step-7: pour the tomato mixture over the cooked pizza dough and spread to the corners.
step-8: add the sliced mozzarella cheese and drizzle with balsamic glaze.

step-1: grease a baking sheet with nonstick spray and lay out half of the pizza dough on the pan, stretching it to make sure the dough reaches the edges.
step-2: pour the marinara sauce over the dough and spread evenly with a spoon, leaving about an inch (2 cm) at the edges.
step-3: top evenly with the mozzarella.
step-4: on the first vertical quarter of the pan, sprinkle the cheddar and parmesan.
step-5: on the second quarter, add the pepperoni and sausage.
step-6: in the third quarter, add the bell peppers, mushrooms, and olives.
step-7: on the last quarter, add the ham and pineapple.
step-8: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-9: place the remaining dough over the topped pizza.
step-10: fold the bottom edge of dough over the top edge and pinch to seal the edges.
step-11: brush the top with olive oil and sprinkle with salt.
step-12: use a paring knife to cut 2 vents on top of the pizza.
step-13: bake for 40 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-14: slice and serve.

step-1: slice the chicken breasts into strips.
step-2: in a medium bowl, add the eggs and 1 tablespoon of olive oil.
step-3: whisk to combine.
step-4: in a large bowl, combine the panko bread crumbs, paprika, and 1 teaspoon of salt.
step-5: place the flour in another medium bowl.
step-6: coat the chicken strips in the flour, then in the eggs, then in the bread crumbs and place on a baking sheet.
step-7: cut the broccoli into florets.
step-8: preheat the oven to 375°f (190˚c) and line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
step-9: in a large bowl, toss the broccoli florets with 1 tablespoon olive oil, ¼ teaspoon salt, ¼ teaspoon pepper, and half of the minced garlic.
step-10: arrange on half of the remaining baking sheet.
step-11: cut the sweet potatoes in half lengthwise, then slice into half-moons.
step-12: toss the sweet potatoes in a large bowl with the remaining tablespoon of olive oil, ¼ teaspoon salt, ¼ teaspoon pepper, and minced garlic, and place on the baking sheet next to the broccoli.
step-13: bake both baking sheets simultaneously, until the veggies are browned and the chicken is crisp, about 20 minutes.
step-14: make the dipping sauce: combine the mayonnaise, mustard, and honey in a small bowl.
step-15: serve the chicken and veggies with the dipping sauce, bbq sauce, and ketchup, if using.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
step-3: add the onion and red bell pepper, and cook, stirring occasionally, until caramelized.
step-4: add the chicken, taco seasoning packet, cilantro, and lime juice, and mix thoroughly.
step-5: remove from heat, cover, and refrigerate until ready to use.
step-6: heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
step-7: add the onion, red bell pepper, and green bell pepper, and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened.
step-8: add the paprika, cumin, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper, and mix thoroughly.
step-9: remove from heat, cover, and refrigerate until ready to use.
step-10: heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
step-11: add the onion, and cook, stirring occasionally, until caramelized.
step-12: add the ground beef, break apart, and cook through until the beef is no longer pink.
step-13: add the tomato, taco seasoning packet, cilantro, and lime juice, and mix thoroughly.
step-14: remove from heat, cover, and refrigerate until ready to use.
step-15: heat butter in a pan over medium-low heat.
step-16: add the onion, and cook, stirring occasionally, until caramelized.
step-17: add the tomatoes, eggs, salt, and pepper.
step-18: fold the eggs and cook until they are no longer wet.
step-19: remove from heat, cover, and set aside.
step-20: generously spray a sheet tray with cooking oil spray.
step-21: place the tortillas so half of the tortilla is hanging over the edge of the pan.
step-22: place 6 tortillas around the border of the sheet tray and one tortilla in the middle, covering the exposed sheet tray.
step-23: sprinkle half of the cheddar cheese and half of the mozzarella cheese over the tortillas.
step-24: scoop the chicken mixture over the tortillas in the upper-left corner of the tray.
step-25: spread the mixture so that it fills ¼ of the sheet tray.
step-26: scoop the onion and pepper mixture over the tortillas in the upper-right corner of the tray.
step-27: spread the mixture so that it fills ¼ of the sheet tray.
step-28: scoop the beef mixture over the tortillas in the lower-right corner of the tray.
step-29: spread the mixture so that it fills ¼ of the sheet tray.
step-30: scoop the egg mixture over the tortillas in the lower-left corner of the tray.
step-31: spread the mixture so that it fills ¼ of the sheet tray.
step-32: top with cooked bacon.
step-33: place the tostadas over the fillings.
step-34: sprinkle the rest of the cheese over the tostadas.
step-35: place the last flour tortilla over the cheese.
step-36: fold over the tortillas so they cover up the fillings and touch the center tortilla.
step-37: place another sheet tray on top of the crunch-wrap.
step-38: place an oven-proof weight, like a cast-iron skillet, on top of the sheet tray.
step-41: bake for an additional 15 minutes until the tortillas are golden and crisp.
step-42: flip the crunch-wrap onto a cutting board.
step-43: slice and serve with salsa and sour cream.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: on a large baking sheet, arrange the onion, bell peppers, and chicken sausage.
step-3: drizzle with olive oil and season with 1 tablespoon creole seasoning, or to taste.
step-4: using your hands, mix everything together well.
step-5: bake for 8 minutes, or until chicken sausage begins to brown.
step-6: while the vegetables and chicken sausage are cooking, place the shrimp in a small bowl.
step-7: season with 1 teaspoon creole seasoning and ½ teaspoon paprika.
step-8: stir to coat.
step-9: remove the vegetables and sausage from the oven, and add the seasoned shrimp and diced tomatoes.
step-10: mix everything together.
step-11: return everything to the oven for 6 minutes, or until the shrimp is just done.
step-12: remove from the oven and add the cooked rice, mixing everything together well.
step-13: garnish with sliced scallions and serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: pour half of the melted butter onto a large sheet tray, brushing it across the entire surface.
step-3: shingle 12 slices of the bread onto the sheet pan, making sure each slice overlaps and the bread reaches the edges.
step-4: place any fillings you choose onto the bread.
step-5: you can mix and match any flavor combos you prefer!
step-6: for the ham and cheese sandwich, place 2 slices of cheddar cheese on the bread, four slices of ham, and 2 more slices of cheddar cheese.
step-7: for the chicken-bacon-ranch sandwich, place the shredded monterey jack cheese, 3 bacon slices, grilled chicken slices, and ranch dressing on the bread.
step-8: for the roast beef and onion sandwich, sprinkle on the shredded cheddar cheese, sliced roast beef, and half of the sautéed onions.
step-9: for the cheesesteak sandwich, add the provolone cheese, grilled steak, sautéed onions, and sautéed peppers.
step-10: for the turkey-bacon-avocado sandwich, add the shredded mozzarella cheese, sliced turkey, 3 slices of bacon, and the avocado.
step-11: for the tomato basil mozzarella, add the sliced fresh mozzarella cheese, sun-dried tomato, 3 tomato slices, salt, pepper, and chopped basil.
step-12: after all your fillings are in place, shingle another 12 slices of bread on top of the fillings.
step-13: brush the bread with the remaining melted butter.
step-14: place a second sheet pan over all the sandwiches and press down.
step-15: place heavy objects that can withstand oven heat, such as heavy pots or pans, on top of the pan to press the sandwiches.
step-16: bake the sheet pan for 20 minutes or until the fillings have warmed through.
step-17: remove the heavy objects and the top sheet pan, and bake the pressed sandwiches for another 20 minutes or until the bread turns golden brown and crisps up.
step-18: remove the sandwiches from the oven, carefully flip the tray onto a large cutting board, and slice squares of sandwiches.

step-1: make the mushroom filling: heat the olive oil in a medium pan over medium heat.
step-2: add the onion and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, until caramelized, about 3 minutes.
step-3: add the tomato and mushrooms and stir.
step-4: add the chili powder, smoked paprika, cumin, pepper, and salt and stir thoroughly.
step-5: cook until the vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes.
step-6: add the lime juice and cilantro and stir to combine.
step-7: transfer to a medium bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate until ready to use.
step-8: make the onion and pepper filling: heat the olive oil in a medium pan over medium heat.
step-9: add the onion, red bell pepper, and green bell pepper and cook until softened, about 8 minutes.
step-10: add the lime juice, paprika, cumin, salt, and pepper, and mix thoroughly.
step-11: continue cooking until the vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes.
step-12: transfer to a medium bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate until ready to use.
step-13: make the tofu filling: heat the olive oil in a medium pan over medium heat.
step-14: add the onion, garlic and red bell pepper and cook until caramelized, about 5 minutes
step-15: add the tofu, smoked paprika, chili powder, cumin, soy sauce, lime juice and cilantro and mix thoroughly.
step-16: cook until the red bell pepper is tender, about 8 minutes.
step-17: transfer to a medium bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate until ready to use.
step-18: make the black bean and corn filling: heat the olive oil in a medium pan over medium heat.
step-19: add the onion and garlic and cook until caramelized, about 3 minutes
step-20: add the tomato, corn, black beans, paprika, chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper and mix thoroughly.
step-21: cook until the vegetables are tender, about 8 minutes.
step-22: transfer to a medium bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate until ready to use.
step-23: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-24: generously grease a baking sheet with nonstick spray.
step-25: place 6 tortillas around the sides of the pan so half of the tortilla is hanging over the edge place 2 tortillas in the middle, covering the exposed pan.
step-26: sprinkle half of the cheddar cheese and half of the monterey jack cheese over the tortillas.
step-27: scoop the black bean and corn filling onto the tortillas in the upper-left corner of the tray.
step-28: spread the mixture so that it fills ¼ of the sheet tray.
step-29: scoop the onion and pepper filling over the tortillas in the upper-right corner of the tray.
step-30: spread the mixture so that it fills another ¼ of the sheet tray.
step-31: scoop the mushroom filling over the tortillas in the lower-left corner of the tray.
step-32: spread the mixture so that it fills another ¼ of the sheet tray.
step-33: scoop the tofu mixture over the tortillas in the lower-right corner of the tray.
step-34: spread the mixture so that it fills the remaining ¼ of the sheet tray.
step-35: sprinkle the rest of the cheese over the fillings.
step-36: place the remaining 2 tortillas over the cheese in the center of the pan.
step-37: fold the overhanging tortillas onto the pan so they cover the fillings and touch the center tortillas.
step-38: place another baking sheet on top.
step-39: place an oven-proof weight, such as a cast-iron skillet, on top of the sheet tray.
step-41: remove the weight and top baking sheet.
step-42: bake for another 15 minutes, until the tortillas are golden and crisp.
step-43: flip the quesadilla onto a cutting board.
step-44: slice and serve with salsa and sour cream.

step-1: place the quinoa in a medium bowl.
step-2: add enough water to cover the quinoa, about 1½ cups (360 ml).
step-3: cover with plastic wrap and soak, at room temperature, for at least 8 hours, or overnight.
step-4: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-5: line a baking sheet with parchment paper and lightly grease it with nonstick cooking spray.
step-6: drain and rinse the quinoa.
step-7: add the quinoa, 1 cup (240 ml) of water, the baking powder, garlic powder, salt, and parmesan cheese to a food processor.
step-8: blend for about 2 minutes, or until a smooth batter forms.
step-9: pour the batter onto the baking sheet, using a spatula to spread evenly.
step-10: bake the crust for 15 minutes.
step-11: flip the crust, removing the parchment paper, and bake for 10 minutes more, or until golden brown.
step-12: top the crust with the pizza sauce and mozzarella cheese, then add your favorite toppings.
step-13: return the pizza to the oven and bake for another 5-10 minutes, or until cheese bubbling and slightly brown.
step-14: cut pizza into squares and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: set a wire rack over a baking sheet.
step-3: arrange the bread slices on the wire rack, then bake for 8 minutes, until slightly toasted.
step-4: heat the olive oil in a large cast-iron skillet over high heat.
step-5: add the onion and cook for 5 minutes, until softened.
step-6: add the red pepper and cook for 5 minutes, or until softened.
step-7: add the garlic, salt, pepper, cumin, paprika, cayenne, chili powder, and tomatoes.
step-8: stir occasionally for 15 minutes, or until thickened.
step-9: spoon the shakshuka sauce onto the bread.
step-10: spread evenly.
step-11: make a small well in the center of the sauce on each slice of bread.
step-12: carefully add an egg to each well.
step-13: season the eggs with salt and pepper.
step-14: bake for 20 minutes, or until the egg whites are set and the yolks are cooked to your liking.
step-15: sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve warm.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: in a large pot of boiling salted water, cook potatoes until just tender and parboiled, about 10-13 minutes.
step-3: stir in corn during the last 5 minutes of cooking time and drain well.
step-4: in a small bowl, combine butter, garlic, and old bay seasoning.
step-5: place potatoes, corn, shrimp and sausage in a single layer onto a greased baking sheet.
step-6: gently toss with the butter mixture.
step-7: bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the shrimp are opaque and corn is tender.
step-8: serve immediately with lemon wedges, and sprinkle with parsley.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚f).
step-2: place potatoes in a single layer onto one of a greased baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil, and season with salt, pepper, garlic, italian seasoning, and parmesan, gently tossing to combine.
step-3: bake for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown and crisp, tossing occasionally.
step-4: preheat oven to broil.
step-5: season steaks with salt and pepper, to taste, and place onto the opposite side of the prepared baking sheet in a single layer.
step-6: place into oven and broil until the steak is browned and charred at the edges, about 4-5 minutes per side for medium-rare, or until desired doneness.
step-7: serve immediately with garlic butter, and top with parsley.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200˚c).
step-2: prepare the vegetables.
step-3: place cherry tomatoes, carrots, yellow bell pepper, red onion, and asparagus evenly on a baking tray.
step-4: (try not to let the vegetables overlap too much, so that they roast properly.)
step-5: season with olive oil, salt, and pepper to taste.
step-6: add garlic cloves and sprigs of thyme on top of the vegetables.
step-7: bake vegetables for 15 minutes.
step-8: roast vegetables for 15 minutes.
step-9: bring back the tray and push vegetables to the side to make room for the steak.
step-10: place the steak in the middle of the pan and season both sides with salt and pepper.
step-11: top the steak with a sprig of thyme and a clove of garlic.
step-12: place back in oven for 10 more minutes or until desired doneness is reached.
step-13: allow the steak to rest for 5-10 minutes.
step-14: plate the vegetables and top with cut steak.

step-1: preheat the oven to 450°f (230°c).
step-2: lay the flank steak in the middle of a baking sheet.
step-3: arrange the bell peppers and red onion around it.
step-4: drizzle everything with olive oil and season with salt, pepper, chili powder, garlic powder, and cumin.
step-5: using your hands, rub the seasoning into the vegetables, then into the steak.
step-6: flip the steak and season the other side.
step-7: squeeze the lime juice over the top of the steak and veggies.
step-8: cook for 12 minutes, or until the meat has reached your desired doneness.
step-9: transfer the steak to a cutting board and let it rest for 10 minutes, then slice it into pieces, going against the grain.
step-10: fill up a warm tortilla with the steak, bell peppers, and onion.
step-11: garnish with cilantro, and serve.

step-1: on a lightly floured surface, roll out the puff pastry sheets to 9x12-inch (23x30-cm) rectangles.
step-2: set one pastry sheet aside and fold the other in half lengthwise, then in half crosswise twice, to form creases for 8 pockets.
step-3: unfold the pastry sheet on the prepared baking sheet.
step-4: make the strawberries ‘n’ cream filling: in a small bowl, combine the cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla, and mix until smooth.
step-5: make the very berry filling: in a small bowl, mash the raspberries, then add the blueberries, sugar, lemon juice, and lemon zest.
step-6: mix with a fork.
step-7: spoon the berry mixture over the center of 2 of the 8 rectangles.
step-8: use a spatula to spread the chocolate hazelnut spread over the center of 2 more rectangles, then top with the banana slices.
step-9: use a spatula to spread the cream cheese mixture in the center of 2 more rectangles, then top with the strawberries.
step-10: place apples slices in the center of the remaining 2 rectangles, then sprinkle with the brown sugar and cinnamon.
step-11: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-12: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-13: brush the egg wash over the pastry around the edges and between each filling, then top with the remaining puff pastry sheet.
step-14: use your fingers to press the pastry down around each filling.
step-15: once tightly pressed, use a pizza cutter or knife to cut out each pocket.
step-16: seal the outside edges with a fork.
step-17: poke the top of each pocket with a fork 3-4 times to ventilate.
step-18: brush the tops with egg wash.
step-19: bake for 25 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-20: make the glaze: in a medium bowl, combine the powdered sugar, milk, and vanilla.
step-21: stir until smooth and thick.
step-22: remove the pockets from the oven and let cool for 5 minutes.
step-23: decorate with the glaze, then serve immediately, or wrap in wax paper and freeze for up to a week.
step-24: reheat in the toaster oven.

step-1: preheat oven to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-2: place the rice in a sieve and rinse under cold water to remove excess starch.
step-3: transfer the rice to a small pot with salt and water and bring to a boil over high heat.
step-4: reduce to a simmer, put a lid on, and cook until water is absorbed, about 45 minutes.
step-5: in a bowl, add the skirt steak, red onion, bell pepper, lime juice, onion powder, chili powder, black pepper, and remaining salt and toss until well combined.
step-6: transfer to a parchment paper-lined sheet tray and bake for 12 to 15 minutes.
step-7: serve steak over rice and top with cilantro and lime wedges.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a bowl, add the pumpkin seeds, walnuts, almonds, cinnamon, maple syrup, and salt, and stir to combine.
step-3: transfer to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes.
step-4: let cool completely, then toss with cranberries.
step-5: store in an airtight container for up to 1 week.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: in a bowl, mix whole wheat flour and baking powder.
step-3: add in milk, applesauce, egg, and vanilla extract.
step-4: mix until well combined.
step-5: pour pancake mix on a greased baking sheet and evenly spread out.
step-6: add desired toppings onto the whole pan or place in different corners for a variety.
step-7: bake for 15 minutes.
step-8: cut into squares.
step-9: serve now or freeze for up to a month.

step-1: in a skillet over medium-high heat, add the ground beef, potatoes, tomatoes, and taco seasoning.
step-2: cook until the beef begins to brown.
step-3: then add the water, cover with a lid, and let simmer for 10 minutes.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-6: in a bowl, mix together parmesan, mozzarella, provolone, ricotta, italian seasoning, and salt.
step-7: set aside.
step-8: flour a clean working surface and place two sheets of puff pastry next to one another, slightly overlapping on the edge.
step-9: press overlapping edges together firmly and roll out with a rolling pin to match the size of an 18x13-inch (45x30-cm) sheet tray.
step-10: repeat with two more sheets of puff pastry and set aside under a slightly damp towel until you’re ready to start assembling.
step-11: to assemble, spray an 18x13-inch (45x30-cm) sheet tray with cooking spray and place one of the big pieces of puff pastry on the sheet.
step-12: press the dough into the corners.
step-13: divide the sheet tray into eight sections.
step-14: first, place half of the four-cheese mixture onto the dough and shape into a small rectangle that takes up about ⅛ of the sheet pan, leaving about half an inch from the edges of the corner of the pan.
step-15: repeat below with the rest of the four-cheese mixture.
step-16: next to the four-cheese pockets, make a rectangle with cheddar, followed by scrambled eggs, bacon, and more cheddar on top.
step-17: repeat for another egg, bacon, and cheese-flavored pocket.
step-18: then, sprinkle some mexican blend cheese in the shape of a rectangle, followed by the cooked taco meat, and topped with more mexican blend cheese.
step-19: repeat for another taco-flavored pocket.
step-20: lastly, spread some pizza sauce in a rectangle shape and top with mozzarella cheese, pepperoni, and a little more cheese on top.
step-21: repeat for another pizza-flavored pocket.
step-22: using a pastry brush, brush around each rectangle with egg wash.
step-23: cover the whole sheet pan with the other puff pastry sheet and press firmly down in between each rectangle to seal and form an isolated pocket.
step-24: once those feel secure, cut the dough into 8 rectangular pockets, and remove any excess dough from the sides.
step-25: using a fork, poke each pocket 4 times for ventilation and brush each pocket with egg wash.
step-26: bake for 28-30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the pockets have puffed up.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: line 2 baking sheets with reusable baking mats or parchment paper.
step-3: spread the cremini mushrooms in an even layer on 1 baking sheet and the shiitake mushrooms on the other.
step-4: drizzle ⅓ cup (80 ml) olive oil over the mushrooms, dividing evenly.
step-5: season with salt and pepper to taste.
step-6: toss well to coat evenly.
step-7: roast the mushrooms for 20-25 minutes, stirring halfway through, until crisp and tender.
step-8: remove from the oven and set aside.
step-9: leave the oven on.
step-10: meanwhile, make the dressing: in a small bowl, whisk together the mustard, honey, and lemon juice.
step-11: slowly drizzle in the remaining ½ cup (120 ml) olive oil, whisking constantly, until the dressing is emulsified and thickened.
step-12: season with salt to taste.
step-13: set aside.
step-14: scatter the peas, shallot, garlic, and lemon zest over the baking sheets with the mushrooms.
step-15: season with salt and pepper to taste.
step-16: return the baking sheets to the oven for 5 minutes, until the peas are warmed through and the shallots are softened.
step-17: sprinkle the roasted vegetables with parsley and set aside to cool slightly.
step-18: place the arugula in a large serving bowl.
step-19: add the vegetables and half of the dressing and toss well.
step-20: top with the shaved parmesan and serve with the remaining dressing on the side.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c) and line two baking sheets with parchment paper.
step-2: make the diy taco seasoning: mix the salt, pepper, cumin, garlic powder, and chili powder together in a small bowl.
step-3: add the flank steak to a baking sheet.
step-4: drizzle with 2 teaspoons of olive oil and rub to coat, then sprinkle with 2 teaspoons of the taco seasoning and rub to coat evenly.
step-5: to the other baking sheet, add the green bell pepper, mushrooms, red bell pepper, red onion, and broccoli.
step-6: drizzle with 1 tablespoon of olive oil and sprinkle with 2 teaspoons of taco seasoning.
step-7: toss to coat.
step-8: wrap the tortillas in foil, add to the baking sheet with veggies, and bake until the vegetables are browned and the steak is cooked to your liking, about 20 minutes.
step-9: let rest for 5 minutes, then thinly slice the steak against the grain.
step-10: make the lime crema: combine the greek yogurt, lime juice, and zest in a small bowl.
step-11: season with salt.
step-12: serve the roasted steak and vegetables with the lime crema and your family's favorite toppings to create a diy taco bar.
step-13: note: feel free to serve with your family’s favorite toppings to create a taco bar that’ll make everyone happy.
step-14: *vegan/vegetarian substitution: omit the steak and serve with 1 cup black beans for added protein.

step-1: make the polenta: bring salted water to boil in a medium pot over medium-high heat.
step-2: pour in the polenta and stir for 2 minutes.
step-3: reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes, stirring every 10 minutes to make sure the polenta isn’t sticking or burning.
step-4: right before serving, stir the milk, parmesan, and butter into the polenta.
step-5: season with salt and pepper to taste.
step-6: meanwhile, make the mushrooms: heat a drizzle of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
step-7: add the shallots and sweat until softened and slightly translucent, about 2 minutes
step-8: season with salt, then add the thyme leaves and mushrooms.
step-9: cook until the mushrooms are caramelized and softened, about 5 minutes.
step-10: pour in the sherry to deglaze the pan and stir to loosen any browned bits from the bottom.
step-11: cook off the alcohol, about 1 minute.
step-12: add the vegetable stock and season with salt and pepper.
step-13: bring to a boil, then let the liquid reduce for about 10 minutes.
step-14: remove from the heat.
step-15: make the gremolata: in a small bowl, combine the garlic, parsley, and lemon zest.
step-16: season with salt to taste.
step-17: divide the hot polenta between serving bowls and top with the mushrooms and gremolata.
step-18:
nutrition, all included

sodium: 1351 mg
total carbs: 42 grams
dietary fiber: 6 grams
sugars: 6 grams

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: on a cutting board, cut mushrooms into thin slices, about ⅛-inch (3 mm) thick.
step-3: spread on baking sheet and drizzle with, soy sauce, salt, pepper, and olive oil and mix until thoroughly coated.
step-4: spread shiitakes onto a single layer on a baking sheet.
step-5: bake 10 to 15 minutes, flipping after five minutes.
step-6: remove when crispy.
step-7: serve with your favorite dish.

step-1: season the steak with salt, pepper, and cumin.
step-2: heat 1 tablespoon of canola oil in a medium pot over medium-high heat.
step-3: add the steak and cook until browned, about 5-6 minutes.
step-4: remove the steak from the pot and set aside.
step-5: add the remaining tablespoon of oil to the pot, then add the onion and sauté until translucent, about 5-6 minutes.
step-6: add the garlic and ají amarillo, and sauté for 3 minutes, until fragrant.
step-7: return the steak to the pot, then add the water and bouillon.
step-8: mix to dissolve the bouillon powder.
step-9: add the potatoes and carrots.
step-10: bring the stew to a simmer, cover, and cook for 10 minutes, or until the potato and carrot are cooked through.
step-11: add the peas and peruvian corn.
step-12: cook for another 5 minutes, or until the peas and corn are cooked through.
step-13: serve the picante de carne with rice and sunny-side up eggs.
step-14: sprinkle chopped parsley on top.

step-1: pat the short ribs with paper towels to remove any excess moisture, then season generously with 2 teaspoons kosher salt and 2 teaspoons pepper.
step-2: add the olive oil to a dutch oven or large, heavy-bottomed pot and heat over high heat until shimmering.
step-3: add half the short ribs and sear on each side until deep brown, about 7 minutes total.
step-4: remove from the pan and set aside.
step-5: repeat with the remaining short ribs.
step-6: discard all but 1 tablespoon of rendered fat from the pot.
step-7: add the onion, carrot, garlic, 1 teaspoon of salt, and 1 teaspoon of pepper.
step-8: sauté over medium heat until the vegetables are softened, about 5 minutes.
step-9: add the tomato paste and sauté for a few more minutes, until darkened and thickened.
step-10: pour in the wine and use a wooden spoon to scrape any browned bits, or fond, from the bottom and sides of the pan.
step-11: reduce the liquid by half, about 15 minutes.
step-12: add the crushed tomatoes, beef stock, mustard, bay leaves, and thyme to the pot.
step-13: stir to combine.
step-14: add the short ribs, making sure the meat is submerged.
step-15: bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover.
step-16: simmer for about 2 hours, stirring occasionally.
step-17: add up to 1 cup (240 ml) of water as needed if the sauce gets too thick.
step-18: skim excess fat off the top as needed.
step-19: the short ribs are done when the meat pulls apart easily.
step-20: discard any bones that the meat has fallen off of, as well as the bay leaves and thyme stems.
step-21: transfer the short ribs to a cutting board.
step-22: pull out any remaining bones and discard.
step-23: using two forks, shred the meat, then return to the pot.
step-24: add salt and pepper to taste.
step-25: simmer for 15 minutes over low heat.
step-26: cook the pasta according to the package instructions.
step-27: plate the pasta in shallow bowls and ladle a scoop of ragù on top.
step-28: garnish with finely chopped parsley and freshly grated parmesan cheese.

step-1: preheat the oven to 180˚c (350˚f).
step-2: in a bowl, whisk together the butter and sugar until combined.
step-3: whisk in the egg, oil, and vanilla extract.
step-4: mix in the baking powder and 250 grams (2 cups) of the flour with a spoon until combined.
step-5: bring the mixture together using your hands to make a dough.
step-6: spray a 23 centimeter (9 inch) square baking tray with cooking oil.
step-7: spread out half of the dough on the tray.
step-8: prick the dough with a fork to prevent bubbles from forming while baking.
step-9: spread the blackcurrant jam on top.
step-10: with the remaining dough, mix in the remaining flour and rub with your fingers to make a crumb like texture.
step-11: sprinkle the crumbs on top of the jam.
step-12: bake for 20 minutes, until golden brown on top.
step-13: leave to cool for around 20 minutes, the jam will be hot!
step-14: sieve icing sugar on top.
step-15: cut into squares.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: let the beef tenderloin come to room temperature.
step-3: season with kosher salt and pepper on all sides.
step-4: add canola oil to a large pan on high heat.
step-5: once the oil is hot, add the tenderloin.
step-6: without moving the tenderloin, cook until a dark brown crust forms, about 3 minutes.
step-7: repeat searing on all sides, including the tenderloin ends.
step-8: remove the tenderloin from the pan and transfer to a cutting board or wire rack and remove ties.
step-9: brush the mustard on all sides of the meat while it’s still warm.
step-10: let the meat rest for while making the duxelle (mushrooms cooked and reduced until dry).
step-11: to the same pan, add the butter, mushrooms, minced shallot, and minced garlic over medium heat.
step-12: cook, stirring occasionally, until all the liquid evaporates and the mushroom mixture becomes a thick, dry-like paste.
step-13: remove the mushrooms from the pan and let cool completely.
step-14: place a large layer of overlapping sheets of plastic wrap on your work surface that is twice the length and width of the tenderloin.
step-15: lay overlapping strips of prosciutto on the plastic into an even square layer.
step-16: spread a layer of the mushrooms evenly over the prosciutto.
step-17: tightly and evenly wrap the tenderloin with the prosciutto, using the plastic wrap to wrap it even tighter and seal ends.
step-18: tie the ends of the plastic wrap together to hold the wellington’s shape.
step-19: place in the refrigerator for 15 minutes.
step-20: place a new layer of plastic wrap on the work surface and lay a sheet of puff pastry over it.
step-21: unwrap the prosciutto-wrapped beef tenderloin onto the puff pastry, wrapping until the ends meet.
step-22: cut off any extra puff pastry, making sure there is no overlap.
step-23: wrap the puff pastry in plastic wrap, tying the ends together to form a log shape.
step-24: place in the refrigerator for 15 minutes.
step-25: place the beef wellington on a greased, parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-26: brush the surface with the beaten eggs.
step-27: with a fork, score a decorative design onto the surface of the puff pastry.
step-28: decorate with additional pastry (optional).
step-29: sprinkle with kosher salt.
step-30: bake for 40 minutes or until the puff pastry is a dark golden brown and the internal temperature of the beef is 135°f (57°c) for medium-rare.

step-1: place chicken breasts inside the instant pot.
step-2: add the chili powder, ground cumin, pepper, and garlic and toss until the chicken is coated on both sides.
step-3: add the salsa.
step-4: seal the lid in place until you hear the beep.
step-5: tip: closing the lid can be tricky.
step-6: have the pressure knob at 11 o’clock and turn right.
step-7: press “poultry” and set time to 13 minutes.
step-8: set pressure knob to “sealing”.
step-9: steam will release and the screen will say “on” before it starts counting down.
step-10: once the timer goes off, carefully turn the pressure knob to “venting”.
step-11: let all of the stream release before opening the lid.
step-12: shred the chicken with two forks.
step-13: serve with tortillas, pico de gallo, guacamole, sour cream, or other desired toppings.

step-1: make the teriyaki sauce: in a liquid measuring cup or medium bowl, combine the brown sugar, soy sauce, lemon juice, sesame seeds, ginger, and garlic.
step-2: whisk to combine and dissolve the sugar.
step-3: butterfly the chicken breasts, then place in a high-walled baking dish.
step-4: pour the teriyaki sauce over the chicken, reserving ½ cup (120 ml) of the sauce.
step-5: cover the dish with plastic wrap and marinate the chicken in the refrigerator for 20 minutes.
step-6: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-7: line a baking sheet with foil.
step-8: make the dressing: while whisking, slowly drizzle the olive oil into the reserved teriyaki sauce.
step-9: transfer the marinated chicken breasts to the prepared baking sheet.
step-10: bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 160˚f (70˚c).
step-11: let cool for 10 minutes.
step-12: in a medium bowl, use 2 forks to shred the chicken.
step-13: pour ¼ cup (60 ml) dressing over the chicken and toss to coat.
step-14: prepare the salad: add the lettuce to a large bowl.
step-15: top with the mango, bell peppers, green beans, avocado, and shredded chicken.
step-16: add the remaining dressing and toss well.
step-17: divide between serving bowls and top with the scallions.

step-1: in a large frying pan, heat 2 tablespoons olive oil over medium-high heat.
step-2: add shrimp to the pan, then season with ½ teaspoon of salt and ½ teaspoon crushed red pepper.
step-3: cook until the shrimp is pink.
step-4: remove the shrimp from the pan and set aside.
step-5: in the same pan, heat 2 tablespoons olive oil and add asparagus.
step-6: add ginger and garlic, then season with ½ teaspoon of salt.
step-7: stir frequently and cook until the asparagus is tender-crisp.
step-8: return the shrimp to the pan, then add soy sauce.
step-9: stir until the ingredients are well combined.
step-10: just before the dish is ready, add lemon juice, stir once more, then serve while hot.

step-1: in a medium bowl, toss shrimp with salt, pepper, and juice from one lime.
step-2: sauté shrimp around 1-2 minutes each side, until the shrimp is pink and cooked through.
step-3: avoid overcrowding the pan, so you may need to sauté the shrimp in batches.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: place chopped lettuce, tomatoes, cilantro, and avocados, in a large salad bowl.
step-6: in a small bowl, mix olive oil, juice from 2 limes, honey, chili powder, salt and pepper to form the dressing.
step-7: toss salad with dressing.
step-8: add shrimp and toss.
step-9: add tortilla chips to the sides of the bowls.

step-1: heat the oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
step-2: toss in the shrimp and immediately season with the taco seasoning.
step-3: sauté the shrimp just until each piece has started to turn pink, about 2 minutes.
step-4: remove from heat.
step-5: in a large bowl, combine the lettuce, shrimp, tomatoes, jalpeño, red onion, cilantro, avocado, salt, and lime juice, and mix until the salad is well-combined.
step-6: serve with tortilla strips, if desired.

step-1: heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
step-2: add shrimp to skillet and season with chesapeake bay seasoning.
step-3: cook shrimp 3-4 minutes, or until opaque.
step-4: remove from skillet and set aside.
step-5: heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
step-6: add sausage to skillet.
step-7: cook until browned, turning links frequently.
step-8: reduce heat to medium-low and add water to skillet.
step-9: cover and simmer for 12 minutes.
step-10: remove from skillet and set aside.
step-11: add onions and bell peppers to the same skillet and cook for 2 minutes.
step-12: add chopped sausage, zucchini, corn, and carrot and cook for additional 2 minutes.
step-13: stir in shrimp and garlic.
step-14: pour chicken stock into pan and stir until well-incorporated.
step-15: add salt and pepper.
step-16: remove from heat.
step-17: top with parsley and serve over rice if desired.

step-1: preheat oven to 425ºf (220ºc).
step-2: lay the corn tortillas on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and lightly brush both sides with olive oil.
step-3: bake the tortillas for 5 minutes and then flip them over continue baking another 5 minutes.
step-4: the tostadas should be brown and crispy.
step-5: set the pan aside to cool.
step-6: roughly chop the shrimp and transfer to a bowl.
step-7: add the cucumber, tomato, avocado, red onion, lemon juice, lime juice, cilantro, salt, and serrano chile (optional), and stir to combine.
step-8: marinate for 10-15 minutes.
step-9: spoon the shrimp mixture onto the tostadas.

step-1: heat oil over medium heat in a large pot.
step-2: cook the garlic and the shrimp until the shrimp is pink, then remove the shrimp.
step-3: add the spinach, onions, salt, and pepper, cooking until the onions are translucent.
step-4: pour in the cream and bring to a boil.
step-5: add the fettuccine, stir until the pasta is evenly cooked.
step-6: mix in the cooked shrimp, bacon, parmesan, and parsley until the cheese is melted.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: butter each side of the tortillas and cut into even quarters, making 24 pieces.
step-3: place one piece in each cup of a muffin tin and push down so it creates a cup shape.
step-4: (make 2 batches or use 2 muffin tins to make the full amount of cups).
step-5: bake for 10-12 minutes or until crisp.
step-6: in a bowl, mix together shrimp, salt, pepper, cumin, paprika, chili powder, cayenne, garlic, and lime juice.
step-7: cook over medium high heat for 8 minutes, flipping halfway.
step-8: set aside.
step-9: in another bowl, combine diced avocado, tomato, red onion, jalapeno, cilantro, lime juice, salt, and pepper.
step-10: stir gently.
step-11: assemble the cups by placing a spoonful of the avocado salsa in the toasted cup.
step-12: place a piece of shrimp on top, followed by a dollop of sour cream.
step-13: serve with lime wedges.

step-1: make the dressing: add the egg, dijon mustard, anchovy fillets, and garlic to a blender.
step-2: blend for about 1 minute, until smooth and creamy.
step-3: with the blender running, slowly pour in the olive oil and blend until thick and emulsified.
step-4: season the dressing to taste with lemon juice, salt, and pepper, and quickly pulse to incorporate.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: the dressing can be made ahead.
step-7: store in the fridge in an airtight container for up to 4 days.
step-8: make the croutons: in a 3-quart (3 l) mixing bowl, combine the bread, olive oil, and italian seasoning.
step-9: toss to coat the bread cubes.
step-10: heat a medium pan over medium heat.
step-11: add the bread cubes, in batches if necessary to keep from overcrowding the pan.
step-12: toast, tossing occasionally, until crispy and golden brown, about 5 minutes.
step-13: remove from the pan and season with salt.
step-14: set aside.
step-15: the croutons can be made ahead.
step-16: store in an airtight container in a cool, dry place for up to 4 days.
step-17: make the shrimp: in a medium bowl, combine the shrimp, olive oil, garlic, lemon zest, salt, and pepper.
step-18: toss to coat the shrimp.
step-19: heat a medium skillet over medium-high heat.
step-20: working in batches, cook the shrimp for 2 minutes on each side, until pink and opaque.
step-21: remove from the pan.
step-22: thoroughly wash and dry the kale.
step-23: add to a large bowl and season with salt.
step-24: gently massage the kale to break down some of the fibrous texture.
step-25: toss with a bit of dressing to coat the leaves, then add more to taste.
step-26: add the croutons, shrimp, avocado, pomegranate seeds, and parmesan.
step-27: toss well.
step-28: divide between bowls and serve immediately.

step-1: roughly chop half of shrimp and finely chop the rest until it becomes a paste.
step-2: place the shrimp and tofu in a medium bowl and break up with a spatula.
step-3: add the mayonnaise, salt, and pepper.
step-4: mix well.
step-5: using your hands, form the shrimp mixture into 2 patties.
step-6: place the flour, eggs, and panko in 3 separate medium bowls.
step-7: dredge the shrimp patties in the flour, then egg, then panko bread crumbs.
step-8: heat the oil in a large pot until it reaches 350°f (180°c).
step-9: fry the shrimp patties until golden brown, then drain on paper towels.
step-10: line a ramekin with plastic wrap, and mold a quarter of the rice into a patty.
step-11: repeat with the remaining rice to make 4 "buns".
step-12: in a medium nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, heat a splash of sesame oil, then add the rice buns.
step-13: cook, flipping once, until the outside is crispy.
step-14: make the tartar sauce: in a small bowl, combine the boiled egg, mayonnaise, pickles, and onions.
step-15: assemble the burgers: start with the rice “bun,” then add the green leaf lettuce, shrimp katsu burger, a dollop of tartar sauce, and top with another rice “bun.”

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, drizzle the shrimp with oil, salt, pepper, and oregano.
step-3: toss until the shrimp are evenly coated.
step-4: transfer the shrimp to a roasting tray and spread into one even layer.
step-5: roast for 6 minutes, until the shrimp have just turned pink.
step-6: for the dressing, place the lime juice, water, avocado, greek yogurt, salt, and pepper in a blender and blend until smooth.
step-7: set aside.
step-8: in a large serving bowl, toss the romaine lettuce, cherry tomatoes, bell pepper, and shrimp until well combined.
step-9: transfer the salad to serving bowls and drizzle on the avocado dressing.

step-1: whisk the egg in a small bowl.
step-2: add 120 grams (1 cup) of flour and water.
step-3: whisk to combine.
step-4: cover with plastic wrap and transfer to the refrigerator.
step-5: add flour to a shallow dish.
step-6: dip each shrimp in the flour, shaking off any excess.
step-7: dip the floured shrimp into the batter.
step-8: heat oil in a pot to 350°f (180˚c).
step-9: fry the shrimp until they float to the top and become golden brown in color.
step-10: use a slotted spoon to transfer the shrimp to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.
step-11: for the mayonnaise sauce, combine mayonnaise, ketchup, honey, and vinegar.
step-12: line a ramekin with plastic wrap, and mold ¼ of the rice into a patty.
step-13: repeat until you have 6 rice “buns.”
step-14: heat a pan over medium-high heat and add a splash of sesame oil.
step-15: add the rice “buns” and cook until the outside is crispy, about 5 minutes.
step-16: top the rice "bun" with a piece of green leaf lettuce, fried shrimps, mayonnaise sauce, and top with another rice “bun.” repeat with remaining ingredients.

step-1: make the ethiopian salad: in a large bowl, combine the garlic, lemon juice, tomatoes, onion, and jalapeño.
step-2: season with salt, the olive oil, and pepper.
step-3: toss well.
step-4: add the lettuce and toss again.
step-5: make the siga tibs: heat a large nonstick pan over high heat.
step-6: add the steak and season with salt.
step-7: cook until nicely browned, or 7-8 minutes.
step-8: add the onion and cook for 2-3 minutes.
step-9: add the butter and let it melt, then add the jalapeño and sauté for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
step-10: remove the pan from the heat.
step-11: serve the salad and siga tibs with injera bread and your desired accompaniments.

step-1: make the tart dough: add the butter to a medium bowl and sift in the powdered sugar through a fine-mesh sieve.
step-2: using an electric hand mixer, beat until smooth
step-3: beat the egg and add half at a time to the butter mixture, beating well to incorporate between additions.
step-4: sift in the flour and cocoa powder, and add the salt.
step-5: using a rubber spatula, mix the dough until the cocoa powder is evenly distributed.
step-6: wrap the dough in plastic wrap
step-7: chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes, or overnight (if you chill the dough overnight, let it sit at room temperature for 15-30 minutes before rolling out).
step-8: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-9: grease a 9-inch (23-cm) tart pan and roll out the chilled dough to an 11-inch (28-cm) circle.
step-10: roll the dough around the rolling pin, then unroll the dough over the pan
step-11: press the dough against the bottom and sides of the pan, then use the rolling pin to roll over the top of the pan, cutting off any excess dough (re-roll any excess dough and bake into cookies, if desired).
step-12: press the dough gently against the pan once more.
step-13: using a folk, prick some holes in the bottom of the crust so it doesn’t puff up.
step-14: bake for 15 minutes, then remove the tart shell from the oven and reduce the temperature to 300˚f (150˚c)
step-15: make the filling: in a medium saucepan, heat the pan over high heat.
step-16: combine the water and butter, and bring to a boil.
step-17: add the instant coffee and stir until dissolved.
step-18: add the chocolate, sugar, and vanilla to a medium bowl and pour the hot butter mixture over.
step-19: whisk until the chocolate is melted and the mixture is glossy.
step-20: add the eggs and whisk well to combine.
step-21: pour the filling into the par-baked shell.
step-22: bake for 12-15 minutes, or until chocolate is mostly set but the center jiggles slightly.
step-23: cool the tart for at least 30 minutes, or until cool to touch.
step-24: garnish with raspberries and sift powdered sugar over the top.
step-25: slice and serve.

step-1: season the chicken with salt and pepper.
step-2: cut the chicken into thin strips then coat in the egg wash and flour.
step-3: shallow fry for a few minutes on each side, until golden brown.
step-4: add the peppers and fry for another couple of minutes.
step-5: remove the chicken and peppers and set aside.
step-6: in the same pan, add the garlic, red chilli, soy sauce, tomato purée, and water.
step-7: stir and simmer the mixture reduces and is thick and syrupy.
step-8: add back in the chicken and peppers and stir well in the sauce.
step-9: serve with rice.

step-1: combine water, olive oil, honey, salt, flour, yeast, and water in a large bowl.
step-2: mix well and knead for 10-15 minutes until the dough is elastic.
step-3: transfer the dough into a well-oiled bowl.
step-4: cover with a towel or plastic wrap and let rise once for 1 hour in a warm place, until the dough has doubled.
step-5: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-6: cut the dough into 8 portions and shape into balls.
step-7: place balls onto greased cast-iron pan and cover for 30 additional minutes with a towel or plastic wrap.
step-8: uncover and brush each with egg wash.
step-9: bake or 15-20 minutes, or until the tops are golden brown.

step-1: in a small saucepan, combine the water and honey.
step-2: bring to a boil over medium heat, and boil for about 3 minutes until slightly reduced.
step-3: remove the pan from the heat and let cool completely.
step-4: the simple honey syrup will keep in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 months.

step-1: to a glass filled with ice, add the seltzer water, lime juice, and simple syrup.
step-2: stir to combine.
step-3: garnish with lime wheels, if desired.
step-4:
nutrition:
calories: 40
sugars: 10 grams

step-1: in a food processor, combine the egg, mustard powder, and vinegar.
step-2: puree for 1 minute, until pale yellow.
step-3: with the processor running, very slowly start to add the oil, 1 tablespoon at a time.
step-4: once you’ve added half of the oil, add the rest in a slow, steady stream.
step-5: the mayonnaise should begin to thicken to the consistency of prepared mayo, or a bit looser.
step-6: add the lemon juice and salt and pulse to incorporate.
step-7: transfer to a clean, airtight container and store in the refrigerator.
step-8: the mayonnaise should keep for up to 1 week.

step-1: add the white vinegar and olive oil directly to mustard bottle, cover, and shake.
step-2: drizzle over salad.

step-1: cut the vegetables into the shapes of your choosing.
step-2: fill the jars with vegetables, leaving ½ inch (1 cm) of space at the top.
step-3: add spices of choice to the jars with the vegetables.
step-4: we like plain beets, cucumbers with mustard seeds and peppercorns, carrots with ginger and fennel seeds, and red onion with peppercorns.
step-5: in a medium pot over high heat, combine the water, vinegar, sugar, and salt.
step-6: stir until the sugar and salt dissolve.
step-7: bring to a boil.
step-8: once boiling, remove the brine from the heat and pour into the jars.
step-9: tap the jars against the counter to release any bubbles.
step-10: close the jars and allow to cool completely at room temperature.
step-11: refrigerate the jars for 48 hours before eating the pickles.
step-12: store for up to 1 week in a refrigerator.

step-1: in a bowl, whisk the eggs.
step-2: add salt and pepper to taste.
step-3: whisk to combine.
step-4: add the butter to a nonstick skillet over medium heat.
step-5: once the butter has melted and begins to bubble, turn the heat to low, and add the eggs.
step-6: using a spatula, gently push the eggs back and forth across the pan until they are cooked to your liking.

step-1: heat a large cast iron skillet over medium-low heat.
step-2: once the pan is hot, add the olive oil and swirl to coat the pan.
step-3: add the onion, bell pepper, salt, and pepper.
step-4: sauté 5 minutes, or until the onion is almost translucent.
step-5: add the cumin, paprika, and garlic.
step-6: sauté 2-3 minutes, or until the garlic is slightly brown.
step-7: pour in the crushed tomatoes and add the bay leaf.
step-8: simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the mixture has thickened.
step-9: stir in the baby kale until wilted.
step-10: reduce the heat to low, then carefully crack the eggs into the sauce.
step-11: cover and simmer until the egg whites are set, about 10-12 minutes.
step-12: top with the feta cheese and remove the pan from the heat.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: add the crushed tomatoes, butter, onion, and salt to a pot and bring to a simmer over medium heat.
step-3: lower the heat and cook for 45 minutes, until the onions are soft and starting to break apart.
step-4: remove onion.
step-5: in a bowl, mix the ground beef, ground pork, panko, parmesan, egg, garlic, onion, worcestershire, salt, pepper, and parsley until fully combined.
step-6: take a golf ball-sized handful of the meat mixture and roll it into a ball.
step-7: transfer to a baking sheet.
step-8: repeat with the remaining meat.
step-9: bake the meatballs for 16 minutes.
step-10: bring a pot of water to a boil, and cook the spaghetti according to the packaging instructions.
step-11: drain pasta and toss lightly in about a tablespoon of oil (optional).
step-12: pour the sauce over the pasta.
step-13: transfer the cooked meatballs and top with parmesan.

step-1: place potatoes into a large pot or dutch oven and cover with well-salted water.
step-2: bring to a boil, then reduce heat to a simmer, cover and let the potatoes cook until fork tender–about 12 minutes.
step-3: once cooked, drain the potatoes and set them aside.
step-4: return the pot to the stove and add 1 tablespoon of oil.
step-5: add onion and garlic and sauté over medium heat until onion is tender and starts to turn translucent, about 3-5 minutes.
step-6: add cumin, cayenne, curry powder, salt, pepper and ginger.
step-7: stir to combine before adding tomatoes, chickpeas, and peas.
step-8: increase heat to medium-high and stir in the coconut milk.
step-9: bring to a simmer before adding the potatoes back to the pot.
step-10: reduce heat to low and cook everything together for 3-5 minutes before serving.

step-1: preheat oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-2: debone, remove skin, and shred rotisserie chicken.
step-3: melt butter in a cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat.
step-4: add in the flour and stir until bubbling.
step-5: whisk in the milk until smooth, then add chicken, frozen peas and carrots, potato, and cream.
step-6: stir until fully mixed and bubbling.
step-7: drape pie crust over the top of the skillet and cut 4 venting holes in the center.
step-8: bake for 30-35 min, or until crust is golden brown.
step-9: carefully remove from the oven.

step-1: preheat your oven to 425°f/218°c, place your skillet in the oven.
step-2: beat eggs and buttermilk together in a bowl.
step-3: in a separate bowl, combine the rest of the ingredients, excluding the butter.
step-4: add wet ingredients to dry and combine until well incorporated.
step-5: take the hot skillet out of the oven and brown the butter.
step-6: pour the cornbread batter into the skillet.
step-7: smooth out.
step-8: transfer skillet back into the oven and bake for 20-25 minutes at 425°f/218°c.
step-9: slice and top with butter and honey.

step-1: in a large skillet over medium heat, sauté the onions in ¼ cup (60 ml) of olive oil, stirring often, for 15 minutes.
step-2: season with salt and pepper, reduce the heat to medium-low, and add the garlic and leek.
step-3: continue to cook, stirring often, until the onions are very golden and tender, 15 minutes.
step-4: stir in the asparagus and scallions and continue to sauté for 5 minutes.
step-5: stir in the peas and half of the lemon zest and cook 1 minute.
step-6: remove the pan from the heat, and set aside to cool completely.
step-7: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-8: in a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, ricotta, parmesan, and remaining lemon zest.
step-9: season with salt and pepper.
step-10: fold in the cooled vegetable mixture.
step-11: in a small bowl, whisk together the remaining 6 tablespoons of olive oil and the melted butter.
step-12: place one phyllo sheet on a work surface (make sure to cover the remaining phyllo sheets with a slightly damp paper towel to prevent them from drying out).
step-13: use a pastry brush to lightly brush the sheet with the oil-butter mixture.
step-14: top with another sheet and brush again.
step-15: repeat until you have 5 sheets stacked, finishing with the butter-oil mixture.
step-16: cut the stack of phyllo into four equal rectangles.
step-17: repeat the stacking and cutting with the remaining phyllo sheets.
step-18: brush eight 8-ounce (225 g) ramekins with the oil-butter mixture.
step-19: press a rectangle of phyllo into each of prepared ramekins (it’s okay if they break a bit), and divide the vegetable mixture among the prepared cups.
step-20: fold the edges over the filling, leaving the center slightly exposed.
step-21: brush lightly with the oil-butter mixture and sprinkle with flaky salt.
step-22: transfer the ramekins to a baking sheet and bake until the phyllo is golden brown and crisp, 30-35 minutes.

step-1: cut steak in half crosswise.
step-2: season with the salt and pepper.
step-3: heat the olive oil in a nonstick or stainless steel pan over medium heat for 1 minute.
step-4: add 1 portion of steak and cook until a golden brown crust has formed, 4-5 minutes per side.
step-5: transfer the seared steak to a plate and repeat with the remaining portion of steak.
step-6: if the pan is getting too dry, add a bit more olive oil.
step-7: let the steaks rest for 3 minutes.
step-8: after the steak has rested, transfer to a cutting board and pour any accumulated meat juices from the plate back into the pan and return to medium heat.
step-9: add the beef broth and scrape up any brown bits from the bottom of the pan.
step-10: add the mustard and butter and stir until combined.
step-11: stir in the capers and cook until the sauce thickens slightly, 1-2 minutes.
step-12: slice the steak into ¼-inch (6 mm) pieces and transfer to serving plates.
step-13: pour the sauce over the steak and serve with rice and broccoli.

step-1: prepare 2 boxes of brownie mix according to instructions on box.
step-2: pour into a greased 9x9-inch (23x23-cm) square pan.
step-3: bake according to instructions on box.
step-4: cut each tray of brownies into 25 small squares.
step-5: form each brownie square into a ball, rolling in palms until smooth.
step-6: in a microwave-safe bowl, add the white chocolate chips and microwave in 30 second intervals until smooth, about 1 minute and 30 seconds total.
step-7: in a microwave-safe bowl, add the milk chocolate chips and microwave in 30 second intervals until smooth, about 1 minute and 30 seconds total.
step-8: turn a plastic sandwich bag inside out and hold it from the inside with one hand.
step-9: spoon the milk chocolate into the bag.
step-10: turn the bag back out making sure chocolate does not fall out the opening.
step-11: seal it closed.
step-12: cut the corner of the bag, keeping in mind the more you cut off the larger your piping hole will be.
step-13: coat the brownie balls in the melted white chocolate using a fork.
step-14: place on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and chill until chocolate has hardened, about 20 minutes.
step-15: place one of the white chocolate brownie bites onto a clean surface.
step-16: using the milk chocolate piping bag draw 2 dots on the upper half of the brownie bite.
step-17: draw a “v” shape for the nose.
step-18: draw 2 wider “v” shapes on either side of the nose for the cheekbones.
step-19: connect those wider “v’s” with line for the mouth.
step-20: using tweezers evenly place 3 chocolate sprinkles on the mouth line for the teeth.

step-1: insert a cake pop stick through the top of an apple.
step-2: create a melting face by using melted white chocolate.
step-3: outline three circles on the side of your apple.
step-4: leave these circles unfilled.
step-5: create a dripping design around the apple by coating the apple with melted white chocolate.
step-6: use red gel frosting to garnish your apple and to create an oozing blood design.

step-1: cook the garlic in the sesame oil until garlic starts to brown slightly.
step-2: add the soy sauce and rice, mixing until the rice is evenly coated.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: beat the eggs with the salt in a medium bowl.
step-5: pour the egg mixture into a nonstick pan over low heat, and swirl the egg around the pan into a perfect circle.
step-6: cook on low heat until the egg is cooked through, then remove from heat.
step-7: mold the rice into 2 large oval shapes, the larger one for the body and smaller one for the head.
step-8: make the arms and legs by molding the rice into 4 small cylinder shapes.
step-9: make the ears by forming small half circles with the rice.
step-10: cut 2 circles from the cheese using a bottle cap.
step-11: slice one of the circles in half.
step-12: these will be the ears, and the full circle will be the nose.
step-13: slice a 1½-inch (4 cm) strip from the large egg circle, and roll that up for the pillow.
step-14: using scissors, cut 2 extremely short and thin strips from the seaweed for the eyes.
step-15: cut a small triangle for the nose.
step-16: to assemble, place the pillow on the edge of the plate, and plate the head on top at an angle.
step-17: place the body next to the head, followed by the 4 arms and legs.
step-18: place the two rice ears on the bear, then the two cheese ears on the rice ears.
step-19: place the cheese nose farther down on the face, then place the seaweed triangle in the middle of that.
step-20: carefully place the two “eyes” next to the nose.
step-21: lay the egg blanket over the sleeping bear, making sure to tuck him in afterwards!

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: using a hand mixer or standing mixer, beat butter until creamy.
step-3: add powdered sugar and beat until combined.
step-4: add the eggs, vanilla, and salt.
step-5: beat until well combined.
step-6: gradually, add the flour until dough is moist and holds together, but doesn’t stick to your hands.
step-7: place dough on a cutting board and form into a ball.
step-8: cut in half, then cover one half with plastic wrap and set aside.
step-9: divide the other half into 6 pieces.
step-10: the outer layers of the rainbow will need a little bit more dough, so make two of them slightly larger than the others.
step-11: dye the dough with food coloring by placing a ¼ teaspoon of dye on the ball of dough and kneading it until it is one solid color.
step-12: gloves optional but suggested.
step-13: starting with purple, roll the dough into a log about 6-8 inches (15-20 cm) long.
step-14: this will be the center of the rainbow.
step-15: next, roll out the blue dough with a rolling pin until it’s about ¼ inch (6 mm) thick, slightly longer than the purple, and wide enough to wrap around the purple dough.
step-16: repeat with the green, yellow, orange, and red doughs.
step-17: the further away from the purple you get, the wider the dough needs to be to go around the previous color, making the red dough the widest.
step-18: wrap the blue dough around the purple, pinching together any cracks that form, cutting off any excess dough.
step-19: repeat with the rest of the colors.
step-20: wrap in plastic wrap and chill for 30 minutes.
step-21: once chilled, remove the plastic wrap, and cut the dough in half to make 2 rainbow shapes.
step-22: set aside.
step-23: cut the reserved dough in half, roll out to ¼-inch (6 mm) thickness, and make it slightly longer than the rainbow log.
step-24: place the rainbow dough in the center and wrap the plain dough around it, again, pinching together any cracks and smoothing out the surface.
step-25: repeat with the other halves.
step-26: wrap with plastic wrap and chill for another 30 minutes.
step-27: once chilled, remove the plastic wrap.
step-28: slice cookies about ½-inch (1 cm) thick and place on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-29: bake for 20 minutes or until the bottom has browned slightly.
step-30: cool on a cooling rack.

step-1: heat 3 quarts (2.8 l) of oil in a large pot until it reaches 350°f (180°c).
step-2: set a wire rack over a baking sheet.
step-3: heat the remaining tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large cast-iron skillet over high heat.
step-4: add the ground beef, 1 teaspoon of salt, and 1 teaspoon of pepper, and cook for 10 minutes, or until browned.
step-5: remove the beef from the pan, leaving the drippings behind, and set aside.
step-6: in the same pan, cook the onion for 5 minutes, or until softened.
step-7: push the onions to one side of the pan, and add the green pepper to the other side.
step-8: cook for 5 minutes, or until softened.
step-9: return the ground beef to the pan.
step-10: add the remaining teaspoon of salt, remaining teaspoon of pepper, the oregano, brown sugar, garlic, worcestershire sauce, and ketchup, and stir to combine.
step-11: add the tomato sauce and stir well.
step-12: lay an egg roll wrapper on a clean surface.
step-13: brush a ½ inch (1 cm) border all around with egg wash.
step-14: place two tablespoon filling of sloppy joe filling in the center of the egg roll wrapper.
step-15: fold one corner of the wrapper over the filling.
step-16: fold the sides over the folded corner.
step-17: continue rolling to seal the egg roll.
step-18: repeat with the rest of the wrappers and filling.
step-19: fry the egg rolls, about 2 at a time, for about 2 minutes on each side, until evenly golden brown.
step-20: set the fried egg rolls on the wire rack to drain, and let cool for 10 minutes.
step-21: serve warm with cheese dip.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a saucepan over medium heat, add the ground beef and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
step-3: using a spoon, break up the meat and stir until browned.
step-4: add the onion and garlic and continue to cook until the onions are translucent.
step-5: add the ketchup, mustard, worcestershire, and brown sugar.
step-6: stir until the meat is fully cooked and sauce is evenly combined.
step-7: set aside.
step-8: cut the dinner rolls in half and place the bottom half in a baking pan.
step-9: top with meat and sprinkle with cheese.
step-10: place the top of the rolls back on top.
step-11: brush the rolls with melted butter and sprinkle with sesame seeds.
step-12: bake for 10 minutes, or until rolls are toasted and cheese is melted.
step-13: cut into individual sliders.

step-1: spray bottom of slow cooker with cooking spray.
step-2: peel and slice apples.
step-3: place them in the bottom of a slow cooker.
step-4: in a bowl, add the pancake mix, oats, brown sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, ground cloves, salt, and lemon juice, and stir to combine.
step-5: pour pancake and oat mixture over apples.
step-6: drizzle the melted butter over the top of the pancake and oat mixture.
step-7: cook on high for 2½ hours.
step-8: for a crispy top, crack the lid for the last 15-30 minutes of cooking.
step-9: serve with ice cream, if desired.

step-1: combine the apple pie filling, cake mix, and butter in the slow cooker
step-2: bake on high for 2 to 2.5 hours
step-3: server a la mode with vanilla ice cream or your favorite whipped cream.

step-1: peel and roughly dice the apples, removing the cores.
step-2: add the apples to a slow cooker with the water, salt, and cinnamon sticks, and stir to combine.
step-3: cover and cook on high for 4 hours or low for 8 hours, stirring halfway through.
step-4: uncover and remove the cinnamon sticks.
step-5: using an immersion blender, blend until your desired consistency is reached.
step-6: scoop out half of the applesauce and enjoy immediately or refrigerate in an airtight container for up to 10 days.
step-7: to the remaining applesauce, add the brown sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, and nutmeg, and stir to combine.
step-8: cover and cook for 3 hours on high or 6 hours on low, stirring halfway through.

step-1: pour olive oil and garlic in the bottom of a 6-qt slow cooker.
step-2: line the bottom with baby carrots, then place the chicken thighs over the carrots.
step-3: season the chicken thighs with salt, pepper, garlic powder, basil and vinegar.
step-4: top with sliced onion.
step-5: cover and cook on low heat for 8 hours or high for 4 hours.
step-6: add green beans during the last 30 minutes of cooking time.
step-7: sprinkle with fresh chopped parsley and serve immediately.

step-1: cut the beef into 6-8 large chunks.
