step-2: season all over with pepper and salt.
step-3: heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
step-4: sear the beef, in batches if necessary, on all sides, until browned.
step-5: transfer the seared meat to a slow cooker.
step-6: in a medium bowl, combine the chipotles, garlic, cumin, oregano, cloves, salt, pepper, beef broth, apple cider vinegar, and lime juice.
step-7: mix well.
step-8: pour the marinade over the beef in the slow cooker and add the bay leaves.
step-9: cover and cook on low for 8 hours, until the meat can be shredded easily.
step-10: remove and discard the bay leaves.
step-11: remove and shred the beef, then return to the slow cooker to marinate in the sauce for at least 10 more minutes, or until ready to serve.
step-12: to serve, add the shredded beef to your choice of tortillas with your favorite toppings.

step-1: lay out the ribs on a large baking tray.
step-2: season evenly with salt, pepper, garlic powder, paprika, and oregano.
step-3: rub in on all sides.
step-4: pour half the bbq sauce over the ribs and brush to evenly coat all sides.
step-5: transfer the ribs to a large slow cooker.
step-6: position the ribs so they are standing up, with the meatier side down, and so the meat side is against the walls of the slow cooker, with the bone sides facing in.
step-7: cover and cook on low for 7 - 8 hours, or high for 4 hours.
step-8: check after the allotted time, you want to make sure the meat is cooked through and tender, but you do not want it to be so tender it falls off the bone.
step-9: if they seem a little tough, allow to cook an additional 30 minutes, as needed.
step-10: remove the ribs and transfer to wire rack set over a foil-lined baking sheet.
step-11: paint the ribs with additional bbq sauce, ensuring they are well-coated on both sides.
step-12: broil high for 5-8 minutes to caramelize the sauce, making it slightly charred and bubbly.
step-13: remove and carefully cut between the bones to separate into individual ribs.
step-14: serve with additional bbq sauce, as needed.

step-1: season the spare ribs with the salt, pepper, and 5 spice.
step-2: place in the slow cooker, along with the garlic, ginger, onion, hoisin sauce, and chicken broth.
step-3: mix with your hands to combine.
step-4: cook on high for 3 hours, or low for 6 hours.
step-5: preheat the oven to 325°f (170°c).
step-6: once the ribs are cooked, carefully remove them and place onto a tin foil-lined baking tray.
step-7: to prepare the bbq sauce, take the remaining cooking juices from the slow cooker and pour into a frying pan set over a medium heat.
step-8: in a small bowl combine the water and corn flour, stir into the cooking juices.
step-9: add remaining bbq sauce ingredients and reduce until a sticky bbq sauce is achieved.
step-10: brush onto the ribs on both sides and bake for 15 minutes.
step-11: chop up the ribs and garnish with spring onion and red chili.
step-12: serve with rice.

step-1: in the insert of the crockpot, whisk together beef broth, soy sauce, sesame oil, minced garlic, and brown sugar.
step-2: place slices of beef in the liquid and toss to coat.
step-3: cover with lid and cook on low heat for 4 hours.
step-4: after 4 hours, whisk together cornstarch and water in small bowl.
step-5: pour into crock pot, add the broccoli and gently stir to combine.
step-6: cover with lid and cook 30 minutes to cook broccoli and thicken sauce.
step-7: serve with warm white rice.

step-1: in a small bowl, combine flour, salt, and pepper.
step-2: rub the flour mixture on the beef, making sure it is covered entirely.
step-3: heat oil in large skillet.
step-4: sear the meat on every side until golden brown.
step-5: transfer meat into slow cooker.
step-6: add onion, celery, carrot, garlic, tomatoes, wine, herbs, bay leaf, and salt.
step-7: cook on low for 8 hours.
step-8: serve it with your favorite side dish and sprinkle some freshly chopped parsley.

step-1: in a large bowl add your blueberries, brown sugar, cinnamon and cornstarch.
step-2: mix it together throughly.
step-3: quarter your pre-made biscuits and set aside.
step-4: in a slow cooker pour your blueberry mix and top evenly with your quartered biscuits.
step-5: cook on high for two and half to three hours.
step-6: server a la mode with vanilla ice cream or your favorite whipped cream.

step-1: combine all ingredients in a crockpot.
step-2: cook on high for 4 hours or low for 8 hours.
step-3: remove chicken and shred, then return to the crockpot for 10 minutes.

step-1: in a slow cooker, throw in all the ingredients and mix to combine.
step-2: place the lid on and cook on high for 4 hours.
step-3: serve with rice and fresh coriander.

step-1: chop squash in half and peel.
step-2: then chop into smaller sections and remove seeds.
step-3: place squash pieces, onion, and garlic into a slow cooker.
step-4: drizzle with olive oil and add vegetable broth.
step-5: sprinkle over ginger, cumin, coriander, paprika, cayenne, sea salt, and pepper.
step-6: place lid on slow cooker and cook on high heat for 4 hours.using a hand blender, blend the ingredients until smooth.
step-7: note: if you do not have a hand blender, you can transfer the ingredients to a regular blender or food processor, just be careful when blending hot liquids!.
step-8: add thyme and coconut milk and blend for a few more seconds until incorporated.
step-9: garnish with chives and pumpkin seeds (optional).

step-1: cut pork into 6 equal pieces.
step-2: add it to the slow cooker.
step-3: add salt, pepper, oregano, cumin, garlic, onion, bay leaves, lime juice and juice the orange.
step-4: add orange to the cooker as well.
step-5: mix together until the meat is well-coated.
step-6: cover and cook on low for 8-10 hours, or until the meat pulls apart easily.
step-7: remove the pork and transfer to a foil-lined baking sheet.
step-8: shred the pork and spread across the baking sheet in a single layer.
step-9: pour about 1 cup (235 ml) of the liquid remaining in the slow cooker over the shredded pork.
step-10: broil for 5-10 minutes until the meat browns and crisps along the edges.
step-11: serve immediately.
step-12: great as a filling in tacos, burritos, salads, or nachos!

step-1: in a medium bowl, toss the swiss and gruyère cheeses with the cornstarch.
step-2: smash the garlic clove, but leave it whole.
step-3: add the cheese, wine, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and pepper to the slow cooker.
step-4: cover, turn the slow cooker on high, and cook for 15 minutes.
step-5: remove the garlic and stir.
step-6: cover again and cook for 45 minutes more on high, stirring every 15 minutes, until the cheese is melted and smooth.
step-7: be careful not to overcook or the fondue will seize.
step-8: turn the slow cooker to warm and serve the fondue with your favorite items for dipping.

step-1: in your slow cooker add the cherry pie filling, cake mix, and butter.
step-2: cook on high for 2 hours or low for 4 hours.
step-3: server a la mode with vanilla ice cream or your favorite whipped cream.

step-1: place the chicken in a 7-quart (6 ½ liters) slow cooker.
step-2: sprinkle on salt & pepper.
step-3: add the veggies and condensed soup, and mix thoroughly.
step-4: cook on high for 3 hours.
step-5: rip biscuit dough into small pieces, and drop evenly over chicken.
step-6: cook an additional hour.

step-1: in a slow cooker, place half of the bell peppers and onion.
step-2: lay on the chicken, and coat both sides with taco seasoning, salt, and pepper.
step-3: sprinkle on garlic, half of the lime juice, and diced tomatoes.
step-4: cover with remaining peppers, onion, and lime juice.
step-5: cover and cook on high for 3 hours.
step-6: remove chicken from the slow cooker, shred, and return to slow cooker.
step-7: cover until heated through.
step-8: serve over brown rice with sour cream, guacamole, shredded cheese and cilantro.

step-1: add half of the sliced peppers and onions to your slow cooker.
step-2: layer the chicken and coat all sides with taco seasoning.
step-3: top with garlic, the juice from one lime, and tomatoes (be sure to drain).
step-4: add the remaining peppers and onions, cover and any remaining lime juice.
step-5: cook on high for 3-4 hours.
step-6: remove chicken and cut/shred into slices (chicken left longer will tend to shred more - cook to your preference).
step-7: return the sliced chicken to the slow cooker to marinate in the juices for about 10 more minutes (on low) until ready to serve.
step-8: note: if you find that there is too much liquid, you can remove till there is a desired amount before serving.
step-9: assemble fajitas to your liking - we recommend topping with cheese, sour cream, and guacamole!

step-1: in a small bowl, combine the cumin, oregano, paprika, chili powder, pepper, and salt and stir to combine.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: place the onion, corn, tomatoes, jalapeño, garlic, and lime juice in a large slow cooker.
step-4: place the chicken thighs on top of the veggies and season with half of the taco seasoning.
step-5: turn the chicken over and season with the remaining taco seasoning before mixing the chicken and veggies together so that everything is well combined.
step-6: cook on the high setting for 3 hours or the low setting for 6 hours, until the chicken is cooked through.
step-7: remove the chicken and slice into small diced pieces, then place them back in the slow cooker.
step-8: give the chicken and veggies a good mix and replace the lid.
step-9: cook the chicken mixture for another 10 minutes so the flavors can marry.
step-10: using tongs or a slotted spoon, place the chicken taco mixture on corn tortillas and top with your choice of toppings.

step-1: make the teriyaki marinade.
step-2: in a medium bowl, mix soy sauce, honey, onion, rice vinegar, ginger, garlic, and black pepper, and set aside.
step-3: in the slow cooker, add chicken and teriyaki marinade.
step-4: cook on high for 4 hours, or cook on low for 8 hours.
step-5: cut vegetables into bite-size pieces.
step-6: mix water into cornstarch and mix until cornstarch is melted.
step-7: add cornstarch slurry and vegetables into the slow cooker for 30 minutes.
step-8: serve by itself or in a bowl of brown rice.

step-1: place the chicken pieces in the slow cooker and coat well with the flour and salt.
step-2: throw in the garam masala, turmeric, paprika, onions, garlic, chillies, chopped tomatoes and tomato puree and mix together.
step-3: slow cook on high for 3 hours.
step-4: after 3 hours, stir in the plain yogurt.
step-5: serve with rice and top with chopped coriander.

step-1: add the chocolate chips, heavy cream, and salt to a slow cooker.
step-2: cover and cook on high for 30-45 minutes, stirring every 10 minutes, or until fully melted.
step-3: turn the slow cooker to warm and serve the fondue with your favorite items for dipping.

step-1: dice the onion.
step-2: cut the broccoli into florets.
step-3: dice the sweet potato.
step-4: add the water, broccoli, chickpeas, sweet potato, onion, quinoa, garlic, ginger, red pepper flakes, turmeric, tamari, salt, tomatoes, and coconut milk to a slow cooker.
step-5: stir to combine.
step-6: cover and cook for 4 hours on high or 8 hours on low, until the sweet potato is tender and the curry has thickened.
step-7: serve warm over rice.
step-8: garnish with parsley, if desired.

step-1: remove the stems from the collard greens, then stack the leaves on top of each other and roughly chop.
step-2: add the collard greens to a slow cooker with the onion, ham hocks, brown sugar, pepper, salt, apple cider vinegar, and chicken broth.
step-3: cover and cook on low for 8 hours or high for 4 hours, until the greens are tender.
step-4: remove the ham hocks from the slow cooker.
step-5: trim and discard any fat and bones.
step-6: roughly chop the meat and return to the greens.
step-7: toss to incorporate.
step-8: serve warm.

step-1: pour cranberry sauce and apple pie filling into a slow cooker and evenly spread across the bottom.
step-2: pour cake mix into slow cooker in an even layer over apples and cranberry.
step-3: slice stick of butter into 8 slices and evenly distribute over cake mix.
step-4: cover and cook on high for 2 ½ hours.
step-5: server a la mode with vanilla ice cream or your favorite whipped cream.

step-1: drain corn and pour into slow cooker.
step-2: add milk, sugar, and pepper.
step-3: stir until mixed.
step-4: without stirring- place the thinly sliced butter and cubed cream cheese on top.
step-5: cover and cook on high for 2-3 hours.
step-6: stir until butter and cream cheese are mixed in.
step-7: cover again for 15 minutes.
step-8: garnish with thyme and serve.

step-1: slice the red potatoes in half.
step-2: lay the potatoes and half of the onion in the bottom of the slow cooker.
step-3: cut onion in half and save for later.
step-4: in a bowl, mix butter, rosemary, thyme, salt, pepper, and garlic until well-combined.
step-5: stuff the chicken with the other half of the onion and lemon wedge.
step-6: rub the herb butter mixture all over the outside of the chicken.
step-7: place the chicken on top of the potatoes and onions in the slow cooker and place a sprig of thyme and rosemary on top.
step-8: cover and cook for 4 hours on high.
step-9: remove the chicken from the slow cooker and place on a baking sheet.
step-10: remove the lemon and onion from inside the chicken.
step-11: add the green beans to the slow cooker.
step-12: cover and cook for 20 minutes.
step-13: broil for 2-3 minutes or until the skin is golden brown.
step-14: let the chicken rest for 10 minutes before carving.

step-1: in a medium bowl, mix together the soy sauce, honey, garlic, ginger, red pepper, and black pepper.
step-2: place the chicken breasts directly on the bottom of the slow cooker, sprinkle with a bit of salt, and pour on the honey sauce.
step-3: cook the chicken for 1½ hours on high.
step-4: toss in the carrots, broccoli, and bell peppers.
step-5: using tongs, mix the chicken and veggies around the slow cooker so that everything is mixed and coated with the honey sauce.
step-6: cook on high for another 1½ hours.
step-7: remove the chicken from the slow cooker and place, skin-side up, on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-8: broil for 2-3 minutes, until the skin is golden and crispy.
step-9: (optional)
step-10: serve on plates with the veggies, chicken, and a spoonful of the leftover honey sauce.

step-1: mix the soy sauce, honey, rice wine vinegar, onion, garlic, pepper and ground ginger together in a small bowl and set aside.
step-2: oil the slow cooker and add the chicken breasts.
step-3: pour the sauce over the chicken, cover and cook on high for 3-4 hours.
step-4: remove and drain the chicken and set aside in a large bowl.
step-5: shred thoroughly with two forks.
step-6: transfer the leftover sauce into a saucepan and add water mixed with the cornflour.
step-7: reduce over a medium heat until thick.
step-8: add the chicken to the sauce and mix thoroughly.
step-9: serve over a bed of rice with spring onions and sesame seeds!

step-1: cut each piece of jackfruit in half, then transfer to a slow cooker.
step-2: add the onion, garlic, salt, pepper, oregano, chili powder, cumin, bay leaves, vegetable broth, orange juice, and lime juice.
step-3: mix to combine.
step-4: cover and cook on high for 3 hours or low for 6 hours.
step-5: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-6: line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-7: uncover the slow cooker and remove the bay leaves.
step-8: using 2 forks, shred the jackfruit until it resembles the consistency of pulled pork.
step-9: transfer the jackfruit to the prepared baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes, or until the edges are slightly crisp.
step-10: serve shredded jackfruit with tortillas, guacamole, black beans, corn salsa, and pico de gallo.
step-11: the jackfruit will keep in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.

step-1: place the chicken, salt, pepper, oregano, rosemary, and thyme into the slow cooker and mix together with your hands.
step-2: add the garlic, lemon, and water.
step-3: place the lid on and cook on high for 3 hours.
step-4: remove the chicken, lemon, and garlic, and stir in the chicken stock and cornflour mix.
step-5: stir until you reach your desired consistency for chicken gravy.
step-6: pour the gravy over the chicken and serve with vegetables.

step-1: add the potatoes, onions, chicken broth, salt and pepper to the slow cooker.
step-2: set it to low for 6 hours or high for 4 hours.
step-3: in a saucepan, combine the butter, flour, heavy cream and sour cream.
step-4: whisk until thickened.
step-5: when the slow cooker is done, pour in the thickened mix.
step-6: stir, cover and set the slow cooker to low for another 30 minutes.
step-7: serve with shredded cheese, bacon and chopped scallions.

step-1: place potatoes, butter, salt, pepper, and water in a large slow cooker.
step-2: cover and cook on high for 4 hours.
step-3: remove lid and mash the potatoes with a masher or beaters, mixing in the milk.
step-4: stir in chives
step-5: keep the slow cooker on “warm” setting while you serve them!

step-1: add all ingredients for the soup in the slow cooker and cook on low for 8 hours or high for 4 hours.
step-2: in the medium bowl, combine all ingredients for matzo balls.
step-3: mix well and refrigerate for 30 minutes to let the matzo absorb the liquid.
step-4: make matzo mixture into balls and set aside or in the fridge until the soup is done.
step-5: shred the chicken and place back into soup.
step-6: add the balls into the soup and cook for 30 minutes.
step-7: top it with dill or your choice of topping, as desired.

step-1: add raspberries, blueberries, strawberries, and blackberries into the bottom of the slow cooker.
step-2: sprinkle cornstarch on top and mix gently.
step-3: pour cake mix on top of the berries and spread out so it covers the berries.
step-4: place pieces of butter on top of the cake mix and cover.
step-5: cook on high for 2½ to 3 hours, until the cake is fully cooked.
step-6: serve topped with ice cream

step-1: place chicken, onion, garlic and spices into a 6-quart slow cooker.
step-2: using a set of tongs or a large spoon, mix the ingredients together.
step-3: once mixed, pour in chicken broth.
step-4: set slow cooker to high, cover and cook for 3 hours.
step-5: after 3 hours remove and shred the chicken into bite-sized pieces.
step-6: return shredded chicken to the slow cooker and add tomatoes, beans, heavy cream and cheese.
step-7: cover and set slow cooker to the low setting.
step-8: let soup cook for an additional 45 minutes.
step-9: ladle soup into bowl and top with favorite nacho toppings.
step-10: serve with tortilla chips.

step-1: in a small bowl, combine the salt, pepper, onion powder, cayenne, cumin, chili powder, and garlic powder.
step-2: rub the spice mix all over the baby back ribs.
step-3: drain the juice from the can of pineapple and add to the slow cooker, along with the barbecue sauce.
step-4: stir to combine.
step-5: add the diced pineapple and ribs to the slow cooker and cover with the sauce.
step-6: cover and cook on high for 4 hours.
step-7: halfway through, flip the racks of ribs so the one that was previously on the bottom is now on top.
step-8: cover with more sauce.
step-9: remove the ribs from the slow cooker and cut into individual pieces.
step-10: serve with the leftover sauce and pineapple chunks.

step-1: place the pork shoulder, seasoned salt, cumin, kidney beans, tomato, onion, and enchilada sauce in a 7-quart (6 ½ liters) slow cooker.
step-2: mix thoroughly.
step-3: cook on high for 3 hours.
step-4: dollop prepared cornbread evenly over mixture.
step-5: cook an additional hour.
step-6: serve and top with cheddar cheese if desired.

step-1: place the chuck roast in a 7-quart (6 ½ liters) slow cooker and season with salt and pepper.
step-2: sprinkle the onion soup pack and top with vegetables and water.
step-3: cook on low for 8 hours, or high for 4-5 hours.

step-1: in a slow cooker, add the potatoes, carrots, and onions to make a base for the meat.
step-2: lay the chuck roast on top of the veggies and season with salt and pepper on both sides.
step-3: wash your hands, because mess.
step-4: mix cornstarch and water until well combined and pour close to the edge so it gets down to the veggies.
step-5: pour worcestershire sauce directly on top of the meat.
step-6: cover with the slow-cooker lid and cook on high for 5 hours.
step-7: place the rosemary and thyme sprigs on top of the meat and cook for 1 more hour.
step-8: remove rosemary and thyme.
step-9: using a fork, shred the meat and serve by itself with the veggies, or on top of bread for a sandwich!
step-10: the juices from the bottom of the slow cooker make for an amazing dipping sauce!

step-1: place the chicken breasts in the bottom of the slow cooker.
step-2: cover the chicken with ketchup, apple cider vinegar, brown sugar, salt, pepper, paprika, cayenne, garlic powder, and worcestershire sauce.
step-3: mix well.
step-4: cover, and cook on high for 3 hours or on low for 6 hours.
step-5: in a large bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, apple cider vinegar, sugar, salt, and pepper.
step-6: add both kinds of cabbage and carrots to the bowl and gently toss with the dressing.
step-7: shred the chicken breasts with 2 forks in the slow cooker.
step-8: serve on a burger bun with slaw.
step-9: also great for bbq pulled chicken pizza, bbq pulled chicken nachos, and bbq pulled chicken mac ’n’ cheese.

step-1: combine bbq sauce, brown sugar, cider vinegar, oregano, worcestershire sauce, cayenne pepper, and chili powder in a small bowl.
step-2: salt and pepper the ribs.
step-3: place ribs in slow cooker, and cover in sauce.
step-4: cook low and slow for eight hours or high for four hours.
step-5: after the ribs are done, spoon the bbq sauce in the slow cooker over the ribs before removing.
step-6: cut the ribs, serve with bbq sauce.

step-1: combine 1 ½ teaspoons of dry active yeast, ½ cup (60 g) all-purpose flour, and ½ a cup (120ml) of warm water.
step-2: cover and set a warm place for 30 minutes.
step-3: then add 1 12 oz bottle of beer of your preference, 2 teaspoons salt, and roughly 4 cups of flour.
step-4: add the last cup of flour slowly to so that the dough dose not become dry.
step-5: work into a ball until all the ingredients are combined.
step-6: cover with a hot damp towel and set in a warm place for 2 hours.
step-7: use top round or top sirloin cuts of beef.
step-8: salt all sides generously.
step-9: sear on all sides in a very hot, heavy skillet.
step-10: if a pool of fat begins to form in the skillet, remove some so that the meat sears evenly.
step-11: place in a slow cooker on a bed of onion, carrot, and celery.
step-12: pour over with a cup of beef or vegetable stock.
step-13: cook 2 hours on high, or until internal temperature reaches 130°f (55°c).
step-14: scrape the dough down from the sides of the bowl and onto a flowered work surface.
step-15: pull the edges of the dough down underneath itself until a smooth loaf is formed.
step-16: sprinkle flour on top of the loaf.
step-17: next, sprinkle cornmeal onto a baking sheet and set the loaf on top.
step-18: sprinkle flour on top of the loaf.
step-19: cover with a dry towel for 30 minutes.
step-20: scar the top with a knife.
step-21: bake at 425°f (220°c) for 35 minutes.
step-22: place a pan of water on the rack below the dough in the oven.
step-23: cool to room temperature before cutting.
step-24: remove steak from slow cooker.
step-25: rest 20 minutes before slicing.
step-26: strain juices to use as a dip or stock in other cooking.
step-27: cool to room temperature before cutting.
step-28: thinly slice steak and place between pieces of sliced bread.
step-29: serve with juices from slow cooker on the side for dipping.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425ºf (220ºc).
step-2: trim the stems and cores from the tomatoes, then roughly chop.
step-3: remove the seeds and ribs from the bell pepper and slice.
step-4: peel and quarter the onion.
step-5: smash and peel the garlic cloves.
step-6: add everything to a baking sheet and drizzle with the olive oil.
step-7: season with salt and pepper.
step-8: roast for 30 minutes, until the vegetables are browned on the edges and fragrant.
step-9: transfer the roasted vegetables to a slow cooker.
step-10: add the oregano, thyme, tomato paste, and vegetable stock.
step-11: cover and cook on high for 2 hours.
step-12: using an immersion blender or a standing blender, puree the soup until creamy.
step-13: stack and roll the basil leaves, then thinly slice.
step-14: add some to the soup and stir to incorporate.
step-15: ladle the warm soup into bowls and garnish with more basil.

step-1: season chicken wings with salt and pepper.
step-2: spray your slow cooker pot with cooking spray, add chicken wings, bbq sauce and root beer.
step-3: cover, cook on low for 4 hours.
step-4: remove wings from slow cooker, place on parchment lined tray.
step-5: brush more bbq sauce onto wings, sprinkle on some brown sugar.
step-6: place under broiler for 8 -10 minutes.

step-1: in a large bowl, mix together the water and sugar.
step-2: sprinkle the yeast over the water and stir.
step-3: let sit for 15 minutes, until the surface is foamy.
step-4: add the salt, olive oil, and rosemary.
step-5: mix well.
step-6: slowly add the flour and mix with a wooden spoon until well combined.
step-7: knead the dough for at least 10 minutes, until it is no longer sticky.
step-8: set the dough in the middle of a piece of parchment paper large enough to line the slow cooker.
step-9: place the parchment paper with the dough in the slow cooker.
step-10: drape a kitchen towel over the top and cover with the lid.
step-11: set the slow cooker to warm and let the dough proof for about 30 minutes, until doubled in size.
step-12: check occasionally to make sure the dough is not cooking.
step-13: lift the parchment paper to remove the dough from the slow cooker.
step-14: sprinkle a bit of flour on a clean surface.
step-15: knead the dough for about 5 minutes, then shape it into a ball that will fit in the slow cooker.
step-16: place the dough back on the parchment paper and return to the slow cooker.
step-17: sprinkle the top with salt and rosemary.
step-18: cover the slow cooker with the towel and the lid and cook on high heat for 1½-2 hours, until the bread has a thick, dry, white crust, or a thermometer inserted in the loaf reaches 190°f (90°c).
step-19: preheat the oven to 500°f (260°c).
step-20: using the parchment paper, transfer the bread to a baking sheet.
step-21: trim the excess parchment.
step-22: bake for 5-10 minutes, until the crust is golden brown.
step-23: let cool for about 15 minutes, then slice.

step-1: in a bowl, mix bbq sauce, brown sugar, cayenne pepper, cumin, oregano, and ½ teaspoon of salt until well combined.
step-2: place bone-in short ribs in the bottom of a 6-quart (6 liters) slow cooker.
step-3: add the spice mix over the meat.
step-4: throw in the baby potatoes and add a pinch of salt, then add onion, garlic, and baby carrots.
step-5: cover and cook on low heat for 7-8 hours, or high for 3-4 hours.
step-6: add green beans during the last 30 minutes of cooking time.

step-1: add all ingredients to a slow cooker and stir until chicken and onions are coated with seasonings.
step-2: cook on high for 3-4 hours, or until chicken is cooked and shreddable.
step-3: with a set of tongs or two forks, shred the chicken and stir into the juices.
step-4: distribute evenly between slider buns.

step-1: in your slow cooker, mix the salsa, lime juice, taco seasoning, and cilantro.
step-2: salt and pepper the chicken to taste, then mix into the sauce.
step-3: cover and cook on high for four hours or low for seven to eight hours.
step-4: remove the chicken, shred with two forks, and return to the slow cooker and stir.
step-5: freeze leftovers in an airtight bag for up to six months!

step-1: slice the top sirloin steaks into half-inch (1 ¼ cm) thick strips.
step-2: place soy sauce, sesame oil, ginger, garlic, onion and meat in a large slow cooker and mix thoroughly.
step-3: place the lid on top.
step-4: set the slow cooker on the low setting for 3 hours.
step-5: remove the onions from the slow cooker.
step-6: pour in the brussels sprouts, bell pepper, and carrots.
step-7: mix thoroughly.
step-8: cook on low for 1 more hour.
step-9: serve with a portion of brown rice.

step-1: place onions, peppers, and whole flank steak in the slow cooker.
step-2: top with taco seasoning, garlic, lime, and diced tomatoes.
step-3: cover and cook on high for 4 hours or on low for 8 hours.
step-4: remove steak from the slow cooker.
step-5: optional: broil steak for 4-5 minutes until crisp for added texture.
step-6: slice steak across the grain into thin strips.
step-7: add the steak back into the slow cooker and combine with other ingredients.
step-8: plate with tortillas of your choice and garnish with cilantro and cotija (optional).

step-1: in a bowl, mix the rice, salt, pepper, corn, onion, beans, tomatoes, and salsa.
step-2: place the bell peppers hollowed side up into a 7-quart (6 ½ liters) slow cooker.
step-3: cut the bottoms of the peppers if needed to help them stand up better.
step-4: fill peppers halfway with rice mixture, then sprinkle on 1 cup of cheese.
step-5: fill to the top with rice mixture, and top with the remaining cheese.
step-6: pour chicken stock into the bottom of the slow cooker.
step-7: cook on high for 4 hours.

step-1: sear the chicken in batches in a few tablespoons of oil, seasoning with salt and pepper as you go.
step-2: transfer to the slow cooker and spoon over the thai green curry paste and drizzle over the soy sauce.
step-3: cook on high for 2.5 hours.
step-4: stir in the peppers, green beans, chilli, and coconut milk.
step-5: cook for a further 30 minutes.
step-6: serve over rice.

step-1: combine the ground turkey, onion, bell peppers, garlic, crushed tomatoes, black and pinto beans, corn, chili powder, pepper, and salt in the bowl of a slow cooker.
step-2: cook on low for 6-8 hours or high for 4 hours.
step-3: once the chili has cooked for 6-8 hours, make the dumplings: combine the eggs, melted butter, milk, and brown sugar in a large bowl.
step-4: add the flour, cornmeal, baking powder, and salt and stir until smooth.
step-5: fold in the cheese.
step-6: using a small ice cream scoop, dollop the batter on top of the chili and cook for 2 more hours on low or 1 hour on high, until the dumplings are puffed and tender.
step-7: if using, garnish the chili with jalapeño, cilantro, and green onions.

step-1: add the ingredients to a slow cooker.
step-2: set it to low for 8 hours or high for 4 hours.
step-3: serve while hot.

step-1: cut off both ends of the butternut squash and poke all over with a fork.
step-2: microwave on high for 3-4 minutes.
step-3: peel the skin off of the squash.
step-4: the skin should peel right off! once peeled, slice the squash in half lengthwise, scoop out seeds, and cut into 1-inch (2-cm) cubes.
step-5: you should have about 5 cups (1 kg).
step-6: in a slow cooker, combine the squash, onion, cashews, nutritional yeast, garlic, rosemary, nutmeg, olive oil, mustard, salt, and vegetable stock.
step-7: stir to combine.
step-8: cover and cook on high for 4 hours or low for 8 hours, until the vegetables are soft enough to be easily mashed with a fork.
step-9: transfer the squash mixture to a blender, or use an immersion blender, and puree for 5 minutes, until there are no chunks and the sauce develops a creamy texture.
step-10: pour the sauce over the macaroni and stir well.
step-11: serve garnished with parsley.

step-1: preheat the oven to 275ºf (140°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, combine 1 cup (235 ml) of the soy sauce with the sugar, garlic, and scallions, stirring until mixed.
step-3: score the skin of the pork by slicing a crosshatch pattern through the skin down to the meat.
step-4: this will help excess fat render out and allow more of the marinade to soak in.
step-5: place the pork in the marinade and toss to coat evenly.
step-6: marinate for one hour.
step-7: on a baking sheet, place the asparagus halves to the right and diced potatoes to the left.
step-8: toss the vegetables with the oil, salt, and pepper.
step-9: place the marinated pork in the middle of the baking sheet.
step-10: bake 1 to 1 ½ hours, depending on the weight of the pork.
step-11: raise the heat of the oven to 500ºf (260ºc).
step-12: in a small bowl, combine the brown sugar, honey, and remaining soy sauce, stirring until smooth.
step-13: spoon the honey glaze over the top of the pork, making sure to fill the cracks and crevices on top.
step-14: bake for 20 minutes until sugar is dark brown and caramelized, and the top of the pork is crispy.
step-15: remove the vegetables and pork from the tray, making sure to save all the juices.
step-16: slice the pork into ½-inch (2 ½ cm) slices, and plate with the roasted vegetables.
step-17: spoon the reserved pan juices on top of the pork.

step-1: using a meat mallet or rolling pin, smash the cucumbers, then slice into bite-size pieces and transfer to a large bowl.
step-2: add the red onion, salt, and sugar, and toss to combine.
step-3: in a small bowl, combine the soy sauce, rice vinegar, and sesame oil.
step-4: drizzle the dressing over the cucumbers, then toss to coat.
step-5: garnish with toasted sesame seeds and red pepper flakes.

step-1: scoop the avocado into a medium bowl.
step-2: season with salt and add the lemon juice.
step-3: mash until smooth.
step-4: spread the avocado on the slice of toast.
step-5: top with the smoked salmon, capers, and dill.

step-1: use a vegetable peeler to peel the cucumbers.
step-2: on a cutting board, cut and discard the ends.
step-3: then cut the cucumbers in half.
step-4: scoop out the seeds and discard.
step-5: in a small mixing bowl, combine the cream cheese, red onion, and dill, and mix until well incorporated.
step-6: spread the cream cheese mixture on both sides of the prepared cucumber, top with smoked salmon, and close the sandwich.

step-1: in a medium bowl, soak the wood chips in the water for 2-3 hours.
step-2: drain the chips and transfer to a medium cast iron pan.
step-3: place a piece of parchment paper over the wood chips.
step-4: season the salmon with old bay seasoning.
step-5: place the salmon on top of the parchment paper and cover the pan with aluminum foil.
step-6: cook over medium-high heat for 10-12 minutes, until an instant read thermometer inserted in the center of the fish reads 145˚f (63˚c).

step-1: spread cream cheese on the toast, and top with smoked salmon and red onions.
step-2: add a sprinkle of pepper (optional).

step-1: in a food processor, pulse the carrots until they reach your desired “rice” consistency.
step-2: in a large skillet over medium heat, heat oil, then add onions and let cook until translucent.
step-3: add carrot rice, salt, pepper, garlic powder and paprika, and cook until the tender, stirring occasionally.
step-4: garnish with parsley.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: place the graham crackers inside a plastic bag and use a rolling pin to finely crush the crackers.
step-3: pour most of the crackers into a bowl, reserving ¼ cup for later.
step-4: add the melted butter to a bowl with the graham crackers and mix until the texture of wet sand.
step-5: transfer the graham crackers onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, spreading into an even layer.
step-6: sprinkle 2 cups of mini marshmallows over the top of the graham cracker crumbs, then bake for 10 minutes.
step-7: pour the melted chocolate over the graham crackers and marshmallows, spreading evenly with a spatula.
step-8: top with remaining cup of marshmallows and reserved ¼ cup of crushed graham cracker crumbs.
step-9: drizzle with any remaining melted chocolate.
step-10: freeze for at least 1 hour.
step-11: remove the bark from the freezer and break it into pieces.

step-1: microwave ½ of the marshmallows and butter in a bowl, stirring every 15 seconds, until fully melted.
step-2: add cereal and graham crackers into the bowl and mix until well coated.
step-3: let the mixture cool to room temperature.
step-4: add the chopped chocolate bars and mix just until combined.
step-5: line a baking dish with parchment paper and pour the cooled mixture into the pan.
step-6: press into the edges of the pan and top with more chocolate pieces and remaining mini marshmallows.
step-7: cool in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours.
step-8: cut and serve.

step-1: sprinkle the mini marshmallows, chocolate, and graham cracker crumbs over the baked brownies.
step-2: broil in the oven for two minutes, or until the marshmallows are toasted.

step-1: combine cake mix, marshmallows, graham crackers, oil, and eggs in a mixing bowl.
step-2: using an ice cream scoop or your hand, form golf ball-sized balls of cookie dough and transfer to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-3: bake at 350°f (180°c) for 10-12 minutes.

step-1: in a freezer bag or food processor, crush the graham crackers to a sand-like consistency.
step-2: add the melted butter and stir until combined.
step-3: transfer to an 8x8-inch (20x20-cm) baking dish lined with parchment paper and firmly pack it down to form the “crust.” freeze until the cheesecake mixture is ready.
step-4: while the crust is freezing, combine the cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla extract, and mix until smooth.
step-5: spread the marshmallows out on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-6: broil the marshmallows for about 1-2 minutes, watching closely to make sure they don’t burn.
step-7: you want them to brown up a little though to achieve a “toasted” flavor.
step-8: carefully scrape the marshmallows from the sheet into the cheesecake mixture.
step-9: mix thoroughly.
step-10: transfer the toasted marshmallow cheesecake mixture into the baking dish on top of the crust and smooth until even.
step-11: freeze at least 1 to 2 hours until the mixture is firm enough to cut.
step-12: remove the set cheesecake from the dish and cut into even square shapes, depending on how big you want your pops.
step-13: dip each stick in melted white chocolate and place into each cut square, this will help secure the sticks into the cheescake.
step-14: freeze until solid, about one hour.
step-15: microwave the milk (or dark) chocolate in 15 to 30 second increments to melt, stirring thoroughly each time.
step-16: add coconut oil if the chocolate seems too thick for dipping.
step-17: dip the set pops into the chocolate and stand upright to set (a cardboard box or piece of styrofoam works best if you don’t have a stand).
step-18: decorate with the remaining white chocolate and crushed graham crackers.

step-1: preheat oven to 325°f (160°c).
step-2: combine the cookie dough, marshmallows, and graham crackers until evenly distributed.
step-3: using an ice cream scoop, place 6 scoops of dough on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-4: bake for 14 minutes.

step-1: note: this recipe contains higher dry ingredients to wet ingredients ratio, so macarons do not need to form a “shell” before baking into the oven.
step-2: preheat the oven to 300˚f (150˚c).
step-3: whisk the egg whites until they stick to the bowl.
step-4: add the sugar to the whipped egg whites and beat until stiff peaks form.
step-5: sift powdered sugar, almond meal, and graham crackers to the whipped egg whites.
step-6: gently fold ingredients together.
step-7: transfer the batter to a piping bag and pipe directly onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-8: bake for 20 minutes.
step-9: in a bowl, add the hot cream and chocolate chips and whisk to combine.
step-10: put the chocolate filling in a piping bag and refrigerate for 2 hours, until firm.
step-11: pipe filling onto the macaron shells.
step-12: place a marshmallow between two macaron shells, creating a sandwich.
step-13: gently place a skewer into the macarons, then lightly toast with a torch.
step-14: refrigerate macarons for another 2 hours before serving.

step-1: clean out an applesauce or snack pack container.
step-2: wash well.
step-3: for the celery and almond butter, fill the container with almond butter then fill a wide-mouth mason jar with the celery sticks.
step-4: secure the almond butter container on top of the mason jar and screw on the lid tightly.
step-5: for the yogurt, granola, and berries, fill one container with the berries then fill the other container with the granola.
step-6: then fill a wide-mouth mason jar with the greek yogurt.
step-7: place the berry container inside of the mason jar.
step-8: place the mason jar’s protective cap over the granola container then flip upside down onto the mason jar.
step-9: screw into place tightly.
step-10: for the vegetable sticks and hummus, fill the container with hummus then fill a wide-mouth mason jar with the vegetable sticks.
step-11: secure the hummus container inside of the mason jar and screw on the lid tightly.

step-1: combine cake mix, cinnamon, oil, and eggs in a mixing bowl.
step-2: using an ice cream scoop or your hand, form golf ball-sized balls of cookie dough and transfer to a bowl of cinnamon sugar.
step-3: cover dough ball in cinnamon sugar and transfer to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-4: bake at 350°f (180°c) for 10-12 minutes.

step-1: in a saucepan set over medium heat, warm the heavy cream, condensed milk and cinnamon, nutmeg and vanilla, and bring to a simmer.
step-2: place chocolate chips in a heat-proof bowl, and pour on top the top cream mixture.
step-3: allow to stand for 1 minute before stirring to combine.
step-4: using a cookie scoop, spoon the mixture into a silicone mini muffin pan.
step-5: garnish with cinnamon sticks.
step-6: allow to set at room temperature for 20 minutes.
step-7: insert a popsicle stick into the middle of each.
step-8: freeze for 2 hours, or refrigerate for 4 hours.
step-9: to serve, dissolve a stick into a mug of hot milk.

step-1: add plain greek yogurt.
step-2: add almond milk.
step-3: add chocolate protein powder.
step-4: add creamy peanut butter.
step-5: add unsweetened cocoa powder.
step-6: add sugar-free caramel syrup.
step-7: add ice (add more for thicker consistency).
step-8: process until well pureed.
step-9: feel free to top off the smoothie with peanuts, caramel syrup, and chocolate syrup to taste.

step-1: preheat oven to 325˚f (170˚c).
step-2: place the walnuts in a ziploc bag and use a rolling pin to crush them until crushed.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine crushed walnuts, flour, sugar, softened butter, vanilla and mix with a rubber spatula until well combined.
step-4: roll the dough into ping pong ball-sized spheres.
step-5: bake for 20-30 minutes, until the bottom of the cookies is slightly brown.
step-6: while the cookies are still warm, sift powdered sugar over the cookies.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: thaw the dinner rolls.
step-3: split 4 of them in half, and roll them into small balls.
step-4: place on a greased baking sheet, cover with a kitchen towel, and let rise while you make the dip.
step-5: in a medium bowl, combine the cream cheese, onion, ¾ cup (75 gram) of white cheddar, salt, and pepper.
step-6: spread the dip into a greased pie dish and sprinkle with the remaining ¼ cup (25 gram) of cheddar.
step-7: bake for 30 minutes.
step-8: remove the dip from the oven and top with the dinner rolls, larger ones on the outside, smaller ones on the inside.
step-9: decorate with pieces of tomato for the scarf, a piece of carrot for the nose, and peppercorns for the eyes and buttons.
step-10: make sure to push them in hard!
step-11: bake for an additional 20 minutes.

step-1: in a small saucepan over medium heat, bring the whiskey to a simmer.
step-2: turn off the heat, add the raisins, and set aside for at least 15 minutes to allow the raisins to plump.
step-3: drain and reserve the raisins and whiskey separately.
step-4: preheat the oven to 400°f (200˚c).
step-5: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-6: in a large bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and fine sea salt.
step-7: add the butter and use your hands to pinch together the butter and flour mixture until coarse crumbs form.
step-8: add the buttermilk to the mixture and mix just until a dough begins to form.
step-9: add the whiskey-soaked raisins and 1½ teaspoons of caraway seeds.
step-10: mix just to combine.
step-11: shape the dough into a 7-inch (18 cm) round.
step-12: use a pastry brush to brush the top of the round with buttermilk.
step-13: sprinkle with the remaining ½ teaspoon caraway seeds and flaky salt
step-14: cut the dough into 8 triangles and transfer to the parchment-lined baking sheet, spacing the scones 2 inches (5 cm) apart.
step-15: bake until golden, 20 to 25 minutes.
step-16: while the scones bake, make the whiskey butter: in a medium bowl, add the reserved whiskey to the butter, a little at a time, mixing after each addition until fully combined.
step-17: stir in the salt.
step-18: serve the scones warm or at room temperature with the whiskey butter alongside.

step-1: in a large saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
step-2: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the onion and cook until semi-translucent, 3-4 minutes.
step-3: use your hands to crumble the tofu into the pan, then use a spatula to continue to break apart while cooking for 3-4 minutes, until slightly browned.
step-4: add the soy sauce, chili powder, garlic powder, cumin, paprika, and cayenne.
step-5: continue to cook and break the tofu apart until browned and crumbly.
step-6: to assemble, spread brown rice on the bottom of a bowl, then layer on lettuce, black beans, corn, tofu sofritas, pico de gallo, guacamole, and onions.
step-7: serve topped with cilantro.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: make the xawaash: in a medium bowl, combine the cumin, coriander, turmeric, cardamom, black pepper, cloves, and nutmeg.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: heat a medium oven-safe pan over medium-high heat.
step-5: add the vegetable oil, onion, tomato, garlic, and cinnamon stick.
step-6: cook until the onions have softened slightly, 5-6 minutes.
step-7: season with salt, then add the vegetable stock cube and cilantro.
step-8: cook for 1 minute, breaking up the stock cube.
step-9: reduce the heat to medium, then stir in the xawaash and soaked rice.
step-10: cook for about 3 minutes so rice grains lightly toast.
step-11: pour in the hot water and increase the heat to high to bring to a boil.
step-12: cover the pot, transfer to the oven, and bake for 20 minutes.
step-13: check periodically to be sure the rice has enough water.
step-14: remove the cooked rice from the oven and drizzle the red and orange food colorings on top.
step-15: gently mix so there are different colored grains.
step-16: sprinkle the raisins over the hot rice, cover, and set aside.
step-17: to prepare the topping, mix the potatoes with the orange food coloring in a medium bowl (wear gloves to avoid stained fingers!).
step-18: heat about 1 inch ( 2 cm) of oil in a large heavy-bottomed saucepan.
step-19: add the potatoes and cook for 5-6 minutes, then transfer to a baking sheet lined with paper towels to drain the excess oil.
step-20: in the same oil, fry the onion slices until browned and crispy, 2-3 minutes.
step-21: add the red peppers cooking for an additional minute.
step-22: drain on paper towels.
step-23: to assemble the rice, transfer the pilaf to a large serving platter.
step-24: top with the fried potatoes, crispy onions, and red bell peppers.

step-1: bring water to a boil and remove from heat.
step-2: cut lemon and ginger into thin slices.
step-3: add to the hot water.
step-4: steep for 5-10 minutes.
step-5: strain and pour tea into mug.
step-6: add honey, stir, and serve.

step-1: crush the crisps in a zip top bag with a rolling pin, or just blend them for a few seconds in a food processor.
step-2: add to a small bowl and set aside.
step-3: in another small bowl, combine flour, paprika, onion salt, and chives.
step-4: in one more separate bowl, beat 2 eggs.
step-5: coat the string cheese in flour first, then egg, then crisps.
step-6: then go back into the egg, and again in the crisps for an extra crispy breading.
step-7: heat a skillet with a bit of oil in the bottom and cook mozzarella sticks for 3 to 5 minutes, turning occasionally to brown all sides.
step-8: sprinkle a pinch of salt and with more dried chives, and serve with sour cream dip!

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c)
step-2: cook the fusilli pasta according to box instructions.
step-3: this will make about 4½ cups (900g) of cooked pasta.
step-4: in a large bowl, mix together cooked pasta, corn, black beans, cooked chicken, alfredo sauce, and taco seasoning.
step-5: pour into a 9x13-inch (23x33 cm) baking pan and spread evenly around the pan.
step-6: sprinkle monterey jack and cheddar cheese over the top and cover with foil.
step-7: bake for 35 minutes, uncovering after 20 minutes to allow the cheese to brown.
step-8: garnish with cilantro.

step-1: preheat oven to 325°f (170°c).
step-2: cut off the ends of squash before cutting squash in half horizontally.
step-3: scoop out seeds and save for roasting.
step-4: drizzle squash with olive oil and sprinkle salt and pepper.
step-5: place cut-side up on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-6: bake for 40 minutes, or until tender.
step-7: in a medium saucepan, add vegetable stock and rice.
step-8: stir and bring to boil over high heat.
step-9: cover and simmer for 45 minutes.
step-10: remove saucepan from heat.
step-11: heat olive oil in a large saucepan or skillet over medium heat.
step-12: add onions, stirring frequently until translucent.
step-13: add garlic and cook until fragrant.
step-14: add bell pepper, salt, pepper, chili powder, cumin, paprika, onion powder, cayenne pepper, and dried oregano.
step-15: stir until spices are evenly distributed.
step-16: mix in black beans, corn, tomatoes, and cooked rice.
step-17: fill squash halves with rice mixture and sprinkle with cheese.
step-18: bake for 5 minutes, or until cheese is melted.
step-19: top with avocado slices and cilantro.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: carefully pierce potatoes with a fork.
step-3: on a baking sheet, oil the potatoes well and sprinkle with salt.
step-4: bake for about one hour.
step-5: if making more potatoes, an additional 15 minutes per potato is needed.
step-6: in a skillet over high heat, add the ground beef with a bit of oil.
step-7: add the taco seasoning, black beans, and tomatoes.
step-8: you may want to drain the ground beef mixture once cooked if there’s too much liquid.
step-9: once the potatoes are cooled, cut them vertically, scoop out the inside, and transfer to a bowl.
step-10: in the bowl with the scooped out potatoes, add the ground beef mixture and cheddar cheese.
step-11: mix well.
step-12: scoop the potato mixture back into the potatoes and top with cheddar cheese.
step-13: bake an additional 15 minutes until the cheese is melted.
step-14: serve warm with guacamole.

step-1: make the sauce: combine the sour cream, lime juice, cumin, paprika, salt, pepper, and cilantro in a mason jar.
step-2: stir with a fork until smooth and well-combined.
step-3: add the rice, black beans, corn, tomato, chicken, cheese, and cilantro.
step-4: store in the refrigerator for 2-3 days.
step-5: when ready to eat, shake well to combine.

step-1: mix salt, cumin, and chili powder in bowl.
step-2: season the chicken breasts.
step-3: in a large skillet, heat olive oil, then add chicken breasts.
step-4: cook roughly 7-8 minutes each side, remove from pan, then let sit for about 5 minutes before slicing into strips.
step-5: the juices should run clear and the chicken shouldn’t be pink in the center.
step-6: cut the chicken into slices.
step-7: in a large bowl, add lettuce, bell pepper, tomatoes, black beans, corn, and chicken.
step-8: toss until everything is mixed.
step-9: add avocados, then toss once more.
step-10: be careful to not overwork the avocados.
step-11: serve in bowl.
step-12: add the avocado dressing ingredients to a blender and process until smooth.
step-13: add 3 - 6 tablespoons of water for desired thickness.
step-14: the dressing can be stored in an airtight container and kept refrigerated for 1-2 weeks.
step-15: toss the salad with the desired amount of dressing and serve.

step-1: heat oil in a pan over high heat.
step-2: cook the ham, peppers, and spinach with a pinch of salt and pepper until the spinach has wilted.
step-3: transfer to a bowl.
step-4: whisk the 4 eggs with a pinch of salt & pepper, then pour half of the mixture into the pan, swirling it around to make a full circle.
step-5: lower to a medium heat.
step-6: cook for about 15 seconds, then spoon half of the veggie mixture on one half of the omelette and sprinkle half of the jack and half the cheddar cheese on the other half.
step-7: cook until the cheese is half melted, then fold one half of the omelette over the other.
step-8: cook for another 15 seconds, then remove and transfer to a plate.
step-9: fan out half of the avocado slices on top of the omelette, then repeat with the other omelette.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium heat.
step-3: once the oil is shimmering, add the garlic, ½ of the onion red onion, salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes, and cook until the onion is softened, about 3 minutes.
step-4: add the crushed tomatoes and stir, bringing the mixture to a simmer.
step-5: crack the eggs directly into the tomato mixture, and transfer to the oven.
step-6: bake until eggs are set, about 11 minutes.
step-7: top with avocado, cherry tomatoes, cilantro, and remaining red onion.

step-1: in a food processor, combine the avocado, lime juice, garlic, salt, and water.
step-2: pulse until smooth, then transfer to a large mason jar.
step-3: add the bell pepper, corn, cherry tomatoes, quinoa, black beans, and spinach and screw on the lid.
step-4: store in the refrigerator until ready to eat, up to 5 days.
step-5: give the mason jar a good shake to mix and use a fork or spoon to stir as needed.

step-1: add all dressing ingredients to a blender, blend until smooth.
step-2: in a large bowl add lettuce, peppers, cilantro, beans, onion, corn, green onion, and tomatoes.
step-3: top with prepared dressing; toss to coat.

step-1: in a frying pan, combine oil, garlic, and jalepeño cook for about 2 minutes.
step-2: add the black beans, corn, tomatoes, quinoa, vegetable stock, chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper.
step-3: mix and cover.
step-4: cook for 15-20 minutes.
step-5: top mixture with avocado and lime juice, then garnish with cilantro.

step-1: cut sweet potato into thin slices, about ¼ inch (6 mm) thick.
step-2: place in toaster and set it to the maximum cook time.
step-3: when it pops, flip the sweet potato slices over and toast 1 more time.
step-4: depending on the strength of your toaster and your preferences, you may need to toast it 1 more time after that.
step-5: remove from toaster and let cool enough to handle.
step-6: mash half an avocado.
step-7: add salt and pepper, to taste.
step-8: mix until well combined.
step-9: spread the mashed avocado evenly across sweet potato toast and top with corn salsa.
step-10: drizzle with hot sauce.

step-1: to make the avocado cilantro lime salad dressing, combine all the ingredients for the dressing (avocado, cilantro, lime juice, greek yogurt, water, salt, garlic, and cumin) in a blender or food processor until smooth.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: pour 1 tbsp of oil into a pan and bring up to medium heat.
step-4: add the diced chicken breast and taco seasoning, stirring until all pieces are well-coated with the seasoning.
step-5: cook through and set aside.
step-6: assemble your salad with a bed of chopped romaine lettuce on the bottom.
step-7: then, lay out each topping (chicken, cheddar jack cheese, black beans, avocado, corn, cherry tomatoes, and tortilla strips) in rows or blend it all together.
step-8: top off with the avocado salad dressing and cilantro then serve immediately.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: cut the head of cauliflower in half, remove the stem, and chop into small pieces.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: heat the oil in a large cast-iron skillet over medium heat.
step-5: add the garlic and onion and cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
step-6: add the corn, carrots, black beans, and 2 cups (600 g) of cauliflower and cook, stirring often, for another 3 minutes, until the corn starts to brown around the edges.
step-7: add the flour, chili powder, and salt and stir until the vegetables are evenly coated.
step-8: add the milk and diced tomatoes and cook, stirring constantly, until thickened, about 3 minutes.
step-9: add the mozzarella cheese and stir until melted.
step-10: turn off the heat and arrange the tater tots on top of the vegetable mixture.
step-11: transfer to the oven and bake until browned and bubbling, about 30 minutes.
step-12: garnish the casserole with tomato, red onion, jalapeño, and cilantro, if using.

step-1: generously season the short ribs all over with salt and pepper.
step-2: let sit at room temperature while you prepare the rest of the ingredients.
step-3: add the dried shiitake mushrooms to a large heatproof bowl and pour in enough boiling water to cover.
step-4: cover with plastic wrap and let soak for 1 hour.
step-5: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-6: heat the canola oil in a large dutch oven over medium-high heat until almost smoking.
step-7: working in 2 batches, sear the short ribs on all sides until deeply browned and crispy, about 10 minutes total.
step-8: remove the ribs from the pot and transfer to a plate.
step-9: to pan with excess oil and beef fat, add the onion, asian pear, ginger, scallions, and garlic, then cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until softened and slightly browned, about 10 minutes.
step-10: add the rice wine and stir to scrape up any browned bits from the bottom of the pot.
step-11: add the drained shiitake mushrooms, 1 cup (240 ml) of the shiitake soaking liquid, the sugar, light and dark soy sauces, gochujang, mirin, and sesame oil.
step-12: stir and bring to a boil.
step-13: nestle the short ribs back into the sauce, cover, and braise in the oven for 3 hours, or until the short ribs are tender enough to fall off the bone.
step-14: serve the short ribs over rice with the braising liquid spooned on top.
step-15: top with kimchi, sliced scallions, and toasted sesame seeds.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: set a wire rack over a baking sheet and grease with nonstick spray.
step-3: make the marinara sauce: heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
step-4: add the onions and garlic and season with salt, pepper, and the red pepper flakes.
step-5: cook until soft and caramelized, about 15 minutes.
step-6: set aside ⅓ cup (50 g) of the cooked onions and garlic for the meatballs and let cool.
step-7: stir the tomato paste into the onions and cook until browned and aromatic, 3-5 minutes.
step-8: add the crushed tomatoes, dried basil, dried oregano, and dried parsley.
step-9: stir together and bring to a boil.
step-10: reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for at least 30 minutes.
step-11: make the meatballs: in a large bowl, combine the ground beef, ground pork, reserved onion and garlic mixture, bread crumbs, ricotta, parsley, eggs, parmesan, milk, salt, and pepper.
step-12: mix with your hands until well combined.
step-13: shape about 2 (55 g) ounces of meat at a time into balls and set on the prepared wire rack.
step-14: bake the meatballs for 20 minutes, until the outsides are browned and the centers are tender and juicy and reach about 155˚f (68˚c).
step-15: bring a large pot of water to boil and add a generous pinch of salt.
step-16: cook the pasta according to the package instructions, 7-10 minutes, until al dente.
step-17: stir occasionally to keep the noodles from sticking together.
step-18: drain the pasta and add it directly to the simmering marinara sauce.
step-19: reserve some pasta water, in case you need it to loosen the sauce.
step-20: stir the pasta into the sauce until fully coated.
step-21: add the pasta to serving bowls, top with the meatballs, and garnish with parmesan, fresh basil, and cracked pepper.

step-1: thaw the ice cream at room temperature until it is soft to the touch, about 20 minutes, so it will pass through the ricer easily.
step-2: over a baking sheet lined with parchment paper, fill the potato ricer with ice cream and press it through, so the ice cream forms “spaghetti”-like noodle piles.
step-3: freeze until firm, at least 45 minutes.
step-4: transfer the “spaghetti” to a serving plate.
step-5: carefully spoon over the strawberry sundae topping to mimic marinara sauce, and top with the brownie bite “meatballs,” if using.
step-6: grate white chocolate over the top to mimic parmesan cheese.

step-1: in a large pot over medium heat, mix the onion, garlic, and red pepper flakes.
step-2: cook until the onions start begin to soften, about 3 minutes.
step-3: remove half of the onion/garlic mixture and place in a small bowl to cool.
step-4: set aside or refrigerate to cool completely.
step-5: to the pot with the remaining onions/garlic, add the tomato paste.
step-6: cook the tomato paste, about 2-3 minutes, stirring frequently, to caramelize the natural sugars in the paste.
step-7: add red wine and canned tomatoes to the pot.
step-8: cook wine and tomatoes, stirring constantly, and scraping the bottom of the pan to make sure nothing burns, until the mixture comes to a low simmer.
step-9: break apart the whole tomatoes using a wooden spoon or squeezing with tongs.
step-10: continue to cook over medium-high heat for about 5 minutes to give the alcohol in the wine a chance to evaporate.
step-11: add salt and pepper to taste.
step-12: reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring occasionally, for about 20 minutes longer.
step-13: in a medium sized mixing bowl, stir the ricotta with the reserved (and cooled) onion-garlic mixture.
step-14: add the ground pork, ground beef, basil, oregano, sage, rosemary, parsley, salt, and pepper.
step-15: gently mix together first with a spoon then going in with your hands.
step-16: shape the meat into ping-pong-sized balls and place on parchment lined baking sheet.
step-17: place the meatballs in the fridge if you will not be cooking immediately or if they have warmed from handling (they will keep their shape better if kept cold before cooking!).
step-18: heat oil in a large saute pan over medium-high heat.
step-19: working in batches, sear the meatballs lightly on all sides until they begin to brown.
step-20: they will not be fully cooked at this point.
step-21: transfer the seared meatballs (and any accumulated juices) to the marinara sauce.
step-22: remove the bone marrow from the bone.
step-23: add to the meatballs and marinara sauce.
step-24: cover and let simmer for an additional 20 minutes to finish cooking the meatballs and allow the bone marrow to render its fat.
step-25: add cooked spaghetti to the finished sauce and toss to coat.
step-26: serve garnished with toasted breadcrumbs and grated parmesan cheese.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: wrap pasta in a clean dish towel and fold twice, breaking pasta into smaller 1-3 inch (2½ - 7½ cm) pieces.
step-3: cook until al dente (about 3 minutes) and drain well.
step-4: in medium-sized bowl, mix warm cooked pasta with garlic, butter, grated parmesan, egg, and bread crumbs.
step-5: still until well incorporated and the butter and cheese have completely melted.
step-6: press pasta mixture into a deep 10-inch (25-cm) pie plate or casserole dish.
step-7: top with bread crumbs.
step-8: bake 15-20 minutes, until crust is set and edges have started to brown
step-9: heat oil over medium heat in a large skillet.
step-10: add onions and cook until softened, about 3 minutes.
step-11: add in ground beef and cook until lightly browned.
step-12: using a spoon, drain off any excess fat that accumulates in the pan.
step-13: stir in tomato sauce, tomato paste, and sugar.
step-14: simmer until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes.
step-15: remove from heat and mix in basil.
step-16: season with salt and pepper.
step-17: in a small bowl, mix together ricotta, egg, and oregano.
step-18: spread ricotta mixture over the cooked pasta crust.
step-19: spread the meat sauce over the top of the ricotta mixture then cover with mozzarella.
step-20: bake at 350˚f (180˚c) for 25 minutes or until golden brown on top.
step-21: let cool for 15-20 minutes before serving.
step-22: fancy-pants parmesan crisps (optional for garnish): pour a tablespoon of parmesan cheese onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-23: bake at 400˚f (200˚c) until cheese has melted and become golden and crisp, about 5 minutes.
step-24: let cool before removing from parchment paper.

step-1: preheat oven to 375ºf (190ºc).
step-2: combine eggplant, onion, garlic, oil, salt, pepper, and oregano on a baking sheet.
step-3: bake for 30 minutes, mixing halfway.
step-4: in the bowl of a food processor, combine eggplant mixture, basil, parsley, parmesan, bread crumbs, ricotta, oregano, and egg, and blend until smooth.
step-5: roll the mixture into golf ball-sized balls.
step-6: transfer to a cast iron pan spacing them about 2 inches apart from each other.
step-7: bake for 20 minutes.
step-8: on a baking sheet, cover spaghetti squash with oil, salt, and pepper, add to oven and bake for 40 minutes.
step-9: remove meatballs, add marinara sauce, and return to oven for 10 minutes.
step-10: remove spaghetti squash from the oven and with a fork pull at the edges to produce that stringy “spaghetti” quality.
step-11: on a plate combine spaghetti with meatballs and garnish with parmesan and basil.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f/200°c.
step-2: use a fork to pierce holes down the side of the spaghetti squash.
step-3: microwave for 5 minutes.
step-4: when the squash is cool enough to touch (5-10 minutes), slice the squash open, length-wise, with a sharp knife.
step-5: scoop out the seeds and drizzle the squash with oil.
step-6: season with salt and pepper.
step-7: roast the squash cut-side down for 40 minutes, until easily pierced with a knife.
step-8: in a large bowl, gently mix together the ground turkey, onion, parsley, parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper.
step-9: form meatballs, and transfer to a greased baking sheet.
step-10: bake in the oven at 400°f/200°c for 20 minutes, until fully cooked.
step-11: using a fork, pull the strands from the cooled spaghetti squash and transfer to serving dish.
step-12: top with hot marinara sauce, and a sprinkle of chopped parsley.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: using a fork, poke holes lengthwise around the center of the spaghetti squash.
step-4: microwave for 2 minutes.
step-5: cut the ends off of the squash, then slice in half lengthwise.
step-6: remove the seeds and pulp.
step-7: place half of the squash flesh-side down in a microwave-safe dish with high sides.
step-8: pour ½ cup (120 ml) of water over the top of the squash and microwave on high for 3 minutes, or when a fork easily pulls the squash away from the skin in long strands that look like spaghetti.
step-9: repeat with second half— there will still be water left over from the first half.
step-10: cool the squash until it can be safely handled, about 10 minutes.
step-11: use a fork to remove all of the squash from the skin, breaking it up into small strands.
step-12: you should have approximately 4 cups of squash (820 g).
step-13: transfer to a medium bowl and stir in the parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper.
step-14: divide the squash into 4 1-cup (205 g each cup) (2 portions and place on the prepared baking sheet.
step-15: shape into nests, creating a well large enough to fit an egg in the center of each.
step-16: bake for 10 minutes, until the squash is starting to brown.
step-17: remove from the oven and let cool for 5 minutes.
step-18: crack the eggs into a small bowl, 1 at a time, then pour into the wells of the squash nests.
step-19: season with salt and pepper.
step-20: bake for 12-15 minutes, depending on your preferred doneness for the eggs.
step-21: garnish each nest with fresh herbs and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: using a fork or sharp knife, carefully poke holes down one side of spaghetti squash.
step-3: microwave the spaghetti squash for 5 minutes to soften.
step-4: let cool to room temperature.
step-5: cut the spaghetti squash in half lengthwise and remove seeds using a spoon.
step-6: place spaghetti squash on a baking pan face up.
step-7: coat the inside of the squash with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
step-8: flip the squash over so that the rims are face-down on the pan.
step-9: bake for 30-45 minutes, or until squash reaches desired tenderness.
step-10: while the squash is in the oven, prepare a second baking sheet with asparagus, cherry tomatoes, olive oil, salt, pepper, garlic and basil.
step-11: combine until vegetables are evenly coated with seasoning.
step-12: bake for 10-12 minutes, or until vegetables have reached desired tenderness.
step-13: heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
step-14: add the chicken breasts and season with salt and pepper.
step-15: cook the chicken, stirring occasionally, until sides become browned and the center is no longer pink.
step-16: remove from heat and set aside.
step-17: once spaghetti squash has cooled down enough to handle, use a fork to shred apart the squash into noodles.
step-18: distribute evenly into four glass containers.
step-19: add 2 tablespoons of pesto to two of the containers.
step-20: add ¼ cup (65g) of marinara to the other two containers.
step-21: top with mozzarella.
step-22: distribute cooked vegetables and chicken evenly between all four containers.
step-23: seal containers with secure lids and store in the fridge for up to 4 days.
step-24: when ready to serve, reheat and stir everything together to distribute sauce.
step-25: garnish with basil, and enjoy!

step-1: microwave squash on high until tender, about 10 minutes.
step-2: shred the flesh of the squash and discard the skin.
step-3: heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
step-4: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the garlic, red pepper flakes, and shrimp, and cook until shrimp are pink and start to curl, about 2 minutes.
step-5: add the lemon zest, salt, pepper, and lemon juice, and cook for 1 minute.
step-6: remove from heat, add parsley and shredded squash, and stir to combine.

step-1: bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
step-2: cook the pasta for 1 minute less than the package instructs, until al dente.
step-3: save 1 cup (240 ml) pasta water, then drain.
step-4: heat a large sauté pan over medium heat.
step-5: add the olive oil, butter, and pepper, and stir to combine.
step-6: stir in the reserved pasta water.
step-7: toss in the cooked pasta.
step-8: reduce the heat to low.
step-9: add the parmesan and toss until the cheese is melted and the pasta is well-coated.
step-10: season with salt, if desired.

step-1: cook spaghetti in boiling salted water until it’s al dente.
step-2: reserve 1 cup (235 ml) of the pasta water before draining.
step-3: while the spaghetti is cooking, heat olive oil in a large pan (it should be large enough to toss the pasta in).
step-4: add garlic and tomatoes, and stir until well-incorporated.
step-5: season with salt and pepper.
step-6: cook tomatoes down for 5 minutes until they soften and release some of their juices.
step-7: then add the wine and allow that to reduce for 5-10 minutes until you’re left with a syrupy sauce.
step-8: add the pasta to your sauce, along with a splash of pasta water and toss to coat it for about 1-2 minutes so the pasta finishes cooking and absorbs the flavor of the sauce.
step-9: add the parmesan and basil.
step-10: add another small splash of pasta water, if needed.
step-11: toss until the cheese is melted down and you’re left with a smooth sauce.
step-12: gradually add small amounts of pasta water, as needed, until the sauce reaches your desired smoothness.
step-13: top off with extra parmesan and basil and serve immediately.

step-1: bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
step-2: cook the pasta according to package instructions.
step-3: save ¼ cup (60 ml) of pasta water, then drain.
step-4: add the olive oil and garlic to a large cold sauté pan.
step-5: turn the heat to medium-low and slowly heat up until the garlic is fragrant and lightly colored, about 3 minutes.
step-6: add the chile flakes and cook for another minute.
step-7: add the reserved pasta water and bring to a simmer.
step-8: add the cooked spaghetti and parsley, if using.
step-9: stir until the pasta is well-coated.
step-10: season with salt to taste.

step-1: heat up the olive oil in a really hot pan.
step-2: thinly slice the onion.
step-3: slice the potatoes into 3-millimeters thick pieces.
step-4: fry the vegetables in the olive oil over high heat for 10-15 minutes until they caramelize.
step-5: drain the vegetables and save the olive oil for later use.
step-6: add 6 eggs to a bowl and whisk.
step-7: add the fried vegetables, stir, and leave to set for 15-20 minutes.
step-8: in a nonstick pan, fry the egg mixture over high heat for 1 minute, then reduce to a low heat for 2-4 minutes.
step-9: cover the pan with a large plate and carefully turn the omelet out onto the plate.
step-10: slide the omelet back into the pan and fry for a further 3-5 minutes over low heat.
step-11: to check the omelet is cooked, gently press on the centre of the omelet.
step-12: if the surface springs back, it is ready.
step-13: repeat step 8 to remove omelet from the pan.

step-1: in a large pitcher or bowl, combine fruit, grapefruit juice, brandy, and simple syrup.
step-2: stir well, cover with plastic wrap, and chill for at least 1 hour.
step-3: top with sparkling rosé, and serve with a lemon slice.

step-1: add strawberries, lemon juice and honey to a blender.
step-2: blend until smooth.
step-3: pour sparkling water and strawberry puree into a pitcher and stir.
step-4: serve over ice.

step-1: prepare the chicken by removing the backbone using a pair of kitchen scissors or a sharp knife.
step-2: turn it over and flatten it down to spread the chicken out as much as possible.
step-3: blend together all of the other ingredients in a food processor and spread it over the chicken as much as possible.
step-4: cover and marinate in the fridge for at least 3 hours or overnight.
step-5: bake in the center of a preheated oven, uncovered for 45-50 minutes at 400°f (200°c), or until the thickest part of the thigh is 320°f (160°c)
step-6: allow to rest for 10 minutes.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: make the cookie butter: in a food processor, combine the butter, evaporated milk, sweetened condensed milk, and cookies.
step-4: process until the cookies break down and the mixture is the texture of peanut butter.
step-5: using a small ice cream scoop or your hands, scoop 12 ½-inch (1 ¼ cm) balls of the cookie butter onto the prepared baking sheet.
step-6: freeze for 30 minutes.
step-7: make the cookie dough: in a large bowl, whisk together the butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla until light and fluffy.
step-8: add the egg and whisk to incorporate.
step-9: sift in the flour, cinnamon, cream of tartar, baking soda, and salt.
step-10: fold with a rubber spatula to combine.
step-11: cover the bowl with plastic wrap and chill the dough for 30 minutes.
step-12: make the cinnamon sugar: in a small bowl, mix together the sugar and cinnamon.
step-13: set aside.
step-14: roll the cookie dough into 24 ½-inch (1 ¼ cm) balls.
step-15: flatten a dough ball in your hand and add a cookie butter ball to the center.
step-16: top with another flattened ball of cookie dough and pinch the edges of the dough together.
step-17: roll into a ball to completely encase the cookie butter.
step-18: repeat with the remaining ingredients.
step-19: roll the cookie dough balls in the cinnamon sugar to coat.
step-20: place the cookie balls on a parchment-lined baking sheet, spacing about 3 inches (7 ½ cm) apart – there should be 6 per baking sheet.
step-21: bake for 12 minutes, until the edges are light golden brown.
step-22: let cool, then serve.

step-1: to make the splice blend, combine spices in a small bowl and mix until evenly distributed.
step-2: to make the cookies, combine flour, salt, baking powder, and spice blend in a large mixing bowl,.
step-3: mix until blended.
step-4: in a new large bowl, mix together the butter, sugar, and brown sugar.
step-5: mix in the egg.
step-6: add the flour mixture and combine until well mixed and dough forms.
step-7: remove dough from bowl and wrap with plastic wrap.
step-8: refrigerate for 2-6 hours.
step-9: on a floured surface, roll out the dough to a ⅛- to ¼-inch (3mm - 6mm) thickness.
step-10: cut the dough into desired cookie shape.
step-11: optional: use speculoos style cookie molds to shape cookies.
step-12: place cookies on parchment covered baking tray and bake at 350°f (175°c) for 12-14 minutes.
step-13: to make the cookie butter, combine cookies, condensed milk, evaporated milk, and butter in a food processor.
step-14: blend until peanut butter texture forms.

step-1: season both sides of the flank steak generously with salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, and cayenne.
step-2: massage the spices into the steak well.
step-3: in an oiled skillet, cook steak for 2-3 minutes on both sides (depending on desired doneness), flipping once.
step-4: remove steak from skillet and allow to rest on a cutting board for 10 minutes.
step-5: allowing the steak to rest before cutting it allows the juices to resettle.
step-6: while the steak rests, combine the mustard, honey, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper in a small bowl.
step-7: whisk to combine.
step-8: set aside.
step-9: cut the steak against the grain.
step-10: assemble the salad with mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, avocados, shredded carrots, and red onion.
step-11: top with cut steak.
step-12: serve with dressing.

step-1: beat brown sugar, white sugar, and eggs.
step-2: melt the unsweetened chocolate and butter, allow to cool.
step-3: mix into the egg and sugar mixture.
step-4: add all of the dry ingredients, and mix thoroughly (you don’t want any cayenne pepper clumps!
step-5: stir in the chocolate chips.
step-6: space out 12 cookies on a baking sheet.
step-7: bake at 350°f (180°c) for 13 minutes.
step-8: remove the cookies from the oven.
step-9: top each one with a large marshmallow.
step-10: broil for 30 seconds, until the marshmallows have just started to brown.

step-1: in a medium sauce pot, combine the rice, 2 cups (470 ml) of milk, sugar, and a pinch of salt.
step-2: bring to a gentle simmer over medium heat.
step-3: cook for 15 minutes, or until thick and creamy.
step-4: in a small bowl, combine remaining milk and the egg.
step-5: whisk well.
step-6: add the egg mixture to the pot of rice.
step-7: stir well and cook for 3 minutes.
step-8: add the nutmeg and cinnamon, and mix well.

step-1: caramelize the white chocolate: add the white chocolate to a medium heatproof bowl and microwave in 45-second intervals, stirring between, until golden brown in color and completely melted and smooth.
step-2: pour half of the melted chocolate onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and spread into an even layer.
