step-3: freeze for 30 minutes, or until solid.
step-4: reserve the remaining melted chocolate.
step-5: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-6: line baking sheets with parchment paper.
step-7: make the cookie dough: in a medium bowl, combine the butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla extract in a bowl and beat with an electric hand mixer until fluffy.
step-8: add the egg and continue beating until fully incorporated.
step-9: add the reserved melted white chocolate and beat to combine.
step-10: sift in the flour, baking soda, salt, and espresso powder,l and fold into dough until no dry spots remain.
step-11: chop the frozen white chocolate into chip-size pieces.
step-12: fold into the cookie dough.
step-13: scoop the dough onto the prepared baking sheets, 6 cookies per pan, and bake for 12 minutes, until golden.
step-14: make the filling: in a large bowl, combine the butter, powdered sugar, espresso powder, cinnamon, allspice, nutmeg, heavy cream, vanilla, and marshmallow fluff, and beat with a hand mixer until well combined and fluffy.
step-15: to assemble the pies, spread 2-3 tablespoons of filling on the flat sides of half of the cookies.
step-16: sandwich with the remaining cookies.

step-1: cut oranges in half and juice.
step-2: pour red wine in a large pot.
step-3: add the orange juice through a sieve to get rid of pulp.
step-4: add cider, cloves and half the cinnamon sticks and bring to a simmer, but do not boil.
step-5: cut apple in ⅓ - ½ inch (1 cm) slices, leaving the peel on and the star in the middle intact.
step-6: put the center slices with a star aside and add the rest of the ends to the punch.
step-7: to serve, pour punch in a heat resistant glass.
step-8: take the center slices with the inner star shape and clean the holes of the seeds and tough lining, making sure to keep the star shape intact.
step-9: carefully place the apple slice on the punch, so it floats on top.
step-10: pour a little bit of the rum in a glass, heat-safe dish.
step-11: have another glass nearby to hold the spoon you will use to move the sugar to the apple.
step-12: soak sugar cube in rum and place it over the star in the glass.
step-13: carefully, with a lighter, set sugar cube on fire until you see the sugar bubbling and a blue flame.
step-14: if necessary, carefully add small amounts of rum on the sugar cube with a spoon to keep it burning until the sugar is melted.
step-15: stir with a cinnamon stick and enjoy immediately while it is still hot.
step-16: if not sweet enough, repeat sugar cube flaming step or add more sugar to the hot drink.

step-1: combine jalapeño, apple cider vinegar, honey/agave, salt, pepper, garlic powder, paprika, chili powder, and cumin.
step-2: mix until combined.
step-3: add tofu and refrigerate, marinate for 1-3 hours.
step-4: prepare as desired!

step-1: blend all the cashew cream ingredients in a blender until smooth.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: fry onion and garlic for a few minutes, then add the ground pork and the ground beef, seasoned with salt and pepper.
step-4: continue stirring and browning the meat until cooked through, about 3-5 minutes.
step-5: add all the fruit, raisins, almonds, and pine nuts, stir to combine, then remove from heat and chill.
step-6: poach the poblano pepper, remove the skin.
step-7: open and remove the seeds and veins, then cut into strips.
step-8: set aside.
step-9: preheat oven to 500˚f (250˚c) (or as high as your oven will go).
step-10: for the empanada dough, mix flour, butter, salt and milk, kneading into a dough.
step-11: add egg, then knead until firm.
step-12: pinch off a bit of dough and flatten into a circle, adding two strips of chile poblano and the meat filling.
step-13: put a bit of water on your finger and wet the edge of half the empanada.
step-14: close the empanada and use a fork to seal the edges.
step-15: brush with an egg wash before putting on a baking sheet.
step-16: bake 20-25 minutes or until golden brown.
step-17: top the empanadas with cashew cream and garnish with pomegranate and cilantro.

step-1: preheat oven to 450ºf (230ºc).
step-2: in a small bowl, whisk together pizza sauce with frank’s red hot original.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: drizzle a 12-inch (30 ½ cm) cast iron skillet with olive oil.
step-5: use your hand or a paper towel to evenly coat the pan with oil.
step-6: sprinkle pan with cornmeal.
step-7: press pizza dough into the pan so that it covers the whole surface evenly.
step-8: spread spicy pizza sauce on the dough.
step-9: top with mozzarella, chicken, and bacon.
step-10: scatter spinach, cherry tomatoes, and red onion on top.
step-11: bake pizza for 14–16 minutes until edges are browned and crisp.
step-12: remove from oven and let cool for 5 minutes, then drizzle with frank’s red hot original and ranch dressing.
step-13: slice and serve.

step-1: in a medium-size pot, add the chicken breast, water, sake, sliced ginger, and scallions, and bring to a boil over high heat.
step-2: once the water is boiling, flip the chicken breast over and put the lid on top of the pot.
step-3: turn off the heat and leave the pot sit at room temperature for 30 minutes.
step-4: chill in the fridge.
step-5: in a small bowl, combine all the sauce ingredients and mix well.
step-6: on a plate, arrange the sliced tomatoes, julienned cucumbers, and sliced chicken breast.
step-7: top with cilantro and drizzle with sauce.

step-1: in a large, nonstick skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
step-2: toss in the onion and salt and sauté for 2 minutes.
step-3: add the oregano, cumin, chipotle, and garlic.
step-4: toast for 1 minute.
step-5: add in the crushed tomatoes and chicken and stir until the chicken is evenly coated and the mixture is warmed through.
step-6: pour the chicken mixture into a large serving bowl.
step-7: toast the tortillas in the seasoned pan, about 3 minutes per side.
step-8: divide the mixture evenly between tortillas, top with avocado slices, and serve.

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine the flour, arrowroot powder, salt, cayenne, white pepper, onion powder, garlic powder, paprika, old bay seasoning, and nutritional yeast.
step-2: in another medium bowl, combine the hot sauce, soy milk, and dijon mustard and whisk until creamy.
step-3: in a large dutch oven or heavy pot, heat the oil to 350°f (180°c).
step-4: double-line a large plate with paper towels and keep nearby.
step-5: use one hand to dip a cauliflower floret into the wet mixture, then drop it into the flour mixture.
step-6: use your dry hand to coat it completely.
step-7: dip it back into the wet mixture and again in the dry mixture, keeping one hand devoted to wet and one to dry.
step-8: carefully lower the twice-coated floret into the hot oil.
step-9: repeat with the remaining cauliflower until you can’t fit any more into the pot.
step-10: do not overcrowd.
step-11: fry for 4-5 minutes, until the pieces are golden.
step-12: transfer the fried cauliflower to the lined plate and continue to fry the remaining cauliflower.
step-13: serve hot.

step-1: mash half of an avocado.
step-2: add salt and pepper, to taste.
step-3: mix until well combined.
step-4: spread the mashed avocado evenly across toast.
step-5: top with the fried egg, and drizzle with sriracha.

step-1: slice the pork into extremely thin slices, then transfer to a large bowl.
step-2: this works best when the pork is super cold or partially frozen.
step-3: add in all of the ingredients besides the canola oil, then mix until the pork and the vegetables are evenly coated with the marinade.
step-4: cover and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
step-5: heat the oil in a pan over high heat, add pork, being sure not to crowd the pan, stir-fry the pork in batches until slightly crispy on the edges, about 3-4 minutes.
step-6: if you’re using pork belly, cook for a bit longer, around 6-7 minutes.
step-7: sprinkle a bit of sesame seeds on top, then serve with rice!

step-1: mix the ingredients for the batter in a bowl until smooth with no lumps.
step-2: heat oil in a pot to 340°f (170°c).
step-3: dip a chicken wing into the cornstarch, shaking off excess, then dredge the wing into the batter, dripping off excess.
step-4: fry half of the wings at a time for about 5-7 minutes, until light golden.
step-5: the oil will drop to about 320°f (160°c).
step-6: drain the wings and increase the heat.
step-7: heat oil to about 375°f (190°c).
step-8: fry the wings a second time until golden brown and crispy.
step-9: drain and set aside.
step-10: in a pan, combine all the ingredients for the sauce and stir until bubbling.
step-11: toss in the wings.

step-1: preheat oven to 425ºf (220ºc).
step-2: in a small mixing bowl, combine flour, chili powder, garlic powder, pepper, and salt.
step-3: pat the chicken wings dry using a paper towel.
step-4: batter them in the flour mixture and place chicken wings on a wired baking sheet.
step-5: bake at 425ºf (220ºc) for 45 minutes, flipping halfway for even cooking.
step-6: in a food processor or blender, mix together the mango, habanero peppers, garlic, paprika, apple cider vinegar, and lime juice.
step-7: blend until fully combined.
step-8: the mixture should be a bright orange vibrant color.
step-9: in a saucepan, combine honey with your mango habanero mixture at medium heat.
step-10: stir occasionally to prevent sticking and simmer for 5-10 minutes or until your sauce reaches a prefered consistency.
step-11: fully coat your cooked wings in the sauce then place on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-12: bake at 450ºf (230ºc) for 8-10 minutes or until sauce has slightly caramelized.

step-1: finely chop two red potatoes, and two large carrots.
step-2: sauté in a little oil for a few minutes.
step-3: add the bell pepper, corn, and edamame.
step-4: continue to cook until the potatoes are soft.
step-5: in a food processor, grind the oats until they are a grainy powder.
step-6: add the veggies, olive oil, and spices.
step-7: blend.
step-8: shape the mixture into patties, and fry, grill, bake, or freeze them for later!
step-9: serve with toppings of choice!
step-10: (topping in this video: vegan mayo, mustard, ketchup, dill pickles, onion, lettuce, tomatoes, and avocado.)

step-1: to a pot with 2 cups (480 ml) of boiling water add the ramen seasoning packet and a tablespoon of butter.
step-2: stir until the butter melts and then add the ramen noodle cube and cook until the noodles become tender, 2 minutes.
step-3: pour the ramen into a bowl.
step-4: to the prepared ramen, add the peanut butter, sriracha, and sesame oil and stir to incorporate.
step-5: garnish with the peanuts, cilantro, jalapeño, and a lime wedge.

step-1: remove the stems, seeds, and veins from the the guajillo and the chile de arbol peppers.
step-2: soak in the hot water in a medium bowl for 10 minutes.
step-3: cut the pineapple in half lengthwise and carefully remove the flesh, forming two deep dishes.
step-4: separate the fruit from the core and discard the core.
step-5: drain the guajillo and chile de arbol peppers, reserving ¼ cup (60 ml) of soaking liquid, and place in a food processor.
step-6: add the onion, garlic, chipotle, ketchup, water used to soak the peppers, vinegar, salt, and pepper, and pulse until fully blended.
step-7: strain the sauce through a fine mesh sieve.
step-8: heat the butter and oil in a medium pan over medium heat.
step-9: add the onion and garlic, and fry for 3 minutes, until the onion is translucent.
step-10: add the tomato and the reserved pineapple, cover, and cook for 3 minutes.
step-11: add the shrimp, stir well, cover, and cook for 2 minutes, or until the shrimp turns pink.
step-12: add the sauce and cook for about 5 minutes, until it thickens.
step-13: serve the shrimp in the pineapple halves and top with fresh cilantro.

step-1: preheat your oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-2: slice pita bread into eighths and spread chips out on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-3: in a small bowl, combine olive oil, garlic powder, salt, pepper, paprika, and red pepper flakes, and brush onto both sides of the chips.
step-4: bake for 10-12 minutes until golden and crispy.
step-5: allow to cool.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: carefully dry the chickpeas.
step-3: removing the skins is optional and they will come off easily.
step-4: the drier you get them, the crunchier they’ll be!
step-5: in a medium bowl, add dried chickpeas, olive oil, cumin, chili powder, cayenne pepper and salt.
step-6: toss well to coat evenly.
step-7: spread chickpeas out on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-8: roast for 15-20 minutes.
step-9: mix around on baking sheet and roast for additional 15-20 minutes, or until browned.
step-10: cool for 5-10 minutes.

step-1: blend together the dry ingredients and butter for the cobbler topping until you get a crumbly mix.
step-2: add the eggs and buttermilk and process until the cobbler dough comes together.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: in a large saucepan, heat oil over medium heat.
step-5: add bacon and garlic and cook until some of the fat has rendered from the bacon.
step-6: add the carrot, celery and onion.
step-7: cook until onion has softened.
step-8: add mushrooms, chicken and a pinch of salt and pepper, cook until chicken is 80% done.
step-9: sprinkle the flour over everything, stir until well combined.
step-10: pour in the wine and chicken stock.
step-11: bring to a boil.
step-12: remove from heat and spread the cobbler topping over everything.
step-13: brush with egg wash.
step-14: stick it in the oven and bake for 20-25 minutes at 350°f (180°c) or until cobbler topping has browned.

step-1: whisk together flour, milk, baking powder and garlic powder.
step-2: add the chopped cauliflower and toss to coat.
step-3: make sure there’s a thin layer of batter over the cauliflower.
step-4: deep fry cauliflower until golden brown, remove and drain excess oil.
step-5: make the spicy sesame sauce by combining the sesame oil, garlic, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sugar and sriracha.
step-6: bring the sauce to a boil then add the cornstarch slurry.
step-7: mix in and let the sauce thicken.
step-8: add the fried cauliflower and toss to coat in sauce.
step-9: garnish with sesame seeds and chopped scallions.
step-10: serve with rice.

step-1: in a large bowl, mix all ingredients for the sweet ‘n’ spicy sauce.
step-2: in a slow cooker, place all protein and pour sauce over until evenly coated.
step-3: on high, cook for 4 hours, or on low for 8 hours.
step-4: portion any meat with a side of veggies and the spicy sauce.

step-1: place turkey, onion, jalapeño, and spices together in a large bowl and mix together until all the ingredients are incorporated.
step-2: lightly wet your hands and use them to shape 4 circular patties about 4 inches (10 cm) in diameter.
step-3: heat up about 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat.
step-4: cook burgers for 2 minutes on the first side, then flip, lower heat to low, and cook them for an additional 5-6 minutes.
step-5: top with pepper jack cheese during the last minute.
step-6: note: the turkey burgers must be cooked through.
step-7: use a meat thermometer to check each patty for an internal temperature of at least 165˚f (74˚c) before removing from pan.
step-8: assemble the burgers as desired with bun, chipotle mayonnaise, lettuce, tomato, avocado, and preferred condiments.

step-1: boil the garbanzo beans until the skins come off.
step-2: remove the skins, drain, and combine all ingredients in a food processor.
step-3: blend until smooth adding small amounts of oil and water until desired consistency is achieved.
step-4: this recipe usually requires more liquid, at the potato will absorb a lot! add more lemon or tahini if needed.
step-5: add fresh veggies or pita chips sprinkled with cinnamon!

step-1: combine marinade ingredients in a bowl, add the chopped chicken.
step-2: marinate for 10 minutes.
step-3: in about 1 ½ inch (4 cm) of oil, fry the chicken until browned and crispy.
step-4: remove and set aside.
step-5: heat oil in a wok or a large pan.
step-6: add the szechuan peppercorn and dried red chilies.
step-7: fry until fragrant.
step-8: add the rest of the dried red chilies, ginger, scallion, and peanuts.
step-9: fry for a minute.
step-10: add the fried chicken pieces, sugar, rice wine and sesame oil.
step-11: toss to coat.
step-12: garnish with chopped scallions.

step-1: salt and pepper chicken.
step-2: in a large pot, brown chicken in olive oil.
step-3: remove chicken and set aside.
step-4: in the same pot, add garlic, ginger, jalapeños and onions.
step-5: cook until translucent.
step-6: pour in the tomato puree, unsweetened coconut milk and chicken broth.
step-7: add the chicken back to the pot.
step-8: bring to a simmer.
step-9: cover and cook for 45 - 60 minutes.
step-10: serve with rice.
step-11: garnish with cilantro or parsley.

step-1: season the sushi rice with the rice vinegar, fanning and stirring until room temperature.
step-2: on the rolling mat place one sheet of nori with the rough side facing upwards.
step-3: in a small bowl, combine tuna filling ingredients.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: wet your hands and grab a handful of rice and place it on the nori.
step-6: spread the rice evenly throughout the nori without smushing the rice down.
step-7: arrange, in a horizontal row 1 inch (2 cm) from the bottom, a large spoonful of the tuna filling.
step-8: grabbing both nori and the mat, roll the mat over the filling so the extra space at the bottom touches the other side, squeezing down to make a nice tight roll.
step-9: squeeze down along the way to keep the roll from holding its shape.
step-10: transfer the roll onto a cutting board.
step-11: rub a knife on a damp paper towel before slicing the roll into six equal portions.

step-1: in a slow cooker, combine all ingredients except the parsley.
step-2: set to low heat for 8-10 hours.
step-3: keep in mind that the longer you cook, the spicier the chili will become!
step-4: (adjust the amount of chilis accordingly)
step-5: sprinkle parsley over top, and stir.

step-1: in a small pot, combine the mustard powder, garlic powder, turmeric, and water.
step-2: whisk mixture, breaking up any lumps, until completely smooth.
step-3: bring to a simmer over medium-low heat.
step-4: cook, whisking occasionally, for 20-25 minutes, until thickened to the consistency of prepared yellow mustard.
step-5: be careful not to let mixture scorch or dry out.
step-6: remove the pot from the heat and stir in the vinegar and salt.
step-7: let cool completely.
step-8: transfer to a clean airtight container and store in the refrigerator.
step-9: the mustard should keep for up to 1 year.

step-1: use a spoon and carefully create cracks on 8 hard-boiled eggs.
step-2: place the cracked eggs in a large bag.
step-3: add black food coloring and water.
step-4: close the bag, mix around and set aside for 15 minutes.
step-5: rinse the eggs in clean water and peel to reveal the cracked design.
step-6: cut the eggs in half and separate the egg yolks from the egg whites.
step-7: combine the egg yolks with mayonnaise, mustard and green food coloring.
step-8: pipe the egg yolk mixture into the egg whites.
step-9: garnish the deviled eggs with an olive spider.
step-10: to create an olive spider use half of a black olive for the body and olive slices for the legs.

step-1: add the apple cider, cinnamon sticks, and allspice berries to a slow cooker.
step-2: turn the heat setting to high, cover, and warm for 30-60 minutes, or until steaming.
step-3: once steaming, reduce the heat setting to warm.
step-4: add the apples and rum and stir to combine.
step-5: ladle into mugs and garnish with cinnamon sticks.

step-1: add the sugar and cocoa powder to a slow cooker and whisk to combine.
step-2: add the milk and whisk to incorporate.
step-3: turn the heat setting to high, cover, and warm for 30-60 minutes, until steaming.
step-4: once steaming, reduce the heat setting to warm.
step-5: add the peppermint schnapps.
step-6: whisk to combine and to ensure the sugar and cocoa powder are fully dissolved.
step-7: add the marshmallows.
step-8: ladle into mugs and top with whipped cream and crushed peppermint candies.

step-1: combine all ingredients in a large pitcher and stir until sugar has dissolved.
step-2: once combined, refrigerate for 3 hours or until the drink is cold.
step-3: serve with ice and the fruit of your choice.

step-1: combine all ingredients in a large pitcher and stir until sugar has dissolved.
step-2: once combined, refrigerate for 3 hours or until the drink is cold.
step-3: serve with ice and the fruit of your choice.

step-1: combine all ingredients in a large pitcher and stir until sugar has dissolved.
step-2: once combined, refrigerate for 3 hours or until the drink is cold.
step-3: serve with ice and the fruit of your choice.

step-1: combine all ingredients in a large pitcher and stir until sugar has dissolved.
step-2: once combined, refrigerate for 3 hours or until the drink is cold.
step-3: serve with ice and the fruit of your choice.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180˚c).
step-2: cook manicotti a couple minutes under the box instructions.
step-3: drain in a colander, and cut manicotti in half.
step-4: arrange manicotti tubes upright in a parchment paper-lined springform pan until the pan is packed with the tubes.
step-5: in a large bowl, combine artichokes, spinach, chicken, ricotta cheese, ½ of the mozzarella cheese, ½ of the parmesan cheese, garlic, salt, and pepper.
step-6: transfer the spinach and artichoke mixture into a piping bag.
step-7: fill each manicotti tube about ¾ of the way up with spinach and artichoke mixture.
step-8: spoon tomato sauce over the filled manicotti.
step-9: top with remaining mozzarella cheese, and parmesan cheese.
step-10: cover with foil and bake 15 minutes.
step-11: remove foil and bake an additional 15 minutes or until cheese is melted.
step-12: garnish with parsley, if desired.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: slice into the chicken several times, about ½ cm (¼ inch) apart, but only cut about 85% of the way through, leaving the bottom intact.
step-3: cook the spinach on a medium heat until it is slightly wilted, then add the artichoke.
step-4: stir in the garlic powder and cream cheese, and cook for a minute or two.
step-5: sprinkle over the mozzarella and stir until melted.
step-6: allow to cool to the touch and then fill each segment of the chicken breast with about 1 teaspoon of the mixture.
step-7: bake in the centre of the oven for 18-22 minutes until the chicken is cooked through and the juices run clear.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: cut pizza dough into 8 sections on a floured surface.
step-3: with one section, roll out dough until flat and circular.
step-4: layer one slice mozzarella cheese, two tablespoons spinach, and 1 tablespoon ricotta.
step-5: fold one side of dough up and over ingredients, and seal calzone by crimping the edges together.
step-6: in a small bowl, mix together melted butter, parmesan, garlic, and parsley.
step-7: place calzone on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-8: apply egg wash to outside of calzone and brush with garlic butter.
step-9: bake calzones for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: in a small mixing bowl, combine the herb and olive oil rub ingredients.
step-3: set aside until ready for use.
step-4: over low heat, cook spinach with olive oil, garlic cloves and salt & pepper to taste.
step-5: cook spinach 1-2 minutes just until wilted.
step-6: transfer the cooked spinach to a large bowl.
step-7: add ricotta, parmesan, salt and pepper.
step-8: mix until well combined.
step-9: lay out the pork loin, butterfly and pound until flat and even.
step-10: spread the spinach and cheese mix on the pork loin.
step-11: roll so that the spinach and cheese mix is on the inside.
step-12: secure with cooking twine.
step-13: rub the herb and oil mix all over the rolled pork.
step-14: sear on all sides until golden and slightly crispy.
step-15: set aside.
step-16: spread carrots, onions and potatoes on baking sheet.
step-17: drizzle with olive oil and season with salt & pepper.
step-18: place rolled pork on top of the bed of carrots, onions and potatoes.
step-19: roast at 425°f (220°c) for 45 minutes, or until the internal temperature reads 145°f (65°c) for medium rare or 160°f (70°c) for medium.
step-20: remove from oven and let the pork rest for 15 minutes before you remove the twine and slice.
step-21: serve with carrots, onions and potatoes.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: spray a six-cup muffin tray with nonstick spray.
step-3: in a bowl, add the eggs, spinach, feta, tomato, salt, and pepper, and stir to distribute ingredients.
step-4: distribute the mixture evenly between the muffins cups.
step-5: bake until the eggs are set, about 15 minutes.

step-1: spread spinach and artichoke dip on toast.
step-2: top with sliced avocado and shaved parmesan cheese, and sprinkle with parsley.

step-1: in a skillet, heat a tablespoon of oil and saute garlic and spinach until spinach is wilted.
step-2: in a bowl, beat the cream cheese until smooth.
step-3: add cooked spinach, artichoke hearts, mozzarella, salt, and pepper.
step-4: peel and slice the onion into ½ inch (1 cm) rings, and detach the rings from each other.
step-5: on a wax paper–lined tray, lay out onion rings and fill each with dip mixture.
step-6: place tray in freezer until solid (about one hour).
step-7: preheat oil in a pot over medium heat to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-8: place the flour, eggs, and breadcrumbs into three separate bowls.
step-9: dip a ring into the flour, shaking off excess, then dip it into the egg, the bread crumbs, then back into the eggs, and one last time into the breadcrumbs.
step-10: repeat with the remaining rings.
step-11: fry the rings for 5-6 minutes, until deep golden brown.
step-12: drain on a paper towel.

step-1: add chickpeas, spinach, artichoke hearts, garlic, tahini, lemon juice, and seasonings to the bowl of a 2-quart food processor.
step-2: blend until smooth.
step-3: while blending, slowly add in the olive oil until hummus is creamy and smooth.
step-4: garnish with a few leaves of spinach, additional chopped artichoke hearts, and a drizzle of olive oil.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: boil the lasagna noodles until they are soft but not fully cooked, for about 10 minutes.
step-3: drain and set aside.
step-4: in a sauté pan over medium heat, saute the spinach with the olive oil and a pinch of salt.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: in a medium-sized bowl, mix the ricotta, cooked spinach, chopped artichokes, garlic, ½ of the mozzarella, ½ of the parmesan, salt, and pepper.
step-7: spoon some of the mixture onto the lasagna noodle and roll tightly.
step-8: spread the marinara on the bottom of the baking dish.
step-9: place the lasagna rolls right side up to fill the dish.
step-10: top with the rest of the mozzarella and parmesan.
step-11: bake for 35-40 minutes or until the cheese is brown and crispy.
step-12: serve and top with parsley.

step-1: preheat oven to 450°f (230°c).
step-2: in a large pan, melt the butter.
step-3: add garlic, and spinach cooking until spinach is wilted.
step-4: add artichoke hearts.
step-5: slowly add the milk, salt, and pepper.
step-6: stir until milk is boiling.
step-7: add the macaroni, cooking until the milk coats the macaroni like a glaze.
step-8: add the cheddar and 2 cups (200g) of mozzarella, stirring until the cheese is completely melted.
step-9: sprinkle the remaining mozzarella on top.
step-10: bake for 7 minutes, until cheese is bubbly and golden brown.

step-1: heat oil in a large pot over medium heat.
step-2: add spinach, cooking until wilted, then add artichoke hearts, cooking for 1 minute.
step-3: add cream cheese until melted, stirring until there are no lumps.
step-4: sprinkle in garlic powder, salt, pepper, and milk, stirring until smooth.
step-5: add pasta and mix until pasta is evenly coated.

step-1: preheat oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-2: in a large bowl, combine cream cheese, artichoke hearts, spinach, sour cream, parmesan, mozzarella, garlic powder, salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes.
step-3: place the two sheets of puff pastry on a parchment paper-lined baking tray.
step-4: using a dinner plate as a guide, cut out equal size circles from both sheets.
step-5: remove the top sheet.
step-6: on the bottom sheet, spread spinach artichoke mixture and lay the other sheet of puff pastry on top.
step-7: take a glass and place it in the center of the circle.
step-8: using a knife, cut away from the edge of the glass to create 12 equally spaced strips.
step-9: take each strip and twist then brush with beaten egg.
step-10: bake at 400°f (200°c) for 30 minutes, or until golden.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a saucepan set over medium heat, add 1 tablespoon of olive oil, garlic and red pepper flakes, stirring until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
step-3: stir in the spinach and artichokes.
step-4: mix in the cream cheese, sour cream, ½ of the mozzarella and parmesan.
step-5: stir until combined and cheese has melted.
step-6: season with salt and pepper.
step-7: remove from heat and set aside.
step-8: remove the top of the sourdough boule.
step-9: cut around the inside of the bread, being careful not to cut through the sides, and scoop out the center of the boule.
step-10: cut the scooped out bread into cubes, and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-11: vertically slice into the edges of the bread bowl, cutting all the way through the bottom, leaving 1 inch (2 cm) of space between each.
step-12: place onto a baking sheet next to the cubed bread.
step-13: spoon the spinach artichoke mixture into the sliced and hollowed bread bowl.
step-14: sprinkle the remaining mozzarella along the edges of the top of the filled bread bowl.
step-15: drizzle the cubed bread pieces with the remaining tablespoon of of olive oil.
step-16: place the sliced top back onto the bowl.
step-17: bake for 15-20 minutes.

step-1: in a large bowl, mix cream cheese, mozzarella cheese, spinach, artichoke hearts, parmesan cheese, sour cream, milk, and garlic salt (if you want it).
step-2: pour a third of the spinach artichoke mixture in a large glass baking tray and spread it evenly over the bottom.
step-3: line the tray with frozen ravioli, spread more mixture over top the ravioli, then spread the rest of the ravioli in the tray and cover that with remaining mixture.
step-4: bake in the oven at 375ºf (190ºc) for 30–35 minutes or until the bake has browned.

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine the cream cheese, spinach, mozzarella, salt, pepper, and garlic powder, stirring until thoroughly mixed.
step-2: transfer the mixture to a square baking pan lined with parchment paper and spread the mixture evenly in the dish.
step-3: freeze for 30 minutes.
step-4: invert the frozen spinach dip onto a cutting board and remove the parchment paper.
step-5: slice the block into 1-centimeter strips, then slice the strips in half into sticks.
step-6: place the flour, eggs, and breadcrumbs into three separate bowls.
step-7: dip the spinach dip sticks into the flour, then the eggs, then the breadcrumbs, then back into the eggs, and finally back into the breadcrumbs.
step-8: set the breaded sticks aside on a plate.
step-9: heat oil in a pot over medium-high heat.
step-10: fry the breaded sticks for about 30 seconds to a minute, until golden brown.
step-11: cool, then serve with marinara sauce!

step-1: mix cream cheese, spinach, garlic powder, and mozzarella until smooth.
step-2: mix ground beef, pork, egg, parsley, breadcrumbs, salt, and pepper until evenly combined.
step-3: take a golf ball-sized handful of the meatball mixture and press it flat in the palm of your hand.
step-4: place a spoonful of the spinach dip in the center of the meat and fold the edges over the dip, sealing it and rolling into a ball.
step-5: repeat with the remaining meat and dip.
step-6: in a pan over medium-high heat, sear meatballs for about a minute, then flip.
step-7: add the marinara sauce and mix.
step-8: cook for about 15 minutes, until meatballs are cooked through and sauce is thick.
step-9: serve with fettuccine.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: grease a 12-cup muffin tin with nonstick spray.
step-3: trim the ends from the zucchini, then slice lengthwise with a vegetable peeler.
step-4: line the muffin cups with the zucchini strips on the bottom and sides.
step-5: in a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, feta, spinach, mushrooms, milk, salt, and pepper.
step-6: divide the egg mixture evenly among the zucchini cups, using a spoon to distribute the mushrooms.
step-7: bake for 18 minutes, until the edges are slightly browned.

step-1: heat oil in a pot over medium-high heat
step-2: cook the spinach until wilted.
step-3: add the mushrooms, salt, and pepper cooking until most of the water is gone.
step-4: add the pesto and parmesan.
step-5: add the spaghetti, and toss until evenly coated, with the sauce sticking to the noodles.

step-1: let the oil heat up in the skillet and add the garlic followed by the mushrooms.
step-2: cook until the mushrooms have softened and caramelized a bit.
step-3: add the spinach and cook until spinach has wilted.
step-4: crack in the eggs and scramble with the veggies.
step-5: season with salt and pepper, and stir until fully cooked.
step-6: remove from the pan and set aside.
step-7: place the tortilla in the skillet and add a layer of both cheeses on half of the tortilla.
step-8: add the scramble, top with more cheese and fold the tortilla in half.
step-9: cook for 6 minutes over medium heat, flipping half way.
step-10: serve with salsa and garnish with fresh parsley.

step-1: bring a large pot of water to a boil.
step-2: in a large saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
step-3: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the spinach and cook for 5 minutes, or until wilted.
step-4: add the spinach to a food processor and process until finely chopped.
step-5: while processing the spinach, spoon the flour in a little bit at a time until a crumbly dough forms.
step-6: while continuing to process, add ¼ teaspoon of salt.
step-7: then, add 1 tablespoon of water at a time until dough comes together (the amount of water necessary will vary depending on how wet the spinach is).
step-8: remove the dough from the food processor and knead on a floured surface to form into a ball.
step-9: with a rolling pin, roll dough out into an oval, about 18 inches (46 cm) long by 12 inches (30 cm) wide, and ¼-inch (6 mm) thick.
step-10: with a knife or pizza cutter, cut the dough into even strips about ½ inch (1 cm) wide.
step-11: roll the strips into thick noodles.
step-12: once the water is boiling, add 1 tablespoon of salt and drop in the pasta.
step-13: cook the pasta for 3-5 minutes, or until the noodles float to the top.
step-14: drain.
step-15: toss with roasted vegetables and pesto and top with basil.

step-1: in a food processor, add all ingredients to make pesto and blend until walnuts are finely blended.
step-2: in a hot pan, add olive oil and cook chicken breast.
step-3: salt and pepper to taste.
step-4: remove the chicken and slice.
step-5: combine the chicken and pesto sauce into spaghetti and mix until the sauce fully coats the pasta.
step-6: serve and top it off with parmesan cheese.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: in a blender or food processor, add the spinach, basil, pine nuts, parmesan, garlic, salt, lemon juice, and olive oil.
step-3: blend until you reach a creamy consistency.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: add the pasta to a large bowl then add the tomatoes.
step-6: pour the pesto onto the pasta and mix well to combine.
step-7: transfer the mixture to a baking dish and top with mozzarella.
step-8: cover with foil and bake for 10-15 minutes.
step-9: carefully remove and allow to cool for 5 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: microwave sweet potato on high for 1 minute.
step-3: let cool.
step-4: using a chef’s knife, cut off the ends of the sweet potato.
step-5: with a vegetable peeler, peel the sweet potato.
step-6: using a chef’s knife, thinly slice the sweet potato into ⅛ inch (3 mm) thick slices.
step-7: toss with olive oil, and season with salt and pepper.
step-8: in a 9-inch (23 cm) circular baking dish, arrange the sweet potato slices around the bottom and sides of the baking dish allowing them to slightly overlap.
step-9: bake for 20-25 minutes, or until potato is softened.
step-10: in a medium bowl, beat the eggs, salt, and pepper.
step-11: add milk, garlic, and sun-dried tomatoes, and beat again.
step-12: add the spinach to the bottom of the baking dish.
step-13: pour the egg mixture into the baking dish.
step-14: add dobs of the goat cheese to the dish.
step-15: bake for 30 minutes, or until the center of the dish is fully set and no longer jiggles.
step-16: cool for 10 minutes before slicing.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f/200°c.
step-2: cut the puff pastry into six rectangles and place on a nonstick baking tray.
step-3: on one rectangle, spread 1 tablespoon of pesto.
step-4: top with cooked spinach, 2 tomato slices, and mozzarella.
step-5: place a rectangle of pastry on top and seal the edges with a fork.
step-6: repeat with remaining pastry rectangles.
step-7: brush with egg wash.
step-8: bake for 15-20 minutes or until the pastry is flaky and golden.

step-1: on a cutting board, place the loaf of bread on its side and slice off the top portion.
step-2: using a small knife, cut around the inside of the bread, being careful not to cut through the sides, and scoop out the center of the roll.
step-3: save this for dipping later on or use for bread crumbs.
step-4: in a large soup pot, combine the olive oil, onions, carrots, and celery, and cook 5 minutes over medium heat until onions are translucent.
step-5: add the garlic and cook 2 minutes.
step-6: add the split peas, thyme, salt, pepper, tumeric, and red pepper flakes, and stir until well combined.
step-7: add the vegetable stock and bay leaves, cover with a lid and cook for 40 minutes.
step-8: add potatoes, then cover and cook 20 more minutes.
step-9: remove bay leaves and serve soup in your bread bowl.

step-1: in a large pot, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat.
step-2: once the oil is shimmering, add the riced cauliflower, leeks, garlic, and 1 teaspoon of salt.
step-3: sauté for 2 minutes, until the leeks just begin to soften.
step-4: pour in the vegetable stock and 2 cups (480 ml) of non-dairy milk.
step-5: increase the heat to medium-high and bring to a boil.
step-6: reduce the heat to medium, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, until the cauliflower is completely broken down and tender.
step-7: meanwhile, in a large pan, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat.
step-8: add the asparagus, peas, and 1 teaspoon of salt.
step-9: sauté for 2 minutes, until the vegetables are bright green with some crunch.
step-10: remove the pan from the heat and stir in the lemon zest and basil.
step-11: transfer to a bowl and set aside.
step-12: wipe out the pan and add the potatoes and enough cold water to cover by 1 inch (1 ¼ cm).
step-13: season with 1 tablespoon of salt.
step-14: bring to a boil.
step-15: once boiling, reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 8-10 minutes, until the potatoes are easily pierced with a fork but not mushy.
step-16: drain and set aside.
step-17: remove the pot with the cauliflower from the heat.
step-18: blend with an immersion blender until completely smooth and creamy.
step-19: add up to 1 cup (240 ml) non-dairy milk or water if needed to thin to your desired consistency.
step-20: stir in the reserved asparagus, peas, potatoes, and the lemon juice.
step-21: season to taste with salt.
step-22: ladle into bowls and garnish with fresh basil, a drizzle of olive oil, and freshly ground black pepper.

step-1: make the dipping sauce: in a medium bowl, add the rice vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, ginger, green onions, sesame oil, and crushed red pepper flakes and whisk to combine.
step-2: heat oil in a large pan or wok over medium heat.
step-3: when the oil is shimmering, add the onion, ginger, and garlic.
step-4: cook until the onion is translucent, stirring occasionally, about 4 minutes.
step-5: add the asparagus, carrots, peas, and cabbage, and stir.
step-6: season with salt and pepper, and cook for 3-4 minutes, until the vegetables are softened.
step-7: add the spinach and cook until wilted.
step-8: remove the filling from the heat and transfer to a large bowl to cool to room temperature.
step-9: once the filling is cooled, add the chives, soy sauce, and sesame oil, and stir until well combined.
step-10: place 1 tablespoon of the vegetable mixture onto a gyoza wrapper.
step-11: dip your finger in water and run it around the edge of the wrapper.
step-12: fold in half and pinch together, pleating the dough as you go.
step-13: heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large skillet over low heat and add the dumplings.
step-14: cook for 3-4 minutes, until a crust starts to form on the bottom.
step-15: pour ¼ cup (60 ml) of water in the pan and cover with a lid.
step-16: steam for 6-8 minutes, then remove the dumplings from the pan.
step-17: repeat with the remaining dumplings.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: break the head of cauliflower into bite-sized florets.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine flour, garlic powder, almond milk and sriracha.
step-4: add the cauliflower florets and coat well.
step-5: transfer the coated florets onto a parchment-lined baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes.
step-6: remove the cauliflower from the oven and allow to cool for a few minutes.
step-7: once cool, transfer into a bowl, add buffalo sauce and coat well.
step-8: return cauliflower to the baking sheet and bake for 10 more minutes or until heated through.
step-9: serve with ranch or your favorite dipping sauce.

step-1: in a mixing bowl, stir together the chicken, mayonnaise, sriracha, onions and celery.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: in another mixing bowl, combine the rice and soy sauce.
step-4: with wet hands, take a handful of rice in one hand, press together and flatten.
step-5: take a spoonful of the sriracha mayo chicken and place in the center.
step-6: take another handful of rice and place on top.
step-7: using both hands, firmly press together the rice until you have a dense ball.
step-8: continue to form the rice until you have a fat triangle.
step-9: pan fry the sriracha mayo chicken onigiri until lightly golden and crispy.

step-1: preheat a grill or grill plate to medium heat.
step-2: drizzle the corn with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
step-3: mix to ensure all the ears are evenly coated.
step-4: place the corn on the grill.
step-5: close the lid to keep the temperature high, and let the corn cook for about 15 minutes per side, or until slightly charred on all sides.
step-6: remove the corn from the heat and set aside.
step-7: mix the mayonnaise and sriracha together, and then spread or drizzle onto the corn.
step-8: sprinkle the corn with sliced scallions and toasted sesame seeds.

step-1: put blueberries in a bowl or square container and place on top of a rectangle food tray.
step-2: place watermelon in a row, and then the pretzels until you fill up the platter, alternating red and white.
step-3: bring to your party, serve and, enjoy!

step-1: for 3 of the skewers add one strawberry and one banana, alternating colors until you have about 2 inches left on the end of skewer.
step-2: to represent the flag, start with a strawberry and end with a strawberry.
step-3: then add 5 blueberries to the end.
step-4: set on the left side of a platter or tray.
step-5: for the rest of the skewers, add alternating strawberries and bananas until you run out of room on your skewer, again starting and ending with strawberries.
step-6: set to the right of the other skewers.
step-7: bring to your party, serve, and enjoy!

step-1: spray a 12-cup muffin tin with nonstick spray.
step-2: in a large pot, melt the butter over medium heat.
step-3: add the marshmallows, and stir with a silicone spoon until completely melted.
step-4: add the graham cereal, and stir until evenly coated.
step-5: decrease the heat to low and leave the pot on the burner to keep the mixture warm.
step-6: using a 2-ounce ice cream scoop, transfer one scoop of the cereal mixture to a muffin cup.
step-7: let stand for 20 seconds to cool enough to handle, then use your fingers to press the ball into the bottom and up the side to mold it to the shape of the cup.
step-8: repeat with the remaining cereal mixture, working with one scoop at a time, then let all the cereal cups cool to room temperature.
step-9: you will have about 2 scoops-worth of cereal mixture leftover.
step-10: discard or save for another use.
step-11: divide the marshmallow fluff evenly among 3 small bowls.
step-12: stir 1 teaspoon of water into each bowl of fluff.
step-13: stir the red food coloring into one bowl, and stir the blue food coloring into a second bowl.
step-14: the third bowl will be plain white.
step-15: transfer each bowl of fluff to a small piping bag or plastic zip-top bag.
step-16: cut the bottoms or corners off each bag and fill 4 cereal cups with each color.
step-17: place the chocolate chips in a heatproof bowl and microwave until melted.
step-18: transfer the melted chocolate to a small piping bag or plastic zip-top bag.
step-19: cut the bottom or corner off the bag and drizzle the chocolate in a zigzag pattern over the top of each cup.
step-20: scatter the sprinkles evenly over each cup then refrigerate the cups to set the fluff filling, at least 30 minutes or up to 1 day.
step-21: stand a sparkler candle in the center of each cup, if you like, and light on fire just before serving.

step-1: cut steak into 8 mm (¼ inch) cubes.
step-2: toss with flour to coat evenly.
step-3: in a large stock pot or dutch oven, sear steak pieces in batches.
step-4: remove all steak and sauté 1 large carrot and 1 medium onion, diced, until translucent.
step-5: add steak back to the pot with carrots and onions.
step-6: pour over 240 ml (½ pint) of ale and 100 ml (½ cup) of stock.
step-7: add 2 sprigs of thyme.
step-8: simmer for 1-2 hours, the longer the better.
step-9: for the samosa dough, combine flour, 1 tbsp vegetable oil, 2 tsp minced rosemary, and 1 tsp salt.
step-10: add water, a splash at a time, working the flour into a dough.
step-11: you’ll end up using approximately 40 ml (3 tbsp).
step-12: let dough rest 30 minutes before using.
step-13: for minted mushy peas, in a food processor, whizz up frozen peas, greek yogurt, a bunch of mint, a squirt of lemon, and a pinch of salt.
step-14: to form the samosa, split the dough in half and then in half again.
step-15: take one of these quarters and roll it into a flat circle, about 2 mm (⅛ inch) thick.
step-16: cut this dough in half with a knife.
step-17: pick up 1 semi-circle, and wipe the flat edge with a wet finger.
step-18: fold this flat edge together to form a cone, pinch together the overlapping dough.
step-19: holding in one hand like a cone, fill 80% full with cooled samosa filling.
step-20: wipe the rim of the cone with a wet finger and pull together, pinching to seal.
step-21: shallow fry in approximately 3 cm (1 inch) of vegetable oil.
step-22: serve with minted mushy peas.

step-1: salt and pepper the steak on both sides, being sure to rub in the seasoning.
step-2: heat the oil in a pan over high heat until slightly smoking.
step-3: sear the steak for about 2 minutes per side.
step-4: rest the steak on a cutting board for 10 minutes.
step-5: slice the steak.
step-6: in a large bowl, combine the lettuce, eggs, avocados, cherry tomatoes, steak, and dressing.
step-7: toss the salad until evenly coated and serve.

step-1: place sliced potatoes in a large bowl.
step-2: toss with olive oil, salt, pepper, and paprika.
step-3: lay the potatoes on a baking sheet and bake at 450˚f (230˚c) for 20 minutes.
step-4: season skirt steak with salt and pepper.
step-5: cook on high heat for roughly three minutes each side, for medium-rare.
step-6: let the steak rest for 10 minutes, then slice into cubes.
step-7: in a cast iron skillet or baking sheet, arrange cooked potatoes into a heap.
step-8: top with steak, then cheddar and monterey jack cheese.
step-9: broil for five minutes or until the cheese is melted.
step-10: serve immediately with sour cream, salsa, green onions or any topping of choice.

step-1: preheat the oven to 300˚f (150˚c).
step-2: in a small bowl, combine 1 teaspoon of salt, the pepper, onion powder, paprika, garlic powder, chili powder, and cumin.
step-3: slice the potatoes on a mandolin or with a sharp knife into ¹⁄₁₆-inch (1 mm) thick slices.
step-4: transfer the potato slices to a large bowl and cover with water.
step-5: toss the potato slices around to remove excess starch, then drain the water.
step-6: sprinkle the remaining 2 teaspoons of salt onto the potato slices and toss, then drain any excess water.
step-7: sprinkle half the spice mixture over the potatoes and toss until well-coated.
step-8: invert a muffin tin and place the potato slices in between the muffin tin walls to create taco shapes.
step-9: if you have one, use a second muffin tin for the remaining potato slices, or repeat when finished baking the first batch.
step-10: bake the potato slices for 25 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-11: season the skirt steak with the remaining spice mix on both sides.
step-12: heat the oil in a large cast-iron skillet over high heat.
step-13: add the skirt steak and cook for 3 minutes on each side until it is seared with a golden brown crust.
step-14: remove the steak from the pan and let rest on a cutting board for 10 minutes.
step-15: once rested, cut the steak into ½-inch (1 cm) cubes.
step-16: sprinkle the cheese blend and steak into the potato taco shells.
step-17: bake for another 5 minutes or until cheese is melted.
step-18: serve with pico de gallo, guacamole, and sour cream.
step-19: garnish with chopped chives, if desired.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: cut zucchini in half, and scoop out the insides (repurpose for another dish).
step-3: place into baking dish.
step-4: season with olive oil, pepper, and salt.
step-5: bake for 20 minutes.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: while zucchini is baking, season steak with pepper and salt and sauté on medium-high heat until steak is browned and cooked through.
step-8: set aside.
step-9: in the same pan, season onions with pepper, salt, and olive oil and sauté for 5 minutes.
step-10: add peppers and mushrooms, and cook for another 5 minutes.
step-11: toss steak back into the cooked veggie and sauté for 1 minute.
step-12: distribute the steak and veggies among zucchini halves.
step-13: top with shredded cheese.
step-14: bake for 5 minutes, or until cheese is melted.

step-1: skewer 3-4 pieces of steak and asparagus in an alternating pattern on a bamboo skewer
step-2: repeat with remaining steak and asparagus.
step-3: heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
step-4: sear 3-4 skewers at a time, seasoning with salt and pepper, and flip when the undersides are a dark brown.
step-5: season the other side with salt and pepper, and cook for about 1 more minute.
step-6: cool and serve!

step-1: heat a greased cast-iron skillet over high heat.
step-2: when hot, add the steak.
step-3: sear on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side, until meat is cooked to desired temperature.
step-4: let steak rest for 5-10 minutes, then slice thinly against the grain.
step-5: while the steak is resting, prepare the eggs.
step-6: whisk 1 egg with ½ teaspoon water, ¼ teaspoon salt, and ¼ teaspoon black pepper.
step-7: (this step will be repeated with each of the 4 eggs).
step-8: heat a nonstick skillet over low heat.
step-9: melt 1 teaspoon of butter in the pan.
step-10: pour in the beaten egg and tilt the pan so the egg coats the pan in an even layer.
step-11: place 1 slice of cheese in the center.
step-12: use a spatula to fold the sides of the egg over the cheese until you have a square with the cheese covered in the middle.
step-13: slide the egg onto a biscuit.
step-14: top with a few slices of steak and the top biscuit half.
step-15: repeat with the rest of the eggs, biscuits, and steak.
step-16: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: season flank steak with olive oil, salt, pepper, cumin and chili powder.
step-3: heat a pan over high heat.
step-4: add the flank steak and cook for 3 minutes on each side.
step-5: remove the flank steak from the pan and let rest for 10 minutes.
step-6: turn heat down to medium.
step-7: add oil, garlic and onion to the pan.
step-8: cook until onions are translucent.
step-9: add the bell peppers, salt, and pepper, and cook for 5 minutes, until softened.
step-10: slice steak into ¼-inch (1 cm) cubes.
step-11: add the cubed steak and stir to combine.
step-12: remove from heat.
step-13: lay out one medium tortilla.
step-14: sprinkle mexican cheese in the center, place two tortilla chips side by side over it, place a 1-inch chunk of jack cheese over the tortilla chips and finally, add roughy two spoonfuls of fajita mix on top.
step-15: fold the top part of the tortilla over the mix and towards yourself, rotate the tortilla and repeat, creating folds as you go.
step-16: continue until the entire tortilla is folded towards the center.
step-17: flip over and place on a small baking pan.
step-18: cover with mexican blend cheese and bake for 25 minutes.
step-19: top with cilantro, serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 350f°/175°c.
step-2: mix the steak, salt, pepper, chili powder, garlic powder, and cumin in a bowl until evenly coated.
step-3: heat oil in a pan over very high heat, until barely smoking.
step-4: fry the steak for 30 seconds on each side, then rest on a cutting board for 5 minutes.
step-5: slice the steak into bite-size pieces.
step-6: in a large pan or skillet, lay down half of the tortilla chips, followed by half of the steak, peppers, onions, pepper jack, and cheddar.
step-7: repeat with the remaining ingredients.
step-8: bake for 15 minutes, until cheese is melted.

step-1: season skirt steak with olive oil, salt, pepper, chili powder, and cumin.
step-2: cook on high heat for roughly 3 minutes each side, for medium-rare.
step-3: let the steak rest for 10 minutes.
step-4: while the steak is resting, sauté onion and garlic until slightly translucent.
step-5: add bell peppers, jalapeño, salt, and pepper, cook slightly.
step-6: slice the steak into strips.
step-7: mix the steak into the pepper mix.
step-8: remove from heat and set aside.
step-9: in a clean pan, melt butter.
step-10: lay the tortilla on the buttered pan, add cheese, fajita mixture, more cheese, then top with another tortilla and pat it down.
step-11: flip the quesadilla over and cook the other side until it’s golden.
step-12: remove from pan and cut into quarters or eighths.
step-13: repeat these steps with the remaining tortillas.
step-14: serve immediately with sour cream, salsa, and guacamole.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a bit of oil, sauté onion, salt to taste, garlic, and bell peppers, until soft.
step-3: combine chili powder, paprika, cayenne, cumin, garlic powder, dried oregano, salt, and pepper in a dish.
step-4: use to season the flank steak on both sides.
step-5: lay the steak flat on a cutting board with the grain running up and down.
step-6: place sautéed onions and peppers in the middle of the steak, leaving an inch (2 ½ cm) or so on both ends.
step-7: cover the onions and peppers with a layer of monterey jack cheese.
step-8: tightly roll up the meat from left to right, ensuring that you will be cutting against the grain when you cut the meat.
step-9: stick toothpicks through the sides of the roll to help them hold their shape.
step-10: use a sharp knife to cut in between the toothpicks.
step-11: in a 4-quart jumbo cooker, cook over high heat until a nice crust has developed and flip.
step-12: repeat with the other side.
step-13: bake for 10 minutes, or until cooked to your preference.

step-1: preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
step-2: combine the steak, cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in a medium bowl and mix until the steak is evenly coated.
step-3: slide a piece of steak down a skewer, followed by a piece of green pepper, red pepper, and onion.
step-4: continue until there is a 1-inch gap on the top of the skewer.
step-5: repeat with the remaining skewers.
step-6: grease the surface of the grill by rubbing the grates with an oiled paper towel (use tongs to grip!
step-7: grill the skewers for 10-15 minutes with the lid closed, flipping them halfway through.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: slice the steak in half lengthwise then season all of the sides with the salt and pepper.
step-3: heat oil in a pan over extremely high heat until oil is slightly smoking.
step-4: sear the steak for about one minute, then flip.
step-5: add the butter, rosemary, and garlic, swirling the pan so that the butter melts.
step-6: tilt the pan towards you, and using a large spoon, constantly scoop the melted butter on top of the steak, basting it for about one minute.
step-7: note: this helps cook the top of the steak faster and provide more flavor.
step-8: sear the sides of the steak for about 30 seconds, then remove it from heat completely.
step-9: repeat with the other strip of steak.
step-10: cut the ends off the baguette and remove the insides using a knife.
step-11: once the steaks are completely cool, stuff the hollowed out baguettes with the steak.
step-12: place the baguettes on a baking sheet.
step-13: in a medium bowl, combine the melted butter, garlic, parmesan, and parsley, stirring until evenly combined.
step-14: spread the garlic butter evenly on top of the steak-stuffed baguettes.
step-15: bake for 15–20 minutes, depending on how you like your steak.
step-16: slice into 1 in (3 cm) bites.

step-1: make the tacos: slice the steak into ¼-inch (6-millimeter) thick strips.
step-2: add the steak to a medium bowl with the taco seasoning and toss to coat.
step-3: let marinate in the refrigerator for 1 hour.
step-4: preheat a large 12-inch (30-centimeter) cast iron skillet over high heat.
step-5: when the pan is hot, add the oil.
step-6: working in batches, cook the steak for about 2 minutes per side, or until the meat is browned and just cooked through.
step-7: remove from the pan and repeat with rest of meat.
step-8: to the same pan, add the onions and bell peppers, then reduce the heat to medium.
step-9: cook the vegetables until tender.
step-10: season with salt, then add the meat back to the pan and toss with the vegetables.
step-11: serve the fajitas in the pan with tortillas, shredded cheese, salsa, and avocado alongside.
step-12: make the next-day grain bowl: reheat the leftover fajitas in a medium pan over medium-high heat until warmed through.
step-13: divide the cooked quinoa between 2 bowls.
step-14: top with the fajitas, black beans, shredded cheese, avocado, and cilantro.

step-1: season the steaks on all sides with the salt and pepper.
step-2: heat oil in a pan or a skillet over high heat until smoking.
step-3: sear the steaks for about a minute to a minute and a half on each side, depending on the thickness of your steak for medium-rare.
step-4: if you would like your steak rarer or more well-done, cook your steak shorter or longer accordingly.
step-5: in the same pan, cook the asparagus with salt and pepper until tender but still slightly crunchy.
step-6: remove from heat.
step-7: after the steaks have rested for about 5 minutes, slice, then serve with the asparagus!

step-1: preheat oven to 250°f (120°c).
step-2: season the steak evenly with the salt and pepper on all sides.
step-3: place the steak on a wire rack on top of a baking sheet.
step-4: bake for 35 minutes.
step-5: heat the canola oil in a skillet or stainless steel pan over high heat until smoking.
step-6: sear the steak on one side for 30 seconds, then flip.
step-7: immediately, add the butter, thyme, rosemary, and garlic, swirling the pan to melt the butter quickly.
step-8: place the herbs and garlic on top of the steak, and push the steak toward the top of the pan.
step-9: tilt the pan toward you to pool the butter near the bottom.
step-10: using a spoon, continuously scoop the butter over the top of the steak for about 30–45 seconds.
step-11: this helps not only flavor the steak, but also helps cook the steak faster.
step-12: if you prefer your steak medium or medium-well, cook your steak longer.
step-13: to test the doneness of your steak, lightly press the tip of your left index finger to the tip of your left thumb.
step-14: the fleshy area below the thumb should feel how rare steak feels pressing the surface of the steak.
step-15: for medium-rare steak, touch your middle finger to your thumb and press the area below your thumb.
step-16: for medium, touch your fourth finger to your thumb.
step-17: for well done, touch your pinky to your thumb.
step-18: rest the steak for 10 minutes on a cutting board.
step-19: slice, then serve!

step-1: bring a medium pot with about 1 cup (240 ml) of water, just enough to cover the bottom of the pan by an inch (2 cm), to a boil.
step-2: add the beaten egg to a ramekin and sprinkle in a pinch of salt.
step-3: while slowly stirring with a fork, pour in the remaining water.
step-4: cover with foil and place the ramekin into the boiling water.
step-5: cover and steam for 12 minutes.
step-6: uncover, carefully remove the ramekin, and take off the foil.
step-7: top with chives if you like.

step-1: bring a large pan of water to boil and set a steamer basket on top.
step-2: place a plate inside the steamer basket.
step-3: peel the ginger with a spoon, then slice.
step-4: julienne half and set aside.
step-5: cut the green onions into 2-3 inch (5-7 cm) pieces.
step-6: thinly slice half and set aside.
step-7: on the plate in the steamer, place the sliced ginger and cut green onions.
step-8: place the whole fish on top and cover with the lid.
step-9: steam for 8-10 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through--check by poking a chopstick through the thickest part of the flesh.
step-10: remove the fish from the steamer and transfer to a serving platter.
step-11: make the sauce: in a small bowl, combine the sugar, soy sauce, and sesame oil.
step-12: mix well.
step-13: scatter the sliced green onions and julienned ginger over the fish, then pour the hot oil and sauce on top.

step-1: in a medium bowl, cream the butter and sugar with a flexible spatula until smooth, about 1 minute.
step-2: add the egg and vanilla and stir until well combined.
step-3: place a fine-mesh sieve over the bowl and sift in the flour.
step-4: fold with the spatula until the flour is fully incorporated and the dough comes together.
step-5: shape the dough into a disc, then cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate until firm, at least 30 minutes to overnight.
step-6: meanwhile using thick paper and a craft knife, cut out a round stencil of your choosing.
step-7: set aside.
step-8: cut a square from a double layer of cheesecloth.
step-9: place the cocoa powder in the center.
step-10: gather the edges, twist, and tie with kitchen string to create a sachet.
step-11: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-12: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-13: lightly dust a clean surface with flour.
step-14: place chilled dough on work surface and lightly dust with flour.
step-15: roll the dough out to ¼-inch (6-mm) thick, lifting and turning the dough as you roll to keep it from sticking.
step-16: using a 2-inch (5-cm) round cookie cutter, cut out rounds of dough.
step-17: gather scraps of dough and reroll to cut out more rounds, lightly dusting the work surface with flour as needed.
step-18: place the rounds on the prepared baking sheet, spacing 1 inch (2 ½ cm) apart.
step-19: place the stencil over a dough round, making sure to press down, and gently dab with the cocoa powder sachet to cover completely.
step-20: bake the cookies for 10 minutes, rotating baking sheet halfway through, until pale golden.
step-21: let cool for 5 minutes on the baking sheet, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.

step-1: preheat the oven to 325˚f (165˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, add the cream cheese, powdered sugar, milk, and 1 teaspoon of vanilla.
step-3: mix with a whisk or hand mixer until smooth.
step-4: set aside until ready to use.
step-5: on a cutting board, cut the crusts off the bread.
step-6: lay out 5 pieces of bread so they are slightly overlapping, then press the overlapping edges together to adhere.
step-7: repeat with the rest of the bread, you will have 7 strips of 5 pieces of bread.
step-8: in a small bowl, melt ¾ cups of butter.
step-9: add the granulated sugar and cinnamon and stir to combine.
step-10: brush the cinnamon butter mixture on one of the strips of bread.
step-11: spread the cream cheese filling on the strip of bread.
step-12: repeat with the rest of the strips of bread.
step-13: roll up one of the strips of bread, take that roll and roll it on to another strip of bread.
step-14: repeat until all of the strips have been rolled up into one large roll.
step-15: in a small saucepan over medium heat, mix together the remaining ¾ cup (170 g) butter, brown sugar, salt, remaining teaspoon vanilla, and honey until melted.
step-16: remove from heat.
step-17: pour ⅔ of the caramel mixture into an 8-inch (20 cm) round cake pan.
step-18: sprinkle the pecans on top of the caramel.
step-19: place the bread roll inside the pan on top of the caramel.
step-20: pour the rest of the caramel over the top of the roll.
step-21: bake for 40 minutes, until the top is crisp.
step-22: place a large plate over the top of the cake pan.
step-23: using oven mitts, invert the roll onto the plate, and remove the cake pan.
step-24: let cool for about 10 minutes before slicing.
step-25: serve immediately, with vanilla ice cream if desired!

step-1: combine the water, olive oil, honey, salt, flour, water and yeast in a large bowl.
step-2: mix well and knead for 10 -15 minutes, until the dough is elastic.
step-3: transfer the dough into a well-oiled bowl.
step-4: cover with a towel or plastic wrap and let rise for 1 hour in a warm place, until the dough has doubled in size.
step-5: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-6: cut the dough into 8 portions and shape into balls.
step-7: cover with a towel or plastic wrap.
step-8: set aside.
step-9: combine the butter, brown sugar, cinnamon, honey and salt in a small bowl and mix well.
step-10: spread the brown sugar mixture onto the bottom and sides of a cast iron pan.
step-11: line pecans on top of the mixture, and place the dough balls on top.
step-12: bake for 20-30 minutes
step-13: remove the sticky buns from the oven and allow to cool for 10-15 minutes before inverting onto a plate.

step-1: season the chicken with salt and pepper.
step-2: cut into bite-size chunks.
step-3: dunk each chicken piece in the egg yolk, followed by the cornflour.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: heat the oil in a deep saucepan until it reaches 190°c (375°f).
step-6: carefully fry the chicken pieces for around 5-6 minutes, until crispy, slightly golden in colour and cooked throughout.
step-7: drain onto a plate covered in kitchen roll.
step-8: in a large saucepan over a medium heat, add 1 tablespoon of oil and fry the onions and peppers for 2-3 minutes.
step-9: stir in the soy sauce, red wine vinegar, tomato paste, sugar, and chicken stock.
step-10: cook for a further 2 minutes.
step-11: add in cornflour paste.
step-12: mix until the sauce has thickened.
step-13: stir in the pineapple and chicken until evenly coated with the sauce.
step-14: serve with rice.

step-1: preheat oven to 200°c (400°f).
step-2: cut the chicken breasts into small bite-size pieces.
step-3: dip chicken pieces into egg mixture then coat with panko.
step-4: place the breaded chicken onto a baking sheet and season with salt and pepper.
step-5: bake 20 minutes until golden brown and cooked through.
step-6: mix together soy sauce, honey, garlic, hoisin sauce, sriracha and grated ginger in a saucepan and bring to boil, remove from heat.
step-7: toss chicken bites in the sauce until thoroughly coated.
step-8: serve immediately with chopped spring onion and sesame seeds.

step-1: using a sharp knife, carefully cut the pineapple in half lengthwise.
step-2: using the knife tip, cut around the inside edge of the pineapple, being careful not to cut through the skin.
step-3: slice down and across the pineapple flesh, then scoop out the pineapple cubes with a spoon.
step-4: discard the core and set the flesh aside
step-5: in a large pan, heat the oil over medium heat.
step-6: add the chicken and season with salt and pepper.
step-7: fry for about 10 minutes, until browned and cooked through.
step-8: remove the chicken and set aside.
step-9: add the cubed pineapple, hoisin sauce, soy sauce, brown sugar, and garlic paste and cook for a few minutes.
step-10: stir in the chicken stock, bring to a boil, then simmer, stirring occasionally, until the sauce has reduced and thickened
step-11: add the chicken back to the pan and stir until evenly coated with the sauce.
step-12: serve in the empty pineapple halves, along with some rice and sesame seeds.

step-1: pre-heat the oven to 180°c (350°f).
step-2: in a small bowl, steep the teabags in the hot water for about 5-10 minutes.
step-3: let cool and take the teabags out, keeping the water.
step-4: in a blender, blend the the medjool dates, cinnamon, nutmeg and teabag water to a smooth puree.
step-5: for the cake, in a large bowl add the butter and both sugars, cream together using a wooden spoon until light and fluffy.
step-6: next, beat in the eggs one by one, using a metal spoon.
step-7: fold in the flour, followed by the puree.
step-8: pour into a thoroughly greased bundt cake tin and smooth out the top.
step-9: bake in the oven for about 45 minutes, until golden brown and cooked through.
step-10: prepare the caramel sauce by melting the butter and two sugars together in a saucepan over a low-medium heat.
step-11: stir in the rum and double cream.
step-12: bring to the boil and simmer for about 5 minutes.
step-13: pour into a jug and leave to cool.
step-14: once the cake is ready, flip onto a cooling rack.
step-15: using a pastry brush, gently brush some of the caramel sauce all over the bundt cake so that it is completely covered.
step-16: this will help keep the cake nice and moist.
step-17: pour what’s left of the caramel over the top of the cake.

step-1: in a bowl, add the soy sauce, sesame oil, honey, rice vinegar, peanut butter, garlic, and ginger, and whisk to combine.
step-2: heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a wok or large pan over high heat.
step-3: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the cubed chicken and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
step-4: cook, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through, about 5 to 7 minutes.
step-5: transfer the chicken to the bowl, and wipe the wok clean.
step-6: heat 1 tablespoon of oil in the cleaned wok over high heat.
step-7: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the red onion, broccoli, and red cabbage, and cook, stirring frequently, for 3 minutes.
step-8: add the red bell peppers and snap peas and cook for 3 minutes, stirring frequently, until the peppers begin to soften.
step-9: add the carrots and cook for 2 minutes, stirring frequently.
step-10: add the chicken, cooked rice noodles, and sauce, and stir until fully incorporated.
step-11: serve with cilantro, scallions, and sesame seeds.

step-1: add the angel food cake mix and yellow cake mix to a jar.
step-2: place a cupcake liner over the cake mix and add the freeze-dried strawberries.
step-3: cover with the lid.
step-4: store in the pantry for up to 3 months.
step-5: when ready to eat, remove the lid and cupcake liner with the strawberries from the jar.
step-6: pour the water into the dry cake mix.
step-7: mix thoroughly, making sure to scrape the dry mix from the bottom of the jar.
step-8: microwave for 20 seconds.
step-9: pour the freeze-dried strawberries into the jar and gently stir to distribute throughout, being careful not to push all of the strawberries to the bottom.
step-10: microwave for another 40 seconds, until cooked through.
step-11: top with whipped cream and freeze-dried strawberries, if desired.
step-12: serve immediately.

step-1: follow instructions on cake mix to bake.
step-2: bake according to package.
step-3: while they bake, finely chop five to seven strawberries until they are almost a pulp.
step-4: cut the tops off of 12 strawberries.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: in a bowl, beat the whipping cream, chopped strawberries, and powdered sugar until the mixture forms stiff peaks when the beaters are lifted up.
step-7: set aside.
step-8: let the cupcakes cool completely, then cut a hole in each one about the width of a quarter (leave room at the bottom of the cupcake).
step-9: press a strawberry, pointed side down into each cupcake.
step-10: then top with whipped cream

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c)
step-2: prepare an ice bath and place a strainer over a medium bowl.
step-3: set nearby.
step-4: make the crème anglaise: in a small saucepan, heat the milk, heavy cream, ¼ cup (50 g) of sugar, and the vanilla bean pod over medium heat for 2-3 minutes, until it begins to steam.
step-5: remove the pan from the heat.
step-6: in a medium bowl, combine the egg yolks, remaining ¼ cup (50 g) of sugar, and the salt and whisk together.
step-7: continue whisking and ladle in the milk mixture.
step-8: once combined, return the saucepan to medium heat, begin to whisk the milk mixture, and slowly pour in the egg mixture.
step-9: cook the custard, continuously whisking to ensure the egg yolks don’t cook on the bottom, for about 5 minutes, until it coats the the back of a spoon.
step-10: set the bowl with the strainer in the ice bath and strain the creme into the bowl.
step-11: whisk until cooled, about 5 minutes.
step-12: cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.
step-13: add the strawberries, 2 tablespoons of sugar, and the lemon juice to a small saucepan.
step-14: cook over medium heat for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the strawberries are softened but still vibrant red.
step-15: remove the pan from the heat.
step-16: strain the strawberry mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a medium bowl.
step-17: use a spatula to press the berries through, making a strawberry puree.
step-18: discard the pulp and set the puree in the refrigerator to cool.
step-19: set 6 ramekins on a baking sheet and coat the insides with the softened butter.
step-20: sprinkle 2 tablespoons of sugar among the ramekins and shake each to coat the bottom and sides with sugar.
step-21: add the egg whites, cream of tartar, and salt to a large bowl.
step-22: using an electric hand mixer, beat the whites on medium-high speed until foamy.
step-23: add the remaining ⅓ cup (65 g) of sugar in small increments, continuing to beat until the whites are stiff and glossy.
step-24: using a spatula, carefully fold in the strawberry puree.
step-25: fill each ramekin with the strawberry-egg white mixture and level off the tops with a butter knife.
step-26: run a clean thumb around the inside edge of each ramekin to allow the soufflés to rise properly.
step-27: bake the soufflés for 10-12 minutes, until the tops are light brown.
step-28: avoid opening the oven prematurely, so the soufflés don’t fall.
step-29: serve the soufflés immediately with the crème anglaise poured over the top.

step-1: in a blender, combine frozen strawberries, frozen bananas, dairy-free ice cream, dairy-free milk, and ice cubes.
step-2: blend until combined.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: slice bread into bite-sized pieces.
step-3: in a bowl, whisk the eggs, milk, vanilla, cinnamon, and nutmeg until fully combined.
step-4: in a separate bowl, mix the cream cheese and powdered sugar until smooth.
step-5: whisk the egg mixture into the cream cheese mixture, and add the strawberries.
step-6: spread the bread evenly along the bottom of a greased 9x13 inch (33x23 cm) glass baking dish then pour the mixture over the bread.
step-7: bake 45 minutes or until bread is getting slightly crunchy and golden brown on top and edges.
step-8: top with whipped cream if desired.

step-1: in a 12-ounce (375 ml) mug or larger, mix all ingredients until just combined.
step-2: microwave on high for 90 seconds to 2 minutes, watching to make sure it doesn’t spill over (depending on the size of the mug).
step-3: let cool one minute before eating.
step-4: top with whipped topping and a strawberry (optional).

step-1: combine cake mix, strawberries, oil, and eggs in a mixing bowl.
step-2: add in cream cheese and lightly mix allowing the cream cheese to still be visible and not all the way mixed in.
step-3: using an ice cream scoop or your hand, form golf ball-sized balls of cookie dough and transfer to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-4: bake at 350°f (180°c) for 10-12 minutes.

step-1: make the ganache: in a medium bowl, combine the white chocolate and heavy cream.
step-2: microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring after each one, until the texture is silky and smooth.
step-3: refrigerate for 20 minutes.
step-4: place the pound cake on a cutting board and slice lengthwise into 4 equally thick pieces.
step-5: set the bottom piece of the cake down first on a small baking pan or serving platter.
step-6: spread an even layer of white chocolate ganache over the cake, then sprinkle with a layer of strawberries.
step-7: repeat making with the next two pieces of pound cake.
step-8: place the final piece of pound cake on top of the last strawberry layer and cover it with an even layer of white chocolate ganache.
step-9: refrigerate for 1 hour.
step-10: remove the cake from the refrigerator and place it on the edge of a cutting board sitting at the edge of your work surface.
step-11: use a serrated knife to cut the cake diagonally, lengthwise, creating two, right-angled pieces of cake.
step-12: use the edge of the cutting board to help guide your knife.
step-13: set the two right-angled pieces next to each other to form a triangle with the final layer of ganache and base cake piece at the center.
step-14: cover with whipped cream.
step-15: serve with strawberry topping.
step-16: pairs well with rosé.

step-1: hull the strawberries by using a straw to push out the stem of each strawberry.
step-2: cut strawberries in half and place on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and freeze until hardened.
step-3: add the frozen strawberries and honey to a food processor and combine until evenly mixed.
step-4: transfer to a loaf pan and transfer to freezer until completely frozen.

step-1: cut sweet potato into thin slices, about ¼ inch (6 mm) thick.
step-2: place in toaster and set it to the maximum cook time.
step-3: when it pops, flip the sweet potato slices over and toast 1 more time.
step-4: depending on the strength of your toaster and your preferences, you may need to toast it 1 more time after that.
step-5: remove from toaster and let cool enough to handle.
step-6: spread cream cheese evenly across sweet potato toast.
step-7: top with sliced strawberry and almonds.

step-1: prepare the coconut cream by whipping the coconut cream and icing sugar together, until you form soft peaks.
step-2: leave to chill in the fridge until set, for about 30 minutes.
step-3: meanwhile, preheat the oven to 180°c (350˚f) and line a cupcake tray with 12 cases.
