step-4: make the cupcakes by mixing the coconut oil, maple syrup, and almond milk together.
step-5: fold in the flour, baking powder, and salt.
step-6: spoon into the cupcake cases.
step-7: bake for 15 minutes, or until golden brown and springy to the touch.
step-8: while the cakes are baking, make the strawberry champagne syrup by bringing the sugar, water, strawberries, and champagne to the boil in a saucepan over a medium-high heat.
step-9: simmer until the syrup is slightly thicker and has changed colour to a deep red.
step-10: set aside.
step-11: take the cakes out of the oven and leave to cool slightly for a couple of minutes.
step-12: poke several holes in each one and pour about 2 teaspoons of the strawberry champagne syrup on top, so that it seeps into the holes and is glistening on top.
step-13: spoon the coconut cream on top and garnish with a strawberry.

step-1: mash the banana in a medium bowl.
step-2: mix the banana and the yogurt together until smooth.
step-3: pour in the almond milk, vanilla extract, chia seeds, and strawberries, and mix until well combined.
step-4: pour the mixture into an airtight container and refrigerate, covered for 4 hours..
step-5: spoon the pudding into desired serving dish and top with sliced bananas and diced strawberries.

step-1: spread the chocolate hazelnut spread evenly over the tortilla.
step-2: place the banana and strawberry slices on the top half of the tortilla.
step-3: fold the tortilla in half from the bottom, then fold in the sides, being careful not to tear the tortilla.
step-4: toast on medium-high, until golden brown.
step-5: watch to make sure it doesn’t burn.
step-6: let cool for 1-2 minutes before removing from the toaster.

step-1: place the coconut milk, strawberries, banana, and honey in a blender and blend until the mixture is smooth.
step-2: pour the coconut mixture into popsicle molds filled almost to the brim.
step-3: freeze the popsicles for at least 4 hours.
step-4: unmold the popsicles.

step-1: in a food processor or blender, add the eggs, milk, oil, vanilla, bananas, sugar, salt, and flour.
step-2: blend until the batter is smooth without clumps.
step-3: in a medium nonstick skillet over medium heat, melt the butter and swirl so it coats the entire pan.
step-4: then pour in ¼ cup of crepe batter and tilt the pan to cover the entire bottom.
step-5: cook until the bottom surface of the crepe begins to brown and the edges are lacey, for about 3 minutes, and then flip.
step-6: repeat with the remaining crepe batter.
step-7: in a food processor or blender, add the strawberries and puree until smooth.
step-8: pour the strawberry puree through a sieve into a medium bowl to remove any seeds and clumps.
step-9: chill for 15 minutes until the puree is cold.
step-10: in a large bowl, using a whisk or hand mixer, beat the cream until thickened.
step-11: add the powdered sugar, and beat until soft peaks form.
step-12: add half of the strawberry puree, and blend with the hand mixer.
step-13: add the rest of the strawberry puree and gently fold it into the whipped cream with a spatula.
step-14: dollop a bit of strawberry cream on a plate, then place the first crepe and frost with about ¼ cup of filling.
step-15: stack the remaining crepes on top of each other, with strawberry whipped cream between each layer.
step-16: spread the rest of the strawberry whipped cream on top of the last crepe.
step-17: arrange slices of strawberry on top for garnish.
step-18: slice and serve.

step-1: combine frozen fruit and yogurt in a food processor.
step-2: blend until smooth.
step-3: spread mixture onto an 8x8 (20 x 20cm) glass baking dish, and sprinkle on fresh strawberries.
step-4: cover and freeze for 2 hours.

step-1: cut bananas into coins and place in freezer in a sealable bag.
step-2: freeze overnight or until solid.
step-3: place all ingredients into a food processor or blender and blend until smooth.
step-4: pour contents into a loaf or small pan.
step-5: freeze one hour or until solid.

step-1: in a large mixing bowl combine the dry ingredients by sieve.
step-2: beat together the egg, milk and butter in a separate bowl, then combine with the dry ingredients.
step-3: gently whisk the mixture just enough to moisten the flour to be sure not to over mix.
step-4: transfer the batter into a larger squeeze bottle.
step-5: on a non-stick pan, squeeze a quarter-sized amount of the batter.
step-6: flip when bubbles rise and the bottom has browned.
step-7: when the pancakes are done, start assembly from bottom to top with a pancake, strawberry, banana.
step-8: repeat twice finishing with a pancake on the top and a skewer down the center.
step-9: note: feel free to use any fruit combinations to your liking.
step-10: finish with powdered sugar and maple syrup.

step-1: mix fruits together in a plastic bag.
step-2: seal bag and place in freezer for up to 6 months.
step-3: when ready, mix milk and fruit in a blender until consistency is smooth

step-1: put fruit in a freezer bag.
step-2: seal and store in freezer for up to 8 -12 months.
step-3: when ready to use, put milk, greek yogurt, and frozen fruit into a blender and mix until consistency is smooth.

step-1: preheat the oven to 180°c (350°f).
step-2: prepare the brownie mix, following instructions on the box.
step-3: pour into a greased 9-inch (23 cm) spring form tin.
step-4: bake in the oven for 20 minutes and leave to cool.
step-5: prepare the cheesecake filling by whisking the cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla extract until smooth.
step-6: scatter the gelatin over the hot water, mix together, and combine into the cheesecake filling.
step-7: spread on top of the brownie base.
step-8: chill for 4-6 hours, until set.
step-9: spread the whipped cream on top.
step-10: place strawberries on top.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a large mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, yogurt, honey, strawberries, and coconut oil until well combined.
step-3: add the flour, baking powder, and salt, and fold the batter together using a rubber spatula.
step-4: stop folding once all of the dry ingredients have disappeared into the batter.
step-5: using a medium ice cream scoop, pour one scoop full of batter into each well of a greased muffin tin.
step-6: bake for for 20-25 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean.

step-1: in a pot over medium-high heat, reduce strawberries and water until there is a jam-like consistency and much of the liquid is evaporated.
step-2: reduce the heat to low, add butter, condensed milk, and white chocolate, stirring continuously until you can see the bottom of the pot for 2-3 seconds when dragging a spatula through.
step-3: pour onto a greased plate, then chill for 1 hour.
step-4: shape and roll the chilled mixture into balls.
step-5: roll the balls in sprinkles.

step-1: microwave the marshmallows and cream cheese in a bowl, stirring every 15 seconds, until fully melted.
step-2: add cereal into the bowl and mix until fully coated.
step-3: let the mixture cool to room temperature.
step-4: add dried strawberries and yogurt chips.
step-5: mix just until combined.
step-6: line a baking dish with parchment paper and pour the cooled mixture into the pan.
step-7: press into the edges of the pan and top with more yogurt chips.
step-8: cool in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours.
step-9: cut and serve.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the eggs and vegetable oil.
step-2: add the cake mix and mix until smooth.
step-3: in a separate large bowl, combine the cream cheese, powdered sugar, and vanilla extract.
step-4: whisk until smooth.
step-5: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-6: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-7: using a medium ice cream scoop, scoop half of the strawberry cookie dough onto the prepared baking sheet and flatten slightly with the back of the scoop.
step-8: with a small ice cream scoop, scoop the cream cheese mixture onto the middle of the strawberry cookies.
step-9: scoop the remaining strawberry cookie dough with the medium scoop on top of the cream cheese.
step-10: bake for 15 minutes or until the bottom of the cookies easily releases from the parchment.
step-11: serve warm!

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a bowl, whisk the eggs until pale yellow, about 2 minutes.
step-3: add in the 1½ cups (300 grams) sugar and whisk again until combined.
step-4: mix in oil, baking powder, salt, and vanilla.
step-5: add in flour, and fold until smooth and combined.
step-6: pour the batter on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and spread evenly.
step-7: gently tap the baking sheet on the counter to release any air bubbles.
step-8: bake for 10-15 minutes, or until cooked through.
step-9: lay out a kitchen towel and sprinkle with powdered sugar.
step-10: once the cake is done, invert it onto the towel and lift the towel to roll the cake into a log.
step-11: the towel will wrap into the cake.
step-12: refrigerate cake for 30 minutes.
step-13: in a bowl, mix the cream cheese, remaining sugar, and vanilla.
step-14: set aside.
step-15: place the cake on the counter and unroll.
step-16: spread the cream cheese mixture in an even layer over the cake and top with sliced strawberries.
step-17: tightly roll the cake bake up, this time just using the towel as a guide.
step-18: top with powdered sugar.
step-19: slice and serve.

step-1: spread cream cheese onto each graham cracker.
step-2: top with strawberries.
step-3: drizzle with honey.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (175˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, combine softened cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla extract until well-incorporated.
step-3: gently fold half of the strawberries into the mixture.
step-4: open the crescent rolls and separate into individual triangles.
step-5: drop one tablespoon of the mixture onto the wide end of the triangle and roll, starting at the wide edge.
step-6: place on a baking sheet that has been lined with parchment paper.
step-7: bake for 13 minutes or until golden brown (times and temperatures may vary based on oven).
step-8: to make a strawberry glaze, mash the rest of the strawberries and powdered sugar.
step-9: continue mashing until all of the sugar has dissolved.
step-10: drizzle glaze over crescent roll and sprinkle powdered sugar on top.

step-1: combine the cream cheese, powdered sugar, strawberries, and vanilla extract in a bowl and mix until there are no large lumps of cream cheese.
step-2: spread a large spoonful of the mixture in the center of two bread slices, then cover and press with the other two bread slices to make two “sandwiches.”
step-3: in a separate bowl, beat the eggs with the milk, sugar, and cinnamon until the cinnamon is evenly distributed.
step-4: melt half of the butter in a pan over medium heat.
step-5: dip one of the sandwiches into the egg mixture on both sides, dripping off excess, then place it into the hot pan.
step-6: cook until both side are golden brown, then repeat with the remaining butter and the other sandwich.
step-7: sprinkle with powdered sugar and serve with strawberries!

step-1: whisk eggs, cinnamon, vanilla and milk together in medium-large bowl to create egg wash.
step-2: in medium bowl mix cream cheese, vanilla, sugar, lemon juice and heavy cream (optional).
step-3: take 2 slices of bread and spread mixture on both.
step-4: press sliced strawberries on both slices & press together.
step-5: dunk in egg wash.
step-6: melt butter in a skillet on medium-low heat and cook bread for 2-3 minutes or until crumbs are crispy and bread is more solid.
step-7: stack and garnish with strawberries and confectioners sugar.
step-8: add maple syrup to preference.

step-1: make the filling: in a large bowl, use a spatula to combine the cream cheese, powdered sugar, and the vanilla extract.
step-2: mix together until fluffy and smooth.
step-3: lay out a piece of plastic wrap and arrange 4 rows of 2 whole slices of brioche bread.
step-4: cut 2 pieces of brioche bread in half and add to the end of each row.
step-5: beat 1 egg in a small bowl.
step-6: brush egg wash on the left side of each piece of bread, except for the farthest left pieces in each row.
step-7: overlap the right edges over the egg wash and press to adhere.
step-8: brush egg was along the bottom of each row of bread, except for the bottom row.
step-9: overlap the top edges of each row over the egg wash and press to adhere.
step-10: use a spatula to spread an even layer of the filling over the bread.
step-11: distribute the strawberries over the filling.
step-12: using the plastic wrap for help, roll up the bread.
step-13: twist the ends of the plastic to seal.
step-14: freeze for 1 hour.
step-15: in a medium bowl, whisk together the remaining 3 eggs, the milk, sugar, and cinnamon.
step-16: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-17: remove the roll from the freezer.
step-18: remove plastic wrap and transfer to a greased baking sheet.
step-19: brush all over with the cinnamon egg mixture.
step-20: bake for 12 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-21: remove from oven.
step-22: dust with powdered sugar, slice, and serve with a drizzle of maple syrup.

step-1: in a large bowl, add the cream and condensed milk, then whip until soft peaks form.
step-2: add the cream cheese, strawberries, and strawberry jam, and mix thoroughly.
step-3: gently fold the crackers into the mixture, then transfer to baking pan (top with crackers if desired).
step-4: freeze for 3-4 hours.

step-1: in a large bowl, blend cream cheese with an electric mixer until smooth.
step-2: mix in the ice cream and blend well.
step-3: add graham cracker crumbs and strawberries and mix into the ice cream.
step-4: in a parchment-lined 9x9-inch (23x23-cm) pan, pour in the ice cream mixture and even out the surface.
step-5: freeze for 4-6 hours or until frozen.
step-6: in a small bowl, melt the dark chocolate until smooth.
step-7: lift ice cream out using the parchment, then cut into desired size.
step-8: evenly coat each piece with the melted chocolate and immediately sprinkle with graham cracker crumbs.
step-9: place back in the freezer for 30 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 285ºf (140ºc).
step-2: in a medium bowl, beat the egg whites until frothy.
step-3: keep beating and slowly add sugar until stiff peaks form.
step-4: sift powdered sugar and almond flour over the egg whites.
step-5: fold the dry mixture into the egg whites, giving the bowl a quarter turn every third fold.
step-6: make sure to not overmix or the macarons will not rise.
step-7: once the batter reaches a lava-like consistency, transfer half the batter to another bowl and add the food coloring.
step-8: mix until just combined.
step-9: do not overmix!
step-10: working quickly, put the white and pink batters into separate sandwich bags.
step-11: cut the corner off of each bag and squeeze the two batters evenly into a larger gallon-size bag or piping bag to create the multicolor effect.
step-12: pipe 1½-inch (4 cm) dollops onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper (tip: take a little batter to “glue:” down the edges of the parchment paper so it stays put).
step-13: let the cookies rest for 30 minutes to an hour, until they are no longer wet to the touch and a skin forms on top.
step-14: while resting, make the filling by mixing the cream cheese, powdered sugar and milk in a bowl until smooth.
step-15: transfer to a piping bag and set aside until ready to fill.
step-16: when the cookies are dry to the touch, bake for 13 to 15 minutes until they have risen to form a “foot.”
step-17: let rest for 10 minutes before filling.
step-18: to fill, pipe a circle of the cream cheese mixture around the edge of one cookie and place a small dollop of jam in the center.
step-19: sandwich with another macaron.
step-20: macarons are best kept refrigerated until serving.

step-1: in a large bowl, beat cream cheese, sugar, egg, and vanilla extract until smooth.
step-2: add in the strawberry jam and fresh strawberries, and beat until combined.
step-3: using a spatula or wooden spoon, stir in the pancake mix and flour until fully incorporated.
step-4: (the dough will be sticky and pink in color.)
step-5: turn the dough out onto a well-floured surface and sprinkle the top with more flour.
step-6: press out dough until it is about half an inch thick.
step-7: with a round cookie cutter, drinking glass, or mason jar lid, cut the dough in as many circles as will fit.
step-8: in the center of each circle, cut a smaller circle with a cookie cutter or shot glass.
step-9: remove the cut donuts to another floured surface and gather up excess dough.
step-10: repeat steps 5 through 7 until all the dough is used up.
step-11: heat oil in a large pot to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-12: carefully place a few donuts in the hot oil, being careful not to crowd the pot.
step-13: once the bottom is browned, flip the donut over in the oil and cook the other side.
step-14: once both sides are browned, remove the donut and place it on a rack to cool.
step-15: for the frosting: beat cream cheese in a bowl until smooth.
step-16: add powdered sugar and continue to beat until fully incorporated, then add vanilla extract, and finally add milk.
step-17: dunk the tops of the donuts in the frosting and garnish with slices of fresh strawberries.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (175°c).
step-2: spray a 9x9-inch (23x23 cm) baking pan with cooking spray.
step-3: take 5 of the graham crackers and arrange them in the pan, breaking some of them to fill in the gaps.
step-4: crush the remaining graham cracker and set aside.
step-5: pour the vanilla cake batter on the graham cracker base.
step-6: bake for 25-30 minutes until an inserted toothpick comes out clean.
step-7: using the back of a wooden spoon, poke 4 rows of 4 holes in the cake, making 16 holes total.
step-8: in a large bowl, mash strawberries with a whisk until very fine.
step-9: add cream cheese and condensed milk, whisking until there are no large lumps.
step-10: add the milk, stirring until smooth.
step-11: pour the mixture over the cake and set until the cake has absorbed as much of the mixture as it can.
step-12: some of the mixture will still stay on top, which is okay.
step-13: spread the whipped topping evenly on top.
step-14: chill the cake anywhere from 3 hours to overnight.
step-15: slice, and serve with strawberries and the reserved graham cracker crumbs.

step-1: cut the center out of the pound cake, leaving a half-inch border on the bottom and along each side.
step-2: in a medium bowl, use a hand mixer to beat together the cream cheese, powdered sugar, and lemon zest until the mixture is smooth.
step-3: add the strawberries and beat until the mixture has turned a light pink color but there are still nice strawberry chunks.
step-4: pour the cream cheese mixture into the hollowed-out pound cake shell.
step-5: using the removed pieces of pound cake, crumble bits of cake on top of the cheesecake mixture to form a thick layer of crumbs.
step-6: refrigerate for at least 8 hours.
step-7: be careful when filling the pound cake and when transferring to the refrigerator.
step-8: cutting the border too thin may cause the sides to spread too far once the cheesecake mixture is added.
step-9: you can simply place the pound cake on a plate or tray before filling to make the transfer to the refrigerator easier.
step-10: use something to prop up the sides in case they’ve bowed out too much, to prevent breaking.
step-11: once the filling has set in the fridge, it will hold its shape.
step-12: slice into 10 half-inch (1 cm) slices and serve.

step-1: in a small saucepan, heat milk on medium-low heat until scalding around 180˚f (82˚c).
step-2: do not boil the milk.
step-3: pour hot milk over chocolate.
step-4: add vanilla and salt.
step-5: let it stand for 3 minutes to soften.
step-6: whisk together until fully incorporated.
step-7: let cool.
step-8: add yogurt.
step-9: whisk together until fully incorporated.
step-10: layer chocolate in the bottom of 2 cups followed by strawberries.
step-11: repeat until the glasses are full.

step-1: in a mason jar, fill with rolled oats, almond milk, greek yogurt, cocoa powder, and maple syrup.
step-2: stir until well combined.
step-3: place diced strawberries on top and seal jar.
step-4: soak the oats overnight.
step-5: place in fridge until ready to eat.

step-1: add strawberries, cucumber, ice, and coconut water to a blender and blend until well combined.
step-2: pour into a glass and garnish with a cucumber slice.

step-1: place the strawberries in a blender and blend until pureed.
step-2: add the vanilla extract, coconut oil, and softened cream cheese, and blend until the texture is silky smooth.
step-3: line a 12-cup muffin with liners (we used silicone liners) or grease with coconut oil.
step-4: divide the mixture between the cups.
step-5: freeze for 2 hours or until solid.
step-6: store in the freezer.

step-1: in a medium bowl, mix the cream cheese, 1 tablespoon of honey, and strawberries until smooth.
step-2: microwave the cream cheese mixture in 30 second intervals for a total of 5 minutes, stirring between each interval.
step-3: this helps cook out the moisture so that the mixture doesn’t create a large pocket of steam in the bread.
step-4: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-5: in a bowl, mash the bananas with a fork.
step-6: add the eggs and mix until well combined and frothy.
step-7: add the greek yogurt and honey, and mix until incorporated.
step-8: sprinkle in the whole wheat flour, baking soda, and baking powder, and fold the batter together with a spatula.
step-9: pour ¾ of the banana bread batter into a greased loaf pan, smoothing it into an even layer with the spatula.
step-10: pour in the cream cheese filling, making sure to keep it away from the edge of the pan.
step-11: pour the remaining banana bread batter over the cream cheese filling and smooth the top with a spatula.
step-12: bake for 50-55 minutes, until the top springs back when lightly touched.
step-13: let the pan cool for 15 minute before removing the loaf from the pan.
step-14: allow the bread to cool at least 1 hour before slicing and serving.

step-1: roll each slice of bread flat with a rolling pin.
step-2: carefully cut off the crusts.
step-3: spread desired amount of cream cheese and strawberries along the edge of the bread, and roll up.
step-4: in a bowl, combine eggs, milk, cinnamon, and vanilla.
step-5: dip each roll-up in egg mixture, and pan fry in a buttered skillet until all sides are golden brown.

step-1: in a food processor or blender, puree the strawberries until smooth.
step-2: pour the strawberry puree through a sieve into a medium bowl to remove any seeds and clumps.
step-3: chill for 15 minutes, until the puree is cold.
step-4: in a separate large bowl, beat the cream cheese and ½ cup (80 g) of powdered sugar together with an electric hand mixer.
step-5: mix in the milk and strawberry puree.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: in a small bowl, whisk the beaten egg and water together.
step-8: set aside.
step-9: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-10: roll a foot-long (30 cm) piece of aluminum foil into a tube.
step-11: repeat with 3 more pieces of foil to make 4 tubes total.
step-12: on a cutting board, roll the puff pastry out to 13 inches (33 cm) by 13 inches (33 cm).
step-13: slice the puff pastry lengthwise into 1½ inch-wide (4 cm) strips.
step-14: wrap 2 of the strips around a foil tube, brushing the edges with egg wash and gently pressing together to adhere.
step-15: repeat with the remaining pastry strips and foil tubes.
step-16: balance the ends of the foil tubes over the edges of a roasting pan or baking sheet so the pastry isn’t touching the surface of the pan.
step-17: brush egg wash all over the pastry spirals.
step-18: bake for 25 minutes, until golden brown.
step-19: let the pastry tubes rest at room temperature for 5 minutes.
step-20: gently remove the foil tubes.
step-21: transfer the pastry tubes to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake for 5 more minutes.
step-22: let cool to room temperature.
step-23: fill a piping bag or zip-top bag fitted with a round tip with the cream cheese mixture.
step-24: pipe the cream cheese filling into the pastry tubes.
step-25: dust with powdered sugar and drizzle with chocolate syrup.

step-1: in a large bowl, add the melted butter, sugar, and eggs.
step-2: whisk to combine, then add the milk and whisk to incorporate.
step-3: sift in the flour and salt and whisk until smooth.
step-4: heat a small nonstick skillet over medium heat.
step-5: scoop ¼ cup (60 g) of the batter into the pan.
step-6: swirl the pan around until the batter evenly coats the bottom.
step-7: cook until the surface begins to bubble slightly and the edges brown, about 3 minutes.
step-8: flip the crepe and cook on the other side for another 1-2 minutes.
step-9: remove from the skillet and set aside to cool.
step-10: repeat with the remaining batter.
step-11: spread whipped cream over 1 crepe and top with sliced strawberries in a pattern of your choice.
step-12: fold another crepe in half and cut out a half-heart shape on the folded edge.
step-13: unfold the crepe and place over the first crepe.
step-14: repeat with the rest of the crepes.

step-1: preheat oven 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: slice each biscuit into 8 pieces and place in a greased baking dish.
step-3: in a saucepan on medium heat, combine strawberry filling ingredients and cook until it reaches a boil.
step-4: reduce heat to a simmer and continue to cook until filling reaches a smooth consistency.
step-5: remove from heat and set aside.
step-6: combine egg mixture ingredients in a large bowl until well-incorporated.
step-7: place biscuits in a greased baking dish and spread the egg mixture evenly on top.
step-8: top with strawberry filling and the fresh quartered strawberries.
step-9: bake for 40-50 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-10: slice and serve with whipped cream.

step-1: to a blender add the strawberries, strawberry sorbet, and lemonade.
step-2: blend until smooth.
step-3: serve immediately to drink or freeze for 30 minutes to eat with a spoon.

step-1: place strawberries and honey in a food processor or blender and puree into a thick, smooth sauce.
step-2: pour the sauce onto a baking tray lined with a silicone baking mat and smooth into a thin, even layer.
step-3: bake for 6 hours at 175ºf (80ºc), until entire surface is just dry to the touch.
step-4: once cool, turn the baking mat onto a cutting board and remove the silicone baking mat.
step-5: roll the fruit sheet and cut into 1-inch (2 cm) pieces.
step-6: note: if your fruit sheet comes out a bit too dry and you worry that rolling will cause it to crack, simply cover the surface with a few damp paper towels for a few minutes and try again.
step-7: the moisture will rehydrate your fruit sheet just enough to be a flexible consistency.

step-1: place the strawberries, lettuce, beet, and ginger in a blender or food processor and blend until just combined.
step-2: add in the ice and continue to blend until the mixture is smooth.
step-3: serve immediately.

step-1: add the strawberries to food processor and purée into a smooth paste.
step-2: add the strawberry purée to a small saucepan with the simple honey syrup.
step-3: simmer over medium heat for 5 minutes, until slightly reduced.
step-4: let cool completely, then strain into an airtight glass container and store in the refrigerator for up to 2 months.
step-5: to serve, mix 1-2 tablespoons of strawberry syrup with 8 ounces of seltzer water in a glass over ice.
step-6:
nutrition, per 1 tablespoon
calories: 16 
sugars: 4 grams

step-1: in a large bowl, whip the cream until soft peaks form.
step-2: add the condensed milk, then whip until smooth.
step-3: fold in the strawberries.
step-4: transfer the mixture to a baking pan or bowl, then freeze.
step-5: serve with strawberries.

step-1: combine all ingredients in a food processor until smooth.
step-2: transfer to an 8x8-inch (20x20 cm) glass dish.
step-3: freeze for at least 2 hours.

step-1: in a blender, combine the strawberries, 1 cup (180 g) kiwi, wine, lemonade, and vodka and blend until smooth.
step-2: place 1 slice of kiwi in each ice pop mold.
step-3: pour the mixture into the ice pop molds, seal with the lids, and add the ice pop sticks.
step-4: freeze until solid, at least 4 hours, or overnight.
step-5: carefully remove the ice pops from the molds.

step-1: pour all ingredients into a blender and blend until smooth.
step-2: garnish with a kiwi slice.

step-1: combine water, sugar, and strawberries in a pot over medium heat.
step-2: once the sugar has dissolved, simmer for 30 minutes and reduce.
step-3: pour simple syrup through a strainer and remove excess liquid, then let it cool to room temperature.
step-4: in a blender, combine simple syrup, strawberries, and kiwi.
step-5: blend until well-combined.
step-6: pour into an 8×8 inch (20x20 cm) baking dish and freeze for at least 12 hours.
step-7: take out of the freezer and let sit for 5-10 minutes before scooping.
step-8: serve.

step-1: preheat your oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: grease three 8-inch (20 cm) tins with butter or cooking spray, then sprinkle with flour to cover all sides, shaking off any excess.
step-3: cut out three rounds of parchment paper to fit in the bottom of each tin.
step-4: in a large mixing bowl, combine the eggs and sugar and use a hand mixer to beat until it has tripled in volume and is thick and pale yellow in color.
step-5: continue blending and gradually add the olive oil.
step-6: add the vanilla extract, lemon zest, lemon juice, and milk, and mix until smooth.
step-7: sift in the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
step-8: using a rubber spatula or wooden spoon, gently incorporate into the liquid batter until just combined.
step-9: be careful not to over-mix.
step-10: evenly divide the batter into the three baking tins.
step-11: bake for 20-25 minutes, until cakes are lightly golden and fork comes out clean from the center.
step-12: allow cakes to cool into the pan for 10 minutes before transferring to a baking rack to cool completely.
step-13: using a hand mixer, whisk the heavy whipping cream until soft peaks form.
step-14: add in the strawberry jam whisking together until fully incorporated and peaks are stiff.
step-15: keep in the fridge until ready to use.
step-16: to assemble, start with a bottom layer of cake.
step-17: cover top with a generous amount of icing, followed by an even layer of sliced strawberries.
step-18: repeat with the remaining layers.
step-19: finish the cake by icing the top and sides with icing, and garnishing the top with remaining strawberries.
step-20: store in the fridge until ready to serve.

step-1: combine all ingredients in a blender, and mix until fully blended.
step-2: serve and garnish with a lemon wedge.

step-1: in a food processor, combine the flour, freeze-dried strawberries, sugar, and 1 teaspoon of salt.
step-2: pulse until the strawberries are fully incorporated into the flour.
step-3: add the butter and pulse until it breaks down into pea-sized pieces.
step-4: do not over-mix.
step-5: add the ice water 1 tablespoon at a time, pulsing between each addition, until the dough just holds together.
step-6: transfer the dough to a clean work surface and divide into 2 discs, one slightly larger than the other.
step-7: cover with plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator while you prepare the filling.
step-8: in a medium pot over medium heat, combine the sliced strawberries, lemon curd, and a pinch of salt.
step-9: bring to a light boil, stirring occasionally.
step-10: add the cornstarch slurry and simmer for 5-10 minutes, or until the filling thickens.
step-11: remove from the heat and let cool.
step-12: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-13: remove the larger disc of dough from the fridge and sprinkle with flour.
step-14: roll out to about ⅛ inch (3 mm) thick and transfer to a greased 9½-inch (24-cm) pie dish, pressing down to form the bottom crust.
step-15: cut off any excess dough around the edges and set aside.
step-16: chill the bottom crust while you roll out the top.
step-17: roll out the smaller dough disc.
step-18: cut 6 1-inch-wide (2-cm) strips from the dough and place on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-19: combine all of the excess dough, re-roll it, and use a cookie cutter to cut out shapes of your choosing.
step-20: add to the baking sheet and chill the strips and shapes for 5 minutes.
step-21: remove the bottom crust from the fridge and poke holes all over the bottom with a fork.
step-22: pour the strawberry filling into the crust.
step-23: lay 3 of the dough strips vertically and evenly spaced across the top of the pie, and lay the other 3 horizontally.
step-24: place a cutout shape at the intersection of every vertical and horizontal strip.
step-25: trim the edges of the dough, then crimp with a fork all the way around.
step-26: brush the crust with the beaten egg, then sprinkle with turbinado sugar.
step-27: bake for 30-40 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown.
step-28: let cool, then chill in the refrigerator until ready to serve.

step-1: in a large pitcher, combine the strawberries, lemon, wine, rum, and lemonade.
step-2: stir until mixed.
step-3: chill for at least 4 hours.
step-4: add the champagne, then serve with a lemon slice on each glass.

step-1: to a pitcher, add apple slices, lemon slices, strawberry slices, rum, and white wine.
step-2: top with lemon-lime soda.
step-3: chill for at least 4 hours.
step-4: pour into wine glasses and garnish with lemon wheels and a strawberries.

step-1: fill a food processor with heavy cream, condensed milk, and strawberries.
step-2: close the top and blend for 30 seconds.
step-3: use a funnel or carefully pour the ice cream mixture into a large squeeze bottle and tighten the lid.
step-4: layout a large thick cloth on top of your cooking area to protect the surface from the liquid nitrogen’s low temperature.
step-5: using insulated gloves, fill a stainless steel bowl with liquid nitrogen and set it on top of the thick insulated cloth.
step-6: use the squeeze bottle to squeeze the mix at a constant drip into the liquid nitrogen.
step-7: fill the bowl with droplets and allow the liquid nitrogen to boil off.
step-8: once all the liquid has boiled over from the bottom, serve.

step-1: line a baking tray with parchment paper.
step-2: using a fine mesh sieve, sift together the almond flour and powdered sugar in a medium bowl.
step-3: discard any large pieces that remain in the sieve.
step-4: in a medium mixing bowl, beat the egg whites with an electric hand mixer on medium speed until soft peaks form.
step-5: add a third of the granulated sugar and with mixer on high, continue to beat until egg whites are stiff peaks.
step-6: add another third of the sugar and beat again until egg whites are back to stiff peaks.
step-7: repeat with the remaning sugar, beating until whites are shiny and fluffy.
step-8: add the sifted flour and sugar to the bowl with the egg whites.
step-9: add 2 drops of food coloring.
step-10: with a rubber scraper, fold the mixture into the egg whites, about 35-45 strokes, or until the batter falls on itself but a slight peak remains.
step-11: note: do not over-mix or batter will be too thin and runny.
step-12: fill a piping bag fitted with a round tip.
step-13: pipe batter onto prepared baking tray into 3-inch (8 cm) disks.
step-14: lift and drop the baking tray onto a hard surface 2-3 times to smooth out the batter and knock out any air bubbles.
step-15: allow macarons to rest at room temperature for one hour, until a skin forms on the surface.
step-16: preheat oven to 275˚f (140˚c).
step-17: after about one hour, gently brush the top a macaron with your finger to check that a skin has formed.
step-18: the batter should not stick to your finger, if it does, allow to set for an additional 15 minutes.
step-19: bake cookies in preheated oven for 15 minutes, or until the macarons peel away from the parchment when lifted.
step-20: allow the macaron shells to cool completely.
step-21: using a small ice cream scoop, scoop ice cream and put onto the bottom side of the macaron shell.
step-22: place raspberries in between ice cream scoops, and sandwich together with a similarly sized macaron.

step-1: pour the champagne into an 8-ounce (235 ml) champagne flute.
step-2: add the mango juice and drop in 1 stemmed strawberry.
step-3: garnish with the other strawberry and serve.

step-1: slice strawberries and place them and the water in a small saucepan over medium heat and bring to a simmer.
step-2: cook until strawberries are soft, about 5 minutes.
step-3: pass mixture through a fine mesh strainer and cool.
step-4: combine cooled strawberry mixture with milk then serve.

step-1: put all ingredients into a blender and mix until smooth.
step-2: serve in a glass and garnish with toppings (optional).

step-1: to a short glass, add strawberry slices and orange slices.
step-2: muddle until juicy.
step-3: add ice and fill the glass ¾ of the way with rosé.
step-4: top with sparkling water.
step-5: garnish with an orange wheel and a strawberry.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: unroll pie crusts and cut in half.
step-3: cut out a 5-inch-wide (12-cm) square in each half.
step-4: rotate the squares to resemble diamond shapes.
step-5: use leftover pie crust to cut out 4 small hearts with a heart-shaped cookie cutter.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: fold four sheets of aluminum foil into small rectangles.
step-8: using your finger, slightly open the inside of each rectangle.
step-9: place the foil packets in the center of each pie crust diamond.
step-10: dip your finger with water and wet the edges of the left, bottom, and right flaps.
step-11: apply cooking spray to the tops of the aluminum foil packets.
step-12: following the folds of a real envelope, close the flaps over the foil, leaving the upper flap open.
step-13: wet one side of the pastry hearts and arrange them wet side down onto the folded edges of the pastry envelopes.
step-14: place pastries onto parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-15: brush with egg wash and sprinkle with sparkling sugar.
step-16: bake for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-17: place a piece of aluminum foil over the top flaps of the envelopes if they begin to brown before the rest of the envelope.
step-18: cool completely before stuffing with strawberry slices.

step-1: discard the green tops of the strawberries and slice the peaches.
step-2: in a saucepan, dissolve sugar in water.
step-3: add the strawberries and peaches.
step-4: bring to a rolling boil and reduce to medium heat.
step-5: boil for approximately 15 minutes, or until the strawberries become pale and the peaches are soft.
step-6: strain the syrup and refrigerate for 2 hours, or until cooled.
step-7: discard boiled fruit.
step-8: in a pitcher, combine the cooled syrup, sliced extra fruit, white wine, and rum.
step-9: chill for 2-4 hours.
step-10: scoop fruit into glasses with ice, pour sangria, and top with champagne or sparkling wine.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f/220°c.
step-2: roll out aluminum foil into a cone.
step-3: make 4 cones for 1 pie sheet.
step-4: cut pie sheet into quarters.
step-5: place cone at one end of the sheet and roll dough onto the cone.
step-6: using a fork crimp the ends of the pie dough.
step-7: bake 5-10 minutes until the dough is set.
step-8: let it cool before pulling out the aluminum foil.
step-9: in a medium bowl, combine all ingredients and mix.
step-10: place pie cone in a mug for stability and spoon in the fruit mixture.
step-11: turn oven down to 400°f/200°c and bake for 15 minutes or until the fruit is soft.
step-12: top it with your whipped cream and a strawberry.

step-1: in a bowl, add the olive oil, greek yogurt, red wine vinegar, lemon juice, honey, poppy seeds, mustard, salt, and pepper in a small bowl and whisk until emulsified.
step-2: season the chicken with salt, pepper, and paprika.
step-3: heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
step-4: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the chicken and cook until browned on both sides, about 4 minutes per side.
step-5: once cooled, slice the chicken on a cutting board.
step-6: toss spinach, strawberries, avocado, almonds, and sliced chicken together in a large bowl and drizzle with poppy seed dressing.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: fill a gallon plastic bag with pretzels and use a rolling pin or meat mallet to crush the pretzels, creating a chunky texture.
step-3: combine crushed pretzels and butter in a mixing bowl and stir to combine.
step-4: place the pretzel mixture in the base of a 9-inch (23-cm) springform pan with the mixture to create the crust.
step-5: use a measuring cup to smooth the surface.
step-6: bake for 10 minutes.
step-7: let cool to room temperature.
step-8: place cream cheese in a large bowl and mix with an electric mixer until cream cheese is smooth.
step-9: add in powder sugar, vanilla extract, and sour cream.
step-10: mix until combine.
step-11: use a spatula to scrape the sides of the bowl.
step-12: add in the whipped cream until batter is thick and smooth.
step-13: pour the mixture into the 9-inch (23-cm) springform pan and spread with a spatula to cover the pretzel crust and create a flat even top.
step-14: transfer to the refrigerator to chill for 30 minutes.
step-15: boil water in a medium saucepan over high heat.
step-16: once boiling, add the strawberry gelatin and stir for 3 minutes, or until gelatin has dissolved.
step-17: remove from heat.
step-18: let gelatin mixture cool for 8 minutes or until room temperature.
step-19: add in strawberries and stir to combine.
step-20: remove the springform pan from the refrigerator and pour the strawberry mixture over it.
step-21: refrigerate for at least 4 hours.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, toss the strawberries and rhubarb with the sugar, salt, and cornstarch.
step-3: set to the side.
step-4: line a pie tin with the pie dough.
step-5: empty rhubarb and strawberry mixture into the pie tin, evenly distributing the mixture.
step-6: cut pie dough into strips and weave a lattice design on top of the pie.
step-7: (you can also top with more pie dough in a full sheet with slits.)
step-8: bake the pie until the filling is bubbling and the crust is golden brown, about 2 hours.
step-9: cover the edge of the pie with foil if it begins to darken.
step-10: let cool slightly before serving.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the flour, butter, sugar, and eggs.
step-2: add ½ cup (120 ml) of milk at a time, stirring vigorously, making sure that each addition is completely incorporated into the batter and that the batter is smooth before adding more milk.
step-3: strain the batter through a fine mesh sieve.
step-4: the batter should be very liquidy and have no lumps.
step-5: rest in the fridge for at least 30 minutes or up to overnight.
step-6: make the filling: in a medium bowl, combine the cream cheese and sugar.
step-7: using a hand mixer, beat until combined.
step-8: add the heavy cream and mix until smooth.
step-9: set aside.
step-10: in a 9.5 inch (24-cm) nonstick pan over medium heat, pour ⅓ cup (40 g) of the batter in the center, and swirl the batter around to the edges of the pan.
step-11: cook the crepe until bubbles rise to the surface and the bottom is golden brown, about 3 minutes.
step-12: flip and cook on the other side until the edges start to crisp slightly, about 1 minute more.
step-13: transfer the crepe to a wire rack to cool.
step-14: repeat with the remaining batter.
step-15: stack the crepes on top of each other, then cut in half.
step-16: stack the halves on top of each other, and cut the stack into two even strips.
step-17: place two crepe strips on a flat surface and spread the cream cheese mixture on both.
step-18: arrange sliced strawberries on one of the strips
step-19: roll up the first strip with the strawberries, then roll the second strip around it.
step-20: repeat with the rest of the strips of crepes, alternating between strips with strawberries and strips without.
step-21: once it becomes too large to roll, lay the cake on a serving platter
step-22: spread the remaining crepe strips with cream cheese and gently press them around the outside of the cake.
step-23: refrigerate for 15-30 minutes to set.

step-1: mix all ingredients together in a large bowl.
step-2: serve with chips or as a topping on your favorite meal.

step-1: slice the tops off the strawberries to create a flat surface for them to sit on.
step-2: slice the tip off the strawberry to make the hat.
step-3: squeeze some frosting or whipped cream on the strawberry, and replace the tip.
step-4: decorate the rest with a piping bag.
step-5: add the mini chocolate chips for eyes.
step-6: strawberry santas are mischievous, and tend to disappear quickly!
step-7: make enough for family and friends!

step-1: marinate the strawberries: in a medium bowl, combine the strawberries, sugar, lemon zest, and salt.
step-2: set aside to marinate while you make the shortcakes.
step-3: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-4: in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, 3 tablespoons sugar, baking powder, and salt.
step-5: add the cubed butter and, using your fingers, cut in the butter until pea-sized pieces form and the mixture starts to clump together.
step-6: add 1 cup (240 ml) cream and mix just to combine.
step-7: transfer the mixture to a clean work surface and pat into a ¾-inch-thick (2 cm) rectangle.
step-8: cut into 8 squares.
step-9: use a pastry brush to brush the tops of each square with the remaining 1½ tablespoons of heavy cream and sprinkle with the remaining tablespoon of sugar and flaky salt.
step-10: bake for 20 minutes, until the shortcakes are cooked through and golden on top.
step-11: cool the shortcakes, then split and serve with the marinated strawberries and whipped cream.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: whisk together eggs, ¾ cups (150 g) sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla until pale and fluffy.
step-3: into the mixture sift in flour, baking powder & salt.
step-4: mix until just combined.
step-5: pour the sponge cake batter onto a 10x15-inch (25x38 cm) baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake for 10-12 minutes.
step-6: allow to cool.
step-7: in a mixing bowl beat together cream cheese, ½ cup sugar (100 g) and 2 teaspoons vanilla extract.
step-8: add in heavy cream and beat until light and fluffy.
step-9: set aside.
step-10: cutting widthways, cut the cooled cake into 4 equal rectangles.
step-11: spread the jam onto 2 rectangles.
step-12: then place the two rectangles together and top with a rectangle without any jam.
step-13: transfer the stack of cake with jam onto a cutting board.
step-14: cut in half longways.
step-15: then cut widthways into 1 cm (½ inch) thick slices.
step-16: the cut pieces of cake should be about square in shape.
step-17: arrange the sliced pieces on cake into a medium sized bowl lined with cling film.
step-18: alternate the direction the lines are facing to create a checkered like pattern.
step-19: as you reach the edges of the bowl, you may need to cut the pieces to fit.
step-20: fill the cake with the cheesecake filling.
step-21: spreading evenly.
step-22: arrange the strawberries on top making sure they slightly overlap each other.
step-23: cover the cake with slices of the 4th piece of cake.
step-24: wrap the exposed cake with cling film and refrigerate for at least 4 hours.
step-25: to serve, unwrap the bottom layer of the cake, and place a plate on top.
step-26: flip the plate and carefully remove the bowl, and the remaining cling film.
step-27: slice and serve.

step-1: using a serrated knife, cut the pint of ice cream crosswise into 3 equal discs.
step-2: lay out 3 sugar cookies and place a pint slice on top of each.
step-3: place another sugar cookie on top of each sandwich.
step-4: remove the ice cream packaging.
step-5: freeze for 30 minutes.
step-6: in a small bowl, stir together the graham crackers and freeze-dried strawberries until thoroughly mixed.
step-7: in a liquid measuring cup or deep, microwave-safe bowl, combine white chocolate chips and coconut oil.
step-8: microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring between each, until the white chocolate is silky smooth.
step-9: let the white chocolate cool to room temperature, about 5 minutes.
step-10: remove the ice cream sandwiches from the freezer and dip half of each sandwich into the white chocolate, then roll the dipped side in the graham cracker and strawberry mixture until fully covered.
step-11: freeze for 30 minutes more before serving.

step-1: preheat the oven to 200°f (93°c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: spread ¾ cup (150 g) of sugar on the baking sheet, then bake for 7 minutes to warm.
step-4: remove the sugar from the oven and leave the oven on.
step-5: in a large clean, dry bowl, beat the egg whites with an electric hand mixer on low speed until foamy, then add the salt.
step-6: while beating, add the warm sugar 1 tablespoon at a time, gradually increasing the mixer speed, until thick and shiny peaks form, 5-7 minutes.
step-7: add the vanilla and fold in until just incorporated.
step-8: line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
step-9: heap 10 equal scoops of meringue onto the baking sheets, spacing at least 1 inch (2 ½ cm) apart.
step-10: use the back of a spoon to create a divot in the center of each mound.
step-11: bake for about 90 minutes, until the meringues lift cleanly off the parchment.
step-12: once done, turn off the oven and let the meringues cool in the oven for 2 hours, up to overnight.
step-13: when removed from the oven, the meringues should sound hollow when tapped.
step-14: meanwhile, make the strawberry puree: in a small saucepan, combine the thinly sliced strawberries, ¼ cup (50 g) sugar, and the lemon juice and let sit for 10 minutes to macerate, until some of the juices have released.
step-15: transfer the pan to the stove and cook over medium heat for 10 minutes, until the strawberries have slightly softened but are still vibrant red.
step-16: remove from heat and push through a fine-mesh sieve to remove any seeds.
step-17: let cool.
step-18: store in the refrigerator until ready to use.
step-19: to serve, heap ¼ cup (60 ml) whipped cream onto each meringue nest.
step-20: top with 1 heaping tablespoon pound cake cubes and 2 tablespoons quartered strawberries.
step-21: drizzle each with 2 tablespoons strawberry puree.

step-1: combine the strawberries, vanilla waters, rum, and strawberry ice cream in a blender.
step-2: blend until smooth.
step-3: top with whipped cream and a strawberry.

step-1: in a saucepan over medium heat, add the quartered strawberries, water, and sugar.
step-2: stir until combined and bring to a boil.
step-3: turn down the heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
step-4: if the syrup is too thin, mix together the cornstarch and water and add it to the strawberries.
step-5: stir again and cook until thickened about 5 minutes.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: in a medium bowl, mix together the wet ingredients.
step-8: in a large bowl, mix together the dry ingredients.
step-9: slowly add the wet ingredients to the dry and gently mix until just incorporated.
step-10: do not over-mix!
step-11: heat 1 tablespoon of butter on a skillet over medium heat.
step-12: add ½ cup (145 g) of batter to the skillet and cook until bubbles form on the surface of the pancake.
step-13: flip and set aside.
step-14: stack the pancakes and top with strawberry syrup and a dollop of whipped cream.

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: pour pancake mix, milk, and eggs into a bowl and mix just until combined.
step-3: pour batter onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and spread to the edges.
step-4: place cream cheese on top of the batter, followed by the strawberry slices.
step-5: bake for 15 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-6: cut into squares and serve immediately, or freeze up to 1 month.
step-7: to reheat, place on a microwave-safe plate and heat for 20 seconds per pancake on the plate.

step-1: generously grease a 9-inch (23 cm) cast iron or cake pan.
step-2: in a large bowl, whisk together warm milk, melted butter, and granulated sugar.
step-3: the mixture should be just warm, registering between 100-110˚f (40˚c).
step-4: if hotter, allow to cool slightly.
step-5: sprinkle the yeast evenly over the warm mixture and let sit for 1 minute.
step-6: add 4 cups (500 grams) of all-purpose flour to the milk mixture and mix with a wooden spoon until just combined.
step-7: cover the bowl with a towel or plastic wrap and set in a warm place to rise for 1 hour.
step-8: preheat oven to 325˚f (160˚c).
step-9: after 1 hour, the dough should have nearly doubled in size.
step-10: remove the towel and add an additional ¾ cup (95 grams) of flour, the baking powder, and salt.
step-11: stir well, then turn out onto a well-floured surface.
step-12: knead the dough lightly, adding additional flour as necessary, about ½ cup (60 grams), until the dough just loses its stickiness and does not stick to the surface.
step-13: roll the dough out into a large rectangle, about ½-inch (12 mm) thick.
step-14: in a small bowl combine the strawberry preserves and butter, stir to combine.
step-15: spread the filling mixture evenly over the rolled out dough, leave about 1½ inches (4 cm) from the edge.
step-16: starting from the bottom roll the dough upward, being careful not to squeeze the filling out.
step-17: with a knife cut the rolled dough into 8 pieces.
step-18: place strawberry roll in the prepared cast iron or cake pan and cover with plastic wrap.
step-19: place in a warm spot and leave to rise for 30 minutes.
step-20: the strawberry rolls should expand to the edges of the pan during this time.
step-21: bake for 45 minutes.
step-22: cover the rolls with foil to prevent the outside from burning, and bake for an additional 35 minutes.
step-23: while the strawberry rolls are baking, prepare the frosting.
step-24: in a medium-size mixing bowl, whisk together cream cheese, butter, vanilla, whole milk, and powdered sugar, until smooth.
step-25: remove the strawberry rolls from the oven and let cool in the pan for at least 20 minutes.
step-26: once cool, drizzle frosting over the rolls before serving.

step-1: grease an 11-inch (25cm) round cake pan and line with parchment paper.
step-2: make the cream cheese filling: in a medium bowl, mix the cream cheese, powdered sugar, and vanilla until fully incorporated and smooth.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: in a small saucepan over medium heat, cook the strawberry jam until reduced by half, about 20 minutes.
step-5: remove the pan from the heat and set aside.
step-6: make the cake batter: in a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt and whisk to combine.
step-7: add the eggs, milk, melted butter, and vanilla and whisk until fully incorporated.
step-8: stir in the lemon zest and juice.
step-9: pour the batter into the prepared cake pan.
step-10: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c)
step-11: transfer the reserved cream cheese filling and reduced jam to 2 piping bags fitted with round tips or zip-top bags with a corner cut off.
step-12: starting in the center, pipe in a layer of jam in a spiral shape, moving towards the outside of the cake.
step-13: pipe a layer of cream cheese filling on top of the jam, following the swirl as closely as possible.
step-14: bake for 30 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean.
step-15: allow cake to come to room temperature before removing from cake pan.
step-16: make the lemon glaze: combine the powdered sugar, lemon zest, and lemon juice in a medium bowl and whisk until a smooth glaze forms.
step-17: remove the cooled cake from the pan and evenly pour over the glaze.
step-18: allow the glaze to set before serving.

step-1: make the simple syrup: in a small saucepan, combine the sugar, thyme, and water.
step-2: bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
step-3: once boiling, cook for 2-3 minutes, until the sugar has dissolved and the thyme is fragrant.
step-4: remove from the heat.
step-5: strain the herb syrup through a fine-mesh sieve set over a blender.
step-6: add the strawberries.
step-7: blend on high speed until smooth.
step-8: divide the mixture between 6 ice pop molds.
step-9: freeze until solid, at least 6 hours.

step-1: blanch the corn in a large pot of boiling water for 3 minutes.
step-2: remove the corn from the pot.
step-3: heat the ghee in a medium pan over medium-high heat.
step-4: add the corn and cook, turning occasionally, until nicely browned on all sides.
step-5: transfer to a serving plate.
step-6: squeeze the lime juice all over the corn.
step-7: in a small bowl, combine the chili powder, cumin, cayenne, garam masala, and salt.
step-8: sprinkle all over the corn.

step-1: preheat oven to 400º f (200º c).
step-2: slice ½-inch (1 cm) off of the top and bottom of the butternut squash.
step-3: slice the squash half lengthwise and scoop out seeds.
step-4: drizzle the halves with the oil, salt, and pepper.
step-5: roast for 40 minutes.
step-6: in a small pan or pot combine rice, oil, and vegetable broth and bring to a boil over high heat.
step-7: reduce heat to simmer, cover with a lid, and cook for 18 minutes.
step-8: add the garlic cloves, chopped tomato, beans, corn, cilantro, cumin, chili powder, and salt.
step-9: stir to combine.
step-10: transfer rice mixture to a bowl.
step-11: scoop out half of the flesh from the roasted butternut squash into the bowl and stir.
step-12: add the cheddar cheese and mix to combine.
step-13: spoon the mixture back into the butternut squash halves and sprinkle a little more cheese on top.
step-14: roast in the oven for 2-4 minutes, or until cheese is melted.

step-1: in a medium pan over medium heat, heat the olive oil until shimmering, then cook the garlic until fragrant, for 1-2 minutes.
step-2: stir in the crushed tomato, paprika, chili powder, ground cumin, salt, and pepper.
step-3: reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 10 minutes.
step-4: set aside to cool.
step-5: in a medium bowl, combine the ground beef, salt, pepper, chili powder, cumin, oregano, rice, and 1 cup (260 g) of tomato sauce.
step-6: mix until combined.
step-7: refrigerate until ready to use.
step-8: bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat.
step-9: add the cabbage, cut side down.
step-10: cover with a lid, reduce the heat to medium, and simmer for 15 minutes.
step-11: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c) for 45 minutes.
step-12: transfer the cabbage to a cutting board, cut side up, and let cool until it reaches room temperature.
step-13: peel off a layer of the cabbage.
step-14: with the stem facing upwards, use a paring knife to trim the thicker stem, which will make the leaf easier to roll.
step-15: with the stem side pointed towards you, place a few tablespoons of filling at the base of the leaf.
step-16: roll upwards so the filling is covered by a single layer of the cabbage.
step-17: fold both sides in, then roll all the way up.
step-18: place the cabbage roll seam side down in a 9x13-inch (23x33 -cm) baking dish and repeat with the remaining filling.
step-19: spoon the remaining tomato sauce over the cabbage rolls.
step-20: cover the dish tightly with foil and bake for 45 minutes.

step-1: season chicken with salt.
step-2: cut a pocket into each chicken breast.
step-3: stuff the pockets evenly with the mozzarella cheese.
step-4: press the edges of the chicken together to seal the pocket.
step-5: separate the flour, eggs, and bread crumbs into 3 separate bowls.
step-6: being careful to keep the chicken from opening, dip the stuffed chicken in the flour, shaking off the excess.
step-7: dip the floured chicken into the egg, then the bread crumbs, coating it evenly.
step-8: heat the oil in a large pan over medium heat.
step-9: preheat oven to 180°c.
step-10: fry the chicken until golden brown on both sides.
step-11: place ⅔ of the tomato sauce evenly on the bottom of a baking dish.
step-12: place the chicken on top.
step-13: top with the rest of the tomato sauce, then sprinkle the parmesan and basil on top.
step-14: bake for 20 minutes.
step-15: serve!

step-1: in a medium saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter and toast for about 5 minutes until it turns brown and smells nutty.
step-2: pour the brown butter into a large bowl.
step-3: let sit for 30 minutes to cool before starting to make the dough.
step-4: to the bowl with the cooled butter, add the granulated sugar, brown sugar, vanilla, and yogurt.
step-5: using an electric hand mixer or stand mixer, beat for 2-3 minutes until fluffy.
step-6: add the egg and egg yolk and beat again until fluffy and well-combined.
step-7: in a separate large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt.
step-8: sift ⅓ of the dry ingredients at a time into the wet ingredients.
step-9: beat just until incorporated, then scrape down the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula between each addition.
step-10: make sure not to overmix.
step-11: add the chocolate chips and mini chocolate chips to the dough and gently fold just to incorporate.
step-12: cover the bowl with plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator for 2 hours.
step-13: you can also store the stuffings in the fridge so they’re easier to work with later.
step-14: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-15: line a baking sheet (or 2) with parchment paper.
step-16: using an ice cream scooper, scoop out 3 tablespoons of chilled dough and flatten out into a ¼-inch (6 mm) thick circle.
step-17: add 1 tablespoon of your stuffing of choice, such as caramel, cookie butter, chocolate hazelnut spread, or peanut butter, to the center of the dough round, and fold the edges of the dough around the stuffing.
step-18: seal tightly and roll into a ball.
step-19: repeat with the rest of the dough and stuffings.
step-20: to the outside of the cookie dough balls, add your choice of toppings, such as mini marshmallows, chopped candy bar, chocolate chips, crushed chocolate sandwich cookies, white chocolate chips, rainbow sprinkles, pretzel pieces, or crushed potato chips.
step-21: press the toppings firmly into the dough, so they don’t fall off.
step-22: repeat with the remaining stuffed cookie dough balls.
step-23: place the stuffed and decorated cookie dough balls onto the prepared baking sheet approximately 3 inches (7 cm) apart, so the cookies don’t spread into one another.
step-24: you may need to use 2 baking sheets.
step-25: bake for 11-14 minutes, or until the cookies are golden brown and evenly spread.
step-26: cool on a cooling rack for 10 minutes before devouring!

step-1: make cake mix according to package directions.
step-2: spray the cupcake tin or use cupcake liners.
step-3: drop 1 to 2 tbsp.
step-4: of cake batter into each cupcake cup.
step-5: add a mini pie and top with another tbsp.
step-6: of cake batter.
step-7: bake according the cake mix package directions.
step-8: let cool when done.
step-9: frost to your liking.

step-1: in a shallow dish or large plastic bag, add the soy sauce, buffalo sauce, garlic, honey, and sweet chili sauce.
step-2: after mixing, reserve half the marinade in a separate bowl for later.
step-3: on a cutting board, slice the chicken breasts horizontally, making sure not to slice all the way through.
step-4: cover chicken breast with parchment or plastic wrap and use a mallet to flatten the chicken, about ⅓ inch (8 mm) in thickness.
step-5: place chicken breasts in the marinade and chill for about 2 hours or overnight.
step-6: add 1 tablespoon of olive oil to a large pan over medium heat.
step-7: once hot, add garlic and cook until aromatic, about 30 seconds.
step-8: add the onion and bell peppers, and cook until soft.
step-9: remove the chicken breast from the marinade and lay flat.
step-10: spoon a layer of the onion and the bell pepper mixture across the chicken breast, then add a layer of spinach.
step-11: roll up chicken breast and secure with a toothpick, about 1½ inches (4 cm) apart.
step-12: cut the chicken breast in half.
step-13: add 1 tablespoon of olive oil to a large pan over medium heat.
step-14: once hot, place chicken rolls inside the pan, cook until inside is no longer pink, about 6 minutes on each side.
step-15: remove from pan.
step-16: add reserved marinade to the pan and cook until caramelized, about 3 minutes.
step-17: serve drizzled in caramelized marinade.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: for the cheesecake filling: in a small bowl, combine cream cheese, egg, heavy cream, sugar and vanilla.
step-3: beat until smooth.
step-4: for the french toast egg mixture, combine eggs, milk, heavy cream, sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt in a large mixing bowl.
step-5: stir until well incorporated.
step-6: dip slices of brioche in egg mixture.
step-7: transfer brioche slices and cover bottom of a loaf pan, using a half or a quarter of a slice if necessary.
step-8: cover the slices with cheesecake filling and spread evenly.
step-9: layer another row of brioche slices and top with slices of strawberry and banana.
step-10: layer one last row of brioche slices using small pieces of the bread to fill in the holes.
step-11: bake for 30 minutes covered, then 10 minutes uncovered.
step-12: let cool to room temperature.
step-13: invert the loaf onto a parchment paper-lined baking tray.
step-14: brush top of loaf with butter and sprinkle sugar over top.
step-15: broil on high for 5 minutes or until sugar starts to carmelize.
step-16: garnish with more strawberries, banana, and powdered sugar.
step-17: slice and serve.

step-1: mix the filling ingredients together in a small bowl until consistency is smooth.
step-2: chill 30 minutes.
step-3: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-4: roll each slice of bread flat with a mason jar or rolling pin.
step-5: put about 1 tablespoon of filling in the center of a slice.
step-6: place another slice directly on top, as if you were making a sandwich.
step-7: note: be careful not to press down on the center so the filling doesn’t spread.
step-8: using a wide-mouth mason jar lid or biscuit/cookie cutter, press firmly down on the sandwich and remove the crust around the lid.
step-9: use a knife to refine the edges of the circle.
step-10: gently release pocket from lid.
step-11: press down firmly on the outer edges of the pocket with a fork to make indentations.
step-12: repeat steps 3-8 for each pocket.
step-13: set pockets aside.
step-14: line baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-15: place baking rack on top of parchment paper and coat with cooking spray.
step-16: whisk eggs, milk, vanilla extract, and cinnamon together in a small bowl.
step-17: separately dip each pocket in egg mixture, flipping to ensure it gets entirely coated.
step-18: let excess drip off.
step-19: arrange 4 pockets on baking rack.
step-20: bake for 15-25 minutes or until golden brown.
step-21: let cool 5-10 minutes.
step-22: garnish with powdered sugar and syrup.

step-1: on a cutting board, slice the ends off the pickles and place vertically on the board.
step-2: using an apple corer, hollow out the pickles and reserve the centers for frying.
step-3: place a slice of ham on the cutting board and roll it around a string cheese stick.
step-4: stuff the ham-covered cheese stick in a hollow pickle.
step-5: repeat with the remaining ham, cheese, and pickles.
step-6: cut the stuffed pickles into ¼-inch (6 mm) slices.
step-7: place the flour, eggs, and bread crumbs in 3 separate medium bowls.
step-8: dip each pickle slice in the flour, eggs, then panko, making sure each slice is fully coated.
step-9: dip each cored pickle center into flour, eggs, then panko, making sure each one is fully covered.
step-10: heat the oil in a medium pot until it reaches 375˚f (190˚c).
step-11: fry the pickle slices and cores for 1-2 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-12: serve with spicy mayonnaise for dipping.

step-1: take your hash browns out of the freezer to allow them to begin to thaw.
step-2: in an eight-inch nonstick pan, melt one tbsp.
step-3: of butter on medium heat and add onions, occasionally stirring.
step-4: allow to cook until they have softened and begin to brown.
step-5: add the peppers, stir, and salt to taste.
step-6: cook until they begin to soften.
step-7: add the spinach and allow it to wilt for a couple of minutes.
step-8: transfer this filling to a bowl.
step-9: put your pan back on the heat and add one tbsp.
step-10: of butter, melting on medium heat.
step-11: add your hash browns and season with salt and pepper to taste, stirring until the butter and seasoning are evenly distributed.
step-12: arrange the potatoes in a flat even layer.
step-13: sprinkle cheese evenly on top and allow it to melt.
step-14: then, sprinkle the filling evenly on top.
step-15: when the bottom of the hash browns has crisped up and browned, your hash brown omelette is ready.
step-16: shake the pan to make sure it’s not sticking to the bottom, then bring it over to your plate and carefully tilt the pan, using the edge to help fold it over in half.
step-17: add your favorite toppings and enjoy!
step-18: (we used chopped scallions and a chipotle sour cream.)
step-19: for the chipotle sour cream:
step-20: combine ½ cup sour cream or crema, one tbsp.
step-21: chipotle in adobo (finely chopped), a pinch of salt, and a splash of water to thin it out.

step-1: add the potatoes to a large pot.
step-2: cover the potatoes with cold water and season with 1 tablespoon of salt.
step-3: bring to a boil over high heat and cook until the potatoes are fork tender, about 20 minutes.
step-4: make the sausage filling: add the onion to a large skillet over medium heat and cook until translucent, about 3 minutes.
step-5: add the peppers and cook until slightly tender, about 6 minutes.
step-6: add the garlic and sausage.
step-7: cook until the sausage is browned, about 4 minutes.
step-8: season with the paprika, cayenne, pepper, thyme, and salt and cook for another 5 minutes until seasoning is evenly distributed.
step-9: remove the pan from the heat.
step-10: make the egg filling: heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat, then sauté the spinach until fully wilted, about 5 minutes.
step-11: add the eggs and scramble until cooked, about 3 minutes.
step-12: add the bacon, pepper, and salt and mix to incorporate.
step-13: remove the pan from the heat.
step-14: transfer the potatoes to a colander and run under cold water to cool.
step-15: pat dry.
step-16: using the large holes on a cheese grater, shred the potatoes into a large bowl.
step-17: add the flour, parmesan, onion powder, garlic powder, pepper, and salt.
step-18: mix together thoroughly.
step-19: transfer half of the hash brown mixture to a greased 13” x 18” (33 cm x 45 cm) baking sheet and spread evenly with a spatula.
step-20: on the left side of the tray, spoon the egg filling into 4 evenly spaced piles.
step-21: on the right side of the tray, spoon the sausage filling into 4 evenly spaced piles.
step-22: top each pile of egg filling with a tablespoon of shredded cheddar cheese.
step-23: top the piles of filling with the remaining hash brown mixture and use a spatula to carefully press down the hash browns, sealing the filling inside.
step-24: use the tip of the spatula to delineate between each pocket of filling.
step-25: freeze for at least 2 hours.
step-26: in a large pot, heat oil until it reaches 380˚f (195˚c).
step-27: remove the hash browns from the freezer and use a sharp knife to cut and separate each pocket.
step-28: fry the hash brown pockets in batches for 5-7 minutes, or until browned on both sides.
step-29: drain the pockets on a wire rack set over a baking sheet lined with paper towels.

step-1: preheat oven to 450°f (230°c).
step-2: cut a 1 pound ball of pizza dough in half and roll out two large discs of dough.
step-3: spray the inside of a springform pan with cooking spray and lay in one of the dough discs.
step-4: press the dough into the corners.
step-5: sprinkle the olive oil, 2 cloves of the minced garlic, salt, and pepper on the dough and brush to cover the surface.
step-6: press the bottom of the dough with a fork.
step-7: bake until the dough is cooked and lightly golden brown, 15 minutes.
step-8: mix together the tomato puree, dried basil, 4 cloves of minced garlic, dried oregano, and tomato paste in a bowl.
step-9: season to taste with salt and pepper.
step-10: into the partially cooked bottom layer of pizza dough, shingle a layer of mozzarella slices and then a layer of the homemade marinara sauce.
step-11: spiral the meatballs in the dish as tightly as possible.
step-12: cover with more marinara sauce.
step-13: add a layer of caramelized onions, and more sliced mozzarella.
step-14: add the green, yellow, and orange bell peppers on top of the mozzarella.
step-15: cut the second piece of dough into strips to form into a lattice pattern on top of the pie.
step-16: brush with 2 tablespoons more of olive oil, 2 cloves minced garlic, and kosher salt.
step-17: bake for 40 minutes to an hour, or until the dough on top is browned and the sauce, meatballs, and cheese are heated through.
step-18: slice the pie, serve with extra marinara sauce and grated parmesan.

step-1: bring a large pot of water to boil over high heat, season with a teaspoon of salt, then add the rigatoni.
step-2: stir and cook until the pasta is al dente, about 5 minutes.
step-3: drain the pasta and transfer to a large bowl.
step-4: add the olive oil and stir to coat.
step-5: set aside to cool.
step-6: in a large bowl, add the ground beef, remaining teaspoon of salt, the pepper, oregano, parsley, onion, garlic, and mozzarella.
step-7: stir until combined.
step-8: spoon the beef mixture into a zip top bag, seal the bag, and cut the corner to create a small opening.
step-9: pipe the beef mixture into one side of the rigatoni, then flip and pipe the other side to fill.
step-10: place the filled rigatoni on a baking sheet and freeze for 30 minutes.
step-11: heat the oil in a large pot until it reaches 350°f (180°c).
step-12: place the flour, eggs, and bread crumbs into 3 separate medium bowls.
step-13: take a rigatoni and roll it in the flour to coat, shake off any excess flour.
step-14: dip the rigatoni in the egg with a fork.
step-15: finally, roll the rigatoni in the bread crumbs until coated.
step-16: repeat with the remaining rigatoni.
step-17: fry the rigatoni poppers 4 at a time until golden brown, about 4 minutes.
step-18: drain on a wire rack or over paper towels.
step-19: sprinkle with fresh parsley and parmesan.
step-20: serve with marinara sauce.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (177°c).
step-2: heat one tablespoon of the oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
step-3: combine the garlic, onions, mushrooms, salt, and pepper in the pan and cook until almost all of the moisture has evaporated and the onions are caramelizing, 15–20 minutes.
step-4: remove from heat and set aside.
step-5: lay the flank steak on a cutting board.
step-6: add salt and pepper on both sides, to taste.
step-7: spoon the mushroom and onion mixture on top, spreading it evenly across the steak.
step-8: sprinkle the spinach on top, followed by the slices of provolone.
step-9: press down lightly to compress the spinach.
step-10: starting at the bottom of the flank steak, roll it up tightly, making sure the grain of the meat is running horizontally.
step-11: use six toothpicks to secure the steak roll.
step-12: slice the steak roll into six equal rolls.
step-13: heat the remaining oil in a pan over high heat.
step-14: sear the steak rolls on one side for one to two minutes, then flip.
step-15: sear the second side for about one minute, then bake for 10–15 minutes, until medium rare.
step-16: remove the toothpicks, then serve!

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c)
step-2: cream the butter and sugar until fluffy.
step-3: beat in 4 eggs, one at a time.
step-4: in a separate bowl, mix the flour, cocoa powder, and baking soda.
step-5: alternate mixing half of the dry ingredients and buttermilk into the egg mixture.
step-6: line the bottom of a 9×13 glass dish with parchment paper, and grease.
step-7: pour in batter, and bake for 22-25 minutes.
step-8: for the filling, mix the marshmallow fluff, butter, powdered sugar, and vanilla.
step-9: set a little aside, and color the rest.
step-10: cool completely, and with a 2-3 inch cookie cutter or biscuit cutter, cut 12 circles into the cake.
step-11: cut each cake in half horizontally, and scoop out a little cake out of each side.
step-12: fill, and stack the cake with the scooped sides in the middle.
step-13: for the frosting, bring the cream and sugar to a boil, and pour over the chocolate chips and butter.
step-14: stir until there are no longer lumps.
step-15: spread the frosting over the top and sides of each cake.
step-16: let dry, flip, and cover the bottom with frosting.
step-17: pipe a football design on the top of the cake with the filling you set aside.

step-1: cut off the top of the tomato and remove the insides.
step-2: fill with cooked sausage, crack in an egg and added shredded cheese.
step-3: drizzle some olive oil over the top.
step-4: bake in oven at 425°f (218°c) for 15 - 20 minutes, depending on how well done you like your egg.
step-5: season with some pepper and garnish with basil.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: grease a 9x13-inch (23x33-cm) baking dish.
step-3: melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat.
step-4: add the sausage and cook until browned and no longer pink, about 5 minutes.
step-5: add the celery, onions, and garlic.
step-6: cook until softened and golden, about 5 minutes.
step-7: add the apples, sage, and thyme.
step-8: cook until slightly softened, about 3 minutes.
step-9: in a medium bowl, beat together the eggs, chicken stock, salt, and pepper.
step-10: in a large bowl, combine the bread and cooked sausage mixture.
step-11: pour the egg mixture over the bread and vegetable mixture, and stir to coat.
step-12: transfer the stuffing to the prepared baking dish and cover with foil.
step-13: bake for 30 minutes, then remove the foil and bake for another 15 minutes, or until the top is golden brown.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: grease a 9x13-inch (23x33-cm) baking dish.
step-3: melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat.
step-4: add the celery, onions, and garlic.
step-5: cook until softened and golden, about 5 minutes.
step-6: add the mushrooms and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
step-7: add the kale, sage, and rosemary.
step-8: cook for another 5 minutes, until the kale is wilted.
step-9: in a medium bowl, beat together the eggs, vegetable stock, half of the parsley, the salt, and pepper.
step-10: in a large bowl, combine the bread and cooked vegetable mixture.
step-11: pour the egg mixture over the bread and vegetable mixture, and stir to coat.
step-12: transfer the stuffing to the prepared baking dish and cover with foil.
step-13: bake for 30 minutes, then remove the foil and bake for another 15 minutes, or until the top is golden brown.
step-14: top with the remaining parsley.

step-1: cook sausage in a skillet over medium heat.
step-2: add onion after 1-2 minutes and cook until sausage is cooked and onion is tender.
step-3: remove sausage from heat and transfer to a large mixing bowl and let cool.
step-4: add remaining ingredients to the bowl and mix until thoroughly incorporated.
step-5: using a large spoon or ice cream scoop, measure out mixture into 8 evenly sized balls and space them out on a parchment paper lined baking sheet.
step-6: bake at 350˚f (180˚c) for 20 minutes or until bites are cooked and slightly browned on top.
