step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c) if making dressing.
step-2: preheat the oven to 325˚f (160˚c) if making stuffing.
step-3: crumble the cornbread and biscuits into a large bowl.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: thinly slice the sage and set aside.
step-6: heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
step-7: add the sausage and cook until browned, 3-5 minutes.
step-8: add the onion and celery, and cook until softened, 5-7 minutes.
step-9: add the sage, rosemary, and thyme, and cook until fragrant, 3-4 minutes.
step-10: season with salt and pepper.
step-11: remove the pan from the heat and set aside.
step-12: in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, combine the butter and chicken stock.
step-13: melt the butter completely and bring to a boil.
step-14: add the heavy cream and stir to combine.
step-15: add the sausage mixture to the crumbled cornbread and biscuits, and mix to combine.
step-16: pour the chicken stock mixture, a bit at a time, over the bread mixture.
step-17: mix well.
step-18: if you are making dressing, transfer the mixture to a buttered 9x13-inch (23x33 cm) baking dish and cover with foil.
step-19: bake for 40 minutes, then remove the foil and bake for 10-15 minutes more, or until the top is lightly browned.
step-20: do not overbake.
step-21: if you are making stuffing, stuff the mixture into the cavity of a small turkey [12-14 pounds (5.5-.6.5 kilograms)].
step-22: bake for 4-5 hours, or until the temperature of the stuffing reaches 165˚f (75˚c).
step-23: serve warm with your favorite thanksgiving dishes.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: grease a 9x13-inch (23x33-cm) baking dish.
step-3: melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat.
step-4: add the bacon and cook until the fat has rendered, about 3 minutes.
step-5: add the celery, onion, and garlic.
step-6: cook until softened and golden, about 5 minutes.
step-7: add the thyme and rosemary.
step-8: cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
step-9: in a medium bowl, beat together the eggs, turkey stock, half of the parsley, the salt, and pepper.
step-10: in a large bowl, combine the bread and cooked bacon mixture.
step-11: pour the egg mixture over the bread and vegetable mixture, and stir to coat.
step-12: transfer the stuffing to the prepared baking dish and cover with foil.
step-13: bake for 30 minutes, then remove the foil and bake for another 15 minutes, or until the top is golden brown.
step-14: top with the remaining parsley.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: prepare the cake batter according to the package instructions.
step-3: line a 12-cup muffin tin with the orange liners.
step-4: scoop ¼ cup (30 g) of cake batter into each cup.
step-5: bake according to the package instructions, until a toothpick inserted in the center of a cupcake comes out clean.
step-6: let cool for 30 minutes.
step-7: frost each cupcake with a flat layer of chocolate frosting.
step-8: divide the buttercream frosting between small bowls and dye with gel food coloring as desired.
step-9: transfer the colored buttercream to piping bags fitted with your desired tips.
step-10: pipe succulent shapes onto the cupcakes.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: line a 10-inch (25-cm) cast iron pan with parchment paper.
step-3: in a large bowl, mix the butter with 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract until light and fluffy.
step-4: add the granulated sugar, then the brown sugar, and mix until well incorporated.
step-5: add the egg and stir until thoroughly incorporated.
step-6: using a fine mesh sieve, sift the flour, cream of tartar, baking soda, and salt into the dough.
step-7: combine with a spatula until evenly mixed.
step-8: spread the cookie dough in an even layer in the prepared pan.
step-9: chill in the fridge for 30 minutes, then bake for 15-18 minutes until lightly golden.
step-10: let cool.
step-11: in a medium bowl, combine the cream cheese, powdered sugar, and remaining ½ teaspoon of vanilla extract until well incorporated.
step-12: spread half of the frosting onto a quarter of the cooled cookie and the other half on the diagonally opposite corner.
step-13: frost the other quarters with the chocolate hazelnut spread.
step-14: decorate with your favorite toppings.

step-1: make the cookie dough: in a large bowl, cream together the butter, sugar, and cream cheese with an electric hand mixer on high speed for about 5 minutes, until fluffy and the sugar is mostly dissolved.
step-2: scrape down the bowl as needed to evenly beat the mixture.
step-3: add the egg, egg yolks, vanilla, and almond extract and mix well, scraping down the sides of the bowl.
step-4: add the salt, then sift the flour, baking powder, and cream of tartar into the bowl and fold to incorporate some of the flour.
step-5: then beat on low speed, just until incorporated and the dough comes together.
step-6: shape the dough into a flat disc and wrap tightly in plastic wrap.
step-7: chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours, or up to 3-4 days.
step-8: when ready to bake the cookies, preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-9: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-10: remove the dough from the fridge and let sit at room temperature for a few minutes to soften slightly.
step-11: on a lightly floured surface, roll out the cookie dough with a rolling pin to ¼-inch (6mm) thick.
step-12: dip cookie cutters of your choice in some extra flour and cut out shapes from the dough.
step-13: gather any excess dough into a ball and chill in the fridge to firm, then re-roll and cut out more cookies.
step-14: place the cookies on the prepared baking sheet and chill for at least 20 minutes to ensure they hold their shapes.
step-15: bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges just barely start to turn golden brown.
step-16: cool completely on a wire rack before decorating with royal icing or frosting.
step-17: to make the royal icing, sift the powdered sugar into a large bowl and add the salt.
step-18: on one side of the bowl, add the vanilla and egg whites.
step-19: where you added the liquids, begin whisking the powdered sugar into the liquids, gathering a bit more as you whisk to prevent lumps from forming, until all of the powdered sugar is incorporated.
step-20: add food coloring, if desired, and whisk to incorporate.
step-21: you can divide the icing into smaller bowls to make more than one color.
step-22: at this point, the icing should be a good consistency for piping borders.
step-23: if you’d like the frosting to be looser to flood or dip your cookies, add a few tablespoons of water, 1 tablespoon at a time, until it reaches your desired consistency.
step-24: decorate the cookies as desired.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: for the dough, put the flour, butter, oil, sugar, and salt in a food processor and process for about 10 seconds.
step-3: add the tablespoon of ice water and process for another five or six seconds.
step-4: remove from the bowl and form into a flat dough.
step-5: wrap the dough with plastic wrap and then refrigerate for 20-30 minutes.
step-6: lightly flour a work surface and roll the ball of dough into a thin layer, around ¼ inch (6 ⅓ mm) thick.
step-7: using a round cutter, or use a round bowl or lid as a guide and cut out into a nice round circle.
step-8: carefully transfer the dough to a large cookie sheet lined with a nonstick baking mat.
step-9: arrange the apple slices, alternating them nicely on top of the dough.
step-10: sprinkle the apple with sugar and put butter cubes on top.
step-11: bake for 30 to 35 minutes, until the fruit is soft and the dough nicely browned.
step-12: some of the juice from the fruit will have leaked out onto the cookie sheet.
step-13: before it hardens and makes the disks stick to the sheet, lift the tart with a broad spatula and transfer them to a cooling rack or platter.
step-14: serve lukewarm or at room temperature with ice cream (optional).

step-1: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: in a small bowl, combine the sugar, cinnamon, cardamom, nutmeg, ginger, and cloves.
step-4: on a cutting board, cut the pears lengthwise in 2 halves, removing the cores.
step-5: slice into ¹⁄₁₆-inch (1 mm) thick slices.
step-6: slice all the way through, but keep the pear halves together.
step-7: lay the pie crust on the prepared baking sheet and arrange the pear halves on top, separating the slices to cover the center of the crust, leaving a 1-inch (2 cm) border around the edge.
step-8: sprinkle the sugar spice mix over and between the pear slices.
step-9: fold the edge of the crust over the pears.
step-10: beat the egg in a small bowl, then brush over the crust.
step-11: sprinkle coarse sugar on top of the egg wash.
step-12: bake for 25 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown.
step-13: serve warm, with ice cream if desired.

step-1: in a large bowl, mix together butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
step-2: mix in egg, vanilla, and salt.
step-3: mix in flour.
step-4: make the dough into a ball and cut into two halves.
step-5: add food coloring to one half of the dough, working it in until evenly mixed.
step-6: on a large cutting board covered in plastic wrap, use a rolling pin to roll out each piece of dough to make two 12x9-inch (30x22 cm) rectangles.
step-7: tip: place wax paper over the dough while rolling to keep the dough from sticking to the rolling pin.
step-8: take the colored dough rectangle and place it over the other regular dough rectangle.
step-9: use the plastic wrap under the regular dough rectangle to help you roll the two rectangles up.
step-10: fill a flat dish or baking pan with sprinkles.
step-11: roll the dough around it until the outside is completely coated.
step-12: chill for at least 4 hours.
step-13: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-14: cut the dough into ¼-inch slices and place them on a cookie sheet.
step-15: bake for 8-10 minutes, until blonde.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: grease a 9-inch (23 cm) cake pan with butter.
step-3: in a medium bowl, mix the butter, sugar, and brown sugar until fluffy.
step-4: add the eggs one at a time, then add the vanilla.
step-5: whisk until combined.
step-6: fold in the flour, salt, cinnamon, and baking powder until combined.
step-7: fold in the berries.
step-8: transfer to a baking pan.
step-9: bake for 40 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-10: cool for 30 minutes before serving.
step-11: slice and sprinkle with powdered sugar.

step-1: put all ingredients into a blender.
step-2: mix until smooth.
step-3: add more coconut water as needed.
step-4: for a thicker consistency, add more ice.
step-5: serve and enjoy!

step-1: crush all the berries and mint in a jug.
step-2: add in simple syrup and stir.
step-3: serve ¼ of the fruit mix in a glass and add 1 shot of vodka.
step-4: top up with ice cubes and prosecco and garnish.

step-1: make the crust: in a large bowl, mix together ¾ cup (95 g) all-purpose flour, the whole wheat flour, and salt.
step-2: add the butter and, using a pastry cutter, work it into the flour until only pea-sized pieces remain.
step-3: continue working with your hands until the dough is shaggy.
step-4: add the water, starting with 3 tablespoons, and mix until the dough is moist enough to hold together.
step-5: add more water as needed, 1 tablespoon at a time.
step-6: form the dough into a disc and wrap with plastic wrap.
step-7: refrigerate for 30–60 minutes.
step-8: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-9: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-10: while the dough is resting, make the filling: in a medium bowl, combine the blackberries, cherries, peaches, sugar, and remaining 2 tablespoons of flour.
step-11: toss to coat the fruit.
step-12: assemble the crostata: on a lightly floured surface, roll the dough out to a 12-inch (30 cm) wide circle, about ⅛ inch (3 mm) thick.
step-13: transfer the dough to the prepared baking sheet.
step-14: spoon the fruit filling into the center of the dough, leaving a 2-inch (5 cm) border around the edges.
step-15: fold the edges of the crust up and over the filling to create a rustic look.
step-16: brush the crust with the beaten egg and sprinkle with sugar.
step-17: bake for 45–50 minutes until the crust is golden brown.
step-18: let cool for 10–15 minutes before slicing and serving.

step-1: in a small saucepan bring water and orange juice to a boil then add quinoa, cover and simmer for 12-15 minutes.
step-2: add quinoa to a bowl.
step-3: top with strawberries, blueberries, and mangoes.
step-4: in a small bowl, mix lime juice, and honey.
step-5: drizzle dressing over the quinoa and mix.
step-6: top with basil.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: add the bread cubes to a medium bowl and toss with 2 tablespoons of olive oil, ½ teaspoon salt, and ½ teaspoon black pepper until well coated.
step-3: spread the bread cubes in an even layer on a baking sheet.
step-4: toast for 15 minutes, until golden brown.
step-5: in a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, whisk together the shallot, garlic, mustard, vinegar, remaining teaspoon of pepper, and 1 teaspoon salt.
step-6: slowly drizzle in ¼ cup olive oil, whisking constantly, until the dressing is emulsified.
step-7: set aside.
step-8: heat the remaining tablespoon of olive oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat.
step-9: once the oil is shimmering, add the corn and cook, stirring, until charred in spots, about 5 minutes.
step-10: season with the remaining ½ teaspoon salt.
step-11: transfer the corn to a large bowl and add the toasted bread cubes, tomatoes, mozzarella, and dressing.
step-12: toss well.
step-13: add the basil and toss again to incorporate.

step-1: place the potatoes in a large pot with enough water to cover by 2 inches (5 cm).
step-2: cover and bring to a boil over high heat.
step-3: once boiling, uncover, add the salt and corn, and reduce the heat to medium.
step-4: simmer for 10-15 minutes, until the potatoes and the corn are tender.
step-5: drain.
step-6: add the potatoes to a large bowl.
step-7: combine 2 tablespoons of pickle juice with the mustard and pour it over the still-warm potatoes.
step-8: toss to coat.
step-9: refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to an hour.
step-10: dice the red bell pepper, removing the ribs and seeds.
step-11: set a medium bowl upside down in a large bowl and stand a corn cob on the inverted bowl.
step-12: cut the corn kernels from the cobs, letting them fall into the larger bowl.
step-13: in a medium bowl, combine the mayonnaise, remaining tablespoon of pickle juice, paprika, salt, and pepper and stir until smooth.
step-14: add the bell pepper, corn, celery, pickles, red onion, green onions, and dill to the bowl with the potatoes.
step-15: pour the sauce over and toss to coat.
step-16: sprinkle the potato salad with chopped chives, for garnish.

step-1: heat oven to 500°f (260°c).
step-2: spiralize the yellow squash and zucchinis into a large bowl.
step-3: bring a large skillet over medium heat and add olive oil.
step-4: sauté shallots and garlic until golden brown and soft, about 2-3 minutes.
step-5: season with salt and pepper and stir.
step-6: remove from heat and set aside.
step-7: quarter and deseed the red bell peppers and arrange onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-8: roast the red peppers until black and charred bits appear, about 25-30 minutes.
step-9: carefully remove the red peppers from the oven and remove the charred black bits.
step-10: transfer the roasted peppers to a blender and add salt, pepper, cornstarch, red pepper flakes, sautéed shallot and garlic, and milk.
step-11: blend on high speed until creamy.
step-12: set aside.
step-13: heat a large skillet over medium heat.
step-14: pour the pepper sauce in the skillet to thicken and simmer, about 2-3 minutes.
step-15: reduce heat to low and continue simmering.
step-16: add the spiralized veggies and stir to coat, cooking for 2-3 minutes.
step-17: add basil and stir, 2-3 minutes.
step-18: serve with red pepper flakes and basil.

step-1: combine oil, carrots, celery, onion, salt, pepper, and potato in a large pot over medium heat for 3 minutes.
step-2: add garlic and stir for one minute.
step-3: mix in diced tomatoes, vegetable stock, and zucchini.
step-4: bring to a boil.
step-5: place the lid on the pot, and simmer for 45 minutes.
step-6: add cannellini beans, spinach, and pasta.
step-7: cover and simmer 10 minutes.
step-8: allow to cool before serving.

step-1: cut the ends off the zucchini.
step-2: with a vegetable peeler, shave off as many thin slices as possible and transfer a large bowl.
step-3: repeat with the yellow squash and carrots.
step-4: place the grape tomatoes between 2 large plates or tupperware lids.
step-5: press down, securing the tomatoes in place, and use a long, sharp knife to slice the tomatoes in half.
step-6: add to the bowl with the shaved vegetables.
step-7: drizzle olive oil over the vegetables and season with salt and pepper.
step-8: toss to combine.
step-9: make the pesto: add the basil, parsley, cashews, garlic, salt, pepper, lemon juice, and olive oil to a food processor and process until smooth.
step-10: spoon the pesto onto the shaved vegetables and mix well with tongs until fully coated and serve.

step-1: in a food processor, combine the carrots, onion, celery, and garlic.
step-2: pulse until finely chopped, but not mushy.
step-3: transfer the vegetables to a bowl.
step-4: add the walnuts to the food processor and pulse until they reach the consistency of ground meat.
step-5: heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
step-6: add the vegetable mixture, basil, oregano, parsley, and salt.
step-7: cook for 25 minutes, stirring frequently, until caramelized and any excess moisture has evaporated.
step-8: add the tomato paste, stir to combine, and cook for 5 minutes.
step-9: add the vegetable stock, lentils, ground walnuts, and tomatoes and season with salt.
step-10: reduce the heat to medium, cover, and simmer for 35 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the lentils are cooked through and walnuts have softened.
step-11: remove the lid and cook off any remaining liquid, stirring frequently, about 5 minutes.
step-12: add the wine, stir, and reduce until there is no liquid at the bottom of the pot, about 10 minutes.
step-13: season with more salt to taste.
step-14: trim the ends of the zucchini, then cut into noodles using a spiralizer or julienne peeler.
step-15: add 2 tablespoons of olive oil, a pinch of salt, the red pepper flakes, and garlic to a large pan.
step-16: turn the heat to medium and cook for 2-3 minutes, until the garlic is fragrant.
step-17: work in batches, add about 2-3 cups of zucchini noodles at a time to the pan.
step-18: season lightly with salt and cook for 45-60 seconds, tossing continuously with tongs, until warmed through.
step-19: add more olive oil, 1 tablespoon at a time, if the pan looks dry.
step-20: serve the zucchini noodles with the bolognese.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: with a knife, carefully cut a slit in the side of the chicken making sure to not cut all the way through.
step-3: season the chicken breasts with olive oil, pepper, and salt.
step-4: stuff each chicken breast with a clove of garlic, half of the mozzarella, half of the sun-dried tomatoes, and 1 ounce (30g) of baby spinach.
step-5: (you may use toothpicks to close the ingredients inside the chicken breasts if desired, just remember to remove them!)
step-6: in a cast-iron skillet, sear chicken on medium-high heat until all sides are browned.
step-7: continue baking in oven for 15-20 minutes, or until internal temperature of the chicken reaches 165˚f (75˚c).
step-8: set aside.
step-9: heat marinara and spinach in the cast-iron skillet on medium-high heat until spinach is wilted.
step-10: serve chicken on top of whole wheat pasta and spinach marinara sauce.

step-1: heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
step-2: add the garlic and cook for about 30 seconds, until fragrant.
step-3: add the sun-dried tomatoes and lemon juice and cook for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
step-4: add the tuna, salt, and pepper, and mix until thoroughly combined.
step-5: add the pasta and spinach and cook for about 1 minute, until spinach starts to wilt.
step-6: remove the pasta from the heat and serve.

step-1: preheat your oven to 200°c (400°f, gas mark 6).
step-2: dice the mozzarella and sun-dried tomatoes into small pieces and tear the basil leaves.
step-3: season the chicken breasts with salt, pepper and dried oregano.
step-4: cut a very deep slit lengthways into the chicken, but do not cut all the way through - spread it out a bit if necessary to give you more room to work with.
step-5: stuff to the brim with the fillings
step-6: use a few cocktail sticks to hold the chicken together and place on a baking tray.
step-7: pour a tablespoon of the oil from the sun-dried tomatoes jar over each chicken breast.
step-8: bake in the center of the oven for 20-25 minutes until cooked through and the juices run clear.
step-9: remove the cocktail sticks.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: in the bowl of a food processor, add sunflower seeds.
step-3: process until finely ground.
step-4: add onion, brown rice, thyme, salt, and water and process until combined.
step-5: add carrot and celery and pulse several times to combine.
step-6: using a ½ cup (120 ml) measuring cup, portion 5 patties from the mixture.
step-7: place onto a lightly greased parchment-lined sheet pan.
step-8: bake for 30 minutes, or until firm and browned, flipping over halfway through.
step-9: serve burgers with your favorite fixins.

step-1: melt the butter in a medium frying pan over high heat.
step-2: crack the egg into the pan and let it cook until the egg whites begin coagulating, about 1 minute.
step-3: sprinkle with salt and pepper.
step-4: cover with a lid on for 1 minute to finish cooking the egg.
step-5: then, uncover and remove the egg from the pan.

step-1: separate the egg whites and the egg yolks in two separate bowls.
step-2: you’ll only need 3 yolks, so discard the other 2 or reserve for another use.
step-3: whisk the egg yolks until they become homogenous and pale in color.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: transfer the egg whites to a large bowl and whisk until they triple in size and become white with medium peaks.
step-6: carefully fold the egg yolks into the egg whites until fully incorporated.
step-7: pour the egg mixture into a medium nonstick frying pan with a lid.
step-8: cook over medium-low heat until bottom of omelet has set, about 5 minutes.
step-9: lift up each side of the omelette and drop a tablespoon of butter underneath.
step-10: cover the pan and cook for another 5 minutes, or until the top of the omelet has set.
step-11: remove the lid and season the omelet with salt and pepper.
step-12: remove the pan from the heat.
step-13: fold the omelette onto a plate and sprinkle with chives.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a bowl, whisk sugar, brown sugar, vanilla extract, and butter together until creamy.
step-3: add greek yogurt, egg, and bananas.
step-4: mash bananas and mix thoroughly.
step-5: gently fold in the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon just until combined.
step-6: add chocolate chips and stir in gently.
step-7: like a baking sheet with parchment paper and place spoonfuls of dough 2 inches (5 cm) apart.
step-8: bake for 15 minutes and cool on a cooling rack.

step-1: combine rice, sudachi juice, and olice oil.
step-2: fill 2 types of donut molds (circluar and flower shapes) with rice mixture.
step-3: fill one row of circular donuts half-way, add tuna, then cover remaining space with rice.
step-4: press rice into molds using hands, then flip and release from molds.
step-5: (flower donut) mix spanish mackerel, shiso leaf, myoga, japanese green onion, and miso until texture is uniform.
step-6: place mixutre on top.
step-7: garnish with slices of radish, okra, and hojiso.
step-8: (circle donut w/ tuna) dip up-side in white sesame, fill center with grated chinese yam, and garnish with wasabi.
step-9: (flower donut) layer sea urchin on top, and garnish with grated nori.
step-10: (circle donut) wrap with slices of salmon.
step-11: fill center with ikura and garnish with slice of lemon.

step-1: wash and rinse the rice thoroughly to remove excess starch.
step-2: cook in a medium pot at high until the water reaches a boil.
step-3: turn to low heat, and let it simmer for about 20 minutes.
step-4: while there is still some water in the pot, add the vinegar and sugar.
step-5: stir and remove from heat.
step-6: in a separate pan, add the oil and mushrooms.
step-7: cook until they begin to brown.
step-8: add the soy sauces, green onions, and brown sugar.
step-9: simmer for 2-3 minutes, adding small amounts of water if necessary.
step-10: spray a square or round bowl with cooking oil, and press the rice into the edges with the back of a spoon.
step-11: layer avocado slices around the edges and bottom of the rice.
step-12: spoon in the mushroom sauce.
step-13: cover and pat down another layer of rice to seal in the goodness!
step-14: place a serving plate on top of the bowl and flip upside-down.
step-15: remove the bowl carefully.
step-16: sprinkle with black sesame seeds.
step-17: use a seaweed snack to grab.

step-1: thoroughly mix all the meatball ingredients, and shape them into golf ball-sized balls.
step-2: over low to medium heat, fry all sides of the meatballs, until the meatballs are cooked through and the outsides are golden brown.
step-3: it will take around 12-15 minutes.
step-4: if you are making a large quantity for a party, make the meatballs in advance and reheat them in an oven for 10-15 minutes at 175°c.
step-5: (when reheating, ensure the meatballs are piping hot throughout before serving.)
step-6: to make the cream sauce, dissolve a beef stock cube in 20 milliliters of water.
step-7: then add in cream, mustard, and worcestershire sauce.
step-8: toss the meatballs in the sauce while it reduces to a thick and creamy sauce.
step-9: serve the meatballs in soft french sticks with sliced cucumber and lingonberry or cranberry jam.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: in a medium-size bowl mix together the beef, pork, bread crumbs, onion, parsley, garlic, eggs, salt, and pepper until just combined.
step-3: take a walnut size of the meat mixture and roll into a ball.
step-4: repeat with remaining meat and transfer to an oiled rack on a sheet tray.
step-5: bake meatballs for 15 minutes, until golden brown.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: melt butter in a pan on medium heat and allow it to brown slightly.
step-8: stir in the flour completely and cook for about 1 minute creating a pale roux.
step-9: add the beef broth, stir, and cook until it thickens.
step-10: add in the ground allspice, nutmeg, salt, pepper, and the heavy cream, stir, and bring to a simmer for 5 minutes.
step-11: add the meatballs and coat them with the gravy.
step-12: sprinkle with the parsley, poke with toothpicks, and serve!

step-1: in a small saucepan, combine the milk, 1 tablespoon of sugar, and the saffron threads.
step-2: heat over medium-low heat, stirring to dissolve the sugar.
step-3: once the milk is steaming, remove from the heat and let cool to 110˚f (43˚c).
step-4: sprinkle the yeast over the milk and let bubble, about 5 minutes.
step-5: in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, remaining sugar, salt, and cardamom.
step-6: make a well in the center of the flour and pour in the milk, 2 eggs, sour cream, and butter.
step-7: stir to combine, then, once the dough starts to come together, use your hands to incorporate fully.
step-8: turn the dough out onto a clean surface and knead until the dough is springy, about 5 minutes.
step-9: place the dough in a large bowl and cover with plastic wrap.
step-10: let rise in a warm place for 1 hour, or until doubled in size.
step-11: punch down the dough and flip onto a clean surface.
step-12: divide the dough into 12 equal pieces.
step-13: form each piece into a ball about 2 inches (5 cm) wide, then roll into a cylinder about 12-14 inches (30 cm) long
step-14: swirl the dough into a s shape starting at one end until the middle and then the other end.
step-15: transfer the dough to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, cover with plastic wrap, and let rise for 30 minutes, until doubled in size.
step-16: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-17: beat the remaining egg and brush over the dough swirls.
step-18: place a single raisin or chocolate chip in the center of the swirls on each end.
step-19: bake the buns for 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown and cooked through.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a medium bowl, whisk the sugar and eggs until the mixture is pale yellow in color.
step-3: sift in the flour, cocoa powder, and salt.
step-4: fold until incorporated.
step-5: mix in the butter and vanilla.
step-6: grease a pan with butter and sprinkle cocoa powder to coat.
step-7: pour in batter and smooth out.
step-8: batter will be very thick.
step-9: bake for 20 minutes or until the top has hardened.
step-10: the center should still be soft.
step-11: sprinkle with powdered sugar.
step-12: add berries (optional).

step-1: make a bain-marie by filling a pot with a little water.
step-2: rest a heatproof bowl on the rim of the pot, making sure that the water doesn’t touch the bottom of the bowl.
step-3: cook on a low heat and when the water starts to simmer add the chocolate, butter, and golden syrup to the heatproof bowl and allow it to melt - when it’s nearly there, give it a quick stir and take it off the heat.
step-4: stir the crushed pretzels in to the chocolate mixture.
step-5: line a muffin tin with muffin cases - if you have the time, you can line each muffin case with 5 pretzels to form a little holder for the mixture.
step-6: one on the base, and 4 walls, but this isn’t totally necessary, the mixture will hold on it’s own when set.
step-7: a single pretzel on top is a fairly good compromise!
step-8: fill the muffin cases with the chocolate mixture and allow to set in the fridge for at least 1 hour.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in bowl, add the almonds, salt, cayenne, honey, and olive oil, and stir to combine.
step-3: transfer to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, and bake for 12 minutes, until the honey is caramelized and the almonds are aromatic.
step-4: let cool.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: add the chopped sweet potatoes and 1 tablespoon of salt to a large pot of cold water.
step-3: bring to a boil and cook for 15 minutes, or until very tender.
step-4: drain and let cool slightly.
step-5: transfer the sweet potatoes to a large bowl.
step-6: add the butter, remaining tablespoon of salt, the milk, and eggs.
step-7: mix with an electric hand mixer until the potatoes are mashed and everything is well incorporated.
step-8: transfer half of the sweet potatoes to another large bowl.
step-9: make the sweet base: to a bowl, add the brown sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, and vanilla.
step-10: mix well to combine.
step-11: make the savory base: to the other bowl, add the green onions, garlic, and pepper.
step-12: mix well to combine.
step-13: spread the sweet base in one side of a 9x13-inch (23x33-cm) baking dish.
step-14: press the uncooked sweet potato slices against the exposed side of the sweet base as a divider, then spread the savory base in the other side of the pan.
step-15: make the sweet topping: in a small bowl, combine the butter, brown sugar, flour, and pecans, and mix until crumbly.
step-16: sprinkle over the sweet base.
step-17: make the savory topping: in another small bowl, combine bread crumbs, salt, pepper, bacon bits, and oil, and stir to combine.
step-18: sprinkle the crumbs over the savory base.
step-19: bake the sweet potato casserole for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-20: remove the casserole from oven and top the sweet side with the halved marshmallows, cut-side down.
step-21: return to the oven and broil on high for 1-2 minutes, or until the marshmallows are golden brown and toasted.
step-22: remove the casserole from the oven and sprinkle the savory side with green onions.
step-23: serve warm.

step-1: preheat the oven to 275°f (140°c).
step-2: strain the pineapple juice from the can of pineapples into a large saucepan and reserve the fruit for later.
step-3: add the rice vinegar, vegetable oil, soy sauce, ginger, ketchup, honey, garlic, and cornstarch.
step-4: whisk to combine and cook over high heat for 10 minutes, or until the glaze is reduced by half and has the consistency of honey.
step-5: remove from the heat and divide the glaze in half.
step-6: place the baby back ribs on a baking sheet and season with salt and pepper on both sides.
step-7: brush half of the glaze all over the ribs.
step-8: cover the ribs with aluminum foil, wrapping tightly.
step-9: bake for 2 hours, or until the ribs are tender.
step-10: remove the ribs from the oven and increase the oven temperature to 400°f (200°c).
step-11: remove the top piece of foil and add the red and green bell peppers to the baking sheet.
step-12: pour the reserved glaze over the top and toss to coat the peppers.
step-13: add the reserved pineapple over the ribs.
step-14: bake for 20 minutes, until the peppers are softened.
step-15: slice the ribs and garnish with sesame seeds and scallions.
step-16: serve warm with rice alongside.

step-1: place the chicken breasts, salt, peppercorns, halved onion, whole garlic cloves, bay leaves, and water in a large pot.
step-2: cover the pot and bring to a simmer over medium heat.
step-3: once the water is simmering, cook for 10 minutes, until the chicken registers 165°f (74°c) when pierced with an instant-read thermometer.
step-4: transfer the chicken to a cutting board and discard the cooking liquid.
step-5: using 2 forks, pull the chicken apart until shredded.
step-6: in a large nonstick pan, heat the oil over medium-high heat until shimmering.
step-7: add the diced onion and a pinch of salt and sauté until softened, about 2 minutes.
step-8: add the minced garlic and sauté until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
step-9: add the soy sauce, honey, and lime juice and stir until the mixture has thickened slightly, about 2 minutes.
step-10: add the shredded chicken and mix until everything is well incorporated.
step-11: remove the pan from the heat and let the chicken cool for 5 minutes before spooning into the lettuce leaves.
step-12: top with sliced scallions.

step-1: sear the chicken until golden brown in the pan with the salt and pepper.
step-2: take out and set aside.
step-3: in the same pan, fry the garlic and red pepper for a couple of minutes before stirring in the soy sauce, ketchup, and vinegar.
step-4: add the chicken and noodles, and mix together for another couple of minutes.
step-5: garnish with sesame seeds.

step-1: in a bowl, combine all marinade ingredients with the pork.
step-2: cover and leave to marinade in the fridge 20 minutes.
step-3: place the corn flour in a large bowl and toss the marinated pork chunks until liberally coated.
step-4: in a medium-sized saucepan, heat the oil to 350˚f (180°c).
step-5: deep fry the pork pieces for about 3-4 minutes until the coating is golden brown and the pork is cooked throughout.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: for the sauce, place a frying pan over a medium heat and add the oil.
step-8: sauté the garlic until fragrant, then fry the peppers until soften.
step-9: add in the pineapple and warm thorough.
step-10: add the sugar, vinegar, and ketchup, stir.
step-11: bring the mixture to a boil.
step-12: add the pork to the frying pan and coat everything evenly with the sauce.
step-13: serve top with sesame seeds.

step-1: add sweet potato, white beans, carrots, and water, breast milk, or formula to a blender or food processor.
step-2: blend very well.
step-3: add more liquid as needed.
step-4: refrigerate up to 4 days or freeze up to 1 month.
step-5: note: check with your pediatrician before introducing new foods to children under 12 months.

step-1: remove the corn kernels from the cob with a knife.
step-2: then, carefully break the cobs in half with your hands.
step-3: place the corn kernels in a food processor.
step-4: pulse several times until coarsely chopped.
step-5: add the chopped kernels, cobs, 1½ cups (360 ml) of cream, and the salt to a large saucepan.
step-6: stir to ensure the ingredients are well combined.
step-7: cover and cook over low heat for 20 minutes.
step-8: remove the cream and corn mixture from the heat and chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours.
step-9: combine the blueberries, sugar, and lemon juice in a medium bowl.
step-10: let sit at room temperature for 10 minutes, or until the berries appear juicy and vibrant, stirring occasionally.
step-11: transfer the berry mixture to a food processor or blender and puree.
step-12: set aside.
step-13: remove the corn cobs from the chilled cream mixture.
step-14: pour the remaining corn cream through a sieve into a large bowl.
step-15: use the back of a spoon or spatula to press the solids to extract any remaining liquid.
step-16: add the remaining heavy cream.
step-17: using an electric hand mixer, whip the cream mixture until soft peaks form.
step-18: fold in the condensed milk with a rubber spatula.
step-19: pour half of the cream mixture into a 9x5-inch (23x13-cm) loaf pan.
step-20: top with half of the blueberry puree and use a knife to swirl it into the cream
step-21: top with the remaining cream and puree, then swirl the puree with a knife again.
step-22: freeze for 3-4 hours before serving.
step-23: if the ice cream is too solid to scoop, let sit at room temperature for 10-15 minutes before scooping.

step-1: in a small bowl, combine water and flax meal, and let it sit for 10 minutes.
step-2: in a large saucepan bring 6 cups (1 ½ l) of water to a boil, add sweet potatoes.
step-3: cook until they are tender, about 10 minutes, and drain.
step-4: preheat oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-5: in a food processor, combine the sweet potatoes, chickpeas, basil, flax meal, garlic, salt, pepper, onion powder, and flour, and pulse until combined.
step-6: add the breadcrumbs and mix.
step-7: take about 1 tablespoon worth of mixture and form it into a nugget with your hands.
step-8: pan fry with a small drizzle of oil over medium-high heat until both sides are golden brown, about 10 minutes.
step-9: or, you can bake them on a piece of parchment paper at 400˚f (200˚c) for 20 minutes, flipping after the first 10 minutes.
step-10: allow to cool 5 minutes.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425ºf (220ºc).
step-2: cut the sweet potatoes in small cubes and transfer on one half of a non-stick baking sheet.
step-3: peel and slice the onion and set aside.
step-4: add the chickpeas to the other half of the baking sheet.
step-5: in a liquid measuring cup with a pour spout, combine the olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, cumin, paprika, cinnamon, cayenne, salt, and pepper and mix well.
step-6: pour half of the dressing over the sweet potatoes and chickpeas and mix with your hands until well-coated.
step-7: keep the chickpeas and sweet potatoes separated as much as possible.
step-8: scoot the chickpeas toward the sweet potatoes and add the onions to the baking sheet.
step-9: make sure everything is spread out evenly.
step-10: bake for 30 minutes, until the sweet potatoes are tender.
step-11: use tongs to stir halfway through.
step-12: let cool for 20 minutes.
step-13: place the greens in a large bowl.
step-14: top with the roasted chickpeas, sweet potatoes, and onion.
step-15: add the parsley, cilantro, and remaining dressing and toss to combine.
step-16: top with dried cranberries, if using.

step-1: slice sweet potato lengthwise into ¼-inch (6 mm) thick slices.
step-2: place slices in toaster on high for about 5 minutes, or until cooked through.
step-3: (you may need to toast them several times depending on the strength your toaster settings)
step-4: while the sweet potato is toasting, mash the avocado in a bowl.
step-5: add garlic and tomatoes.
step-6: stir to combine.
step-7: top your sweet potato toasts with the mashed avocado mixture and garnish with crumbled bacon and feta.
step-8: serve immediately.

step-1: heat olive oil on medium heat in a 4-quart chicken fryer.
step-2: add sweet potatoes, onion, pepper, salt, pepper, paprika, and cumin, and stir.
step-3: cook for 10 minutes, occasionally stirring.
step-4: add spinach and cook for an additional five minutes.
step-5: lastly, add the black beans and stir until all ingredients are well-blended.
step-6: note: we topped our hash with an egg and avocado slices.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: using a mandolin, slice the sweet potatoes to about 3-millimeter thick slices.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine sliced sweet potatoes, oil, salt, and pepper.
step-4: lay out sweet potato slices on a large sheet pan and bake for 10 minutes.
step-5: combine eggs, tomatoes, green onions, bell pepper, garlic powder, salt, pepper, and milk in a large bowl, whisking to combine.
step-6: remove sweet potatoes from oven once edges start to crisp and turn the oven down to 400°f (200°c) .
step-7: line the sides and base of a 9x5-inch (20x10-cm) greased loaf pan with the sweet potato slices.
step-8: repeat with ham slices, then add spinach, another layer of sweet potatoes slices, the egg mixture, another layer of ham, and a final layer of sweet potato slices.
step-9: fold the outside sweet potato slices over the final layer of sweet potatoes.
step-10: bake for 30 minutes.
step-11: place a plate over top and invert the loaf pan onto the plate, slice and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: line a 9-inch (23 cm) square baking pan with parchment paper.
step-3: in a large bowl, stir together the mashed sweet potatoes, almond butter, maple syrup, and vanilla until well combined.
step-4: add the oats, cinnamon, and nutmeg and stir until well combined.
step-5: transfer the mixture to the baking pan and spread in an even layer with a spatula.
step-6: bake for 20 minutes.
step-7: remove from oven and top with the slivered almonds and shredded coconut, pressing gently into the bars.
step-8: bake for another 10 minutes, until the coconut is lightly toasted.
step-9: let cool for 10 minutes, then slice into 9 bars.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: use a fork to pierce holes all over the sweet potatoes.
step-3: microwave the potatoes for 7 minutes until they have softened significantly.
step-4: slice the potatoes in half and use a spoon to scrape out the inner flesh, making sure to leave at least a ¼-inch (6 mm) thick border on each side, saving the scooped out potato parts to use for side dishes.
step-5: transfer the potatoes to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-6: fill each of the potatoes with 1 egg and an assortment of fillings for whatever flavor combinations you’d like.
step-7: season each potatoes with salt and pepper.
step-8: bake for 8-12 minutes, until the egg has cooked to preferred doneness.
step-9: top the potatoes and side dishes with your choice of topping and garnishes and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: with a mandolin or a sharp knife, carefully cut the sweet potatoes into ¹⁄₁₆-inch (1 mm) thick slices.
step-3: place the sweet potato slices in a large bowl, add the salt, pepper, paprika, garlic powder, and onion powder, and toss the potatoes until evenly coated.
step-4: let sit for about 20 minutes, until water releases from the sweet potatoes and the slices are soft and flexible.
step-5: brush the cups of a 12-cup muffin tin with the olive oil.
step-6: arrange 5 sweet potato slices around the sides of a muffin cup, overlapping slightly.
step-7: place 1 slice on the bottom to create a flower.
step-8: repeat with the remaining potato slices.
step-9: sprinkle a bit of cheese in the bottom of each cup.
step-10: bake for 10 minutes until the cheese has melted and the sweet potato slices are tender.
step-11: remove the potato cups from the oven and reduce the oven temperature to 300°f (150°c).
step-12: add your desired fillings to the cups.
step-13: season with salt and pepper.
step-14: bake for another 20-25 minutes, or until the eggs are completely cooked and/or the vegetables are tender.
step-15: let cool for about 5 minutes.
step-16: serve warm.

step-1: peel potatoes and cut into ¼ in (6 mm) rings.
step-2: move rings to a medium-sized mixing bowl.
step-3: add butter, syrup, salt, and pepper to the bowl of rings and toss to coat evenly.
step-4: spray down a standard 12-cup cupcake tray with nonstick cooking spray and place sweet potato rings inside, stacking them up until level with the rest of the tray.
step-5: cover with aluminium foil.
step-6: bake at 350˚f (180˚c) for 15 minutes.
step-7: remove foil, then bake the potatoes uncovered for 5 additional minutes.
step-8: once cooked, remove tray from the oven and quickly add marshmallows, placing 1 marshmallow on top of each stack of potatoes.
step-9: turn oven to broiler setting and place the marshmallow topped stacks under the heat for 1 minute.
step-10: using a fork or spoon, carefully remove stacks from baking tray and transfer to plate for serving.

step-1: in a small bowl, mix together peanut butter, lime juice, soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, garlic, ginger, red pepper flakes, and water until smooth.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: in a large bowl, mix lime juice, sesame oil, salt, and pepper.
step-4: add cubed chicken to mixture and stir until completely coated.
step-5: cover with plastic wrap and marinate in refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-6: heat a large skillet or saucepan over medium-high heat and add chicken.
step-7: cook for 4-6 minutes, or until no longer pink.
step-8: once cooked through, remove chicken and transfer to a bowl.
step-9: spiralize bell peppers and sweet potato into a large bowl.
step-10: add sesame oil to the skillet.
step-11: once the oil is hot, add in the broccoli florets and cook for 2-3 minutes.
step-12: add in the spiralized vegetables and cook for 2-3 minutes.
step-13: add in the chicken and peanut sauce and stir to coat.
step-14: note: add additional water if sauce is too thick to coat.
step-15: reduce heat to medium low and cook for 3-4 minutes, until sweet potato noodles are al dente.
step-16: top with green onions and chopped peanuts.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, microwave chickpeas for 1 minute, or until softened.
step-3: peel the cooked sweet potato, and add it to the bowl of chickpeas, along with the garlic, chili powder, and salt.
step-4: mash until chickpeas are finely mashed.
step-5: add cornmeal and scallions, and set aside.
step-6: for the barbecue sauce: in a medium-size bowl, combine tomato paste, water, maple syrup, apple cider vinegar, chili powder, garlic powder, and salt.
step-7: mix to combine.
step-8: add barbecue sauce to the mashed chickpea mixture and mix until thoroughly combined.
step-9: using a ½ cup (120 ml) measuring cup, portion 5 patties from the mixture.
step-10: place onto a lightly greased parchment-lined sheet pan.
step-11: bake for 40 minutes, or until firm and browned, flipping over halfway through.
step-12: serve with the remaining barbecue sauce and favorite fixins.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: cut sweet potato into ⅛ inch (3 mm) to ¼ inch (6 mm) slices.
step-3: in a medium bowl, toss slices with olive oil until fully coated.
step-4: add seasonings and toss until fully coated.
step-5: arrange slices on a baking sheet.
step-6: bake for 25 - 35 minutes, flipping halfway.
step-7: allow slices to cool to room temperature.

step-1: in a food processor, pulse the sweet potato chunks until they reach your desired “rice” consistency.
step-2: in a large skillet over medium heat, heat oil, then add onions and let cook until translucent.
step-3: add sweet potato rice, carrots, salt, pepper, and vegetable broth and cook until the liquid has evaporated and the sweet potato is tender, stirring occasionally.
step-4: add peas, eggs, and soy sauce, and combine, allowing it to heat through.
step-5: garnish with green onions.

step-1: preheat oven to 425ºf/220ºc.
step-2: slice the ends off of the sweet potato and then slice it in half.
step-3: take one half and slice it horizontally 4 times then slice vertically 4 times to cut into fries.
step-4: in a large bowl mix fries and ingredients until evenly spread.
step-5: place fries on a prepared baking sheet and bake for 25 minutes or until fluffy inside and crunchy on the outside.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: cut sweet potato into fries and combine in a large bowl with olive oil, rosemary, salt, and pepper.
step-3: place in a single layer on a baking sheet lined in parchment paper.
step-4: bake for 20 to 25 minutes, flipping halfway through.
step-5: prepare dip while fries are baking.
step-6: combine all dip ingredients in a small bowl and set aside in the refrigerator until ready to use.

step-1: in a blender, combine the sweet potato, almond butter, molasses, vanilla, cinnamon, ginger, milk, and salt.
step-2: blend on high speed for 3 minutes, or until completely smooth.
step-3: transfer the sweet potato mixture to a small saucepan and heat over medium-low heat until just warmed through.
step-4: do not boil.
step-5: pour into a mug and serve immediately.
step-6: nutrition - sweet potato gingerbread - calories: 480, total fat: 22 grams, sodium: 361 mg, total carbs: 60 grams, dietary fiber: 4 grams, sugars: 33 grams, protein: 14 grams

step-1: preheat oven to 400º f (200º c).
step-2: prick the sweet potato with a fork several times and bake for 40 minutes (or microwave for 5 minutes).
step-3: allow potato to cool at least 5 minutes before peeling skin off.
step-4: in a large bowl, mash potato with masher or fork until smooth.
step-5: add parmesan cheese, egg, and flour.
step-6: knead the dough until it is firm and no longer sticky, adding flour as needed, forming a ball with the dough.
step-7: divide the dough into four equal parts.
step-8: take one part and roll it out into a long rope, about a 1-inch (2 ½ cm) wide.
step-9: slice into ½-inch (1 cm) rectangles and set aside.
step-10: using an overturned fork, slide each gnocchi over the fork prongs so they become serrated in a corkscrew shape.
step-11: bring a large pot of water to a boil and add the gnocchi.
step-12: boil until the gnocchi float to the top, about 1-2 minutes.
step-13: drain in a colander.
step-14: in a pan over medium heat, melt butter and add sage.
step-15: simmer for 1 minute without letting butter burn.
step-16: add gnocchi to pan with the sage and butter, tossing until lightly golden.
step-17: top with more parmesan cheese.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: trim and discard the tough green parts from the leeks, then cut them in in half lengthwise.
step-3: swirl in water to remove any sand.
step-4: pat dry.
step-5: on a large baking tray, place the leeks, sweet potatoes and garlic.
step-6: pour melted butter and salt evenly over the vegetables.
step-7: bake for 25 minutes.
step-8: in a large saucepan, bring the white wine, thyme and parsley to a boil and cook until it loses the raw alcohol smell, about 5 minutes.
step-9: reduce the heat to a bare simmer.
step-10: when the leeks are golden take both leeks and garlic off the tray.
step-11: place potatoes back in the oven for another 20 minutes.
step-12: add leeks and garlic into the simmering wine sauce.
step-13: cook until leeks are tender, about 30 minutes.
step-14: melt 2 tablespoons butter in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
step-15: pull the leeks from the cooking liquid, pat them dry and add to the butter to cook briefly on both sides, about 3 minutes total.
step-16: remove the stem ends from the leeks and cut into 2-inch (5 cm) lengths.
step-17: for each taco, heat 2 tortillas on a griddle or in a large skillet over medium-high heat with a little butter.
step-18: place 2 slices of oaxaca cheese next to them on the griddle.
step-19: when the tortillas are warmed through, stack them on top of the cheese.
step-20: when the cheese has browned on one side, remove the tortillas and cheese to a plate, cheese-side up.
step-21: add 2 to 3 strips of leek and some sweet potato.
step-22: spoon over 1½ to 2 teaspoons salsa and sprinkle with 2 teaspoons crumbled feta, a few toasted pine nuts, and 1 teaspoon minced green onions and serve immediately.
step-23: repeat using the remaining ingredients.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: use a grater to shred sweet potato.
step-3: add to a large bowl and mix with panko, olive oil, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
step-4: spoon into greased muffin tin, filling each tin about ⅔ full.
step-5: bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown.
step-6: add in optional toppings/fillings.
step-7: for the bacon and egg hash cup, use a spoon to form a well in the sweet potatoes.
step-8: gently pour in egg and top with salt, pepper, and bacon.
step-9: bake for an additional 30 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: shred the sweet potato.
step-3: in a medium bowl, combine sweet potato, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
step-4: in a greased 6-cup muffin pan, evenly divide the sweet potato mixture.
step-5: press into the bottom of the muffin cups.
step-6: bake for 15 minutes.
step-7: crack an egg into each muffin cup.
step-8: add your desired combination of fillings to the muffin cups.
step-9: season with pepper.
step-10: add shredded cheese if desired.
step-11: bake for 15-20 minutes.
step-12: garnish with green onions.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: carefully slice sweet potatoes into ⅛ inch (3 mm) slices.
step-3: add to a large mixing bowl.
step-4: add melted butter, coconut oil, cumin, cinnamon, and red pepper flakes.
step-5: toss to coat potato slices.
step-6: mix in the parmesan cheese.
step-7: in a greased cupcake tin, stack the sweet potato chips to fill each cup.
step-8: bake in preheated oven for 50-55 minutes until tops and edges nicely brown.
step-9: remove from oven and top each stack with a marshmallow.
step-10: return to oven for 3-5 minutes, watching carefully, until the marshmallows are light brown and have puffed up.
step-11: alternatively, broil for 30 seconds.
step-12: remove from oven.
step-13: carefully pat down each marshmallow to form a nice dome over the stack.
step-14: let cool slightly before removing from pan.

step-1: use a fork to poke holes into 1 sweet potato.
step-2: wrap the sweet potato in a damp paper towel and microwave on high for 10-12 minutes, until fork-tender.
step-3: peel and dice the other sweet potato into 1-centimeter (½ inch) cubes.
step-4: carefully scoop the pulp of the cooked sweet potato into a food processor or blender.
step-5: add about 1 teaspoon each of salt and pepper and blend under smooth.
step-6: add a splash of water if the puree is too thick.
step-7: in a pan over medium heat, add 1 tablespoon olive oil and the mushrooms.
step-8: cook until the mushrooms start to crisp, about 3 minutes.
step-9: add 1 teaspoon each salt and pepper to the mushrooms and remove from the heat.
step-10: drain the mushrooms of excess oil in a paper towel-lined bowl.
step-11: add 6 tablespoons of the butter and sage to the pan and cook until brown bits start to form on the bottom, being very careful to not burn the butter.
step-12: once slightly brown, remove the sage and add the cubed sweet potato and 1 teaspoon each of salt and pepper.
step-13: cook about 5 minutes, until the potato becomes tender.
step-14: stir in the reserved purée and chicken stock.
step-15: simmer for two minutes, until the sauce thickens slightly and the mixture comes together smoothly.
step-16: add the penne and mushrooms and coat evenly in the sauce.
step-17: finish the pasta with 1 tablespoon butter, 1 tablespoon of olive oil, and sherry wine vinegar, stirring to combine.
step-18: remove from heat and stir in the parmesan cheese.
step-19: serve warm, garnished with chives, crushed amaretti cookies, and more parmesan.

step-1: in a small saucepan, warm the soy milk and vegan butter over medium heat until the butter has melted.
step-2: do not boil it.
step-3: remove from the heat and stir in the mashed sweet potato.
step-4: in a large bowl, mix together the flour, granulated sugar, salt, and yeast.
step-5: pour the liquid ingredients into the dry and use a wooden spoon to combine.
step-6: once it gets too difficult to stir, use your hands to combine the ingredients.
step-7: flour a clean work surface and transfer the dough onto the prepared work space.
step-8: knead it until you’ve got a smooth dough ball.
step-9: lightly oil a large bowl.
step-10: place the dough ball in it, cover with plastic wrap or a kitchen towel, and let rise for 1 hour.
step-11: the dough should double in size.
step-12: make the filling: in a small bowl, combine the brown sugar and cinnamon and set aside.
step-13: chop the pecans into small pieces and set aside.
step-14: in a small saucepan, melt the vegan butter and set aside.
step-15: once the dough has doubled in size, preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-16: press the air out of the dough, then transfer it back onto your floured work space.
step-17: roll the dough until it is about ¼-inch (6 mm) thick.
step-18: you should end up with a roughly rectangular oval, about 12x16 inches (30x40 cm).
step-19: brush the dough with the melted butter, sprinkle with the cinnamon-sugar mix, and then top with the chopped pecans.
step-20: fold the short side of the dough over and roll tightly until you have a log.
step-21: carefully cut the log into twelve 1-inch (2 cm) slices.
step-22: grease a large skillet or a 10-inch (25 cm) round baking dish and place the rolls in it cut-side down.
step-23: bake for 25 minutes, or until they've expanded and turned slightly golden on top.
step-24: meanwhile, make the frosting: place all the ingredients in a food processor or standing mixer with the whisk attachment on high and blend until creamy.
step-25: remove the rolls from the oven and let cool for 5 to 10 minutes.
step-26: top with the sweet potato frosting and serve immediately.
step-27: they will stay fresh for up to 2 days, but they’re best eaten the day you bake them.

step-1: add chickpeas, sweet potato, maple syrup, milk of choice, vanilla, cinnamon, and a pinch of salt to a food processor and blend until smooth.
step-2: top with chopped pecans and serve with your favorite fruit or dipping snack.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: line two baking sheets with parchment paper.
step-3: carefully slice the sweet potatoes into ½-inch (1 cm) rounds.
step-4: transfer the sweet potato rounds to a large bowl.
step-5: drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
step-6: stir to coat.
step-7: transfer the rounds to the baking sheets, spacing evenly.
step-8: bake for 30 minutes, flipping halfway, until golden brown.
step-9: top the sweet potato rounds with marinara sauce and mozzarella, or pesto and mozzarella.
step-10: bake for another 5 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the sauce is warmed through.
step-11: garnish with fresh basil and serve.

step-1: heat olive oil in a large skillet on medium-high heat.
step-2: once pan is hot and ready, toss in the sweet potato and reduce heat to medium-low heat.
step-3: sprinkle in half of salt to season.
step-4: sauté sweet potato in the skillet for about 3-5 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-5: toss in green and red bell pepper and sauté for about a minute before adding the onion.
step-6: cook until transparent, then add garlic and the spices.
step-7: once veggies are evenly coated in the spices, add the corn and black beans, continuing to cook until corn and beans are heated through.
step-8: remove skillet from heat.
step-9: serve with brown rice or quinoa, and garnish with a dollop of plain greek yogurt and chopped cilantro.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: thoroughly wash sweet potatoes.
step-3: slice in half, then into wedges.
step-4: toss wedges in olive oil and seasonings.
step-5: place on a baking sheet, skin side down.
step-6: bake 30-40 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, add the roasted sweet potato, white beans, onion, parsley, lemon juice, and seasonings.
step-3: using a potato masher, mash the ingredients until thoroughly mixed together.
step-4: once mashed, add the bread crumbs and mix them in.
step-5: in a pan, heat a small amount of oil over medium heat.
step-6: add the patties and cook for 3 minutes on each side.
step-7: transfer to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes.
step-8: place patties on buns, and top with chipotle mayo, avocado, and red onion.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: lay a sheet of puff pastry dough over the ice cube tray and carefully press into the dough forming it to the ice tray.
step-3: place a spoonful of chocolate hazelnut spread and a slice of banana in the first four cube divots.
step-4: place a spoonful of raspberry jam and a piece of chocolate in the middle four cube divots.
step-5: place the chocolate chips, marshmallows, and graham cracker into the last 4 cube divots.
step-6: place the other sheet of puff pastry over the ice cube tray and use a rolling pin to seal it.
step-7: chill for at least 10 minutes.
step-8: on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, invert the ice cube tray releasing the puff pastry pockets.
step-9: using a knife cut any excess dough from the sides.
step-10: using a fork, press into the the edges of the pastry and seal.
step-11: brush the pastry with egg wash and bake for 30 minutes.

step-1: make the filling: in a medium bowl, combine the ground black sesame seeds, powdered sugar and melted butter.
step-2: mix until well combined.
step-3: roll 1 tablespoon scoops of the mixture into balls.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: make the dough: add the rice flour to a medium bowl.
step-6: gradually add the water and mix with your hands until the dough comes together.
step-7: on a lightly floured surface, turn out the dough.
step-8: shape into a ball and cut in half.
step-9: roll the dough into 2 logs, then cut into about 16 2-3-ounce (55g -85g) portions.
step-10: flatten a dough portion in your palm and add a sesame ball to the center.
step-11: encase the filling with the dough and roll into a ball.
step-12: repeat with the remaining ingredients.
step-13: bring a large pot of water to boil.
step-14: add the sugar and osmanthus flower.
step-15: drop the dumplings into the boiling water.
step-16: gently stir so they don’t stick to the bottom of the pot.
step-17: cook until the dumplings float to the surface, then remove from the pot.
step-18: serve the dumplings in a bowl with the cooking liquid.

step-1: season chicken with salt and pepper.
step-2: coat with cornstarch, dip in beaten egg.
step-3: fry until golden, crispy and cooked through.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: dab with paper towel if greasy.
step-6: in a large pan, heat oil and fry garlic until fragrant.
step-7: add the bell pepper, cider vinegar, soy sauce, ketchup and sugar.
step-8: bring to a boil.
step-9: when the sauce has thickened, add the fried chicken.
step-10: toss to coat.
step-11: garnish with chopped scallions and sesame seeds.
step-12: serve with rice.

step-1: cut pork into bite-sized pieces and place in a medium-sized bowl.
step-2: season with pepper and add soy sauce, garlic, and green onion.
step-3: cover and let marinate for 1-2 hours.
step-4: coat pork pieces with egg, dip in cornstarch, and fry until crispy and golden (about 2 minutes).
step-5: drain on paper towels.
step-6: heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
step-7: add the onion and bell pepper.
step-8: once the vegetables start to become tender, add pineapple with syrup.
step-9: stir for 30 seconds before adding vinegar, soy sauce, ketchup, and sugar.
step-10: stir regularly over medium-high heat for 3-4 minutes as water evaporates and sauce thickens.
step-11: add the pork to the pan once the sauce begins to thicken.
step-12: stir to coat evenly.
step-13: garnish with additional green onions and a sprinkle of sesame seeds.

step-1: preheat oil to about 160˚c (320˚f).
step-2: season both sides of the chicken wings with salt and pepper.
step-3: coat with potato starch.
step-4: fry the wings at 160˚c (320˚f) approximately 7 minutes.
step-5: heat oil to about 180˚c (350˚f).
step-6: fry the wings until golden brown, about 3 minutes.
step-7: drain them on paper towels.
step-8: set aside.
step-9: make the glaze.
step-10: combine all the glaze ingredients in a shallow pan and bring it to a simmer.
step-11: reduce until thick.
step-12: toss in the wings.
step-13: sprinkle toasted white sesame.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (175˚c)
step-2: combine all seasoning ingredients and mix well.
step-3: add 2 tablespoons of the seasoning mixture to the panko bread crumbs, set aside.
step-4: (the extra seasoning can be used and stored for 1- 2 years!)
step-5: coat the chicken in flour, then egg, and finally seasoned panko.
step-6: pour melted butter into the bottom of the 9x13 (22cm x 33cm) inch pan.
step-7: place each coated piece of chicken skin side down in the butter.
step-8: bake for 1 hour at 350˚f (175˚c) (times and temperatures may vary depending on the oven), flipping the chicken over halfway through.

step-1: combine soy sauce, honey/agave, lemon juice, garlic powder, sesame seed, ginger, and garlic.
step-2: mix until combined.
step-3: add tofu and refrigerate.
step-4: marinate for 1-3 hours.
step-5: prepare as desired!

step-1: pre-heat the oven to 200°c (400°f).
step-2: add the sugar and eggs to a large mixing bowl and whisk with an electric mixer until pale and thick.
step-3: fold in half of the sifted flour, then the other half.
step-4: add 1 tsp lukewarm water and fold in.
step-5: grease a paper lined baking tray with vegetable oil, then dust with flour and sugar.
step-6: pour the mixture in.
step-7: bake for 10-12 minutes.
step-8: place some baking paper on a warm tea towel and dust with sugar.
step-9: place the cooked sponge face down on the paper and peel to reveal the sponge.
step-10: cut off the edges to make a rectangle, then roll up with the paper to ‘train’ the sponge.
step-11: unroll and spread strawberry jam all over.
step-12: roll up without the paper then dust the top with icing sugar.
step-13: cut thin slices, stick in the lolly stick and dust with more icing sugar.

step-1: use a fork to de-stem the parsley.
step-2: pick any remaining leaves with your fingers.
step-3: compost or save the stems for vegetable stock.
step-4: chop the parsley very finely and transfer to a medium bowl.
step-5: mince the tomatoes and transfer to a fine-mesh strainer, then set the strainer over another medium bowl.
step-6: sprinkle the tomatoes with a pinch of salt and mix.
step-7: let stand for 30 minutes, tossing occasionally, then add to the bowl with the parsley.
step-8: discard all but 2 tablespoons of the tomato water.
step-9: rinse the bulgur in a fine-mesh strainer under cold running water and drain well.
step-10: add 2 tablespoons of lemon juice, the bulgur, and water to the bowl with the reserved tomato water.
step-11: let stand until the grains are beginning to soften, about 1 hour or according to package instructions.
step-12: add the cucumber, scallions, mint, olive oil, soaked bulgur, remaining lemon juice, salt, and pepper to the bowl with the parsley and tomatoes.
step-13: toss to combine.
step-14: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: spoon 1 tablespoon piles of cheddar cheese 2 inches (5 cm) apart onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-3: bake for 5-7 minutes, or until edges of cheese piles are golden brown.
step-4: cool for 1 minute.
step-5: press cheese piles into mini muffin tin slots to form cups.
step-6: allow cheese to cool completely before removing.
step-7: add ground beef and salt to a skillet over medium-high heat and cook until browned.
step-8: drain grease from the meat.
step-9: add garlic, cumin, chili powder, and water to skillet and stir until well-incorporated.
step-10: stir in salt.
step-11: distribute meat to cheese cups.
step-12: garnish with tomatoes, guacamole, and greek yogurt.

step-1: for the dip, cook ground beef until brown.
step-2: add taco seasoning and stir.
step-3: set the beef aside and cook chopped poblano pepper.
step-4: in a saucepan, combine all cheese pretty much any amount of each will work.
step-5: melt over low heat.
step-6: stir in milk as needed to reach a medium-thick consistency.
step-7: add beef and pepper.
step-8: stir until well combined.
step-9: you may need to add more milk at this point.
step-10: for the bowl, preheat oven to 190°c / 375°f.
step-11: take a large flour tortilla and warm for a few seconds in the oven.
step-12: spray the outside of upside-down oven-safe bowl with canola oil and press tortilla over the top.
step-13: cook in oven until brown.
step-14: fill tortilla bowl with dip.

step-1: heat oil, add chicken, 1 tsp salt, and 1 tsp pepper.
step-2: cook until 60% done.
step-3: add the taco seasoning, stir to incorporate.
step-4: add water and cook until chicken is done.
step-5: fill egg roll wrapper with cooked chicken, tomatoes, onions and cheese or whatever ingredients you like.
step-6: roll and seal with egg wash.
step-7: fry until golden brown.
step-8: serve with salsa.

step-1: combine crust ingredients except water in food processor bowl.
step-2: pulse until the mixture creates coarse crumbles.
step-3: add water, one tablespoon at a time, until the dough forms a ball.
step-4: roll out dough on a lightly floured surface.
step-5: place into 9-inch (22cm) pie plate, and trim the sides.
step-6: bake at 400°f/204°c for 10-15 minutes or until crust is golden brown.
step-7: cook onions and beef in a medium skillet until beef is browned and cooked through.
step-8: drain if watery.
step-9: return beef to skillet, add salsa, and taco seasoning.
step-10: cook until bubbly.
step-11: pour into baked crust.
step-12: top with refried beans, and cheese.
step-13: bake 3 minutes or until cheese is melted.
step-14: let cool.
step-15: top with lettuce, tomatoes, sour cream and more cheese!

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: in a skillet over high heat, cook ground beef with salt, pepper, and taco seasoning until fully cooked.
step-3: remove from heat and set aside.
step-4: place pizza dough on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-5: bake for 10 minutes.
step-6: top pizza dough with beef mixture and cheese.
step-7: bake for an additional 5 minutes.
step-8: top pizza with lettuce, tomatoes, avocado, and sour cream.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (175˚c).
step-2: wash and dry potatoes.
step-3: using a fork, pierce potatoes all over.
step-4: coat with olive oil and salt.
step-5: bake directly on the oven rack for one hour.
step-6: heat oil in a large skillet over medium/high heat.
step-7: add onion and jalapeño – cook until start to soften.
step-8: add ground turkey, break apart and season with entire taco seasoning packet.
step-9: cook through.
step-10: add tomato and allow the mixture to simmer about two to three minutes.
step-11: remove from heat.
step-12: finish with cilantro and lime juice.
step-13: remove potatoes from the oven and allow to cool slightly.
step-14: cut a wedge from the center, fill with taco mix and top with cheese, guacamole, and sour cream.

step-1: add the ground beef and onion to a large pot and stir until the beef is cooked through.
step-2: drain excess liquid.
step-3: add the kidney beans, black beans, corn, tomatoes, tomato sauce, and taco seasoning to the pot, and stir until combined.
step-4: cook over medium heat for 10 minutes.
step-5: serve with cheddar cheese, sour cream, pico de gallo, avocado, corn chips, lime wedges, and cilantro.

step-1: cut off the top and remove the seeds from each pepper.
step-2: place in a baking dish and bake for 20 minutes in a preheated oven at 350˚f (175˚c).
step-3: while the peppers are roasting - heat oil in a large skillet over medium/high heat.
step-4: add ground beef and season with entire taco seasoning packet.
step-5: allow beef to brown on all sides.
step-6: note: if you made your own taco seasoning, you'll want to add 2 tablespoons.
step-7: the ingredients above will make more than this recipe requires.
step-8: add diced onion - continuing to cook until softened.
step-9: reduce heat to medium.
step-10: mix in the black beans, brown rice, corn, and salsa.
step-11: add in 1 cup (100g) of cheese and stir until incorporated and the cheese has melted.
step-12: remove from heat.
step-13: remove peppers from oven and fill each with the taco mixture.
step-14: top with additional cheese.
step-15: return to the oven for 15 minutes until the cheese has melted.
step-16: top each pepper with a generous scoop of guacamole and sour cream.
step-17: top with additional cheese.

step-1: in a large pan over medium heat, add the olive oil, onion, red and green bell pepper, salt, pepper, paprika, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, and dried oregano.
step-2: mix to combine.
step-3: add the lime juice and cook the vegetables until soft, about 5 minutes.
step-4: seperate the vegetables in three medium bowls.
step-5: to one bowl, add the shredded chicken.
step-6: to another bowl, add the black beans.
step-7: to the last bowl, add the ground beef.
step-8: stir each bowl until everything is incorporated.
step-9: cut a tortilla in half with a pizza cutter or knife.
step-10: put a spoonful of one of the fillings in the center of the tortilla half and sprinkle with cheese.
step-11: fold each corner over the middle, forming a triangle.
step-12: flip the tortilla triangle over so the seam is down.
step-13: brush the edge of the tortilla with egg wash and press with a fork to seal.
step-14: repeat with the remaining tortillas and fillings.
step-15: in a deep pan, heat two inches of oil to 350°f (180°c).
step-16: once the oil is hot, place 2-3 tortilla triangles in the pan and cook on each side for 3 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-17: drain the triangles on a rack
step-18: serve with cilantro, sour cream, guacamole, and salsa.

step-1: fill a large pot with about 6 quarts (5 ½ l) of water and add the beef shank, 3 scallions, 5 slices of ginger, and 3 pieces of star anise.
step-2: cover, bring to a boil over high heat, and cook for 5 minutes.
step-3: remove the meat from the pot, rinse in cold water, and cut into thick slices.
step-4: discard the cooking liquid.
step-5: in a wok or large pan over medium-high heat, pour in the vegetable oil and add the remaining 3 scallions, 3 ginger slices, garlic, red chilies, remaining 3 pieces of star anise, onion, rock sugar, and spicy bean paste.
step-6: cook until the onions start to become translucent.
step-7: add the sliced beef.
step-8: add the dark soy sauce, for color, stir, then add the rice wine.
step-9: pour in the light soy sauce, for flavor, then add the tomatoes.
step-10: stir fry for 8-10 minutes.
step-11: fill the same large pot about a quarter of the way with water and heat over medium-high heat.
step-12: add the stir-fried meat, vegetables, and cooking liquid.
step-13: add more water until the meat is just covered, then add the white pepper, salt, and bay leaves.
step-14: cover and reduce the heat to low and simmer for at least 2 hours, until the meat becomes tender.
step-15: remove bay leaves and star anise before serving.
step-16: bring a large pot of water to boil over high heat and cook the flour noodles according to the package instructions.
step-17: remove the noodles from the water.
step-18: add the bok choy.
step-19: boil for 3 minutes, then remove.
step-20: to assemble the soup, place a generous amount of noodles in the bottom of a bowl.
step-21: then add bok choy, meat, and broth.
step-22: garnish with scallions, cilantro, and red chilies.

step-1: in a medium pot over high heat, combine the water and tea bags.
step-2: bring to a boil, then remove the pan from the heat and let the tea cool to room temperature.
step-3: bring a medium pot of water to boil over high heat.
step-4: once the water is boiling, add the tapioca pearls and boil until softened, about 20 minutes.
step-5: drain the pearls through a strainer.
step-6: set the strainer with the pearls over a medium bowl.
step-7: add the brown sugar to the strainer and pour the hot water over.
step-8: stir to dissolve the brown sugar.
step-9: soak the pearls in brown sugar syrup for 30 minutes, then store the bubbles and syrup separately until ready to serve.
step-10: assemble the tea: divide the pearls and ice between 2 glasses, then add the brown sugar syrup, tea, and half and half.
step-11: stir with a wide-opening straw, then serve.

step-1: place the glass noodles in a large bowl and add enough hot water to cover.
step-2: let sit for 10 minutes, until softened.
step-3: drain the noodles and chop into ½-inch (1-cm) pieces.
step-4: in a large bowl, mix together the chopped glass noodles, cabbage, carrots, scallions, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, pepper, soy sauce, and sesame oil.
step-5: toss until well combined.
step-6: then, fold in the chopped shrimp and ground pork until just incorporated.
step-7: place a spring roll wrapper on a clean work surface and add 3 tablespoons of filling to the center.
step-8: fold the bottom of the wrapper over the filling, then fold in the sides and roll.
step-9: lightly wet the exposed with your fingertip and continue rolling to seal the egg roll.
step-10: repeat with the remaining wrappers and filling.
step-11: fill a deep skillet with ½ inch (1 cm) of vegetable oil and heat over medium-high heat until the oil reaches 325˚f (160˚c).
step-12: fry the egg rolls in batches of 1-2 at a time for 2½- 3 minutes on each side, until crispy and golden brown.
step-13: remove from oil and drain on a wire rack or plate lined with paper towels to absorb any extra oil.

step-1: place the glass noodles in a large bowl and add enough hot water to cover.
step-2: let sit for 10 minutes, until softened.
step-3: drain the noodles and chop into ½-inch (1-cm) pieces.
step-4: in a large bowl, mix together the chopped glass noodles, cabbage, carrots, scallions, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, pepper, soy sauce, and sesame oil.
step-5: toss until well combined.
step-6: place a spring roll wrapper on a clean work surface and add 3 tablespoons of filling to the center.
step-7: fold the bottom of the wrapper over the filling, then fold in the sides and roll.
step-8: lightly wet the exposed with your fingertip and continue rolling to seal the egg roll.
step-9: repeat with the remaining wrappers and filling.
step-10: fill a deep skillet with ½ inch (1 cm) of vegetable oil and heat over medium-high heat until the oil reaches 325˚f(160˚c).
step-11: fry the egg rolls in batches of 1-2 at a time for 2½- 3 minutes on each side, until crispy and golden brown.
step-12: remove from oil and drain on a wire rack or plate lined with paper towels to absorb any extra oil.

step-1: beat the eggs in a small bowl.
step-2: add edamame and soy sauce.
step-3: pour the egg mixture into a nonstick pan over low heat, and swirl the egg around the pan into a perfect circle.
step-4: when the egg is cooking through, fold both side and roll.
step-5: wrap with plastic and arrange the shape.
step-6: cool in the fridge.
step-7: cut into half.
step-8: place into the bento box.

step-1: in a small bowl, combine the dashi, salt, soy sauce, sugar, and water.
step-2: mix until everything is dissolved.
step-3: in a medium bowl, beat the eggs and add the seasoning mixture.
step-4: mix until well-combined.
