step-5: heat a tamagoyaki pan over medium-high heat.
step-6: brush a thin layer of oil on the pan.
step-7: pour a third of the egg mixture into pan and quickly swirl to cover the entire pan.
step-8: when the egg is half-set, gently roll the egg.
step-9: with the rolled egg still in the pan, pour in another third of the egg mixture.
step-10: lift up the rolled egg and let the mixture to flow under it.
step-11: when the egg is half-set, roll the omelette toward you.
step-12: repeat with the rest of the egg mixture.
step-13: slice into bite-sized pieces.

step-1: in a large bowl, add the flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, and baking soda and whisk to combine.
step-2: in a medium bowl or liquid measuring cup, add the buttermilk, melted butter, and egg yolks and whisk to combine.
step-3: add the buttermilk mixture to the dry ingredients and gently fold with a rubber spatula until just combined.
step-4: add the egg whites and fold until just combined.
step-5: be sure not to overmix.
step-6: some lumps are okay.
step-7: let the batter rest for 15-30 minutes at room temperature.
step-8: add the butter to a cast iron skillet and heat over medium low heat.
step-9: once the butter has melted and is bubbling, reduce the heat to medium-low and add ⅓ cup (75 g) of batter to the pan.
step-10: cook for 2-3 minutes, until bubbles start to appear on the surface.
step-11: if adding any toppings like chocolate chips or blueberries, sprinkle over the pancake.
step-12: flip the pancake over and cook for another 1-2 minutes, until golden brown.
step-13: repeat with the remaining batter.
step-14: serve the pancakes with butter and maple syrup.

step-1: make the dough: in a large bowl, whisk together the warm milk, sugar, and melted butter.
step-2: the mixture should be just warm, registering between 100-110˚f (37-43˚c).
step-3: if any warmer, allow to cool slightly.
step-4: sprinkle the yeast evenly over the milk mixture, stir, and let sit in a warm place for about 10 minutes until the yeast has bloomed.
step-5: add 4 cups (500 g) of flour to the milk mixture and stir with a wooden spoon until just combined.
step-6: cover the bowl with a kitchen towel or plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place for 1 hour, until nearly doubled in size.
step-7: generously butter 2 9-inch (23 cm) round baking pans and set aside.
step-8: make the filling: in a medium bowl, combine the brown sugar, butter, and cinnamon.
step-9: mix well, then set aside.
step-10: remove the plastic wrap from the dough and add the remaining cup of flour, baking powder, and salt.
step-11: stir well, then turn out onto a clean surface.
step-12: leave a bit of flour nearby to use as needed, but try not to incorporate too much.
step-13: knead the dough for at least 10 minutes, adding more flour as necessary, until the dough just loses its stickiness and does not stick to the surface or your hands.
step-14: the dough should be very smooth and spring back when poked.
step-15: roll the dough out into a large rectangle, about ½-inch (1 cm) thick.
step-16: fix the corners with a bench scraper or a spatula to make sure they are sharp and even.
step-17: spread the filling evenly over the dough.
step-18: starting from one short end, roll up the dough into a log and pinch the seam closed.
step-19: place seam-side down.
step-20: trim any uneven ends.
step-21: using unflavored dental floss, cut the log into evenly pieces, about 1½ inches (8cm) thick.
step-22: place the cinnamon rolls in the prepared pans, 1 in the center and about 5 around the sides.
step-23: cover with a towel and let rise in a warm place for 35-45 minutes, until expanded by about half of their original volume.
step-24: if you’re saving the cinnamon rolls for later, cover with plastic wrap and freeze for up 3 months.
step-25: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-26: bake the cinnamon rolls for 25-30 minutes, until golden brown.
step-27: while the cinnamon rolls are baking, make the frosting: in a medium bowl, whisk together the cream cheese, melted butter, milk, and vanilla extract until smooth.
step-28: gradually add the powdered sugar and whisk until homogenous and runny.
step-29: when the cinnamon rolls are finished, let cool for about 10 minutes.
step-30: drizzle the frosting over the cinnamon rolls, using the back of a spoon to spread if desired.

step-1: in a medium bowl, sift together the flours, salt, and baking soda.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: in a medium or large saucepan, add the butter and melt over medium heat.
step-4: the larger the pan you use, the quicker the process will be!
step-5: bring the butter to a boil, stirring frequently.
step-6: as the water begins to boil out of the butter, the milk solids in the butter will separate, sink to the bottom, and begin to toast and brown.
step-7: as this begins to happen, make sure to stir constantly so the butter browns evenly.
step-8: it may become quite foamy, splatter a bit, and be difficult to see, so keep a close eye on it, removing from heat and continuing to stir if it starts to foam over.
step-9: once the butter has turned a nice nutty brown, remove from the heat and pour into a large liquid measuring cup to stop the cooking.
step-10: allow it to cool down for a minute or two, give it a stir, and carefully add 2-3 tablespoons of water to the butter to bring it back up to 1 cup (240 ml) of liquid.
step-11: set aside to cool to room temperature.
step-12: to help speed this process up, you can place in the fridge for 10-15 minutes.
step-13: you want to make sure the butter is still liquid when you’re adding it to the dough later on, so make sure to remove after 15 minutes.
step-14: in a large bowl, add the sugars, vanilla, espresso powder, and cooled brown butter.
step-15: cream together with an electric hand mixer until light and fluffy, 1-2 minutes.
step-16: add the egg and yolk and beat until incorporated.
step-17: add the dry ingredients, about ⅓ of the mixture at a time, and beat between additions until just incorporated.
step-18: it’s okay for there to be a bit of unmixed flour on the edge of bowl, this will be incorporated in the next step.
step-19: using a wooden spoon, fold the chocolate chips and chunks into the dough
step-20: scoop the cookies onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet in 3-tablespoon-sized mounds.
step-21: for optimal flavor, cover and refrigerate for 1 hour or, even better, overnight.
step-22: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-23: evenly space the dough 3 inches (8 cm) apart from one another on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-24: bake in a preheated oven for 12-14 minutes.
step-25: let the cookies cool on the baking sheet for 2-3 minutes before transferring to a cooling rack to cool completely.

step-1: in a bowl, beat the eggs with milk, salt, and pepper.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: spread the sausage over the bottom of a glass 9×13-inch (35 cm x 25 cm) baking dish.
step-4: pour on the onion soup, and mix with the sausage.
step-5: sprinkle the cheddar cheese evenly over the top.
step-6: cover with the lined up tater tots, and pour the egg mixture over everything.
step-7: bake uncovered at 350°f (180°c) for one hour.

step-1: pour the tater tots in a large mixing bowl.
step-2: microwave for one minute and forty-five seconds (or until soft)
step-3: add one egg to the softened tater tots and mix.
step-4: grease a cast-iron pan with butter, then pour the tater-tot mixture into the pan and spread it out to create a crust.
step-5: bake the crust for 15 minutes at 400˚f (200˚c).
step-6: remove from the oven, then add ½ of the cheddar cheese, ½ of the mozzarella cheese, and ½ of the bacon bits to the base of the crust.
step-7: crack the rest of the eggs evenly over the top of the crust, then top with the rest of the cheese and bacon bits.
step-8: bake for 15 more minutes at 400˚f (200˚c).
step-9: top with avocado slices and pepper.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: add the tater tots to a 10-inch (25 cm) springform pan.
step-3: use a flat-bottomed measuring cup to flatten the tots against the sides and bottom of the pan, creating a ½-inch (1 cm) thick tater tot crust.
step-4: spread the shredded cheese evenly over the bottom of the crust.
step-5: arrange cheddar slices along the walls and base, overlapping slightly.
step-6: bake for 30 minutes, or until the crust is lightly golden brown.
step-7: in a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, salt, pepper, paprika, bacon, and milk.
step-8: when the crust is par-baked, remove from the oven and place the ham slices along the wall and base of the crust, overlapping slightly.
step-9: pour the egg mixture into the center.
step-10: add zucchini slices and cherry tomato halves on top.
step-11: bake for 1 hour, or until the center is set.
step-12: slice and serve warm.

step-1: preheat oven to 180°c (350°f).
step-2: mix the flour, salt, sugar, and cinnamon together in a large bowl.
step-3: in a smaller bowl, mix the egg yolks, milk, and butter until combined.
step-4: whisk into the flour mix until a dough is formed, using your hands, if necessary.
step-5: in a small bowl, mix together all the ingredients needed for the filling.
step-6: roll the dough out on a lightly floured surface until the size of a sheet of paper.
step-7: spread the filling evenly, and then roll up tightly.
step-8: cut into 8 equal rolls and arrange in an ovenproof dish so that they are all tightly pushed together.
step-9: bake for 35 minutes.
step-10: serve with icing.

step-1: on a cutting board, cut tempeh ¼-inch (6 mm) thick slices.
step-2: add olive oil to a pan over medium heat and add the tempeh.
step-3: cook for 5 minutes on each side until brown and crispy.
step-4: add 1 tablespoon of water to the pan and stir.
step-5: add soy sauce, maple syrup, liquid smoke, garlic powder, and black pepper, and stir until tempeh is evenly coated.
step-6: let brown for 2-3 minutes.

step-1: cut the tempeh into a medium dice.
step-2: in a medium saucepan, heat a drizzle of olive oil over medium heat.
step-3: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the tempeh and cook for 6-8 minutes, until golden brown.
step-4: add the soy sauce, garlic powder, chili powder, and cumin, stir, and cook for another 5 minutes, until all of the seasonings are well-distributed and the tempeh is browned.
step-5: remove the pan from the heat.
step-6: make the avocado dressing: in a blender, combine the avocado, lime juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper and blend until smooth.
step-7: add the water 1 tablespoon at a time until your desired consistency is reached.
step-8: arrange the lettuce, tomatoes, black beans, corn, cilantro, red onion, and tempeh in a large bowl and pour over the avocado dressing.

step-1: add tempeh to food processor and pulse until a crumbly consistency is formed, making sure not to over-pulse.
step-2: heat olive oil in pan over medium heat.
step-3: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the onion and sauté for 3 minutes.
step-4: add jalapeño and sauté for 2 more minutes, or until onion is translucent.
step-5: add ground tempeh and sauté for 4 minutes, or until tempeh is slightly golden.
step-6: add soy sauce, cumin, chili powder, garlic powder and black pepper and continue to sauté for 3-5 more minutes or until desired consistency is reached.
step-7: serve on warm tortillas with desired taco toppings.

step-1: prepare shrimp by taking off shell and deveining.
step-2: make 4 slits down the stomach.
step-3: flip shrimp on the side and diagonally slice 4 more slits on each side.
step-4: (this will keep the shrimp straight when cooked.)
step-5: in a medium bowl, beat egg and soda water.
step-6: heat a pot of oil to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-7: then add cake flour and mix, but keep it clumpy.
step-8: do not over-mix.
step-9: dredge shrimp up to the tail and carefully place into frying oil.
step-10: fry for 2-3 minutes or until shrimp is fully cooked.
step-11: place tempura on paper towel to absorb oil or a wired rack to drain excess oil.
step-12: for the dipping sauce, combine soy sauce and mirin.
step-13: if using, dissolve dashi in the hot water and add to the soy sauce and mirin.
step-14: arrange assorted tempura on a bowl of rice.

step-1: scoop out 6 balls of ice cream onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, and freeze for at least an hour, or until firm.
step-2: slice pound cake into 1-2 inch (2 ½-5 cm) slices.
step-3: lay three slices of pound cake on plastic wrap side by side and flatten with a rolling pin.
step-4: wrap frozen ice cream ball in pound cake so it’s fully enclosed.
step-5: freeze for at least an hour, or until firm.
step-6: make tempura batter by mixing flour, egg, and water a little at a time.
step-7: heat oil to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-8: coat the wrapped ice cream in tempura batter.
step-9: carefully lower the coated ice cream into the oil and cook until golden brown, 15-30 seconds.
step-10: don’t cook for too long or else the ice cream will melt.
step-11: remove excess oil by patting with a paper towel.
step-12: serve immediately with your toppings of choice.

step-1: scoop the avocado into a medium bowl.
step-2: season with salt and add the lemon juice.
step-3: mash until smooth.
step-4: spread the avocado on the slice of toast.
step-5: line the cucumber slices, cherry tomato halves, and radish slices on top, then sprinkle with flaky salt.

step-1: in a cocktail shaker, combine the ice, raspberry jam, lime juice, and tequila.
step-2: cover with the lid and shake vigorously for 30 seconds.
step-3: strain into desired serving glass.
step-4: garnish with a lime round.

step-1: preheat oven to 250˚f (130˚c).
step-2: place wings in a large bowl and pat dry.
step-3: add the baking powder and salt to the wings.
step-4: stir to coat.
step-5: spray a baking rack with nonstick cooking spray and place on top of a foiled sheet pan.
step-6: distribute wings evenly on top, making sure none of them touch and they are all face-up.
step-7: bake for 35 minutes, then increase the temperature to 425˚f (220˚c) and bake for an additional 45 minutes, or until wings are crisp and golden.
step-8: (do not remove the wings from the oven when increasing temperature.)
step-9: for sauce, in a hot pan, bring soy sauce to a boil.
step-10: stir in brown sugar and honey.
step-11: add in sesame seeds and stir until slightly thickened and bubbling.
step-12: add wings and stir to coat.

step-1: preheat oven to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-2: cut the head of cauliflower in half.
step-3: pluck bite sized florets from each half.
step-4: trim bottoms of florets as necessary.
step-5: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-6: spread cauliflower florets on the baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil.
step-7: bake for 20 minutes.
step-8: in a small pan, heat soy sauce, brown sugar, and honey.
step-9: reduce until viscous.
step-10: remove florets from oven and toss with teriyaki sauce.
step-11: return florets to the oven and bake for an additional 10 minutes until browned to your liking.
step-12: sprinkle cauliflower with sesame seeds and scallions.

step-1: in a large bowl, place the chicken soy sauce, honey, sesame seeds, and spring onion.
step-2: stir well, refrigerate and marinade for at least 2 hours.
step-3: on soaked bamboo sticks, skewer on the chicken and mushrooms.
step-4: repeat until the skewer is full.
step-5: on a coal bbq, cook the chicken skewers for 3-4 minutes a side until the chicken is cooked through and the skewers are golden brown.

step-1: in a bowl, add the soy sauce, maple syrup, garlic, ginger, cornstarch, and black pepper, and whisk until well combined.
step-2: microwave broccoli on high for 1 minute.
step-3: add the cauliflower to a food processor and pulse until it is the size of rice.
step-4: on a cutting board, season chicken breast with salt and pepper.
step-5: heat olive oil in a large pan or wok over high heat.
step-6: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the chicken and cook until browned on both sides, about 2 minutes.
step-7: add the teriyaki sauce and bring to a simmer.
step-8: add ¼ cup (35 g) green onions, red cabbage, and carrots, and cook for 30 seconds.
step-9: add cauliflower and cook, stirring constantly, for 1 minute.
step-10: add broccoli and remove from heat.
step-11: top with sesame seeds and remaining green onions.

step-1: in a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, mix together the sugar, ½ cup (120 ml) soy sauce, and the mirin.
step-2: add the chicken to a large bowl.
step-3: pour ½ cup (120 ml) of the marinade over the chicken and save the rest for later.
step-4: toss the chicken to coat, cover with plastic wrap, and marinate in the fridge for 30 minutes.
step-5: add the canola oil to a wok or a large skillet over high heat.
step-6: when the oil begins to shimmer, add the carrots, onion, and pepper.
step-7: season with salt and pepper.
step-8: cook, stirring occasionally, until starting to soften, 5 minutes.
step-9: add the peas and broccoli florets to the skillet.
step-10: cook, shaking the pan or stirring, for about 3 more minutes, until the broccoli becomes slightly tender.
step-11: remove the vegetables from the skillet.
step-12: add 2 tablespoons of sesame oil to the skillet and heat until it shimmers, then add the minced garlic and ginger.
step-13: when the mixture is fragrant, about 15 seconds later, add the cooked rice, breaking up clumps with a spoon and tossing in the oil.
step-14: when the rice is well-coated, push to one side of the skillet and add the beaten eggs to the other side.
step-15: scramble until it starts to set, then return the veggies to the pan and stir into the rice to incorporate.
step-16: add the remaining 3 tablespoons of soy sauce.
step-17: stir until well-combined.
step-18: transfer the rice mixture to a greased bundt pan.
step-19: pack the rice down slightly.
step-20: cover and set aside.
step-21: heat the remaining tablespoon of sesame oil in the skillet.
step-22: add the marinated chicken and cook until browned on all sides, about 10 minutes.
step-23: add the reserved teriyaki sauce and cook until reduced and thickened slightly.
step-24: sprinkle with sesame seeds.
step-25: invert the fried rice dome onto a serving platter.
step-26: pour the hot teriyaki chicken into the center of the dome and garnish with sliced scallions.

step-1: in a bow,l mix the chicken and teriyaki sauce.
step-2: place the mixture over the romaine leaves.
step-3: top with scallions.

step-1: preheat grill to medium heat.
step-2: combine the chicken, soy sauce, brown sugar, sesame seeds, and green onions, stirring until evenly coated.
step-3: chill and marinate for at least 2 hours.
step-4: slide a piece of chicken down the skewer, alternating with the pineapple, until there is a 1-inch gap on the top of the skewer.
step-5: repeat with the remaining chicken, pineapple, and skewers.
step-6: grease the surface of the grill by rubbing the grates with tongs and an oiled paper towel.
step-7: grill the skewers for about 12-18 minutes with the lid closed, flipping them halfway.
step-8: brush the skewers with the leftover marinade during grilling, if desired.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: in a medium-size bowl mix together the beef, pork, bread crumbs, onion, parsley, garlic, eggs, salt, and pepper until just combined.
step-3: take a walnut size of the meat mixture and roll into a ball.
step-4: repeat with remaining meat and transfer to an oiled rack on a sheet tray.
step-5: bake meatballs for 15 minutes, until golden brown.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: in a pan on medium high heat, add the mirin, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, and sugar.
step-8: stir the mixture and bring to a simmer for 5 minutes.
step-9: add the meatballs and coat them with the sauce.
step-10: sprinkle with the sesame seeds and scallions, poke with toothpicks, and serve!

step-1: cut the salmon into bite-size cubes.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: prepare the marinade by mixing the soy sauce, lemon juice, ginger, chilli, garlic, and sea salt together.
step-4: mix the salmon into the marinade, cover, and marinate for 15-30 minutes.
step-5: in a large pan with a little oil, pour in the marinade and add the honey and sesame seeds.
step-6: mix together until it starts to bubble and gets thicker/saucier.
step-7: add the salmon and fry for a couple of minutes on each side.
step-8: take off the heat and garnish with more sesame seeds, spring onion, red chilli, and cocktail sticks.

step-1: combine soy sauce, mirin, sake, and sugar in a bowl and stir to combine.
step-2: add the salmon and marinate for 15 minutes.
step-3: for the sauce, combine soy sauce, mirin, sake, and sugar in a bowl and stir to combine.
step-4: heat a pan over medium-high heat and add a splash of salad oil.
step-5: add the marinated salmon and cook until both sides are cooked through, about 3 minutes.
step-6: add the reserved marinade to the pan.
step-7: stir until the salmon is fully coated in the glaze.
step-8: form the rice into four patties.
step-9: heat another pan over medium-high heat and add the sesame oil.
step-10: add the rice “buns” and cook until the outside is crispy, about 5 minutes.
step-11: top the rice "bun" with a piece of green leaf lettuce, salmon, mayonnaise, and top with another rice “bun.” repeat with remaining ingredients.

step-1: in a baking dish with the steak, mix the soy sauce, garlic, ginger, honey, lime juice, and sriracha sauce (optional).
step-2: lightly massage the marinade into the steak and cover.
step-3: refrigerate 1-4 hours.
step-4: place toothpicks in a bowl and pour water over toothpicks until completely submerged.
step-5: water will prevent toothpicks from burning.
step-6: once marinated, cut the steak into 8 equal rectangles.
step-7: you may need to pound the steak thinner if using a thicker cut.
step-8: place a few slices of each of the vegetables on a slice of steak, making sure they are all about the same length.
step-9: roll the steak up over the vegetables and secure it with a toothpick.
step-10: in a small saucepan over medium heat, pour in the leftover marinade and bring to a boil.
step-11: boil for about one minute, take off the heat, and set aside to use as a glaze.
step-12: in a grill pan or on the grill over medium high heat, place your steak roll-ups and cook for 2-3 minutes.
step-13: flip the roll over and use a heat-safe brush to brush the glaze on each roll.
step-14: cook for about one minute longer and remove from heat.
step-15: top with sesame seeds.

step-1: to a pot with 2 cups (480 ml) of boiling water add the ramen seasoning packet and a tablespoon of butter.

step-1: melt the coconut oil in a large, high-sided pan over medium heat.

step-1: cut the tops and bottoms off the eggplant and cut into quarters.

step-1: fry the prawns with salt and pepper until they’ve just turned pink.

step-1: in a large pot over high heat, combine the water and thai tea leaves.

step-1: pour the thai tea into an ice cube tray.

step-1: in a small saucepan, bring water and vegetable stock to a boil, then add quinoa.

step-1: combine the tamarind, fish sauce, sugar, and lime juice with 1 tbsp water and set aside.

step-1: preheat the oven to 325˚f (160˚c).
step-2: make the crust: add the cornflakes to a zip-top bag, seal, and crush into crumbs with a rolling pin.
step-3: transfer the crumbs to a large bowl and add the melted butter and sugar.
step-4: stir to combine.
step-5: add the crumb mixture to a 9½-inch (24 cm) pie dish and press evenly into a ¼-inch-thick (6 mm) layer against the bottom and up the sides of the pan.
step-6: bake until the crust is golden brown, about 15 minutes.
step-7: let cool completely.
step-8: make the filling: in a small saucepan over medium heat, bring the milk to a simmer.
step-9: add the thai tea leaves and stir into the hot milk.
step-10: turn off the heat and let the tea steep for 30 minutes.
step-11: in a medium bowl, whisk together the egg yolks, salt, cornstarch, and sugar.
step-12: line a fine-mesh sieve with cheesecloth and set over the bowl with the egg mixture.
step-13: slowly pour in the thai tea mixture, pressing the leaves to extract as much liquid as possible.
step-14: whisk to combine.
step-15: return the thai tea mixture to the saucepan over medium heat and cook, stirring constantly, until thickened, about 8 minutes.
step-16: add the butter and whisk until melted and the filling is smooth.
step-17: remove from the heat.
step-18: brush the chocolate hazelnut spread over the bottom of the cooled crust.
step-19: sprinkle the toasted coconut flakes over the chocolate hazelnut spread.
step-20: pour the thai tea filling into the crust and spread evenly.

step-22: refrigerate the pie until set, at least 4 hours.
step-23: before serving, remove the plastic wrap and spread whipped cream over the top of the pie.
step-24: serve chilled.

step-1: bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over high heat.
step-2: while the water heats up, prepare the collard green leaves.
step-3: trim the stems, then, using a paring knife, carefully remove the thick part of the stem from the leaf.
step-4: working parallel to the leaf, shave off any excess stem so that it is flush with the leaf and will roll easily.
step-5: repeat with each collard.
step-6: blanch each collard green leaf in the boiling water for 1 minute, until softened and bright green.
step-7: remove from the water and immediately submerge in an ice bath for 1 minute, or until cool to the touch.
step-8: dry the collard greens on paper towels until ready to use.
step-9: make the peanut sauce: in a medium bowl, combine the peanut butter, sriracha, sesame oil, honey, lime juice, water, and salt.
step-10: whisk until smooth.
step-11: in a small bowl, mix together the soy sauce, garlic powder, and red pepper flakes.
step-12: pour over the tofu strips and marinate for 15 minutes.
step-13: heat the sesame oil in a medium pan over medium-high heat.
step-14: add the tofu strips and sear for 2 minutes on each side, until browned.
step-15: remove the tofu from the pan.
step-16: to build the wraps, lay a collard green leaf on a flat surface.
step-17: spread 2 teaspoons of peanut sauce across the center of the leaf.
step-18: lay 1 strip of tofu on top of the sauce, followed by 3-4 pieces of cucumber, 1 tablespoon shredded carrot, and a bit of mint, thai basil, and scallions.
step-19: fold one side of the leaf over the filling and dollop a bit of peanut sauce on top.
step-20: fold the other side of the leaf over the filling, and using the sauce to secure.
step-21: fold the bottom of the leaf up and over the filling.
step-22: tuck in all of the ingredients and roll until the bottom half has reached the top of the leaf.
step-23: spread a bit of sauce on the top of the leaf and roll to secure the wrap.
step-24: repeat with the remaining ingredients.
step-25: cut in half on the diagonal, then serve with more peanut sauce for dipping, if desired.
step-26: nutrition - per wrap - calories: 282, total fat: 18 grams, sodium: 484, total carbs: 21 grams, dietary fiber: 11 grams, sugars: 5 grams, protein: 18 grams

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).

step-1: make the sponge: stir together the yeast, honey or maple syrup, water, and flour together in a medium bowl.
step-2: some lumps are okay.
step-3: cover with a kitchen towel and let sit in a warm place for 20-30 minutes, until foamy and expanded in volume.
step-4: to finish the dough, add the salt, olive oil, and warm water to the bowl with the sponge.
step-5: add the flour in ½-cup (60 g) increments, stirring to incorporate each addition before adding the next, until the dough comes together enough to knead with your hands.
step-6: knead in the bowl briefly, until most of the flour in the bowl is incorporated.
step-7: turn the dough out onto a floured surface and continue kneading, adding more flour as needed, until it is soft, pliable, and does not stick to your hands, 8-10 minutes.
step-8: transfer the dough to a clean bowl lightly greased with olive oil.
step-9: cover with a towel and let rise in a warm place for 40 minutes, or until doubled in volume.
step-10: preheat the oven to 475˚f (240˚c).
step-11: remove the dough from the bowl and punch down.
step-12: cut in half.
step-13: dust a piece of dough with flour and roll out to about a 13x18-inch (33x46-cm) rectangle or oval.
step-14: repeat with the remaining dough portion if making 2 pizzas, or wrap the leftover dough tightly in plastic wrap and keep in the fridge for up to 3 days.
step-15: drizzle a baking sheet with olive oil and sprinkle with semolina flour.
step-16: transfer the rolled out dough to the baking sheet.
step-17: add your toppings of choice.
step-18: for a gravy, turkey, and stuffing pizza, spread the gravy over the pizza dough.
step-19: top with the stuffing, turkey, cheese, and rosemary, if using.
step-20: for a cranberry sauce, brussels sprout, and sweet potato pizza, add the cranberry sauce to a blender with a bit of water and puree until smooth
step-21: spread over the pizza dough and top with dollops of mashed sweet potato, the brussels sprouts, and spoonfuls of the goat cheese.
step-22: bake the pizza for 12-15 minutes, until the dough is crispy and golden brown and the toppings are warmed through.
step-23: slice and serve immediately.

step-1: make the waffles: in a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt.
step-2: in a separate large bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, olive oil, maple syrup, vanilla, and sweet potato until smooth.
step-3: add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and stir with a rubber spatula until just combined, making sure not to overmix the batter.
step-4: heat a waffle iron and grease with oil.

step-9: the syrup should be thin enough to drizzle, but not liquidy.

step-11: set aside.

step-13: cook over medium-high heat until the syrup starts to glaze the pecans and the apples soften, about 10 minutes.
step-14: serve the waffles warm with the pecan topping, cranberry syrup, and a few pieces of goat cheese, if desired.

step-1: preheat oven to 350° f (180° c).

step-1: preheat the oven to 200°c (400°f).

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).

step-1: in a large bowl, whisk together the sugars, salt, and butter until a paste has formed with no lumps.

step-3: sift in the flour and baking soda, then fold the mixture with a spatula, being careful not to overmix too much.
step-4: this will cause the gluten in the flour to toughen which will result in cakier cookies.
step-5: fold in the chocolate chunks evenly, then chill the dough for at least 30 minutes.
step-6: for a more intense toffee-like flavor and deeper color, chill the dough overnight.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: add olive oil and butter to a skillet on medium-high heat.

step-9: once the wine comes to a simmer, add in the diced canned tomatoes, and stir to combine.

step-11: stirring occasionally, and then set aside.

step-1: in a bowl, toss ¼ cup (30g) of cornstarch and the chicken wings together until fully coated.

step-1: preheat oven to 450°f (230°c).

step-1: cut each eggplant into about ½-inch (1-cm) thick round slices.

step-7: uncover the eggplant slices and pat dry with paper towels.

step-9: set aside.
step-10: in a separate medium bowl, combine the flour, oregano, basil, garlic powder, and pepper.
step-11: mix well.

step-13: coat each eggplant slice in the flour mixture, shaking off any excess flour.
step-14: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-15: fry the eggplant in batches until golden brown on both sides, 2-3 minutes per side.
step-16: drain on a paper towel-lined baking sheet and pat dry using more paper towels to absorb excess oil.
step-17: pour about 1 cup (260 g) of marinara sauce into a 2½-quart (2 l) baking dish and spread evenly to cover the bottom of the dish.

step-20: repeat to make 2 more layers.

step-22: bake for 30 minutes, until the mozzarella is bubbling and golden brown.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).

step-1: add walnuts to the bowl of a food processor and pulse until crumbly.

step-9: set aside.

step-12: add in vital wheat gluten and use hands to knead burger mixture together until all wheat gluten is fully incorporated.

step-15: add on vegan cheese slices and melt.

step-1: generously rub two disposable foil pie pans with vegan butter.
step-2: in a large bowl, whisk together the almond milk, melted butter, and sugar.
step-3: the mixture should be just warm, registering between 100-110˚f (37-43˚c).
step-4: if it is hotter, allow to cool slightly.
step-5: sprinkle the yeast evenly over the warm mixture and let set for 1 minute.
step-6: add 5 cups flour and 1 teaspoon of salt to the milk mixture and mix with a wooden spoon until just combined.
step-7: cover the bowl with a towel or plastic wrap and set in a warm place to rise for 1 hour.
step-8: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-9: after 1 hour, the dough should have nearly doubled in size.
step-10: remove the towel and add an additional ½ cup (95g) of flour and salt.
step-11: stir well, then turn out onto a well-floured surface.
step-12: knead the dough lightly, adding additional flour as necessary, until the dough just loses its stickiness and does not stick to the surface.
step-13: roll the dough out into a large rectangle, about ½-inch (1 cm) thick.
step-14: fix corners to make sure they are sharp and even.
step-15: spread the softened vegan butter evenly over the dough.
step-16: sprinkle evenly with brown sugar and cinnamon.
step-17: roll up the dough, forming a log, and pinch the seam closed.
step-18: place seam-side down.
step-19: trim off any unevenness on either end.
step-20: cut the log in half, then divide each half into 7 evenly sized pieces.
step-21: about 1½ inches (8 cm) thick each.
step-22: place 7 cinnamon rolls in each cake pan, one in the center, six around the sides.
step-23: cover with plastic wrap and place in a warm place to rise for 30 minutes.
step-24: to prepare the frosting.
step-25: in a medium-size mixing bowl, whisk together powdered sugar, almond milk, and vanilla until smooth.
step-26: remove plastic wrap.
step-27: bake the cinnamon rolls in a preheated oven at 350˚f (180˚c) for 25-30 minutes, until golden brown.
step-28: while still warm, drizzle evenly with frosting.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: line an 8-inch square baking dish with parchment paper.
step-3: chop the chocolate into chunks.
step-4: melt half of the chocolate in the microwave in 20-second intervals, saving the other half for later.
step-5: in a large bowl, mix the butter and sugar with an electric hand mixer, then beat in the eggs and vanilla for 1-2 minutes, until the mixture becomes fluffy and light in color
step-6: whisk in the melted chocolate (make sure it's not too hot or else the eggs will cook), then sift in the flour, cocoa powder, and salt.
step-7: fold to incorporate the dry ingredients, being careful not to overmix as this will cause the brownies to be more cake-like in texture.
step-8: fold in the chocolate chunks, then transfer the batter to the prepared baking dish.
step-9: bake for 20-25 minutes, depending on how fudgy you like your brownies, then cool completely.
step-10: slice, then serve with a nice cold glass of milk!

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: grease an 8x8-inch (20x20-cm) baking pan and line with parchment paper.
step-3: make the brownies: in a large bowl, whisk together the melted butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar.
step-4: add eggs and vanilla extract.
step-5: whisk until thoroughly combined.
step-6: sift in the flour, cocoa powder, and salt, and fold to incorporate.
step-7: fold in the chocolate chips.
step-8: pour half of the batter into the baking pan and spread to cover the bottom.
step-9: arrange the caramel candies in a single layer over the batter.
step-10: pour the rest of the batter over the caramel candies and spread to cover.
step-11: bake for 35 minutes or until center is cooked through.
step-12: remove the brownies from the oven and let cool.
step-13: make the topping: combine the caramel candies and heavy cream in a medium heat-proof bowl.
step-14: microwave for 1 minute in 30-second intervals, stirring between each until the mixture is thick and velvety.
step-15: pour the caramel topping over the brownies.
step-16: let set for 10 minutes.
step-17: sprinkle with sea salt.
step-18: slice and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: add the butter and 1 cup (175 g) of chocolate chips to a large microwave-safe bowl.
step-3: microwave for 1½ minutes, then let sit for 3 minutes before whisking together.
step-4: add the granulated and brown sugars, vanilla, and salt.
step-5: whisk to combine.
step-6: whisk in the eggs until fully combined.
step-7: sift the flour and cocoa powder into the bowl and fold in with a spatula.
step-8: add the remaining chocolate chips and fold to incorporate.
step-9: line a 9-inch (23-cm) square baking pan with parchment paper and grease with nonstick spray.
step-10: spread the batter evenly in the pan.
step-11: bake for 35-40 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out with a few moist crumbs attached.
step-12: let cool completely before cutting.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: in a small bowl, mix together sugar and cinnamon until evenly incorporated.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: in a large mixing bowl whip the butter with vanilla until light and fluffy.
step-5: add the sugar and brown sugar and mix until well incorporated.
step-6: add the eggs and stir until thoroughly incorporated.
step-7: using a sift add the flour, cream of tartar, cinnamon, baking soda, and salt and sift into the dough.
step-8: combine until evenly mixed.
step-9: cover with plastic wrap and chill.
step-10: using your hands roll dough into ping pong sized balls.
step-11: dip the dough into cinnamon sugar mixture and roll around covering the dough ball completely.
step-12: place cookie dough on parchment paper-lined baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes.
step-13: allow to cool and serve.

step-1: place the cashews in a large bowl.
step-2: add enough room-temperature water to cover the cashews.
step-3: cover the bowl with a kitchen towel and soak overnight.
step-4: place the bowl of an ice cream machine in the freezer overnight.
step-5: add the cashews and soaking water to a blender.
step-6: blend, starting on low speed and increasing to high until smooth and frothy, about 40 seconds.
step-7: strain into a large bowl through a fine-mesh sieve or cheesecloth.
step-8: reserve 1 cup (240 ml) of cashew milk for the ice cream and store the rest in the refrigerator for up to a week for another use.
step-9: in a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the water and sugar and cook, stirring constantly, until the mixture is clear, about 2 minutes.
step-10: whisk in the cocoa butter, coconut oil, and salt.
step-11: remove the pan from the heat and set aside.
step-12: in a blender, combine the cashew milk and coconut milk.
step-13: blend on low speed.
step-14: with the blender running, pour in the sugar mixture to emulsify.
step-15: continue until well-blended, about 2 minutes.
step-16: pour the mixture into a large metal bowl and mix in the vanilla extract.
step-17: scrape in the seeds from the vanilla bean and whisk to combine.
step-18: chill the base in the refrigerator for 1 hour.
step-19: add the chilled base to the ice cream maker and churn for 1 hour, or as long as the machine requires, until thick and creamy.
step-20: transfer the ice cream to a loaf pan and freeze overnight.
step-21: scoop and serve immediately.

step-1: place sugar in the bottom of a rocks glass.
step-2: add bitters and muddle together until combined.
step-3: add preferred amount of ice and pour over whiskey.
step-4: stir until sugar is mostly dissolved.
step-5: hold a piece of orange peel between your thumb and forefinger and squeeze over the glass to release the oil.
step-6: if you like, you can carefully use a match or lighter to flame the orange oils for a caramelized flavor.
step-7: garnish with the orange peel and a single cherry.

step-1: place gold sprinkles in a small bowl.
step-2: run the lemon wedge around the rim of a champagne flute.
step-3: dip the rim in the sprinkles.
step-4: add the goldschlager to the flute and top with the champagne.
step-5: gently stir in the edible glitter.

step-1: make the smoke bombs: add the wood chips to a bowl and cover with water.
step-2: let soak for 1 hour, then drain.
step-3: place 1 cup of the damp wood chips on a piece of aluminum foil and fold into a packet.
step-4: poke multiple holes in the top with a toothpick or fork.
step-5: repeat with the remaining wood chips, creating 4 packets total.
step-6: make the sauce: add the ketchup, brown sugar, molasses, apple cider vinegar, worcestershire, salt, pepper, and smoked paprika to a small pot over medium heat, whisking to combine.
step-7: once the sauce begins to boil, reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes.
step-8: remove from the heat and let cool to room temperature.
step-9: make the rub: in a medium bowl, whisk together the brown sugar, salt, pepper, cumin, onion powder, paprika, cayenne, ground mustard, and garlic powder.
step-10: on a large cutting board, pat the ribs dry with paper towels.
step-11: if necessary, remove the membrane on the bone-side of the ribs by using a paring knife to gently loosen and pulling it up in one sheet.
step-12: generously season the ribs all over with the dry rub.
step-13: wrap the ribs in aluminum foil until completely covered.
step-14: preheat the grill to 300°f (150°c) with the lid closed.
step-15: place the foil-wrapped ribs over indirect heat and close the lid.
step-16: cook for 2½ hours, until the meat is tender and starting to pull away from the bone, flipping every 30 minutes.
step-17: remove the ribs from the grill and let rest for 10 minutes.
step-18: meanwhile, carefully remove the grates and place the smoke bombs over the flames.
step-19: close the lid and let smoke build up for 10 minutes.
step-20: unwrap the ribs and discard the foil.
step-21: baste one side of the ribs with the sauce and place directly on the grill, sauce side down.
step-22: baste the other side, now facing up.
step-23: continue to flip and baste every 5 minutes for 15 minutes total.
step-24: remove the ribs from the grill and serve with extra barbecue sauce.

step-1: in a medium bowl, add the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt, and stir to combine.
step-2: in a medium bowl or liquid measuring cup, add almond milk, apple cider vinegar, and vanilla, and stir to combine
step-3: pour the liquid mixture into the dry mixture and whisk until smooth.
step-4: let batter rest for 5 minutes.
step-5: pour about ½ cup (65 grams) of batter onto a nonstick pan or griddle over medium heat.
step-6: when the top begins to bubble, flip the pancake and cook until golden.
step-7: serve warm with maple syrup.

step-1: to make the crust, blend together the cookie sandwiches and the vegan butter in a food processor.
step-2: blend for 10 seconds at a time until the cookies have absorbed all the butter.
step-3: the mix should stick when pressed together.
step-4: transfer to a greased pie pan, press to form a crust.
step-5: refrigerate for 30 minutes.
step-6: to make the filling, place your dates in a bowl and soak them in the boiling water for 10-15 minutes.
step-7: transfer the dates and the water to a food processor and blend for 10 seconds at a time until a thick paste has formed.
step-8: transfer to a large mixing bowl.
step-9: add the rest of the ingredients for the filling into the mixing bowl and fold them into the paste.
step-10: mix thoroughly.
step-11: pour the mix into the chilled pie crust.
step-12: bake in the oven at 350° f (180° c) for 40-45 minutes.
step-13: the texture should be thick and fudgy.

step-1: mix the burgundy food coloring with the cream cheese frosting.
step-2: transfer the frosting to a piping bag fitted with a round tip and pipe onto the cupcakes.
step-3: place the chocolate truffles on top of the frosting.
step-4: take a small piece of fondant and flatten into a quarter-size circle.
step-5: place on top of a chocolate truffle and gently fold over the sides to resemble a bonnet.
step-6: repeat with the remaining cupcakes.

step-1: pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker.
step-2: shake with ice.
step-3: strain over ice in a glass.
step-4: garnish with a pineapple leaf, lime slice, and cherry.

step-1: preheat the oven to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-2: score the chestnuts in a cross with a knife.
step-3: place the chestnuts on a sheet pan and bake for 30 minutes.
step-4: remove the chestnuts with a towel, and quickly peel the warm chestnuts.
step-5: put the peeled chestnuts in a pan and add water, sugar, and vanilla extract.
step-6: cook and stir the chestnut on high heat until the water has evaporated and chestnuts has softened, about 15 minutes.
step-7: place the chestnut filling in a food processor, add in water and blend until smooth.
step-8: push the chestnut filling through an sieve into another bowl.
step-9: transfer filling to a piping bag with a circle tip and chill.
step-10: preheat the oven to 200˚f (90˚c).
step-11: in a bowl, whisk the egg whites until foamy using a hand mixer.
step-12: add sugar to the egg whites and whisk until stiff peak forms.
step-13: transfer the meringue into a piping bag fitted with a circle tip and pipe the meringue in a swirling motion onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-14: bake the meringue for 1 hour.
step-15: get the pie crust, and cut small circles to serve as the bottom for the meringue and bake for 30 minutes
step-16: place the meringue on top of the pie crust and pipe the whipped cream around it.
step-17: pipe the chestnut cream around the whipped cream.
step-18: sprinkle with powdered sugar.

step-1: in a large saucepan over medium-high heat, melt the butter, then add the onion and saute until translucent, 3 minutes.
step-2: add the garlic and stir, then cook for 1 more minute.
step-3: add the mushrooms, salt, and pepper and cook until they begin to turn golden brown, about 5 minutes.
step-4: add the flour and stir to coat the mushrooms, until combined.
step-5: add the white wine, stir, and cook until combined, about 1 minute.
step-6: add the vegetable stock, stir, and simmer for 15 minutes.
step-7: add the heavy cream and stir to combine.
step-8: blend soup to your desired consistency with an immersion blender or standing blender.
step-9: serve hot, garnished with parsley.

step-1: heat a cast-iron griddle over medium-low heat until warm.
step-2: meanwhile, open the hamburger buns and brush the insides with the melted butter.
step-3: a soft brush is helpful here.
step-4: place the buns buttered side down on the griddle and toast until golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes.
step-5: transfer buns to a plate.
step-6: create the shack sauce with the provided ingredients.
step-7: spoon the sauce onto the top bun.
step-8: increase the heat to medium and heat the griddle until hot, 2 to 3 minutes.
step-9: evenly sprinkle a pinch of our salt & pepper mix on top of each puck of meat.
step-10: place the pucks on the griddle, seasoned side down.
step-11: using a large, sturdy metal spatula, firmly smash each puck into a ⅓-inch-thick (8 mm) round patty.
step-12: pressing down on the spatula with another stiff spatula helps flatten the burger quickly.
step-13: evenly sprinkle another big pinch of our salt & pepper mix.
step-14: cook the burgers, resisting the urge to move them, until the edges beneath are brown and crisp, and juices on the surface are bubbling hot, about 2 ½ minutes.
step-15: slide one of the spatulas beneath the burger to release it from the griddle and scrape up the caramelized browned crust.
step-16: use the other spatula to steady the burger and keep it from sliding.
step-17: flip the burgers.
step-18: put the cheese on top and cook the burgers 1 minute longer for medium.
step-19: cook more or less depending on your preference.
step-20: add a piece of the lettuce and two slices of tomato.
step-21: transfer the cheeseburgers to the prepared buns.

step-1: preheat the oven to 300˚f (150˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, whisk the flour, baking soda, and salt to combine.
step-3: in a separate large bowl, cream the butter and sugar together using a hand mixer until light and fluffy, about 5 minutes.
step-4: add the egg and mix until fully incorporated.
step-5: add the sour cream and vanilla and mix until creamy.
step-6: add the flour mixture, a third at a time, until fully combined.
step-7: shape the dough into a rectangle and wrap in plastic wrap.
step-8: chill the dough for 1 hour in the refrigerator.
step-9: make the frosting: in a large bowl, beat the butter with a hand mixer until fluffy.
step-10: sift in powdered sugar and mix until incorporated.
step-11: add milk and continue to beat until the frosting is smooth and velvety.
step-12: remove the plastic wrap from the dough and lightly flour clean surface.
step-13: roll out the dough to about ½-inch (1 ¼ cm) thick.
step-14: cut out circles using a glass or cookie cutter.
step-15: transfer the cookies to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, leaving about 1 inch (2 ½ cm) between the cookies.
step-16: bake for 8 minutes, until the bottoms are golden brown and the tops of the cookies are pale.
step-17: let cookies cool on the pan or a wire rack.
step-18: frost the cookies and decorate as you wish.

step-1: in a large pan over medium heat, heat the olive oil for 1 minute.
step-2: add the breakfast sausages to the pan and cook for 12 minutes, turning constantly, until crispy and browned all over.
step-3: drain the sausages on paper towels and let cool.
step-4: insert a small ice pop stick in each sausage.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: make the pancake batter: in a large bowl, sift together the flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, and sugar.
step-7: use your hands to make a well in the middle of the dry ingredients.
step-8: pour the milk, eggs, and melted butter into the well, then stir the center working your way out until the mixture is thick and well-combined.
step-9: fold in the bacon.
step-10: heat the canola oil in a medium pot over medium-high heat until it reaches 350°f (180°c).
step-11: pour the pancake batter into a tall glass, then dip a sausage stick into the mixture.
step-12: use tongs to gently place the battered sausage into the hot oil and cook until golden brown, 1-2 minutes.
step-13: drain on paper towels or a cooling rack.
step-14: repeat with the remaining sausages.
step-15: dust with powdered sugar and serve with maple syrup.

step-1: preheat oven to 325˚f (160˚c).
step-2: grease and line three 8-inch (20 cm) cake tins with parchment paper.
step-3: in a large bowl, sift together the flour, cocoa powder, salt, baking soda, and baking powder.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: in a large glass measuring cup, combine the stout, vanilla, and espresso powder.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: in a large mixing bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until it is light and fluffy, about 5 minutes, scraping down the sides occasionally to ensure all the ingredients are being evenly creamed together.
step-8: beat in the eggs, one at a time, ensuring each egg is fully incorporated before adding the next.
step-9: add the mayonnaise and beat until the mixture is smooth and creamy.
step-10: alternate adding the prepared dry and wet ingredients to the batter.
step-11: starting with about ⅓ of the dry ingredients, beat until incorporated.
step-12: then add ⅓ of the liquid ingredients, mixing until the batter comes together.
step-13: continue until all the wet and dry ingredients have been incorporated.
step-14: using a rubber scraper, fold the dark chocolate chunks into the batter.
step-15: distribute the batter evenly between the 3 prepared cake tins.
step-16: bake for about 35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
step-17: place the cakes on a cooling rack and leave to cool for about 10-15 minutes, until the outside of the pan is cool enough to touch.
step-18: once the cakes have cooled, loosen the edges using a butter knife.
step-19: then place a large plate over the tin and invert to release the cake from the pan.
step-20: remove the parchment paper from the bottom of the cake and slide the cake back onto the cooling rack to cool completely.
step-21: repeat for the remaining two layers.
step-22: while your cakes are cooling, prepare the buttercream.
step-23: in a large bowl, beat together the butter and vanilla.
step-24: gradually add in the cocoa powder, powdered sugar, and milk, continuously beating until all the ingredients have been incorporated and the frosting is light and fluffy.
step-25: frost and decorate to your liking.
step-26: slice and serve.

step-1: in a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, combine the warm milk, warm water, melted butter, and sugar.
step-2: sprinkle the yeast evenly over the wet ingredients, stir to combine, and let stand for 5 minutes, until foamy
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the flour and salt, and stir to combine.
step-4: beat 1 egg, then add to the bloomed yeast mixture.
step-5: pour the wet ingredients into the flour and use a knife to stir until the mixture just comes together and forms a dough.
step-6: turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 5-10 minutes, or until the dough becomes smooth.
step-7: add more flour as needed to keep the dough from sticking.
step-8: to test if it’s done, tear off a small piece of dough and stretch into a thin layer.
step-9: if the dough doesn’t rip, it’s ready.
step-10: or, press a finger into the dough to see if it bounces back.
step-11: lightly grease a large glass bowl with oil.
step-12: add the dough, cover with plastic wrap, and let rest for 1 hour, or until doubled in size.
step-13: punch down the dough, then turn out onto a floured surface.
step-14: knead for a few more minutes, just until the dough is smooth, about 2 minutes.
step-15: divide the dough into 16 equal balls, roughly the size of tangerines.
step-16: knead the balls, gathering the edges of the dough toward the center to make a taut, round ball with a smooth top.
step-17: place the rolls on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-18: cover with plastic wrap and let rise for 30 minutes.
step-19: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-20: beat the remaining egg in a small bowl.
step-21: uncover the rolls and brush with the egg wash.
step-22: lightly sprinkle the rolls with sea salt.
step-23: bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the rolls have lightly browned and doubled in size.

step-1: in a medium bowl or liquid measuring cup, combine the buttermilk, vanilla extract, and vegetable oil.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, and baking soda.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: in a separate large bowl, combine the granulated sugar, light brown sugar, and butter.
step-6: beat with an electric hand mixer on high speed until super light and fluffy, about 4 minutes.
step-7: add the eggs and egg yolks one at a time, beating in between additions.
step-8: beat the batter until almost doubled in volume and very light and fluffy, about 5 minutes.
step-9: with the mixer on low, gently beat in a third of the flour mixture.
step-10: before it's fully combined, add half of the buttermilk mixture.
step-11: repeat with remaining flour and buttermilk until everything is well-blended and no lumps remain.
step-12: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-13: spray 3 9-inch (23 cm) round cake pans with nonstick spray.
step-14: add ½ cup (80 g) of sprinkles and gently fold into the batter with a spatula until well-incorporated.
step-15: divide the cake batter among the prepared pans and place 2 pans on the top oven rack and 1 pan on the middle rack.
step-16: bake for 30 minutes, rotating the pan on the middle rack to the top rack, and vice versa, halfway through baking, so the cakes bake evenly.
step-17: the cakes are done when they are golden brown, pull away from the sides of the pans, and the tops spring back slightly when pressed.
step-18: remove the cakes from the oven and invert them onto a wire rack to cool completely.
step-19: (if you don't have a wire rack, let them cool in the cake pans on the counter.)
step-20: make the frosting: in a large bowl, use an electric hand mixer on high speed to beat the butter, cream cheese, and salt.
step-21: mix until light and creamy, about 4 minutes.
step-22: add the powdered sugar and beat on low speed to combine.
step-23: once the sugar is incorporated, beat on high speed until there are no lumps and the frosting is super white and fluffy, about 5 minutes.
step-24: place a dab of frosting on a cake stand or an inverted plate.
step-25: place a layer of cake on the cake wheel, then evenly spread frosting on top with an offset spatula.
step-26: place the next layer of cake on top of the frosted layer, and spread frosting on top.
step-27: add the last cake layer and lightly frost the entire outside of the cake to create a thin crumb coat.
step-28: chill the cake in the refrigerator for 20 minutes.
step-29: remove the cake from the refrigerator and use the remaining icing to frost the cake in an even layer.
step-30: take the end of an offset spatula or knife and gently press it against the against the frosting at the bottom of the cake.
step-31: then, spin the cake and slowly raise the spatula after each rotation to create a ribbed effect.
step-32: smooth the top of the cake with the spatula.
step-33: place sprinkles around the edge of the cake.
step-34: set a small cookie cutter, any shape you like, in the center of the cake and fill in with sprinkles.
step-35: gently remove the cookie cutter.

step-1: make the tomato soup: melt the butter in a large pot over medium-high heat.
step-2: add the onion and stir for 6-8 minutes, until the onions just start to brown.
step-3: add the garlic and stir for another minute.
step-4: stir in the crushed tomatoes, chicken broth, heavy cream, salt, and pepper.
step-5: bring the soup to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes.
step-6: remove the soup from heat and transfer to a blender.
step-7: remove vent so that steam can escape.
step-8: blend for 2 minutes, until the soup is smooth and thick.
step-9: alternatively, leave the soup in the pot and use an immersion blender.
step-10: make the grilled cheese bowl: cut the crusts off the bread and set aside in a medium bowl.
step-11: arrange the bread slices into 3 lines: a line of 5, a line of 4, and a line of 2.
step-12: in a small bowl, combine the melted butter and garlic and use a brush to spread the mixture over each piece of bread.
step-13: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-14: brush the bottom of each slice in egg wash and then dab the bottom of each piece of bread in the line of 5 and the line of 4.
step-15: dab all four sides of the bread in the group of 2.
step-16: overlap the edges of the 5 pieces of bread, then press the edges together to adhere.
step-17: repeat with the line of 4.
step-18: in a greased medium oven-safe bowl, place one of the single slices of bread.
step-19: then, take the line of 5 slices and make it into a circle on the inside of the bowl.
step-20: press down the edges to adhere to the piece of bread at the bottom of the bowl.
step-21: cover the bread with 6 slices of cheese.
step-22: lay the remaining single slice of bread over the cheese, then make a circle with the line of 4 slices of bread, pressing to seal the edges and adhere to the bread below.
step-23: lay the remaining slice of cheese on the bottom.
step-24: using a small bowl, press down on the bread bowl to compress slightly.
step-25: bake for 15 minutes, until the bread is golden brown.
step-26: make the crouton fries: add the olive oil, oregano, pepper, and salt to the bowl with the crusts.
step-27: toss until thoroughly coated.
step-28: transfer the crusts to a large baking sheet.
step-29: bake for 5 minutes, until the crusts are golden brown.
step-30: remove the bowl and crouton fries from oven.
step-31: use tongs to move the bread bowl from the bowl to a serving dish.
step-32: fill with tomato soup.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: spread the brussels sprouts on a small baking sheet.
step-3: drizzle with 2 tablespoons of olive oil and season with ½ teaspoon salt and ½ teaspoon pepper.
step-4: toss to coat.
step-5: bake for 45–50 minutes, or until the sprouts are browned and crispy.
step-6: while the brussels are roasting, marinate the salmon: in a small bowl, combine 1 tablespoon of olive oil, ⅛ teaspoon salt, ⅛ teaspoon pepper, and the brown mustard.
step-7: place the salmon, skin-side down, in a glass baking dish and pour the mustard mixture over it.
step-8: spread the mixture evenly over the salmon, then marinate at room temperature for 20 minutes.
step-9: just before the salmon is finished marinating, prepare the arugula salad: in a medium bowl, toss the arugula with the lemon juice, 1 tablespoon of olive oil, and ¼ teaspoon salt, or to taste.
step-10: heat the remaining tablespoon of olive oil in a medium pan over medium heat.
step-11: pan fry the salmon for about 4 minutes on each side, or until cooked to your desired level of doneness.
step-12: transfer to a serving plate.
step-13: sprinkle the brussels sprouts with the mustard seed powder and plate with the salmon and arugula.
step-14: squeeze a bit of lemon juice over the salmon.

step-1: the day before serving, prepare the turkey for brining.
step-2: pat dry with paper towels.
step-3: set the neck aside for the stock.
step-4: cut off the wing tips and set aside with the neck.
step-5: butcher the turkey into 8 pieces: 2 breasts, 2 legs, 2 thighs, and 2 wings.
step-6: set aside the carcass for the stock.
step-7: combine the salt, brown sugar, pepper, and granulated garlic in a small bowl.
step-8: set a wire rack inside a baking sheet.
step-9: place the turkey parts skin-side up on the rack and generously sprinkle with the seasoning blend.
step-10: refrigerate, uncovered, for at least 2 hours, or overnight.
step-11: make the stock: preheat the oven to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-12: place the turkey carcass, wing tips, and neck on a baking sheet with the onion, carrots, and celery.
step-13: season lightly with salt and drizzle with oil.
step-14: roast for 30-45 minutes, or until the carcass and vegetables are deep brown.
step-15: transfer the roasted vegetables, turkey carcass, and other parts to a large stock pot.
step-16: from the still-warm baking sheet from roasting the carcass, pour any rendered fat into a small bowl.
step-17: add about 1 cup (240 ml) of water to the pan and scrape off any browned bits from roasting process, then pour into a separate bowl.
step-18: reserve for the gravy.
step-19: strain the stock, discarding the solids.
step-20: the stock will keep for 5 days in the refrigerator or for 3 months in the freezer.
step-21: cover the carcass with cold water.
step-22: add the bay leaves and bring to a gentle simmer over medium heat.
step-23: continue to simmer (don’t boil!) for 3 hours.
step-24: make the gravy: heat a medium saucepan over medium heat.
step-25: add the turkey fat and flour, stirring to combine.
step-26: cook the fat and flour together, stirring constantly, for about 5 minutes.
step-27: this is a roux--you are cooking out the raw flour taste and deepening the flavor.
step-28: gradually add the stock to the roux, stirring constantly to prevent lumps.
step-29: bring to a boil, continuing to stir until thickened.
step-30: season with salt and pepper to taste.
step-31: remove the pan from the heat and let cool to room temperature.
step-32: store in the refrigerator until ready to warm for serving with the turkey.
step-33: the gravy will keep in the fridge for up to 5 days, or in the freezer for up to 3 months.
step-34: 2 hours before you are ready to serve the turkey, preheat the oven to 425°f (220˚c).
step-35: remove the turkey parts from the fridge and drizzle with oil before placing in the hot oven.
step-36: roast for 30 minutes, then rotate the baking sheet to ensure even browning.
step-37: reduce the oven temperature to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-38: continue roasting until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of breast registers 160°f (70˚c).
step-40: start checking after about 20 minutes, removing any parts from the oven as they reach proper temperature so that they don’t overcook.
step-41: once all parts are done, loosely cover with foil and let rest for 5-10 minutes while you warm the gravy.
step-42: add the gravy and sage, if using, to a medium saucepan over low heat and bring to a simmer, stirring occasionally.
step-43: season to taste with more salt and pepper, if needed.
step-44: serve the turkey with the gravy and your favorite thanksgiving dishes.

step-1: add the tomatoes to a deep, large bowl.
step-2: using your hands, crush the tomatoes until no large pieces remain, just a coarse tomato puree.
step-3: peel the garlic cloves and finely chop.
step-4: heat the olive oil and butter in a large pot over medium heat.
step-5: add the onion and garlic and season with salt and pepper.
step-6: cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is softened but not browned, about 10 minutes.
step-7: add the anchovies and the oil they are packed in.
step-8: cook, stirring occasionally, until dissolved into the oil, about 2 minutes.
step-9: add the red pepper flakes and stir to combine.
step-10: add the tomato paste and cook until it turns a dark, brick-red color, about 4 minutes (this caramelizes the sugars in the tomato, which will give a really great flavor and take the edge off that raw tomato-y taste).
step-11: add the wine and cook for about 1 minute, just to burn off the alcohol.
step-12: add the tomatoes and stir everything together, making sure to scrape the bottom of the pot to get all those good bits.
step-13: add water and bring it to a boil.
step-14: reduce the heat to medium-low and cook the sauce for 1½–2 hours at a very low simmer; there should just be a few bubbles here and there.
step-15: if medium-low is too high (every stove is different), reduce the heat to low.
step-16: stir every 30 minutes.
step-17: ladle out about 2 cups of sauce: this is what is known as your "extra sauce." you'll serve it alongside the pasta or freeze it for later.
step-18: to serve, cook the spaghetti in a large pot of salted boiling water.
step-19: drain the pasta and add it to the sauce.
step-20: serve it right out of the pot, or transfer to a serving bowl.
step-21: top with grated parmesan cheese.

step-1: thinly slice the red onion and add to a large bowl.
step-2: quarter the cucumber, remove the seeds and dice, then add to the bowl with the red onion.
step-3: use a fork to remove the leaves from the parsley, then finely chop and add to the bowl.
step-4: add the chickpeas, kidney beans, and cannellini beans to the bowl.
step-5: in a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, combine the olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper, and whisk together.
step-6: pour the dressing over the salad and mix well until evenly distributed.

step-1: preheat oven to 450°f (230°c).
step-2: sauté the garlic and spinach in oil until the spinach wilts.
step-3: add the ricotta, parmesan, salt, and pepper, and stir until heated.
step-4: salt and pepper the chicken breasts, add the cheese mixture, and roll ‘em up.
step-5: dip each chicken breast roll-up in the egg, then the breadcrumbs, and place in a 8×8 (20 x 20 cm) or 9×9 (22 x 22 cm) baking dish seam side down.
step-6: bake for 25 minutes.
step-7: remove from oven and top with marinara sauce and mozzarella.
step-8: bake an additional 5 minutes.
step-9: remove from oven and top with basil.

step-1: create the purple layer by combining 1 banana, frozen mixed berries, frozen blueberries, one fifth of the greek yogurt, and half of the water in a blender.
step-2: blend well, adding more water if necessary, but do not add too much because you want the mixture to be thick.
step-3: pour into a bowl and refrigerate while you blend the other layers.
step-4: create the yellow layer by combining 1 banana, ½ of the frozen pineapple, one fifth of the greek yogurt, and a squeeze of fresh orange juice.
step-5: blend well, adding water if necessary, but do not add too much because you want the mixture to be thick.
step-6: pour into a bowl and refrigerate while you blend the other layers.
step-7: create the green layer by combining 1 banana, spinach, second half of the frozen pineapple, 2 kiwis, one fifth of the greek yogurt and a squeeze of lime juice.
step-8: blend well, adding water if necessary, but do not add too much because you want the mixture to be thick.
step-9: pour into a bowl and refrigerate while you blend the other layers.
step-10: create the orange layer by combining 1 banana, peach, frozen mango, one fifth of the greek yogurt and a squeeze of fresh orange juice.
step-11: blend well, adding water if necessary, but do not add too much because you want the mixture to be thick.
step-12: pour into a bowl and refrigerate while you blend the other layers.
step-13: create the pink layer by combining 1 banana, frozen strawberries, frozen raspberries, remaining greek yogurt, and remaining water.
step-14: blend well, adding more water if necessary, but do not add too much because you want the mixture to be thick.
step-15: remove all the bowls from the refrigerator.
step-16: spoon a little bit of each color into popsicle molds, alternating colors and amounts to create a tie-dye look.
step-17: place popsicle sticks into the molds and freeze.

step-1: preheat the oven to 450˚f (230˚c).
step-2: in a bowl, whisk together the eggs and milk until smooth.
step-3: pour the eggs onto a greased sheet pan and sprinkle in your favorite toppings.
step-4: bake for 15 minutes or until the eggs are cooked through.
step-5: slice the omelette and serve immediately or put into a storage container and freeze for up to 1 month.

step-1: make the pasta dough.
step-2: combine the flour and salt and make a small mountain of flour on a clean, flat surface.
step-3: make a well in the middle.
step-4: add 2 eggs to the well, and using a fork, carefully incorporate the eggs into the flour.
step-5: add the egg yolks and carefully mix into the flour.
step-6: once the eggs are incorporated, knead the dough by pulling, stretching, and folding for 3-5 minutes, or until it’s smooth and elastic.
step-7: shape the dough into a ball, and wrap it in plastic wrap.
step-8: rest in a fridge for 30 minutes to overnight.
step-9: make the ricotta-herb mixture.
step-10: in a medium bowl, combine the ricotta, parsley, basil, parmesan cheese, egg, salt, and pepper.
step-11: mix well and set aside.
step-12: in a large pot of boiling water, cook the rigatoni, then the jumbo shell pasta for 5 minutes less than the suggested cooking time.
step-13: transfer the cooked pasta to two separate medium bowls.
step-14: mix the marinara sauce with cooked rigatoni.
step-15: set aside.
step-16: stuff the jumbo shells with the ricotta-herb mixture.
step-17: set aside.
step-18: grease 10-inch (25 cm) diameter dutch oven with olive oil.
step-19: using a rolling pin, roll out the pasta dough on a lightly floured surface until it is about ⅛ inches (3 mm) thick and 2 times larger than the dutch oven you are using.
step-20: fold the rolled out dough into a triangle and transfer it to the pot, pressing down around the edges, letting the excess dough hang over the sides of the pot.
step-21: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c)
step-22: layer the pasta-lined pot with the rigatoni, mozzarella, meatballs, hard-boiled eggs, provolone, ricotta-stuffed shells, caramelized onions, and sausages.
step-23: fold the pasta dough over the sausages and cover with the lid.
step-24: bake for 45 minutes, then remove the lid and bake for 30 minutes more.
step-25: cool for at least 30 minutes.
step-26: invert the timpano onto a cutting board and cool for 10 more minutes before cutting.
step-27: serve with marinara sauce.

step-1: dip the ladyfingers in coffee.
step-2: in two spring form pans lined with parchment paper, layer the coffee-dipped lady fingers in a single layer.
step-3: freeze until the ladyfingers are frozen.
step-4: in a bowl, add the cream cheese, mascarpone cheese, and vanilla extract.
step-5: stir to combine.
step-6: add the milk, sugar, and gelatin to a bowl and whisk until the gelatin has dissolved.
step-7: pour the milk mixture through a sieve into the bowl of cream cheese.
step-8: pour 1 cup (290 g) of cheesecake batter into a springform pan.
step-9: refrigerate until firm, about 2 hours
step-10: add one layer of frozen ladyfingers on top of the refrigerated cheesecake layer.
step-11: add another cup (290 g) of cheesecake batter on top.
step-12: refrigerate for two hours, and repeat with remaining batter and ladyfinger layer.
step-13: refrigerate for 2 hours or until firm.
step-14: dust the top with cocoa powder.

step-1: crush cookies in a bag and set aside.
step-2: mix cold espresso and rum in a small bowl.
step-3: mix in gelatin and let stand for 2 minutes.
step-4: add boiling water and stir until gelatin is completely dissolved.
step-5: mix sugar and cocoa in large bowl.
step-6: add whipping cream and vanilla.
step-7: with an electric mixer, beat on medium speed until stiff.
step-8: pour in gelatin mixture and beat until well-blended.
step-9: add ½-inch (1.5 cm) layers of crushed cookies to dessert dishes, then scoop mousse into dishes and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
step-10: while mousse is chilling, whip cream in a cold bowl until soft peaks form.
step-11: add mascarpone and powdered sugar and continue whipping until stiff peaks form.
step-12: scoop a dollop of whipped cream on top of the mousse and sprinkle with extra cocoa powder.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the eggs, vanilla cake mix, vegetable oil, and water.
step-4: beat with an electric hand mixer to combine.
step-5: pour the cake batter onto the prepared baking sheet and spread with a spatula into an even layer.
step-6: bake for 8 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-7: sift the cocoa powder through a fine-mesh sieve all over a clean kitchen towel.
step-8: flip the cake onto the cocoa powder-dusted towel and remove the parchment paper.
step-9: starting with a short end, roll up the cake with the towel.
step-10: refrigerate for 1 hour.
step-11: in a medium bowl, whip the heavy cream and espresso powder with an electric hand mixer until fluffy.
step-12: add the mascarpone, sugar, and vanilla to the espresso cream and beat until smooth.
step-13: unroll the cake and spread with the espresso cream in an even layer, leaving 1½ inches (4 cm) from the top empty and reserving 1 cup (225 g) of espresso cream for decoration.
step-14: arrange the ladyfingers on the cake horizontally, 2 inches (5 cm) from the bottom.
step-15: brush the ladyfingers with the chilled espresso.
step-16: roll the cake back up, using the towel as a guide but not rolling it inside the cake.
step-17: refrigerate for another hour, then unwrap the cake.
step-18: transfer the remaining espresso cream to a piping bag.
step-19: pipe 6 espresso cream dollops on top of the tiramisu roll.
step-20: sprinkle chocolate shavings on top.
step-21: slice and serve.

step-1: in a large bowl, whip the cream until soft peaks form.
step-2: add the condensed milk and coconut milk, then whip until smooth.
step-3: in a pan over medium heat, toast the coconut until browned, stirring constantly.
step-4: fold the toasted coconut into the cream mixture.
step-5: transfer the mixture to a baking pan or bowl, then freeze.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (175˚c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: toast the pasta for 10-12 minutes, until golden brown.
step-4: bring a large pot of water to boil over high level heat, and season with salt.
step-5: add the toasted pasta to the water and cook for 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally, until al dente.
step-6: reserve ½ cup (50 g) of the pasta cooking water and drain the pasta.
step-7: in a small skillet over medium heat, melt the butter.
step-8: add the garlic, thyme, and pepper, and cook until fragrant.
step-9: add the pasta to the sauce, along with the reserved water, and mix thoroughly to coat.
step-10: sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

step-1: if your ravioli is frozen, allow to thaw before breading.
step-2: dredge the ravioli in flour, then egg wash (allow excess to drip off), then bread crumbs.
step-3: fill a large pot or skillet with 2 inches (5 cm) of oil and bring up to 350°f (180°c).
step-4: carefully place ravioli in the oil (don’t crowd them - cook in batches) and let cook for about 1 minute per side until golden brown.
step-5: set aside on a plate covered with paper towels to drain excess oil.
step-6: once the ravioli have cooled, plate and serve with warm marinara sauce.

step-1: preheat the oven at 180°c (350˚f).
step-2: prepare the toffee by gently heating the brown sugar and butter together over a low heat in a saucepan.
step-3: once bubbling, stir in the apple slices for a few minutes and take off the heat just as they start to soften.
step-4: lay out half of the apple slices in a oven-proof dish and then throw the bread chunks on top.
step-5: lay the rest of the apple slices on top and set the remaining toffee mixture aside.
step-6: in a jug, mix together the cream, milk, and eggs.
step-7: pour all over the apple slices and bread.
step-8: bake for 1 hour.
step-9: reheat the toffee mixture and then pour over the bread pudding.
step-10: serve with vanilla ice cream.

step-1: heat oven to 180°c (350ºf).
step-2: beat the sugar, butter, and egg in large bowl with electric mixer on medium speed until light and fluffy.
step-3: stir in flour, nutmeg, cinnamon, salt, and bicarbonate of soda.
step-4: combine into a smooth dough.
step-5: mix in the apple.
step-6: drop dough by rounded tablespoons about 2 inches (5 cm) apart onto baking paper-lined tray.
step-7: add in 1 chewy toffee piece per cookie.
step-8: bake 8 to 10 minutes or until light brown.
step-9: cool on a wire rack.

step-1: remove tofu from package and drain.
step-2: wrap the tofu in paper towels and cover with a couple heavy books.
step-3: let sit for 10 to 15 minutes to remove excess water.
step-4: cut tofu in half, reserving one half for a future recipe.
step-5: slice into 4 rectangles.
step-6: add olive oil to pan over medium heat.
step-7: add the tofu rectangles, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, ¼ teaspoon garlic powder, and ⅛ teaspoon turmeric, and let brown for 3 to 4 minutes before flipping over.
step-8: repeat on other side with other half of seasonings.
step-9: when both sides are browned, transfer tofu to plate.
step-10: to make sauce, combine vegan mayo and ketchup in small bowl.
step-11: assemble sandwiches by coating ciabatta roll with sauce, then stack on 1 hashbrown, tofu “eggs” sliced tomato and sliced avocado.
step-12: repeat with remaining ingredients.

step-1: drain tofu from container, wrap it in a paper towel, and place it on a plate.
step-2: rest another plate on top of the tofu and microwave for 3-5 minutes.
step-3: unwrap the tofu and cut into cubes.
step-4: place the tofu in a bowl and mash with a fork.
step-5: cut the top off a bell pepper and remove all the seeds and thinly slice.
step-6: chop the onion.
step-7: heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
step-8: add the onions and peppers, and cook until softened.
step-9: add in the tofu and cook on medium heat until most of the water has evaporated.
step-10: add the salt, pepper, onion powder, garlic powder, and cumin, and mix well, until all the seasonings are evenly distributed.
step-11: add the lemon juice to the tofu and mix until evenly combined.
step-12: remove the tofu from the heat and serve.
