step-1: in a medium bowl, add the soy sauce, lime juice, honey, ginger, and chili sauce and stir to combine.
step-2: set aside .
step-3: wrap the tofu in a dish towel then place a plate on top.
step-4: allow to drain for 10-15 minutes then remove the plate, unwrap the tofu, and slice into cubes.
step-5: in a wok or large frying pan heat 2 tablespoons of sesame oil over medium heat.
step-6: add the tofu and pan fry for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
step-7: add the garlic and the onion and stir until softened, about 1 minute.
step-8: add in the edamame, red pepper, and carrots and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, 2-3 minutes.
step-9: add the soba noodles, sauce, and sesame seeds.
step-10: cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring occasionally.
step-11: remove from the heat.
step-12: garnish with green onions, if desired.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-2: use your hands to crumble the tofu into a medium bowl.
step-3: add the soy sauce, tomato sauce, chili powder, garlic powder, cumin, pepper, and cayenne and stir until well-combined.
step-4: add a drizzle of olive oil to a large baking sheet.
step-5: transfer the tofu to the baking sheet, using a spatula to spread it out as much as possible.
step-6: bake for 20-25 minutes, stirring halfway through, until golden brown and slightly crispy.
step-7: fill the tortillas with the tofu, lettuce, tomato, shredded cheese, and guacamole.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425ºf (220ºc).
step-2: grease a baking sheet with nonstick spray.
step-3: wrap the tofu in a clean dish towel and place a heavy object, such as a cast-iron skillet, on top.
step-4: press the tofu for 20 minutes to remove excess liquid.
step-5: flip the tofu block on its side and slice in half lengthwise.
step-6: season all over with salt and pepper.
step-7: cut each piece of tofu lengthwise into quarters so you have 8 equally-sized pieces.
step-8: in a medium bowl, combine the flour and cornstarch.
step-9: mix with a fork.
step-10: in a separate medium bowl, combine the milk, apple cider vinegar, and dijon mustard.
step-11: whisk with a fork until combined.
step-12: in another medium bowl, combine the bread crumbs, salt, pepper, garlic powder, paprika, onion powder, nutritional yeast, cumin, and cayenne.
step-13: mix with a fork until combined.
step-14: take a piece of tofu and coat it in the flour mixture, followed by the milk mixture, then back into the flour mixture, back into the milk mixture, and finally, in the bread crumbs.
step-15: place on the prepared baking sheet and repeat with the remaining tofu sticks.
step-16: using a brush, coat each tender with an even layer of olive oil.
step-17: bake for 30-35 minutes, flipping halfway through, until golden brown and crispy.
step-18: brush with more olive oil, if necessary.
step-19: serve with honey mustard dipping sauce.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c)
step-2: remove tofu from packaging and drain.
step-3: place tofu on a couple of paper towels and find a heavy object to place on top of tofu, leave it there for 20 minutes.
step-4: slice the tofu into bite-sized pieces.
step-5: combine the marinade ingredients in a bowl then add the tofu.
step-6: mix until evenly coated.
step-7: cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
step-8: place the marinated tofu pieces on bamboo skewers, then place them over a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
step-9: make sure there is space underneath the tofu to help distribute the heat more evenly.
step-10: bake for about 15 minutes, until slightly dark brown on the edges.
step-11: heat oil in a large pot over medium heat, and sauté the onions, ginger, and garlic until tender but not browned.
step-12: add the spices for about 30 seconds to release their aromatics and flavor, stirring constantly.
step-13: add the tomato sauce and water, then bring to a boil and cook for about 5 minutes.
step-14: pour in the cream and mix in the tofu, cooking for another 1-2 minutes.
step-15: serve with rice and naan bread.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: soak the wooden skewers in water to prevent them from burning when baking.
step-3: crumble the tofu into a medium bowl lined with a dish towel.
step-4: gather the sides of the dish towel and squeeze out as much liquid as possible from the tofu.
step-5: to a food processor, add the pinto beans, drained tofu, nutritional yeast, soy sauce, poultry seasoning, garlic, salt, pepper, onion powder, and vegetable broth and puree until smooth.
step-6: with the processor running, pour in the olive oil and continue blending until incorporated.
step-7: add the vital wheat gluten to a large bowl, add the mixture from the food processor, and stir until the dough comes together enough that it can be kneaded.
step-8: knead for 1-2 minutes, until most of the cracks have disappeared, then turn out onto a clean surface and shape into a ball.
step-9: cut off about ¼ of the dough with a bench scraper and set aside.
step-10: transfer the remaining dough to a small glass bowl.
step-11: using your hands, form a hole in the center and evenly stretch the edges to help it expand to about 3-4 inches (8 cm) in diameter.
step-12: scoop the stuffing into the well, then stretch the sides of the dough over the stuffing to encase completely.
step-13: wrap the tofu turkey in parchment paper, then in foil.
step-14: divide the reserved dough in half and shape into 2 drumsticks.
step-15: insert a wooden skewer in each one.
step-16: wrap the drumsticks in parchment paper, then foil.
step-17: set the tofu turkey and drumsticks on a baking sheet and bake for 1 hour, flipping every 20 minutes.
step-18: remove the drumsticks after 40 minutes.
step-19: serve with gravy.

step-1: soak wooden skewers in a shallow dish filled with water to prevent burning.
step-2: place tofu on a paper towel-lined plate.
step-3: top with another paper towel and another plate.
step-4: microwave for 3 minutes.
step-5: slice tofu into 9-12 cubes and set aside
step-6: combine water, maple syrup, soy sauce, bbq sauce, oil, garlic powder, sriracha, and pepper then stir.
step-7: place tofu in the marinade and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
step-8: remove tofu from marinade.
step-9: heat marinade over a low heat and cook for about 10 minutes, until it reduces and thickens.
step-10: assemble skewers, alternating between tofu and veggies.
step-11: heat a pan or grill and cook each skewer for 3-4 minutes per side.

step-1: trim off the top third and very bottom of the lemongrass stalks.
step-2: using the side of a knife, press down across the stalks to bruise the lemongrass and release the oils.
step-3: chop each stalk into 4 pieces and set aside.
step-4: add the chili peppers, garlic, and galangal to a mortar and pestle and grind into a paste.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: melt the coconut oil in a large pot over medium heat.
step-7: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the lemongrass and cook for 3-4 minutes, until fragrant.
step-8: add the chili pepper paste and cook for another 3-4 minutes, until fragrant.
step-9: add the vegetable broth, tomato, lime leaves, coconut milk, and soy sauce and stir to combine.
step-10: bring to a boil.
step-11: cover, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes, until broth has reduced slightly.
step-12: add the tofu and mushrooms and stir to combine.
step-13: cook for 5 minutes, until the mushrooms are tender.
step-14: add the lime juice and agave and stir to combine.
step-15: season with salt to taste.
step-16: garnish with cilantro and serve.

step-1: combine all ingredients in a small bowl.
step-2: mix until combined.
step-3: serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 450°f (230°c).
step-2: slice the baguette into ½-inch (1 cm) rounds and place on a baking sheet.
step-3: brush both sides of the baguette slices with olive oil.
step-4: bake for for 6 minutes until slightly crispy.
step-5: in a medium bowl, combine the tomatoes, minced garlic, balsamic vinegar, basil, salt, and pepper.
step-6: rub the garlic into one side of the baguette slices, then spoon the tomato mixture evenly across the slices.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: on a parchment-lined baking sheet, season both sides of the chicken with olive oil, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and oregano.
step-3: bake for 30 minutes, or until cooked through and juices run clear.
step-4: while the chicken is in the oven, combine the balsamic vinegar and honey in a sauce pot and simmer, stirring occasionally.
step-5: note: it should take about 20 minutes for the mixture to reduce.
step-6: once the glaze has reached your desired thickness, remove it from the heat and set aside.
step-7: remove the chicken from the oven and top with slices of mozzarella and tomato.
step-8: broil for 8-10 minutes, or until the cheese is melty and the tomatoes are slightly charred.
step-9: while the chicken is broiling, you can chiffonade (cut into thin strips) the basil.
step-10: drizzle the balsamic glaze over the chicken and top with basil.

step-1: cook the sausage in a pot over medium-high heat.
step-2: add the onions, salt, and pepper, cooking until the onions are translucent and sausage is starting to brown.
step-3: add the marinara, milk, and basil, cooking until sauce has thickened slightly.
step-4: add the spaghetti, and toss until evenly coated and sauce sticks to the noodles.

step-1: combine oil, onion, celery, and garlic over medium heat in a large pot.
step-2: sauté for 3 minutes until onions are translucent.
step-3: add salt, pepper, tomato paste, basil, crushed tomatoes, broth, baking soda, and thyme.
step-4: bring to a boil.
step-5: lower heat and cover, simmering for 15 minutes.
step-6: uncover and remove thyme.
step-7: use an immersion or countertop blender to blend the soup until smooth.
step-8: allow to cool 2 minutes and serve topped with basil.

step-1: combine all the ingredients in a medium-size bowl and whisk to combine.
step-2: spoon over salad, or keep covered in the refrigerator for 3-5 days.

step-1: peel the tomatoes: bring a large pot of water to a rolling boil.
step-2: prepare an ice bath in a large bowl and set nearby.
step-3: carefully place the tomatoes in the boiling water.
step-4: boil for 30 seconds, or until the skin begins to split.
step-5: carefully transfer the tomatoes with a slotted spoon to the ice bath.
step-6: once cool enough to handle, gently peel the skins off and discard.
step-7: chop the tomatoes, discarding the seeds.
step-8: add the soaked bread, tomatoes, cucumber, bell pepper, red onion, basil, garlic, lemon juice, water, red wine vinegar, salt, and pepper to a food processor or blender.
step-9: while blending, slowly add the olive oil and continue blending until the mixture has reached your desired consistency, adding more water as needed to reach your desired consistency..
step-10: transfer the soup to a large bowl and refrigerate at least 30 minutes, or overnight, to allow the flavors to deepen.
step-11: serve the soup chilled with a drizzle of extra-virgin olive oil, and garnish with croutons and fresh basil.

step-1: use a vegetable peeler to peel the cucumbers.
step-2: on a cutting board, cut and discard the ends.
step-3: then cut the cucumbers in half.
step-4: scoop out the seeds and discard.
step-5: spread the pesto on both sides of the prepared cucumber.
step-6: fill one side of the cucumber with mozzarella and the other with tomatoes, and close the sandwich.

step-1: soften the butter and mix it with the minced garlic.
step-2: cut the loaf of bread in half lengthwise.
step-3: spread the garlic butter on the bread.
step-4: top with mozzarella, and bake at 400°f (205°c) for 15 minutes.
step-5: top with tomatoes and basil, sprinkle on salt and pepper.
step-6: for the dipping sauce, mix equal parts of balsamic vinegar and olive oil, and sprinkle with italian seasoning.
step-7: slice into strips.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: grease a 12-cup muffin tin with nonstick spray.
step-3: trim the ends from the zucchini, then slice lengthwise with a vegetable peeler.
step-4: line the muffin cups with the zucchini strips.
step-5: in a large bowl, whisk together eggs, tomato, diced zucchini, mushroom, milk, salt, and pepper.
step-6: add a bit of crumbled feta to each zucchini cup.
step-7: divide the egg mixture evenly among the cups.
step-8: bake for 18 minutes, until the edges are slightly browned.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: fold the parchment paper in half, then open up.
step-3: trim the ends of the asparagus and lay them on one half of the parchment paper.
step-4: drizzle on oil and sprinkle on salt and pepper.
step-5: lay the chicken on the asparagus, season with salt and pepper, and spread on the pesto.
step-6: top with tomato slices.
step-7: fold the parchment paper over the chicken, and cinch the paper together by folding it over itself along the edges.
step-8: bake for 25-30 minutes or until internal temperature of chicken reaches 165˚f (75˚c).

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: on a baking sheet, lay down zucchini.
step-3: drizzle on olive oil and sprinkle on salt and pepper.
step-4: lay the salmon on the zucchini, and spread the pesto on top of the salmon.
step-5: top with tomatoes.
step-6: bake for 10-12 minutes.

step-1: preheat gas grill on high heat.
step-2: using a sharp knife, slice the avocados in half by cutting in a straight line around the pit.
step-3: place the avocado half containing the pit in your hand and face it away from you.
step-4: gently stick the tip of the knife into the side of the pit and carefully pry it out of the avocado.
step-5: place the avocado halves on a tray.
step-6: using a pastry brush, brush oil on each of the avocado halves.
step-7: season avocados with salt.
step-8: place the avocados on the grill, flesh side down, and grill for 3-4 minutes, until grill marks appear.
step-9: remove the avocados and set aside.
step-10: in a small bowl, mix the tomatoes, onions, jalapeños, cilantro, lime juice, and salt until well combined.
step-11: spoon the salsa into the avocados and serve.

step-1: prepare 2 boxes of brownie mix according to instructions on box.
step-2: pour into a greased 9x9-inch (23x23-cm) square pan.
step-3: bake according to instructions on box.
step-4: cut each tray of brownies into 25 small squares.
step-5: form each brownie square into a ball, rolling in palms until smooth.
step-6: in a microwave-safe bowl, add the milk chocolate chips and microwave in 30 second intervals until smooth, about 1 minute and 30 seconds total.
step-7: turn a plastic sandwich bag inside out and hold it from the inside with one hand.
step-8: spoon ¼ of the milk chocolate into the bag.
step-9: turn the bag back out making sure chocolate does not fall out the opening.
step-10: seal it closed.
step-11: cut the corner of the bag, keeping in mind the more you cut off the larger your piping hole will be.
step-12: coat the brownie balls in the melted milk chocolate using a fork.
step-13: place on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and chill until chocolate has hardened, about 20 minutes.
step-14: place one of the milk chocolate brownie bites onto a clean surface.
step-15: using a chopstick, poke a rectangular hole into the brownie bites using the flat end.
step-16: break graham cracker in half into a rectangular shape.
step-17: with the milk chocolate write rip.
step-18: zig zag the milk chocolate around the hole.
step-19: stick the graham cracker in the hole.
step-20: coat the chocolate with chocolate sprinkles.

step-1: dill citrus aioli: combine all ingredients in a small bowl.
step-2: season with salt and pepper to taste, then set aside.
step-3: burgers: cut salmon into 2-inch (5-cm) pieces.
step-4: transfer 1⁄3 of salmon to a food processor and process, scraping down sides, until mixture is very smooth and paste-like.
step-5: add remaining salmon and pulse 4–5 times until pieces are no bigger than 1⁄4 inches (6 mm) (be careful not to make it too smooth).
step-6: transfer to a large bowl.
step-7: gently fold in citrus zests, juice, chives, and salt.
step-8: shape into 4 burger patties.
step-9: heat 1 ½ teaspoons of oil in a cast-iron skillet over medium heat.
step-10: once oil is hot, add salmon burgers to pan.
step-11: sear for 3–4 minutes on each side until cooked through.
step-12: assembly: spread about 1 tablespoon of dill citrus aioli on the bottom of 4 buns.
step-13: place one burger on each bun, then top with tomato, avocado, and butter lettuce.

step-1: spiced green tahini sauce: pulse garlic, cilantro, parsley, cumin, and 2 teaspoons salt in a food processor until similar in texture to pesto.
step-2: add tahini and lemon juice; process for seconds.
step-3: with motor running, gradually drizzle in 1⁄2 cup (120 ml) water and process, adding more water to thin if needed, until sauce is light green and the consistency of sour cream.
step-4: season with salt.
step-5: falafel: to the bowl of a 2-quart (1.9 liters) food processor, add the chickpeas, onion, parsley, garlic, lemon juice, spices, and eggs.
step-6: pulse the ingredients together until just incorporated, forming a wet paste.
step-7: don’t over-process.
step-8: transfer the chickpea mixture to a large bowl and add the breadcrumbs, mixing until just incorporated.
step-9: cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1–2 hours, or overnight.
step-10: pickled red onions: place onions in a bowl.
step-11: heat vinegar, water, sugar, spices, and salt in a small saucepan over high heat, whisking until sugar is dissolved.
step-12: bring to a boil, then strain and pour over onions.
step-13: press onions down with a spoon until submerged.
step-14: let rest until onions are softened and liquid has cooled, about 25 minutes.
step-15: cabbage slaw: in a bowl, combine all ingredients.
step-16: remove the chilled falafel mixture from the refrigerator and shape into 6 patties.
step-17: in a large nonstick skillet, heat about 1 tablespoon of oil over medium heat.
step-18: cook burgers in batches of 3 for 3–4 minutes each side, flipping halfway through.
step-19: once they are golden brown and crispy, transfer them to a paper-towel-lined plate and sprinkle lightly with salt.
step-20: assembly: spread about 1 tablespoon spiced green tahini sauce on the bottom of each bun.
step-21: place a burger on each bun, topping each with a tomato slice, pickled red onions, and cabbage slaw.

step-1: sriracha aioli: combine both ingredients in a small bowl and set aside.
step-2: carrot and daikon pickles: combine carrots, radish, sugar, and salt in a large bowl.
step-3: using fingertips, massage salt and sugar into vegetables until dissolved.
step-4: add water and rice vinegar.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: burgers: combine the pork, garlic, scallions, fish sauce, chili sauce, sugar, pepper, and salt in a large bowl.
step-7: mix gently until spices are evenly distributed, but don’t overwork meat.
step-8: form into four balls.
step-9: heat a pan with a tablespoon of oil over medium-high heat.
step-10: place burgers on pan and use a wide, stiff spatula to gently smash the balls into flat patties, about 3⁄4-inch (2-cm) thick.
step-11: cook until the bottom of each burger has formed a brown crust, about 3–4 minutes.
step-12: flip each patty and cook through, approximately 3–4 minutes.
step-13: assembly: spread about 1 tablespoon sriracha aioli on the bottom of each baguette quarter.
step-14: place a burger on each baguette, topping with carrot and daikon pickles, sliced cucumber, jalapeños, and cilantro leaves.

step-1: creamy herb sauce: stir together cilantro, scallion, mint, lemon juice, lemon zest, greek yogurt, and a pinch of salt until combined.
step-2: onion saute: heat oil, then add red onions to a large saute pan over medium-high heat.
step-3: cook until they begin to soften but still retain their color and crunch, about 2 minutes.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: burgers: combine the lamb, cumin, sichuan peppercorns, chile flakes, sesame oil, sugar, mustard, and salt in a large bowl.
step-6: mix gently until spices are evenly distributed, but don’t overwork meat.
step-7: form into four balls.
step-8: in the same large saute pan used for the onions and peppers, heat a tablespoon of oil over medium-high heat.
step-9: use a wide, stiff spatula to gently smash the balls into flat patties, about 3⁄4-inch (2-cm) thick.
step-10: cook until the bottom of each burger has formed a brown crust, about 3–4 minutes.
step-11: flip each patty and cook through, approximately 3–4 minutes.
step-12: assembly: spread about 1 tablespoon creamy herb sauce on the bottom of each bun.
step-13: place a burger on each bun, topping each with a spoon of onions, sliced cucumber, chilis, and cilantro.

step-1: preheat the oven to 325ºf (160ºc).
step-2: microwave the potatoes for 1-1 ½ minutes, then leave in the microwave for a few minutes to cool down and soften.
step-3: insert a wooden skewer into the bottom of each potato and gently push it all the way through the top.
step-4: working in a spiral motion from one side to the other, hold a sharp, thin knife at an angle and cut in the opposite direction you are turning the skewered potato, cutting all the way down to the skewer.
step-5: take your time and work to make thin, even spiral all the way down the potato
step-6: gently fan out each potato down the length of the skewer, until you have even gaps between the slices.
step-7: brush the melted butter all over the potatoes.
step-8: in a medium bowl, combine the parmesan cheese, pepper, garlic powder, paprika, and salt.
step-9: place each skewered potato over the bowl and sprinkle half of the spice mixture over each potato until they are entirely coated.
step-10: carefully set the potatoes on a baking pan, letting the skewers rest on sides of the pan so that the potatoes are suspended.
step-11: bake for 25-30 minutes, or until nicely browned.
step-12: garnish with additional parmesan and parsley.
step-13: let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

step-1: preheat oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-2: take potatoes and poke them on all sides with a fork.
step-3: microwave for 2-3 minutes.
step-4: coat a wooden skewer with oil and insert the skewer through the length of the potato.
step-5: hold a sharp, thin knife at an angle and cut through the end of the potato until it hits the wooden skewer.
step-6: begin rotating the potato to cut down the length of it and form a spiral.
step-7: gently fan out the potato down the length of the skewer, until you have an even gap between the slices forming the spiral.
step-8: brush the potato with melted butter.
step-9: in a medium bowl, combine remaining ingredients.
step-10: shovel the dry mixture all over the potato until it is entirely coated.
step-11: rest the skewered potatoes over a baking pan so the skewers suspend the potato over the bottom of the pan.
step-12: bake for 25-30 minutes, or until nicely browned.
step-13: garnish with additional parmesan and parsley.
step-14: allow to cool for 5 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: cut the ends off of the zucchini and cut it in half.
step-3: using a bamboo skewer, pierce down the middle of the zucchini and push it down to the center of the skewer.
step-4: hold a small knife at an angle and cut the zucchini while turning it the opposite direction that you want the tornado to go in.
step-5: spread out the tornado and drizzle with olive oil.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: in a bowl, combine panko, cayenne, chili powder, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, pepper, and parmesan cheese.
step-8: sprinkle over zucchini tornado until well-covered, and place on a baking sheet.
step-9: bake for 30 minutes, flipping halfway, or until golden brown
step-10: serve with your favorite dipping sauce.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: pour the vegetable oil (1 teaspoon per bowl) into medium (1.2 quart) oven-proof bowls and rub around to coat the surface.
step-3: press each tortilla into a greased bowl.
step-4: bake for about 10 minutes, until golden brown.
step-5: let the tortilla bowls cool.
step-6: make 3 cuts lengthwise on each of the romaine hearts, remove the stems, and chop into smaller pieces.
step-7: rinse, drain, and place in a large salad bowl.
step-8: dice the tomatoes and add them to the bowl with the romaine.
step-9: dice the onion and add it to the salad.
step-10: cut the avocados in half, remove the pits, and dice.
step-11: add to the salad.
step-12: add the corn and black beans.
step-13: in a small bowl or liquid measuring cup, combine the olive oil, lime juice, garlic, cumin, red pepper flakes, cilantro, salt, and pepper.
step-14: mix well.
step-15: pour the dressing over the salad and toss well.
step-16: fill each tortilla bowl with the salad.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: butter each side of the tortillas, sprinkle with cinnamon sugar, and cut into even quarters, making 12 pieces.
step-3: place two pieces in each cup of a muffin tin and push down so that it creates a cup shape.
step-4: bake for 13-15 minutes or until crisp.
step-5: in a bowl, mix together heavy cream, vanilla extract, and sugar.
step-6: assemble the cups by placing a spoonful of whipped cream in the toasted cup.
step-7: top with fresh fruits of your choice.

step-1: place the beef bones in a large stock pot, then add enough cold water to cover by 2 inches (5 cm).
step-2: bring the mixture to a boil over high heat and cook for 10 minutes to blanch the bones and remove any impurities.
step-3: set a rack in the upper third of the oven and preheat the broiler.
step-4: drain the bones in a colander and rinse under cold running water.
step-5: return the blanched bones to the stockpot.
step-6: meanwhile, arrange the ginger, garlic, and onions cut-side up on a rimmed baking sheet and broil on high until the aromatics are deeply charred in spots, 5 minutes.
step-7: remove from the oven and add to the stockpot with the bones.
step-8: meanwhile, combine the cinnamon sticks, peppercorns, and star anise in a medium skillet over medium-high heat and toast, shaking the pan occasionally, until the spices are darkened in spots and extremely fragrant, about 5 minutes.
step-9: add the toasted spices to the stockpot.
step-10: season the brisket liberally with salt and add it to the stockpot.
step-11: fill the pot with enough cold water to cover everything by 1 inch (2 cm).
step-12: bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to medium to maintain a gentle simmer, skimming off and discarding any fat that floats to the top as needed, until the brisket is fork-tender, 2-3 hours.
step-13: using tongs, transfer the brisket to a plate and let cool completely.
step-14: refrigerate the brisket until ready to serve.
step-15: continue to simmer the broth to get as much flavor out of the bones as possible, 3-4 hours more.
step-16: using tongs, remove and discard the bones and aromatics.
step-17: slowly strain the broth through a fine mesh strainer set over a large pot.
step-18: skim and discard the fat from the broth, then stir in the fish sauce.
step-19: taste and add more as desired.
step-20: thinly slice the brisket.
step-21: very thinly slice the raw sirloin steak against the grain.
step-22: divide the noodles among 6-8 large bowls, then top with the brisket and raw steak.
step-23: ladle the hot broth over the noodles and meat and serve immediately with the bean sprouts, onion, jalapeño, thai basil, lime wedges, hoisin sauce, and sriracha alongside.

step-1: melt peanut butter and honey together in the microwave, stirring every 15 seconds.
step-2: add oats, almonds, peanuts, and raisins into the bowl and mix until well coated.
step-3: let the mixture cool to room temperature.
step-4: add chocolate candies and mix just until combined.
step-5: line a baking dish with parchment paper and pour the cooled mixture into the pan.
step-6: press into the edges of the pan.
step-7: cool in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours.
step-8: cut and serve.

step-1: make the soaked spiced dried fruit: in a medium saucepan, combine the raisins, currants, prunes, cherries, cherry brandy, rum, cinnamon stick, and star anise.
step-2: cook over medium heat until just boiling, then remove from the heat and let steep for 1-2 hours.
step-3: about 20 minutes before making the cake batter, make the burnt sugar syrup: add the sugar to a small nonstick saucepan over medium-high heat.
step-4: let the sugar deeply caramelize, turning almost black and smoking a bit.
step-5: reduce the heat to low and carefully pour in the water (it will steam) and stir vigorously to incorporate.
step-6: let the syrup remain in saucepan while it cools, about 15 mins.
step-7: if it hardens too much before using, add a little more water and stir over low heat.
step-8: remove the cinnamon stick and star anise from the soaked fruit mixture.
step-9: transfer to a food processor, add the candied citrus peel, and pulse into a chunky paste.
step-10: set aside.
step-11: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-12: grease 2 8-inch or 1 10-inch (25 cm) round cake pans.
step-13: make the cake batter: in a medium bowl, combine the flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice, and baking powder.
step-14: set aside.
step-15: in a large bowl, cream the butter and brown sugar with an electric hand mixer.
step-16: once light and fluffy, beat in the eggs, 1 at a time.
step-17: with the mixer running, add ⅓ of the flour mixture then ½ of the fruit paste, then another ⅓ of the flour.
step-18: switch to a rubber spatula and fold in the remaining fruit paste and flour.
step-19: add the burnt sugar syrup, vanilla, bitters, and sliced almonds.
step-20: fold quickly to incorporate so the syrup doesn’t harden.
step-21: transfer the batter to the prepared baking pan(s).
step-22: bake for 1 hour, then reduce the oven temperature to 250˚f (120˚c), and bake for 45 minutes more, until the cake is dark in color and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
step-23: while the cake is baking, make the soaking liquid: in a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, combine the rum, cherry brandy, and sherry.
step-24: let the cakes to cool for 5 minutes, then carefully run a knife around the edges of the pans.
step-25: slowly pour the soaking liquid over each of the cakes, a little at a time, allowing it to soak in.
step-26: (reserve about ¼ cup for serving) let the cakes cool completely in the pans.
step-27: you can serve the cake immediately, but the flavor improves with time.
step-28: wrap the cooled cakes in plastic wrap and refrigerate for up to 2 months.
step-29: pour ½ cup of rum over the cake every 7 days to keep moist while storing.
step-30: brush with more of the soaking liquid before slicing and serving.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and salt, and mix until fully incorporated.
step-2: slowly add the water until the mixture forms a dough.
step-3: divide the dough into roughly 12 loyas (balls), cover with a dish towel, and let rest for about 30 minutes.
step-4: sprinkle each ball with flour and flatten or roll out into a circle roughly 5 inches (12-cm) in diameter.
step-5: spread ghee on each round and make a cut from the center out to the edge, then roll to make a cone.
step-6: press the peak and flatten the center of the cone.
step-7: let rest for another 30 minutes.
step-8: on a floured surface, roll each ball into a circle roughly 8 inches (20-cm) in diameter.
step-9: heat a tawah or flat frying pan over medium-high heat.
step-10: coat with oil and place a round of dough on the pan.
step-11: cook the dough until light brown, watching carefully, about 5 minutes.
step-12: then flip and cook on the other side, about 3-4 minutes more.
step-13: repeat with the remaining dough rounds.
step-14: break up the cooked roti with your hands or serve whole.
step-15: serve the fried roti with the fillings.

step-1: mix fruits together in a plastic bag.
step-2: seal bag and place in freezer for up to 6 months.
step-3: when ready, mix milk and fruit in a blender until consistency is smooth.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: roll out a circle of pie dough and cut in half.
step-3: press the dough into two small tart tins, and remove any excess dough.
step-4: use a fork to prick the base of the pie dough.
step-5: bake in the oven for 20 minutes at 425˚f (220˚c), or until the tart is golden brown.
step-6: remove from the oven and cool completely.
step-7: add the sugar, cornstarch, and salt in a medium saucepan over medium heat, and whisk to combine.
step-8: pour in milk and egg yolks and whisk, until the mixture just barely comes to a boil and becomes thick like pudding, about 6-8 minutes.
step-9: stir in the butter and vanilla, and remove the saucepan from the heat.
step-10: in three separate microwave-safe bowls, melt each of the chocolates by microwaving for intervals of 15 seconds, stirring until smooth.
step-11: pour the pudding into each of the separate bowls of melted chocolate.
step-12: stir until they are well combined and silky.
step-13: spoon many small dollops of each chocolate pudding into the pie crust.
step-14: make any design you would like with a toothpick.
step-15: chill in the fridge for 2 hours, until set.
step-16: garnish with fresh fruit, or mint

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: press the cookie dough in an even layer on the bottom of a 9x9-inch (23x23 cm) square baking pan.
step-3: place the 16 cookies evenly on top of the cookie dough.
step-4: pour the brownie batter on top, spreading it evenly over the cookies.
step-5: bake for 45-50 minutes, until a toothpick inserted inside comes out clean.
step-6: cool, slice, then serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 300°f (150°c).
step-2: in a greased, 9-inch (23 cm) springform pan, spread ⅓ of the brownie batter evenly on the bottom.
step-3: lay the chocolate cheesecake in the center, then spread the rest of the batter on top.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: in another greased springform pan, spread ⅓ of the cake batter evenly on the bottom, then lay the vanilla cheesecake on top.
step-6: spread the rest of the red velvet batter over the cheesecake and set aside.
step-7: in a third springform pan, press ⅓ of the cookie dough evenly on the bottom, then another ⅓ of the dough around the sides of the pan to make a wall.
step-8: lay the remaining vanilla cheesecake in the center, then cover with the rest of the cookie dough and seal the edges.
step-9: bake all 3 filled cakes for 2 hours, until a toothpick inserted in the center of each comes out clean.
step-10: chill the cakes overnight in the refrigerator.
step-11: dollop a bit of of cream cheese frosting onto a serving platter and line the sides with parchment paper.
step-12: add the cookie cake to the platter and spread the top with layer of frosting.
step-13: stack the brownie cake on top, then spread another layer of frosting on top.
step-14: finally, place the red velvet cake on top, then frost the top and sides evenly.
step-15: add the chocolate ganache to a squeeze bottle, then decorate the top of the cake working your way around the top edge of the cake to make a drip pattern.
step-16: squeeze more ganache over the top of the cake and spread evenly to cover.
step-17: decorate the lower part of the cake by pressing the chocolate chunks into the sides.
step-18: slice and serve.

step-1: use a vegetable peeler to peel the cucumbers.
step-2: on a cutting board, cut and discard the ends.
step-3: cut the cucumbers in half.
step-4: scoop out the seeds and discard.
step-5: spread mustard on one half of the prepared cucumber and mayonnaise on the other.
step-6: layer the roast beef, turkey, ham, and cheddar cheese, and close the sandwich.

step-1: add all the ingredients to a blender and mix on high.
step-2: pour into a bowl or half a coconut, and top with desired fruit and other toppings.

step-1: place orange juice, mango, strawberries, and lime juice in a blender, and blend until smooth.
step-2: turn off blender before stirring in sparkling water.
step-3: serve over ice.

step-1: combine all ingredients in a food processor until smooth.
step-2: transfer to an 8x8-inch (20x20 cm) glass dish.
step-3: freeze for at least 2 hours.

step-1: combine all the ingredients above in a large bowl.
step-2: mix the dressing ingredients together and spread over fruit, mix well.

step-1: put milk and spinach into a blender and blend until spinach is fully incorporated into the milk.
step-2: add in remaining ingredients and blend until smooth.

step-1: add tofu and maple syrup to a mixing bowl and whisk together until smooth and no large lumps are present.
step-2: transfer tofu mixture to ice tray and use a rubber spatula to evenly spread the mixture into each of the cube slots.
step-3: freeze completely.
step-4: place banana, kiwi, mango, spinach, 4 tofu cubes, and milk in a blender, making sure that the cubes sit on top of the fruit.
step-5: blend until smooth.
step-6: serve immediately.

step-1: in a large pitcher, combine the strawberries, orange slices, pineapples, peach schnapps, and sparkling water.
step-2: stir and refrigerate for at least 3 hours, or overnight.
step-3: when ready to serve, remove the pitcher from the refrigerator and add the champagne.
step-4: gently stir to combine.
step-5: place 1-2 small scoops of orange sorbet in a glass.
step-6: pour the sangria over the sorbet and stir with a spoon.
step-7: garnish with an orange slice.

step-1: combine pineapple, coconut water, and lime in a glass and muddle to infuse flavors.
step-2: strain and serve.

step-1: in a large bowl, using a hand mixer, whip heavy cream until soft peaks form.
step-2: whisk in condensed milk.
step-3: evenly divide the cream base into 3 separate bowls.
step-4: in a saucepan set over medium heat, add raspberries and water.
step-5: cook until berries have burst, about 3-5 minutes.
step-6: remove the pan from the heat and cool for 5 minutes.
step-7: place a mesh sieve over one the bowls of cream.
step-8: add the raspberries and using a spatula to press on the mixture so that the seeds are caught in the strainer
step-9: using a blender, puree mango until smooth.
step-10: add mango puree to the second bowl of cream.
step-11: add pineapple to the third bowl of cream
step-12: mix each flavor until uniform in color.
step-13: alternating each flavor, layer the 3 flavors into a freezer-safe loaf pan.
step-14: once all flavors are added, use a butter knife to gently swirl the sherbet.
step-15: be careful not to over stir, making more than 5 passes with your knife.
step-16: freeze until solid, about 3-4 hours.

step-1: using a blender, blend all ingredients until smooth.
step-2: serve immediately.

step-1: place wooden skewers in a bowl of water to soak for at least 10 minutes.
step-2: puree the pineapple, garlic, chili sauce, and water in a food processor.
step-3: heat a pan over medium heat, and add the pureed sauce mixture.
step-4: add vinegar, salt, coconut cream, lime juice, and zest of one lime.
step-5: bring the sauce to a boil, stirring occasionally.
step-6: reduce heat to a simmer.
step-7: mix the cornstarch and water in a small bowl to create the slurry, then add the mixture into the sauce and simmer until the sauce thickens, about a minute.
step-8: skewer the pineapple and shrimp, then brush sauce on both sides.
step-9: grill skewers over medium-high heat until cooked, about 2-3 minutes per side.
step-10: sprinkle finished skewers with lime zest and serve with remaining sauce.

step-1: in a blender, mix fruit until consistency is smooth.
step-2: add in yogurt and blend until fully mixed.
step-3: pour mixture onto a baking pan lined with parchment paper.
step-4: add desired amount of toppings.
step-5: freeze for 6 hours, or overnight, until frozen solid.
step-6: break yogurt bark into desired number of pieces.
step-7: serve cold, or store in a closed container in the freezer.

step-1: in a medium pot, melt butter and cook mushrooms until soft.
step-2: remove from pot.
step-3: in the same pot, add 2 tablespoons of butter and flour.
step-4: mix with a whisk until flour is cooked, approximately 2 minutes.
step-5: add milk and continue to whisk avoiding lumps to form.
step-6: mix in cheese and mix until the sauce thickens to desired thickness.
step-7: add in cooked pasta and mushrooms.
step-8: mix until sauce fully coats the pasta.
step-9: top it off with chives and truffle oil.

step-1: make the pasta by adding flour and a pinch of salt to the bowl of a food processor, pulse a few times.
step-2: add the egg yolks, milk, and olive oil.
step-3: run the food processor, adding additional milk or flour if the mixture is too wet or dry.
step-4: once it to starts to clump together and becomes a dough, let it get “worked” in the food processor for about 10 turns.
step-5: take your pasta to a floured table surface and knead it with your hands until you start to get a shiny, smooth surface.
step-6: wrap in plastic and set it aside to rest, about 30 minutes.
step-7: add all of the truffle shrimp mousse ingredients to a cleaned food processor and run until very smooth.
step-8: transfer to piping bag and set aside in the refrigerator.
step-9: begin rolling out the pasta dough by cutting off about an eighth of the dough ball and flattening with a rolling pin, until it forms a long rectangle about ¼ inch (6 mm) in thickness and is no wider than your pasta machine.
step-10: run the dough strip through your pasta machine from the machine’s widest setting a few times until smooth.
step-11: start rolling the dough through the settings, towards the most narrow, skipping no settings in between, rolling the dough through each setting twice.
step-12: note: cut the dough strip into smaller pieces if it becomes too long and unmanageable.
step-13: store finished strips under a damp cloth to keep pasta from drying out.
step-14: use a circular cutter about 3 inches (7 cm) in diameter to cut ravioli.
step-15: pipe about 1 tablespoon onto each circle (the amount will vary depending on the exact size of your circles).
step-16: egg wash the perimeter and join sides of the circle to form a half circle.
step-17: gently pinch dough together to seal ravioli.
step-18: place prepared ravioli on a floured surface to prevent sticking, covered with a lightly moistened towel.
step-19: egg wash the perimeter and join sides of the circle to form a half circle.
step-20: gently pinch dough together to seal ravioli.
step-21: heat butter for the bread crumbs in a saucepan until milk solids begin to brown and it starts to smell nutty, then remove from heat.
step-22: puree all bread crumb ingredients with the browned butter in food processor until it reaches a coarse sand-like texture.
step-23: return bread crumbs to saucepan and toast until golden.
step-24: stir often to prevent burning.
step-25: cook ravioli in salted boiling water 2 minutes.
step-26: note: submerge in ice bath if not serving immediately.
step-27: for the glace, melt butter in saucepan.
step-28: add chicken stock and whisk together until simmering.
step-29: add shallots and chives and then immediately add ravioli.
step-30: continuously move the ravioli to warm and coat the with the glace, about 2 minutes.
step-31: serve topped with toasted hazelnut bread crumbs.

step-1: roll out prepared brownie and cut into 32 squares (8 rows of 4).
step-2: form brownie square around truffle, sealing the truffle completely.
step-3: dip brownie in melted chocolate, covering the entire ball.
step-4: coat the chocolate-covered brownie in cocoa powder and chill.

step-1: place water, bonito flour, soy sauce, sesame oil, chicken stock, and green onion in a small pan.
step-2: bring this mixture to a boil.
step-3: boil the noodles for tsukemen, wash in cold water and cool it tightly.
step-4: feel free to add any other ingredients you might like.

step-1: combine the tuna, olive oil, panko, parsley, chives, garlic, salt, pepper, paprika, and egg in a large bowl until evenly mixed.
step-2: divide the mixture into 4 portions and form patties with your hands.
step-3: heat a drizzle of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
step-4: place the patties in the pan and cook for 3-5 minutes on each side, until golden brown.
step-5: serve on whole wheat buns with your preferred toppings.

step-1: bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
step-2: cook the pasta according to package instructions.
step-3: drain.
step-4: add the olive oil, garlic, and chile flakes to a large sauté pan.
step-5: turn the heat to medium-low and slowly heat up until the garlic is fragrant and lightly colored, about 3 minutes.
step-6: add the oregano, capers, olives, tomato paste, and diced tomatoes.
step-7: bring the sauce to a simmer and cook for 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
step-8: add the tuna and cook for another minute.
step-9: toss in the cooked pasta.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper, add the green beans, potatoes, and lemon.
step-3: drizzle the vegetables with 2 teaspoons of olive oil and season with salt, pepper, paprika, rosemary, thyme, and garlic.
step-4: mix until evenly coated.
step-5: add the bell pepper halves to the center of the baking sheet and drizzle with the remaining teaspoon of olive oil, ½ teaspoon of salt, and ½ teaspoon of pepper.
step-6: roast for 20 minutes until vegetables are golden brown.
step-7: let cool.
step-8: make the tuna salad: combine the tuna, celery, greek yogurt, salt, pepper, and parsley in a medium bowl.
step-9: add a large handful of greens to 2 bowls.
step-10: divide the roasted vegetables and bell pepper halves between the bowls.
step-11: add a hard-boiled egg, if desired.
step-12: scoop the tuna salad into the bell peppers.
step-13: serve with a balsamic vinaigrette, if desired.

step-1: slice six teacakes into eighths and set aside.
step-2: crush digestives in ziplock bag and set aside.
step-3: melt the butter, chocolate and golden syrup in a bowl placed over a pan of simmering water.
step-4: pour digestives and teacakes into the melted chocolate mix and stir together.
step-5: pour into a lined tray and refrigerate for 2 hours.
step-6: slice into segments.

step-1: top toast with turkey bacon, eggs, and sprinkle with cheese.
preheat griddler, fitted with the griddle plates, to 425°f (220°c) and grease with nonstick spray.
step-2: on a cutting board, arrange 4 slices of turkey bacon vertically directly next to each other.
step-3: weave the 5 remaining bacon slices horizontally through the vertical pieces.
step-4: wrap the bacon weave onto a rolling pin, taking care to keep it intact.
step-5: carefully transfer the bacon to the griddle and carefully unroll in an even layer.
step-6: close the griddler and cook for 8 minutes, until the bacon is fully cooked and has begun to crisp up.
step-7: remove the bacon weave from the griddler.
step-8: use a bread knife to slice the intact loaf of rolls crosswise so that the bottoms can be separated from the tops.
step-9: set aside the top half.
step-10: place the bacon weave on the bottom half of the rolls.
step-11: distribute the scrambled eggs on top of the bacon weave, smoothing them into an even layer.
step-12: place the cheese on top of the eggs, covering as much area as possible.
step-13: place the lettuce on top of the cheese.
step-14: place the tomato slices evenly on top of the lettuce leaves.
step-15: replace the top half of the rolls and slice the individual sliders.

step-1: use a vegetable peeler to peel the cucumbers.
step-2: on a cutting board, cut off the ends and cut the cucumbers in half.
step-3: scoop out the seeds and discard.
step-4: spread guacamole on both sides of the prepared cucumber.
step-5: layer the turkey on one half of the cucumber and bacon on the other half, and close the sandwich.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: grease a 12-cup muffin tin with nonstick spray.
step-3: trim the ends from the zucchini, then slice lengthwise with a vegetable peeler.
step-4: line the muffin cups with the zucchini strips on the bottom and sides.
step-5: in a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, cheddar cheese, turkey bacon, spinach, milk, salt, and pepper.
step-6: divide the egg mixture evenly among the zucchini cups.
step-7: bake for 18 minutes, until the edges are slightly browned.

step-1: use a cookie cutter to cut out shapes in the cheese and turkey.
step-2: using cupcake liners to separate, place cheese, turkey and crackers in the bento box.
step-3: in one of the other compartments, place the cucumber spears.
step-4: carefully, slice the skin of a clementine in two half circles on either side of the navel.
step-5: then, make 3 cuts within the inside of those half circles to make tentacles.
step-6: repeat on the other side and separate the skin from the fruit to make it look like a little octopus.
step-7: place in bento box.
step-8: pack bento box in a lunch box with a frozen water bottle to keep everything cold.

step-1: spread the mustard on the tortilla, and lay down the cheese and turkey.
step-2: tightly roll up the tortilla, and cut into slices.
step-3: serve with a clementine and sliced bell pepper.

step-1: spread 1 tablespoon of cream cheese on 1 piece of bread.
step-2: place lettuce and turkey on the cream cheese.
step-3: roll it up with the bread on the outside.
step-4: cut in half and place in bento box.
step-5: place cherry tomatoes in one compartment and in another add cereal, pretzels, chocolate candies, and raisins.
step-6: pack bento box in a lunch box with a frozen juice box to keep everything cold.

step-1: preheat oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-2: add the turkey, breadcrumbs, egg, salt, pepper, and olive oil to a bowl and mix to combine.
step-3: form the meat into 15 meatballs approximately 2-inches (5cm) across.
step-4: place the meatballs on a parchment paper-lined tray and bake for 15-20 mins in the oven, or until cooked through.

step-1: spread the pesto evenly over the tortilla with a butter knife.
step-2: peel the mozzarella string cheese into strips.
step-3: place the cheese and roasted red peppers over the top half of the tortilla.
step-4: top with the turkey.
step-5: fold the tortilla in half from the bottom, then fold in the sides, being careful not to tear the tortilla.
step-6: toast on medium-high, until golden brown.
step-7: watch to make sure it doesn’t burn.
step-8: let cool for 1-2 minutes before removing from the toaster.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: melt the butter in a large pan over medium heat.
step-3: add the onion, carrots, and celery, and cook for 8-10 minutes, until the vegetables have softened.
step-4: add the sausage and cook until browned, about 8-10 minutes, breaking the meat up into smaller pieces.
step-5: season with the sage and thyme.
step-6: add the stuffing mix and chicken stock.
step-7: stir until the bread is no longer dry.
step-8: remove from the heat and set aside to cool.
step-9: place the turkey breast on a cutting board, skin-side down.
step-10: cover with plastic wrap and pound with a meat mallet to about ½-inch (1 cm) thick.
step-11: brush the turkey breast with the dijon mustard.
step-12: spread the stuffing mixture over the turkey breast in an even layer, about ¼-inch (6 mm) thick.
step-13: transfer any extra stuffing to an oven-safe dish.
step-14: starting from a short end, roll the turkey into a log with the skin on the outside.
step-15: tuck in any loose bits.
step-16: use kitchen twine to tie the turkey closed crosswise at 1-inch (2-cm) intervals.
step-17: tie once lengthwise to seal the ends.
step-18: transfer the trussed turkey to a wire rack set over a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-19: brush with melted butter and season all sides generously with salt and pepper.
step-20: bake the turkey roulade for 45-60 minutes, until the internal temperature of the turkey reaches 165°f (75˚c).
step-21: bake the leftover stuffing for 20-30 minutes, until lightly browned on top.
step-22: let rest for 15 minutes, then remove the twine, slice, and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: grease a 12-cup muffin tin with nonstick spray.
step-3: make the batter: in a large bowl, stir together the whole wheat flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, pepper, and sugar.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: in a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, buttermilk, and butter.
step-6: add the turkey, onion, bell pepper, sun-dried tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, spinach, basil and italian seasoning to the egg mixture and stir to combine.
step-7: pour the egg mixture into the dry ingredients and fold to combine, being careful not to overmix the batter.
step-8: using an ice cream scoop, divide the batter between the muffin cups, filling almost completely.
step-9: bake for 18 minutes, rotating the muffin tin halfway through baking, until browned on top and a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean.
step-10: let cool for 10 minutes before removing the muffins from the tin.
step-11: serve or store in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.
step-12: nutrition, per muffin - calories: 188, total fat: 9 grams, sodium: 486 mg, total carbs: 19 grams, dietary fiber: 3 grams, sugars: 2 grams, protein: 10 grams

step-1: heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
step-2: toss in the sausage and break up with a wooden spoon until brown.
step-3: pour in the beans, tomatoes, salt, pepper, and thyme, and mix until everything has warmed through.
step-4: move the contents of the pan out of the way to form an open well in the center of the pan.
step-5: pour the eggs into the well, and as the bottom of the eggs start to cook and solidify, use a spatula to gently scrape the cooked bits off the bottom and slowly mix with the other contents of the pan.
step-6: add the spinach to the pan and mix.
step-7: spoon a portion of the mixture onto a warmed tortilla, top with avocado slices and greek yogurt, and roll the tortilla into a burrito.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: in a 10-inch (25 cm) cast iron skillet, melt 4 tablespoons of butter over medium heat.
step-3: add the ¼ cup (30 g) of flour, and cook, stirring constantly, until smooth.
step-4: add the chicken stock and salt to taste.
step-5: cook until the stock has reduced and thickened.
step-6: add in the rosemary, frozen vegetables, turkey, and additional salt, and stir until fully mixed.
step-7: remove from the heat.
step-8: add remaining flour, baking soda, 8 tablespoons of butter, and pinch of salt to a bowl.
step-9: using a wooden spoon or your hands, mix together until the butter is the size of peas.
step-10: add the buttermilk and mix until the dough barely comes together, about 1 minute.
step-11: place the dough on a floured countertop and gently form into a 1½-inch (4 cm) thick layer.
step-12: use a 3-inch (6 cm) round cutter to cut 10-12 biscuits, rerolling the dough as needed.
step-13: place the biscuits on the turkey in the cast iron skillet.
step-14: brush the top of the biscuits with heavy cream (optional).
step-15: bake for 20-25 minutes, until biscuits are golden brown.
step-16: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: heat the olive oil over medium heat in a large skillet.
step-3: add the turkey and cook until browned, about 5-6 minutes.
step-4: add the onion, bell pepper, salt, and pepper.
step-5: cook for 5-6 minutes.
step-6: add the tomatoes, garlic, thyme, basil, and oregano.
step-7: cook for 2-3 minutes.
step-8: add the spaghetti squash.
step-9: cook for 4-5 minutes until most of the liquid has cooked off.
step-10: add half of the mozzarella and stir until cheese has melted, about 1-2 minutes.
step-11: remove from heat and ladle the mixture into a baking dish.
step-12: bake for 20 minutes.
step-13: carefully remove then add the remaining mozzarella cheese.
step-14: bake for an additional 10 minutes.
step-15: carefully remove and allow to cool for 5-10 minutes.
step-16: garnish with green onions, if desired and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: using a sharp knife, cut off the tops of each bell pepper.
step-3: use the knife to help cut out and remove the seeds and ribs from inside the peppers.
step-4: place the peppers in a lightly greased roasting pan and set aside.
step-5: heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
step-6: toss in the onion, cumin, oregano, paprika, salt, and black pepper, and sauté until the onions have softened, about 2-3 minutes.
step-7: toss in the garlic and sauté until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
step-8: move the onions away from the center of the pan to create an open surface in the skillet.
step-9: place the ground turkey in the center of the pan and break up the meat.
step-10: move the meat and onions to the sides of the pan to create an open surface again.
step-11: pour in the black beans, corn, and salsa and stir the mixture until evenly combined.
step-12: spoon the mixture evenly into the hallowed bell peppers and replace the bell pepper tops.
step-13: bake for 30-35 minutes, until the bell peppers have softened and wilted slightly.
step-14: remove the tops of the bell peppers, spoon on a large dollop of guacamole, and replace the tops.

step-1: heat a skillet over high heat.
step-2: once hot, add oil to coat the bottom of the pan.
step-3: add the ground turkey and break apart with a spatula.
step-4: add taco seasoning, salt, and pepper and stir, cooking until meat has browned and is fully cooked through.
step-5: stir in the tomatoes.
step-6: bring to a gentle simmer for about 5 minutes and remove from heat.
step-7: assemble tacos with your favorite toppings.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a large skillet, heat the oil and cook onions and garlic for 3 minutes, or until they start to soften.
step-3: add the ground turkey to the pan, followed by salt, pepper, and oregano.
step-4: stir and cook for 3-4 minutes.
step-5: then add zucchini and diced tomatoes.
step-6: cook until zucchini has begun to soften and remove from heat.
step-7: cut the top off of the bell pepper low enough that the stem remains attached and remove the seeds.
step-8: save the top!
step-9: carefully, carve out your desired jack-o’-lantern face using a steak knife or paring knife.
step-10: repeat for the rest of the bell peppers.
step-11: place carved bell peppers in a baking dish and spoon in a layer of cooked rice in the bottom followed by the turkey mixture, and top with mozzarella cheese.
step-12: put the top of the bell pepper back on top.
step-13: bake for 35 minutes or until peppers are tender and the cheese has melted.

step-1: press caramels into the brownie batter.
step-2: sprinkle the top with chopped nuts and chocolate chips.
step-3: bake according to package, slice and serve.

step-1: in a large mixing bowl, combine waffle mix, egg, oil, cocoa powder, and chocolate chips.
step-2: stir until mixture is smooth.
step-3: in a small saucepan over medium-low heat, combine ingredients for caramel sauce and bring to a low boil, whisking constantly once mixture starts to boil.
step-4: continue to whisk until mixture darkens slightly and begins to thicken.
step-5: remove from heat and let cool for at least 30 minutes.
step-6: preheat a greased waffle iron.
step-7: pour ½ cup of waffle mix into the iron, then top with ¼ cup of pecans and a few tablespoons of caramel.
step-8: cover that with another half cup of waffle mix.
step-9: close waffle iron and cook according to manufacturer directions.
step-10: when waffle is cooked to desired crispness, remove to a plate.
step-11: top with more pecans, a drizzle of caramel, a dollop of whipped cream, and a cherry on top.

step-1: in a large skillet over medium heat, add the olive oil, onion, and mushrooms.
step-2: cook 5 minutes, or until the onion begins to turn translucent.
step-3: add the sun-dried tomatoes and garlic.
step-4: stir and cook for another 3 minutes, or until fragrant.
step-5: add the white beans, fire-roasted tomatoes, artichoke hearts, balsamic vinegar, honey, oregano, thyme, salt, and pepper.
step-6: stir to combine.
step-7: cover and reduce the heat to low.
step-8: let cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
step-9: garnish with fresh basil and serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: rub each potato with 1 teaspoon of oil, and prick the top with a fork.
step-3: place the potatoes on a rimmed baking sheet and bake for 1 hour.
step-4: transfer potatoes to a cutting board, and cut in half.
step-5: using a spoon, gently scoop out the inside flesh of the potatoes and transfer to a medium bowl.
step-6: reserve the skins.
step-7: add the sour cream, melted butter, salt, pepper, ½ of the shredded cheese, and ½ of the scallions, and combine with a hand mixer until smooth.
step-8: use a spoon to transfer the potato mixture back into the scooped out potato skins.
step-9: bake for 10 minutes.
step-10: sprinkle the potatoes with remaining cheese, and bake for 5 more minutes, until the cheese is melted.
step-11: top with sour cream, bacon, and the remaining scallions.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: wrap the beet in tin foil and place on a baking sheet.
step-3: roast for 1 hour, until fork-tender.
step-4: wearing gloves, peel the beet skin.
step-5: add the beet to the bowl of a food processor and pulse until smooth.
step-6: in a medium bowl, add 3 tablespoons of the beet puree to the butter and use a spatula to mix until evenly colored.
step-7: transfer the beet compound butter to plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or until very cold.
step-8: make the beet-colored dough: in the bowl of a food processor, add the flour, sugar, and salt, and pulse 2-3 times.
step-9: add the cold, cubed beet compound butter and pulse 8-10 times until butter is pea-sized.
step-10: transfer the dough to a large mixing bowl, and gradually add the beet juice, 1 tablespoon at a time, mixing with your hands until the dough comes together.
step-11: knead the dough on a work surface, and divide into two even discs.
step-12: wrap in plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator overnight.
step-13: make the dough: in the bowl of a food processor, add the flour, sugar, and salt, and pulse 2-3 times.
step-14: add the cold, cubed butter and pulse 8-10 times until butter is pea-sized.
step-15: transfer the dough to a large mixing bowl, and gradually add the ice water, 1 tablespoon at a time, mixing with your hands until the dough comes together.
step-16: knead the dough on a work surface.
step-17: wrap in plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator overnight.
step-18: add the blueberries, lemon juice, sugar, salt, and tapioca starch to large bowl and stir to combine.
step-19: remove one beet dough disc from the refrigerator and place on a lightly floured work surface.
step-20: using a rolling pin, roll the dough into a 12-inch (30-cm) circle, adding more flour to the dough as necessary.
step-21: place the rolled out dough in a 9-inch (23-cm) pie dish, trimming any excess dough to fit the dish.
step-22: add the blueberry mixture to the pie dish.
step-23: remove the other beet dough disc from the refrigerator and place on a lightly floured work surface.
step-24: using a rolling pin, roll the dough into a 12-inch (30-cm) circle, adding more flour to the dough as necessary.
step-25: remove the plain dough disc from the refrigerator and place on a lightly floured work surface.
step-26: using a rolling pin, roll the dough into a 12-inch (30-cm) circle, adding more flour to the dough as necessary.
step-27: using a ruler, cut the beet and plain dough into ½-inch (1-cm) strips, and create a lattice pattern of choice.
step-28: trim any excess dough.
step-29: refrigerate the pie for 1 hour.
step-30: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-31: in a bowl, whisk the beaten egg and water.
step-32: using a pastry brush, brush the top of the crust with egg wash. sprinkle the turbinado sugar on top.
step-33: cover the edges of the crust with a pie shield or tin foil.
step-34: bake for 10-15 minutes, until the top is golden brown.
step-35: reduce the oven temperature to 375˚f (190˚f).
step-36: continue baking for 40-45 minutes, until the crust is cooked through and filling is bubbling.
step-37: let the pie rest at room temperature for at least one hour.

step-1: scoop the avocado into a medium bowl.
step-2: season with salt and add the lemon juice.
step-3: mash until smooth.
step-4: spread the avocado on the slice of toast.
step-5: lay the chive diagonally across the toast.
step-6: put the chopped egg on one side of the chive and the other half egg on the other side.
step-7: season with pepper.

step-1: in a bowl mix together yogurt and 1 cup flour (125 g) until it forms a smooth dough.
step-2: transfer dough to a floured surface.
step-3: divide into four equal parts.
step-4: roll out each section of dough to about 8 inches (20 cm) in diameter using plenty of flour to prevent sticking or tearing.
step-5: cook the bread in a dry hot pan set over medium high heat.
step-6: cook each side for 2-4 minutes until golden brown and cooked through.

step-1: for the yellow: puree 3 eggs with the chopped turmeric until smooth, preferably in a high-speed blender.
step-2: place 1 ¾ cup (220 grams) flour in a medium mixing bowl and pour in the yellow puree.
step-3: stir with a wooden spoon until a shaggy dough forms.
step-4: sprinkle some flour on a wooden surface or cutting board, and turn the dough out of the bowl onto the surface.
step-5: knead for 5-10 minutes, or until silky and smooth, using additional flour as needed.
step-6: cover with plastic wrap and let rest for 30 minutes before sheeting.
step-7: will keep up to 3 days wrapped tightly in refrigerator.
step-8: for the green, puree 3 eggs with the baby spinach until smooth, preferably in a high-speed blender.
step-9: place 2 ¼ cup (340 grams) flour in a medium mixing bowl and pour in the green puree.
step-10: stir with a wooden spoon until a shaggy dough forms.
step-11: sprinkle some flour on a wooden surface or cutting board, and turn the dough out of the bowl onto the surface.
step-12: knead for 5-10 minutes, or until silky and smooth, using additional flour as needed.
step-13: cover with plastic wrap and let rest for 30 minutes before sheeting.
step-14: will keep up to 3 days wrapped tightly in refrigerator.
step-15: for the parmigiano reggiano cream sauce, melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat.
step-16: whisk in the flour and continue to cook for 2 minutes.
step-17: add the milk to the roux one cup at a time, whisking vigorously and smoothly after each addition.
step-18: once all the milk has been added, reduce heat to low, and begin to add parmigiano reggiano, a handful at a time.
step-19: stir with a wooden spoon to incorporate each addition of cheese.
step-20: once all of the cheese has been incorporated and the sauce is smooth, stir in the nutmeg.
step-21: taste the sauce and add salt and pepper as needed.
step-22: toss with pasta and serve immediately.

step-1: grease a 9x13-inch (23x33-cm) dark metal pan with softened butter, then line with parchment paper, leaving overhang on all sides.
step-2: grease the parchment with softened butter.
step-3: combine the chopped chocolate, ¼ cup (30 g) of cocoa powder, and espresso powder in a heatproof liquid measuring cup or medium bowl and set aside.
step-4: add the butter to a small saucepan over medium heat and cook until the butter just comes to a vigorous simmer, about 5 minutes, swirling the pan occasionally.
step-5: immediately pour the hot butter over the chocolate mixture and let sit for 2 minutes.
step-6: whisk until the chocolate is completely smooth and melted, then set aside.
step-7: combine the granulated sugar, brown sugar, vanilla extract, salt, and eggs in a large bowl.
step-8: beat with an electric hand mixer on high speed until light and fluffy, about 10 minutes.
step-9: it will be similar to the texture of very thick pancake batter.
step-10: with the mixer on, pour in the slightly cooled chocolate and butter mixture and blend until smooth.
step-11: position a rack in the middle of the oven and preheat to 350°f (180°c).
step-12: sift in the flour and remaining cocoa powder and use a rubber spatula to gently fold until just combined.
step-13: pour the batter into the prepared baking pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
step-14: bake until lightly puffed on top, about 20 minutes.
step-15: remove the baking pan from the oven using oven mitts or kitchen towels, then lightly drop the pan on a flat surface 1-2 times until the brownies deflate slightly.
step-16: sprinkle with flaky sea salt.
step-17: return the pan to the oven and bake until a wooden skewer inserted into the center of the brownies comes out fudgy but the edges look cooked through, about 20 minutes more.
step-18: the center of the brownies will seem under-baked, but the brownies will continue to set as they cool.
step-19: set the brownies on a cooling rack and cool completely in the pan.
step-20: use the parchment paper to lift the cooled brownies out of the pan.
step-21: cut into 24 bars and serve immediately.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: in a large pot of salted boiling water, blanch the green beans for 3 minutes, until tender and bright green.
step-3: drain and transfer to a 9x13-inch (23x33 cm) baking dish.
step-4: melt 4 tablespoons of butter in a large pan over high heat.
step-5: add the onions and cook for 8 minutes, until softened and translucent.
step-6: add the mushrooms and cook for 5 minutes, until browned.
step-7: add the garlic and cook just until fragrant, about 1 minute.
step-8: transfer the vegetable mixture to the casserole dish with the green beans.
step-9: wipe out the pan.
step-10: melt the remaining 4 tablespoons of butter in the same pan.
step-11: add the flour and stir to combine.
step-12: cook until a golden brown roux forms, for 5 minutes.
step-13: add the milk, heavy cream, salt, pepper, chicken broth, and parmesan cheese, and stir to combine.
step-14: reduce the heat to medium-low and cook until the sauce is thickened, about 10 minutes.
step-15: pour the sauce evenly over the vegetables in the casserole dish and toss until everything is well coated.
step-16: cover with foil.
step-17: bake for 20 minutes, then remove the foil and bake for another 10 minutes.
step-18: top the casserole with the fried onions, then serve.

step-1: in a very large bowl, whisk together the dry ingredients.
step-2: make a divot in the middle of the flour mixture and add a few tablespoons of water.
step-3: stir with a wooden spoon, gradually adding more and more water until the dough starts to come together.
step-4: you may need a tablespoon more or less water, depending on the consistency of the dough as it forms.
step-5: using your hands, ensure the dough is well incorporated, but do not knead.
step-6: be careful not to overwork the dough.
step-7: cover with plastic wrap and store at room temperature overnight, or for at least 12 hours, until doubled in size and porous.
step-8: make the sauce by combining tomato paste, water, vinegar, maple syrup, salt, pepper, garlic, oregano, basil, marjoram, and cayenne pepper in a medium bowl.
step-9: let sit at room temperature for an hour before canning or jarring.
step-10: refrigerate as necessary up to 2 weeks.
step-11: once the dough has risen, transfer to a clean, floured work surface and form into a large ball.
step-12: cut the dough into 6 equal parts and form dough balls by folding the corners into themselves.
step-13: place the dough balls on a floured sheet pan, sprinkle with flour, and cover with a damp towel for about 30 minutes to an hour.
step-14: preheat oven with a pizza stone in it to 500ªf (260ºc) or a low broil.
step-15: work each dough into a disk on a floured work surface.
step-16: knuckling the edges of the dough and tossing it gently will help thin it out.
step-17: be careful not to rip the dough.
step-18: place the dough disk onto a pizza peel generously floured with semolina or cornmeal.
step-19: this will prevent sticking.
step-20: top with desired sauce, cheese, and toppings.
step-21: slide the pizza onto the stone and bake for about 9 minutes, watching carefully to make sure it doesn’t burn.
step-22: look for the edges to become charred and crispy and the cheese to bubble.
step-23: let the pizza cool for 5 to 10 minutes before cutting and serving.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a large pot over medium heat, cook the bacon crispy and the fat has rendered.
step-3: add the garlic, bread crumbs, chives, and parsley.
step-4: stir and cook until the bread crumbs are toasted, about 5 minutes.
step-5: remove from the pot.
step-6: in the same pot on medium heat, melt the butter.
step-7: sprinkle in the flour and stir until combined.
step-8: add the evaporated milk and bring to a simmer.
step-9: season with salt, pepper, mustard powder, and cayenne.
step-10: whisk to incorporate and smooth any lumps.
step-11: the sauce should be thick enough to coat the back of the spoon.
step-12: add the pasta to the sauce and stir to combine.
step-13: add the cheddar, gruyère, colby jack, gouda, and provolone cheese, then fold the cheeses into the pasta.
step-14: if it seems too dry, add more milk to your liking.
step-15: transfer the mixture to a baking dish and top with the shredded mozzarella and cheddar.
step-16: bake for 45 minutes, or until the mac ‘n’ cheese is bubbly, melted, and golden brown on top.
step-17: serve with a sprinkle of the bread crumb mixture for added flavor!

step-1: on a cutting board, peel the potatoes.
step-2: place the potatoes in a large bowl of cold water after peeling to avoid discoloration.
step-3: cut the potatoes into 1-inch (2 cm) cubes.
step-4: add the potatoes to a large pot and cover with cold water.
step-5: bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 12 minutes.
step-6: in a small saucepan, bring the milk, heavy cream, and garlic to a simmer over low heat.
step-7: remove the pot from the heat and strain the cream through a fine mesh sieve.
step-8: drain the potatoes in a colander and transfer back to the pot.
step-9: mash the potatoes with a potato masher, potato ricer, or by pushing through a fine mesh sieve with a spatula.
step-10: add the cubed cold butter and salt.
step-11: stir to combine.
step-12: gradually add the cream mixture to the potatoes, little by little, until fully incorporated.
step-13: top with freshly ground black pepper and sprinkle with chives and serve.

step-1: peel the sweet potatoes on a cutting board.
step-2: trim the ends of the potatoes and cut into ½-inch (1 cm) thick matchsticks.
step-3: add the cut potatoes to a large bowl of water and soak for 1 hour.
step-4: drain the potatoes in a colander, and rinse with cold water.
step-5: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-6: thoroughly dry the sweet potato matchsticks with paper towels.
step-7: add the sweet potatoes to a large bowl and sprinkle with cornstarch, tossing until fully coated.
step-8: drizzle the grapeseed oil over the potatoes, add the paprika, garlic powder, and pepper.
step-9: toss to coat.
step-10: arrange the sweet potatoes in a single layer on a greased, foil-lined baking sheet.
step-11: bake for 15 minutes.
step-12: use a spatula to turn the sweet potato fries over.
step-13: bake for another 15 minutes.
step-14: turn off the oven and crack the door open, then let the sweet potatoes rest in the oven for 10 minutes.
step-15: season the fries with salt.

step-1: in a medium pot, stir together the milk and heavy cream over medium-high heat.
step-2: bring to a boil.
step-3: slowly whisk the grits into the pot.
step-4: when mixture begins to bubble, reduce the heat to medium-low.
step-5: add 1 teaspoon salt and ½ teaspoon pepper.
step-6: continue whisking the grits frequently for 10-15 minutes until mixture thickened.
step-7: remove the grits from the heat.
step-8: add the butter and cheddar cheese, and whisk to incorporate.
step-9: set aside.
step-10: heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet on medium-high heat.
step-11: add the onions, peppers, and garlic.
step-12: sauté for 2 minutes until onions and peppers have softened.
step-13: add the sausage.
step-14: cook until cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
step-15: slowly add the chicken stock.
step-16: stir until well-incorporated.
step-17: add the shrimp.
step-18: cook until pink in color, about 3 minutes.
step-19: add the cayenne, remaining teaspoon salt, and remaining ½ teaspoon black pepper.
step-20: add additional cayenne pepper, if desired.
step-21: remove from the heat and spoon the sausage and shrimp mixture over the grits.
step-22: sprinkle scallions on top, if desired.

step-1: heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
step-2: add shrimp, salt, pepper, 1 teaspoon of garlic, honey and lime juice.
step-3: mix well.
step-4: cook for 2 minutes, or until bottom of shrimp turns pink and opaque.
step-5: flip the shrimp and cook an additional 2 minutes or until shrimp are fully pink and there are no gray bits.
step-6: remove shrimp from skillet and set aside.
step-7: in a fresh skillet (or you can clean out the same one), add oil and sauté the asparagus and bell pepper with salt, pepper, and the remaining garlic.
step-8: when the asparagus and bell pepper have reached your desired doneness, add the shrimp back into the skillet and combine.
step-9: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, prepare 2 boxes of vanilla cake mix according to the package instructions.
step-3: fill 3 separate bowls with 1 cup (225 grams) each of cake batter and dye one batter pink, one purple, and the last one blue.
step-4: pour the remaining batter into two round 8-inch (20 cm) baking pans and one loaf pan that have been lined with parchment paper.
step-5: in random places, place spoonfuls of colored batter on top of the plain batter.
step-6: using a toothpick, mix the colors together until the batter looks marbled.
step-7: bake all 3 cakes for 20 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
step-8: let cakes cool on a cooling rack completely before assembling.
step-9: using a hand mixer, mix powdered sugar, butter, vanilla extract, and milk until well combined to make the frosting.
step-10: set aside 2 small bowls of frosting and dye one pink and the other black.
step-11: assemble the cake by placing one round cake on the serving dish and spread a layer of plain buttercream frosting on top.
step-12: place the second round cake on top of the frosting.
step-13: cut two of the corners off of the loaf cake to make ears.
step-14: spread frosting on the inside of the ear and stick to the top of the round cakes at 10 o’clock & 2 o’clock.
step-15: cover the top and sides of the cake with the plain buttercream leaving a semicircle at the bottom for the pink frosting.
step-16: frost the semi circle and the side with the pink buttercream, saving some for later.
step-17: put the black frosting into a resealable bag and cut off the tip of the corner.
step-18: decorate the cake with eyes, nostrils, and a smile.
step-19: cover an ice cream cone with the remaining pink frosting and pink sprinkles.
step-20: place the cone in between the ears and gently push into the cake to secure.
step-21: decorate with more pink sprinkles around the horn and on the ears.
step-22: place the cone in the middle of the cake (between the ears) and sprinkle the area around the cone and the ears with the pink sprinkles.

step-1: use a handheld mixer to combine the cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla extract.
step-2: microwave the milk for two minutes, and mix with the gelatin.
step-3: add the gelatin and milk to the cream cheese mixture.
step-4: separate the batter into three separate bowls.
step-5: add a drop of food coloring to each bowl, and stir to combine.
