step-6: add the graham crackers to a sealed plastic bag, and use a rolling pie to crush until the graham crackers resemble a fine crumb.
step-7: transfer the graham crackers to a bowl.
step-8: add the butter and sugar.
step-9: mix until thoroughly combined.
step-10: press the graham cracker crust into a greased 8-inch (20 cm) springform pan and chill.
step-11: layer the blue batter into the graham cracker crust and refrigerate for 30 minutes, or until firm.
step-12: repeat with the purple batter, and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
step-13: repeat with the pink batter, and refrigerate for 60 minutes.
step-14: dip each waffle cone into the white chocolate, top with sprinkles, and chill until firm.
step-15: top the cheesecake with the sprinkles, unicorn horns, gumballs, and the lollipop.

step-1: in a large bowl with an electric hand mixer or in a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, cream together the butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar, and corn syrup until light and fluffy, about 5 minutes.
step-2: scrape down the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula, then add the eggs and vanilla.
step-3: beat for 3 minutes, or until fully incorporated.
step-4: add the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt and mix just until the dough comes together.
step-5: do not overmix.
step-6: scrape down the sides of the bowl again, then fold in the white chocolate chips, sprinkles, oats, rice cereal, and fruit-shaped cereal.
step-7: using an ice cream scoop or ¼ measuring cup (60 grams), scoop the dough onto a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-8: cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or up to a 1 week.
step-9: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-10: line baking sheets with parchment paper.
step-11: arrange the chilled dough balls 4 inches (10 cm) apart on the prepared baking sheets.
step-12: bake for 6 minutes, then remove the cookies from the oven and place a corn chip in the center of each cookie to resemble a unicorn horn.
step-13: return to the oven for 6-8 minutes more, until lightly browned around the edges.
step-14: let the cookies cool completely on the baking sheets before serving.
step-15: the cookies will keep in an airtight container at room temperature for 5 days, or in the freezer for up to 1 month.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: in a pot over low heat, combine egg yolks, heavy cream, sugar, and cornstarch.
step-3: turn the heat up to medium-high, whisking constantly to prevent any lumps.
step-4: allow the mixture to thicken, stirring until smooth.
step-5: transfer the custard into three small bowls.
step-6: drop different colors of dye in each bowl and mix.
step-7: cover the tops of each bowl with plastic wrap and press down onto the surface of the custard to prevent skin from forming.
step-8: chill in the refrigerator.
step-9: in a pot, combine the water, salt, and butter, bringing it to a boil.
step-10: add the flour and stir until the dough comes together in a ball.
step-11: remove from heat.
step-12: add in the eggs, one a time, stirring until the dough becomes a paste.
step-13: add the vanilla and stir to combine.
step-14: transfer the dough into a piping bag with a large round tip.
step-15: on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper, pipe 1-inch ( 2 ½ cm) mounds.
step-16: (to form a more rounded shape, dab your finger with a little water and press down on the mound to eliminate the peak.)
step-17: bake for 20 minutes until the pastry has risen considerably and the insides are dry.
step-18: allow the pastries to cool.
step-19: then, using the tip of a knife, cut a small “x” into the bottom of each pastry and transfer (“x” side up) to a cooling rack.
step-20: this will allow any excess steam or moisture to escape, ensuring your pastries maintain their shape.
step-21: transfer the custard to a piping back alternating the colors in order for the custard to swirl inside the pastry.
step-22: fill each pastry with custard.
step-23: in a bowl, melt the white chocolate chips and vanilla, and swirl teal, pink, and purple dye in order to create a purple marble shell.
step-24: dip the top of each cream puff in the chocolate and garnish with sprinkles of your choice.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c) and grease a 9” (23cm) cake pan.
step-2: in a bowl, cream together the butter and sugar.
step-3: whisk in the eggs, vanilla and milk until fully incorporated.
step-4: add the flour, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon.
step-5: whisk until combined.
step-6: for the sauce, melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat, and stir in the brown sugar.
step-7: bring to a boil and continue to stir for 30 seconds, or until vigorously bubbling.
step-8: pour the sauce into the greased cake pan.
step-9: arrange the apples on top of the sauce in a circular pattern.
step-10: pour cake batter on top of apples and smooth the top of the batter.
step-11: bake for 45-55 minutes, or until the cake is done (the top will spring back when gently poked).
step-12: cool for 10-15 minutes and loosen the sides of the cake by running a butter knife around the edge.
step-13: place a plate upside down on top of the pan, then invert the pan, flipping the cake onto the plate.
step-14: garnish slices with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (175°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, mash the ripe bananas.
step-3: add the eggs, oil, sugar, and cinnamon, mixing until evenly incorporated.
step-4: add the flour and mix until the batter has no large pockets of flour.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: in a pot over medium-low heat, melt the butter, then mix in the brown sugar until dissolved.
step-7: bring up the heat to medium-high, cooking until the mixture starts bubbling and the sugar has melted.
step-8: remove the caramel from heat and pour into a greased 9x9-inch (23x23 cm) baking pan.
step-9: lay the banana slices evenly on top of the caramel.
step-10: spread the banana bread batter on top.
step-11: bake 40-50 minutes.
step-12: cool until the bottom is barely warm and use a knife to loosen the edges from the pan.
step-13: place a plate upside-down on top of the pan, then invert the pan, flipping the banana bread onto the plate.
step-14: slice, then serve with vanilla ice cream.

step-1: in a large, microwave-proof bowl, combine the milk and melted butter.
step-2: microwave for 40 seconds, until the milk mixture reaches 110˚f (45˚c).
step-3: add the yeast, then let sit for 10 minutes.
step-4: add the granulated sugar, salt, mashed bananas and stir.
step-5: add 3½ cups (435 g) of flour, ½ cup (60 g) at a time, stirring between each addition.
step-6: transfer the dough to a floured surface and knead for 3 minutes, adding more flour ¼ cup (30 g) at a time if the dough is sticking to your hands or the surface.
step-7: form the dough into a ball.
step-8: add the oil to clean large bowl and place the dough in the bowl.
step-9: cover with a kitchen towel and let rise for in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours, or overnight, until doubled in size.
step-10: once the dough has risen, roll it out to a ¼-inch-thick (6-mm) rectangle about 18x12 inches (20x30 cm).
step-11: make the filling by mixing the melted butter, granulated sugar, and cinnamon together in a small bowl.
step-12: spread the filling evenly over the dough.
step-13: roll up the dough and slice into 15 1½-inch (4-cm) thick slices (discard the ends).
step-14: make the caramel sauce: in a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the butter, brown sugar, salt, vanilla, and honey.
step-15: keep stirring to prevent the sugar from sticking to the pan.
step-16: bring to a gentle boil, then remove the pan from the heat.
step-17: pour the caramel sauce into a 9x12-inch (23x30-cm) baking dish and sprinkle the walnuts on top of sauce.
step-18: arrange the rolls in the dish so there are 3 rows of 5 rolls.
step-19: cover with plastic wrap and let the rolls rise for 15 minutes, in a warm place.
step-20: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-21: remove the plastic wrap and bake the cinnamon rolls for 40 minutes, or until light golden brown.
step-22: let cool for 20 minutes, then invert the rolls onto a serving platter.
step-23: leftover cinnamon rolls can be stored up to 5 days in the refrigerator.
step-24: reheat in the microwave or oven.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: using an 8-inch (20-cm) round cake pan, cut a circle out from the puff pastry.
step-3: using a fork, poke holes all over the pastry to provide ventilation.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: cut the tops and bottoms off of the bananas, then halve 2 of the bananas crosswise and set aside.
step-6: in a large saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter, then add the brown sugar and cook until fully incorporated and the sauce appears amber in color, about 5 minutes.
step-7: add the vanilla and cinnamon.
step-8: stir until combined.
step-9: add the bananas to the pan and cook until softened, about 2 minutes.
step-10: turn the bananas to fully coat them with the caramel, then remove from the pan.
step-11: reserve the caramel.
step-12: grease the cake pan.
step-13: arrange the bananas on the bottom of the pan.
step-14: pour over the caramel sauce.
step-15: cover the bananas with the circle of puff pastry and ensure the edges are tucked into the pan.
step-16: bake for 30 minutes, or until the pastry is puffed and golden.
step-17: let cool at room temperature for at least 30 minutes before inverting onto a serving plate.
step-18: slice and serve with vanilla ice cream.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a 12-inch (30 cm) cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat.
step-3: once the pan is hot, add the onion and cook until softened, about 4 minutes.
step-4: remove from the pan and set aside.
step-5: add the green pepper and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
step-6: remove from the pan and set aside.
step-7: turn off the heat.
step-8: grease the pan with nonstick spray.
step-9: arrange the pepperoni in an even layer on the bottom of the pan.
step-10: top with the green peppers, onions, parmesan, and mozzarella.
step-11: arrange the provolone slices over the shredded cheese in an even layer.
step-12: top with the pizza sauce and spread evenly.
step-13: on a lightly floured surface, roll out the pizza dough to a 12-inch (30 cm) round.
step-14: gently lay the pizza dough over the pizza sauce, making sure the dough reaches to the edges all around.
step-15: brush the dough with the remaining tablespoon of olive oil.
step-16: bake for 25 minutes, until the dough is golden brown.
step-17: carefully remove the skillet from the oven.
step-18: place a large baking sheet on top, then quickly invert the pizza onto the pan.
step-19: return to the oven and bake for another 20 minutes, until the pepperoni begins to crisp.
step-20: slice into 8 wedges, then serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: in a large bowl, mix together the flour, sugar, baking powder, eggs, oil, milk, and vanilla until smooth.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: in a small pot over medium heat, melt the butter.
step-5: add the dulce de leche and stir until mixture comes to a boil.
step-6: immediately pour the dulce de leche mixture into a round baking pan.
step-7: layer the apples in a circular pattern with each one overlapping the other.
step-8: repeat until the entire bottom of the pan is covered.
step-9: pour the cake batter on top of the apples and spread the batter evenly on top.
step-10: bake for 25 minutes, then cool until bottom is slightly warm.
step-11: place a large round plate on top of the cake pan, then flip quickly.
step-12: give the cake pan a few pats to make sure the cake is released, then lift off the pan.
step-13: slice and serve with ice cream!

step-1: in a large mixing bowl, whip together the heavy cream, espresso powder.
step-2: add powdered sugar until you have stiff peaks.
step-3: cover and refrigerate so it can stiffen more before you add it to the chocolate box.
step-4: to form the chocolate box: use melted chocolate to “glue” the pieces together; leave the top off.
step-5: feel free to decorate the top.
step-6: set chocolate.
step-7: add the refrigerated whipped coffee cream, top with some whipped cream, add the strawberry, and place on the top piece of chocolate.

step-1: prepare red velvet cake according to instructions on box.
step-2: in a bowl, crumble the red velvet cake.
step-3: mix in cream cheese until smooth.
step-4: roll into 1- to 2-tbsp.-sized balls, and chill.
step-5: melt the white chocolate.
step-6: roll the balls in the chocolate to coat evenly.
step-7: set aside.
step-8: decorate!
step-9: let the chocolate harden before serving.

step-1: mix oats, almond butter and honey in a large bowl.
step-2: add almonds and vanilla.
step-3: mix.
step-4: place bowl in the refrigerator for 30-60 minutes, or until the mixture has solidified.
step-5: mold mixture into bite-sized balls.
step-6: serve immediately.

step-1: cut bananas into coins and place in freezer in a sealable bag.
step-2: freeze overnight or until solid.
step-3: place all ingredients into a food processor or blender and blend until smooth.
step-4: pour contents into a loaf or small pan.
step-5: freeze one hour or until solid.

step-1: put all ingredients into a blender and mix until smooth.
step-2: serve in a glass and garnish with toppings (optional).

step-1: put all ingredients into a blender and mix until smooth.
add the black tea, almond milk, protein powder, yogurt, banana, blueberries, and ice to a blender.
step-2: blend until smooth.
step-3: serve in a glass topped with sliced almonds.

step-1: in a large bowl, crumble the cake into fine uniform crumbs.
step-2: add the vanilla frosting and mix thoroughly.
step-3: press the cake mixture into an ice cube tray.
step-4: dip the lollipop sticks into 2 tablespoons of melted white chocolate, then stick them into the center of each cake pop inside the ice cube tray.
step-5: freeze for at least 2 hours or up to 8 hours.
step-6: use a butter knife or offset spatula to loosen the cake pops from the ice cube tray.
step-7: pull out the cake pops.
step-8: dip each cake pop in the remaining melted white chocolate.
step-9: decorate with sprinkles

step-1: remove the vanilla bean from the pod.
step-2: with a small knife, cut down the middle and scrape out the beans.
step-3: add vanilla into a medium saucepan with the heavy cream.
step-4: bring it to a boil and set aside for 10 minutes for the vanilla to be infused.
step-5: in a bowl, combine egg yolk and sugar.
step-6: whisk in the cream gradually.
step-7: place into a ramekin and sift out the pod.
step-8: fill the baking pan with hot water and bake for 25 minutes, or until the middle of the custard gives a jiggle.
step-9: set in the fridge for a few hours.
step-10: add spoonfuls of sugar on the top.
step-11: torch the sugar until it caramelizes and let it cool.
step-12: take your time to avoid burnt sugar.
step-13: using a metal cookie cutter place the shape on top of the hardened sugar.
step-14: carefully add colored sugar and torch until the sugar melts.
step-15: let it sit a few minutes before enjoying!

step-1: note: if you have unroasted nuts, preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: spread almonds onto a baking tray and bake for 10-12 minutes or until you can smell them.
step-3: in a food processor, blend roasted almonds.
step-4: scrape down the sides when necessary.
step-5: once the almonds look creamy, add the espresso powder and vanilla extract.
step-6: continue blending until the mixture turns into a ball and evens out again.
step-7: slowly add canola oil while still blending.
step-8: pour into a jar, store in a refrigerator and use within one month.

step-1: fill a food processor with heavy cream, condensed milk, and vanilla.
step-2: close the top and blend for 15 seconds.
step-3: use a funnel or carefully pour the ice cream mixture into a large squeeze bottle.
step-4: lay out a large thick cloth on top of your cooking area to protect the surface from the liquid nitrogen’s low temperature.
step-5: using insulated gloves, fill a stainless steel bowl with liquid nitrogen and set it on top of the thick insulated cloth.
step-6: use the squeeze bottle to squeeze the mix at a constant drip into the liquid nitrogen.
step-7: fill the bowl with droplets and allow the liquid nitrogen to boil off.
step-8: once all the liquid has boiled over from the bottom, serve.

step-1: pour the matcha mixture into an ice cube tray.
step-2: freeze for at least 4 hours, or overnight.
step-3: add the matcha ice cubes, milk, sugar, and vanilla to a blender.
step-4: blend until smooth.
step-5: pour into glasses and top with whipped cream and a pinch of matcha powder.

step-1: sprinkle gelatin over the water.
step-2: the gelatin will absorb the water and dissolve, in a process called “blooming.”
step-3: in a small saucepan, combine heavy cream with sugar and cook over medium until it’s at the scalding point, or just under a boil.
step-4: once the cream has almost reached the boiling point, remove from heat and add vanilla extract and bloomed gelatin.
step-5: stir until fully dissolved.
step-6: strain panna cotta mixture into desired serving tempered glasses.
step-7: allow cream to come to room temperature before chilling in the fridge for 2-4 hours, or until the cream is firm in texture.
step-8: top with berries and honey.

step-1: in a bowl, mix oat flour, protein powder, baking powder, and cinnamon until fully blended.
step-2: add egg whites and greek yogurt to the bowl and mix until a batter-like consistency is reached.
step-3: melt coconut oil in a skillet over medium-high heat and wipe down to prevent the pancakes from sticking.
step-4: pour in some batter and cook pancakes until bubbles form all around the top of the pancake, then flip and cook for a few more minutes, or until cooked through.
step-5: top your pancake stack with bananas, blueberries, or honey.

step-1: make the crust: in a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, and salt.
step-2: add the cubed butter, a bit at a time, and use a fork to work it into the flour with a fork until it breaks down to dime-sized pieces.
step-3: gradually add the ice water and mix just until the dough can be pressed together.
step-4: divide the dough in half and shape into discs.
step-5: wrap in plastic wrap and chill in the fridge for 1 hour.
step-6: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-7: make the filling: peel and core apples, then thinly slice.
step-8: transfer to a large bowl and add 2 cups of sugar, the lemon zest, cornstarch, lemon juice, 1 teaspoon melted coconut oil, salt, and 3 teaspoons cinnamon.
step-9: toss until the apples are well-coated.
step-10: set aside.
step-11: on a lightly floured surface, roll out both of the discs of dough to about 1 inch (2 cm) thick.
step-12: transfer one round to a greased 8-inch (20-cm) pie dish and gently press against the bottom and sides.
step-13: trim the excess dough around the edges, then prick the bottom of the pie crust all over with a fork
step-14: pour the apples into the bottom crust and cover with the top crust.
step-15: trim the excess dough around the edges, then crimp the top and bottom crusts together with a fork.
step-16: brush the top of the crust with the remaining tablespoon of melted coconut oil and sprinkle with the remaining teaspoon of sugar and cinnamon.
step-17: cut 4 vents in the top crust
step-18: bake for 1 hour, until crust is starting to turn golden brown.
step-19: let cool for 10 minutes, then slice and serve.

step-1: chop up some bananas and freeze in container for at least two hours.
step-2: blend until the bananas are smooth.
step-3: add some chocolate sandwich cookies, peanut butter, dark chocolate and chocolate chips and blend again.
step-4: pour into a container and freeze until solid.

step-1: bring a medium saucepan filled with water to a boil.
step-2: add the cashews and boil for 30 minutes, then drain.
step-3: add the boiled cashews, basil, lemon juice, and salt to a blender.
step-4: start to blend, then slowly add the water while the blender is running until the “ricotta” reaches your desired consistency.
step-5: serve immediately or store in the fridge for up to 4 days.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: heat the olive oil in a medium pot over medium heat.
step-4: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the yellow onion and cook for 4-5 minutes, until semi-translucent.
step-5: add the garlic and cook for another 2-3 minutes, until fragrant.
step-6: add the jackfruit, salt, pepper, chili powder, paprika, cumin, and liquid smoke and stir until the jackfruit is well coated in the spices.
step-7: add the vegetable broth, cover, and cook for 15 minutes, until the jackfruit is tender enough to be mashed.
step-8: mash the jackfruit until mostly broken apart and stringy.
step-9: transfer to a baking sheet and spread in an even layer.
step-10: bake for 20 minutes, until lightly browned.
step-11: use your hands to stretch the pizza dough into a circle about 14 inches (35 cm) in diameter and ½-inch (1 ¼ cm) thick.
step-12: lay on a sheet of parchment paper.
step-13: remove jackfruit from oven and increase the oven temperature to 425°f (220°c).
step-14: pour ½ cup (145 g) of vegan barbecue sauce over the jackfruit, then toss to coat.
step-15: spread the remaining ¼ cup (72g) barbecue sauce over the pizza dough in an even layer.
step-16: top with the jackfruit and red onion.
step-17: bake for 14-16 minutes, until the crust is lightly golden around the edges.
step-18: remove the pizza from the oven.
step-19: drizzle with the vegan ranch and garnish with cilantro leaves.
step-20: cut into 8 slices and serve.

step-1: in a medium bowl, pour the soy sauce over the tempeh.
step-2: set aside to marinate for at least 25 minutes.
step-3: while the tempeh marinates, prepare the rest of the ingredients.
step-4: heat a medium nonstick pan over medium-high heat.
step-5: add the marinated tempeh strips.
step-6: cook for 1-2 minutes on each side, until golden brown and lightly charred.
step-7: remove from the pan and set aside to cool.
step-8: in a medium bowl, toss together the carrot and cabbage.
step-9: build the sushi rolls: lay a sheet of toasted nori, shiny side down, on the bamboo mat or clean work surface.
step-10: pat about ¼ of the rice evenly over the nori, leaving about a ½ inch (1 ¼ cm) of space at the top.
step-11: layer a few slices of avocado over the rice toward the bottom of the nori sheet.
step-12: top with a few pieces of cucumber, some of the carrot-cabbage mixture, a couple of pieces of tempeh, and about 1 tablespoon of chopped cashews.
step-13: to close the sushi roll, brush a bit of water across the empty edge of the nori.
step-14: using both hands, roll the filled end of the nori sheet over onto itself, carefully tucking all of the ingredients inside.
step-15: continue rolling until the nori sheet covers the rice and seal with the damp edge.
step-16: repeat with remaining nori sheets and fillings.
step-17: with a sharp knife, cut each roll into 6-8 pieces, depending on preference.
step-18: pro tip: if you wet the knife before slicing, it will cut through the nori more cleanly.
step-19: but be careful!
step-20: make the sesame miso sauce: in a small bowl, combine the olive oil, lime juice, maple syrup, miso, sesame seeds, and ginger, if using.
step-21: whisk to combine.
step-22: serve the sushi rolls with the sauce for dipping.

step-1: in a powerful blender, pulse chickpeas until they reach a powder-like state.
step-2: transfer chickpea flour to a strainer and strain over a large bowl.
step-3: add the garlic powder, onion powder, baking soda, turmeric, salt, pepper, and nutritional yeast and stir to combine.
step-4: preheat oven to 400ºf (200ºc)
step-5: in a bowl or liquid measuring cup, combine water, almond milk, and apple cider vinegar and stir to combine.
step-6: pour the liquid mixture into the dry mixture and whisk until smooth.
step-7: let batter rest for 2 minutes.
step-8: pour the mixture into a cupcake tin and add your toppings of choice
step-9: bake 15 minutes.
step-10: allow to cool, but serve warm.

step-1: bring a medium saucepan filled with water to a boil.
step-2: add the cashews and boil for 30 minutes, then drain.
step-3: add the boiled cashews, yogurt, coconut oil, nutritional yeast, salt, and water to a blender.
step-4: blend until smooth.
step-5: transfer the “brie” mixture to a large bowl, cover with a kitchen towel, and let sit at room temperature, or between 72º-90ºf (22˚-32˚c), for 12-16 hours.
step-6: transfer the mixture to a large saucepan over medium-high heat and add tapioca flour and agar agar flakes.
step-7: cook, whisking constantly, until the mixture is thick and pulls away from the sides of the pan, about 5 minutes.
step-8: line an 8-inch (20-cm) round baking dish with cheesecloth and pour in the hot cheese mixture.
step-9: cover with the cheesecloth.
step-10: let cool in the refrigerator until firm, 4-8 hours.
step-11: remove the cheesecloth.
step-12: eat right away or place the cheese on a wire rack and refrigerate for up to 36 hours (cheese will become drier the longer it waits).
step-13: store in the refrigerator for up to 4 days.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a food processor, add cashews and beans.
step-3: process until smooth.
step-4: add hot sauce, milk, lemon juice, nutritional yeast, paprika, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
step-5: process until smooth.
step-6: transfer to greased 9x9-inch (23x23 cm) baking dish and stir in chickpeas and cheese.
step-7: cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes.
step-8: garnish with scallions or parsley, if desired.
step-9: serve with pita chips or crackers.

step-1: combine almond milk and apple cider vinegar, and whisk together.
step-2: let sit for 5-7 minutes to “curdle”.
step-3: use as a substitute to buttermilk in a variety of recipes!

step-1: in a medium bowl, combine the yeast and a pinch of sugar.
step-2: pour 1 cup (240 ml) of warm water over the yeast mixture while turning the bowl so it stirs itself.
step-3: rest for 5 minutes, or until the yeast has bloomed and is bubbly, then add 2 tablespoons of melted coconut oil.
step-4: in a separate medium bowl, mix 3 tablespoons of melted coconut oil, the remaining 3 tablespoons of warm water, and the baking powder.
step-5: in a large bowl, whisk together 3 cups (385 g) of flour, the table salt, and remaining ½ cup (110 g) of granulated sugar.
step-6: while stirring, add the coconut oil and yeast mixtures to the dry ingredients and combine with a spoon.
step-7: once the dough is smooth, gradually add up to 1 cup (125 g) of flour and incorporate by kneading the dough with your hands (you may not need all of the flour).
step-8: knead until the dough isn’t sticking to the sides of the bowl, then transfer to a large bowl greased with coconut oil.
step-9: cover with a damp towel and let rest on the counter for 2 hours, or until the dough has doubled in size.
step-10: punch down the dough and turn out onto a floured workspace.
step-11: knead gently to get out any large air bubbles, and form into a log shape.
step-12: depending on the braid you are planning to do, cut the dough into the appropriate amount of even pieces.
step-13: braid into desired shape (braiding options below) and transfer to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-14: cover with a damp towel and let rise again for 1 hour.
step-15: preheat the oven to 325˚f (165˚c).
step-16: lightly brush the challah with melted coconut oil for a nice shine and bake for 25-30 minutes, brushing with more coconut oil halfway through, until golden brown.
step-17: to check for doneness try knocking on the bottom of the bread.
step-18: if it sounds hollow, it’s done!
step-19: cool completely on a wire rack before slicing.

step-1: soak cashews in water for 3 hours or over night.
step-2: combine all ingredients in food processor and process until fully incorporated and smooth.

step-1: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: add flour, sugar, cocoa powder, salt, and baking powder to a large mixing bowl and whisk to thoroughly incorporate, making sure there are no lumps.
step-3: once, the dry ingredients are thoroughly mixed together, create a small well in the middle and add in the coconut oil, maple syrup, and almond milk.
step-4: continue to whisk until a thick and lumpy batter forms.
step-5: grease the inside of two 9-inch (23 cm) cake tins with coconut oil or nonstick baking spray, and add about 1 teaspoon of cocoa powder to dust the inside of the pan.
step-6: pour half of the batter into each of the cake tins.
step-7: bake them for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean.
step-8: once cakes are finished, transfer them or a cooking rack for 5-10 minutes before removing the finished cakes from their tins.
step-9: while the cakes cool prepare the frosting.
step-10: add vegan butter, powdered sugar, cocoa powder, and vanilla extract to a mixing bowl and whisk using an electric hand-mixer until a smooth and glossy frosting forms.
step-11: add almond milk and continue to mix until incorporated.
step-12: choose which of the cakes will be the bottom of your finished cake and carefully level it off.
step-13: place a small amount of the icing in the middle of your serving dish and place the cake on top.
step-14: using about a cup (about 115g) of the icing, generously coat the bottom layer of the cake using a spatula.
step-15: once the icing is spread out evenly, place the second cake on top and continue to frost the cake using the rest of the icing.
step-16: refrigerate the cake for 30 minutes before serving.
step-17: slice and serve.

step-1: in a large bowl, whisk together the granulated sugar, brown sugar, salt, and coconut oil until combined.
step-2: whisk in the oat milk and vanilla, until the sugar has dissolved and the batter is smooth.
step-3: sift in the flour and baking soda, then fold the mixture with a spatula, being careful not to overmix, until just combined.
step-4: fold in the chocolate chips.
step-5: chill the dough for at least 30 minutes.
step-6: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-7: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-8: using an ice cream scoop, scoop the dough onto the prepared baking sheet, leaving at least 2 inches (5 cm) of space between each cookie and the edges of the pan so the cookies can spread evenly.
step-9: bake for 12-15 minutes, or until cookies just begin to brown.
step-10: let the cookies cool completely.
step-11: use a serrated knife to slice the pint of ice cream pint into 1½-inch (4-cm) thick discs.
step-12: peel off the paper container from each ice cream slice.
step-13: take 2 cooled cookies and sandwich an ice cream slice in between, pressing firmly.
step-14: roll the edges of the ice cream sandwich in the chocolate chunks, if desired.
step-15: repeat with the remaining cookies and ice cream.
step-16: eat right away, or place on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet and freeze for 20 minutes.
step-17: the sandwiches will keep in the freezer for up to 6 months in an airtight container.

step-1: in a large bowl, whisk together the sugar, brown sugar, salt, and coconut oil until combined.
step-2: whisk in non-dairy milk and vanilla, until all sugar has dissolved and the batter is smooth.
step-3: sift in the flour and baking soda, then fold the mixture with a spatula, being careful not to overmix.
step-4: fold in the chocolate chunks evenly.
step-5: chill the dough for at least 30 minutes.
step-6: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-7: scoop the dough with an ice cream scoop onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-8: be sure to leave at least 2 inches of space between cookies and the edges of the pan so cookies can spread evenly.
step-9: bake for 12-15 minutes, or until cookies just begin to brown.
step-10: cool completely.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: grease a 12-cup muffin tin or line with paper liners.
step-3: in a large bowl, cream together the sugar and coconut oil with an electric hand mixer until smooth.
step-4: sift in the cocoa powder, then add the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, vanilla, and almond milk, and stir with a rubber spatula until well combined.
step-5: fold in the chocolate chips.
step-6: use an ice cream scoop to fill each muffin cup about ¾ of the way.
step-7: bake for 20- 25 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center of a cupcake comes out clean
step-8: make the frosting: in a large bowl, cream the vegan butter with an electric hand mixer until smooth.
step-9: sift in half the powdered sugar and continue to beat.
step-10: sift in the rest of the powdered sugar and beat again.
step-11: sift in the cocoa powder and vanilla and beat until smooth.
step-12: use a butter knife to spread the frosting onto the cupcakes, creating a flat top with smooth sides.
step-13: place the sprinkles in a shallow dish.
step-14: roll the edges of the cupcakes in the sprinkles.

step-1: in a medium-sized bowl, beat aquafaba until stiff peaks form.
step-2: gently fold in melted chocolate, sugar, and vanilla, being careful not to overmix.
step-3: distribute mousse into 3 cups and chill for at least 3 hours, ideally overnight.
step-4: garnish with fresh strawberries or fruit of choice.

step-1: add coconut butter and maple syrup to a saucepan over medium heat.
step-2: cook for 2-3 minutes while stirring constantly.
step-3: the mixture should start out smooth then thicken into a dense paste.
step-4: add peanut butter and vanilla extract to the saucepan and stir to incorporate.
step-5: continue to cook for an additional 2-4 minutes until the mixture achieves a smooth and pourable texture.
step-6: remove the peanut butter mixture from the heat and allow it to cool slightly.
step-7: while the mixture cools, break up the baking bar of chocolate into a microwave-safe bowl and microwave it for 1 minute (stirring every 15 seconds) or until it is completely melted and smooth.
step-8: prepare a 9x9-inch (23x23 cm) baking tray by spraying it with nonstick cooking spray and layering it with a piece of parchment paper.
step-9: pour half of the peanut butter mixture into the baking tray and spread it out evenly.
step-10: add the melted chocolate to the remaining peanut butter mixture and mix thoroughly.
step-11: once incorporated, layer the chocolate mixture into the baking tray, over top of the peanut butter layer, and spread it evenly.
step-12: give the tray a few shakes and taps to remove any possible air bubbles and place the tray in the freezer for 1.5-2 hours to set.
step-13: turnover the baking tray to remove the fudge.
step-14: cut into small rectangular pieces before serving.
step-15: note: fudge should be stored in the refrigerator until ready to serve.

step-1: line a 9-inch baking tray with parchment paper.
step-2: set aside melted dark chocolate and white chocolate.
step-3: chop the top half of the strawberries off.
step-4: carve the inside of the strawberry hollow.
step-5: place strawberries in empty egg carton.
step-6: fill a piping bag (placed in a glass container) with melted chocolate.
step-7: fill the strawberries with melted chocolate and cover them with the top half again.
step-8: chill for five minutes.
step-9: dip in white chocolate and place in baking tray.
step-10: sprinkle on topping of your choice.
step-11: chill for another five minutes.

step-1: in a bowl, soak cashews in boiling water for 1-2 hours.
step-2: prepare the bottom of a 9-inch (23 cm) springform cake pan with parchment paper.
step-3: in the bowl of a food processor, blend 20 cookies for 30 seconds, then pour in coconut oil and continue blending until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
step-4: press the crumbs into the bottom of the cake pan to form an even layer.
step-5: freeze for 1 hour, or until the filling is prepared and ready.
step-6: scrape the filling from 10 sandwich cookies and reserve both the filling and cookies.
step-7: drain cashews and add to the bowl of a food processor.
step-8: blend until nuts start to ball up and stick together, approximately 30 seconds to 1 minute.
step-9: add coconut cream and cookie cream filling to the cashews and blend until fully incorporated, then add lemon juice and continue to blend until smooth.
step-10: it will resemble slightly coarser hummus.
step-11: once smooth, crumble in half of the reserved scraped cookies and pulse until incorporated, but not crushed.
step-12: remove the crust from the freezer and smooth out half of the filling over the bottom.
step-13: crumble the remaining scraped cookies on top, then smooth out remaining filling over it.
step-14: decorate as desired.
step-15: freeze for at least 1 hour before serving.

step-1: add chickpeas, hearts of palm, and artichoke hearts to food processor.
step-2: pulse until mixture is chopped, yet still slightly chunky.
step-3: transfer mixture to large mixing bowl and add 1 cup (50 g) of bread crumbs, ¼ cup (55 g) vegan mayonnaise, dijon mustard, 1 teaspoon lemon juice, salt, pepper, and old bay seasoning.
step-4: mix well.
step-5: form the mixture into 6 1-inch (2 ½ cm) thick patties.
step-6: dip each patty in remaining bread crumbs.
step-7: heat a pan of oil to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-8: fry each patty for 3-6 minutes per side, until golden brown.
step-9: transfer to paper towel-lined plate to absorb excess oil.
step-10: for tartar sauce, combine remaining vegan mayo, relish, and 1 teaspoon lemon juice in mixing bowl.
step-11: top the patties with tartar sauce, dill, and lemon juice.

step-1: gently melt the butter over a low-medium heat.
step-2: add milk and 2 tablespoons of sunflower oil and mix together.
step-3: once combined, take off the heat and set aside.
step-4: in a separate bowl, combine the flour, half of the sugar, baking powder and salt with a fork.
step-5: make a well in the center and pour in the butter mixture.
step-6: combine gradually until a thick dough forms.
step-7: using your hands, roll dough into little flat balls and with your thumb, press a hole in the center of each doughnut.
step-8: (you may need to flour your hands for this part to avoid getting sticky!)
step-9: heat up oil in a pan.
step-10: to know when it's hot enough, fry a little bit of bread in the oil.
step-11: if it goes brown and floats to the top, in 45-50 seconds the oil will be ready!
step-12: gently lay the doughnuts into the oil using a spatula.
step-13: fry for about 3-5 minutes on each side, until golden brown.
step-14: transfer the doughnuts onto some tissue paper to soak up any excess oil.
step-15: roll the doughnut into a bowl of the remaining half of sugar.

step-1: in a medium saucepan, whisk together oil and flour over low heat.
step-2: add spices and mix together.
step-3: slowly add the veggie broth and chili powder while whisking continuously.
step-4: let simmer for a few minutes until it begins to thicken slightly.
step-5: in a separate pot, lightly sauté the onion and peppers for a few minutes, before adding the zucchini, and finally the black beans.
step-6: season with pepper and a pinch of salt.
step-7: soften the corn tortillas by wrapping in a damp paper towel and microwaving for 10 seconds.
step-8: next, spread some of the sauce over the tortilla, and add the filling.
step-9: roll and place lined up in a baking dish.
step-10: pour the rest of the sauce over the enchiladas.
step-11: sprinkle with olives and green onions.
step-12: cover with foil and bake at 350˚ (177˚c) for 20 minutes.
step-13: soak cashews in hot water for 10 minutes (microwave works) add salt and lemon juice.
step-14: blend until creamy.
step-15: serve with avocado, cilantro, and a dollop of non-dairy sour cream.

step-1: boil 4 cups (945 ml) of water in a small pot.
step-2: cut a quarter of an onion into cubes.
step-3: peel and chop the potatoes into ½ inch (1 cm) cubes.
step-4: add onion and potatoes to pot and boil for 10 minutes, or until soft.
step-5: remove potatoes and onion from the pot.
step-6: make sure to save the water.
step-7: begin cooking fettuccine pasta in a separate pot.
step-8: in a blender, combine 1 cup (235ml) of the water used to boil the veggies, raw cashews, veggies, lemon juice, and seasonings.
step-9: blend until creamy.
step-10: add more of the boiling water if the mixture is too thick.
step-11: add salt to taste and garlic.
step-12: note: adding 1 tsp of nutritional yeast, and ¼ tsp truffle oil will really make this dish pop with cheesy flavor!
step-13: pour the sauce over the cooked pasta and serve.

step-1: in a medium pot, bring 4 cups (960 ml) of water to a boil.
step-2: add the cashews and carrot and boil for 10 minutes, or until the carrot is fork tender.
step-3: use a slotted spoon to transfer the cashews and carrot to a high-speed blender.
step-4: do not discard the cooking water.
step-5: to the blender, add the nutritional yeast, tapioca starch, lemon juice, salt, garlic powder, turmeric, and 1 cup ( 240 ml) plus 2 tablespoons of reserved cooking water (discard any remaining water).
step-6: blend the sauce for 2-3 minutes on high speed, until completely smooth.
step-7: pour the “cheese” sauce back into the pot and stir with a spatula over low heat.
step-8: clumps should begin to form.
step-9: continue stirring for 2-4 minutes, or until the sauce is thickened and stretchy.
step-10: remove the pot from the heat and set aside.
step-11: butter each slice of bread on 1 side.
step-12: in a medium nonstick skillet, heat a dollop of vegan butter over medium heat.
step-13: once the butter begins to bubble, add a slice of bread, butter side down, and use a spatula to spread cheese sauce on top.
step-14: top with another slice of bread, butter side up.
step-15: cook for 2-4 minutes, or until the bottom of the bread is golden brown.
step-16: flip and cook for 2-4 minutes more, until the other slice of bread is golden brown as well, then remove from pan.
step-17: repeat with the remaining ingredients.
step-18: slice the sandwiches in half and serve immediately.

step-1: line a 9-inch baking tray with parchment paper and grease thoroughly.
step-2: set aside a metal whisk and one tablespoon of baking soda.
step-3: in a large saucepan (the bigger, the better, as this will more than triple in size) over medium-high heat, combine sugar, corn syrup, and water.
step-4: stir to incorporate, then leave to boil.
step-5: insert candy thermometer and continue to heat without stirring until the mixture reaches 300˚f (150˚c).
step-6: remove from heat, and working quickly, add the baking soda and quickly whisk into the sugar syrup (whisking for no more than five seconds to prevent deflating the toffee).
step-7: the mixture will begin to expand.
step-8: quickly pour it into the prepared pan and leave to set.
step-9: do not move it for 1-2 hours.
step-10: once the toffee has cooled and set, remove from pan.
step-11: using a blunt object, shatter the toffee into bite-size pieces.
step-12: melt chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl for 75-90 seconds.
step-13: make sure to stop and stir after every 30 seconds.
step-14: dip the toffee pieces in chocolate and place on a lined baking tray.
step-15: finish with a sprinkle of sea salt and place in the refrigerator to cool for 15 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 375º f (190º c).
step-2: in a food processor combine tofu, lemon juice, nutritional yeast, basil, garlic, salt, and pepper, blend until smooth, then set aside and rinse out food processor.
step-3: in the food processor combine walnuts, garlic, oil, liquid smoke, soy sauce, smoked paprika, oregano, rosemary, and pepper, blend until well mixed, then set aside and rinse out food processor.
step-4: in the food processor chop up mushrooms so that they are in small chunks.
step-5: in a large pan cook mushrooms so that liquid is released and evaporated, about 6-8 minutes.
step-6: clear out a circle in the middle, add onion and oil, sautè onion until translucent, add walnut mixture and mix well.
step-7: in a large sauce pan cook lasagna noodles for half of time required.
step-8: in a 9”x9” lasagna pan add 2 cups of red sauce to cover the bottom, then layer 4 half-cooked lasagna noodles, then spread ricotta mixture over top, followed by “meat” mixture, and then more red sauce.
step-9: repeat until finished.
step-10: cover with aluminum foil.
step-11: bake in oven for 25 minutes, remove aluminum foil and bake for 5 more minutes.
step-12: allow to cool about 10-15 minutes then cut into ninths, serve.

step-1: add vegetables to a large pot or dutch oven of boiling water.
step-2: cover and allow the vegetables to cook for 10 minutes, until the potatoes are fork-tender.
step-3: remove boiled vegetables from water and save 1½ - 2 cups (360 ml) of the water.
step-4: add vegetables, cashews, and seasonings to a blender with half of the reserved water.
step-5: blend, adding a few tablespoons of water at a time until the desired consistency is achieved.
step-6: pour vegetable puree over the macaroni and stir to incorporate before serving.

step-1: in a small mixing bowl, combine chocolate chips, mint extract, and vegetable shortening, and microwave for 1 minute.
step-2: stir often and make sure the chocolate doesn't burn.
step-3: dip cracker in chocolate mixture.
step-4: place chocolate covered crackers on parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-5: refrigerate or freeze until hard.
step-6: refrigerate or freeze until hard.

step-1: bring a medium saucepan filled with water to a boil.
step-2: add the cashews and boil for 30 minutes, then drain.
step-3: add the boiled cashews, non-dairy yogurt starter, xanthan gum, and water to a blender.
step-4: blend until smooth.
step-5: transfer the “cheese” mixture to a large bowl, cover with a kitchen towel, and let sit at room temperature, or between 72º-90ºf (22˚-32˚c), for 12-16 hours.
step-6: return the mixture to the blender.
step-7: add the salt, apple cider vinegar, agar agar flakes, tapioca starch, and coconut oil.
step-8: blend until smooth.
step-9: fill a large bowl with water and salt generously.
step-10: stir to dissolve the salt, then add ice.
step-11: set aside.
step-12: transfer the “cheese” mixture to a large saucepan over medium-high heat.
step-13: stir constantly until the mixture begins to pull together, 3-5 minutes.
step-14: using an ice cream scoop, scoop golf ball to baseball-size pieces of the mixture into the ice water.
step-15: allow the “mozzarella” balls to sit for 30 minutes, until they have firmed up and become stretchy.
step-16: store in salt water in the fridge for up to 1 week.

step-1: in a large pan, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat.
step-2: add the onion and sauté for about 3 minutes until translucent.
step-3: add the garlic and cook for about 2 minutes, until fragrant.
step-4: add the green pepper.
step-5: stir and sauté for about 5 minutes until tender.
step-6: transfer the sautéed vegetables to a bowl and set aside.
step-7: melt the vegan butter in the pan.
step-8: add the mushrooms and stir to coat in the butter.
step-9: add the paprika, ¼ teaspoon onion powder, ¼ teaspoon garlic powder, ½ teaspoon black pepper, and ½ teaspoon salt.
step-10: stir well.
step-11: sauté for about 7 minutes until the mushrooms are dark brown and reduce in size by half.
step-12: add the green pepper, onion, and garlic mixture back to the pan and stir.
step-13: add the soy sauce and worcestershire sauce.
step-14: stir well.
step-15: continue to sauté for about 7 minutes until the liquid has thickened.
step-16: in the meantime, place the carrot, vegetable broth, remaining 3 tablespoons of olive oil, the lemon juice, nutritional yeast, remaining teaspoon of onion powder, remaining teaspoon of garlic powder, the tomato paste, remaining ½ teaspoon of salt, and remaining ½ teaspoon of pepper in a food processor.
step-17: blend until it forms a smooth and homogenous sauce.
step-18: add the potato and blend until homogenous.
step-19: fill the hoagies with the mushroom mixture.
step-20: top the mushroom mixture with the vegan “cheese”, and parsley.
step-21: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: in a food processor, pulse the walnuts until mostly crumbly, about 10 pulses.
step-3: add the mushrooms and pulse again until crumbly, but do not to overprocess.
step-4: heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
step-5: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the onion and cook for 3-4 minutes, until semi-translucent.
step-6: add the garlic and cook for another 2-3 minutes, until fragrant.
step-7: add the mushroom walnut mixture and cook for 5-7 minutes, until most of the liquid from the mushrooms has been released and evaporated.
step-8: add the soy sauce, paprika, fennel, salt, and pepper and cook for 3-4 minutes more, until the mushroom mixture begins crisp slightly.
step-9: remove from the heat.
step-10: use your hands to stretch the pizza dough into a circle about 14 inches (35 cm) in diameter and ½-inch (1 ¼ cm) thick.
step-11: lay on a sheet of parchment paper.
step-12: spread the marinara sauce over the pizza dough in an even layer, then sprinkle with the vegan mozzarella.
step-13: top with the mushroom walnut mixture, olives, and bell pepper.
step-14: bake for 14-16 minute, until the crust is lightly golden around the edges.
step-15: cut into 8 slices and serve.

step-1: add the orange juice, yogurt, and agave to a blender and blend until well-combined.
step-2: pour the blended mixture into the ice pop mold.
step-3: freeze until solid, 2-3 hours.
step-4: if desired, dip the frozen pops in yogurt and sprinkle with orange zest.
step-5: place the pops on a parchment paper-lined plate and freeze again for 30 minutes.
step-6: the pops will keep in the freezer for up to 6 months in an airtight container.

step-1: soak the rice noodles in room-temperature water for 30 minutes prior to cooking.
step-2: make the sauce: in a small saucepan over medium-high heat, whisk together the rice vinegar, soy sauce, brown sugar, worcestershire sauce, and tamarind paste.
step-3: bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low.
step-4: simmer for 5 minutes, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens and coats the back of a wooden spoon.
step-5: remove the sauce from the heat and set aside.
step-6: heat a large cast-iron pan or wok over high heat.
step-7: add the peanut oil, scallions, chiles, and garlic.
step-8: stir, and cook for about 2 minutes until scallions soften.
step-9: add the carrots, stir to incorporate, and cook for about 1 minute.
step-10: add the bean sprouts and stir to incorporate.
step-11: add soaked rice noodles and stir to evenly distribute all ingredients, then stir for 1-2 minutes to heat the noodles through.
step-12: add the sauce and stir to combine.
step-13: add the tofu, stir to incorporate, and remove the pan from the heat.
step-14: serve immediately with peanuts, bean sprouts, scallions, and red chiles, if desired.

step-1: prepare the blueberry syrup by combining the sugar, water, and blueberries in a small saucepan over medium heat.
step-2: bring to a boil and then reduce until you have a deep blue, syrup-like consistency.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: for the pancakes, mix together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
step-5: whisk in the soy milk and oil until you have a smooth, creamy batter.
step-6: heat some extra oil in a frying pan and pour the batter into the frying pan.
step-7: fry for a few minutes on each side until golden brown.
step-8: serve with the blueberry syrup.

step-1: combine all ingredients in food processor and processor until well mixed and incorporated.
pour 1 cup (240 ml) aquafaba into a pot and reduce to ⅓ cup (80 ml) over low heat.
step-2: refrigerate aquafaba overnight.
step-3: preheat oven to 250°f (120°c).
step-4: in a bowl, add the powdered sugar, almond meal, and dark cocoa powder, and whisk to combine.
step-5: add the chilled aquafaba to another bowl and beat until soft peaks begin to form.
step-6: add the cream of tartar and sugar to the whipped aquafaba and beat until soft peaks form.
step-7: sift powdered sugar, almond meal, and dark cocoa powder into the whipped aquafaba, and gently fold ingredients together.
step-8: transfer the batter to a piping bag and pipe directly onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-9: let the tray rest at room temperature for 2 hours until the surface does not stick to fingertips.
step-10: bake for 30 minutes.
step-11: let the macarons cool for 15 minutes.
step-12: pipe the peanut butter onto the macarons.
step-13: refrigerate macarons for another 2 hours before serving.

step-1: combine basil, arugula, lemon juice, water, and olive oil to a blender and blend for 5-10 seconds.
step-2: add garlic, salt, pepper, and almond meal to the blender and blend until completely incorporated.
step-3: boil salted water and cook spaghetti according to packaging instructions.
step-4: when draining the pasta, reserve ⅓ to 1 cup (80 to 235 ml) of water.
step-5: once drained, return the pasta to the pot, and stir in the pesto, adding reserved pasta water until the sauce reaches desired consistency.

step-1: preheat your oven to 400ºf (200ºc).
step-2: drain and rinse the jackfruit, then cut the jackfruit into smaller pieces, removing the core.
step-3: add the olive oil, onions, garlic, salt, and pepper to a large frying pan or skillet over medium-high heat.
step-4: sauté until the onions are tender and become translucent.
step-5: add the jackfruit, chili powder, paprika, cumin, liquid smoke, salt, pepper, and liquid smoke, and stir.
step-6: add the vegetable stock, cover, and cook another 10-15 minutes, until the jackfruit is soft enough that it can be mashed.
step-7: mash the jackfruit with potato masher or a couple of forks, until it looks pulled or shredded.
step-8: spread an even layer of pulled jackfruit across a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-9: bake for 25 minutes.
step-10: remove from oven and pour over the vegan bbq sauce and stir to combine.
step-11: place back in the oven for 10 more minutes.
step-12: build your burger, top with dressings of your choice.

step-1: preheat your oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-2: oil a large knife and cut the jackfruit in half.
step-3: note: if using fresh jackfruit, line your work surface with plastic wrap
step-4: carefully remove the core of the jackfruit by cutting into it at an angle.
step-5: pull each fruit out and remove its seeds and outer coating.
step-6: rinse the fruit thoroughly then dry.
step-7: note: you can save the seeds to roast.
step-8: heat the oil over medium heat in a large pan or dutch oven.
step-9: add the onions and garlic, and cook until translucent.
step-10: add the jackfruit, spices, worcestershire, and liquid smoke.
step-11: stir to coat evenly.
step-12: add the vegetable stock and bring to a simmer.
step-13: reduce heat, cover and simmer for 45 minutes, until the liquid is mostly absorbed and the fruit has broken down.
step-14: spread the jackfruit on a prepared baking sheet.
step-15: bake for 75 minutes, until the liquid has baked out and the jackfruit has a deeper brown color.
step-16: pour the vegan barbecue sauce over the jackfruit.
step-17: mix and return to the oven for 15 minutes.
step-18: serve warm on vegan buns with vegan coleslaw.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: line a 10-inch (25-cm) springform pan with parchment paper and grease the sides with nonstick spray.
step-3: bring a small pot of water to a boil.
step-4: add the cashews and boil for 10 minutes, until fork-tender.
step-5: drain and set aside.
step-6: add the graham crackers to a food processor and pulse until they break down into crumbs.
step-7: pour in the coconut oil and pulse until combined.
step-8: transfer to a medium bowl and clean out the food processor.
step-9: add the cashews, tofu, pumpkin puree, sugar, cornstarch, pumpkin pie spice, vanilla extract, lemon juice, and salt to the food processor.
step-10: puree for 5-8 minutes, or until the mixture is completely smooth and not at all gritty.
step-11: add the graham cracker crumbs to the prepared pan.
step-12: use a flat-bottomed measuring cup to help pack the crust in an even layer.
step-13: using a spatula, spread the filling over the crust in an even layer.
step-14: bake for 20-25 minutes, until the cheesecake is set.
step-15: refrigerate uncovered for at least 4 hours, or overnight.
step-16: unmold the cheesecake, then slice and serve with non-dairy whipped cream.

step-1: line an 8-inch (20 cm) square baking dish with parchment paper.
step-2: add the dates, oats, almonds, and salt to a food processor and pulse until crumbly.
step-3: add the water and pulse again until the mixture is sticky enough to hold together.
step-4: transfer the crust to the prepared baking dish and spread in an even layer.
step-5: freeze while you prepare the rest of the recipe.
step-6: bring a medium pot of water to boil.
step-7: add the cashews and boil for 10 minutes.
step-8: remove with a slotted spoon and transfer to a food processor.
step-9: process until smooth.
step-10: in a medium bowl, spoon out the coconut cream from the top of the can of coconut milk (making sure to take only the cream and not the liquid).
step-11: beat with an electric hand mixer until soft peaks form.
step-12: add the coconut oil, maple syrup, and the vanilla and beat until well combined.
step-13: add the cashew paste and stir with a spatula until well combined, using a whisk if necessary to smooth out any stubborn lumps.
step-14: set aside.
step-15: in a separate, medium bowl, combine the pumpkin puree, remaining 2 tablespoons of maple syrup, cinnamon, allspice, and ginger and mix until well combined.
step-16: remove the crust from the freezer and pour in the cashew mixture.
step-17: smooth evenly.
step-18: add small dollops of the pumpkin mixture on top of the cashew mixture.
step-19: using a wooden skewer, swirl the pumpkin mixture into the cashew mixture.
step-20: freeze for at least 2 hours, or overnight.
step-21: remove from freezer and slice into 9 even bars.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: grease a 12-cup muffin tin or line with paper liners.
step-3: in a large bowl, cream together the brown sugar and coconut oil with an electric hand mixer until smooth.
step-4: add the flour, baking soda, baking powder, pumpkin spice, cinnamon, vanilla, salt, lemon zest, pumpkin puree, and almond milk, and stir with a rubber spatula until well combined.
step-5: use an ice cream scoop to fill each muffin cup about ¾ of the way.
step-6: bake for 20- 25 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center of a cupcake comes out clean.
step-7: make the frosting: in a large bowl, cream the vegan butter with an electric hand mixer until smooth.
step-8: sift in half the powdered sugar and continue to beat.
step-9: sift in the rest of the powdered sugar and beat again.
step-10: fold in the maple syrup and vanilla with a rubber spatula until well combined.
step-11: fold a piece of tape around the one of the bottom corners of a large zip-top bag.
step-12: then cut a ¼ inch slit along one edge of the corner.
step-13: put the zip-top bag in a tall glass and scoop a good amount of frosting into the bag.
step-14: squeeze all of the frosting toward the taped corner of the bag.
step-15: decorate the cupcakes by frosting small loops resembling petals on top.

step-1: add cashews to a small bowl and cover with boiling water and soak for 1 hour.
step-2: heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
step-3: add onion and garlic, and cook until the garlic is fragrant and the onion begins to soften, about 2 minutes.
step-4: add carrots and chiles.
step-5: continue to cook for an additional 3-4 minutes, or until the onions are translucent and the chiles are tender.
step-6: add cumin and chili powders, and stir well to coat the vegetables.
step-7: increase heat to medium-high and add the vegetable stock.
step-8: bring to a simmer before covering and cooking for 15 minutes.
step-9: once the carrots are tender, transfer to a blender.
step-10: add the soaked cashews, nutritional yeast, salt, pepper, and milk alternative to the blender on top of the sautéed vegetables.
step-11: puree until smooth and creamy, adding more milk alternative to adjust the consistency if necessary.
step-12: pour mixture into a shallow bowl or serving dish.
step-13: garnish with additional chiles and freshly chopped cilantro.
step-14: serve with tortilla chips.

step-1: in a large pot or dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
step-2: add the garlic, ginger, and onions and sauté until onions become translucent.
step-3: add vegetable stock, water, shiitake mushrooms, and soy sauce.
step-4: stir and simmer for at least 45 minutes, up to 3 hours.
step-5: the longer you simmer, the more flavorful the broth will become.
step-6: uncover the pot, add the miso paste, and stir.
step-7: ladle the broth into a bowl and add noodles and toppings of your choice.

step-1: place mayo, milk, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, pepper, paprika, apple cider vinegar, and lemon juice in a blender or food processor.
step-2: blend or pulse until smooth and creamy.
step-3: add parsley and dill and pulse together until well-blended.
step-4: transfer to a small bowl or serving container and place in refrigerator until ready to serve.
step-5: garnish with more dill and parsley, if desired.
step-6: serve with veggies.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: grease a 12-cup muffin tin or line with paper liners.
step-3: in a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, combine the almond milk and lemon juice, stir with a fork, and set aside for 5-8 minutes until it appears curdled.
step-4: in a large bowl, cream together the sugar and coconut oil with an electric hand mixer until smooth.
step-5: add the the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, salt, vanilla, apple cider vinegar, red food coloring, applesauce, and almond milk mixture, and stir with a rubber spatula until well combined.
step-6: use an ice cream scoop to fill each muffin cup about ¾ of the way.
step-7: bake for 20- 25 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center of a cupcake comes out clean
step-8: make the frosting: in a large bowl, cream the vegan butter with an electric hand mixer until smooth.
step-9: add the vegan cream cheese.
step-10: sift in half the powdered sugar and beat to combine.
step-11: sift in the rest of the powdered sugar and beat again.
step-12: fold in the vanilla and lemon zest with a rubber spatula until well combined.
step-13: scoop about 2 tablespoons of frosting onto each cupcake and smooth out with a butter knife.
step-14: use a wooden skewer and more red food coloring to decorate to your liking.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: place red bell peppers cut-side down on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-3: bake for 20-30 minutes, or until the skin blackens.
step-4: remove peppers from the oven and transfer with tongs to a sealable container or bowl.
step-5: cover and let cool for 5 minutes.
step-6: once cool enough to handle, peel the blackened skins from the peppers and place into a blender or food processor.
step-7: discard the skins.
step-8: to the blender, add the avocado, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, salt, pepper, red pepper flakes, and nutritional yeast.
step-9: blend until smooth, adding more olive oil or seasoning as desired.
step-10: serve either chilled or heated up.

step-1: peel, chop, and boil the potatoes for 10-15 minutes until soft.
step-2: meanwhile, chop the carrots, celery, and onion, sauté in vegan butter or oil for a few minutes.
step-3: add the mushrooms, and cook until the edges begin to darken.
step-4: add the garlic, and season with salt and pepper.
step-5: add the tomato paste, flour, thyme, and sage.
step-6: slowly add the veggie broth and wine, stirring continuously.
step-7: let simmer for a few minutes to thicken.
step-8: mash the potatoes and add the soy milk and vegan butter.
step-9: add more if needed until smooth.
step-10: season with salt and pepper to taste.
step-11: lay the veggie filling into a baking dish, the spread the mashed potatoes over top.
step-12: at this time you can get creative with designs and patterns for the top.
step-13: the rougher the surface, the crispier it will turn out.
step-14: spray the surface with cooking oil.
step-15: broil for 10-15 minutes, or until the top is crispy.

step-1: preheat oven to 220ºc (425ºf).
step-2: in a medium-large pot, over medium heat, combine oil, garlic, and onions.
step-3: cook for one minute, until onions start to soften.
step-4: add celery and carrots, stir until onions are translucent.
step-5: add mushrooms, corn, parsley, tomato paste, thyme, sage, salt, and pepper until well mixed.
step-6: add veggie stock in half-cup (120 ml) increments, allowing it to come to a simmer before adding more.
step-7: add flour, then mix.
step-8: continue mixing until the mixture thickens.
step-9: once thick, remove from heat and pour into a pie dish.
step-10: add potatoes to a large pot and cover with lightly salted water.
step-11: set over medium-high heat and bring to a boil.
step-12: cook until potatoes have softened and are fork-tender.
step-13: remove from heat and drain.
step-14: mash potatoes then add butter, milk, salt, and pepper.
step-15: spoon potato mixture over the top of the veggies in the pie dish, and smooth so that it is evenly spread.
step-16: optional: using a butter knife or a long, thin spatula.
step-17: press into potato surface every inch (2 ½cm) to create a beautiful, undulating presentation.
step-18: bake pie for 20-25 minutes.
step-19: allow to cool for five minutes then serve.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
step-3: in a large bowl, cream together the sugar and coconut oil with an electric hand mixer until fluffy.
step-4: add the vanilla and salt, and stir with a rubber spatula to combine.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: sift the flour and baking powder into a medium bowl.
step-7: gradually add the flour mixture to the coconut oil mixture and stir to combine.
step-8: gradually add the non-dairy milk and stir until a crumbly dough forms.
step-9: using your hands, knead the dough into a ball.
step-10: on a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to about ¼-inch (½ cm) thick.
step-11: use snowflake cookie cutters to cut out shapes and transfer to the prepared baking sheets about 2 inches (5 cm) apart.
step-12: re-roll excess dough to cut out more shapes.
step-13: bake for 10-12 minutes, until slightly golden around the edges .
step-14: make the royal icing: sift the powdered sugar into a large bowl.
step-15: add the vanilla and some of the water.
step-16: whisk until smooth, adding more water as needed to reach your desired consistency.
step-17: transfer half of the icing to another bowl and add blue gel food coloring to one.
step-18: immediately transfer the icing to piping bags, or cover with plastic wrap.
step-19: do not leave the icing uncovered, as it will develop a film.
step-20: if this happens, add a small amount of water and whisk to incorporate until the icing returns to your desired consistency.
step-21: decorate the cookies with the royal icing and sprinkles.
step-22: let dry completely, at least 3-4 hours or overnight.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: cook pasta according to package instructions.
step-3: toss shiitake mushrooms, oil, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper in a medium bowl.
step-4: arrange mixture on parchment paper-lined baking sheet and bake for 7 minutes.
step-5: flip the mushrooms and continue baking for 7-8 minutes, or until mushrooms are crispy and brown.
step-6: cool mushroom slices on baking sheet.
step-7: for the sauce, combine cashews, olive oil, garlic cloves, nutritional yeast, milk, lemon juice, pepper, salt, and paprika in a blender or food processor.
step-8: blend until smooth and creamy.
step-9: drain water from pasta and return pasta to pot.
step-10: add the sauce and stir until pasta is well-coated.
step-11: mix in mushroom bacon.
step-12: top with parsley.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
step-3: add garlic and saute for 1 minute, stirring frequently.
step-4: reduce heat to medium-low heat and add spinach.
step-5: cook until spinach is wilted.
step-6: add tofu, nutritional yeast, lemon juice, basil, salt, and pepper to a blender or food processor.
step-7: pulse until smooth.
step-8: add artichokes and spinach mixture, and pulse until well-incorporated.
step-9: transfer to greased baking dish and bake for 30 minutes.
step-10: remove from the oven and serve with chips, crackers, or bread slices.

step-1: add the strawberries, coconut milk, lemon juice, and agave nectar to a blender and blend until smooth.
step-2: pour the blended mixture into the ice pop mold.
step-3: freeze until solid, 2-3 hours.
step-4: if desired, dip the frozen pops in yogurt, then roll the coated pops in the granola.
step-5: place the pops on a parchment paper-lined plate and freeze again for 30 minutes.
step-6: the pops will keep in the freezer for up to 6 months in an airtight container.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: heat the oil in a medium pot over medium-high heat.
step-3: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the onion and celery and cook for 5-6 minutes, until the onion is semi-translucent and the celery has softened a bit.
step-4: add the apple and cook for an additional 4-5 minutes, until softened.
step-5: add the salt, pepper, parsley, rosemary, thyme, and sage and cook for 2-3 minutes, until the herbs are fragrant.
step-6: add in about a ¼ of the cubed bread and 1 cup (240 ml) of the vegetable broth.
step-7: stir well until bread cubes cook down.
step-8: continue, alternating between adding bread and broth, until everything has cooked down but the stuffing is still slightly chunky.
step-9: transfer to a large baking dish and cover with foil.
step-10: bake for 10 minutes, then uncover and bake for another 10 minutes, until the top is golden brown.
step-11: serve warm.

step-1: add the cashews to a medium bowl with enough vegetable broth to cover.
step-2: soak for at least 2 hours, or overnight.
step-3: drain and rinse.
step-4: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-5: using a mandolin or a sharp knife, thinly slice the sweet potatoes into rounds.
step-6: add the sweet potatoes to a large bowl and toss with the olive oil, garlic, thyme leaves, pepper, and salt.
step-7: add the drained cashews to a blender or food processor, along with the garlic, coconut milk, nutritional yeast, lemon juice, vegetable broth, nutmeg, cayenne, and salt.
step-8: blend until smooth and creamy.
step-9: grease a large cast-iron skillet or other ovenproof dish with oil.
step-10: pour ⅓ of the cashew sauce into the skillet and tilt to evenly coat the bottom.
step-11: layer half of the sweet potato rounds over the sauce, overlapping slightly to completely cover the bottom of the pan.
step-12: repeat with another ⅓ of the sauce, the rest of the potatoes, and the rest of the sauce.
step-13: bake for 1 hour, or until golden brown on top and the sweet potatoes are tender.
step-14: let cool for 15 minutes before slicing and serving.

step-1: make the ladyfingers: in a medium bowl, sift together the flour, cornstarch, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: in a separate medium bowl, cream together the butter and sugar with an electric hand mixer until fully combined.
step-4: add the aquafaba and vanilla and beat for 2-3 minutes, until light and fluffy.
step-5: the mixture may look broken, but will come together once the dry ingredients are added.
step-6: add ½ of the flour mixture to the wet ingredients and beat until just combined.
step-7: scrape down the sides of the bowl and add the almond milk.
step-8: beat until combined.
step-9: add the rest of the dry ingredients and beat until smooth.
step-10: line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper and grease with nonstick spray.
step-11: transfer the batter to a piping bag fitted with a ½-inch round tip or a zip-top bag with a corner snipped off.
step-12: pipe the ladyfingers onto the prepared baking sheets, spacing at least 1½ inches apart.
step-13: each cookie should be 2¼ inches long and ¾ inch wide.
step-14: you should have 50-55 total.
step-15: chill the piped cookies in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
step-16: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-17: bake the ladyfingers for 13-15 minutes, until the edges are light brown.
step-18: let cool completely.
step-19: make the vegan mascarpone: add the cashews to a medium heatproof bowl and pour in enough boiling water to cover by 1 inch (2.5 cm).
step-20: let soak until slightly plumped and softened, about 10 minutes.
step-21: drain.
step-22: add the cashews, almond milk, maple syrup, coconut oil, salt, vanilla, and lemon juice to a blender.
step-23: blend until smooth.
step-24: set aside.
step-25: scoop the solid layer from the cans of chilled coconut milk into a large bowl.
step-26: discard the liquid or save for another use.
step-27: add the powdered sugar and beat with an electric hand mixer until light and fluffy, 2-3 minutes.
step-28: using a rubber spatula, fold the blended cashew mixture into the whipped coconut milk.
step-29: make the soaking liquid: in a shallow bowl, combine the espresso, water, and rum.
step-30: alternatively, replace the espresso and water with 1½ cups (360 ml) of brewed coffee cooled to room temperature.
step-31: assemble the tiramisu: spread about a ½ cup (65 grams) of the mascarpone in the bottom of an 8-inch square baking dish.
step-32: quickly dip a ladyfinger in the espresso mixture and place on top of the cream.
step-33: repeat with more ladyfingers to cover the cream, 16-18 total.
step-34: carefully spread about 1 cup (130 grams) of the mascarpone over the ladyfingers, then add another layer of ladyfingers, another layer of cream, and a final layer of the remaining ladyfingers.
step-35: spread the remaining mascarpone cream on top.
step-36: cover the baking dish with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or overnight.
step-37: before serving, uncover the tiramisu and lightly dust the top with cocoa powder.

step-1: make the bao buns: add the warm water, sugar, and yeast to a liquid measuring cup.
step-2: whisk to combine, then set aside to bloom, five minutes.
step-3: in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
step-4: make a well in the center.
step-5: add the yeast mixture and vegetable oil to the well and stir with a wooden spoon until a soft dough begins to form.
step-6: transfer the dough to a clean surface and knead until smooth and elastic, about 3 minutes.
step-7: keep extra flour nearby in case the dough sticks to the surface or your hands.
step-8: shape into a ball.
step-9: lightly grease a clean large bowl with 1 tablespoon of sesame oil.
step-10: place the dough in the bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size, about 2 hours.
step-11: meanwhile marinate the tofu: in a medium bowl, whisk together the scallions, ginger, garlic, sugar, five-spice, soy sauce, rice wine, and dark soy sauce.
step-12: add the tofu to a separate medium bowl and pour the marinade over.
step-13: cover with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for 1 hour.
step-14: make the pickled vegetables: prepare the cucumber, red pepper, daikon, carrot, yellow pepper, and jalapeños and set aside while you make the brine.
step-15: in a large pot or deep pan over high heat, combine the water, sugar, rice vinegar, and salt.
step-16: stir until the sugar dissolves, then bring the mixture to a boil.
step-17: add the vegetables the brine.
step-18: stir to submerge, then remove the pot from the heat.
step-19: let sit while you sear the tofu and bake the buns, about 1 hour, then drain.
step-20: once the bao dough has risen, turn it out onto a floured surface.
step-21: divide the dough in half, then cut each half into 2 ounce pieces.
step-22: roll each piece into a ball.
step-23: working 1 at a time, flatten a ball with your palm on a lightly floured surface.
step-24: use a small rolling pin or wooden dowel to roll the dough out to a 5-inch round.
step-25: brush the top with sesame oil, fold it in half, and transfer it to a square of parchment paper set on a baking sheet.
step-26: repeat with the remaining dough.
step-27: cover the bao buns with a kitchen towel and let rest for 10 minutes.
step-28: bring a pot of water to a boil and set a bamboo steamer on top.
step-29: working in batches, transfer a few of the folded dough rounds at a time to the steamer, making sure the buns are not too crowded.
step-30: cover the steamer and steam the buns for 8-10 minutes, until the buns puff up and form a skin on the outside.
step-31: very carefully, lift the lid and remove the buns from the steamer.
step-32: repeat with the rest of the buns, keeping the steamed buns warm as they finish by covering with a towel.
step-33: sear the tofu: remove the tofu from the marinade and pat dry with paper towels.
step-34: reserve the marinade.
step-35: heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over high heat.
step-36: add the tofu and sear on one side until deep brown in color, about 5 minutes.
step-37: flip and cook on the other side until deep brown, 5 minutes more.
step-38: remove the tofu from the pan.
step-39: pour the reserved marinade into the skillet on medium heat and reduce until thick and syrupy, about 5 minutes.
step-40: return the tofu to the pan and stir to coat with the glaze.
step-41: remove the pan from the heat.
step-42: to serve, slather the inside of the bao buns with hoisin sauce, then add the pickled vegetables, glazed tofu, sliced scallions, and sesame seeds.

step-1: in a blender or food processor, combine coconut yogurt, lemon juice, vinegar, salt, and pepper.
step-2: when creamy, add chopped garlic and oil.
step-3: blend again.
step-4: seed and grate cucumber and wrap in towel.
step-5: squeeze excess water out of cucumber.
step-6: add cucumber to coconut yogurt dip, and stir to blend.
step-7: cover and chill 2-3 hours.
step-8: garnish with dill.
step-9: serve with chips, crackers, or veggies.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: grease 10 cups of a muffin tin or line with paper liners.
step-3: in a large bowl, cream together the granulated sugar and coconut oil with an electric hand mixer until smooth.
step-4: add the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, vanilla, apple cider vinegar, applesauce, and almond milk, and stir with a rubber spatula until well combined.
step-5: use an ice cream scoop to fill the muffin cups about ¾ of the way.
step-6: bake for 20- 25 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center of a cupcake comes out clean
step-7: make the frosting: in a large bowl, cream the vegan butter with an electric hand mixer until smooth.
step-8: sift in half the powdered sugar and beat to combine.
step-9: sift in the rest of the powdered sugar and the vanilla and beat until smooth.
step-10: fold in the sprinkles with a rubber spatula.
step-11: place a large zip-top bag in a tall glass.
step-12: scoop a good amount of frosting into the bag.
step-13: squeeze all of the frosting into a corner of the bag, then snip off that corner.
step-14: pipe the frosting onto the cupcakes in a spiral pattern

step-1: make the sweet chili sauce: in a small pot over medium heat, mix together ½ cup (120 ml) of water, the garlic, fresno chilies, sugar, rice vinegar, and salt.
step-2: bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 2 minutes.
step-3: in a small bowl, whisk together the cornstarch and remaining tablespoon of water.
step-4: whisk the cornstarch slurry into the sauce until fully incorporated.
step-5: continue to simmer for 1 minute, or until the mixture has thickened.
