step-6: remove from the heat and let cool.
step-7: make the lumpia: julienne the carrots.
step-8: cut the green beans on the diagonal.
step-9: in a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
step-10: add the onion and cook for 3 minutes or until slightly tender.
step-11: add the garlic and ginger, and continue cooking for 2 minutes more, until fragrant.
step-12: add the carrots and green beans, and toss to combine.
step-13: add the shrimp, fish sauce, salt, pepper, and rice vinegar, and cook for 2 minutes or until shrimp is pink.
step-14: add the bean sprouts, toss to incorporate, and remove the pan from the heat.
step-15: lay out a lumpia wrapper in a diamond shape and spoon 2 tablespoons of filling onto the bottom of the wrapper, leaving about 1½ inches (4 cm) of space from the bottom point.
step-16: fold the bottom point over the filling, then fold in the edges to create an envelope shape.
step-17: roll the wrapper toward the top point.
step-18: brush the top point with egg wash and finish the roll to seal the end.
step-19: repeat with the remaining wrappers and filling.
step-20: in a large, deep skillet, heat 1 inch (2.5 cm) of canola oil to 300°f (150°c).
step-21: carefully add 4-5 lumpia at a time to the hot oil.
step-22: fry on each side for 1-2 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-23: note: if the lumpia are cooking too quickly or burning, reduce the heat.
step-24: remove the lumpia from the oil and drain on a wire rack or paper towels.
step-25: garnish with cilantro and serve with the sweet chili sauce.

step-1: in a small mixing bowl, combine flour, baking powder, and salt with a spatula.
step-2: form a well in the middle of the dry mixture and add 2 tablespoons olive oil and warm water.
step-3: mix until dough forms in to a sticky ball.
step-4: cover with a dish towel and set aside.
step-5: in large pot or dutch oven, add the olive oil over medium heat.
step-6: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the onion and carrot and cook for about 4-5 minutes, or until the onions are semi-translucent.
step-7: add in the garlic, dill, sage, thyme, and pepper, and cook for 2-3 more minutes until herbs are fragrant.
step-8: stir in potatoes, vegetable broth, and bay leaves, and bring to a boil.
step-9: reduce heat to medium-high and simmer about 8 minutes or until potatoes are about 75 percent cooked through.
step-10: carefully drop in dollops of the dumpling dough, about 1 inch (2-cm) in diameter.
step-11: let dumplings simmer for about 10 minutes, or until chewy and cooked through.
step-12: to serve, garnish with lots of fresh parsley.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: make the béchamel sauce: melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat.
step-3: add the garlic and sauté for 3 minutes, or until fragrant.
step-4: add the flour and whisk into the butter.
step-5: cook for 3 minutes, or until lightly browned.
step-6: while whisking, pour in the milk and heavy cream.
step-7: season with the salt and pepper.
step-8: reduce the heat to low and simmer, whisking frequently, until the sauce coats the back of a spoon, about 10 minutes.
step-9: remove from the heat and set aside.
step-10: remove the leaves and stem from the head of the cauliflower and chop into roughly ½-inch (1-cm) florets.
step-11: set aside.
step-12: trim the brussels sprouts, then thinly slice.
step-13: add the sprouts to a 9x13-inch (23x33 cm) baking dish and push to one side, filling about a third of the dish.
step-14: add the corn to the center third of the baking dish.
step-15: add the cauliflower florets to the remaining third of the baking dish.
step-16: pour the béchamel sauce evenly over the vegetables.
step-17: top the brussels sprouts with the gruyère cheese and bacon bits.
step-18: top the corn with the cheddar cheese.
step-19: top the cauliflower with the parmesan cheese.
step-20: sprinkle the bread crumbs evenly over the vegetables.
step-21: cover the dish with foil and bake for 30 minutes, then uncover and bake for 30 minutes more, until the vegetables are tender and the top is golden brown.
step-22: serve warm.

step-1: place an oven rack in the center of the oven.
step-2: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-3: in a medium bowl, toss together the vegetable peels, olive oil, and salt.
step-4: spread the peels in an even layer on a baking sheet.
step-5: roast for 20-25 minutes, tossing halfway through, until the peels are dried and crisp, but not burnt.
step-6: in a small bowl, mix together the garlic powder, paprika, and dried parsley.
step-7: toss the peel chips with the spice mixture.
step-8: season with salt to taste.
step-9: the veggie peel chips will keep for up to 3 days stored in a cool, dry place.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with a reusable baking mat or parchment paper.
step-3: arrange poblanos on the prepared baking sheet and roast for 20 minutes, turning occasionally, until the skins begin to turn brown and pull away from the flesh.
step-4: meanwhile, make the filling: heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
step-5: add the red onion, season with salt, and sauté for 3 minutes, until beginning to soften.
step-6: add the garlic and sauté for 1 minute, until fragrant.
step-7: add the cumin, coriander, and cayenne and stir to coat the vegetables with the spices.
step-8: add the quinoa, beans, corn, tomato sauce, and lime juice and season with salt.
step-9: stir to combine, then cook until heated through, about 5 minutes.
step-10: remove the pan from the heat and stir in the chopped cilantro.
step-11: transfer the roasted poblanos to a bowl and cover with a plate or plastic wrap.
step-12: steam for 15 minutes.
step-13: reduce the oven temperature to 375°f (190°c).
step-14: peel the skins off the poblanos.
step-15: leaving the stem intact, cut a slit lengthwise down each pepper to form a pouch.
step-16: with a small spoon, carefully remove the seeds.
step-17: the poblano flesh will be delicate—it’s fine if it tears a bit.
step-18: lay the peeled poblanos side by side in a greased 9-x13-inch (22 cm x 33 cm) baking dish.
step-19: stuff each pepper with about ½ cup of the filling.
step-20: top each pepper with 2 tablespoons of monterey jack cheese.
step-21: bake the stuffed peppers for 15-20 minutes, until the filling is completely warmed through and the cheese is melted and beginning to brown.
step-22: serve the peppers garnished with cilantro leaves and serve with avocado slices and lime wedges.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-2: in a large saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
step-3: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the onion and cook for 4-5 minutes, until semi-translucent.
step-4: add the garlic and cook for another 2-3 minutes, until fragrant.
step-5: add the paprika, chili powder, mustard powder, salt, and pepper and cook for 2 more minutes, until the spices are fragrant.
step-6: add the tomato paste, maple syrup, molasses, soy sauce, apple cider vinegar, and liquid smoke and stir for 1-2 minutes, until well-combined.
step-7: then, add the vegetable broth and stir until smooth, about 1 minute.
step-8: add the beans and stir for 1-2 minutes, until evenly coated.
step-9: cover and bake for 40 minutes, until the beans are bubbling.
step-10: uncover and bake for another 10 minutes, or until desired consistency is reached.
step-11: stir well and serve.

step-1: toss the sweet potatoes with the olive oil, salt, and pepper in a medium microwave-safe bowl, and microwave until tender, about 2 minutes.
step-2: heat the tortillas in a dry skillet over low heat and fill with cooked sweet potatoes, black the beans, pico de gallo, and avocado.
step-3: garnish with cilantro.

step-1: heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
step-2: add the onion and garlic and cook for about 4 minutes, until fragrant and the onion is translucent.
step-3: add the apples, mushrooms, fennel seeds, rosemary, sage, maple syrup, salt, and pepper and stir to combine.
step-4: reduce the heat to medium-low and cook for about 10 minutes, until the mixture is tender and the liquid released from the mushrooms has evaporated.
step-5: remove from the heat and let cool.
step-6: add the cannellini beans and chickpeas to a food processor and pulse into a smooth paste.
step-7: transfer the bean paste to a large bowl and add the apple/mushroom mixture and vital wheat gluten.
step-8: mix with a spatula and then your hands until well combined.
step-9: form the sausage mixture into a loaf, wrap in plastic wrap, and refrigerate for 2 hours.
step-10: unwrap the chilled sausage mixture and divide into 10-12 equal pieces, depending on what size sausages you would like
step-11: roll a piece between your palms into a sausage shape.
step-12: place in the center of a large sheet of plastic wrap and roll the plastic over it so the sausage is completely encased.
step-13: twist the ends of the wrap and knot them together tightly.
step-14: repeat for each sausage.
step-15: bring a large pot of water to a simmer.
step-16: plunge the wrapped sausages in the water and simmer for 45-50 minutes, until the sausages are firm
step-17: remove from the water and let cool for about 5 minutes, then unwrap.
step-18: heat the remaining tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-low heat.
step-19: fry the sausages for 1-2 minutes on each side, until golden brown.
step-20: serve immediately or keep wrapped in the refrigerator for up to 4 days.

step-1: preheat oven to 425˚f (220˚c)
step-2: on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, season veggies and chickpeas for the roasted chickpea & veggie brown rice bowl with olive oil, salt, pepper, and paprika.
step-3: on a separate parchment paper-lined baking sheet, add veggies for the roasted veggie quinoa bowl and season with olive oil, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and onion powder.
step-4: bake both pans in the oven for 15 -20 minutes, or until roasted to your liking.
step-5: separate cooked brown rice evenly between two tupperware bowls, and the cooked quinoa between two other tupperware bowls.
step-6: fill the brown rice bowls with the roasted chickpea and veggies.
step-7: then fill the quinoa bowls with the other pan of roasted veggies and sugar snap peas.
step-8: mix the cilantro lime dressing ingredients and split the dressing between two small dressing containers.
step-9: add to the roasted veggie and chickpea bowls.
step-10: mix the soy maple dressing ingredients and split between two small dressing containers.
step-11: add to the roasted veggies and sugar snap pea bowls.
step-12: store in refrigerator for up to 4 days.
step-13: to serve, remove dressing and microwave.
step-14: pour dressing on top of your grain bowl and mix everything together.

step-1: in a large pot, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat.
step-2: once the oil begins to shimmer, add ½ cup (75g) diced onion and cook for 3-4 minutes, until semi-translucent.
step-3: add the mushrooms and cook for 5 minutes, until most of the juices have evaporated.
step-4: add 2 cloves of minced garlic, the soy sauce, 1 teaspoon thyme, 1 teaspoon paprika, ½ teaspoon oregano, ¼ teaspoon cayenne, 2 teaspoons vegan worcestershire sauce, ½ teaspoon liquid smoke, ½ teaspoon salt, and ¼ teaspoon pepper and cook for another 4-5 minutes, until all of the liquid has evaporated and the spices are fragrant.
step-5: add the cannellini beans to a medium bowl and mash until mostly smooth (a few lumps are okay).
step-6: then, add the mushroom mixture, bread crumbs, vital wheat gluten, and 2 tablespoons vegetable broth and mix well until combined.
step-7: use your hands to knead the mixture until cohesive, then begin to roll about a tablespoon at a time of the mixture into “meatballs”.
step-8: in the same large pot, heat 3 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat.
step-9: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the meatballs and cook for about 5 minutes on each side, until golden brown.
step-10: remove the meatballs from the pot and set aside.
step-11: add the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil to the pot, along with the flour.
step-12: stir the roux continuously with a wooden spoon for about 3-4 minutes, until the consistency resembles wet sand.
step-13: add the remaining ½ cup (75g) diced onion, the celery, and the okra to the pot and cook for 4-5 minutes, until the onion is semi-translucent.
step-14: add the remaining 4 cloves of minced garlic and the green bell pepper and cook for another 3-4 minutes, until the garlic is fragrant.
step-15: add the remaining teaspoon of vegan worcestershire sauce, ½ teaspoon liquid smoke, 1 teaspoon thyme, ½ teaspoon oregano, 1 teaspoon paprika, ¼ teaspoon cayenne, and ½ teaspoon pepper and cook for 4 more minutes, until the spices are fragrant.
step-16: add the crushed tomatoes and stir until combined.
step-17: then, add the red beans and add the remaining 3½ cups (840ml) vegetable broth and stir until well combined.
step-18: simmer on low heat for 30 minutes, stirring from time to time, until the gumbo has thickened.
step-19: season with salt to taste.
step-20: then, add the meatballs and stir to incorporate.
step-21: serve over rice and garnish with parsley.

step-1: cut the hearts of palm into oblique chunks and add them to a large bowl.
step-2: mince the celery and add to the bowl with the hearts of palm.
step-3: add the dill, chives, old bay seasoning, salt, pepper, lemon juice, and mayonnaise and stir to combine.
step-4: brush the insides of the potato buns with the melted butter.
step-5: toast in a medium skillet over low heat for 2-3 minutes, until golden.
step-6: fill the buns with the hearts of palm mixture.
step-7: garnish with chives.

step-1: in a food processor, pulse the mushrooms and onions until broken into uniformly fine pieces, about 10 pulses, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed.
step-2: heat the oil in a large skillet set over medium-high heat.
step-3: pour the mushrooms and onions into the skillet and season with salt and pepper.
step-4: sauté until the veggies have released moisture and softened, about 8 minutes.
step-5: add the garlic and oregano.
step-6: sauté until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
step-7: push the veggies to the sides of the pan and add the tomato paste, slowly mixing in the veggies from the side until a uniform paste has formed.
step-8: add the crushed tomatoes and stir until well combined and thick.
step-9: add the vegetable stock and stir until the sauce has thickened slightly.
step-10: reduce the heat to medium-low if it is bubbling and popping too much.
step-11: while the sauce simmers, place the chickpeas in the food processor and pulse until broken into fine pieces, about 10 pulses.
step-12: pour the chickpeas into a fine mesh strainer and submerge in a medium bowl filled with water.
step-13: shake the strainer for 1 minute to remove starches from the chickpeas.
step-14: you’ll know when to remove the strainer when the water has become very cloudy from the starches.
step-15: transfer the chickpeas to the sauce and stir for at least 1 minute to give the chickpeas time to cook.
step-16: use the sauce as desired for pasta, veggie noodles, calzones, etc..

step-1: in a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, vegetarian oyster sauce, brown sugar, and chile powder.
step-2: add the tofu to a medium bowl and drizzle with 1 tablespoon of the sauce.
step-3: gently toss to coat.
step-4: reserve the rest of the sauce.
step-5: using your hands, break up the sheets of noodles into individual noodles.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a large nonstick wok or skillet over high heat, swirling the pan to coat.
step-8: working in batches, add the tofu to the pan in a single layer and cook for 1-2 minutes on each side, until browned.
step-9: flip and brown on the other side, 1-2 minutes more.
step-10: remove from the pan and set aside.
step-11: add the remaining tablespoon of canola oil to the pan.
step-12: add the shallot to the pan and cook until tender and lightly browned, about 2 minutes.
step-13: add the garlic and water and cook for 30 seconds, until fragrant.
step-14: add the chinese broccoli and cook, tossing occasionally, until crispy and tender, 2-3 minutes.
step-15: add the reserved rice noodles, tofu, and sauce and toss to combine.
step-16: cook until the noodles are warmed through and coated in the sauce, 1-2 minutes.
step-17: push the noodles to one side of the pan and pour the eggs into the empty space.
step-18: cook for 30 seconds, stirring constantly, until the eggs are scrambled.
step-19: toss to incorporate the eggs into the rest of the dish.
step-20: divide between 4 serving plates.

step-1: heat oil in a deep pan or wok over medium heat and cook onions, ginger, and garlic until onions are translucent.
step-2: add mushrooms and bell peppers to the pan.
step-3: cook until mushrooms are soft.
step-4: add cabbage, carrots, salt, and pepper.
step-5: cook for another 3-4 minutes and remove from heat.
step-6: set aside to cool completely.
step-7: once mixture is cool, add cilantro, green onions, soy sauce, sesame oil, cooking sherry, and sugar.
step-8: mix well.
step-9: place a spoonful of the mixture onto a wonton wrapper.
step-10: dip your finger in water and run it around the edge of the dough.
step-11: fold in half and pinch together, pleating the dough as you go.
step-12: heat more oil in a large skillet and place dumplings in the oil.
step-13: cook for 3-4 minutes or until a crust has started to form on the bottom.
step-14: pour the water in the pan and cover with a lid.
step-15: steam for 6-8 minutes, remove the lid and remove from the pan.

step-1: slice bread into cubes.
step-2: in a bowl, add egg, milk, cheese, salt, and pepper, and mix.
step-3: in a microwave-safe mug, place half of the cubed bread and desired amount of spinach and red pepper.
step-4: place the rest of the bread and fixins and pour the egg mixture into the mug.
step-5: microwave for 1½ minutes or until egg is fully cooked.
step-6: sprinkle with some tomatoes, if desired.

step-1: layer half of the sweet potatoes on the bottom of a greased slow cooker.
step-2: layer half of the mushrooms, red bell peppers, broccoli florets, tomatoes, onions, and spinach.
step-3: repeat the layers with the remaining sweet potatoes, mushrooms, red bell peppers broccoli florets, tomatoes, onions, and spinach.
step-4: in a large bowl or measuring cup, whisk together the eggs, egg whites, milk, salt, and pepper.
step-5: pour the egg mixture over the vegetables.
step-6: top with cheddar cheese.
step-7: cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours.
step-8: carefully remove lid and serve hot.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, add half of the black beans and mash well (a few chunks are fine).
step-3: add the mushrooms, broccoli, remaining black beans, red onion, garlic, dill, paprika, red pepper flakes, rosemary, salt, pepper, and liquid smoke.
step-4: mix thoroughly, then mash until the mixture is well-combined.
step-5: add the bread crumbs and eggs and mix until thoroughly combined.
step-6: grease a 13x18-inch (33x45 cm) baking sheet with olive oil.
step-7: transfer the veggie burger mixture to the pan.
step-8: using a spatula and your hands, form the mixture into a rectangle that is roughly the size of the slider buns.
step-9: bake for 40 minutes, or until firm and browned, flipping halfway through.
step-10: make the avocado dressing: add the avocado, jalapeño, greek yogurt, garlic, lime juice, olive oil, salt, pepper, and water to a blender, and blend until smooth.
step-11: keeping the slider buns attached, cut in half lengthwise with a serrated knife.
step-12: remove the top half and set aside.
step-13: when veggie burger is done baking, remove from oven and place on top of bottom half of slider buns.
step-14: spread the avocado dressing over the veggie burger, then top with the tomatoes and lettuce.
step-15: cover with the top slider buns, and cut into 12 sliders.

step-1: remove all leaves and cut the cauliflower into small florets.
step-2: place the florets in a food processor and blend until they are a rice-like texture.
step-3: be careful not to over process or it may turn mushy.
step-4: set aside, and drain excess moisture with a towel, if desired.
step-5: in a large saucepan over medium-high heat, cook onions, bell peppers, mushrooms, salt, and pepper until vegetables are tender but not soft.
step-6: add the cauliflower rice.
step-7: cook for about 3-4 minutes until the vegetables are incorporated evenly into the cauliflower.
step-8: spread the rice towards the edge of the pan, creating a well in the center.
step-9: pour the beaten eggs into the well, stirring only the eggs until they are cooked.
step-10: fold the eggs into the rice.

step-1: in a large dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat until shimmering.
step-2: add the onion, carrot, and bell pepper and stir.
step-3: cook for about 8 minutes, until the vegetables are tender.
step-4: add the oregano, cumin, chili powder, smoked paprika, cinnamon, garlic, salt, and pepper.
step-5: stir and cook for about 2 minutes, until fragrant.
step-6: add the tomatoes, black beans, kidney beans, pinto beans, and corn and stir to combine.
step-7: add the lime juice and vegetable broth and stir.
step-8: increase the heat to high and bring the chili to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer uncovered for about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
step-9: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-10: in the meantime, prepare the cornbread batter: in a medium bowl, whisk the egg and milk until well-combined.
step-11: in a large bowl, combine the cornmeal, flour, brown sugar, salt, baking powder, and baking soda.
step-12: pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and whisk until smooth.
step-13: add the melted butter and stir to combine.
step-14: add the jalapeño and stir to incorporate.
step-15: remove the chili from the heat.
step-16: pour the cornbread batter over the chili and use a spatula to smooth the top and make sure it covers the chili completely.
step-17: bake for 25-30 minutes, until the cornbread is fully cooked and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
step-18: let cool for about 10 minutes.
step-19: garnish the cornbread with sliced jalapeño and chopped cilantro.

step-1: in a wok or deep skillet, heat up the oil over high heat and cook carrots, onions, and garlic until onions are translucent.
step-2: add bell peppers and broccoli and cook an additional 3-4 minutes.
step-3: push all of the cooked vegetables to the side of the pan.
step-4: beat the eggs and pour into the cleared half of the pan.
step-5: scramble the eggs and mix with the rest of the vegetables.
step-6: add peas, corn, rice, soy sauce, sesame oil, and pepper.
step-7: mix well and let the rice cook until slightly crispy.

step-1: heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat.
step-2: add the garlic and 3 spring onions and cook for 2-3 minutes.
step-3: add the carrots and peas, before stirring in the brown sugar and soy sauce.
step-4: add the noodles and mix together for another couple of minutes.
step-5: season with salt and pepper, then slice remaining spring onion and top to serve.

step-1: in a food processor, combine 8 ounces (225 g) of hummus with the avocado.
step-2: puree until smooth.
step-3: transfer to a small bowl.
step-4: clean the food processor.
step-5: add 8 ounces (225 g) of hummus and the red peppers.
step-6: puree until smooth.
step-7: transfer to another small bowl.
step-8: clean the food processor.
step-9: add the remaining hummus and the beets.
step-10: puree until smooth.
step-11: transfer to another small bowl.
step-12: serve with pita chips.

step-1: in a food processor, blend carrots, cauliflower, broccoli, garlic, egg, onion powder, salt, and pepper until combined.
step-2: add 1¼ cup (145 grams) of bread crumbs and blend just until incorporated.
step-3: scoop a tablespoon of the mixture and form a small circular-shaped “nugget.”
step-4: place the remaining ½ cup (60 grams) of bread crumbs in a bowl and cover each nugget with the bread crumbs.
step-5: pan fry with a small drizzle of oil over medium-high heat until both sides are golden brown, about 10 minutes.
step-6: or, you can bake them on a piece of parchment paper at 400˚f (200˚c) for 25 minutes, flipping after the first 15 minutes.
step-7: serve with your favorite dipping sauce.

step-1: preheat the oven to 325°f (170°c).
step-2: make the dressing: use a knife to slice off the top third of the head of garlic, just enough so that all of the cloves are exposed but the head remains intact.
step-3: fill a small ovenproof saucepan with the olive oil and place the garlic bulb, cut side down, in the oil.
step-4: cover the pan with a lid and transfer to the oven.
step-5: bake for 40 minutes, until the garlic has softened and is easily pierced with a paring knife.
step-6: let cool.
step-7: once the garlic and oil have cooled enough to handle, squeeze the cloves out of the garlic skin into a blender.
step-8: add the salt, pepper, water, lemon juice, and mustard to the blender.
step-9: puree until smooth.
step-10: with the blender still running, slowly add the oil from the saucepan in a steady stream.
step-11: the dressing should be a creamy and slightly thick.
step-12: set aside.
step-13: in a medium bowl, season the chicken with turmeric, onion powder, cumin, salt, and pepper.
step-14: toss until evenly coated.
step-15: heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
step-16: add the chicken to the pan and sauté until firm and cooked through, about 4 minutes.
step-17: remove the pan from the heat.
step-18: to build the buddha bowls, divide the rice between 2 serving bowls.
step-19: top with shredded cabbage, sliced avocado, turmeric chicken, shredded carrots, halved cherry tomatoes, and green onions and drizzle with roasted garlic dressing.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: in a medium saucepan over medium heat, add the tomato sauce, vegetable broth, salt, pepper, chile powder, cumin and garlic powder.
step-3: stir occasionally, until the sauce begins to boil.
step-4: remove from the heat.
step-5: using a box grater, grate the zucchini.
step-6: in a large skillet over medium heat, add grated zucchini, red onion, salt and pepper.
step-7: cook until onions are translucent.
step-8: add chicken and ¼ of the tomato sauce mixture.
step-9: combine well and remove from heat.
step-10: fill the tortillas with the zucchini mixture and add cheese.
step-11: fold the tortillas over and place seam-side down into a greased baking dish.
step-12: repeat with remaining tortillas.
step-13: pour the remaining tomato sauce over the tortillas and sprinkle with cheese.
step-14: bake for 20 minutes, or until heated through and cheese is melted.
step-15: top with cilantro (optional).

step-1: preheat the oven to 350°f ( 180°c).
step-2: bring a large pot of water to boil over high heat and add the potatoes.
step-3: cook in gently boiling water for 10-15 minutes, until they are tender and can easily be pierced with a fork.
step-4: drain the potatoes in a colander.
step-5: divide the potatoes into two medium bowls and mash half of them.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat until the oil is shimmering.
step-8: add the onion and garlic, and sauté until the onion is translucent, about 2 minutes.
step-9: add the celery, corn, broccoli, carrot, mushrooms, chickpeas, parsley, dried thyme, and dried rosemary.
step-10: add salt and pepper to taste, and stir.
step-11: add the fresh rosemary and thyme sprigs.
step-12: stir and cook over medium heat for about 15 minutes, until the vegetables are tender but still slightly firm.
step-13: remove the rosemary and thyme sprigs.
step-14: sprinkle the flour over the vegetables and mix well.
step-15: pour in half of the vegetable stock and stir.
step-16: add the nutritional yeast and stir well.
step-17: pour in half of the remaining vegetable stock and cook for about 2 minutes while continuing to stir.
step-18: incorporate the mashed potatoes and enough of the remaining stock to reach your desired consistency.
step-19: add the diced potatoes and stir.
step-20: pour the vegetable mixture into a 9-inch (23-cm) baking dish.
step-21: mix 2 tablespoons olive oil and 2 tablespoons soy milk in a small mixing bowl.
step-22: brush the outside edges of the baking dish with the mix using a brush or your fingers.
step-23: place the pie crust dough over the top of the baking dish, pressing the edges to make it stick.
step-24: brush the top of the dough lightly with the oil-soy milk wash.
step-25: make a small x-shaped incision on the top of the crust.
step-26: bake for about 45 minutes or until the pie crust is golden.

step-1: in a wok or deep skillet over medium-high heat, heat 2 tablespoons of cooking oil, then add the par-cooked noodles.
step-2: cook for 1-2 minutes, allowing the noodles to crisp, then flip and cook for another 1-2 minutes.
step-3: transfer to a plate and set aside.
step-4: in the same wok, heat the remaining tablespoon of cooking oil over medium-high heat and add the onion, bell pepper, broccoli, and carrot.
step-5: stir and cook for 2 minutes, then add the garlic and season with salt and pepper.
step-6: stir and continue to cook for 2 minutes, or until the onions are translucent.
step-7: add the cabbage, shiitake mushrooms, snow peas, and corn.
step-8: in a small bowl, combine the water and cornstarch.
step-9: mix with a fork to dissolve the cornstarch, then add the soy sauce, hoisin sauce, rice wine, sugar, and white pepper.
step-10: mix well.
step-11: pour the sauce over the vegetables.
step-12: mix well and cook for 3-5 minutes, or until the vegetables have softened.
step-13: add the crispy noodles to the wok, mix well and add bean sprouts.
step-14: toss gently and cook for another 2-3 minutes, or until everything is well-combined.
step-15: garnish with sliced scallions.

step-1: to make the flax eggs, combine the flax meal and water in a small bowl and mix well.
step-2: set aside for at least 10 minutes.
step-3: preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c).
step-4: in a large saucepan, heat a bit of olive oil over medium heat.
step-5: once the oil begins to shimmer, add the carrot and celery and cook until lightly browned, 2-3 minutes.
step-6: add the onion and mushrooms.
step-7: cook another 3-4 minutes, until the onions are semi-translucent.
step-8: add another drizzle of olive oil to the pan, then add the garlic, bell pepper, and tomato paste.
step-9: cook for 2 more minutes, until the tomato paste is slightly browned.
step-10: add the salt, pepper, parsley, and thyme, and cook for 1 more minute, until fragrant.
step-11: add the soy sauce and worcestershire sauce and cook for 2 more minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
step-12: remove the pan from the heat.
step-13: in a food processor, add the lentils, brown rice, oats, flax eggs, and sautéed vegetables.
step-14: pulse 10-12 times until the mixture is slightly chunky.
step-15: transfer the mixture to a parchment paper-lined loaf pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
step-16: to make the glaze, combine the ketchup and maple syrup in a small bowl.
step-17: brush half of glaze on top of loaf, reserving the other half for later.
step-18: bake the loaf for 45-50 minutes, or until an fork inserted in the middle comes out clean.
step-19: brush with the remaining glaze, then slice and serve.

step-1: on a cutting board, place the loaf of bread on its side and slice off the top portion.
step-2: using a small knife, cut around the inside of the bread, being careful not to cut through the sides, and scoop out the center of the roll.
step-3: save this for dipping later on or use for bread crumbs.
step-4: in a large soup pot, combine the olive oil, onions, carrots, and celery, and cook 5 minutes over medium heat until onions are translucent.
step-5: add the garlic and cook 2 minutes.
step-6: add the split peas, thyme, salt, pepper, tumeric, and red pepper flakes, and stir until well combined.
step-7: add the vegetable stock and bay leaves, cover with a lid and cook for 40 minutes.
step-8: add potatoes, then cover and cook 20 more minutes.
step-9: remove bay leaves and serve soup in your bread bowl.

step-1: in a large pot at medium-high heat, add the olive oil and carrots to the pot.
step-2: cook the carrots for about 10 minutes until they start to brown slightly.
step-3: next add the chopped onion, red bell pepper, celery, garlic, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper to the pot and cook until the vegetables are caramelized and tender.
step-4: add the tomato paste, stir it into the vegetables, and allow the tomato paste to brown deeply.
step-5: it should be very aromatic before moving forward.
step-6: add the canned tomatoes and water, bring the sauce to a boil, and then reduce to a simmer.
step-7: simmer the sauce for at least 1 hour.
step-8: add the sauce to a blender in batches or use an immersion blender to puree the sauce to your desired consistency.
step-9: let the sauce cool completely and then pour the sauce into freezer-safe bags.
step-10: place the bags into a leak-proof container/tray, and freeze for up to one month.
step-11: reheat the frozen sauce with ½ cup of water in a pot until it comes to a boil and then use as desired.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: using a vegetable peeler, peel ribbons from the zucchini, carrots, and yellow squash.
step-3: set the ribbons aside.
step-4: in a medium bowl, mix together the whole wheat flour, butter, coconut oil, and salt.
step-5: using 2 thin butter knives, or a pie butter, pull the knives past each other in the mixture so that the butter and oil are cut into smaller chunks and mixed in the flour until the chunks are about the size of peas.
step-6: mix the ice water into the flour using a wooden spoon to combine and pack the mixture.
step-7: once the crust has started to come together, pour into a 10 inch pie pan and press it down to form a solid layer along the bottom and the sides.
step-8: line the walls of the pie crust with the veggie ribbons until the entire pie has been filled.
step-9: season the pie with thyme, oregano, salt, pepper, a drizzle of olive oil, and parmesan cheese.
step-10: bake for 30-35 minutes, until the crust has set and the cheese has melted.
step-11: allow the pie to cool for at least 20 minutes before slicing.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: place all the vegetable skins on a nonstick baking sheet or a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-3: drizzle the olive oil over the peels and sprinkle with the garlic powder, onion powder, and paprika.
step-4: season with salt and pepper.
step-5: toss the peels with your hands until they are evenly coated with the oil and spices.
step-6: bake for 8-10 minutes, tossing the peels halfway through with a pair of tongs.
step-7: let cool before eating.

step-1: fill a medium shallow bowl with warm water and set near your work station.
step-2: dip a rice paper wrapper in the warm water for a few seconds, submerging completely.
step-3: remove and lay flat on a smooth, clean surface, such as a plate.
step-4: add your desired combination of sliced mushrooms, sliced carrots, sliced cucumber, sliced cabbage, and sliced bell pepper to the middle of the wrapper.
step-5: be careful not to overfill, or rolling it will become difficult.
step-6: working quickly, before the rice paper dries out, fold both sides of the rice paper over the vegetables to secure.
step-7: lift the bottom edge of the rice paper and carefully fold it over the top of the vegetables, tucking it under on the other side, then gently roll until the vegetables are completely covered and the top edge of the wrapper adheres to the spring roll.
step-8: set the spring roll aside and cover with a damp paper towel to keep fresh while you repeat with the remaining ingredients.
step-9: once you’ve finished making the spring rolls, chill in the fridge while you make the sauce.
step-10: make the peanut sauce: add the peanut butter, ginger (if using), sesame oil, rice wine vinegar, soy sauce, and maple syrup to a small bowl.
step-11: whisk until combined.
step-12: transfer the sauce to a small serving bowl and sprinkle with red pepper flakes.
step-13: serve the chilled spring rolls with the sauce.

step-1: collect veggie scraps in a resealable container and freeze for up to 6 months.
step-2: when you have enough scraps to make stock, add the scraps to a large pot and cover with water.
step-3: simmer over medium-low heat for at least 30 minutes, up to 3 hours.
step-4: strain the stock and transfer the liquid to resealable containers.
step-5: refrigerate for up to 4 days or freeze for up to 3 months.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: heat the oil in an oven-proof skillet.
step-3: toss in the bell peppers, onions, salt, pepper, and garlic, and sauté until the veggies have softened, about 10 minutes.
step-4: season the flank steak on both sides with a good pinch of salt and black pepper.
step-5: sprinkle on the spinach in an even layer and top with the sautéed peppers.
step-6: sprinkle the mozzarella cheese over the veggies and tightly wrap the steak into a roll.
step-7: skewer the steak with toothpicks about 1½ inches (4 cm) apart so that the steak will hold its shape.
step-8: slice between the toothpicks to create individual steak rolls.
step-9: heat a few more tablespoons of oil in the skillet.
step-10: when the oil has begun to smoke slightly, sear the steak rolls until browned, about 2 minutes per side.
step-11: note: to bake the entire steak roll at one time, simply sear each steak roll in a large skillet and transfer to a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-12: once each roll has been seared and transferred to the baking sheet, proceed with steps 10-12.
step-13: transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 10-15 minutes, or until it has reached desired level of doneness.
step-14: let the steak rest for 5 minutes before removing toothpicks.

step-1: in a small pot over medium heat, add the rice vinegar, sugar, and salt and whisk to combine.
step-2: bring to a boil and continue whisking until the salt and sugar have dissolved.
step-3: remove the pot from the heat.
step-4: add the cooked sushi rice to a large bowl and the cooked black rice to a separate medium bowl.
step-5: add ¾ of the rice vinegar mixture to the sushi rice and the remaining ¼ to the forbidden rice.
step-6: mix until the vinegar mixture is well distributed.
step-7: make the shiitake veggie roll: heat the sesame oil in a medium pan over medium heat.
step-8: once the oil is simmering, add the shiitake mushrooms, soy sauce, garlic powder, and pepper and cook for 6-8 minutes, until the mushrooms have released their juices and begin to crisp up.
step-9: place 1 sheet of nori over a bamboo sushi mat.
step-10: scoop 1 cup (230 g) of sushi rice on top of the nori.
step-11: fill a small bowl with water to dip your fingers into--this will prevent them from getting sticky when handling the rice.
step-12: using your fingers, spread the rice in an even layer over the nori, leaving a 1-inch (2-cm) border at the top to seal the roll.
step-13: over the bottom quarter of the nori, layer the spinach, cucumber, carrot, and shiitake mushrooms.
step-14: use your fingers to hold the vegetables in place while you begin to roll the nori.
step-15: squeeze the bamboo mat around the roll as you go to ensure a tight sushi roll.
step-16: transfer the sushi roll to a cutting board and cut it in half, then cut each half into quarters for a total of 8 sushi pieces.
step-17: make the sweet potato tempura roll: heat the vegetable oil in a medium pot until it reaches 375ºf (190ºc).
step-18: in a medium bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, salt, and pepper and mix well with a fork.
step-19: pour in the ice water and mix until incorporated--some lumps are okay.
step-20: drop the sweet potato sticks into the batter and toss with your fingers to ensure they are thoroughly coated.
step-21: transfer a few of the sweet potato sticks at a time to a spider and carefully drop them into the hot oil.
step-22: cook for 3-4 minutes, until crispy, then transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.
step-23: place 1 sheet of nori over a bamboo sushi mat.
step-24: scoop 1 cup (230 g) of sushi rice on top of the nori.
step-25: using your fingers, spread the rice in an even layer over the nori, leaving a 1-inch (2-cm) border at the top to seal the roll.
step-26: over the bottom quarter of the nori, layer the sweet potato tempura and avocado.
step-27: use your fingers to hold the vegetables in place while you begin to roll the nori.
step-28: squeeze the bamboo mat around the roll as you go to ensure a tight sushi roll.
step-29: transfer the sushi roll to a cutting board and cut it in half, then cut each half into quarters for a total of 8 sushi pieces.
step-30: make the avocado cucumber mango roll: place 1 sheet of nori over a bamboo sushi mat.
step-31: scoop the forbidden rice on top of the nori.
step-32: using your fingers, spread the rice in an even layer over the nori, leaving a 1-inch (2-cm) border at the top to seal the roll.
step-33: over the bottom quarter of the nori, layer the avocado, cucumber, and mango.
step-34: use your fingers to hold the filling in place while you begin to roll the nori.
step-35: squeeze the bamboo mat around the roll as you go to ensure a tight sushi roll.
step-36: transfer the sushi roll to a cutting board and cut it in half, then cut each half into quarters for a total of 8 sushi pieces.
step-37: make the teriyaki tofu roll: place 1 sheet of nori over a bamboo sushi mat.
step-38: scoop the remaining cup of sushi rice on top of the nori.
step-39: using your fingers, spread the rice in an even layer over the nori, leaving a 1-inch (2-cm) border at the top to seal the roll.
step-40: over the bottom quarter of the roll, layer the teriyaki tofu, red bell pepper, and carrot.
step-41: use your fingers to hold the filling in place while you begin to roll the nori.
step-42: squeeze the bamboo mat around the roll as you go to ensure a tight sushi roll.
step-43: transfer the sushi roll to a cutting board and cut it in half, then cut each half into quarters for a total of 8 sushi pieces.
step-44: serve the sushi with wasabi, pickled ginger, and soy sauce.

step-1: add the tomatoes, carrot, celery, red bell pepper, salt, pepper, garlic, and water to a large pot and bring to a boil.
step-2: reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes, or until vegetables are tender.
step-3: remove from heat, let cool for 10 minutes.
step-4: add mixture to a blender and add in the parsley.
step-5: blend until consistency is smooth.
step-6: serve chilled.

step-1: soak cashews in water for 30 minutes.
step-2: rinse, then drain in a colander.
step-3: add cashews, coconut milk, maple syrup, water, dates, allspice, vanilla bean seeds, nutmeg, and rum (optional) to a blender.
step-4: blend until completely smooth.
step-5: refrigerate the mixture until ready to enjoy.
step-6: refrigeration will thicken the veggnog.
step-7: add more water and blend again for a thinner consistency.
step-8: serve chilled with nutmeg, and cinnamon stick.

step-1: preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: line two baking sheets with parchment paper.
step-3: in a large mixing bowl, beat the egg yolks with 1 cup (200 g) of sugar and the vanilla extract until pale and fluffy, about 3 minutes.
step-4: sift in the flour, half of the cocoa powder, baking powder and salt.
step-5: mix until just combined, and set aside
step-6: in a separate large mixing bowl, using a hand mixer, beat the egg whites until soft peaks form.
step-7: add the remaining sugar and beat until stiff peaks form.
step-8: beat a third of the egg whites into the chocolate mixture, then gently fold in the remaining egg whites.
step-9: divide the batter between the two baking sheets.
step-10: spread evenly and bake for 10-12 minutes.
step-11: let cool at room temperature until the pans are cool to touch.
step-12: dust the tops of the cakes with the remaining cocoa powder.
step-13: cover with parchment paper, and flip the cakes over to remove from the pans.
step-14: carefully peel away the baked parchment paper and discard.
step-15: cut each cake in half vertically, then set aside.
step-16: in a large bowl, whip the cream cheese and butter until fluffy.
step-17: gradually incorporate the powdered sugar, then the vanilla extract.
step-18: use a spatula to fold in the crushed cookies.
step-19: evenly spread a thin layer of icing onto a cake quarter.
step-20: starting from one short end, tightly roll the cake into a spiral.
step-21: repeat with the remaining cake layers, placing the rolled piece at the start of each new layer.
step-22: wrap the cake tightly in plastic wrap and chill for at least an hour until icing in center is slightly firm.
step-23: use the remaining icing to cover the cake and pipe small swirls on the top.
step-24: garnish the top with the sandwich cookie halves, and chill for at least an hour before serving.

step-1: in a large pitcher, combine the strawberries, blackberries, raspberries, blueberries, brut rosé, and triple sec.
step-2: stir and refrigerate for at least 3 hours, or overnight.
step-3: when ready to serve, remove the pitcher from the refrigerator and add the lemon lime soda.
step-4: gently stir to combine.
step-5: place 1-2 small scoops of blackberry sorbet in a glass.
step-6: pour the sangria over the sorbet and stir with a spoon.
step-7: garnish with a fresh strawberry.

step-1: pour the ground coffee into a vietnamese phin filter base.
step-2: place the phin filter strainer on top of the coffee.
step-3: pour the sweetened condensed milk into a glass.
step-4: place the phin assembly on top of the glass.
step-5: pour hot water into the phin filter.
step-6: place the phin filter lid on top and let the coffee drip through the filter into the glass.
step-7: stir well before serving.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the beef, garlic, brown sugar, 3 tablespoons of soy sauce, oyster sauce, fish sauce, and black pepper.
step-2: toss to combine.
step-3: let marinate at room temperature for 30 minutes.
step-4: in small bowl, combine the granulated sugar, remaining 2 tablespoons of soy sauce, white vinegar, and water.
step-5: add the red onion slices and coat the red onions in the dressing thoroughly.
step-6: set aside to soak.
step-7: on a platter, arrange the watercress and tomato slices.
step-8: preheat a large wok or skillet over high heat, then add the vegetable oil.
step-9: when the oil is shimmering, swirl the oil around in the pan.
step-10: add half of the beef cubes and sear on all sides, shaking the pan, until the meat is slightly charred and medium rare, 3-5 minutes.
step-11: set the meat aside and repeat with remaining beef.
step-12: arrange the beef on the bed of watercress and tomatoes.
step-13: top with the dressed red onions and fresh cilantro.
step-14: serve with domed white rice.
step-15: for a full meal, serve alongside vietnamese crepes, spring rolls, and banh mi sandwiches.

step-1: in a large bowl, mix together the flour, salt, baking powder, and sugar.
step-2: add the cold shortening and water, and mix until evenly incorporated, but still crumbly.
step-3: transfer the dough onto a work surface and knead until the dough just comes together, about 1 minute.
step-4: wrap the dough in plastic wrap, and let it rest for an hour at room temperature.
step-5: heat a skillet on medium high with 2 tablespoons of olive oil.
step-6: add the onion, bell peppers, celery, garlic, salt, pepper, dried oregano, dried parsley, dried thyme, and the scotch bonnet pepper, and cook until all the vegetables are soft and slightly caramelized, about 10 minutes.
step-7: add the tomato paste and cook until aromatic and slightly caramelized, about 5 minutes.
step-8: add the ground beef.
step-9: cook until the meat is browned, about 15 minutes.
step-10: remove from the heat and set aside.
step-11: unwrap the rested dough and roll it out on a work surface until ⅛ of an inch (3 mm) in thickness.
step-12: using an inverted 6-inch (15-cm) wide bowl, cut out circles of the dough to set aside.
step-13: remove the excess and re-roll it to cut out more dough circles.
step-14: take a dough circle and place ½ cup (110 g) of filling into the center of the circle, leaving about 1½ inches (3-cm) of room around the edges.
step-15: dip your finger in water and brush the edge of the dough.
step-16: fold the dough over the filling to meet the opposite end and press the dough ends together to form a half-moon shape.
step-17: firmly press down the two edges to become one, and decorate the new crust with the prongs of a fork.
step-18: make sure the pastry is completely sealed.
step-19: preheat fryer oil in a large pot on high heat to 350°f (180°c).
step-20: place the pates into the heated deep fryer, one at a time, for about 5 minutes or until they puff up and the outside turns golden brown.
step-21: remove from the fryer and let them drain on a wire rack or paper towel-lined plate.

step-1: in a cocktail shaker, combine the ice, blackberry jam, lemon juice, and vodka.
step-2: cover with the lid and shake vigorously for 30 seconds.
step-3: strain into desired serving glass.
step-4: garnish with the lemon peel.

step-1: add the celery and mint in a pestle and mortar.
step-2: crush until the celery juices are released and you have a mushy mixture.
step-3: add ice cubes to a glass and add the vodka, simple syrup, lime juice.
step-4: place the celery and mint mixture into a sieve.
step-5: using a spoon press over the glass to push all the fresh celery juice through the sieve.
step-6: top with soda water and finish with a sprig of mint and a wedge of lime.

step-1: remove seeds and veins from 6 chillies.
step-2: (wearing latex gloves for this part is advised.)
step-3: refrigerate chillies in vodka for 4-12 hours.
step-4: melt dark chocolate and stir in black pepper
step-5: dip the chillies in the dark chocolate, coating fully, and rest on some baking paper
step-6: drizzle with melted white chocolate.
step-7: quick tip: you can make white chocolate thinner by stirring a teaspoon of vegetable oil to it after it’s melted.
step-8: leave to set in the fridge (about 30-60 minutes).

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: line baking sheets with parchment paper.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, and salt.
step-4: mix with a fork.
step-5: in a separate large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar with an electric hand mixer for 3-5 minutes, until butter and sugar are fully combined, but before the mixture becomes fluffy.
step-6: add the egg and vanilla, and beat to incorporate.
step-7: add the flour mixture and mix until just combined, but crumbly.
step-8: finish mixing with your hands until the dough comes together in a ball.
step-9: transfer the dough to a floured surface.
step-10: lightly flour the top of the dough and roll out to about ¼-inch thick.
step-11: use cookie cutters of your choice to punch out cookies.
step-12: place the cookie cut-outs on the prepared baking sheets.
step-13: bake for 10 minutes, until lightly browned around the edges.
step-14: let cool completely.
step-15: decorate the cookies with royal icing and let dry completely, at least 3-4 hours or overnight.

step-1: place a sausage patty and a mug or ramekin on a large microwaveable-friendly plate.
step-2: crack the egg into the mug.
step-3: season with salt and pepper.
step-4: add a splash of milk, if desired.
step-5: whisk until well-mixed.
step-6: microwave the entire plate for 1½-2 minutes, or until the egg is cooked through.
step-7: invert the mug with the egg.
step-8: you may have to run a knife around the mug first to ensure that the egg comes loose in one solid piece.
step-9: toast two frozen waffles.
step-10: after the waffles are toasted, layer 1 waffle, cheese, the cooked sausage patty, eggs, and the remaining waffle.
step-11: fold the edges of a sheet of aluminum foil down by half an inch (1 cm).
step-12: place the sandwich in the middle.
step-13: bring the top and bottom of the edges of the paper together over the center of the sandwich.
step-14: repeat folding in half-inch (1 cm) turns, creasing each time, until the fold is level with the top of the sandwich.
step-15: starting on the left side, use your fingers to press the edges into the center to form a pleated triangle.
step-16: press down and crease the triangle's edges, including at the base of the sandwich, before carefully folding it underneath.
step-17: repeat this process on the other side of the sandwich.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine waffle mix, rosemary, egg, oil, and milk.
step-2: stir until well combined.
step-3: pour about ½ cup (120ml) of the batter into the waffle iron (amount may vary based on the size of the waffle iron).
step-4: cook until the waffle is golden brown.
step-5: add slices of cheese on half of the waffle.
step-6: carefully, fold the other half on top and close the lid.
step-7: cook until the cheese is melted.

step-1: in a medium bowl, add the beaten eggs, any of your favorite toppings, salt, and pepper.
step-2: mix well.
step-3: grease a waffle iron with nonstick spray.
step-4: add the egg mixture and cook according to machine instruction to until the eggs are fully set and slightly browned, 2 minutes.
step-5: remove the egg from the waffle iron and serve.

step-1: to make the berbere braised lamb, heat the vegetable oil in a large pan over medium-high heat until oil is lightly shimmering.
step-2: add the lamb to the pot, season with salt and pepper, and brown on all sides, for about 10 minutes.
step-3: remove the lamb from the pot.
step-4: to the same pot, add the red onions and cook until brown, for about 15-20 minutes.
step-5: stir in the ghee, garlic, ginger, paprika, cayenne, fenugreek, nutmeg, cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, allspice, and tomato paste.
step-6: pour in the beef stock, stirring well to incorporate.
step-7: bring the sauce to a boil and return the lamb to the pot.
step-8: reduce heat to medium-low, so the sauce is at a gentle simmer, and cover and cook for 1 hour, stirring occasionally until the lamb is tender.
step-9: to make the jeweled vegetable pilau, use a separate large, shallow pot, melt the ghee over medium heat.
step-10: add the sliced red onions and cook until soft and slightly caramelized, for about 20 minutes.
step-11: add the cabbage, carrots, garlic, and ginger, and sauté until vegetables have softened and cooked down.
step-12: season with salt, pepper, ground cumin, curry powder, and cardamom.
step-13: stir in the rice and add the water.
step-14: add the bay leaf, cinnamon stick, and star anise.
step-15: reduce the heat to low and cook for 20-25 minutes until water is absorbed and rice is slightly fluffy.
step-16: discard the bay leaf, cinnamon stick, and star anise.
step-17: stir the rice well before transferring to a large serving platter.
step-18: create a small well in the middle of the rice, and spoon the lamb over the top.
step-19: serve garnished with scallions, cashews, and pomegranate seeds.

step-1: cut a large watermelon in half lengthwise.
step-2: dice half of the watermelon and save the rind for later.
step-3: place watermelon, cucumber, red onion, salt, and balsamic vinegar into large bowl and mix together.
step-4: pour salad into hollowed out watermelon rind (optional).

step-1: place watermelon, coconut water, and lime juice in blender and blend until smooth.
step-2: serve over ice.

step-1: in a small pot over medium heat, combine the sugar and water.
step-2: bring to a boil, stirring to dissolve the sugar completely.
step-3: remove the pot from the heat and stir in the cucumber.
step-4: let steep, covered, for at least 4 hours or up to overnight.
step-5: strain the syrup through a fine-mesh sieve or cheesecloth, pushing to extract as much syrup as possible.
step-6: store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 month.
step-7: in a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the gin, watermelon juice, lime juice, and simple syrup.
step-8: shake vigorously for 20 seconds.
step-9: strain into a glass filled with ice and top with club soda.
step-10: garnish with the cucumber slice.

step-1: add the watermelon, cucumber, and lime juice to a blender, and blend until smooth.
step-2: using a mesh strainer, strain the juice over a large liquid measuring cup to remove the pulp.
step-3: use a spoon to help stir the pulp and press out the liquid.
step-4: reserve the pulp to make pulp muffins.
step-5: chill the juice for at least 30 minutes (and keep up to 3 days).

step-1: cut a ripe watermelon into round discs about 1-2 inches (2-5 cm) thick.
step-2: scoop the coconut cream into a bowl.
step-3: use a mixer to whip the cream until it reaches a soft consistency.
step-4: cut 3-4 strawberries into thin slices.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: peel and cut 2-3 kiwis into thin slices.
step-7: set aside.
step-8: remove pit and cut 2-3 apricot into thin slices.
step-9: set aside.
step-10: spread the mixed coconut cream around the top of the watermelon disc.
step-11: place the cut strawberries, kiwis and apricot slices on top of the coconut cream.
step-12: add in blueberries, coconut flakes and granola.
step-13: sprinkle a few sprigs of mint across the top the dessert.
step-14: slice and serve.

step-1: cut the watermelon into 1½-inch (4 cm) cubes, removing the rind.
step-2: using a teaspoon measuring spoon or a melon baller, scoop out the center of each watermelon cube, only going about halfway through.
step-3: in a large bowl, combine the cucumber, feta, mint, olive oil, and salt.
step-4: spoon the cucumber mixture into the watermelon cubes.
step-5: garnish with more mint.
step-6: chill until serving.

step-1: add the watermelon, cucumber, bell pepper, jalapeño, mint, balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper to a food processor or blender..
step-2: while blending, slowly add the olive oil and continue blending until the mixture has reached your desired consistency.
step-3: transfer the soup to a large bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or overnight, to allow the flavors to deepen.
step-4: serve the soup chilled and garnish with a slice of cucumber, a slice of jalapeño, and a sprig of mint.

step-1: using a melon baller or half teaspoon, make three divots in the bottom of the watermelon that are slightly smaller than the circumference of the celery stalks.
step-2: cut the watermelon in half, with the bottom side of the “grill” being slightly larger than the “lid” side.
step-3: hollow out the watermelon halves using either a melon baller or spoon.
step-4: save the pieces for the fruit skewers.
step-5: insert the celery into each divot on the bottom half of the watermelon and secure with a toothpick if needed.
step-6: insert 3 wooden skewers into the watermelon half along its top edge to start assembling the “grill”, spacing about ½-inch (1 ½ cm) apart.
step-7: cut the skewers as needed.
step-8: fill the grill with blackberries, which will act as your charcoal.
step-9: finish inserting the rest of the skewers to complete the bottom half of the grill.
step-10: take the hollowed top half of the watermelon and toothpick a lime half to make the grill lid.
step-11: assemble your fruit skewers and get “grilling”!
step-12: add two skewers into the rim of the bottom half of the watermelon so that the lid can rest on it.

step-1: in a blender, combine the watermelon, wine, lime juice, simple syrup, and rum and blend until smooth.
step-2: pour the mixture into the ice pop molds, seal with the lids, and add the ice pop sticks.
step-3: freeze until solid, at least 4 hours, or overnight.
step-4: carefully remove the ice pops from the molds.

step-1: pour all ingredients into a blender and blend until smooth.
step-2: garnish with a slice of lime.

step-1: using a sharp knife, cut around the watermelon slices rind to remove, then dice into 1-inch (2 cm) cubes.
step-2: transfer 4 cups (600 g) to a medium bowl, reserving the rest for another use.
step-3: in a small bowl, combine the soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, lime juice, agave, scallions, ginger, white sesame seeds, and chile flakes.
step-4: mix well.
step-5: pour the marinade over the watermelon cubes and stir.
step-6: cover the bowl with plastic wrap and let marinate in the fridge for 1 hour.
step-7: slice the cucumber into thin half moons and set aside.
step-8: in a small bowl, combine the mayo and sriracha.
step-9: to assemble the poke bowls, start with rice as a base and top with cucumbers, avocado, edamame, nori, pickled ginger, sriracha mayo, cilantro, and crushed peanuts.
step-10: add a scoop of the marinated watermelon and use the marinade as a dressing to drizzle over the bowl.
step-11: garnish with black sesame seeds, if desired.

step-1: using a sharp knife, cut off the top and bottom of the watermelon to reveal the red flesh and create flat surfaces on both sides.
step-2: stand the watermelon upright, and slice off the remaining peel so only the red core remains.
step-3: cut the watermelon into roughly 1-inch (2 cm) cubes and transfer to a large bowl.
step-4: in a small bowl, whisk together the lime juice, water, honey, and salt.
step-5: while whisking, gradually add the oil in a very slow, steady stream to create an emulsification.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: add the arugula, feta, and honey lime dressing to the large bowl with the watermelon.
step-8: toss the salad until well-combined, then divide between serving bowls.

step-1: using a sharp knife, cut off the top and bottom of the watermelon to reveal the red flesh and create flat surfaces on both sides.
step-2: stand the watermelon upright, and slice off the remaining peel so only the red core remains.
step-3: cut the watermelon into roughly 1-inch (2-cm) cubes and transfer to a large bowl.
step-4: in a medium pot over high heat, bring the balsamic vinegar to a boil and reduce until roughly ¼ cup (60 ml) remains and the vinegar has thickened significantly, about 10 minutes.
step-5: remove the pot from the heat and set aside to cool.
step-6: arrange the watermelon cubes on a plate or place in a large bowl.
step-7: arrange the red onion, mint leaves, drops of balsamic reduction, basil, and thyme decoratively over the watermelon.
step-8: or, if using a bowl, toss the watermelon, onion, and herbs together, then drizzle with balsamic reduction.

step-1: using a sharp knife, cut off the top and bottom of the watermelon to reveal the red flesh and create flat surfaces on both sides.
step-2: stand the watermelon upright, and slice off the remaining peel so only the red core remains.
step-3: cut the watermelon into roughly 1-inch (2-cm) cubes and transfer to a large bowl.
step-4: in a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, water, honey, salt, and pepper.
step-5: while whisking, gradually add the oil in a very slow, steady stream to create an emulsification.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: add the spinach, mango, almonds, and lemon vinaigrette to the large bowl with the watermelon.
step-8: toss the salad until well-combined, then divide between serving bowls.

step-1: add all the ingredients to a blender and mix on high.
step-2: pour into a bowl or half a hollowed out small watermelon, and top with desired fruit and other toppings.

step-1: preheat oven to 325˚f (160˚c).
step-2: to prepare red pepper spread, cut the top quarter off a head of garlic and place in a baking dish or oven-safe skillet with the chopped peppers.
step-3: drizzle with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
step-4: roast in oven for 1 hour.
step-5: once cooled, combine peppers and garlic, parsley, oregano, and lemon juice in a food processor or blender.
step-6: puree, slowly drizzling in remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil.
step-7: chill for at least 1 hour, or up to overnight.
step-8: arrange turkey, cucumber, cheddar cheese, red pepper spread and good thins sweet potato crackers as desired in a resealable food container.
step-9: refrigerate until ready to eat.

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with foil.
step-3: place the chicken, peppers, and onions onto the baking sheet and drizzle with oil.
step-4: sprinkle the taco seasoning evenly over both sides of the chicken breasts.
step-5: sprinkle salt and pepper on the bell peppers and onions, tossing to coat.
step-6: top each chicken breast with a generous pour of salsa.
step-7: bake in a preheated oven for 25 minutes.
step-8: rest chicken for 10 minutes, before slicing into strips.
step-9: add a base of brown rice to 4 food storage containers.
step-10: top each with a scoop of black beans, corn, additional salsa, cheddar cheese, cooked bell peppers, and onions, and sliced chicken.
step-11: garnish with fresh cilantro and a lime wedge.
step-12: store in the refrigerator (and enjoy any extras immediately).
step-13: can be kept refrigerated for up to 4 days.

step-1: in a pan, cook cut chicken over medium-high heat until almost done.
step-2: salt and pepper to taste.
step-3: reduce heat to medium and stir in the crushed garlic.
step-4: add in the soy sauce, honey, and 1 tablespoon of the sesame seeds.
step-5: stir until thickened.
step-6: remove the chicken from the pan, leaving the sauce, and add the vegetables to the pan.
step-7: cover the pan for several minutes and cook until the vegetables begin to soften, then remove the lid and stir until the sauce is thick again.
step-8: split the rice, vegetables, and chicken evenly between 4 containers.
step-9: top with a sprinkle of sesame seeds and sliced green onion.
step-10: refrigerate for up to 4 days.

step-1: in a large pan, heat olive oil and add chicken thighs.
step-2: season with salt and pepper.
step-3: when the chicken is completely cooked through, remove from pan.
step-4: slice into strips, and set aside.
step-5: add green beans and cook until crisp tender.
step-6: return the chicken strips to the pan, then add tomatoes and pesto.
step-7: stir until fully incorporated.
step-8: divide into 4 food storage containers and store in the refrigerator.
step-9: or serve immediately!
step-10: note: can be kept refrigerated for up to 4 days.

step-1: heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
step-2: add the peppers and onions and season with salt and pepper, to taste.
step-3: cook, stirring occasionally, until vegetables have softened.
step-4: remove from pan, set aside.
step-5: add ground turkey to hot skillet.
step-6: break apart with a wooden spoon to separate.
step-7: season with taco seasoning, stir, cooking until meat has browned and cooked through.
step-8: stir in tomatoes.
step-9: bring to a gentle simmer for about 5 minutes.
step-10: remove from heat.
step-11: to assemble the taco bowls, add a base of rice to 4 food storage containers.
step-12: top each with a scoop of black beans, corn, salsa, cheddar cheese, cooked peppers and onions, and taco meat.
step-13: garnish with fresh cilantro and a lime wedge.
step-14: store in the refrigerator (and enjoy any extras immediately).
step-15: can be kept refrigerated for up to 4 days.

step-1: for the whole wheat sandwiches, assemble your desired combination of cheese and deli meat on slices of whole wheat bread.
step-2: pack the sandwiches in lunch containers with condiment packets.
step-3: for the wraps, place the lettuce and your desired assortment of cheese and deli meat on the whole wheat tortilla and wrap it closed.
step-4: cut the wrap in half and pack in lunch container with condiment packets.
step-5: for the dry snacks, store the wheat crackers, pretzels, and cheese crackers in individual snack containers.
step-6: store in the cupboard.
step-7: to assemble the lunch containers, fill with your desired assortments of sandwiches, wraps, fruit, and vegetables.
step-8: store in the fridge for up to 5 days.
step-9: to prepare for school in the morning, pack an insulated lunch container with one of the lunch containers, a snack container, and a bottle filled with your little one’s favorite drink.

step-1: add the buttercream frosting to a piping bag fitted with a round tip, then pipe on top of the cupcakes.
step-2: place the chocolate crisps on the cream, concave-side up, and gently press to adhere.
step-3: pipe a small amount of buttercream on the chocolate crisps and place the chocolate caramel candies on top.
step-4: gently press so they stick together.

step-1: add the cream to a large bowl.
step-2: using a hand mixer, beat the cream until soft peaks form.
step-3: add the sugar and continue to beat until stiff peaks form.

step-1: in a blender, combine all ingredients.
step-2: blend until smooth.
step-3: serve with bread and toppings of your choice.

step-1: in a small saucepan, combine ginger syrup ingredients and bring to a boil.
step-2: lower to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes.
step-3: strain through a sieve and cool.
step-4: place the mint and one lime wedge in the bottom of tall glass.
step-5: muddle well and add 1 ounce (30 ml) of ginger syrup.
step-6: add the second lime wedge and muddle again.
step-7: top off glass with the bourbon, ice, and club soda.
step-8: stir well and garnish with a lime wedge and a few mint leaves.

step-1: in a cocktail shaker, combine the ice, peach jam, lemon juice, and whiskey.
step-2: cover with the lid and shake vigorously for 30 seconds.
step-3: strain into desired serving glass.
step-4: garnish with a lemon twist.

step-1: combine all ingredients in a food processor.
step-2: blend until smooth adding small amounts of oil and water until desired consistency is achieved.
step-3: add extra olive oil, dried cranberry, and a sprig of rosemary to garnish!
step-4: eat with sweet crackers or fresh vegetables.

step-1: in a medium pan, combine the white chocolate chips, vanilla, and heavy cream over low heat.
step-2: mix until smooth.
step-3: pour the mixture into a loaf pan.
step-4: allow to sit in the refrigerator for 20 minutes to cool.
step-5: pour the semisweet chocolate chips into the truffle mix and stir to combine evenly.
step-6: place in the refrigerator for 1 hour, or until the mixture is solid.
step-7: with an ice cream scoop, form balls from the mixture (refreeze the truffle mix if it begins to thaw).
step-8: keep the truffle balls in the refrigerator while you prepare the topping.
step-9: make the topping by melting the semisweet chocolate and white chocolate in separate bowls.
step-10: dip each truffle in the melted semisweet chocolate and allow to try.
step-11: drizzle the truffles with the melted white chocolate and refrigerate.
step-12: serve cold.

step-1: peel bananas and cut in half.
step-2: place popsicle sticks inside bananas and put on tray with parchment paper.
step-3: freeze for 1 to 3 hours, depending on how firm you want your bananas to be.
step-4: heat white chocolate chips in microwave at 30 second intervals until liquified.
step-5: coat bananas in white chocolate and sprinkle with rainbow sprinkles.
step-6: chocolate will harden so move quickly!
step-7: serve immediately or set aside and freeze for an additional 10 minutes.

step-1: preheat your oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-2: in a microwave-safe bowl, microwave the raspberry jam for one minute.
step-3: add the white chocolate and stir until smooth.
step-4: freeze one hour.
step-5: in a mixing bowl, add the white chocolate and hot melted butter.
step-6: mix to combine.
step-7: add the eggs, egg yolks, sugar, and flour, and whisk to combine thoroughly after each addition.
step-8: coat the inside of the ramekins with butter and then add approximately one teaspoon of flour, moving it around so that it coats the inside completely.
step-9: discard excess flour.
step-10: fill your ramekins about ¾ of the way with cake batter, then add a tablespoon of your raspberry mixture.
step-11: fill to the top with remaining batter.
step-12: place the ramekins on a sheet pan and bake at 350ºf (180ºc) for 15-18 minutes, until the lava cakes are no longer jiggly in the middle.
step-13: run a knife along the edges of the ramekin to loosen and invert onto a plate.
step-14: serve warm with ice cream.

step-1: in a large pitcher, combine the orange, lime, cranberries, simple syrup, vodka, orange liqueur, white cranberry juice, and white wine.
step-2: stir well, then chill until ready to serve, up to 2 days.
step-3: immediately before serving, add the lemon-lime soda and stir to incorporate.
step-4: pour into glasses and garnish with orange wedges.

step-1: divide pizza dough into 12-14 equal sized balls.
step-2: with floured hands, roll the dough balls into logs and tie into individual knots, tucking the excess underneath.
step-3: coat a 10 inch (25 cm) oven-safe skillet with olive oil.
step-4: place the knots in a ring around the skillet.
step-5: cover with plastic wrap and let rest for 30 minutes, allowing the dough to reach room temperature.
step-6: in a medium bowl, combine cream cheese, mozzarella, parmesan, ricotta, fresh basil, 3 cloves of garlic (chopped), and red pepper flakes.
step-7: melt the butter and add the fresh parsley and remaining garlic.
step-8: stir well.
step-9: uncover the knots and scoop the dip into the center of the skillet.
step-10: brush the knots with the butter/garlic mixture (reserving some for after baking), and top the dip with an additional sprinkle of cheese (optional).
step-11: bake in a preheated oven (400˚f/200˚c) for 20 minutes.
step-12: broil on high for two additional minutes or until knots and cheese are lightly browned, watching closely so as not to burn it.
step-13: remove from oven and brush lightly with additional garlic butter.
step-14: let cool slightly before serving.

step-1: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-2: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-3: arrange the hard candies on the prepared baking sheet.
step-4: bake for 3-4 minutes, or until melted and fused together in a thin layer.
step-5: let cool.
step-6: once cool to the touch, drop the baking sheet onto a flat surface to break the candy, then separate into large chunks.
step-7: add the frosting to a piping bag fitted with a round tip, then pipe onto the cupcakes.
step-8: sprinkle coconut flakes over the frosting.
step-9: top with the broken candy pieces.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: prep cauliflower by removing leaves and stem with a knife, then place on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-3: in a small bowl, whisk together tahini, olive oil, turmeric, paprika, garlic powder, chili powder, cumin, salt, and garlic.
step-4: pour tahini mixture over cauliflower, using your hands to make sure entire head is covered.
step-5: bake cauliflower for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
step-6: make a tent with aluminum foil and cover halfway through.
step-7: cut cauliflower into pieces and then separate florets.
step-8: serve on warm pita with tzatziki sauce and cilantro.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: in a large, ovenproof skillet or frying pan, mix together the carrots, squash, and broccoli, and coat with the oil.
step-3: spread the veggies into 1 even layer.
step-4: place the chicken on top of the veggies.
step-5: season the bird on all sides and in the cavity with salt, pepper, and fresh thyme leaves.
step-6: while seasoning the bird, make sure that enough seasoning has fallen onto the veggies below to give them good flavor.
step-7: to truss the chicken, fold the wingtips underneath the breasts so that they fit snugly.
step-8: using a piece of butcher’s twine, tie the legs together so the bird holds a nice shape.
step-9: bake for 1 hour, or until a thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the breast reads 160°f (70°c).
step-10: note: once resting out of the oven, the temperature will continue to rise to a safe 165°f (75°c).
step-11: let the chicken rest for at least 15 minutes once out of the oven, so that all of the juices in the meat can settle and the internal temperature has time to finish rising.
step-12: carve the bird as desired.
step-13: serve on a plate with the veggies, and fresh thyme sprigs for garnish.

step-1: in a large bowl, combine the whole wheat flour, coconut sugar, and salt.
step-2: add the butter and use a pastry cutter to work it into the flour mixture, until the butter becomes about the size of peas.
step-3: work quickly to keep the dough cold.
step-4: add the ice water 1 tablespoon at a time and mix thoroughly until dough becomes crumbly and just hydrated enough to hold together.
step-5: dump the mixture onto a floured surface and form the dough into a disc with your hands.
step-6: cover and chill for 30 minutes.
step-7: meanwhile, make the filling: combine the peaches, blueberries, lemon zest, coconut sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, cardamom, and vanilla in a large bowl and mix well.
step-8: cover and chill while the dough chills.
step-9: preheat the oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-10: on a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough into a circle about ¼- to ½-inch (6 to 13 mm) thick.
step-11: carefully use the rolling pin to transfer the dough to a 10- or 12-inch (25 cm or 30 cm) cast-iron skillet.
step-12: gently press the dough against the bottom and sides of the pan
step-13: add the filling to the center, then fold the edges of the crust in.
step-14: brush the edges of the crust with egg wash and sprinkle with turbinado sugar, if desired.
step-15: bake for 45-50 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-16: serve warm or at room temperature, with ice cream, if desired.

step-1: preheat griddler, fitted with the griddle plates, to 375°f (190°c), and grease with nonstick spray.
step-2: use a whisk to beat the eggs in a 9x13-inch (23x33-cm) casserole dish until smooth.
step-3: add the milk, maple syrup, vanilla, cinnamon, and salt, and whisk until smooth and well combined.
step-4: dunk the bread in the batter, 4 slices at a time, until just soaked.
step-5: do not let the bread soak in the wet ingredients too long or it will become too wet and fall apart when you attempt to pick it up.
step-6: transfer the soaked bread to the griddler and cook for 10 minutes.
step-7: sprinkle with powdered sugar, drizzle with maple syrup, and serve.

step-1: boil salted water and cook the pasta for 1 minute less than the time indicated on the package.
step-2: when the pasta is finished cooking, reserve ¼ cup (60 ml) of pasta water.
step-3: meanwhile, heat two tablespoons of olive oil in a cast-iron skillet.
step-4: season cubed chicken with salt and pepper, add it to the skillet, and brown it on each side.
step-5: once cooked through — about 2 to 4 minutes — remove from skillet and reserve.
step-6: heat remaining three tablespoons of olive oil in skillet and add garlic and red pepper flakes.
step-7: cook until fragrant, about 1 minutes.
step-8: add kale, lemon zest, lemon juice, salt, and reserved pasta water.
step-9: cook until kale is tender, about 3 minutes.
step-10: add cooked chicken, and pasta.
step-11: stir to coat, and serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 350ºf (180ºc).
step-2: slice pita bread into eighths and spread chips out on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
step-3: in a small bowl, combine the olive oil, salt, pepper, and garlic powder and brush onto both sides of the chips.
step-4: bake for 10-12 minutes, until golden and crispy.

step-1: in a large bowl, whisk the water, honey, and yeast.
step-2: let sit for 5 minutes, until the yeast has bloomed.
step-3: note: it may be tempting to use all whole wheat flour in this recipe, but, in our testing, that method resulted in dense, tough, squat breads that barely rose when we tried to proof them.
step-4: using some all-purpose flour was necessary to give us the rise and soft, pillowy texture we wanted in a good sandwich bread.
