step-5: pour in the wheat flour, all-purpose flour, oil, and salt, and mix until the dough comes together in a ball that does not stick to your fingers.
step-6: note: you can also do the first 2 steps in a standing mixer fitted with a dough hook attachment, mixing on low speed until the dough no longer sticks to the sides.
step-7: on a lightly floured surface, knead the dough a few times until it really starts to form a tight ball.
step-8: form the dough into a ball shape and transfer to a greased bowl, turning the dough to coat it in grease.
step-9: cover the bowl with plastic wrap or a wet towel and store in a warm place for 1 hour.
step-10: allow the dough to proof until it has doubled in size.
step-11: save the plastic wrap or towel as you’ll be using it again.
step-12: transfer the proofed dough to a lightly floured surface and press the dough – don’t stretch – into a 7x7-inch (18x18 cm) square.
step-13: fold the top 3rd of the square down, and the bottom 3rd up to form an even rectangle.
step-14: pinch the top fold to seal the dough.
step-15: roll the dough over so that the seal faces upward and fold both ends up toward the center, so that the dough has formed an even log shape about the size of your loaf pan.
step-16: transfer the dough to a greased loaf pan and cover with with the same plastic wrap or towel used before.
step-17: let the dough rise for 1 hour, until it has poofed over the edge of the loaf pan about 1½ inches (4 cm).
step-18: preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-19: remove the plastic wrap or towel and transfer to the oven and bake for 50-55 minutes, until the dough has browned slightly and formed a light brown crust.
step-20: immediately remove the loaf from the pan and set aside to cool for at least 1 hour before slicing.
step-21: store in an airtight container or bag.
step-22: the bread can be stored in freezer up to 6 months.

step-1: preheat the griddler, fitted with the waffle plates, to 375°f (190°c), and grease with nonstick spray.
step-2: whisk the eggs in a large mixing bowl until smooth.
step-3: add the greek yogurt and whisk again until smooth.
step-4: whisk in the milk, oil, and maple syrup.
step-5: add the flour, baking powder, and baking soda, and whisk together until the batter is smooth and well combined.
step-6: use a 1-cup (130 g) measuring cup to pour batter onto the griddler.
step-7: cook for 10 minutes, until the waffle has puffed up and is golden brown.
step-8: transfer the waffle to a cutting board and repeat with the remaining batter.
step-9: cut the waffles into sticks.
step-10: sprinkle with powdered sugar and serve with maple syrup.

step-1: in a large pot, add olive oil and set over medium heat.
step-2: once the oil begins to shimmer, add cubed chicken breast and season with salt and pepper.
step-3: cook the chicken, stirring occasionally, until sides become browned and the center is no longer pink.
step-4: remove chicken and set aside.
step-5: add the chicken broth, onion, and garlic to the pot and cook, stirring occasionally, until onions become translucent.
step-6: add the green curry paste and stir until evenly distributed.
step-7: add in the coconut milk, turmeric, chili powder, coriander, ginger, salt and pepper and stir until thoroughly combined.
step-8: add in the cooked chicken, butternut squash, red bell pepper, broccoli and cauliflower and stir, bringing to a boil.
step-9: reduce heat, cover with a lid, and simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until vegetables are tender.
step-10: remove from heat and allow to cool.
step-11: in 4 glass containers, add in 1 cup of riced cauliflower each.
step-12: distribute curry evenly between each container.
step-13: store in the refrigerator for up to 4 days.
step-14: when ready to enjoy, microwave, and garnish with fresh cilantro.

step-1: trim the fronds and stalks off of the fennel bulb.
step-2: cut the bulb in half crosswise, remove the core, then thinly slice.
step-3: add the sliced fennel to a medium bowl and set aside.
step-4: slice off the top and bottom of a blood orange so it sits flat on your cutting board.
step-5: carefully cut off the peel and pith in downward strips around the orange, removing as little fruit as possible.
step-6: carefully cut between the membranes to remove the segments.
step-7: repeat with the rest of the blood oranges, the cara cara oranges, and the grapefruit.
step-8: add the citrus segments to the bowl with the fennel, along with the mint.
step-9: season with salt and toss to combine.
step-10: set aside while you make the dressing and farro.
step-11: make the dressing: in a medium bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, honey, salt, and tarragon.
step-12: add the olive oil, a bit at a time, and whisk until fully incorporated.
step-13: set aside.
step-14: heat a bit of olive oil in a small pot over medium heat.
step-15: add the farro and toast until just slightly golden brown.
step-16: pour in the water and bring to a boil.
step-17: reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes, until the farro is tender and has absorbed the water.
step-18: add 2 tablespoons of the honey tarragon dressing to the warm farro and toss well.
step-19: in a small pan over medium heat, toast the pistachios until slightly brown and aromatic.
step-20: divide the citrus fennel mixture between serving bowls and top with the farro and pistachios.
step-21: add more dressing to taste, if desired.
step-22: nutrition - salad, with dressing - calories: 415, total fat: 15 grams, sodium: 429 mg, total carbs: 70 grams, dietary fiber: 11 grams, sugars: 33 grams, protein: 6 grams

step-1: slice the pomegranate in half crosswise.
step-2: hold the pomegranate cut side down over a medium bowl and tap the back with a wooden spoon to release the seeds.
step-3: rinse and drain.
step-4: add the apples, pears, clementines, kiwis, and pomegranate seeds to a large bowl.
step-5: in a small bowl or measuring cup, combine the lime juice and honey and stir until incorporated.
step-6: drizzle the dressing over fruit and gently toss until well coated.
step-7: serve chilled.

step-1: place a pint glass or stein in the freezer to chill while you make the milkshake.
step-2: in a blender, combine the ice cream and beer.
step-3: blend on medium speed until fully combined.
step-4: drizzle the chocolate syrup around the inside of the chilled glass.
step-5: pour in the ice cream–beer blend to fill.
step-6: top with whipped cream and drizzle with more chocolate syrup.
step-7: garnish with chocolate shavings.

step-1: in a large, heavy-bottomed pot, heat a drizzle of olive oil over medium heat.
step-2: add the onion, season with salt, and cook until the onion starts to sweat and become translucent, 3 minutes.
step-3: add the garlic and cook until fragrant, 2 minutes more.
step-4: add the parsnips and butternut squash and season with salt, paprika, oregano, cumin, allspice, and chipotle powder.
step-5: stir to coat the vegetables with the spices.
step-6: cover and cook for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking, until the vegetables begin to soften.
step-7: add the cannellini beans, cilantro, and vegetable broth.
step-8: increase the heat to medium-high and bring to a boil for 2 minutes.
step-9: reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 15 minutes, until the chili is thickened and the vegetables are cooked through.
step-10: ladle the chili into bowls and top with cilantro and cheddar cheese.

step-1: heat the olive oil in a medium pan over medium heat.
step-2: add the celery, leeks, carrots, and a pinch of salt and white pepper, and sauté until the vegetables start to cook down.
step-3: add the cream and stir to coat the vegetables.
step-4: cook until the cream is thickened.
step-5: remove the pan from the heat.
step-6: line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
step-7: roll out both sheets of puff pastry until they are ⅓-inch thick.
step-8: transfer one sheet of puff pastry to the baking sheet.
step-9: cut the sea bass along the back to remove the spine, then butterfly open.
step-10: season with salt, pepper, and the tarragon.
step-11: scoop the cooked vegetables onto one side of the fish, then fold over the other fillet.
step-12: transfer the fish to the center of the sheet of puff pastry.
step-13: brush egg wash around the fish, then lay on the second sheet of puff pastry, pressing around the fish to seal.
step-14: use a paring knife to cut away the excess puff pastry in the shape of a fish.
step-15: brush the top of the puff pastry with egg wash and use the leftover pastry scraps to decorate the fish with an eye and gills.
step-16: use the tip of the knife or the large opening of a pastry tip to draw scales on the body and tail.
step-17: chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
step-18: make the chive butter sauce: in a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine the wine, lemon juice, shallots, and tarragon.
step-19: reduce until only a ¼ cup (60 ml) of liquid remains.
step-20: add the cream and reduce until the mixture thickens slightly.
step-21: slowly whisk in the butter, 1 piece at a time, until the sauce is glossy and thickened.
step-22: remove the tarragon stem and season with salt and pepper.
step-23: stir in the chives.
step-24: preheat the oven to 375℉ (190℃).
step-25: when the oven is heated.
step-26: bake the fish for 15 to 20 minutes, or until the pastry is golden brown.
step-27: transfer the fish to a platter and garnish with fresh parsley and lemon wedges.
step-28: to serve, cut the fish into individual portions and plate with a drizzle of chive butter sauce.
step-29: recipe by: wolfgang puck

step-1: in a medium skillet, heat 3 tablespoons olive oil over medium heat.
step-2: add the shallots and 1 teaspoon minced garlic, and sauté until soft, but not brown.
step-3: add the rice and sauté until well-coated with the oil.
step-4: deglaze the pan with the wine and reduce until the pan is almost dry.
step-5: using a 4-ounce (115 g) ladle, add one ladle of boiling stock to the rice.
step-6: stir the rice until the stock is absorbed and the rice is almost dry.
step-7: continue adding stock 1 ladle at a time until the rice is tender, but still firm.
step-8: it should be moist and creamy, but not runny.
step-9: add the tomato basil bisque and stir to combine.
step-10: remove the risotto from the heat, and stir in the butter and the parmesan cheese.
step-11: season with salt and pepper.
step-12: heat the remaining 3 tablespoons of olive oil in a medium skillet over medium heat.
step-13: add the remaining teaspoon of minced garlic and the shrimp.
step-14: season with salt and white pepper.
step-15: add the peas and cook until the shrimp is pink and opaque, 4-5 minutes.
step-16: remove the shrimp from the heat and sprinkle with parsley.
step-17: divide the risotto between 2 warm serving plates.
step-18: top each with half the shrimp and peas.
step-19: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (175˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, add the chocolate cake mix, water, vegetable oil, and eggs and whisk until well combined.
step-3: add the batter to a 9x13 inch (23x33cm) oven proof baking dish, and bake for 25 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean.
step-4: add the pudding mix and milk to a bowl.
step-5: whisk until well combined.
step-6: fold in the whipped cream and crushed cookies until evenly incorporated.
step-7: let the cake rest for 20 minutes.
step-8: using the base of a wooden spoon, poke holes in the cake and fill with the gummy worms.
step-9: drizzle the cake with chocolate fudge sauce.
step-10: use a spatula to spread the whipped cream and cookie mixture over the cake.
step-11: transfer to the fridge to chill for 1 hour.
step-12: top the cake with remaining gummy worms and crushed cookies.

step-1: blanch the corn in a large pot of boiling water for 3 minutes.
step-2: remove the corn from the pot.
step-3: heat the canola oil in a medium pan over medium-high heat.
step-4: add the corn and cook, turning occasionally, until nicely browned on all sides.
step-5: in a small bowl, combine the soy sauce and sugar.
step-6: pour over the corn in the pan and brush over the corn until well coated.
step-7: transfer to a serving plate.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: use a vegetable peeler to peel the yellow squash into ribbons.
step-3: add the squash to a large bowl.
step-4: add 1 teaspoon salt, 1 teaspoon pepper, the garlic powder, onion powder, and 1 teaspoon oregano, and toss well until the squash is coated.
step-5: set aside.
step-6: heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
step-7: add the onion and garlic and cook for 5 minutes, until fragrant.
step-8: add the ground chicken, the remaining teaspoon salt, remaining teaspoon pepper, remaining teaspoon oregano, and the thyme, and cook until chicken is lightly golden brown.
step-9: add the crushed tomatoes, stirring to break up, and cook for 15 minutes, or until the sauce has reduced.
step-10: remove from the heat and set aside.
step-11: in a medium bowl, combine the ricotta, parmesan, and eggs and whisk until smooth.
step-12: grease a 9x13-inch (22x33 cm) casserole dish with cooking spray.
step-13: spread about ¼ of the ground chicken and tomato mixture in the bottom of the dish.
step-14: top with about ¼ of the squash noodles and ⅓ of the cheese mixture.
step-15: repeat with the remaining ingredients, finishing with a layer of noodles
step-16: top with the fresh mozzarella cheese.
step-17: bake for 30 minutes, or until the cheese is browned and melted.
step-18: serve warm.

step-1: cut the bananas in half horizontally.
step-2: insert popsicle sticks in the middle of the banana halves.
step-3: transfer bananas to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, and freeze until solid.
step-4: in a tall glass or mixing cup, add greek yogurt and almond milk, and mix together.
step-5: if the texture is too thick, add more almond milk until the coating is silky.
step-6: place chocolate chips onto a plate.
step-7: dip the bananas into the yogurt coating, then roll or sprinkle on toppings.
step-8: place bananas in freezer until the coating has hardened.

step-1: cut the bananas in half horizontally.
step-2: insert popsicle sticks in the middle of the banana halves.
step-3: transfer bananas to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, and freeze until solid.
step-4: in a tall glass or mixing cup, add greek yogurt and almond milk, and mix together.
step-5: if the texture is too thick, add more almond milk until the coating is silky.
step-6: place cookie crumble onto a plate.
step-7: dip the bananas into the yogurt coating, then roll or sprinkle on toppings.
step-8: place bananas in freezer until the coating has hardened.

step-1: mash banana in a large bowl and then add in the oats, honey, vanilla, cinnamon, and a pinch of salt.
step-2: fill a greased muffin tin with the granola mixture and use a spoon to form the crust.
step-3: let chill for 1 hour.
step-4: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c) and bake for 30 minutes.
step-5: let cool.
step-6: add in greek yogurt to each cup and fill with toppings.

step-1: peel bananas and cut in half.
step-2: place popsicle sticks inside bananas and put on tray with parchment paper.
step-3: freeze for 1 to 3 hours depending on how firm you want your bananas to be.
step-4: when bananas are ready, coat in yogurt and sprinkle with granola.
step-5: set aside and freeze for an additional 20 minutes.

step-1: cut the bananas in half horizontally.
step-2: insert popsicle sticks in the middle of the banana halves.
step-3: transfer bananas to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, and freeze until solid.
step-4: in a tall glass or mixing cup, add greek yogurt and almond milk, and mix together.
step-5: if the texture is too thick, add more almond milk until the coating is silky.
step-6: place granola onto a plate.
step-7: dip the bananas into the yogurt coating, then roll or sprinkle on toppings.
step-8: place bananas in freezer until the coating has hardened.

step-1: scoop greek yogurt into box.
step-2: place mixed berries into box.
step-3: place sliced almonds into box.
step-4: pour honey on top of the greek yogurt.
step-5: refrigerate until ready to eat.

step-1: cut the bananas in half horizontally.
step-2: insert popsicle sticks in the middle of the banana halves.
step-3: transfer bananas to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, and freeze until solid.
step-4: in a tall glass or mixing cup, add greek yogurt and almond milk, and mix together.
step-5: if the texture is too thick, add more almond milk until the coating is silky.
step-6: place pretzels onto a plate.
step-7: dip the bananas into the yogurt coating, then roll or sprinkle on toppings.
step-8: place bananas in freezer until the coating has hardened.

step-1: cut the bananas in half horizontally.
step-2: insert popsicle sticks in the middle of the banana halves.
step-3: transfer bananas to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, and freeze until solid.
step-4: in a tall glass or mixing cup, add greek yogurt and almond milk, and mix together.
step-5: if the texture is too thick, add more almond milk until the coating is silky.
step-6: place sprinkles onto a plate.
step-7: dip the bananas into the yogurt coating, then roll or sprinkle on toppings.
step-8: place bananas in freezer until the coating has hardened.

step-1: sift the flour into a large bowl, add sugar and beaten eggs.
step-2: add half the milk, whisk until smooth, then add the other half and whisk until lump free.
step-3: rest batter for 30 minutes, or refrigerate for 15.
step-4: fill muffin tray with 1 tsp vegetable oil in each hole, then heat at the highest temperature on your oven until piping hot.
step-5: add 3 tbsp batter to oiled holes then bake for 20 mins at 230°c (450°f).
step-6: for the chocolate sauce, heat the chocolate, butter, double cream and golden syrup in a bowl above heated water until melted.
step-7: whisk until smooth.
step-8: serve the puddings with whipped cream and chocolate sauce.

step-1: in a large bowl, mix together the flour, baking powder, salt, milk, softened butter, and egg.
step-2: slowly add the water, stirring between each addition.
step-3: knead the dough for 5-10 minutes.
step-4: the dough should feel very soft, but not too sticky.
step-5: grease the bowl with oil, return the dough to the bowl, and cover with plastic wrap.
step-6: rest for 30 minutes in a warm place.
step-7: place the dough in the center of a large piece of plastic.
step-8: wrap it tightly, ensuring the dough is completely covered.
step-9: refrigerate for at least 8 hours.
step-10: remove the dough from the refrigerator.
step-11: let it rest on the countertop for 1-2 hours, or until it comes to room temperature and is soft to the touch.
step-12: fill a wok or large skillet with enough oil to come 2 inches from the top of the pan.
step-13: heat the oil over medium heat until it reaches 375°f (190°c).
step-14: lightly flour the dough and the surface, then carefully pull, press, and roll the dough to form a long flat loaf shape, about ¼-inch (½ cm) thick and 4-inches (10 cm) wide.
step-15: cut the dough crosswise into 1-inch (2-cm) wide strips.
step-16: stack them 2 by 2.
step-17: using a chopstick or skewer, press the center of the dough stack down lengthwise.
step-18: gently stretch, then lower each dough stack into the oil.
step-19: if the oil temperature is right, the dough should rise to the surface right away.
step-20: use chopsticks or tongs to quickly roll the dough in a continuous motion for about 1 minute.
step-21: fry until the dough is light golden brown, about 5-7 minutes.
step-22: cool on a wire rack.
step-23: serve with sweet soy milk for dipping, if desired.

step-1: cut each yum yum into four pieces and set aside in large bowl
step-2: add milk, double cream and eggs to a different bowl and whisk until smooth.
step-3: soak the yum yum pieces in the mixture.
step-4: layer soaked yum yum pieces in a baking tin.
step-5: cover first layer in strawberry jam.
step-6: add second layer of yum yums.
step-7: bake for 45 mins at 190°c/375°f
step-8: serve and enjoy!

step-1: preheat oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: in a bowl sift the flour cornstarch, baking powder, and salt.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: in another bowl, add the butter, milk, and vanilla.
step-5: whisk until well-combined.
step-6: cover with a kitchen towel and set aside.
step-7: in two large bowls, separate 3 eggs into yolks and whites.
step-8: crack the last 2 whole eggs in the bowl with the egg yolks.
step-9: pour 6 tablespoons of sugar into the egg yolk bowl.
step-10: mix on high until the batter is thick and pale yellow, about 5 minutes.
step-11: beat the egg whites on high until frothy, then gradually add the 6 tablespoons of sugar.
step-12: continue beating until soft peaks form.
step-13: gently fold in the egg yolk mixture into the egg whites.
step-14: add the flour mixture, continue folding until the flour is mixed in.
step-15: create a well in the bowl, pour in the butter mixture.
step-16: fold all of the ingredients until the batter is smooth and silky.
step-17: pour half of the batter into a smaller bowl.
step-18: sift the cocoa powder over the batter.
step-19: fold in until the cocoa powder is fully incorporated.
step-20: in a greased parchment paper-lined 8-inch (20 cm) cake pan, spoon in a scoop of the vanilla batter in the center of the pan.
step-21: spoon in a scoop of the chocolate batter over the vanilla in the center.
step-22: repeat until you have poured about 6 to 8 layers, keeping in mind you will be spooning in a little less batter each layer.
step-23: using a chopstick or skewer, gently draw a line from the edge of the pan to the center.
step-24: repeat until you have made 8 lines.
step-25: pour a little chocolate dot in the center.
step-26: bake for 30 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean.
step-27: use a knife or spatula to gently release the cake from the edge of the pan.
step-28: cover the cake with a greased plate.
step-29: flip the cake on to the plate then transfer to a wire rack to cool.
step-30: let cool for about 20 minutes before slicing.
step-31: for the strawberry sauce, heat a saucepan over medium heat.
step-32: add the strawberries and sugar, and stir until bubbling.
step-33: remove from heat.
step-34: serve with strawberry sauce and whipped cream!

step-1: season both sides of the chicken thighs with salt and pepper.
step-2: in a large skillet, add the olive oil and place the chicken skin side down for about 5 minutes or until skin is golden brown.
step-3: flip the chicken and cook for another 3 minutes.
step-4: take the chicken out and add the onions and cook until they’re translucent, about 5 minutes.
step-5: add the rice, stir to coat in the oil and onions, and toast for 3 minutes.
step-6: add the garlic then pour in the chicken stock and place the chicken on top of the rice.
step-7: bring to a boil, then cover and simmer for 25-30 minutes, or until rice is cooked.
step-8: once cooked, take the chicken out and add in the cilantro, black beans, and the juice of one lime.
step-9: mix until well-incorporated.
step-10: serve the chicken over rice and garnish with cilantro.

step-1: in a bowl, combine pasta, chicken, cucumber, celery, black olives, sliced tomatoes, carrots, and italian dressing.
step-2: mix well and pour pasta salad into a reusable container.
step-3: pack with fruits and veggies for sides.

step-1: preheated oven at 350ºf (175ºc).
step-2: mix all of the dry ingredients (flour, salt, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, chopped almonds) in a bowl, and set aside.
step-3: in a new bowl, combine pineapple, eggs, vegetable oil, sugar, brown sugar, zucchini, and vanilla, and mix well.
step-4: pour the dry ingredients gradually into the wet ingredients bowl, and mix them until smooth.
step-5: spray your baking pan and pour in the mixture, top with sliced almonds.
step-6: bake for 60 minutes (times may vary depending on oven), and check for doneness with a toothpick.
step-7: while baking, mix your glaze ingredients together until smooth.
step-8: let the bread cool down, drizzle with the glaze!

step-1: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: in a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, heavy cream, 1 teaspoon of salt, and the ricotta.
step-3: set aside.
step-4: heat a 12-inch (30 cm) cast-iron or stainless steel skillet over medium-high heat.
step-5: add the bacon and cook until crisp, 3-5 minutes.
step-6: using tongs, transfer the bacon from the pan to a paper towel-lined plate, leaving the rendered bacon fat in the pan.
step-7: add the onion to the pan and cook until caramelized, 8-10 minutes.
step-8: add the garlic and red pepper flakes and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
step-9: add the zucchini and sauté until starting to soften, 2-3 minutes.
step-10: add the corn and cook for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the zucchini softens further but is still bright green.
step-11: season with the remaining teaspoon of salt and the pepper.
step-12: pour the egg mixture over the vegetables, then top with the bacon.
step-13: transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 12-15 minutes, until the top is puffed and the eggs are cooked through.
step-14: garnish with parsley, then serve directly from the skillet.

step-1: mash chickpeas with a fork in a large bowl.
step-2: set aside.
step-3: grate zucchini.
step-4: place in a clean dish towel or cloth.
step-5: grate carrots.
step-6: place in a clean dish towel or cloth with zucchini.
step-7: squeeze out as much moisture as possible.
step-8: add veggies, panko, egg, basil, garlic powder, salt, and pepper to the bowl with the mashed chickpeas.
step-9: stir until completely combined.
step-10: heat olive oil in a large skillet on medium heat.
step-11: scoop 2 tablespoons of mixture into your hand press to compress it into a patty.
step-12: cook for about 1-2 minutes, until the underside is golden brown then flip and repeat.
step-13: serve with a dollop of plain greek yogurt and diced green onion.

step-1: preheat the oven to 350˚f (180˚c).
step-2: grease a 12-cup muffin tin with nonstick spray.
step-3: make the batter: in a large bowl, stir together the whole wheat flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, pepper, and sugar.
step-4: set aside.
step-5: in a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, buttermilk, and butter.
step-6: add the zucchini, carrot, cheddar cheese, and chives the egg mixture and stir to combine.
step-7: pour the egg mixture into the dry ingredients and fold to combine, being careful not to overmix.
step-8: using an ice cream scoop, divide the batter between the muffin cups, filling almost completely.
step-9: sprinkle more cheddar cheese on top of the muffins.
step-10: bake for 18 minutes, rotating the muffin tin halfway through baking, until browned on top and a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean.
step-11: let cool for 10 minutes before removing the muffins from the tin.
step-12: serve or store in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.
step-13: nutrition, per muffin - calories: 182, total fat: 10 grams, sodium: 433 mg, total carbs: 17 grams, dietary fiber: 3 grams, sugars: 2 grams, protein: 7 grams

step-1: preheat oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-2: cut zucchini into ⅛ inch (3 mm) to ¼ inch (6 mm) slices.
step-3: arrange slices on a nonstick baking sheet.
step-4: don’t overlap the zucchini, or they won’t dry out properly.
step-5: brush slices with olive oil, then season with salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
step-6: flip slices over and repeat.
step-7: bake for 25-35 minutes, flipping halfway.
step-8: allow slices to cool to room temperature.
step-9: slices will continue to get crispier as they cool.

step-1: in a bowl mix together chicken, onion, red bell pepper, jalapeno, 1 cup of monterey jack (100 g), enchilada sauce, lime juice, garlic powder, chili powder, salt, pepper.
step-2: mix thoroughly and set aside until ready to use.
step-3: with a peeler, peel slices of zucchini vertically.
step-4: once you can no longer peel a whole slice of zucchini peel the rest into smaller strips and save for zoodles!
step-5: preheat the oven to 400˚f (200˚c).
step-6: spread chicken mixture on to a slice of zucchini and roll into a tight spiral.
step-7: place in a greased springform pan and bake for 15 minutes.
step-8: sprinkle with the rest of the cheese and bake for 10 more minutes until cheese has melted.
step-9: transfer to a plate and sprinkle with cilantro.
step-10: serve immediately.

step-1: preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
step-2: in a pan over medium heat, add the oil and the onions and cook until the onions are translucent.
step-3: add the garlic and stir to combine.
step-4: add the black beans, corn, 1 cup (290 g) of enchilada sauce, lime juice, salt, cumin, and chili powder, and stir until combined.
step-5: cook until just simmering.
step-6: set aside.
step-7: cut off the end of each zucchini then using a vegetable peeler, peel each zucchini into wide strips.
step-8: place 4-5 zucchini strips on a plate and spoon a large spoonful of filling at the bottom of the strips.
step-9: fold the ends of the zucchini over the filling and continue to roll, tightly.
step-10: transfer the zucchini rolls to a baking dish.
step-11: spoon over the remaining enchilada sauce and top with cheese.
step-12: bake for 15-20 minutes or until cheese is melted.
step-13: serve with sour cream and cilantro.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: cut zucchini into fries and set aside.
step-3: in a large bowl combine panko, parmesan, garlic powder, basil, salt, and pepper.
step-4: whisk eggs in a shallow bowl or dish.
step-5: dip zucchini in eggs, coating evenly, and then toss in bread crumb mixture.
step-6: place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
step-7: bake for 15-20 minutes, flipping halfway.
step-8: prepare dip while fries are baking.
step-9: combine all dip ingredients in a small bowl and set aside in the refrigerator until ready to use.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f/200°c.
step-2: using a box grater, grate the zucchini on the coarse side.
step-3: transfer the grated zucchini to a large bowl and sprinkle with salt.
step-4: mix the zucchini and set aside for 20 minutes while the salt draws moisture from the zucchini.
step-5: transfer the zucchini to a large kitchen towel and strain the excess liquid into a bowl.
step-6: place the zucchini back to the large bowl and toss in the chives, parmesan, oregano, garlic powder, black pepper, and egg, and mix until well combined.
step-7: portion the zucchini mixture into 6 even hash brown patties on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
step-8: bake for 35 minutes, until golden brown.
step-9: cool the hash browns for 10-15 minutes to set.
step-10: serve with desired dipping sauce.

step-1: cut the ends off of the zucchini, and cut in half, lengthwise.
step-2: using a vegetable peeler, peel long strips of zucchini (these will be your “noodles”) and set on a baking sheet lined with paper towels.
step-3: dab zucchini strips with a paper towel to absorb the excess moisture.
step-4: in a large pot, add olive oil, onions, and garlic.
step-5: cook until translucent, about 4-5 minutes.
step-6: add ground turkey, and cook for another 4-5 minutes, or until the turkey has browned slightly.
step-7: pour in crushed tomatoes, basil, parsley, oregano, salt, pepper, tomato paste, and a bay leaf.
step-8: cover and let simmer for 30 minutes.
step-9: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-10: in a bowl, combine ricotta cheese, egg, parsley, parmesan, salt, and pepper.
step-11: mix until well combined.
step-12: using a baking dish, layer turkey sauce, zucchini strips, ricotta mixture, and parmesan.
step-13: repeat until there are 3 layers total, ending with the turkey sauce and topping that with parmesan cheese.
step-14: bake for 50 minutes (times and temperatures may vary depending on the oven).
step-15: let rest for at least 20 minutes.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200°c).
step-2: using a vegetable peeler, peel long strips from the zucchini.
step-3: in a large bowl, mix the zucchini strips, shrimp, bell pepper sliced, lime juice, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and olive oil until the mixture is evenly coated.
step-4: on a roasting tray, spread the mixture into one even layer and bake for 8 minutes.

step-1: remove each end of the zucchinis and use a cheese grater to shred into a large mixing bowl.
step-2: sprinkle salt over shredded zucchini, toss, and let rest for 20 minutes to pull out excess moisture.
step-3: preheat oven to 375˚f (190˚c).
step-4: using a dish towel/cloth squeeze out excess liquid from the shredded zucchini.
step-5: move the zucchini to a dry mixing bowl and add the remaining ingredients.
step-6: stir until evenly mixed and form into golf ball-sized balls.
step-7: bake in a preheated oven for 30-40 minutes or until browned, flipping halfway through.
step-8: serve over pasta with your choice of sauce.

step-1: using a spiralizer, spiralize the zucchini into thin noodles.
step-2: microwave the noodles for two minutes, then drain any liquid.
step-3: melt the butter in a pan over medium heat.
step-4: cook the chicken, salt, pepper, and garlic until garlic is starting to brown and chicken is cooked.
step-5: add the heavy cream, parmesan, and parsley, stirring until evenly combined.
step-6: bring to a boil, then stir until the sauce has reduced by about half.
step-7: remove from heat.
step-8: toss the zucchini noodles in with the chicken mixture, and stir until the noodles are coated evenly.
step-9: serve with more parmesan, if desired!

step-1: in a saucepan over medium high heat add zucchini and water.
step-2: let steam for 5 minutes, or until slightly tender.
step-3: drain the zucchini and let cool in a medium mixing bowl.
step-4: once cool add parmesan cheese, egg, flour, minced garlic, salt, and lemon to a bowl and mix until the mixture has a semi-creamy texture.
step-5: place a large pan over medium-high heat and add vegetable oil.
step-6: use a spoon to scoop out medium dollops of mixture and place it in the pan.
step-7: let cook on each side for about 3 minutes, or until golden brown.
step-8: remove from pan and place on paper towel to absorb excess oil.

step-1: preheat oven to 425°f (220°c).
step-2: cut off the end of each zucchini then using a vegetable peeler, peel each zucchini into wide strips.
step-3: transfer the zucchini strips to a plate then layer two strips vertically and two strips horizontally to make a cross.
step-4: repeat process with remaining strips.
step-5: heat a pan over medium-high heat.
step-6: add olive oil then garlic and sauté for 30 seconds to 1 minute.
step-7: add spinach, salt, and pepper.
step-8: sauté for 1-2 minutes, until wilted down.
step-9: remove from heat and allow to cool for 10 minutes.
step-10: in a large bowl, add the spinach and garlic.
step-11: add the ricotta, basil, salt, and pepper.
step-12: mix until well combined.
step-13: using a spoon or cookie scoop, scoop approximately 1 tablespoon of the mixture and place in the middle of each zucchini noodle cross.
step-14: fold each side to seal the ricotta mixture then flip over the ravioli so the seam side is on the bottom.
step-15: in a baking dish pour the marinara sauce then smooth with a spatula.
step-16: evenly place the zucchini raviolis then top with mozzarella cheese.
step-17: bake for 15-20 minutes.
step-18: serve with fresh basil.

step-1: preheat the oven to 425˚f (220˚c).
step-2: grease a baking sheet with nonstick spray or line with parchment paper.
step-3: cut each zucchini crosswise into ½-inch (1 cm) slices.
step-4: use a 1-inch (2 cm) round cookie cutter to punch out the center of each zucchini slice.
step-5: in a large bowl, combine the bread crumbs, parmesan, garlic powder, paprika, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper.
step-6: add the eggs to a separate bowl and whisk.
step-7: add the flour to a third bowl.
step-8: dredge the zucchini rings in the flour, then the eggs, then finally in the bread crumb mixture, making sure to coat all sides.
step-9: arrange the zucchini rings on the baking sheet.
step-10: bake for 10-15 minutes, flipping halfway through, until golden brown on both sides.
step-11: serve with your favorite dipping sauce.

step-1: using a coarse cheese grater, slide the zucchini down the grater, shaving of long strips.
step-2: rotate the zucchini constantly, grating all sides, until you reach the seeds in the center.
step-3: heat the oil over medium-high heat in a large, nonstick skillet.
step-4: add the shrimp in and season with the salt, black pepper, red pepper, and garlic.
step-5: sauté the shrimp, until they evenly begin to show a pink color, about 3 minutes.
step-6: pour in the chicken broth and lemon juice, and let the liquid come to a simmer.
step-7: add the zucchini noodles and stir until everything is combined and the shrimp are fully cooked.
step-8: sprinkle with chopped fresh parsley leaves and serve.

step-1: preheat oven to 400°f (200˚c.)
step-2: grate the zucchini into a bowl and salt generously.
step-3: allow zucchini to sit for 20 minutes as the salt draws out moisture.
step-4: pour zucchini onto a clean dish towel and wring it out over the sink or into a separate bowl.
step-5: pour the zucchini back into your bowl and add bread crumbs, cheddar cheese, eggs, garlic powder, and pepper.
step-6: mix together until well-blended.
step-7: take a tablespoon of mixture and roll it into a tot, repeat for rest of mixture.
step-8: place on a greased baking sheet and place in the oven for 20-25 minutes or until tots are crunchy.
step-9: serve warm.

step-1: preheat oven to 350°f (180°c).
step-2: slice the ends off of each zucchini, then slice them in half and into wedges.
step-3: in a bowl, mix breadcrumbs, red pepper flakes, and salt.
step-4: dip each wedge into egg mixture, then breadcrumb mixture.
step-5: place on a baking sheet, skin side down.
step-6: bake 15-20 minutes.
